reviews.review: Great day out. It is rather pricey but much better value than Disneyland. Kids enjoyed it which is the important part! We were unlucky that by around 3pm there were high wind warnings meaning all rides were effectively closed but we managed to get some in before 3pm so I guess that was ok.

The quality has significantly declined. We live across the border in Shenzhen, China. We go to Ocean Park a couple of times each year. While we have usually enjoyed Ocean Park, our last visit was very disappointing. We arrived 30 minutes before opening and entered when the gates opened. We have done this previously, enjoying the Park before it gets too crowded. This time we were disappointed to find that the rides and food & beverage sales did not open until 11:00 AM or later. We were informed over and over that they were "Getting ready." It was one and a half hours before we got on a ride. We spent one and a half hours walking around in the hot sun looking for water because they took our water away at the entrance. There's another amusement park in Hong Kong. It's a bit more expensive than Ocean Park, but when they open their gates, they are ready to entertain you.
worth the effort - go to big wave bay. Def worth the effort (I did it in August, lunch time). Bring enough water and go for big wave bay to swim after the hike.

Obscene rip off. Turned up with my 13 and 17 year old children for what was meant to be a fun day out on various fairground rides at Ocean Park. Total entry fees for three of us: HK$1,155.The weather was pretty bad but there were NO signs up at the ticket booths to suggest that any rides would be out of action. I also asked the woman at the ticket booth if there were any problems with rides and she said she didn't think so.As soon as we entered the Park we saw a digital sign saying some rides might be closed. NOTE this was AFTER WE HAD PAID OUR ENTRY FEES.We took the cable car to the far end of Ocean Park to discover that nearly ALL the rides were shut. NOT a single sign up to explain for how long.Even the Raging river attraction (half way down the mountain on the other side) was "closed for inspection" but the people "on duty" there couldn't even tell us for how long and seemed confused that we would even want to know the answer.Given the amount of money involved in visiting this park it was a TOTAL RIP OFF.Management should be ashamed at luring people in and then only alerting them to problems with the rides AFTER they have paid.If they have any decency they will offer a refund. But I'm not holding my breath....

A great day out for all ages. Ocean Park is a favourite place of mine...most of the time.I did make the mistake of going there once at Chinese New Year, never again. I have never seen so many people in my life! Tons to see and do, plenty of food choices, lots of rides and of course the displays are excellent. It is not a cheap day out but it is an alternative to Disneyland and a bit more "educational' if thats your thing. But loads of fun if thats all you are after. Go with a group and enjoy the day.

Nice day trip for the family. I would recommend Ocean Park over HK Disneyland to anyone visiting HK. With rollercoasters, kiddie rides, games and numerous aquariums and mini-zoos, it offers a much wider range of entertainment over Disneyland.

So much better than Disneyland. This was my wife's first trip to a decent theme park. We went to Disney land last year and while she enjoyed it, Ocean Park just has SOOOO much more to see and do ! So lets start at the beginning, Don't buy your ticket at the concierge in the hotel and certainly NOT at the park its self, we found it cheaper at Admiralty MTR. Leave early, and try arrive as the park opens, at 1000hrs i think. Our experience, in September, was that the rides at opening time are empty ! We rode all the biggest and best rides, without queuing. Ironically, the Ferris wheel had a ten minute queue while we walked straight onto all the roller coasters. However we watched the show, ending at 1600hrs, and the throng of people arriving was amazing, hundreds upon hundreds of people, it certainly pays to arrive early ! The mixture of, Panda's, sea life, aquariums, seals, penguins, shows and rides make for a truly memorable day, and represents fantastic value for money. So in summary, 1. Buy your ticket at Admiralty MTR, ride the bus from there.2. Arrive as soon as the gate opens.3. Ride all the biggest and best rides early, even if it means walking ALOT4. SEE THE PANDAS !!!!!5. Allow all day, we arrived at 1000hrs, and left at 1730hrs, queued only once for 10 minutes and still felt we hadn't done it all !6. Enjoy !Oh the only disappointment was the price of food and drink (a normal gripe in these type of places), and the cable car was closed for maintenance on the day we visited.

Refreshing experience. First time here at ocean park after watching it on hong kong drama while growing up. There are a few different section from less intensive suitable for young kids to rollercoasters suitable for trill seekers. The park happen to be doing halloween night during our visit and the night weather is really cooling. Would highly recommend for visit.

A lot of fun and good entertainment for kids. I went a lot of times with my daughter from age 1-2 years old. She loves all the animals and whiskers theater with lots of rides for small kids. Stroller friendly. changing rooms everywhere. Just not good for pregnant women, if you want to use the rides. I was kicked out of the children merry go round...

Halloween. I went to Hong Kong just for the ocean park Halloween. This year their daytime ticket gives access to their night time Halloween too! So I got there early and went visit the panda exhiibit. The red panda was really cute and cuddly and not really camera shy. The whole park was swarming with tourists and many were from China. The Halloween was also well done this year. With their staffs donning makeup and dressing up as Chinese vampire, ghost buster stay puff marshmallow man, witches, ghost dolls, zombie and hell entities. The Hwa Wei palace of death was really scary. As the ghost will jump out from nowhere to scare you and the ghost house was really dark can improve on the lighting. We also visit the school of shadows and it was also really real and scary. I like the ghost buster academy where you can learn how ghost busters learn their tricks and even a laser shooting game to shoot ghost and be ranked on their chart.i suggest that to cut short some waiting queuing time to start queuing at popular ghost house like ghost buster and school of shadow 15 mins before it opens. Average queuing time is about 15-45mins. You can take bus at bus terminal right outside Admiralty station which brings you straight to ocean park.

Not Recommended. We have been to at least 20 parks around the world, we love parks but unfortunately, this is the most horrendous experience we have ever had in theme parks. They obviously had over sold entrance without considering how their guests can possibly enjoy the park. Park has a nice theme and plenty to do, but everything is at least 90 minutes wait. Park was too full, cable car in the picture was two hours wait on each way. We did 3 rides during the ten hours in the park, spent the rest of the 6 hours waiting in lines. I am sure you can figure this one out.

1 day visit to ocean park. Went with 2 young children on a friday. Took a cab there from cosmopolitan hotel at wanchai. Fare ard $42. We only went to the areas suitable for kids and stayed only for half day. Some kiddy stuff looks like SG funfair in olden days.The rides are a bit boring. Did not complete the place as the kids are cranky and weather is hot.

A full day out. We arrived at opening time, after taking the bus from Admiralty, the queues were ok as the park was not busy on a weekday in October. There is a lot to see and the park was much bigger than expected, all the animals and rides kept us busy for a full day. Plenty of food options in the park. a great family day out.

Pandas!. A huge park is going to take the entire day escpecially if you line up for every attraction. The lines is the only flaw of the park, for the rest it has attractions for every taste and colour: colourful perfomances made by fancy dressed actors, breathtaking views from the cable car, Old Hong Kong installation, a wide variety of animals and ocean inhabitants... The highlight of my trip absolutely was seeing a panda - an extremely adorable creature. Most of the park decorations and attractions are always changing according to the season (my trip was near Helloween, the actors managed to create a really fancy atmosphere). Ocean park would definately impress you + add more fun photos to your travel album! Admission ticket is about 350 HK dollars, totally worth its money. Must see!

Staff was rude, i am not going back.. The park is quite clean. One of the staff was yelling at my dad for trying to walk behind him. I think there was no need to yell, we thought he may not know how to say 'excuse me'. I dont think i will come back, nothing really is special in this park.
Short trip . Is best to go early to avoid all the tour group... it will take around four hours to complete the whole park... unfortunately the advantage park is closed for maintenance

Fun theme park - worth a day trip in HK. We took the 171 bus there from Mongkok as it didn't require any transfers and sitting on top of a double decker bus provided a great view of the city from Mongkok all the way down to HK island. Once we were there, we walked a little to get to the park entrance. After going in you can start planning your day but we started by going to the submit and working our way back. This was to keep our energy level up so we get to experience the entire park. Overall the park offer some adult rides but don't expect them to be exceptionally thrilling. This park is known for it various aquatic tours and attractions but there are activities for everyone. They have various animal exhibitions which we recommend to quickly check out but the dolphin/seal show was a buzz kill so set your expectation low if you decide to go. Otherwise enjoy the park and as it was a fun day for us!

Amazing . We had loads of fun... one tip to everyone.. if you want to enjy this place . Go against the crowd... we went to cable ride and straight way to upper deck which had all the fun.. hair raiser ride... pendulum ride.. North Pole fun... when we reached we got all the rides almost with no crowd and lot of time was saved and then gradually completing all of them we went one by one down covering other places there... lastly we saw the aquarium and discovery ... it was fun we really enjoyed lot there.

Lets hv an adrenaline rush!. Try the roller coaster! it will take the whole day to explore all area of the park. You may get to other wings of the park by hopping on a train for faster access or the sky trem for slower access while enjoying the view.
First day in Hong Kong that we go To Ocean Park . It awesome with coster roller with my sweetheart, that we never got like this holiday, really happy.
Only ride is worth. Don't visit any show and waste time. Take ride and other activity. Food is very costly. Only Panda is atrative

Good place to have a day out. The ocean park is a good place to spend a whole day for the entire family. It offers rides and entertainment for people of all ages. The rides on The Summit are amazing and adrenaline pumping. They're definitely not for the fainthearted. The dolphin show was really good and it was amazing to see how nicely they are trained. The aquarium is slightly under kept and could be maintained better but overall good enough for a one time visit. Would be better to finish The Summit first and then do the areas in The Waterfront. A better way to cover the entire park as most adult rides are on The Summit.However, the downside is that there's too much walking involved up and down the hill. The map doesn't really help you get around the place and the entire park is spread over a very wide area. Getting from one place to another is really tiresome. Food is not so great for vegetarians. There's hardly anything available. But all in all, good place for family outing.

Food shops were not accessible. Overall we had fun and enjoyed our visit last february 2016. The only downside is the food stalls and resaurants were closed during our visit, we ended up queing for 30minutes just to get food. Amusement parks where expected to be crowded and filled with people, but when we were in there the crowd control was bad , people stepping on our toes, folks sprinting to get ahead of us and etc. I hope they will do better alternatives with crowd control.

Entertaining. It's a fun place with lots to do for both kids and adults. The biggest downfall was how wheelchair and stroller unfriendly it was. There were lots of stairs and steep hills with no lifts which for the strollers weren't a big deal but for a wheelchair it was quite inconvenient.
Great day out. So much to see and do. The highlight was seeing the Panda's. Dolphin show was abit lame, lacked content. Shame there were big ques for many of the atractions.

Something to kill time.. Very easy to get to the park via bus from hong kong mtr. We went early on a tuesday which was by far the best decision as there were almost no crowds until 3-4pm. Dissappointing that a third of the rides and attractions were 'closed due to maintainance' and we were given no notification of this before forking out our cash. Most of the rides were very quick in session and pretty tame. Best part was probably seeing the pandas and penguins.

Great day out but very busy. Firstly the best bit of advise I can offer is to visit on a weekday!!! We visited on a Monday and even though we had bought our tickets before visiting we still had to wait a long time to enter the park.The park itself however is good. The aquarium is very impressive and of course the pandas are so cute. We started our day on the lower part of the park and then caught the cable car up to the higher part of the park which contains the majority of the rides. The views on the cable car are an added bonus and you get a great view of a part of Hong Kong you don't get to see so often. The food in the park is also very good - especially in the old Hong Kong section and the noodles were amazing.

Great for our 18YO....but tad hectic for us old fogies.. Nipper went on every ride imaginable....screamed her head off all the time, and thoroughly enjoyed her 2nd visit. First was 10 years ago, when she had a distinct fear of heights. She is obviously over that now. Kids of all ages were enjoying themselves immensely...you only had to look at their faces.

Really enjoyed ourselves.. while we heard pretty much about ocean park HK when we are young, we didn't have the chance to visit. brought our 2 toddler there when we visited Hong Kong. we were quite unlucky that the night before there is no 8 typhoon. knowing that we might miss the chance to visit Ocean park the next day, we were very disappointed. however the typhoon warning was lifted at 2pm in the afternoon that day, we immediately rushed to ocean park! to our delight, it was open and well prepared to receive patron already! we really had much fun! the amount of rides and things to see for toddler was really plentiful! although it was just a 6hours visit, we are really having fun and tired at the end of our day. we bought plenty of plushie (very good quality) to end our trip! it was much better than Disneyland although most of the reviews said Disneyland is better.

Good theme park for all ages. It offers everything for everyone. All age groups have activities. It has very mild to very difficult roller coaster rides. And other thriller rides. It also has animals, birds, rain forests, penguins, seals, walrus, sting rays... just too good. Don't miss it.

A very much crowded place. I'm planning a trip to Hong Kong & I hear one of the must go to places is the Ocean Park. So, we book our tickets via "KLOOK.COM" & went ahead. Our first impression was that the place was well spread out but we were disappointed to see the huge no of people turnout. We had deliberately chosen to go on a weekday, yet we were stuck due to the large crowd. Waiting for 1.5 hours in line for a single ride is too much to handle & the whole experience got spoiled because of the queues. The best part was the dolphin show, which was well played out & the 'Shark Mystique' enclosure which had different levels & different types of sharks. Thiese two were probably the best attractions of the park.A special mention for KLOOK here, even though their ticket said 'Fast Track' it wasn't. Also, we had taken a meal to go with the ticket & sadly none of the restaurants were open which was really tragic. We ended up spending time & money to get food which was really upsetting. Overall, not at all happy with the experience for a place which promised so much

Worth to go on Weekdays compare to Weekend.. I went to ocean park on Friday 20160923. Quite less people in the morning and some game no need to queue up. It's also fun that period is halo ween season. So i able to take picture with a lot of horrible dress up model. I am also able to access the cable car cause before that still under maintenance. Suggest to play the lower park first than only go up to the higher park. It's can be play full day. i like ocean park.

Good for adults . This place is really exciting for adults rather than Disneyland.What makes me say that is only because of super horrific rides.I was not able to enjoy much as I had my four year child with me and roamed around in the park.The one thing which should not be missed is the cable car ride,free of charge,almost 15 minutes and a must try.There were plenty local food outlets unfortunately could not try them.

Pandas. We did not go for the fun park rides, we wanted to see the Pandas, we arrived early on a eel day morning and there were no crowds, and we spent an extra long time visiting the Panda house. Was nice, well recommended

Pandas a highlight . Lots of walking and lining up here. We did the animals early - Pandas, aquarium, etc which was a great option. Rides a plentiful but many have height restrictions that rule out kids more so than other parks.

I've been to better parks. the lines to extreme rides are very long. if you plan to do all the rides make sure you have a fast track ticket. one day is not enough to enjoy both rides and animals. you may want to buy an annual pass or weekly pass so that you can return. the animal show is mediocre. other places like singapore zoo have better trained animals.

Better than Disney. Ocean Park is great to visit with children and Teenagers. The choice of amusement rides and animal sanctuaries is good especially if you want to see Panda Bears. The restaurants in the park are a bit overpriced and food just so so, better bring your own snacks or sandwich as well as water.

Worth to revisit!. Second time in this theme park & would love to go back in a heartbeat! Super fast WiFi internet connection. Take note that ALL rides close at 6pm. Symbio show is only on weekends. Must visit when in Hong Kong!

Happiest Place in Hong Kong, for me!. Me and my family (there were 7 of us) visited Ocean Park for the first time in November 2015 and we did it DIY style. We bought our tickets online with the price practically similar with tickets bought at their booths. For first timers, we didn't find it difficult to commute to the park coming from Jordan Station. In fact, it was effortless. We spent an entire day at Ocean Park to fully enjoy all its attractions and rides. We arrived around 9 and left the place right after their light/fountain/fire show at around 6 or 7. I didn't research about the place, as I was dependent with my brother who organized this trip. As a result, I got confused on how to go around the place even with a map which was available everywhere in the park. It was very overwhelming because we didn't know where to start and we were all eager to see all their scheduled animal shows. I didn't even know where the cable car would take us and I only thought that it would just go up and then go down back to where it would fetch us. We made the cable car terminal our first stop but at this early, the queue was already long and we didn't want to wait for 1 hour to get our turn for our very first activity of the day. Meanwhile, the attendant kept telling everybody that there was a train that we could take instead. I didn't know where it was supposed to go as well but we just obliged. As we got off the train, the map started to make sense. We were on top of the mountain and this was also what was behind the mountain that we kept looking up while we were on the ground. That's where all the thrilling rides had been hiding. We started the first half of the day at the top of the mountain enjoying their roller coaster and other exciting rides. Note that there will always be a queue and each of them usually takes 45 minutes waiting time on the average. You really need to pack a lot of patience before coming to this place. We continued the rest of the day with more rides, visits to big aquariums, and animal shows of sea lions and dolphins. The day at the park was almost over and we still had not done what we had been really clamoring for that day, the cable car. We patiently waited for the last time and so we had the ride of our lives. It was already dark and it was peaceful and quiet. So we started singing our hearts out until we arrived at the bottom of the mountain.It was probably my best day in our 4 day vacation in Hong Kong. The weather was perfect. The sun didn't show up fully but it was just perfect as we didn't like it to be a hot day. Apart from the fun rides and shows that the park offered, there was actually one thing that topped the experience. It was the wonderful view from the top of the mountain that closed the deal for me. I would dare to say that this was the happiest place in Hong Kong for me.

A nightmare and rip off. I should have been warned by the 35 minute wait in a queue to buy entrance tickets. Don't go to this attraction on a busy day. We paid over a 1000 Hong Kong dollars for entrance tickets and then spent most of the day queuing to go on rides. The wait for some rides was over an hour. I can't understand why people spend over an hour in a queue on a hot day in order to go on a ride that lasts around a very few minutes. We were there for six hours and managed to get on three rides! These turned out to be very expensive rides considering the entrance price. We gave up in the end. Not good value for money.

Timing is everything . Despite my many visits to ocean park timing is always the most important attribute to the trip. Going during the summer in the weekend or public holiday is chaotic and humid. Extremely humid! If you go during a Monday around the months of March, April, or September you will have a much better visit. Prices for ticketing are fair and the variety of restaurants are few, but the food is excellent. This is definitely a place for animal lovers and families to experience Hong Kong's variety of wild life.For those who concern parking or transportation you can go by taxi bus or private car. A mtr is in the process of being build right outside the entrance.

Quite fun. I went on weekdays with friends and it's really really enjoyable. Best to head directly for the cable car to bring you all the way up to enjoy the more powerful rides. Then slowly make your way down. Best to take the train back to the entrance less crowded than taking the cable car again. Only downside, food options are rather expensive and not good at all. Yet again you dont come for the food at an amusement park. Big highlight, the dolphin show which aims to educate against marine pollution and the penguins!

The place to see pandas in Hong Kong. As a frequent visitor of fun parks I quite enjoyed seeing the different division of space - upper and lower area around the hill. The park is big enough, keeping in mind the lack of space in Hong Kong, and a nice mix of roller coasters, museum / aquariums, cinema and animals. Better than the tiny Disneyland in my opinion.. I suggest visiting during work days as it is a popular place but a lot of the food / souvenir stands are closed (we came on Tuesday). Good for families, couples or groups of friends.
Different. Was a little disappointed as I thought there would be water rides/slides and that sort of thing, but loved seeing all the animals. The Dolphins, Seals, Penguins, Polar Bears etc

Very busy on the weekend!. We probably went on a very hot busy day, so didn't quite get to enjoy the park in its full glory!I would have liked to have bought a "fast pass" or at least be told what to do, as the lines were too long with 3 small children!It is a massive park and there was heaps to do, and the kids loved looking at the fish and animals etc., but the lines for the rides and aquarium were just too long to bother with. Would have liked to have been given more info

Very disappointed . Teens enjoyed the rides and using the fast pass was the only way to do it. Everything else just horrible. Purchased meal deal ticket, waited in line 45 min for set meal of chicken and chips with coke (only drink allowed) it was pre pored there for hot and flat, last thing anyone wants after lining up that long. Animal shows and enclosures simply sad. Only redeeming feature was actually being able to see a panda. We were pushed and shoved by rude people from the moment we lined up for the bus from the city. Will never return.

Stunning views, decent theme park . Perhaps not the best theme park in the world but probably the most visually stunning you will see anywhere. The cable car is worth the admission ticket alone. The animals, especially the pandas, are fantasticThe rides are decent but nothing exceptional or something you wouldnt see done better elsewhere. However the views, animals and rides combined (and water park in years to come....currently being built) make this a brilliant park.

The best theme park in hog kong. Even better than the Disneyland and more cheaper. Very nice to spend one day. The only negative point is the price of the restaurant and the quality. Ocean Park deservs better

Hk trip with my grandchildren. We had a goodtime in ocean park..near to our hotel ibis in north point... Easy to access.. The park is good for all ages.. The park is not crowded during weekdays coz will be able to ride and watched the shows...over all ratingdouble thumbs up

Good one. Cool And complete theme park. The spot is crazy. Rollercoaster is hang out to the cliff. There is Dolphins, Panda. It's for all ages. Kids area is mainly at the entrance area. And Adult at the top! Enjoy!

Unforgettable Experience and Would Make Your Heart Beat Fast. If you want to go to this park, wake up and catch the bus in the morning around 9 AM, take the bus number 629 ((runs daily from Admiralty MTR Station or Central (Star Ferry)). Install MTR Mobile, find in apps or play store to get bus info or MTR route map. You should try Hair Raiser roller coaster and Cable Car FYI this park open from 10 AM to 7 PM.
A must do. This place was excellent When in Hong Kong you must make it a stop.Has rides for all ages it's like an aquarium and an amusement park in one place.

Not so great. Went to Ocean Park in June 2016 with our 8-year old daughter. Though the tickets were pretty expensive, there was not enough to do. We finished the entire park, along with a prolonged lunch, in about 6 hours. It was extremely hot, and the food inside is very expensive.

Breat mix of rudes and exhibits but.... I loved Ocean Park, not only for the wide choice in rides but also the exhibits including the Pandas and pengiuns. The use of the land and how they maximise what is there in a way that ensures you don't feel overwhelmed but can have a great time.However I found myself frightened by a group of Chinese Tourists who wanted a photo with a westerner. Nothing Ocean Park could do, I was just unlucky that they could not accept No for an answer (when I was alone). I understand why they do it as westerners are people they have little chance to see and want to show off to friends they have seen a westerner, and others were ok with no, but it is a little warning for the afternoons to ensure you do not get seperated from your group.

Huge amusement park... It is a huge amusement park built across 2 levels.. it has lot of rides, a zoo and an ocean life too. A must see for kids is the dolphin show but do check the schedule before visiting or else you would have to wait for sometime. Any ways there will be superlong queues so pls take that also into consideration.

So much fun!! . Our two teenagers will be raving about the park for years to come. We went mid week and early in the morning so there were no lineups (September) and the bugs rides like the Hair Raiser were enjoyed multiple times. It's very clean and well marked, so you can make your way around with only signage to guide you. High octane rock Muzak plays continuously at a volume to get everyone stoked for the next adrenaline experience, but it can be wearing by the end of the day. Food options are plentiful and fairly priced, but don't looking for cheap eats (although there is a Macdonalds)and I don't think you can bring in your own food. It's all about the rides though..... And they are awesome!!

Thrill rides section was best. I was confused between ocean park and Disneyland and decided to go with former as it had more thrilling rides.I was not wrong.The thrill rides section was awesome.It had great rides for the person who love thrills.Whisker harbour section was for small kids.Also we saw one animal show it was excellent don't remember the name though.Grand aquarium was nice.You can cover the whole park in a single day if you want to see each section comfortably.Must first time visit.

Great place! Must go to the Chinese restaurant with mega fishtank! . The park was brilliant! The Panda was lovely and seems well taken-cared of. The aquarium was a must visit which there are so many mega-size sharks and fishes! The restaurant is just beside it, so you can have lunch while looking at those Beautiful Creatures swimming beside u! It's just amazing!

A great, casual way to spend a day with the family. Location: Hong Kong islandAccessibility: 15 minutes from Admiralty MRT (bus route 629 - non-stop, $HK21.20) or drive. An MRT station is being built. Hours: 10-6. Cost: $HK380 approx. Ocean Park surprised me. Whilst it has rides in a variety of 'lands', it was the animal and earth exhibits that really fascinated me. From giant pandas and red pandas up close to the far from shy penguins vying for your attention, to the beautiful aquarium and rain forest land, there was more to see than the day permitted. The rides are fun and some quite terrifying. The over the cliff roller coaster and the abyss rides are heart stopping and you will get wet on the wild rapids. The restaurants are in reasonable supply - check out the 'Tuxedo' and be entertained by penguins diving and swimming whilst you have lunch (a huge glass wall separates the dining area from the penguin pool). Accessibility: be prepared to move across a large area. Plenty of ramps and disabled access. The Ocean Express is a great train (submarine?) ride that takes you to the summit..Facilities: Plenty of clean toilets thought the park. A number of kiosks and gift shops. Souvenirs: Plenty - especially about penguins, pandas and, walruses. Tips: Go on the Ocean Park Tower and enjoy spectacular views of the area. Avoid the aquarium when filled with children (it's a huge echo chamber), plan your day as you won't fit it all in over 8 hours.
HK Ocean Park. I found this okay, but nothing spectacular, some good rides and activities, but a lot of walking and up,and down hills.
Play. it is a good place for all age to visiting,you can going for a full day.You will have a lot of fun in there.
Make over. Place bit old and need improvement. Food and things are expensive and not so tasty. Packed with Chinese tourist......Need to work on it more.

Elder version of Disneyland. A place for elder kids and youngsters. Rides are spaced out, lots of walk.
Best part was the tram ride. gives nice view of the island and areas around.
Some rides are for daredevils. if you have little kids, I think you are better off with Disneyland.
Food is expensive and of poor quality.
One day is enough.

Theme park in Hong Kong. Visited Ocean Park Hong Kong with my family on a holiday. It's a few times I came to Hong Kong, but I never had a chance to enter Ocean Park. At this time, I finally went in Ocean Park.Went in with a happy face and were excited to go on the rides and all that. We also enjoyed looking the Penguins, pandas , aquariums and all that. Went on a few rides and all the rides I had been, I rode it again because it was too fun, especially the water rides. And we also enjoyed watching the animals show with the cute dolphins and sea lions. We waited about 30 mins for the cable car back to the main entrance.

Very interesting demographics. I am travelling with a 12 and 14 yr old. What really surprised us was the hordes of very old tour groups form main land that attended this attraction, yelling in your ear and pushing in front of you. As with every thing else about this region, be prepared for large masses of people that come at you. The rides them selves were average, nothing too memorable. We did all the rides,given the ageing demographic of the attendees, the queues were very short, so don't bother paying extra to jump the queues.

what a good times ! . easy access...if compared to Disneyland...various themes well enough for a good day out walking up and down the hill. However most roller coasters are not for under 12 years old...too few for 8 years old...overall a good experience...
2 hours not more. an old amusement park with some old facilities, an aquarium is a must old other shows lack behind all european similar parks

as expected...supernice!. Huge park, in the contrary of disneyland hong kong, you will probably need 2 days to cover it all. the kids loved it. the wait for the games wasnt too long, the only weird thing as a black family you become an attraction and get photographed by people all the time

Well worth a visit!. Ocean park was fantastic! The rides were all really fun, the aquarium was amazing and it was such a fantastic experience seeing the giant pandas! It's wise to get there as soon as it opens as the morning seems to be the quietest time with no queues, when we left at around 2pm the park was filling up quickly!

A fun mix of theme park and zoo. I only wanted to see a Panda bear to be honest. Little did I expect this massive theme park when my partner and I jumped in a taxi and asked to be taken to ocean world. I knew little about it and hadn't really bought much money with us. We were convinced to enter on the novelty of watching otters catching food just outside the park entrance. It was money well spent. A very clean park.Yes, I could have watched the panda all day, but I didn't want to miss out of the walrus or the rides. This is a fun day for family and kids and even big kids like me.

Not worth the price . Quite disappointed to this ocean park as the overall facilities are quite old. Nice good view from the peak of mountain.Staff in a good service mode.So so food and don't expect a fair price for it.One good objective would be educate next generation to save those lifes under water.The dolphin show really lame if you been to other country for similar show, I almost fall asleep during the show.
Awesome. Great day for price - full day, relaxed and plenty of great views. Went on a Friday and queues minimal.

Fun and retro. We have been to HK before but always head to Disney, never Ocean Park. This time we tried it and enjoyed the whole day at the Park. The animal exhibits allow you to get close to the adorable little creatures and the rides were fun- especially Mine Train- it's on the side of the mountain, facing the South China Sea. It is a unique place to Hong Kong and should not be missed.
Complete Theme Park!. The theme park is an all-in-one theme park!You can see animals, ride thrilling rides, and watch animal shows.

Great Day out. Well worth a visit to this park. It is much larger than Disneyland with lots to offer for both young children and adults. Ensure you take a comfortable pair of walking shoes as you will find yourself there for the whole day. There are many food outlets, along with a couple of restaurants, one of which has a floor to ceiling aqaurium and the other a penguin enclosure which is something very special. The park had started Halloween celebrations and we were fortunate to share in this opportunity. We found alot of characters roaming around, lending itself the opportunity of having your photo taken with them.....ALL FREE! Park admission includes all rides but NOT games and you do have the option of upgrading or purchasing fast track tickets which I would probably recommend, as a lot of rides have long queues.There are several ATM machines located throughout the park along with designated smoking areas. This park is readily accessible via bus, taxi and train, although it is a little out of the way, however as preciously mentioned a definant must, especially if you have children.
visit. so far so good. too crowd but hong kong is less adventure park. must go 2 times or 3 times per year.

Its more like a small city ! . This park is HUGE and divided into several areas each with a particular theme. The park is so huge that visiting each all the areas by foot is very tiring and impractical if you have children, not to mention time wasting since the park is open for a relatively small time during the day. You have to take the train or the cable car to move around. Anyways its has the best thriller rides in hong kong, wild animals, children rides. Its perfect for all !

Great rides. Ocean Park combines rides and animals. You can have fun and try rides. And you can also get to know about the wild life also. They also selling food. Overall the rides are suitable for teenagers or adults not really suit forbyoung children.
Fun is the only word!. Spending time here allows an adult to be a kid once again! If you are looking for thrilling rides, Ocean Park is the right place.

Bring your walking shoes...its a huge park. We went there on a Thursday and there was hardly any line ups for the rides. We absolutely recommend visiting the park on a weekday.My only complaint was that eve though the park opens it gates at 10am, none of the rides(except the chair lift) operate until 11am...so you're just hanging around for an hour doing nothing...weird.Once everything started operating, we had a lot of fun. We covered the park in one day and managed to get on all the rides and caught a couple of the shows.Getting to the park from Kowllon was quite easy via MTR and then shuttle bus directly to the front gates.

One Fun Full Day at Ocean Park. Spare at least 3/4 day to enjoy all the rides and entertainments. Your entrance ticket is inclusive free for all the rides, entertainments and shows. Try the long and tall cable car rides, see the dolphins, sea lions, penguins, panda, Walrus, and many others. Enjoy Old Hong Kong too...Don't bring any foods to the park (for lunch or whatever) as your bag will be checked at the entrance gate. Water is ok. Wear comfortable shoes and cloths for the rides. I enjoyed the day at Ocean Park.. Worth the visit.

Our trip to Hong Kong. Ocean park is a fun place for all the family members . The cable car was amazing since you can see the green mountain and the ocean is below you . They provide you with English map so you know where you are and where you want to go . They have a lot of lovely animals that are not available else where. One very bad thing happens with us we went in Halloween night and a lot of attractions was poked for some company staff only they refused to let us into this certain attractions which was so annoying since we traveled thousands of miles and for very long hours to be there that was a fetal error from there side .It was really disappointing to all my family specially my daughter .
AMAZING. this is a must to do and see,the views are spectacular from far and wide,this would take approx 1 hour over and 1 hour back

More suitable for teens and adults. We were unlucky as it was a boiling day. The sun was beating down hard and made it difficult to enjoy. The fish were amazing. Dolphin show was a bit let down. We have more sophisticated ones in Kish Island in Iran. Not many rides for kids under 10... would recommend Disney Land but not Ocean Park for kids under 10.
Fun day out.. Worth a visit. The gondola ride across the park gives you a sensational view of the ocean and small islands.

Good adventure place. This place isnt only about fhe thrill rides it's also about the animals and animal shows there. The rides avg 1.5min per ride and they are fun the roller coasters are nice they have 4 and each differ in speed level.The shows are amazing and you have to be in the location 30min before so you find a good place to sit.The most attractive are the animals from the Panda, dolphins, sea lions, penguin and the Koala. Sadly it closes at 6pm and we were not able to see the birds.You won't wait long nor need a fast track if you go on week days and early.

ideal for a fun day. Ocean park was the last place we visited before wrapping up the trip, and yes it was worth it. they have a cable car that connects the land front to the water front based park. its a full day activity with a lot to walk, if you want to take the cable car, go to water front area first, this way the lines/queues are shorter. the water front area has a lot of rides, the best one is the roller coaster overlooking the sea. they also do have dolphin shows and a shark aquarium hosted there. the food options re not much and its pricey as well, they do not let you carry any water or food inside. now to go back to the land front park you can board the express train that is designed to look like a submarine. loved the golden fish arena and panda territory here, they had a huge aquarium, which was not the best that i saw. but ocean park is a suggested activity, can be equally enjoyed by children and adults.
Nice day out. Really need to get there early to appreciate all that's on offer to see. As with all tourists locations, lots of queues wherever you go! Definitely a nice place to take the children!

Pandas!. This was a great place to see the pandas. Two of the four pandas were available for viewing, it was very exciting! Loved the penguins and arctic foxes as well. It was so hot that I just looked at the animals and then left, I didn't ride any rides.

Entertaining park with excellent view around. Situated amidst many islands of HK, this is one place which can entertain all ages of people. Would not recommend for senior citizens though as it involves lot of walking around.Impressive designs of the shops, rides are very inviting and the themed areas are also likeable. The rides are quite basic though but entertain nevertheless. Revolving Macao tower gives panoramic view of the park and topography around from a great height. Enjoyed this Tower ride multiple times (*also given the fact that it was relief to get in air conditioned cabin while it was extremely hot & humid outside ;-))Would recommend to start from the top level as there are more rides and places around there plus the view from top are just beautiful. Cable ride going to top level is a must do thing here. Eating places and choices are limited but quite easily found & available.We went on a clear day however it was hot & humid, advise you to carry enough water and hydrate regularly. Carrying a hat or cap is advised too.On the overall scale, its an enjoyable day out specially for families. Reach there at park opening times to enjoy maximum times once inside & avoid weekends totally. You will waste a lot of time on weekends waiting for rides in long queues. Try to Pre-book tickets and check out for some deals on few portals.

Great park awful staff. Ocean Park is a great park, it's combined amused park with Zoo, with the worst staff and food area you can imagine.I suggest to visit it on a raining day (summer) .The park have introduce recently the fast pass (cost money) but you can only ride 7 different attraction (you can not use for all the same). It worth if there is a lot of people or you don't like queu, as is not too expensive .Also they introduce a great feature that is the app of the park (all park have wifi free) that allow you to reserve 3 attraction of your choice,at a schedule time. you can make only one change... but they give you the schedule so is a bit confuse. Also you can check the waiting time for the attraction.The best views from the island of Hong honk and sourronding areas.BAD THINGS: don't try to buy food or EVEN water 1.5 hour before the park close ... Even they will replay on a very bad mood.Is not one of the employee if not most of the staff . They were so rude and unkind , never smile...If you need a Taxi to Kowloon forget about it... (Or queue for more than 1 hour) Take one to Hong Kong and then cross the bay, is quick the transfer than the queu and the same price...

You can see the world smallest monkey there. very good aquarium, rain forest animals with some activities. You can see giant panda and red pandas but roller coasters are deadly. food and water inside the park is very expensive

Best theme park. It's a good place with lots of rides to be enjoyed by kids, youth, families and aged as well. It also has an adventurous rides like hair raiser (high speed ropy turvy rollercoaster) for people to have raise their heart beat. It also has a flash ride to make the people heads and hairs down in air at a height which makes you nervous for adventurous youth. It's a challenge for anybody to take these rides for the first time as well as second time too. The water fountain show at the end of the day is really an attraction and must a see.
Animals and Theme Park. You can find sea animals and pandas. This theme park is big but unfortunately they close at 6.30pm. You should try the gondola.

Nice mix of rides and animals. We booked tickets online and arrived around 11.30. We walked straight in although lines were minimal at this time on a Monday so it would have been fine. We took others advice and headed straight to the summit side of the park by the train (The cable car was under maintenance unfortunately) and down to the far side. No lines on any of the rides! We rode everything twice without having to re-queue- maybe we were just lucky. By the afternoon this area was much busier. The rides are a mix of carnival style and a few larger roller coasters that are worth a go- the hair raiser by far was the highlight. The animal side of the park was great with a good diversity. I was impressed with the level of care- enclosures were to western standards, keepers were attentive and there was strong conservation messages throughout all shows and graphics. Much of the indoor animal areas were air conditioned too - a life saver on a hot and humid day and great to cool down in between rides.By about 1pm the bus loads of mainland Chinese have all arrived making the park much more crowded for the rest of the day. We spent about 6 hours there and didn't see everything- lots to do for all ages and well worth a visit.
Pandas . Go just for the cable car and pandas - amazing!! Some good fast rides too which are good fun but I was there really for the pandas and gorgeous views, fab day!

Best park in HK. This is a very well managed and diverse park that I personally rate higher than its famous competitor.Pros- It's huge and offers more fun than Disneyland- Some nice sealife displays- Hair Raiser, Dragon and Mine Train are good rides- Nice transport within park using the cable car or train Cons- Hair Raiser requires 140 cm of height, which is a lot. My 8 year old son was not allowed which caused some big sadness. It is more than most other parks require for this kind of attraction and frankly I do not how the Chinese kids cope with this. Similar for Dragon (130 cm). Mine Train is more OK at 120 cm- Ridiculous lines for food around noon time. There is a small McDonalds but no chance we would waste time in the queue.
Penguin encounter. The best park to learn, have lots of fun! The penguin encounter was great, they let you meet and feed the penguins! My favorites are the jelly fish, Panda, Shark and the flash!

Fun day out with kids. Fun day out with the family, the waiting times were not too long. The entrance price was fair, and staff were helpful. The amazing part of the day was the light show at the end of the evening which involved hologram like images with water, sound and fire!! effects. Great day out

No crowds!. Arrived just before 10am after a 10 minute bus trip from Admiralty station. Went straight onto the chairlift and started with rides up the top. No crowds, no waiting, brilliant. Rides were great and kids had a ball. Meal back down the bottom was reasonably priced and okay. Not a bad way to spend a mid-week day in Hong Kong!

Great Park with lots of thrilling rides. Dolphin show was amazing. Our son enjoyed a lot. Rides are good and thrilling. Not that much for smaller kids as very few ride options for my 4 year old son.
Only issue was pathetic staffs at Bay restaurant.
Overall a great experience.

Simply the BEST. Being to Imagica in India, California Adventures etc, but this place is perfect mix of rides and theme based attractions.
All rides were my fav.
but most is Giant aquarium just behind water fountain

Don't bother unless you have kids or are very easily amused. I'm writing this review because before I visited (Nov 2015) with my partner, (we are both in our 20s), it was very unclear that this park is entirely pitched at the 'family' entertainment level. By which I mean all of the rides are extremely tame and would only excite the under 12s. There is absolutely nothing thrilling on the same scale as say Alton Towers in the UK or any of the Orlando theme parks. The animal aspect of the park is also second rate and the enclosures for the larger mammals are particularly sad. None of the food stalls are particularly appetising, and there were reasonably long queues for everything (particularly the chair lift/gondola at the end of the day, around 2 hours!!), despite the fact we visited midweek.Positive aspects: nice views over the bay, if you have young children or have never been to a theme park or aquarium before you may find it reasonably interesting.Bottom line: if you are an adult without children and have limited time in Hong Kong then don't bother coming here.
Nature and Technology in Harmony . Fun day at ocean park, very planned and educative way of information and fun great rides and we'll maintained animal enclosures

A Theme Park of everything. It is not only a theme park of sea world, but there are many other games and highlights to satisfy different visitors. It is a bit crowded with mainly people from mainland China during peak hours and there may be long queues waiting at popular spots.

Fun time. Ocean park offers amazing getaway for a one day outing with friends & kids. The park and numerous rides which everyone will enjoy. One needs to spend the entire day to cover most of the places & rides. Major attraction is the Panda park inside. In addition one should take rope way & reach other end of ocean park which has adventurous rides. I would rate this place better than Disney land any time.
Best Amusement Park in the World. Forget Disney, go to Ocean Park, stay in town... great rides, great views, clean and easy. A cherry on top of your Hong kong Sunday!
Great day. Had a fantastic day here, good facilities , great cable car ride and the Zoo was brilliant, my wife fulfilled a lifelong dream and saw the Pandas

Dated , but still good to visit. lots of walking & a bit hilly, spread over a fairly large area, we visited by bus, stops right outside, as at the time the MTR was not open... yet. there was a lot to see and do, but not much cover when it rained - August bad time to visit HK it seems

A must in HK. Just the cable car ride is worth the trip to Ocean park. Go on a sunny day as under the train, many rides are closed. Go on a week day as it is less packed with tourists. The old HK area is to be visited if one doesn't like rides, bird show, the aquarium with sharks... for those who haven't seen pandas, it's worth visitinh them at Ocean park. A park unique to HK!
More games and lovely place. This is my second time and this time I enjoyed it more tha before, they added more attractions and games that we enjoyed our time in it.
Rollercoasters. Do cable car first then finish all the rides at the top. Have McDonald's for lunch. Then go down again via the ocean express. Look at pandas and fish.

Interesting theme park for children and adults!!!. Both children and adults can enjoy here. One day seems to be not enough to enjoy all the rides and shows.A trip in the Cable car gives beautiful views.Water is quite expensive inside the premises and hence recommended to carry some additional bottles. Water bottles are allowed. But outside food and soft drinks are not allowed.Nice to see playful pandas and funny penguins.

Super. We had a good time , we spent whole day there, esp. Cable car is great. I love this transport style. My kids saw pandas, dolphins, penguins.Also they enjoyed all the games. Only problem is weather ıt was too hot. If you are planing to go, take an umbrella or hat also extra food with you. Food prices higher than we think, take care of it.
Amazing experience. Highly recommended for everyone.You get to see animals(pandas/penguins/ dolphins' show and so much more) and play on roller coasters.

After so long, i laugh till i cried. went there early morning on weekdays. not so many people. Grab chance to take photo infront of their big logo. Some of the rides are on maintenance during my visit. but worth the visit. quite challenging but short time rides. suits for everyone. i even saw 70 years old grandpa accompanying his grandchildren play the ride. so totally safe. ticket bought cheap at online website.

Must Visit !. Its a nice place for kids and adults as there are so many rides/ activities to do. It was a tiring day but well spent! My son was thrilled seeing the panda & the kangaroo !! Really enjoyed!

Fun and so beautiful . It's completely different Disneyland and ocean park both I love and so much fun we enjoy a lot. The Dolphins show, the cable car, the aquarium and many more. everything was so well organized. Will no regret visit this place.

Fun Filled day out with family. the park has easy access and easy to find, go prepared to walk a long distance inside asn prepared to spent a whole day there. if visiting during a local holiday season advisable to get the quick access pass at the gate.. the tickets are decently priced but with quick access pass tends to appear pricey. there are numerous rides inside, animal site seeing, the dolphin show.. drink lots of fluids,, travel light,, and u ll enjoy the place..

For the kids and kids at heart. We went here on a weekday and still its a ltittle crowded. Weather was cold. We went up to the summit first via the cable car. It was fun and the view was amazing. Only few people were there and we enjoyed the rides and attractions. We made our way down via the ocean express. They let us skip the long line and we were prioritized to board the train because we had kids in strollers. So nice people!
love it. It's a great place for your family, friends, couples to go to. Many attractions eg. roller coasters, kiddy land, exhibitions of fish/sharks/pandas etc, Fun experience. Food is great too!

Excellent place. Ocean park is awesome, if you don't have enough time & given an option between ocean park & Disney Land please without giving second thought go for ocean park. Totally loved it. Awesome rides, underwater world.. beautiful aquariums..

Fun day out. Park was easy to find and access. Well set out and signed well. Several rides not operating which was disappointing. Cable car ride to the summit fun and peaceful. FasTrack tickets are worthy of the $150HKD per person and on most of the rides it was a plus to jump the queue. Food wasn't to expensive with combos between $50-$110 HKD

Inhumane Treatment of the Animals. Avoid the chaos and ill-treatment of the animals.Animals do not belong in cages on display like this. The animals are so adorable. However, their living conditions are deplorable. it's not a good lesson to bring children to such a park, it teaches inhumane treatment of animals.The park was so crowded with PRC group tours due to the low pricing of the tickets.Overall, not a pleasant experience and should be avoided.

Great and value for money. Ocean park is great for a day trip. I took the bus from admiralty mtr and it was only about 5-10 mins. The park open at 10am but they let you in before that, so arrive early. I bought my tickets from klook, cheaper and there is no need to exchange tickets. Just use the barcode to scan for entry. There are 2 areas in ocean park. The waterfront and the summit. Once inside, take the tram or cable car to the summit where there are more rides and stuff to see. The waterfront only has kiddy rides, aquarium, polar bear and koala. You can come see these in the evening, before closure. Food is expensive, go for McDonald's if on a budget. They allow you to bring water bottles and there are water cooler for you to refill. Do not forget to watch the light show just before closure, it's at the big fountain near the entrance. The show is very nice. On the way back, we took the mini bus direct back to mongkok for hkd 23 each. There were a lot of people shouting, so you won't miss it.

one day trip is not enough. Huge marine theme park located on the mountainous hilly side on the southern part of hong kong island. Around 45 mins by bus number 629 from Admiralty MTR station. Unlike Disneyland in Lantau Island this park offers more choices of entertainment. If you are a thrill seekers then this park is for you. It has both extreme thrilling and family friendly rides, marine shows, cable cars or underground train connecting both parts of the park, and mini zoo. Soon this park will be reacheable by MTR train but don't know when as the rail construction is in progress. Wheel chair and kids stroller are available for rent.
Holiday. This really good place to play and so many thing that we can play. I like this place than disneyland. But both of them really good place.

Outdoor themepark. I love the cable car -beautiful panoramic hk. Eventhough it had a long line it was a short time waiting. Unfortunately it was raining when we went so during rainy season make sure to bring umbrella or raincoat -cost of a raincoat hkd40. Make sure to finish all activities in the ground area then have lunch before u ride in a cable car if ure scared u have an option to ride in a express service (train) In the mountain area you will experience fast rides so dont forget to bring extra shirt you might get wet from one of the rides.

Nice play with more grown up kids. Pros:1- Huge place with variety of attractions.2- Will maintained3- They have Panda :)4- They allow you to bring your own food and drinks with youCons:1- food and drinks are so expensive, a bottle of water cost 30 HK$ - out side 5-6 dollars2- I was glad that they had an outlet with Halal food. However the oven was out of order and the choices were limited to 2 dishes.3- Age and hight restrictions are bit more than what other theme parks would do. My kids missed a lot of games that they used to ride in other parks.

Check weather before going. . Ocean park is quite big n has many different kind of rides.raining on n off when we went there so remember to check weather forecast b4 going else u will b taking shelter if it rains.

Holiday at ocean park. Wanna see the giant panda is very hard to match the time bcause the panda mostly sleep. But for little panda at least we can see the activity. Everything ok but for moslem it is not easy to find halal food so we only eat fruit that selling in ocean park.

Annual pass better than single ticket. Havent visited for a long time. One day tour is not suffice. It takes at least two or three days to visit all the spots. An annual pass is recommended if u really like to play and ride in the whole park.

Best place to visit in Hongkong . The place is at par with Disneyland. More rides more thrills and frills. You need to prioritise the parks and rides in advance as it is very difficult to see all in a single day. But it's a must must go and do list if visiting Hongkong.

Thrilling rides. Ocean park is awesome. Thrilling rides - Hair raiser is my fav. Wear comfortable shoes as theres quite a bit of walking. We have annual passes so we get fast tracked (I think its about 5 rides per day) but what a good thing to have when the lines are backed right up. Our fav place to eat there and seems least expensive is near the bottom of the park by Mine carts? The wooden roller coaster overlooking the ocean.

A memorable part of my life happened here.... This is place is so amazing! The staff were so accommodating and friendly. When I contacted them before to help me organize my wedding proposal, they were very eager. We were the one who interacted with the sea lions in the meet and greet. Then right after, they played our song and I proposed to her. This was January 31, 2013. And now, we have a 1 year old boy and another one coming :) Thank you so much HK Ocean Park!Oh, by the way, the rides and attractions here are so awesome!!!

" best for kids Knowledge". its such a big and its on the hills, its start from 10:30, after reaching there u first take the cable/ train which one is easily available to reach on top. there are so many aquarium for fishes all kind of see animal is there, dolphins show is good one 3 time a day make sure you reach early to take your sit there. almost 2000 people are there to watch the show. pl do not list disney land next day because its very tried, make one day gap. Monday to Friday almost 5-7k people is there, food court is there,( Mc donalds, pizza,) water is easily available free of cost and paid one also. carry empty bottle. don't carry big trolly bag.
Great holiday. It's the perfect place to enjoy and have fun, the train and so many slides, we saw the giant Banda but shame was sleeping hehe.Ideal place to have a quality time with your kids.
You will have fun!!. No matter you want excitement or want to have fun with animals, you will have fun in this one of the best amusement park in the world!!

Excellent theme park. A theme park combining the merits of Sea World with another section of rides and games for youngsters. Suitable for all ages.Very convenient outlying location soon after the opening of the MTR extension.

What a lovely world!. Since we were grown ups, we chose ocean park over Disney land and I think it was a wise choice. Start early in the morning and reach here using the bus( a metro station is also coming up). We came prepared for rains and had already bought plastic overalls from a 7-11 before starting journey. Tickets should be bought online from klook for great discounts. There was already a line before the park opened. And do not forget to take a map. Once inside, do not wait to see any attraction on the entrance, quickly move towards the ropeway and reach the upper section of the park(you will see some beautiful views from the ropeway). Cover the Adventureland first and move backwards. This way you will be going against the crowd and beating the lineup happening. Please go to all the aquarium and animal enclosure. There is such amazing and important information shared there. You will understand the impact of human activities on the marine environment. Try to catch the dolphins show in ocean theatre. Cover the fun rides as you finish each area( we went for all roller coaster and scary ones since we didn't have any kids with us). Have lunch at thrill mountain and then take the train down. From now, your legs should start aching, but now it's the most peaceful part of the park. It's mainly panda and the aquarium now( like the one in finding Dory). You would find hoards of mainland China groups who may irritate you, but tell yourself this is the last part of the journey and enjoy while you are here. We spent around 6 hours here and were dead tired by the time we reached to hotel. Do not miss this place for anything !

Quite fun. Took 629 from admiralty station took less than 25min to reach. The animals exhibits are good. We enjoyed. Quites a numbers of rides for the kid is above 122cm. The ride to summit is nice too.

Amazing world. One day not enough to cover it all.
It's really great place especially for families who have kids.
There are many options in this park.

Nice Rides and Fun.... Ocean Park is nice place to visit...you need full day to exp the entire Ocean park....The entry ticket cost is HK$385 if you buy at entrance of Ocean Park...However you can get the cheaper if you buy at Admiralty MTR Station for HK$ 355 and even HK$300 in some places in Tshim Sha Tsui...Now to go to Ocean Park through Public transport is really convenient... alight at Admiralty MTR...take City bus no 629...we can use the Octopus card also for Citybus...Now to start...there is one Fastpass track ticket available at counter for HK$150 which can be use to skip the long waiting ques for various attractions, but the disappointing part is we can only use 7 Attractions out of available 14 with that fastpass ticket including cable car...waiting time in cable car is usually 60 mins...in weekends....Rides :- Do visit the these breathtaking rides at Ocean Park.1. The Flash at Thrill Mountain2. Hair Crushier at Thrill Mountain3. The Dragon at Marine World4. The Abbys at Marine World5. Mini Train at Adventure Land6. Ranging River at Adventure Land..Overall exp is really good.....there is light show at nigh at around 8'o clock.....its good.

It's Ocean Park - I'm so excited. Ocean Park - still as fab as it's always been with one awesome cable car ride and now even more exciting theme park rides and roller coasters. You must take the cable car ride - the views are incredible, over Deep Water Bay. So many childhood memories for me and it was amazing to show my little guys what I'd always loved about Ocean Park.Can get busy during the peak seasons but great fun. And there's a new hotel and MTR station opening up at Ocean Park very soon - even better!

Amazing park !. The park is divided into two parts and I felt that I need two days at least to explore the whole park. Very good rides for teenagers I liked the wooden roller coster, the viewing tower was fun , you can see the whole park from there

Great experience. The park is one of its kind. It offers you lot of adventrous rides try to njy them all. You will have lot of waiting for rides so plan for good rides in the evening. Peiple generally stuck at the rides which are first on the way. .Try using ocean express and cable car both to reach to different places in ocean park.It is too big and needs one full day. They do have laser ligght show in the night which is again worth watching..Bay watch restraunt offers you a great view but bit costly. There are some snack corners all along The way in park so no worries. Make sure you come in early to avoid crowd.Weekday is preferred.For transportReach to Admirelty mtr station and take bus 269 just outside the station.It is a Best way to reac ocean park.

Pandas!!. For westerners the pandas are a big draw. They have both Giant Pandas and Red Pandas. The panda enclosure was visited by more westerners than locals unsurprisingly and is close to the entrance.The site is split in two and the cable car up and over the hill splitting the two sides has a nice view.We were with a 7 year old so Disney was better for us overall, but this is the place to come for bigger rides.Disney are trying to stop the big problem of mainlanders queue jumping but it is left unchecked here which is really annoying.They let you bring in drinks and snacks which Disney don't.It is easy to get here by bus from Admiralty and it looked as if the MTR station is close to completion.

Better than Disney. As I didn't have much time in HK, I was hesitating between Disney and Ocean Park and I am so glad I chose Ocean Park because it has more thrilling rides and aquariums. Cable car rides is a must to get to the majority of the attractions because most of it is located behind tall mountains but you are blessed with spectacular views of the sea and HK city.Unfortunately, we travelled during June which is the hottest season and the temperature was humid and very warm (about 36 degrees). We got dizzy and almost suffered from a heat stroke and always had to look for air-conditioned places to cool off. My advise is to always have a water bottle with you and hydrate yourself (there are water coolers around to refill). Food is slightly pricer (there is McDonald's there but the price is higher than normal) hence you can consider packing your own lunch.Overall, I would say its a good place to visit if you love thrills. Wear good shoes (lots of walking there) and hydrate yourself :)

highly recommended. Went here with the family and I can say the place was huge, friendly atmosphere and well run compared to the neighboring theme park - disneyland. If I can only choose 1 theme park, ocean park vs disney I would say this is a better choice personally as it is bigger, have more rides and less crowded. Again this is only my personal opinion and based on my kids enjoyment having visited both places in the same week.
wheelie good day out. This is a very good park, well worth the money, they have an excellently stocked aquarium and is also very wheelchair friendly

Great aquarium and show. The aquarium of this park is great. A lot of sting rays, sharks, and other large fishes. There are also fishes for coral reefs.  The show for the dolphins and seals is very good too.  We purchase our tickets online and printed them out. This enables us to go direct to the park without having to queue for the tickets.  They are now building a subway station to Ocean Park. Now it is not yet functioning.

Very crowded but lots of fun. There are many rides and many things to do at this attraction. We came early at 10:30 a.m. and there were already a lot of people. Once we got in we found out a few rides were closed, so we basically spent the entire time indoors. The dolphin show was spectacular and I enjoyed most of the time at Ocean Park.
Good day out. Many trips over the years - can be very busy at Peak times like Chinese New Year though. Great aquarium, fun cable car.

So much fun!. We had a super fun time at Ocean Park, it has so many things to do and things for people of all ages and interests to enjoy. As well as having a huge theme park there is also an aquarium and other animals on display such as giant pandas, red pandas, arctic foxes, penguins, dolphins, sharks and many more. The park is mainly marine themed but also has other areas such as the arctic zone and Asian animals. The park is divided by a huge hill and you can get to the summit by taking the cable cars or the train- I would highly recommend taking the cable cars on the way up to the summit as you get some beautiful views going up. There are lots of rides for people of all thrill seeking levels- some of our favourites were the Hair Raiser, arctic express, whirly bird, minetrain, raging rapids and the dragon. As mentioned, there are also other live exhibits that you can visit to view animals- these all seem to be well looked after and happy. There are plenty of places to eat- food is more expensive than most other places in Hong Kong but this is to be expected in a big theme park. We had lunch in the Bayview café which has lovely views over the bay and the food was delicious.Be prepared to do A LOT of walking and set aside a whole day as the park is huge but well worth trekking around to see as much as possible. I would definitely advise booking tickets in advance to beat the queues at the entrance and also opt for fast track tickets too. The fast track tickets mean that you can skip the main queue for 7 attractions- we saved these for the big rides and the cable cars and saved so much time queuing up. Ocean Park is definitely not to be missed when in Hong Kong!
Good place . The park worth the visit. You can enjoy the rides and the off course the view. Try to go in a clear day as some rides maybe close if the weather is not good.

Kids still love it. It is super hot this summer in Hong Kong, we went there for three times as my bro has annual pass that can redeem two free child tickets. If you visit Hong kong, you can go " Sa Sa" to buy some thing, they will give you a coupon for 15 % off. or you can just go to MtR admirably station to get discount ticket ( hkd30 off), bus fair not included, so better to get a MTR card, you can take the direct bus fro admiralty station to Ocean park. Don't need to line up at the Bus station to buy ticket, there are plenty of counters at the main gates.

Awesome rides!. The place is so cool! It offers different rides from traditional to extreme ones, the animal in captivity are also a must see feature of this place, they have an express ocean train going to the summit which is the other part of the theme park located at the top of a mountain, they also have a cable car going to the other side which gives you a breathtaking view of the hongkong islands. The food here are reasonably cheap compare to the other theme park in hong kong.

A waste of money and a waste of time don't come. . I am so frustrated with the day I am spending in Ocean park that I am actually doing this review now. We are a family of 4. 1 12 year old and 1 15 year old. We came here for the rides primarily and then for the animals. The doors open at 10 but none of the rides start until 11am. Then you find out that 4 of the rides are closed for maintenance including one of the biggest roller coasters 'there is no mention of this outside the gates before you come in or on the website' then there were another 2 that we temporarily closed while doing maintenance. There aren't a huge amount of rides here. So we managed to do 3 rides before it started to rain. What you wouldn't believe is once it starts to rain they stop all of the rides. It's a tropical country. It rains here all the time. I went to customer relations to ask if when the rides will start again. And they say "when it stops raining" at this time it has virtually stopped. So the animals are good, the food is expensive but that's expected. But don't come here for the rides just in case it rains.

Perfect way to spend the day. Super packed and hot on the day we visited ... Kids loved it ... Queues were long but buying the fast track helped ... It is a bit of an odd system where you can only use it on a ride once (ie no repeat) but worked out ok for us

Best Theme Park in Hong Kong. The marine themed Ocean Park is the largest theme park in Asia and one of the most visited in the World. A hill within the park divides it into the Waterfront and the Summit. A cable car and the Ocean Express funicular are available to travel between the two. The Summit is hilly and several escalators are available to take the visitors up and down to the various attractions.The park is divided into several zones including the Aqua City, Amazing Asian Animals and Whiskers Harbour in the Waterfront area and the Polar Adventure, Rainforest, Marine World, Adventureland and the Thrill Mountain at the Summit.The main attractions in the Park are the Grand Aquarium which houses various types of marine creatures, Panda Village, Penguins at the South Pole spectacular, Old Hong Kong with the Cable Car station and the Australian Adventures, Pacific Pier and the Shark Mystique. There are several roller coasters and rides including two wet ones and a walking trail.Main shows include Emperors of the Sky - a bird show at the Amazing Bird Theatre, Ocean Wonders marine show at the Ocean Theatre and the Symbio musical fountains and pyrotechnic show in the evening at the Aqua City Lagoon. The ocean show features dolphins and sea-lions while the bird show provides an opportunity to take photos with colorful macaws.Children will love the attractions, games and shows at the Whiskers Harbour. Several restaurants located around the park serve all kinds of cuisines. Some of the restaurants at the summit provide great views over the South China sea. The fully enclosed Ocean express has screens displaying underwater scenes giving an impression of being in a submarine. The park also hosts animal contact and feeding programs which enable the visitors to get close to the animals in a safe way.The park is huge and provides something for everybody whatever your interests although you need to be fit to enjoy it fully since it involves a lot of walking and climbing. A discounted annual pass is available for frequent visitors. A marine breeding and . The park is also involved in the breeding, research, rescue and rehabilitation of animals marine animals.The park is one of the foremost attractions in Hong Kong and is not to be missed. Budget a full day to enjoy it fully.

Cable car trip of a lifetime. This has to be one of the most amazing cable car rides in the world. It climbs up over Hong Kong with incredible views then takes you up into the mountains. We chose the glass bottomed crystal car so we could enjoy full views as we travelled from island to island. We finally caught site of the Buddha and temple- inspirational!

Poor at best - cruel at worst.. Summary: visited as a couple from UK, found the amount and quality of rides to be poor. Most zoo animals in small and cramped conditions, however the park was very clean and tidy and staff were friendly and helpful.Full review:We purchased our tickets from the MTR station tourist information which was a wise move as not only were they cheaper, but we avoided the long ticket booth queues upon arrival. Traveling to the park via bus was quick, easy and cheap so it is certainly a good way to travel.Being the holidays, the park was very busy all day however the queues for the attractions were certainly not as long as they could have been. Most of the staff on rides moved quickly to load the rides to keep the queues moving. Generally, the staff and the appearance of the park was the biggest highlight. All staff we interacted with were friendly and helpful, and the park's appearance was impeccable throughout.In terms of the ride offering, excluding the fairly new Hair Raiser ride, all other attractions are dated by any countries standards. The Hair Raiser ride is fantastic, however apart from that, the park is lacking any sort of attraction that can't be found at another park elsewhere.Regarding the animals, the only show we saw was the Sealion and Dolphin show where the park have opted for the theatrical approach rather than an educational one. Other shows I have seen in the UK are of far better quality where the trainer explains how the animal is cared for and explains some facts about them. At Ocean Park, the trainer acted as a confused explorer who was bemused to see dolphins splashing around.
