Neither of us found it amusing, and in my opinion it failed to pay due respect to the amazing creatures that were part of the show.Regarding the rest of the animals, some enclosures seemed okay (when comparing to other zoos) yet others were either very overcrowded or severely cramped. The most shocking of which was the Sealion enclosure in the North/South pole encounter area - two Sealions crammed into a space that was far smaller than the average swimming pool.The food we had was expensive and poor, however in an amusement park, this is to be expected.

Family. The place is good for all ages. Bring snacks and food lots of it.I preferred this over Disney, variety of rides for children of different ages.Take the train ried up and the cable down.The games are expensive and try to avoid those.Walk your way down if you ever attempt to bring kids to the water play area make sure you are able to supervise as there are just too many kids and some adults in there.
The view from the goldola is amazing. A great place to take kids. The rollercoasters are great for the older kids and adults. Remember to take bathing togs as there are places to get wet and swim.

OK way to spend your day. I went on a Tuesday and a number of the less adventurous rides were closed as were a number of food outlets which are mainly catered towards Asian tastes. I found it difficult to find something to eat particularly when you finally find a dish you like only to be told it's not available. I started the day with a cable car ride. Not a fan of heights so I took the Ocean Express train back down. If you have any mobility issues you may find it hard to get around up at the summit. Lots of hills to contend with. The waiting times for rides were on average 10-20 minutes. The exhibits are ok. Given the size of the park I thought the enclosures would be bigger. Expected more animals and less displays. The dolphins were cool but too much talking by the presenter. Went to a number of shows but in some there was no English translation (bird show) or there was extremely limited English spoken too fast (seal feeding) so I had no idea what was going on until the presenters were waving and saying bye bye. It was a nice way to spend the day but it will probably be a one time only visit.

awesome. this place is sooooooo lovely..a lot..adventure ..i enjoyed it sooo much even i almost feel dizzy riding some..and its sooo lovely when i ride you can see all the views from then top..also the panda is so cute..i want more to come and over and over again..

great ocean experience. ocean park hong kong has so much to give. very beautiful place. the ocean express is so cool and the cable car experience. tip is you have to download ocean park app to get discounts on restaurants, shopping, bakery... the special effects during the fountain show was so amazing

Awesome day but some rude locals!. The attraction itself is worth the visit with lots of stuff to do for both adults and children, we spent most of our day there and the time flew by mostly because of the queue, so I would defiantly recommend buying a fast pass.My only negative experience was how shockingly some of the locals are, specially when they are within a group, they skip queue and tend to push their way through, I thought that was very disrespectful to the tourists and the staff did nothing about it!

plenty for all the family to do. This place can get overrun with mainland tourists and there can be cultural misunderstandings but if you get there early and invest in the fastpasses which mean you can queue jump it is great! cable cars a must, what a view! children have to be 122cm tall for most rides, 133 for a couple of the big ones.The animals and aquariums appear well looked after and in good condition, my children enjoyed this part of the park a lot.The park is very spread out and there is plenty of walking so wear comfy shoes and try to go on a cooler day!

You better have a plan...... We arrived 1/2 hr early & waited with @ 500 people. Once the gates open it's a cattle call. We went to the peak 1st... Awesome! Hair Raiser... AWESOME!!!Terrace View Cafe for lunch....stunning views, pretty good food but pricey ($60 USD) for my wife & I. Nice panda exhibit...too many rides to get to in 1 day.Ocean Park Express bus was perfect way to get to the park!
Ocean and more. Ride the cable car, a fast train, see the aquarium, dine while viewing the sea or the sea creatures, read and learn, be amazed, watch the dolphins and the birds, have fun.

Awesome park for both adults and families. Ocean Park is one of my favorite attractions in Hong Kong. I've been here several times. This park is a combination of a zoo and theme park. There are so many animal attractions that you can easily spend 5 hours just looking at those. You can see penguins (my favorite), seals, dolphins, several pandas, an awesome aquarium, jelly fish - sea jelly spectacular, sharks - shark mystique, and more. If you want to go on the rides, good luck standing in line. It can take a good long time. Also, I recommend going to the Ocean Express first. Come back on the cable car. Usually, there isn't a line or at least there hasn't been when I left the other side at around 2 pm. Plan on getting to the park right when it opens usually at 10 am and plan on staying until around 4 or 5 pm. Have fun you'll love it if you really like animals!

You must be 100% Fit !. Great settings! Up in the mountain! Stunning view in a cable car. So much to do and ride. Food is expensive on the cable car cafe but check the Old Hongkong alley affordable. Beautifull fish/marine collection and Panda . Always bring extra Clothes for children as heaps of water activities to have.

Big park with a lot of activity . It is big , 2. Person for 800. HKD , there is a good aquarium there , you can see sharks, car Caple is the best , some shows start many times there , we try to see Panda but it is sleep , this place good for kids .

Great day out. But difficult to see it all in a day Fantastic setting with the rides on a mountain top accessed by a cable carSomething for all the family Try to gain entry from opening time to get maximum benefit from your ticket Some great rides and things to seeA truly world class attraction

Holiday visit. The experience was amazing. We enjoyed every part of it.There is so much to do at ocean park. Unfortunately the time we got there the dolphins part of the park was closed so did not get to see them . Otherwise the views are phenominal.By far beats Sea World in Orlando in my opinion.

Great Fun, and the Panda's. Great park, it was raining quite a bit, but this did not spoil our enjoyment. This was booked as part of a tour, and we visited a jewellery factory also - this was ok, but a bit Pricey, if I was to go again I would just go directThe park was good, especially the Panda's, actually that made it worthwhile. The rides were good as were the beautiful views. A great day out.

Be prepared. When going to ocean park the smart thing to do is buy your entry ticket before you go, also very handy would be a brolly, it keeps the sun and the rain at bay,---if you don't you will be in a Q in the heat for some time at the ticket counter, that's after you've stood in a Q for the bus to get there, The bus that takes you there goes from admiralty MTR station,If you don't want to Q for the rides or the cable car, for an extra charge you get 7 fast passes, we took them and it was worth it, -- it was 33 deg on the day we went and the fast pass was a great way of not standing in the heat for some time waiting to get on the attractions, ocean park was a much better day out than Disney, there are more rides and it's much bigger.-- coming back on the cable car at night was breathtaking -- when leaving the park be prepared for a Q for the bus back to. Admiralty station on the MTR, you can of course get a taxi --- they are currently building an MTR station to right outside the venue so in the future it will be much easier and quicker to get there, I only hope they can do something about the Q for ticket sales, the MTR will drop a lot more people than a few buses,

Huge Park ⛲ . This place is awesome. You can be adventurous by riding rollercoasters and etc or just wanna go around and enjoy the scenery on their cable cars. Best time to come here though is during winter season. We were there during summer and so damn hot. Wheew!
A great day out!!. Many things to do and see! The gondola ride is great!! Fantastic day out for young and old!! Do not miss!

'Kids day out". Kids will love this place!! lots of rides, cute pandas, cable ride to the top of the mountain, a well maintained aquarium. A perfect day out of kids and teens. Long queues are the only dissatisfiers here, you may try the underground train while returning from top.

One day is definitely not enough.. Went here with our company, I thought out bus tour guide was just exaggerating that one day is not enough to tour around, but it's true! We went inside in a rainy day, but the weather turned so HOT! I think I burned my skin here. The rides were awesome, also the shops are cheaper, what I love the most was the cable car ride and the Old Hong Kong City part!Also kids would love that Spongebob area, I forgot what it was called, but you all will get wet!For Filipino's out there, I suggest Bayview Restaurant to eat, a proud Filipina was in there serving your delicious foods!I expected a tunnel aquarium with the Grand Aquarium though, but turned out not. :( also that

Not bad. Got the evening tickets. Not as hot as compared to the morning. Visited on Wednesday. Queue time reasonable. Roughly 30mins. Drinks is pricey so if on budget, get it outside. 28 HKD for a mineral water. 150 HKD if you want fast track, would be better with the evening ticket as its only 4 to 8pm.

Fantastic day out. We visited Ocean Park on a free day of a business trip. It was delightful.Well worth a visit and so much to see and do.For the youngsters and young at heart are the roller coaster rides and fun rides. We didn't go on any but the people looked to be having tremendous fun and at some places you can spray water at unsuspecting ride goers on a water ride - fun for any age !!We visited all the exhibits, which was so interesting.We started with the panda's which are just super. We then headed for the aquarium which is great (the queue can be long and longer when raining as indoors so most people head there). We then took the train (definitely worth a ride ! Inside looks like a submarine and the journey is interesting) to the other side of the park. There you find a whole host of further interesting things to see and do.We visited the Poles and it's quite incredible to see the Pacific walrus and others, the shark mystique is incredible, the rainforest, just lots of great exhibits.To get back to the other side you can go by the train again or cable car - your choice and having done both would recommend both for enjoyment.This place caters for all, kids, bigger kids, grown ups and pensioners.There are places to get food and drink snacks. We stayed right until closing and they have a very interesting show to end the day.Would definitely recommend.We travelled there by bus from town (Island Hong Kong) and it was very easy. Bus's all waiting to take you back after closing (and before).
Long waiting times!!!. Would not recommend due to the extremely long waiting times 1.5 hours for any rides in 35 degree heat! Extremely crowded

I like going to the playground with my friends because we are happy there. I like Ocean Park. You have more knowledge and understanding in the nature, marine life& conservation after visiting HK Ocean Park. But beyond that, we enjoy ourself, the facilities are great.

The Kids Loved It. A mix between an amusement park and Sea World. The rides aren't as exciting as what you get in Los Angeles, and the shows weren't as exciting or polished as what you get at Sea World, but the kids loved it. Closes at 5 or 6, so get there early.
Must visit with kids. This place will make you a child. Awesome Place. I thing two days even not sufficient to see all rides.

Awesome theme park, a must visit!. We visited this park on a normal Friday. If you are taking the bus to the theme park like most people do, be sure you have bought the entrance tickets beforehand as they don't allow people without entrance tickets to board the bus.There was a huge crowd from early morning so we thought all the rides will have long queues too but fortunately that is not the case. Most of the thrilling rides require us to queue on an average of 15-30 minutes only. The more thrilling the ride the shorter the queue, we did not have to queue up for The Flash at all, which I have to say is extremely exhilarating. Hair raiser is another nerve-racking ride. Don't try these rides if you get nauseous easily though.Moreover you can watch animals there like pandas, seals, penguins, walruses, sharks, dolphins etc. We did not watch the shows due to lack of time but if you're going with children it is worth a try.Food here is extremely expensive (HKD80 for a hot dog), if you get hungry you can get takeaways in a McD outlet here. Yes it's more expensive than those outside but still better than other stalls that sells hot dogs/meals. There are water coolers near McD to quench your thirst so there is no need to buy the pricey mineral water there (HKD15 for 500ml!). They check your bags before you enter the park so you can't bring heavy meals in from outside.Ocean park is highly recommended if you enjoy theme parks but Disneyland is above your budget. It's better to go on normal weekdays as the crowd is insane during weekends/holidays. Arrive early before 10am so you have ample time to enjoy the whole park.

Not worth a visit with younger children. We were quite a bit disappointed about our trip to Ocean park.You will find limited things to do for young children (4 and 7 years old). A large number of attractions are not accessible for our children due to their size. Although both can enter similar attractions in other amusement parks. Seems security standards at Ocean park are much more strict compared to others.Besides the attractions there are several animal shows, but this needs careful timing to make sure you are in the right place at the right time. Another disappointment was that when visiting the panda, there was no animal around…Also food in the restaurant was very expensive for the quality received.

Such a great place to spend the day. with or without kids or anywone else!. spent the better half of a nice hot summers day here. I recommend going straight to the top part. -take the cable car up on the 10 minute ride. The top part has all the rides and a few animal attractions. once been up the top, go back down either via cable car or the express train which is unique.. it has led screens inside and shows images as the train 'passes through the mountain and the centre of the earth' - but it has air con!down below is more animal related and gift shops. Great thrill rides, great animal displays. - definatly worth the trip out!Can currently catch the bus out here but they are building an MTR stop.

Fantastic theme park with a difference.... Excellent theme park - full day from 10am to 17pm for us. Great quality attraction with thrill rides and wildlife (including giant pandas !!!). Wildlife exhibits done really well.Penguins, sharks, seals, walruses, pandas, jellyfish etc etcMy top tips;1) Buy your tickets in advance from any 7Eleven store in the city thus avoiding the ticket queue.2) Get the taxi there for 10am opening. Taxi is about $60-70 from Causeway Bay, so very cheap.3) Head straight for the cable car base station and head up to the summit attractions first and then work your way back to base (by 2pm the park is heaving and all the big rides are at the top)4) on your way to the cable car base station stop at Ricky's Shack and buy "jump the queue" tickets at $150 per head (no child price).You will thank me for these - the queues get very long (1hr+) yet the priority access queues are complete empty. The tickets allow you (one) priority access entry to each of 7 of about 9 big rides. That's about $20 per ride to save an hour on each...5) use one of your 7 priority accesses to jump the line onto the cable car at the base station and get to the summit early and before the crowds. I suggest to dave another for your return journey on the cable car (you will be hot and tired by mid afternoon and not feel like another hour long queue)6) IMO, the best big rides are the dragon, mine train, hair raiser, raging river, rapids, abyss. Plus arctic blast for younger ones.7) choose your first ride and go their straight away. If you are at the summit early, as I have suggested then you won't need to use one of your priority accesses.8) after your first ride, go to the south pole and then north pole experiences to see the fantastic penguin seal and walrus exhibits9) thereafter, do you other choice of rides as you want. Use all your priority accesses except for one if you don't want to queue for the cable car back.10) take lots of bottled water. It is hot here and water is expensive. There are various food outlets all seem OK. There is a McDonald's if you must..11) the snow cone from the ice cream sellers (basically a form of slush puppy) was a good way of keeping the kids hydrated and cool $45 each12) save time on the return to the base resort for the pandas and aquarium. The pandas are a must do.13) get taxi home. Bit of a queue but OK. mtr or bus as alternatives (cheaper).All in all - a fab day !!!

Ocean Park Rides. Get ready for some thrilling rides and ocean view atop mountains while riding the ropeway. The day we visited the place it was cloudy and rained a bit. Travelling with kid , there are many rides out of bound but there are still plenty of water rides. Opt for online Ocean Park Hong Kong - Admission + Meal Combo ticket available on Klook.

very hot day at ocean park. it was very very hot and sunny day at ocean park. we couldn't go on any ride because of the massive queues. we stood in a queue for an hour to get to see the aquarium. we liked the spongebob theme, but there were no proper restaurants there.

Rides Rides Ocean Park. Disneyland HK was for my kids but Ocean Park was for me...Here the rides are much scarier and exciting than disneyland but there are lots of rides for the kids as well and other stuff like huge aquarium, panda zoo, etc. Ocean Park is for everyone from kids to adult...Thank you Ocean Park.
Ocean park. Very good place to visit...A day is less to complete all d activity...most trilling amuesment rides....

Great park however crowded.. Great park, with nice rides for most ages, dolphin show, aquarium, giant pandas, gondola.Quite crowded.Attended evening session with lower ticket prices and cooler weather. Take shuttle bus from central.Dolphin show is recommended.Beautiful views from gondola and upper area of park.

Long queues, short coasters . This place was fun but overly crowded. After waiting through a very hot queue you get on the coasters and they are really short. The most disappointing ride was the rapids as it was just a bunch of things squirting water on you and not any action. The animal exhibits were done at a really high level which was nice to see and a good place to cool off.
so much to see and do. really enjoyed ocean park. you definitely need more then a day we loved to see the pandas even though we had to wait to see them awake would love to go back

Very nice, large but complicated. We have visited with park with three kids. Its a nice large park. However, it is very complicated. Not like u can easily find out where u need to go to see everything.Also we were in the summer and it was super crowded bcoz of the summer holidays at school.We have seen pandas. Tried two or three attractions. But we couldnt use the tides bco lines were at least 80-90min long.It was unbelievably humid and hot and overall was a tiring experience. I think if u go there during other less hot months mayb u will have a better experience.

Brilliant. Great park with loads to do. Recommend booking online as 10% cheaper. We got fast pass tickets which were useful although only valid to use 7 times.Arrived early and queued to get in. Generally people do the part of the park at the front first. We used our fast passes on the cable car and jumped the queue and did the Summit park first. This was very quiet and we didn't have to queue for any rides at all.Great fun.
Very nice place. Try to go in weekdays for happy time with less visitors.no need for fast track.also take some snacks with you because couldn't find good food for Muslims.
Very good for child. This is better than Disney land but sad that they don't have concessionary tickets for Elderly from other countries , Found it very discriminatory .

great amusement park with hair raiser its best ride. We went on sunny day which was the worst decision and could not enjoy till 3 pm in the afternoon becoz of the sunny weather. But after moving to the upper part of the park and enjoying rides line hair raiser and artic experience our day was made. Ocean park definetly has lot of activities for person of all age group.

Top HK attraction. Ocean Park is still one of the top attractions in HK, and the best theme park in the region. Even though often hideously crowded, it is a must for first time visitors to HK, and staple entertainment for local families.
Great!. this is a must visit in Hong Kong - definitely worth it and so much to see and do. We thoroughly enjoyed it. Also took a taxi there and back from HK Island which was reasonable.

Panda bears and thrilling rollercoasters. If you are European, like I am, you should definitely go and visit Ocean Park. First of all, this place has amazing views over the South China Sea and a part of Hong Kong. Secondly you can see PANDA BEARS!!!! And thirdly of course there are some awesome rollercoasters. If you go on a rainy day, you won't have to wait too much time in queues as well, so you can just enjoy the rides and amazing animals. They have an aquarium as well, but because last year I got to see the Genova Aquarium in Italy (which was pretty amazing), I was not as much amused about this aquarium.

rain rain rain. it was raining when we went here. There were not much people so lines were short. Ocean Park is big. You need a whole day to go through every attraction. Big aquariums were amazing and the dolphin show too! Wish I could back on a nice weather
Great Place ! . Ocean Park is on of the greatest places in Hong Kong. Even adults can really enjoy there may be more than kids. İts really big , we couldnt even finished half of it whole day.

Ocean Park Tour. It's easy to travel to Ocean Park by car. Just drive through the Aberdeen Tunnel from its Wan Chai Entrance via the Canal Road - Wong Nai Chung Road Overpass. The tunnel fee is HK$5 one way. After going through the tunnel, you'll be on Wong Chuk Hang Road. Turn left into Ocean Park Road and turn left again at the Ocean Park Road roundabout, you’ll be on the Main Entrance of Ocean Park Hong Kong. hulutrip.com is the most reliable company in HongKong.
Family Fun. This is great for a day with the family. Lots of walking and lots of things to see and do. Just go and have fun
Must spend full day here !. Went on a family trip n thoroughly enjoyed this place. Top attractions were dolphin show in ocean theatre, penguins n sea lions and main aquarium.

When it rains, go to Ocean park!. When my boyfriend and me had a trip in Hong Kong for one week, but it won´t sure about wheather. Because the wheather is still changing every hour. When we had plan to Ocean park, but it rained and was truely ugly wheather. We were decided to go to Ocean park, when we hoped it will change wheather. We were there in Ocean park, it still rained. It was perfect idea! There wasn´t lot a of people and we didn´t wait a long time! Only 3-5 minutes. When it rains, so you could go by all different roller coaster. Don´t worry, if it rains and all atract is always opened plus to get super experience.

Great alternative to Disneyland. My wife and I decided to take our children (ages 5 and 9) to Ocean Park instead of Disneyland and we weren't disappointed. This park offers loads of family oriented activities and is educational at the same time. The kids thoroughly enjoyed the aquarium and other animal sites!Take your family here, you'll enjoy it!

Wish we had more time . Read we would need around 4 hours. Caught hop in bus from ticket we bought through them. Loved this park. The line ups like anywhere around 30-45 mins. Great food options. Cable car a highlight. Wish we scheduled full day as missed a few attractions.

Big and lots to do. This park has to be the best in China, even compared to Hong Kong Disneyland. You do have to walk large distances to get to other secluded rides. The theme park is separeated by a mountian range, each side can accesed by a cable car or a train. I recomend the train because its faster while for the cable car you have to wait around 1 hour. Rides have a much shorter wainting time than Disneyland and are frankly better, more intense and most important fun. The aquarium and the pandas really makes this place better than Disneyland. The shows are entertaining and amazing. The animals seem happy with everything. Also make sure to check the weather, most of the park is outdoors so BEWARE!

Disney it's not but they have Panda'a which Disney does not.. Ocean Park is a must the Chinese appear to love amusement parks and this is about as Chinese as it comes. The very structure of the park (built on the ridge of a mountain) makes it a must see but as parks got this has enough to keep most people happy. If your a westerner it has 4 things that a must see (4 panda's) and that makes this park a must, must see.

Overated. If you like lining up for an hour or more to access the park then you may enjoy the aquarium and animal exhibits. We didn't want to stay any longer so didn't see the thrill rides. It looks like they have a front of the line you van purchase to ski on the crowds, but don't know how much extra you have to pay. It would be worth inquiring.

Worth the time and effort . Got chance to have my many first encounters, specially with Panda, Seals, Walrus, penguin and SharksGood fun for kids, and can be done in a day. Only thing Dolphin show was outdated and not that great

Huge theme Park.. Preparations are needed!. One of the largest theme park I ever visited. Easy access to go there. Recommend to take a shuttle bus no. 629 from exit B MTR Admiralty, it costs HKD 10.6 (around that!), try to come early as the queue is long! The park is open at 10AM.The park is divided into 2 sections (Waterfront and The Summit) connected by both Cable Car and express train. We came on Sunday (which may be the worst day!) at 930am and The queue in front of the gate was already soooo long, and with NO queue manner from the guests, get ready to defend your position or let them go first :))Try to get the tickets online and e-ticket on your mobile is acceptable. Express access sold separately with addition of HKD 150, and you need to print it to A4 paper or you gotta queue at the ticket counter to print it, don't forget to bring the CC you use to purchase the ticket, yes, they asked for it for some reason!).The summit area is more interesting for adults with some "crazy" rides as the Hair Raiser, The dragons,Mine Train, etc. Ask for the map on the ticket counter. But better you make list of what you wanna ride as the park is huge, may take you a full day! We only use the express tickets twice (at Grand Aquarium and Wheel) only, as the Q at other rides were kinda acceptable (compared with the Q at Universal Studio Singapore on weekens!). Foods and drinks are more expensive, it cost HKD 28 for a water bottle. Better bring your water bottle and there are some water dispenser machines available. Unfortunately, you can't bring food inside of the park, Yes, the security guys in front of the gate checked it!Went there at early August and it was superrrrr Hot, not many places got shade, so put on the sunblock, bring sunglasses and maybe hat..
Be prepared to do long walks!. If you are under 30 years old, and you want to walk a lot, do the exciting rides, healthy and love to scream, this is the place for you!

Ocean park with family . Ocean park is one of the main attraction location that need to step in during travel in Hong Kong especially with kids. Transportation to ocean park also very easy; just take the MTR direct to Admiralty station, once reach station just follow the signage to "ocean park" city bus no#629. The bus station very well organize and just follow the queue. The bus at the morning session are more frequent which about 5 min once bus depart. One thing that need to do first before depart to ocean park is to purchase the ticket first. There are a few place to purchase, one of it is at the MTR Admiralty station on the way to the bus station, there is a counter that sell ticket. But I have bought the cheapest ticket compare to other is from travel agent office near Nathan (I not sure that allow to mention the name of the travel agent here, anyhow if anyone of you want to know I can personally tell). Once ticket purchase, the next thing that you must have is the ocean park officials apps. You must download the apps before go there, once reach there, you can connect the apps with ocean park server. The purpose of this apps is allow you to book 3 of the most attraction that you like most by follow the given time; means you can by pass the long queues if you reach the attraction time per what have you book. The most front station is the the aquarium which is the longest queue, 45 min. This station is best to put to last station and book the time. Read the map and know which attraction to go first, time planning is very important. Seeing that the MTR station also in progress of construction, when this station complete, it will be more convenient to all. Overall this place very nice for kids, take picture with mascot no need to have long queues as in Disneyland. Enjoy!

So cool. Ocean park was amazing. The aquariums were good. (There is kind of a rumor floating around that there is a whale shark on site. They have one but at a different location.)It is more of a theme park then an aquarium, the rides are okay.The day we were there the lines were manageable, so I don't think the fast passes were worth it.You definitely need to do the cable cars. It is a long beautiful, scenic ride.If you have any walking issues or you are not in great condition, or if you are handicapped the park was built very poorly. Getting off rides you have to walk around a lot. It is not easy for someone who is in shape. LOTS of steep hills, and walks for 2 rides on the mid part. Although it was an fabulous experience, so if you up to the challenge.... I would recommend it.Some rides have great views of the harbor.

Nice Place. Overall it was not too shabby. But nowadays there are so many water parks and smaller amusement and theme parks that it's almost not necessary to go to these big huge parks anymore. There were a lot of Chinese Tourists and the wait for every ride is at least 45 minutes. However, for an additional HK$128 per person ( Adult or Child same price ), we got priority that helped getting in front of the crowds. The kids also complained a lot as the rides were so short that just as you started enjoying the ride, it would come to an end. Like less than 2 minutes per ride!!!

Ocean Park with Family. Visited the park with my mom, two older sisters and my niece on July 30, 2016. It was a hot day (it was a few days before the storm - signal #8 according to their weather report). We took a taxi from our hotel and it was a fast ride and before I knew it we were on the park's main gates. I was a bit happy because the last time I visited the park was like 20++ years ago? (Lol) We had to trudge on stairs for a few minutes before there was several escalators that would carry us to the main gate. The one thing I noticed when we were on the escalator is that they were building an MTR station just for Ocean Park and they are also expanding the area. We went in and the first thing we did was to grab a map. The place is huge with lots of people milling around. We walked around and one of the things we tried was riding the cable car. The line was long and you have to wait in the heat but the ride was worth it. Thankfully there was no strong wind but we all were kind of nervous as we went higher in the mountain. It was really high but the view was spectacular and it was worth the ride up. We took some picture and we went to the aquarium. We also went to see the dolphin show but we were late so the seats are full. I ate pineapple ice at HKD$25/piece and squid skewer for HKD$ 40. Water is around HKD$40. (Kind of steep if you ask me.) They have this machine were you insert HKD$10 and a bronze coin will come out with a certain design, there are 4 designs to choose from. There were only a few food joints that was open and they serve really good cold cuts with rice and the serving is large, good for 2 people. It was an okay day. The thing is there were not enough benches with roof for people to rest when they are tired especially for senior citizens.Also they should have a transportation cart when the places visitors wanted to go is too far from their current location, especially for senior citizen. I saw several senior citizens sitting down on pavements and in the shade because there's no benches for them to sit on. Please address this concern. We rode the submarine back to the main park and it was fun. It was an okay experience but I was kind of disappointed that I wasn't able to go to the other rides since I had to tend to my mom. Hopefully this review will be read by the park administrators so they can fix the problems that I pointed out.

Wet day at Ocean Park means fewer people!. Had a very good experience at Ocean Park during the recent trip due to no overcrowding. The last trip in 2013 was horrendous due to massive crowd of ch--- tourists. This time, there was plenty of seats at the restaurants and the amphitheatre for the show!!! Queues were much shorter for the cable car and the express train to come down!! Phew!!! Souvenirs were really cute too. We did not try thrilling rides as our kids were too young.

The so-so park. Ocean Park used to be known for its dolphin shows but that was in the past. Now, with so many theme parks offer similar programs, the one at Ocean Park looks tired.Also, the rides are catered mainly for adults. They look not well maintained and scary.The aquarium looks decent enough. However, the influx of mainland Chinese tourists made the queue unbearable as they skip lines and push others around like everyday life.

Bit hard to navigate and get around. It was raining the day we went so it affected our visit. The rides were average, the park is hard to get around, you are constantly walking up and down hills. The aquarium within the park is fantastic and view from the gondola were amazing.

Well worth a visit. We really enjoyed this park. The aquariums were beautiful. I loved the Walrus display, where you can see them below the water line playing together. The Penguins, seals, Arctic foxes, Panda bears were wonderful to see. The Cable car gives a good view over the Island. Make sure you get a map with timetables of feeding times to easily plan your day.

Lots to do and see. Have been a few times and still loves the place. The highlights for me is the cable car ride over the peak. The view is stunning. The new (to me) aquarium is the best one I've been to. It's massive and well designed. The polar animal attraction is overlooked, with a pair of gigantic walrus on show. Queue is not bad if you get there early.

perfect view and adventure. i was my first time to came her in OCEAN PARK HK, My expectation met more than 100%
the view is nice and rides are perfect.
bonding for family is perfect for this park and there is food restau inside you can choose.
nice park with variety of sea animals. very nice park with variety of sea animals. avoid weekends as the number of visitors are at crazy numbers.

plan your itinerary to maximize morning time. I recommend pre-selecting your must-do attractions ahead of time, there is realistically not enough time to do everything. We went on a Saturday. Took MTR to Admiralty station. After you exit the turnstiles, head for exit B (it's clearly marked on the direction signs in the station.) There's a stall selling discounted tickets right before you exit the station, Adults HK 355, children 180. Got to Admiralty station around 9:30, then took Bus ride to Ocean Park (can pay with Octopus card) and entered the park a little before 10:00. As other reviews have suggested, go straight to take the cable car up to the Summit area. We then went straight to the Adventure Land area. There was zero wait for the Mine Train. We then did the Raging River, again zero wait time. Rode it 3 times.Came back to catch the 11:30 dolphin show at Ocean Theater. (Even caught a ride on the Ocean Park Tower since there was a few minutes before the show started). The Shark Mystique exhibit is worth a look. Actually, all of the indoor animal exhibits were a nice air conditioned respite from the heat, in addition to being interesting. Avoid the Flying Swing if you have motion sickness. It will ruin the rest of your morning. Be prepared to leave your backpack/loose items in an open shelf area. Ferris wheel is close by. There is a McDonalds at the Marine World area which is probably the most economical food you will get at the park. After you get your food, you can eat it at the shaded eating area which is nearby (it looks like a tent on the map). After an extended lunch break (to recover from the aforementioned flying swing), went to see Sea Jelly and Chinese Sturgeon exhibits. (Passing by the shark exhibit, there were actually lines at that point, whereas when we went in the morning there was no wait time). Exhibits were crowded, but no wait time to enter. Moved on to Rainforest for The Rapids (30 minute wait). Be aware of the minimal height requirements for the rides. A family ahead in the line didn't realize this until they got closer to the height check area, this after having waited in line for some 10 minutes. Thrill Mountain bumper car ride (30 minute wait) has minimal height, children below that cannot drive the car and can only be passenger with adult. The bumper cars are harder to control than you think, the steering can keep you stuck. Take the Ocean Express train back down to the lower part of park. It's designed to look like a submarine, so a better place to stand is in the center of the car under the overhead screens (there will be images appearing in them) rather than by the windows which just give a view of the tunnel. If you plan on visiting while the SpongeBob play area is still there (goes until end of August-ish), bring a change of clothes or swimsuit. It is a get-completely-wet zone. Even has giant bubble pool that the kids can slosh around in. Recommend you stick around for the Symbio water/lights show which starts at 7:30 pm. It's about 10 minutes, and has some surprise elements which made the show quite entertaining. My 9-year old says of Ocean Park "it was AWESOME".(If you need a place to eat after bus drops you off at Admiralty, we ate at Fairwood Cafe located in the tower across the street on the 2nd floor. HK fast food restaurant. Hubby said it was surprisingly one of the best sweet and sour chicken he's has.)
Great place to visit. Clean, well organised and worth the trip to Ocean park. The staff were lovely and the experience fun

Hot n humid. Took 2 kids under 5 here and they enjoyed bits of it. Although it was a very hot and humid, the kids were a little bit cranky but still manageable. The food was pretty average and pricey. Not to mention that most of the rides had a long queue which is a no no if u have impatient kids like mine. We spent the whole day there but only got to enjoy few rides due to long queue. Overall, it was an ok place to visit but would avoid summer and peak season.

One hell of a ride!!!!. Oceanpark is like Disneyland with a small disage of steroids! :P the rides are much thriller and exciting though not all of them but still fun. Also they are known for their aquarium exhibit, panda experience, and other marine exhibits. Just wera comfortable shoes cause you will do a lot of walking and check the weather before going there because some of the rides are closed if it raining...dont make the same mistake we did...

Rides and the Ocean World. Ocean World is a mix of several rides like roller coasters, cable cars, etc. and a world of animals which consists of Pandas, penguins, and marine life. It becomes pretty crowded even on weekdays and is divided into several zones which each have a theme. Its best enjoyed for the whole day with family and friends.Tip: For people travelling to Ocean park from Admiralty station there are dedicated buses(629) which take you directly to Ocean Park.
Hong Kong. Still a great place to visit. Cable cars scary but a fantastic view all around. Been here before (12years ago) and still love it.

Great experience . What a beautiful place with so much to do and not enough time to do it,my children absolutely loved it and so did the parents, the Dolphin show was great with a wonderful backdrop to gaze upon,my daughter had a personal extra where you can book a session with the dolphins which was a special treat for her birthday,thank you Tony & mau ,a wonderful day in a amazing place with great friends and family

Great day out. Lots to see and a great cable car ride too. There were queues, but they went quickly and it wasn't an unpleasant wait. Lots to see and do here. My kids are varying ages and they all enjoyed the day

Massive!!! But a lot of fun for all ages. We spent a full day with the family (3 kids ages 6, 4, 2). There is something to do with for everyone. Need to really plan it properly because the place is massive. Very clean and plenty of options for food and drinks.

This is a seriously good option to Disney. This park has so much that it will take you more than one day to get around it....we when on two days and still failed to take in all the things we wanted to do. It is split over two levels and we advise you to get the Ocean Express train between the levels as opposed to the cable cars. The lower level has a great indoor water play area and the kids(and adults) will enjoy this for about two hours. Get ready to get soaked, even in your clothes hahahahahahahaha. The Giant Panda is hard to catch because it sleeps so much hahahahahaha........go to the other panda house and you will even see the RED panda's. All the big kids(and adults) rides like the roller coasters etc are on the upper level. They are top rides, but be prepared for 30 minutes in the line. The dolphin show is also worth catching if you can drag them away for 30 minutes.

fantastic!. This HUGE park is great for teenagers. Well, I brought my toddlers with me and they enjoyed a bit of here and there but with the ticket price, it's not worth it for small kids. Most rides have minimum height requirement, so most toddlers wont be able to enjoy even the basic ones. I enjoyed the park very much as it is beautiful, as it's close to the ocean. From Lantau Island, we took the MTR to Admiralty station. Just outside the station, there is a ticket booth that sells both Ocean Park and bus tickets to Ocean Park. First bus starts at 9:00 am and last is 4:00 pm with an interval of every 10 minutes. I suggest you buy the tickets there. I bought Ocean Park tickets online, and didn't have a printer to print them. So, I opt to pick them up at the Ocean Park itself. I had to queue up for quite sometime as they don't have a special ticket booth for 'pick up' tickets only ( which I think they should!!).Anyhow, we got our tickets, and went to take the map and rent a stroller for HKD$50. Cable car was pleasant with a spectacular view. You can cut the queue if you have the FasTrack Pass. Most of the queues are long so I suggest bring snacks. Halal food stalls are available. We got down via tram instead of the cable car, so we get to experience both rides. Some suggested that you should go up via tram and get down via cable car- it's up to you. we took the tram because the queue is shorter than cable car's. WIFI was also available and I downloaded the Ocean Park app to get the showtimes for different shows at different venues. Planning is important as you need to walk for a far bit to catch these shows. In a nutshell, it was a fun visit. It was my second time there, first without kids and recently with kids. I will return- perhaps when they are a bit elder and taller!

CHARMING PLACE. Ocean Park is also equivalent attraction to Disneyland. The rides here are very adventurous . Recommend to see the Aquiarium which is top class and very big.Recommended and not to be missed areMine train and the splash car / ocean park rolling cabin / Cable car and of course the lovely big PANDA.Don't waste the time in queue better to to buy priority pass which is affordable price and get through directly.

Attention old-timers: The long forgotten kid in you could come out of your shell here. We went in late July; bring lots of water - and perhaps a few coldies. The cafeteria style food here is very expensive so consider bringing your own munchies, but none of those disgusting 7-Eleven rice balls. Make sure, moreover, you are in good shape; otherwise, you might end up in an emergency room due to the heat, humidity and long-distances you have to walk between exhibits.Should you pay extra to avoid long queues? We thought about that one and decided not to, and were happy in the end that we didn't pay extra because the longest line we faced was 20 minutes right at the beginning in order to enter the big aquarium. We went on a Friday so I guess that accounts for the absence of large numbers of people. We waited no more than 10 minutes for all major attractions, including the outstanding Hair Raiser roller coaster. The only time the queue jumping pass would've come in handy was right at the end of our visit at closing time when close to everybody in the park lined up to get on the great cable car ride back to the park exit. We took the cable car to the upper half of the park in the morning, and intended to take it back down but were not willing to wait an hour or so to do so; so we ended up taking the train through the tunnel, which entailed a waiting time of about two minutes.If you do go in the Hong Kong summer, take note that you can find air-conditioned relief in all of the public toilets as well as in many of the exhibits, such as the fantastic panda pen.Most of the animals we came across seemed to be happy, except for the one snowy owl I saw that'll probably never fly again.Don't forget some of the largely overlooked exhibits, such as the wonderful goldfish one.Your correspondent hadn't visited a themepark for years prior to coming to Ocean Park and was uncertain whether he would enjoy himself.At the end of the day, he was a very happy customer. The admission price is very reasonable and with that one pass, you can do everything. The cable car ride from the bottom half to the upper half reveals the fantastic location of Ocean Park; the views on the way up to the top are incredible and likewise when you get to the top.The new Ocean Park MTR station should be open pretty soon, so accessing the venue from your downtown hotel will be easier henceforth. Moreover, the already massive park is getting even bigger with an extension under construction.When we visit Hong Kong again, we will be sure to visit Ocean Park once again.

A Place to love the oceans and mother nature. Beyond being a tourist spot and a key recreational center for tourists and visitors alike, what is unique with Ocean Park is that it provides the visitor with a deeper understanding of mother earth, its oceans and the need for humanity to conserve, protect and keep our world clean. The park educates us on the wonders of the animal kingdom and that we need to clean up and protect our environment because we are not the only inhabitants.

Best for animal lovers and adventure seekers!. Many people would prefer Disneyland HongKong as their main travel destination in Hongkong, but for animal lovers and thrill seekers, Ocean Park is still better! Lots of animals are around and you're sure to spend the whole day here! Also, the park keeps updating their rides and attractions, which makes frequent visits still fun for the whole family.

Easy way to see pandas . Must theme park advertise themselves as having everything and to be honest ocean park really does . The rides aren't the best or the biggest but they are sufficient . It's better for younger children to be honest . The best part about it is that it's all in one place , where else can you see penguins and pandas all in the same place . Take swimwear as well as their is a splash park for younger children ! Getting there is easy , take the train then there is a bus that goes every 5 minutes from the station to ocean park , it only goes there so you can't get off at the wrong stop etc . If you are going in summer , dress in shorts etc and there really isn't much shade or places to hide fromThe sun .I would recommend this over Disney land due to the animals and the cheaper entrance price !Enjoy your day there !
Best rides, beautiful pandas, marine life, cable cars and more... Rides are really thrilling.. Recommend to buy priority pass to avoid queue in case you have less time. Don't miss Panda..

Get ready to walk. TIPS:-Bring water. Lots of it. Unless you're willing to pay $28 for a small bottle.-Buy your tickets using a 3rd party app (like klook) to skip the long ticket line and head straight to the entranceWe went here to see the animals. Spent the whole day here and we didn't even ride anything (except the cable car). If you plan on going on those rides, one day won't be enough. Queues are long even on a weekday.

The original Hong Kong Amusement Park. Stand by its own, The Ocean Park Hong Kong occupies the huge area with many attractions. There are so many attractions to enjoy from a roller coaster, cable car ride up to panda viewing. The park really good for sporting as many up and down paths and steps are required to explore this big amusement park. The Ocean Park MTR station projected to be ready by 2017 would definitely offer an easy access to reach the park
Save your money. Rides are old and they've not changed a thing for the past 10 years. Food are insanely hiked up. Not many people and don't have to queue up on weekdays but many tour groups.

Hot & lots of walking. Took my children here and they were very tired with all the walking we had to do. Only went so we could see the Pandas. People were rude & staff could speak very little english.

Brilliant fun, right for kids and adults. I have been to Ocean Park numerous times and I feel this park is suitable for both children and adults. Only downside of Ocean Park compared to Disney Land is that there is a lot more walking with nothing in between. This can be a good thing but during the summer time I would recommend taking an umbrella as it can get very hot. Overall the park is very nice but the only thing I would complain about is the aquarium. I do not believe in Zoos or aquariums but for any reason I believe they should expand some enclosures as some felt very small. They have two large walrus in a very small enclosure and I couldn't help but feel sorry for them. May be they will change it one day or release them back to where they belong.The park is very nice.

Terrible customer, no refund even though all rides stopped. Not worth the visit, at no point on the Web site or when we entered the park did anyone mention the rides would be stopped due to the typhoon. We checked the website before we left this morning. Now they are refusing to refund us.Definitely not a trusted company, will be Disney next year when we return.

Unorganised. Very unorganised, crowded, unruly tourist crowd from across the border, arrogant staff controlling the rides.We faced Long lines during our visit and could not ride most of the attractions. Minimum wait for each ride was almost an hour, because of the badly Organised queuing system. When they can't handle large crowds, they should restrict the daily crowds so that everyone can get their fair share of rideS. They make you buy special tickets to buy your way through the winding queues, a typical Asian VIP culture, where you pay your way through.

Fantastic park for an excellent day out. The park is big, several attractions makes it a very diversified place for children to enjoy the full day. The cable car to the top offers a great trip with remarkable views of the southern side of Hong Kong island. The trip itself is an attraction. A number of ¨wet¨ and fast rides complete the set of games for this park. Getting to the park from Central Hong Kong is easy and fast by bus. Very soon the park will be connected to a MTR station.

One Day is not enough. Ocean park is widely spread out and you cant cover everything in one day. So you need to pick and choose the rides you want to do and the shows you want to see. Don't miss these rides / shows : Hair Raisers, Train Ride, Dolphin Show, Tower ViewFood & water is expensive inside the park so carry dry snacks, sandwiches, water bottles. Pre-Book the tickets online as there is huge rush for buying tickets, if you have booked online tickets it can save you atleast an hour in the queue. The park opens at 10 am so be there by 9:30 and head straight to the cable car ride to reach at the top. Finish 2-3 rides and then head to the dolphin show. Overall its a good experience for adults as well as kids... Don't miss it !

A great day out. Good value at $HK365. Didn't get the fast pass as an extra $150. But as we were waiting to get in the rides area when they opened at 11am we got straight on the first few rides without queuing. But in the afternoon we were queuing for up to 45 minutes. True it is the holidays but it was a Friday. Rides good and kept my 16 year old daughter and her Hong Kong resident childhood friend happy. Roller coasters, etc, too much for my wife and I but we enjoyed a few rides such as dodgems, log flume, etc. A great cable car ride to the main part of the park which was great and had good views. The penguin area was good, and cool. The panda was eating bamboo shoots right in front of the enclosure so got some good views. And the aquarium, though not as Shanghai, was nevertheless spectacular with everything from a ranfe of sea horses to Manta Rays swimming overhead. We took the advice of our Hong Kong friend and bought sandwiches outside the Park. But with the heat we still had to buy cool drinks at £3 a time. But a great day out.

Ocean Park Experience for the Whole Family. Everything in this place is awesome! From the time we entered the park, you will really feel the excitement. The aquarium was great, too bad we didn't see the pandas - they were sleeping zzzzzz. The cable car was the highlight and the train ride. The restaurant with the overlooking view (The terrace) has a delicious casserole ever. Basically you will really have to pay for both food and the view, but it's all worth it! Everybody enjoyed the rides and it was a fun experience I would say. In order to enjoy Ocean Park, you really have to spend the whole day not to miss the fun. It's one of the biggest parks we've been to and would always recommend it to my friends and family. By the way, I scratched my legs in one of the marble edge outside the park, their First Aid Team was so quick, located in a strategic location ( entrance) and it was like magic, that it didn't even bruise after few hours they had spray ( I guess medicine) my legs. Overall, was a great experience

Family excursion ... First  Please check the timings on the day you are planning to visit the place .. The day we went it was till 6 in the eveningy .. Its so big that if you are not fast you cannot finish in the day .. The queues to the rides are least 30 minutes long and there is no way that you can finish the same in a day .. We tried but could only manage 60% and I think it was a big feat ...Worth the Visit once .. But I feel that Underwater world in Singapore is much better and organised as compared to this ..The ripper is that any thing you want to buy or drink is 4 times the prices to what is available ...outside and is a big downer ..

Too Exciting.,,.. and The best Adventure park I visited so far.. I visited the Ocean Park with family in this April.This is the best park, which I visited so far. I regret that last time i skipped this, because of the feeling that it will get bored after seeing fishes in their tanks as in Singapore.But this park is exciting in all aspects.. The animals most of the rarely found are living in their almost natural habitat. This includes plenty of penguins and good nos of Pandas.The rides are trilling, especially the "Hair raiser" This Roller coaster was too inviting to have four rides with my kids.. Wife scared of seeing the speed of its travel and the dropping heights, kept herself away. Other four roller coasters are also good to drop yourself down. You can enjoy a lot of rides like dropping tower etc. The location is beautiful and accessible by bus. This Park is really a value for money. I would surely recommend to anyone visiy=ting Hongkong
A wonderful day out.. A great day out, suitable for families. Great rides, wonderful aquarium, majestic pandas, and spectacular night time light show!

Fading out. It's a fairly decent themed park. They really need to maintain and introduce new rides. Many food kiosks were closed, and that's silly because I was looking to spend on themed park food but couldn't. We dined in one of the restaurants that really was serving cafeteria standard food. We bought the express pass which excluded certain rides and that was quite a bummer.

A fun fun place. It was october 2014, the place is big, clean and so funny, so many good rides and colourful places.The park is alive and u will spend a very good time inside. It is worthy to visit and spend almost a half day.

Lots of varieties. There are aquariums, dolphin/sea lion show, panda, roller coasters......Basically, good for all ages. One of the top places to visit in HK.The cable car ride is nice. The place is quite big and get prepared for lots of walking.
Great rollercoasters. We had a yearpass during our expat stay here.. if you like rollercoasters, this is the place.. beautiful views too from the park spread over the hillside.

Under-rated, Awesome Must-see, must-do in HK. Unfortunately, we spent only 1 day at the Ocean Park. However, the 90+ hectares of sheer fun and wonder deserve / need 2 days. In retrospect, if we had to choose between Disneyland and Ocean Park, we would pick Ocean Park undoubtedly. There are many unique aspects to this park, most amazing of which is watching a tremendous variety of fauna, from varieties of penguins to koala bears, sea horses to jelly fish, pandas to polar bears and any fish that one could think of (the goldfish pavilion was superlative too), in world-class habitats. Moreover there are the rides, dizzying to tame, and totally awesome. There are also a number of shows that one should see and the cable car is also a MUST-DO. Be prepared to walk long distances, though!

Loved the sky ride . The sky ride which takes you from one part of the park to another was probably the best part for me. We bought fast track tickets as a treat at around £15 each yet the park was dead until around 1-2 so didn't really need them. Maybe this is because it was midweek Wednesday. Plenty to do for an entire day out although heat unbearable midday for us, nearly sent me to sleep. Found that we did more indoor/shaded activities such as pandas, seal and dolphin show, penguins, aquarium as when we were queuing for rides it was quite tough in the heat. Take your own food and drinks if you can as prices are extortionate, £3.50 a drink almost everywhere or £2.20 from Macdonals for a large drink. When the weather is as hot as it is in July you will need a few drinks and if you have a family too it adds up quickly. Definitely a must if you are in the area, rides no more spectacular than anywhere in the UK but definitely worth a day out.

fantastic Ocean Park Hong Kong. “Awesome!” Vast open space, plenty to see and do for all the family including a high cable car ride. Wonderful animals. Without going on the rides it can be done in one day, but allow two if you go on the rides. There is a MTR station opening outside the park soon. There are also plenty of buses which stop outside. Food wasn’t expensive in the cafeteria and the food quality was good.

Wild life + Amazing Rides!. Ocean park is packed with activities to do, be it wild life or rides! If you are an animal lover, be sure to visit the aquarium and the panda sanctuary! And if you are an adventure seeker, take the tunnel train or the cable car to the theme parks!!
This place is way better than Disneyland!

Lots of fun, lots of pandas!. If you want more of a local experience of a theme park (ie not Disneyland) then this place is great. It has the largest aquarium in the world, apparently. Plus pandas that look clean, happy and well-kept. Also there's a great view from the top of the park, where there are thrill rides. Try and get there early, as a) - it'll be cooler, and b) - the crowds really start to swamp the place around lunchtime. For those with kids - it easily kills 4-6 hours of time.
Amazing and Fun. my whole family enjoyed the experience;we are definitely coming back and it will be a whole day of more fun.

Could be better without the mainlanders yelling and cutting in lines. We were so happy to celebrate my sister's birthday at the Ocean Park and she got her birthday freebie. Ocean park has always been a wonderful place when we were kids. After so many decays, we still feel the excitement. However this is not enough to see even half the attractions within a day. After a few hours on a hot June weekday, mainlanders from those buses have come in that had turned the whole park into a chaotic market place, a whole Chinese tour cut in the observation deck line, pushing and yelling. It was only in the early afternoon, we didn't feel like to stay any longer. We wish we could have spent a little longer as we probably won't be back in another 10 years as we had come from 10,000 miles away.

Best amusement park in Hong Kong for teenagers . You need one full day to complete the rides at ocean park. There are all kinds of attractions starting from kids to senior citizens. The roller coasters here are rides you cannot miss.If you don't like waiting in the queue, you can opt for fast track tickets, it's worth the extra money.

awesome!. just for my experience...you dont have to book a tour going to ocean park..its very easy to reach,after mtr admirality,the bus going their directly is waiting outside already,all have english direction..be sure to bring umbrella,its so hot during summer..if you are travelling with kids,bring sweamwear,theres a sponge area that they will really get wet and its fun ..,bring extra dress if you love to play the boat area because you will really get wet,or bring a disposable raincoat and shoes raincoat because you will really get wet!the disposable raincoat cost 40hkd there..in my experience,they allowed food and bottled drinks to enter..the food inside is expensive..buy ticket online is more cheap..i bought mine from klook.com and is legit..just buy it 1 week before you go and print the vouchers..

One whole day in Ocean Park. Lots of activities inside the Park, There are cable car, train, roller coaster; fishes, dolphin, whale; monkey, panda; and more.... You can easily spend one whole day in the park.

Way better than Disneyland but got rooms to improve . The ticket is around $400 at the door for each over 11 years old but if you buy online you get it for 300. It is way bigger than Disneyland so a lot of walking and mostly outdoor. So avoid the sun by going early or late. Bring water as you will need to pay $30 for each bottle. Wifi is free so don't worry if you like to post photo or video online.

Lots to do and opportunities to chill on a very hot day. Travelling there by bus (the nearby MTR station has not opened yet) we queued for tickets for an hour in the mid-morning sun. It was hard to imagine being any hotter, with saturated clothes and no breath of a breeze. Once in and rehydrated with vast sugary drinks (no diet options) there was much to do and see; many rides and exhibits and snack options. Various sea creatures were worth a visit, not least as their environments have been created at refreshingly low temperatures in contrast to the blazing sun outside. We alternated these with rides, allowing our core temperatures to drop again to a survivable temperature.We brought towels, erroneously assuming that there were swimming pools here (as there were in the 80s). Travel light and be prepared for a pricey day (we bought tickets that gave us fast-track access to 7 rides/exhibits, as we didn't want to spend the day queuing - about 50% more costly but in the event well worth it). Fun and (a bit) educational for kids. For adults - not a cultural experience but a contrast to another urban(e) day in Hong Kong.

Fun but prepare for a lot people and scorching heat during the summer. The park was fun but they really need to install more fans for the outside waiting areas especially during the summer. We paid extra for the fast track, best decision ever as we went during the weekend and the lines were crazy. We wouldnt have been able to ride a lot of attractions as the heat made waiting for our turn unbearable1 if not for the fast track passes.

Great mix of fun and adventure.. We finally made it to Ocean Park this past Sunday and was very surprised on how much fun we had. Started by taking the cable cars to the top of the park, great views of the beaches, mountains and surrounding islands. Many exciting thrill rides to enjoy including a number of roller coasters, water rides and more. Make sure you take the time to visit the many nature exhibits offered including the seal/walrus aquarium, the penguin exhibit as well as the Panda and goldfish ponds. We ate lunch at the Penguin restaurant, Food was very good and how cool is it to watch penguins swimming and playing around while you dine. We can not stress this point enough.... MAKE SURE YOU PURCHASE THE SKIP THE LINES PASS. This costs like $15.00 and it saved us more than 3 hours of waiting in line for attractions, rides and cable cars. They really mean skip the line here, they shut down the normal lines and skip you right on the ride. Great place for families and children as well.
Make sure you give yourself plenty of time. The theme park was massive. We did not visit all the sites that were there. The rides were enjoyable and the shows were great to watch.

Horrible horrible horrible . After several opinions, we decided to go to Oceans Park instead of Disney (since we've been to Disney in other countries several times). Nobody speaks English, food is horrible, waiting times of 50 mins on the good rides, and worst of all, very very long walks between rides as the park is very widely spread out. A day out of our six Hong Kong days wasted, utterly wasted.

Its an educational tour for all ages.. If your home country don't have Ocean Park, going here is a must!In our country Philippines, we also have Ocean Park and its almost the same as HK's Ocean Park. Except for the Cable Car.It's nice to explore sea creatures through out the Park. Go ride the Cable Car of course!
Many rides and attractions. You need a full day to visit Ocean Park and for sure, you will never run out of attractions to visit and watch, and rides to try!

Like a cross between a zoo & a theme park. We lived on a boat near here for a few years and when we went back after having kids, got a season ticket.It's like a fishy-themed disney crossed wit a zoo. i used to work in UK zoos so a lot of things there we didn't do in the UK/ EU but its very entertaining for todllers upwards.Things do/ have changed and will have changed since last time I visited HK but there are usually:lots of fish/ tanks, some with some educational info on. My eldest when a toddler loved the jellyfish tubular tank gallery with music (Sky!) & colour changing lights, the goldfish gallery (lots of odd species) and the turtle bowls, the red & giant pandas (hugging their refrigerated rocks) and the acrobatic shows.The seasonal stuff is always good too and although i never went as Halloween is my busiest time of year, other face & body painters I know are flown in to decorate the actors at the annual scarefest.If you are new to HK/ China be aware there are coachloads of mainlanders coming to this, whi will want to touch/ hold/ semi-kidnap any western child (especially blondes/ red heads) for spoiling/ kisses/ photo opportunities. it is very sweet but scarey if you don't expect it, happened every single visit with us.Food cafes all over, varies, we liked the squashed squid vendor and the mat ball thingys. The skyline varied too, some kids loved it others panicked.Very enjoyable day, lots to see, and over the other side of the mountian is a bird park etc too we never made it to that as often... Do take shade/ hats etc as a lot of walking in hot sun on a clear day!

Nothing spectacular . This park is located at some distance from the city centre. It took us about 2 hours by road. I would suggest opting for an MTR. Good for the kids. Enjoyed the rides here. It's good for a half day excursion but nothing spectacular.

Adventure on honeymoon . Simply great the day spent here. Such a lovely place. Full of colours & music & dance everywhere. The rides were breath taking. Hair raiser roller coaster literally raised our hair off our heads. Going to hong Kong without a day in ocean park is wasted holiday. Must must must go.

worth going , different from disneyland. Buying tickets from kook is cheaper but its not instant confirmation! We bought tickets for the same day , but the tickets did not show up in the mail fast enough. So , I tried cancelling the ticket by dialling the service line. The english option ... no one picked up ....thrice! The mandarin option was picked up instantly and I had them cancelled the tickets. The line if you buy on spot is long ...yes... but it moved swiftly. Cable car rides were good! There were no queue up when we were there and we waited 10 minutes for the ride down . The animals look healthy and well taken care of. You won't feel sorry or guilty when you see them. The rides ... we didn't get to ride many because the park is just too huge! But they look fun and the queue more humane ... I bet its only 5-10 minutes per ride. There are rides for older kids /teens.There were many shades and restaurants. Also, ocean park do allow you to bring food and drinks in , they are not as strict as disneyland. Go there , my kiddos actually prefer ocean park than disneyland!

Good afternoon. Despite it's not a big park, it's worth to pass a mid day there. There are lot of fin things for children and a few for adults.For sea lovers like me, they have some interesting fish species and other animals.As usual in this kind of places, the drinks are too expensive, but that is normal.

Hong Kong classic. A definite tourist visit spot with family fun for all. For HK residents, the Park even offers free entry to persons aged 65 and above and on your birthday!!Lots of fun rides and I must say, one of the best roller coaster in Asia, probably second only to Japan. Lots of maritime exhibits (naturally)And the Park is also famous for its annual Halloween festival in October. Coming additions to the Park includes subway access and also a brand new Water theme park.

Great experience. DO NOT BOOK A TOUR GUIDE, other wise you won't get round the whole park in time! There's a MTR right outside! I had such a great time but didn't get round everything because I had a guide and had be back to entrench at 5.30 parks open til 7.30! I was at the other side of park and had 30 minutes to get cable car to beginning and Q was huge! Also we did not arrive early enough as the tour guide changed time to later! Please go yourself MTR is so easy to use and it's such a great park to be at, buy a fast track as the Q's can be very long and 45mins wait for them fast track you skip majority of the Q.. Have a wonderful time

Was a bit sad. The rides are fantastiiic! This one's better than the disneyland. However, I was a bit sad on the oceanpark. There arent any animals left (although id rather have them out of captivity). The aquariums are a bit sad and empty. The panda area is a bit too crowded. The pandas are obviously a bit disturbed and annoyed from all the noise. Tip: avoid the rainy season. Advice: Do NOT use flash on the aquariums pleaaase! And be quiet at the panda area. If I will be back, it will be because of the rides.

Worth it! And the pandas are awesome!. Another activity which will keep children happy for almost half a day. You get to see the rare types of pandas, sharks, etc. the show which takes place in the evening is stunning. Cable car is a must, and scenery is mind blowing. Lot of pictures can be captured freezing the lovely memories forever. We enjoyed Ocean park a lot!

A perfect treat for your kids and family. This is an amazing place to visit. Offers rides and attractions for both kids and adults. Park is so huge that you have to ride the cable car or train to see both ends of the park...my kids and i first tooked the cable car going to the other side..the ride was such an adventure...you'll see the great view of the island the ocean the mountains during the ride...upon reaching, we went on to watched the dolphin show and started exploring the rides and attraction...we went back to the other side by train and continued to explore everything...it was such an adventure and a perfect treat for my family...
Good surprise . I was told by friends to skip Disney and go to ocean park and that was the best decision. My kids could not get enough- combines the best of all worlds, theme park, zoo and aquarium.

Excellent park, well managed. Ocean Park is an absolutely excellent theme park, with a large variety of well-maintained and thought-out rides, as well as other attractions such as the aquariums, which are clean and enjoyable. I used to live in Hong Kong, so I've been to Ocean Park ever since I was younger, and the standard has been maintained for many years. Ocean Park is a great day out for any type of audience.

Exceptional Ocean experience. There were a lot of new attraction to enjoy. Live dolphin show. Pandas and rare species you can see up close safely. Lots of water adventure that kids will surely love my kids love it SO MUCH. The want to keep coming back!
So good. Awesome day , fun for all ages, clean , food options were good! Easy to get to via the 629 bus from Admiralty MTR. Highly recommend it!

6/10. Wasnt exceptionally crowded despite being the summer holidays, but some popular rides needed 1+ hour of queuing. I bought the express pass seeing that it only cost an additional HKD150 and it proved useful. 2 of the rides broke down on the day i was there, but they resumed after a while. Some of the better rides include the Hair Raiser roller coaster, Mine Train roller coaster, Rev Booster (fast spinning ride), The Dragon roller coaster and The Flash (upside down spinning thrill ride). The Abyss (tower ride that goes up and down) was disappointing with only one small drop, not worth sitting if the queue is long. The viking ride looked pretty small and lame hence i skipped it. For a real theme park lover, i would rate ocean park as a 6/10 as the rides are not THAT scary. Theyre pretty enjoyable, but nothing really impressive. The aquarium was ok, but nothing spectacular really. If you've been to Singapore's SEA Aquarium, this one really pales in comparison. Variety is limited, nothing very special. The dolphin/sea lion show was pretty plain as well.
Must see !!. Loved the Birds around in the Park ! Kids or Adults, Its not like a Hong Kong Disney Land, but far better

Great place for all the family. . This theme park is a must do when in Hong Kong. Located on Hong Kong Island on the opposite to the city near Aberdeen. Getting there for us was by bus, which we caught from the terminals at Star Ferry. There are many service available from all areas so getting there is easy and cheap. They were building a new MTR Station and rail network to Ocean Park while we were there, so in the near future getting there will be even easier. The park is divided into two sections, and gaining access to either section is done by cable car or a funicular, which is a themed cable train. This is because one section is at sea level at the foot of a mountain and the other section is on top of the mountain. The views from the upper section is worth the entry price alone. It is also where all the great rides are. There are many rollercoasters, and some are located on the edges of the mountain which adds to the thrills, because you are quite high up and overlooking the South China Sea. There are a large assortment of rides available for all types of thrill seekers. There is also a section that has old style challenge games. It was noisy with the operators calling out and ringing bells, but was fun and exciting. The animal exhibits are second to none, and in plentiful supply. There were the Giant Panda's, Asian Animal Exhibit, Arctic Fox, Emperor Penguins, Seals, etc etc. There was even an exhibit on Gold Fish which I though would be rather boring, but was really quite interesting and worth a visit. We visited during the Halloween period, which is an exciting time to visit this park. The staff dress in costume and they have themed areas to celebrate this event. In the afternoon we noticed more and more staff that were in amazing costumes and make up, wandering around all areas of the park. They were all available to have their photos taken with us. There is a lot of different types of restaurants and food outlets for all tastes and budgets. We always eat at the Panda Cafe located in the lower section of the park. Good Hong Kong food at good prices. Entry price to the park is very good value considering the size of the place, and what it offers. Line ups to the rides can sometimes be long, but don't take long to get through due to them running things very efficiently. All exhibits and rides are included in the entry price. Souvenir shops are everywhere and offer great products at very reasonable prices. Food prices are not much more than what you would pay outside the park. Don't be scared by the crowds. Everything is run efficiently and designed for high volumes of people. We have been twice and look forward to our next visit.
