pretty exciting rides and huge tour crowds. compare ticket prices before you get them, i think we got cheaper ones near the exit of the mtr. bring shades, hat and water. get there early and get on the cable car to get to where all the rides are! you'll see mountains and the ocean while dangling pretty high up, might be a little scary for the kids. there were huge slightly rude and loud chinese tour groups but luckily they weren't there for the rides so we didn't have to wait very long for most.loved the flash! scary if you watch it stay in the air and turn people upside down but get on it! loved the hair raiser roller coaster too! was sad that the dragon roller coaster was closed but we got on the mine train, that was so much fun! got over my fear of the abyss kind of rides too, it goes up slowly and your palms get sweaty as you take in the ocean view then it drops faaast!
Great day. To reach the place you have to go on a cable car which is great. You can spend the whole day with lots of rides. Taking off on a gas balloon is the Highlight of the day.
great location. Besides the attractions, already the cable car ride to Ocean park is a highlight. Great view on incoming ships and the sea at the dolphin show :-)

Thrilling rides, animal encounters, quirky and informative attractions. Ocean park is a mix of ultimate theme park and a zoo, It is a staple in every first-time visit to the city. Get up close and personal with marine life in one of the largest aquariums in the world, Atoll Reef, and hop on the plethora of hair-raising rides - including one called the Hair-Raiser! - for a thrill-filled afternoon. Well-loved among locals and tourists, the Park is a destination worth marking a day or two on your itinerary for. Make sure to pick up a show schedule when you arrive at the park so you can plan sightseeing around fantastic shows! The park is divided into two main sections. The main entrance is on the Waterfront (lower) side and is linked to the main section on the Summit (top) via a scenic cable car ride and a marine-themed funicular train called the Ocean Express . Cross the Park via cable car and view the entire 870,00 square meters from above! On top part they have mostly all the scary rides as lower side they have the panda and penguins zoo where you get to know some of Asia's most precious native animals at the Giant Panda Adventure. Over all it has been nice experience at Ocean park.

If in doubt - go. Ultimately a theme park but the location cannot be understated. The express passes are really good value and an excellent way to avoid the heat by standing in queues that can run about 30-60 mins a ride. The Cafe near the cable car (which is a must despite the queue) is very nice. We belatedly worked out there is a Macdonalds and a halal option in the park also.There are however not enough water fountains but we did find some eventually. Buy tickets before you go to avoid the enormous lines - and get the bus back to Admiralty when you are done - the lines though long, move quickly

Mr. & Mrs. K. Tsang. We love to go to the Ocean Park because we can breath the ocean! Their dophin-show is awesome! The gondola ride is unforgettable : you can see the ocean, the trees on the hills and also most of Hong Kong are in dight. We really enjoy the ride especially when you are tired after the long walks in the park. It is good to bring kids along because they will enjoy the aquarium and also the padding zoo.

Aquariums a highlight, rides underwhelming. We went to Ocean Park on an extremely hot week day. There were long queues to get on the gondola (if this is the case, I'd recommend just taking the train) and the gondola is quite small and cramped compared with the one to Lantau Island. The queues were also fairly long for those rides that were open (a number were shut for maintenance). In comparison with the theme parks in Australia, Gold Coast, the rides and shows seemed quite old and underwhelming. The highlight however turned out to be the many wildlife displays such as the jellyfish, pandas and many different aquariums. If this is of interest to you then it would be worth the visit.

Good. It was a pretty good place crowded as it was vacation of school kids. So there parents brought them there. There are quite a good no of shows which you can see over here. Also the rides are quite good. Rome around and have fun here. The skate show is the best.

When you get to Ocean Park, I would advise you to immediately head for the cable cars or the Ocean Express.. Ocean Park is a lot of fun. They have many different rides as well as animals. It's kind of a amusement park/zoo. I saw my first panda bear. They have this area that was full of beautiful gold fishes. My favorite had to be the penguin exhibit. They had so many penguins in and out of the water. We also enjoyed their dolphin show. Don't miss it!They had a ton of rides. There was a huge, scary, roller coaster that I didn't go on. People seemed to enjoy the river rafting ride. I just rode the ferris wheel, which had a very nice view. Ocean Park consists of two parts. When you pass through the entrance, you're at the bottom part. To get to the upper part, you take the cable cars or railway cars. I prefer the cable cars because you get to see the beautiful scenery. It is a little scary when you're in the car and it's dangling from so high up. The only thing that sucked for me was the food. It was horrendous. I got a chili dog and onion rings. I just ate the dog because the bun was hard. The onion rings were stale, soggy, and cold. Everyone complained about their food. I guess people don't go there to eat. From what I saw, the place is under heavy construction. They are currently building a hotel and more rides. I can't wait to go back when it's done.

Great Day. A great day here to spend with young children or older ones, something for all.The cable car just went on forever, then when you arrive at this end there is just so much to do and so many rides. Need to get here early and stay till the end.

Revisit after 5 years. Nothing much has change but its still provide the cheap trills and fun.Please bring your own water if you dont wish to pay for alot more when inside the park. Bring your own raincoat or brolly as well. Don't forget your hats and shades.

World class theme park in Hong Kong with something for everyone.. Set in Aberdeen, Ocean Park is accessible by taxi and bus from Hong Kong Island. Sitting on the top deck of the bus as it winds up and down the circuitous coastline is a treat for the eyes. The park has various attractions and can take up to 1 full day to see in it's entirety. From dolphin shows to an amazing aquarium and thrill rides to keep everyone entertained, Ocean Park is a must see for anyone in Hong Kong. Bear in mind the weather, while a little rain won't hurt, a shower would be a hindrance to getting around while the scorching summer heat would also make it painful to cover the entire park on foot.

Cheap practices. We were made to wait an hour in long queues to buy the tickets . The signs inside and their maps often contradict . Long queues for each ride. Water priced at HKD 28 for 500 ml !! Water and sun protection are a must. You really need to plan out your priorities and route and if you are lucky you might enjoy a fifth of what is available .

Cable Car, Pandas and Sharks. The highlight of this park for me were the Cable Car ride, Sharks and the Pandas!The cable car offers a breathtaking view of the park and Hong Kong!!!I just love pandas and to finally see one in real life was exciting. Of course those panda videos on the internet should not be what you expect to see when you visit them... Because you'll mostly end up seeing them sleeping, eating or hiding in the training center... But it is still cool to have finally seen one in person.The Shark Mystique was pretty awesome! It was a nice place to hang out from the sun or rain.

Day trip to ocean park . Kids loved it. Couple of points to remember. Book via Klook.com, the booking via online is a breeze. Just download the bar code and show it at the entrance. You can easily avoid the queue at the park and save some time. Once u enter - head straight for the cable car as line is relatively small in the morning. This will take u to the top of the park. Feel free to choose rides that suit you'll. Carry your makeshift raincoat or else be ready to buy one for HKD 40 if u don't wish to get wet while taking the Rapid river ride. U can take the ocean express to come down. Our kids enjoyed the sponge bob experience. Carry extra change for kids and their swimming costume. U can easily miss half the rides as it's physically not possible to see the whole park in one day. Very tiring. Summer months are extremely humid as such pls carry lots of water as water in the park is for HKD 28. Both Disney and ocean park charge exorbitant prices for food and water. Overall kids enjoyed and so did we. A must visit for families with young kids.

Great place . So much better than Disney land. Strongly suggest you get there early and head straight to the cable car and head over the hill to the rides on the other side as it's usually quiet for the first couple of hours. Many things for kids of all ages to do here only slight let down is the food. They have a massively overpriced McDonald's which tastes like everything was cooked 3 years in advance but that is the only real draw back.

FUN-TASTIC for Kids and Adults Alike! Must visit. Mini zoo, aquarium, theme park, lovely shows, beautiful location and scenic beauty - The place has it ALL! if you have the time, it's a must visit. if possible try and do it on a weekdaySome animals are rather rare and not often found in most zoos. The shows are well planned and designed. The cable car gets really crowded so while going up one may want to use the ocean tram and take it while coming down instead of wasting time both sides.The place is definitely huge and will require you to be there as soon as it opens and plan meticulously if you want to cover it all without wanting to spend on Fast passes but I think it can be done if one just keeps going with minimum breaks. Also, it would be wise to choose and know what you want to do against what can be left off.Oft asked question - Disney or Ocean park?Value for Money - Ocean parkActivities and rides - Ocean parkMore full family entertainment - Ocean parkBut if you are a Disney fan then i guess you can't miss that either!
Ocean park. Ocean park is fun. My favourite ride is the ferris wheel. My sisters favourite ride is also the Ferris wheel.

Not for children below 8-9 years old. I went with my 6 year old daughter. Almost 80% of the rides have 122cm or more as height requirement and hence we couldn't do most rides. Lot of options as such, but different sections are just too far away from each other. Avoid very hot days as it's all in open and a lot of walk. Need one full day to do justice to it.

Excellent amusement and marine life theme park. It should be definitely a "must visit" on your travel itinerary if you love adventure,amusement parks and animals.  We loved the polar adventure, where we could explore long tusked walruses,arctic foxes,spotted seals and huge number of penguins and many other extraordinary polar animals.  The waterfront and summit areas are connected by cabel car and ocean express train.The cable car experience was very joyful with mesmerizing view of the entire Ocean park.  The thrilling adventure of "The Thrill Mountain" especially Hair Raiser, Rev rooster ride and floorless roller coaster are a must try. We loved the interactive journey at giant panda adventure,Chinese alligators,small clawed otters,beautiful variety of gold fishes and vibrant and different species of colourful birds. There are various other equally beautiful things to explore in Ocean Park like Old Hong Kong Memories, different kinds of sharks,Rainforest with most fascinating animals in the world especially world's smallest monkey and world's largest rodent. Overall it's totally a fun filled adventurous trip and was worth every Penny of my HK$150. NOTE: Buy tickets online from asiatravel.com to avoid queues and better prices.

Pandas lovely. Get fast track.. Worth visiting if you buy fast track to skip the queues. We went in July and it really wasn't too busy especially with fast track. Pandas were the main draw for us and we saw them all.

Wonderful theme park. This was well worth the visit as I was particularly interested in the Pandas and spent quite some time observing them. There are many animals of interest and the exhibits appeal to both adults and children and are professionally presented

all staff were helpful. Worth a try.You should go to ocean park if you were in Hong Kong.Excellent service from their staff.More friendly than Disneyland's staff.Free dispense water were also provided in few points.Weather was good even in summer and quite windy.MTR still on progress and once it works,more convinience for people who wants to go there.Recommended if you are the first time come to Hong Kong.

A must for Amusement. It is a marine mammal park, oceanarium, animal theme park and amusement park. Hair rasier and free fall are two must for the rides lovers. And also the penguin, Panda and Dolphin shows are worth watching/ Please check the show time for the Dolphin showm before plant. Its a vast area so you need to plane where to go first and what to do. I suggest to go for the rides first as the crowd grow you need wait in Queue. Then the other attractions.

Better organised than Hong Kong Disney!. A wonderful themepark, very busy but justifiably so. Fast pass for seven attractions HKD150 per person highly recommended to fit everything in on one day visit.

Great plae to spend a day!!. It was a nice amusement park to spend a whole day but beware of the climate. It was soo hot and humid and left us exhausted and hindered our enjoyement.Kids enjoyed a lot especially the animals like Panda, the polar section with penguins, Polar Fox, then the dolphin show, shark mistique, dolphin feeding center, the water land.The dolphin show was not that great as the one at Dubai Dolphinorium and the aquarium can't beat the Dubai Underwater zoo and Sharjah Aquarium.There were various kinds of rides but the long queues will kill time and energy. Some rides were good but not thrilling as the ones in Dubai an dwadi adventure in Al Ain.In overall, it was a good experience.
Beautiful Park 😊. Very entertaining park. Its a blend of singapore sentosa, thailand saffari & marine park. + Great view from top of the park.

Cute animals and fun rides. I have been to Ocean Park for a lot of times and as a teenager, it is definitely my favourite amusement park in HK. They have a lot of cute animals, panadas are sleeping and eating all the time while they have a new exhibit for koalas and kangaroo now. Koalas are really cute. Though they dun have programs for touching koalas, we can meet them in Hong Kong is already great enough. Roller coasters and rides in Ocean Park are more exciting compared to HK Disneyland, while they have an area for kids to play rides and I think that is quite thoughtful. And in summer, after lining up for roller coasters for a long time, you can get into the exhibits to look at animals and enjoy aircon for a short time. I think Ocean Park is definitely a must-go place for teenagers.

A nice park with lots of activities and fun rides. An excellent day out for the family with lots to do. Staff were sometimes not very friendly but were very effective in making sure that people did not cut the line as this happened quite often, The ease of getting around was great. Pandas are awesome - a must. The water ride was great - You WILL get wet as promised.

Ocean Park Treat. When in Hong Kong make sure you visit Ocean Park and a few tips to make it easier and an unforgettable experience. It is worth paying the extra HK$150 to fast track the rides. It will save heaps of time and you wont spend time waiting in line. It is a fabulous day out - catch the cable car to the top of the mountain and start at the top first and get there as soon as it opens (10am). If the weather is hot, taking a refreshing walk to visit the penguins will cool you off. Catch the public transport as the double decker bus ride gives you a great look at this awesome city. A must if in Hong Kong. The mine car roller coaster gives you an amazing view of the city - even if you don't do roller coasters (I had never been on one) put this on your list. Have fun.
A "New Age" Zoo!. A must go when in Hong Kong. I have never seen as much marine life in one huge "fish tank" but this one in Ocean Park.

Go here if you love panda rides and thrills. The major attractions at the Waterfront are Amazing Asian Animals and Aqua City .Cable Car is nice experience but during summer and sunny day some of you will find it too hot inside, lucky the ride is not too long.They call it Ocean Park however it is actually part zoo, part amusement parkZamperla ride is our favorite ...

Great day out pity about the grumpy staff. I took my 2 boys to Ocean Park in mid July and we did have a very enjoyable day despite the heat and humidity. This is our second visit in 3 years and as a fun day out it ticks most if the boxes. The animal/sea life exhibits are excellent and the theme park rides are all good - however some are very dated. The only real negative are the staff - so unfriendly across multiple rides/animal exhibits. The are the polar opposite to every other major tourist attraction. Often so rude. At the end of the day it was a fun day out.

Still a good place for family to enjoy. Ocean Park has always been our fav. I personally have been there for over a dozen times. Fond memories for when I was a teenager myself. This visit was after a few years not going and it's still a fascinating place. There have been some improvements on having more indoor exhibits which were definitely great for visitors in summer. But many of the facilities are closing at 5-6 pm so making the day a little short.

Worth to visit. An amusement park to compete with Disneyland on a budget? From my experience the rides and shows were good. I came on public holiday so I can't explore much since it was so crowded. The lines can be half to an hour long. Hair Raiser is one thing I can recommend, the name itself already speak how fun this roller ride. Definitely will come again to try another.

educational and fun. The place is so huge and 1 day is not enough to cover the rides and sights. I was with my mother and sister and we had the time of our lives seeing the animals and pandas. I want to come back soon. I blogged about our day trip at katmeifucan :)

Great fun for all!. Ocean park was great, tons of rides, ranging from kiddy rides to more extreme rollercoasters. Lots of aquariums and animal attractions. It's a great combination of a theme park and an aquarium / zoo. If you have to choose between this and Disneyland Hong Kong, pick Ocean Park.

One Stop Amusement Center. This attraction requires you to just go comfortable and light to enjoy every ride and tour around its different spots. Walking shoes, small backpack for your camera, mobile phone, portable charger and just enough money on your wallet based from your projected expenses need is a brilliant idea for your convenience. Go early morning as you need a whole day to explore the entire valley of attraction. Buses are available so transportation is not an issue at a reasonable cost. Bring extra water and biscuit in your handy bag as goods inside are a bit expensive.
Hotcha wetty ocean park tour!!!. Amazing experienced;rollercoaster take my breath away!the cable car views;great adventures ever!yay!

Great day out !. We went as a group of 4 adults and although the very start was a bit of a disaster , with the off site ticket booths not accepting vouchers and then a long queue , actually x2 , before actually getting into the park which turned out to be a great day out.Bring plenty of fluids though because the stalls are a bit on the pricey side compared to off site stalls.Make sure the camera is fully charged and plenty of room on the memory cards

Ocean Park. I went to Stanley Market first then caught a Taxi to Ocean Park. The grand entrance has plenty to see before you take a cable car up to the Amusement Park. The Dolphin show was magnificent, as was Sea World. Have been back several times. A great day out.

Different perspective. i have a mixed feeling about the Ocean park, and infact, in my perspective , it is not a must see, contrary to the reviews posted. We got ( family of three, including a teen boy of 12) , thoroughly boredPros1. Good cable ride , excellent views2. Pandas are a highlight3.Good aquariumCons1.Exteremely unprofessionaly managed. Queues on all rides is more than one hour. We could not see any urgency with the service staff, like preparing the people to sit in advance, filling all teh cable cars completely etc2. You need to see in the queue in hot summer , without any fans or AC, you will actually burn yourself3.Coming to rides, there are mainly Roller coasters only - if you don't like Roller coasters , you practically do not have any rides to do4.Aquarium - good, but , if you have done big aquariums , anywhere else in the world, no charm left5.Food - Hardly any vegetarian optionsPractically, we found, it can be given a skip , its not the best use of your time and money

Fun day out!. A lot of activities to have fun with. Reach early to try out most of the games and also to avoid the crowd and heat later in the evening.Was very hot, so fan and umbrella would be very useful. Even though we went on Monday, it was still crowded especially in the evening.Bought ticket with meal. Meal coupon gives you set meal different from what you can order over the counter. The quality and taste is not up to par. We didn't finish our food.Didn't have enough time to cover all the games. My younger son, 5 years old could not play many of the games because of height limitations.Have fun here if the weather is kind and the crowd is less.

Beautiful grounds. Panda! Tram ride, roller coasters!Freezing penguin exhibit ( bring a light sweater)!Food is ok - but it's Chinese so it's a lot better than nasty macdonald food. They have rice with roasted duck, chicken and pork. Plus noodles. Favourite snack is half of a mini watermelon yumThe view from the tram, wow worth the nice ride seeing the islands below. Lines are moderate for popular rides on the weekend 35 min wait. The line areas are covered by umbrella and there are fans. So it's bearable to stand there. Just be mindful you will see some people w less than desirable behaviour. In animal exhibits, the people are slightly obnoxious tapping on the glass and yelling and talking loudly. poor animals

Fun for everyone. Ocean Park is the place for enjoyement. Do plan your day well try to reach as soon as park opens. Online tickets are recommended as they turn out cheaper. Outside food is not allowed but there are refreshments inside. All sides are good but I recommended the grizly bear and the roller coaster.
A must visit. Its so big and with so many things to do, one day seems very little to go around as well as see all the shows on offer. Needless to say, its a must visit place for all.

Lovely place. Amazing place for kids.... i made a mistake of coming without family as it was an official trip... but its a definite treat for kids... Although the goodies inside are really expensive so u better keep your pockets stuffed to cease your temptations....

Amusement. The ocean park is a ocean wildlife centric amusement park with activities for every age group. The must do things at the ocean park is the "Hair Raiser" roller coaster, "the pendulum", the north pole and the south pole, watching a panda (the best), the cable car

Great! . A fabulous park, with Great attractions! The animals in the park had Great space and looked really healthy, so that was lovely to see. My only tip is to not go there when it's hot outside, but save it to a rainy or cloudy Day, because the heat really bothered us. Another thing is that it's extremly pricy once you get in. A shame to pay 30 hkd for a Coca cola.

A day well spent.. Ocean Park is good option to spend a day in Hong Kong.Divided into 2 parts, The Summit and Waterfront. Summit is located on the top of the hill, most of the rides and rollercoasters are situated in this part.Rollercoasters were good with breathtaking views, Whereas Waterfront areas consists of aquariums and other wild lifeYou can go up and down by cable car(not recommended, because its too crowded) and train.The fountain show is the must watch at night.

Beautiful Ocean Park in Hong Kong. It's a Famous Theme Park and one of the largest in Asia that provides fun and amusement for all the family members is situated in Wong Chuk Hang and Nam Long Shan in the Southern District of Hong Kong. It's famous for its various rides. One must visit this place during their visit to Hong Kong.

Pride of Hongkong. What an amazing and big theme park in Hong Kong and much much bigger then Disney Land Hongkong One cannot complete it in a day for sure. All rides are nice and thrilling, one should carry sufficient clothes for change as there are wet rides as well in the park.There is too much walking inside the park, Indian vegetarian food is available inside the park and price wise is decent one. Mine Train is quite exciting and one should not miss it, Rapid Booster is must with family to enjoy a wet ride, Rev Booster would be fun, we could not do Whirly Bird as it has gone under maintenance, Raging River was funWe were quite thrilled to see Penguins and Pandas in the Park and they are well maintained.To go to Park one can take a bus 629 and walk up and to go to Park take either train or trolleys to go into the central attractions. Train is much faster and give decent experience for thrillers it would be good to take Gandola however, it takes some 25 mins. It is better to enjoy these rides in winter season as in summer the place is quite hot and humid with occasional rains which further shorten the quality time in the Park

Awesome day out with the kids. We took our kids for a day out in the middle of school holidays. The park was packed on arrival with a 40 min wait for tickets. We purchased the fast track tickets which allowed us to skip all the lines thereafter. We went on all the main rides which were excellent. Would thoroughly recommend as a great day out for families.

Something different . Visit with no expectations. Go with water bottles. Take all rides. N enjoy. But heart patient don't . Cervical patients be careful. Walk walk n u will enjoy fully. Spend full day.

Love this!. There is much to love about this place, the view from the cable car was indeed one for the books. I love how this big amusement park have trains that take you uphill or downhill. Amazing indeed! Very incomparable to Manila Ocean Park.

Get the Fastpass. We thoroughly enjoyed our day here - which was markedly enhanced by paying the extra HKD150 for the Fastpass. Unlike the Disney version, this offered real benefits both in accessing many of the animal attractions and for (a maximum) of 7 of the rides - make sure that you save one of the Fastpass to catch the gondola back down at the end of the day, the ability to bypass a lengthy queue was worth the price alone.

Loads to see and do, but a little expensive. Our 2-yo boy loved seeing the fish and animals. The cable car gave amazing views and was pleasantly quick-moving. We loved the dolphin show and found plenty to do. We could easily have spent another 4-5 hours there had we not had a tired toddler and parents who had had enough of being unbelievably hot and sweaty. The buses from Admiralty station were regular, quick and cheap. (And there's a tourist office in the station near exit B for the Ocean Park bus that sells tickets for $30 less than the list price.)Overall it was a great attraction but didn't quite feel worth the price. It's great than children under 3 get in for free, because I'd probably not have thought the price reasonable if I'd had to pay for him too.Drinks and food are very expensive inside, so stock up before you go! There also seemed to be free buggy hire for kids.

Variety of animals and rides. Arrived at ocean park at 10:30am and there was a massive line already to buy tickets. I waited in line for about 30 minutes to get my tickets. The best thing to do is to buy tickets at the train station or beforehand from a verified retailer. I couldn't buy it beforehand because I had a 10% voucher I wanted to use and this could only be redeemed at the actual park. After 30 minutes of waiting, we finally got in. The beginning of the park started with an aquarium section which was similiar to Sydney aquarium with a variety of fish, Sharks, sting rays, sea horses, octopuses and a few other marine life. It was nice in here because of the air conditioning and it was dark and peaceful.there are other sections of the park such as the panda section where there are two pandas enclosed. As pandas sleep for most of the day, we didn't see these two as they were asleep in the back. (Only saw them via cc tv camera).There was another section a few blocks away which housed one 11 year old panda. This panda was awake and asleep and we saw some movement which was cute! Other sections in this area was an Australian animals part and a little area which has a jumping castle + water like thing for kids.You can travel to the next part of the park via ocean express which is a pretend submarine which is actually a train. Or you can catch the cable car up. There was a 30 minute wait for a cable car so we just decided to hop on the fake submarine. The wait for that was only 5 minutes.It took us to the other area which has theme parks, games where you can win prizes and some more restaurants including mc donalds!North Pole encounter with seals, artctic encounter with 50+'penguins , shark mystique with sting rays and sharks to see.I charged my mobile phone at one of the mobile phone charging lockers for $20HK PER hour. Went over time by 10 minutes to go and pick it up and it charged me $20 extra "overtime".There's heaps of rides (roller coaster, Ferris wheel etc) throughout the other 2/3 of the park such as a ride which is on water and you get splashed and wet, a ride that goes up very high perhaps 200m high and it gives you a nice view of the city. It's not really a scary ride because it goes up and down quite slowly. There's rides for children and a lot of thriller type of rides too. Most rides you have to line up for about 10 -20 minutes depending on the ride . We went on the feris wheel around 615 and there wasn't much of a line so waited for a few spins and got onI spent most of the day there which included rest stops, eating and taking my time looking at the pandas and different animals for a while. I ended up leaving the park at 7pm.Some things to take note for the day, bring a portable charger, water bottles, hat, sunscreen and comfortable walking shoes.
Good attraction but potentially for younger crowd. Ocean Park has pockets of attractions for adults, thrill rides provide a great escape although most of the rides are tailored to younger audience
The best ever. adults and kids will really enjoy this amusement park. its so nice. especially riding in a cable car. a day is not enough to enjoy the rides

Standard Park. Pretty standard if a bit small amusement park *plus* aquarium with (somewhat lame) dolphin show and pandas and a few other animals. All adequate and reasonably clean, with reasonable lineups mostly, but not particularly interesting compared to, say, Sea World in the US. Not worse, just not especially impressive or anything. One beef: we arrived early and most rides didn't open until 11 AM, which was annoying.

amazing place for all age group.kids and adults. we were travelling as a group of 5 kids and 4 adults and we had such a great time at ocean park..the whole day passed with such ease..we booked tickets through klook app so got discount as well as had not to stand in the line.we also took 4 priority pass which helped somewhat..after visiting disneyland felt ocean park is far better as most time is spend in enjoying rides and games but in disneyland it has been created in a way no one can over it in 2-3 visits even..long long tiring lines..you end up wasting the whole day..that way ocean park is wow and specially their penguin area is amazing never seen before..keep adding new stuff:)

Great Amusement with creative wild life. Just a station on MTR from Hing Kong, its a great entertainment for kids. Its a must go in Hing Kong, with a lot of activities and roller coasters. There are cheap bus service from the nearest MTR station.There are prime shows with dolphins and sea lions, which is the prime attraction. There is also a White Panda breeding within the park. Lots of sea lions and penguins also to look after when you are inside.The water rides are very good and not be missed. There is also a nice cable car over looking the ocean. This park over the hills provides a great view of the ocean from almost all ends of the park. The Australian section displays some exotic animals as well. Overall this place is a very pictorial and enjoyable place for kids and is a must go in Hong Kong.

Great day out. This is a great day out for young and old, we were a group of 11 and we all thoroughly enjoyed ourselves here. I was in China many years ago and didnt get to see a panda but they have them here so that was one of the high lights for me see pandas, they have other animals such as seals, walrus, penguins, koalas, kangaroos, sharks, they also have a cable car ride and some rollercoaster rides as well as an aquarium, this is all included in your park admission, a definite must do when in Hong Kong. It is easy accessible by public transport to.

Amazing park but à little bit old. I really had a great time there! The lack of English of the staff is sometimes annoying, as well the lack of communication when the rain started and all attraction were stopped during 45 minutes. Moreover some attractions are really old. But the spot is really amazing!! And there are many attractions with looping or adrenaline.I would recommend this park if you stay in Hong Kong long enough.

Another great day out in HK!!!. Easy to get to by bus. Awesome cable car ride over the mountain. The top has the great rides. The bottom is a bit lacking except for the pandas. Awesome North and South pole exhibits. Great dolphin show too!

Some nice highlights lots of crowded sections . Ocean park has a number of great highlights. The old town area, some rides for the little kids, the tram ride up and best of all the night show with lights and fireworks. Being a theme park, there are some areas of high traffic such as waiting lines, some rides and the tram going to the top of the mountain. Even though there are usually lines it is very organised and coordinated well that you don't wait too long. Staff may be a bit pushy or seem unfriendly but that's their way of getting things going. Our kids loved the night show. It was a great end to a long and tiring day. Sitting there to watch the lights and fireworks was spectacular. You will however need to wait till night time for it to start. Towards the end of the show we started heading to the exit to avoid crowds pushing and waiting too long for the taxi. Great family outing

Great place for kids as well as adults.. The attractions are perfect for everyone from adrenaline junkies to little kids and the elderly. There are loads of well functioning rides with an average waiting time of about 15-20 mins as well as a zoo with all kinds of animals. Good day out.

Loved it!. Spending the day here with the kids was the best thing we did in Hong Kong. There were a few long lines meaning we couldn't get to see everything, eg the Cable Car, but it has a great acquarium, animal display, rides for the kids, water play park and so much more.This is a must do for a family but take a spare set of clothes as you are likely to get wet. Also, take loads of cash for all of the attractions and games. Be prepared for a 'hard sell' when a park photographer takes your photo. After the first attempt, we just walked away happy in the knowledge that we took lots of nice photos anyway.

Average. My visit left me a little underwhelmed with the park having a lot of potential but falling a little short of the mark. A theme park with some animal attractions with no story or imagination. We did it but prefer Disney and would skip this next time.

At the park for one day. This was my niece's first time to be at the park. Although the only rides we got onto were the Cable Car and the Sea Life Carousel, we still had a great time walking around, taking pictures and shopping. My niece even pressed her own souvenir penny of a panda and had her picture taken with the panda mascot.

Whatttay park!. Ocean park is amazing enthralling unbelievable and huge. Divided into two parts north pole and south pole, the connectivity between the two is via cable cars and the ride between the two poles itself is another adventure, let alone the fantastic rides that are there for all ages . Loved the water zone a lot too! All in all this is a place that needs at least 2 days to cover each zone and is not to be missed

its a WOW! place. wow!, its a great place, I enjoyed more than Disney land. Cable car gives a nice experience and awesome views. rides and everything is awesome here, you need at least 2 days to enjoy fully here.

Brilliant. Eventually it looks like the MTR (trains) will go right to the entrance of Ocean Park but we took an inexpensive taxi.I went there because I had seen on youtube some people who did some of the rides and they looked amazing but not so amazing as the views and, boy, the views are truly amazing! This has to be one of the best parks in the world for sightseeing!It's divided into two, the animals and the rides. To get from one to the other, which is the other side of a mountain by the way, there are two choices ... if walking is a third I'd say don't! The two choices are the cable car and, wow, what a vision or, the not so scenic railway through the mountain which, to be honest, is a little tacky. The queue lines for the cable car seemed significantly longer than the train but it is a must do experience (unless you don't like heights in which case it would be mega dumb)If you ever, like me, had 'seeing panda in China' on your bucket list, this is the place for you, they have rather a lot of them.The aquarium is awesome too.They seemed a little lacking in the likes of polar attractions but I can forgive them that.If I am honest, I'd say that this park, were it transported to the US, would knock Seaworld out of business, it is so much better.The rides are not the best thrill rides in the world but a good time anyway.Plenty of eating choices from fast food to sit down meals and equivalent budget levels tooWe didn't watch the dolphin show but they have a dolphin centre where they can be seen anyway.Everywhere is a long walk and a lot of hills. Build up stamina for several weeks beforehand if pushing someone in a wheelchair.We were there a whole day, it's just so restful going around it.

Fun Place with Big-boys rides. Ocean Park is a huge property with lots to offer to the adventure-seeker. We went there on 14th April 2016 with kids and family. We went straight to the top of the hill to start from the end but huge queues (45 Min Waiting) forced us to cover 5-6 rides only.

Great place for kids. Had taken their Premium package tour....an attendant was with us throughout the day to guide us. Kids could go unlimited times for the rides without waiting in the queue. So....it was really wonderful. Thorough, enjoyed the day. Thumbs up!!!!!! I would suggest to take their premium tour..it saves your time and you enjoy without getting tired.

Worth the visit. Don't expect big aquarium as SEA Spore, this one had their time. So dark inside, i need to hold my son hand so he won't fall. Rides were pretty good, attraction is ok, food is average, haven't got the chance to meet the pandas though. So if you have spare time in HK this place is worth the visit.
Great experience. Kids love the ocean park, so many attractions in here...the food is quite expensiveif you go in June or July its very hot because the area is barren

New Rides. One thing that my family love to do is to always visit Ocean Park for the many myriad of activities there. They had the panda enclosure, Oceanarium and the RIDES! My son had a great time going for the Hair Raiser ride. And his other favourites since he was a kid. Unfortunately, his favourite log ride was close as it was being renovated.My advice is to go when the Park just opens. No lines and you could get into the rides without any hassles. However, after 12 pm, you have loads of mainland Chinese tourists coming in tour buses. The lines to practically every attraction was incredibly long. So we decided to leave at about 1 pm when the crowds really started to surge into the Park.

Mix of everything. Its a beautiful place to visit... if you think of Ocean - you get to see every species you can think off !!! Also there are Giant Pandas and rides with plenty of restaurants inside.. suitable for kids and great fun....

Definitely crowded. Booked 1 day tickets before we go. Got cheaper price than the official. The park was getting more crowded at night. We spend a lot of time just to queuing the attraction. If you have extra money go with the priviledge tickets where you have special line. Worth it. Also 1 day is not enough to explore it all

So many activities and rides yet too crowded. We had visited the park on a Monday, 4th April which to our surprise was a public holiday, so I would first recommend that you check your travel dates and the coinciding holidays of Hong Kong, if you're planning to go to any theme park.The park was amazing with rides for everyone. Even though we missed a few parade shows because we had wanted take the cable cars that had a very long queue of people, it was all worth-it. The view was amazing and my son loved it. The aquarium had a long queue as well and so a limited number of people were allowed at certain times. Also would recommend to take a few bottle water and snacks as stores and fast-food restos tend to have queues especially lunch-time.Overall, a great family experience especially for my son whose first time trip to Asia was made memorable.

Exciting Place! but it seemed like a very big "local" theme park. Great for families, nice atmosphere, great rides, love the cable car that linked the mountains in between! but i still think Disney is better. The park seems more Asian, more local but big. Disney is much more sophisticated. But i did enjoy the rides there!

not good for little child. the park is bit dated. Food was not so good comparing with disney land. No much choice for little child. Esp, the doplin show is really disappointing. panda is the very cute

Funfilled time at ocean park. Very nice place if you are interested in animals and marine life, but most of all the pandas. There are different zones for various interest. loved watching the pandas.Best is to spend 2 days to cover everything as there are long ques for a lot of attractions. Food inside the park are very average as in most of the fun parks. Gift shops are pretty good

What fun!. Visited Ocean Park on a rainy day & pleasantly it was a great idea! Had a super time with an infant in row. She enjoyed seeing the animals & birds..We took the cable car while on our way up & ocean express while coming down! The cable car was a super experience - my little one enjoyed looking out of the window & we enjoyed the weather too! Had our lunch at the Bayview Restaurant which had some great options & the food tasted good. The dancing fountains at the entrance were a beautiful sight.The rides were majorly for the elders except one or two which we enjoyed with our little one - she was overjoyed! Well, there is a lot of walking involved - so be ready! An experience worth every penny spent! Must visit when in HK..

Theme park for anyone. Visited the park with two sons - pre-schooler and infant. Knowing most of the rides are not suitable for us, we planned a quick tour initially and ended up spending almost a full day packed with fun.Here are my recommendations• Do some desk research - study the map on the official website with all the POIs (rides, shows etc.) which is very detailed and up-to-date and plan the routes beforehand definitely make all the differences• If you want to avoid the crowd, take the Ocean Express to the Summit in the morning before everyone else does and take the cable car back in the afternoon • Wear plenty of sunscreen or avoid summer time• Sub-par food and drinks at rip-off prices all over the park• Buy fast-track passes at HKD150 per person to avoid queues Although the park shows its age in many different ways, but I think it is very well maintained and organised. And aquariums are very educational to young kids as well. A very well thought-out theme park overall speaking.Transport • 30-mins by taxi from downtown HK island but traffic jam is possible when you leave the park in the afternoon• MTR station is under construction when I visited

good for all ages- but come with full energy. this is a great amusement park with a huge diversity of attractions for all ages and types, its very big and take time to travel all around have a full day and be prepared to get get to all the attractions, also in busy days which are most of the year some rides have very long lines, get there early, take the map and plan to go first to the busy attractions, you can take the internal submarine train up to the top and come down with the cable car. my kids loved it
fun place for all ages. We enjoyed the view from the top via cable car and ocean park tower. Liked the panda park, huge aquarium, polar adventure, dolphin show, and relaxing views.

All kinds of fun. This park has many rides, shows and exhibitions that you have to spend at least a whole day to enjoy it. No rush or you will be regret to miss some of the programs. Well plan ahead so that you can visit both sides of the park.

Fun for the Whole Family. I went with some friends and even though this is kid centered we still had a great time. We went early on Saturday morning and basically had the park to ourselves. However around noon the place got way too crowded. Lots to do there!

Too hot a day on my visit.. Although this place was highly recommended by my friend who I insisted that I must visit. I was impressed that this place is very well maintained and i understand it is more than 30 years. Unfortunately on my day of visit the weather was punishingly hot and I had to cut short the visit to prevent my friend and from being roasted by the scorching sun. The discounted price of our special promotion ticket of HK$259 was well worth it as all the rides in the park were included. I strongly recommend this place for families and group of friends to visit.

Fun but not thrilling. I preface my review with saying, I am from California, home to the land of amusement parks such as Magic Mountain, Disneyland, Sea World and Knott's Berry Farm etc. The gondola ride which takes guests to the top of the mountain to the rides is quite lovely giving a beautiful overview of the surrounding areas. Most of the rides are not terribly sophisticated but more adequate than thrilling. The Hair Raiser was the exception albeit quite short (lasting approximately 1.5 minutes) but nonetheless, quite fun. Some of the queues were quite long so I recommend paying for the Fast Trak which gives you priority and brings you to the front of the line. We ate at the Terrace and the food was quite bad and overpriced but hey, they have a captive audience. Ocean Park is a nice place for the family to get away from their everyday life and just be a kid again.

Clasaic theme park with aquarium and aquatic animal edu. Classic and so HK theme park. Mainly with aquarium and aquatic animal show and conservation center. Situated on the mountain which you can choose cable car to transport between the zones. Nice choice when can not choose aquarium or amusement park. One thing that is such a weak point fore is that if you come in rainy day or sunny day, that is so exhausted!! Not much places to rest and the park is quite crowded. Good for edu trip and children with higher age. If kids need something characteristic and cute---> go to Disney land btw. Ticket is cheaper for OC park. Take bus or MTR to Admiralty station and follow B exit(I think) or with the sign that shown like 'Bus to ocean park'. Just directly from station to the park with approximately 10 HK$ for a single way and takes only about not over half and hour from Admiralty bus stop to the park's main entrance. Enjoy!

HUGE... Good value for money. We went to Ocean Park today with our 2 kids aged 7&8. Soon after arriving we realized that all of the best rides have height restrictions from 132cms up which meant that we couldn't go on any of them. There were a few things our kids could go on but I recommend you check the restrictions before you go to save disappointment.That being said, we did still have an enjoyable day. The train and bus to and from the park were easy and cheap. Once we arrived there were no queues to get in (we got our tickets from the 7-11 at the train station for full price but we did go past one place selling a bit cheaper on the way out of Admiralty station). We paid about $200AUD for 2 adults and 2 children.There is an English map and guide on a stand once inside. There are friendly staff everywhere eager to help with any enquiries. There is an option to pay an extra $150HKD pp to fast track 7 of the main rides (we didn't bother due to height restrictions).It was a really hot day but there are places where you can escape into air conditioning. Although it seemed like there were lots of people the lines weren't bad at all ranging from 5-20mins. We could see the really long queues set up which obviously get used during peak times and were grateful it was a quieter day today.We took the train up the mountain and the cable car down and didn't have to wait for either. Both were highlights of our day. There are lots of restaurants (including McDonalds) ranging in price but we recommend bringing as much food and water as you can to save money.Ocean Park is massive!!! It is spread over such a sparse area on a mountain so lots of walking is unavoidable. There are lots of long escalators to help you get up and down most of the hills but we were absolutely exhausted by the end of the day. The kids struggled with this.I'm giving Ocean Park 4 stars for the excellent service and efficiency in accommodating so many people. Lots of interesting things to see and a good variety of rides. The only reason I'm not giving 5 stars is because compared to home the height restrictions are too high and this meant we missed out on all of the best rides. Back home our youngest can get on nearly all of the big rides.Totally recommend but remember to research before you go.

Fantastic experience!. A wonderful experience exploring this theme park. One day was not suffient to explore all the rides. The best part was the cable car ride. Highly impressive and brings one close to nature!
kids loved it. enjoyed animals north pole and south pole sections were chilling even in may .....enjoyed arctic blast ride very much.... kids loved the PANDA'S ...as they saw them first time

Extreme.. The rides were perfect for our age (16-23) we got to enjoy the Hair Raiser. Although we didnt ride much because it rained and almost half of the rides were closed due to the weather.So i suggest to plan your visit on a cloudy weather. So you can make most of your stay. :)

Great!. The first time i was here was last 1988. Obviously so much has changed. Except for the rains we had a grand time. Ride as much as you can and as much as you can handle. As with theme parks...food is a bit expensive inside. Imloved the aquarium, penguins and pandas.... Take the ocean express up and the cable car back down. Be ready for a lot of walking. My feet really hurt from all the walking there but it was all worth it. I read different blogs on ocean park...picked out tips. A worth it experience.

Enjoyed it more than Disney. We really did enjoy it more than Disney, and that said it all doesn't it?It was more organised, great rides, even greater shows, more a/c to beat the heat.Take the meal voucher option and the food is expensive( compared to Disney).Rate animal shows like the panda was the icing

Amazing place but currently under renovation (new metro station opening soon). I spent a full day with my daughter and was impressed by the size, number of rides and an amazing aquatic show. The various aquariums were also world class. Unfortunately we could not see the wild life exhibit which was closed that day. Nice value for money.
Amazing day out.. The rides are great. It was a pretty hot day when we went so make sure you take a hat and drink. Great day.
One of the best theme park!. Many awesome rides, my favorite is the Hair Raiser Roller Coaster. Everything is awesome except a lot of tourist from 'certain' country likes to cut queue!

Seals and Penguins. Our 1st time visiting the penguins in the enclosure and 2nd time with the seals. We got close with the wonderful animals! You can learn more about them and ways to protect them from the keepers! You will never forget the lovely experience..

Great for all ages. Plenty to do including thrill rides, walk through exhibits, shows, and scenic decor. The location is beautiful with greenery and ocean vistas. Fairly hilly but not too much walking as place is compact.
Queues everywhere . It was okay overall but lots of queue. Not as magical as Disneyland but the aquarium was active enough to attract people.

Improvement in software needed. I have not visited the Ocean Park for a long time. Yesterday, I went there to redeem my annual pass. While there are many new attractions there, I found out that there is no sufficient information to help the visitors to tour the Park. For example, the signage to the attraction is not clear and the staff cannot point out the correct ways to go there. Moreover, compared with another theme park in Hong Kong, I found out the staff in Ocean Park are less cheerful and enthusiastic. In fact, when I redeemed my annual pass, the young man handling my request just continued talking with his colleague while leaving me waiting him to process my request.

I dont understand why people want to sit in cable car for nearly an hour.... I have no interest of sitting in the cable car, but the children are the kings nowadays, so.... I filmed it when everybody looking around left and right and left again, luckily the car looked quite safe, every minute or so there was a funny grinding sound coming from above, otherwise quet and "tranquil", I dont think people will want to meditate... the view? Ok, that were bure blue and white... what else.

A confuse traveller. Didn't know why we came here at the first place. Hongkong is too hot to play outdoor and in Ocean Park, they do nothing to help you to cool down. Their staff speak terrible english. To make it worse, we have trouble in finding rice for lunch and when we found it at Panda Cafe, we were robbed. US$ 100 for a chicken/duck rice, 1 beef rice, 2 coke, 1 terrible soup and 1 plain rice. That might cost half of the price to eat the same food in Singapore. Really regret coming here.

Excellent place, cable car is good experience. Excellent place, cable car is good experience.Travelled early June, experience was good. The cable car station is close to MTR station. Waiting time for boarding the cable car was more than 1hr, suggest to plan accordingly.

Not for us. If i were younger i would say that i would have enjoyed Ocean Park, the views were great and everthing else but to walk around the park was very tiring for us who are in the senior years, for kids, its a really great way to have fun.Advise, dont go on a summer month, its soooooooooo hot and humid!
Eoe. You can spend all day here .. A little expensive to get in but well worth it so much to see.. Lots of walking make sure you've the right footwear...

Amazing getaway for all age groups. Excellent place for all age groups, although it is far away from city centre and not easy to commute for outsiders.Enjoyed few water rides as they were non in Disneyland. Make sure you wear comfortable shoes as you would have to walk a lot.Alert: Cost of food served inside is steep, suggest to pre book meals

Disneyland for adults. If you are travelling among friends, this is the theme park you need to visit. The attractions are suitable for adults and won't make you feel bored and wasting money compared to our time in disneyland.
Must visit. Extreme fun. This was the icing on the cake on our Hong Kong trip. Loved all the rides here. Huge park with many attractions. People of all ages have something to enjoy here.

Very big theme park. Ocean park consist of aquarium, panda, fox , penguin and many exciting rides and roller coaster. Try flying swing, ferris wheel, pirate ship, eagle & bumper car & many more rides.

Day out . Come with a good pair of sandals not shoes as you have to walk a lot and with the untimely rains u don't want ur feet in wet socks and soaking shoes all day. Carry your rain gear without fail. Personally I found it even better than HK Disneyland and the ticket is cheap too. U get a stroller for 100HKD; don't forget to get it once u get in. It is huge place so don't spend a lot of time gazing around at one place as you might not be able to look around the entire park in a day. Make it a two day trip if you have the time. Lots of variety to eat as well along with few healthy items as well like the frozen pineapple candy and frozen watermelon. There are not many baby care rooms most of which are occupied forever. So I used the ladies washroom to change my baby diaper. But it is an amazing place with better thrill rides than Disneyland for sure. You will love it. You will want to come back again !!!

Great place. Went here last week.. my kids were very happy. Love the dolphin show very much... not too crowded maybe because not a peak season at hongkong through the hot weather but we are fortunate it was cloudy but no rain

Ocean Park. One of the best theme parks in HK. It is as good as Disneyland in my opinion. My favorite part was taking riding the cable car. The views were absolutely spectacular. Highy recommend Ocean Park to everyone while visiting HK.

Fantastic amusement park.. When I visited HKG years back, this was the place to go...before the new Disneyland. Many exciting rides and monorail and chair ride to get you around plus a fantastic aquarium. A fun day for adults and children alike.

Trip to Ocean Park. I would have given ocean park 5/5 had there this been open beyond 6 pm. The day we had gone the timings was 10 am to 6 pm. There is no way with kids you can cover the entire ocean park in 8 hours.Here too we took the stroller and went on a friday. The queues was as bad as the previous day at disneyland owing to long weekend.i suggest , to cover the adventure land first and then come down to complete the remaining attractions. For all indian tourist, veg food is available at clowning restaurant in the adventure land. Though tad expensive you dont have much options..All food items are expensive including water ($28 HKD) so suggest take your own stuff while going entering ocean park.Overall a great attraction with Kids and worth every penny

Lots of fun. I have heard that the Ocean Park had added more attractions including rides. I have not visited Ocean Park in 30 years when there was no Disneyland in Hong Kong yet. I bought tickets at the airport where I got quite a discount. Getting there was easy because there were directions from the MTR station. In the park, the aquarium was not better than others in other countries. However, the North Pole and South Pole exhibition was amazing as well as other exhibition. I had never been to very close encounter with the Penguins as here. May was not the best month to visit Hong Kong because it was to warm for outdoor activities. However, there were very short queues at every ride we got in. We took a leave from the hot weather into the cooler exhibition every now and then through out the day at the Ocean Park.

A great place to spend the day!. Loved our Ocean Park adventure! We went straight to the summit using the cable car (amazing views by the way) and tried out all their thrill rides. It's better to go early on the rides so there's less queue. The Hair Raiser is amazing! The Rapids should not be missed as well, but you need to get ready to get wet for this. For the best dining views, check out The Bayview Restaurant near the cable car. There's a lot more attractions here than in Disneyland, and everything's a treat. Aside from the gigantic aquarium, make sure you visit the sharks, pandas, penguins, arctic foxes, and the seals. Don't miss the shows too, specially the one in Ocean Theatre.

Great day out . Yesterday I visited ocean park with my family. I have to say that is is very different from other parks. The whole park is set upon a mountain which is very cool but sometimes you look at rides and they become quite scary hanging tracks over cliffs. The park is clean and very large. The cable cars are extremely good which are you from the entrance and over the mountain. The shows are good. The rides are plenty and the whole place seems a good day out. The panda house is brilliant and you can even go and see koala bears. I really did enjoy my time here but the only thing I found a little poor was the price on the food outlets. It becomes quite expensive when eating at parks. Overall a great day out. And just to add one more thing. I would say 2 day is plenty of time to do the park. I wouldn't return for a while to give them a chance to add some new things
Good Attraction. It is family attraction must go within spring, autumn. The attraction is new. The aquarium is great.
Fun day out!. It's much more fun than Disneyland and they are always improving what they can offer. Even if you don't get on the rides, it's still a fun day out and the cable car view is amazing.

Been here so many times! Love it. Been here so many times!! Amazing theme park, love the marine animals here and all the rides!' The best theme park in Hong Kong! Highly recommend! Source: used to intern with dolphins here at this amazing park with great animal care

Better than Disney. If you have the time to visit a theme park, than this is the one. Exciting rides and beautiful shows through the day. The park spreads across the mountain and the cable car is a beautiful experience with a great view of the city and sea, You will need to plan for a whole day for this, and the walking is extensive with many uphill trails. Not recommended for seniors. A fantastic enclosure of the sharks is an experience you don't want to miss. Do carry a handheld fan and a bottle of water at all times, you will need it constantly.

Interesting for families with young children. It's our family's 2nd trip to the Ocean Park. The place has not change a lot since 4 years ago, but there are some minor improvements here and there. The Ocean Park MTR looks almost ready and it will be very convenient in the future for visitors.The park is interesting for families with young children as it has both animals, rides and shows. As with all theme parks, the cost of food prices here is really expensive!
A must go ! wonderful experience. Really enjoyed the place . Picture worthy and full of happy memories. Do bring along light disposable ponchos for the water rides can be a little wet.

Best theme park is Hong Kong!!!. I wanted to visit a theme park in Hong Kong for my birthday so I had to decide between ocean park and Disneyland... I'm so happy I chose ocean park, for value for money and for the rides available. Great roller coasters and top quality fun. All the staff are really friendly, my only criticism is there was literally 1 person working at the McDonald's restaurant so it took us half an hour to queue! animals are very well looked after and it is clear that they take safety precautions seriously as there was a serious thunderstorm during our visit and they wouldn't reopen any of the rides until they had thoroughly tested etc. My dreams came true when I saw a panda for the first time here, what an experience! The park is very clean and well kept. Would love to visit again! :)

A better Disneyland. (+visit tips). With Ocean Park in HK - I do not understand why Disney is still operating the HK Disneyland. This is so much better and well priced. The rides are good and there is almost no queue on a weekday. Recommended. Pro tips: 1. Get a park map near the entrance 2. Ride the Ocean Express train up to the summit where the thrill rides are in the morning - then take the cable car down and enjoy the view. 3. The park is big - do hit the big rides first. There's 3 roller coasters, the Abyss ride and don't miss Flash.4. When tired, head down to the aquarium and take a break!5. Food inside the Polar restaurant is acceptable in quality but don't order the pizza - it's no good. Do eat there though - the restaurant has a cut section so you can view the Penguins. We were lucky to catch them during feeding too! It's pricey with a min spend of HKD100/pax too. But worth the view. Cheers and enjoy the park!

Rating is VG but not because if their staff!. People who work here are rude and impatient! If it weren't for the attractions in the park it wouldn't be worth the visit! Rude staff aside, we still had a lot of fun because of all the rides and shows, and wish we had more time to spend there, so we will visit again. If you're bringing your luggage with you, you need to rent a locker, HK$60 for a small one and HK$100 for a jumbo sized one, expensive! Food is way cheaper in the kiosks than in the restos, so find those kiosks. Also, sections aren't interconnected, so get yourself a map so you can plan out where you're going first otherwise you just might waste your time walking around in circles! Rides are so fun! Make time to see the Pandas!
A fun place. It's a huge place which takes a lot of time to cover. Must wear good walking shoes. Kids have a ball. Nice rides. Plenty of photo ops.

I want to go again!. WOW, I was overwhelmed by this place! If only one day in Hong Kong this is how I would spend it!we went here on a Sunday during a thunderstorm... if you can embrace that your going to get wet then its the best time to go; the park was deserted and all the rides were still in operation!the North and South pole area are well worth a look with some amazing animals (pacific Walrus, empire penguins etc.), the panda enclosure is a must... make time to swing past a few times to catch them in various stages of the day... we went on 5 occasions spending quite a lot of time with these magnetic animals. We watched them walking around, eating, climbing, sleeping and even rolling around MUST SEE. the park offered so great thrill rides and all the food and drinks was at typical theme prices with the addition of a maccas down the back. at 7:30PM ensure you make it to the main fountain to watch the water show... its Vegas quality and will leave you with goose bumps... get up close and watch the water turn to fire in a battle of two dragons!!!this park also offered one of the larges aquariums I have seen with ample of viewing spots... very impressive and couldn't say a bad word about the day... even the entrance price was affordable.

Super Fun!!!. We alighted from MTR Admiralty Station and took Bus 629, upon exiting the station (just follow the signs inside the station, and it will lead you to where the bus station for Ocean Park is). Ocean Park in Hong Kong is one of the places I went to which I really enjoyed very much - not only me, but my wife as well. I love the Grand Aquarium, the Cable Cars and a "glimpse" of old Hong Kong. I was also surprised to have seen many animals inside the park, including a Panda, which I have not seen in person before. This park is recommended for people of all ages. Surely, you will enjoy your stay there. There are a lot more to do and see at the park. I reckon, a whole day is not enough to enjoy everything inside it. I would still go back to this place if given the chance to go back to Hong Kong once more. This place is a MUST-SEE!

Not too bad. The only reason we went here was because we took our granddaughter to Hong Kong. My first visit to The Park was around 1985-6, then it was great. Now it is just too big, especially as we are not young anymore. It would be great if you are younger and able to walk all day.

Get the VIP passes. I lived in HK for 8 years before I got around to visiting Ocean Park, but I definitely should have gone sooner!Plenty to see and do and the roller coasters are fantastic!!You can pay a little more for a VIP pass which allows you to bypass many of the lines for rides and exhibits. It's a pretty popular place so that's well worth it.With the pass we were able to ride the roller coasters multiple times without lining up at all.Something to see and do for all ages even if you don't like rides.

Rainy Day, Good Adventure Rides. Visited the ocean park on the rainy day in June 2016. The Hair Raiser ride was awesome. So was the Dolphin Show and the Sea Lions. Panda was cute and the Penguins a sight worth watching. Aquarium was decent, nothing spectacular. Overall a must visit site in HK

Good. Nice clean park. Rides don't seem to open till 11am apart from cable car. The day we went a cyclone grade 3 was to hit. We managed to get on cable car before they closed it. Stunning views well worth it. Saw panda bear which is the reason we went. But due to cyclone all rides were shut till about 2.30 well after it had passed which was dissapointing. Did not rate the food. We were told you could not take food in our bags were searched however we noticed alot of people had taken food in double standard??? The aquarium was great big sting ray and some sharks. Neptune's restaurant was amazing as you are next to the tank and can watch the fish swimming around. Long day fir young ones as not many rides they can go on our daughter was 4yrs.
superb. awsome place for hangout...my kiddo just loved the shows and rides. had a great experience with panda, dolphins and other

Full day activity . Went to Ocean Park on 12th June. It is full day activity. Had lunch in the Bay Garden. Saw most of the events including Dolphin show. Very beautiful and we'll kept. Nice outing. But total walk that day will be minimum 10000 steps.

Timeless Experience. Despite existing for a long time, ocean park still manages to provide fun through its rides and cable car journey. Definitely a must go for first time visitors to Hong Kong but only recommended if you are willing to spend a day there as queues can get pretty long.

Lovely fun park that caters for all ages. Lovely park where both adults and children can have fun. Very large park so be prepared to walk a lot with loads of ups and downs. They offer rides for all ages. The park can be overcrowded so be prepared to wait for hours in a queue.

Family fun !!. People warned us about the queues and the cost. They were right. Single visits while in Hong Kong are expensive, however having now purchased a gold annual pass and FasTrack queue busting tickets (to be used on 7-rides) it makes all the difference. We're now able to enjoy everything Ocean Park has to offer. There are the more sedate rides and their are the roller coasters !! The 'Old Hong Kong' area was interesting, the dolphin research centre had the desired calming effect on our children and the cable car to Adventure land provided some superb views across Aberdeen and beyond.Worth a visit.

Ocean park . I've grown up going to Ocean Park during the summers I've come back to HK. Now that I make my own money I realize Ocean Park tickets have gotten more expensive. It's still cheaper than like Six Flags or Disney but just thought I would share how I got cheaper tickets. Buy at the Klook app for 327$hkd instead of 385$hkd. If ya don't mind, here's a referral code (66SG6) where you can get ~$25hkd off.I just checked with a friend, even if you're a teacher of HK and get discounted tickets it's still not as cheap as Klook. I just don't know how much it is at the China Travel Service (so you should check)!You can also get the OP tickets cheaper $30 hkd then retail value at the mtr booths in Admiralty.
Had to leave. I went in July, and the average waiting time for each attraction was 45 minutes. It was incredibly hot, and we decided to leave as we were not enjoying the day at all

Zoo, aquarium, amusement park all in one. This was my daughter's second most favorite place to show me. The cable car ride should have been worth it on its own, be we got one with the sides all scratched and impossible to see out of. It is enormous, so be prepared for a lot of walking. When crowded, it's not very pleasant. Enjoyed cooling off in the Wild River ride. Allow a full day because it is huge and there is a lot to see. Wear comfy shoes because you will walk miles.

Nice park but rides/attractions are far apart.. Visited the park last week when it was extremely sunny !!!! Was almost impossible to withstand the heat .. so best is to visit the park when it's raining to avoid the sun. Please get yourself fast track which is 15 pounds per person valid for 7 entries. .otherwise you could be waiting at least half hour for most rides even on a weekday . The dolphin show is a must see so grab a seat half hour before the show starts . Excellent overall experience! To make it more enjoyable for visitors the park should open at 9 am instead of 10 and close a hour late than its usual closing times. Please note that Outside Food and drinks are not allowed and it's very costly inside to buy stuff. Rightly deserves to be in the top 10 !!!

Decent Place for kids!!!. When in hongkong one has to visit ocean park..It is a one day affair for the entire family. U have cable car...rides for kids and adults..penguin feeding. .. aquarium. pandas..and the dolphin show.The dolphin show is not be missed..nice show...nice synchronisation by the dolphins and seals..It also provides a decent wifi!!Overall a nice full day outing!!!
Unique. This place has two sides that connected with a rail. For the first 3 times will be unique but later on will be kind of delaying. But overall still okay

Thrill, Excitement & Fun !!. Ocean park is one of the best park I have ever visited. There are 66 rides in it. They have different colour zone for each activity. Penguins, Panda and Fish aquarium are really very nice. Atmosphere they have created was fantastic. Security during the rides are unbelievable. Must visit place along with Disneyland.
Family visit. Everything up and down hill. Lots of buyers traps. Cable car great. Same for rides and train. Nice aquarium. Nice entrance fountain
Poor choice.. I hated every minute of Ocean Park. OK for the kids and teenagers. Long lines and very noisy. no good for an old fart like me!
Enjoyed tour . one of the memorable day in our life.super enjoy even i got scared in cable car but it is really really fun family get stick together for this trip....happy family day

Memorable experience. Went with family many years ago and it remains an unforgettable experience. The cable cars offer amazing views that can't be missed. Then there's the animals, aquariums, rides and shows. Shouldn't be missed!

Great Theme Park for Family. This theme park offer many attraction and of course giant aquarium with many fishes is the great choice to spend quality holiday with your family. What I don't like is the staffs there always push to take photo even no obligation to buy.

Nice small park, but closes quite early. Reach there early as the park closes by 5:30pm local time. Park is small, the rides are fine for younger children than teens. Main drawback is the early closing time of the park. Not too far from the main city and well connected by Bus. MTR is opening soon which'll make this place more accessible.

A spectacular park to visit!. We have been to many theme parks around the world but Ocean park is definitely a place worth visiting when you are in Hong Kong. Famous in their Dolphin show, you can have fantastic and exciting rides too but bear in mind there are height constraint for some rides. Love this place a lot!
A must place to visit . A place that we must visit when we went to this place. My son really like this place so many rides to enjoy, love the sea life aquarium, love most of the rides.
Enjoyed alot. I went with my frnd there and had fun. There are so many visitors from foreign. There is restaurant and the cutlet was awesome @60 only

Must visit. One of My primary aim to go to Hong Kong was to visit Ocean Park. It is a world in itself. Lovely location and beautiful scenery all around. Booking the tickets online before hand will be helpful and a little cheaper as well. Lots of attraction for kids as well as the adults. I was lucky to see Pandas active and in action. Aquarium is good but one has seen in other countries as well. They have a cute and efficient train service to go up to other places. Dancing Dolphins shows are at 12 pm, 3pm an 5 pm. A map and guide book is available at the entrance free of charge. So plan accordingly. But don't miss the cute penguins. Plenty of rides, food and souvenir shops around to bring back memories.

Better than Disneyland . It's a great experience to visit ocean park despite there are lots of visitor from mainland china, it's very crowded. But so as Disneyland. At least the game and the nature are better.

Went with 7yr old daughter and wife.. Great time. Nice place especially the cable car, dolphin show..Ferris wheel was no good, after waiting in queue for 10-15 minutes, all we got was two full rounds and it was over..All other shows and rides are wonderful..I guess no visitor to HK on holiday with kids should miss it though better to go on a weekday..

Best Theme Park in Hong Kong !!. Rides: are definitely by far the best in HK, better than Disney and better than those temporary rides you find in the Central area that sometimes appear. Would recommend all the roller coaster rides.For Kids: it may not be as toddler and under 5-year-old friendly as Disney but there is still plenty of small rides and attractsions for them.For Food: there are plenty of restaurants, not cheap, but honestly I would skip the fancy stuff and stick with the fast food and put more hours on rides.Animals: The water attractions and the shows are a must. Work your schedule around those.View: the view on the cable car is really amazing, and you can take it to get to the middle kingdom side on the other end.Tip: The place gets very crowded, especially in weekends or festive times around December. If you want to be efficient you have to plan. That would include trying to line up to get in (my recommendation is to arrive either 45-60 min before the park opens to ensure you're the earliest - or arrive aroudn 15 min after it opens - there will be a queue but at least everything is moving by now). Its better to start with the rides starting FURTHEST from the entrance and work your way backwards.

Feel like a kid again!. One of the best theme parks for me!
