Worth the whole day to spend here. 2 parts to the park - and my favorite was taking the cable car to the other side which runs along the edge of the mountain! Must try the roller coaster overlooking the edge!! Adrenaline rush and a great view. There's something for everyone of all ages to do.

Amazing Fun, Exciting and Entertaining Day !!. Location: Its one end of Hong kong and about HKD 200 by Taxi if you are putting up near TST.Beautifull Park and amazing fun, from Animal kingdoms like seeing Panda, Penguins and other species. The ocean Park is divided in 2 parts one is below and other is on the hill top. To get to the hill top there are 2 ways one is by taking a Cable car or by Ocean Express train. The cable car is scenic and slow and while going up i would recommend this. Ocean express train takes less than 5 mins and i would recommend while coming back down.The Hill Top park has amazing fast and medium ride for ages above 8 years.We tried all and the best we liked were th Hair Raiser an amazing roller coaster ride.Total there are 3 roller coasters there in the above park and 2 -3 other rides.There is dolphin show also which is worth watching. there are 3 shows in day so you can choose the time you want to see it with your convenience.

More than disappointing!!. The park is divided into two areas. The lower part (start area) of the park is totally boring / uninteresting, so that the best will be, when you go directly to the cable car or underground train to get to the upper area.This park is not the right for older people, for sick people and others who not really good by feet, because of the very few rest benches and the less shops to by drinks (very hot weather at time!).Likewise, the few options for dining were very disappointing! There was only one McDonald, the few other food stalls offered only asian food.Short riding times of the attractions, but very long waiting times.Far too little quieter rides, or which are nice for couples.The aquarium was a huge disappointment:1) Only simple fishes2) Big fishes were to smallThe Panda House was really big, but inside you get another disappointment: ONLY two panda bears and two monkeys.When you reach the end of park after walking some hours in the burning sun, you must walk all the way back to the entrance. An exit at the end of the park would make many people happier!!Taxi to Kowloon are very rarely, the most drive only at Kong Kong island. We had to wait 45 minutes!!

The Ocean Park on the edge of Ocean. The wonderfully situated on the hills ending & touching the ocean, the first ever seen theme park on the mountains & looking over the ocean. The perfect name for the perfect place. The rides were amazing & thrilling also. The penguin & Panda houses are very much enjoyed by mu daughter. The cable on the ocean was also nice experience. The big & giant escalators are breath taking. The architect of the theme park was fabulous. One must visit ocean park in Hongkong.

Thrilling ridessss!. The rides were thrilling. I dont ride rollercoasters with loops but I had to get out of my comfort zone so I tried the rides here and I SWEAR IT IS ALL WORTH IT! Just make sure to arrange or plan your day because lines are too long on some of the rides.I fell in love with the pandas!!! An An! She was so playful I wanna hug them! ♥

Fun time with the Family. Brought my parents and son there. Parents last visited more than 15 yrs ago and was amazed with the changes within it. Of course the new additional rides keep the 8 year old boy well entertained. But as we visit during the weekend, so it was a little too packed for our liking. And luckily we bought some Fast Track access that saved us quite a fair bit of time in terms queuing up for the rides. It started to rain at almost end of our time there and the crowd started to get crazy into the shelters. Quite dangerous with the crowd though the officers at the park tried to keep the crowd in order

6 hours at the ocean park. flThe main attraction is the main aquarium, and the restaurant inside is quite cool, however the food is payable! And expensive for the taste.The cable ride is fun and the rides and Roger coasters are plenty but not fun if you have small kids.The panda enclosure is good. The aquarium doesn't have too many large species- only few sting rays, a very big Manta Ray- that's the show stopper I guess, few hammer heads. Didn't find the penguins, the Arctic enclosure has spotted seals and walrus.Pretty well made with great viewing locations in the enclosures, with a cable car and a train inside, the train is quickest mode between the 2 sections of the park. The dolphin show is okay- if you have seen the ones in America or even Europe, you might be disappointed - has 4 dolphins and 2 seals in the show. I haven't seen others in Asia though. There is an enclosure for Kuala bear and kangaroo - the kid lived it! 65 hk $ for one way taxi from Pacific center in central area, however there is a train as well!

Superb!. We spent two days exploring Ocean Park, it is just wonderful, there is so much to do! The animal exhibits, the rides, the gardens, the entertainment are all exceptional, Neptune restaurant and Panda Cafe had delicious and fresh food. All the staff that we came into contact with were very helpful and polite. We will definitely be back when we next visit Hong Kong!!

Awesome park, but unfriendly taxi stand with no benches for elderly. Awesome park! We used the klook vouchers and got the tickets at a discount. We were with young kids and my mother in law who wasn't very mobile but we managed through the park. There were plenty of seats under shelter or small trees once you reach the summit. The view from the summit was beautiful and the rides were a hit with the kids. My MIL and kids enjoyed the penguin and arctic animal e closure at the summit. It was however a hilly climb once we were at adventure land, marine show and shark enclosure. So if you are with elderly who can't walk much, best to stay within the polar land (rides and arctic animal enclosure) near where the polar express train drop you off. The polar express train up to summit was a cool ride and turns up the imagination. A letdown was however the taxi stand as we depart. There were no benches at all. And what made it worse was the long wait for taxis willing to drive you back to Kowloon. There were two queues (one for those heading to kowloon and one for those within HK island). Very few cabs available for passengers heading to Kowloon. We ended up waiting in line for at least half an hour.

Good park but not much ocean animals. The park is big, well organised and clean. There are many things to see and to do for children, such as aquarium, Panda, amusing park, cable car to see the view and many other things. However, there are not much themes related to the ocean, so if one expect to see dolphin or wales, or other sea animals, you would be disappointed. We had a good time there.

Enjoyable for kids and adult alike!. This was our 2nd trip here after more than 10 years and we enjoyed it. There were lots of improvements since then, thus my daughter enjoyed her 2nd visit as she was when she was just 10 years old. There were lots of attractions and since we were early (arrived before the park opens), when it opened, we went straight to the cable rides up and we're able to have 3 cable rides. If you enjoy riding cable cars, do so early since there will be long lines later. Depending on ones interest, there are different attractions - birds, land animals, fishes, etc. Do get a schedule of the different shows so you can also arrange your itinerary.

One of the Best.... Ocean Park represent Hong Kong own Amusement park, no doubt, it had its own identity and uniqueness. All the shows and rides are the glamour of Ocean Park. It's a must visit place in Hong Kong.
RIDES FOR ADULTS. -Ocean park is more likely a rides for adults. -Has extreme rides compare to Disneyland.-Watch the shows, you will surely love it.

Pandas, Dolphins, Rollercoasters!. What an amazing day! You can do a good day here. You do not need to rush either there is an amazing cable car to the park there are penguins and pandas to look at as well and rides! it really is amazing, do not do disneyland which is westernised this is very authentic!

Good amusement park for 10yo & older. From rides to aquarium, from pandas to carousel, from water show to cable car, this amusement park is just great in HK.Just 4 negative points : -The food is just awful in the whole park (all kinds are disgusting) and unfortunatly you are not entitled to bring yur own food ;-Avoid visiting on Sunday or Public Holidays : with chinese tourists and domestic employees, it becomes just overovercrowded-In my opinion it is not adapted to the little ones : my kids just feel bored with "baby" attrations and till they reached 10yo, they really prefered HKDisneyland (and I agree, even if it is more expensive)-We are visiting this park since our arrival in HKG in 2008. After noticing a real improvement in animals shows till 2014, we observe they are not original and interesting anymore.Another positive point to finish, the opening of MTR in South island (expected by the end of 2016?) will make it much easier to reach this place. A good place!

FANTASTIC FAMILY DAY OUT. This is a super place for all ages, the kids will love the shows and the sites, you go up on a sky bubble, a bit high for people with height issues. But lots of fun, you must do this at least once while in Hong Kong
2nd time visit. This was our family's 2nd trip in 2 years; this time was on a rainy summer's day. We took the MTR and public bus there and back. The park is very enjoyable.

Fun Parlour Extrordinaire. Even being there for when it opened at 10 a.m. there were several hundred people ahead of me. TIP pre purchase your ticket from your hotel (as I did) or the Tourist Agency to save even more time having to line up. Too many superlatives to describe this venue. A whole day there was not enough to see and do everything. Well worth taking the cable car over to the far side of the theme park. Lots more to do there and the gnarliest Roller Coaster ride ever! Arctic penguins only outdone by the adorable Giant Pandas back at the main entrance.

Nice huge park. The park was huge. It will be an advantage if they have an accessible wheelchair rental in different areas on the park. We went with my father, he felt tired and difficult to walk when we reached ocean theatre. But there were no shortcuts or easy way to go back to the main entrance or at least a wheelchair for rent within the area.

Recommended for all age groups, must have in your itenary. Hong Kong Ocean park visit is one full day activity. It is huge and to cover the major attractions inside, one should plan on what they want to cover as must see. Pandas definitely are in to do list along with South pole and north pole attractions. Rides are very good, specially the hill top activity and the roller coaster, don't miss it. Take one way rope way and one way train to get to the hill top, both are on no extra ticket. It is recommended to reach by 10am so as you will have maximum time to cover all the rides and attraction by 6pm. It is not recommended to fall in their photo frame selling activity with the characters as they are very expensive, you could cover the same in your own cam frame..
Good !. A huge park ! A lot of activities that you can do on this place. Children and teenagers all had fun doing and trying all the activities !!

Adventure park with educational ocean life tour. Love the ocean life tour with the guide explaining and to see so many fishes up close and they also allow u to touch some star fishes etc .. always enjoy the cable car rides acroos the scenic views of mountain by the sea .. must go for family esp w kids

A Great place for fun. We bought entrance ticket online before we went to Hong Kong due to avoid waiting in line because we visited here during new year holiday and it worked perfectly. The park is perfect specially for family with young kids. The most beautiful thing was marine life in the huge aquarium. And there are many different roller coaster rides and our son loved all of them, he rode every ride. We had a wonderful day there.
Excellent fun. Had a lovely time with my 3 year-old. No queue for most attractions and activities. Clean and accessible with buggy. Ocean express such a good alternative to the tram.

Pandas Galore. LiLi one of the resident pandas was having great fun during our visit, the keeper was surprised at how active he was, playing role poly with a sack bag down the hill in his enclosure and generally mucking about in the trees and tracks. We watched him for about half an hour. Had read they usually sleep so maybe we were just lucky. One other of the visiting pandas from China was active but nothing like Lili. The golden snub nosed monkey was also fun to watch. The gondola (cable car) ride was also fun.

always happy at the Ocean Park. This theme park has remained to be a true family and friends destination. The marine life in the giant aquarium, giant Pandas , beautiful fishes, Penguins, seals keep the young and old alike mesmerised by the beauty and mystery behind the animals way of life. The cable car is a highlight as much as the rides in Thrill mountain.

wonderful, but avoid tourist peak day. value for money, it is not only entertaining but also educative. we had so much fun in all parks. all the animals are well nurtured, and wide variants. thene parks are set at peak of d mountain with beautiful landscape.avoid peak time. when we came on saturday, 80% are tourist groups & majority of them had vey poor habits on queuing.

Cruel and Inadequate provisions for animals. Very sad to see many of the animal displays kept animals in displays not adequate for their wellbeing. You can claim a conservation need in some cases, but this is clearly not a setup for conservation but a setup for our tourist dollars.Sad to see Dolphins and Seals display. Sea lions and walrus were showing signs of stress and boredom, clearly their pens too small without sufficient stimulus.We will not visit again and avoid.

Great Park, Great Rides, Great Features. One can experience this only by visiting this place.Better to take the Fast Pass if travelling with a large group in order to have faster access on cable car to top, on some of the popular rides as well as to the Grand Aquarium. The cable car takes longer to reach than the internal train.Can divide the time around 70:30 ratio between teh Summit and the Waterfront if one is travelling with kids who want to do all the rides - there are more in the Summit.Also dolphins, polar creatures and sharks are at the top.The waterfront has activities for smaller kids as well as the Grand Aquarium, the Panda and birds

Fun with family. I visited Ocean Park in January 2016 with family. There are a lot of fun things to see here and we were very tired out by the end of the day. We visited both Ocean Park and Disneyland, and while both were wonderful, we found Ocean Park to have a larger number of rides totally, as well as a larger number of thrilling rides. They also have beautiful creatures like the Panda, Koala bear, red panda, penguins, etc. Tips:> This seems obvious but try and visit on a weekday as queues are smaller.> Try and visit the animal exhibits earlier in the day. I visited the red panda in the evening and it was resting for the day so I could not catch a glimpse of it. > There is a McDonald's in the park for those interested - but it seemed very crowded.> Do take the cable car, the view is breathtaking. We rode it twice during our trip.> On the rides where you will get wet, you can purchase a rain poncho at the entrance of the ride. If you don't plan to buy one, bring a raincoat or a windcheater jacket with you.> You will spend the whole day there so plan accordingly - comfortable shoes and clothing, no loose jewelry if you plan to get on the rides.> There is a light, sound and fire show at the fountain at 8 PM so be there a little in advance to get good seats around it.

Family with senior. They have really good senior discount which surprised us! Fun place to go, great place for family, good exercise for senior, nice facility. Taxi from Shangwan is easier than take bus.
amazing amazing. This park definitely has the wow factor the exhibits the rides and the cable car trip over to the other side. Brilliant day out icing on the cake being the pandas.

wow wow wow. No words to describe how they built this amazing attraction..so many things to do in this place and the rides were funtabulous and really needs a heart to try all of them..I love them all not only the rides but all the amenities they offered.

Nice park. Went there with 2 young kids aged 5 and 3.They had more fun here than at Disneyland in Hong Kong.
The queues were generally much smaller compared to Disneyland and less crowded.
Downside is less eating places and the menu is limited for foreigners not used to the local delicacy.
Nice view, overall a nice day. The park is located on a mountain with a great view, the rides are nice (not too exciting). We went on Mon so it was quite empty.

Great! . This was a great way to see hong kong sky high, just be careful though if your afraid of hights don't for the glass bottom one! I initially thought the glass bottom ones were just a higher class as they were called the crystal rides or something similar but then later found out the bottom is clear! So just make sure your going into a normal one before you get your tickets!

A good family day out. Had a great day with the family at Ocean ParkThe Cable Car had breathtaking views the restaurant at the summit also had a great view with good food. We purchased a voucher for entry and lunch with Klook TravelThe rides were fun the aquarium was good the dolphin show a bit boring but ok

Park with good view. The cable car ride was very scenic and Best to visit on weekday. Less queue on that day. Washroom and signages was well placed with free wifi. Tourist friendly. Nice performance form the sea animals with reminders to care for the sea environment. Hope there will be more food selection instead of fast food

Fun starts here! . I was really ecstatic when we decided to go to Ocean Park, I went here for the sole purpose of seeing pandas in person and for the cable car as well. But this place has a lot of interesting attractions to offer and the place is way too big for my capacity to walk. The cable car really scared the bejeebers out of me, but its all worth it especially the scenery. I cant wait to come back here, hopefully by that time the MTR straight to the park is already up and running. Thank you Ocean Park for a wonderful experience.
Fun day out. This was well worth a visit even just to see the Giant Panda which were out of this world, the rides are also great

Great!!. Well. if you go to Hong Kong, you gotta visit Ocean Park along with Disneyland and Madame Tussauds. This place is so vast ans so gigantic with so many reality shows included in ti that you cannot finish seeing this place in one day. Dont miss the dolphin show and the Gigantic Aquarium. There is a Roller Coaster at the last point of the Park over an Ocean. Do that and see your clicked picture after that :p .
Excellent place for kids. Had a great time with family. Kids enjoyed the most.Lots of rides and the cable car from base to summit was wonderful.

Great place to spend an Entire Day. We were here in Jun 2013 but TripAdvisor doesn't have dates beyond 2015 to select so I had to choose Jun 2015.We were 4 adults and had a great time. For the ticket price, this place offers way too many cool things.Beautiful and long cable car journey over the sea, excellent rides to suits people's different adrenaline needs,sci fi train journey, aquarium, penguin enclosures...this place is like all in one destination point.Mind you, you dont have to pay additional dollars for any activity which makes the whole experience very light on your pocket.If you want to spend one full day in HK, don't miss it. If we adults liked it so much, I'm sure the kids will absolutely looooveee it.
Bundle of joy. It is a full day fun especially if you are with kids.Lots of rides,games,food,water games.Some of the rides are too adventerous....

Best Family Park around. Ocean Park is a must visit and we prefer it to HK Disneyland. It's easy to get to and has adventures for the whole family. The Panda enclosure is amazing and if you get to see it eating it makes the whole day worthwhile. The kids loved the train (submarine) up to the top of the park and they also loved all the rides. We spend 5 hours there and it still wasn't enough. The chair lift coming down was spectacular. Every time we come to HK we go back to Ocean Park.

A wow place to be. I would say Ocean Park has much more to offer than Disney Land when it comes to rides and excitement. The cable car ride is a must do and the roller coaster rides are really thrilling.

Good fun place for adults and kids. Unlike the HK Disneyland, the Ocean park can be enjoyed by both adults and kids. The park opens at 10am. Rather than buying the ticket on spot, check with your hotel or agent for a ticket with meal combo. Tip: Try reaching early and without wasting time on the events in the valley, head straight for the cable car to the mountain. The park is divided into 2 parts- valley and mountain. 80% things to do are at the mountain. While descending take the train as the cable car queue may be a long wait. There is only 1 McDonald's near the Ferris wheel! The park closes at 6pm so make sure you take the train back from the mountain to the valley around 4pm so you can finish the things at the valley. Must watch: the dolphin show.

Excellent place to roam around !. I loved this place as its one of the best amusement parks I have visited.It has rope ways, rides, shows, marine life aquerium and many more things.In short everyone has something for them inside ocean park.

Ocean Park is such a big place, one day is not enough! The attractions are far from each other that you need more time t. Spend a great time with family and friends in Hong Kong Ocean Park for thrilling rides, animal encounters, quirky and informative attractions, a cable car ride, breathtaking views, and plenty of food. All's set for a day of fun! Explore the park's many popular attractions, including the Polar Adventure, Old Hong Kong, Thrill Mountain, Rain-forest, Aqua City and Amazing Asian Animals. Get to know some of Asia's most precious native animals at the Giant Panda Adventure. Cross the Park via cable car and view the entire 870,00 square meters from above!
Ugh. Overall, I love the theme park. However, I was so disappointed since my to-do-list rides are under maintenance. It's kinda frustrating

Exhilirating -- one day is not enough. Ocean Park is such a big place, one day is not enough! The attractions are far from each other that you need more time to stroll especially if you're with small children. We started our trip from the far side, then going back to the gate so that by the time the park closes, we're near the exit. Our family's favorite attraction is the cable car where you can see the view of the park plus the majestic view of the ocean.
Kids Love it. Lots of activities. Lots of attraction. A whole day event. Every one will love it and for kids, its is WowDon't miss Dolphin Show

Great for everyone, come for the Halloween celebration in October!. im a local and i have been to Ocean Park for MANY times but never get bored. if you are young and seeking for excitement, the rides (especially that roller coaster with a clown in the entrance) are all good for you, you can even get a very good view of the ocean since all the rides are high up on the mountain side ( dont be scared by the word "mountain", it only takes 10 minutes to get from the lower side to the mountain by the in-park tram; or you may take the cable car to enjoy the stunning scenery)If you are coming with kids, there are MANY cute animals and animal shows, and there is also a fun area for kids. Especially recommend all of you to come for the Halloween month in Ocean Park, there will be many ghost houses and well-dressed up/make up ghosts wandering around to scare you, get a taste of how Hong KOng people celebrate the Halloween!!ok so whats bad in this park? Food is limited and not a good place for rainy days

Solo Trip. I had to explore Hong Kong alone while my, then fiance, was working. This was one of my favorite things I did there. A lot of walking but I enjoyed every bit of the attractions I made it to. Just wish I could have made it to the aquarium!

Plan for the entire day. This place was a sensory overload. We took the gondola over to the upper park, which gave you a fantastic view of the harbor. Then you ride roller coasters that appear to loop out over the cliffs and you feel like you could zoom out into the water - for the added thrill. There was heavy rock music with Chinese lyrics blasting in the speakers. It was truly an amazing time. Even the escalator system that takes you down to the expanding portions of the park was pretty amazing. The ride back in the underground tram was cool too. Don't forget to visit the aquarium and say hello to the pandas. Overall, it was an excellent day for parents and kids. The lines were a bit long, but it was July and the park staff did the best they could. I would advise taking the tram up the mountain and saving the gondola ride for the way back. We took the express bus from Pacific Place - get there earlier than suggested because the line for the bus was quite long. We were there before opening and the queue to enter was mayhem.

Fantastic day. My wife and I went with a large group. We abandoned them early and went on an adventure. The park is great and we had a magnificent time.The roller coasters are great and the rest of the park is simply outstanding. Just go and enjoy the day.
Enjoyable. Felt like i am young again whenever we are in this place. Very touristy eventhough we were there during ordinary day. This is a good place for all ages.

Great day out. Has a day here during our week in HK. Got very sunburnt - so take sunscreen! Awesome ride up to the park via the cable car. Had a great day on all the rides - loved the roller coasters. Because you are on the top/edge of mountain - they're pretty scary - you feel like you're going to fall into the ocean :-)Only complaint is that it's a very long walk all day between the rides/different sections of the park

Ocean Park fun for everyone. We did not go on the scarier rides but there are plenty if you like thrills. We went on the Rapid ride and that was good - if you dont want to get wet take a rain poncho. You can buy there but they are expensive. We watched the Dolphin and Seal show and saw the Pandas. To get to the summit you can take the Cable Car or Ocean Expess but coming down there can be quite a wait we got our tickets on KLOOT - a fantastic app and the tickets are on your phone and they just scan them - no need to print them. Discount and skip the line to buy tickets. A great day. We cauth MTR to Admiralty and then the 629 bus. They are building an MTR station there so that will make it a little bit faster but the 629 is a dedicated Ocean Park bus. Having Octopus card makes MTR and Bus, ferry trvsl really easy. See my review on Octopus card for more info.

Too Touristy!. Ocean Park HK still has it's attractions but I think it lacks things or "parts" now that should be something to be seen only in their park. Yes, there's that panda that's so cute and makes you feel that you want to hug them BUT only if you get to see them. Because of so many people in the park, and almost all always saying something to each other even if the signs says SILENCE, the pandas are reluctant to get out of their area. So now it's a hit or miss to see these wonderful creatures. There's always a long queue in all the rides also.

Fun day there!. It is my first time there and to no surprise there is a really big crowd even though it's a weekday. I thought I will be crazy about the rides but surprisingly I spent my day almost for the animals and shows. Love their idea of shows that can educate the public about the importance of keeping our nature safe and clean. I must say it is a great place for family with children. The park is open from 10am till 6pm and I wish to stay longer if I could. Transportation is very convenient as there is plenty number of buses waiting right outside the park even after 6pm.

Fun Place. Be it the Pandas or be it the Ocean Park Show of dolphins and sea lions or the Artic fox or the red Pandas! it is an experience in itself. The kids and adults (who enjoy fun rides) have to literally be pulled away from rides to ensure you cover the whole park. The line for the cable car can be daunting, so while going to the summit use the train and the cable car on the way back. (then too the wait is much..about 30-40 mins in Q) , but then all the wait time is worth it for the view!

Wonderful theme park. Ocean Park is the setting of many of my childhood memories, and returning as an adult was just as fun.There is such a huge range of attractions ranging from pandas, seals, aquariums and dolphin shows to rollercoasters and cable cars that you could spend the whole day here with things still on the to-do list. I also like that they have several exhibits focusing on marine conservation. This is such an important issue and the exhibits explain in a way that is simple for children to understand, plus the option to donate via Octopus card - genius!The park itself is well maintained and clean, easily navigated with good signage and there is no shortage of food and drink kiosks.However, there aren't many "healthy options" so if you suffer from a food allergy or are not into overpriced deep fried snack foods then I would recommend bringing something along with you. I would also recommend bringing a lot of drinking water as it can get very hot in the sun and the bottled water at the kiosks is expensive.

Lovely place! . Loved ocean park. Extremely child friendly. Park was kept clean and well maintained. Bathrooms were clean. My son loved all the animal exhibits. Loved the cable car ride. Highly recommended to everyone who visits HK!

A must visit place in Hongkong !!!. Dolphin & Seal show + Panda is life time experience at this place. Gandola ride + train is another attraction. You'll find hell lot of rides and wonderful attractions here.

Fanttastic. our kids absolutely loved ocean park, ages 4&5, go in the morning and be gone by 1, for the younger children most of the attractions are on one side only, the other side have a lot of heigh restrictions which wont be suitable for the little ones anyway, penguins are on the other side though....kids loved the aquarium and seeing the pandas along with many more, great place must do if you have kids that need entertaining..But if i was only citing for just a few days i would check out the city and skip this.

"BEST IN HONG KONG". We visited ocean park on the 29th of April its was our 1st in HK as we had our share of excitement.. The "cable car" was as exciting as ever its around 10 mins Ride its gives a Good view of Hong Kong The "Ocean theatre" is one of my favourite .. Its well Maintained & Better than Disneyland.......

Better than Disneyland HK. Visited here with friends & it certainly didn't disappoint! Filled the day nicely & got to see everything. We taxi'd into Stanley after & have a lovely few drinks at the harbour before heading back to the island, very tranquil compared to the hustle & bustle

Still awesome!. Have memories of this place when i was a lot younger and the feelings still haven't changed after all these years, it's still loads of fun! Just make sure you dedicate majority of you day because there is so much to see and do. Also might be wise to pre-buy your ticket as queues might be busy.

Ocean park - still as attractive as ever. We visited ocean park after spending few days in Disneyland.. Was bit apprehensive given we had our share of excitement.. The "cable car" was as exciting as ever gives a fabulous view of Hong Kong - though not for weak hearts..!!! The park has some Amazing mix of different types of rides for all groups. I have visited Ocean park few times and have seen great additions every time. The "Ocean theatre" is one of my favourite .. Now I know the exact place to sit to get a great view and maximum entertainment.. !!!

Visit during the week. Thankfully we visited during the week, as I would not to have visited in the weekend or during the holidays. There were a few waiting time and the longest we had to wait was 20 minutes for the gondola.We mainly visited to see the Pandas, luckily we got to see one panda playing around, he was rolling down the hill and was very active, even the staff were amazed in his activity.Some of the exhibits are a bit rundown, but are still enjoyable to see, the Sichuan exhibit was interesting and they had Golden snub nosed monkey, which was active and came close down to the glass for great photo opportunities. The Panda in this exhibit was asleep between a couple of rocks looking down the hill.The gondola ride was impressive and thankfully not too busy, the top area was great and the water ride "the Rapids" was just what we needed for the humidity of the day.The Walruses we very active and the cold areas of the Pole areas was a great way to cool down as well as see some wildlife up close.Good value and could easily spend a long day here, food prices were up a bit as per any facility like this, but good options were available.

A lot to see and do-Loved the pandas. There is a lot to see and do at Ocean Park. We had a 2 and half year old who enjoyed all the rides in the harbour area. We (mum, dad and granny_ enjoyed the cable car, train ride and all of the animals on the amusement park side. We didn't go on any other rides but I could see that this park could appeal to so many different ages.Excellent park and a lot to see

Wonderful. We visited today with family a winderful.place soecially for the young kids everything so nicely arranged excellent infrastructure and arrangement to reach this place is very well good place one must see

Fun fun unexpected. It was a rainy day but still managed to get in many rides which were open . Major attractions had closed down due to public safety reasons
The best ride is : hair raiser
If u like wild life n have kids this is the place to be !
Fun fun fun
Good for family with children. dont forget to bring umbrella when you visit in summer. at the top (after using cable car) was so windy, use some jacket

A whole day joy!. The place is hugeee. I am ranking this park as no 1, topping off Universal Studios of Singapore. Everything is here, from the small birdie to 1 tonne sea lion! Variety kind of animals and shows part of cultural shows. A complete joy for a day.

Good for a day !!. Few rides and shows are good like ocean wonders , hair raiser and mine train ..check the weather before going ..get in early to the park to avoid crowd. As the day progresses it's too crowded.

Good for family who bring their kids 11yrs above. If you all have kids 11years & abve, better visit Ocean Park. They do have muslim stall who sell chicken rice, nasi lemak etc. Don't worry abut it. A lot of thing you can do here, so many game etc.

Good for older kids. Our kids were a bit small for the majority of the rides at ocean park and this was a bit of a let down, that being said the animals, views and some rides were great. Good for a day out

Better than Disneyland!. I've been going to Ocean Park since I was a kid whenever we go to HK. Now that I am a father, I feel that it's my duty to take my baby to Ocean Park as well. Although, he's still a baby, he really loves animals and the place has lots of them. He loves the trained otter by the panda area and the aquarium of course. The cable car was probably the highlight of this trip. He had so much fun riding it he didn't want to let go of the center pole when we got to the top. All in all, it was fun all throughout.If going there with baby, it would be best if you had a baby carrier instead of stroller. in some attractions, the strollers must be parked outside.

HONGKONG VISIT IS NOT COMPLETE WITHOUT VISIT THIS PLACE!. well Ocean park one of the most beautiful and amazing place to visit not just for the kid or family! even if you are alone or traveling as a couple, you may find out this place equally interesting and quiet romantic! where as for kids it's heaven! they just thrilled and screaming literally when they see dolphins! and seal !!! an amazing experience and must must must visit place at HK though bit expensive

Kids area is Tired. I was a fun day and we enjoyed our visit. Most of the small kids area was closed and what was open was tired. The playground was out in the sun an too hot for my daughter to play on.Animal attractions were great. If you want to see the pandas active you will need to get there early.

Fun Place. In this place there are so many things to play with, you forget how the time passes away and won't even know its already dark lol. You just have to book the tickets online to skip the long line.

Park with Amazing & Thrilling Rides. Ocean Park is huge Park having lots of thrilling rides. It also have an Ocean Park Express, which takes you upper part of the park for various rides. Also, there are Penguines, Sea Lions, Aquarium, Animal Garden, Cable Car and lot more. Must visit attraction of Hong Kong.

Great park!. I am proud Ocean Park is in Hong Kong. Everything is great except it is sometime crowded at times. There are far too many Chinese Mainland visitors at times. Think this is unavoidable anywhere is Asia. Kids friendly. Family friendly. Everything is good. TO improve, I guess some of the staff can be better trained to me more enthusiastic. Some acts like zombies . . .

PREFER HK DISNEYLAND. I highly recommend going to HK Disneyland than Ocean Park as it is more clean and you won't get bothered wiping your hands all the time. But if you want to see the aquarium, then the place is alright.

Go Hungry !!. Plenty of food there but to ️enjoy the real park and rides go higher,,,,,,,;) the cold park is the most enjoyable park for me to see the seal actually fighting for space,,female seems dominant to get distracted when they are drying off,,lol️Super nice on collection of fishes,,the one that I really love is the Octupos ,, my ️my never see it before when is actually open up and creep on the glass top of your over head,,,Amazing !!Too many things to see and too little time,,so make sure come early before the tour company brings there ️️bussiness even to buy tickets is a long wait but is fun,,,very hot outside queuing for tickets,, one time pay and see all !!Rides and more rides and stop and get Dim sum,,lol my favorite !!Ride a ️merry go around train is fun and relaxing when you are in your own,,,hahahaaa,,two by two but ️Family only !! Panda is the best of all,,,,,️️kinda showy when people taken photos so made sure camera charge full as I run out of mind,,hahahaaaa,,,,,go go goooooo really full of fun and fo not forget to ride the cable to go higher,,,,,️enjoy the beauty of Aberdeen fishing boat and the over looking at Repulse bay fantastic.Then ️enjoy the selection of food inside after the ride,,,,,,,plenty of boots never run out of ice cream,,,kids Favorite venue ;)
Ocean Park is wonderful with lots of attractions.. There is an entrance fee, but all the rides and exhibits are included and the cable car gives you a view of the whole park.

Complete Package. One of the finest parks visited so far. Must start the day early as there is so much to cover. There are many thrill rides which can boost your adrenaline. Extensive collection of animals like Pandas, Dolphins, Sea Lions, Penguins, Arctic Foxes, Seals and many more. The park is well maintained by the authorities. Locker facilities are available at 80/100 $ (HKD).We purchased the Part ticket+ Meal combo on Klook.com, which offered a big saving. Lunch is preferred at Bay view restaurant which offers wide varieties of cuisines like Western/ Cantonese/ Chinese/ Indian/ Indonesian with a amazing view.
must of family. its divided two part upper and lower upper part over hill has more thrill rides for odler age kids and lower has for young oncefast past is must over here **

Ocean Park. Visited Ocean Park on 13 Mar 2016. It was a rainy day. Took an Ocean Park public bus outside Admiralty MTR station directly there. A taxi will cost about HKD 100. Alight at the front entrance of Ocean Park. Admission ticket at HKD 350.There was long long queue at the cable car station, about 1.5 hour. To cut waiting time, one needs to buy the express ticket at additional HKD 150 which entitled to any 5 rides on the express lane (about 10 minutes queueing time). Purchased the 2 tickets will be HKD 490, really costly; not worth the money.The Seal and Dolphins Show was the most interesting. Need to sit on the amphitheatre (about 45 minutes before show time) early to get better viewing seats. My frank opinion is that the theme parks were flooded with mainland Chinese, adopting push-push, talk aloud, patterns. You can smell them everywhere. I do not enjoy the theme park anymore.

Very good rides for all age groups. We reached the park at 12:00 noon and were there till 6:00 and we think we should have reached there when it opens by 10:00. The park has many rides and animal activities which is liked by both kids and adults i will advice when you reach there ask for show timings and feeding times of the dolphins , pandas and other animals . Don't miss the aquarium at the base as it houses sharks also . Take the train while going up and the cable car while coming back from the top Try to do all rides in the south pole area with the hair raise to the most thrilling ride , we did it twice

Review is of visit with a 3 yr old. Ocean Park is a fun place to spend around 6 hours or so in Hong Kong. When visiting with children, make sure you carry a stroller! There are many uphills and the kids may not walk the full length. The rides are fun. Vegetarians - food options in the park are limited and not really exciting. You may want to carry your own food.

a great family experience. we enjoyed various attractions...seeing the great Panda in flesh is amazing...we enjoyed the ocean express...got the extreme thrill in the hair raiser and great scenic view plus cool breeze on the cable car....

great fun and educational too. It's been several years since our last visit and the park has undergone a lot of changes. It's so much nicer now and it feel more cohesive and easy to navigate. It's a great learning experience for kids while they are having loads of fun. And there's the MTR being constructed right in front of the park so it will be a lot easier to access. They just have to make better wait time estimates because we were waiting for rides a little way longer than the estimated time they put out.
Excellent Stay Kids Love it. very nice. we enjoyed lot with my two kids. lot of rides and facilities. bit expensive but its worth to go.

A Good Day Out. Things you need to know (from the Adrenalin junkie perspective) 1. While the park opens at 10am. I cued for tickets at 10 didn't take too long mid week. 2. The thrill mountain polar express areas didn't open till 11am.3. To get to the top of the mountain and fun stuff in the park you need to take the cable car or ocean express to get there. Cable car takes longer.4. The whirly bird tower thing isn't scary and gives you a good idea of the layout of the park. It's not that straightforward to do.5. Best rides are Hair Raiser, The Dragon, The Abyss, (Mine train was closed). 6. Going mid week (Tuesday) I hit the hair raiser first did it twice without using my fast pass and didn't cue more than 15mins. Using a fast pass you can walk straight onto the platform and skip all the cue. All the rides in the marine world area i walked on to, next in line no cues.7. I'm always a fan of fast passes though I only used it twice, at about 3pm there was a significant cue for the hair raiser and also for the cable cars up and down, was really worth having to avoid these cues.8. The shark thing in marine world is good.9. Longest cue was at McDonalds.10. They are building a MTR station next to it. 11. It's a nice park, very pretty, well maintained and has a good variety of rides, not all for the adrenalin junkie, was a shame that some of the rides wern't working but was still a good way to fill a day. Left at about 3pm doing all the rides i wanted.12. If you go on the rappids ride you will get wet, might be good when its hot but buy a poncho or leave it till last.

Visit with family. I have visited Ocean Park three times now. It can be a nice day out but in the three times (over 8 years) it doesn't really feel like much, if anything, has changed. That said what I do like about Ocean Park is that it has a bit of everything - some animals, some rides, including water rides (take a coat or poncho if you don't want to get wet!), shows, etc. You can easily spend a whole day there. Definitely recommend you see the dolphin show if you're visiting. Easy to get to on the bus from Admiralty, the bus runs regularly and you can get your entrance ticket along with your bus ticket from the stand at the bus station. Would highly recommend getting your ticket in advance where possible to avoid the queues which can get long on a weekday so dread to think of the queues at the weekend!Take a picnic or have a big breakfast if you want to keep your costs down while you are there. The cheapest place to eat by far is the McDonald's but this is practically deep into the other side of Ocean Park so I imagine by the point a lot of people see it, they have already eaten at one of the park's restaurants or stands.
Ocean Park is perfect!!!. this is so fun with activities and animals to visit!!! there are hair-rasing thrill rides and endangered animals ( pandas and artic foxes ), this is a perfect site to go!
Full Value For Money.... . My Daughter Loved It.... Only Suggestion Go Early So That You Can Enjoy It At Fullest... PANDA KUWALA SEA HORSE DOLPHIN Shows Don't Miss It... Rides Are Awesome
Must Visit. Nice enjoyment for the family Must try Hair Raiser truely Hair Raiser and dont miss the ocean aquarium and IF YOU ARE LUCKY will able to see Panda
Love this place. The Pandas, Sharks, Seal so many different shows. The water rides are really fun. Anytime better than disneyland, less crowded. It has a great view...Food is difficult to find.

Something adventrous feels when we enter this Park. All activities like roller coasters,rides,aquariums & water body games are worth seeing.No food problem as many best eating joints are there to relish.Children enjoy a lot there.Even older people have lot to enjoy there.

Amazing Theme Park. Big and complete fir thene park in Hongkong, suite for young children and also teenagers. So many animal show can entertain us (Dolphins show, Seal, pingguin, panda) There's a aquariums for fresh water fish, there are 5 type of coasters. The cool weather will maintain urstamina. Then of ghe show was a water fountain shiw its very spectacular, lazer and fire entertaint you much. Wonderfull

Fun filled Experience. Had a fun filled time with my family. As the name suggests its has lots of ocean lives, but you will too find penguins, pandas and other Asian animals. You can enjoy different rides. Maximum numbers of rides are installed at the peak of the park, you can either take train or can take cable car to reach there. All in all it was an excellent, fun filled trip for my family.

Great Attraction. i visited with my wife and son. its a great place to visit, but there where so many rides which we could not do as they have some height restriction for the kids.Overall great place for adult also
Everything in one place. Funny Pandas, amazing cable car ride, huge aquarium, exciting machines, games, many restaurants. Everything just in one place. Really my day will come back.

Rainy day at Ocean Park. It is an amazing theme park to visit! The sea aquarium is the first attraction to visit when you enter the park and there are a lot of information on the various creatures on display. Very high educational value. There is a goldfish museum which is very interesting. There are a number of amusement park ride to try out but i went on a rainy day and didn't managed to try out most of them.
Nice experience... We love the view.. My children were so amaze with the animals...they get to see them closer most especially the penguins.... The place was big and clean...

excellent and phenomenal park. EVEN though we were there at 10-30 am, we were almost last to leave at 7-30pm from the park, (it closes at 6-30 pm), we still missed a couple of rides..we had a fast track ticket too, but still couldnt complete a few rides..MY kids has plenty of excellent time in the ocean park, lots of rides, and plenty of things to do..I AM sure any of either individual or with families with have a whale of a time..how i wish i had more time or taken a 2 day pass..so one should a good walking shoes, and enjoy some adventurous rides, and sea animals to see all across the park...

Good not Great. The quality of rides not very great, when I compare with universal studios in Singapore, this falls short.Also, the food options for vegetarians is worst.Bottled Water is so expensive in HK, Ocean Park, there are not adequate water dispensers for travellers, it can be planned and installed in more places within park.The best part is cable ride by the sea, the train ride is also good.

A family tour! . We were attacted to go to this park after looking at its review. Our experience were as follows: 1. Positive - place was clean and orderly - though place was really hot and very humid. It was not convenient to go during end of spring and maybe summer.  - signage were available although quite confusing with the map.  - clean toilets - attentive attendants2 negative - some restaurant staff are not courteous - it lacks shaded areas to stay while waiting for shows.  - restaurants are quite expensive Among the best show, the dolphins and sea lions weas good. Although we were expecting better and larger aquarium fishes. The place is still can have magic if you bring smaller kids, but its quite uncomforatble for older folks.
Great Family Adventure!. My kids and I loved the place so much we would like to come back again in the near future. Great rides and adventures!

Nice place for rides & fun. It was a very nice & fun place for thrill rides and attractions. Good place for family. Everyone enjoyed it so much that 1 day is not enough. Recommend to go in early to avoid queues & tour groups.

Worth the price. Money well spent. Rides are awesome and you can also see Different animals like Panda, wallaby, Penguin and diff types of fishes. Oh let's not forget the Dolphins and sea lion.. Will surely be back again next time we visit Hong Kong with the kids. Hopefully by then they can ride all the rides they want. (Too small for the big rides)

Go if you really have some spare time. . Disappointing place. Performance time are not available on brochure and you have to go to the location to find out. Unable to plan as a result. Performance are lack of excitement, no interaction with the audience. It was actually boring to us. But we do enjoy seeing the Penguins, seal, sea lion, etc. No comments about the rides as I had not try them. They don't look very well maintained.

Fantastic rides. Had a great day here. The thrill rides are fantastic and the animal exhibits are well done. There is heaps to see and do do you will need the whole day 10 -6 . Unfortunatley a few of the cafe's (bayview and terrace view )were closed,so finding something decent to eat was hard . some of the exhibits are indoors and cooled for the animals, especially Arctic, so if its a super hot day you can escape the heat. OR you can ride a wet ride and get a soaking haha thats fun!

Perfect mix of park and fun. We arrived early on a Friday and were alone on the first rides, it was never crowded and we never waited more than 5-10 minutes. We really enjoyed the mix between a wonderfull park (with pandas), an aquarium (mantas, fish, sharks) and thrilling rides. There were also otters and sealions, so it was really a wonderful day out there and we walked a lot.

a Adventure filled place. If you are energetic and don't mind walking long distances, this is the place for you. Take the cable car ride on top first. enjoy your rides. dont miss any ride. and take a tram back. its a one full day trip and trust me by the end of the trip you will be dead tired. Do not miss any shows like the Panda show, dolphin show, shark show, sea gull show penguin show etc. A full filled park sure to make your Hongkong trip very memorable.

Adult rides park. Good place to go for teenagers and for adults lots of rides recommend to take fast pass will save time while taking cable carNeed to get there by 11 to try and finish by 6 pm if u don't take fast pass will require to be there for 2 days... Good rides for all age groups with enough stuff put in for adults

Bland aquarium, not world class, lacking value. Poor value, very expensive tickets since 2016, Around 70 US dollars per person.Shocking Aquarium, only 1 real tank with only coral skeletons.No tropical species, very faded fish, obviously stressed.No diversity in species: Some stingrays, hammerhead, silver sweep/ocean fish - thats it!No coral tanks or anything with any real beauty.The restaurant is plain appalling.
A good day out. nice attraction, good rides, enjoyable for family, dolphins and seals are good. Panda is very nice. rides also quite decent

Did not meet expectations. We had opted for Ocean Park over Disneyland. There are a lot of rides and ocean animals etc to see. But its all cluttered and you do not get a sense of which direction to follow in order to cover the entire park. You end up walking downhill only to realize that certain other rides or displays are uphill.
Nice place and nice view. good place to visit, nice view too.well mantained and many games to play.food also good too.many attractions to watch too

Fastpass is a must. Ocean park is a relatively good place for leisure time but you should get a fast pass if you want to enjoy every facilities especially in those special holidays. You may need to queue up for the cable car if you don't have the fast pass. It may waste your time to wait for the cable car.There are some performances in the park, if you are interested on it, you may need to check the schedule on the Ocean park website.

Great Fun, on a Cool Day. Arctic blast is great for younger kids, the Rainforest Rapids ride is pretty cool as people can actually shoot at you with water guns. You will get wet, but you might appreciate that on a hot day. Go there before the tourist buses come later in the afternoon. Ranging river and the Mine Train are kind of hidden so the lines aren't too long, but they are both very fun. The shark exhibit is interesting to explore. This is a great place for very young kids, and also teenagers because there are thrill rides, and more tame ones as well. Part of it is on a mountain, so it does require quite a bit of walking. There are two parts of the park. They are connected by a train and a cable car. I would recommend the cable car, but do it first before the line gets too long.

Fun for kids and adults... It was fun to watch Pandas, Dolphin Show, Polar animals, sharks.. Rides were really good. There was a long queue at the entrance, but not for rides.Ocean express ride was also fun. Aquarium is not that great. Water fountain show which starts at 7:30 pm was spectacular. To summarise, a day well spent at ocean park.

A must visit !!!. Reached ocean park around 10:00 a.m for a day full of enjoyment. It has rides, games,aquarium, shows,souvenir shops, cable car, restaurants, penguins,panda,gold fishes etc. This park offers something to all. Definitely a must do & better than disneyland.Divided in two zone waterfront and summit. cable car or train can be used to reach the summit.Didnt find much of a que for the rides.

A great disappointment. I'm sure Ocean Park has plenty of admirers who are young fit and mobile.However if you are of advancing years this is not the place for you particularly on a humid Monday in MayBecause the crowds were small many of the exhibits and food outlets were not open.My wife loves aquariums and was so looking forward to the visit but the aquarium here is not a patch on those we have seen elsewhere -- to make things worse the Pandas were asleep in their den so were nowhere to be seenWe found the lack of signage particularly disappointing and there were few staff to ask for directionsIt says it all that the highlight of the day was a turkey sandwich and cold drink in the bakery near the exit.Maybe great for younger people and kids but a waste of money for us-- so sad

Cool place with picturesque backgrounds .. Prebook your tickets online to save time. We reached there by 11am & finished almost major parts by 6 pm .Pandas are definitely a big attraction & the train ride to the top & Cable car ride back are not to be missed. Overall, this park is a good mix of animals, penguins, aquariums and theme park rides. Also the seal & Dolphin show were entertaining. Hair raiser is the best coaster by far.

So much fun!. This park is for all ages. Love it! The pandas were our favorite. They are so cute! Had loads of fun all day. Many of the the snackbars were closed, so it was kinda hard finding something to eat. But overall an amazing day!
人山人海. It is fun, but the line for everything is too long. you have to wait for an hour for a 2 minutes ride

Balance of Fun and Education. Fortunately the park has its rides updated and the new rides would whet the appetite to those who seek excitement more compared to the old ones. on top of that, the variety of exortic animals you can discover are the real stars of the park: panda, aquarium... you name it! just to be aware of thing common in theme park, if not popular one - Crowds!!!

Get the fast pass. Great rides, even my 7yr old could go on a few. My 12yr old enjoyed all rides. Do see the pandas and the sharks were a highlight.
Get a fast pass some queues are long and they are well worth it, but they can only be used once per ride. Plus save one pass for the ride down!

Definitely worth a visit, not that overcrowded as Disneyland. We spent our whole day there and it was great fun! The shows leave much to be desired, but the exhibitions and rides are awesome. The most impostant for me was that the queues are quite small and waiting time was from 0 to 30 minutes. Cable car is a must for young and old, also visit shark attraction - there are lots of them there, even saw-sharks, leopard sharks, bamboo sharks and hammerheads!! The best way to get there is on direct bus from Central Station. Please note that the list of busses running to the park on their website is incorrect!

Good Place for Kids. Its a good place to visit with kids. Its a full day tour. Not suitable for people with walking problems. Amazing light & sound show in the evening. Be there atleast 15 minutes before the show starts otherwise you will not be able to get the best view.

Worth going with your kids. Went there with my wife. Nothing new if you've been to some amusement parks before. I personally wanted to see the panda. the rides are good, better than disneyland. the roller coaster was so much fun. Must go if you've never been to any aquariums or seen marine wildlife. We reached the place at 9am so that we get to see the rides first, but it typically opens at 10am and most of the rides remain closed till 11am.

Fun fun fun . Make sure you visit ocean park on a week day. It may get super busy and crowded over the weekend! Even if the weather is cloudy over a Sunday, don't think people will give up to visit the park. The park is quite vast so allow one day to visit it. Everyone is welcome, so even if you are not attracted by roller coasters there are multiple things to do. You can visit it overnight during Halloween as they organize special events!

Our favorite! Super fun for kids and adults.. Buy your tickets with CTS at the airport. Got ours at 300hkd for adult at that time. I forgot how much for the child. Admiralty station is your stop. Dont forget to visit the Australia Adventure near the cable car. You will find wallabies and koala and kookaburra but I am not sure if this is all year round exhibit. and of course dont miss the super cute pandas!

If you don't like to sweat buckets, don't come in june. Overall, I would not come back. I've been to several amusement parks- nothing special here. I was miserable the wholetime because it was literally 99% humidity over 100 degrees F that day..There were so many people bunched together for every ride...in retrospect- I would NOT come during the summer months. Hong Kong gets VERY hot..and I picked the wrong day to come, I guess. But if you do end up going on a hot day, head to the polar bear exhibit if you're overheating- that's where I spent most of my time while my friend rode rides- it was very cool and air conditioned inside.

Nice. Aquariums, big rides, kiddie rides, koala bear, panda bear... Nice and very educational.We took bus from mtr admiralty station; got 10% off coupon from the HK map. Park was huge! It did not feel crowded. Just be ready to do a lot of walking uphill and downhill. Since I was here last time- maybe 7 years ago- lot has improved. Toilets clean. Rides ok. Food inside pricey. Drink - hk$30 for coca cola; water hk$28. So everything else follows.

A must visit whilst in Hong Kong. Prebook your tickets online to save time. Get there early (like most places in HK). GO see the pandas first whilst they're awake and eating and there's less crowds. Overall, this park is a good mix of animals, aquariums and theme park rides. Hair raiser is the best coaster by far. It needs a full day to do it justice.

Awesome rides. Rides here are awesome n worth to try!Price maybe comparable to USS in Singapore.Ps: the queues can get very long during the weekends and would advise to lookout for possible "queue cutters" from the mainland.Nonetheless, staff is always around to assist n supervise.

Few hours of fun. This is a pleasant park that would be good fun for a family with plenty of rides and exhibitions to keep young ones entertained. We visited during the week and the park was very quiet in the morning (almost no queues for anything) but it got substantially busier after 1pm. Luckily we had covered most of the park by then. Food options are limited (we had dumplings at one fast food outlet that were horrible) so have a decent breakfast.We chose this park instead of Disney - in hindsight Disney may have been more fun.
great fun for childrens.... lots of attractions for the young and young at heart! good family outing and photo shootings. but it will be very crowded during peak seasons

Exhilarating experiences await you at this theme park. The setting of the park amidst mountains and near the sea provides a beautiful backdrop for the rides and attractions. Just remember to time your visit outside of peak periods so that you don't spend most of your time queuing.

Overnight in the Ocean's Depths. I took my 2 nephews (6 and 10) to participate in Ocean Park's overnight experience- Overnight in the Ocean's Depths. It was fantastic!!We were met at the entrance by the staff who would be looking after us during our stay. There were 20 people in our group and when everyone had arrived they led us through the entrance and into the Grand Aquarium area. We had a talk in the classroom about the programme and then had dinner in the Neptune Restaurant.Neptune Restaurant is great because it's IN the Grand Aquarium so you can eat your food watching the fish! We had a set menu - I had soup and then chicken and rice. The children had their food served in a train - tomato pasta, chicken nuggets and chips and some vegetables.After dinner we headed out to a private seating area to watch Symbio! Well, it was probably the best theme park show I've ever seen! It was amazing - even if you're not staying overnight I recommend staying to watch Symbio.After the show, the park closes. So we headed back into the Gran Aquarium area and were given a guided tour of the visitor areas, but also the backstage area. Then we went to get our tents and headed back into the Gran Aquarium. We put our tents up and prepared to sleep watching the fish! They provided sleeping bags and pillows although we took some of our own bedding. The room was cold overnight so I would recommend taking extra warm clothes. In the morning we were given a dim sum breakfast at the Panda Cafe and then people that wanted to stay in the park could buy tickets with a 25% discount or if you were leaving you had to go by 10am. It was such a great experience and definitely something different to do in Hong Kong!
Great day out. Loved this place. Actually got to see pandas. The cable car is a must, it's a really long ride where you see spectacular views of the bay.

Excellent marine theme amusement park in Hongkong . Really great fun going around the park with our 4yr old son who just couldn't get enough of. Everything from the aquarium - sharks, starfish, octopus, sting rays , the cable car, the reptiles, the pandas and exotic birds to the penguins, and the seals, walruses, was simply breathtaking. The live shows and costumed dances were added fun. Not too many rides for a 3year old though, but there was just too much to catch up , on the end it was a long day of endless fun. My second visit in 30yrs and is great fun.

So many things in one place! Amazing!. This place has everything:Amusement park(Rides, roller coasters)Amazing ShowsMini ZooAquariumCable car rideYou get all the above in one place. I don't think there is any other place which has all these things in one place. The ticket price is much less than what the park has to offer. Has something for all age groups.
excited park!!. love this park so much, it was my second time. the zoo, the playground, the attractions, the cable car, all about ocean park is terrific!

Best place ever. It has been a while since I last visited Ocean Park. I found it has improved and has been keeping to its standards. Staff are mostly friendly and understanding. The place was well maintained and we love the old Hong Kong look throughout the lower part of the park. The waiting time for machines/games/cable cars are long as usual, but we did not mind since the crowds were mostly orderly and well behaved. We will go there again.

Be sure you visit on a good day. The first time I visited Ocean Park the weather was fairly good. You have to wait for long lines though. The roller coaster along the sea was very special and worth trying. Other facilities are pretty normal among playgrounds and the fishes on exhibition are also pretty average. Overall speaking it's a quite expensive recreational park.

Five plus stars. This park is very good for everyone. Very interesting place. Better to go early morning , in the afternoon it was overcrowded. We were lucky to see sleeping panda:) comfort is everywhere. Buy tickets on the mtr station to avoid long line in the park.

Fun and exciting. It's a bit messy and crowded at the entrance point. It's better to be in the park early and straight head to the cable car before the queue build up. Panoramic view inside the cable car. Many interesting and different types of attractions e.g.: giant panda and red panda viewing, shark aquarium, some games at the old Hong Kong street.. Spent 6hrs there but should have stayed longer.. Will be back again!!

Worth a visit . We visited the OP on a recent hot and steamy day in Hong Kong. We bought our park tickets at the station and were hustled onto the bus, where we could use our Octopus Pass.As went on a Monday the crowds were small and for many of the rides most to the queues were not too long. We started on the cable car to the top section of the park (that was a 30 minute wait), and did that part first. The views of the harbour on the way up were spectacular. The entire set up of the park is orderly with a clear focus on kids and families. The mix of zoo, aquariums and rides means there is something for everyone. Highlights were the pandas, the Grand Aquarium, the cable car ride and the walruses. We also liked the focus on education and conservation.If you plan to eat in any of the restaurants, go early and put your name down. At noon there was already a 2.5 hour wait for the one with the penguins.The trip back to the city was also via bus, although a new station is due to open soon. At around HK$400 for the day, this is pretty good value.

Spectular place. I went to Ocean Park last April of 2016 and it was a good visit. This place is very awesome, a place to recommend for the family and kids. Glad to see some animals that can only seen in North America and Australia, such a good experience. I suggest to go here during weekdays to avoid too much people so you will enjoy your visit and you can ride all the rides.

Great day out for everybody . We had a great day out here, we got here just as it opened at 10am and had already purchased tickets from our hotel so there was no queueing to get in. We went straight to the panda enclosure and there was only a handful of people in there so had plenty of room to get a good look. We didn't really go for the rides but enjoyed the log flume and river Rapids that we queued about 10 mins each for. Food isn't great but was also pretty reasonably priced for a theme park. Make sure you get to go in all the different animal enclosures they are worth the walk long around!

Ocean Park rocks!. It's been a while since I've been to Ocean Park, born in HK but living abroad for most of my life. I always remembered it when I was little, as a nice amusement park but with way too many people and way too hot. This time I returned as a mother with her own family, in May on a relatively not too hot a day with not too many people and I was amazed! I never knew the park was this huge, it comprises two sides of an entire mountain and is much, much better than Disneyland which stays a formula. Ocean Park is an original Hong Kong concept of its own with a great focus on marine preservation and taking care of our earth and ocean. It's a cross over of an aquarium (largest stingrays I have ever seen), a zoo (panda's!) and an amusement park (great rides). When you come back from the other side of the mountain by cable car (of course), you end up in a replica street of old Hong Kong. It's not such a big deal perhaps but as a Hongkonger, it made be very happy that this amusement park is proud of its heritage. And it should, as it's simply marvellous, for young and old.

Not enough time in a day!!!. We arrived about 12pm and left at closing time! There were so many diverse things to do that the 6 pm closing didn't seem to give us enough time at all! Although the entrance fee seemed reasonable for the kids, I found it a bit steep for the adults considering we didn't go on any of the rides and spent the whole time standing around waiting for the kids while they queued for a 2 minute ride. We queued for three quarters of an hour to go down with the cable car and we waited nearly an hour for a taxi to take us home at the taxi rank. Seeing the panda was great and the dolphin show was OK too.
Awesome. Amazing place for both Adults and kids. however access to snacks was limited. Entrance fees are also a bit on the high end, if you are low on budget. But all in all Great stuff!!

Must go. I enjoyed every second in Ocean Park. Many things to do for every age group. Very well maintained must must visit while in HK. Go early and first visit to summit tgen waterfront. Can take outside snacks ni body check thoroughly.

Ocean park. Family visit...very good.The park is full of rides..well worth the money...Visit this place and you will want to return..It makes Olton towers look cheapNice activities and food restaurants inside.You will need early start to get through rides and activities. Enjoy..I did

A Lot of Fun. Amazing Place, a lot to see and do for both old and your children.
The ride from the park to the other side is spectacular. Both me and my wife enjoyed this very very much. Highly recommended

Most amazing place to visit.. Wow, you first enter on ground level and think that the park is not that big or exciting but once you see the Pandas and other animals it's amazing. Then you head of on an incredible cable car ride to the top of the mountain. The ride probably takes about 15 minutes and the views are breathtaking. Even more astounding once you reach the top there is a huge theme park and lots of aquariums and animals in special habitat exhibits like a huge aquarium, seals, penguins, walruss and more. There is heaps to do for kids and adults alike. There are thrill rides perched on the side of cliffs and there are rides for the little kids plus heaps of animal exhibits unlike anything anywhere else. There is plenty of food to choose from from fast food to bakeries and restaurants. The engineering of how this place was built is just astounding given it's location. Awesome, amazing and incredible.

Good for the money but .... Pandas were great. A few rides and attractions under maintenance. Not laid out very well. Cable car ride was great. Park is spread out and hard to get a handle on. It is like they just keep adding to it. MTR will be available soon by the looks of it.

Good family Fun. It's highly rated attraction in Hong Kong. I found it just okay. Firstly it's was overly crowded when we just entered. It's maddening!Buy tickets from Klook and quite cheap. You just need to show your QR code at the entrance which we did for Disneyland. It's separate Q and much shorter. Q for Cable car to Ocean Park was around 60 minutes and for toddler it won't be advisable. Better you take Ocean Express and Q was very short. The park staff were very rude and did have any kind of courtesy whatsoever. We covered 3 sections, Polar adventure, Rainforest and Marine world. Took cable car as there was no crowd from Marine world. The view from Cable car was excellent and not to be missed. It's good family outgoing.
A must go place when you are in HK. A must go place when you are in HK. Rides, foods, sight seeing , its a one big place for everyone ! Will come again on June, 2016!

Amazing experience . The place is so darm big and i loveed it the park have there own app so its really amazing it will show which is near ride not so manly people but reallygood we guys had a blast but i think the rides r really amazing

Not apropriate for kids. Was very disappointed with this park, I have 2 kids and one of 3 year and one of 7 years and we spend the entire day to found out what my 7 years boy can ride nothing much do.Was bit old and let down maybe that the feeling that you have when you make Disneyland first.Other wise it was a good day.

Good but....... At 385 hkd seemed high priced....especially when locals visiting on a birthday get in for free......internationals such as myself also on a birthday do not!! Discrimination :-))Otherwise the pandas are fab....cable car ride great....Some of the rides very good.On the must improve list is food....visited 2 options and the food was not nice so left and ended up at McDonald's in desperation .Will also be easier to visit when the mtr opens rather than the 629 bus from admiralty.

Huge Park, great for kids and adults. The park is huge, you probably need more than one day to visit every attraction.Roller Coasters are especially nice since they are on top of the mountain so you not only have the thrill of the ride but also the fantastic view of the island around.There are also zoo and aquariums, lots of attractions for kids...overall a great day for anyone!

Better than Disneyland. This is our 4th visit to Ocean Park. We love the dolphin show (on the top) and the bird show (at bottom). The rides on top are for kids over 6/7, or taller than 120cm to be precise. There is a play park, and simple rides for smaller kids at the bottom. FYI, it is better to take the train ride up, and cable car back down, as the waiting time to take a cable car up is long, usually 30 mins or more. For smokers, there are designated smoke areas both on top and ground. Didn't visit the aquarium this time as my kid went crazy at the play park. in our opinion, Ocean Park is definitely better than Disneyland and less hectic. Look out for promos if you want to book online. We booked our tickets online thru a local agent called KLOOK, and got the 2 adults 1 free child promo, paid 90usd instead of the normal 124usd. Easy rides from admiralty mtr, bus 629 goes directly to ocean park, same bus back, abt 25 mins each way.

You will have visited better parks. The place is ok, but the most exciting ride is the cable car transfer across the mountain to other parts of the park. Not many rides for kids under 120cm tall. The aquarium is poor in comparison to others in Asia (Tokyo, Beijing). All in all, the place is ok, but nothing fantastic.
Too big and less fun. Improve transport along the area its too big and attractions are far from each other, hurts the foot and it often rains
It is just so so. dolphin show was exciting but it is too crowded. Limited for toddlers. will see for any better next,,,,,,,
Ocean Park - possible to review?. OK - HK's Biggest theme park. A little dated now but seems they are still adding new bits + a new MTR station - has to be good for business - right?

great place for kids and adults. Very good choice to spend a whole day. not only for kids but also adults. My husband and I enjoyed a lot, especially him since it was his first time there. You can see animals, enjoy the cable car view and so much fun.

GREAT DAY. . We really enjoyed our day at Ocean Park, I would recommend this place for all age groups. The park is BIG so be prepared to walk around, it is also very busy. It is best to go early to the park to take advantage of all on offer. We seen a huge variety of animals including Sharks and Dolphins. We also went on a good choice of rides including roller coasters and cable cars which was fun. It is well worth the money, time and effort to visit this park.

Huge Place... The place is really huge. Good combination of zoo and fun park. However the aquarium is not as big as Sentosa, Singapur but nevertheless a good one it is. Rides are good. Some were closed. It didnt had much veg eating options so we had only coke to drink through out the day. All in all good one as my teen kids enjoyed themselves.
Good for adults. Rides were awsome. Some were scary buy had fun. Food for vegetarians is a little problem. Transportation is convinient.

Visit. Amazing. We loved the combination of entertainment and zoo. Finally saw a panda. And the aquarium was beautiful!! Unfortunately some lines to wait up to 30Minutes. The cable car ride was awesome and we loved the option for the train ride.

Oooo lovely . What a lovely time we had! We have gold tickets for Disney and always visit but we fancied a change and decided to try Ocean Park.We went straight for the annual passes as they are fantastic value and we were so glad we did as we only covered a fraction of the park and will need many more visits to see it all.We didn't try any of the rides as we were more interested in the animals.
