The jellyfish aquarium is spectacular!! We started watching the dolphin show but alas the heavens opened so we will have to try again next time.The park is immaculately clean. It does look a bit dated in places but that doesn't spoil anything at all. Lovely!!!

A place to enjoy for whole day!. The place was huge. There were zoo, aquarium, fun park. Everything was nicely done.
We came for Aquarium most specifically. And we were beyond amazed by how good the environment they made for all animals. They all looked happy to be there.
Also, you can enjoy the view because it's located on the mountain.

Go there for the marine life. It's divided in two major parts. One is the aquatic marine animals and other is the adventure Park.We liked the marine animals more and it's definitely a crowd puller. Though as it is on a mountain u Ll end up getting a bit tired just by walking.There are a lot of games inside the park which were enjoyable. Tip: even though the park officially closes at around 6, there are some additional shows post that which you should not miss at all.

All-in-One Place. They have animals and rides all in one. We watched the dolphin and seal show, rode the cable car and train, enjoyed the rides and ate some snacks. Water refilling stations are always near comfort rooms. It was also our first time to see pandas (they had two). You have to bring extra clothes in case you ride the ones where you get wet. Amazing place.

Pick your date carefully and book online. Visited with grandchildren. Avoid weekends and bank holidays and get there in good time. Pre-booking avoids long queues at ticket office. Try to get up to the top early, again before queues and take the mountain train down at the end. The whole experience was a delight and I would thoroughly recommend a visit. Take a picnic if possible as catering slanted to Chinese taste (it is in Asia after all!). If you can wait the water and light show at 7.00 pm is worth waiting for and don't miss the aquarium and arctic zone. Rides pretty good too. All in all good value for the money.

You will love it!. Ocean Park has something for everyone and is always being re-vamped so it will never be the same on your next visit.The pods that whizz you across the island are thrilling in themselves.For thrill seekers of the big ride variety you will not be disappointed.Make sure you wear sunscreen during the summer months as you are in a very exposed area.Great for a family day out!Price wise it's approx 600HKD Per person but if you go for the whole day worth every penny.

Fun day out experience. Loved our day spent here. Took the Ocean Express bus from Central direct, takes approx 20 minutes. Operates from 9am til a few hours after closing.Look online for special offers. Upon arrival we took the cable car to the Summit and enjoyed all the hair-raising rides before making our way to the Seal-lion and dolphin show. Hardly any queues.Good range of restaurants and snack bars throughout park.The enclosures were clean and well maintained. My daughter experienced her first Walrus, Panda, Shark, penguins and many more. Free cable car to the Summit is simply mind blowing. Stunning scenery and 360 views.Queues heading back were approx 30 minutes - take the mountain train instead. Go early for opening to ensure you see everything on offer.
Great place. Fantastic . So so much to do and see the park is huge and the gondola ride Was great but also heeps of walking . And the pandas were great and all the other animals

Best attraction in HK. We went in April and it was rainy and foggy. Try not to go during this time as rides will be closed and wet even after they open when the rain subsides. Good thing is that there were barely any queues! There are third party sites for you to book tickets in advance at a discounted price too, so do some research beforehand. Bring snacks in as the food there are ridiculously expensive. Security there will usually close one eye for small packets of food. Be sure to ride the cable car too - the view is AMAZING.
Lift to remember. This park is way to overcrowed to enjoy in a single day. The Sky tram ride was the highlight of the day. The food was overpriced. The views were excellent

Bad attitudes all round. The 2 best rides where closed. The people are so rude and pushy. The new prune restaurant was shut so we ended up having horrible noodles. Told to buy a fast pass $60 Australian waste of money didn't even use it. Panda was beautiful monkeys and sea creatures but very disappointed over all. Thought I was going to see so much more of a good day since it has been hype up so much from tour guides. My opinion don't waste your money.

Best in Value. We went very early taking the bus from Admiralty. As the park was still quite empty we could take many lovely photos. There are so many rides and they cater to different ages. The park is a very beautiful location and from the cable car as well as some of the rides, you can see a lot of Hongkong's natural scenery. Really a visual feast.

Very Good!. Had a really good time. Lots of things to do and activities to pick from for all age groups.We had a flight back home to catch the same day at 8 in the evening and hence had to return back to our hotel before 4pm. So the best thing for us was the Ocean Fast track option. which costs you 150 HKD per person and allows you to skip the endless queues for the rides specially the popular one. You can do this for a max of 7 rides out of a total of 13 options.When you buy the fastrack option you also get 4 vouchers (food, drink and merchandise purchase). For those who worry about not getting enuf value out of their purchase, the discounts offered thru these vouchers more than compensate the cost of 150 HKD. Ofcourse you need to use them in the 1st place
Love this Theme park. Love this theme park as this has many different type of animals and amusement. It is also very educating about protecting the environment and concerns.

Ocean Park. We visited ocean park on the 2 January 2016. The park is clean, neat and well run. Excellent rides, Que was very long, but well worth the wait. We booked online, was easier than standing in the Que to buy a ticket. Needed another day to see the whole park. We took the MTR, then took the bus to the Park. The transport in Hong Kong is amazing, safe and well priced.

Amusement Park. After visiting HKG Disney this is a small amusement park strongly recommend you ignore this park - it is not worth waiting in huge queues to get into a ride. The only good thing is the Cable car ride.

Expensive, tiring and overrated. We spent a day here, like most theme parks.Entry was expensive, and a third of the place was closed.Don't visit with under 10's as they can't do a lot of the rides due to height. Terrible food.

Not Disneyland, but still nice place to visit.. Obviously, not Disneyland... But it's a fun place to visit. Kind of reminds me of a Bush Gardens style amusement park. It's a lot bigger than I expected. Most of the park is toward the other side of the island. You start in the front of the park. And the either by a cable car style tram take you over the hill, or a train system that takes you through the hill, you end up on the other side where most of the parks attractions are located. Good for a day trip.

Very enjoyable. We visited the park on a weekday morning, this proved to be a good move as we were able to avoid large crowds and lineups. We all really enjoyed our visit with lots of attractions to keep everyone of all ages entertained.

Fun outing for adults and children . Loved Ocean Park more than Disneyland. I guess because the compounds are a lot bigger and you can take the cable car to take in some magnificent view. Lots of rides both wet and dry (be ready to either bring your own raincoat or purchase HKD40 raincoat if you're planning to go on the wet rides). There are some water attractions, such as the dolphins show and some other sea life exhibitions (the Antartica penguins, sharks, massive stingrays, etc). Be prepared to spare 1 whole day there though because there's plenty to do.

A great day out - Shame about some of the other Tourists . It's been over twenty years since I was last at Ocean Park, so I was really looking forward to today. I wasn't disapointed either.Tip: wear comfortable shoes, you will do a lot of walking. Unfortunate for me I was with my three year old son, so I couldn't go on any of the rides. However all the animal enclosures and aquariums were well thought out. The animals all had plenty of room. I was really impressed with the polar exhibition, the walrus and seals had loads of swimming space.We were lucky to get to the sea lions at feeding time. They were fun to watch but disapeared as soon as feeding time was over.I was a bit disapointed with the Australia outback exhibition. My one year old got shushed at by a keeper, as if i had control over his noises. Apart from the koala, the wallaby and kangaroo looked a bit sad. I recommend getting the Ocean Express up to the highlands and the cable car down, the lines aren't as long. We went to one of the restaurants in the park for lunch, Tuxedos. It was fun to have lunch alongside the penguins, and it wasn't too expensive either.It was a bit nostalgic, but also a bit dissapointing to see the kids area really hadn't changed in thirty odd years. Including the concrete play castle. Overall as a family we had a fun day, only marred by some other tourists who pushed our kids out of the way to get on the ideal horse on the carosel. I found it a bit uneasy, lots of tourists were taking pictures (without permission) of my fair haired children. I did find it annoying at the end of every attraction was a shop! But other than that i would recommend coming to Ocean Park.

Fun day out. Great day, excellent rides. Rides are a bit bigger than Disneyland, so a bit more exciting for teenagers. Aquarium also good, but a highlight is the panda enclosure. We were there on a particularly busy day. Make sure you get to the return train early enough before the crowd otherwise it will take ages. Overall a great day out.

Take a child. Had a great time at Ocean Park. Visited on a WEEKDAY, got there EARLY. No crowds or queues. Rode all the rides. Saw the dolphin show. Saw the seals, penguins, sharks, pandas, birds. All good. Our 10yo had fun and so did we. By 2pm the park was filling up with tour groups but we were ready to go by then. The only cafe we tried was over-priced and the coffee and hot chocolate were terrible.

Combination of great theme park and zoo. so many things that could we saw on this attraction. Animal, the show, restaurants, great location and view. Ticket price was valuable. Good also for children.

A Great Place to Spend a Day. I had a fantastic time at Ocean Park! I traveled with a group consisting of myself and three other people in their twenties and we had a really great time. The rides were a lot of fun, and definitely provided more thrills for an older crowd than HK Disney would have. The lines were reasonable and there were some enjoyable coasters and fast rides. The animal exhibits were also great- the aquarium in particular was stunning and had some really amazing sharks I've never had an opportunity to see in person before. The underwater tunnels are really transporting, and even with the crowds you can still manage to feel like you're alone in a deep, chilling ocean. The staff were quite nice as well- I liked that we were greeted by people willing to take pictures of our group without expecting money in return, and one of the costumed characters got hilariously goofy with us. Food was a bit pricey, but you expect as much in a place like this, so oh well. Worth going for families, especially those with slightly older kids, or just groups of friends.

Ocean Park exactly must be into trip program. Very cool place , very nice location , nice view to Pacific Ocean.. I suggest to all Hong Kong visitors . New aquapark under construction now and I can not wait to see...

Fun day at Ocean Park. I visited this park on a weekend in April on a slightly rainy day. The transportation is convenient because there is a bus right outside the MTR station which takes to the park. However, the bus drivers can be rude so make sure you have the necessary change for the fare. Also, it can take more time to get to the park if there is traffic on the roads. It was raining to begin with but there are several indoor attractions which can be visited during this time. There is a nice aquarium, pandas, penguins, seals, sharks and a nice dolphin/seals show. Also, do not miss the cable car ride which provides nice scenic views. There is an area called Whiskers harbor for young kids. There were roller coaster/other rides as well for those who enjoy them. Some of the restaurants here are very expensive and do not provide the value for money so do some checking on the same. Suggest downloading their app and showing it while buying the tickets at their counters which gives you a discount. Overall, a fun park with lots to do!

Very windy day, brilliant. Being a family with 6 teenagers we went straight to the summit by train, didn't realize the main rides did not start until 11am, but never mind we went up the Ocean park tower instead, what a view! Once the rides opened it was "let's go on this", "let's go on this" and it was hard to pull them away for lunch. We had lunch at Boardwalk cafe as was easier for us as we could use our Octopus cards to pay. After lunch we went to watch the dolphin show at the Ocean theatre, "stupendous" To finish off we played on the rides at the lower part of the summit and looked at the sharks & jelly fish on our way back to the cable car.

Not a bad place for a day. Was there with my family. The aquarium was great and so was the experience with Pandas and other animals. The rides were not permitted to children below 120 or 140 CM height. So if you are having young children you may avoid the rides. The Dolphin show was great

Pandas is nice. For nowadays park looks very outdated, at least on 15 years. Very bad navigation inside park. For such outdated park entrance fee is too expensive.Most of all we liked Pandas - very good and informative pavilion with good personnel.Recommended only to see Pandas and australian pavilion

Worth a Visit. Well, what can I say? Ocean Park is Ocean Park. While the one in Manila has a larger aquarium, this one has more to do. There is an amusement park with rides, some shows, water fountains and flower garden. We enjoyed our time there. Best of all, unlike a lot of attractions in HK, Ocean Park is easy to get to and to get back from. We stayed in Kowloon and had not problem with the transportation. It is a nice place to spend several hours with something for everyone in the family.

Amazing first time around but lacked something this time :(. Second time back to Ocean park and oh boy was Ocean park the place i looked forward to visiting again! It rained a little the time we visited and the sun decided to hide but we soldiered on. The rides are fun as usual! The park was not too busy to we had plenty of time to do stuff. Unfortunately this time around i guess my excitement didnt get ahead of me and i saw some downsides to the park. I noticed a member of staff very obviously mocking a patron on the ride he was operating, he had to call out to another staff member to shout his opinions about this person which i thought was pretty terrible customer service and if that were me he was talking about oh man! lets not go there. The staff at the food stalls like literally all of them , yes we went to about 3 different ones were terribly rude. The young girl was on her phone and when someone approached the counter her reply's where "WHAT" and everything seemed to be sold out. no manners at all. This is a fun park to go to , the rides are great and the views are absolutely amazing but i recommend going in better weather..

Over hyped. The whole of internet was loaded with comparisons between this theme park and HK Disneyland and I must say, the internet has definitely been rigged in favor of this theme park. Shoddy interiors which were a cheap imitation of Disneyland and other premium theme parks like Universal Studio. Malfunctioning rides, lack of cleanliness and worst still....shoddy dolphin show. Highly pale in comparison to HK Disneyland or any other out there globally.

OH MY GOD!!!. Awesome place to overcome you fears for roller coasters and fast rides. My honeymoon would have been incomplete without my trip to ocean park. i would advice everyone to pre-book your trip to ocean park as its a little far off from the city. Also reaching there on your own would cost a lot. so its better to arrange a pick and drop facility with the ticket booking. We started our trip by taking the cable car to the upper part of the park as all the major rides are located there and we wanted to avoid the waiting line as well. The cable car ride was great as we got to see a really good view of the ocean. Also i would suggest not to carry a lot of things with you as you ll find it hard to walk with such luggage. Food is not really a problem. They have stalls all around the place. Be prepared to walk as the park is huge and worth your energy. Must visit the place if you are visiting Hongkong.

Amazing Park. In fact this visit was a substitute for my earler booked Land between tour which did not happen for want of minimum 4 pax.Since,I had seen many such theme parks elsewhere,I was bit reluctant to accept this substitute from tour company,but when I was out of this attraction in the evening ,I was more than satisfied with this attraction.The climate was bit cloudy but not raining and temperature not much and so ideal for tour on walk.I LIKE EVERYBODY LIKED CABLE CAR and did it twice,Beautiful seen below with all hongkong island view.The ocean express was also worh enjoying with a view of ocean world you can see at the roof of your train compartment.The ideal way is to go on top of hill by cable car and descend down by ocean express.I did it twice as I had enough time.I suggest to do cable car in the beging as a first attraction,go on hill,get down,do many rides,descend down the hill by ocean express,take lunch,rest for a while and finish other attractions at the ground level,do some shopping and say goodbye at assigned time of departure at about 5.30.I enjoyed this fully.

Great attraction , friendly staff but got seriously tourists management issue.. I was at ocean park with my family on April 2016. Overall park experience was great. Some attraction were old but well maintained. But,I think the park seriously need to have a tourist management improving. There were a massive group tourists rudely cutting line in "every" attraction. And there don't even respect to staffs suggestion.

As Always!. Always great to bring the kids to Ocean Park. They enjoyed it every time we visited during our trip to HKG. This time we find that a new MTR station will be ready soon. It simply makes it easier to visit this great place in the future. Remember to plan this as a full day trip with lots of walking. Sunglasses and sunscreen are must if visiting on sunny day.
OH MY LAUGHS! . What an incredible bang for your buck. I honestly haven't had so much fun or laughed so much since I was in my teens. Ocean Park is beautiful, clean, convenient and affordable.

A great way to Spend the day in Hong Kong. We love roller coasters and Ocean Park is a great park. It costs nearly around the same as Dinseyland and it has some great attractions in the park. Not a bad experience.

Educational and leisure visit . I went with a 3 years old kid and she enjoying the visit. The ride of cable car is excellent experience although it take a while to line up, but the staff could separate us to the stranger in a cable is appreciated.Although there are some Chinese tourist are rude and impolite, they are not line up fairly, hope the park could do more educational advice for them that promote how to become the one to considerate the other using the parks.If the Parks is full of rude people, we may not go to anymore!!

Beautiful Kids place. A crowded but beautiful place situated on a Hill, You have to dedicate full day for this activity. Try to enter early & take some food, water along with you as you will be walking.... walking .... & walking.Take bus No. 629 at Admiralty MTR Station or Central Pier No.7 to the park directly.Take bus 6A, 6X, 70, 75, 90, 97, 260, M590, 72, 72A, 92, 96, 592, 41A, 38, 42, 77, 99, 107, 170, 171, 671 or 973 and get off at Hong Kong Country Club or Aberdeen Tunnel Toll Plaza. Then walk a few minutes to the Park.Fun for Kids if you have that stamina & patience to wait for your turn on rides.Have a nice day

Very good for family and kids. The ocean park attarctions are divided in 2 parts , 1 part is on the uphill -sumitWe went early during park opening time but still we have to wait 45 min for cable car ride. what i heard that for train it was only 5 min waiting kids loved the giant panda attraction and dolphin show. rides in ocean park are more suitable for teenagers- adults, i will not recomend for small kids.you will eaisly spend whole day with having good time

50% of park closed. This park will be good on a sunny day but don't go if it's wet or windy as the majority of the attractions are set on top of the hills. When we visited the entire adventure land was closed as were many rides. We couldn't see the pandas as they were mating do there wasn't much to do. The park is full of Chinese tourists who will push you out of the way the entire day. I complained and received a partial refund.

Great View. The ride from the entrance to the top mountain for the rides had a fantastic view! The cable ride was along side the mountain with magnificent view of the ocean.The rides was great too but you have to take long escalator down and basically like hiking at Ocean Park to take one ride to another. But the view was fantastic.. The rides split out into different parts of the mountain.We went on weekdays and basically no queue but the last cable car ride back down will be at 5 or 6 pm if I am not mistaken. It was worth it!

For Young and Old. Visited Ocean Park and found the Dolphin & Seal show to be excellent along with the aquarium. In fact most of the rides catered for either the young, teenagers and elderly. The only downside I found was that some of the feeding times they indicated were for say 10am but they did not open the gate until that time so by the time you got to the venue you missed the feeding which was disappointing.Probably the highlight of the park would have to be the Panda bears as I along with many people would not have seen them before so to stand there and just watch them was memorising.
Pandas!. This is average theme park, but park has PANDAS and they are the best attraction of the park. Price of ticket is OK.

One day is not enough to explore this park. Definitely will go here again, and check it all out. My recommendation so far;- grand aquarium- giant panda adventure- Grab a snacks on old town Hong Kong - Take Cable car to the summit, be thrilled - Have lunch in the Bayview restaurant or terrace cafe, they have the best view- seajelly spectacular - The rapids- ocean Park towerWe watch the show in Ocean theatre, but it was dissapointing. That's all we got in one day..

Excellent day out. We really enjoyed visiting Ocean Park, having not been for a few years. A lot of new attractions have been installed, and everything is clean and tidy. We especially loved the train, which means you don't have to spend two hours queueing for the cable car.The rides were really fun, there being only one or two that my kids were not tall enough to go on. On the Wednesday we went there were not too many people, so we didn't spend much time queueing for rides.The animals were really interesting, especially the walruses, which I did not expect to see (although I do question whether the facilities were big enough for them, they just seemed to swim around in a kind of bored, monotonous way). The highlight for us was the Australian section, with the small kangaroos and the gorgeous koalas - just hearing the kookaburra was amazing, it was so loud and resonant! Our whole extended family had a brilliant day out at Ocean Park, which we feel is more suitable than Disney now that our kids are bigger - the rides are great, and there's loads to learn. Do wear comfy shoes though, Ocean Park always entails a huge amount of walking!

Visit on a Weekday. Ocean Park is a amusement park that is not far from the city, you may be able to ride a public bus to the site (ride is about less than 30minutes).The park opens at 10am, but the zones (Thrill Mountain & Rainforest) only opens at 11am. Even if you go on a weekday, try to go as early as you can to avoid queue. We didnt have to queue up and it was fantastic. My favourite was The Flash & Hair Raiser. Both rides give you a wonderful view of the ocean. Once you entered Ocean Park, you may choose to linger around or go straight to the Summit (two ways- via cable car or express train), we would advise to go for the cable car as you would get an amazing view of the ocean on the way up. There are a few zones, they have zoos, aquariums, overall a really fun place to be. However, rides are more suitable for teenagers- adults. not so much for kids, as they're more of a adrenaline rush.Ps. "The Dragon" ride was painful, my head keep on hitting the sides when it turns a corner, really uncomfortable, and i would not recomment riding the "Eagle", it's a simple ride, but i got nauseaus on that very badly. The day trip takes about 6~7 hours will do. (if there is not much crowd)

Forget Disney, this is where you need to be!. Been going since 1989, and it's still an absolute blast. If you are visiting town with the children and only have one day spare, I'd take OP over Disney every time. Fantastic cable car up to start the day, great rides, and doesn't get crowded until 2pm or so. I went early with my son on a public holiday last September and we were riding the coasters and log chutes continuously..didn't even have to get off and re-queue. Lots of traditional fun, with the only downside (obviously) being that it can get extremely hot from May-Nov.

One theme park. we walked around the town and asked the local people which place nice to visit and they recommended Ocean Park. I would like to go one theme park only, we decided to visit this place. They have plenty of good view for example hair raiser and the wild west train.
Good place to get Adrenaline. Very good park with lots of attractions for adults and kids. Good Zoo, Good dolphins show and the good meal. Very good views and nature.

Unique park. This park stands out by being both a zoo and amusement park in one place. And like Hong Kong's characteristic, you find many old and new elements in this park - something old-school and something new. If you are looking for everything to be shinny, polished, then i think you would be disappointed.This park has been around since my mother was my age (20 something) ! Over the years there has been renovations and new rides added.The park is divided into 2 zones - waterfront and summit, which is connected by cable car or a railway (ocean express), which is about 5 minutes ride. These two areas are not connected by footpath so walking is not an option. The cable car has consistently long queues, especially after lunch hours when tour groups arrive. I did not have an opportunity to take it since the queues are 30min-1 hour.animals: interesting animals such as pandas, koalas, red pandas, a big aquarium, to name some of them. Many are on the waterfront area, though the sharks and performances are at the summit.rides: located mostly on the Summit. Then again there are 2 areas: Marine World, which has all the old-school amusement park rides: viking, ferris wheel, roller coaster, drop tower, swings ; and Thrill Mountain which has the park's fastest roller coaster (Hair Raiser) which has a really awesome view and in my opinion is the best roller coaster in Hong Kong (better than space mountain in disney). Other rides: old-school bumper cars, many games kiosks where you can win plush toys.

A day at Ocean Park. Haven't been to ocean park for years so decided to pay it a visit.Everything has changed.There are lots of aquatics, live performances and this new food street leading to the cable car ride.

Wonderful Day. If you've got enough time in Hong Kong, I definitely recommend coming here! It's a fun day trip!! To avoid big crowds you should come as early as the park opens and take the gondola to the other side straight away as you won't have big queues for the rollercoasters! The park is definitely not just for kids as there is stunning views from the rides! The animals are all seperated in different houses, for example there's a jellyfish house, a seal house, a shark house, a penguin house, panda bears and of course amongst lots of other local animals, there is a big aquarium! Take enough water and maybe somesandwiches with you as the food & drinks are overpriced like in every other theme park!

Average and below the hype. Took the kids there today. We were looking forward to a great day. I guess we had high expectations as we had already been to disneyland and everyone said.to go to ocean park.The aquarium, shark tank and pandas were great. Whiskers harbour is pointless as you have to pay for everything including the kids jumping castle. Needs an upgrade and not a PAYG system The train was good to get you to the top. The cable car was good too but kept stopping. Not good in wind. As for everything else, their were so many tour groups in the park that it made it difficult to get around. Lots of walking up and down hills as well. Food was expensive and average. It was great that our server had such a poor attutide as well. Looked like she was having a real bad day. Lots of rides and some for the thrill seaker so this is a plus but lots of walking around to get to them.Went to a couple of shows. Sea lion and dolphin........ below par. Both went for 15 to 20 mins each and nothing like a sea world performance. Gave up after that.Lots to do but to be honest, i would not make this park a priority on a holiday. Do your own research online to see if you will get what you want from the park before committing. I would also google tickets tickets online as you can get them cheaper than the website/park.I would also recommend getting there near opening so you dont have to queue up too much. We left just after 4pm and the crowds were still coming in from tour groups.From a transport perspective, awesome. Catch the 629 bus from Admiralty MTR station and it takes you to the park. Same bus pick up too. Cost is 10.60 HK each way for adults. Very cheap. 629A from central is also available.I will leave this one up the the individual to decide if the park hits the mark. For my family, not so much.

Unexpectededly great. I was second guessing about visiting ocean park since we spent 2 days n disneyland already but im glad we did. Our kids ages 5 and 7 truy enjoyed ocean park not because of the characters present (not familiar with any of them ) but to see animals like the walrus, seals, panda and penguins up close! We also enjoyed the cable car ride as well as the ocean express. And the "carnival" games where you can win prizes was an added treat specially since my daughter won a prize. Made her trip that much more special.

You must go!. Brilliant day our. Value for money, (it's about £35 per adult ). Go early, I really only wanted to see the giant pandas, but I was delighted to see the other animals such as red pandas, Arctic foxes, walruses etc. The list is too long! The animals were wide awake and in superb condition. There are rides and other attractions too. I'm really glad that I went.

A theme park, a mini zoo and an aquarium rolled into one. Want a combination of rides and a zoo all in one? Ocean Park has both. Visit the aquarium, see the penguins, visit the monkeys and pandas and watch both a bird and dolphin show. When you're done with looking at the animals you can go on a ride..maybe go on the under ground trin to the other side...go on the abyss.. or the ferris wheel...take the cable car back and take a stroll through old Hong Kong. Go shopping for souvenirs. You can easily spend a whole day here and be thoroughly entertained. You will enjoy your visit to Ocean Park...its more than just a theme park! I loved it.

Fun visit . The kiddos as well as my husband and I really had a good time at this Park. Enjoyed the cable car ride and the Penguins. They wanted to play with the Dolphins but it was late, it was fun nonetheless:)

Worth a day out.. I downloaded the app and got a 15% discount off the admission tickets when I bought it at the door. Also forked out a little more for the fast pass and totally no regrets. Did not manage to utilise all the 7 fast pass entitlement but it saved me more than an hour at the cable car station and saved me a lot of energy standing in Qs. Advisable to check bus timings for leaving the park, I missed the 629 bus by one minute to star ferry and the next one was only scheduled for half an hour later.

Pandas are lazy. Yes they sleep a lot and has funny gestures. :) they are so cute. The Pandas are my favorite. I also love the availability of drinks everywhere because it is hot. I have fear of heights but I manage to ride the cable car. It was safe and has super nice mountain and ocean view. Never miss to go to Ocean Park when you are in Hong Kong.

Animal exhibits make this worth it even if you don't like rides. I hadn't been to Ocean Park in getting on for 10 years (!) and was slightly worried that the 385HKD ticket price was going to be wasted on me as I'm neither really into kiddie stuff nor rides however, the animal exhibits are really extensive and really enjoyable. Even the excitement of seeing pandas again was matched by the aquariums and the rainforest section. Really, really enjoyable afternoon.

Very good place. Due to paucity of time we had to decide between Disneyland and Ocean Park. Visited this site to decide and based on availability of animals and journey to reach the place we decided to restrict our visit to Ocean Park and visit Disneyland next time. Fun begins as soon as you enter the park and you encounter really big fountains but we were more interested in Gondola ride that takes visitors from one mountain to another and its breath taking - mountain on one side and sea on another; it can't get better than this. On top of it we were allocated one gondola to ourselves thus doubling the fun. Dolphin show coupled with walrus, shark pond, stingray, jellyfish section, penguin section were amazing for me (these were first for me so please excuse the excitement). :)Some people were comparing it similar parks in other countries but we were too happy to ensure that we cover all animals including big Panda :)Make sure you dedicate an entire day for this park. Due to limited time we didnt try a single ride :( may be next time.

Ocean Park Hooray!. Amidst visiting during April (2016) with my husband and daughter (2 years old) and experiencing rain, wind and fog for the entire day - we were able to maximize our visit by enjoying the cable car and express train ride... There is also a play area where kids can enjoy while the parents are just resting. Food is relatively expensive:Popcorn - 46 HKD Soda - 35 HKD

Very Unique, a must visit. An Aquarium/ Theme park/ Zoo all mixed in together. We had an amazing day. Cable car ride is long and the view spectacular. Great viewing opportunities of the animals, we had a super view of one of the pandas. Some of rides have height restrictions that we thought were a little extreme and only our 9 year old was tall enough for a lot of the rides. But there are some rides that the littler ones can go on if accompanied by an adult. It was raining off and on when we went so I think this kept crowd numbers down a little. We also avoided going on the weekend. It was still busy don't get me wrong but wait times were only 10 mins max for rides. Judging by the queuing areas for rides it must get much much busier so we were thankfull for the rain. Everything still ran in the rain. Food and beverages big $$$. We got there via the Ocean Express Bus from Amiralty MTR station. Quick and easy. A must do attraction.

More fun than disneyland , can spend one whole day here. Ocean park really improved by a lot with more things to do there. A decade ago there is just the sea animals and some rides. But now so many things to do after its expansion. Now there are land animals, birds and sea animals. There are also different shows here. Love the aquarium, pandas and the sea animal show. There are also specific feeding times where you can see the animals perform while they feed. You should take the cable car or the express train up to the peak first before coming down because tour groups that come after noon time always head to the peak and can be quite crowded there after. 6 hours is not enough for us although we did not take much rides. It is a great place to explore and play for the whole day. Good for children and adults. There are fast food stores and restaurants there so fret not if you feel hungry. For the price, ocean park is worth every single cent compared to disneyland. we went on a day with some drizzle , so at the start it felt like the park is just for us. So fun .
Playing. We played the water activities and Halloween specialtys with scary scores and numbers for guests. If you play water activities, remember to bring a jacket just in case.

Amazing Animals & Amazing White Knuckle Rides. We visited on a week-day so the crowds were virtually non-existent so we got to see all the animals, animal shows and all the rides in one full day. We ate in The Neptune restaurant which was beautiful food with an incredible backdrop and very reasonably priced for such a top restaurant. Apart from this top end eatery the park is covered by every type of food outlet covering all tastes and placed around the park with at least one in every zone. If in Honkers this is a MUST visit attraction during the week to avoid the queues.

Great Park. Went here last Monday, weather in HK was rainy but surprisingly it wasnt raining when we arrived, since it was a Monday, there wasnt too many people, we came around 10:30 am, we didnt have to line up for any attractions, the aquariums were amazing, the dolphin show was so so, food was kinda pricey but was kinda good, my kids rode some rides and we also rode the cable car, good thing we finished early cause people started coming in by mid afternoon, and we were lucky weather was nice and cool, will definitely go back here in the future!

More Adults than Kids. Ocean Park is huge and segmented into different areas. There is a corner full of kiddy rides which we did not visit at all. We hardly had enough time for the thrill rides! There are also plenty of aquarium exhibits for those not interested in amusement rides. There's so much to do in Ocean Park!

Goodf. Enjoyed our day here x my granddaughter loved it, the rides and the animals and the Lion King show was fantastic. My biggest complaint would be the terrace restaurant which was not very good, the food was mediocre at best, the staff member that served us didn't look at us, speak to us or answer when we asked for some salt and mayo, then they have the cheek to add a service charge to the bill which we refused to psy but they were not very happy about it. The light show at the end of the day was really lovely and well worth waiting to watch.

Amazing and Wonderful place to spend the day. The Ocean Park offers so many to be explored in just one day, the park is HUGE and has many attractions.The Dolphin and whale show is amazing to attend and watch, the rides is fun.Make sure to visit in Halloween season or the Christmas time when the park is themed for the occasions.The only problem here is the large queue lines.Overall this Park is a MUST.

Exciting Day with Reasonable Price. It's not just about aquatic life but all other interesting things about nature and culture - the rides, entertainment, ambiance, food.....the cable ride gave me a spectacular view of the islands composing Hong Kong and a great view of the lower part of the theme park.....I love the Old Hong Kong section with the feel of what was the Crown Colony in the past plus the music played and food stalls (much much cheaper here than Disneyland).....every space was ideal for taking a photo.....I guess I need two days to explore every part of it

Ocean Park Hong Kong . What a wonderful place for a visit. Wish we had more time at the park. My 10 year old loved all the animals, both aquatic and land. Her favorite was the giant panda. We spent a lot of time just admiring the majestic creature. Then there are the rides. Wow. We must've been on the Riptide 10 times. Facilities were clean, well maintained. It was both educational and fun for all ages.

Good family fun you can learn from our mistakes...!. We enjoyed our day outing to Ocean Park. We arrived at 10am to beat the crowds. Tickets bought online with the Ocean Park app provide a 15%. You need to do this at least one day in advance - unfortunately something other reviews here didn't mention. I asked for fastrack to jump the queues (it's not unlimited but can be used once on the major rides), it costs H$150 extra. The ticket seller advised against as it would not be crowded. She was right we saved $600 We took the express train to the top, as recommended by other reviewers, again to beat the crowds. "Epic fail" in the words of our teen son as rides didn't open until 11! We hadn't eaten so asked for directions to restaurants that were open. We were sent to many. None open. All open at 11. By now my 6, 9 & 12 year old sons were not happy. It was surprisingly cold up there. Lacking the humidity in the city. Take a jacket!We ate at Tuxedo Restaurant. As it was bang on 11, we got a table by the penguin window. This is very cool. You'd need to book to guarantee this. Tables face a glassed off penguin inclosure! My boys - & I - loved it!! The waitresses were lovely, offering to take photos & generally being very accommodation. The food is not good & massively overpriced. We had 2 cooked frozen pizzas, chicken wings, cheesy fries & soft drinks. The bill was H$950!! Rides great. No queues as promised.The park is massive! Long, windy paths that were confusing to navigate.As it was cold & we were unprepared for this I bought my 6 yr old son a hoodie $450!! Everything super expensive in the park.The pandas were mating so could not be seen, which was disappointing.Best bits were the jellyfish (illuminated in lights to classical music, really cool) l, shark enclosure with giant rays & sawfish. We didn't get to the aquarium.We left as the heavens opened at 2pm to see hundreds & hundreds of mainland Chinese arriving by coaches. Seems we did best the queues after all.We come to Hong Kong regularly. Not sure we'll come back here....

Great entertainment > better and cheaper than Disneyland. On Hong Kong island$385HKD If purchased in the Chung King Mansions’ lobby $340HKD 11am – 7pm From Chung King Mansions (40 Nathan Rd) go right on Nathan Rd. and walk to Mody Road Bus stop 973 Bus: 973 from Tsim Sha Tsui (Mody Road)($13.6HKD)Stop #32 > Ocean Park Road, Wong Chuk Hang RoadTake the same bus back > or take a bus from the Ocean Park exit to the Admiralty MTR train station and then take the train back from there. Buses only run until 10pmIf you get there for the 11am opening on a weekday a steady day will take you through 90% of the park sites and rides before the 7pm close.Ocean Park is much nicer than Disneyland and cheaper too.
One Full Day trip. This a huge park but not to worry there are many many escalators. Plan which areas you want to do & go according or else you may end up missing a lot.

A place you should not miss when in HK. This theme park offers something for all ages. Make sure to wear comfortable shoes since this place is really HUGE! The park has 2 parts. The Summit & the waterfront. Going up to the summit it is better if you try the cable car which will give you nice view at the top and going back to the waterfront you can also make use of the train so that you can try both. In the summit, they have rides for adults and what I like most was the dolphin show. When you go back to the waterfront it would be best to go inside the giant aquarium, sea lions, penguins, sharks and lots of fish of all kinds. For places like this expect food and drink choices are expensive. But overall my boyfriend and I had fun and if ever we get the chance to visit HK again, we surely come back to Ocean Park, you should not give this place a miss when in Hongkong.
Fun :). I always love it when I go to Hong Kong and visit Ocean Park. The rides are so fun and the cable car is fantastic.

A pleasant day in Ocean Park. We went to ocean park on a saturday with my wife and my son of 19 years old and were little bit worried about the waiting queue at the different attractions. If you want Its possible to buy the option to skip the queue for 7 attractions ( 150hkd additional per person ) but we didnt .First we arrived at the opening of the park, arround 10am so that there is not yet too much people. In order to do the maximum of attraction before the park become very busy, we decided to ride the ocean express train instead of the cable cable and went directly to the summit where the main attractions are. We started first to ride the attraction there, and there was no waiting queue or maximum 5 minutes so it was great. We have done arround 10 attractions only as some are only for chidrens and we wanted to ride only the ones with sensations. The best ones are the hair raiser, the flash, the mine train , Abyss...We went also to see the show with dolphins and seal at the ocean centre. Its not an incredible show like some aquatic park have but it was nice to see and we can relax a bit after walking and riding the attractions all day.Arround 4pm we decided to go back and took the cable car..it was only the first time we have to wait long..arround 45 minutes..the ocean express was only 10 minutes waiting but we decided to wait for the cable car as we didnt took it in the morning. Then before to leave , we went to the grand aquarium...Honnestly we didnt stayed long time as it is not so "grand" and great and it is not quite at all when you have loads of mainland chinese who shout all the time and take pictures with flash all the time in front of the different aquariumIn general we can say that we spent a good day. Maybe we will go back in few years...if they have new attractions

Fun times at Ocean Park. Ocean Park is definitely worth a visit while you are in Hong Kong. It has to be one of the best theme parks in the world, set across two islands linked with a chair lift. we spent most of our time on the second island as this is where all the thrill rides such as the rollercoasters are located. While you are at the park, download and use the Ocean Park App. Use of the App gives you a 15% discount on park entry tickets between 19 March 2016 and 17 April 2016. I also noticed that in some Mc Donalds stores in Hong Kong you can pick up a voucher that gives you 20% discount on park entry. I would also recommend that you purchase the 'Fast Pass' for $HK150 which gives you priority access on 7 rides. Lines for the Cable Car can be up to 60 minutes both ways, so the Fast Pass is worth it just for this.

Non Stop Fun. The Ocean Park may be termed as one of the best fun places of Hong Kong. It offers limitless opportunities of entertainment, fun and thrill to people of all ages. The cable car ride and the train- run through the Ocean Park hillock were simply exciting.

Great Park - Ocean themed it is a good day out.. We first visited this park 30 years ago, wow, it has changed .... you think... I really like this park. Go early, as soon as you get in through the turnstiles, make your way straight to the cable car, there is a lot to see but there is more on the other side, so catch the cable car first, look at all the stuff on this side when you come back. The Chinese mainlanders can be a problem on the weekends, best if you can go through the week. Make sure you see the penguins and note: the entire building is a water tank, the penguins can swim under your feet, it is amazing.The Cafe restaurant is reasonably priced, but the view is to die for.Have a great day.

A must do! No queues for us! Best views are from the rollercoasters. A great day out, we were unsure as many of the reviews stated long queues and waiting around.We went on a wednesday, possibly when the HK schools were still in as not many school children. We arrived around 11:30am after getting on the direct 629 bus from Admiralty (you have to pay for this, clear signage). The park was quiet on arrival, it did get very busy after lunch hours. We took the advice of getting the cable car up to The Summit side first. Cable car ride was both petrifying and awe-inspiring! Great views but not great with heights. It's safe to say we got the Ocean Express back down to the park entrance.Best were the Mine Train and Dragon, seeing the pandas and penguins were a particular highlight.Bring in your own drinks and snacks. They checked our bags and it wasn't a problem. It was very hot on the Summit side of the park.

Very Good for Rides watching exotic animals. The park divided into two, the mountain & water front. Most of the rides are at mountain. The main attractions are rides, very thrilling and some casual ones. We saw lot of exotic creatures which we saw first tome in life. Red Panda, Panda, Kuala, Kangaroo, Arctic Wolf, Variety of Penguins, Walrus, sea lions, and many exotic sea creatures.

Mr Shek . Great place with lots to do. Will need to spend a whole day here as so much to see. Also great delight to see pandas eating right Infront of view point. Queues were little long but that's why it's such a busy place. Very expensive to buy things to eat and drink which is a disappointment also not allowed to bring in any of your own too.

A good theme park, somewhat different from others. I really like this park, where I've been twice so far. The second time I was a bit unlucky because it was crowded with a big number of impolite Chinese mainlanders. The staff, always so nice to visitors, had to scold them the whole time. But it is a "must", anyway. Don't miss the cable car and the show with the dolphins. Amazing.

A day walk . The park opens at 10 am. All will be worth if you come early and seize every adventure inside the park. I suggest you book online when you are in hongkong for discounts. When we went there we booked our entrance fees online and availed 15% discount.Love the street foods as we go along. Toasted squid is my favorite of all. Don't forget to bring bottled water as you stroll along the park to prevent dehydration.Enjoy!
Wow. This was an amazing park. The rides were awesome. The best I've ever been to. And the cable car up I offers breathtaking views.

Awesome!!!. I had the most extreme ride and indeed was my first time in my entire life and I conquer my fear of riding it!! Awesome experience. I ride all the the extreme ride starting with the Hair Raiser. Hair raiser was definitely the extreme of the roller coaster. Better ride it first and you will be amazed and want to ride again.. :D

Youngers Paradise. Try to reach here as soon as park open . Park divided into 2 parts . Upper n Lower . You can go up either by tram or by cable car . So take any one of this which have lesser que n directly go up n finish it first than come down . It may save your time .Avoid visiting here on holiday .

A day long affair that is easily preferred over Disneyland. This place is so huge that if you try out everything it will take you more than a day. Just to back up my claim let me tell you that they trains and cable cars inside the complex to take you from one spot to another. It is basically a marine mammal park, oceanarium, animal theme park and amusement park. The theme park has various attractions and rides, including four roller coasters, and also animal exhibits with different themes, such as a giant panda habitat, rainforest and polar displays, as well as an aquarium featuring the world's largest aquarium dome. Be sure to take the brochure and flier when you enter the facility, this map/ guide will help you plan as to what attractions you want to check out and the timings for the animal shows.

Great day out. I love this place , great day out with the rides and also the animals ,in 2014 we saw the Pandas and watched the dolphin display and 2015 we saw there new OZ attraction , was nice to Kolas and some Kangaroos up close

Better than Disney. This is a theme park with lots and lots to see. I like this better than Disney because it other shows and animals as well as rides. Disney is mainly for kids but Ocean Park is for fish and ocean lovers too. Fluffy toys and mickey mouse do nothing for me so Ocean Park is my vote. Fabulous day out for both adults and children. It is important to stay till night falls. Excellent firework show and performance.

Superior to Disneyland. Ask the locals and they'd likely recommend Ocean Park over Disneyland if you are going to one theme park only. The roller coasters here have some of the best views of Hong Kong, especially Hair Raiser and the Wild West Mine Train.

Amazing theme park and Zoo. It has it all.this what i can say. The panda the animals the theme park. the aquarium. the shows the resturant. The view and location.It has it all. Its a place you will love to go twice and more.the staff are pleasant and its is worth the value of ticket price. Easy to access metro and public transportation . It was the favourite attraction for me and my kids in Hong Kong.

Funtastic. Too crowded with the Chinese tourists. Go on off peak and avoid summer if possible. Lots of exciting ride and educational sites for adults and children. Unlike Disneyland, there isn't fast pass so you will probably need to queue for a while. A roller coaster will take about 40-60 min yet strangely in a more heart pumping ride, the wait was less than 5 min.

so so for us. we recently visited the ocean park , travelled 3 couples with three toddlers. Rented the stroller which was very much needed. Its a big place, dolphin show was good, but was way too crowded and has limited activity for toddlers. It did not excite us as disneyland had...

Pandas. we went here to see the Pandas, well thought out family park with reasonable shopping/ dining. Great (but scary) at the time open sided cable car that takes you to the top of the park, discounts were available for credit card ticket purchases , may have changed. Must go if only to see the pandas

Very nice but shadowed by Disneyland. Very nice experience. Kids loved a lot. Shows are good.Rides are a blast. However to have Disneyland in the same city and to be done in consecutive days takes some glory away from ocean park.
Great and fun place!!. Overall it has been a great experience except the part where one of my brother got too nauseous from the rides and vomited on me. But nonetheless, great rides!!
a great day out. get there at opening as there is a lot to do here in a day. The Pandas get fed about 5pm so worth going to see them then as they are moving and it is not soo busy.

Go while the weather is good. The Ocean Park is worth a family visit. For the senior citizens, they get in free. As a resident who visited the Park at various stage of my life, I found the place less attractive than before. Even the main attraction like the Water show is less interesting than before. It has a nice Panda area and Pigeon section. But, make sure that the wather is good. My last visit was rainy and there was little fun.

Great local attraction. Get there in the morning, when the park opens and head to the rear of the park (using the cable cars or train). By 2-3 pm you can head back over to the front and beat the crowd. It gets VERY crowded around 12-1 like most attractions in Hong Kong. There isn't a huge about of rides for little children, but there are a few and animals that hold their attention. Other roller coasters are based on age and height of a person (just because a child might be tall enough to ride the ride, they have to be old enough as well).

Children will Love the Ride ,Fishes , Penguin and Dolphin show. Must Visit Place to enjoy Fish , Penguins , Ride on great Swings and Finally the Dolphin show ...Full day excursion for children and Grown ups
Animals and fun!. If you're spending more than a vacation in Hong Kong you should definitely go there. Our favourite things: animals (we did the panda encounter!) and the ice skating show!

A huge crowded resort. We bought the tickets via klook, which was handy: no queueing, just a flash of the e-tickets at the gate. The park has quite a bit to offer. Lots of animals, organized performances and amusing rides.We did not buy the "fast track service" for 150 hkd or whatever it's called, and I regret that. The park was really crowded and the queueing times were a bit too much for us. We spent a good 3 hours in queues that day which was really exhausting. Either we are stupid or the map was a bit unclear, but we didn't realize that the park was devided on two main continents, from which you could move to an other ONLY by Ocean express (train) or cable cars (the view was quite impressive). Either way we had to spend a good 40 minutes in queue just to get out of there.We went to see the aquarium, pandas, koalas, penguins and boarded a few rides. The food there is also very expensive as you can imagine.The day was fun but a bit rough.

2 tired children. Great fun!. Long queues for tickets when we arrived. Our fault to a certain extent, should have pre booked but don't understand why parks like this don't open more desks or offer a quicker alternative. We bought a fast track ticket and were glad we did. The queues are a lot shorter than some of UK parks we've been too but some were 30 minutes long and when you are there for only a day at $150 per head its worth it. Some fun rides and good shows. The dolphins were excellent and we enjoyed getting soaked on the rapids! As usual for these places food and drink choices were rubbish and expensive. Take a picnic instead. Overall though a good day. The kids had a blast.

BIG DAY OUT. Plan this as a whole day visit and pre book tickets on line to beat to rush. even with a bit of rain the kids will still enjoy. Some of the best attractions on show for sea creatures.Also a fun park to keep ever the fussiest kids amused.Try to plan your time as it will slip away quickly here.

A must go park in Hong Kong. I loved to go Ocean Park as my kids were small. They issued seasonal tickets by that time and I would like to have a walk in the park with so much to see and so much to play with. Although I had been to Ocean Park for so many times and so many years, I still enjoyed very much every time I went. They offer seasonal themes changing frequently so that you will not got boring with them. Last time, I went with the monks from Tibet. At first, I didn't know they would like to go there as I thought they were usually doing nothing except worshipping Buddha. To my surprise, they enjoyed very much. Actually, Ocean Park is a very good place for many purpose. There is the cable car that my sons used to ride on while they were young. All the animals are lots of fun to children. There are also exciting machines to suits people needs. Besides, the area is so close to the city centre and there will be MTR operating this year with a station at the entrance. Flowers are nice and air is relatively fresh. There is no reason for me not to visit there with my friends from overseas. If you are a tourist and if you like the about reason, I think Ocean Park is a must go in Hong Kong.

Worth going with Family for full day. Reach at Admiralty MTR station and exit B for 629 bus stand. As soon as you get out bus is there and in 20 min you will be there at gate. Buy online line travel agent like Klook etc tickets it will save money and print out is sufficient to enter. Take Cable ride to go top and from there go all rides & shows. Come down and see Panda & aquarium and then exit. If you enter at 10 am then by 5 pm you can finish. At top MacDonald is there but no meal option. All separate buying although not much costly. From MTR, Bus & Mcdonald every where you can pay by octopus card. Return by same route. More bus for Admiralty than any other place.

Fun All Day!. We were there on Halloween and the park was doubly more fun with ghouls, ghosts and monsters roaming around to scare kids and take great pictures wit them. You can start with the aquarium and panda area then ride the astonishing cable car for more rides on top of the mountain. You need to see the penguins and walrus at Polar Adventure area. Not a minute wasted.

Nice Ocean Theme Park. You can spend pretty much the entire day there. We took the Subway(MTR) to Admiralty station,where you take the direct bus to the Ocean Park non stop. The dolphins show is at the Peak area. There are some exciting rolling coaster rides at the Peak area also. Coming back down to street level. Take the individual cable cars. Its a beautiful scenic 1o minutes or so ride. Well worth it. Also, there are two Pandas living in the Park. Take a look at them.

favorite of teen age .. We reach there from admirality metro station by bus 629 easily .we buy the ticket from china travel agency in previous day .so much to do but mainly for teen age. It is not good forsmall childen .

Excellent day out . Fantastic family day out. The rides and the animals made it a great day for us all. The penguin enclosure is probably the best one I've seen in the world! Loads of space for them and they seemed healthy and happy.The red panda was my favourite. What an amazing example of a gorgeous animal.The Dolphins were fantastic and looked healthy. A definite must for a day out and the transport to and from our hotel was seamless.

Poor management of crowd . Good place and must visit. It's better than Disney land but very poor management of the crowd. There are too many people and too few facilities. You have to keep queuing everywhere for atleast 2 hours even to get tickets. If visiting book tickets online for a discount than at the park at full price despite waiting for 2 hours.

Worth going just for 'The Dolphin Show'. I have been to ocean park 3 times and have been on all the rides, but the dolphin show always stands out. There are times where a couple of the rides are closed for maintenance but there are many substitutes. Do take a paper bag as some of the rides can make you feel nauseous.

Best theme park in Hong Kong. I came with the kids, but admittedly not with high expectations, and didn't really investigate what was available. Oh boy was I surprised! Loads to do with great rides, nice exhibits on marine and other wildlife, and other fun bits like arcade games. Not as polished as Disney, but a with heart and great variety. Better than Disney overall.
Must go!. A theme park that must not be missed for a holiday in Hong Kong. Children will enjoy the most. Full of excitement!

Family Fun. Wear comfy shoes and put some sunscreen when you visit because there's a lot of outdoor walking to do. This park is big and you will see so many sea creatures, birds and some featured mammals Choose the rides, aquariums, and shows you want to see before you visit because a whole day is not enough to see the whole park. There are lots of souvenir shops around the park so don't spend too much time in one store.
Place cannot be missed in HK. Another amazing place in HK.... Your visit is incomplete if not visited the Ocean park in HK... They have all kind of rides and few rides are just amazing .....

Ocean Wonders at the Ocean Theatre . You wouldn't want to miss it when you visit Ocean Park Hong Kong. It’s a fantastic show held at the newly furnished Ocean Theatre with dolphins and sea lions as the main stars.

A Must have. Specially if you are travelling with Kids this is a must have
You can see the Pandas and then have fun in the amusement park
Must visit. Ocean park is must visit for all age people.. all rides are awesome.. specially oyster. Wud surely recommend every traveller to visit & have fun. Cable car ride is too good

Good fun for the whole day. The theme park offers something for all ages, from roller coasters to aquariums, to dolphin shows, to penguins....its attraction galore.While going up use the train, it will save you precious time. Come down by cable car. The view is breath taking . Visit the penguins, enjoy the dolphins, sea lions along with the rides. The roller coasters, hair risers , lazy river are fun.It is a very big park and going early will save you precious time. The restaurants are not cheap, but the dining environment is spectacular with views of the ocean. We were given coupons for Indian food, but the food was bad with no variety at all.

Ocean Park. Book your entry tickets online days before you go. The lines to get entry tickets on premises are ridiculous. Also - INSIDER TIP - pay the extra money for the Fast Track Passes. You get to skip the line on 7 of the amusements including the cable car. This pass paid for itself several times over on our visit.
Fun day out - but pricey!. The restaurants are very expensive for what they are: eat at the 'street vendors' for better value. Otherwise a nice mix of aquariums, animal habitats and theme park rides.

Excellent park with something for all age groups. It is a must visit place for all tourists. Based on my experience, my suggestions are1. Cheapest n convenient way to reach is by MTR. Reach admirality station n take bus 629 after taking exit B.2. Prebook the tkts through klook, it's the cheapest, can opt for family combo @90 USD. Do take the fastpass tkts if going on weekends n holidays, otherwise you will not be able to cover even 40% bcoz of long queues. fastpass has discount coupons as well for food, drinks, souvenirs n make up for half of their cost at least.3. The park has two parts..waterfront n the summit. If your kids are small, I mean less than 5 yrs, opt for waterfront first, otherwise go to summit first as waterfront has activities primarily for very young children.4. Most of the rides for children 6 and above are at the summit.5. Cable car options is far better than express train and if you take cable car, you may even miss ngong ping 360 but for the big Buddha. ( lantau island trip, if planned for another day ).6. McDonald's, KFC, food kiosks, terrace cafe for Indian veg options are all there..Go there in time to enjoy most of the rides as at some places waiting can be upto one hr, however fastpass can help.

Great fun on a cold day. We were here mid week at the end of March so there were no crows and no waitin in line for the rides, I'm sure in the summer it is much much busier. The aquarium is nicely laid out, not huge but very pleasant. We had lunch at the restaurant which was perfectly fine, not cheap as you would expect but not outrageous. The rides are good fun although I chickened out on the hair raiser rollercoaster, the rest of the gang reported it as being short but intense! It's not an enormous park but there is quite a bit of construction so I imagine that it's going to add a lot over the next while. There is also a mtr station being built there which will make it very easy. Right now you get there by bus, which is very east and so well organised, the line seemed so long when the park closed but the organisation was great and there was no shortage of busses to get us home. As I say we were there on a quiet day really can't vouch for what it would be like at peak times

Fantastic. A must visit place especially with children when in HongKong. Lots of fun and Learning. Kids will love this place. Cable car ride was really exciting. Never miss it out. Overall a good place to spend the whole day.

Rainy but fun!. Unfortunately the day we visited Ocean Park it was quite stormy. Despite this, most of the rides were operating. Ocean Park is not as new as the Disneyland, but I would still recommend visiting. We went on a weekday so luckily it wasn't too crowded so we didn't have to wait too long for most rides.

Great but sadly spooky by rude tourists . I must say that Ocean park exceeded my expectations as I haven't been here for almost 20 years. The park is big and updated with various different activities to do. The electronic app hasA neat feature that gives you three free e-queue spaces which came in quite handy. Everything was going well until we started to head back and decided to take the Asia express train back down the mountain. The organisation of this queue is poor and sadly the number of tours that are operating meant that very rude tourists were literally queue barging and at one point almost caused a stampede as there are gaps in the queue system where it becomes a free for all. I was with my daughter and wife and were literally shoved out of the way. This I believe is an accident waiting to happen. For this reason I am knocking off 2.5 stars. Perhaps it was a one off, but with the number of signs saying please queue in an orderly manner I suspect it's not.

A great place to be at. It's quite a big space here in Oceanpark. There are a lot of shows and performance. Rides are seem to be an additional attraction here. Be sure to take a map, even better to have a few map, and mark down every show's time, and the location of the show, and plan your time. You wouldn't want to go up to the north side for a show, and the next show at the other end of where you are. If you go on a hot and sunny season, be sure to apply some sunscreen, there are limited shades on the park. Food are still ok. Plenty of restaurants in the park.

Good place for kids only. It's a must do for kids but very few options for young adults.. Only a few rides are thrilling ... While kids enjoyed them.. Adults will find it a bit boring... There are more thrilling rides in Genting or even Adventure Island in Delhi. The aquarium was a big disappointment.. Since it had hardly any new variety of fish and was mostly dirty and not well kept.

Great day out.....loved the Pandas and Cable car. Great place to visit for scenery, animals and thrill rides. Loved the Pandas the best! The Cable Car ride was long with amazing views best to up grade to FasTrack for 150 HKD to avoided all the long queues. Be aware it only gives you 7 priority accesses so save some for Cable Car. It was ridiculous the line up on Easter Saturday well worth paying the extra to get straight on all the major rides and attractions. The food like most theme parks is expensive and average but we knew it would be. When upgrading to FasTrack you get discount vouchers to use on good, drink and souvenir purchases these came in handy. There are some great roller coasters and other thrill rides. You need a whole day to see the park and lots of energy as it is very spread out. My best suggestion is head straight to the cable car first and do the rides then relax in the afternoon seeing the animals and sea life. We did an organised tour which which we booked the morning of at our hotel the Holiday Inn. It picked us up and dropped us back and we avoided to huge line up to purchase entry tickets once we arrived, well worth it rather than train, bus and queuing for hours. Tour price was 480 HKD for Adult and 320 HKD for Child. Tour company was Grayline.

Ocean park, is a theme park for everyone.. Ocean park is world's best theme park and a major attractions for all visitors visiting Hongkong, it is located at Aberdeen outside Hongkong at a mountain just on beach next to sea.It is a full day event which has something for people all ages. Park is really well planned keeping all aspects in mind like transfer to the rides in mountain has trolley which is most preferred, train to manage people on crowded days & option to go on foot also. There are 2 Roller coaster both are good, flash ride and Asus high drop are best rides. Kids enjoyed dolphin show, Penguins and the aquarium. If you want to really enjoy the day avoid holidays, weekends and reach there early by 10 Am as all rides close at 7.00 PM.The ticket is expensive at 375 HKD. There is an option of buying cheap tickets at chunking mansion from money changers.
Great adventure. Good outing for families, kids , adults and oldies alike. Have fun learning with actual experiences. Have a good glimpse at ocean life both shallow waters and deep ocean animals.

One of the best sea creatures in the world.. I love ocean park in Hong Kong. Been there a few times before I immigrated to US in 1997.I always wanted to visit again just didn't have company. I have a chance to visit again in March as I celebrate my 60th birthday in HKG this year.Ocean Park offers free entrance to visitor on their birthday. I visited with a friend who's been waited for 5 years to enjoy the privilege. We all paid and that's alright. Just remember they search your bags for food and drinks at the entrance.Some security are less demanding than others. You just need to be smart. Bring empty bottles to get water. Foods inside are very expensive. We fed ourself before we went there.We took a bus at Admiralty station to Ocean Park. The young people like those roller coaster, while I enjoy watching the sea creatures and other animals. They are very educational besides fun. There are machine that for everyone of different ages.The weather was not hot nor cold. Been shower a little. A wonderful day and I ended up paying the balance for close to HK$1000 (US$150) for a year pass as I know I would be back at least a few times a year. I want to go back to try those machines again.It can be very crowded if the weather is good. Tons of visitors from China as its close for them to travel. The big tank I called it deserves the best as its soooo big with 4 storeys high.Bring something for shade as well as to prevent getting wet. Have fun.
Fun for all. Be prepared to walk a lot! This place is huge! Also take some extra jumpers cause up the hill it can be windy. Food and drinks are expensive and not good but attractions for all ages.
Ocean Park . Nice place to spend the day with family and friends. Several things to do and activities too. Lots of animals and shows to see.
Great day out!. The rides, the aquarium, the light and sound show at night all AMAZING!!! The Panda looks so sad, quite disturbing in a tiny enclosure.

great day out. This exceeded my expectations. Very good set up with different areas which are colour coded on the park map. Great aquarium displays and the giant pandas were my favourite. Most of the rides are on the top of the mountain, so you need to take the cable car or train up. We took the cable car and the view was fantastic. The most we queued for a ride was 15-20 minutes but we visited the park on a Monday. I advise to get to the park at opening time because if you like rides and want to see all the shows you will need as much time as possible.

Can say better than Disneyland . 1 day pass is comparatively costlier than 2 days pass of Disneyland. Place Closes quite early, should have self printing kiosk for tourist who but tickets online. Should start 2 days pass for tourist as it is not possible to cover in 1 day. Soon an MTG station to be opened which will make it real good and easy to access.

Great rides, long queues.. No matter when you go you can pretty much expect to spend half your day queuing up. However, this is probably to be expected with it only having Disney land as its competitor (and that's for a younger demographic if you're looking for adrenaline pumping rides). Fun rides with some good old classic that HK locals will be familiar with. Aquarium is great too.

Highly recommended. We enjoyed our visit.. More than what we expecting.. It need at least 6 hours in weekday and maybe more than 6 hours in the weekend.. Highly recommended for couples and for family.. Price are around 380 HKD for adult.. Almost similar to Disney land.. If you didn't visit it you will miss a lot.

Not so suitable for younger kids who like roller coaster. We enjoy the animals show with performances. We like the animals from sea to land and cold places. But my kids couldn't get any ride on the theme park side cause most of it have a safety requirement on height. So it wasn't that worthy for younger children cause they only can enjoy on the zoo and not the theme park.

Not getting younger :). Ocean park is enormous park with 91.5 hectares to be exact... and walking to cover the whole place is not a joke... waterfront and the summit. Feet aching, legs cramping but the smile is still there. You got more than what you've paid for.... experience and enjoyment. Had a good time especially in the Panda Glass cage... they're so cute. Hungry, no worries... 7 restaurants are available in different locations... try dining at Neptune's, food is great... Definitely, I will bring the whole family next time...

Lots of good rides and a dolphin show !. It has lots of good rides and dolphin show is must. My kid is 5 yrs and his height was less than 105 cm so most of the rides he was not allowed which made him disappointed but we enjoyed the dolphin show.

Fun & Entertainment. Ocean Park is a large amusement park in Hong Kong Island. It is a mixture of marine mammal park and animal theme park. Also you can find there 4 roller coasters and 2 water rides.The park offers spectacular views over the South Chinese Sea, Aberdeen and Lamma Island.On weekends and public holidays the park is normally crowded with people so if you can, better go on a week day.

Great for kids and adults. Free site maps are all over the entrances of Ocean Park so don't miss that. The Park is zoned (rainforest, asian animals, polar adventure, whiskers harbor, marine world, etc). The Park mainly has two parts-- the Waterfront and the Summit. It will take you the whole day to enjoy the whole park. It is that big. Start in the morning, as the park opens its doors, and head straight to the Summit because you don't want to go with the conventional crowd who will explore the lower part first. To get to the Summit, you will either ride the cable car or the train. Best to take the cable car on your way up and the train going down so you can experience both. The Summit is where more of the adult and scarier rides are. You can spend half your time here and half your time down the Waterfront (where the giant aquariums are). Food here is very expensive and bringing food from outside is not allowed. To save a bit of money, suit yourself with the food kiosks instead of restaurants.

Standing in queue.. I have not got in yet. Tried to book on line. Error message after error message. Arrive at park. Huge queue and several of ticket booths closed. But the annual pass booth fully staffed. Someone needs to get a grip here.

So excited. DO NOT miss the exciting fireworks show. It is so spectacular.The only problem is that there are so many tourists that we spend too much time in a queque. It is a good idea to visit the park in an early morning when there are not so many tourists. Otherwise, you may not enjor most of the facilities since they are so many people in a queque.
