Ocean Park Hong Kong. The ocean park was one of the best ocean parks I have been to. I recommend you go there and I hope to go back again. I had so much fun especially being on the cable car and seeing the pandas. Overall, I had a wonderful experience.

Bad customer experience with Ocean Park. My daughter went to Ocean Park today with some friends. Despite she has shown her ID that she has just turned 11, the ticket sales staff insisted that she need to purchase an adult ticket. In order not to hold up the rest of the group, she paid. When I learned about it and complained to Ocean Park, they made all kinds of excuses that their staff knew the rule and this shouldn't be the case. I would not go there again.

A very good theme park. If you are there, definitely try the hair raiser rollercoaster, and the flash pendulum ride. Whoa , nice dolphin shows, full packed ,huge theme park, cable car ride, train , shows ,oh it's a must visit in Hong Kong, better than Disneyland in my opinion.

Wonderful Experience. We spent a day at the Park and loved every minute of it. We started off at the Aquarium; beautifully layed out and easy to get around. Plenty of marine life to see and the highligh is the dolphins. It was nice to see families enjoying themselves. Off to see 2 pandas who are enjoying their life in a nicely set out area; one lazing on a log and the other frolicing in the pool. Across from them are some little red pandas which are fun to watch. Plenty of things to keep small children amused and parents enjoying the relaxed atmosphere of the park.The cable car to the summit provided a good view back across the bay to Kowloon and more wonderful views at the top. The cable car provides access to more activities and the highlight is the Ocean Park Tower, providing extraordinary views of the South China Sea, from 70+metres up in a gently rotating, seated viewing room that provides 360 degrees of sweeping views.Plenty of eating establishments, one area being Old Hong Kong. Good, cheap food.
Lovely park. Full on fun.. If you go to hongkong then don't miss to visit this place. We enjoyed a lot. Rides for all , dolphin show which is too good. etc a must place for entertainment

A good combination. If you had been in similar places, the shows will not please you much. There are much better dolphin/ sea lion/ bird shows in Bangkok or Singapore. But what make it special is number and quality of rides available. They have better rides than Disneyland Hongkong! Don't miss the 1900 programme, sort of water dancing/light/fire work show. Dont stand too close, no not for splash, but for heat from fire. Overall a must visit at Hongkong.

This is more exhausting and walking than Disney, larger rides, zoo, but both need to be seen, 23 year old couple review. OK let me preface this by saying that both Hong Kong Disney and Ocean Park need to be seen , Before I went to either of them I believe that one would be better than the other one would be more necessary than the other that proved to be not true. GETTING THERE: We took the subway then us not far not too hard at all and the person selling the tickets was very courteous and give us great information about the bus there was also a little water vendor who had a sign water here 10 dollars water Ocean Park $25 so it gave me the incentive to buy outside the park, the bus was around 30$hkd ride to Ocean Park was very beautiful and scenic I enjoyed it a lot,ARRIVAL: Upon arrival to Ocean Park there's a very old-fashioned steam punk train that takes you to the main area , TICKET GATE: The ticket area was also very convenient to get online and recently showed the online code and the security seemed very well they stopped some Indians from doing something and they thoroughly examine the bags , I gave my famous I don't have a gun line and was able to not go through security , ENTERING THE PARK: there was a love fountain and it's to view there was a panda VW car which looked really cool , CLEANLINESS: Ocean Parkway is also very clean and we didn't see Ocean Parkway is also very clean and we didn't see a lot of workers many workers cleaning, so that's goodPANDAS!!!!/zoo / aquarium : what really separates this place from Disney is the fact that they have a zoo with a lot of these and animals not a lot but these monkeys 2 what really separates this place from Disney is the fact that they have a zoo, monkeys, 2-4 pandas, for you animal activists the animal were very clean and seems mentally healthy, The aquarium was also very nice it was nice and chilly inside so it was a nice break from the summer weather weather and they had a lot of seals and walruses they also had many stingrays sharks fish . Hammer head sharks, we could touch the shovel crab, and this was no extra charge this was all included the original ticket price BATHROOMS: I don't remember so therefore wasn't spectacular or badPUBLIC WATER: I forgetRESTAURANTS: we weren't very hungry so we only had to McDonald's remember we both adequately ate for 100hkdRIDES: The rides were pretty good there a little bit larger than Disney then there's also a cable car that takes you to another area of the park , THE LINES: I don't recall them being grandCOMFORTABLITY: like I said the park is a bit more of a hike in Disney and if you're for you enjoy just sweating and definitely give you a good workout they were in abundance of seats and like I said if you were hot you can go look at the marine animals again , THE SCENERY: what really made this park special for me was the rides were good and they were also very well situated with the natural beauty of Hong Kong so while I'm upside down on a ride I'm looking at beautiful islands beautiful oceans ,VALUE FOR MONEY: I feel so the value for the money was very good it was $270 , it was beautiful for the hiking the rides were good , The animals were very special aquarium was very nice ,So all in all I believe this park is also with visiting but I put Disney a little bit better if you were into the Disney universe if you just want to go hiking and bigger rides go to Ocean Park but both are equally valid and one does not substitute over the other thank you for reading this and if you have any questions please feel free to so all in all I believe this park is also with visiting but I put Disney a little bit better if you were into the Disney universe if you just want to go hiking into bigger rides go to Goshen Park for both are equally valid and one does not substitute over the other thank you for reading this and if you have any questions please feel free to contact me

Just another park. Well for the kinds it is certainly great stuff around here, but for someone like me 54 years of age its more of the same regarding to the many other parks around the world. However there concern for the enviroment is recommendable and to trvael with the cable car was nice also its aquarium is nice too.

Amazing place in Hong Kong. This is a must see adventure via tram up to the tops of some very high mountains. Eventually you go over the mountain range and can view another group of mountain peaks with a prominent Buddha statue on top of one mountain. Upon departing the tram, you venture into a wondeful mountain village full of shopsand restaurants. Onward you find the stairway that lead up the mountain tothe Buddha statue. Fantastic views of the airport and ocean below!

A park full of thrilling rides . One whole day at the park is not enough to enjoy the fullest. It has variety of things to do and watch as the most thrilling rides I have experienced till now. Do have some energetic and adventurous companions.

fun day plus educational. I'm not interested in the rides, but amazing exhibitions and stunning park, Loved the cable car and the ocean express, So much to see and do. Easy to get there via mtr & bus. Do not miss this

Nice trip for family. This was my visit after almost 8 years ago. They have definitely change (to the better) during these time. Unlike Disneyland or other major themed parks, you will not get the dreamlike atmosphere at Ocean Park. Instead you will rewarded with a much more relaxed experience which you don't feel the need to rush and queue for popular rides/shows. Perhaps this is because I was visiting it on a weekday but I definitely enjoyed the visit more. The cons are the inaccessibility (no MTR but one is opening soon), expensive food (like most theme parks). The show (dolphin and seal show) also seems to be not as interesting as before. Another thing which is almost nondescript of most HK services is the attitude of the staffs at the park. You can hardly feel that you are welcomed at all.

good place for a family day. buy the tickets online if u do not queue. we took bus to ocean park from the MTR. frequency of the bus was very good. we did not wait Long although queue looked Long. once inside ocean park the food is rather expensive u can get drinks from the convenient stores. rides are great. I love the cable car ride to the other parts of the island we waited rather Long but it was worth it. prepare to wait for popular rides.

Still worth a visit. It has been a couple of years since my last visit and Ocean Park is still undergoing massive changes. The old style part is, regrettably, gone. One of the long escalators is blocked off at the moment whilst alterations are taking place. The panda house has been upgraded and is now more 'user friendly'. The dolphin show has closed but you can still view the Dolphins indoors although I do not agree with this type of show. There is a new train type form of transport tha is quite effective and the cable car. Is always good. Not sure what they are moving towards but we felt there was a lot missing from the park and hope they reopen parts fairly quickly.

The best all round Theme park!. We went on a friday, Got there at 10am, took the express train up to the other side of the mountain, and pretty much had the whole side of the theme park to ourselves. It was amazing, There rides are great and the gondola ride back down had amazing views and was very beautiful. I def recommend going to ocean park for a day. Grab 15% off tickets from klook.com. No need to buy the skip line tickets, judge it when you get there. The park has everything, just google it, Suits everyones needs!

Time well spent. We came here at 11am on a Thursday with the intention of buying fast passes but it was not necessary since the line for all rides was less than 5 minutes.We purchased our tickets from our hotel to find out the MTR at admiralty was selling them 30HKD cheaper. I would recommend buying tickets upfront so you can't walk right in otherwise there is a queue to get tickets. By the afternoon (about 3-4pm) the park had gotten substantially busier to due to tourist buses therefore it's probably best to go on rides including the cable cars early.The website doesn't give much detail on how to access the park using public transport however there are plenty of signs at admiralty MTR station giving instructions on how to get to the park using the bus which accepts octopus card (11HKD)

Unexpectedly good!. Came here as four adults in the family. I was not at all sure I would enjoy the day, but I did! And very much! Seeing animals especially the pandas which were very much awake was special. The aquarium is magnificent we spent ages looking at the wide variety of species there. We also went on the cable car which went on and on it was so long and with amazing views. Do try to stay for the end as the finale is very colourful. The restaurant is also good, some people had seat close to the aquarium, but you probably have to book a table early. It was a really good day out.

Not bad! . This is not my first time visiting Ocean Parkand I found my second visit is much more valuable than the fist time. I tried a number of rides and every ride surprises me! I recommend people to stay-over until 8pm. There will be a water fountain show at the main square by the entrance!
Great Ride. This is a great ride which gives you some fantastic views of a different Hong Kong-both the harbor and vegetation

Superb theme park. This a terrific theme park/zoo in Hong Kong. It's in a spectacular setting, has two lots of pandas and the rides are good too. Our young grandchildren loved it-there is a huge amount to do. The walruses were superb and the Penguins lovely. Get there early: it's a favourite destination for mainland Chinese tour parties. And they are large! Highly recommended.

One of the World's Best Ocean Theme Park. Ocean Park is a major attraction in Hong Kong. The park is located on the south end of Hong Kong Island. With an area of 170 acres, it's one of the largest ocean theme park in the world. The park was opened in 1977 (over 30 years) and still attracted many visitors each year with its continuing effort in the development and improvement of the park. It has various attractions and rides, including roller coasters, animal exhibits with different themes, such as a giant panda habitat, rainforest and polar displays, as well as an aquarium featuring one of the world's largest aquarium dome. There are 2 major attraction areas (Waterfront & Summit) and they are connected by 1.5km long cable car (with great view) or Ocean Express Train. We visited Ocean Park almost each year and enjoyed each visit. There are really lots of things to see and do for the whole family (young & old). The only complaint is that the food is very expensive and bringing food is not allowed (like many theme parks around the world) as security guards will check your bags. Also, you might encounter some of the uncivilized Mainland Chinese (if you are unfortunate) do not line up and jump the queue. Other than that, it is a pleasure and rewarding experience with satisfying good memories.

Best theme park in Hong Kong. It was summers and as per the tradition we had to go somewhere. So we landed up in HK. Went to Disney land and many places but Ocean Park turned out to the best part of our trip. Loved this theme park. We spent the entire day here and still fell short of time. The roller coasters were amazing as well as the animals we got to see. If I ever get a chance, I would visit it again for sure.

Great ocean park. I have been to so many aquariums and ocean park in the world and this is one of the best ones ! They have a relatively big shark tank and I am a shark lover. Maintenance of the tanks are good. I often see algae in other aquariums but this one is so clean so you get to have a clear look of the aquatic animals.
first stop along the way. Fantastic day out for adults and children, theme park rides and zoo attractions all in the same park

Very good Recreational and family place. This park built on top of a hill is a expansive area consisting of lot of Rides and activities. There is also a North Pole, South Pole section where conditions are created to house Polar animals. There's a Dolphin show too. Aquariums, rides, other shows etc.Lot of eating places and overall a good experience.

Really lovely. With 2 kids we got to ocean park early in the day. There were many highlights one being able to see the panda bears out and about eating! Due to the park being so quiet we were able to go on rides with out much of a wait. In fact we had no wait at all for certain rides, which was a surreal experience for all of us as we were expecting to wait up to half an hour!All in all a lovely day!

I saw a panda !!. Highlight of my trip absolutely seeing a panda. Although I felt personally they could've done with a larger space for such a magnificent animal. Loved all animal areas. I arrived around 10.30 on the bus from central, ride only took about 20 minutes. Wasn't too busy at this time. I went up to the bit where the rides are on the train and came back via cable car. As I was traveling on my own I was apprehensive about going on the rides on my own but once you looks around you'll notice plenty of people are in same boat so you just have to do what you want and get on the rides. I thoroughly enjoyed the day out.
an amusement park with the best scenery. well worth it and can spend a whole day here. also love the cable car and its view, interestingly the park also has its own underground funicular tram!

Not a very child friendly rides. Uphill walks, Adults here in group are very eager to rides they dont even respect people around in queue and may even bumped you just to go first. Rides are thrilling but can be very scary.
Expensive challenge games. Very nice show of dolphins and sea lions. There are smelly areas. Staffs are nice and can speak english well enough.
Full day of adventure. A wonderful place to spend the whole day relaxing and enjoying all the rides. Enjoy the cable car ride up and slowly plan your way down to end your day.

Good day out. As we live on the Gold Coast, we have Sea World which is wonderful, so Ocean Park is similar, but it has the most amazing roller coaster right on the edge of the hill and the cable cars which give amazing views. The nightly light show is a must see so make sure you stay for this.

Fun day!. We went to Ocean Park at the beginning of March and mid week. It was a beautiful sunny day and extremely quiet which made the day so easy and enjoyable. There were no queues and so much to do, from rollercoasters to seeing pandas and moneys, aquariums, dolphin shoes, cable cars, trains, exhibitions, walks and restaurants. A great full day out for all ages and very inexpensive.

One of the world's Best Amusement Park. The fun and thrill that one one experiences here is beyond words!! It has something for everyone. One day is way too less to explore this park. You just dont seem to find the end of activities that you can indulge in. The best possible rides, shows and animals to witness. Do not give this place a miss when in Hongkong.
Better than Disney, but without the branding.... More and better rides....shorter queues. A fun filled day out with rides for every age group. Thoroughly recommended.
I'm back after 10 years!. China, Australia, Africa all in Hong Kong :) Awesome panda, penguin, sea lion, white fox, koala and kangaroo encounter!! Certified young at heart :P

Fun Fun Fun !!!!. This adventure park is quite fun filled. We all enjoyed every bit of it. Rides were available for all age groups. Overall a full day activity in which you will feel short of time to cover and enjoy everything. Go for it. Have fun and enjoy !!!

Nice oark. We enjoyed our time there so much.It's like complementary to Disney land because it has the real roller coaster and the adult type of games.Many varieties and nice games for all ages.It closes early though (6-7 Pm) so I would recommend to take the cable car to the far Island first.
Simply Brilliant. You think that you have seen it all - and then there is more. Great for adults and kids alike. Great views, great facilities, great value.
Simply Brilliant. You think that you have seen it all - and then there is more. Great for adults and kids alike. Great views, great facilities, great value.

One day is not enough. Too hard to say incomplete for Ocean Park Hongkong. Compare with Singapore underwater world, this is a giant park with too many various kind of sea animal from tropical to arctic animal can live here. We can see penguin, polar bear, wolf, dugong and animal kingdom of the ice land. The great giant panda also stay here. For the ocean pet lovers there are very beautiful dolphin show. Its better than singapore underwater. Manta and sharks also stay in an 60 cm width of glass giant aquarium. Jelly fish, lion fish and thousand of wild species completed this ocean park. Coming here for 1 day felt not enough to explore the whole park. Inside here also a cable car station connect one site to another. Cause i gonna went back to singapore, i should leave in a hurry. A little disappointed , but time up what can i say. Ocean park hongkong is great , nobody says no . Proud for ocean park. Hope one day i will come back. Will u?

Thrilling rides. The park is very huge and has two portion one uphill and one on the ground level. The uphil portion has more thrilling rides and more suitable for older kids. The park is so big that it definetely cannot be covered in a single day. Moroever it closes early by 6.30 or so and hence one needs to go early in the morning as soon as it opens. My kids had a blast here and some rides were really groovy.

Ocean park experience . Awesome moments when visited ocean park!With husband and our friends! Its a huge place to be interacted with animals like panda..different fish animals.. intense shark stingray and there huge!! Cute dolphins and sealions show well trained and worth to watch! Omg the rides intense is soooo power very entertaining and i guess it got some more improvement by years wow wow great to visit Worth to come back!Dont miss out!

Nice park, good rides. Really nice park, with cool rides. Difficult to move around since the map is not very clear, so ask for directions to not get lost. Fodd is very expensive, including mc donalds which does not sell meal, so if you want sandwuich, soda and fries, will cost 70HKs. To go to the park, use bus 629. 10,60 HKS each way. And a very good tip: buy ur ticket at 7 eleven, try the student discount which will cost half the price(193,00HKs).If u want to see the panda, go early in the morning when he is not sleeping. And then, start your day in the adventure land which close at 5pm.
Good. . I seem like adding more thing after my 1st visit in yr 2009. So this time bring my daughter here and she is very enjoying at here.

A Park with Panda bear.. The Ocean Park, is very nice park lots of greenery, lots of attractions.With size aquarium, and lots of fish, of all kinds.The cable car in the park is nice, one is more than 10 minutes in it.The dolphin show is wonderful, and fun photos made with the Panda.

and 1 more time wooohooo. before u go exploring take there a map and make a fast plan...we took skycar and it was Amazing..lot of Island and beautiful view...fishes and animals whitch i saw only on discovery chn...i was immpressed

Good place for whole day. Here the tips from my experiences:- First, you should buy ticket online to avoid waiting queue at ticket counter.- You should go early and avoid the weekend, take MTR go to Admiralty, look at the exit map to find the bus stop that have number 629 go direct to Ocean Park with round trip bus ticket.- Bring your food and cover it by overcoat then put in the bottom of your backpack. This will help you save a lot of money instead of spending money for expensive lunch in park- After get into the park, pick the map and rush to the cable car to go to The Submit (most of attractions in here) then back to Water Front by Ocean Express

Good place for whole day. Here the tips from my experiences:- First, you should buy ticket online to avoid waiting queue at ticket counter.-You should go early and avoid the weekend, take MTR go to Admiralty, look at the exit map to find the bus stop that have number 629 go direct to Ocean Park with round trip bus ticket.- Bring food with you, cover it by overcoat and put in the bottom of your backpack. This way you can save a lot of money instead of wasting it for lunch in the park -After get into the park, pick the map and rush to the cable car to go to The Submit (most of attractions in here) then back to Water Front by Ocean Express

Hiking Park :P. There are a lot of extreme rides that we did enjoy esp the "hair raiser" and the "flash". Since we went on a Friday, there are almost no queues and we can ride as much as we want. The only thing i did not like here are the high slopes. it's very tiring walking around Ocean Park.

Fascinating Park. This is one of the top attraction at Hong Kong. This Ocean Park has very big area and so much selection of attraction inside it. Very Enjoyable time to spend like Half Day in This Ocean Park.

Massive themepark with extreme rides. Perfect venue for those who love adrenaline rush rides. You need atleast a day or two to tour around the area. For those with fear of heights, i recommend the tram ride going to the peak. For those who would like some adventure and a good view, you may ride the cable car going to the peak (longer queuing), it will take you about 10 mins. Went there on a saturday, waiting time for rides is about 10 minutes. TIP: Make sure to grab a map before you enter the park.

Ocean Park Adventure. The scenery is perfect for relaxation and adventure. There are plenty of activities for people of all ages. Fun rides are everywhere; Cable Car, Roler Coaster rides, Arctic Adventure, Dolphin Show, Under Water Train Adventure and etc...you name it they have it!Casual attire is necessary and bring camera with you.

Fun place for the whole family. We visited just before Christmas 2015 so the crowds were quite large. We're not big rides people, but we did have a go on one or two. We came more for the cable cars and animal displays. If you do want to spend you day on the rides, then I suggest buying the express pass to jump the queue - we waited more than 45 minutes for one ride and judging by the queue bollards and ropes, that wasn't as busy as it could be! The animal displays are great, far better than many zoos in the world that we have been to. The pandas and red pandas were a hit with our kids.The cable car is worth the wait. It takes you from the main area up and over a couple of mountains and concludes atop a mountain where there are some great rides.

Fantastic. Loved the Panda Exhibit - it was the first attraction I went once I entered the gate in fact! I also saw the marine collection as well.Overall it was a fun experience and would love to go back someday!

Ok if you have the time.. We had a day to spare so decided to go to Ocean Park. Sat am, caught the bus from Admiralty. Could not use our 3 day MTR travel card, not valid. Bought tkts in advance from a 7 Eleven store. Cheaper online but our credit card wouldn't work. Park not busy on a Saturday, we thought there would be long queues. Disney/Universal it is not. Very spread out with lots of walking. The two areas are connected by either a train or cable car. You cannot walk between them so if it was busy I would imagine long waits in the sun. The rides are nothing special but it was nice to see the animals (pandas, seals, penguins, fish). The ocean show with divers and sea lions was awful- we left half way through. The park is more suitable for small kids or for someone who hasn't experienced the USA theme parks. We left after 3 hours and caught a taxi to Stanley to get some lunch. Made a change after the noise and crowds of HK city. Lots of walking up and down hills/paths, you have to retrace your steps to catch the cable car or train to get to the exit. Hard going for the elderly or those pushing buggies.

Fun for all ages. We went on a Wednesday and there were almost no queues to the rides and exhibits. I had a blast on the rides. The views around the park were spectacular. It's a nice place to take elderly family members without tiring then out too much.

For Kids and Adults alike!. Love the rides - cable car (relaxing, nice views).The underwater tunnel, gives you a nice view of sea creatures.Enjoyed the view of some sharks, there's a lot of marine life available here.There are old and new rides available.This trip would probably cost you a day.

Fantastic Amusement Park. I have not been this park at least 25 years, and I found this amusement park is running surprisingly great. The park has lot of new things, I will say family with small children around 7-14 will enjoy in this park. Besides people can learn a lot in aquarium area, even though aquarium is not huge. You can access this park by bus, minivan, car, etc.

Nice attraction for the young and old. Enjoyable trip with nice attractions such as panda exhibit, penguin exhibit, aquarium, etc. Was pleasantly surprised to see animals such as capybaras and pigmy marmosets. Again, food was a tad too expensive. Cable car ride was fun with good view of the scenery. Transport wise was convenient and easy, you can take the MTR to Admiralty station and exit B to take bus 629 which brings you to the park. Overall fun for the young and the old.

Great for kids . Ocean Park was a bit of a letdown for me. The aquarium side was pretty average compared to others I've seen. It was also very very noisy, and too many long queues. On the plus side, the Pandas were great and should be advertised more. The goldfish and koi were great. If you like rides then go for it! It's better than Disneyland, HK. But buy a Fastpass so you can jump the queue into some exhibits and some rides. For an extra $150HK you can skip 5 queues including to the cable car, some rides and the big aquarium. Food is expensive and very very average. Overall, more for families than adults.

Amazing family day out. . Fantastic views, great rides (although majority of the most interesting ones are for children over 120cm which is a shame). We visited with a 4 year old. He loved the aquarium and it has been a fantastic opportunity for us to see giant pandas. Food was very average as we expected so if you want to avoid disappointment make yourself some sandwiches :) cable car offers spectacular views. Lots to do in one day. Nobody will leave disappointed.

Day trip to Ocean Park. Bus from Central Station to Ocean Park, long que with bus at regular departure times. Another que to get into park but worth the wait. Well laid out park, but long ques to each exhibit. Pandas worth the wait as have great viewing areas. Needs a two day timetable to visit all exhibits. Easy to catch bus back to Central Station as there's a long wait for taxi's. One of the best attractions in Hong Kong along with Madame Tusards Wax Museum.

Honeymoon Getaway. Stay at oceanpark was very amazing. We enjoyed the facilities and amenities of the park. Every minute of it was worth it. Got tired of trying everything and roaming around the park. It was a great and memorable experience for us.

Never disappoints. Always a place to visit whenever we pop by Hong Kong. Transportation has become earlier and going to become more so when the MTR station is completed. A mix of old and new attractions (cable car ride, aquarium etc) that caters to both adults and the young. Good to go early in the morning.

A wonderful adventure!. We visited Ocean Park on our first day in Hong Kong. We happened to be there during Chinese New Year--this was really cool because there were some specific cultural happenings that we really enjoyed. On top of that, the penguin, panda and koala attractions were outstanding. We saw these amazing animals up close yet felt unintrusive to them. The rides and attractions were really fun, and we particularly enjoyed the gondola experience. What a way to see Hong Kong straight outta the blocks! The aquarium in the main restaurant is also not to be believed! The park is impeccably clean to boot!

Amazing Place. From Manila we arrived at Hong Kong around 9 in the morning. Then we proceed to the hotel which is Rambler Garden. Day 1 is our free time, we decided to visit this place since this is one of the best attraction in Hong Kong so from the hotel we ride a cab going to the nearest MTR(Tsing Yi station, the landmark going to the Ocean Park is Admiralty station. You have to ride a shuttle bus going there. We enjoyed the cable car ride. You must visit this place if you want to see Panda Bear, Penguins, Dolphin and Koala Bear.Grand Aquarium is totally amazing! I really love this place... We will surely come back!

Cool place to visit. This is a great adventure park, lots to see and rides. Separate pavilions for Panda bears, seals, birds, and aquarium. Ride the gondola to the top and find exciting thrills rides. Go on early on a weekday, no line ups and not too crowded.

Wonderful. Had a wonderful time here when I visited with my family in late December. The queues for the rides were quite long but they were fun. I always liked the pandas and the aquariums. A very great place for visit while in Hong Kong! Never sick of it!

Must visit when in Hong Kong! First class amusement park!. Ocean Park is the best place in Hong Kong to visit. It's ideal for all kinds of tourists, especially those thrill seekers! The cable car connecting the areas has just a wonderful nature view!

Interesting. Reach early to have time to see around - interesting animals - white and red panda, penguin, walrus, arctic fox, dolphins, tropical birds, fishes,whales, all make it very interesting, especially for the kids. One can book the tickets from Klook, which allows for discounts.

Beautiful Place. Adventures, beautiful, well maintained, lots of variety of fishes..
If you are going to visit hong kong then must go here..
You have to spend full day here to see whole ocean park..
It's beautiful.. nice view from up..
Ideal for Families - Lot to See -. This is ideal for famlies, lot to see and do. The scenery and activities are for the whole family.Even if it is raining.
It was amazing . It was an amazing experience. . But quite boring due to rush there were long queues..but otherwise amazing experience overall

Outstanding considering it's a theme park. Lots of activity options and cool animals. The conservation messaging here is outstanding and was a very pleasant surprise. The only negative was the animal rehabilitation center was not open and they do dolphin shows which is controversial.

Great Day. This park is a must-do for whoever is travelling to Hong Kong. Plenty of nice attractions, both animals and roller coasters will keep you busy all day. Make sure you don't skip the aquarium and, of course, the panda!

One of the prime places to visit in HK. Ocean Park is a great one day excursion. Easy to get to by bus. Beautiful aquarium, water world with real penguins, seals and a walrus. Another house with five pandas. another with many different animals, insects and reptiles all well done and very environmentally friendly. Many rides and attractions including a cable car ride across a mountain to another part of the park. It is free if you are a senior citizen (70) and also free on your birthday. This has to be on your bucket list especially if you have children. A very full day.

Ols attraction that needs to keep up. The rides are pretty old, I went in Summer and it was real hot to take them. the tram up could be improved with real creatures to view and the animal show is only the sealion and dolphin. nothing much to see.

Always a good visit. Came here on a Wed and there were practically no lines which made the day all the better. Don't know how it compares with Disney land but my choice is to come here for variety and the views.. be sure to check out the aquarium and the cable car.

Great entertainment! Must visit esp. for kids.. A huge park, we had a lot of fun on the thrilling rides, watching the sealions and koalas. There are plenty of food joints so don't bother carrying food. Difficult to cover all of it in one day, start early, and avoid weekends when the queues are long. Use the maps available to plan which areas you would like to cover. It helps to book the tickets online in advance.

one of the best theme park to visit in asia . Rides are good both roller coaster and water rides and thrill to see animals mainly penguins..nice experience to watch penguins walking and eating in group.perfect theme park fr one day visit @hongkong.

A must-visit international park in Hong Kong!. Overlooking the whole Repulse Bay, Deep Water Bay and South China Sea, Ocean Park is truly a must-visit park in Hong Kong. It has several Aquariums with tens and thousands of tropical fishes, sharks, stingray and numerous other fishes that you can't even name; It also has a panda enclave, penguin and sea lion aquarium, jellyfish aquarium and many fun and easy rides as well as hair-raising adventures. My kids just love Ocean Park and keep going there. We are fortunate to live in Hong Kong and can visit there whenever the kids have time or holiday, again and again. I strongly recommend Ocean Park to overseas visitors.

Best in Asia. This is an amazing theme park that is impresses for the whole family no matter their age. It has something for everyone where you can easily spend the whole day and leave when its closing time. A mix of zoo, theatre, aquarium and carnival rides. the park is well laid out, easy to navigate and exceptional value for money. The cable car ride is breathtaking as it opens up the island to the many attractions including a gravity defying roller coaster perched on the side of the island ready to swallow up those who choose to conquer its stomach churning twists and turns...

Blend of brilliance. . I love animals and I love rides, so imagine my delight when they were all under one roof (spread across one mountain). I read a really good article before I went which gave me some advice on how to plan my way round the park and it worked. So I ordered tickets on line and got a 20% discount, it was about £60 for two. Then we got the bus there for about 80p. Brilliant. Upon arriving we took the cable cars and took full advantage of the rides without the need to queue. The view from the cable car is ace, I spent the whole time wondering how they managed to build all of that on a mountain. The ride selection was good and I really enjoyed everything the park had to offer. The Hair Raiser and The Dragon were my favourite rides. I am a huge animal lover, so to be abel to spend my time between roller coasters and animals was the best thing ever. I was a bit disappointed when there were loads of polar bear statutes outside of the Arctic building and then there were no polar bears. But to be fair, that's probably me being a bit dim, China doesn't really cater for that climate. The food at the park is unusual. Many people were eating this paper thin flat grilled squid which smelt a bit like popcorn and fish. I opted for a hot dog, I wish I'd had the popcorn squid. But, that didn't ruin the day as there is plenty of choice, we just found it too late. The park is definitely loved by the people of HK and there weren't a great deal of tourists there (we did go in low season on a Wednesday - I don't anticipate it's always so quiet), despite that, the majority of staff spoke English and if they didn't I used the international language of pointing. The ultimate highlight for me was to see the pandas. OMG. They are docile fluffy magical beasts. I was so overwhelmed I wanted to cry. One of the most beautiful things I have ever seen. I loved how tranquil there environment was, one was tumbling around being adorable. And the other was just napping outstretched by Superman. Best. Thing. Ever. Well worth a visit and an experience that will stick with me forever. I just loved it. Perfect for all ages, with something for everyone.

Forget Disneyland or Europapark!. Ocean Park is a wonderful mix between Zoo and action park! The lovely and detailed construted park is in a wonderful area at the foot of a mountain and the second part on top! It is impressive how they bring you close wildlife and nature in the mix with rollercoasters etc.! everywhere is a nice chinese music giving a great atmosphere!this park is a highlight for a whole day and not just for families with kids!and take time to visit the dolphin show with the great view over the ocean!
worth to spend a day here. there are so many attractions and games here, no matter quiet or active, you can still find the place that you like to see or play
better than disney. large with lots of rides activities and an aquarium. go early to avoid large crowds. Standard theme park food , overpriced

Showing its age but still a good place to see Pandas. Have been to Ocean Park a few times over the years, this time I noticed how the park had aged in the last 40 years. It is definitely no sea world. From entering the park I first notice how old fashioned the ticketing is compared to HK Disney, old fashioned tickets of course don't affect your visit. Shows like the sea Lion and Dolphin show were short and uneventful, but still more than enough to mesmerize our two year old. If you have not visited Ocean Park before, and I am guessing the fact that you are reading this means you have not, then it is a mixture of a traditional theme park along with something of a Zoo. The rides are older but never the less can be quite thrilling. The animals a fair mix of cuteness and interest. the Cable car ride in particular is quite long and interesting, particularly on an increasingly rare clear day in Hong Kong. The Panda's which are quite rare in other zoo's around the world can be worth a trip in themselves, and usually you can spot at least one of these illusive creatures. As we live in Hong Kong with young Children we have purchased an annual pass as the Children love the trip. As long as you don't expect anything like Sea World in the USA then you should have a good day. There is certainly enough to do for a whole day.

Pandas!. We wanted to go here to see the PANDAS. What an experience. We saw all four. Spent an inordinate amount of time watching and filming them. Anyway, there is more to see and we ended up spending 6.5 hours here. The journey on the citybus 629 from Admiralty took 10 minutes. Set off early as there are crowds. Buy return tickets for the bus. You will need to get the train through the mountain up to the Aquarium and also the rides are up at the top of the mountain. The aquarium is extremely well thought out as you meander down in the darkness which simulates the sea. The penguins are great but the dolphins are the attraction here. They come up to you in the breeding centre but the show is amazing. They have more than enough space to swim around and clearly have a rapport with their keepers. Show is free but you have to go early to get a seat. Show as at 2pm. We came down on the cable car. Queues appear at various times throughout the park but we only had to wait 15 minutes which was spent shuffling along the route with others to the cable car. If you like heights it is a spectacular view, but if you don't, just don't look down. You either have to get the train or the cable car as this part of the park is over the mountain. The Australian Kingdom was interesting with the Koala and wallabies but they are in a cramped environment. The food choices weren't great and they weren't allowing people to take food in. Water was ok but food was confiscated. Our feet were hurting when we finished but again, another trip to the pandas reminded us why we had come. Would definitely go again.
A place filled with fun. This is one place in Hong Kong which will give thrills to all in the family , Theme park ,Water Park and all in one entertainer , A Must visit while visiting Hong Kong

must visit in hong kong. ocean park in as amusement park with aquarium inside it and the best part is the cable car to reach the new amusement park on the top of the hill. The new roller coaster is is soo awsam must try it .

Took a decade to finally get here. Glad I made it!. I've been travelling to Hong Kong on business trips since 1998. 3 or 4 times per year. I finally, FINALLY got to Ocean Park! Not necessarily because I wanted to, but my business associate LOVES roller coaster rides and amusement parks. We're both from the San Francisco Bay Area of central California. I grew up near the Santa Cruz Beach Boardwalk, so I've had my fill of rides. My associate will travel throughout the western USA to ride different roller coasters as a hobby. We were 1st in line that Saturday morning in mid January 2016. Weather was pleasant, about 70 deg F that day with almost no wind. We headed to the aquarium first to see the manta rays and sharks. Large tanks, interesting constantly lowering walkways as you circle the tanks. Good views. This aquarium is worth the price of admission. This, and the tram ride to the roller coaster area of Ocean Park. Loved that ride the best. Fantastic views. I could ride that one ride for hours. My associate enjoyed two of the coasters, but the other was under repair. Much of the area was under repair in the winter. But that was ok, because we were there for the rides and the aquarium. While I took over 10 years to finally get to Ocean Park, I can say that I'd probably not go back. I think this is a perfect place for school children to see the aquarium, and local teens to enjoy a ride on a roller coaster with great views. Other than that, with so much more sightseeing to do in the HK area, I'll be happy with one visit only. Thanks, Ocean Park, for a really good day!

Fun filled evening . Buy your tickets online prior to arrival to avoid long lines. It also helps to buy the fast track to minimize waiting for rides. It's a really good entertainment park with lots of rides to suit all levels and age groups. Food selection is quite varied. I recommend it !

Must go. So much worth going. You can enjoy life of all the kind of animals and theme park rides. Very reasonable price. You need to walk a lot to explore the full park and full day might not be enough too. I can highly recommend this park to anyone.

a great day out. A wonderful day out something for every age group. We spent the whole day there and still didn't see everything.My highlight was seeing the giant pandas and the cable car ride, the views are spectacular.. The water and light show at the end of the day is fantastic. The park is excellent value for money and deserves to be Hong Kongs top attraction.

Delightful experience. This is a great place to visit especially with friends, family and children. It has easy access via Central MTR , bus 6 and takes you directly to the entrance of this park. The layout is not very planned or structured but there are four broad divisions and there is always something going on in each sector, in each theatre and right along the water front. One can travel from the waterfront to the summit either via cable car-( steep climb over the moutntain with great view of the harbour) or take the ocean express a train which goes underground. Both are very interesting rides. The place is really big and will take one full day to see all rides, all shows and enjoy the rides. On special occasions like Chinese New Year, Christmas and New Year there are special shows which are a must. It is a delightful experience with the underwater aquarium, dolphin and penguin shows et al.

Fun Day Out. The park is a mix of zoo and theme park with lots to see and do- ideally suited to families with kids or teens/ young adults. The main park involves a lot of walking in order to get around. Good selection of rides available for thrill seekers.

Lots to see!. the cable cars were one of the highlights of coming here for me, lots of different rides and the waiting time was not long. Lots to do and before you know it you have spent the entire day here and still havent seen everything the park offers. The views at the top of the cable cars were wonderful, lots of things to do and all the family really enjoyed it.

Grand Aquarium Diving. This isn't a review for the whole park, just for the behind the scenes tour you can do scuba diving in the main aquarium with the hammerheads and manta rays etc. You need to have passed some basic qualifications to do, but I'd highly recommend. I can't think of any other way to swim with creatures of this size without leaving HK. The facilities are good and the instructors patient. It's an amazing experience to be on the inside of such an exhibit looking out. The aquatic life is used to humans and so don't behave in an intimidating way. The tour guide was also very passionate about conservation issues. Would highly recommend for anyone looking to get a taster for shark swimming in a safe environment.

Ocean park tickets for 2adults and 2children . My family was in HongKong for a holiday last month. We purchased Ocean Park tickets through the Big Bus Tours, but unfortunately couldn't make it as my kids were unwell. These tickets are valid until April 2016. Please find photo attached. If your interested please contact me. I can also throw in Hong Kong Maritime museum tickets for 4 for free. Thanks

Excellent day out, fabulous views. Amazing views over Lantau Island, lots to do at top of Island. Starbucks, vegetarian food places available to eat. Big Buddha steps are a good climb and good views from top.

Absolutely brilliant!. There is a reason why this theme park is scored as one of the best in Asia. We had an amazing day with the kids and was absolutely thrilled by the variety of exotic animals and displays. Highly recommended!

Mixed . Went on a solo day out to go see the pandas. Park is quite big, and fragmented. Pandas lazy. Aquarium areas really good, very pro shark and the whole park gives off an important conservation message, esp. Regarding Chinese use of shark fin products. All good but then dolphins very sad. Horrible contrast of huge open space behind them and a tiny pool. Made me feel a bit sick, I had to leave the dolphin show. Seals are good, lots of these. Rides are fun mine train was my favourite, even better as its so high up. Food inside is terrible, go full up and wait till later to eat.

Great value for money as lots to see and do but awful food inside park!. Very easy to reach Ocean Park, we stayed on Kowloon and walked 5 mins from our hotel (Intercontinental Grand Stanford, Mody Road Kowloon) to the bus station and took a lovely clean air conditioned double decker bus (run approx every 15 mins) cost about £1.30 one way The journey took us through the tunnel from Kowloon to Hong Kong Island and the journey time was about one hour. Many stops (about 20 )along the way but we were sitting on the top deck in the front seats and great view along the way!I visited Ocean Park in 1986 and was advised nothing much had changed. It was approx £38 entrance fee and divided into different sections- similar to Disney. The cable car takes you up high along the side of the mountain/cliffs to the higher section where there were many rides built into the side of the mountain and huge outdoor escalators to access the different levels so suitable for everyone as not too many steps.Chinese tourists seem to love roller coasters and scary rides as there were plenty of those. Saw the dolphin show but if I'm perfectly honest I really think dolphins should not be in an aquarium half way up a mountain but in their natural habitat. You could count the western tourists on one hand we were very much a minority but no one bothered us and everyone very friendly. Food in the park aimed at the Chinese market- one particular thing I noticed was 'Korean Squid' flattened squid in a plastic packet which looked revolting! So always have something to eat before you go as nothing particularly appetising !! We found a 'bakery' but only thing we fancied was a custard bun with a luke warm coffee !2 buns and one small latte £9! We saw a real Panda as they have a conservation programme with I hope the Pandas being released back into the wild.We enjoyed feeding the sea lions and seeing the penguins but again they were half way up a mountain and although well cared for- not in their natural habitatWe came down from the mountain on the Polar Express which was about a 10 minute journey. This was a tram/ train and an alternative to the 25 min Cable Car journey if you are not good with heights! It's a fun park mainly I suppose aimed at children but enjoyable to walk around and take in the atmosphere.

Lots of fun even for adults. My husband and I bought gold annual pass and went to ocean park 4 times within a year. On each occasion, we took the cable car to the peak (a fabulous trip not to be missed) first as the queue was usually much shorter in the morning. The park has 3 different roller coasters and I strongly recommend you to try them all. The other must-see attractions include the two panda places, aquarium and North Pole showroom with many penguins, including baby penguins. But it is important to visit the park in the morning as the park tends to get really crowded from 3pm onwards with the arrival of tourists group from mainland.

Too crowded, queues too long. Yes, it can be described as a 5-star theme park. It contains all the necessary facilities that appeal to both adults and children. A good place to spend a day. It is close to town, only about 20 minutes by bus from HK Central. The above said, it does not contain anything so special that makes it a "must visit" attraction. I do not quite understand why it is so popular with Mainland visitors. It is very crowded throughout the day and every day of the year. Queues can be very, very long. Fast passes have to be separately purchased. Meals inside the park are unreasonably pricy.

Very retro, but the crowds seemed to be enjoying it. Perhaps admittedly it is my Western theme park experience growing up, but Ocean Park has the feel of an '80s theme park, albeit with a fresh coat of paint. As expected, the themes of the rides and attractions are Asian, based on cartoon animal characters. For those not really into rides, there are enough live animal attractions to keep you busy for several hours. The crowds were very light on the day we visited (a Tuesday) and we often felt like we had the place to ourselves. The preservation and Save-the-animals sentiment being offered doesn't often seem to quite fit with the fake conditions under which some of the animals are housed. But in many cases, the up close experiences are well done (most noteably the penguin exhibit). Food is expensive, but that's now the norm in all theme parks where they have you at the disadvantage of having no other option.

Great place to spend a day. Too slow in processing the long lines.. I was lucky to be there on a sunny and not too warm day. There are great shows, good rides and some animals on display. I was lucky to see the pandas being fed.Unfortunately the time to wait for a ride is too long even on a not so busy day. Therefore its necessary to plan what rides and shows are a must to try and see as you wont be able to do it all in one day.

Excellent 1st roller coaster experience for 6yrs old. Took a belated family vacation. Off we went to hong kong. Me, spouse, and our 6yrs old. Decided it was time to intro him to roller coaster rides. So when we landed at HK Airport, we straight to the CTS counter outside the arrival hall and bought tixs to Ocean Park, and HK Disneyland. Tixs was priced based on the dates we wanted to visit.Tixs for OceanPark was greatly discounted. We found out why when we visited OP the next day. The main animal show was closed, and so was the GrandAquarium. Next time, we must check the show availability before we buy tixs.There was already a small crowd at OP when we arrived opening time. Probably because it was a Sunday. Fortunately, we did not have to wait more than 30mins for the rides we selected.Went straight to the MineTrain ride, and then the Raging River ride. There was no waiting time for either. The 6yr old just reached the 122cm minimum height requirement. We worked with the friendly ride attendant to build up the courage of the 6yr old. After this 2 ride, the rest of the qualifying rides was a cinch. He even rode the EagleRide twice.The longest line we waited was the bumper car. it was a 45min wait even though the line said 30min. we also queued 30mins to ride the carousel.Wait time for the FerrisWheel was 45mins. probaby because it was lunch time and the attraction was near the food places. So we skip this ride.Most dissapointing ride was the OceanExpress ride. it was less exciting than a MTR ride.Closing show Symbio was the star for us. Definitely worth the wait. There are more attractions that can be covered in a single day. We will come back for another visit.

So crowded . My friend recommend to visit this them-park. The ride is more enjoy for adult. But for myself i would love another them park in Hongkong more that this one. Here many ride interesting but many people on quote is long and they run very slow. I am not impression with this them park

Terrible Experience. We did visit Ocean Park 3 days ago and I have to say this is terrible choice for my trip, not value for money, nothing special. Aquarium has nothing to see. Do not recommend this.

We had a great day!. Ocean Park was awesome ! We queued early (09:30 hrs, opening at 10:00 hrs) and it was worth it. Also we booked the "Skip the line" Pass and would do it again, we saved really a great deal of time as we were visiting over Chinese New Year and the park was full. The only thing which was not nice, were the other visitors to the Panda cages. There are millions of signs NOT to use flash lights and to be quiet - seems some tourists don't read signs at all. Very disturbing.

Ocean Park. There are a lot of rides that you could take. Some rides are scary and some are just great for kids. For example the hair raiser is a very scary ride and it is more suitable for grown ups, but there is also an underwater train that kids could enjoy. Shows are also available at Ocean Park. For example the dolphin show.  The Ocean Park food isn’t that good and it is also expensive. People are also very crowded while you are purchasing the food. The line of the food and restaurant are so long same as the roller coaster line. I would like to recommend you to go during winter season. During the summer seasons you would be very hot because most rides are outdoor and you could get sun burn. If you go during the winter season while you are on the ride you would be very hot.  Overall, Ocean Park is a wonderful place to visit because of the rides and the show that are amazing. P.S. I would recommend you to spend 2 days at the Ocean Park because 1 day isn’t enough!

Still the best theme park in hong kong. I like ocean park, so i am a bit biased. From its old catchy theme song "it's hip it's fun, it's ocean park" to the multi level areas accessible by trains or cable car or escalators. As a HK resident, you can get in free when you are over 65, or on your birthday. And their annual pass is a great value, which you will have paid off if you go more than 3 times a year.The staff are friendly and helpful and even during crowded days (sundays and public holidays) thinks keep moving.It has something for everyone, aquariums, rides, playgrounds and amazing views.However the downside: there is a security check at the beginning of the entrance. You need to open your bags. They aren't looking for weapons or publications of ill-repute, they are looking for food. You are not allowed to bring in your own food into the park. This would be ok if the food inside the park was any good. But it isn't. It is atrocious at worst and not worth the money at best. We went to all the food outlets over the years and the quality is going down progressively. And the cost? HK$ 40 for a tiny hot dog that in my opinion contained more fillers than meat. That's just one example. The park is still worth a visit, just eat before you go, and don't dare to bring your own food, lest you want the sandwich patrol to confiscate it.

Perfect for families with young kids. I personally love this place more than disneyland! It's a good mixture of rides, shows, exhibits and a place to run around.If you go during summer, I now understand why Asians carry an umbrella around cause the sun does burn even with 50+ sunscreen. Compared to overseas the food isn't too over priced. We luckily went on a slightly rainy day which didn't bother us but the crowds were not as bad.It's true what they say about mainland chinese tourists unfortunately about barging in and always rushing, I got shoved back into the toilet stall cause the lady was in such a rush! But a sharp word and they seem to wake from their daze, I think they are just so used to crowds pushing and shoving is the only way to survive and they genuinely don't realise they are being rude. So I just learn to expect it and take it down as a cultural experience and instead try to appreciate their excitement instead.Great place that symbolises HK to me and of course the young kids love it.

Family of 6 with a wheel chair . Get their early and have your day planned out. Do the area at the top first and then lower Park later. Go on the rides first as they get very long lines very quickly. Go during the week to avoid the masses. Dont buy food at ocean Park, I'm not complaining this is an honest review... It's Terrible. Nothing on the menu was edible. Take your own food, as you would expect food is pricey at locations such as ocean Park but it was all terrible. The attractions were well thought out and showed a great deal of care for the animals welfare. Really enjoyed the thrill seeker ride and penguin attraction. I would definately go again.

Beautiful park, great rides. Down south of Hong Kong is the Ocean Park. It consists of giant aquariums, animal shows, ropeway and a cool train connecting one section of park to another.The rides are pretty cool! The location is particularly exciting and scenic.Top Tip: The park sections are divided into 4-5 parts. Reserve your entire day for it. Food is very expensive, it'll drill your wallet.
It needs two days to enjoy this place. It is good place to enjoy. One must visit this place while in Hong Kong. Lots of items are there for ride and to enjoy the whole of the area

1 day is not enough!. Very accesible by mtr and bus going direct to/ from the park is available. Very large area to explore full of palces to meet different animals, shows to watch, rides and attractions to see. Shows are not as good as dianeylands particularly the KALEIDOSCOPE show, very boring and performers are not well rehearsed. Food is better here compared to disneyland. Very good for families with kids.

Half ocean park have amusement. Visited Ocean Park today. It was a lot bigger than I expected! There are lots of attractions including a shark reef, penguin enclosure, aquarium, panda habitat, and many others. You can see toucans, macaws, and many other types of birds as well. There is also a huge amusement park with lots of rides in many different places. I stayed away from those. The only thing that I was disappointed in is that they advertise a "polar encounter" yet there's no polar bears. The dolphin show was lame, I've seen much better!

Not What I Expected, but Still Tons of Fun. For some reason, I thought Ocean Park would be a water park. Our friends advised us it wasn't, but we still had a great time looking at the sea creatures and riding the rides. The food was decent but pricey. I recommend bringing snacks. The park was clean, and transportation from the metro stop was extremely convenient. One of the nicer animal parks I've been to in Asia.

Marine and Asian Animal Encounter. Filled our third (3rd) day in Hong Kong with marine and Asian animal life after an early breakfast in Mongkok. We went to Asia's largest amusement park via Citybus 629 in the southern part of Hong Kong.How to get to Ocean Park from Mongkok via Citybus 629?1) Take Mongkok MTR (Red Line)2) Alight at Admiralty station3) Get to Exit B going to Ocean Park Bus (Citybus 629)4) Take Citybus 629 going to Ocean ParkAdmission Fee is at 345HKD per head but we purchased 45HKD less from the hotel owner where we stayed (Sunrise Hotel – look for Mike).Amusement park is subdivided into two large areas, The Summit (highland) - where all thrilling rides, north and south pole animals and dolphin show stage is at. Rides include Hair Raiser (gravity defying rollercoaster), The Abyss (a death defying drop of about 20+ floors). The Waterfront (lowland) – where other marine and aviaries are located. Options going to The Summit from The Waterfront are via cable car and Ocean Express train).

Great Attraction for Families!. Ocean Park tickets are not that cheap but for the price you get to ride all the attractions and watch the animal shows for free! The aquarium is amazing, you get to see Pandas up close and Sea lions and Dolphins in action. The rides are entertaining and you have very nice views of HK Island. You can ride a cable car or take a underground train to the top of the Ocean Park hill.

Much much better than Disney HK. Despite visiting OP during CNY holidays and enduring the inevitable crowds, this was a fantastic day out and way better than our previous experience of Disney in HK. The park is clean and well organised, it offers a lot of variety for all ages from the gentle kids stuff to the super fast thrill rides. Also on offer are some very well maintained animal attractions including dolphins and giant pandas. The buses run efficiently and frequently to/from Admiralty MTR. Buy your tickets from the tourist office in the MTR station to save a few $$$s.

So much fun and we don't even have kids!. We decided to go to ocean Park instead of Disney world because we read many reviews that said Disney is more for children. We got into a bus at Central Station and it took us right to the entrance in about 15 minutes. The place is huge and I would recommend a full day there. We thoroughly enjoyed ourselves and felt like kids ourselves. Some of the highlights were the roller-coaster, the cable car ride between two sections, the dolphin show, the aquarium exhibit and the restaurant overlooking the gorgeous water. It was December and busy but we never waited as long as the sign indicated. There is just so much to see and explore with the theme park and animals all just as exciting. What a lovely day we had. We even saw giant pandas. I would definitely recommend you going here if you are in Hong Kong for a few days. The entrance fee is quite steep but well worth it!

nice but super-busy. whilst a nice experience, do go early; on a sunny day, there are lots of areas with little shade and it gets very very busy. great with kids from 4yrs+ most rides though are for older ones; the animals appear in good condition and our kids enjoyed seeing a great range of them. The gondola ride up is very popular - be there early to avoid long queues (alternatively there's a train up, but the gondola is very!! nice). Food options have improved over the last year. parking is easy to find and accessible if you come early. a fun day out!

Family Vacation. Fantastic shows of water marines.Taking a ropeway are the best attractions of different varities of water games and rides on top of the mountain.Never to be missed place while in Honkong.We took full day tour and the family enjoyed fully.
Nice. I recommend not to visit that place alone. It's a very family park. It's better to be here with company of relatives or friends

Fish all around. We took our 2-yr-old granddaughter to Ocean Park. It is a wonderful family place to visit and the exhibits are quite good - including standing under a fish tank with the fish swimming above you. There are also wonderful outdoor and indoor displays.

Plenty of potential, but too busy during CNY. Lovely enclosures, neat rides, well-maintained grounds, but far too busy during Chinese New Year. The staff were not prepared for the crowds and I was a bit worried for our safety when we tried to exit the park. We loved the Rapids ride and Raging River. The animals looked well cared for...

Adventure indeed!. I really had fun when I went to this place. You can see different sea creatures. Plus there's ocean express train or the cable car which will take you to the adventure park on top of the mountain. Ocean Express is cool, you are like inside a submarine. If you choose the cable car, you get to have a nice view for roughly 15mins ride I guess. The rides are really fun specially the hair raiser. This is a great place to visit for enjoyment. Though the foods are a little bit expensive. I guess you can bring your own food. Not so sure about it. Make sure to come before the park opens.

Must see when you visit Hong Kong!. This place is amazing. Ticket price is fair enough but I recommend you to get your discounted tickets from MTR Admiralty station. You'll save around $40HK. In a few months as I write this post, the MTR Ocean Park station will be completed. I think it's 90% as of this writing. You can bring in your own food and water, keep it inside your bag (Food inside is pricey). You must see the Pandas!!! They have 4 now. There is also 2 fluffy red Pandas there. Animals look so healthy and well taken care of. The cable car ride is breathtaking. It's a good warm up cable car ride if you are planning to ride the Ngong Ping 360. Not that much people on our visit (Wednesday) so the lines on almost all of the rides is not that long. All in all, it's time well spent there. More attractions I think are being built.

Playground in the Hill. Ocean Park is "wow" me.The big aquarium is magnificent.The water fountain show is superb.The cable car is outstanding.The dolphin breed is the place you should visit.The rides are cool.The scenery is breathtaking.If you visit HK with teenager, you should visit this Ocean Park instead of Disneyland. But, of course, better to visit both place.Ocean Park has its own transportation (bus), so the place is easy to reach.

Thrill-seeking Adventures. They have so much attractions for thrill seeking travellers and enjoyment for those who wants to see himself for being a child again.Ride without fear in their cable car to reach from simple attractions to next mountain with great funs.

Fun.. We took a train to Admiralty Mtr station. There is a counter there to buy tickets to Ocean Park. And there is also a bus service heading directly to Ocean Park.It is a huge development and i will strongly advise to reach there when the park opens. It is opened till 7.30pm. If you would like a smooth return back, try to leave earlier. If you leave at 7.30pm, the queue to take the bus is ridiculously long. The rides there are good. Especially their rollercoasters. A must go to place for experience if you haven't.

Bigger and better than Disney. Ocean Park is definitely bigger than Disney and has more varied and enjoyable attractions. The rides cater to different ages. They have thrilling rides for teenagers and adults and they have pleasurable and relaxing ones for the older and younger ones. You can also enjoy playing games at different stalls and win stuffed toys for 50 HKD. In addition, they also have a lot of shows which are worth seeing. Aside from that there are more food choices within the park with reasonable prices. It also has a McDonald stall so if you are on a budget then you are covered or better yet buy a park ticket that includes a meal with it. Based on value, Ocean Park is a definite win. An adult ticket is priced at 385 HKD which is definitely cheaper than Disney which is priced at 539 HKD.

One of the best amusement parks!. I loved this place, its a combination of a amusement park with rides, an aquarium and a zoo. Theres so much to do here, you could never get bored. Theres different levels for the activities. The first level has all the animal exhibits and the top level has all the rides. Ocean park also has a pick up and drop off service which was amazing and took that stress of finding a taxi away.The staff are very helpful(They returned my wallet that i had conveniently forgotten on the table safe and sound)I had a amazing daydefinitely recommended for all ages

Pandas!. Seeing the pandas at Ocean Park makes it worth the trip there. They are in huge panda enclosure which seems to be designed to give them an environment they can thrive in. Although seeing them is not guaranteed (they sleep a lot), there is also the opportunity to see red pandas in addition to the more popular giant pandas. You can also eat in The Neptune Restaurant while viewing a giant aquarium with all kinds of fish swimming around.

Fun but not during Mainland Holidays. Everyone wants to have fun, but when there are too many Mainland tourists here, it can be a bit too crowded, noisy, etc. That is okay if you don't mind, but if you want a bit more time for rides, go during low season

Thrilling rides! Must try - Cable car rides cause they are as thrilling as the amusement rides!. Brought out the child in me. Everybody love thrilling rides and they have them all! Didn't manage to complete all though as stomach juices were churning after a while. Will return to try the other rides. Cable car rides are a must for a visit to the Ocean park.

Huge park with lot's of rides etc. This park is must visit for Hong Kong traveler s as it had lot of things to do there rides dolphin show huge aquarium cable car water rides food joints and at last amazing fire works during closing time

hectic - but the kids loved it. im not a theme park person, but the kids enjoyed it without going mad over it. a couple of serious roller coasters and other rides and the cable car ride is pretty special although the wait can be huge - i would buy tickets in advance as the queue once there can be massive. Probably not worth the pricey entry fee.

Fun Themepark. Went here for a daytrip last January, and I was not expecting much more than an aquarium park. So I was pleasently supprised with all the rollercoastrers and fun attractions in the park. They have beautiful animals, and it's all well taken care off. The park is also really concerned about the environment which is a great thing. I have one negative point that the food and drinks in the park are way too expensive. I've ordered a piece of chicken with french fries for an amount of USD 18. Which was way too high since the quality of the food was not really impressive.

Go here!. I say this as a big Disneyland fan: if you can only go to one park in Hong Kong, go here. I was kind of on the fence about it, but it was such a good day. The lines were not that long, and there was so much to see and do. I like roller coasters, and theirs were kind of average (uncomfortably bumpy and shaky - one of them my head spent the whole time uncontrollably banging between the sides of my harness, to the point where I felt quite ill coming off), but they were okay and there was so much else to see. We wandered down to a section of the park we didn't realise was closed, and while we couldn't access that, we ended up outside the vet centre for all the animals. While I can't imagine many visitors would seek this out - you should! They have a room that you can walk into that has 5 swimming pools with dolphins in, swimming and training and playing around. We stayed for about half an hour or more just watching the dolphins, and most of the time were the only people there. The park was also just really well put together and interesting to move around, and the exhibits were amazing. Very immersive and interactive. Plus, a theme park with a huge mountain in the middle, where you can catch a cable car or a train to get to the other side? Very cool!

A day of varied fun. This is a place that has something for everyone. It is a place where one can see the varied sea life, also get a feel of the zoo - different kinds of animals and birds. The speciality is the Panda. For those who enjoy rides there are many different kinds of thrill rides. There is a park express that can be used to return to the entrance. The ride is a short one but very different from any train ride you might have experienced.

Fun. This was an amazing place. Old or young. Its suitable to all. The animal shows were top class. People flocked to this place.Travelling with the citybus to oceanpark was a pleasure. So fast. It was clean. Beautiful groomed gardens and plants. Safety was high on the list for visitors.The highlight was the enormously long cable car ride. Wow, very impressive views.The only huge let down was the food. Fast foods quality is poor and very expensive. Recommend to have a good meal before you arrive.
Good for kids. If you're a family it may be nice to take your kids here but i'd probably pick disney land. Kind of average but the red pandas are awesome!

Great visit. Wasn't quite sure what to expect here but had a fantastic fun day. Disappointed to have two main attractions closed on the same day, but being the off season that is understandable. Lots to do and enjoy, with rides ranging from mild to wild. Easy to get around despite the big hills, maybe not so for people pushing strollers or wheelchairs. Loved the train ride up to the mountain and the cable car ride back down. Rated this attraction higher than HK Disney

Plenty for the "older" children. This park has a great mix of activities to suit young and old. Plenty of fluffy animals to support the underwater ones, old style amusement park games, a carousel, and then the more wild rides up top. Everything is quite compact so walking around the park is easier than say Disneyland. The cable car provides wonderful views..as does the Hair Raiser if you can stomach it..

SCENIC PARK!. Really loved this place as well. If you are in Honk Kong visiting with friends or family, You should definitely go to this park. Its very clean and scenic and the roller coaster rides are super fun! There is alot of walking to do here so best wear your joggers or walking shoes here. The view from the cable cars was absolutely amazing. I am not sure if you will enjoy here as much if you are a couple. I think our fun was 2x because we were here with friends. :D They also have alot of animals here to see like pandas and red panda and plenty more. They have an exhibit for alot of different kind of fishes aswell.So Yea definitely a place worth a visit.

Very commercial. We went to the wron place.. got on a hop on hop off bus. We realised that it was not the place for us. Great if you have kids. i thing it is a very Chinese type of theme park. Quite expensive too.

Great experience!. We went to Ocean Park on a drizzly Monday Morning (Feb 01). The temperature went down to up to 10 degrees so it was really cold that day.It was a great experience in the sense that we can have fun taking rides at the park and at the same time being environment conscious as you get to learn about the animals inside the park as well.There was not much queue on the rides probably because it was a rainy Monday and many people may have opted to stay indoors or go some place else but it was an advantage on our part as we do not have to wait long time for any ride.The rides in Ocean Park is more extreme than Disneyland but nevertheless exciting.I am a bit scared of heights but was able to overcome it 2x when I rode Ocean Park Tower, a tower with a rotating view deck where you can have a 360 degrees view of Hong Kong and also taking the cable car on the way down. It was one of the most exciting (not to mention terrifying) 15 minutes of my life. Thank God I made it down alive! Ha ha ha!And I wanna try it again.They sell very nice souvenirs which are not very expensive.Ocean Park is definitely worth a visit. It is very accessible too. From MTR Admiralty station, take the shuttle bus 629 that goes to Ocean Park directly same thing on the way back.
Amazing experience. Being in the Ocean Park was surely one of the greatest experience I have ever had. Highly recommend it to all!

brilliant day and well cared for animals. It wasn't to see well treated animals in large enclosures in Asia and to put it in the real estate market that is Hong Kong makes it doubly good. A real zoo this isn't though, think sea world in the nineties instead of London zoo. Going of peak was also a factor in our great experience it would be a very different park if it were busy.

A day may not be enough!.
