Ocean park scores over DL in HK cause of its expanse and variety of rides for both adults and kids but a day may not be enough for you to cover the entire park due to long queue for cable car to transit between thrilling rides at the top of the hill and kiddie rides and aquarium at the foot of the hill. You would love every bit of it though. HAir Raisers and the Flash are must do if you are into thrilling rides.

Impressive!. A place which is very suitable for both kids and adults. Once we stepped foot into the compound, we immediately went for the roller coaster ride and it was a really awesome experience! Kids who are 140cm tall are only allowed to enter.

Real Pandas!. The park is huge and we were there on a very hot day. It was very well organized and people are actually respecting the rules (well, most of them ;))We really enjoyed walking around there and especially see real pandas! And this on different places. That would have already made our day, but then, they have this Australia place with Koalas and kangaroos, in the Polar Adventure you can see penguins and there are lot of things to do.If you like it, there are some roller coasters, but as they line was very long, we decided not to go on a ride. Instead we went to the aquarium and all other places to see more animals (seals etc).A small tip: We used the Ocean Express to get to the summit. Lining up for the cable car to go up was like a 45 mins wait, while the Ocean Express was there without a line. We then took the Cable car to get back down, when the line was not long. Somehow, the line at the bottom was all the time long. At least, we had a chance to use the cable car and didn't have to wait long.The day was one of the highlights we had during our stay in Hong Kong.

Must visit for kids and adults who are in for some fun rides!. There is a lot for all age groups out here! Lot of rides and fun stuff for small kids on the ground level. And then, you can take the gondola and visit the upper area for some fun rides for older kids and adults. Some really dangerous roller coasters and lot of water rides. Also see the dolphin show. Highly recommend to visit this place during off season or the long queues could just kill you. The gondola ride is awesome as you can see the entire ocean from in there.

Always a great experience!. I've been to this amusement park many times, but still it never fails to entertain every time I visit. The important part is to manage your expectations - I see this place more like a zoo & interesting attractions, but not much for rides. (The rides are average overall) The cable car is an iconic experience - but if you're at the park early and there's a long line waiting for it, it might be a better strategy to take the ocean train up first and to take the cable car down in the afternoon. They have a good range of animals from red pandas to arctic foxes - and has two impressive aquariums with a variety of specimens. One good thing to remember: buy water before you get there. It's expensive!

Not so . I like the HK Ocean Park but the thing is, it is too wide and oldies are not suitable of touring there. However, I really like to come back I'm still young. 😂 I wish to enjoy the hair raiser everyday! That was the most amazing ride I had.

A nice few hours. Not the greatest theme park but well worth it if you have half a day or more to spend in Hong Kong. The rides are more like the old fairground rides, nothing spectacular, but the park is nice for a walk around.

Best Place for Family. This place is so cool that a family of all ages can enjoy. You can see many different types of sea animals. They also have a zoo type attraction where you can see pandas, Koala, Wallaby, Red Monkeys, Kookaburra, Penguins, Walrus, Sea Lion, etc. They also have different rides on top of a mountain. You can either take the train or take the cable car to go to the theme park with roller coasters, and more adult rides. They also have this ride that will take you up and will show you a 360 degree view of the mountains. The ticket price is worth every penny. You get to see a lot of animals, ride amazing thrill rides, and a cable car all included in the ticket price.

Ocean Park with friends . Ocean Park in Hong Kong is really a great place to spend with ur family or frnds. We took most of the rides but the best is hair riser ride. Though the waiting is a lot but its worth the wait. We also took cable car. It has a breath taking view of the sea which is just besides the ocean park. Overall a wonderful experience. Cheers
Cool Rides!!!. Just go to this theme park and you'll never regret going to this place very easy to go here specially from Admiralty MTR station

Plan ahead!. Just some advance advice, Hong Kong banking is third world, note you can only purchase tickets online if the credit card holder is present and shows ID and the Card used.(due to HK bank regulations) And while you may buy tickets on line, you still have to print something out and or print out a confirmation slip and then claim the actual tickets at the venue. Kind of third world compared to how attractions are managed in other countries.

Park on a island . All the animals in school books +all the adventures+ cabel car+ fabulous views all around..Only lacking is the not clear map, schedule detail (complex) and less directions with long walksCan keep open till 8-9 as 6, 6.30 is too early

Ocean park is an amusement park. If you haven't experienced this kind of amusement part before then it's a must visit. However, after visiting Similair parks in Thailand and Malaysia and singapore, we found Ocean park lacking in many ways. The rides are mostly for big children and the sea life that they have on display is not very impressive. There weren't many shows on and the fountain show in the evening is just about average compared to the one in Sentosa island in singapore or even the fireworks at Universal studios. The Park is divided in 2 parts and the one on top of the mountain also does not offer much in terms of variety. You have to spend almost half hour in line to catch a ride which lasts for maybe 10 minutes. Not worth the ride and the money.

never go on a weekend. 1) 1st & foremost never go on weekends, it will be your doom 2) Reach there by 10am or whenever the park opens 3) till 1'0 clock enjoy all the rides you can 4) then the crowds start building up. At every ride you may have to wait 30-40 mins. Be prepared for that The rides are awesome, more thrilling than Disney world so don't give this place a miss. What I liked best (& its my personal opinion) were the exhibits, there is never much crowd over there, within 10-15 mins of waiting time you can easily enter, It was the first time I saw so many things up & close & it was beautiful. Imagine watching a toucan less than 1 metre away & noticing it has blue eyes!!! Tips if u have kids 1) rent the stroller even if u have to pay 100HKD. After 3 hrs he/she is going to be dead tired. My hubby had to carry my son on his shoulders most of the time. 2) most of the souvenirs r over priced but less than what they sell in Disney world. So take extra cash 3) Food everywhere is 30% higher rate so, again, take extra cash Tickets: we booked from klook.com & no, its not fake...we got discount, entry was super quick how to reach : . if ur hotel is near any metro station, use the mtr home website to find the metro line route.Ocean park is a bit expensive but worth every HKD provided u go on weekday & go early...Have fun
Must go . After Disneyland, we tried Ocean Park. There, you can find some scary attractions. Flying on the sky with ocean view around is unique. Must try!
Pandas. The Ocean Park is an absolute must visit when in Hong Kong. During my 5 years in HK I went a number of times just for the aquarium and the Pandas

Excellent Halloween event. We visited there in October 2015 for the Halloween event. The atmosphere was excellent. Because we bought the express pass so we could visit all the ghost houses without queuing for long time.
Amazing trip. My kids enjoyed so much with the rides and games. We can even have a good view while traveling on the cable car. Get to see animals from North & South Pole.

1 whole day feels insufficient if you want to do everything.. Visited oceanpark in january. Reached around 12pm and had only 6 hrs here. Saw whole of the summit area but missed a few things in the lower section(harbour). The light and sound the show is breathtaking. The old honkong area is also very well depicted. We went up through the cablecar and came back through ocean express train. Wish we had 4-5 more hours

Great entertainment. We have not been back there for 35 years and we were more than pleasantly surprised, don't expect the same american standard of disneyland but the rides are very good the shows are what it is all about and the prices are better than disneyland, it was a fantastic day and if we ever go back to Hong Kong and we had to choose between a day at disneyland and ocean park it would be ocean park. ,

great place for family. This was our 2nd time there, always fun to take tram and see the pandas! Got lucky and there was no crowd when we were there around 11am. Tip: buy your tickets online so you don't need to wait in line to buy- just show the QR code on your phone to kiosk at gate- no wait!!
Amazing . Was here actually in 2007 for my brother's wedding. There was a few roller-coaster and one went over a cliff. The trolley ride was fun and spend a lot of time in the pandas area

Good day out. Lot of rides and attractions although you gotta plan this carefully as with popular spots the place is jam packed and you can get bogged down in 1-2 hr lines for ride if you don't plan carefully (or buy a Fast Pass?)Tip: also take some bottled water with you because the prices inside are over inflated.

Spend a day. You could easily spend a day here. The entry was expensive but if you are going, go ahead and get the fast pass as well. It will pay for itself in time and line waiting. The only complaint was the 40 minute wait to buy a ticket.The pandas as worth the whole visit for me, but no fast pass entry.The aquarium is a good one and you can use your pass. It is well laid out and has a good variety of animals.The jellyfish display over by the rides was an excellent one.The gondola ride was lots of fun and we jumped ahead of about 200 people with the pass.We did not ride the rides, but enjoyed the displays, music, dancing and food.
Great day at Ocean Park. Ocean Park is a massive park spread across three hills. A great deal of rides and sight seeing for both adults and kids alike. I would recommend Ocean Park over Disneyland.

Huge Theme Park with Great Staff. We are really glad we chose to visit Ocean Park instead of Disneyland. The park is huge and has many areas to explore. During our visit, we focused mainly on the adventure park and the marine world, as my teenagers would prefer thrill rides. But there are many other areas we have yet to explore, like the Panda and Aquarium, as well as the performance arena. And not forgetting - the amazing dolphins! We loved their performance! Overall, we had a good time there. The staff were energetic and friendly, this is a very well organised theme park, we look forward to revisit again! Thumbs up!
A must try cable car ride. I've been to Ocean Park many times since I was a child. What I love the most is the cable car ride which gives you great views and sceneries.

Disappointing. Ocean Park is a wonderful experience for all ages! Though we had many disappointments. The animals show was closed. we didn't get to see any animals except sharks (baby sharks actually). the queues for rides are really long and they take a lot of time in between two rides. Amazing views of the sea especially from the cable car. The ocean express train was also a huge disappointment.I would call it a one time visit only.

Family trip from January 18, 2016. Ocean Park is an absolute must must must visit when you're in Hong Kong. Super destination for people of all ages & has something in store for all ages. The highlights are definitely the cable car & the rollercoaster. It takes you a while to realise the amazing infrastructure of this park which is actually connecting 2 hills by two modes - cable car (very scenic & takes you above the mountains) & train (which takes your through the mountains)There are many eating joints but we personally preferred the joints near the amusement park rides & where the games are.

fun day in HK. Ocean Park is amazing, it was my first encounter with Pandas, the aquarium and all marine creatures were magnificent. The hair raiser ride is Epic, best moments there. Also do not miss the ice skating show and the water show at the end. Good for kids and adults.

Beginning to get tired of this place already.. Been there a few times already but the last two trips were very much a disappointment. Too many China and India tourists. I have no problem with their ethnicity BUT, too MANY of them and they too NOISY. They sit on the STAIRS (dolphin show) block your views and STILL too NOISY. Found other attractions. Planned for next trip but may pass on this one. It depends.

A Bit Tired. We tried the Park mid week and got there around 11, while it was still quiet. A lot of the rides and other activities were out of action and the place was looking tired. The food is terrible and we left around 3 pm as it was getting very busy. If your stuck for things to do, give it ago, but Disneyland is much better.

Money well spent. Same like Disneyland do not visit d Park during school holidays else you would in d line 80-90% of d time. Nice place as from the Waterfront to the Submit if you take the cable car more than half your money is already being repaid. However if you go on a weekend or non school day, it is better to take the train which is quicker and can carry more people. An ocean Park MTR should be opening soon in 6 months time, once open train will definitely be d best way to reach the park. Do check the park's website for information about any ride or show being cancelled.Not too many things for 0-7 year olds but still worth a visit.

Rollercoasters and Pandas. I had a great time here, if the weather was better it would of helped though. That's not the park's fault. A long cable car with good views of the bay, seeing a Red Panda be fed and do tricks (I want one) and 4 decent rollercoasters were the highlights. Off-peak season too, so queues were small everywhere. Shame the rapids were closed for renovations and the Log Flume was poor, only 1 drop. Also, most of their exhibits seemed too small for the animals, but that's common across most Zoos.Seemed they were building large extensions to the park, so its only going to get better.

Amazing family time. A must do on your trip to Hongkong. Adults and children both will enjoy the park. The cable car ride is a must do and during daylight to enjoy the scenic sights along the way. Dolphin shows are very cute. All rides are just awesome . And please do not miss the lights and fire show at closing time.

Fun day in the sun. Choose a week day to visit and it was a wise choice. Pre-purchased tickets made entry a breeze. The crowds were low and the lines were very quick. Made the mistake of doing the cable car up to the summit, should have done train then cable car, less wait. Food was a bit expensive but the kids area (went with a 4yr old) throughly made up for it. The frog hopper was "awesome".

Great rides and good fun. I did most of the adrenaline pumping rides with my four boys and they were as good as any I have spent time on previously. Easy to get around and good choices. Only criticism is that the place is poisoned with Western style food venues - McDonalds, fried chicken, etc. I thought a steamed dim sim or noodle soup wouldn't be hard to find but I was wrong! If you like to eat healthily, take your own food.

So much fun!. We had so much fun visiting Ocean Park for the day! The dolphin show had a great ocean friendly message, and we were selected to meet some sea lions which was so cool. We went on several rides, and they were all brilliant fun. It must've been a very quiet day as there were hardly any queues. It was absolutely boiling though, a very hot day, but they have fans going in the queues, lots of shade and also misters. A really great day out for people of all ages.

Just Okay Experience. I am indian and went on Christmas Holiday to Hongkong.One Day i kept reserve for Ocean Park. Reaching to park is pretty easy. I took MTR and then caught bus which directly took us to Park.Ice skating show is must see. Do not miss it. Other than that i did not find any single show interesting. Ocean Heros is waste of time, drama was in Chinese so we did not understand anything,Other bird show was flop and again in Chinese. Pandas didn't show up. Australian adventure is very very boring. I did not enjoy Park much. Disney world experience was far better than this.No comparison. I do not not think Ocean park is must visit.

Brilliant day out!. We got lucky on our January holiday - we had one super sunny 20 degrees day and it's the day we chose to go to Ocean Park, meaning we had lovely weather, but barely any queues because we were so out of season. Our party consisted of three twenty-something year olds and a fifty year old and we found that there was absolutely loads to do. We had to give a couple of rides a miss actually, even though we went in when it opened 10:30 and left around 17:00. The rides were all great - my personal favourite was the mine train due to the stunning views that came with it, but the big roller coasters were also awesome. We also enjoyed the fact that there were aquariums and other animals to visit - the pandas was the biggest hit for us by far! Amenities-wise, there were plenty of toilets around the park and many places to buy food, although we went for a simple McDonalds which cost the same as it would out of the park.

Must see at Hong Kong ... don't just limit yourself to Disneyworld. The main purpose of our visit to Hong Kong was a HK Disneyworld trip for our 11-yr old son. We came across a review of Ocean Park .. our visit there esp the Cable Car ride (one car all to ourselves) will remain an unique memory for all of us.

Great Fun-filled place. The Ocean park is an amazing place for kids and adults alike to have a fun-filled day out! Went there 2 weeks back and had a lot of fun.Some of the rides look really scary but are not to be missed! If one has to choose between HK Disneyland and Ocean park purely in terms of fun, in my opinion the Ocean park wins over it's more famous counterpart.Some tips and information (the promotions in points 7 and 8 may no longer be valid):1. Try to reach at the opening time itself, as experiencing all attractions would easily take the whole day long.2. Do not spend too much time at the aquarium and other attractions near the entrance first. Maybe 15-20 minutes3. There will definitely be much lesser crowds during weekdays (Tue-Thu), so if possible should plan on going there on these days4. All rides stop at 6 PM5. One should definitely experience the cable car ride back from the summit to the base. It would easily qualify as one of the scary rides of the park :-)6. Carry raincoats or ponchos with you, both to protect against intermittent rainfall and also for the water ride7. For Krisflyer members - there was a 12% discount on the entry tickets (for upto 4 tickets per krisflyer member) - so carry your krisflyer card or atleast have an image of it in your phone8. For ppl who have arrived from Singapore to HK via TigerAir, there was a 10% discount on the entrance tickets upon presenting the boarding pass (for upto 4 tickets per boarding pass)

Awesome day out. We love the zoo/animal enclosure parts of the park. Every aspect of crowd facilities were extremely organised and well thought out. We wish we had longer time to explore other attractions. Great park!
Simply wow............ Very good experiance to all rides. No Q no waist of time.Very friendly and helpfull staff. You must go there. Indian dishes also available there.

Awesome day!. Everything is great! But what struck me was, when we rode the cable car! It was breath taking! The moment was amazing, such an awesome view and not for the faint hearted. But, not to fret, there's always a back up plan for it, go and try the "Ocean express!"

Good one but not much for younger kids!. We visited the Ocean Park in Sep 2015. To make it simple, we took a taxi from the city and the ride takes about 30 minutes.There are 2 levels - Waterfront and Summit - the upper one reached with a cable car/train. Overall the options for young kids are minimum. Our son who was 3 years old that time couldn't enjoy to his heart's content (he did so in Disneyland).There are some interesting rides for older kids in the Summit. The cable car ride to the summit in itself is interesting!Overall, good to spend a day with older kids. If you have younger kids and choosing between OP & Disneyland - go for the latter.

Boring, random, thrown together disaster of a theme park. . We visited on a wet day, which admittedly didn't help the atmosphere. However, we paid for fast passes, when some fast past queues were closed- no warning of this on ticket purchase. The dolphin show and water ride were closed, there was a broken down cable car, the aquarium had many empty tanks and rude tour guides. the park looks generally run down and staff uninspiring and miserable. The queuing time was not fast because they took so long to empty and refill the rides. Don't waste your money, this is not a good day out for westerners.

Lots of Fun. Ocean park had some great rides, however the lines were absolutely ridiculous. Some rides had wait times for over an hour. Overall though the rides were more extreme than that of Disneyland.

incredible experience. Going to and from the big buddah is an amazing experience , expecially if you take the crystal cabin, all round 360 veiws plus downwards and if your really lucky you can see people walking up the man made tracks, , I suppose some of them are on a pilgrimage of sorts... All of a sudden in the distance you see Buddah, it is a feeling you cant describe... so beautiful and just there in all its glory surrouded by forrests. Its a must see.. cant wait till I go again.Once you get to Buddah, a lot of steps, but just take it easy, its really worth it when you get to the top.
A fun day out with great views. I've been a few times over the years and always enjoyed it. It's run very well and I love the cable car ride - the views are fabulous!

Nice,well appointed and colorful.. More nice, systematic and joyful than the Disneyland to me. The tow part of this park is awesome. you can shift by ocean express train or cable car one park to another.Huge aquarium with lots of sea creatures. Dolphin and wheal show was great.Too many children and scary rides than the other parks in Hong Kong. I definitely recommend everyone to visit this park once.

Ocean Park experience. No really worth the price you pay for this attraction and they have just increase the price this Jan . They only have dolphin shows which is so so in my opinion . Food (beside fast food) is on the expensive side . Avoid going there during holiday season as the q for the riders , exhibits are long .
Excellent fun. . No lines, great rides, great exhibits, clean toilets and helpful staff. Excellent wifi. Puts oz theme parks to shame.

Keeps getting better!. I love the thrill rides though I believe they can bring in more thrilling rides! haha Went there during a weekday, it was perfect as there wasnt any Q! Everyone is nice and friendly in there. The cable ride really is worth your time, i had the whole cabin to my fiance and I as there was hardly any Q. Perfect place for family, friends, or dates. There are lots of aquariums around to educate the public about conserving the environment, it was quite interesting to visit whilst we escaped from the rain.A fun place to be any day of the week.

One of the must go theme park in Hong Kong. This is one of the must go theme park in Hong Kong. It is a combination of roller coaster rides and aquarium.TIPS: Best way to get there for Tourist w/o getting lost: Get to the Admiralty MTR station, take the 629 bus. It will put you right in front of the park.Tickets: Get your tickets at Admiralty 629 Bus Booth, you can avoid the crowd at the gate.Best way to navigate the theme park: Get to the top of the theme park first in the morning (via Gondola or Ocean Express Train), then work your way down during the day. Most people do the reverse, you can avoid the crowd by working backwards.

The ride there, the view, and a great fun time!. The first time here I was alone but I found Ocean Park fascinating and a great weekend relief from the hustle of Hong Kong. I went back with my wife and children and it was a wonderful time watching the joy on their faces. The cable ride there is worth your time.
A fun place any day of the week.
Ocean park. I love seeing the panda bears and the large jelly fishes. The cable car is my favorite ride. I love eating at the resturant at the top. It has a beautiful outdoor view of the sea.
Over Rated. Hell of rush and when you reach there you don't find anything to enjoy except one or two rides. Overall very average experience. Travel by trolley was nice.
Awesome........ Best place to be in Hong Kong, best ride was Hair Raiser waited for 2 hours in queue but was worth waiting.

Super Thrilling Roller Coasters!. You will need to try the roller coasters here. It is really superb to be in a roller coaster high up on a mountain hill. Fantastic experience. Children will love this. Different from your normal theme park. Thanks.

Worth to visit. Ocean Park is one of the place you should not miss is you visiting Hong Kong.
You spend entire day in Ocean Park. There are many type for fun rides. The underwater world aquarium is the most impressive. Compare to Disneyland Hong Kong, Ocean Park is much better and worth to visit.

Nice experience. In order to fully maximize your enjoyment. You need to spend a whole day here. Aquarium is not that good but the attraction rides and cable cart are fantastic. There is only 2 white panda which is always hiding. This place is not good when raining, make sure you have your raincoat when riding attractions.

Much better than Disneyland. Ocean Park is all in one: Zoo, North and South Pole animal environment, underwater world aquariums, shark and string ray tanks, dolphin basins, scenic cable car ride and thrilling rides on roller coasters.With such a conception, it is far more interesting than Disneyland for the whole family. You'll need an entire day.FIRST ADVICE: Buy your tickets online at Klook.com It will save you 15-20% on the regular prices, plus you skip the lines and go directly to the entrance gates.ACCESS: If in party of 3 or 4, don't bother with the 629 bus. Take a taxi and for around 50 HKD you're at the entrance gate. VISIT PLAN: Be there 10 min before opening times and take the cable car to the second station (there are only two stations, start and end). Now, you're in the ride attractions area. Take the roller coasters first, before the big queues form. Best coaster is the Hair raiser. Apart from the rides in this section, not to be missed is the shark tank and Polar stations. Watch for the feeding times to be there. On the way back you can take the cable car again or the Polar express train. In the first part (which you missed when entering) most interesting are the pandas (watch for feeding time also). Apart from that, in that part is a big aquarium (nothing special) and rides for the youngest ones.NOTE: The park is huge, spread on 2, 3 hills. You'll need a lot of walking, uphill and downhill. For elderly, wheelchair and strollers can be very demanding.FOOD: Expensive and low quality. McDonalds is most reasonable with prices (it's by the shark tank).

Great aquarium.  It's been 12 years since I last visited Ocean Park. New, more thrilling rides have been put in. The hairraiser was great, the dragon seemed as it was 12 years ago. The aquatic exhibits are magnificent and worth the visit even just fm for themselves. It's a lot more walking than I remember, wear good walking shoes. I suggest coming early via the Admiralty or Central bus that goes directly to the park. (Don't worry there are signs inside the Mtr station that says to Ocean Park buses). Once at the park, take the express train up and ride the thrill rides before lunch to avoid the crowds. Take the cable car down, and spend the afternoon on the aquatic and panda displays. We ended at the grand aquarium and thought we had a perfect itinerary. All in all, a great way to spend a day in HK.

Fun day out . The theme park delivers on the major rides - the thrilling near ocean drop roller coaster, crazy car rides, the vertical drop etc were all amazing fun. Get there early to beat the crowds and the queuing lines.

Not well-maintained and quite dirty. While Ocean Park has seen significant expansion over the years and the addition of some quality attractions, this park remains mediocre when it comes to theming or basic maintenance. Toilets are filthy and smelly and the same can be said for the street-side food. Never in my life have I endured such smelly fried squid! There's also littering everywhere and the ride buildings and vehicles are showing their age and consequent decay. Yes it is great for Ocean Park management to keep competing with Hong Kong Disneyland and boosting their attraction number but at the end of the day, quality is far more important than quantity and no amount of attractions will make this park any cleaner. The layout and geography of the park isn't very well thought out either. An example would be a lack of benches and a profound lack of shade under the biting Hong Kong sun. My suggestion? Skip this one if you can.
Still solid after all these years. Ocean Park is still the best theme park in Hong Kong. Rides are top notch however you need to be fit as the park is spread out over many hills and valleys.

good family day out. a friend and I took a day out of drinking in LKF to go to see the animals and go on some rides at Ocean Parks a few years ago.it was great to see the Giant Pandas, the rides were OK and it was well run, clean and efficient.

Simply Amazing. I simply love thrill rides and the rides were the most exciting I have ever been on. The animals were very cute, especially the pandas. Souvenirs were much more affordable than in Disneyland, and better choices too. The park has cable cars to travel from one side to the other, which goes to show how big it is. I also love the mini-game stalls scattered around the parks, which give off a real "amusement park" feel.
Rip Off. Prices at Ocean Park are exorbitant. Paid 435 HK dollars for chicken curry and rice.Did not meet my expectation as my previous visit.

Be prepared for lots of climbing and walking!. We visited Ocean Park on a weekday with 2 elderly and 1 toddler in tow.The rides in the park is very much enjoyable, good thing is there isn't much queue for most of the rides which means we get to ride as much as we can. Paid games here is also very worth it, managed to won 2 soft toy for my son. There are photo taking BEFORE the rides, which i find it to be interesting as most theme park i went took the photos in the mid of the ride, but this also means you can pose nicely for the camera (Which kind of defeat the purpose of an impromptu shot?). They print out the photos irregardless if you want to buy it or not, which i think is quite wasteful. One thing to note thou, the way the park operates I feel is not very organized. Many time, at the ride queue, they could have prepared for the next batch to queue at the 'gate' area of the ride before the ride arrived to save on time, which unfortunately was not done. They have to wait for the people on the ride to disembarked fully, then get the next batch to queue at the gate. Time is wasted there. The pandas enclosure is a big plus to the park, especially love the red panda feeding time, where the trainers will ask the red pandas to pose for the camera, super cute!! The dolphin show was closed when we was there (And was told by their staffs that it's been closed for almost a month now, which is a big disappointment to the elderly as that was one of the only attraction they could enjoy but it was not available)Love the sea life carousel as well, as they have 'Double' seat for parents with young children to sit together.The tram ride up is also very interesting, and love that they have special lane for the wheelchairs and strollers.

Continous improvement over years. I grew up with OP. I think I've been there like 10 times since I was a kid. I never got bored to go there as a kid and I went there for Halloween last year. It surprised me by the tremendous improvements they made. The new aquarium is bigger and has better viewing windows but I still like the old one more(nostalgic reason). As a diver and a marine animal lover I made my stop every time. I also think it is one of the best aquariums in the world in terms of species variety and scale and information after being in many aquariums around the world. They also added a train as an option besides cable car to commute between the upper and lower park. Cable car has better view but the train usually has a shorter queue. It was also my first time to visit the glacier area for the new roller coaster and see snow foxes and penguins. Only complain is the queue was 45mins for the roller coaster. The Halloween event had been a big success every year and they also improve a lot compared with my visit few years ago. The queue was not as bad as I imagined. I queued up from 0-30 mins for each haunted house. The haunted houses are all very well prepared in details and the actors are all very well dressed and passionate in their roles. The haunted house that only allow you to go one by one was such a surprise. It was very creative. I think it was so much above my expectation for the tickets price I paid. Definitely worth going back again!

Wonderful Walrus. The rollercoasters were amazing but the aquarium and the South and North Pole were the highlights of our visit. Just love to see the walrus and seals swimming underwater. The penguins were cute as usual. The only thing bad is that the hours were too short. Couldn't do everything in one day.

GO here first before DisneyLand. Well what can i say. We went to Disneyland 2 days before we come here and it was a mistake. Please go here first before you go to Disneyland as it is a note lower than Disneyland.The transportation to get here is pretty good, nice bus from the train station. Please get your Octopus card ready (although if you haven't got your octopus card by this stage you're in trouble...) Its about a 15 - 20 minutes bus ride from the nearest train station.We saw a somewhat traditional Chinese Circus, this was great. All the performers are fantastic!There are a lot of stuff here, but the ones that really sticks with me are the Pandas (Black White, and Red too) So thats Poh and Master Shifu... the extensive collection of gold fish was great too i thought.After the small zoo that has some otters, turtles and such we tool the Cable Car to the hills. I though the cable car ride was great. You can see the bay and the view was really great!A little note about food, find a table first if you dont want to stand around with a tray full of food on your hands trying to look for table, because you wont be able to maneuver as fast, And don't eat the ramen, it was barely palatable... stick with fried stuff.We didn't take any rides as we have young children with us. We went to the arctic area which reminds me of a scene in happy feet. It nice and cool in there with a strong fish smell :) There was penguins, walruses, sea lions and seals. Lots of information about the animals for the kids that are not too excited. THen the big shark tanks was pretty good too.We went to a dolphin show, but it was a bit disappointing... i know there isnt too much that we can do with them, but it feels like wherever we go its the same show..I think if there are nothing new, once is more than enough to come here.PS: its super busy at all the attractions..
something for kid & family. i go there everything i 'm in hk, sth different to disney , zoo/aquariums/scenic cable car ride.. my kid love it .

Most scenic rollercoaster ride in the world!. We went on Boxing day. It will be busy on the door any day but quite quick to get in.The place is huge. I haven't compared it to Disneyland but all the locals say it is - why go to a smaller crowded version of Disneyland when the real thing in Florida/California is so much bigger.Anyway back to Ocean Park. We arrived before lunch and headed straight for the cable car (no queue). Amazing view. Getting off, it was virtually empty with no queues for anything so we just went for it. The roller-coasters were great. Amazing scene of turning upside-down over cliffs and the beautiful seas. it was magic.The rest of it was fine for our small children. Lots to see for all ages, lots of animals etc.Then came lunchtime. Lots of choices. Importantly unlike many rip off theme parks around the world McDonald's is as cheap there as anywhere in Hong Kong, $20 (£2 or $2 US) for a Big Mac. Then came the crowds - they have obviously slowly worked their way slowly to our end of the theme park. There are a lot of people from middle of the afternoon. However by that time we had done our bit with the rides very satisfied and spent the rest of the day enjoying the static attractions.Moral of the story - arrive early, head straight for the cable car, then do your rides, then relax

BIRTHDAY OF A LIFE TIME!. Ocean Park you blew us away. Ismare and I share a birthday and we decided to enjoy our day at Ocean Park. Little did I know what i had in store. My boyfriend who is living all the way in South Africa worked up the surprise of a lifetime with the awesome guest services team. I love Otters so much and i was just so excited to see the training show. Little did i know i was going to tick off a bucket list item... hold an otters hand. What an awesome surprise guys I was blown away. They also drew this great card! Minnie you are so talented!From hair raising rides to awesome animal enclosures. Every second spent at Ocean Park was a WOW moment. We honestly felt like 5 year olds.Go early and make a day of it!Well done guys what a world class place!Thank you for making my day so super special! You guys are awesome!!!We are coming back!!!

The aquarium is simply the best. The aquarium is the best one I have ever visited. I also like the dolphins/seal show, the panda and the sichuan monkeys. There are plenty of attractions and be prepare to spend a full day there. Don't expect too much about the food quality there and it is expensive too. I went there on a Sunday and it was very packed even though it was a rainy day.

Amazing Theme Park In Hong Kong. I have to admitted, this is my regular favourite theme park and I often came here. Personally I prefer Ocean Park rather than Disneyland HK, most probably because I'm used to Disneyland Paris and Tokyo way too much. Well whatever it is, Ocean Park is good for everybody. Halloween is AMUST for me to be here. I suggested for those who visit Hong Kong, do visit Ocean Park and it's worth it.

Enjoyable Family Day. We went on a week day and it wasn't too busy which was really good. There's a nice aquarium near the entrance which is fully air conditioned so it's nice and cool browse the various sea animals (really nice especially on a hot humid day). There's an area called "old Hong Kong" which is a must see. it features a typical Hong Kong street back in the 50s that we often see in Asian movies such as Ip Man. the food are authentic Hong Kong Hawkers' food. Really Yummy. Try the egg waffles, curry fishballs & steamed rice noodle rolls.Old Hong Kong is right next to the cable car which is an all time favourite so there's usually a 45 min wait to go on but it's worth the wait. If you don't have the patience there's a express train that takes you up to the area where the rides are. There are enough variety of rides for young child, teenagers and adults. Don't forget to wait for the water show at around 6.30pm before leaving. In our opinion, the Ocean Park has been better maintained than Disneyland in Hong Kong. You can easily spend a whole day there.

Return Visit. Hadn't been here in a few years so with a spare day we decided to go and have a look. Very large theme park incorporating live animal exhibits with theme park rides. tere are 2 parts to the park. A large section as you enter where you van view pandas and sealife. Take the cable car to the other side of the island for some pretty exciting roller coasters.Very busy on weekends but it's so large it's easy to get around.

Spend a day. more on how we got here in another review but let's jump into Ocean Park. Having enjoyed Seaworld on the Australian Gold Coast and USA San Diego, I was looking forward to this park/aquarium experience. It was a quiet day but still plenty of crowds, but this park laid out over 2 main areas separated by a cable car ride meant we didn't have to wait long on too many attractions.This is more of an amusement park with an ocean theme although the Marine Mammal Rehab & Hospital was an interesting yet slightly hidden opportunity to see behind the scenes.The Great Aquarium was fascinating and a wonderful sight of many different species.The Walrus was a sight to behold but his repetitive swimming behaviour (sterotypy) suggested a lack of environmental stimulation and a concern for emotional welfare.The standout feature was not a fish or marine mammal but the pandas, both Red and Giant. Could have sat there for hours & watched them interacting in the well planned environment.Food was standard amusement park fare with both Chinese & Western influences.A very tiring day well enjoyed, with some caveats.

A nice change from Disneyland. We visited Ocean Park for the visit time in all our 7 visits to HK and its such a nice change from Disneyland. Its like a combination of SeaWorld and a fun park. Though we didn't have much time to spend there we still enjoyed ourselves. It gets quite crowded with mainland China folks so the trick is to head to the Summit first and have lunch before trying out the rides. Then go down to enjoy the animals and games. Try out 'The Terrace Cafe' up there - food's not too bad and it gives you a beautiful view of South China Sea.

Amazing Fun for young and old. We took the MTR and then a bus to get to the Park. Attractions included Pandas, Aquarium and Bird Show. Rides galore for young and old. Took the Chair lifts to the top - what an amazing view. Train back down which goes through the mountain. Well worth going. You buy tickets at the Park Entrance. You can buy a fast pass for 5 attractions at an extra cost. Well worth the money as the park was extremely packed and you could enjoy a ride again without waiting in long queues.

Thrillseekers. Now here was a pleasant surprise! Way better than any Disney park, Ocean park offered so much more, best rollercoaster we have ever been on with Panda's including the endangered Red Panda BLISS
Awesome place for kids. Very big park. Price is half of disneyland but its awesome. My three year old son really enjoyed it.

Nothing out of the box. The ocean park is reasonably priced and easily accessible. The rides are just OK, the hair raiser rollercoaster being the best. The aquarium was good and the various animal feeding displays. Nothing to write home about. Can be difficult when crowdy with those who like to push in. We followed the advice of another traveller and took train to top and started from there. Great idea missed a lot of the crowds.

Very Enjoyable!. Went on a Thursday on a 17 degrees day.So it was great, lines for the rides and to see the animals were short. Max waiting was 10 min. All the different sites to see the animals are very well arranged. You get never bored, very impressive. I really liked everyone of them. The all have a wow factor. Nature is so amazing and beautiful, you cant believe your eyes.

Boring. The only good thing about the park is how big and colourful it is. The shows are mediocre. There really is nothing to do there, the food is just OK too. The only entertainment I liked was the cable car ride.

One of the greatest park in the world. Havn't visited the park for few years. This time, the park brought me great excitement and surprise. There are few more thrilling rides for the adventurers. At the same time, there are different theme zones for animal lovers. I had an amazing tea time in the Penguin cafe which you could watch lovely penguins swimming while enjoying your meal. Ocean park is for sure one of the must visit places in Hong Kong.

2nd visit. Visited the park on 30th Dec 2015. Is my 2nd visit and I still love the park. Esp the panda zone, with lele and yingying. It is a sure to visit zone in the park. Definitely worth spending your entire day with your family there.

OceanPark Adventure. If you love the Thrill, then don't miss Ocean Park.Here you can get lot many rides and thrilling activities like Roller Coaster. Don't miss the Fireworks in the evening, here you can view Fireworks on the water surface. Worth Visiting!!!

One of the best places. Ocean Park is a true one day getaway with lot of exciting things to do and enjoy on. Take the rides, see the marine life in the huge aquarium, the numerous fishes clustered together, Penguins in chilled air, cable car ride and so much more at just a decent 345 HKD per adult. Some hotels can arrange tickets for you, and it's possible to book the tickets online through their website to avail discounts and to prevent from falling in the huge queues at the ticketing counters there. Must visit! You will love it.
Okay . Don't really like it - too many animals in captivity and it's heartbreaking to see the dolphins and seals performing :(

Good family outing, requires a full day visit to fully appreciate and be cost effective.. Lots to do and see. Visiting Ocean Park, can be a fun day for the whole family. For those that enjoy the adrenalin rush there are rides aplenty and for those who just enjoy good fun, there are the rides that will just give you the views. Aberdeen Channel and Deep Water Bay. Food aplenty to choose from. Animals and fishes to see. We took the train up and cable car down which once again had awesome views. It is a full day outing. We were lucky as queues were not long- try to go during the week as on a weekend you may miss out on Funtime while standing in queues.
Fun fun fun!!!!!!. The place is huge, the aquarium is really nice and the area for the pandas! On top of island are all the rides that are very fun... The best part is of course the view!!!

Not Safe. I believe this place is not safe for people with young children. My son was sexually assaulted here by a psychiatric patient in a toilet and I feel that the lack of security in both the toilet and fun water park nearby is unacceptable. Ocean Park only has one family shared toilet which is far away from the water area on the other side of the park. I suggest keeping a close eye on your children, whilst playing and not letting them enter the toilets alone, even if they are older like my son. The person who assaulted my son was a holder of a disabilities card which allows free entry to those with both mental and physical disabilities. I was offered a free day after the incident, but I will never be returning and my son still has nightmares. Watch your kids at all times, this is a busy place I would hate for it to someone else.

good choice for alternative. we been here to avoid peak seasons in disneyland. this place is good though, we had enough ride, fun , enough resting area. it is also very easy to access by bus from tsim tsa shui area.

Amazing place for teenagers! . Ocean Park is a really huge theme park with a really wide variety of rides. I would say that the rides cater to mostly teenagers. I visited on a Thursday and I was lucky that there weren't as many people as I've expected. The queue for the rides were only 5-10 minutes, unlike weekends that could be as crazy as 30 minutes to an hour! The longest queue we queued for would be the cable ride from the top of the park back to the entrance...

Recommended!. It is a huge theme park, a lot of activities to be done here. Don't forget to catch up with the thrills game such as The Flash, The Hair Riser, The Abyss, and the Mine rider. A friend of mine lost her plush toy that she won while shopping. Pretty much sad though that you can't really trust anyone there. So be careful always with your things.

good for older kids. if you have kids in their teens this is fantastic. pls go early as lines can be long. plan well. one day might not be enough. one can take the cable car while going up if you are going early coz on the way back lines are very long

Great Adventure park. The access to Ocean park was amazingly easy as one can take route 629 bus from Admarility station exit B. The ride is for 20 minutes and goes right to the door. The first glance of the park takes one to a whole different level. The cable cars going to the top of the mountain, big fountains etc makes one go gaga over the place. Anyway if one likes rides/roller coasters he should head directly to the cable car. The roller coasters here can really pump up the adrenaline . Moreover one can see sharks, fishes, penguins, 30 degree view of the park and south china sea from that area, before heading in the ocean express back to see the rest of the park. The ocean express was a bit of disappointment as it is only a mode of travel and does not go deep in water as w thought though it was made almost like Captain Nemo's "Nautilius".A must visit if you have young children with you like i did.

Dated but less crowded. We went to ocean park because our toddler loves animals. Good thing about this park is that it has thrill rides, sea world and some panda to see. For the price, i thought it was fine. But place is very dated and maybe with Disneyland in place, not too many crowd. I suggest for it to go for facelift. Guess with the new MTR coming soon, people will come here in volumes. Until then, you can enjoy the whole park (and not even Q for rides) to yourselves. Which is very rare in crowded HK!

Just so much to do. There are an incredible amount of things to do at Ocean park, we hardly scratched the surface. If you go here, plan on going a few times if you want to get the full experience. There is something for everyone, from fast food to restaurants, to kiddies rides and roller coasters along with world class shows and performances.

Great views, but long queues. We were taken here by a friend and the queue to buy the tickets was long despite early departure. The ride itself is very good however I think promoting booking on line over queuing would help improve it.
Wray out. Bit expensive but worth a visit can't use your card in restaurants it's all cash the children love it.
Great day out. Great day out for all the family, reasonable amount of rides, excellent animals and just a fun day! Must do for HK.
LOTS TO SEE, GO EARLY. Overall really good time. A bit of everything really. Lots of good roller coasters, aquarium, variety of food.

1 day visit to OP. the children loved it. their favorit is hair raiser, arctic blast and 2 other roller coaster rides.
it was a huge park. so make sure to bring your walking shoes
price of food is high on the ridiculous side too..
Day out. Excellent fun but penguins looked a little bored. Rides very enjoyable and the coastal location spectacular. Price about £36 pp well worth it and nice to breath clean coastal air.
Amazing mix of zoo and theme park. Great animal exhibits as well as amazing rides for the thrill seeker within! The panda exhibit is really worth a visit

Beautiful Park. We had not plan to visit this park but on our way back to the hotel I decide that it was worth stopping to show my grandchildren the Pandas. I was surprise to see how beautiful the park was and I was sad not to have the time to spend a whole day. We had been the day before at the Disney Park and this would have been a much better choice by far.

Attraction For Roller Coaster Freaks. You need minimum 2 days if you want to ride everything. Most of the rides requires minimum 120 cm height, so is not fun if you kids below the height. When i came, the ocean theater was closed so i probably miss the main attraction however i enjoyed all the rides and the hair riser rides its totally raise your hair !!!.There are halal food at the park but you can bring your own foods as they are not strictly checked your bag.

Excellent!!!!!. Ocean Park HK is one of the best water parks I have so far been to. In fact its not just a water park, its a zoo, theme park combined. It gives you one of the best views of HK islands. Its a complete package...there are things to do for kids, thrill lovers everyone. Hair raiser is one of best thrill rides I have ever been on. What makes the rides even more thrilling is their location on the cliff overlooking south China sea. Its spectacular......Among things there is a dolphin show which was simply amazing, jelly fish museum, penguins, shark museum etc. Though we just had half a day, we simply cherished the time we had there...

Fun day. This is one big theme park, we were at the park for 6 hours and there was still lots of ground to cover. Highlights include seeing the giant and red pandas, cable car ride to the summit. Downside was difficulty in getting lunch, obviously busy park but one cafe was off limits due to a private function (Kikki gets married). Plenty of restrooms and also baby feeding areas. Orderly lines to attractions and plenty of friendly, helpful staff around the park. Lots of gift shops to pick up souvenirs. Fun day! We travelled by taxi from Grand Hyatt (Wan Chai) the morning trip took less than 10 mins, return trip about 5ish was met with heavier traffic but no problems in getting a taxi.

Good theme park. Excellent theme park at hongkong, many attractions, clean toilet and can go with family or your friend.
Cheer !

A place that has everything for everyone. It has been more than 15 years since my last visit to the park and I was awed by how it has transformed over the years! We spent nearly the whole day there and never felt bored. The adventure rides were superb: the Hair Raiser was the most thrilling for us and we enjoyed the Dragon and the Mine Train. You will hear various groups of visitors having loads of fun playing games and stalls across the park in attempts to win attractive prizes. We particularly enjoyed the show at the Ocean Theatre where you will get to see wonderful performances by the dophins and seals; you can see the rapport the trainers have with these animals and you will be wowed by the natural tricks that they exhibit.

Take you walking shoes. This is a very big park set over 3 levels on the side of a mountain, you need good shoes and plenty of water. If you have a fast pass check the shows that need to be pre-booked so you don't miss out (ie Ice spectacular)

Dont miss the Klaidoscope show!. Breath taking and one of a kind show on ice! Yes, ice skaters performing soo close and soo well!! It was a fantastic experience!Advice to do summit rides first n then ocean rides. Dont forget to try your luck at game stalls where every individual - kid or adult could be a winner of Big Stuffed toys!!!!Vegetarians do not hv indian options. They allow outside food a little so advice to take own meals.Better to go for full day rather than half day tour.

Totally unexpected . It was a short bus journey from Hong Kong city centre to the park. Once we arrived I was totally underwhelmed and thought we should have went to Disney! However I was totally blown away once you realise the other side on the mountain is where most of the big rides are. The view are breathtaking and plenty of ride to use to get good pictures. The food was rather good too, we are at the panda restaurant. There was plenty to do for all age, the aquarium and panda central was a highlight. As were some on the big roller coasters. Would recommend the crazy train, as you won't see views like it anywhere else.

Go on.....become a kid ;). It is a great place to be, but be ready to walk & wait in "Q's" the rides are there for all ages, but the thrill is in the roller coaster & tower view, well it depends on individual preferences. It's quite a learning experience about the ocean life & the importance of respecting it. The cable car is a nice way to look over the coast line of Hong Kong, but if you are afraid of heights Don't Look Down!!! The train is an option. If you could predict the weather then you should go on a clear day.

Not enough time!. Our second visit to this place after more than 10years. So much improvement since. Wheelchair friendly. Too many rides to take. Too many attractions to catch and shows to see. And theme restaurants to eat in. Carnival games to win prizes. Not enough to cover in one day. Crowds expected as there are really no off peak Seasons going by the tourists in this place. The cable car a must try as it offers scenic views of sea and mountain. Recommended even for returning visitors.

Amazed. Amazing experience for cheap money compared to euro and USA parksRides, shows and plenty of animals Very clean and spacious Definitely will recommend getting the fast pass! Cost only 15 euro extra and saves you a LOT of time. Don't understand so few used it!

A nice way to spend the day. Ocean park is a really big amusement park/aquarium. The lines were long but the rides were very nice. Check out the roller coasters when your there. The food was just ok. It was amusement park food at amusement park prices. Enjoyed my time there but I probably wouldn't return.

Views, Rides and environmental awareness packed in one!. We visited Ocean Park, Hong Kong, on Christmas eve, 2015. It was by far, the most fun thing we had done in Hong Kong. With the numerous rides, beautiful view and the educational and conservation angle added to this theme park, it is no doubt one of the must-visit places when anyone goes to Hong Kong.Personally, I most enjoyed meeting with the Giant pandas, Ja ja, An An, the penguins, pygmy marmosets and the numerous other animals.And entire day there might not necessarily be sufficient. So plan accordingly. If you want to take your time and visit all parts of the park, you may need 2 days, possibly. It is unbelievably huge~The rides are incredibly exciting too! The only problem is that it is usually so crowded that you end up spending too much time waiting in the queues.I really would love to (in fact, I definitely plan to) re-visit the theme park again!
Great experience. Highlight was seeing the pandas up close and the cable car ride.. But the walking was crazy! The rides were pretty out of this world. One was enough for me though)

mixed feelings. my family and i went to ocean park just today and it was pretty cool. i especially enjoyed the roller coaster rides. however, being a petite sized teen, i felt it was quite dangerous to go on the flash ride and the rev booster as my shoulders and hips (basically my whole body) could fit through the safety seat belts and i was mostly relying on my arms strength (on the rev booster) to stay actually seated on the seat (ALSO I DONT RECOMMEND GOING ON IT bc it gave everyone bad motion sickness. but other than that every thing was mostly good. the enclosures were good and it seemed like most of the animals are kept in humane environments except some of the fish and amphibians. the pandas were also giving a choice to go inside for a rest or come out for food and allow visitors to take pictures.however, more staff should be put into them to ensure then visitors speak with inside voices as well as turn off their flash on their cameras as i myself had to shush some of the inconsiderate guests (seahorses are very sensitive to light). what i found weird was that the penguins were hand fed, which is very unnatural ( maybe they could release live fish into the enclosure for them to catch and eat?) the queues weren't very long too, which is a plus. it was overall a good day. this park is suitable for everyone generally

nice views if good weather. this place we recommend you to go only in good sunny weather because you will miss nice views over the mountain.fishes r not good and not worth time, some attractions like hair raiser, dragon r the most recommended.

Not for the Seniors. Have a great time at the park. However there is a long walk between each attraction which is not to easy for the seniors. They have a make over and the place look great.Totally different attraction with Disneyland.Can't find any taxi when returning as the taxi would not be coming to the park in the evening as the tunnel will have major jam. Have to take bus and railway to get back to TST

A day full of fun. If you are dare enough to ride. Many rides available although the queue was rather long which was filled with mainlanders. Keep a watch out for your stuff cos it was rally packed. Cable car and under ground tram to bring you to the other part of the park. Easy access with public bus.

Preferred the animals to the rides. My first time in Ocean Park two years ago was amazing! We visited each animals during their scheduled feeding and/or met with their keepers. We read most signs. We saw the animals being very active and learned so much about them. This time we're traveling with a toddler, and it was a totally different visit, not as fun as the first time. We still saw the same animals but didn't try to follow any schedule. As a result, the animals were sleeping or hiding, hence not as interesting for a little one. The big fish tank, shark tank, jelly fish tank were his favourite but was lost interest very quickly. So we were constantly moving, not staying in one spot marvelling at sea horses or sturgeons. We didn't do the rides except the cable car that offers beautiful view. The long queue is worth it! But we took the ocean express train on the way down. They have a policy to not bring outside food in and will search your bag at the entrance. The food is ridiculously overpriced and they don't look extensively. We learned our lesson the first time. This year we brought plenty of food and water for the entire day. Lastly we took the MTR to Admiralty station and took the bus 629 (very easy to find). In that MTR station there is an official tourists office selling discounted Ocean Park tickets for HKD340 instead of the HKD385. It's worth it to buy your tickets there: cheaper and faster entrance.
Tour Around HK. It was a really great place for family vacation, the place are really great for fun especially the Rides there it was amazing experience i highly recommeded of my behalf.

Very large park. Unlike Disneyland where you just follow the road and go around, the theme parks in Ocean Park are scattered. There's also a lot of shows going on in each park. Plan your trip ahead - if you can download the map online before going there, do it so you can mark the areas you want to visit and plot out your route. Also when you ride the cable car, they'll take your picture. You can purchase your picture without the frame - but they won't let you know that unless you ask. The frame costs $100 (it's not that nice), while the photo costs $98.

Better than Disney. During our visit we went to both famous HK Parks, Ocean and Disney park. Ocean park wins in terms of rides and attractions. If you are a teen or family with older kids, just take the Ocean train and cross into big rides area. Go early in the morning and complete as many rides as you can. Good food options available & many photo opportunities with all cartoon characters. Have fun !!!

More than just pandas. I remember visiting Ocean Park when I was 5. The park has since undergone a rejuvenation and make over. Yes the train and cable car ride are still present and the sea life theme is ever present. They have also added Chinese Pandas (donated by the Chinese government) which was one of the highlights of our visit. There are plenty of rides to please the young ones although dining options here are rather pricey.

Spacious and colourful. Cable car ride was good except that the queue was too long. 1 hour wait to hop on one. Staff were helpful. Display of all animals was good. View was excellent. Tram ride was good, fast and efficient...

It's not always about the rides. Probably one of the best zoos and aquariums that I've been to. The animals were good (not great, but good) but the information was ABUNDANT! Zoos that just give the name of the animal are a waste of time. There wasn't a single organism in there that wasn't loaded with fun facts and information that even I learned a ton!The rides are good and the lines aren't TERRIBLE (half an hour at most) in January. The food isn't unreasonable for a park and the view from some of the attractions is marvelous.We rode four rides the entire time, but spent 8 hours there just enjoying the zoo and aquarium.

Damn crowded!! full of china people... Very rude and not considerate. I'm very surprised the place was so crowded. Full of china people, especially from the countryside. They are damn rude, no manner and damn inconsiderate.....

Holiday. Alot more rides than Disney and more suited for older children our son is 11 so he enjoyed it more than Disney. The lines took longer but it is amazing how it is built on the side of a mountain Good rides and be prepared to walk

Awesome !! Awesome !! awesome. Really fun. A Must see in Hong Kong.. We arrived in the afternoon at this place, when it was already brimming with crowd. We did our bookings with KLOOK for this place, and trust me not only this anywhere in Hong Kong if u are prebooked you have an advantage. The whole ambience is quiet thrilling and exciting. We saw the Money and the Panda enclosures was fun. Then we went to the Rides on the top section of the park. The rides are terrifying, you should try the "HAIR RAISER" and the ship. The food is good too, but the menu is small. Again as an Indian , found very less options for myself. There are many things you can do. For kids it really a great place, there are fun games, for them. We then visited the Aquarium which was the second best thing here. They have Sting Rays, Sharks and really rare species of fish. And ofcourse King Crabs and Octopuses, awesome Experience. First time this close to an Octopus. The best part was the Water , Fireworks and Pyro show. This show tells about how the world same into existence when Fire and Water Dragon made peace. The whole story and the firworks and pyro setup was AMAZING, a amust see again if you plan to stay here till closing time. We also saw ice performers which was fun.

Best last day :). Devoted the whole last day to Ocean Park. What initially looked like an expensive entrance fee, it has proved to be worth it. Once you enter, the fun begins. Roller coasters, a show with dolphins and seals, an exhibition of goldfishes, a big aquarium with sharks ...The park includes the ride by cable car, which offers wonderful views of the Repulse Bay Beach and Aberdeen. If you get hungry, park offers different kind of delicious food. I recomend for families, frends, adventure seekers... :)

Brilliant. We went to ocean Park mainly to see the pandas and we werent disappointed. One panda was sleeping but the other panda was up walking around and scratching his back on the trees. Information on the animals in English aswell which was great. The cable cart up to the amusement rides gets very busy in the afternoon so try go up to the amusements first thing in the morning and then finish your day with the zoo and aquarium. We started in the amusements they are great with amazing views no queues in the morning. Regular shows of animals -we went to the dolphin and seal show which was nice.

family fun. this is the best place for a family trip, suitable for all ages as it has tons of attractions, many kinds as well.however, do go early and maximize your time as much as possible as u definitely need plenty of time to cover up the whole park

Not for young kids. The rides at Ocean Park kept the teenagers happy, even though there were no stand outs. No well known top 10 or top 20 thrill rides here.You were able to have a leisurely wander around the park which was good.The cable car ride there was good with excellent views across to Repulse Bay.As an Aquarium.......so so

Fun place to spend a day in HK!. We were there from open to close (10am - 7 pm) and was able to just complete the park. We bought our tickets from a 7-Eleven to by pass the ticket line. We arrived shortly after 9am and was able to get some nice family pictures at the entrance without the crowd.There is a nice assortment of activities for everyone in the family. There are thrill rides, aquarium, pandas, koalas, penguins, along with shows throughout the day. There is a lot of walking involved so make sure you wear comfortable shoes!I was pleasantly surprised by how reasonably priced the souvenirs were. There were a large variety of food available and the prices were ok for the venue.Just be aware when you leave at closing time, there are huge line ups for buses. We luckily stumbled upon the line for "standing room" on the bus (which was separate from the main line) so we were able to bypass the hundreds of people waiting for the bus but had to stand on the bus. The ride was approx. 15 minutes to the MTR so it wasn't too bad.

Excellent place to visit . Very huge and excellent place to visit with (young) children.. As I was in en December, the park was so busy and crowded the reason why I paid extra money to get fast track tickets.. To be honest, I was so glad to pay the additional cost as the queues were sooo long: more than 1h to get the cable car and 2h for the return.. Unbelievable.. Overall it was an amazing place, but food was awful and very expensive..

love it. Ocean Park its for kids and adults, this was my Favourite day at HK !! i definitely want to go back ! the acuarium its awsome! dont miss the big pandas !! the souvenis store its a litlle expensive as the fast food :S but any way the best options they have good rides for adults i love it!

Exceeded expectations. Best for families/kids.. A must-see for families. From their website, I'd expected it to be relentlessly cheesy, but I actually enjoyed this more than I did Disneyland. A surprisingly diverse mix of things to see and do.Wear your walking boots though, because it's *hilly*.

Hong Kong's Second Best Theme Park. Disneyland is clearly the best theme park but for older kids the thrill rides at Ocean Park which are lacking at Disneyland is certainly going to be a preference. It is a little tired but you will have a great day. Because much of it is on the side of a hill this is a bit of a problem for the elderly or anyone with mobility issues.
Breathtaking views. I took the crystal cable car down from the buddha and it was worth the price. You also don't have to wait in line for this one :)

A great park to visit. Actually it's 2 parks in 1. There is the huge Aquarium where you can see sharks and rays and the other places with animals. At the same time there are some really nice rides. On the other side of the mountain you will find all the rides and you can go by cable car or by train. Try both ways. If you bring kids, you will need a whole day here. If you go on the water slide, wear a raincoat, you WILL get wet. Later you can go directly to the park by subway, I think the station will open mid 2016. Or take the bus outside Admiralty station going to Ocean Park. Ride is 10,6HK$
Thrilling Rides. A must visit if you are in Hong Kong with the family. Love the rides and the cafe with a beautiful harbour view.

Must visit list in Hkg. If you are first time in Hkg then visit this place besides the others. Children or adults are recommended here. You can see the sea world version of Asia and by cable car could see the beach and harbor site of Hkg and a bit scary for alto phobia, fearing of heights.
Nice place to visit when you're bored. Nothing special, poor quality of everything and not a place for vegetarians.You can take a few nice pics of sharks, dolphins, and so on. Thats all.
Must visit. We took the 1st bus at 9.45am and it took about 20 mins from Central to Ocean Park. My daughter (13 year old) enjoyed the trill rides.

Nice But can be better. Ocean Park is the other attraction in HK apart from Disney Land. As the name suggests, unlike Disney which does not have live animals, the USP of Ocean park is the the recreation of habitats and the presence of animals. You could see sharks, seals, dolphins, penguins, bears, and other marine life in all its splendour. I some how could not understand why they need to keep rides in an "Ocean Park" as that was distracting from the main theme of getting to see Marine life.. Not that the rides were bad, but some of them were not for the faint hearted...I was not very impressed with the signage for directions and the the rather low number of customer service volunteers for support. Considering i visited during a busy holiday season, they needed to have more volunteers on the ground to help visitors. I was stuck on a couple of occasions where i had to seek directions, and then had to walk a long way back.all in all its definitely a must in any HK itinerary and worth the time and effort.How To reach: Reaching the park is pretty easy with Direct bus services from the park connecting to Admiralty and central stations on the MTR network.Traveler tips: suggestion would be to reach the park as soon as it opens, so that you could do all the themes before it closes.

Too strenuous and mismanaged. Although it has very good attractions line animal shows .. Roller coasters etc . But it's too spreaded out and they could have easily made escalates to go up and downLot and lot if walking So be prepared

Most go no matter what is your age!. This place can easily give you hours of fun! For all ages! Just remember not to go at weekends or holidays because it will be too crowded. Ice skating show is amazing!

Great park with lots to do and see. If you are visiting hong kong with kids or not, Ocean Park should definitely be on your todo list. To get the most out of the park you will need an entire day. The park has everything from roller coasters through to penguin & dolphin exhibits.

Good place for family. Worth the effort to get to Ocean Park.Plenty to do and see in the way of rides, definitely see the PandasBest to get there early as to avoid quenes which built up during the day.

If you have teens, you must visit this place.. I went on a Saturday, 26 Dec. The waiting times for rides were indicated outside each ride, averaging 30-60 mins. Bring disposable raincoats as there are 2 rides that will wet you. They sell disposable ones there at HK $40 each (S$8). If you bring your own, you'd save $7 on each coat . As I have 4 kids, there's a lot of savings.Another savings you can consider is eat at Macdonalds. the other foods costs roughly S$25 for roast pork rice with a drink. The sausage on a stick is S$8 each. Other than the high food costs, the attractions, rides and cable car ride is well worth the trip.

Fun, fresh air, view of the sea!. First thing first, food for Muslim there is only one booth available near the entrance in front of the souvenir shop. Since it's the only one with the Halal sign food booth available, it can be sold out pretty fast. I was buying one around 2pm and mostly are almost sold out. The food is OK for me but lack flavors(the chickens). Other than that, it's amazing! Fun rides, lots of ride actually with lesser queue to deal with. You can enjoy the rides or shows.

Ocean Park never fails to impress. Nice weather and on a non-peak day, Ocean Park is a must see must do place. Amazing rides, awesome exhibits, and very educational in regards to learning about the environment, animals, and conservation. Food choices are nice, from cheap eats to pricey. Must ride both the cable car and underground train, for whole different experiences. Cable car with its views and train with its speed! Be prepared for a fun day out!

Worth a visit . Suggest a gap of one day if you have visited Disney in HK . Good attractions but food could be better. Be prepared for long queues for top rides . Must try the polar express and the cable. Good for 9 year old boys but as mentioned keep a day or two gap between visit to Disney and ocean park.

Poor service. Very poor service.. Customer service standards seemed non-existent as this theme park. Sadly the majority of staff were not friendly, approachable or had a genuine interest in the hospitality of guests. There clearly is a customer service training gap that needs to be addressed Customer service issues aside; the rides, attractions and cleanliness of the park was equivalent to what we have enjoyed in many other theme parks worldwide. The fast track pass is highly recommended if you visit during peak times and are keen to avoid waiting 60 minutes per ride. A great day out, ensure you arrive early so you have enough time to cover the entire theme park!

If you don't do rides, don't go. We don't do rides so there was a lot of walking with no amusement. The dolphin show is doesn't compare to sea world, Gold Coast Australia. The panda's as beautiful as they are, seem manic, even demonic in there 4 wall habitats. The snub nose monkeys where beautiful and seems content. The aquariums beautiful, shops dominating each exit. Well maintained and lovely grounds. The cable car worth the effort. All in all was not bored but only needed a few hours. The tour with greys tours so stupid. Picked up at 7am went to 4 other hotels for pick up then they made you go to a jewellery factory, we left at 7am got to the park at 10.30am was furious. Check the hotels supplier before you confirm, it was easier to catch a taxi then go on the tour bus.

kids loved it. gorgeous views of southern HK island but over crowded and long lines. We got there as it opened and the kids loved the kiddie land rides, but as the afternoon passed and the crowds grew, we skipped a lot of the park and went home.

Great place to social with teenage friends. I went to OP with my friends for the Halloween's specials (several times haha). It was fun to go into a haunted house with your friends to experience how scary it was. The amusement rides in Ocean Park are a lot more exciting than those in Disneyland to me, but then the 2 theme parks are in 2 different themes so there can't be any direct comparison I guess. BTW, you should try Hair Raiser which is on the hill! It's thrilling A_A All in all I enjoyed my time in OP :)
Fun filled day!. We were able to see the Panda while feeding and also the penguins and seals while feeding. Awesome. Very clean park amazing views from the sky lift.

Ocean Park, Hong Kong. Was there on Christmas Eve. Very crowded, but managed to manoeuvre around. Exhibits were great, but the smell is well.... Fishy! The train ride up was good and the cable car ride down was awesome! Had late lunch at the Cafe and the price was not too bad compared to Disneyland. Queued up for about 45mins for the Arctic Ride. Worth the wait. Must have a look at the pandas!
