Long queues for boring rides; animals more interesting. We went on a weekday morning, so the queues for the rides weren't particularly long at first. However, the queues started to get longer in the afternoon.The rides weren't particularly interesting or worth the queuing time, however, the animal exhibits were interesting. One should definitely not miss the arctic fox enclosure and the aquarium.

Kids delight!. Personally i think this one is better than Disney, which is atrociously expensive. The rides a bigger, better and it has an amazing aquarium (with a large collection of sharks and sting rays) and a panda exhibit. Loved it!

Excellent facilities and helpful staff. Smooth, efficient, and the newer rides are brilliant. The older ones are a tad rattly! My fiancée had a broken leg in a moon boot, so we visited guest relations on arrival and they gave us a queue jump ticket with no quibble immediately. Great! Light show at night was really good and all the animal displays interesting and well laid out. I'd recommend getting there at opening time and getting the cable car straight up to the rides (great views en route) to have the best chance to avoid the crowds, then working your way back down to the animals. Don't miss the aquarium!

A whole day of fun for the whole family. We were there in March, visiting family. I barely remember going to ocean park as a child and wasn't sure about taking my kids. Decided to go here instead of Disney, and glad we did. It exceeded all my expectations! The amount of rides, the variety of animals, the conservation and education aspects were impressive. We spent all day there and didn't get to see everything. Definitely worth it.

Great exhibits but too crowded and a lot of queue cutting. We got our tickets from klook which would only cost 293 hkd vs 385 hkd for a regular ticket from OP's official website. We just showed our vouchers to the employee at the entrance, he then just scanned our vouchers then let us in. The exhibits were still as good as it was 10 years ago, and the animals look well taken care of. It was crowded (we went on Boxing day which also happens to be a Saturday) and the waiting time for the cable car alone was 1 hour, we wouldn't have minded the wait if the queues were well regulated but unfortunately there were specific groups (not just individuals) who kept on cutting the queues.

Most Scenic Roller Coaster rides. We reached and were allowed inside even before the Ocean Park opened and with prepaid tickets already, were among the first few to enjoy the impressive Cable Ride, which carried us across mountains and oceans, as soon as the Park officially opened. Two pairs of cable cars run both ways all the time. You could also capture full view of the entire Airport from the Cable Car. On the Return journey we took the Ocean Express, which has an interesting Submarine theme.The Roller Coaster rides at the Summit truly capture the essence of the beauty of this massive place and its scenic setting. You wished the roller coasters stopped for a moment to enjoy this sublime beauty. At the Summit, the rides/attractions are at various levels and corners. Signage/Orientation is little and confusing sometimes and unless you have the proper orientation you may end up walking a lot while you could have easily taken an Escalator nearby. Look for the nearest Escalator to save time and energy on walking. The Ocean Theatre itself has a brilliant setting. However, the Dolphin Show at the Ocean Theatre was dull and boring. The Jelly fish encounter was superb and an interesting see. We missed the Kaleidoscope Ice Spectacular, which we regret till date. However, we did see an Excellent Stunt performance at the Waterfront Plaza.A visit to the Ocean Park would be incomplete without seeing the Giant Pandas. We were lucky to spot a few of them. Vegetarian/Vegan food is a big concern while other food is way too expensive.

Excellent but a very long wait in the queues. excellent!!! the rides are awesome. the best rides are the flash, the abyss, the roller coasters, but don't enter the dragon ride as when it goes into a loop the handles of the seats hurt the ears. but the most beautiful ride at the ocean park was THE ABYSS..if you are a lover of rides don't miss the ABYSS. the view up the abyss was SIMPLY BREATHTAKING!!! never SEEN A view as this... keep it up ocean park :) but if you thing you can complete the full of ocean park in one day..FORGET IT... you need 2 full days.not to forget if going in vacations or on holidays spend the extra $150 and take a fast track pass along with the entry pass of ocean park, it saves time in a few rides and also saves time queueing for the cable car. expensive but good.

Hong Kongs best attraction. Does not get as much hype as Disney but has far greater attractions for nearly half the price. You even get a free cable car ride thrown in too. The are several sections, incuding aquariums, Panda Bears, Penguins, Dolphin shows, Sharks, Seals and a "tunnel aquarium" The rides are far too many to mention but they cater for those who love scary sppedy rides and the more sedate. The major attraction is the hair raiser which is a roller coaster on the edge of the mountain. There are also other roller coasters, and some unique rides. The park is huge and the only downfalls is that its virtually impossible to finish it in a day which means you have to either miss some of the attractions or buy another ticket the next day. However, they generally have fast moving queues with stipulated times. The MTR station is being built which means that travelling here will be even easier soon. An absolute must do for any visitor to Hong Kong

Kids loved it.. Recently travelled to HK. Was in Ocean Park. Would have repented if did`nt come. Great place. My kids (9,5) loved it more than Disneyland. Make sure to go to the summit first using cable car and come down using the express train. Lots of rides at the summit, mostly for older kids. The sea front is for smaller kids. Good for an entire day, but 2 days would be better. Lots of shows also, which cannot be covered in a day. Easy access using public transport. A must to visit, if you have kids.
a day well spent!. It's like an educational zoo cum aquarium cum amusement park. With a great cable car ride up to the summit offering fantastic view of Aberdeen. It's a great family day out!

Too many things to do. This park is loaded with things to do, from rides and carnival games to aquariums and theaters, the park has two main areas that are separated by a mountain and connected be cable cars and a tram. Try to go as soon as possible to try the main attractions without the long queues, and pay attention to the shows timings.
Excellent for a day. With or without kids. This is excellent place to spend a day if the weather is good, like it was in Dec when I went. The rides are fantastic and the zoo is also very nice.

Cable car ride is my highlight. Went on a weekday and the queues at most rides and attractions were manageable. I remembered the cable car ride 18 years back that it was nice and it is still the most enjoyable ride this trip. Park attendants were attentive too.

Surprisingly fun. We were told to come here by everyone we know who has visited HK. They were correct.By far, the red panda was our favorite. The giant pandas were pretty cool too.The view from the cable car is fantastic. It lets you get the lay of the land, and see how they built what are essentially two separate parks.We're not big roller coaster people, so we only did the mine train. Pretty tame compared to the other rides they have (at least by appearance). Food was decent, but expectedly expensive. The shark exhibit was OK, but more crowded than the rest of the place, and in a very narrow series of walkways that just got claustrophobic. The aquarium, however, was spectacular. We took the city bus (629) from Admiralty directly to the main gate. While there was a line, it is very efficient. Would STRONGLY recommend buying tickets before you get to the gate -- they are sold (at a discount) in the MTR station, just before you exit for the bus, and in the line at the bus (At full price). The MTR tickets are sold at about a $30HK discount (approx $4US), but with a wait that may make you want to pay full price just to avoid the line. (By the way, the MTR also sells discounted Disney tickets.)This was a pretty good way to ignore jet lag - we went on our first day here - and walked enough to fall asleep easily.

So amazing! . We had so much fun! We got the the priority wristbands to jump queues which for HK$150 I definitely recommend. The hill down to the ferris wheel and abyss is pretty grueling so avoid that if you're not in at least ok shape.Hairraiser is the best ride!
So much sea animals. Lots of sea animals there are pink Dolphins and I mean there colours are pink!!!!!!!!!???????????........u gonna go ther!!!

Fantastic Theme Park with rides, animals and other attractions - Need 2 full days!. Our family went to Ocean Park HK in late Nov 2014 and regret that we planned only 1 day for this massive theme park. It is usually lot crowded on holidays and weekends and since there are so many attractions and items to see.Families with young kids would be certainly needing 2 days to cover. Our family were thrilled with the many animals that we got to see and many of them for the 1st time - Panda, Red Panda, Seals in a show, Monkeys, Penguins and a separate Rain Forest area which had Capybara, Sloth, Pygmy Marmoset, Spider Monkey, Basilisk lizard, Toucans & Parakeets! Our family could not cover all areas and had completely missed the area where there were may kids rides including a giant ferris wheel. The cable-car queue was a almost a 1.5 to 2 hour wait, but the ride was quite scenic during its 20 odd minutes. The only thing that we didn't like was the smell of fried quids.

Plenty of fun. I won a Doraemon there!! Lots things going on. I love that cable car connecting the two sides, great view and pretty exciting. I will suggest to take the cable car one way and take the mountain train the other, to experience the differences. The cafe there is very special, cakes and breads are made into the shapes of different sea animals. And always go to see the panda first, avoid prolong waiting.

Park suitable for people with different interest. Unlike Disneyland, Ocean Park HK seems able to deliver more variety of activities that suitable for people with different interest. With 1 ticket price, you get to : a) visit different types of animal such as panda, arctic fox, penguin etc. b) ride on cable car that give you fantastic scenic viewc) ride on multiple roller coaster and thrilling ridesd) watch dolphin, sea lion performancee) aquarium with good collection of sea creaturewithin the permises, there's food booth along the way which sell pizza, fried chicken and there's McDonald outlet as well.One of the advise is to wear super comfy shoes with good support as there will be a lot of walking up and down the hill when you want to hop from one attraction to another.
Nice Theme Park. I spent a whole day there, the park have a great aquarium, panda museum, penguins, games and cable car. My family enjoy the trip so much.

Simply Super. It's one of the top tourist place in HK. Very big in size also one can't cover in full day. It has lots of swings for adults like hair raiser, Flash and others. It has rope way and tram attraction as well. No need to purchase separate ticket as you are in the park can do anything.One must take the experience of both the options....take tram to go to the ocean world and get back via ropeway or vice versa. Must attend the light and water show at 6.30pm. Sunday is a quite a rush day.The price of adult ticket is 345 hkd and for child 4-11 is 173 hkd.Drop down at Admiralty mtr, take Exit B and catch the Bus to Ocean park bus No 629, frequency is every 15 minutes.

Great day!. Spent the day at Ocean park today - December the 27th...was meant to be busy as but, thanks to a little drizzle it wasn't too busy. The rides were great and they are a little more scary because of the location of the park! I think more healthier options of food would be a good idea. Anyway, the ride lines were on average of 10 minutes. We didn't upgrade to the ticket express. It's an extra $175 on top of basic adult ticket, but we didn't need too. I can imagine that on a busier day, maybe you'd need to? Anyway, taxi from central is around $70hkd. Happy Ocean-Parking :)

Worth a Visit. My first and only other visit to Ocean Park was in 1997 when Hong Kong had not yet been turned back over to China. I only have a very vague recollection of that trip but somehow I don't recall the park being as massive at it seemed in this most recent visit. My family and I purchased discounted tickets online and it was well worth it as we managed to skip the queues at the ticket stalls. We took the 629 bus from Admiralty station on a Wednesday arriving at the bus terminal just past 10 AM. There was already a queue but it moved fast as the buses were plentiful and dispatch was quick. I expect on a weekend the picture may be different. In any case, the kids enjoyed the rides and attractions. We were not able to watch any of the shows on tap but still very much worthwhile despite this. The queues at the popular rides went up as high as 30 minutes but WiFi was free and available and you could while away the wait on your smartphone or tablet. Food was expensive, which was quite expected as with other theme parks. It was cloudy during our visit, which made conditions more pleasant and walking around less arduous. This was my one complaint in fact. Other theme parks usually have trains or cable cars that connect the major sites in the park. Ocean Park did have this but only between the entrance and the Summit areas, where you can take either the Ocean Express train or the Cable Car. But the wide expanse of areas even at the Summit alone proved quite difficult to walk particularly those areas that required either a climb up or down lengths of stairs. Had it been a hotter day than it was, then I don't think it would have been a pleasant visit. I suppose the park can think up ways on how to facilitate movement of people between the various themed areas that will not unduly impact the look and feel of the park.

Don't waste your money. Avoid!. The Ocean Park is a poor cousin of HK Disneyland. It's tacky, poorly designed, and they service is sub-par. None of the rides have English announcements. People jostle and push each other as you walk around the aquarium. We went here because it was one of the premium attractions included in the iVenture pass. Had I paid separately for entrance I would have been very disappointed. Avoid, especially if you have been to a Sea World type attraction in Australia or the US.

Amazing place for kids and adults. We went here towards the end of our trip and wished we had come earlier! Absolutely loved all the rides and attractions. Bought several souvenirs at reasonable prices for friends back home.
Adrenaline rush!!. You should try their rides. One i recommend is the flash, hair raiser, dragon and the mine. It was sooo good. If you want thrill, you should try it 😁✌🏻️

Light & Water Show at 7pm. We took mrt from TST station to Admiralty ( only 1 stop ) about 4min. From admiralty we walked to Exit B, then took the double dekker bus citybus no 629 direct to Ocean Park only 25min from Admiralty mrt station. There are 2 sides at Ocean Park, the summit and the children area ( I forget the name ). When arrived at Ocean Park, we took cable car to the summit first ( the attraction is suitable for teenager such as rollercoaster, mine train, etc ). We took express ocean train back to the main entrance ( children area ). There is big christmas tree and colourful light at night. Best for photo side. We saw the symbio water n light show ( dancing water ) near the main entrance at 7pm. Only 15min show.

Had an unpleasant experience. Was quite enjoying Ocean Park until I made the gigantic mistake of going on the water ride. Signs said you "may" get wet. Hmm. It was a cool winters day and I was absolutely drenched to the point of utter discomfort. I was shaking with cold and there was nowhere to dry off - there was one small dryer in the nearby toilet, one of those automatic ones that turn itself off every couple of seconds - ANNOYING. Only other dryers were the ones you put your hands in and out of; found one in a parents room, locked the door and spent nearly an hour putting my jeans and coat in and out to get them dry enough to wear (the air being blown out was COLD so it took ages!). Imagine this to be almost a passable ride on a hot day (though still not sure what is entertaining about sitting in a big tube whilst water is squirted right at you) but in winter it was just horrid. It was enough to ruin my day and turn me off Ocean Park full-stop. My son enjoyed himself and it was not an expensive day out by theme park standards. Good assortment of infant rides/entertainment available and we didn't need to queue at any stage as it was so quiet. Cable car is great though a little hair-raising if you don't like heights; express train back was a bit of fun.

Whoa! Awesome!. Awesome place to visit and enjoy. The place is large, not enough to visit all the amenities of the park. One can wonder about the architectures inside. I truly appreciate the idea behind of being one with nature. A park that promotes the welfare of the environment especially of the ocean. Perfect place for family bonding, picnic. Don't forget to bring extra clothes when riding the Rapids I highly recommend this place to visit and will be included as part of their itenerary whenever one plans to visit Hong Kong (of course, aside from doing shopping)

Best place to visit with Family. You'll find some adrenaline rush rides inside the park but make sure that all water rides and normal rides are functioning before you visit this place. When we visited this place all water rides are closed except 2 of them. Don't miss dolphin show and rare collection of fishes inside the park. Don't miss the Pandas and sea lion walrus. You need to carry that map till you leave the place because of the vast area. It will take time to reach the fun ride area on the top of the hill if you go by rope-way, but it is fun to ride in it for 10-15 mins. Fastest way to reach the top of the hill is train. Food is definitely not up to the mark. Don't miss your passports or children in those areas because it's tough to find them. Once you visit an area, try to cover the ride in that area because you might not be able to visit that area again.

Good Attraction for Teenagers. I went to this place as i heard that it is better than HK Disneyland. True enough, my teenage daughter really enjoy herself on riding all the attraction here. It is well maintained, and cool atmosphere during december makes it enjoyable. The only backdraw is the hilly place, so it really takes time to move around as we have to walk quite far and lots of stairs to climb. Make sure you wear comfortable shoes, and you are fit to go around !
Fun!. The Ocean Park may be old but the attractions are still fun. It is complete and offers various attractions. I also like that we don't have to wait in long lines just to try the rides.

Good effort, but the old park is showing age. It's my third time visiting the park over many years, and I would say it has improved much since my last visit. The aquarium is good, rides are too and there's now a younger kids play area. But having just come from Disneyland, Ocean Park is comparatively much sleepier. The attitude is rather casual, though better than in Disneyland. Shows were not quite polished, mainly leaving it to the animals and trainers to charm (if they feel like it).Rides are a lot more exciting than Disneyland's, so would appeal more to older kids and adults who don't care about cartoon characters. Wished they were able to improve capacity to tackle the long queues, even on weekdays. Park is only open to 7pm so there are only that many rides and shows you can take in one visit.

Must visit for full day of fun. Very nice park. Recommended for friend, families, and there are lots of things to do for all ages and groups. Weather was perfect. You can spend all day and have lots of fun. Its kind of zoo, fun city, and place were you can enjoy the nice view of whole hong kong . Try to get online ticket from the hotel or online as they offer discounts and avoid queuing. Recommended

Nice theme park and zoo. Beter then hk Disney land . Nice attractions , Nice location in THE hills , panda bears in real . Travel from THE highest attractions back down by cable car . All For one price .

Local's theme park. If Disneyland is not your thing, perhaps this one does. It's a local with their passion with everything related to the ocean. The animals, shows, decor are all about the sea creatures. There are indoor and outdoor sites, bigger than disneyland and of course the souvenirs and foods are cheaper here. I read that there's review about the rude staff. Well they aren't as friendly as this is still Hong Kong afterall. A food stall staff ask me question with vert funny accent, and he just kept repeating with louder and louder voice with the exact same accent. Dude, I'm not deaf, it's your accent. Apart from that, there's this huge crowd of tourists from the mainland China who are really loud, doesn't seems like understand or know simple basic courtesy as in queing, how to use public restroom (flush please), or even walk without hitting anyone on your way.apart from that, the theme park itself got potential with its own 'local' charm. I do recommend the cable car. Kids love to see the big aquarium with jelly fish, sting rays, sharks and all. They especially love the dolphins.

Always fun. Been there about 5-6 times but its always been an amazing experience. A must visit for thrill seekers. Love the cable car ride with all the awesome view. Can't wait to visit again. Hong Kong is the best!
9/10 - Very good!. I love the oceanarium, it's perfect for family trips! Although I am afraid of heights, I survived the long cable car! Ahhh lol!

Excellent area for adventure!. I won't forget the long walks going from different areas but it is all worth it. The rides were perfect for me as an adventure seeker. The Abyss, The Hair Raiser, etc.. I probably won't forget most of my experiences here. And to think that many development was going on that time, I will not be surprised if it becomes more popular and one of the top destinations in Hong Kong.

Theme park with animals! Perfect combo!. I like the fact that there are animals in this awesome park. I particularly love animals and going here and seeing a wide variety of animals makes me really happy. I also loved the various rides Ocean Park offered as it were really close to nature and were unique. Even though I'm really scared of heights, I enjoyed the cable car. The transpo from the 1st park to 2nd. There were extreme rides that I tried and these were really cool. I highly recommend for you to visit Ocean Park

Rude staff!. The staff for Kaleidoscope Ice Spectecular to be precise during the 6.30PM show were rude and disrespectful. After the performance they allow some audiences to take photos with the performers and stop the queue when it came to a limit. We were in the queue unfortunately one of our kid was not allowed to join the queue due to the numbers of person allowed had reached the limit..well understood. What surprised me was the attitude of the staff handling this matter in a rude manner. They shouted to the kid not to join the queue in bad manner. Why did they behave badly to such a young kid? Can't they talk politely as they are in the customer service line and need to be good to customer no matter what. We paid the for the ticket and that pays their salary...why were the staff behaved arrogantly to customers? If they were tired..they should have not show it to customers. I hope the management will look into this matter and train the staff again to serve customers better in future. Eventhough we had good time with the rides, I was pissed off with the staff and they had spoiled my day at Ocean Park....the theme park with rude staff!!

Ocean park fun Day. It was a good day. We saw the dolphin/sea otter show, the symbio show and the ice rink show. The ice show is unexpectedly amazing, the roller coasters are pretty good too. The cable car was a fun ride if you are short in time take the ocean express back. There are some cute Christmas activities all around because it's December. We went on a Monday and lines weren't too long. Stay for the symbio show at 7 pm! It's worth it.

A Must visit for fun/thrill/nature lovers. A fun place to visit which will take more than a day to cover ..amazing thrill rides at par with best thrill parks of the world ..cable car ride gives breathtaking views..

Ocean park . A must visit spot in HK. River rafting was a splendid moment for me and my family. We went uphill by train and came down by cable car. ... awesome views of mountain and sea from cable car. ... strongly recommended. ... one of the best cable cars. Views from the ocean tower were worth seeing. .. beyond imagination. Dolphin was good but not as good as one in Thailand ocean world. .

So much fun for an amusement park!. We all enjoyed this! There are rides for all ages, and so many animal exhibits and shows we are going for day two sometime during out visit. The ride on the tram would have been enough to bring me back.Try the bbq squid, it's delish!!

A Pleasant Day. Ocean Park turned out to be better than we expected. Although swarmed with tourists it didn't feel as tight and crowded as other theme parks.
We thoroughly enjoyed our trip to OP.
The one thing that sort of let us down a little bit was the ridiculous prices of the food and drinks.

The cable car is a must do! . Ride the cable car! Enjoy traveling up a mountain as you get a spectacular view of the South China Sea!
Go to the aquarium to get out of the heat.
See the pandas.
Everything else is what you'd expect from a theme park.
Superb time. HongKong is incomplete without going to ocean park. It's the best park I have been yet. The panaromic amazing view welcoming you to the world of entertainment.

Great day than expected. I've read reviews and articles that place Ocean Park in the 'not-worth-going-list'; but my experience proves them wrong. The park is huge, filled with activities that suit all ages - from toddler/children rides to sanctuaries of animals for the reserved ones. Although an adjustment of more friendly and passionate workers would make the park more comforting. Overall, its worth it.
Good times!. We had great time... Gondola was the highlight of our visit never thought will see so many rides it was great fun with kids!

Good variety for the whole family.. A good park all round. I was looking for a good roller coaster and found it. Maybe not the worlds greatest but was well worth the trip. Taxi from HK island was under $100HK one way. Entrance fee was reasonably priced. You can purchase a fast teach ticket for some rides at $150HK or use it to pass the queue in exit. Have a great day!

Bring out the kid in you . Worth the visit.. so much to see.. especially with young kids .. visiting the panda was a delight.. the dolphin and sea lion show was a delight. . Make sure you spare a full day to enjoy the whole park..
Fun+Adventure!. This place definitely requires a full day to be explored fully. Plenty of attractions and thrilling rides with great food.

Wonderful - But Not that Stroller Friendly!. I was expecting a rather dated, old park, but instead I was impressed with how large and well-organized it was, and how many activities they had that catered to children of different ages. HK Disneyland may have taken some of the thunder from this old favorite, but this made the experience more enjoyable as there were no queues at all for any of the rides, and my toddler went repeatedly on all the rides in Whiskers Harbour, the area for small kids. I do have to say though, that because it is an old park, it is not THAT stroller friendly. There were parts like, embarking the cable car, that we had to carry and fold the stroller, then getting out there was a flight of steps (about 15-20 steps) where there was no way up but to carry the stroller up! Also trying to get into the theatre, oh my - steps, steps, steps… there is wheelchair access but you do sometimes have to take the (very) long route around. And if you decide to go down to the waterfront (where the big ferris feel and viking ship are located)… be prepared for the walk back UP… with a 20kg toddler in a stroller pushing back uphill, I nearly expired! You can take the "Ocean Train" as an alternative to the cable car, but its really just a train (with TVs on top that play images of the sea to make you feel like you are underwater… meh) … the cable car is much nicer, but steps everywhere. Still, overall we really enjoyed this! A very different experience for HK Disneyland, but really lovely with oceanfront scenery.

Not a fan. I wasn't amazed when I came here , probably because I see that the animals are stress. Few fishes only. Nothing really spectacular , I do like the Panda ,a very beautiful creature. I am sad seeing the dolphins and the sea lion doing some stunts to entertain people. Maybe it is not for me.

Be there early.. After 8 years, my teens were looking forward to some rides (the roller coaster at the other end, not the one at the summit) and taking the long escalator down and were disappointed. Signages for the train down were not explicit enough from the closed-down escalator and the jostling for the train were not well controlled especially from the tour groups. The Summit and the Shark enclosure were something new but more for kids whilst the Panda and Crocodile Marsh was better for viewing the Pandas feeding on bamboo leaves, as opposed to the other enclosure where we could not see them as they were inside the resting enclosure, except for the lively monkeys. They should have more seating at the Chicken outlet as these were shared with those that had Macs. Do get there by 10am before the busses with tour groups arrive.If you have younger kids, they would enjoy and be happier at Disney!
Long queues even on quiet day. The queues were way too long even though we were there on an extremely quiet day. The park has no nice food.

Asian version of Sea World/Disneyland hybrid. I recently went to Ocean Park with my son and his girlfriend. Getting there was a little tricky. We took a fast bus but didn't realize that you have to request the stop. We ended up backtracking several blocks with the help of a cellphone map app. There are two basic parts to the park. Be sure to get a map (there are Chinese and English versions). Near the entrance is a nice fountain display. On the lower section there is an aquarium which is okay but limited. Next to the aquarium is a panda exhibit but they were all inside. There is a better display in the exhibit "Amazing Asian Animals". Avoid the "Emerald Trail. There is really not much to see and you keep coming to "staff only" roadblocks. I always like a carousel, but the line was long for the one in Aqua City and the ride was about 1- 1 1/2 minutes.We took the cable car to the other side of the park - rather intimidating but good views of the harbor (not so good if you don't like heights). The Terrace Cafe was a nice place to stop after the cable ride. Food portions were huge. The top was broken into several sections, each interesting. The thrill rides are here, but there are also some great animal exhibits and the carnival type games. The dolphin show was good, but not like Sea World. Go before the last show, as it is not easy to see when it is getting darker. Plan on spending the majority of the day in the upper section of the park. Then be sure to leave in plenty of time to see the evening light show in the lower park section. (We left the upper part a little late so missed most of it). Take a taxi back, It is much easier.

A great day out..but be ready to rush. Well you do have to rush if you want to experience everything....which my 12 years old insisted and endeavoured. It is a fun filled park with lot of attractions and shows, made more interesting with a funicular and a cable-car for traveling between the two zones. We enjoyed it more than Hong Kong Disneyland. Plus points:  Only 20-25 mins bus ride if you are in Hong Kong island. Good bus connectivity. Ease of purchasing tickets.Enjoyable. Family friendly. Has something for all ages. Adequate signage. Value for money. Permits carrying of own foodMinuses : It is spread out over a large area so be prepared to walk. You will be rushing against timeExtremely crowded due to group tours from Mainland China. So be prepared for loooonnng queues, pushing and jostling at times to the point of being rude.Most of the shows were in Chinese.Random Tips : 1. Take the bus from the bus stand adjacent to Admirality MRT Station Exit B. You can buy park tickets alongwith return bus tickets to avoid queues at the Park. The bus accepts Octopus Card for the bus fare. The bus drop and pickup point is right in front of the Park gate.2. Start early if you want to experience all the attractions in ONE DAY. Some deft planning is required to keep with the schedule. USE THE PARK MAP AND SHOW SCHEDULE. We were at the gates at opening time but still could not finish all the attractions.3. Avoid weekends/ holidays at all cost. You may land up spending half the day standing in queues.4. Do not miss the Dolphin and the Sea Lion show.5. Stay till the end to experience the amazing SYMBIO, the dancing musical fountain with fireworks and other light effects. It is worth the wait.6. Do one way by the funicular and the other by cable-car.7. Lot of photo opportunity at the hill tops. Do carry your camera.8. IF YOU ARE FORCED TO PUSH AND JOSTLE....BE FIRM AND HOLD YOUR POSITION..else you may remain rooted to the same place all day long.Enjoy it because it is enjoyable. Have a fun filled day....

Just an experience . Went there w high expectation but rather disappointed esp. the dolphin show n sea.lion show. Im sure they can do better than this. Such huge park n so many tourists come from all over the world to enjoy the park but they didnt put up a good show. Sigh....singapore has better dolphin show. The kaleidoscope show was too long n too boring also. Probably time to reflect n review their programs. What i like most is the food n reasonable prices at Mcdonald. At least they dont over charge too much. The souvenirs are at reasonable prices compared to disneyland.

Will be back! #FUN. I went with 3 of my girlfriends. We were bless by the chilling weather and there wasn't a lot waiting time for the rides as we went on a weekday.Would recommend tourist to visit this attraction Ocean Park, though there's really a lot of china people. Have Fun!

Fun filled day. Ocean park is really fun. U can look at the sea animals like seal, dophin ,walrus, jellyfish... & panda, koala bear & kangaroo ... & at the same time enjoy all the exciting rides. The view from the cable car is spectacular too. Really enjoyed myself. Will definitely go again if I go HK .

Not that good. After i go to disney, ocean park became not that fun. I only play 3 rides. No shopping. So many china tourist that dont want to waiting in line.. not recomended for couples.. just go here to enjoy with your kids.

One of the best Theme Parks in the world. Ocean Park is a fairly big themepark located on the south part of HK Island. It's basically divided in to two parts with one of the parts located on top of the mountain. There's plenty of different attractions for young and old, a big collection of animals including panda's and sharks (don't forget the cool jellyfish display). The ferriswheel provides you with a great view! The only downside is that it can be very crowded and that it's hard to get into the cable car. Best to go on a weekday, not during the weekends or holidays. They have plenty of shows too so you might need two days to see all.

Ocean Park with terrible China People. The theme park itself is fun. But not the people, those china mainlanders. Very uncivilised. Cut queues. Rowdy, pushing people. They are like monkeys escaped from a cage. gosh! Food is overpriced. And the stall open late. There is only 1 halal food stall available there. So food might be seasonal.

A treat for the whole family - something for everyone!. Having visited Disneyland many times before, we decided to give Ocean Park a try. And as a family, we all agreed it was definitely worth it! Bigger spaces, more attractions and different types of entertainment for all ages. As I have a kid who was too young for the regular rides, having a designated area for smaller kids was a blast! The numerous animal attractions also catered to the adults' interest. Although this is an older amusement park, it is very well-maintained. Many of the Hong Kong cultural overtones also made it interesting for foreign tourists like us. The whole family agreed we will definotely come for another visit the next time we visit Hong Kong! If there is one gripe, we felt the souvenirs/ memorabilia could have been a little cuter but that was not much of a problem

Not worth any penny. The park doesn't have many attractions for and start and for someone who has been to many many parks this one was boring and not trilling at all. The people were super ghetto and annoying. The park were full of mainland chinese people who have no manners and cut queues and push people and step on you and don't even apologise. I left there pissed and I'm never ever going to ocean park ever again. The food was terrible and disgusting (I know not to expect a lot from theme parks but the food there was unbearable).
great place to spend a day with rides and animals. great place to spend a day with rides and animals .. reach on time to enjoy all the sections of ocean park

Go on a weekday!. Got in early on a weekday to celebrate my sons 2nd birthday. Much nicer without the weekend crowds.The animal exhibits are very good for the kids - pandas and aquarium were the highlights although we didn't see everything before our son had to nap.Well worth getting the annual pass if you live in HK.

A Tourist Must See Site for All Ages. I have to admit it has been a few years since I last visited this attraction.I was thoroughly impressed with how friendly and how well the animals were looked after.The only mistake I made was not planning the shows and attractions to see. If I visited again I will make sure that to plan ahead and get there as soon as the doors open to make the most of the day. I went on a weekday so it was not as busy (I was informed).The staff were really friendly and helpful. There was plenty of toilet facilities for family with children. Lots of souvenir shops, beware for the shopping lovers paradisoMake sure you stay for the end of the day fireworks show, I missed part of the beginning and there were crowds of people everywhere so could not see all of it properly but I still thoroughly enjoyed it much the same. Fantastic and definitely worth the money

Great Day Out. Wife thought that this was better than Disney. Gotta say I certainly appreciated the smaller lines. Big hit for the family wa seeing the walruses playing around - made everyone around us laugh :-)

One of my favorite place in Hong Kong. I love Ocean park and I visited here almost 10 times in the past 20 years. I would like to introduce this attraction to everybody as this place really worth to go when you come to Hong Kong.

The Perfect Toddler Visit to Ocean Park. My son and I frequently visited Ocean Park during the weekdays to avoid lines and to visit as many toddler-friendly locations before his afternoon nap. We arrived at 10:00 when it opened and went immediately to the train that takes you up to the mountain. (This part might not open until 10:30) Since everyone gets busy taking pictures by the front gate and trying to ride the gondolas up the mountain, you bypass everyone to enjoy the animal exhibits up top (bring a jacket for the penguin exhibit). After spending the morning in the upper section, take the gondola down the mountain before lunch when no one is going that direction. Lunch options are quite limited but I found the Chinese food court near the train station at the base of the mountain to be decent. Spend the afternoon at the bottom portion where there is a great playground area for the toddlers and a few toddler-friendly rides. Bring serious bugspray if you wear shorts since the Hong Kong sand fleas are rampant in the playground area.

One full day of Fun & thrill. went with family, had long ques but was worth it, all the rides were fun, the view that some rides give are amazing, specially with family it is a one full day of thrill and fun. would recommend taking your own food for vegetarians.

More than what i have expected. This is my first visit to ocean park after few times of visits to hong kong. I love this place very much. I love seeing all those sea lion, penguins, jelly fish, fox, sharks and etc. Overall all the attractions and rides are still acceptable. I have spent one whole day there and have a lot of fun there also. While playing the rides, you will able to see the nice view with excitement feeling. I like taking the cable car up to the another attraction park. Along the way up, you can relax and enjoy the view quietly.
Great for the teens. This is a excellent theme park with a very stretched cable car system. This theme park is harder to get to than Disneyland.

Great surprise. My partner and I literally discovered this place by accident after seeing a picture of some pandas on a tourist map of Hong Kong! Was a great surprise with some really good rides and the day we went there was not very long waits for them. The cable car ride and roller coaster were the highlights. Worth a visit

Great!. We loved the Sky Cable Ride! It's like Ocean Park, Zoo all mashed up into one. We spent the whole day there and it was great.We loved the shows. We also loved the Water Fountain show at the end of the night. I'm not sure if they do it every day.
This is serious fun. This is serious fun. Most impressive cable car ride and attractions. Easy to get to from central on the bus.

Value for money.. Bought tickets through Klook for about $54 AUD.Visited on a Monday so crowds very tolerable.I had read lots of reviews and were surprised by the lack of pushy tourists,short lines for rides and multiple places to sit.The food was even tolerable!My 2 teens had about 10 rides each on the Flash and Hair Raisedr which they loved.We didn't look at many animals except for Panda.The ice- skating show is out of this world and worth the admission alone.

reasonably priced theme park. Easily accessible with public bus. Near the city. compared to disneyland its a very reasonably priced theme park with many rides up and down the hill. As expected food is often bad and over priced in theme parks. The cable cars is a must try very scenic view.

Interesting experience, many attractions at one place. We reached the park at 1020am, managed to get entry tickets smoothly. We started with cable car ride up the summit, view were really good. We also managed to see panda bears, koala bears and many many others. Happy that there were many attractions under one roof. We stayed there till the closing and catch the firework and light display at night. Overall very good experience.

Fun! Fun! FUN!!. We wet there in the morning so that we can go on all of the rides (since theres just so much people going everyday) and we had a blast! The rides were fun and just kept my heart pumping! but there are also some rides thats for children and small parks where you can see animals and also a show with some aquatic animals! Time flew by so fast and we had to go :( But we can't wait to go back when we can

Sooo crowded!. We got there at morning opening with pre purchased tickets in midweek in early november. Already there were buses of pushy Chinese tourists who just ran like crazy things when gates opened. We went to see the Pandas on the lower area first. This was good as they were awake and active and we pretty much had them to ourselves whilst the hordes ran to the cable car. We caught the nemo train up to the rides and this was easy. The park is lovely and the shows and exhibits are great but my teenagers just got 2 rides the entire day due to the long waiting times. We also found the areas near the summit confusing. Lots of walking up and down steep hills to access areas. Not fun on a hot day. The park was great but crowd control and signage and better accessibility to the summit attractions with the addition of a mini train or people mover, needs to learn a lesson or 2 from the Disney people.

Fun park. Went to ocean park with 2 adults and 2 teenage kids. Unfortunately it rained heavily on the day of our visit which closed some rides, but still a fun day of activities. The gondola ride gives great views and is a fun way to get to the top of the park.

Height of ectasy. Right from the way you reach to the ride over the mountain by cable, to the ocean of beings under water to gaze through glasses to the top of the mountain ride and finally the tunnel train run you cant expect better. A sort of visiting all planets in one day

Experience of a life time. We started off with the cabe cart ride which was amazing, view is stunning and worth the wait in line.We are fans of water life so to see different mammals and fish so up close was amazing. We were very lucky to be chosen to be part of the sea lions show where we could show them commands such as wave and sing which they did so after that i was high on experience and loved everything else i saw. Pandas did not feel like being seen so sadly did not see much of them.There is also train possibility between areas but You won't be seeing anything during that ride so i do recommend to take cable carts only.

Best park in the world. It is a must place to visit and spend one day here. Your children will be very happy n learn a lot from various ocean animals n birds.With hkid you can have free entrance on your bday.

Worth every Penny visit. So much to do but so little time....;)You have to really start off the day early in order to go through all the Park's attractions and clearly time is really a scarcity commodity in this huge park.

Educational & Exciting Theme Park. Every Hong Kong people and tourists has a good memory in Ocean Park. Not only see lovely animals such as giant pandas, but also meet the cute sea animals and enjoy the good show in Ocean Theatre. The children & adults can learn more acknowledgement there.Young people love having the exciting rides on the highland site in Ocean Park. Of cause little children can have other rides on the lowland site there. They also enjoy having a scared experience in Octobers. It is the best event at Halloween.

A theme park that is value for money!. Initially I was not keen to bring my 2 kids of 6 and 8 years old to this theme park but decided that we gave it a try, I did not regret my decision as the park was really enjoyable . The park was 3 in 1 - zoo, rides and aquarium. The bus service from Admiralty MTR to the park was very frequent and could take in many passengers as it was a double decker. We went on a Monday so it was not that crowded. I thought we could cover everything by 3 pm but there was so much to see that we only left at 5.30pm.I would highly recommend this park to families with young kids!

Lovely day out. We loved Ocean Park, it was a great day out for us, we travelled as 3 adults and 1 4 year old, it was a great day, the separate little villages were great, the aquarium bit was really popular as was the cable cars.... if you like heights! if not maybe give that bit a miss... what a lovely day out.... would definitely visit again, and better value than Disney!

Could have been better. Visited with 2 teenage kids. Enjoyed both the numerous ride attractions as well as the aquarium n panda exhibits which offer both thrills and knowledge in one single theme park setting. Only wished there were more signages directing visitors to the attractions and also better positioned posters/signs advising visitors about closed/under repair attractions. My family trekked a good way downhill before learning that the Adventure Land zone had been closed for upgrading. Also, could've installed notice boards that depict waiting times for the various attractions at central locations to help visitors plan better during the visit.
Great day out. Great for all ages, it's not all about the rides but everything else you see as well. You get in free on your birthday too!

Worth a visit. We had to choose between a day trip to Macau or Ocean Park and we didn''t regret going for this. This is a good place with a mix of action rides, animal zoo and aquarium, etc. Most of the rides are not suitable for small kids hence my elder daughter enjoyed it. And the Panda, aquarium and some small rides for kids were enjoyed by my younger daughter. This is a huge place and needs a lot of walking. If you have small kids do rent a stroller. It may become difficult otherwise. The park has a website and I suggest one should book online tisane time. There is a cable car ride and ocean express to travel between to parts of the park. We used both of them on our return trip. It's a good experience and not to be missed. The attractions are scattered and one needs to walk a lot. If you want to enjoy all rides you may need 2 days (considering the long queues) here. We spent only a day here.The park is open with very little shade at places hence caps/hats are must. It was also very hot during our visit.

4 DAYS 3 NIGHTS FEBRUARY 1986. It was Chinese New Year, a cold season. We are landed at Kai Tak International Airport (now Hong Kong International Airport Chek Lap Kok Airport). Me including my eldest son together with my husband who were attended course with airline including my colleague & her sister. While my husband was attending course, we managed to go to Ocean Park using cable car. Quite amazing though a bit scary as our first time going by cable car to go to Ocean Park. We managed to go up the hill of the Ocean Park & a lot of people or tourists. We wanted to go by bus by using the escalator (that time was the longest escalator in the world - correct me if I am wrong). But because we arrived not the right time to go by bus due to schedule time is a bit later, so we have to go back by cable car which was safely arrived at the end. Good bargains for leather products. Good people & nice shops. My husband have to attend airline course & stayed a few days than us.

Ocean Park, Hong Kong. Went to Ocean Park in December on a Friday. It was not too crowded, and there was lots to do. Not only was it fun (some of the roller coasters were hair raisers!), but it was educational as well. The cable cars gave a great view.Really enjoyed our day here, would visit again.

Thrilling!. Hongkong visit is not completed with out a day at Ocean Park. We finished of with the cable ride which made the adreline rush. My younger boy was a bit upset that he couldn't get to enter due to height. Disney was more generous in this regards. A high heeled shoe could have helped in some :). Over all great enjoyment.
Ocean park. we were there for one day. but it also be considered a two day for those who want to have fun at all the rides and themes activity.plenty to eat and enjoy !!

Enjoying the beautiful sea views from atop the Ocean Park Tower. A must-do while being in the Ocean Park is to take the Ocean Park Tower. It takes passengers up 72 metres. The viewing room is slowly rotating in 360 degrees and we can have breathtaking views of sea and sky - the town of Aberdeen, Aberdeen Typhoon Shelter, nearby outlying islands, the South China Sea etc.

Ocean Park. We were on transit in Hong Kong from Taipei to Singapore. As we had been to Disneyland before, so this trip I suggested to my kids to go Ocean Park. It was such a huge disappointment. There place was rather crowded. It started to rain heavily when we are there. There's not much we can do as we don't have umbrella and raincoat with us. I was thinking of buying raincoats but not able to get one as we are not near any of the gift shops. Actually we are at one of the water attractions, taking shelter. I thought those water attractions will sell raincoats but there is none. As the rain doesn't seem going to stop, we moved off when it was drizzling. As my kids were hungry, we stopped by a nearby café. We were shocked at the price of the snacks, they were so expensive. 5 pieces of mid wings, french fries and soft drink cost HK$105 (S$23). As the weather was so cold, we wanted to change the drink to hot drink, there was none. Really ridiculous.The staff in the park there were not helpful too. I find them rather rude in their attitude. As the weather or wind conditions not favourable, cable car was not available.Since the rain not going to stop soon and we are feeling wet and cold. We decided to head back to the hotel. We need to take a cab back to the hotel.The queue was rather long and not many taxi available. We waited for over an hour to get a taxi.Quite disappointed with HK this time round. I would say that it is not worth to make a trip to Ocean Park.

Day trip. Ocean Park was really fun, and since it's just a short cab ride (approx 10mins) from causeway bay it's really accessible. I'd recommend visiting during the week in the mornings instead of the weekend or afternoons to avoid massive crowds. I went beginning of Dec, so weather was awesome; cool but yet sunny. The wait for rides were relatively short (15mins wait max), but watch out for folks trying to barge their way in front of you! Pretty fun rides but they all ended a bit too quickly for my liking. Do remember to bring sun blocks, hats, etc coz u will get sunburnt!!

Prefer Disneyland. The park is HUGE!!!!!!We took ocean express to beat the queue at the cable car station, and reached the summit in no time. We bypassed all the rides as we wanted to explore Marine World before watching Ocean Wonders. To our surprise, we were blocked at the Marine World entrance. We were told to wait until 11am (whereas website opening hour for the Marine Park attractions were 10.30am).We were happy to see that the animals in Ocean Wonders show had a gigantic pool to swim in, larger than some of the other aquatic pools in other countries. However, our view was partially obscured by audience who were holding up umbrellas to shield themselves from the sun's rays. Whilst the animal performance was good, the storyline was weak and not entertaining. We thought that Farglory Ocean Park in Hualien (Taiwan) did a better job in keeping audience amused with anecdotes and jokes.The rides in the park were not designed with young kids in mind. Most have a height restriction and hence my younger son could only participate in game stalls. My older daughter was slightly above the height restriction but we felt that some of the rides were dangerous for petite-sized kids and I feared she would slip under the bars, particularly Rev Booster. Perhaps they ought to review and increase the height requirement further. Or maybe learn from Disneyland, where staff would advise the child to sit inside and the adult outside so that the adult doesn't squash the child when the ride is moving.As others have pointed out, the park is huge and the rides are spaced far apart. We had to walk long distances to reach one ride after another, and sometimes it makes me wonder if I have walked in the wrong direction. A little pre-planning and good map reading skills would have helped.What we really liked were the scenic views from various lookouts. Something that not all parks have.

Day out for 350HKD. Quite expensive for what it is. Not a lot of challenging attractions. More for less experienced and less adrenaline driven people. Awesome animal cages though. Underwater world is boring except for being under the aquarium. Waited 1 1/2 hours for watershow which then got cancelled when it should have started. Mildly angry at that

It has a Great view and Lots of activities. If you want to go in the exciting part ocean park you have to cross mountain! But you can ride in a cable car if you are not so afraid of heights but you are not so Brave you can pass under the mountain by riding train. A must go ride is The Abyss having 185 FOOT!! but the rest was kinda scary but its a must go. And also The Flash.

Park that caters for diverse groups but lots of walking required. Just been to Ocean Park with my family. Ocean Park is divided into 3 Sections with 2 on the hill. It is largely commercialised with several gifts shops and photo stops all over.
Rides are largely for the adventurous. Lots of walking around to be expected. Confusing sign boards just add on to the challenge.

More Suitable for Tennagers and/or Adults.. Most of the rides at ocean park are quite scary for children and/or babies. Ocean Park is also quite cold if you go there in December, as it is near the mountains. If you are traveling with young children/babies, go to Disneyland as the rides there are more suitable for them.

Better then disney. I would recommend this for all people young and old. There's something here for everyone and if you a group of older travellers this is much better then Disney. There is a mix of rides and roller coasters for all ages which is great and the animals are also awesome. The cable car up or down is worth the trip though you probably don't need to do it both ways unless you really enjoy it and have time. The pandas are super cute and prepare to get wet on the Rapids.Also super easy to get to on the bus as mentioned in the other reviews.

2nd visit after 26 years. I wanted to revisit Ocean park after 26 years just to see how it has changed in the years since I first saw it when I was in my early 20's. I remember how I loved the cable car back then. The rest was just a blur; although I know I tried several rides as I love amusement parks. And I am a sucker for all types of rides.The first thing I noticed when we entered was how huge the place is. I read that the management decided to infuse billions of HK$ to improve the place because they have to compete with Disneyland. So I excitedly walked around to discover what was done to the place. Since Ocean park in situated in the hills, one has to walk quite a bit going up & down to get to the attractions. IF you are physically fit and it isn't a hot day, this should NOT be a problem. But one has to be prepared to WALK. We immediately went to the cable car station. The line was quite long but we patiently waited until it was our turn to board. It is still as breathtaking as I remembered! Part of the way was the view of the high, lush hills and part of it was the view of the Hong Kong ocean. Simply beautiful! After we got off the cable car, we walked around to explore the different attractions and rides that we can try. The signs are quite confusing. We got lost several times before we would find the attractions we were looking for. When I needed to freshen up and looked for the toilets, I was disappointed to see that for a huge place, the management didn't invest enough in building more toilets for the customers to use. We also noticed that there were NOT enough restaurants where customers can chose refreshments and food. Also there were not enough tables and chairs where you can sit and enjoy whatever food you finally end up buying. The tables & chairs are situated out in the open so IF you happen to go there on a sweltering day, then you will have to eat your food in the heat, too. Not very pleasant and relaxing.We tried a ride called something "express" but it was just a ride to transport us to the next area. The attractions we viewed i.e. shark place, sturgeon, and the aquarium were just so - so. Overall, we were quite disappointed in the whole place. Specially since so much money was spent to improve the park. We actually think that the double decker bus that brought us to Ocean park was a more exciting ride as we chose to sit in the very front seats on the upper deck! For the first time in my life, I left an amusement park way before the closing time!I certainly wont be returning to Ocean park in the near future. OH! In case you want to check out the place yourself, please google "Klook.com" so you can at least save 15% on the entrance tickets. Hope you enjoy yourself.
A Day of Fun. If you have a day to spend, head to Ocean Park for a fun-filled day. Spectacular dolphin shows, breathtaking views and awesome rides.

Fun and exciting. I definitely loved our visit here. There are a lot of rides, we were just too scared to try any of them. I loved the cable car ride towards the other side of the park (even though i'm a bit scared of heights), perfect destination for a good time with the family! :)

Yet Another Wonderful Theme Park. This was my second visit and I must say I had thoroughly enjoyed it and found it to be value for money. One of the things that impressed me most about the park is crowd control. When I got there in the morning at about 10am plus, I was overwhelmed by the crowd at the entrance. However, it did not take me long to get into the park and get my tickets. The ticketing officer was most helpful. She had checked which country I came from and explained the promotions which are applicable for me to the park. In the end, I have gotten a savings of 12percent.If you want a park with almost everything, this is one park you should go. It is an amalgamation of aquarium, zoo, carnival and rides! Had enjoyed the carnival and rides most. Some of the rides are not for the weak hearted. This park has a roller coaster ride with full view of the sea. Beautiful view when getting a dosage of thrill during the ride. The cable car is another wonderful part not to be missed. Is priced in the ticket already. You get a breathtaking view of the sea while the ride span across two hill tops. On it, you will also get to see the whole part. Thoroughly enjoyed my trip there. Highly recommended.
One of the best amusement parks.. The amusement park is fantastic and is almost on par with the Universal Studios in Singapore. Worth a visit.

Outstanding. This is one amusement park that both children and adults will enjoy. The cable car has some fantastic views of the bay where you can actually see the natural beauty of HK. The rides are just fantastic esp the roller coasters. the aquarium is great for kids and there are lots of other activities too. The evening light and sound show at the fountain is not be missed.

Great Family Day out. Reserve in the restaurant for later. Go first to see the pandas, the red ones too, then take the cable car and see the penguins and jelly fish, the big rides have less people before lunch time, then take train down and eat at the restaurant, nice views of the fish although pricey.Then some time to see the fish and some shopping and the water / lights show at the end. lots to do. Our son like it more than Disneyland.

A superb enthralling ride. The ocean park is located in Aberdeen on hilly side. It is divided into 2 major sections waterfront and summit. My advise is to cover summit first. 3 ways to summit, they are cable ride with long wait time(absolutely amazing views of sea on one side and Aberdeen with stunning tall buildings and beautiful green mountains on other side). another ocean express( the fastest way to reach summit ), escalators (only one way I.e upwards to summit with beautiful looks but time consuming and strenuous.Reach early by 9:30 and try to go for cable ride but check the waiting time not more than 15 mins, otherwise you may miss on some thrilling rides as it closes by 6:30.I first went for hair raiser the most enthralling rides of all. Had wait time of 50 mins but was worth. Its superb enthralling roller coaster ride with great trajectory path, curves, and speed. Its not meant for weak hearted, bp and heart patients. It sets your nerve pulsating. The speed, height and curvaceous trajectory at which you are upside down makes you feel you are gone.Its absolutely breath taking ride.The other rides I liked was flash, dragon, whirly birds, rev booster, the Abyss, Ocean park tower, flying swing, mine train, the rapids (water fun ride which can make you wet. Its fun getting wet.The polar adventure has north pole and South pole animal encounter where one can see arctic fox, walrus, seal and so on.Marine world had shark mystique, sea jelly spectacular which is worth watching. The pandas, koalas,kangaroo's are worth watching. Old Hong Kong too.The grand aquarium and dolphin show too. The last but the best is symbio absolutely amazing water light dragon show which sets water on fire.So plan well on weekdays and if you can get maps in advance, it would be great.

A must go!. Admission is almost half of Disney HKG. Offers totally different experience. Get a choice of travelling up peak with funicular train or cable car. Good to venture both. Dolphin show a must, a non-stunt show by the dolphins, so one will not feel sad or worry dolphins are ill treated. Kids willl be thrilled!

Excellent Animal Exhibits... Rides Iffy. Ocean Park is comparable to Sea World in that it has a fairly even split with animal encounters and rides. Ocean Park excels in animal exhibits, but not exactly the rides. The polar animals, pandas, Australia animals, Grand Aquarium, sea lions, and jellyfish all have really beautiful exhibits. There are some creative viewing opportunities and I felt that I saw active animals in all of the areas. Many times with zoos, it seems I either don't see the featured animal or it is sleeping. I don't know if the unique layouts or in-park animal enrichment helps here, but it was a great animal experience. Don't forget to see the jellyfish exhibit! As for the rides, they seemed rather dated and just not fun. The big roller coaster, the Hair Raiser, is in desperate need of a little maintenance as it is quite a jarring experience. The lone bright spot was the cable car from one side of the park to the next. Otherwise, don't plan on coming for the rides. A lot of guidebooks suggest Ocean Park over Disneyland and that is an absolutely ridiculous suggestion. Ocean Park is nice for what it is. It has above average animal experiences with a collection of mediocre rides. Disneyland is the far better experience if you just have one day for amusement parks during your Hong Kong visit.

Weekdays for lesser crowd. Bought tickets through klook.com with a good discount and ease of entry into Ocean Park. Weekdays crowd are much lesser, most of the rides are only 5-10minutes wait. Places a bit run down as compared to Disney. Staffs at the eateries are rude most of the time, especially when they deal with foreigners. A lot of rides were closed such as the eagle and the tower. Dont think I'll go again.

You better be able to walk steep paths and handle lots of steps for this park!. I'm glad we went and highly recommend the park but want to be sure you know that it isn't for everyone. If you can't walk far with out a break have issues walking up steep inclines or can't handle multiple steps you will be very challenged here. I am physically fit but have to say I found the park exhausting. You take a train or cable car to the highest part of the park but as the park sits on a hillside and had many rides spread about it is a very physical day. I saw parents pushing strollers up and down hills and toddlers running down steep hills and thought oh, my I'm so glad my child is older(10)! The rides are fun, the panda was wonderful to see and the view of the Ocean from the rides was amazing. There were not a lot of places to sit and rest. Benches were few and far between. I'm glad I went, have no desire to go again but really want you to know you will be in for a good hike through the park. This is no Disney, easy access kind of park.

Amusement Park, Gardens, aquarium all-in-one. Me, hubby and our 3 year old visited yesterday and were very impressed. There was so much to see that we didn't get to everything despite being there almost open to close (6:30 pm). The shark exhibit was the best I've ever seen. They had a ton of shows, my favorite was the dolphin show. We saw 3 shows altogether but the other two were in Chinese. They had a kids area which our 3 year old loved, which included rides, a bounce house and a large play area. They had an awesome water show at closing but we didn't stay to watch the whole thing, definitely will next time. To get to the summit we rode a cable car which was an amazing experience. The return trip was a simulated submarine which gave the illusion of being underwater.Recommendations: visit the MTR ticket office at the Admiralty Station for discount tickets and consider the 2-days ticket if you have time.

Nice attraction. Nice place with different kinds of attraction. Come early to beat the queue for the rides and short queue to ride the cable car to the other part of the park behind the hill. Make sure to ride the cable car once as the view is nice. We came back to the main entrance using the Ocean Express, another fun experience as if we were going underground. Do visit Pacific Pier as the view from there is serene. We enjoyed the animal exhibits as well, especially the walrus and the panda.We bought the park ticket in town but a kiosk just outside Admiralty MTR sell discounted ticket. The CIty Bus 926 can be paid using Octopus card so no need to queue for bus ticket. Overall, very smooth travel to and from the park, short waiting time as many buses are available right outside Admiralty MTR.

Great fun.. We went on Tue. Took bus 629 from Admiralty MTR. Reached before 930am. No queue to buy tickets but people start queing up to enter before 10am. Park opens at 1030am. Took the cable car to the Summit. Breathtaking view. Did most of the rides first as there was hardly any queue. Food n drinks are expensive but there are drinking fountains there. McD is probably the cheapest food there. Overall it is also quite an educational trip with an emphasis on taking care of the environment in particular the ocean. Go early. Take the rides first. The tourist groups will start coming in about noon.

Nice Place and Poorly Managed. This is a nice place for kids as well as others but this place is badly managed compared to Disneyland. They do not have any policy for crowd control. Sometimes the waiting period for some ride like Hair Raiser is more than 2 hours. Lot of time will be wasted due to poor management. Show times are limited. When somebody will waste lot of time in queue then he has to miss number of shows either or some rides. It is very difficult to handle yourself on weekdays. But the place is good and relaxing. Variety rides are there. Enter early to avoid disappointment. The ticket price is not worthy compared to their service.

Amazing place for kids!. We always take our sixth grade students every year and we have a great time. It is very safe, and a lot of fun. It's safe enough to let teenage kids wander on their own. We love it.
Great Experience. Great Experience but stay ready for huge queues and crowds avoid it on Saturdays and sundays its sickening waiting in the queues
Very poular attraction. Great place to see Panda's and the penguin restaurant with the big glass viewing window was very cool.

Cable car ride. Great day out, with many attractions, sea and bird life. Now have a Australian theme, and great to see how our animals are taken care of. The scenery to the the top was fantastic,and hopefully not scared of heights. Many more rides for the young.

Ocean Park Consists of 2 Areas. A good way to go to Ocean Park is to take the MTR to Admiralty Station, then take City Bus 629 which is a special bus service to Ocean Park. Ocean Park consists of 2 areas: (a) the lower area which includes The Grand Aquarium, Asian Animals area and kids area and (b) the upper area which includes the rides area and the Polar Adventure area. You can go from one area to the other area either by cable car or by Ocean Express which is a train where the train cars are darkened during the journey and film of the marine world is shown.

We went here instead of Disneyland(Halal outlet review). This attraction is much cheaper than disneyland and I believe much bigger as they have 2 different section separated by a cable car ride/train ride. The theme park is very educational as every aspect of the park will educate you about saving the world. This is good as we are a group with very young kids. So we took some time to explain to them the destructive effect human is causing. The park opens at 10.30am till 6.30pm. Go when the park open as you will not have time to cover the whole park even if you stayed till 6.30pm. At 6.30pm there will be a water/fire/fireworks show at the fountain near the park entrance. But if you stayed till 6.30pm, be prepared to queue for the bus back as you will be fighting with the rest. Bus 629 from Admiralty travels to Ocean Park for about 30mins. Only one outlet for halal food. Best to bring your own food if you are a muslim as the halal outlet is very seasonal. Sometimes there is food sometimes there isn't. If the security stops you, just be nice and explain politely your needs for halal food. You can view from my photos the halal menu at the outlet. The location of the outlet is clearly indicated in the park map.

Excellent fun day out, rides and animals so a broad mix. We didn't have huge expectations based on the tickets being fairly cheap but the park is a really good day out. One side is an aquarium and small zoo type area ( with Pandas) and the other is rollercoasters and theme park area. Worth taking the cable car at some point as they are a bit hair raising but give you great views of the bay. Take your own water though as they charge you 5 times the normal price once you are in the park. Easy to get to by using ghe express but going from the bus terminal at Central station, think its bus 627 and costs about 10 HKD each way.

Big and nice place to explore. It is very nice. Especially the underwater world which you can see all different types of fish. The panda and all different animals too. It is also very big place to explore. You can also take cable car and come back on rail train

Great day out with plenty of things to do. We recently visited ocean park. It was a great day out. The cable car ride was very scenic. The roller coaster was great fun. Not sure about the water rides though.The park also have plenty of animals to see from kangaroos, panda to special monkeys etc In addition the park has sea walrus, dolphins, penguins, sharks, aquarium etcThe highlight was the 7 pm show near the fountain with sound, fire, fireworks. A truelly magical day.The view from ocean park is great. Although it is a Sunday, crowd control seems to be no issue at all. Very easy to move around.
Great for families!. Wonderful theme park with amazing rides. Went here with friends but want to visit again as could not get on several rides due to typhoon signal 3 that day.
WaterWorld !!. a great place to chill out with family and friends. excellent thrilling rides and fun filled sights.do not miss if you are in Hong Kong

Had fun, tried few interesting rides, geeat shows. It is good to go to the top of the park in the begining. It is generally less crowded when it opens. Same for cable car. It is easier to take train to the top and take cable car to enjoy the great view. The park is spread over a big area. Considering the waiting time for each ride, it is good to choose ride in advance. Food is expensive inside. Good to have some snack at reasonable price. We booked tickets through klook.com and enter directly to the park with the printout. Not require to change the coupon to ticket. Laser show at the closing time was really great. Overall, it was fun. Recommended..

Disneyland fan will like it for sure!. If you visiting Hong Kong with children must spend at least half day at Ocean Park, kids will love it. If you do not like to walk much, dropout all attractions which are bit away. Suggest to proceed to rope-way first and on landing, visit all attractions next to landing station; these are the main attractions of Ocean Park!

Kids will love it. Brought my kid to Ocean Park, He absolutely love this place.I love the idea where it is incorporate the theme park and the marine life in a same park.The shows of dolphin for this year was okay only but overall its a great place.The child also get to enjoy the ride of cable car....We enjoys every single ride .....

Very attracting. This place is an excellent place for people wanting sensation, for younger one's who can stay in the younger part and the parents who can have attraction for watching the view. I would recommend not going on a hot day.

Ocean park was great fun!. Ocean park was great fun, not cheap but you get a lot of bang for your bucks. First part of the park is more appealing to younger kids but once you have taken the funicular (20-25mins) it takes you to the fun stuff, pretty awesome roller coasters and some themed rides. Hair raiser is by far the most excellent ride I have ever tried. It shows a very cool view over Hong Hong at the start and then the fun begins. 5 Loopings and a very smooth ride. I was there during Halloween and they did a great effort in decorating the park. Don't forget to visit the aquarium as well, up close and personel with sharks.
Beautiful !. Ocean park is full of activities. It is suitable for all age. The cable car ride is the highlight. But you may take the tram when coming down from the mountain there is no q at all.

Lucky to get in here with family. Largest theme park in asia, around 225-230 acres, ocean park has numerous rides for kids and adults. Around 4-5 roller coasters which keeps you on the edge of the seat. The ocean park cable car and ocean express help you to reach anywhere inside the park. The dolphin show in ocean theatre and sea lion fun time were the shows i had the privilege to watch and enjoy. The food in the restaurants is also pure and delicious. Worth visit

Four days in Hong Kong . Very easy to reach you have lots of buses and practically every one prepared to send you here from the admiralty station. So many buses queued up one after the other. N a kiosk telling the cost of water in there, which was really helpful as we bought a couple of bottles to take us through the day n even they were not sufficient as its a big property and if the day is sunny you will need lots of it. The aquariums Are nice n informative. Head straight to the summit as the queue for the cable car gets longer n longer. The train is an alternative. we missed the Dolphin show n still regret it. Hair raiser is thrilling n so is the flash. not many rides for the little children though. So people with kids under 12can give it a miss unless you yourself are crazy for the thrill. Younger Children enjoy Disneyland more.

Great fun. Ocean Park is an icon of Hong Kong that tourist must go! It consist of amusement rides, many aquariums, bird zoo, forest animal learning centers. It has water fun games during summer. You can spend a day there easily.

Great with children but not pushchair friendly. We came here with four children, but as one was in a pushchair it was a pain.
