There was a strict no buggies on the escalators, which meant getting my son out of the pushchair for each escalators. A pain when the theme park is built on a mountain. We'll be back, but only when we are pushchair free.Great to see the pandas though.

One of the best parks in the world. Undoubtedly has to be one of the best parks in the world. Located on 2 mountains which can be travelled either by cable car or an express train. The aquatic / polar and other animals present in the park are just awesome and the wonderful dwellings made for these animals is a treat to watch in itself. One can have a look at the Gaint Panda, Walrus, Seal, Shark and many many other animals. Also, the bird show has many different kinds of rare birds making an appearance. The amusement park rides are very good too. Start early and make use of the entire day to experience the park in its entirety. Also browse through the map and show timings guide to reach the shows that interest you. A suggestion is that.... skip the cable car and transit between the mountains on train to save a lot of time standing in queues

Xmas 2014. Went here with my family Dec 2014, after first visiting Disney. After high expectations we all found Disney quite disappointing. Granted it was late season but there were still plenty of families visiting Disney. We all loved Ocean Park, especially my 9 yo daughter, with the high speed rides and the cable car back to the exit after a long day the highlights. Highly recommended.

Kids at heart, unlocked!. All the attractions are awesome! indeed a worthy place to visit all day long! its just sad they close at 0700 PM - most of the aquariums close at 625pm.tips : wear a very comfy shoes. you will walk all day long! 1)bring umbrella. 2)wear sun block. 3)bring water bottle - there are quite a number of drinking fountain where you can top up your water bottles to keep you hydrated. 4) extra clothes - some rides will make you wet so better grab few shirts5)jacket - penguins are kept in low temperature rooms
Fun filled, action packed and educating. Fun filled experience with lots of activities.Action packed and crazy rides that blow your minds off.Educating tours and animal experiences.

Family outing. We all enjoyed the Ocean Park. Our reservation of a table at the restaurant above the aquarium was very nice and allowed for an entertaining lunch. The attractions are overall fun for little kids even though many are targeted at an older audience (10 years and over). We all had a great time. Well worth the entrance fee. Food inside is grossly overpriced so bring a pic-nic.

Greatest Theme Park in the World. Ocean Park is my best memorable theme park. It good for family. It got all essential of what a child want and what most suitable for a day visit. The panda show and dophan show is terrific. The aquarium is the best in the world. The amusement games there there are very suitable for teenagers. Dun miss the excellent theme park if you visit Hong Kong.
Nice !. Don't miss the 'HAIR RAISER' roller coaster ride ! Its not for the faint-hearted and is a must-try at Ocean Park. Seeing the Panda, Kangaroo and Koala was also a good experience !

Fantastic Theme Park in Hong Kong. It is famous with its cartoon theme as well as the exciting games. Even if you are afraid of playing the exciting games, this is a good place to enjoy too. I enjoyed most of the shows there, seeing dolphins, birds, and other animals. A good place to go with family members too!

Pretty great theme park. It was a lot of fun and also of walking, so be sure to wear trainers or something that will actually be comfortable. Has a few good thrill rides, but the roller coasters might be a bit painful on the shoulders for anyone tall (175cm or above)

Suitable for kids. The attractions and rides are suitable for kids. I kinda like the water ride. ☺Cable car has good view too. But tip: take from the top back. The queue from entrance to summit is way too long.

Fabulous aquarium . Very fabulous showers at entrance. Very large aquarium to view with many of different fishes to view. Amazing rides for all . The dolphin show was a must to see . The dolphin show was enhanced with the beauty of sea behind

Brilliant mix of animals and rides!. We came here over Disney world as it was cheaper and they had a lot of animals as well as rides. We had a brilliant day.The animals they have are amazing - red pandas, pandas, koalas, penguins... They all have their own section and all seem to be happy animals which was great to see. You can either get the cable car (which there was a bit of a queue for) or the train (less of a queue) to the ride section. The rides feel very safe - some of them are well scary! But brilliant. We spent all day here and at the end of the day there's a light show at the fountain at the entrance/exit. Loads of shops for gifts. Food fairly expensive but to be expected at a theme park - bringing your own maybe better.
Way better than Hong Kong Disney. Being Disney fans we tried Disney first and then here. You have to try the cable car with views of Deep Water Bay. Rides are great. Much better than Disney!
Great views, rides and pandas. We visited with our 4yo daughter. The aquarium, rides, dolphin/seal show and pandas were fantastic. The views from the cable car were awesome. Had a great day!

Worth the Visit. We had a great time in Ocean Park. There are plenty of rides, exhibits, and attractions. Because the park is so huge, you'll be needing a day or two in visiting the park. It can be very tiring, so come in your comfortable clothes and footwear. You can ride the MTR going to the Admiralty, then go out at Exit B and hop on to Citybus 629. I recommend buying tickets beforehand to avoid the long queue at the site itself (I bought our admission tickets in the Citybus Ticket Booth in Admiralty Station).

Terrible queue. We went on a tuesday. We arrived around 11. Then it was a two hour waiting time for the cable car! We descieded to skip the statue and go for a walk in the nearby fishermans village instead.

A fun day out but avoid food and merchandising madness. We visited Ocean Park back in 2010 and decided to come back this year as our daughters were big enough to enjoy more of the rides. The park has changed and is undergoing massive change which will see it transform yet again. We enjoyed our day but felt that the constant pushing of photo opportunities and merchandising didn't sit right. Also check all the ride descriptions and children's height before you go as small children will not be allowed on several of the rides (even those which are fairly tame compared to other theme parks). Food options are uninspiring, expensive and often inedible but that's fairly standard across all theme parks - stick to snack items and don't expect much. The pandas, arctic wolves and aquarium were some of our favourites.
Entertaining. Great time spent with little kids...they lived it so much we spent 3 consecutive days there.It put a smile in all our faces.

A good day out. I recently returned here after a few years and as always it is a good day out with the children... The rides are fun and appear to well maintained with wait times never that terrible for you to get too bored. The venue has at last introduced the nice touch of free wifi so not only can you promote the park for them on social media but you can read the news and catchup on emails while waiting for your turn, which is a nice way to pass time.I have often wondered what it is thats made me feel a little disconnected from this place and on this trip I put my finger on it - the staff... they are never rude but they do not have that joy you want from theme park staff (the sort of thing that we have come to expect thanks for places like Disney). If I was advising management I would be encouraging them to do some team building and staff development around being friendly and welcoming.If you have time and are in Hong Kong this is a good place to go!

Views & Pandas. Ocean Park should be more widely advertised for travellers to Hong Kong. It is not just a fantastic destination for families; the views from the cable car are stunning and gives a really good perspective of the "other side" of the Island. And then there are the pandas. Wow! I went with low expectations - thought the Pandas would be a bit ho hum and probably hiding in their enclosure - but no - they love an audience. And they sure put on a show! The glass wall is easy to see through (kept very clean) and there is an attendant who gives you tips of the best place to take a photo from and will even take the photo for you with the panda and you in the photo - the ultimate selfie shot! I could have stayed and watched these adorable animals for hours - they are so playful and photogenic.Lots of other interesting stuff to see & do - great for the kids. This park is part zoo and part theme park. A good day out if you want a break from the hustle & bustle of the city.

Great value for money!. We got 30% off our tickets by going on the website and playing the game on there which is valid until December 15, just keep playing until you get offered more than 15% off!Given this it cost us around £20 each for a whole days activity, great combination of zoo and theme park and I doubt you'll get better views from a roller coaster anywhere else.I'd recommend taking your own food if you can as its overpriced for what it is

Middle of the week, don't waste your money there. We visited Ocean Park in the middle of the week and not all the rides or exhibits were open. The rides that were open started closing more than an hour before the park closed because they had not a lot of people and even if you wanted to go to one ride with a small line, they wouldn't let us head that way and started asking people to go towards the cable cars to head out. We were on line to get a cable car for almost two hours. By the time we made it to the exit, we had missed the fireworks.

Hard for kids. We arrived Halloween last October. The rides were fun for my older kids but there were just too many people because it was peak season. My younger child was tired from the hilly terrain. The Cable Car was the best experience for us because of the view . The best way to use it is when you are on your way back already. Going up using it will be an hour and a half waiting time. Food was expensive at the restaurant near the cable car station at the top.

City stopover. A good day out, but very tiring, and quite expensive. Even midweek in November the queues were long - at 10:45 an hours wait for the cable car (20 minutes for the Ocean Express train), but worth the wait. Good shows & rides.

The park is great but the view are even better. Great fun park with loads to do. This park is great for all ages. It is like an amusement park and a zoo combined. You can see pandas up close, you can see how they train the dolphins, enjoy a sea animal show or go on a roller coaster with the most fantastic views. The only down side to this park can be the long line ups and the food... it's terrible.
Good time. Had the most fun here spent like 12 hours here literally would strongly recommend buying the premium ticket save a alot of time

A huge park with something for everyone !. It is a large park with rides, shows, aquarium, animal zones, etc. Ocean Park is divided into 2 parts – Summit (Houses thrill rides and animals) and Waterfront (houses animals and aquarium). One can travel between Summit and Waterfront by cable car (15 mins ride) or Express train (4 min ride). Waiting time in cable car can be 15-30 mins but views are stunning. Express train is quick with almost no waiting time. However, there are no views.Spend most of the time at Summit. Plan to spend 2-3 hrs at waterfront. Do not miss out on Hair raiser, Flash, Polar Adventure, Pandas and the Dolphin Show !
Must go for children; adults will also enjoy. A whole day trip is needed to enjoy the park fully. You may like to go second time too. Every single item is worth visiting inside the park.

Nice park with good halloween events!. This park is fairly big and has fairly long lines, but nothing too crazy. The rides aren't very scary, but some are decent. I did like that shows that they do around the park at different times. Lots of entertainment and very family friendly. The haunted house was good fun! People work inside it and will scare you if you're not attentive.

Great Amusement Park. The park is divided into many segments. All the adventure rides are on thrill mountain. Some rides are real good e.g. Flash, Hair Raiser.One shouldn't miss the Dolphin show & visit the Grand aquarium.My advice take train for one side and cable car for another.
Total zero. This place have nothing to offer at all. Forget it ! Tons and tons of loud and disorderly tourist. Please use the money for a dim sum lunch would be a better way to spend your day.
its best place to enjoy !. loved dolphin show they have best of them. also has few best rides to enjoy and there aquarium was best !

Theme Park With Animals. Spent the whole day here and for the price you pay it was worth it. Half a theme park with all sorts of rides and games whilst the other half is full of animals for you to see.
Cheaper than Disneyland but twice the fun

So much to see. Must do for families. The aquarium is excellent. Loads of rides and activities for kids. Food is average. Suggestion if there is a long queue for the cable car - take the ocean express train to the other side and the cable car back.
Ocean Park-A life time experience... The best place to visit in Hong kong. Cable car and water front train makes the life easier. Dolphin show is a must watch. Management is highly cooperative.

There are better attractions. We found Ocean Park to be too much hard work. There was too much walking and too many hills between attractions. There were a few down for maintenance as well which didn't help. Food was over priced and not very appertising. Panda was a no show. We did enjoy the Jelly fish display and the cable car was OK. If you are short on time do Disneyland instead.

THEME PARK - ZOO - A MUST SEE. I had mixed feeling about going to Ocean Park as a lot of people have said it wasn't that special. Well I'm here to tell you that this place was everything I expected and more.I went with my 15 year old daughter on a Tuesday and it wasn't that crowded in the morning but the place filled up by the afternoon. We got there when the park opened and literally 'ran' for the cable cars to the summit lol, it was so funny but make sure you get in early or you wont get a ride on these. By midday the line up was ridiculous, I'm so glad we made it the first thing to do.The Ocean Express is another way to get to and from the Summit, I assumed it was just a train, boy how wrong could I have been, it was an amazing ride in itself, *make sure you ride this train!!*Adventure Land was being renovated when we visited so it was closed to the public.I loved the Giant Pandas, the Goldfish Treasures, the Polar Adventures and my favourite was the Grand Aquarium.The Australia exhibit wasn't worth the wait, I suppose because I am from Australia but really I thought it was a waste of time.I will never forget our day at Ocean Park :)

Of Pandas and penguins, Marine life viewed on a mountain peak!!. Ocean park is divided into 2 sections - the waterfront and the summit. Each of these sections have their highlights. The waterfront highlight is watching the white and red panda in their ecosystem while the sea lion/dolphins show is the highlight of the summit. Fun place for kids and adults. Get to see marine life up close and front from all sides. One should reach there by the opening time and spend the entire day till about 6 pm to cover all shows. There are rides as well on the summit; some of which are quite daring. The ride upto the summit on the cable car is scenic with the sea in the background!
Wow!. We've never visited an amusement park with such scenery! Great rides for our five year old and many more options for those taller and young at heart! Great day!

Birthday getaway!. It's so much fun going here if you're into rides! Always coming back here for the thrill! Especially my boyfriend loves going back here, we are kids at heart I guess! It's a bit crowded as it's summer but overall rides are amazing.

Good But Not As Great As Before. I used to love Ocean Park but it's a bit too commercialized now. The Grand Aquarium used to be my favorite part but has been overtaken by restaurants.With that said, the place is still good to go especially with kids.The rides are great and if you are too lazy to walk, you can take the mono-train to go from one end to the other.Getting there is a pain because there is no subway that goes there. Plenty of buses do that instead but Hong Kong buses can get confusing because some buses only go to Ocean Park during a specific time interval.

good shows, breath taking rides. it was raining cats and dogs when we visited Ocean Park but still managed to enjoy the place. They didn't cancel the sea lion and dolphin show, so o the bird show despite of the weather. Sad that many rides were closed for maintenance. Amazed with the Symbio, their closing show. Worth it!

Whole Day Visit. We spent an entire day here.We visited on a weekday and proceeded straight for the cable ride to Thrill mountain, rain forest and Polar adventure covering the rides and exhibits and working our way downwards to Marine world and Aqua city. The Ocean world Dolphin show was the highlight of the visit. There are great rides including Flash & Hair raiser ( there are height restrictions 150 cm for some of the rides). One day is good enough as there are duplicity of rides.The evening fireworks all added up to a brilliant day.

Worth a visit. It includes everything from aquarium, adventure rides, sharks, dolphin show, antartic adventures like penguins and seals, australian animals, pandas, kiddy rides, amazing view from cable car, underground train, etc.Have a map provided at the entrance and make sure you cover everything. It will take around 6 hours for a complete planned coverage. ( be active and quick)1. Be quick right from the start. Do not waste a lot of time at the grand aquarium which is at the start if you dont want to miss other stuff inside.2. Carry waterbottles as inside the park it is costly.3. Buy 2 way bus tickets + park entrance ticket from admirality station exit. It will be very crowded while returning and you will be too tired for purchasing bus tickets.4. In one of the rides you will get wet (and you should not skip it) so it would be convenient to carry a windcheater.5. Should be visited on a not so sunny day as the park is open and includes a lot of walk.6. Stroller/ wheelchair services available at the entrance.

I Still Love Ocean Park. I remembered the first time I went here at Ocean Park, HK. I super enjoyed all the rides and it was really memorable. But the last time I went here, it rained so hard that some of the rides stopped working. We had no choice but to leave the park immediately.

Enjoyable. It's a good location for a day away from the shops.Prices are reasonable and we found lots to do and see.Rides (which I didn't do) were fairly busy but waits were not too long.An interesting mix of theme park and aquatic zoo.

highly tiring. our visit to this place was average . its huge and no other option but to walk . even comfortable footwear do not comfort your feet. go there if you have extra time . it takes almost full day .

A great day!. Do not do this park and Disney consecutively- my son and I are very able, but this was a stretch... Anyhow we had a great time at ocean park. We went on a Sunday Got there early - metro to Admiralty bus to the gates. We got our tickets at our hostel for slightly cheaper... Our first stop was the pandas- no one was there but one keen photographer and the keeper- it was odd! But we had our own private viewing like... It was November 1st, the pandas had some Halloween themed pumpkin and bamboo to play with. We joined the cable car queue- our longest wait for the day. Should have gone on the ocean express- if we'd had realised that was the train up the other side. The cable car was fun- (not as swish as the 360 one on way to big budda!) we went on the mine and water rides, the Arctic blast roller coaster... Visited seals sharks penguins and more. Plenty to do at this park. Good value for money I think. We were there on a busy Sunday but that was not too crazy. Good fun had by all. Water $hk25 which was high and food exy too- but eat well before and after... A must with kids when visiting Hong Kong- there is nothing else like it!
Magical!. This place is fun, fUn, FUN! Attractions inside are very nice. Both young and elder will enjoy the place.

Great way to spend the day. Ocean Park was fantastic. There are a variety of things to do - rides, animals and aquarium. The cable car is a must. The views along the ride are beautiful. The queues can get very long so it is advised to go early in the morning.
ocean park. has many fun and thrilling rides for all, young and old, rollercoasters and smooth rides. fun for all!

Amazing theme park. All you want could be found here, Ocean Park. Located on one big mountain in my feeling. Aquarium, animals show and attractions are available. You should prepare to spend one-fully-whole day at Ocean Park. Everything just nice!
thrilling rides. an exciting place for the older children. the rides are hair raising at times. be prepared to spend the whole day.

Amusement park. It is an old childrens park for children but in times it has grown into a full fledged amusement and entertainment centre visited regularity by local residents.Being a local brand gives a stiff competition to Disneyland. It has lot of rides and activities for all.One can reach there by rope ways. Resident takes annual pass for year round treat for family

great park, awesome cable car. Lots to see and do for all ages. Its not only an amusement park with rides for young and old but also a zoo and aquarium with great views to boot. I would highly recommend this park to anyone traveling with or without kids. A really fun place to get away from the city for the day and enjoy the scenery of HK Island and the South China Sea.

Not a very good experience. This place is big but better bring umbrella as it will be useful during rainy day or not as it can be very hot there. Got a lot of attractions for kids and teenager. Got some places where you can see the animals too. There's a cable car to go up to the mountain, which is nice view.

Good Theme Park. 2nd time visit to Ocean Park. Is better than the Disney Land. Not just the theme park, a lot to see including panda. Recommended for family trips, definitely worth the visit for children and adult.

Brings back good old memories. I used to come here as a kid. I brought my fiancee here on a weekday, with the main aim of seeing the dolphin show (which was great). Overall the park has really developed and the new attractions (i.e. The Summit).One downside, we had no option but to queue for the cable car (45 mins), and the staff do not control the masses of Chinese tourist who just love to queue jump and act as if it is normal. Also, might add that the staff were not interested to allow the elderly couple behind us move to the front of the queue when we asked for their assistance. The queues for the rides were not too long (apart from the cable car). So overall, definitely worth a visit. And watch the Ocean Theatre show.

Very Good Amusement Park. The place is huge, i got a very tired legs and feet after too much walking form one ride to another. I enjoyed the extreme rides : the abyss, crazy galleon, and the flash. I also like encounters with the sea creatures.
Great day out. I went there by myself and still had a great time. The views from thrill mountain are amazing. Arrive early as at around 2, tour busses arrive and lines start getting long.

A must see in HK. Great both for kids and adults. Animals seem to be very well taken care off, we saw there the happiest captive penguins. Also the sharks, pandas, seals, dolphins have very nice habitats and it's a joy to watch them. The roller coaster (the one that is called mine train) offers stunning views.

Great fun. Very family focused, but still fun for singles and/or couples. Was a little put-off by the pushy Chinese tourists. Seemed to get busier after noon, the summit area was pretty quiet until then. Food is on the expensive side, but nothing shocking for a amusement/theme park.Easy to access, Take the MTR to Admirality, there's a bus (#40) that goes directly to the Ocean Park gate. At least until the South Island line is completed.

Very Impressive. Just got back from a full day of rides and fun with my family including 2 kids under 8. A very well presented park which caters for all ages and tastes. We were advised to avoid the weekends and public holidays and this was a great idea. We hardly had to wait in queues. You need a full day......get there early and be prepared to walk a bit. An amazing place and equal to any that I've experienced.

The better Hong Kong Theme Park. A place full of fun and knowledge about different animals. Kinda old, but I can say that it's well-maintained. One day isnt enough for this place. My favorite part was the Mountain - wherein The Flash and Hairraiser was located. I had fun with the rides and the animals; Going here isn't hard: a dedicated bus goes to this place (Bus 629). If you had to choose (budget or time constraint) between this and Disneyland, choose Ocean Park.

Must Visit. Please plan well to reach there when the gates open. There is plenty of places to see and spend time. Don't miss the shows and then the rides.The hair rising ones are awesome - but make sure you sit on them with a strong heart.

A great place to learn more marine life. I love to visit most of place with those cute animals ~ and some marine weird but beautiful that live in the sea~~I also enjoy some food~ the show~ We also can swim with the dolphin~~ I will be here again~~

Horrendous queue from Summit . We took our driver's advice to go at 12noon to avoid crowds. We took the cable car (best experience and view vs tram or bus) to The Summit. Our plan was to take cable car back around 4-5pm but the queues were already horrendous by then as the tram broke down and tour groups were starting to leave. Kid enjoyed the artic blast roller coaster most.

Avoid the Rush by arriving early. Caught the 629 bus from Admiralty Station for $10.6 which takes you direct to the park entrance, we arrived at 10:10am and I was suprised how busy it was with large school parties and tour groups already waiting to enter the park. Managed to get a 10% discount on entry tickets by producng our tickets for the Lantau Cable car ride. Went straight to the giant panda exhibit however the keepeers were still cleaning the enclosure but after a short wait one of the pandas made an appearace. Then went to the grand Aquarium which was quite impressive with its displays, in particular the sharks and rays. The Asian Animal Wonders exhibit has some more active younger pandas and red Pandas on display. The wait in line for the cable car was in excess of 45 mins so opted for the funicular train which was quick and no queue. A lot of rides at thee top but just visdited the seals, shark mystique, sturgeon exhibit and jellyfish - al of which were interesting and well presented. Returned to the lower area by cable car and suprisingly there was no queue at the top. It's a big park and if you wanted todo rides and visit the animal exhibits there is no way a day visit would be long enough. On exiting there were dozens of tour groups arriving by coach yet a member of staff said it was a quiet day.Wouldn't want to visit on a busy day then.
Its ok. It was ok. I cant say it was bad, or it was great, it was just ok, good. Roller coasters, family friendly place, lots of fun for kids, but that's about it.
AMAZING!. If you're interested in Marine Biology or seacreatures, you need and must go to OCEAN PARK :)It is cheaper than HK disneyland and also it provides English (inside the rides and museums)

Fun at Ocean Park. First thing before to ocean park is to have your ticket handy to avoid long queue at the park entrance. Tickets can be bought easily at 7-Eleven shops and costs just HK$ 345 for adults per person and HK$ 173 for children. You better start your visit as early as you can because one day is not enough to visit all of the attractions inside the park and other activities. On weekend, public holidays and festival time; it is literally crowded and waiting time could be more on every games and other shows. It is really a great place to have fun with family, friends and your kids and further more a knowledgeable too. Live shows of Dolphins and Seals are shown which is really fun to watch and life time memorable event. Have a great day.
Good theme park. A good theme park, it's a huge park and up and over a hill. Very spaced out so lots of walking to cover the whole park.

Great place for good fun. The rides are awesome, you have to try hair raiser and The Flash!! My heart almost stopped from excitement , one of the best rides ever!! Very big park, loads of rides, entrance fee 300 hkd per adult approx, nice snacks all over the park. The aquarium is big and well laid out but needs to up their game and get us a shark or at least a crocodile (have you not been to Dubai people? They got sharks and crocks in shopping malls!) Wear shorts and T shirts here.. have fun :)
Mr. It was a really good experience and was alot bigger than I expected.. Really good venue for families... Would recommend it to anyone that's planning to go to Hong Kong :)

Always worth a visit. Returned after 5 years and this time with a wife. Always worth a visit and would suggest you get the tickets towards exit to bus in the admiralty mtr as its cheaper than buying at the gate. Also suggest going early to avoid crowds and see the pandas move as after breakfast they just sleep (learnt this when i was jn Chendu seeing pandas there).The shark exhibit was fun and so was the artic ones along with associated animals.Be prepared to spend at least 5hrs there to get full value for money.

One of the Best in the World. It is more than a theme park, in fact it has entertainement, zoo and bothanical sections. Location is special with peaks and lush gardens; travelling between theme parks cand be done by gondols or speed trains thru tunnels. Have lunch in the middle of pinguins and ice, then visit red and giant pands in their habitats. Birds on exhibit are absolutely beautiful and unseen by Europeans. While atrrections are spectacular, but lines are quite long.

Still charming. Was here when I was a boy, and back then the park seemed to be just an amusement park. Now, more than 10 years later, I'm back at Ocean Park and the things that used to keep me excited still do! The park has expanded much since and I hope it will continue to charm the hearts of many for years to come.
Too big for just 1 day!. They have everything for all ages! From educational, to thrill rides and even for those who want to experience a family packed fun!

Don't miss the Halloween at Ocean Park. If you ever visit Hongkong in the month of October, make sure you keep one day of the weekend (Friday to Sunday) for Ocean Park. The Park itself is amazing where you see Penguins and Pandas and Dolphins and sharks and sea lions. The rollercoasters ride are strategically placed on top the hill on the cliff sides, which give the feel of falling into water. But coming back to Halloween at Ocean Park, its a lifetime experience. The park is open till midnight with proper elaborate costume characters walking all around very convincing in their character. The decor is spooky and the characters scare you and take you by surprise number of times. There are ghost flash mobs by amazing skeleton and clown dancers, rock concerts, other special spooky performances like Hellympics and horror zones like walking dead which take your breathe away. Its unbelievable how the park has invested in Halloween but its one experience one should not miss

Superb Theme Park. Worth going to for the Pandas alone but there is so much to see here it would take several days to do it justice. Really well thought out attractions kids of all ages would happily spend all day here. Plenty of places to sit and eat too. Cable car to higher section of park gives stunning views. Highly recommended.

Good, but be prepared for queues!. We chose to check out Ocean Park because of fun memories as a child, the rides were exciting and it was almost a full day out. The place has been significantly renovated in recent years, with newer exhibits like Old Hong Kong and Goldfish Treasures making up a few of the nicer little diversions. Panda Village was adorable, with both red pandas and HKs famous giant pandas gifted from the mainland in 2007- they are situated in an air conditioned, covered grassy enclosure designed to simulate the Chinese mountainside habitats the bamboo giants now inhabit. While the enclosure seemed a little small, the pandas seemed happy and were a highlight of our day.One major disappointment we did not foresee was the extortionate food prices, with hindsight this should have been expected given that once inside you have no choice but to pay $40 for a hot dog or $25 for a bottle of water (almost 5x the price in the street). The queues were absolutely packed for the cable car with crowds and crowds of day trippers from across the border. While walking from halfway along the queue to join the end, the waiting time increased by 15 minutes. Other than the crowds and the food prices, we still enjoyed the beautiful sea lions and the view from the cable car over Deep Water Bay and the park itself was really pleasant. Probably better to pack your own lunch, and if you go mentally prepared to wait in queues fairly often you will most likely have a good experience.

Feels like a child again. The place is beyond my expectation,they have lots of exciting rides..the aquarium itself is really amazing seeing the nature of the sea is fun to look at,and travel to the other side of the place by cable car it was a great experience seeing some part of the whole amusement park and so is the nature of Lantau. I was in awe seeing the all the rides and riding the long escalator... To sum up it all it was GREAT.. TOTALLY AMAZING..

Wowie. I missed my family. Its a leisure day trip.Very well maintained park.Do try the hair raiser. Its bound to raise hair. The aquarium, seals and walrus was the highlight of the trip. Try all. Us the cable car both ways up and down. And please use the fast track uprgrade in membership. It is well worth the extra bucks.Saved us a good 5 hours i reckon and we could hence complete the ocean park.

Must do for the giant pandas!. Really good theme park, with great animal attractions - the aquarium is excellent, seeing giant pandas was amazing, there's a dolphin show and penguins and Arctic foxes. It's spread out, with a great cable car connecting the two main areas (take the train down to avoid the queues at the end of the day) great day out with the kids
Need 2 days to finish all the rides. This theme park is big, you need at least 2 days to finish them all. The Express Trains was really good and fun for kids, they have priority access for kids
Worth going with kids. Takes a full day to see the full place.great fun for kids.the seals,penguins and pandas are added attractions.

Great fun day out. Easy to get to with a short metro and bus ride. The logistics of getting to the park is made easy with excellent services. The park has roller coasters, cable cars and wild life that all makes for a fun day out for everyone.

Great day out. Cheaper than Disney well worth it!. A great theme park! So much to see and do. So many zones due to the hills so ppl very spread out and queues not to long. A cross between Busch gardens and sea world.

Always worth a visit. We have been to Ocean park several times, and it never gets boring as they always build new things and add more attractions. Be sure to arrive there early and book your tickets in advance!

A great outing. Had a great time with friends and enjoyed the company of dolphins, penguins, panda and seals. The rides are good but queues are lengthy maybe because of Sunday. Horror show was not at all scary. Food is good.

Great Fun!. Ocean Park offers a little something for everybody. There are rides galore for kids and adults, animal shows, bird shows, exotic animal exhibits (The kids fell in love with the adorable panda), an ocean theatre, aqua attractions and a cable car ride to the other half of the park! It is a well - planned park with decent restaurants and clean restrooms. No wonder this place is the local favourite! There is very little not to love about it!

Fun time with my son during Halloween!. Ocean park is a great experience. Lots of rides for young and old. Plenty of animal shows, aquariums and exhibits. See the panda and check out the arctic exhibits. Ride the cable car and get spectacular views! Since it was Halloween there were people in costumes, there were walking dead exhibits and a haunted house. The park was decorated and there were lots of zombies walking around! fun fun fun!To get there take the mtr to ADMIRALITY. Then take exit B. BEFORE you exit the mtr there is a place to buy discounted tickets. Buy your tickets there and save yourself lining up at the park. Lastly when you exit the MTR the CITYBUS is on the left. Cant miss it. No need to get tickets for the bus, just use your octopus card! Have a great time!
Asia Holiday . The park look ok. Staff are not very cooperative with visitors, will not speak in English. Will not go back.

Great adventure park. There are two major destinations in hong kong that almost everyone visits - disneyland and the ocean park.The ocean park is absolutely breathtaking. Rides like the Flash (360 degrees turn vertically) and other roller coasters which are just absolutely thrilling. The cable car ride gives breathtaking views.A good advice for adults - if you dont have enough time and have to cut your trip short, then avoid the disneyland but definitely do go to ocean park. The disneyland may come across as childish.
Out of Asia experience. A must for every genre of TUIrist n have the best fire n water show in Asia region. You need a full day to cover all and not half

Better for Older Children. Did not have a great experience, all the rides were for older children. They do have some fun rides for small children down at Whiskers Park; went on a Monday and it was packed. The waiting for cable car to go up was 45 minutes, so took the funicular instead. All in all i much preferred Disney.

One day trip. The ocean park is a must visit in Hong Kong. One can easily spend a day here as there is so much to do.The best attraction here is the Cable car. Although there are long queues, it is definitely worth the wait as the view is spectacular.

Regressing to childhood at Ocean Park. Being the week of Halloween there was a lot of excitement around. Too many rides and places to be seen in a day. Aquarium was good but could have conveyor belts to go around as is in Singapore and Australia. Took a cable car to summit where roller coaster games are also there. Some arrangement should be made for senior citizens and kids to return in the same cable car as it is too tiring to go back to the queue for returning. The fountain at the entrance is awesome.

Nice place to visit in Hong Kong. A Mini Zoo with amusement park.Has a cable car ride to the top of the mountain where the amusement rides are there.Hell raiser is a great roller coaster ride.They have Pandas, Koala Bears, Kangaroos, Penguins, Seals, Walruses, Jelly Fishes, A Huge Aquarium with Sharks and other fishes.They have a Dolphins & Seal Show atop the hill.A nice place to visit with the Family.Crowded as it is among the star attractions of hong kong

Animals and rides. Ocean park is kind of like Sea World. They have animals to see (in mostly cool rooms which is a great on a hot/humid day), and rides for all ages.Its definitely at least a day (if not two) days worth of things to do there. As is with most theme parks, the food is ridiculously overpriced, however Ocean Park actually has a McDonalds on site.The park itself is massive! You definitely can not walk it all. You need to take either the train or cable cars up to the other side of the park, but both provide a great trip/views in the process.I would remember going early in the morning, as it starts to get crowded and wait lines get longer after lunch.We went on a Monday when the park opened and it was less than 5 mins wait to go on any rides. But after lunch, wait times extended out to 20+ mins.The park offers strollers for hire, and they are worth it. Not only does it save you from carrying tired little ones, it means you go in a separate, and most beneficially faster! queues even when its busy.Worth the money it costs to get in here.The only thing it was lacking was a pool - which apparently is what is going in at the moment (which explains the construction at the entrance).

A day at Ocean Park. This park is a little way out on Hong Kong Island but Transport to it is easy Via Bus/MTR. Locate on the side of a mountain the adult rides at the top are awesome. It is a wide spread park so be prepared to walk a bit. Direction and signage can be a little confussing at first, study map proir and plan your day well.Plenty for all the family from young to old.In October its Hallowen nights and they go way out to celebrate, great fun.Best place to eat it at the top next to cable car ride.On busy days the wait for cable car can take up too 20 mins but worth it for the view.Value for money, and I've been a a good few around the globe.
Horrible in the summer. Scorching heat and long queues. It started raining at 3pm. Did not get to take any rides other than cable car.Would come again during spring/fall.

cable car. Long queue to ride cable car-,food is not good at all , one should eat only in Macdonalds in this park, many rides but one should wait their turn, return downwards better train raid to save time.

good one. a very big theme park but littlebit scattered and not well organised.it takes a lot of time to find out the ways and areas as informations are not proper.good day out for children.remember to study the map first before going.

Not great. Ocean Park is like stepping back in time to a fun park from the 1970s and really not great.There are not many rides and the ones that there are are very tame.The park is split over 2 sites and connected with a cable car (which is probably the best bit)The pandas are cute, but mainly asleep

Something for everyone Ocean Park is a must in HK. Ocean Park is a theme park with conservation at its heart. the are giant pandas, red pandas, koala bears; dolphins, penguins many many other wildlife exhibits. All these are built within the site which has 2 main areas separated by a mountain with a lovely cable car ride or a subterranean cable railway connecting the areas. At busy times there can be long queues for the popular attractions and rides. there are rides for all ages from infants to roller junkies! all beautifully landscaped into the coastal site. There are special themed periods e.g. Halloween when the site is decorated throughout. The day is not cheap but all profits go into conservation research.
Awesome . Made on two mountains i wud say it is one of the finest theme parks i have seen and the cable car that travels accross is as awesome as it can get

very cool place with nature beauty. its very cool & interesting place full of many interesting places mixed with nature beauty & there r alot of people from all around the world come 2 visit this place & it really deserve to visit ,specially during halloween time . u will feel it more that time more than other times cuz it full of spiritual feelings,recommended to visit it
ordinary amusement park. For me nothing special here. Just like another amusement park. Plus point of ocean park is the view around this place.beautiful...

MUST GO especially during the Halloween period!. Came here by public transport. Took the Citybus Route 629 from Admiralty MTR Station. For other pickup points or other modes of transport, you can check their website for details.This is a great place to spent a full day at. Ranging from thrilling rides to viewing of animals, shows, it is a place filled with endless things to do! You can spend the whole day here, especially like now, when during the Halloween season: it opens from 10:30 am - 11 pm. for Fridays, Saturdays and Sundays. It is a must-go for people who enjoy being scared haha! Their extremely scary attractions are really worth queuing for, and there are 6 of them! Other than that, you are still able to play the other normal rides in the park. Along the way in the park, prepared to be greeted by different scary characters and you can take photos with them. They may sneak up behind you and suddenly scare you. HAHA!I would love to visit again during Halloween next year!!!

Great rides, too many people. Interesting mix of aquariums and rides. I wouldn't advise people to visit between July-September as there are way too many people from mainland China. They will do their best just to annoy you and trod on you whilst you are waiting patiently in the queues. The rides themselves generally had waiting times of over 40 minutes and even aquariums were full. I wouldn't recommend buying too much food from the stalls as they were overpriced compared with other theme parks. Never get a spaghetti bolognese from the park....it was brown and revolting. ;)

Had a great day! Good layout but expensive food. Really enjoyed our day, went midweek but still had to dodge coach parties. The park was clean and well organised, on entry we were offered free upgrade to fast track, which was actually very useful to avoid the queues.We travelled by taxi from Times Sq, though an MTR station will be opening soon.Onsite food and drink follows the trend for such places being quite expensive, so it is worth doing as we did, bringing a packed lunch.Overall fully recommended!

For the Ingorant . Anyone that likes Ocean Park obviously has not been out of the village in a long time. The place is run down, poorly managed, and generally low quality. The majority of the clientele are mainland Chinese locals who are on their first vacation. If you have any frame of reference or experience you are best served to spend your valuable time somewhere else.
Great attraction. Pleasantly surprised as this is much more than a theme park. Kids can have a great time and there are many displays/attractions for adults. Views are also impressive.

Top notch. This place was not included in my itenieryBut as I had a spare day planned to have a go Had I not been here it would have been a big mistake A vast park with cable car being the star attraction Was there during the Halloween month so everything was ghastlyThe rides shows and amusement games all top notch MUST VISIT

Huge Ocean Park in Hong Kong has lot of sea animals and also some game rides and activities. The Park is huge and needs one full day to go around and enjoy all the attractions. There are nice displays of animals and aquatic life which are educative and also there are fun rides .. Some Hair Raiser rides and terrific roller coaster rides are also part of the park. There are enough activities for younger kids, like the Doraemon shows . As we went during halloween time, there was trick or treat organized and my younger child enjoyed it thoroughly

Pandas, Penquins, Koalas and much more. I visited Ocean Park on a Thursday. I got there before opening time and it was quite quick getting a ticket and entering the park. I went first to the panda enclosure.It is a thrill to see the large panda up close chowing down on bamboo. There were only a few visitors in the enclosure which made it so enjoyable.I took the Ocean Express train to the upper level. Some may prefer the cable car, but for those who have vertigo like me the train is the way to go.One highlight for me was the penguin enclosure. Dozens of adorable penguins standing on ice or swimming. Bring a jacket; its very cold!A super attraction is the river rafting. For those who might not be brave enough to go river rafting, here's a chance to sample it in a safe way.After taking the train back to the lower level, I visited Old Hong Kong, which gives visitors an opportunity to see what Hong Kong was like years ago.Another highlight is the Australia enclosure. There are adorable koalas munching on eucalyptus leaves in the trees and wallibies hopping around.The huge aquarium is brilliant.These are my personal favorites in the park but there is much more. There are places to eat, beautiful views from the upper level, and courteous park staff to answer questions.Buy a ticket at Admiralty MTR station and get 10% off. Then take the 629 bus from Admiralty to the Ocean Park entrance.

Amazing Experience. Don't miss it. I experienced Ocean park on my second trip to Hong Kong and the first thing that crossed my mind was WHY DID I NOT DO THIS THE LAST TIME!!!Ocean's park has something for all age groups. From cute pandas to high thrill rides there is something for everyone. Thrill mountain is a perfect recipe for adventure junkies. Definitely try the hair raiser at least twice. I'll summarize my experience in the form of tips that might help people visiting the place:1. Needless to say, if possible schedule the trip to ocean's park on a weekday (preferably sometime between Monday and Thursday). You can beat the crowd and enjoy to the fullest.2. Buy your ticket through Klook. They offer you a discount of HKD 50 per ticket. Booking is instant and you can skip the ticket queues at the park.3. The park timings sometimes tend to change. Make sure you know the opening and closing times for the park on the day you visit. Arrive at the park 15 minutes before it is scheduled to open.4. As soon as you enter the park, there is a locker room on the immediate right. Store all your luggage there at the earliest. Its very convenient. Its a keyless system. Once you pay for a locker, you can set a 4 digit pin and that will be valid for the whole day. 5. The first thing you should do take the ocean express (train) to the summit station. 6. Thrill mountain first: The thrill mountain is located on the summit. This has 4 high thrill rides. Go for this first. Make sure you ride the hair raiser first and then the flash. These are two of the most popular rides in the park. As the day goes, the waiting time for these rides range between 30 min to 90 minutes on a weekday (maybe longer on weekends). I went for hair raiser first and got the seat on the first row in 5 min. After this, I immediately went for the flash. I was done with both the rides in 20 min. If you decide to keep this for later, you will waster hours of precious time waiting in queues. 7. The park is divided into zones: Each zone has a theme and rides associated with that theme. Use the map provided to you at the entrance (for free) and cover the park in a systematic manner to ensure you don't miss anything.8. Popular rides which normally attracts queues: Hair Raiser, Flash, Raging River, Mine Train, Make sure you cover these in the first half. The park is generally more crowded in the second half and thus the lines become bigger. 9. There are display boards at many places which show you the waiting time for all rides. If you find a ride you want to go with less waiting time (<30 min) go for it immediately. Make hay while the sun shines)10. Getting a gopro is not of much use. I wanted to create videos of all rides. But the staff out there are very sharp to hunt down on any video recording device however well you hide them (Trust me I tried). In the end, you will just be carrying it around and leaving it by the side for every ride. 11. Raging river is the only place you will get wet. Swimwear not required in this park. 12. Keep a note of all showtimes. The ideal time to watch the shows would be in the afternoon. This is when you will be tired from the walking and the rides. You can enjoy the shows while having a light meal and drink (Do not have a heavy lunch. You will regret it if you want to repeat any of the high thrill rides)I think I have covered everything I experienced during my trip to ocean's park. Don't miss this place.

Great rides amazing for kids. Getting there is very easy just take a taxi and you get there. There are lots of great rides in ocean park but one thing was there were rides for little kids than thrill seekers. Little kids will definitely enjoy all the rides. There is a cafe to eat lunch with kid and veg options. Overall an OK trip.

Great. It's very nice. Cover all shows before going for rides. Rides are till late but shows close early. The park is well spread out with very nice views and rides. All rides are a must. Well managed. Food quality and variety is nice.

Btter than Disneyland. A great amusement park without the huge lineups of Disneyland. The aquarium and water shows are wonderful. Chinese theme entertainingly appropriate. Wonderful place for children and adults.

Horrible experience at the park. Terrible experience at this park, my friend and I were so pissed.We queued up for one of the rides for 40 minutes and there was this mainland China woman trying to cut our queue.At the Ocean Express Waterfront Station, we encountered the same.Full of mainland China old folks and uncivilised people trying to get in front of you in line.Totally no personal space for us in this park.We queued for more than an hour at the cable car ride to get back.We left the park within 4 hours of visit.Will never return to this park ever.

Did not meet expectations. It is a large amusement park with a large aquarium, fish exhibits and amusement rides. We decided to go here as we had already been to Disney Land in Paris and did not want to go back within such a short span. The park is huge but it did not meet expectations. The no. of fish and mammals in the park are impressive but overall it turned out to be a bit boring seeing the same things again and again. The dolphin show was also not what we expected considering the one in Safari park, Bangkok. It is definitely a good place for kids considering the activities and it would be fascinating for them to view all the fishes but overall to little bit of disappointment. The best thing here was the ropeway, it gives spectacular views.
BOO !. Ocean Park was amazing, the special Halloween themed characters running around were VERY scary! Amazing

Amazing day at the park worth the visit. So let me start first that we been at the park in the time of Halloween and this is a huge difference! First of all the landscape from the park is amazing! The park is quite big so you have a long way to walk there so get a comfortable shoes and get ready to be wet there , me and my wife have been there on Friday morning from 11:00 (park open at 10:30) until 22:30 (park close at 23:00) and we almost did all the rides in the park, because of Halloween events there the park was already full at 10:30, the waiting time for each ride was between 10-15 min to 45-50 min depends which ride and what time u try to go there, I really recommend you to buy a ticket before so you won't need to wait there to buy tickets, we bought our tickets on the "seven eleven" shops around 350$.The overhaul experience was really good and the rides there was really fun, but I think that without the Halloween special activities it was less fun and we probably stay there for less time.If you kind of person that can't wait for long time for each ride you can buy the premium Vip ticket that usually cost twice the price (but still affordable, around 60€) and u have a special entrance for each ride that u just pass all the long waiting time and just get in.But the Chinese know how to manage this queues and it goes pretty fast (except 2-3 rides that we really waited for long time) if you can be there at Halloween time I really really recommend you that and also recommend you to buy the Vip ticket so you won't spend time for waiting like us, it could cut us 2-4 hours of free time to do something else.They made some scary rides there specially for Halloween that really well made (one of them was "the walking dead" that u escape zombies) and u got a trick or treat path that u get a bag and get candies :)So I really recommend u to go there, the entrance is not expensive and even if it's not Halloween u still have lots to do there (like the big aquarium there and some places u can see dolphins and more animals)Lots of fun for couples, families and even alone
Just Hideous.... If you want to see a 40 year old man climb over your infant just to get in front of you in line, then this is the place for you!

Fun Halloween day. A good place to be for family and friends for a day or so... If you are going for their halloween theme, please make sure you have purchased the premium tickets which is more expensive but really worth it especially if you are planning to go on weekends. The premium ticket is good for most of the rides and the queue is 10 times shorter! Worth the money!!

Perfect one-day activity for an 11 year old kid. The Travel Desk at the Harbour Grand suggested we go to Ocean Park and provided us tickets. Ocean Park is a large local amusement and attractions park similar to Disneyland (where we went too) but with more of a family feel. My 11 year old grandson enjoyed Ocean Park 100%, the rides, the laser cinema, the cable car... Soon there will be a MTR station next to the park entrance. We went in a taxi... taxis are not expensive in Hong Kong.
Massive. Its a humungous park which you certainly can not do in a day.Lines to enter for rides sometimes can be hour long so plapplan accordinglyaccordinglt.

Everything is Awesome. Everything is great about this place from the rides to the food and the awesome halloween haunted houses! definitely alot one day for this attraction or better yet come back for two days as the lines and cues can be an hour long! Only bad thing were some ____ tourists who generally do not know how to fall in line, some were a bit rowdy and always shouting when talking to each other ( Blank Tourists you know who you are)

Ocean Park at Halloween. We chose this park over Disneyland and I'm certainly glad we did as this park really does have it all. At the time we were there they were in full Halloween mode with lots of haunted house style attractions as well as the animals, roller coasters and exhibits. After travelling around various Panda enclosures in mainland China, and back home at Edinburgh Zoo, it was here at Ocean Park I finally got to see a Panda take a walk (albeit only for around 10ft).After dark is when the park sprang to life and the Halloween decorations came into their own. The staff who were dressed in costumes looked incredible and were happy to pose for a photo or two.At this time the park was promoting The Walking Dead fairly heavily, I suppose to coincide with the release of season 6. Personally as a huge Walking Dead fan I loved this, so thank you Ocean Park for one amazing day.Take a day here as you'll need it, and the rest, to see everything.

Great, but avoid weekends & holidays. This park is huge, too big for us to see everything in a full day. We went mid-week thinking it would be quieter, but it turned out to be a public holiday, so queues were massive, 60 mins to buy entry tickets & up to 75 mins for some rides. We ended up up-grading to fast pass for double the entry fee & it was worth it on such a busy day. This is much better suited to teens and older kids than Disneyland, far more thrilling rides & shows for teens.Would go back, but check the holiday calendar first!

Possibly the best theme park in HK. My family bought season tickets to OP and weren't disappointed. In addition to the usual attractions; cable car, aquarium, animals, shows and thrill rides, there is almost always something new in the park each time we've visited. My advice would be to plan your visit to visit the 'top' attraction ie top park first as it gets very busy up there in the afternoon. We've found that going up in the submarine and coming back down around 2pm in the cable car works best as the queues always seem to be shortest then. A season ticket also gives you chance to book seats at shows at a time of your choosing and this tends to be less crowded. A great park overall

Over the top. In its goal of becoming Asia's leading zoologically-focused theme park, if that is indeed its goal, Ocean Park tries to become all things to all men and is becoming too large, too complex, just too much. Poor signposting which loses you in mid journey to attractions, silly bureaucratic rules which prevent children from joining adults on some of the safer rides and other obstacles can make vidits tiring and frustrating. There is much that the park does well: the wonders of the jellyfish and the aquarium exhibits, which are excellent and the environmental awareness enhancing marine shows. There is much that could be improved: the food and beverage offering and some of the terrestrial exhibits. Why not provided some standard insulated clothing for the freezing cold penguin and arctic exhibits, which everyone wants to see but for which few are prepared ? These wraps could be distributed at the entrance and collected at the exit. There is a cavalier lack of attention to detail and a "take it or leave it" attitude which smacks of hubris and does nothing to enhance the value of the brand. Rather than grow, grow, grow into further unmanageable sprawl, why not rethink, disaggregate and create more profitable opportunities for enjoyment ?

Great Park in the centre of the city. No MTR connections to Ocean park as of now, although station is still being built.Take 629 bus from Admirality which takes you right to ocean park.Must see: The cable car ride to the top i.e summit where most of the rides are located. Gives you excellent view of the sea and the mountains.Hair raiser, Rapids, mine train, dragon, Flash, and Abyss are some the thrill rides which are a must try.Ocean theatre has got the sea dreams musical show which is also a must watch. Check the show timings.When coming down from the summit, take the train ride. once down you can go to see the pandas and the Grand aquarium. I liked the way in which the aquarium is built, it tends to be crowded as most people visit it during the closing time.There is also a laser lights fountain show at the end of the day.Food is theme park styled and costly.

Excellent. Highlight for me is the ride on the cable car to the top. breathtaking drops. There was a 60 minute queue to get on ( both up & down). This could have been reduced considerably if the cars were filled, they're 10 seaters but the staff were letting as few as 2 at a time get on. Allow at least half a day here, probably more. All the attractions are free once in and there's lots of inexpensive food stalls around with a good choice.The panda's were a bit shy for us sadly, its a great though for young and old

Disappointing !. I went with such great expectations and was disappointed . The aquarium was under equipped , the staff not interested , despite signs of no flash usage , tourists kept using flashes and the staff just stood there n watched .the dolphin and seal show left much to be desired

Better than Hong Kong Disneyland. I had more fun at this park than Hong Kong Disneyland, it has animal attractions, roller coasters, kids themed rides, but as another theme park, expect super long queues.

Much Better than Disneyland!. We did Disneyland on my birthday and Ocean Park the next day. What a difference between the two places. Ocean Park is everything Disneyland should have been and more. We thoroughly enjoyed Ocean Park and consider it a must see attraction in Hong Kong. The only negative I can think of is that if you are mobility challenged in any way, Ocean Park may be more than you are up to. You will walk ALOT. There is both a train and a tramway connecting the two sides of the park, but even so, you still walk a great deal. If walking is difficult for you, you may not enjoy this park as much as others.On the day we were there, the sky cars were running but only half of the cars were being used. So half the cars left the station empty. This resulted in quite a long line which seemed senseless. I asked one of the attendants why this was and she said, "because we are only using half of the cars." That helped! NOT. LOLOther than that, we found the rides very good, the exhibits interesting and the street entertainers quite good. The walk through aquarium is a must see as is the Panda exhibit.The roller coasters were awesome unlike the ones at Disneyland which were mostly mediocre. Disneyland would still be the go to place if you have young children though.Getting to the park is a bit more challenge than getting to Disneyland. The MTR will take you close, then you must transfer to a bus for the remainder of the ride. There are plenty of signs directing you along the way, just follow the signs and you'll have no problems.The seal/Walarus exhibit was very good. We come from an area where seals live in abundance, so seeing them is pretty old hat for us. If you are not so blessed to live in such an area, I think the seal exhibit would be much more exciting. Still, who can not like watching seals play...besides Salmon fishermen I mean?
It,s Amazing. It is a beautiful park with lot of rides. But it can not be seen in one day. The best attaraction of Oceon Park is Cable car.

Love the Cable Car. I had an amazing experience in every theme park. For Ocean Park Hong Kong I really love the cable car rides and for the Hot Air Balloon experience. and also meet the Giant Panda here and experience the acquarium.

Great Park for Adults and Children. My husband and I spent a few hours at the park and were very impressed with the huge acquariums which is the best we have ever seen .The only drawback are the queues to take the gondola ride to the acquariums. Theattendants instead of filling each one with at least 6 people, at times they let 1, 2 or 3 people go alone when there were about 300 people waiting to go! Very crazy! They should try to get people moving much quicker. The Park itself has excellent facilities and animals of interest.

Extremelyyyyy .... Such a wonderful theme park i have been to. To get over there we need to ride cable car across the sea. Nice view from up there. The attraction super duper extreme! Hope to come back when i have kid!

More fun than Disneyland. Disneyland is for children. If you want more fun attractions and rides, visit Ocean Park.Must see and must try:1. Aqua City. Check it out at night when it has a show similar to Las Vegas Bellagio's Dancing Fountain.2. North Pole Encounter which has walruses.3. South Pole Spectacular. Dozens of penguins including king penguins.4. Space Wheel, Flash and Rollercoaster. Don't be a chicken. Do more than taking Ocean Park's cable cars. These extreme rides are scarily fun! But be prepared to wait in queues for these popular rides. 5. Grand Aquarium. Lots of fishes and stunning corals. Check out the Reef Tunnel (nice photo-op spot). This is the world's largest aquarium dome.6. Panda Sichuan. The highlight of my visit because I just love pandas and to see it up close is amazing!There were just so many attractions to see and rides to enjoy here that one day is not enough.Con: Bad and expensive food wherever we dined inside the park.Note: If you have younger children, better take them to Disneyland. As some reviewers shared, queues are long, the place requires a lot of walking and rides have height requirements. But if you're a group of friends or adults, this place is for you!
Panda experience. We went there primarily to see the Giant Panda. They didn't disappoint. Parts of the park are a little tired and the food isn't great. The new aquarium is definitely worth a look.

Lovely day out for young and old. We recently spent a day at Ocean Park with our 6 and 4 year old children. A lot of the reviews I read noted that it was not a place for young children. We however had a different experience. Our children loved the park, although they could not go on most of the rides.We enjoyed the aquarium, Asian animals, the Polar lands and the cable car was a great hit. It was a great day out for our family.

Good day. We enjoyed our day there. We caught bus 629 from Central which takes you to the entrance. Really enjoyed Polar Adventure also Asian animals, the pandas also the red panda. The summit wasn't open on the day we went. There was a large queue to the Aquarium when we went past so left that for later, but our later was at closing time so we missed it. There are 2 different areas and you catch the train to the other area. This area has roller coasters, water rides, etc.

Great way to spend a day. Ocean park has so many activities and things to see and do. I spent all day there and still had things left to do. It is a must for anyone who has a strong interst in the ocean and a spare day.

Bigger is not always better. This theme park is impressively huge, but it's maybe too big.We are pretty fit, but even for us it was way too much walking and the queues for the cable cars were incredibly long and since it was such a hot day it felt like being tortured slowly.If I had taken my younger kids on this occasion it would have been a disaster because I don't think they would have been able to do that much walking and waiting in queues with toddlers will never be fun.The pandas however made this excursion worth it for me. They were just magnificent.

Halloween fest pass was worth it. This was one enjoyable day..Actually highlight of my trip to HK....The Halloween fest pass was great as it almost equates to VIP entry to some of the rides. It felt like I visited 3 places in one spot and day with VIP access...1. Theme park with rides. 2. Animal life/Zoo (sea life, other animals), 3. Haunted houses. This equates to fun, fun, fun. Ocean Park is enjoyable as i wanted a change from the Disney theme parks. Also, the premium ticket is better than Disneyland's Fast Pass. But without a doubt, Disney theme parks are "better" in general. So i would recommend to any first timers to visit Disney first.

Good for kids as well as adults. This is a great place for the whole family. It has many things to do for adults as well as kids. Don't come here on weekends to avoid crowds. Especially at the Buddha statue. Few good places to eat, however overpriced. But this is expected at the tourist destination.

A Hong Kong diamond ( ocean park ). As a western traveller in Hong Kong I found visiting ocean park one of the highlights of my visit !from the brilliant cable car with amazing views to the massive aquarium as well as the sealife show ! parking and transport links are very good from the main bus stations on Hong Kong island .my favourite part of the day was the panda enclosure great to see a visitor attraction taking such a pro active view on animal conservation .well worth a visit

A fun day out but not for younger kids.. Not the best place to go if you have small children under 122cm tall as there is not much for them to do there. We had a younger child who was only 120cm tall and he could only go on 2 rides. There are other attractions to see, but we were interested in all the rides and it was a shame that only 1 of our children could enjoy it all. It's a better place for families of older children. Disneyland is better for younger kids.

Whole day experience . Make sure you have the whole day there. The park is massive. I spent 8 hours they're and don't think I quite did everything. I went on a Friday and it wasn't too busy. During October they are having a Halloween fest which is awesome. The characters are brilliant and the park is open til 11pm. It's ready to get there on public transport. It's pricey but I would say is worth it. I would love to have taken kids but it would be worth it if they are tall enough for the rides. Brilliant day and a must do
Great for older kids. We took our 3 kids, 9,9,4 on a friday and it was good but the rides are for older kids and there were massive waits (30-60 minutes).
Great Day Out. Absolutely loved this place. It is great not only a theme park but also an aquarium and a zoo. Spent the day here and it was well worth it.

too hot, too spreadout. The day we visited Ocean Park the cable car was shut - which was an issue at the end of the day when we had to pack like sardines into the Ocean Express to get back through the mountain to go to the exit. We thoroughly enjoyed the different animal displays, the frigid temperatures in the north pole encounter and south pole spectacular were certainly a welcome relief from the unrelenting heat outside. There was also a great variety of rides to suit all ages. The first downside to this park is that everything is so spreadout and there is very little to no shade throughout. We ended up leaving without seeing everything as the heat made us exhausted. The other downside was that we couldn't easily find our way around - the park is a bit confusing. We would visit Ocean Park again though.

Just another theme park. * unless you go to the gym 3 times a week for cardio workouts - be prepared for puffing and huffing to get around the park.* lines that last over an hour to go on a water ride that last 5 mins!* average food - even at the restaurant for corporate guests (company family day and company off-site experience!).* kids preferred disneyland!
expensive. to busy, to expensive, silly to do while you can do so many nice things! This is the thing to avoid!

Excellent. Something for everyone. Loved it. Not a ride person but still had plenty of things to see and do. Lots of animals and an amazing aquarium. Cable car might be a long line up but there is free wifi to keep you entertained and it is definitely worth the wait. Getting there was really easy from train and connecting bus ride. Plenty of toilets and food options and the map and signs make the park easy to navigate Tip:ride cable car early to avoid the lines.

great park (esp. for older kids!), LOTS of space. have been numerous times, also for birthdays with bigger groups of kids, and loved it every time! I think due to the attractions it is especially great for older kids. What I also very much like about it that is very spacious - you have to walk lots, which I like! during peak times you might have to queue for major attractions for 1.5 hrs though :-(...but I guess that is the same in any park. IF you only have time to do one park while in HK, I would make it dependent on the age of your kids (if any) and would take younger ones to Disneyland and older ones to Ocean Park. Have fun!
Better than Disneyland for grown up kids. The rides are thrilling and the train ride between parks is great . A must see attraction in Hong Kong

How to ruin a good day. We arrived at the theme park which has good exhibits and rides located in two areas connected by a gondola lift. It appeared to be a relatively quiet day as the queues on the rides were short and it was easy to get into the shows. We enjoyed the rides and shows and decided it was time to go. As we had to go on the gondola to get back to the other side, we joined a very long queue which took 50 minutes. When we got to the lift we found that they were not filling the gondola cars which hold 6 people - there was only two of us in ours, and the one behind had 3, few were full, so we had waited way longer then necessary. Also we found the they were selling tickets to jump the queue, so we gathered that this was organised this way to have a long queue so to sell tickets to jump the queue. At one stage there was a big argument from people in the queue when the operators were putting people with tickets ahead of the queue. This is totally unacceptable, AVOID this place and go somewhere else.

A Very Fun Park.. I usually stop by Ocean Park when I visit Hong Kong as it does provide a lot of thrills. The park itself is huge with a lot of rides and attractions and though sometimes the wait times are long, it is standard for any amusement park. The Gondola ride is super scary but has a very nice view of the ocean and the mountains. The rides are thrilling enough for riders of all ages.

not a must see but try to go. since we had seen Disney,we went to ocean park.the tickets are little cheap outside the bus stand then from the park itself.few rides were closed and few rides were badly maintained.the polar region is the only worth seeing as you will never see those animals anywhere in closure.the rides are good ,food expensive. Disney is better but this is good ,depends on whom you go with .
Looveed it. Loved the birds, animals, rides, location....just about everything about this place. Highly recommended.

Ocean Park. On your trip to Hong Kong do visit Ocean Park. You won't regret it. Also, if your time and budget permits do Encounter with the Dolphins (needs to be booked two days prior). It's amazing. Check out their website for more details / show.
Fabulous. A fantastic experience.Stayed all day. Get a 2 day pass you'll need it.Plenty of rides and lots of animals and birds and sea creature's to enjoy

Exciting trip. As a part of our sight seeing trip to Hong Kong we visited Ocean Park for one full day. It is very exciting to watch so many animals. Penguins, walrus and other marine animals as well as all the shows were fantastic. we particularly enjoyed dolphin show. The major attraction is cable car ride to the other part of the park which is really very nice with spectacular views. However, only draw back is lot of walking. It is very tiring walking between each attraction. Also really wish they have more places to take rest and with good shelter. Since the day we went was very sunny and hot, we had some problems. While returning in cable car, we happened wait in long queues and without any shelter in hot sun. That has almost spoiled our enjoyment.

NOT AS EXPECTED. "Come out of the Admiralty MTR and take Bus no . 629"Yes it is Big,,, So?Doesn’t really impress the people who have seen the world before. But I would still guide to those who love thrills. Take the cable car immediately and visit the Summit. The only rides I personally liked were The Hair Raiser, Rev Booster and The Dragon. Rest all of them are very mediocre and may not impress. The musical fountain at the entrance looks better after the evening sets in.Symbio the show doesnt run on weekdays so it wasn’t a luck for me but since I didn’t have the courage to queue for the rides I preferably chose a Tuesday.Ocean theater’s show is below average and turns out to be poorly themed. Singapore zoo, Universal Studios and The SEA aquarium offers much more organized shows and displays than this one. To me this is a below average theme park with nothing much to offer for an international visitor. Not even that many photo oppurtunities. Visit this if the only intention is to kill the time in HK.Period !!

Sunday visit. . Went there on a Sunday morning. Surprisingly wasnt crowded for a Sunday but it got really really crowded at 3pm onwards. Many exciting rides, better than those at Disneyland HK. Many animals to see too. Many of the characters were kinda copied from Western cultures though like Wizard of Oz. but exciting to see sth new.
