There are two parts of the park, one is at the bottom and another at the hilltop which is accessible by cable cars or undertunnel train.

Think twice if fearful. We got stuck for 15min and our friend was fine until that point when she had a mild panic about heights, falling, or roasting in the cable car.All was restored and fine, and I enjoyed it. Great way to explore big Buddha either one way or roundtrip
Good time for 4hours. Worth a visit...and much better than we expected in the tour. Had a 2yr old w us..do bring a pram along. Lots of walking

Great day out. Must see,Once in everything except food and drinks are free.Mono rail White water rafting.See penguins ,polar bear all in natural habitat.entertainment all day.Dont miss .Great cable car ride scary.

Great family day, as long as you like the rides :). A little expensive, if you don't go on all the rides. Beautiful park, much to see and do.Would recommend not taking children under the age of 4.Good facilities.Food closed early.Overall a good day.Saw some Pandas..

Family Fun Day. We had been to Ocean Park before but over 4 years ago, so we decided to give it a revisit. Not a lot had changed but there is still plenty to do. There is all different types of rides and attractions that can keep the whole family amused for hours. Whatever the age group, you will find something you would like to do or see.Word of warning, when you catch the ocean express train, it actually takes you to the very top of the park, same place the cable car takes you. It took us a while of walking around to realise where we were. There is some very steep hills that you walk up, if you get lost. To save a bit of money on the entry ticket, you can pre-purchase tickets from the MTR train station that you get off at to catch the bus. There is a little tourist booth that you can visit on the way to the bus you need to catch. Just happened to catch our eye as we were walking.Well worth a visit when you get to Hong Kong
Family Theme Park. A 3 in one family theme park - zoo, aquarium and rides. Amazing! The dine in restaurant with an aquarium in it is just like here in Singapore.
Breathtaking. Breathtaking, superb views went midweek and avoided the crowds. Great value for money. Very comfortable on board due to having air vents and at height lovely breeze.

Good place to visit. we went to ocean park. That the cyclone warning became No 3 from No 1. so no outside rides. The north pole and souht pole was quite goodNo indian veg food available at ocean park. we managed with ice cream
Ocean Park. Must check out! The cable car from one mountain to the next is just breathtaking! There's plenty of rides, sights, and eateries to check out!

Free admission for folks with HKID card on his or her birthday. Free admission for folks with HKID card on his or her birthday. Haven't been to Ocean Park for more than 3 decades and before I went, I had high hopes for it. Not much surprises or disappointment but would recommend three must do at Ocean Park: the cable car, the pandas and the Ocean theatre. Thumbs up to all the staff and animals (pandas, dolphines, seals...) They are the best.

Loved it. Hubby n i loved ocean park. We were lucky enough to get a super quiet day so we literally didnt queue for anything. It was a Thursday if that helps. Love that its an amusement park /zoo/ aquarium. The cable car is awesome. The only ride i didnt like was the dragon rollercoaster. My head smashed from side to side in the harness and gave me a headache but that could be cause im quite small. Otherwise a fantastic day

A STANDARD THEME PARK BUT WITH A DIFFERENCE.. Ocean Park in Hong Kong is just like any other theme park elsewhere. It has all the necessary attractions with some new ones added . I would just comment that this park is unique because the attractions / events are widely scattered which gives the visitor a chance to take his own time and make choices to witness. Simply put - the themes are widely spaced and not sequenced which makes it more appealing. This is one factor which is worrisome to Sr. citizens and people with disabilities. Other wise a good place to visit.

Reserve the Full Day. To explore Ocean Park in Honking you need a full day. So many things to do, explore and ride, a half day as we did was not at all enough. People like us who came from Himalayan Kingdom of Bhutan, its one of the best experiences for us in Hongkong. The Sharks, Corals and Dolphins are some of the animals you will see up close. If you are more interested and have time you can learn a lot from the decorations and side walls where so many beautiful facts and figures are mentioned about these animals.

Dolphin Show at Ocean Park. The Ocean Park is absolutely fantastic experience for the family. The Funicular train ride climbing a near vertical hill to reach the Ocean Park is a wonderful way to start the magical experience. The ocean park is similar to the ones in Singapore & KL. However the the dolphin & seal show is stunningly brilliant. Dont miss. Check the timings.After a long day the return is a beautiful and long cable ride back to the base.Factor a whole day of fun; excitement and rides.

Ocean park, not what it used to be.... Not what we expected. Overcrowded and very tiring Long walk on hilly terrain). No clear signage to find your way around. Avoid staying till late, there is a serious traffic jam of people trying to get out... and they all choose the train in which you are packed like sardines for the 2 minutes journey down to the exit. Getting a taxi down there is also an adventure... Not the best of experiences.

Bad weather = no rides . Unfortunately a tropical cyclone was on its way in the same time we were. We pre booked our tickets beforehand so we had to go. When there is high wind they don't run any of their rides which is super disappointing. We were able to get the cable car before they closed it down which was good. The animals and aquariums were awesome. Without those the park wouldn't be worth while without the rides. We caught the ocean Park bus from the station which was super easy. I recommend pre booking your tickets to avoid the massive lines and also get there before the park opens to avoid excessive queues to get in and for the cable car.

A trip though expensive. Visited Ocean park in September 2015. The main attraction is cable car ride. The park is just OK compared to other similar parks in the region. Should have more shows and animal exhiblts.We didn't do any rides since these were not exclusive and had been in these earlier.

Pandas!. This place was crazy busy when we arrived as it was just after Christmas and I think it might have been school holidays. We were just here to see the Pandas so we made a bee line for them straight away. They were pretty much as I expected, lazy as, but it was cool to finally see them in the flesh. The real highlight for me was the golden monkeys which were being trained by a keeper when we were there. Their little blue faces are such a delight. We didn't see much else as the queues were huge and we had limited time but worth visiting for the Pandas and I will definitely go back for a longer visit to see some of the other animals and go on the rides
An amazing Theme Park to see the ocean. An amazing Theme Park. All age visitors welcome. Wheel chair visitors are welcome, too. Many ocean things. Motorized rides also can't miss.
Excellent. Wonderful ride over the mountain on the aerial trams. Great views of the old city and a nice park to visit.. I would recommend it.
Excellent one day trip. took bus to reach this place. excellent way to spend a day in HK. amazing adventurous rides. most of eating joints are very expensive

If under 122 cm, don't bother going! . Visited with my family, 2 adults and 4 children aged 9,8,5&3. Only my eldest daughter was allowed to go on all the rides due to height restrictions. My 2 youngest children were not allowed to really go on anything. Saw the carousel and got excited that they could finally go on a ride but when we got closer realised it was closed. Shows are a little lack lustre if compared to other theme parks world wide and for an English speaking family only the main dolphin show was translated. Although, in writing on the screen, not really helpful for young kids who can't read. Visited on a hot day and as stated in previous reviews there is little shade and a lot of walking between attractions. As a comparison Disneyland lines are mostly in sheltered/ air conditioned areas making it much more comfortable. There is a McDonald's in the park which was surprising to see but offered a cheaper alternative for lunch. The park setting itself is quite nice on a hill with good views from the rides over the neighbouring towns. My children liked seeing the giant pandas, which is probably the major draw card here. For Australians who have been to dreamworld on the Gold Coast they have the rapids ride and the log ride here which are exactly the same. It is a relief to get a bit wet on a hot day, although again strict height restrictions. Still had an enjoyable day even though we were all hot and exhausted from walking so far.

Place to enjoy for all age group. I was thinking should I do this in my short trip to Hong Kong... And I made the right choice of visiting Ocean park... Park has lot of attractions for every age group... Animal and marine enclosures are very informative... They have some thrilling rides to keep the adrenaline pumping for adventure seekers... Lot of food options too... Plan your trip within the park even before you reach the entrance and get there in time... By this, you will be able to cover the attractions that you want to experience... I don't think one day is good enough to cover all the attractions, it is spread over a large area... Even with cloud cover the place was too hot and humid, be prepared... Easily accessible and it will become much easier with upcoming MTR station next to it... Really enjoyed here...

Great for swimming, but at around AUD130 for two people .... Went to revisit this attraction by Big Bus (although its served by other cheaper modes of transport. Our interest was to use the Cable car to see part if the island. The Big Bus ticket just dumped you there, and to get in required a fee of around AUD130, even for just a Cable Car ride. Great as a water park, easy to get to, and clean and organised, but ovetpriced by most standards.

Beautiful park, beautiful intentions, awful communication, awful MTR sales post. This is clearly a nice park, with good intentions and goals as well as direct personnel (but NOT good MTR sales departments), but if you go on a windy day, this should serve as a warning: all the 'mechanical outdoor rides' will be closed, even the Ocean Park lookout tower and the raft attraction (which was clearly not affected by the wind). So check the weather forecasts, although you're never sure: when we were there, they already closed way before the strong winds. Especially if you buy your tickets at the MTR station Admiralty, where they give you a discount, they will not tell you that all the rides are actually closed (even though they were already closed at the moment we bought the ticket). So don't let them mislead you here, ask if all the rides will be open, because the fact that they don't provide accurate info is 'not Ocean Park's responsibility' (which seems slack management to us, they should keep their offices selling their tickets in check).
Quite hot. The park will be hot and not be good to visit during rainy season. It can get very hot so bring an umbrella or hat to get good shade.

Still fun - keep out of the heat as much as you can. Lots to do, lots to see......slightly difficult to get to via public transport, but doesn't ruin the visit. Busy as the day progresses. Take plenty of water with you..... can get extremely hot and humid. Plenty for the dare devils (cable cars, roller coasters etc.) and not quite so daring (rapids were our family favourite), including interesting shows.... expect a big day out......slept long and well that night....

A HUGE day out for all the family. You can spend the whole day here and still not do everything. There is something for everyone here - from childrens games and rides to Pandas/aquariums to Dolphin/seal and bird shows to Frozen worlds and Roller coaster rides, and then there is the Cable car... See a view of Stanley and Repulse Bay as they transport you over the hill to the other side of Ocean Park. There is just so much to do. Food is not allowed into the park, bags are checked when entering, but there are some cheap food options there. Well worth the visit and the price. Tickets can be purchased at Admiralty MTR for a discount price. Catch the 629 bus from Admiralty bus station - just outside the MTR

Ocean park. First time going to this attraction, and it was Halloween time were all the dead character come alive. Recommended to visit the dolphin show. but for those with families please use the stroller that provided by the park. As the walking distance is quite far and stroller is convenience for those with babies. Very crowded and hold on to your love ones.

Amazing amusement park. Went during halloween time so they were open till 11pm. Plenty of rides and attractions like aquariums and zoo animals to keep us busy from noon till close time. Special event spook houses were also great. I would highly recommend Ocean Park to anyone.

Wow, what a surprise!. Boy is this place a surprise! Walking in the entrance it seemed very sedate but after taking a ride on the chairlift, a whole new world appeared. Once there you are met with a big assortment of roller coasters, river rides and other attractions. The roller coaster on the side of the hill is fantastic and the chairlift ride is spectacular in itself. Be prepared to do a lot of walking and its not flat so by the end of the day you will feel it in your legs. Easy to get to as well, take the MTR to Admiralty station and then hop on the 629 bus which is dedicated to taking you to the park.

Loved it but not much. I loved so many things and I hated the long walking in it, as part of it down mountain was nice, the plays were on the mountain, to go from place to place I need to go up and down walking and it was to easy but very long, the rides were great and the Panda was cute, I loved the aquarium and old Hong Kong in it, I advise everyone to go there and have fun.
Good for kids. Be prepared for a lot of walking and long waits for rides and food. Probably best for families with children.

First place to think of when you are in Honkong. Last summer break during July, I went to Hong Kong with my family. We went to many amusement parks but the best one that I enjoyed is Ocean Park. My cousins went there too, and they were still young. So we were worried that they weren’t going to be fun. But we realized we were wrong. They enjoyed it very much. Ocean Park is an amusement park where we could go there with our whole family.The kids watched the dolphin show, and saw real sea lions and dolphins. Ocean Park is humongous. We thought that it would be tiring to walk from one zone to another. But really, there were shuttle buses and escalators, and it took just a few steps to continue walking.The place was so clean and there were cute decorations. I enjoyed all the roller coasters especially the “Hair Dryer”. If you go to Hongkong , I think this would be the first thing you should think

Fantastic. Visited Ocean Park on a weekday, just after the school holidays and it was not that busy. My goal was to see a panda, and I was not disappointed. The panda was sitting there munching on bamboo, it was so special to see. Then we saw the cute red pandas. So many wonderful and different animals to see, it was brilliant. The grounds and enclosures were so very clean with beautiful gardens. Saw the dolphin show. Had lunch at the Terrace Cafe with spectacular views over the water. Took the tram to the other side of the park and it was quick and efficient. Queues for the cable car were too long, but at least we had the option of the tram. Did a lot of walking around the grounds as well. We were not there for the rides so cannot comment on them. Had a thoroughly enjoyable day, and it was good that we could catch the 629 bus directly there from Admiralty MTR station. We were able to get an extra 10% discount off the entrance price, as we had a voucher off one of the maps provided by our hotel. Even though we we were there from 11am to about 5pm we did not get to see everything, there is just so much to see and do. Would thoroughly recommend.

exhilariting theme park for kids and adults alike. ocean park is an amusement park that boasts a variety of attractions.for animal lovers you have underwater aquarium with detailed info ,giant panda nibbling on bamboo shoots,dolphin and seal show,many more.for adventure junkies,a lot of thrill rides are on offer.recommended to spend an enitre day.lot of guided tours are on offer.1 hour ride from the town.
Proper amusement park. Thoroughly enjoyable with good rides, especially the rollercoasters perched on the hill slopes. Even the cable car is very good and lengthy.

Give it a miss!. It was very hot and crowded on the day we visited. There is little or no shade and we waited one hour for the cable car even though we had arrived early morning. The ride was breath-taking and I almost forgot how long we had waited (and how much the kids had complained!!!). But aside from the cable car the rest of the park was a disappointment. It desperately needs to be modernized. My kids aged 11 and 13 love roller coasters but the ones at ocean park were just not exciting. Universal studios in Singapore is much much better. If you have been to amusement parks in the U.S. Or even Australia, you will be bored to tears here!!!! Tip: If you have younger kids or must go, then buy tickets from any 7-11 convenience store and at least you won't have to queue when you get there. You can walk straight in.

Fun fun fun. It was brilliant. Went on a weekday. Still quite crowded. Stood in a very long queue for the cable car - but the actual rides moved quite quickly. Ride queues between 5 minutes and 40 minutes. Food very expensive. Ran out of time. Only did the rides. Didn't have time to see the Pandas or any of the shows. 2 tips - at 4.30 pm it totally emptied out. You could do all rides with no waiting. So maybe do the shows, aquarium, pandas etc first and the rides last (that's what I will do if we ever visit again!) and secondly buy your tickets to the park at Admiralty station, just before you exit at Exit B. They sell discounted tickets and there are no queues. We all had a fantastic day. Oh it also seemed way hotter there at Ocean Park. Take hats and suncream.

........ To be honest there is so much to do in Hong Kong if you are on a time constraint I would skip this place. We have been to Disneyland and had had a fantastic time before but wanted to do sthing special for our son that was new so we decided to go here. The park is VERY spread out with little bits of nothing much in between. The constant photo op's become very irritating and you get the feeling of "BUY BUY BUY". The water rides were fun but there are only a few, they are VERY short and you don't really get very wet. With all that space those rides could be double the size. The day we went wasn't that busy but the queues were still rather long. Either way, if you decide to go don't set on spending the whole day. Just go and play it by ear. The Aquarium was interesting but full of Mainlanders who are definately not as well versed in manners. We were pushed and shoved and it was chaos inside there. If it's between here and DisneyLand ... or Lamma Island.... or the zoo..... well I'd take the other option.
Nice Experience - a good cable car ride. Nice experience, but 1 day will not be enough as there will be too many things to cover in one day, but worth of the money paid

Not Good Anymore. Went to Ocean park on a weakday i thought going there in weakdays is good but i was wrong so many people in the park overcrowded . Have to wait long time for every ride.. There are nothing special for kids...i use to go 6,7 years before in ocean park. that time is very good..but may be so many people are now a days i always hate waiting only cable car is good....

Better than Disney!. I say better than Disney, but to be frank, we didn't even do Disney in Hong Kong. I've been to both the American ones, and Ocean Park has better rides, has way more space, and is a good mix of animals and theme park rides. I was impressed with the enormous animal enclosures in the marine park side - some of the largest I've ever seen. Though a lot of tourist behaviour to the animals was horrific - banging on glass aquarium walls with umbrellas to get their attention, and using flash despite the warning signs not to use flash.

Best Park in Hong Kong.. A great park with lots of different attractions for all ages. Some are unfortunately aging a bit but the park is investing quite a bit of money into improving them. For now though, some areas are a work in progress.The food is the one disappointing area with a couple of restaurants but otherwise mostly low quality fast food. Why do theme parks have to be associated with bad food choices?I can recommend taking the cable car or train early to the other side when you arrive at the park, then do the main section before you leave as trying to leave the far side of the park at the end of the afternoon can include 60min queues for the cable car, although less for the train.

Enjoyable rides. This place would really appeal to animal lovers. Though I myself am not fond of animals, I still enjoyed our visit to this place. I found the cable car and the train ride very memorable. The rides were great, especially the whirly bird ( not sure of the name, but it's on top of the mountain), which I found exhilarating. On the whole, this is one place you mustn't miss when you visit HK.

Bad Idea to go to this place!!. Never go to this amusement park again! The service is very bad, the only main attraction is only the huge aquarium. The games are all bad and it can not use by my toddler (is totally different than Disneyland).The location is also far far away from the city, and there is no MRT Station close to this park..The terrible thing is the people who come to this park is an unciviliazed persons I think. A lot of China Mainland people come to this place and they have no manners at all. The example is THEY CAN NOT QUEING, and it's really bother me because at Disneyland, all things are in order, people get queue to get their turn. It's totally different!Never go to Ocean Park again! I hope you do the same thing too.. :-((

Heaven on Earth. WOW, just wow. This place is amazing!! There is such an array of activities here, from seeing some amazing animals like a panda to going on thrilling rides to having a water fight to getting an excellent view of the bay and land. You will need to get here as soon as it opens and stay the whole day. It is such a large park that you may even want to cover it in two days. There is just so many fun and exciting things to do here.It is easy to get here. You just need to catch the city bus 629 from Admiralty MTR.
Totally feel as u are in Another world. You will be in between of whales , star fish all like real total natural fell like u are in another world of Oceannnnnnnnnnnnn, thumbs Up.

Fantastic Day of Family Fun. We loved Ocean Park.. it is a cross mix between a zoo, aquarium and amusement park. There is so much to see and do, and to be honest to enjoy the park fully you could easily have a couple of days here. We were a group of 3, 11 YO, 65 YO and 40 YO (Mum, Daughter & Nan). We all found things to do and see that we all enjoyed, there was plenty of areas with shade and seats for my mum to have a rest throughout the day. We facilities were good, we ate at McD in the park, slightly on the expensive side but was still reasonable, drinks were slightly more expensive than on the street, but again still reasonable. The park is very well maintained and is kept spotless. Highly recommend for families of all ages. We also caught a taxi to the park as it was the easiest way to get there from Sha Tin.. but we did notice a MTR station currently being built right opposite the park.

Must visit place in HK. Ocean Park was the highlight of our visit to HK. With different themes & various shows it was clearly the best place to visit. It has got something for all age groups, rides & all.....

Still great after 40 years . Went there for the 1st time since the mid 80s and found that, despite the Disney competition, OP is still great, and now it has Pandas! Only downside was the ridiculous number of tour parties of mainland Chinese, but that is just part of HK life these days.
Parks for teens.. i enjoyed the being here but this theme park is more recommended for Teens/Adults since most of the Rides Requires height limits average to 9 yrs. old above kids.

It's Wooooooooooow!. It's ultra awesome! It's HUGE! A few tips:- 1) Food is expensive, however Mc Donalds does not have inflated prices, just the usual city prices :) 2) Carry as much water as you wish to! They allow unlimited water inside!3) At my visit the cable car was not functional :( :( :( so unless you are with a fixed group tour, make sure to check the functionality of the cable car4) The best attraction of the whole park is the first attraction, THE GRAND AQUARIUM, give a lot of time to it!5) If you have not seen the Dolphin Show here, you are missing an extremely beautiful part of your tour! PLEASE RESERVE TIME FOR IT! It will rob your heart! :)

One of the best theme parks I've been too. As the title says, just marvelous and caters to all ages.The queues are quite big for some of the rides but that's due to how popular it is and there's also a few Pandas there which I wasn't expecting but so glad I was that close to them!

This place is AWESOME!!. We were here from 12-6pm and loved every second!! So much to do and see. There were no queues when we were here so it was easy to hop on and off rides many times but looking at the queuing systems it may be different on weekends or holidays!!! The animals are interesting, big aquarium and pandas. But the rides are super fun!!! Lots of big roller coasters for the big kids and a whole little park for the smaller kids!! Everybody loved it!!Only slight down side was the dreadful food - just over salted sugar loaded rubbish. We would come back here again and again!!

Fish-tastic!. We went there around noon time and I wish we went there a little earlier,. The view was great! The park is too vast to see try every ride and see every aquatic specie they had. We get to see the Grand Aquarium first since its in the lower part, many fishes, different species. Then went to polar adventure to see the penguins and the seals, then to the sharks. The park's too big so we didn't manage to see every attraction, we also didn't ride any. But oh, don't forget to ride the train and the cable car. It's one of a kind experience. You get to see the Ocean park, bird's eye view. Oh! Oh! Don't forget to stay until closing time, there's Symbio, the parks closing attraction. Its a dancing fountain that tells story about water and fire dragon and the balance of nature.

Awesome cable car ride!. My husband and I took the metro from Kowloon road to Admirality station and took a bus which takes us directly to Ocean park, we went to the aquarium, cable car ride, the shark house and saw the street shows. We had a great experience and I would recommend everyone to visit Ocean park. The view from the cable car ride is awesome. The only disappointment was the crowd, August being a month of school holidays in hongkong, we had to wait for minimum half an hour for each attraction.
Whole Day of Enjoying. One of the best places in Hong Kong and you need to go very early The tickets we bought it from the hotel and we spend very great day with many activity in the park

Ocean Park great attractions.. Ocean Park is worth visiting place.One will not be able to complete all the events available therein. Inside this there is water park, polar bear, penguins and lot many attractions. You can visit with your all the family members which would enjoyable and memorable.

Fun, Sea education. The theme park is great, fun, for young kids can only enjoyed the ocean education such as aquarium,museum,animal displays, and some games. But most of the games suitable for teenager.but if u havent visit here, must try, because it has hongkong old towns great place to take pictures, and for the souvenirs the prices is more affordable for average pockets, not too expensive

Awesome big park and loved conservation concept. The park is huge and even onevday is not enough for it.Try to come early so that you can enjoy maximum ride.The provided by park authorities is not good so may u should try the app for attraction details.The park is mixture of zoo,adventure and theatre performances,so all in all a full package.Go for it if u are in Hong Kong.Take bus 629 from admirality station and that will take you directly to park.

Enjoyable morning.. The view from the cable car was fantastic. I do wish I could take it again. The rides was quite enjoyable and the shark exhibits was awesome. Other than that, there was not much else. I managed to finish everything in one morning and left after I ate my lunch. The rest of the rides and the displays were more kids orientated. Go very early to avoid the crowd. I was there standing at the entrance before it was opened. Buy your entrance tickets at the 7-11 to avoid queueing at the ticketing booths. The bus service to ocean park was quite quick and comfortable. It runs quite often too. Be prepared to walk..
Ocean Park. the most amazing thing abt this park the sky way.Which is one of the longest i have been.Overall a decent place to visit.Second half park is too much crowded..prefer go in morning hours.
Must-go place~. A good place to spend half or whole day here~ Good for people who like those exciting rides. Enjoyed myself here with my friends~

Great Rides, Great Exhibits, Great Show. Going to the park is really like going to an all-in attraction place. It has rides for all types of amusement park goers. There are mild rides and extreme rides.The exhibits are well curated great segmentation of areas. The animals looks well maintained. The show was a blast because it also discusses issues regarding preservation of our flora and fauna.Don't forget to bring extra shirt or jacket especially because the place is way big and you may sweat a lot. There are also rides that can drench you in water. The area where in the penguins are is really cold. Don't forget to bring hat and jacket.Give it an entire day to surely enjoy Ocean Park.
Fun for all. Great for the kids, we were there for Halloween and all the extra scary stuff was a highlight for our 12 year old. Very busy at night but the views from some of the rides are fantastic.

Waste of Time and Money. I went there on 21st of september ( Monday). I pre-booked the tickets and its a full day tickets. I took MTR to the Admiralty station and a public bus no.629 to the entrance of the ocean park. There were a lot of visitors queuing to enter the theme park. Once entering the theme park, I went to the summit by the Ocean Express as the cable car was under maintenance. When I reach the summit there were no queue requires at all rides. The rides were old and no fun at all. UNIVERSAL STUDIOS SINGAPORE WAS WAY MUCH BETTER THAN OCEAN PARK. The tickets price was expensive and not worth at all. Around 12:00, there are more visitors coming up to the summit but SURPRISINGLY THERE WAS NO WAIT REQUIRES AT ALL. They were mostly senior citizen and they were just walking around the theme park rather than riding the rides. The whole parks were crowded with visitors but no wait requires as well. I got to ride all the rides at the time around 2:30 at the afternoon so I make the exit of the park and I went into the store to get some souvenirs. The souvenirs were not attractive at all. All in all the whole day in the theme park was not really good because the rides are kind of out-dated and boring. The food inside was quite expensive compared to the food outside the theme park and not tasty.
A Must Visit park!. A great big place to play for the children and teenagers. Big aquarium and great variaty of rides. Defenetly will come again to this park!

Fun times. I'm probably biased but I think Ocean Park is way more fun than Disneyland. It is less sightseeing but contains a lot more activities and rides. It is a place that no matter what age you are you will find it charming - minus the crowdedness it can get during peak seasons.

Good day out, try to go on week day. I loved visiting Ocean Park. As we have only just moved here we heard good things. The queue for the cable car can be quite long and I suggest to take packed lunch unless you like hotdogs

Great day out. Ocean park was very good for our family of 6- mum dad and 13,11,9 and 8 year old. We got straight on the cross island train and went straight to thrill mountain. All rides were very good. My youngest two weren't able to go on all the rides ( too short) which caused a few issues. However they were all ok for the dragon which was a great roller coaster. The Canadian water raft was also very good.

Place mixed with adventure, fun and relaxation. Nice place to spent the day. The rides are very good. Wildlife has a huge range of animals including pandas,koalas, kangaroos. Dolphins and seal show is a must.

Fantastic Rides for the Teenagers. Wonderful park with fantastic rides for the teenagers! The dolphin show was wonderful and the Ferris wheel ride was breathtaking! The cable car ride down to the base was also spectacular though the queue was quite long.

A theme park, zoo and aquarium all in one. This place was amazing, and so big! Make sure you allow a full day as there's so much to do here. Just keep in mind that you're not allowed food in the park, so prepare to buy lunches

Animals galore . If you love animals you'll love ocean park. Word of advice go early to avoid the crowd of tour bus people. We managed to avoid the crowd till around 2pm on the weekday. If you into rides do those first. The shows are a bit kid focused so I'd avoid those if you just going with adults

awful, boring, tourist trap. I would never ever go back in hell. We were so bored and it was so crowded with pushy mainland Chinese. So overpriced and pretencious. You wait for every single thing for 30 minutes. Never more!

a very welcome surprise. when we first arrived here i thought it would be very underwhelming we looked around & decided to head to the gondolas..this is very picturesque & quite amazing..over the hill was a complete surprise with amazing things to see & do..all sorts of exhibits & a lot to keep the kids happy..all done in a very orderly fashion..no mad rush..take your time & enjoy..sales people would love it..under promise & over deliver..salesmans best attributes..very well done.
Great day out for the family.. Even though it rained all day we had the best time. We did the honorary panda keeper program and it was wonderful. The food was good , the aquarium amazing.

Disneyland can keep it's secret!!!. What a great experience, for all ages, multi experiential, something for all.We went as a couple who have been to HKG many times but never to Ocean Park, well, what a surprise.Transport via the MTR and busses was efficient, on time and good value.We were early and there when the park opened. Did every ride, saw every exhibition and show, except for the real kiddie things. We spent from 10.00 to 16.30 at the park and never had a problem with queues. HOWEVER beware of the ones that like to push in or use excuses to get forward. Elbows out and a stern NO worked for us - fair is fair.Make Disney Land look like Mickey Mouse was downgraded !!!!

Hong Kong's must visit!. Amazing place!! Huge place with a huge aquarium, amazing rides! Not only it is recommended for kids but adults can have a good time too!
Personally, I found it better than disneyland, its more of a kids thing.

Ocean Park is much better than you think !. One of the highlights of a trip to Hong Kong. The park is accessible by bus and taxi via Aberdeen and tunnel to the other side of the mountains surrounding the harbor. The park entrance area is similar to a visit to Universal Studios / Disney. There are many hotels and souvenir shops in the ticketing area. On entry to the park you will see many interesting exhibitions and the equivalent of a small zoo with the main theme based on Pandas living in what is created to represent their natural living environment. There are some classic rides there for the kids including a carousel. When you progress onward to the main attractions you can choose to go by skyway (scenic chairlift) or by train (through the mountain itself). It is one entrance fee covers all, if you want you can return and try both ! We did try both and preference was for the skyway. Travelling over 3 peaks to our destination which I can only describe as breathtaking, to a multi-level amusement park that was built into a hillside going down to the harbor exterior with nice views. Travel between levels is by outdoor escalators. Every level contains different themes and all sorts of amusement rides and sights to see. Top level there are big american style rides for thrill seekers, down to the bottom levels where you will find a Roller-coaster and some Water rides / Flumes. We really enjoy our visit here and all I can say is that a whole day is probably how long it will take to get round. It merits a second visit to go and experience the rides. Very good attraction. We will go back there again soon.

Fun!. Had a lot of fun on the day. There were many different attractions and rides. Definitely suitable for a family day out and it's worth the visit if it's your first to travel to Hong Kong. Also, apart from the rides, there are also animals. The pandas and penguins are super cute, my personal favourites!!!
Outdated Theme park. outdated theme park ,.... very little new attraction ,.... not very interesting marine show, need some upgrade , the cable car is nice though.....

A Great Destination. Ocean park is a place for all ages .It is a great park with lots and lots of activities and amausments.It is super good and affordable theme park. You will need whole day to see it. It is better to go on weekdays to avoide queues.

Great fun, but go prepared. We went on a hot day and should really have been a bit more prepared in terms of hats and sunscreen.Like any theme park, you can expect crowds and queues aplenty.We spent a half day at the park and felt we only just got our monies worth. Half the rides were closed for various reasons which was unfortunate.The highlights were the dolphin show and roller coasters.The lowlights were the crowds and queues.Tip: Take your own shade and be prepared to pay top dollar for drinks and food inside the park.

Very nice experience, cable car ride is out of world!. Very good experience, but plz dont compare this with sea world sandiego. The best experience in this park was cable car ride, ocean on one side and mountain on other. Its a very long ride, just loved it. I was there on a bank holiday and not crowded. Remember, as u arrive in the hk airport there are free vouchers given. U can redeem that for good discount in the venue only. I used this and saved some dollars. The best attraction for me is red pandas and aquarium. Its near to the city, so need of too much time planning. Also dont rush early in the morning, i reached there around 11am and covered almost everything.

Fun place. We got lucky as some kind girl came over and gave us free tickets. That saved us around £60 on entry fees. This review is probably biased on the basis that as it cost us nothing it didn't matter if it was any good. It was good however. The floods of chinese tourists pushing, shoving and shouting in the animal enclosures was the only annoyance. Poor pandas having to listen to that racket every day! The rollercoasters are good and the hair raiser hangs over the cliff and looks a few hundred feet down to the sea during a loop! The polar enclosures were cool and it was nice to see the walrus'. It was obviously amazing to see the panda and i have become a big fan of the red pandas. There was so much more to see but we had to go to the airport.

Super good and affordable theme park. Very nice theme park and I love all the rides there! On top of tt this is so much more afforable as compared to uss and disneyland hk! Went twice and will definitely be back for more!
Must Go. This is a must go for both visitors and locals. There are rides, gondolas, gardens, pandas, aquarium, games, shows....Suitable for all ages. You will need a whole day there.

Inexpensive theme park but has so much to offer.. Ocean park is place for all ages. It's a theme park, it's a zoo, an aquarium, and tropical garden all in one. I was there with my 18 year old son and an elderly. They all get to see and do something that they like. The thrill rides were awesome for my teenager. The gardens were beautiful, the animals at the zoo and aquariums were wonderful. The dolphins and walrus show was amazing. If you have a day to spare in HK. GO.

Hong Kong Ocean Park. this is the highlight of our travel, great park with lots and lots of activities. i really love the cable car and the aquariums. these are devided islands but transportation is not a problem to reach your destination. Definitely a great destination, we really enjoyed our visit

A quicker way to Ocean Park. Many people take Bus no.629 departing from Admiralty Centre to Ocean Park. However, sometimes the bus station are full of people and you will have to queue for a long time before boarding a bus. A much faster and cheaper way is to take any bus that pass through the Aberdeen Tunnel. So just look for buses in Central, Wanchai or Causeway Bay that goes to the Southern side of Hong Kong Island through the Aberdeen Tunnel. Examples are bus no. 70, 90 and 590 departing from the bus terminal in Exchange Square Central. No. 590 is the first choice because it is a express route.Get off at the Aberdeen Tunnel Toll Plaza, the first stop after passing the tunnel. There is a sign in the bus station showing you how to walk to Ocean Park. It takes around 10 minutes to reach the Park Entrance.Ocean Park is a great place. Enjoy the visit.
Excellent place for Riders. Excellent experience and you can spend almost full day and rides are fantastic and some of the rides are breathe taking

Worth to Go. It is a good place full of fun and enjoy if you like the roller coaster and looking to see panda and penguins and a real side of ocean life just go , don't miss the show of fountain dancer at the end of day

Must visit in HKG. Great place for a day out in HKG. Lots of entertainment and education for the young and old.We went on a week day and the queues were non existent till about 1:00pm. The rides were running 1/2 empty.However in the afternoon there were lots of group tourist and the place was jam packed with long waits.Suggest getting in early

Better than we thought!. After reading all the mixed reviews on here I was a bit nervous about committing to take our kids to OP . However it was very smooth to get there, easy signage once inside. We arrived about 11am and went straight by cable car to the summit. The cable car was amazing, a long queue to get in but moved very quickly. The rides on the summit were awesome and only 5 min queues max. The highlight were the Penguins and walrus. We also loved the aquarium and the pandas. When we left we realised we had missed an entire section of the park.... That's how big it is!!! We noticed that as we were leaving at about 3' massive coach loads of people were arriving, tour groups from the mainland. So the morning was a much better option. The food was ok but expensive, they check your bags on entry so you have to buy food inside. It was very hour and humid, so we got through a lot of bottled water. But left OP happy ,tired and pleased we went.
Event for Children. Children will enjoy activities here. Cable cars are great and looks new. Queuing is a headache. The aquariums are not that impressive. Panda was inactive.

Aquarium is average. Half the park was closed for Halloween upgrades yet no discount or notice was given when we bought tickets. The aquarium was not as good as we expected, but still had some nice things.

Ocean Park is one of the best theme based parks I've been to.... If you are in HK for travel, then Ocean Park is a must visit..!! Located on a hills, the ocean view surrounding the place is just beautiful.. Rides are thrilling, the aquariums are huge and has large variety of species, the rope way commute is amazing..

How to plan your trip there. Having visited Ocean Park the second time I can say its a decent place to spend an entire day. Before going there you need to plan how you want to spend your day and whats more important "the rides" or the animals" or "the shows" to you cause you will not finish all the rides and see all the shows in one day.. So here is some tips how to plan the day. I wont bother how you get there that is easy to figure out.# Avoid weekends and holidays if possible, the park will be most crowded and that would mean longer wait on rides.# Book your tickets in advance, if you do not want to wait in line for tickets as well.# If you have the choice also check the weather, if its rainy some of the rides will not be open.# Wear comfortable clothes and footwear especially since you will be doing a lot of walking.# carry sun block and umbrella for heat and rain (if you want to carry things around) # Get to the Park a little before it opens, you may have to wait to enter but that way you have time to click pictures outside. While your waiting you can pick a copy of the map and the show timings from outside.# You can download a map online and plan your route though the park, it will save a lot of time then standing there and figuring out, anyways you will be waiting in line for each ride.# Its ok to carry you bag / cameras etc, they do have lockers at the entrance which you can rent out, can carry your camera with you most rides have places to store your things just before the ride# If you are carrying your bag make sure its not too heavy, you don't want to be lugging things around# First thing to do after you enter is to decide if you want to take the train or the sky cable car to the top, the train is quick and the cable car is more scenic (takes longer though) but I recommend taking it at the beginning of the day on the way up.. usually the evenings the wait to get on the cable car is lot longer and you will be too tired to enjoy it then.# Study the rides that you want to take and go straight for them, recommendation would be do any many rides before lunch and post lunch do the animal visits and shows (unless you are not interested in rides of course)# Recommended rides if your up to the turning upside down type of things.. in order of my preference.. Most scary n fun downwards1. Hair Raiser (The best ride of the park)2. The Flash3. Ragging River (can carry a rain coat or covering but if you don't get wet what's the fun)4. Mine Train5. The Rapids (get wet for God's sake)6. Whirly Bird / The Abyss / Eagle (all similar feel)7. The dragon (I found it too bumpy a ride) For the shows please do catch the dolphins at the ocean theatre, avoid going for the last show since the animals would be tired having done the same things so many times before in the day.# For food would suggest eating light and quick so that you can enjoy most of the rides.#overall tip - do most of the scary rides before lunch and the lighter ones after.. but also try and cover area wise rides so you not wasting too much time getting from one ride to another since it is a big park to walk around.. # Also some rides maybe cancelled or open later for maintenance so you may have to re-plan on the spot quickly.

Fun Filled Attraction For All Ages. Wether you are into animals or thrill rides or just looking to take in some of Hong Kong's breath taking scenery, Ocean Park is for you. It has all sorts of animals on exhibition, from Pandas, to sharks to alligators. If you are more into the rides you can take the cable car ride to the second half of the park, giving you a great view of Hong Kong's rural aspect. On the second half of the park you will find some absolutely brilliant rides, such as the the Abyss or the Mine Train.

How to get the best out of a trip to OP. Ocean Park is a MUST for both tourists and residents and definitely to be preferred over Hong Kong Disneyland.Planning is the key to enjoying your day out. Get to the gate 15 minutes before the park opens and head to the far right of the line of entry turnstiles. There you will find the information or services centre. Get a free map of the park and find out the times of shows (or check these out online before your visit). When you enter the park proper, head first to the Grand Aquarium, which is stunning. Queues for this build up rapidly, so best to kick your visit off here. Then take the Ocean Express to the Summit and enjoy the attractions there, before taking a relaxing cable car ride back to the Headland. This way you will avoid many of the queues you would otherwise encounter, particularly at the cable car. Of course, if 'rides' are your thing, then you will head directly to the Summit!Toilets are plentiful and generally regularly cleaned at OP. There are some drinking water fountains so it is a good idea to take your own water bottle with you and replenish for free. F & B is expensive at OP, but then all profits go to the Ocean Park Conservation Fund, OP being a non-profit organisation. You can of course take your own picnic with you to save money.

Lots of pushing, long queues and limited rides . I wouldn't bother with this park to be honest. The rides are pretty limited and the park gets very crowded (and adults are very aggressive pushing in front of kids). Also they close quite early, around 6 or 7, so that means you can't go later when it is cooler and less crowded.
Fun fun fun. Too much to do for the hours the park is open. Rides are awesome. So is the shows. Food is expensive and average

It can easily be better. Lets be honest here...if you have been to the ones in San Diego or Sentosa in Singapore, this is a big let down. Definitely a go, if you have not been to either places. I liked the fountain show in the end and the collection of fishes are good too....if you have time, do the other shows. What sucks - Crowd Management - Absolutely pathetic and directions are even hopeless. Announcement languages are in the local language, so you may be surprised at the end that you were on the wrong line all along. We ended up waiting almost an hour with a baby in a line only to be sent to another line. No consideration for wheel chairs, strollers, senior citizens.

Fun day out. We were only in Hong Kong for 3 days, so I was debating whether to go to Disneyland or Ocean Park. In the end we chose Ocean Park as it was cheaper and - most importantly - it had pandas. It's easy to get to on public transport. It's a beautifully laid-out park, built on two levels of a mountain so the views are spectacular. The rides are fun, the animals are better and the pandas were incredible - it was the first time we had seen pandas in real life, and they were beautiful. We spent almost an hour watching them eating their dinner. Great day.
Fun day out. I really loved ocean park it was a great day out even though a lot of the rides seemed to be closed. The animals were really cool especiallly the red pandas.

Revisited after 20 years !. Fabulous day out for all the family. If your kids are too old for Disney this is where you go for theme park in HK. Get the tickets I advance on Klook .com the printed bar code ticket will get you through the turnstiles no need to wait in line for ticket purchase or collection. The queues are long both here and at the Aberdeen MTR tourist ticket office . This theme park has a wonderful range of animal and sealift exhibits. Don't miss the Red panda sooo cute. The big thrill rides are all at the top level of the park , go early when it opens, go straight to the cable car , go up to the rides and you won't have to queue. Do not go on the weekend where you will battle the local and mainland tourists busy and noisy ! Buses go direct and plenty of taxis. It has changed a lot , for the better in 20 years ! Professional , clean and well worth it plan to spend most of the day here.

The Panda Place. A good day out. We got to see the giant pandas - the highlight of my visit!!! The aquarium is very good as is the polar experience - the walls even feel cold to touch!!! There are plenty of rides for the whole family and the cable cars are an added bonus

Must take your kids to enjoy as well as educate them on ocean creatures.. Good Place to enjoy with your kids and family , a compete entartainment park , full with ocean creatures and their specific shows, must visiti on muntain with cable car drive and enjoy all roller coaster ride as well as dolphin show.

Beautiful and has fantastic rides. Too bad we only managed half a day at this attraction. It was good but rides are limited for children.Worth it to watch the shows available. The night lights are above average.The Rapids Ride is awesome. be prepared to get wet =)Ensure that you are fit coz some of the areas are uphill and will be strenuous for people who are not that fit.The underground express is awesome. We went on like 5 times just to go back and forth for the shows =D

Trip to Ocean Park.. Ocean park is built on 2 hills. There are two ways to get through the park, cable car and train. The cable car has very nice view and especially at night. It was not as crowded as expected on a Saturday. I like "the Dragon" roller coaster, it is thrilling and exciting. Although food and drinks there are expensive, it is around the same as other famous theme parks, and some beverages costs less. The ticket price is reasonable for the variety of attractions is ocean park. However, transportation is not very convenient as the MTR station is still under construction. One way to get there is taking CityBus 629 from admiralty station (Exit b). In a nutshell, Ocean park is enjoyable for teens and adults, I would definitely recommend them to my friends.
Amazing is the word. Amazing is the word, its starts and end with this word, by far this was the most developed Theme Park that I have visited. Will rate it a notch over Hong Kong Disneyland

A fun day at the Ocean Park. A good time with some great animals and marine life. The shark area and panda bears were our favourites. We would typically enjoy the various roller coasters but didn't this time around. The layout of the park is not very good and several areas were being maintained making it harder to navigate to some areas.

Go there during off-session times. As a silver card holder I am entitled to visit between Monday and Friday plus Saturdays before 12 noon, excluding public holidays. After lots of visits I am a fan of this place as it is situated at the beautiful cost this the aquarium is amazing, so as the cable car.I really recommend going there around 4pm so that there will not be a queue to grab the cable car to go up-hill! In addition I suggest you visit during off-peak session so that you spend less time waiting.

Adventure fun. This was a new year trip and we shouted our heart out. Enjoyed each and every ride. The roller coaster overlooking ocean was super fun. Gondola ride is scary and train back is fast pacing fun. Must visit and take every ride there.

Not just for kids. Be ready to spend a day there. It has so many things you have to see. For us it was very intersting. And the thing I liked most was the educational idea of the place. The park is very much oriented to tell you why and how protect our world

Good to go at least once if you are in HK. Ocean Park is a theme park that centers on marine and nature conservation. Roller coasters and the various theme park rides are decent but not those crazy types like Japan. Expect to plan a full day of your itinerary if you are planning to come here due to traveling and the large theme park space.A must see is the Ocean Theatre performance involving dolphins and seals. They do some amazing stunts which I will leave for you to find out for yourself.Pack your own food if you plan to beat the insanely high prices of the food there. One restaurant has a plate of rice with two types of meat at HKD155.All in all, good for a one-time visit as part of your tour of HK as there will be many areas inside where you can take memorable photos. - dp
Kids loved it. I am giving this five stars because my grandkids loved it.If you love rides this is the place to go..Warning on a hot day there was very little shade.There are also pandas there

Super Fun!. We spent an entire day here, and every minute was full of fun. The view in itself from the Ocean Park is more than enough reason to go here. The rides and the animal shows were icing on the cake for me. I suggest you come here during weekdays so that it won't be as crowded.

Back to being a kid!!. Theme parks are always fun. Based on reviews, we choose to go to Ocean Park and not to another famous Park. The decision was certainly not wrong. Screamed our lungs out in the rides and filled our tummies with snacks and food within the park itself. Will certainly recommend to fellow starters.

Great park like an amusement park with a zoo.. I thought Ocean Park was amazing! The two sides of the park separated by a mountain. You can take a train through the mountain or the gondola over the mountain to view the island and the bay.Lots of food options, different from North America. Some grab and go and a lot if sit down options. Even a McDonalds;) rides are great! The lines aren't too bad the aquarium and shark exhibits have stunning viewing rooms. The Aqua show has a great viewing section (very big). I would recommend this attraction, but...... Don't go at the end if August(way too hot) and way too many people over from the mainland for last minute vacations. Visit the park on a weekday, easier to maneuver and see everything without huge lineups and pushy people.
Family with young children. Big theme park! More for adults n great roller coaster rides.worth e $$ going here. In fact i enjoy Ocean Park more than Dosneyland..heehee..

Crowded but full of fun. We went to ocean park by bus. Quite easy route. Hop on the bus and it will arrive in front of ocean park. But soon there will be new mtr station to ocean park. We arrived before the park open. We had bought the ticket from CTS. Cheaper price.When the gate was opened, there were so many people from all around. Very crowded and we should stay attached if we dont want to be lost in the middle of nowhere.However there is so much fun. The zoo, the cable car, the thematic photo spot, and the amusement theme park. All in one.Really enjoyed my time.

Amazing experience . The ocean park is a theme park as well as a zoo and aquarium...best part about this is the rides and the panda bears which you can literally see from a few meters away....souvenir shop isn't great but everything else is brilliant...the top of ocean park is brilliant and you can see the whole of Hong Kong... View is just as good if not better than the peak...

Great Value. If you like Zoos and Aquarium it is a must to go there. They have so much to see and for the ones they looking for fun they do have additional roller coaster and other attractions to explore. A good combination of a Zoo and Fun Park.

Fantastic day out for children. A great day of entertainment and education for children in particular, especially for those who like marine life and animals. Great rides too. Suggest to take the train up to visit the upper part of the park first and can take cable car back down.

Its very big be prepared to walk!. We had extremely hot sticky weather and were exhausted by the time we left. There are two parks with a cable ride separating the two. It's a beautiful cable ride, need to be comfortable with heights to do this, beautiful view of bay below. No lines close to opening time, but long lines when we left the park. I thought it was a place to swim also but no, any wet rides are done fully clothed and u can buy a raincoat if u don't want to get wet. Pandas were beautiful to see. Goldfish/tropical fish enclosure was also great. We had planned to go to the peak straight after but the heat got the better of us, we were dehydrated & exhausted, very hot this time of year and we were lucky it wasn't raining. A big place!

wonderful adventure park with ocean views on a mountain top especially better for older kids and adults. we visited hongkong ocean park in november 2014. we had visited hongkong disneyland on previous day. After visiting both parks I felt ocean park was way better than disney hongkong. The rides there were very thrilling and adventurous. Especially the rides in upper part of ocean park, had awesome views of the ocean. adrenaline pumping rides. will be loved by older kids and adults alike. Food in the restaurant is awesome along with excellent views. especially indian lunch was really good. Never to miss this park when in hongkong. Definitely worth the day spent.

Better than our expectations..!. We visited Ocean park in June, 2015 and the park really was wonderful. We visited the place instead of Disneyland because people said that it would become a pearl in our visit to HK.We bought the tickets from klook.com which offer tickets at a marginal discount.The park is divided into two sections and they can be accessed by a tram or a train. I reccommend people to prefer the train as you can reach the other side quicker as the tram takes a lot of time and the waiting time has a minimum of an hour.The rides are wonderful and adrenaline-packed. I, being an Indian-vegetarian expected no Indian food in the park. But Lo! There was an Indian Vegetarian meal available (Rotis, Sabji and Rice). The only request I would make to the park authorities is to stop the sale of squids as the smell really engulfs the place and induces a vomiting sensation. I even found a few Westerners with their children who came out of the queues in the rides because the quid really emitted a very bad smell. Being called 'Ocean Park',it should be aiming at conserving marine life rather than selling it.Overall, the expreience was very nice and almost all the rides are suitable for families with young children.So, rush out there families, a pearl in HK's crown awaits you!!
Worth to go!. Long waiting time due to school holidays. But the rides were worth it. The park is big so the crowd is well spread out

tired but fun. The park itself is very tired and looks more like a fayre than a theme park but the rides are safe enough and there are plenty of attractions to keep both adults and children entertained. we also loved seeing the pandas and watching the dolphin show. the only bad part was the hour long queues to get to the main section of the park. it is only accessible by cable car or train and the quesues were over an hour long. This is just after you have queued for ages to buy entry tickets. there should be a path people can use to save time and actually see some views
Ocean without a ocean. One of the finest places to spend a day with family. Kids will enjoy this place. There are long ques for some rides but then they have made good arrangements for tourists.

Way better than Disneyland. The cable car is the highlight of the park which takes you to a hill top where all thrill rides and roller coasters are made up for you to have a great time. This theme park has everything for all age groups unlike disneyland. Definitely recommendable :)

Mixed feeling about Ocean Park. It isn't just 'Ocean' park, it is a 'little bit of everything' park. So its great, it sounds like you could get the most bank for your buck, right? We went there on a weekday morning, the average waiting time for each single activity/rider/show/thing was 45-60 minutes (if you got lucky nobody cutting in line). So you need to plan ahead and run right to the areas you are looking for. It seems to me that they have no capacity limit and crowd control.Ate at Bayview restaurant for lunch. Beautiful view up there, but that was it. It actually is an overprice cafeteria offering below average quality foods. There must be a reason why McD's line was so long, silly me.

Nice place. Avoid August -- Summer Rush!. the park is home to rides for adults. nicely maintained property. this said, the maps and show times are really hard to comprehend. The aquarium, panda hangout and penguins were a sight to see.

Worth it!. It's quite pricey but I was lucky as I was queueing, someone came over and gave us 2 tickets. So I only had to buy one more as there were 3 of us.The park is so interesting and great place for kids to learn about Ocean animals.Well maintained but also full of mainland Chinese (watch out and don't get trampled by them). Other than that, I had a great time learning about sea animals, north pole and south pole!

Best of Best in Asia.... Ocean Park , from the name we can expect something and yes it's just above ocean, we begin with ticketing ... I'm a frequent flyer of Singapore Airlines and for this you get 12% off ...Then we head to take ocean express train to reach highland which top and u can also go by the longest cable car crossing 3 hills and panoramic views of ocean... and once reach up the most wonderful rides ever we tried ... roller coasters at the best , unfortunately can't remember the names but arctic express was nice too, most of the rides are amazing and the bay view restaurant adjustant to cable car is give awesome view of bay and cable car lines ... me and my really enjoyed all of the rides, even though it was Saturday management properly maintain the standard to let all customer enjoy everything. .. We're coming back again soon ! Hats off to dolphin in seal for their amazing show...

Ocean park. Not bad! Lots of things to see and play. Take the cable car or train up to the amusement park for more thrilling rides (we prefer the cable car to see the view). But train is faster I guess. If u are not for the thrilling rides or traveling with families with children and elderly, there's plenty of shows, performance and family rides. One full day may nt be enough to cover the whole park, given the really long queues for most rides. I went twice and couldn't cover every single ride. If u only have one day there, then play smart and be selective. Food there is overly priced, but u can't really bring food into the park. Overall, worth the money! Have fun!

Very Hot in the Summer. I was there in the middle of Aug 2015 and it was very very hot and draining stamina. The park was so big but with less trees. Many attractions was using air conditioner with very low temperature, so that the temperature difference outside and inside was quite disturbing. There was no drinking water fountain in there, you must prepare a lot of money to buy bottled water which rather expensive, including the food. Attractions itself was good enough. Better if you visited the park on Autumn or Spring season.

Happy Feet. Literally I got so tired in this attraction. It takes one whole day to explore and enjoy this place. It's worth the wait and the fee is reasonable. We got a discounted ticket ( I guess ) for 310HKD. If I'm not mistaken the regular price is 360HKD. We bought the ticket along the subway in Central. it's good to experience marine life for a short time, perfect for kids. Extreme rides? I give them two thumbs up. Not to mention the bad catch is the long queue and the hot weather. Better bring water because it double it's price when you get inside. Have fun!

Crazy rides and beautiful animals!!. HK's best theme park. You get too see a lot of animals and birds. Pandas, monkeys, dolphins, penguins, koalas, birds and many more. You get to play small games which are pretty good (ofcourse they are paid). Get a glimps of old HK made as an attraction. The best thing to do is riding Hair Raiser!!! If you can ride this than do not miss any chance, get some adrenaline rush. A tip for Hair Raiser, go in the evening after 6 as during day time there so much rush for this ride.

An amazing theme/animal/sealife park - highly recommended!. Amazing park and one of the best I've ever been to, as it is a great mix of theme park/aquarium/zoo, with multiple different zones and animals to engage everybody's interests, no matter what age!Disappointingly, the pandas were sleeping when I was there (which was to be expected, I suppose) but the aquariums were impressive, modern and informative and there was a large selection of sea life on show.Queue times for the more popular rides and attractions ranged between 45mins-1hr and rides ranged from those suitable for little children through to thrill-seeking adults.Lots of food and restaurant options were available too and a choice of cable-car or the express train, to get from the bottom zones all the way to the upper-level zones and attractions. A particular highlight for me was watching one of the regularly-scheduled dolphin and sea lion live shows with their trainers and just wandering around the 'rainforest' area and aquariums in general.A great day out for the family or with friends, it offers the perfect getaway from the bustling city.

Great day out in a spectacular setting. Visited early September on a Saturday. I was expecting the place to be packed but, whilst busy, we didn't have to queue for rides for too long. There's also a good mix of rides and animal attractions, which helps to break the day up. The setting is spectacular, high up on the coastline. The cable car, and some of the roller coasters are almost worth the entrance fee themselves. The only slight downside to the day in the fairground area was when my son had a go at kicking a football through the hole. The big cuddly toys were all hanging up on display, so you can imagine his delight when he scored. Unfortunately, the attendant went to the side of the stall and presented him with a pink pig that could sit on the palm of your hand. We took this as an affront and handed it back saying he didn't want it, and after a couple of supervisors later she agreed to swap it for a more acceptable toy from one of the other stalls. Simple really. Of course there are souvenir shops on the way out of every single attraction, and you'll have had your picture taken a dozen times with park reps trying to sell you copies at $190, but it's your choice. At the end of the day, there's a spectacular show of water jets, music, flames and fireworks. I'd definitely recommend this park for children or all ages, and I'd say it was good value in comparison to other amusement parks and zoos that I have been to.

fun day out. worth spending a day out with the family. park has improved since the last time i was there 5 years ago. be prepared for queues. i found that people also tend to push in front of you in queues. were unable to get our photo at the rollercoaster as the machine was out of order.

Ocean Park. entry fee is cheaper compared to Disneyland but not as accessible. i saw a MTR station being built and thats good.overall i find that there are more rides suitable for young kids at the park compared to Disneyland
Amazing cable ride. 1 day is not enough to try all the rides and different attractions in the Park. Start the day early, because of the long queue line. had so much fun with the cable ride.

Don't go durning typhoon weather warning!. Not a gust of wind in sight so we still decided to go to ocean park during a typhoon warning.When we got there, all rides apart from the cable car were shut. Then gradually throughout the day, everything was closing including the dolphin show. The day quickly turned into a day to the zoo which wasn't too bad but it was still very disappointing. We mannaged to see the dolphin show before it shut. I'm not one to watch these types of shows due to the animals being in tiny swimming pools but they were very good at promoting sustainable fishing and teaching children about littering and not eating endangered animals like shark fin soup. I saw the potential for a fun day out so if i'm ever back in Hong Kong when it's not typhoon season i may go back

My favorite theme park . It's just sad that we can't get to check all the attractions in one day. But I love everything there is in Ocean Park except for the very expensive foods. I had fun watching the animals and hopefully they are being treated well. I was amazed by the aquarium and on how the place brought me to North Pole to South Pole. We weren't able to try any of the rides as the line was taking forever. If given the opportunity, I'll check Hair raiser and the flash. Tip: Bring your own food with you.

Nothing to shout about . The positives:Nice location - good view all throughoutIn park train is fantastic with special stroller fast lane Amazing animal sanctuary - especially the panda Food was good albeit pricey to the coreThe negatives:Long queues with no effort of queue entertainment Bad visitors who keeps cutting lanesPricey - even pricier than Disney, Universal or Legoland parks Horrible horrible taxi service upon leaving during evening - at least 1 hours wait but no effort to inform beforehand that this could be a problem. We ended up having to cancel dinner with friends because of the ridiculous long wait Lack of entertainment - only some hopeless shows and nothing like the likes of what the bigger names would offer Stroller parking is not at the exit, after exiting an attraction you need to walk back to the entrance to collect your stroller (ie the shark place - have to walk back up the hill just to collect stroller!!!)Unfriendly staff - understand this because there were too many people around but no effort to make the visit memorableOverall just a very average park, nothing much to shout about.

The place worth visiting everytime we're in Hongkong. I suggest you start early at opening time. Because 1 day is not enough..Btw, plan your trip and check the weather, we went there on a rainy day so most of the time were indoors watching the shows or eating snacks.

You need 2 days to enjoy all. At first I thought that this is just an ordinary ocean park like in the Philippines. which is more likely for kids only. but that was more more different. It is really big and has more rides that hk Disneyland.

Visit for cable car and the thrill rides. Nice place to visit if u can walk a lot. Remember to take sunscreen as you might get tanned. The cable car is just awesome and the thrill rides are good. But beware of long queues. For animals., you will not find much except pandas. Food is very expensive inside ocean park and you cannot bring outside food also. There were some shows but didn't find attractive. Can easily reach there by taking shuttle buses from Admiralty.
Fun trip with family and friends!. They have a very well designed park spots and lots of cute animals inside!Take the gondola to enjoy the beautiful ocean view!
Great day out for all. I loved this place so much I have been twice . It's a great if a little old theme park . Lots to see and do .

Must if You lové xgame and animal. It is must go activity if You lové Crazy machine game and animal. Océan Park is réally à good Park All over thé World. At there, You CAN See Many animal and play Many Crazy scary games. It keeps going up with NEW games and animals.
memorable trip..... a nice place for adults....i find the rides scary and tried only a few. love the cable car ride! reasonable entrance fee...

A large great theme park. This large theme park is divided by two sections: The Waterfront and The Summit. A great family day trip for one whole day with fun-filled activities. Much cheaper than the Disneyland
Really Fun and beautiful place. i love it here, the penguins are cute, the dolphin show were entertaining, i like the jellyfish exhibition. The most loveliest is the cablecar ride, oh em gee..Scenic!

Place for Have Fun. You need a whole day to spent your time here, because the area is so big. It has 2 areas uphill and downhill, you can get the map in front of the gate. Actually I was very excited to try the cable car, you can see nice view of Hong Kong. That day was very sunny. I was very excited with the roller coaster that near the clown gate. Another area you could see big aquarium and some animals. I bought discounted ticket at HKD 315, the ticket was not including the bus ticket.

Just Too Much To See!. I visited this theme park two years ago and on this occasion I am still amazed at what it has on offer.There is just far too much to see and do in one day and I could quite easily spend three days in this Park.The animal enclosures are magnificent and they can keep you entertained for hours.The restaurants are very good and of course there are the many rides that are available.

Crowded, EXTREMELY CROWED even on a weekday. Like my topic said, this park is extremely crowded with tourists. If you're hoping to get to this park with your kids and relax, no this is not the place to go as it felt like you need to fight for your position as soon as you enter here. I understand most themed park are usually busy and crowded but this one is at the extreme level. I am definitely not a fan of being packed and squeezed. No thanks
So-so. Do not go there during August-Sep as it's the hottest season. You will definitely melt while lining up for the different rides. Not very interesting compared to Disneyland

Fun-filled Day!. Do:This place is divided in 2 segments - Uphill and Downhill. Plan your day well in Advance, start as early as possible to be able to cover the entire park.For people who like rides its best recommended to start with Uphill park and eventually move downhill.Do carry sufficient food as the food options are less there.Dont:Wear uncomfortable cloths or shoes

Fantastic day to relive your childhood. Ensure you have whole day free as there is so much to do. Apart from the cable cart ride to the top of the park, there are 4 roller coaster to help get the adrenalin pumping plus the water ride (just be prepared to get a little wet hehehe). Then stroll through the dolphin rehab centre while was a great experience and end the day at the aquarium restaurant... Awesome place

Great park, well managed great exhibitions. I've been to Hong Kong many times but was showing my sister around and the weather was terrible so we went on Sunday morning to Ocean Park. Before you stand in a queue for a long time, if you are paying by Visa or Mastercard (and have no vouchers) you can use the kiosk in the middle of the entrance, which we wouldnt have known was there unless the very nice lady at the entrance told us.I live in China and i have to say I was so delighted to see the standards in all of the animal and fish exhibits, they were all really tastefully done and the panda house is beautiful and quite surprisingly empty when we went in. There are red panda's as well as the Giant Panda and the staff were really full of information to help you get as much out of the trip as possible.Really loved the shark exhibition and it's aquarium and the views all over the park were amazing.
