Very well managed and everything is free (apart from food) so great value.Finished off by an amazing cable car ride down the mountain. Tip get the ride by the panda's up the mountain and the cable car down as there were no queues at the top but 45 min wait at the bottom.

Great Fun in the Rain!. We had an excellent visit even the whole day it is raining. We get a map and plan our route due to very limited time from 11 AM to 6 PM. We start the day with Cable Car ride to the Summit and into the Ocean Park Tower to have a great look of the whole area. Followed with watching a show in Ocean Theater due to strong rain. After finishing the show and rain subside a little we proceed to Adventure Land then Marine World then Thrill Mountain and back to waterfront via Ocean Express and finished the day with smile and excitement.

Theme park. When we come here it's raining heavily which make us need to queque under the umbrella to enter the aquarium. We need to queque about 30 minutes to enter any attraction and can't catch up with the show. We can't enjoy anything there and very tired. The weather is really hot just after the heavy rain.

Brings out the kid within you!. Not even the bad weather can stop me from visiting Ocean Park and get to experience riding in a cable car. It was a fun-filled, memorable experience. The queue is kinda long for each attraction since it's summer. It would have been less crowded most likely if it wasn't summertime. There are a lot of food inside the park but some of them are overpriced (I think). I suggest you come here early during the opening and spend an entire day in the park in order to enjoy all the rides and attractions.
Theme park . Plan a full day there, quite deceiving on how big it is , plenty of rides for all , typical inflated food prices for a theme park the animal attractions are quite good ,
nice place!. a nice place to visit if you are in hongkong...the first ever park in hongkong...take the cable ride even if the long lines of waiting its worth the wait.

Our Fun Memories In Hong Kong's Ocean Park. We travelled as a Family with Daughter & son In Law with three grandchildren what a wonderful time we had Ocean Park was absolutly fantastic the grandchildren even went back two days later with their Parents they enjoyed it so much highly recommended for the Grandparents, Parents and Children fun fun fun wonderful experience
Must visit. Kids loved it. Has some great rides. Do not miss drop zone. Could get really hot and humid so travel accordingly and wear suitable attire

Queues and rude people. We spent most of our day waiting in line to see everything! They let far too many people into this place. Even just to get on a cable car (which is mandatory if you want to see 50% of the place) took up an hour! Not only did we spend most of the day waiting in queues but we were pushed and shoved by ADULTS who were also queuing.The dolphin show was depressing and the marine mammal enclosures were tiny. My partner and I actually walked out of the dolphin show half way through.The only thing that made coming to this place worth it was getting to see the pandas. This was something we have never done before and probably won't do again.The place is just overpriced and packed. Avoid!
Great day put. Great theme park, very fun filled day out. Lots of good rides and shows to see. The cable car to the other side is pretty high on the cliff edge and is a ride in its self.

Never get bored here. i have to come to Ocean Park every a few years because Ocean Park never disappoint me. I have new experiences every time i come here. One of the most popular places for Hong Kong locals as well!

must visit ocean park. !Totally enjoyed while I was at Ocean Park! Be sure to spend one full day at Ocean Park if you are in Hong Kong! If you are choosing between Disneyland and Ocean Park, choose Ocean Park if you are not too much a fan of Disney characters. The rides make me feel like a kid once again, and there is an aquarium as well.

Rain can't stop the adventure... Arrived in the Ocean Park around 9am:-) good thing they open the entrance and let us go inside 10mins before their operating hour. Place was compose with amusement park, animal theme park, marine mammal park, and oceanarium. I tried the rides and it was very exciting:-), the show was nice and dolphins was amazing. One thing i really liked the most is they show their advocacy in conserving our wildlife and habitats. The place is not only for fun but also you can learned while your having fun:-)

Awesome Rides for Adults. I went to Ocean Park on a Monday afternoon from 4-7pm, there were quite a lot of people but the lines went quick, no longer than a 15-20min. wait. Single lines go even faster. 3-4 hours is enough time to ride the scary rides-- The HairRaiser, The Flash, The Dragon Roller Coaster, Mine Train Ride. The Abyss Turbo Drop wasn't operational that day so I need to go back to ride that one.
Fun Times!. Good time out at Ocean Park, heaps of stuff to do! Some cool rides and animals to see, very clean and organised!

Fun fun fun. After a decade we came to visit again ocean park. A lot of new attraction was made but the one I enjoyed the most was seeing the panda.
They still have the dolphin show & I also like the shark tank, jelly fish changing colors due to lights effects.
I really had fun in ocean park. ☺

Great place but busy in summer.. We spent five hours here and it is easy to get to by bus. A new MTR is being built which will be fantastic. While we enjoyed the attractions most lines including even the cable car to come down in were an hour long. The winter seems to be the best time to go with shorter queues.
Better than Sea World. Does Sea World have lots of shows and cable cars and a giant aquarium and a rotating view tower thingy?

Too Crowded with People. There's no direct MTR to the theme park like Hong Kong Disneyland. But it's not too difficult to reach there as you can just go to MTR - Admiralty station and buy ticket from MTR tourist information center. The price of ticket is cheaper than buy at the theme park as the normal price is $HK 345. And the queue to buy the ticket is not too crowd. After you buy ticket you walk up to the exit and turn left to take bus no. 629. This bus is only stop at Theme park only. So it's not complicated at all. The theme park is divided into many sections. Start from Grand Aquarium zone then you can walk future to the zoo zone and you can go further to other zone by using the theme park express which is the rail connect to Playground zone which there're many entertainment machines. But the queue to play each machine is really long. You may need to be very patient. With the crowd of people and limited seating inside the theme park including less area with cover. I'd recommend to bring the sun glasses, sun block, hats or umbrella as during summer the sunlight may really hurt the skin.On the way back, you can either take cable car back to the main station or take the theme park express. There're few shows available in each section. If you are interested to see the show like dolphins show, I'd recommend to go before schedule.There're few restaurants in theme park but quite pricy for example one noodle soup outside may cost you $HK40-50 but in there will charge you more than $HK165 even the price also include one drink and ice cream. But if you buy burger at Mc Donald shall cost you $HK20-30 only. The water inside charge you $HK24 whereas outside charge $HK7. But there's some area provide the water but you need to bring the bottle to take it.The finale show is the fountain show at 8 pm. You can stay on to see the show or if you would like to avoid the crowd I would recommend to leave in the evening time.On the way back you can just take bus no 629 same as arrival time and drop off at MTR - admiralty.
Ocean park.. For kids and their parents(also saw grand parents) complete fun. The management of the que is good , so be prepared.

It's really Awesome!. I spent almost 2 days in the park. Took a park of the map and did a trip around a whole park, each attraction, saw each aquarium, each animal, each fish. At the end of each day was totally exhausted but happy and impressed.

A Fun Family day out. I would recommend arriving when the park opens (10am) and heading straight for the amazing cable car before queues build. The do the most popular rides (such as the Hair Raiser, Raging Rapids and log flume). At midday cool down from the heat by doing the Polar and Antarctic displays (you can essentially just walk into these without queuing). If you want to see the Ocean Wonders (dolphin and seal acrobatics) show I would recommend arriving at the Ocean Theatre 20 mins before the showtime as this tends to fill up. But most importantly, buy your tickets in advance (online or at the bus terminal) for a cheaper price and to avoid the entrance ticket queues. If you leave when the park closes (7pm Mon-Fri, 9pm weekends) you will have a long queue for the bus or taxi, so either leave earlier or order a taxi. Have a great day!

Awesome rides. Super place for visit if you are lover of dangerous rides.there are different types of rides for childrens and young people.there are some water shows also.we experienced the different types of funny rides and eating pizza there for lunch.it is very clean and disciplined place to visit.
To much time taking..... BUT WORTH IT. Very tiring. Too much wait time in every ride. But hair razer is amazing ride. should not miss it if going there.
Worthy to visit. Awesome place to visit if you are a ride lover. And if you are really interested in seeing penguins, arctic fox, walrus you should must visit. Worthful to visit.

Great day out - especially with kids. The aquariums are excellent. There are some very special animals to see including Pandas and Arctic Foxes and the Dolphin Research Centre.
The park is undergoing a transformation with some parts and rides new and shiny and others in need of an overhaul - which they are obviously doing.
Great!. Pretty awesome rides! Keep an entire day to explore the whole park. Loved the penguins, koala and kangaroos. And an amazing cable ride!

Super bad theme park. Had a very horrible experience, staffs were rude and the mainland people kept pushing during the queues and they were hurling vulgarities through the phone. The animal enclosures was ok. The queue time was insane, 1 hour plus per ride. Wasted so much time standing under the hot sun with people who kept shoving their elbows and arms around you. It was like an umbrella dodging game when we watched the v depressing dolphin show. The shark enclosure had horrendous stench as well. Not worth paying over $60sgd. Very very disappointed.
Good time to spend. best place to spend time. i luv it, it was a great place. enjoined a lot. had lots of fun. cable care & train was too good.

What a horrible experience!. We took my kids to Ocean Park, what a mistake, it was not the Ocean park I could remember from years ago. First of all the traffic was crazy. Inside the park we spent 3 hours just queue up for everything. In the end we saw nothing not even the major attraction the aquarium! I can't believe I paid to be tortured. It was horrible no fun whatsoever, even dangerous! I felt so sorry for my kids being pushed and stepped over.The park is way exceed its capacity with bus loads of tourists. I can see the tragedy of Lang Kwai Fong and Shanghai repeat in the park with human domino it is insane. After 2 hours in the queue the only thing we wanted was to get out of the taki park, but even that we had to wait, for the dangerous over crowded train to go down the fill, it was hell!Ocean Park management you are either too greedy and have absolutely no idea about park management. You must limit the number of tourists buses allowed on a daily basis.

A whole day of fun and adventure!!!. A day well spent, this place can be described in one world "awesome". It is an amazing theme park and water world. People of all ages can have fun and kids can learn as well. The staff here is friendly and welcomes with whole heart. The roller coaster (The Hair Raiser) is the best attraction according to me. Do give it a try once you are there.As we went during the Chinese new year celebrations, the rush was pretty much. But if you reach early in the morning the queues are short (people generally start coming in the late mornings).

Ocean Park Theme Park & Aquarium. Have been a fan of theme parks for a long time now, and so hopped off a bus here to give it a look. It has some great roller coasters, most notably the Hair Raiser, and the aquarium is fantastic. It's very crowded, and finding your way around can be a bit confusing, what with it being divided into 2 parts, but it's a great day out for the family, and well worth the price of admission.

Entertaining as well as educational. I have been impressed very much by the pandas, koalas and the aquarium. Games rides are exciting, can be too exciting if you have height fright. Amenties and signs are user-friendly. Worth visiting more than once.

one time attraction. very nice, lots of venues and attractions, helpful and nice staff, the queues for the venues is enorm.... takes forever to get a seat... be patient...very good price promotions, restaurants rather poor
Very nice place!. Cool place for all ages!you cannot bring food inside but there are resto inside.the place is a bit big but you will surely enjoy the place.you can ride the cable car too.

Expanded. We were in the park 6 yrs ago and have notice expansion and added more attraction.It was raining during our visit but the park is still crowded and moving around is not so comfortable.Ocean express was a good alternative for cable ride during bad weather. We still able to ride the cable on our return to the entrance.Desipite the weather, its still worth the visit
Visitor. Great place and experience for the whole family. The kids love it especially the dolphins show. Lovely

New Rides. There are several new rides available at the Ocean Park Hong Kong. Including Rev Booster, Flash and Hair Raiser. I suggest to visit this area in the morning to avoid hours of queing in line.

Wish I could have this day back.. Full disclosure, I'm not a fan of Amusement Parks and it is August in HK. School is out and it feels like +48.Aquarium and animal exhibits are mediocre. No ride had less than a 45 min wait. You need to take a train our gondola (60 min lineup) to access the newer area. We arrived at opening and lines were immediately everywhere. I was appalled at the aggressiveness and rudeness of others in lineups. Once we decided to leave at approximately 5pm it was 2 hours later at 7pm that we were sitting in a taxi leaving the park. Massive lineups to take the gondola or train back down then 30 minute wait in the taxi line. Based on our experience at this park we have decided to avoid HK Disneyland.

Amazing Theme Park. It is very impressive! By the park, we can know a lot about creatures,like dolphin, shark, penguin, polar bear and so on. There are two mainly parts in the park. One is better for younger children, and the other one is more appropriate for elder children and adults. Seven topics are divided. They respectively are Whiskers Harbor,Amazing Asian Animals, Aqua City, Polar Adventure, Rainforest, Thrill Mountain, Adventure Land and Marine World. Different shows will be played on at different time. Visitors can get a map at the entrance.Before you go there, you'd better get a ticket online so that you don't have to wait in line. I also advise that visit the Ocean Park in the morning. It deserves us to spend the whole day in it. Be sure that visit the Summit in the morning by free cable car in the park, visit the Waterfront in the afternoon by train. Yes, the transportation in the park is free!!! When you sit in the cable car, you can see an unbelievable view.

A good day out. On your own, with friends and or family this is definitely worth a visit.Real competition and a favoured alternative to Disney but also suffers from long queues when busy and I'll mannered mainland to our groups!The annual pass is definitely worth getting if you live here and have children - great value for money.Food and drink are pricey, way too pricey and the quality of food was questionable.
Good. Our outing to Ocean Park was a good one. The views were worth the visit. My wife and i enjoyed it and will be back.

A fun day - but avoid the touristy period. This park has got good points - Safe, clean and tidy, wonderful South China seas from the cable car and observation tower. There is also something for everyone and always new attractions/developments.The location is easily accessible by bus, 25-30mins from city center.I really think they managed very well to use wisely the small space they had and leave you enough to do in a day.But, there can be some bad points: this park is notoriously crowded during popular holidays in HK and China (yes, that includes all Summer, early May, Chinese New year, Halloween) And Crowded + hot = disaster. I went there in march, I didn't queue for more than 20-25mins on anything. It is true it is lacking of rest areas, the few ones available are taken immediately... And the "animal" part is lacking a little bit of animals for my taste.Other than that, if you manage to find a day where the pack is not crowded it really is worth a visit.

Amazing Fun in the Park. A day with fun and adventure, good food and not too big lines. All attractions are very good organized and young and old can have something new to discover. My favorite place was the water show with the dolphins and the walruses! The big aquarium is just amazing and everybody has to see it. Unfortunately I could not see the pandas, since one of them showed giving birth syndromes...so I will have to go back. One should not leave Hong Kong without visiting the place.

Nice but super crowded!!. It's been nearly 20 years that we have last visited ocean park. To be fair, there are lots more attractions and rides. It's well staffed and they are all friendly and polite. However, they can do better with crowd controlled through pre booking to avoid unexpected crowd and lose control.

ocean park - great attraction. interesting place to spend half - a day time. definitely different from disney, the main attraction would have been the water attractions rather than the rides, as a ride is a ride no matter which theme park imho). great place to bring kids and the young at heart. but beware of the large number of visitors during peak times.

Hot and fun! But crowded and did I mention hot?. If you're choosing between Disneyland and Ocean Park I'd tell you that there are other Disney Parks but just the one Ocean Park. My one day experience at the park was enough, but it was a worthy day trip and a real bargain for what you get.The upsides were great views of Hong Kong and the ocean from many spots of the park, lots of attractions and rides, its affordable, and you can pretty much find something for anyone to enjoy. Though there are some potential cons if you are lazy and didn't plan well (like me) you may find yourself waiting in a very long and hot queue to get in. Just buy a ticket online or get there early to avoid the massive lines. Also use your octopus card to get onto the bus to avoid another line buying tickets to get on the bus. Once at the park, you also might find some of the rides and rollercoasters small and slower compared to other bigger parks, but lines can get long for these as well so I would recommend doing all of those things first as we were able to get into some rides with no queueing due to prioritizing time. The biggest downside (which is probably a case for all theme parks) is inevitability at some time in the day you'll have to wait in some long line for something. The visitors were mostly local people or tourists from nearby asian countries, but if you only speak English you'll still find its no problem to get around. Just remember it gets super hot in the summer and if you don't remember to put some sun protection on you might end up a bit burnt at the end of the day, so also take breaks throughout the day from the rides to go into some of the cooler air conditioned animal exhibits. The jellyfish one is especially cool.

Fab day out.. Visited during a really hot sunny day in August. Such a fab atmosphere, ques were around 30/40 mins for some of the bigger rides but things like the aquarium and the colder animals like the Penguins were all around 5 mins and it was lovely escaping the sunshine for awhile.When travelling with little ones you do worry but at Ocean Park things are made to help include families with prams. Most attractions had lifts or different routes in so you could avoid the stairs and escalators. Only thing to watch out for are Mainland Chinese people who seem to think that they can just push themselves to the front and are not very patient at queing.Food choices were excellent and good value for money. The whole family enjoyed themselves and we will definitely be visiting again just on a day it's not so hot and not a weekend :)

Well worth the time spent - wonderful experience . Good combination theme park - big acquairium, cable car ride, sea animals like dolphin / seal, giant panda, Australian animals and many more. The rides were exciting and fun filled. Games zone for kids and light show at night - too good.Worth each minute spent there. Don't miss visiting Ocean Park every time you are in HK.
Excellent!. Excellent! Kids and adults love it!! Very nice view on the ocean from the cable car ride.. Polar adventure area was amazing!

Waste of time and attractions are below par.. This is a complete waste of time and energy if you plan to visit this place. Their shows are so amateur and cannot be even compared to water parks that I have been. They show so much concern to marine wildlife harping on this to generate more revenue and sell the attraction's product.
Very good and impressive Ocean park. There are countless species of ocean creature and a variety of amusement. You can also find HK food inside.BTW,the toilet there is very clean and neat.

Get organised by reading this review.... I read what I thought was needed to go to Ocean Park but it wasn't enough.If you have any children you need to take swimmers! Its so hot and you queue for so long that I thought my daughter in the end was going to faint. There is a huge water enclosure filled with the most fun that any kid could have getting wet and can keep them cool in between queuing to rides. Such a shame we didn't know!PS. Do the Cable car on the way back as there wasn't a queue rather than waiting at the bottom for over an hour!

Big Park full of Amazing Roller coasters and Views!. Came here having never heard of the place, and had an amazing time. From the animal exhibitions, the aquarium, the old hong kong, to the roller coasters on top of the mountain etc. and the gondola ride! AMAZING! Definitely coming back soon.

Mixed feelings.... Whilst I enjoyed the rides, particularly the Mine Train and Hairaiser, there were many let downs. The presence of staff as we were leaving on the express train was woeful, meaning that there were crowds of people pushing and shoving down wide queue lanes, jumping the 'queue', complete chaos! No order to it and noone present to police it.The heat was another issue, lack of shade and few fans/air conditioning. Queues were also long and very narrow(!!!), we went on four rides- all rollercoasters- one of those as single riders, which is a good idea if you don't mind being separated from your party. The views from the cable car are fantastic and the layout of the park, while a bit impractical being separated by mountains, is interesting and nicely done.The park was also clean and all rides were operating during our visit. 3/5 because of the issues mentioned.
Lots to do..... So much to do at this park, from fast rides to visiting Pandas!!!!My 8 year old daughter really enjoyed it!!

Busy with long queues and a lack of rest areas. We went to Ocean Park in midweek, only to be confronted with large crowds. Queues were generally over an hour for each ride. The panda enclosure was closed because one of the Red Pandas was pregnant so we didn't even get to see the giant pandas.The experience started badly with the sign for the Arctic Express saying the queue was 45 mins only it took 90 mins. The customer service was poor in comparison to other parks around the world. It rained while we were there and there was a lack of places to shelter such that everyone was in the same place and then there were huge queues for the train and cable car back down from the top.All in all not a great experience.
Great Park for fun. Ocean park is a versatile place to be at and it provides a lot of fun filled activities for both the children as well as for adults.

Waiting in line, Waiting in line, Waiting in line. We went there on a Tuesday when the weather was good and we wrongly believed that we could avoid the crowds by choosing a weekday. What a mistake ! Not a single attraction had waiting times below 1 hour. The park was totally ran over and queuing already started from buying the ticket to gettting into the park. Taking the cablecar was totally excluded, with waiting times exceeding the 60 minutes (waiting in the heat, btw). And totally unnecessary ! A gondel has the capacity of 6 people, though most of the gondels are leaving with less than 3 people. The panda park was closed and the other attractions (including those like the visit of the aquarium) were minimum 60 minutes waiting time. Count that in a total day (if you are ready to queue for at least 5 hours), you can do 4 things.We will not be back and we were not pleased with the way the flood of people is managed.

Amazing Views!. Although this is an older theme park, the views are what keep it popular. Every ride is surrounded by senic ocean views, and the cable car ride is fantastic. I loved the rapids ride, but you will get wet! The only problem was the very expensive water. Bring your own, and lots of it. I loved the blue skies and roller coasters. The old Hong Kong Street was charming, and the Tuxedos restaurant was excellent. Both are must sees!

Good family day out. We really only visited Ocean Park to see the Pandas but it turned out to be a great day. The Park is divided into two halves with a peak in the middle so you have to hop from one side to the other via the chair lift but this worked well (and there is also a train for when thunderstorms stop the chairlift from running). We saw one of the shows with the dolphins which was great (just what you would see at any other water park) but all part of the experience. It is a huge park and gets very busy so be prepared to queue a bit for the bigger attractions (like the aquarium) but stick with it as once inside the attractions they are worth the wait.

Great theme park. We came here bright and early via the bus from Causeway Bay MTR station. The park is divided into the Waterfront (mainly kid rides and and the Summit (where the main thrill rides are). As soon as the park opens watch out for the big rush of people running to the cable cars to get to the summit. We bypassed it by catching the less scenic but faster Ocean Express to beat the queue. Hair Riser was definitely a must-try, being on the side of the hill adds a new level of excitement!Unfortunately when we went, both The Dragon and Mine Train roller coasters were closed for works. The visit was still great. The panda and aquarium were both good visits too. Great prizes for the carnival games as we won a couple of Sesame street plushes.Average queue times were around 30min on the Monday when we went. As we went in September, they park was getting ready for Halloween however the Halloween-specific attractions were not open then. They look like great attractions too.Wider selection of food compared to most theme parks.
Must fun. Very much fun..... Its not that far from hk. Not very good fast food. Good entertainment. Not too long lines

Brought out the inner child in me!. If you are bringing kids along, be prepared to be here all day as it does become extremely busy during peak times. Two adults with three kids aged 10 and 11, going on a very hot Sunny afternoon for our afternoon of fun on our last weekend here. This is my inner child's favourite place to have fun in Hong Kong as she was here for the first time back in 1980 and what fond memories she has of her first visit! HeheBring lots of water and snacks because the food and drinks here cost as expected for a theme park, an arm and a leg! We headed up to the top of the park by cable car and the view was just breathtaking yet coming back down was so much more rewarding as it was getting dark and the lights came on! So the cable car ride is a must to get the views of Hong Kong that we can never get elsewhere! This attraction is very educational for kids as well as adults about animals and mammals. Go inside to see the penguins and all the sealife to escape from the intense Hong Kong heat and you will get your socks blown off! hahaI was still recovering from whiplash symptoms so I needed to stay off the roller coaster rides yet I still had the time of my life here as I was the biggest kid there! hehe I went onto The Rapids three times just to stay cool and what fun it was each time to get water on me! There is an area undercover for those who want to get wet and bring a change of clothes so you can have a whale of a time! This is the best opportunity to stay out of the intense heat and be the biggest kid ever! heheThe queuing times on this particular busy Sunday for popular rides was an hour or slightly over so an afternoon was never going to be enough yet we made the most of what time we did have. Be very aware that the rude mainland China people will and do skip the queues, push through you as well as walking straight up to the front of the queues! I never allowed this to bother me as I was having the time of my life yet some people will stand up to them, for me, nothing much gets done about this as I had witnessed at Disneyland. There's definitely less pressure to buy souvenirs from here compared to Disneyland so we spent less money here. Yet the photos that can be purchased from the cable car ride and other rides were well worth the memory of the moment! hehe Do make the most of your visit and be the biggest kid ever!
Ride you wont foget. Views from the sky ride up, looking Down on planes taking off a new experience all I can say great,Big Budda worth it spoilt by dirt and cheap tatty stalls

So Disappointing. We were so disappointed, we LOVE theme parks and rides. We might be a bit jaded because we have been to most of the big parks in the USA. Our son was almost 6 at the time and he could only go on the babiest of rides even though he had been on much more adventurous rides elsewhere. The rides for the adults were super tame. I was expecting much more. Positive they did have some wonderful acrobatic shows, the best part of the park was the cable car to the entrance.Save your money and go to HK Disney if you are looking for fun and rides.

Infrastructure behind other attractions in Singapore. In the scorching sun, the backward infrastructure of Ocean Park can be felt by long queues and often queues under the sun. The new Pandas are not available because a lucky lady in there got pregnant. A nice trick to avoid the cable car queues up to the hilltop is to take the express train. And a trick is to bring a stroller or rent one at the park so your whole family can go to the express line without queueing. This way you can take cable car down from the hill. And you can do it two times before it's your friend's turn at the bottom of the hill! A must visit place is those game stalls in the children's park, almost nobody there and as long as you are willing to pay, the kids will sure carry a few plush toys home! The Aquarium is a disappointment comparing to the SEA Aquarium in Singapore. The terrace restaurant at the hilltop is a must visit, but make sure you arrive there before noon time to get a nice seat with photo spots for the entire south of the hk island (some liken it to the French Rivera) and the cable cars view. Also, why can they offer online ticketing?

Feels like I'm a kid again. Step into the world where you forget your responsibilities and live in a dream. (Well sort of) Best rides are found here. #1 the hair raiser. Don't forget to drop by and see the world famous panda :)

Surpassing all expectations -- action-packed, ambitious rides. We headed to Ocean Park on a hot, sunny day in Hong Kong, raring to go on real rides this time and not the Toy Story hand-holdy practical jokes HK Disneyland has the audacity to call rides. We were not disappointed. Thrill Mountain is above and beyond the best region of the park to head to if you're in the mood to have your bum kicked by seriously spine-tingling roller-coasters. Even if you're not into heavy-duty coasters, Ocean Park has a lot on offer, like animal shows, dolphin encounters, exhibitions and more tame rides for the kids. Apart from its rides, the park's ultimate selling point is its location. High up on a mountain for which you need to take a bus from Admiralty to access, the park offers stunning views of the landscape from the peak of one of Hong Kong's shapely land structures. The sea and the sky complement each other beautifully, and from a coaster it's even more fun to admire the natural beauty that surrounds the bustling city.Tips: to get there, you have to take the Metro to Admiralty, from where a bus will take you across Hong Kong Island to Ocean Park. At the Admiralty Metro station, stop by the Ocean Park ticket booth near the exit of the station for a discount. Buy water from the vendor near the bus stop; it's cheaper. Wear walking shoes that are unlikely to fall off your feet when on a coaster (though if you wear sandals there is storage for each ride). Don't carry too many bags. Bring an umbrella as it may drizzle. And for god's sake, wear sunscreen! The rides that we did, in order:1) Hair-Raiser. On Thrill Mountain, for which you ride a cable car to reach. A relentless roller coaster that immediately takes you through three swooping loops through the air, defying gravity and thwarting all hopes of escape. 45 seconds of pure adrenaline and heart-stopping terror. Long queue: 45 minutes for 45 seconds.2) The Rapids. At the Rainforest. Get ready to get wet! You'll be plopped onto a boat that seats 9 people in total. You'll be taken on a tropical adventure that involves sailing along an automated approximation of a river. While the path to the finish does not involve any jumps or scares, the folks at Ocean Park know how to keep us on our toes: intermittently we are doused with water from nearby fountains. Quite fun. Bathrooms are located nearby for you to freshen up, and the water does tend to dry up quickly in the Hong Kong heat. Raincoats can be purchased before the ride. Quick queue. 3) Raging River: a water slide with a Canadian theme. The Chinese do love their Canada memorabilia; I think it's aspirational. Anyway. Tear your gaze away from the Maple Leaf motifs adorning the First Nation canoe you step into and embrace the sprays of water that drench you during an exhilarating 10-second drop into a large puddle. Like riding a water slide, but shorter and scarier. If you're in the middle of the 4-seater you'll get less wet. Plus you get a picture of your screaming as a souvenir if you choose to buy it. Very long queue for us. 35 minutes. Not so fun as the other two. 4) Mine Train. Not on Thrill Mountain but at the same place as Raging River, wherever that is. Very fun ride -- an electrifying roller-coaster like Hair Raiser. Outstanding view of Hong Kong from the mountain peak. I'd do the ride again just for the views of the surrounding mountains and sea! Very fast-moving queue: 20 minutes. Good ride.5) The Flash -- far and away the most thrilling ride I have ever taken. Better than Hair Raiser. Up on Thrill Mountain. The seating car goes up into the air and performs a 360 degree turn so that you can appreciate the stunning view of the South China Sea from upside-down. That was like fulfilling a dream I didn't even know I had. Not a ride: a spiritual experience. Not for the faint of heart, or for children under 12. Take a good look at it before going!5 minute queue, probably because I did it shortly before closing -- a good time to catch any ride.6) Bumper Car -- not sure if this is the official name, though it is on Thrill Mountain and involves sitting in a car that goes up and down on a loop. Reminiscent of a Luna Park rollercoaster. More tame than the others but still nice and scary. Brace yourselves! Short queue, 5 minutes as we were nearing closing time. The rhythmic motion of the ride was a welcome change from the crazy twists and turns of the Flash.We had lunch at the terrace cafe. Quick and courteous service, decent food -- I recommend the club sandwich. Avoid the pizzas: they are much smaller than they appear on the menu. The Caesar salad was not much to speak of.We had a caricature portrait done by Paul, the sitting cartoonist. I didn't think much of it.To catch the cable car back from Thrill Mountain you'll have to do a fair amount of walking, so prepare yourself for that -- don't get too tired, now! We arrived at noon and went home happy and satisfied around 7pm. A great day!

Fun and family-themed as well. Ocean park is one of the two parks in HK, this being more adult feeling! So when you want to go to Ocean park, you really want to try the hair raiser, it features big loop the loops as well as being very scenic as you are on the edge of the mountain. This ride can be ridden by people 140 cm or taller.

Ocean Park Fun. There is so much I could say but if you are visiting Hong Kong you would probably find out about the fun and wonders of this place anyway! Enter the park by the chair lift. I was petrified but so glad I did it. Be a big kid and enjoy!

Height of fun!. As much as I love doing the grown up thing of going for dinners and having a nice drink here and there, it's also good to be a kid again! and that's what Ocean Park brings out in you. It was heaps of fun! You could easily spend the whole day there and not get bored and not see everything that there is to see! There are fantastic rides, water shows to watch, a fantastic Aquarium and Zoo. It got me feeling like a kid again.
nice place. had gone there with a group of 60 people.high light is cable car ,u could view full hong kong from there

World class experience. Ocean Park is an amazing place for kids and adults to enjoy alike. This fun place provides enjoyment to all age groups. Joy rides, food joints, gaming zones and beautiful parks to troll around are all built in. The cable car ride back from the hill top is great and is my favorite

Too Many People. Too Many people to actually enjoy the place. The queues were enormous & the time spent waiting was no better as when you got inside there were just as many people. The Panda enslosures were empty as it was too hot for the Pandas. The acquarium was good but not as good as Singapore. All in all a little disappointed in the place.

Family entertainment home grown in Hong Kong. Ocean Park the title says it all! The theme is aquatic! It is a very well done park that has grown up in Hong Kong gradually over the years.Its great to bring the kids and teach them all about marine life and some of its more popular as well as unusual animals and more much more!Really a worthwhile park to visit during your visit to Hong Kong
Great day out. This is a good theme park for teens/young adults. Its not the best of the best but still a great place to visit

Fantastic show, exciting rides, reasonably priced . Bring enough bottled drinks and some snacks with you as the food is pricey here. You may pass the whole area of stall games as the prizes are not attractive at all. Hair Raiser, the Rapid, Cable car and Mine train are the four must ride. All the animal habitats are great places to escape from heat. The ocean theatre is the must see show which is full of fun. Arrive 10 min earlier at least to secure a seat. Animal lover can catch the feeding time because the animals will do a few tricks as well at that time .

Summer night visit was a success. We bought the summer night ticket which they sell in August on Sat and Sun evenings, as felt that at 36 degrees with high humidity we didn't want to be here for a full day. Great saving and we really enjoyed our few hours.Got quite a few rides done, saw the pandas, had dinner in one of the restaurants and caught the show on the way out.It poured with rain as we were leaving so we stopped to buy a couple of umbrellas just by the Pandas, by the time we reached the exit (3 minutes later!) one had broken, definitely not built to last!

Worth a visit if you haven't been there!. Despite the heat, the crowd and expensive food, it was worth a visit!! Buy tickets from HK Tourism Board at Admiralty MTR which are slightly cheaper. The cable car ride was pleasant with good view.
10 out of 10 . This was a fun all day activity suited to everyone, I enjoyed myself completely and was never bored at any point of the day and I loved seeing all the Asian animals

Long Line up, need to be there super early. I think it might take 2 visit to completely experience all facilities.Or you have to be there early especially high season. The long wait under the sun....for 45 mins line up each.. Do the math before you go, but, its real fun.

Very nice for families . It was very nice although as usual crowded as all Hong Kong but it was nice. Book online to avoid long queues at the entrance and enjoy the Online discount.Take extra clothes and enjoy the summer season water splash.Cable car was very nice.Very strict for the 120 cm rule for kids my daughter was 118 and refused to let her in.Panda always sleeping. Penguins were phenomenal.

Some of the rides are quite dated now. Loved the cable car - an amazing experience in a tropical downpour! Lots to see - hard to fit everything in. A very popular destination with thousands of people there.

Great day for big kids. If you are in HK with small children, head straight to Disneyland. However, if you have anyone over 10, the sugar sweet sappyness of that place will get to you. Head straight to Ocean Park for the real rides. The park has seen better days, everything is in need of a makeover but man the rides are still awesome! You won't be able to do more than 6-7 rides with long waiting times but the adrenalin rush is worth the heat, the queues and the occasional rain.
I was little disappointed.I thought will be like little Disney land but it was not.. I think travelers should go to Macau it is very nice to spend a day or two.Go to the casino and try your luck.

Worth a visit but pick your day. It was 35 degrees the day we spent at ocean park. Get there at opening, generally avoid Fridays and weekends, although every day apparently gets busy. Lots of walking. Do the rides first (dragon coaster extremely bumpy). to beat the crowds. Prior trip advisor reviews complain about food prices but theyre not too bad (we just had some maccas) Highlights were the pandas, sharks and aquariums, and the penguins. Any of the animal and indoor sites are worth the visit.

Cable Car Ride is a Must!. I went to Hong Kong a few years ago. I remember the cable car ride like it happened yesterday. I am one of those people that like to see the city view from a birds eye view.

Great Park, basic improvements needed. Must say a great way to spend a day, but some areas where there could be improvements:First tips:1 Carry umbrellas and drinking water.2 download the app on your mobile which you can view when you are there3 you won't be able to see all that's there, so choose what you want to see and do.Improvements:1 the signs aren't good.2 the bus service isn't the best, the staff isn't courteous 3 no drinking water,filling slots.4 the ocean express crowd handling wasn't the best.Cheers!

Take your own shade and insect repellant!. I should have known better than to try a visit to Ocean Park in Summer! Hong Kong is hot and Ocean Park is pretty exposed so make sure you have hats, sunscreen and insect repellent. All compounded by the 10am opening which ensures that you will be milling around in the hottest part of the day, we lasted 3 hours before we felt the crowds where building as well as the heat as our composure eroded. Crowds are also part of the norm and bus loads of tourists from the mainland take queue jumping to a new level (Note: everyone feels the heat in summer and starts to try and cut corners!). It's well organised and the staff are all relaxed and friendly. Make sure you do your research before you arrive if you want to see any of the shows. Unlike DL Ocean Park has some attractions that have a broader age span but it seems to be aimed at impressing tourists from the mainland rather than impress on an International standing but it's the best HK has to offer. Young kids should take their swimming kit so they can enjoy the 'wet area'. You may like to consider taking your own snacks and drinks or eating afterwards as the fast food is not for me......

DISSAPPOINTED. They are called Ocean Park, but their aquariums are pathetic and disappointing. Except the jelly fish display, other aquariums were nothing to write about. No excitement or imagination. No attractive or colourful displays. Only drab and boring stuff.They had regular kind of rides like any other amusement park, like roller-coaster. But that was not what i went there for. Layout of the park was also not visitor friendly. Too much of walk on gradients. The worst of all was the food. HK$ 170/- for a combo meal, which is poor both in quality and quantity. ( I've had far better food for HK$ 95/- a combo meal @ Disney)Overall - Dissapointed. Waste of time & money

a place for every age group. amazing rides, shark tank, arctic animals, australian animals and symbol of china the pandas are the main attraction of the place. well situated and from the ocean tower you get 360 degree view of hong kong. a must visit place. so much water sports option, very children friendly and adventures place.

Very good, on several levels.... One of the best parks of it's kind, and I know what I'm talking about. I've been to several others in a bunch of countries, in Europe and the States. They might have more this or that, but overall this is really good.What I like the most are the aquariums, but there are also great rides. It's a pity they demolished the pools, those were also amazing...

Great day out. Ocean Park was a great day out. It isn't Disney or a Mega theme park, but there are some good rides and the gondola was lovely with great views over Aberdeen on one side and HK on the other. You can get bus transport from Admiral, which was convenient.

Great Outdoor Park for every families. Great Outdoor For Amusement Park for Families. The Cable Car is already Old , need to be replace.
Visiting at July or summer holiday is very hot. Take the sunglass and Lotion and umbrella is better.

loved this place. Ocean park is a fun day out for everyone .The park has roller coasters, rides etc not to the same sophistication as disney and busch gardens in USA but very enjoyable.The park is larger than I expected and I didnt get to go on all the rides.The park could be a bit better laid out or maybe be sign posted better.Had lunch in the netune restaurant which was a pleasant experience,watching the fish in the gigantic tank was quite relaxing

Not Great For Young Children!. After spending the previous day at Disneyland (which is AWESOME), we were disappointed with Ocean Park for the following reasons:- For children under 120cm, the number of 'fun' rides are limited compared to what's on offer at Disneyland.- Staff aren't all that cheerful.- The park is large and very time consuming to get around, especially as the park is on a hill, so you have to take a train or cable-car up and down, or even several slow escalators. On a positive note, there are plenty of buses to take you from Admiralty MTR to and from the park if using public transport, and it looks like there will be a MTR opposite the park completed some time in the near future as construction was well under way!If your kids are under 8 years of age, I think your best to take them to Disneyland. Lots more rides and fun to be had!

Best Team Park Experience. This is my 2nd time to ocean park. Its a good experience for this time. The first time I went, I only experience a few games and watch a few animals. The 2nd time experience is the best. I only managed to experience 80% of all the park, games, animal show, and many more. This is great experience I have. I will be coming back again for my 3rd visit.

White knuckle rides a plenty.. Great place to visit, from the cable car to the aquarium to the theme park, the rides not white knuckle due to their speed, more that some overhang the cliff tops well worth the visit, it will keep you entertained

Big Fun in Town. Catch anything you can -- sea animals, birds, cute animals with lot of excited games, wonderful park for family with children, hugh spacious you can stay for whole day for fun and natural education, don't miss to say hi to panda, koala, penguins , the entry fee not costly but crowed always coz where is the must go sightseeing in HK.

Big park with cable car. I was amazed with ocean park , it has huge selection of animals that is rarely seen in other aquarium or zoo. One day is definitely not enough to spend in ocean park. The view on the cable car which connect one park to another side of park is amazing. Make sure you wear commie shoes since you will walk a lot.

Lots of fun for all ages and likes. Was amazed by the many improvements and larger number of attractions since my first visit to the Ocean Park 8 years ago. The cable car offering a stunning ocean view continues to be the main attraction but if you like rides I counted at least 10 of them including roller coaster, tower drop, ferry wheels, lazy river, water splash, etc. The mega aquarium and shark exhibits are state of the art and not to be missed. There are many other animal exhibits so it depends on what is your interest. Suggest visiting the Pandas as soon as the park opens at 10 am, that’s when they are fed and usually more active. Large groups of tourist and students are inevitable but even so the queue time was bearable at say some 15-20min depending on the attraction. We bought tickets at 10% discount from some deal websites.

Amazing day!. This resort gives you the chance to see animals you might never see again. Very moving, and fun!Up the cable car, the views are second to none. Amazing rides and rollercoasters for all the family!Well worth the ticket price - and then some!
Huge Park, Lots of walking. Its a huge park. So be prepared to walk a lot a lot a lot. If are having a little child with you, you may opt for a stroller, but still beware, you have to walk a lot.

Ocean park. It is super convenient to just take mtr to admirity & there is a free shuttle there. No worry on long waiting for bus as they are plenty. Ocean park is huge !!! Cant finish in a day recommend on a weekday where is less crowded. Unforturnately, it rain on our visit if not it would be a v good trip. The rides are fun!!

Amazing Theme Park. I never expected that Ocean Park would be so amazing ! The fact that the park surrounded by ocean and mountain, is just amazing. When you take cable car to go up, you can see how beautiful the scenery is. The roller coaster sight is so great ! If u are afraid of height maybe this is not for you. The attractions so far quite balance between the adult ride and the kids' so this is worth to visit but during Summer, don't forget to use sunscreen because the heat burns ur skin easily.

Enough sights for eveyone. Chose this over Disneyland and wasn't disappointed.Easy access via public transport, do buy the ticket before getting to park to save time. So much to do, the animal enclosures were a respite from the heat...... amazing aquarium and to see a Panda and Walrus and ride a roller coaster or 2, amazing. Our kids had a great time and still talk about it. Yes food is very pricey but what theme park isn't !

Hong kong's own...... Ocean park is and will always be HK's must visit places. On any day, the rides are much better and exciting than disneyland- although you can't compare the two. The gondola ride to the play area is amazingly beautiful. Very scenic and just above the ocean. They're always adding new games so there's always something new to expect. The waiting lines in ocean park, unfortunately is longer with some games like the water adventure where you have to wait for more than an hour. There's lots of waiting and walking to do so a comfortable shoes would be good-better still if you get a shoes with rollers below ;). You can get the gandola on your way up and get the express train on your way down. There are also panda conservation, Hk cultural and history shows etc which adds a different charm to it just being synonymous to thrilling games.

Avoid cable car during typhoon. Great Park with lots of variety and thrills. Had the added adventure of cable car, stop, starting due to typhoon winds. Our cable car the last arrival, with closure due to weather. Superb views on journey. Something for everyone, including great rides. The layout of park perhaps "scattergun" part of the charm. Not on the tourist radar, lots of mainland Chinese utilize, so mid week best.

Mixed feelings. It is a theme park and zoo in one, for some it satisfying enough, but for me its sort of half half of nothing. There is not enough time in 1 day to enjoy everything fully if you want to do rides and see animals. Food is expensive and not allowed to bring from outside (however if you have a backpack you can easy smuggle some food in) There are drinking fountains so bring a bottle for refill. Or buy a cool one from the souvenir shop :)The park is very big so prepare for lots of walking. Some attractions have lines, sometimes you need to que for and hour or more. Try to go on non crowded days or else you won't be able to do many attrations.Pandas are cute! but visit their pen when there is still daylight if you want to take pictures.

Spectacular outing. While I am no fan of aquariums and zoos, Ocean Park is so much more. The enclosures are clean and the animals are clearly taken care of. The pandas are given mounds of bamboo to enjoy, and lumps of ice to laze on when things get warm. The aquariums are really something special. Then take a ride in the train through the mountain or take a gondola over the top, which is breath-taking and a bit frightening. The rides are great fun, but some of them look like they need a bit of attention. The food options are vast, and for the non-locals, eye-opening. Don't be afraid of the grilled squid in a bag, it's quite delicious.

Ocean Park adventure!💪🏼. We really had an amazing adventure at the Park! A place like no other. Definitely one of a place to go to when you're in Hongkong. Tried the rides, screamed on top of my lungs! Especially the Abyss! (a must try).

Family days are awesome at Ocean Park !!. Ocean Park is a fantastic day out for all the family. Wear comfortable, sun friendly, cool clothing, take your sunscreen, hat or umbrella as the sun can be very hot. Especially whilst waiting in line for attractions such as the Log Ride. Please also note that many attractions are up hills, or down steep slopes. Please wear closed in comfortable walking shoes ! There is a fantastic cable car ride to many of the higher attractions. I recommend you take this from "Old Chinatown" near the entrance after viewing the Panda enclosure. Then when you have finished seeing all the rides and shows at the top, take the Ocean Express train back down ! A fascinating experience rather like being in a submarine.... as you travel through the mountain. Kids of all ages are catered for with a large range of rides to suit. Make sure to take plenty of water as it can be very expensive to buy once inside. If you are staying in Kowloon, get the ferry across to Central from Star Ferries at Tsim Sha Sui. Thanks to Citybus's Ocean Park Express bus service (Route 629), you can get there fairly easily in under 25 minutes. You can get on the Ocean Park Express from Central just outside the Star Ferry terminal on the Hong Kong Island side or from Admiralty (West) Bus Terminal just outside the Admiralty MTR Station. But beware !!!! If you decide to get the bus from Admiralty, it will most likely be full already from passengers embarking at Central. There are LONG LONG queues at Admiralty Station. The cost is (as at July2015) $10.90HK for Adults and $5.90HK for children. The drivers are usually fairly lax in making sure you have the exact change as you simply pop it into a box, so most times they just say $10 and $5 to make is simpler. We were 2 adults and 2 children and the drivers we encountered for all our public bus trips around HK Island rounded down for us each time. It is then simply a case of catching the same bus outside Ocean Park for the trip back to the ferry pier. Make sure you plan your day with enough time to get to the bus early - the first one leaves Star Ferry Pier at 0915am and they go every half hour. Ocean Park opens at 1000am and it is very much recommended that you pre buy your tickets either with your tour desk at the hotel or online. The queues for tickets once you arrive are huge ! Also please make sure no alcohol or prepackaged food from outside fast food retailers is in your bags as it will be confiscated at the compulsory bag search on entry. Something that is often missed on a trip to Ocean Park is the Mammal breeding centre - GO TAKE THE TIME TO HAVE A LOOK !!!! Well worth the walk. Also the Jellyfish spectacular is a bit tricky to find, but well worth the effort. The dolphin show is also very good, but get there for a seat early !!! Seats over 2thousand people..... HAVE FUN :)

Better than Disneyland. After a day of major letdowns at Disneyland, we decided to try out Ocean Park. We made no mistake, as this park was worth the far drive from Kowloon. From the aquarium to the cable cars to the rapids ride, this place was extremely entertaining. Definitely recommend this over Disneyland, which is small and boring.

Very few rides for 4-5 yr age group. The park is well connected with taxi and MTR. Be ready to wait in queues for a 30-40 min period for each ride.The min height that can do the ride should be mentioned at the entrance for the ride and not after waiting for 30 min.The seal show was good ,treat for the lil ones who dont have many rides on which they can go.I wish they had more cooler places like the penguins area and the seal show where the outside temp is forgotten for sometime at least.Extremely hot and humid in july.

Great day out for all the family. We had a fab day with our 13 year old son. I would suggest arriving early to avoid crowds. Much cheaper than Disney and we really enjoyed going a park which included a Zoo, it made the day more varied. We were very luck and saw Pandas which if you book in advance can help prepare their food. There are rides to suit all tastes and plenty of places to eat. We took a taxi from Hong Kong centre which was cheap and quick, around 20 minutes.

Only complain is that it's small. But other than that it's a great park. Good seaworld-esque shows and good rides. Too small in my opinion and too many people cutting lines. Staff are afraid to keep order and let many guests basically do whatever they wanted. Other than that, a great park.
Great Day Out. Really good tool for spreading the word of ocean conservation to all. Great assortment of rides, displays and shows to cater for the whole family of different ages.
ONLY for children. Boring.Nothing to see and the park is design for children. Not recommended for teens and adults. It is recommended for family with children.
Go go go, awesome. Best day out, so much fun for all ages. Ques not to big and prices reasonable. Wish we had time to back the next day.

Wonderful way to spend the day. The entrance fee was HK$345 but i got a 10% discount because i got the coupon at the airport when we arrived. We rode first the cable car going to the top. We watched the dolphin and seal show. We also rode the rollercoasters, swing etc. We then visited the aquarium . We missed the pandas. They said they were already tired and were resting. They were lots of food stalls but as expected a bit pricey. We also bought some stuff toys and got a 10% discount from the coupon we got from the airport. There weren' t too many people . The lines for the rides were quite short. We had a fun filled day but was not enough to do everything.

Way better than Disney HK. If you have a choice then go with Ocean Park over Disney HK. There is lots more to do but be prepared to wait for rides. Having visited both Disney and Ocean Park, this is clearly a more popular park even with the locals. The queues for rides were long with no fast pass option. The cable car looked great but there was a wait time of 90mins. All in all would like to visit again but during a "quieter" time.

Much better than you might think. We went to Ocean Park with our 11 year old. I have a personal dread of entertainment parks, but this was far, far better than a Disney experience. Although there are rides, there is also a high educational component, so you really get to learn a lot, about everything from Asian animals to old Hong Kong. Our child considers the goldfish exhibit alone as the best thing he saw in Hong Kong! The day we went it rained constantly,but there was quite enough to do and keep relatively dry!
Loved it!. Loved the red roller coaster, the aquarium and the night water-light-fire show, in general a good option to spend a fun day with friends or family. The food is terrible though.

Fun and Different. Ocean Park was fun - I have younger kids (7, 3 and 1) and a lot of rides were definitely geared toward older children but at the same time there a lot of rides and attractions for younger kids too. Also, I love that this park is half amusement park, half zoo. There were a lot of animal exhibits scattered everywhere and the aquarium was nice (and cool, esp in the oppressive June heat!). Food is overpriced and ok and there are so many great places to eat in HK - I'd go and eat dim sum before getting there, have a light lunch in the park, then go and eat a large dinner outside the park after you are done!
Fun. although the queue is long and a bit confusing, it is still worthwhile to wait for the fun it brings.

Enjoyed with kids aged 4 & 7. One day is not enough for Ocean Park - planning the rides and course ahead, especially if you have small kids will help immensely. Only issue was long wait time for cable car. Suggestion: Carry water bottles

Always crowded. 2nd time visiting this place, it was crowded as always. We did not enjoy our time here cause the Q was far too long and the weather was boiling. Guess there should be a better service provided and the signage was not very clear.

The exciting ocean park. Me and my daughter went to ocean park last june, soo hot and rainy, but exciting, even rain is heavy too crowded still, and some part is under renovation, you can still enjoy and entrance is still reasonable. We enjoy the show, but you must have the map to know time of the show, ride the cable car and enjoy picture taking all the way. Have fun during quee to cable car, even in the show all the day, just bring out your camera and enjoy.

Fun for all Ages!. Start you day as early as possible to enjoy the most of the park. Plan your visit inside the park by taking the cable ride and finishing the rides on the upper side of the park first. Eating options are more upstairs and do not forget to see the light show that happens in the evening around 7.

Amazing experience, Allot at least 2 days!. wonderful experience.both adults and kids can have their share of fun.sprawling park needs atleast 2 days to cover 30% of the attractions.cable car ride is a must.
Your second best theme park in Hong Kong. This is a nice addition to the Disneyland. Place is spacious and offer street performance, good rides and animal displays as well

Some fantastic bits but oh so crowded. Theme park crossed with a Panda exhibit, Aquarium and Dolphin/Sea lion show. The rides are OK, nothing really stand out.The aquarium and shark tanks are very good.Shows including dolphin show are OK.Pandas are good to see.Top tip arrive when the gates open then get to the rides/exhibits you want to see really badly. By early afternoon the place is jam packed with tourists, mainly from over the border and it can take a long wait to do something.If you have young western kids, specially with blonde hair and blue eyes you will become a focus for Photos. It can be very annoying.

Would rate better than disneyland hong kong !. Seriously fantastic place Must visit when in hong kong Unique concept of amusement park + animal show and zoo type There are two parts of the park One side is the animal observatory and shows ka part and other side is the amusement park with breathtaking ridesone has to travel thru cable cars to enjoy the whole park or has option of tram But cable car experience is recommended (thought there is long que)Dolphin and sea lion show are ok ok (bangkok had better shows)Among rides hair raiser is the best (By the name you would have got to know what does it state)Theres mcdonalds and some indian food available Better carry ur own packets (recomm for veggie indians)
A great day out!. The aquarium was amazing, this is more suited to older children than Disneyland if you're looking for thrill rides. You must do the "hair raiser"....it really does!

Animal and Theme Park. Ocean Park is an animal and theme park combined in to one and is spread out on two islands. The easiest way to get to Ocean Park is to take the MTR to Admiralty and then follow the directions to Exit B which takes you to the Ocean Park Bus Stop. Here you can board the 629 bus which goes directly to Ocean Park and takes about 15 minutes.Once you arrive you can purchase your ticket if you have not done so already online. The ticket price is a little costly, although covers the cost of all the attractions inside apart from food and drink - so make the most of it - you can easily spend the whole day there. The entrance to the theme park takes you to a variety of animal enclosures. For each of these it has been very cleverly designed so that as you walk through you always end up in a souvenier shop! You can then either take the cable car or the more recently developed underground train to the other island where there are a few other animal enclosures although mainly this side of the island is the theme park attractions. There are various rides from water rides through to roller coasters. Again throughout there are souvenier shops and restaurants.You will do a lot of walking around here, so ensure you take drinking water with you. At the entrance / exit of the park there is one very large souvenier shop which has all the souvenier's available that you would have seen in the other various shops. I would suggest wait until the end to buy these as otherwise you will be carrying these around with you all day. If you do have bags you are carrying and you want to go on the rides they provide lockers at each ride that you can leave your bag in and then pick them up when you finish your ride which is also helpful.A great day out for the family although be prepared to spend money there!

Excelente ocean park. You can find thinks for everybody. Aquarium. Zoo. Amazing Telepheric.In the aquarium you can walk inside of him. The sharks are swiming over you head. You can see some pandas bears and zafari zone with lions walking free. You are inside a bus while lions are around you. A day is necessary to see it complete.

Decent way to spend a few hours . If possible avoid going on weekends - queuing isn't as bad. If you buy your tickets in advance from China Travel Services, you can get 15% discount. The animals are great, watch the pandas during feeding time! Rides are average and waiting time can reach an hour on some. Avoid Panda Cafe - prices are ridiculously expensive and quality is under par. Enjoyable way to spend a few hours though and Stanley Market isn't far if you have time after.

Best part about Hong Kong !!!. If you have just one day to spend in Hong Kong, Ocean park is where you should be headed to. This was the best part about our HK trip. Youngsters can miss the disneyland but not the ocean park. Arrive as early as possible (10am is the gate opening time) using the public bus from MTR station . Buy the tickets in advance to beat the queues. Take the scenic cable car straight up first thing to the summit. Start off with the thrill rides like hair raiser (single rider option is a must do to beat its queues..I did it 4 times in 30 mins without paying anything extra), flash, dragons ride, abyss. Take panoramic views from the tower and eagle ride. Go take the escalator down for the water ride (won't get much wet though) and another roller coaster . The dolphin show can be squeezed in to relax and take a breather from the thrill rides. Do the rides multiple times and you would enjoy them.

Worth the visit!. This is my first trip to Ocean Park and I must say that this place is huge. The attractions are spread openly into two areas; lower section and higher section. For the higher section, you will need to take the free cable car ride or the ocean express. As the area is huge and most portion have to be covered by foot, it can be daunting especially during the hot summer period. The rides are worth the try and queue time is not as long as the ones in Disneyland or Universal Studios. In addition, you will also get to see penguin, walrus, sharks, seals and sea lions. Recommended for family with children.

More can be done. Good customer services and the safety measures and requirements are rather high. Little kids with stroller are given preferred Q in some areas like ocean express. Good rides within the park.Areas that need to be improved in my opinion : -1) the information map and introduction flyers does not indicate the highlights of the park. Example "must see" or "most popular". That can save alot of problems for visitors who have only half day to spare in the park. In addition, for first timers, the park is split into 2 parts and only connected with cable car or the LRT (ocean express). But it has not clearly indicating this way. So indication of highlights become more important.2) Short marine live shows involving dolphins and sea lions only. Overall including others like animals from down under were limited, the shows or exhibits areas are touching on the surface.3) Several Steep slopes on one side of the park. A real challenge to the takecarer pushing stroller or wheelchair up slope.
Divine scenery. The most beautiful scenery... Natural beauty, breath taking , worth at least one try.The journey is unbelievably beautiful

A LITTLE TIRED. If you have a few spare hours, you can check out this amusement park - the rides are average, with the highlight being the cable car ride! - just sit back and enjoy the great views across Hong Kong island.

Great place for rides or when it is too hot PENGUINS!!!. Went there with hope to see the aquarium, a bit disappointed that the aquarium was small. Going up using either cable car or train and there will be penguin, walrus, seal and sealion. The smell of grill squid is everywhere so hide your wallet.

Worth a visit with kids. good bits:1) watch the dolphin and seal show2) see the underwater life (sharks, sting rays and more)3) watch the outdoor artists4) cable car ride and ocean express are fun rides5) drinking water is free6) Pandas are cutenot so fun:1) gets very hot in summer and lot of walking around needed from ride to ride2) Australia show (near old hong kong section) is a bit boring3) some of the joy rides are a bit too fast and scary4) food options limited, but u have McDonalds as a standby option

Fun day at Ocean Park. Very nice place place to be, it doesn't matter if you are travelling with kids/ not, this place is just great!! Expensive food but there is a McDonald inside the park! So great to see where they trained the Dolphins, a few of them came and basically stopped in front of us for quite a while, I guess they were waiting for food from their trainers, we were really lucky to have them right smack in front of us so that was really cool! Had a very good view of the panda who was so relax while enjoying his feast! Love the goldfish areas! Didn't like cable car as I don't fancy going for anything high but I survived the ride which comes with the magnificent view! Was able to see Aberdeen from the other part of the park as well. The Q for taxi was crazy and they were hardly any taxi so we gave up and just started walking for quite a while and caught the bus thereafter to get to Jumbo floating restaurant which is located not too far away from the park.

Wonderful amusement park. Oh what a big place . It is a huge amusement park with lots and lots of activities. We spent one whole day there but we did only very few activities like Polar adventure, cable cars, aquarium, Panda village, Ferris wheel etc. It is beautifully maintained park. In some activities there is a huge queue. In the evening there is a show of water,light and fire which is beyond imagination. One must visit such a attractive place.

Amazing day out. A must if you travel to Hong Kong! Rides are brilliant. Park is massive. The "exhibitions" are amazing! Can get up close to Pandas, Kuhala beers and much more. The various ocean exhibitions and tanks/ aquariums are brilliant. Q's can be quite long!Avoid the water log ride, long wait and not worth the wait.

Best amusement park in HK.. Definitely a great place to spend a day with kids. Plan well in advance which attractions you want to visits. Some of the rides needs to wait and queues can be long in weekends and holidays. Pay attention as some attractions require a minimum height for kids.Is very big so you can really find quiet places and not so crowded attractions. Worth to take the cable car to enjoy fantastic views. Watch out during lunch time as some food stall get long queues.

Without doubt the best amusement park in Asia. Go for it.. Ocean Park has everything you would like to have in a theme park. It is a marine mammal park and oceanarium with variety of big and small marine animals, animal theme park with Giant Panda and amusement park full of world class roller-coaster and other stunning rides. Don't miss the following (not for the faint hearted)Hair Raiser - A floor less roller coaster on the edge of the mountain hanging over South China SeaThe Abyss – A Turbo Drop ride, the Abyss raises you to more than 200 ft in 20 seconds before thrusting you downward, faster than free-falling. Mine Train – A "mine train" roller coaster perched on the edge of a cliff Raging River – A water ride that takes you through tropical waterfalls, narrow ravines and finishes by shooting you down a slide at a great speed.You can also do a scuba diving for around 250 USD.Buy the tickets online (a lot cheaper )or through your agent to avoid big queues.Suggestion: Go for the cable car as soon as you enter and come back via ocean train to enjoy the facilities at the entrance to best utilize your time. Also be ready to spend 5-10 mins in queues for every ride but it is worth it.My biggest ever recommendation: Go For IT....
Stunning view from the park!. Stunning view from the park overlooking the ocean, but the park itself is very nice to enjoy for the entire family. Prepare to spend the entire day from 10am to 8pm
Great Parc for kids and adults. Nice combination of Zoo, Aqua world and fun parc. Kids loved this place and so did we. And good fun to watch Panda's

Congested. Congested. . Has not been there for at least 4 years. I was expecting crowd but not few hundreds of people waiting to buy tickets. Staff are exhausted directing people to the right que. Once entered the park, it has a very cluttered feeling because there are lots of built up, no space left unused. There are many tourists from the Mainland. In short, shouting, yelling, que jumping, pushing, elbowing, spitting!!! Useless to post any signs to keep quiet in panda showroom and koala showrooms. Totally ruin the enjoyment of others. The dolphin show was great and has a theme, but Mainlanders yanked open their umbrellas dispite advise not to. Regardless where we go, congested and rules are to be broken. While there are lots of things to see : aquarium, sharks, jelly fish, panda, koala, kangaroo, but the lack of crowd control is very unwelcoming

Lots Better than Disney. - you could try the HK street food at old HK street area in Ocean Park- you can see panda or other animals... Kids would enjoy that- less people than Disney HK, larger than Disney HK- more to see than Disey

Large park but requires more rides for toddlers. Extremely huge so you must plan well and as there arent very many information centres positioned all over you wont be able to get appropriate directions and will be going around in circles. Not all the staff speak english so asking for directions would be pointless. Make sure you get there by 10am in the morning as it starts getting crowded past noon. Buy your tickets online through klook to avoid waiting in line at the box office at the park and to get a better price. As soon as you arrive my advice is take the cable car and go to the summit first and do all the rides and visit the north pole and south pole exhibits first. Then walk down towards the ocean express train and go to the rainforest section before you get into the train to head down towards the aquarium. A must visit is the giant panda and the aquarium is beautiful as well. The most enjoyable for my toddlers was the north pole and south pole being able to view the walruses seals and penguins at such close proximity and of course the giant panda. The rides are for more of a older age group and i wish there was more for children under the age of 4 but defenitely a fantastic time was spent with an entire day practically set out for this visit. Restaurants in the park are expensive as expected so plan a heavy breakfast and ensure you have sufficient water and snacks for the day if you dont intend to eat at the restaurants.

Amazing Customer Service. We had poor treatment by our hotel who would not honour our prepaid tickets however the management and staff at Ocean Park sought to do anything they could to make our experience happier. Amazing customer service when the issues were not even their doing. We ended up having a fantastic day. I would especially like to thank Sophie for her compassionate nature and turning our bad experience into a great one.

FUN!. Affordable theme park! extreme rides for the adventurous and simple-cute, fun rides for the kids! The food and drinks inside, although pricy for HK, it is actually pretty decent as compared to the food prices in other amusement parks. Perhaps the downside would be that the distance to each ride takes a while and there aren't many travellators around so you don't really get to enjoy every single ride.

Hong Kong signatory place. We been there on Tuesday but still full with visitors because of summer holiday.
