We bought ticket from Internet in advance and the price is slightly cheaper compare to the actual price. Took MTR to station Admiralty (金钟) and change bus 629 to Ocean Park. You may purchase Ocean Park ticket at MTR Admiralty with HKD305 (original HKD345).Staff in the park were friendly and helpful. Air conditioning in aquarium were extremely strong.Food in park were pricey, we finally choose McD as our lunch which located at the inner area.

Super Park!!. One of the best amusement parks in the world and definitely one of the best aquariums and ocean shows in the world!! Been there with my family and everybody enjoyed it even my 65 year old dad!!

one of great amusement parks in Hong Kong. Try The Hair Raiser, The Dragon, The Abbys for a really exciting experience. The park was really huge, you just couldn't get them all in just one day. You can get the discounted ticket for HKD285/person from your trusted travel agent in Hong Kong.

What a day!. We went by train and bus from Kowloon to Hong Kong. The Park is huge and there is so much to see. We started with the Panda area then Old Hong Kong and then we took the cable car to the top. What a fantastic experience and so many cars it looks like soap bubbles in the air. We covered the whole top area and get onto the express train back to the entrance again. Fantastic experience

Am glad I did. Before we left for HK, our family debated as to go HK Disneyland or Ocean Park. All of us have been to Disneyland in Florida, you have seen one Disneyland you have seen them all, and therefore Ocean Park was the choice. I have been to HK many times in many years and had not the chance to go Ocean Park, I am glad I did go to Ocean Park, and I said to myself I should have been there before. The place was awesome with its cable car, train rides, varied shows aquariums w first to see animals and of course their nerve wracking rides. Our family enjoyed and worth the fee for all of us. One day is not enough to enjoy everything in Ocean Park. You need to be very early to experience every thin in OP.

Good for teens!. The place is huge and mostly good for teens for the rides. Not for someone who is with a faint heart. The best way to get there is by MTR then bus. The ropeway is amazing. Compared to Disney the rides here are for a much older age, however disney is also an experience.

Great for kids and kids at heart. First timer here. We have purchased the ticket in china travel which in near in our hotel in wan chai. We have saved HKD 70. Comparing if you will buy it directly in the website. We have read the rules and regulation so we wont break any rules. Since it would be very hassle if something comes up. We got there as early as 9:30 am, through Mtr and bus. Although it says in the rules dont bring liquid, its not as strict as we think, we see people bringing in their drink. The water cost around HKD 5 and inside ocean park its 25 yup times 5 f the price. DO NOT FORGET TO BRING UMBRELLA AND RAIN COAT, most of the rides may get you wet and umbrella for the very hot weather. And some clothes also. You may also  want to buy those mini-electric fan. There is also small storage for your bag in every ride. There is a special line for loners or just one person riding but you cAnt choose where to seat in , you will just fill in those empty seats. For sight seeing of animals, always have your camera no flash.

Awesome Place. Ocean Park is huge, so much to see and do. From the Pandas to riding the cable cars. Lots of rides for all ages to enjoy and so many different animals to see. You really need two days to see and do everything.

A day well spent. This is one the most wonderful places i have been to. It really brings out the small kid in you. Take the MTR to Admiralty and you have buses from there. Also buy the entry tickets to ocean park at the Admiralty station to avoid long queues plus you get some discount if you buy the tickets here. Make sure you reach early as there are a lot of things to do. The must do at Ocean Park are as below1. Visit the Panda enclosure2. Visit the North and South Pole enclosures3. Go to the massive aquarium4. Watch the dolphin show, and last but not the least5. Ride the Hair Raiser.

Pandas and more pandas. We went to Ocean Park purely so I could see the pandas. They have 3 giant pandas and 4 or so red pandas, and unlike Singapore Zoo it doesn't cost extra to see them and you aren't limited to a time you can view them for. The park itself is a hybrid between a zoo and a theme park, which is cut in half by mountain, but the cable car and train mean you can easily go between the two. Getting there on the Citybus from the MTR station was easy and cheap too. We went in July so the humidity was incredible, it would be much more enjoyable after the peak of summer is over
Great Place. I still cant forget its huge aquarium and show. The park itself was huge, a place could spend for full day.

Aawesome place for Youngsters. Its an awesome place for youngsters. The park is full of exciting rides for both children's and adults. We have visited in the month of july so it was really hot their but it was worth going their. In this place you get to experience in tram and express train both. So its a must go place in Hong Kong.

Great for kids, though adults can have fun too. Ocean Park is a great playground for kids - It is huge and has lots of rides. We've been waiting 30 minutes to take the cable car ride and quit since it could take 2 hours of waiting. There's a small zoo and also sea animal which you are not seeing everywhereThe dolphin show was beautiful, well choreographed with moving music. You'll be amazed how the dolphins trained are.There are lots of opportunities to take photos so if you missed something, the next adventure is right aheadUnless you are coming with an anger, there is no way to finish the hole park on one day.there is also games stalls - The prizes are very attractive and there are 3 types of sizes - think again if you wanna win one, coz you'll have to get a seat on the plane for the bigger one and it's not that comfort to walk around with this kind of "prize"Check the weather before you are getting in - it can influence on your day and some attractions can be close because of that.Have fun :)

A little disappointing. Have been to Hong Kong many times but hadn't made it here yet. What a disappointment that so many of the rides/attractions were closed. Really disappointing. 8-10 closed.On a positive note I saw my first Panda which was pretty awesome but I could have gone to the zoo.Had read negative reviews re crowds and food. We went on a very hot Monday and the crowds were very minimal for most of the time we were there. Had chips and a coke so can't complain about that and you can bring your own water.I'd imagine when it's all completely renovated it might be worth a visit again.The cable car when you arrive at the park offers the most spectacular views. Great photo opportunity. My favourite part of the whole park. Easy to get to. Take the MTR to Aberdeen station. Find the marked exit. Don't buy your tickets at the 7 Eleven instead walk another 50 metres and you'll save 50HKD per ticket at the Ocean Park shop front. Jump on the Ocean Park bus and alight at the entryway.

loads of fun and the views are nice!. forget about disney HK. if you can afford it just check their CALI homebase its so much better and complete. Ocean park has two parts, lowlands and uplands. you get to ride a very scenic cable ride to get to the upland part. Go plan this destination ahead cause theres just too many things to see and enjoy here you might not maximize your stay at ocean park. during summer bring lots of water, wear light clothes and wear sandals cause its really very humid and uncomfortable. during the rainy season, skip on this cause you might not enjoy the place.

Very big amusement park with varies of entertainment. Very big amusement park with varies of entertainment. With 2 part of area the summit and harbour. Kids are enjoying the cable car ride and ocean express that feels like inside the submarine. Playground are one of my kids favorite. The restare more to older kids. The site are quite tiring with the up and down track and quite far from 1 area to another area. Animal show are of the main attraction for younger kids and aquarium are also interesting

Ocean Park - Must Visit. Ocean Park is a delightful playground. It is huge and has many thrilling rides if your heart can take the spins and speed. We queued for about an hour to take the cable car ride. It lasted about 10mins and offered a fantastic view of the park and some luxurious houses. Each cable car can sit 6 persons; however the operators are generally very considerate and do not pack it to full capacity. Chances are you get to sit with people you know. My husband and I had a cabin to ourselves. The dolphin show was beautiful, well choreographed with moving music. You'll not stop smiling and be in awe at how ably trained the dolphins are.There are lots of great photo stops and we barely covered the entire grounds in 8 hours with only two very tame rides. I tried my hands at the games stalls and quickly lost HKD50 at the hoops and bottles game. The prizes were very attractive and I was aiming to bring Oscar (my favourite character from Sesame Street) home - it would be a thrill to lug the 3 ft soft toy around in the park, like in the HK dramas but it was fat chance. The hoops bounced like crazy and all I contributed in that 2 min game were the chinks and clinks sounds. Nonetheless it was thoroughly enjoyable. No embarrassment with poor aiming either, I just played and had fun.It was a very hot summer's day, and we were exhausted quickly. Bring a hat and UV umbrella with lots of water if you are visiting during the summer (and medicated oil if you are prone to fainting). I will return again during the cooler climate as I want to explore each attraction more thoroughly. I think it would be even more enjoyable without the heat.

Better than Disney . Even after 15 years of taking kids from the stage of toddlers until teenagers, this is still the best place for a day off and family enjoyment.This is Hong Kong's premier home grown theme park attraction, and is better than Disney. Certain times of the year, the park takes on themes eg Christmas and Halloween and the hours are extended into the night.The park has general appeal for all, regardless of age, and whether visiting singly or as part of a group. The site on a headland surrounded by a forest and jutting into the South China Sea is breezy and spectacular.The must-do is the gondola ride which offers panoramic views of the sea and some of HKs most expensive real estate.A MTR underground station link to the park will increase accessibility. Otherwise it's a 10 or 15 minute taxi from Central and Causeway Bay.Tip to avoid queues: start early, head for the other side of the park, and do your visit in reverse. Take the underground train to the other side, do all the roller coaster rides and lunch - the best snack in summer is the mini watermelon. You then take the gondola ride from the back side of the park to the front, avoiding any long queues.

Fun trip. A must-visit, even if you are on a short trip to Hong Kong. It is super fun for both kids and adults. In terms of thrilling rides, if you are an adrenaline junkie, it might be a bit of a downer-we felt only 2 rides were good, The Flash and The Hair Raiser. But if you are with kids, there are plenty of options. The best part though are the sea creatures and animals. Seals, walrus, sharks, penguins, exotic birds, pandas...so many of them in properly planned exhibits. What's more-the aquariums and exhibits are properly labelled when it comes to creature names and information. There are also lovely lessons on how we can help in preserving the environment-so it is great for kids to learn. You must take the cable car ride connecting 2 parts of the park, for the stunning view of the surrounding water body and the park, but be prepared to stand in a queue for a long time. The food options are expensive and the food itself okayish, but there are enough outlets around the park in case hunger strikes. Do not miss the shows at Ocean Theatre where dolphins perform some incredible water stunts.Although it is a little bit far from the city, it is incredibly well connected by city buses. The ways to get there are clearly mentioned in the promotional pamphlet. You can either buy the tickets at park entrance, or get them from any 7 eleven outlet. Make sure to get the park map as soon as you enter, because it is pretty BIG and you need to manage your time. Overall, big fun and great for adults and kids alike.
It's a lot of FUN, especially the Dolphin Show, Must see. It is a huge park, a lot of walking too, just make sure you wear flat shoes, ladies. I tried the water slide, the dolphin show, too much fun.

An experience to have for sure.. I wouldn't say attendance is dwindling but ever since HK Disney came into existence the attendance here is down. However It's really fun and it's worth visiting. Panda's, Monkey's, Aquarium, cable cars, roller coasters, and Old Hong Kong it's literally got everything. A pleasant day out for the family for sure. Or for a nice walking date with your S/O. At Christmas time it has amazing scenery of lights.

Bigger than I thought !!!. We arrived early and managed to be the first in the park. We ran straight for the cable car which took us over to the second part of theme park. Here the rollercoasters were waiting for us. The annoying thing is most of the big ones did not open till 11/12. We started to walk towards adventure land and when we got halfway there through the heat there was a sign saying this did not open till 11. I wish they could put a sign up further up the path because it was a long walk !!! When the park fully opened at 12 everything was alive and cooking. The rides were great and the animals were amazing to look at. Would choose ocean park over Disney land as its much bigger and more choice of rides and attractions to see, plus much cheaper.  The grand aquarium is a must see too !! I dropped one star due to the fact most of the rides didn't even start till 11/12, can't see how they can't start at 10 when rest of park opens ?

Fun for everyone -feb 2014. There is so much to do and see in Ocean Park. A great place for the whole family. Aquarium, adrenaline seeking rides, dolphin show with a great view, gondola rides. Must visit on a trip to Hongkong.

The Best. One of the best amusement parks I've been too. The place is huge and one day is not enough. I tried all the roller coasters and had the time of my life! I love the adrenaline rush and went for more than 3 times for the big yellow rollercoaster (not sure the name)I'm surprise to see elderly taking the roller coaster ride too. Kudos to them but I was concerned on their health condition. Overall, a must to visit this place and worth the price. I had a blast!

Thrilling. Ocean park is a must visit for every tourist coming to HongKong. It a place for a lot of thrilling rides, lots of fun to meet the hundreds of sea creatures. It is place where a full day is not enough. One can enjoy to the hearts content and have their day.

Tons of fun for any age - so good I went two weeks in a row. I loved this place! It's packed full of things to do and see. I enjoyed it so much, I went two weeks in a row!!Not being the biggest fan of heights, naturally I was sufficiently scared by many of the rides, but they're all fantastic and worth a go, even if you're a little scared. On my first visit we had a friends 2 year old niece with us, the joy in her face in seeing the animals was absolutely amazing. Too sweet!!! The gigantic animals that roam around were just as entertaining to her.Ocean Park has something for everyone. The foods a bit pricey, but who goes there to eat?Lots of fun, highly recommended.General admission is 345 HKD, you can also have a few animal interactions, but this is at an additional cost and requires advanced booking.
Good place with amazing rides. Nice place but not for kids lesser than 120 cms height (say 5+ year olds). Some of the rides are very thrilling.

Breathtakingly Massive. One of the best amusement parks that I have been to till date,simple,sweet economical compared to Disney World but equivalent to it or even better in some aspects. Jaw-dropping roller coasters,unbelievable animal-shows,aquarium,uncountable number of rides,this park is a small town in itself,name it and this park has it,it lacks nothing and a day seems less to took one complete tour of this wonderful park.

Favorite place in HK. I am not a fan of amusement rides, but I am sure that if you are, you will not be disappointed.I love staying in all those aquariums , even the aquariums are 99% of time full of people, you can still find peace pretending yourself are under water with all those mysterious creatures.Only downside, as I have mentioned above, the park is always crowded. You really need to be wise when picking when to visit the park. DO NOT visit on national holiday ( HK / China), try your best to avoid weekends.

Great. Tips: go as soon as the park open, and go on weekdays, can avoid lots of tourists and had fun with rides. No wait in line for hour. By the time you finished all the rides, approximately 4h , the tourists rush in after lunch hour. Plenty of time to see animals or aquarium.

Not like before. Staffs are not friendly and should be re-trained!!!. I have been to Ocean Park years ago and it is just not the same animal. Yes - the park expanded and with more rides and facilities built. However, the staff and the facilities in the park are relatively poo. To list out some:-staffs carry no smile on the face. not proactive enough even you stand right in front of the counter. No greeting, no hello, no bye, no thank you, nothing. i have a feeling that the staffs might be tired of their jobs and no happy servicing people from "that certain big country". i saw a lot of them giving mean faces when the guests spoke to them in Mandarin. -the aquarium's glass was so dirty....that the visibility was so low that day i visited. i didnt even wanna stay there for too long even though i wanted to. the ventilation indoor was bad...-food was very very expensive! bring more money!! a set of meal (noodle/burger/sandwich/pizza) will cost you over HKD100. the meal comes with the main course and a soft drink only... not to miss mentioning, the staffs at the food kiosk have really bad customer service :( SADTips: Make sure you be at the entrance gate before the park opens! if not, you wont be able to get on most of the rides and visit around!

Fun rides. A little cooler heat wise than Disneyland. Remember to take bathers so that you can join in some water cooling activities. No food allowed in, we didn't know this ahead of time and had a packed lunch to avoid buying food. The lines were horrendous if going with family, try to take a single ride to quicken up the time waiting. Too long wait time to get from one side of park to the next if you want to access it by cable car or train. It's spread out over a big area so when a hot day, it does get tiring to get around to some of the attractions.

Must visit place for family with kids. park is spread in a large area in 2 different sections. Aquarium & other animals exhibit in 1st section. Then you have to use tram or cable car to reach amusement park. My suggestion is to first go for amusement park & finish all the rides then come back for animal show.

although old, but still good amusement park. very unique cable from foot of the hill to the peak. it's first time for my son to take the cable, and ever since then, he will ask us to take any cable he saw. due he is not high enough, he would not take part in some activities, which really upset him. now his target is to grow to 120cm as early as possible, so that he can go to the ocean park to finish those experiences.

One day is not sufficient.. Park is too big with lots of rides. Lot of People turn up to park so its takes real long time to finish any ride. Too many rides. Cable car Ride is must its very beautiful to see the park from height and give good scenic view as well. If travelling from metro from Admiralty Metro station there is a bus which takes to Ocean Park. Bus no 629 good way to commute in less time. If travelling to Hong Kong do visit.
Great day for all ages. A more relaxed Hong Kong. The cable car is fabulous. Views views and more views. The aquarium is amazing and so calm. A day for all ages. And the pandas!,,,,,dolphins, seals.

nice park. i like this park because is quite "lagend" theme park in hongkong, they already renew the place, is quite entertaining, but my suggestion don't go on jun-jul is very hot, and sometimes rainy too.

Used to be excellent but overly crowded with nasty visitors these days. I have been this park many times and it used to be excellent but not anymore these days.Don't get me wrong, the theme and games are alright. Scenery from cable car is fantastic. Long escalator bring you up the hill from entrance. Dolphins and killer whales show is incredible, even for an adult.The bad things about the park, for example, over crowded fish tank, you don't have "ocean" feel. Most glass is dirty for display. I think the management does clean it but not frequent enough to catch up stupid visitors who oily fingerprint it again. I will be fair to say the crowded condition reflects what it is like in Hong Kong. If you ever visited any local family household, these animals are considered living in a mansion. It is cruel but true.The worst part comes to over crowded with nasty visitors. I would not name where they come from but they are well known over the world for inappropriate behaviour. I can almost feel the frustration and helplessness from the staff. There were shocking number of stories about nasty visitors complaining staff not being nice and friendly and I don't believe that is fair and represent the overall image of theirs.It is a dilemma, if you have never been Ocean Park. I think it is still worth to give it a go. Stay calm, stay cool. It can be fun visiting Ocean Park if you avoided colliding nasty visitors.

One day is too short. One of the best theme parts visited in the world (comparing with US, Aust, Japan, Taiwan, etc). Too much to see and too many rides that can easily spend a whole day.Tips: Please with the seals buy moving your hat and they will chase until you are tired (not them).

Worth a Visit and full of rides... this place is Awesome. Ocean park has many things to offer from shows to rides and fun time for children. If you are a ride lover then straight away goto Hair Raiser Ride.. its fantastic. roller coaster goes upside down and gives a beautiful view of Sea.2) The Flash: This ride will take ur breath out. its full of swings. Gives ultimate view of sea and surrounding area. 3) The Abyss: This ride takes you up around 100 meter and then throws you down. Its thrilling when you fall from almost 100 meter. We enjoyed this so much. 4) The Dragon Ride: one more roller coaster. it flips you up side down twice. 5) Rev Booster: one of the fastest ride. Shouldnt miss this. its near to The Flash.in summer time its too hot. Carry umbrella or sunscreen lotion. or wear full sleeves clothes. Prices are cheaper than Disney Land. its very good place to visit.
too hot in the summer. an huge amusement park for the family. But it is too hot.... should have more trees and a place for take a rest. The attraction and the games actually just an average.....

Must visit if you are in Hong Kong. One of the best theme parks i have visited. The Ocean World theme park is an island and a bit far from downtown HongKong but its worth it. Most of the tracked rides are closed if it rains and it rains a lot. Do not miss the dolphin show.

Good for entertainment; Bad for food availability. Definitely a must visit in Hong Kong for travelers. It requires full day to enjoy every part of the park. There are plenty of shows which give good knowledge and exposure to children. Also there are rides for people excited for thrill.The most inconvenient and worst part of the park is the unavailability of international cuisines. Extremely limited options or as good as no options for travelers looking for good food. For Indians those are vegetarian be prepared for starving the entire day in your visit to Ocean Park.

Definitely worth a visit but not on a weekend !. The park is easily accessible by bus and has an interesting set of attractions. Make sure you are there at flag drop as HK wakes up late and you can easily beat the crowd. Avoid the weekend if you want to fully enjoy the day. Also avoid days when it is raining heavily because all the good rides would be closed.Start with the thrill mountain and polar adventure zone - this area has the best rides in the park. It is slightly further down the park and you can take the Ocean Express or Cable Car to get there. Don't miss the HAIR RAISER - it is definitely one of the best rides.Dolphin shows happen at certain pre-scheduled timings, make sure you know the time so that you don't miss it. Show duration is much less than some other places like Singapore and Bangkok but it was nice.For people who want to see the Panda and other animals - there is a closing time for animals which is much earlier than the rides (7 PM I think) - pls. check with the staff if you don't want to miss it.You can get free vouchers with the entry tickets to enjoy discounts with food and shopping in the park - so make sure you pick them too.

Great day out... Ocean park Hong Kong is a fun day out, it's like a Zoo, theme park and Aquarium in the one place . Plenty to see and do, The huge cable car takes you up the top of the mountain where there are Awesome Rollercoasters and animal attractions, there are also some great restaurants with spectacular views over the Bay and Ocean.. Loved it..

Must visit place with family n kids. If u with family n kids then it's must visit place in hongkong , good Dolphin show , but mark the show timings , a good view from cable car n must for all the rides , a full day is required , please better carry umbrella if accompanied by older family members

Detailed review - Disappointing visit for family with for two young children (& on a rainy day). During our one month stay in Hong Kong, we visited Ocean Park for my son’s 5th birthday (along with our 2 year old daughter) … and unfortunately left feeling very disappointed. We know that many people with limited time in Hong Kong have to make a choice about whether to visit Ocean Park or Disneyland, and having been to Ocean Park (one day – a Saturday) and also Hong Kong Disneyland (two days – a Saturday and Sunday), here are our thoughts based on our experiences with our two young kiddies:• We purchased our tickets online the day before we went, printed them off, and then beat some of the crowds when we arrived on the day (we arrived 5 minutes prior to opening, and long queues had already formed in the ticket purchase areas).• We took the #629 Bus from Admirality to Ocean Park – it was well sign-posted, and came very frequently – and we could use our Octopus Cards … extremely easy!• We found Disneyland to be a far better experience for our young children, and actually for us as parents too: o There were several more rides that our kiddies could do at Disneyland (12 different rides in total, plus the Flights of Fantasy Parade, and the Lion King Show), versus only a handful at Ocean Park (my 2yo could only go on the Carousel and the Merry-Go-Round, and there were only three other rides that my 5yo could go on, being the Arctic Blast, Balloons Up-Up-And-Away, and the Frog Hopper). My 5yo loved the Arctic Blast ride, but found the others quite lame.We did some research prior to going about the height requirements on each of the different rides, and so knew that our kiddies wouldn’t be able to go on any of the rides in “Thrill Mountain”, “Adventure Land” or “The Rainforest”, and we knew that they would not be able to go on five of the six rides in “Marine World” … our best bet for rides was therefore in “Whiskers Harbour”. However, as it had been raining, Toto the Loco, Clown A Round and the Playground were soaked and too wet to sit on … and the Bouncer house was deflated.We therefore found Ocean Park to be incredibly disappointing on a wet day for young kiddies from a ride perspective.o The atmosphere at Disneyland was amazing (it even wore off on my stoic husband!), and every employee that we encountered (including the cleaners!) was entirely fabulous with our kiddies – unfortunately we just didn’t pick up that same vibe at Ocean Park … it really had the same atmosphere as a shopping centre.o We were amazed by the difference in demographics between the two parks … we found Disneyland to be mainly frequented by families with young children, whereas almost everyone that we encountered at Ocean Park were adults, and many of those were middle-aged (particularly in the afternoon when the tourist buses arrive from the Mainland). We found that fellow park-goers at Disneyland were much more accommodating, patient and friendly … unfortunately we were on the receiving end of quite a bit of pushing and shoving in Ocean Park (and my 5yo was even pushed out of the way by a 50+ year old man racing to get to his preferred horse on the kids Merry-go-round!!!).• In terms of the animal encounters at Ocean Park we loved seeing: o The Giant Pandas (definitely the highlight of the day for my husband and I, but I think that the wonder of this experience was lost on the kids).o The dolphins at “Ocean Theatre” (moral issues aside of course!).o The walruses & seals at the “North Pole Encounter” (try and time your visit for the seal presentation … and sit at the bottom: you will be incredibly close to these beautiful creatures!). o The Arctic Foxes in the “Arctic Fox Den”. We were in & out of the “South Pole Spectacular” in a matter of seconds as it was just so cold! Amazingly the animals (seals and sea lions) were not on display at the “Pacific Pier”, apparently because of the rain (which was not at all heavy)!!!• We found “Old Hong Kong” to be really disappointing … it just seemed to be full of souvenir stalls / food outlets, and was lacking the sense of authenticity that had been advertised!.• By the time that we got to the “Grand Aquarium” at 3pm, the tourist hoards had arrived by the bus load – so we decided to cut our losses and leave! We also didn’t make it to the “Sea Jelly Spectacular” or the “Garden of Joy”.So in summary, we are glad that we went, but we are disappointed with the experience, and disappointed that we spent our son’s 5th birthday there instead of Disneyland. If you have limited time, and young children, I would recommend Disneyland over Ocean Park in a heartbeat. If you do go, pre-purchase your tickets (but try to avoid a wet day), get there when the park opens, and do your research about where to best spend your time (their website is very informative).

Sea World + Carnival + Knotts + Zoo. I have to give it to the Chinese for this innovative theme park. They really used the land well to fit everything under the sun into it. The views are spectacular! While being large and diverse is it's advantage, it's also it's disadvantage. It's so enormous and has so much to do that it is impossible to do it all in one day. Instead of trying to do everything in one day we decided to hit specific parts of the park that would be new to us. We traveled with our 2 daughters, ages 7 and 12, and by the end of the night they were excited, filled with memories, and worn out. That's what I call a good experience.We highly recommend you view the digital map from their website to strategize or get a basic idea of where everything is at. We decided to skip the cable car ride and used the tram to go from the Waterfront (lower) to the Summit (upper) since we previously did the cable car ride at Lantau Island. One, it's a 4 minute ride vice a 15 minute ride and every minute counts. Two, more people fit inside the tram than the maximum of 6 people to a cable car making it more efficient. Third, cold AC! We focused much of our time on the rides and skipped out on shows. This worked out for us because while the locals sat for the shows, we had shorter lines. We figured that the shows would be pretty similar to what we've seen at Sea World and other similar parks and also decided it wouldn't be the same with the language barrier. In no particular order, we experienced:-Arctic Blast x 2 (slow but youngest daughter enjoyed it)-Arctic Fox Den, North and South Pole Encounter (used to cool down)-Hair Raiser x 2 (not bad)-Whirly Bird-Bumper Blaster (longest wait, about 40 minutes)-Mine Train x 3(favorite and views from a roller coaster and line that CANNOT be beat)-Raging River x 2 (get more wet than the Rapids ride)-The Rapids x 2 (nothing spectacular)-Shark Mystique (to cool down)-Crazy Galleon x 4 (most exciting for youngest daughter)-The Dragon x 2 (head bounces around a lot)-The Eagle (not for those with fear of heights)The best thing to snack on during the day were their small watermelons which ended up being about 7 USD. Both refreshing and tasty, this is something Disney needs to do. We decided to eat at the Bay View Restaurant since this was a recommendation we found online (it's like a cafeteria they said). Personally, we did not find the food (4 individual meals) worth $114. Maybe it's the view and A/C that you pay for but then again, you can get the same view from the outside and find other places with A/C to cool down in. My recommendation is to save your money on the food and instead go for either souvenirs or watermelons throughout the day. We finished up the Summit around 7 p.m. and headed down to the waterfront to let the kids soak themselves up in the Waterfront station (swimsuits are a must). It was a perfect way for our girls to end the day. The attractions are housed in a huge open "warehouse" type of building. It houses a foam station, water swings, waterslide, and a water station. It is controlled very well with limited people per station for time. One can choose to get on over and over again. With closing time after the water show/fireworks at 8 p.m. we decided to grab some souvenirs and beat everyone to the bus lines. Well worth it but definitely need to plan what you will want to do inside the park. Tons of walking so ensure you have the proper footwear. Sun block, umbrellas, and water are a must. Enjoy.

Suitable for Adults also. I was thinking that theme park is the place for only kids until I enter ocean park. bring your camera to take wonderful pictures with panda and old hongkong city views... Like it...

Worth the experience. Arrived there around 11AM and couldn't finish the tour. This park is so huge and too many things to do. It's pack on a week days so I can't imagine on weekends. There a various ride. My kids are 7 and 9 and they loved it. The food inside is very very expensive so be prepared for that.

Fun day out. Ocean Park is a really diverse place: rides, education and activities. The aquarium is good, not the best we've seen but good. The lines for the rides were long, and there's only 1 or 2 suitable for smaller children. The Pandas, Goldfish, Jellyfish and Penguins were our favourites. Worth your time for sure. Take swimsuits for children in summer, they had a waterplay centre set up for kids

A different point-of-view. I visited, along with my three children - 10, 8, 7 years of age. Check your kids heights, as the majority of rides require a minimum height of 120cm. Wait times for rides were getting to 75 minutes - just couldn't be done on the normal hot summer day.Plenty of penguins to see; the walrus was impressive. The polar exhibits provided a cool respite to the sweltering outside.There was one red panda, and one giant panda. Did not know where the rest were.Although the cable car looks like a nice ride, choose the train to get to the top of the park. The queue was ridiculous for the cable car - 60 minutes at any time of the day.By 1430, my kids had had enough of the heat, the inability to get on rides, and the underwhelming animal exhibits. We were on our way out, and came across a summertime indoor water park area. This was the only saving grace for an otherwise, pretty ordinary day. Check the guides to see if it's still open, and bring swimming costumes to change into - there are change rooms.The slide, and other play equipment is good fun, with not much waiting. There is even a foam (suds) play area.Read my other review on Disneyland. For my family, Disney was by far, the better park.

A must visit place in Hongkong. Really an amazing place, a must visit attraction in Hongkong.Also would recommend a whole day spend (instead of just half day, as done by few visitors). There are so many hidden viewpoints within this place, that it would surely take whole day to visit all the surprises around.Free drinking water available everywhere, (as against the stories told or misconceptions about this place) just need to use their FREE map to locate the right points.

The best family theme park in Hong Kong. When traveling to Hong Kong, whether as a family or by yourself, your trip is not complete without having visited the huge theme park called Ocean Park. The theme park offers a vast variety in rides, attractions, shows, and photo opportunities. Whether you like thrilling rollercoasters or live animal shows, then Ocean Park is well worth a visit. Great fun for the entire family, and make sure that you set aside a full day for Ocean Park, because there is alot to try, ride, see and do.

Fun day. Went alone as my sister had other plans. Was very hot/humid day. My feet were painful & cut up, due to my shoes. Visited first aid centre & they were very helpful. There are 2 sides to the park, need to hop on the cable car to visit the rides. Was hoping to see the giant pandas, but they were sleeping. Could not find any food stores that met my taste. I loved the rides. Recommend the water tyre ride, went on ride twice & couldn't stop laughing. Got soaked which was great on a hot day. Roller coaster also amazing. Even had an Australian area with wallabies, kookaburras & koalas. Caught local bus to Central & then star ferry. All in all a great day. Caught the cable car up to rides area but if you don't want to queue for an hour to get back I recommend the train back.

Great Place, One day is not Enough. Great place for a Total family enjoyment. We have marked the rides, places within the park to see. Prioritized but still one day was not sufficient. Good thing about the whole park is, it caters to all the age groups. There are three ( one generally people dont know or lazy to walk) roller coaster rides. For sure it is a total package.

Nothing but fun at Ocean Park. Forget Hong Kong Disney, Ocean Park is the place to go if you want to experience a Chinese theme park. It is worth the hassle of getting there (skip the bus and take a taxi). The food includes local favorites such as red bean pudding and vegetables stuffed with fish paste. The food is worth a try but I wouldn't go to the park hungry. The cable car is a must do although it can be a little disconcerting as you rise higher and higher toward the clouds. The Toto the Loco ride is so bad it's good and a perfect example of a Chinese theme park ride. The dolphin show is also worth seeing. Disney is fun if you want to see what it's like when a western company tries to implant itself in the complex diversity of Hong Kong.

Time well spent at ocean park. It is very big in size.Go early.Get tickets from china travel service at the aiport.Bus leaves regularly from the Admirality bus depot. travel time is hardly 30 min or so.the park has two areas, lowlands and highlands.head for highlands sooner.The park gets crowded by afternoon 2 pm as mainlander tourists arrive.The rides are relatively empty in the morning. However the rowdy crowd arrives by 2 pm and there is no place free.waiting times increase drastically.

Worth a visit. this attraction was massive, lots to see and do but on a very hot/humid day it isn't fun standing in queues. if you just wanted a quick snack the food wasn't that great (one food stall even sold out by 2pm). however, everything that we did see/do was well worth it - the massive aquarium was amazing. the rides were great but 1 of our children was too small so didn't like missing out and considering he was able to go on every ride in Disneyland, this was disappointing. unfortunately the one thing that lets this place down is the people who don't think they have to queue, lots of pushing in going on which does put a dampener on them and their culture.
Home of the Panda Bears. Ocean Park is breathtaking in its location. It is spread out, easy to get around, wonderful attractions & the home of the Pandas.

Disappointing . We visited Ocean World on 30 June 2015 following recommendations from friends in Australia. Unfortunately this was not our experience. We paid the full entry fee only to find that many of the attractions, including rides, were "Closed for Maintenance" despite not seeing anyone working on them. The feeding of the Panda was scheduled for 10:00am which is the park's opening time. There is very little provision for seating and shading for respite on a hot day. There was a 50 minute queue for the return Cable Car rid. This may be a result of them only partially being filled. If you are tossing up between Disneyland and Ocean Park I would recommend Disneyland.

At ocean park in hongkong.... It was very exciting I thought it will all just bIt was very exciting I thought it will all just be all fishes since it is an ocean park,but I cann't believe that there are also penguins and a panda. Oh right we rode a roller coaster too, I wasn't able to capture anything I don't want my phone to end up to the deepest part of the ocean or below the mountains and then "boom"...Oh that's right there were many rides there too,but we don't have enough time so we only rode the roller coaster and there is also "polar adventure" it has penguins and foxes and it's cold in there too,If you plan to go maybe you can taste grilled squid,It's really delicious...Well I guess that's all.e all fishes since it is an ocean park,but I cann't believe that there are also penguins and a panda. Oh right we rode a roller coaster too, I wasn't able to capture anything I don't want my phone to end up to the deepest part of the ocean or below the mountains and then "boom"...Oh that's right there were many rides there too,but we don't have enough time so we only rode the roller coaster and there is also "polar adventure" it has penguins and foxes and it's cold in there too,If you plan to go maybe you can taste grilled squid,It's really delicious...Well I guess that's all.

Ok. Very good rides though not for faint hearted. It's a good place. When compared to Disney, it's not well structured or laid out. Attraction is tye cable car ride to top, the awesome rides which are not for the faint hearted and the animals and birds. Kids will enjoy the spotted seals, etc.

Visit to the Ocean Park,Hong Kong. Ocean Park is situated south of Hong Kong island at Aberdeen and is about 30 minutes drive from TST. I had been with a day's pass, but it is a bit too much to cover the entire park in a day. Ocean Park is a multidimensional theme park.By the virtue of its name one gets an impression that it could be a massive water amusement park. Once inside,it is full of surprises. Actually, at the end of the visit,I wondered whether the name Ocean Park is justified? Finally, I felt convinced thinking it is a ocean of surprises to discover and a it has a ocean of activities to experience. The park has many categories some of which are up the mountain, which can be reached either by a cable car ride or by the Ocean Express-a theme ride in a train.The cable car ride offers some stunning views of the sea. I managed to ride it twice. Expect long queues if visiting on weekends.  Apart from having the largest aquarium,the park also features a rare collection of koala,california sea lions, panda,seals etc. The Dolphin show is the main attraction of the park and makes one to wonder how dolphins and seals could be so human friendly. The view of the sea in the backdrop,with ships passing by is awesome. From thrilling rides to water front shows to walking down in the old city one never realizes how the morning tranforms to evening.The grand finale is however the 'Symbio', a fountain show at Aqua city where jets of water form a 360 degree water screen. A story of two dragons is projected on this water screen amidst amazing sound effects and fire spewing out from the water. It is a one of a kind show only seen at Ocean Park. Overall,it offers a memorable experience especially for kids.

Good one. Great rides, Live water animals seen very clearly in their natural form, roler coster rides, great ropeway and romantic evening ....describes the whole park. Pandas were a good attraction, just be in time before they sleep.

SIMPLY AMAZING. If you are planning to visit the this place with kids below 12 years than you should keep at least two days for the park. Don't purchase the tickets from park site directly rather you should check sites like KLOOK.com who offer deeply discounted tickets which offer discount up to 30 percent. Now plan meticulously about time for different sections of park on park map which are available in abundance at just after entrance. Staff was friendly and were trying to run the things in orderly fashion with a polite and humble attitude. It is also advised to check the height restrictions for kids on various rides in advance from their website so as to avoid any disappointment to kids at ride's entry.In nutshell no HK visit is complete without a visit to ocean park.

great rides & awesome aquairiums. There is too much to see all in only 1 day, so i strongly recommend planning in advance (unless you buy an annual pass). The waiting time for rides varies a lot depending on day of week, time of year and of course the specific ride itself. The rides range from kiddie ones to rollercoasters.The park is very fair, so if you're on a budget - you can take your own food and drink inside (but they also have a lot of food outlets, including McDo)!

Best theme park. It was the best theme park I visited. It's so huge and remember to bring plenty of water as you will get dehydrated. I really enjoyed the Hair Raiser ride. It's also beautiful surrounded by mountains.
Great time. Suprisingly good amusement park. Fun rides, good views and cool animals. Worth a visit if you have the time.
Wow! So much fun-cable car awesome.. We loved the mix of features: amazing indoor light sculptures, cable car ride, the easy-to-win huge soft toys, the rides... Everything!

Amazing & a must visit. The park is a marvellous piece of architecture design and engineering. The park has almost all types of means to entertain and enjoy with friends or family. A beautifully designed and managed, its a place of total fun..

Great family outing. Ocean park has been upgraded since the last time I was there several years ago. Loved the walrus, sea lion, penguin enclosures. And the aquariums too. Very well maintained. The rides were excellent, something for everyone. The Flash was our favourite for those who like being swung upside down at great heights! Hair Raiser was excellent too. The 2 water rides were nice for the younger kids. Do not try The Dragon or the Rev Booster. The Dragon looks thrilling but it was very bumpy, rough, quite terrible. My head was thrown side to side hitting the sides of the protective pull-down barrier. On the Rev Booster, passengers sit in cars that are arranged in a circle. The cars move in a circle at high speed. Each seat can sit 2 or 3 passengers. When the ride starts, passengers end up being swung to the edges of their seats, and pressing down on top of each other, as they hold on for dear life. Although the height restriction allows kids as young as 8 to ride on it, I would not even recommend this for adults! It is a terrible ride! The food outlets served a range of food like fried chicken, pasta, baked rice. They tasted quite terrible and were expensive too. Cost around 50HKD. Drinks were 30HKD. There was one McDonalds outlet which had understandably an extremely long queue. Ocean park was built over some hills, so do expect lots of walking up & down hills. The cable car ride was excellent offering beautiful views of the water in the day, and gorgeous lights in the night !

Great place . Sexing visit to OP and it remains a great day out. Once of the reasons I visit HK it is visit Ocean Park. Great rides and lots of room to move around. Most of the food offers are great and now has a McDonald's in the park. Lots of places to sit down and take a break. Well worth a visit in HK
Interesting Park. Visited the place twice.. While the park needs a makeover, it is still a place of fun for adults and children..

Fun for all ages. I have visited Ocean Park twice now, first time via the cable car (not a lover of heights), however the picturesque scenery made the 10 minute transfer bearable. The second time via the express train. There are so many people as such a busy place however very impressed by the smooth operations of staff getting people lined up and on to the cable car of the express shuttle service. The view from the top is amazing, however the many wonderful things to do and see at Ocean Park is amazing. Plenty of toilets and eateries, benches, seats to rest, lining up for rides did not appear an issue either. My favourites places visited were the Aquarium where you see so many different species of fish, sharks, seahorses, walrus, seals, stingrays, eels, you name it they have it and can view from glass roof tops with stingrays flying over your head and the larger sharks makes for a scary but exciting venture... The Artic Wolves are so cute, first visit were only pups, now grown up, very active when the food is out, then back to sleeping when not. The Pandas do not appear to want to know you, both times hardly got to se their faces, often showing their rear ends more to the public Lol... They have new enclosure that requires much quiet, the Australian Zoo, this was such a treat to see our native animals being viewed by the rest of the worlds visitors to this place, great advertisement for AUST. Kookaburras, Koalas, kangaroos.... The Asians love them... so they should they are amazing creatures... Cant fault this place, a must see for young and old. Plenty of souvenir shops with a wide range of quite reasonably priced items. Take a stroll down Old Hong Kong as they simulate what HK looked like back in the day. The rides are user friendly however more so designed for young families and the thrill seekers... Some nearly made me throw up just watching the kids scream for joy... A must see experience... Cost is approx. $350 HK with free transfer from most hotels, however you have to get your own way back and if anything was a chore on the day was the very long wait at the taxi stand, one lane for each side of HK and no seats... standing in the heat can be a chore...

Surprises galore, all pleasant.. Had seena few reviews of Ocean Park, and I must confess, had a few doubts about the experience. Post visit, have to state the obvious first. What happened to your eyes?? Because, besides the rides, the shows, the aquarium and the lot, Ocean Park has some of the most spectacular views you can hope to get at an amusement park. I actually found myself getting on some of the rides for the sheer pleasure of the views they offered of the Ocean, or the rolling hills around. That the view came with some thrills was a huge bonus.The park is huge, and you are always likely to miss a key section, that is at a level below the main area. This one has the mine train, the river rapids etc. I advise you to check it out, as it has some of the better rides, lesser crowds, and of course, the views:) Frankly, even the escalator that takes you down to the minetrain level or back is spectacular.Frankly, between Disneyland and this, I would vote for Ocean Park if rides is what your game is. If it's shows that you want, then you should put Disney on your schedule too.

Great day out, just go early!. Great day out but go early be there when it opens as once the day tour groups arrives after about 2pm it goes to crap pretty quickly. The 40- 80 yr old on the tour don't queue, don't stand in lines; but do push, hit you in the back, spit, push young kids over to get to the front.So go early; do the Gondola ride up to the top attractions-you get a fantastic view of all of HK. The queue for this in the afternoon was over two hours. Do the big rides first that what the tour groupies are most interested in. Food is nothing rave about though better than Disneyland H.K. Have two Maccas there and introspect should have let the kids eat there rather than the chicken or Pizza. Once the tour groups arrive do the minor rides (Though I have to say I couldn't bring myself to bump into the 80+ years old man with the walking stick who couldn't work out how to use the dodgem Car) and get down to the lower levels to see the animals,not that we did that we spend an hour in line to get down to the lower level on the gondola arms locked to stop people walking through us with two lines "excuse me, No English"The lower level was deserted when we actually got down and the water show at the end was worth staying for.

Superb. Really enjoyed.There was a zoo housing penguins to pandas...good for kids.
There were some great rides...roller coasters were excellent. Great for teens & adults.
There was also a cable car to go from one end to the other...it was good.
Highly recommended.
November 12

FUN AND MORE FUN. Great day out, we took the bus very easy to get to. Drops you at bus parking area. Then the fun begins take the cable car to the park. What a ride. Heaps to do great rides, better than Disneyland. Food and drinks are a bit on the expensive side but that's a theme park. Lots of fun, give it a go.

a full day of fun!. Best way to get there is take a bus from HK island. Give yourself a full day to enjoy all the rides at the park. The food concessions stall offer a variety of good food that is not exorbitant - but do pack some extra water and a few snacks. A roller coasters offer a thrill ride and the ropeway crossing is simply amazing!

great stuff for kids. we visited ocean park on a hot sunny day. trust me it does get hot and sweaty in june. never the less, the park is great attraction for kids visiting the aquarium and lots of rides that give a thrill of a life time. the old hong kong street and the cable ride in the evening is a must do.

Nice place to go. This is our second trip and there were much more attractions nowadays. You can spend the whole day in this park and there are a number of attractions there ranging from pandas to penguins.It is very easy to assess as well, via MTR and busline.

Fun for all the family. Ocean Park has fun install for all the family and attractions both indoor and out so that it is suitable all times of the year. Rides will be shut in bad weather so its worth checking before you go. It gets very hot in the summer to make sure you stay hydrated and visit the penguins for some cool times. To miss the tour coaches and crowds get there when it opens. It does get busy and not all the guests are equally polite so can be a hassle and there are queues for rides. The staff at the park are well trained and have a lot of patience helping to make the day memorable.

Better than Disney. if you want to spend the day in a theme park in Hong Kong, you should choose Ocean Park rather than Disneyland. More fun, cheaper and more things to see.The only thing that we do not like is more packed. So crowded and you will need more time to queue for a ride.We really like the cable car, the big aquarium, the north pole area, and kids try the "Hair Raiser" (the roller coaster).The food and drink were quite expensive there, but you can bring your own drink if you like. Just make sure you bring not too many inside the park or the security will not let you in.

Great fun. . We were deciding between this and Disneyland. Ended up choosing here because it's much more unique experience. Of course we visit in the middle of summer, so it's quite humid and hot. I suggest going to the polar area as those buildings are very very well air-conditioned. We used that as a break area. Exhibits were overall very educational. I like reading stuff so I got a lot out of it. My wife does not like reading stuff, but she really enjoyed exhibits as well. The food choices are somewhat limited. The restaurants are typically average quality at high prices. I suggest the Bayview restaurant. It's reasonably cheaper, and it's essentially cafeteria style food. You have the ability to control volume and cost this way. It seemed to lessen the pain. The area of the park is quite large, there is a cable car that takes you between the two sides. There is also a train that runs between the two. I suggest taking the cable car early or late in the day. You can use the train for the other direction. They will give you estimates of the line length. You can decide based on this.

Beautiful park. When we arrived at the gate they had not opened yet and there was already a very large crowd. I was worried that the park would be uncomfortable with so many people. Not the case. There is plenty of room to roam so people are spread out. Loved the red pandas, the giant pandas and especially the Koala bears. Didn't ride any of the rides and didn't eat at the park but the food all looked and smelled delicious. Great place for families or just a couple.

Nice Experience. Great rides..... Large area.... it was raining when we reached. everything turned so pretty thereafter. Plesant weather.Great shows specially those Acrobatic Seals. We were so happy after enjoying funfilled ride. The best part was the Cable ropeway which took us to a great Old Hong kong type Cafes n cuisiness area. what a journey it was. Overall woth a visit.

Best bang for ur buck. Been here before when I was in my teens. Wasn't really keen on visiting again but am so glad I did. OP had changed a lot, in size & in fun scale. Excellent location with fabulous view of Hong Kong. Rides for kids & adults alike. Park visit can't be covered in a day so maybe plan for a day & a glad visit. We were there the whole day till they closed but we weren't even able to see all of the Park. Cable CAR ride between the 2 mountains is excellent. Will def come Back on my next visit to HK

Theme park suitable for all age. This theme park is divided into 2 sections, the Summit section and Waterfront section. When you first arrived, you'll see the Ocean Park logo and the infamous Grand Aquarium. Beside many thrilling and adventurous attractions, we can also play small games. In fact, me and my daughter got the jumbo prize for winning a ball-throwing game.

Scenic and Fun!. It was a blazing hot day to visit Ocean Park, but we totally enjoyed ourselves. We were expecting long queues but we only waited an average of 15 mins per ride, including the very scenic cable car ride. The marine world, shark mystique, dolphin show and panda enclosure are great places to visit, plus it's much cooler in there too. The thrill rides like the Viking and roller coaster are fun but a little too old and bumpy. Overall a good place to visit with many scenic spots for photo taking.

Great park !. A great place to see real marine life, friendly creatures such as dolphins, penguins, one of teenagers such as sharks, rays power ... an amusement park large-scale scenic lot guests and children come here, the tour always have this place. Fares are quite expensive, but the amount of people visiting really very crowded, perhaps now is the tourist season.

Amazing theme park. Visited this theme park during June.Very huge theme park and fun exciting rides and games.1 day is not enough to cover the whole theme park, may need at least another half a day more. All the rides waiting time is about 20mins during off peak which is still ok for us. The food and drink are expensive. Place is crowded with china PRC and tour groups, and they tends to cut queue without asking politely.Park is easily reached by public buses and the upcoming MTR which will be ready by end of the year.

Fun rides and cool exhibits. The hair razor roller-coaster was a blast. Looks scary but turns out to be a lot of fun. On a hot day the tube ride is a nice way to cool off and get a little wet. All rides were fun and the lines weren't too bad the day we went (about 15-30 minutes each). The red Panda was super cute as was the large Panda (though he looked really sad). Worth a visit with kids. The view is great too.

Satisfied. The kids love it! It was tricky though that to have the pictures taken and it costs more.Lines were long on a Thursday but at least we rounded the place in one day. More rides for toddlers please.

Full of barging mainland Chinese. We gave to park two attempts. Granted they were both weekend days but all the rides and attractions had queue waiting times of 45 mins plus. The park is too full at the weekend especially of rude mainland Chinese tourists that will push past 4 year olds and step on their feet just to get one ahead of the line. I am Chinese and really am not trying to be racist but this is what we experienced. I think Ocean Park need to limit their daily intake or risk losing business from young families.

Fun for kids.. We were there for the day. We started early when it opened and it did get busy later on. There was lots to see and do. We had lunch there. There is also a nice view from up on top. Many of the rides were fun and the displays were good.

A must experience for kids after Hongkong Disneylad. We were here in May 2013. We took the MTR from Tsim Sha Tsui then rode the bus going here. The terminal is just walking distance to the park. It's a huge place and the line for the rides is not as long as with Disneyland. Get a map and plan which rides you'd like to take or which attraction you'd like to visit so that you can maximize your stay here. Be sure to ride the cable car in going up the other side-mountain and then ride the train in going down or vice versa. Do stay for the fountain-light show and be sure to pick the bench closest to the center fountain.

Pandas!!!!!!. When you first arrive, you think, this is a bit small, then get on the cable car, for a really long trip, then pandas, Dolphins etc etc, it's really great, the view is brilliant and there seems to be a care for the animals, but just get up close and personal with pandas

Cool not only for kids. A nice entertainment park with loads of attractions and animal shows. You need at least one day to explore the park without too much time pressure. I personally find the park more interesting than Disney Land. Try to avoid Public Holidays and Sundays. And the early ones will be rewarded with less waiting time at main attractions.

Marvelous. We enjoyed our trip to the Ocean Park. We also enjoyed the cable car and the underground train. the rides are fantastic but the their dolphin show is a bit boring. Aside from that, our kids enjoyed the park because it has animals, I hope they are treating all of their animals nicely. The Ocean Park management is also campaigning for the good of our environment.

Miss your childhood days? Come here.... First came here in 1988. Revisit after 27 years.So much has changed. Maybe due to Disneyland. But the change was good.If you miss your childhood days, come here to relive them.

One of the best aquariums in the World. Ocean Park is a multi-generational favourite for HK residents, and a magnet for thousands of visitors every day who mostly get absorbed by its huge expanse of space. Whatever your group's age range or interests there's something - from kids play areas, through teenage thrills, things for young couples to share, or parents and grandparents. The must-see highlights are the sharks, the Chinese Sturgeons, the Pandas, and the unusual jelly fish display, but there's much more than I can list here. Views from the hill are magnificent, and some of the rides are able to scare even the most hardened theme park visitors ...

A good combo of education and entertainment. We visited Ocean Park with our two young daughters (both below 7 years of age) in June 2015 and found the park to be a well kept & maintained, educational and entertaining place. The majority of the rides however are for children above 120-140cm in height so our younger child missed out! Apart from the usual plethora of rides and carnival games, there are also animal exhibits which focus on marine life, e.g. seals, sea lions, walruses, penguins, pandas, sharks, fish, etc. As parents, we definitely liked this educational aspect of the park versus a pure entertainment place like Disneyland!The park is divided up into two areas - you enter via the lower park which has a number of rides and the panda exhibit, and then can take either a train or the cable car to access the upper park where the majority of the thrilling rides (e.g. the roller coasters and the ride which drops you 10 stories) are located. We definitely discourage taking the cable car up to the upper park as the queue is horrendous - instead, take the train up, and the cable car back down as the queues are more manageable then. Food is plentiful and runs the range from cheap to expensive, and given that this is a more mature park, the trees and shelter from the sun are more developed. On the day that we were there, it was extremely sunny and hot so remember to drink lots of water to stay hydrated. There are drinking fountains thoughtfully dotted around the park so you needn't buy bottles of water all the time.Distance from Causeway Bay where we stayed was around 15min by taxi so it's very close to the central area of Hong Kong island.

So much to do!. You could really spend the day and get your money's worth. There is something interesting for every age. The food was very expensive but I was impressed with all the different things that the park had to offer - it was huge from the rainforest to the pans and shark exhibits.

Ocean Park Hong Kong. Visited the theme park with my family in November 2014. The park is quite big but was overly crowded with mainland Chinese tourists. It was not pleasant for us as they were yelling to each other on top of their voice (don't understand why they need to talk so loudly), won't say "thank you" when you hold the door for them, will not hesitate to jump queue i.e. pretend they have somebody waiting for them ahead, push their way through when you are waiting for the door of the tram to open, using priority queue which are meant for visitors with young children, strollers, and etc. Nevertheless, my children enjoyed visiting the marine exhibits.
Ocean Park. somewhat long journey to get there but then you are a very well organized park with a lot of attractions long queues waiting time between 30 to 45 minutes at peek times

A must visit if ur in HK. It's a huge place to cover in a day but it's worth every drop of sweat. One of the best ocean parks with huge variety of sea life. It will leave u spell bound and amazed. The Dolphin show is a must watch. Though the train ride is a total waste unless you want to go to the other side.The place is massive so wear comfortable clothes as per the weather and running shoes are a must.

A must visit if ur in HK. It's a huge place to cover in a day but it's worth every drop of sweat. One of the best ocean parks with huge variety of sea life. It will leave u spell bound and amazed. The Dolphin show is a must watch. Though the train ride is a total waste unless you want to go to the other side.The place is massive so wear comfortable clothes as per the weather and running shoes are a must.

Fun with the family.... Visited the place after nearly 24 years....and pleasantly surprised with the improvements and more so with my daughter enjoying every moment in the park....most importantly the cable car, the aquarium and the thrilling rides.....I missed the dolphin show this time....and do regret it...but there's too much to do and too little a time...

Great Experience.. Went on a hot summers day and the place was crowded with mainland Chinese tourists. Although there were long queues to see or do anything this didn't diminish from the experience. The Panda's were great. Great roller-coasters too. Can recommend the ski lift along the coast which was brilliant at sunset. The dolphin/seal show was enjoyable even if you've seen a few. Loved the penguins but the Aquarium was a bit disappointing because it was smaller than expected and there was nothing to distinguish it from others around the world. Overall a great time had with family but try to avoid peak summer times.

Ocean park hong kong. In my 7 times i have been to hong kong i have been here 3 times ( i love hong kong if you havent guessed) and the only reason i never visited ocean park on more occassions is i didnt have time. the park itself is a great theme park with great rides, an ocean type park with dolphin displays etc and probably the biggest aqaurium tanks you will ever see. In these tanks they have the fish and turtles and sharks to match the size of tanks aswell .it is a brilliant day out with all the features youd expect and the prices are not rip off either. the park is in two sections one is where you enter the park where there is loads of rides and animals etc ( have a look at the pandas while you are in this bit aswell they are really well looked after here) and the other part of the park where there is a lot more sealife bits and loads more rides is on the outer edge of the headland with some hills in between and the way they are connected is a cable car system with loads of cars running all the time ( the waiting time is only a minute or 2) or if you dont like cable cars they run a coach around to the other side of the park and you go in the small back entrance and there is a couple of esculators to take you to the top where the park is ( this way takes about 15-20 mins) ive done both ways and the cable cars are the better way.the park is clean modern and very safe and a great day out you wont be sorry you went.check out the rides and bits on the popular online video service i dont know if im allowed to name and you think its a great place as i always have.we stayed on the island when we went and used a taxi when we went and this was quite cheap ( only a little more than the bus) but make sure he goes through the tunnel under the mountain on the island it cuts the journey down by loads and the taxi fare aswell unless you want the scenic route of course.it can get a tiring day so dont rush around too quickly and it can be a bit hilly due to where it is. it is very disabled freindly so even if youre in a wheel chair you are still ok on pretty much everything there. check the weather aswell as the first time i went there was a rainstorm ( it only lasted about an hour) and the rainstorms here are proper rainstorms ( the pathways turn to rivers in a matter of minutes) once the rainstorm had stopped the warm climate of the place it was dry in no time

Ocean world! . It's a good place to encounter different species of animals. It didn't look like animals were being tortured. I hope they're not. They've tried to keep them in suitable conditions. Penguins and dolphins were the highlight of this trip!

Beautifull setting. Really nice park, built on and on the sides of a mountain. Expect lots of walking despite the vast numer of escalators.Nice rides but first of all a great ambience to the entire place.

Educational and fun park. This park is huge with cable cars and trams linking the lower section to the upper section. It wasn't much fun when my friends and I were there because it was raining pretty heavily in May. If you are in your 20s like us, I would suggest spending less time on the lower section which is pretty much like a zoo and spend more time on the roller coasters in the upper section. Hit the rides first thing in the morning to prevent long lines due to busload of tourists. One of the main attractions in the lower section is the panda. Be sure to catch the dolphin show as well on the upper section!

Plan ahead, and get there early.. We went by cab (cheap and quick). Ocean Park is big, so a good idea to plan ahead and work out which attractions to visit. This gives you a better chance of doing all you want to.We deliberately avoided the weekend (and its assumed larger crowds). Pretty sure our theory was sound, because even though we did a fair bit of queuing, friends who went the next weekend struck horrendous queues.We didn't have young kids, so bypassed attractions geared to those age groups. If you take kids, there are services available to make life easier. Including wrist bands for their name and your contact details (tried to pin one on our 13 yr old, but, he wasn't keen). You can also hire lockers to store any gear you don't want to lug around all day.We started with the Grand Aquarium, which was fantastic, then wandered around the lagoon before heading to the cable car. There are various places around the park where you will be offered a photo of your group. Sometimes you won't even know your picture has been taken. Don't be pressured into buying if the shot isn't that good, because there is likely to be a better one around the corner.The Cable Car was a great way to get to the Summit. Brilliant views and a really unique bonding experience for the family (i.e. conversation turned to "what happens if the cable breaks?"). That doesn't bear thinking about, so best just to snuggle-up and do a lot of ooohing and aaahing about the view.The Summit has a big range of rides, some suitable for families/younger members, and others for the more adventurous/mad. This is where your day can disappear on you!Walking, queuing, riding, eating, etc., means time just vanishes. Roller coaster fans should love the Hair Raiser. It's long (so's the wait), it's scary, and it's on the side of a cliff! If you can keep your eyes open, there is also an amazing view from up there. There are the likes of Polar Adventure and Ocean Theatre for those preferring more sedate activities. We even enjoyed the long escalators.The Summit closes before the Waterfront. Our clue was that rides started shutting down, and it was getting dark. We took the Ocean Express back to the Waterfront, and it was also brilliant.We had to queue (think it's the only way down at that time), but, the train and waiting area is 1930's science fiction nautica-like (think Captain Nemo's Nautilus). Inside the train is very theatrical, main lights turned off, nautical/ocean movie playing on the ceiling, and special effects lighting/sound made it a really cool experience.That time of night there was a light show at the lagoon which was also pretty cool, and a great way to end our day.Outside the entrance were plenty of waiting cabs, and a stream of others arriving all the time. There were a lot of people wanting cabs, and some queue jumpers, but, we managed to get ours without really waiting at all (perhaps luck, or, maybe we were more organised/aware than others).All up, an awesome day and a brilliant park (although we still didn't get to everything we wanted).My tips: 1. Plan ahead; 2. Avoid weekends/public holidays; 3. Get there early.

Fantastic location on the top of the island, but really too crowded. The experience with the cable car up the hill is unique with the sea amazing hill view.Otherwises, at the week-end the activities are crowded: large queues and long waiting times in the heat. The panda was too tired and could hardly be seen despite the huge queue.The aquarium offers spectacular views if you can afford queuing for so long too.

Awesome. Much better than Disney land . From train to rope way to rides and food .... Every thing was awesome. 2 rides were under maintenance so little bit of disappointment but this place is for all age groups. 10/10

Fun place for young children too!. We were travelling with 2 young children and didn't want to go through the hassle of taking the mtr and transferring to a bus, so we took a taxi from mongkok. Journey was around 30 mins and cost us HKD200. We arrived at 11am and there wasn't much queue at the ticket counter. For Singaporeans, do remember to ask if there are promotions with any cards as there was a UOB card promotion and SQ krisflyer promo when were were there... I think we had a discount of 10% off the ticket price.There is a playground and bouncy castle for young children. The froggy ride was also very fun for young children. However, we do noticed that a number of rides were closed at the children's section of the theme park.If you like to take the cable car, do arrive early or take it on the way down from the summit (and before the closing time - say 4 to 5pm), otherwise, expect a long wait.If you ares staying at mongkok or Tsim sha tsui, it's more convenient to take the mini bus back... There will be drivers directing you to their buses and it takes one to mong kok is less than 30 mins. We usually take these buses as it beats taking the hsu and then mtr... Only gripe is that these bus goes real fast so safety is a concern.
Busy Place -- Go Early. Had fun but took advice of others and went early. There were no lines and not many people, by noon it was packed an lines had hour wait times.

Worth The Trip.Ocean Park >>> Disney. I absolutely loved this place. I went on a Tuesday right at opening and thoroughly enjoyed myself. I went alone and still had a great time. The rides are fun and the lines were relatively short. I loved that the bathrooms were air conditioned and very well stocked and clean. All the staff was very helpful and very kind and courteous. You MUST do the cable car ride and the mine train. Both great. Overall, loved this place and would recommend it over Disney in Hong Kong.

Stunning location for a theme park. You could not get a more picturesque location thats for sure, the trip from one side of the park to the other on the cable car is breathtaking. But the downside to all those beautiful green mountains surrounding the park is getting around it. Up and down and up and down again gets very tiring very quickly, especially when its 35degrees with 90% humidity. Go on a week day and when its cooler if you can. We sought relief in the penguin enclosure which is cooled to mimic the north pole. They are also very strict on the minimum height restrictions for rides. There were also several rides out of action on the day we visited which was very disappointing. Perhaps check in advance if you have time to find out what rides are running on the day you plan on going. All in all a great day out. We took the bus from Tsim Sha Tsui, took about 45 minutes and on a weekend goes directly to the front gate of Ocean Park.

Not to be compared with Modern Theme Parks. My sister wanted to see Pandas so we capitulated and spent most of the day at the park. We saw the Pandas and enjoyed the cable car ride that had wonderful views but generally, if you have visited modern theme parks and are looking for thrills, don't bother. It is a little tacky, very busy and at £30.00 each for the day, not great value. The Dim Sum was good though!
