Fun for kids and adults alike. There are many attractions within Ocean Park so one never gets bored. It's like the zoo, aquarium, bird park and an amusement park all thrown into one big attraction venue. The cable car ride was also pretty awesome. My 4 year old child enjoys this attraction better than Disneyland!

Cute Pandas!. Ying Ying and Lok Lok were the highlight of our trip at Ocean Park. Their home is so nice with air condition! This is the only place I felt the breeze and cool while visiting animals at the park! Also, the cable car and ocean express was quite an experience!

Beyond words !!! An AMAZING place!!!. This is the best theme park I have been to so far. It has not only got some crazy and awesome rides, but also a lot of interesting and awesome things too see.It is the right kind of place for just about anyone to visit. A group of friends, family, office colleagues just about anyone.It has got enough number of rides / attractions to see over a period of 2 days easily.A group of friends wanting to go to some scary an awesome rides, or a groupo of family wanting fun rides for your kids? There is a ride for every single kind of person who enters this place. Small play areas for infants, mini rides like - carousel, dashing cars, etc for the young ones, or rather scary and huge roller coaster rides for the adrenaline rush craving enthusiasts. I dont think there would be anyone who would come back disappointed out of this place.They also have a wide range of restaurants here catering to all kinds of needs. Fancy lavish restaurants to simple fast foods like McD / Popeye.Theya have many attractions related to wildlife, animals and birds - a shark mystique attraction, an atraction for the north / south poles showcasing penguins, arctic fox, polar bears; sea-life attractions with different kind of fish, seal, walrus etc; australian attractions like koala bear, kangaroo rats etc. These are not only awesome to watch but very informative with a lot of interactive apparatus for students, kids or the interested ones.One of their main attraction in this space is the giant aquarium they have. You get to see a wide variety of species with the best possible close view.It is amazing how they maintain these many things, so efficiently and neatly.They even have a Gondola to go to the top section which again is a beautiful ride. You have a view of the harbour, whole of ocean park and the complete greenery that is surrounding Ocean Park, this is view is just describable in words.I would say, if you are visiting Hongkong, this is a must visit place.

Ocean Park Exceeded my expectations!. We had a full day experience at Ocean Park where the kids played the games and enjoyed the aquarium and the Cable cars experience as well as the climbing train. The Park was packed with tourist groups from China, and we could not play much due to the timing and there were long ques. In my opinion, the best time to visit the Park is after 14:00. Dont miss the Rapids, the close encounters with the Panda and the Penguins, and the new short roller coaster!

Marine life at its best. Your Hong Kong trip wouldn't be complete without visiting their two most famous attractions, the HK Disneyland and Ocean Park. We had our full day dedicated enjoying the Hong Kong Ocean Park. If you're a thrill seeker, you'd surely enjoy their nerve rockin rides. Since we have a small child travelling with us, we skip the rides and just went sightseeing. They have a huge stadium for the dolphin/sea lion show. But I didn't enjoy the show as much as the show presented at the Ocean Park in Subic (they have more tricks there, just see it for yourself). What I like most is our cable car ride where you can have a breathtaking view of the whole park. Our 5 year-old son even enjoyed it. You can also take the express train going to the other side of the park but you can't see anything while inside the train because it go thru inside the mountain tunnel so it's just total darkness until you reach the other side. And lastly, they have an extensive collection of fish and sea creatures which is very educational for kids and adults alike.
Another visit 10 years later. Well maintained and it was easy to get to from Mongkok. We got there at 11:30AM and it was eating time for the Panda. We were able to see the Panda in action. Cool.
explore the ocean. ocean park in hongkong is like no other park in the world.it has everything u need to experience about the ocean for kids to adults.. a must visit in a life time..

Thrills. This park should be called Ocean Thrill Park. The rides were amazing, you could not get the teenagers to come off. They had a ball. Would definitely recommend you visit the park, the only problem maybe for the adults & little ones is the walking uphill
Great Place for Visiting with Kids. Fantastic place to visit with kids. Lots of activities. Need a whole day. Lots of snack locations. The retaurants are good. Must visit.

One of a kind ! Beautiful view all around. U reach there and find hongkong is so so beautiful !
Look all around , can b there for days !
The tram ride is scenic !
Rides are awesome !
Advise to be there right in the morning so that get to do all rides
As there is heavy rush !!!
Hong Kong is wonderful

Cable car is the best part...!. Long queues for cable car even on weekdays was a pain but the cable car ride was the most paying experience at Ocean Park.Grand aquarium is a world in itself,mesmerises...rides are fun but most of them can't be done with kids so becomes a constraint for parents.Panda house was a relief in the heat.

Nice day trip, beautifully set up. Activities more interesting for smaller kids.. The Ocean Park, got strongly advertised to us by friends who went to it before. They said if you go to HK you have to see it. So we made sure it got included to our sightseeing package. When you buy it, you should already have the ticket. This makes it easier for you to enter the ocean park, because you only need around 5 minutes, while others have to stand a long time, in order to buy the ticket. The outlook of the park is really big, and nicely designed and it is easy to find your way through with the printed maps and road signs. As soon as you get in, there is a possibility for you to take a break in the coffee. Right next to the coffee you can rent a wheelchair or childen cart for a reasonable price. This is great! If you got a person, whose walking capabilities are a little ristricted, you should take this opportunity, because the park is HUGE and even exhausting for a person who can walk quite well. Everything is interesting to see, be advised that when the Pandas are out a LOT of people interested to see them. You should also take the little tram that gets you from one side of the park to another side. This is a great picture opportunity. So, go out and visit it :)

fun visit with grand son. very good place to visit along with children's , under water world is too good ,but same problem here also ( like Disney land ) you to find your own way and if you are there just for one day your half day will spoil in locate the things . they should keep proper guides to help people.

Fun. The park have rides, game booths, animal shows and experiential activities. In short, something for everyone. We went on a weekday when the park just opened and there was already a queue for cablecar to the summit. I recommend that you take the cablecar to the summit to take the thrilling rides, games booths and the animal shows, and take the train to the ground to see the rest of the animals and shows before you depart. Try to go when the park opens as there will be shorter queues.
fun! . personally I would prefer to bring out of town guests to ocean park as opposed to Disneyland. there's so much more to see and do here. it's a gorgeous place. fit for everyone of all ages!!!

Awesome place. This park is a great way to spend a day if you don't have anything else planned. When I went there were no lines. The sky lift is worth the wait, it was one of the best views I have ever seen in my life. The only down side is there is no alcohol. It is a family place so I can understand that. Lots of stuff to do for all ages!
Awesome fun rides. Ocean park is a must visit if you are heading to honkong. It is a great fun for all the ages. Rides are really thrilling and it was a great fun with family.

Interesting but not suitable for kids under 122cm. Since i was there on summer, the weather quite hot & have to take along walk from one part to another part of park looking for the ride. But sadly most of the ride not suitable for young kids under 122cm make my kids disappointed. Have to wait & standing almost 1 hour to use the cable car to the water front. Not recomended for young kids & on summer.

please dont be racist ocean park employees. every thing was at its best my kids me and my wife were enjoying this park and were really thrilled till we have encountered a booth outside the place where live panda was keptthis booth was having cartoon character and you can get yourself photographed with this character, so seeing this my 6 year daughter ran toward this booth but to her shock was yelled by the staff managing this booth and was made to stand outside as some handicap person was given preference, well there was no problem but as my daughter turns was next so she got exited to meet this character but to my shock she was again stopped and the local girl standing behind her was brought in front saying she was waiting before us so she is first to click the photo but i was 100%sure that there was no one at the time my daughter entered this booth, it was that a handicap person also entered almost same time as of my daughter. i don't understand that this place is mostly for kids and if kids are not from your country then it does not means that you would treat them differently as these actions of us make us racist and our future generation are also affected so please educate your employees to be more human and humble especially to the kids

Get there early to make the most of it. . Had a great day here on June 8th. Took the 629 bus from the pier in the Central area which is direct to Ocean Park and takes approximately 30mins depending on traffic.Two things I strongly recommend which we did; Get there just before the park opens at 10.30am and with your tickets already purchased (you can buy these from any 7-11 in Hong Kong as long as the cashier understands English!).Got the cable car to the summit immediately (you will have to queue for 5-15mins) and went straight for the big roller-coasters. Got on first five rides without waiting. It gets a lot busier in the afternoon but longest we waited for a ride was 25 minutes. Also went to the dolphin show which was short but sweet. Overall it has a great mix of animals and attractions and a fun way to spend a day in the HK sun! Enjoy!

A visit after 7 years again. This is my second visit to ocean park after 7 years! Seems a lot of things added and changed. The Dolphin show was just average compare to 7 years ago which was much amused than the current. The theme park workers are not really friendly. Don't go for Golden Fried Chicken meal, it's so expensive and the workers are so not friendly! Opt for McDonald's in Ocean park which is much cheaper!

Our visit to Ocean Park Hongkong.. We had one full day visit & it was very entertaining.There were several adventurous rides providing enough thrill.The view from the top was superb.The Indian food though with limited menu is available both veg & Non veg.It was a day well spent

Fun day. Kids and adults enjoyed the rides. The aquariums were also very interesting. Since it was a hot and humid day, the North Pole Encounter was the place to be. Too bad the pandas are asleep (I was told the pandas are always mostly asleep).

Big boys playground. To be honest its more for big boys to enjoy the thrilling ride and adventure of the park . ts neatly outlined and you need full day to enjoy all the attraction .the train ride was awesome , must recommended .aquarium was very educative & fun .Must visit the panda section along with penguin . They are rarely seen anywhere else .enjoy

Don't miss !!!!!. 5 stars and more!! we absolutely loved it. Our son aged 6 years completely freaked out as he is a sealife lover. The dolphin show is amazing and the shark aquarium is really awesome. The penguin place is very smelly but totally worth it. Plenty of eating options there. Some tips: Carry your water and raincoat. Go up the peak by the ocean express and come back by the gondola. its a 30 min wait in the queue for the gondola in the evening but the trip is amazing! we had to leave at 6 pm as were dead tired but we still hadn't covered it all !

Very Good. Was lots of fun and there were lots of interesting things, roller coasters were exciting and petrifying but great fun. Especially raging river and mine train in Adventure land and the hair raiser at thrill mountain and also the Rapids in the rain forest zone. The park is very well organised and it is quite easy to get from area to area, although, to get from one part of the park to another, you would need to take the cable car, but this just adds to the fun! There are four restaurants and four cafés in Ocean Park, one of the restaurants being McDonald's , we only went to café ocean though. There are also lots of animals and attractions besides the roller coasters and water slides. Enjoyed the dolphin and sea lion show too. Overall, a great visit and well worth the money!

My favourite place in Hong Kong. First time i went to ocean park I was sooo happy that I immediately bought myself an annual pass. I loved the mix of a zoo and a amusement park with rides. The view is absolutely stunning and sometimes you can get in during the week and not wait at all. I am usually very sceptical about zoos but ocean park does a lot in terms of green and environmental education and they provide nice and spacious living areas for the animals. I love this place, it just has such a special atmosphere. My favourite part is probably old hong kong, which is right before you enter the cable car downstairs.

Worth the visit !!. We enjoyed ourselves very much. Please occupied yrself for a day if u wanna enjoy every bits of the area especially on the rides. My hubby and daughter spents at least 2 hours to queue for 3 rides but it was very worth it. At the mean time, i brought my son to play some simple ball throwing and it won him a lil doggie. It was a cery rewarding trip for my family !!

Better than Disneyland. Very beautiful location on the top of the hill. I travelled with 9 years old child and she also enjoyed it tremendously. Price was very reasonable. You can easily spend full day there. There are two ways to get from Main door to top of the hill. Gondolas and Train.

Nice day out (if the weather is good). As a young girl, my family and I often went to Ocean Park. Those rides are often very exciting (in the same time - terrifying ) . Although the daily ticket for an adult or child can be seen as quite pricey , definitely recommend for tourists (you will get a totally different feeling compared to Disneyland). One advice - do make sure the day you go is a nice day, otherwise your Ocean Park experience may not be that great !

Lots of fun for all ages!. We visited Ocean park with our young children (8,6,3) and we really enjoyed our day. We arrived as it opened and went straight to the Summit, this meant we got to go on alot of the big rides before the lines got long. The cable car to the summit was lovely. The views were so beautiful!We spent 3/4 day at the Summit going on all the rides and watching the dolphin/seal show.Then we finished the day in the lower section at the aquarium, panda enclosure and the little kids rides. It was clean, well run and because it wasn't in school holidays it wasn't too busy. A great family day out

Fun. Spent a complete day there with my two grandchildren , great place to have a lot of fun for all ages , plenty do , very safe , great rides for the kids , food ís good , not great but good , cost is very reasonable for a whole day out, the ride up has so many great views.

Wonderful rides.. However if you have a 5yrs old with you.. It's more disappointing... Since no rides for little ones. It surely offers a wonderful view when on cable car... But it is very tiring as ocean world is spoilt in 2 parts... Difficult to convert everything in one day... So use the ocean park map to choose your activities.U shud visit this place before Disneyland... As you won't enjoy it as much.. If you already have been to Disneyland.
Must Visit in HK. Must do if you have a weekend to spare in HK and want to experience some good fun, see some wildlife, and generally get some entertainment

nice place. It was really nice place for kids to play. Most of the game are more suitable for kids n they have some show too. We spend 1 day there to see dolphin,Fox, panda, fish, penguin n sea lions. it recommended going on weekday due to very crowded on weekend special for those China tourist very irritating.Recommended to buy ticket online before heading down so u can direct entry because the que to purchase the ticket are very long n waste time.What i dont like is they food n drink really over kill price that shock us but cannot bring food in the park where it had very tight security check at entry gate. The escalator also not working gd where up n down share the same line cause long que in hot weather. The direction also not very clear so u can walk n walk to unknown place where it totally waste time.

A Full Days Fun. We had visited this park in May end on a family vacations to HK & Macau. Park is located on top of a hill hence please be ready to walk a lot, stand in long queues in the sun. The entry level has the aquarium, the Giant Pandas and few other attractions. Take the cable car to go to the top before you see the entry level stuff to avoid long queues and delays. Carry a Park Map to reach the best rides and shows on time. The Dolphin show is a must see. Also carry lots of drinking water as water cost inside is very steep and outside eatables are not allowed to be carried in. A spare set of clothes for children are advised incase of getting wet during some of the rides. The park closes too soon to fully enjoy the fountain with lights at the entry level. Be prepared to thoroughly enjoy and get exhausted. Must see for families.

Nice place especially for kida. Location:30 mins from my hotel ramadaPark:Ita good park for kids... have nice dolphin shows... and cable cars... ans some small rides also...Food:No indian food at all... even non veg food is oakyish ( my frds ate)Time:U need full day to explore d place...Its for kids ... adults wont enjoy... can give a skip

Fantastic views, limitless fun. The park is a very good place to spend half of the day. Make sure to visit pandas and take a ride on the cable cabin at least once. You can feed sea lions, take limitless number of rides on roller coasters, look at the penguins, while they stare at you back and have a lot of fun with improvised shows through the day.You may consider to take some snacks with you, because the choice on the park grounds is limited. We found the best to our liking is one directly above sea lions open pool.

Really is the best park in the world. you better go early if you really want to get your money worthy and spend whole day in the park . The best thing I like are the animals . Specially the pandas in two different section homes for them ,lovely 70 penguins in the other side of the mountain , many fishes but I still like the older aquarium that not insist any more . The dauphins shows but you need to go there earlier to get a better seat. I also like the birds show when I have time to see it but its not the best one now. It has so so many rides that looks good . My family also like to play some game but money goes fast .Its not hard to win if you willing to spend some money or you are the expert. 20 minutes of Cable car ride is must but go earlier to Q the line and coming back to take the fast 5 minutes train ride . It has many snack places or restaurants but its not cheap . Only place I like to eat at is penguin or aquarium restaurants . The food is so so but its fun to see the penguin swim around . Make sure you wear a jogging shoes ,umbrella and a rain coat for the wet rides. Ocean Park not allow you to bring food inside the park . I saw some people had to eat the food they tried to bring in before entering the park .I bought the annual card and try to go there at least three times a year ,otherwise you won't make it back. Sometimes I bring the grandparents to the park ,if they are the HK senior citizen and allow to go in for free and also free for the birthday person but must with HK ID. You can rent a wheel chair for very little of money .

They have my vote for most improved!. Compared to my first visit to the place which was very disappointing, I would have to say that this place has improved tremendously. The no. of attractions have increased, the food options have increased and the overall quality and feel to the place. However, do avoid the rather pathetic children's play area and stick to the other attractions like the pandas and polar adventure. Cable car ride was horrible (long queues, hot and no dedicated lines for families with young children) but the Ocean Express train ride was definitely worth it. Food options could have been better but perhaps to open some fast food joints if they aren't able to handle it themselves well?

Is used to be better. Been so many times and used to enjoy it but it has since turned into a loud, over crowded, mayhem place with too many mainland Chinese tourist smoking where they shouldn't, using their camera where they shouldn't, cutting lines and shoving past you. Not really the best place to take your kids as it used to be.

Mesmerizing experience. Great place for kids.You have pandas .penguins,seals,huge fishes.They would love it.The rides are great for adults as well.The cable car ride to the top of hill is a life time experience where u get a beautiful scenic view of the ocean and the outlying islands. Defnitely worth the money you pay
Ok.... Ok. Well I would not rave about this place, but then I have traveled a lot so people may differ with my opinion.The cable car ride however was worth it
Very big place. Visited during the off peak period, but still it was packed. A lot of walking around so be sure that you wear jogging shoes, umbrella and lots of water

Much better enjoyed with older kids. We were at Ocean Park on 2nd June 2015 with our kids aged 5 and 3. Like many reviewers have rightly said before, they were too young for most of the rides. However features like the Polar Adventure (penguins, arctic fox, seal, walrus etc), Shark Mystique, Expedition Trail (animals and birds in a rainforest), Amazing Asian Animals (Pandas, golden fur monkey) are outstanding and highly recommended. In fact, it would take a couple of days to go through the park fully. Only grouse is that they should add water rides for the kids - my children were really looking forward to it and were somewhat upset when they realised there were none :(

More than just an Amusement Park. The Ocean Park is more than just an amusement park. Of course it has all those rides which young people would love queing for, and those games that can win you soft toys. What's more is it also comes with a full scale aquarium and many interesting animals including pandas and koalas. One can easily spend a day here. I enjoyed mine very much!
Interesting. A good theme park, though it can get very crowded. Our younger family enjoyed it very much, although it's a lot of walking.

Ocean Park. whether you are 4 or 80 years of age, the Ocean Park has many attractions for you. Breath-taking panorama view of the South China Sea, Marine Park show with dauphin, dare-devil roller coaster ride or under water view Aquarium. A must visit in Hong Kong.
Ok park. Went Ocean Park on Friday late morning, please get your admission ticket when reach the Admiralty MTR station (cheaper by HK$50 per pax).

Nice place for whole family. This place not only educates you about conservation but also you can have your share of fun. Lots of animals, mostly marine, quite a few animal shows, will keep everyone happy!arrive early ,as the park closes by 7.30pm

My grand son prefers this to Disney. A really good place to take kids. This was my grandson's favourite place. The Panda's and the Sea Lions were cute. Worth visiting in the week to avoid too many people. Also the cable car is a must, but take it on your way out, not on your way there, unless you like a lot of people. Restaurants are not brilliant.

Local Amusement Park. 30 years ago used to be a paradise. Now, it seems only catering to the mainlanders. Is it worth it. Yes, if you are willing to wait for each rides between 1-2 hours then yes, its worth every penny. But now overly priced and too commericalized..... The place stinks of squids so don't forget to wear a mask if you don't like how squids smell...

Good fun. Ocean Park is much bigger than Disneyland and you need to plan your day ahead. 6 year olds will enjoy the North and South Pole encounters and all the animal interactive sessions. We went on the Cable car ride and the view is spectacular. There are many rides for thrill seekers as well.Vegetarians you cannot find ANYTHING for yourselves here. We made do with noodles and broccoli with chilli sauce. We did not have time to search for other restaurants as everything takes quite a long walk. The North pole did not have the Polar Bear for some reason which was a disappointment. Then we took the Ocean Express which gives the feel of sitting in a submarine.It can get quite crowded though. But the lines are extremely long and cumbersome for every ride.

Dont go when its raining. Ocean Park is the other version of the disneyland. It is the marine version of the disneyland. If you look at the rides at ocean park it is more thrilling than disneyland. The only thing that makes ocean park that makes them unique is the animals.. you can see the animals closely(except for the pandas). We were so lucky that time because the one of the four giant pandas appeared to us, not that near to us but totally made my visit to ocean park. Ps: dont go there when its raining because youll be totally wet, even your shoes..

Iconic attraction in Hong Kong. If you don't want to face huge crowds, always arrive early in the morning or just visit when it's not a public holiday/holiday season. Also, never start playing at the bottom, just take the cable car, bus or train to the other side and start playing there. Food is okay but overpriced, so just bring/buy some food and hide it in your bag. What I don't like are the rude mainlanders so make sure they don't take your spot when lining up because they always jump the queue! Great rides though

Must visit for fun and knowledge for children. It has all the fun filled rides, rope way, internal train, zoo having animals and birds from around the world. Full one day trip and still time is insufficient if you go in details.

Good Place but very crowded on Public holidays.. There are many swings and they attract a huge rush, so try to avoid on holidays otherwise it's waiting for half an hour sometimes. As you enter rush to cable car station or to Ocean Express to reach THE SUMMIT, a station where all the good rides are. Outside food is not allowed , they check the bags. Closes by 7.30 pm. If you get a chance to go up to the Summit by cable car, then avoid dark without windows Ocean Express. Here you may find a line for single riders, they get a chance faster as compared to group or a family.

Great rides. The rides were great and exhilarating. Perfect for family day trips. There were great animals to see in cool encounters. There was a restaurant with good food for reasonable prices and getting there was easy.
Something for everyone. A popular attraction for many visitors...It's not difficult to get there..It can suit different interests...Food is a bit expensive though
A rare combination of sea, hill and marine creatures. Ocean park begins with a cable car ride and ends with a train ride. All the marine life thrown in between is the Bonus.A great half day trip.

Best Place. I just loved Ocean Park and dolphin show in it. We took a train from Monkok to Admiralty station. From Admiralty station we took 629 bus which goes till Ocean Park entrance. Rides are good for kids except the big ones, they are allowed everywhere. Aquariums, Panda , Penguins all are good to watch. We reached there by 11am and left at 6pm and covered everything since there was not much rush and waiting time was less. We ate at bay view restaurant where we got Indian food.

Terrific Time. WOW is the Word with excellent crazy rides and well maintained place this is a definite Star Attraction at HK. If you are crazy like me on the rides you will love the FLASH and Abyss Rides at this place. They are thrilling and Yeah terrific. There's much more for all age groups and nice mix of activities for everyone. Kudos to the team maintaining it

Got to love the animals. I am an animal lover so I like Ocean Park better than Disneyland. If you like extreme adventure and rides, and animals and animal shows, I would recommend Ocean Park. We were able to explore the whole place. I had a lot of firsts in Ocean Park. My first time to see a sharks, pandas, dolphins, dolphin and seal show. Their rides are extreme and better than Disneyland but we were not able to ride them all.To cross to the other side of the park you can ride their submarine train or cable car.

Worth a day. The rides are much more exhilarating and thrilling than the Disney ones. Couple of water rides are not to be missed. It has something for everybody. Don't forget to purchase the tickets from China Travel Services at discounted rates. All in all, an experience to remember.

Hong Kong Trip. On the advice from the hotel we travelled early to Ocean Park via an excellent bus service. Arriving 20 minutes before gates opened at 10:00. An interesting day visiting all sorts of things from sharks & Jelly Fish to Polar Exhibits. Forced to go on the water flume (but it was brilliant), got totally soaked. Luckily it was a hot day and soon dried out

A park for people who don't do theme parks. I love going here. Always aim for random mid-week days when it's quieter. Rides are fantastic and views from the top of the hill are wonderful. Ideal for park theme fanatics and those who "don't do theme parks". Head to the beach for sun-downers afterwards. Perfect day out.

Fabulous. As seasoned theme park travellers this park didn't disappoint. We love Disney parks but I wouldn't miss this one if you have the chance. Crowds were hardly a problem, being used to the queues in America they were pretty non existing here.

Awesome Awesome Awesome!!!!!. Most spectacular Animal park. It hosts the endangered species of the White Panda, the South Pole spectacular has the Penguins, the Fox, the Walrus, Seal.. really cool.Then the Rides which are on the summit are simply brilliant. It seems you are on the south China sea adding to the sheer thrill.And the rides themselves are impressive.The Summit is on a very impressive place with the beautiful cable car ride.All in all it is full fun.
An excellent park even for adults. Great rides, fantastic view. Food could be problem for some. Crowd and queue on weekends could be killing. Otherwise it a great family fun theme park.

Kudos for keeping the animals so well !. Loved the Polar adventure, and got to see the dolphins been taken care of by their trainers ! It was a pleasure, Great experience, lots of walking around and great food treats, a carnival sort of theme with games which could remind most of us of our childhood. All in all a must visit when in Hong Kong !

Attraction well worth seeing. Spent the whole day at Ocean Park which is a short taxi ride from Kowloon depending on traffic. There is so much to see here from a beautiful music water feature as you walk in to all the difference sea creatures to the beautiful Pandas. There are a rides, exhibits and even a cable car that takes you close to the exit at the end of the day. Enjoyed our day and recommend it for all ages, well worth it.

Ocean Park.. I was very happy to go to Ocean Park as the last time we were in Hong Kong, (2009) I was not able to go. It is amazing, lots to see and do. We saw the penguins, seal lions, seals and lots of fish. When we went to see the Panda's they were asleep but I managed to get a photo of one of them asleep. There is a lot to see and do. We had a terrific day and will go again if I'm ever in Hong Kong. day
Our family's favorite attraction. This place has rides, attractions, restaurants and panda. What more can you ask.There are hotels coming soon, too.

Excellent full day tour for kids. Its a must see for young children. It covered everything from a range of fishes to animals to joy rides.There is not many rides for young children but the other activities cover for it.must dos : the dolphin show; the waterfront aquarium; cable cartip: go up the summit by the train while going up and come down by cable car to save time as lines for cable car in the morning are long

IF YOU LIKE OYSTERS......... Go to Stanley Market and after some hard bargaining for various shopping items, go to the Promenade and the third bistro/restaurant/bar on the right is THE place. It is called MAIN STREET and spills out onto the pavement under a large awning. Their speciality is oysters, Irish, Scottish and Pacific. What a choice ! We have tried them all and they were all delicious so we go for whatever is recommended.

You'll need a day!. This is like an ocean themed Disneyland. Huge number of things to see, including walrus swimming over your head, polar bears and a dolphin and sea lion show. Rides are free! Not just for the young.
Nice and fantastic place to visit. A localized theme park visited many time of this place and you don't feel bored. Staff are nice and friendly
Kids paradise. Too big an island to cover in one day. Still kids enjoyed the same. The season when we visited was Halloween season , which added the zing in travel.
Good Option for family day out. Good Exhibits ,Good Rides.If only they could have decent options for lunch/dinner.Food options are totally not worth it in Ocean Park.

A worthwhile visit. Advisable to visit on a weekday to avoid crowds.We took the trolley ride up to the mountain early on to avoid wasting time standing in queue for the trolley. The queue can get pretty long.Struggled with directions within the park and English was an issue in some instances. Some employees did not understand English and hence were not able to direct us.Lot of adventure rides. The main attraction was the Panda and Koala enclosures apart from the very well maintained aquarium which are all on the lower hill which we visited in the late afternoon.The water ride was great...do not forget to carry a poncho if you want to avoid getting drenched by people around you trying to aim water guns from above.The north and south pole areas were also a pleasure to experience.

Huge park full of fun. This park is really huge! It's composed of 3 sections so it'll take more than 1 day to see everything even during the low season.Wear comfortable shoes since you'll be doing a lot of walking. This park has everything: fish, animals, and rides, most of which are quite extreme.I particularly like the panda area and the dolphin show. I'll definitely come back.

Ocean park-a must for families. Ocean park is a fantastic attraction for families with children. Our kids 13,11 and 8 had a fabulous time, as did my husband and I. The tip is to take the cable car over first and do the rides then come back for the aquarium and the pandas. We spent a full day there from opening at 10am and left at 7pm. The older kids went as single riders on a couple of attractions which gave them a couple of turns.

Not bas. The only way to like it for sure is to buy golden pass to pass all the queues without standing in them. Because scenery of the park (mountains, the sea, islands) is marvelous. But queues spoil everything. To go to the cable car you have to wait for half an hour during the weekday, and on the weekend it will be even worse. Each attraction is also around 30 minutes of waiting. When it started ratings and we put on our raincoats, the staff didn't allow us to take attractions, they said that the only way to ride is to put raincoats off. And of course no one wants to be completely wet after riding. But chinese do, so it didn't reduce the queues) P.s. Coalas were cute but sleeping)

Simply amazing and beautifully designed. I must say its a beautifully designed park. We had an amazing day there.. the views, the rides, the various shows, specially the dolphin show.. we loved it all.. If you have not booked your tickets in advance make sure you reach early enough because they have long queues for tickets. you need one full day to see the park.. If at all you are confused between disneyland and ocean park and you are not a Disney fan just go for this. You will absolutely love it.

So much fun!. Huge place. Make sure you take all day to enjoy all the rides and aquariums ... And drink enough water to keep yourselves hydrated lol. I endend up exhausted but loved it. Felt like a kid again.The cable car was the highlight.I recommend it for a day out with a group of friends.I went with me best friend and honestly couldn't have been better.mwe both loved it and have lovely memories of that day.

A great day out for all the family. Took the kids expecting it to be a day just for them but there was loads to do for adults too. Not just a theme park but educational and enjoyable. The only downside being food is quite pricey and the restaurants very busy. Would book in advance next time so as not to have to queue.

Hong Kong Ocean Park. If you wish to visit Hong Kong Ocean Park, do take these tips for a fun-filled day at the park:1. Check the weather condition before going to the park. It is really too cold since it is located at what I call as “mountain ranges”. Shows are also cancelled due to bad weather which can make your visit frustrating.2. Bring brellies and raincoats for I doubt that good weather will be permitted at all times. I think that it is really misty out there. 3. Wear comfy shoes. You will be spending the entire day walking and walking and walking at very long distances. Attractions are scattered and too far from each other. If I will compare it here, it’s like going to Hoyohoy then to Guimad and to Gala. Mind you, it is not just hills in Hong Kong Ocean Park that you’re gonna stroll to. These are mountains!4. Enter all portals to all attractions, theater shows, and rides for these are already included in admission. Make the most out of your time in Hong Kong Ocean Park!5. When in Hong Kong, stay at Oi Suen Guesthouse and buy your Hong Kong Ocean Park tickets there at a discounted price! For more information about Oi Suen, visit their website here.
Great day. This park is a must it has rides, animals on display, educational talks and the best soft serve ice cream (old Hong Kong) that I have ever had.

HK Ocean Park on a Sunday. Make sure you get the park guide upon entering otherwise you might get lost or pick a longer route to where you want to go. There's a english guide with descriptions of the attractions inside the park. Also, if you have enough time for planning, visit the website and plan all the attractions you want to visit before you get there to maximize the time. When you get there at noon and the queue going up to the peak using the cable car is long, use the express train up, then take the cable car down instead. When you're at the peak, there's a shortcut to the cable car queue inside the BayView restaurant.If you're interested in viewing the pandas, take note of the show times otherwise you'll find the panda asleep. Food in Ocean Park is not as expensive (about 60-100HKD) compared to HK Disneyland. We got 3 pcs pork buns at 30HKD (or 40HKD) near the entrance which is already enough for a quick snack. Bring water to save money and to keep hydrated because it can get really hot and humid. Avoid the park on weekends because it's very crowded. Senior citizens may get bored and irritated with the crowd.

Cool Park with a lot of rides. Ocean park is like 5 parks in one all residing on a mountain with a lot of walking because the park is so spread out. There is a free cable car and train to bring you from both sides of the theme park. There is a shuttle bus to the park from the MTR Station as they are currently completing a direct Ocean Park MTR station. Plenty of sea life, food and rides at the various parks so be prepared to walk.

Acceptable experience. The mainlanders totally spoiled the experience of my visit to ocean park. Recommendations to go in the early morning when they open to avoid them. Once they are in, they push around and present themselves as a nuisance to the other tourists. Suggestion to leave ocean park slightly after noon as that's the time the mainlanders arrive. Which means there's a lot of areas to cover in the morning!

Something for everyone ... Ocean Park has transformed itself into an excellent theme park, with something to see /do for Children and adults of all ages. My 4 year old loves the kids playground and if you get there early on a weekday, you can beat the crowds and have multiple rides on the carousel, frogger and mini train without having to wait in line. There are thrill roller coaster rides for the older kids and the aquarium, penguins and panda bears are a must see for the animal enthusiasts. The train is a convenient way to get to the other side of the mountain If you don't want to queue up for the cable car and if you come back by cable car, you pass by the old Hong Kong and can try the Chinese softie ice cream - yum. A great day out - just wear comfy shoes and bring lots of energy.
Fun theme park with rides and animals. The rides are fun, jelly fishes are beautiful, panda is a must see! Stunning ocean view along cable car ride.

great place for family, friends of all ages!. Theme park designed for all ages, especially good for families and friends! Public transport available (Bus and taxi). You can find the lovely pandas there too!
Nice Day with Family. Ocean park is a good way to spend day with Family. Could be very busy on the week end and bank Holiday.
fun and learning. a one-full day activity particularly when you have school age children, one of the must spot in Hong KOng

great day with family. if you already kwow hk or have more than 4 days in the city its worth a visit. panda bears+aquarium is great and also great views of the city.
also some amusement ( not sooo good)

For the young and young-at-heart!. Awesome rides and fewer people on the lines! The lower section called the Water Front includes Amazing Asian Animals, Whisker Harbour and Aqua City whilst the top section is called the Summit and includes Thrill Mountain, Polar Adventure, Rain-forest, Marine World and Adventure Land. Both sections are joined by a cable car and themed funicular railway. There is a good selection of both marine and Asian animal enclosures placed around the entire park. The Water Front includes red and giant pandas, primates, exotic bird aviary and the largest dome aquarium in the world, holding over 4000 fish. The Summit includes dolphins, walruses, seals, sharks, arctic foxes, snow owls, king and gentoo penguins, sturgeon aquarium and assorted rain-forest animals. The rest of the park consists of themed rides, eateries and shops. The top section of the park has quite a few steps and escalators to negotiate including the second largest escalator in the world.

Amazing family park. Reading about Ocean Park, HK, first time did not impress me much. But, after visiting the park, I have to admit that it is something very special and I'm very amazed with what I have seen in just few hours touring the park. The diversity of activities and nature of those activities are very unique compared to other parks. Taking the cable car is a MUST, even though the queue might be very long to take the cable car, but it worth the wait. The only down side of the park is food. As a foreigner who is not an Asian-food-friendly, I suffered to find something to eat.

amazing rides!wildlife!pandas.....too much to offer. It has a lot to offer which is difficult to cover in a single day. Divided in two parts, one part is dedicated to never seen before rides and other to animals.Rides are available catering to all ages. The rides are spine chilling and amazing. You can also see penguins in a special cold north pole adventure for them.There is a dolphin show which is worth seeing.You can see pandas, sea animals, fishes n a whole lot of aquatic life. The musical fountain show after sunset is different from the usual ones, based on a story or theme n full of fire, light n projector effects. Sure to visit when in Hong Kong.

Ocean Park... We found it better that the Disneyland, in terms of overall activities. However, small kids ( around 4-5 years ) may not enjoy the place as most of the rides do not allow them. For kids though, Ocean park does have a lot to see such as Penguins, Lots of ocean creatures like fishes etc, Amazon animals etc.

Fun @ Ocean Park. Ocean park was nice, having good quality and some thrilling rides. The views of the coastline were also breathtaking. The collection of the inmates (animals, fishes, birds) etc was awesome. My Kid loved the penguins, sea lions and the birds. Unfortunately the Panda was asleep and we couldnt get a good look at him up close. Must for kids.

Very good in Hong kong. I visit this place very first time though it is similar to one park in India and one in Singapore ,but I like rides here very much my child's enjoy here very much they see very big fishes over there we have some good food here we see dance also.i like this place.

So many things in one place. The best thing about OP is the two in one products that they offer. The first part is wet world that place the cute pandas and giant aquarium. Second part, which you have to form a long line in order to ride the cable car is where you can ride many thrilling and adrenaline rush coaster. I think this place worth a visit when you are in HK.

Great place for children and families. Well organised, fantastic acquarium. Great transport by train or cable car. Food could be better. We did not try the rides as we had a young child with us but overall this was a good experience.

Worst park in Chinese Holidays. It is very over crowded, particularly when Chinese schools are on holiday and lot of families come to the park. Management seems to be not limiting number of visitors and hence every ride has 90 minutes waiting which is ridiculous. Went there and came back without a ride!!
Surprising. Best place to on your own or in couple or with family. Many amazing things to discover as the big aquarium and the nice view you can see, if dare, from the top of the rollerkoster! 😊 ☺

Great Fun. Amazing views over the South China sea, great rides, terrible McDonalds kiosk, fantastic animals including the red and the giant pandas, koalas, wallabies (or kangaroos) and kookaburras. We missed the opportunity to try the cable cars out as the heavens opened up before we were going to go on but the underground train up the mountain was fun (and dry). Brilliant day out. You will need to get the bus from the MTR station (all clearly sign posted) but it's not expensive and there are loads of buses. Aim to arrive early in the day - it gets busy (although the queues are nothing like you get in most theme parks).

Love it !. I love to go the Ocean Park in Hong Kong. this park is a first world-class theme park and a premiere educational facility. An integrated urban resort with marine life attractions. they are suitable for solo, and family travelers. you can explore the park with a guided tour around the aquarium area. (paid a little bite of fee). there is lots of eatery for you to choose. the Cable car can overlook the view of harbour.

Ocean Park. Is a massive place, ideally need 2 days to explore it fully. The cable car ride is great, as are the views from the top. Can get very crowded especially with the Chinese tour groups, so keep ample time for waiting!
Great Theme Park. I believe this is a better bargain than Disneyland Hong Kong. There are many more attractions here. Food is expensive.

Specially located theme park good for all ages. Best for Halloween or when not busy. Some refurbishments needed. Visited Ocean Park during the occupation in October last year. We did not go for their Halloween night which the Ocean Park is best known for since I can't stand any scary jumpy things. If you like haunted house and if you are from very different culture it would be interesting for you as there are many unique local/ Asian elements put into the themes. "PRICES" They have been raising the price so much and this is too high for local standard. However considering how much they have invested and improved in the past years it's a pass for me. I can always get 15% discounts myself anyway. For tourist buy at some discount booths near the shuttle bus station. Be cautious to touting outside park entrance."TIMING" Weather was perfect. Not recommended to go in summer if you are not fit enough as the park is divided in 2 parts and is built on hill lots of walking is expected. A hot sunny day could go up to 35 degrees and lots of typhoon during July and August (I went during on and off Typhoon 8 before and the wind was scary). Check weather or get yourself ready before you go. Although it closes early on "RIDES" Due to the occupation it was not busy at all, we barely queued for anything and hence we had so much fun. The rides are decent but apart from the Hair Raiser none of them really worths long queuing time. Some of the very old ones really need refurbishment or reinvented. Though, going on rides in Ocean Park would be a one of its kind experience as many of them are built on top of hills and right next to sea. The view is spectacular and extraordinary on front seats! Highly recommended."NATURE"Meeting the Panda is a MUST-Do. but be aware this is up to these chubby adorable to show up or not so sometimes queuing for 1 hour during peak season does not guarantee you can meet them. There are two houses you can see them though. The one nest to the big eye goldfish room allows a closer look to them. Don't miss out Sea Jelly Spectacular and the dolphin show! You will be impressed! The park is very well done and well balanced in both educational and entertaining parts. "FOOD"Overpriced as expected in any other theme parks. I personally suggest to go for the booth between summit plaza and rainforest where their prices for chicken and fries make more sense than other places. Bring your own food to save budget."SOME UNEXPECTED SILLY FUN" You can shoot people who are on the Rapids for free...and unlimited. My boyfriend was so malicious enough and spent a good 10 mins shooting people in their faces. There are several shooting places, the one outside Expedition Trail's Exit has the best angle. He told me I have to add this in to let people like him to know... Have Fun
Not to miss aquarium. Like the panda, parrot, birds, fishes and the cable car. The cable car can overlook a specular view of the Hong Kong waterfront.

Half and Half. Half theme park and half zoo/aquarium. It offers a fun day out. Currently there is a lot of renovation, so if you visit in the next few months, be prepared not to have a full park at your disposal. The queue management is not handled very well which means if you have a long queue there is not much entertainment other than a fan blowing warm air in your direction and watching fellow fun seekers. Many rides were 'closed' for maintenance on the day we visited (a Friday) including the Hair raiser and the River Rapids. They can do this according to the T&C's without notice. The park gets really crowded at times and sadly not many of the park guests understand theme park etiquette. In fact signs constantly remind people to queue orderly - which they don't. Beware of guests not watching where they are walking as they are staring into a phone and selfie sticks and umbrellas become a real nuisance. The bird show is a waste especially for English speakers and the dolphin show was ok. The new aquariums are very good and the panda exhibit is very well done. Having done both the big parks in HK on this visit and if asked which I would recommend, at this time, I would have to say Disney especially since Disney have added some new thrill rides. This said, if you have the time, budget and the patience it makes a great day out. Bonus - you are done by 6.30 pm and that leaves more time for shopping.
Nice Experience. The rides were thrilling, particularly Hair Riser Roller Coaster and Water based rides. The Dolphin show was very good.

Nothing opened yet was still busy.. Not that impressed. The rides are old and worn out. Lots of the rides were not open. The food vendors insisted on selling only Korean Squid and coke.The only thing really good about this place is the incredible views which is located on the top of a mountain overlooking oceans.We were told a lot of hype about this place before we came. Even taxi drivers told us it was the best in Asia.I can tell you it is no where near the best in Asia. It's pretty ordinary.
fun. a great place to visit with big family. the rides are various. there is also some attraction and indoor aquarium inside the theme park

Fun day out. It'a a nice theme park, very clean and open. The cable car is AWESOME, a very memorable experience. I went here years ago and I still remember it vividly. Kids would love it. Definitely a novelty thing you kind of have to do once.

One Day Adventure. Ocean Park is awesome not only for kids but adults too. The rides are not the best but still fun, and more importantly, have a safe track record (unlike the temporary carnivals). There are a good amount of games, there's pandas, an aquarium, for those afraid of heights. The place is also relatively big, you can easily spend up to a day there. If you are going during holidays, fast pass is recommended. If you are choosing between Disney and Ocean Park, I would definitely choose Ocean Park!

Tips not to get stuck. Pretty good theme park with a variety of rides and attractions for all ages, the grand aquarium is huge and you can dine looking into it.The park is based in two separate sections you go between by gondola or tunnel train. At 4-6pm both of these ways have extremely long queues as family's rush back to the entry/exit side. The wait can be more than 120minutes; to avoid this I suggest heading straight to the adventure side when u arrive at the park and heading back to the entry side by 3pm to see all of the attractions.Most of the visitors are families and as a result children's rides have significant queue times and the adrenaline rides have very short queues(5-20min).The best way to get there and back is on the 629 buses, straight outside central subway station, you, can't miss it.The park is definitely worth a visit, but they do have captive dolphins(sad face), so If you have any compassion for cetaceans I would recommend missing the sea lion and dolphin show( queues will be shorter during this as an added bonus).

Fast service, suitable for families, thrill seeker and animals lover. It's worthwhile to pay a visit.The rides queue was fast especially thrilling rides. We enjoyed few animals show and tour. The touching one is the penguin show! It's a must watch. The show educates people about not to litter as it will cause pollution. I especially love that show. Recommendable to bring kids to watch it. You will not regret!

The things I wish I knew before going. This was a great family day out. It's a good theme park with a diverse range of rides and marine animals and some interesting shows. It's been well reviewed so here's some things I had missed, or just didnt know:1. It's built on a huge hill and is split in two parts. You have to take either the gondola or train between the two sections. Even so, it's really hilly in parts. There's a big escalator on the ocean side, but be prepared for some hiking... I knew it. Was hilly and quite enjoy walking but I found it tough going at times.2. There wasn't a published list (that I could find) of daily shows and attractions in chronological order. This info is all on the website, but we couldn't pick up a list at the gate and it's not on the reverse of the park map.3. If heading down by gondola, the access is actually under the gondola. It's not intuitive. Head for the dolphin show arena and follow the signs from there.4. We visited on a weekday and were there from the moment the park opened, went straight to the top and virtually had the place to ourselves for around 2 hours. There was no wait for any rides in this time. It became very busy after 1230/1300, mostly tour groups.5. This attraction is not wheelchair friendly in my view. We took the stroller and I could carry it up and down stairs and escalators at times if required, but I anticipate it would be incredibly difficult for a PWD.

Better than Disney. Ocean Park has come a long way in the past decade, its been under new management and its doing really great. The park has been renewed and there is lots of fun rides for the kids, the aquarium is absolutely my favorite place in Hong Kong. The view from the gondola is spectacular and you can see the ocean south of the Island. I certainly recommend this park over Disney unless you are a fanboy. Its more suitable for adults and kids alike and the queues aren't nearly as bad as they are at Disneyland. It will take you the better part of a day to get most from the park, so be prepared to be worn out by your kids!

Good but not for little kids. We had a full day at Ocean Park however their height restrictions are much higher than any other park we have visited in the world!! If your child is under 122cm don't expect to ride on anything. Our six year old boy is 121cm and wasn't allowed on anything (even the dodgem cars with an adult!!). Thankfully he loved the animals.We left the summit at 3:30pm and the cable car down was an hour wait (lucky we took it up ine morning - worth the trip) so went to the train and found ourselves stuck in the middle of some very pushy tourists pushing us over to get on the train down!!!! Definitely arrive at 9:30am to collect tickets and line up for the 10am opening to get to the cable car up at 10:30am. Most local tourist don't arrive until after lunch so most rides the older kids could do over and over.We also went on a Tuesday!

More could be done . Arriving into ocean park is great My top advice to everyone is to buy the tickets before the day you want to arrive at ocean park in the admiralty mtr station For a slightly discounted price My next advice is to arrive early and travel to the back of the park and work yourself forward as there tends to be a massive in flux and saturation of mainland tourist that will spoil your day out in the afternoon if you don't arrive back to the front of the park by the early afternoon This has also unfortunately put a lot of strain on the ocean park staff to even be able to smile and serve you properly. I have found that the best way is to enjoy your day out but please please don't judge on the mainland tourist as they still have a lot of learning and understanding in more westernised culture

go early. If you go early you will beat the asian rush as they appear to start arriving after midday. Some sections were closed down for renovations and repairs. Enjoyable day the scarier the ride less time to wait. In the grand aquarium beware the delay in queue is due to photo opportunity in yellow sub on entrance go to the left and say no picture wanted

Had a really good day. We are family of 4 (6yr & 12yr old). We enjoyed it a lot. My 12 yr old could go on all rides, 6yr old there was about 4 he couldn't go on but it wasn't an issue. Most rides you need to be 122cm tall. We went on a Wednesday & most of the day we didn't line up until afternoon we reached THRILL MOUNTAINS area and lined up for 30-40min per ride we expected that eventually though. Tips; weekday they don't open till 1030, close 630pm.Catch MTR to Admirality st and you can buy cheapest tickets at the Grey liner shop (I think it's called) but it wasn't opened just before 9am. Alternatively there is a tourist info shop just near EXIT B which is ocean park exit where tickets are still cheaper than park we saved about $100as a family. You get amazing views from this park, it's on the side of a cliff with ocean below you, awesome photos, park is very spread out so a lot of walking but there is a chair lift, escalators & train to help get you around.

Wonderful Attraction which reminds you of preserving oceans. The Ocean park is conveniently located near the Admiralty MTR station and there is a regular bus which goes there from the station itself. The aquarium at the ocean park is hugely educative about the various ocean species and how we can help preserve the oceans for a better future. Afterwards, we took a train to the summit and indulged in various rides and saw the various enclosures. The cable car ride from the summit is highly recommended. Also don't miss the dolphin show and the various animal enclosures on the summit. The food arrangements are also quite comprehensive.

Wonderful experience with Ocean Park. We visited this park on wenesday, 6th May. We enjoyed all rides and attractions as it was weekday and less crowd on most of the places. Shows were good. Enjoyed meeting Panda, Penguins and also dolphin show. Many many things in here. There is cable car inside in here also another option is train ocean express. Food is very expensive also and if you are muslims there are few halal restaurants. Over all had very good time and would definately recommend to visit this place.
excellent and varied entertainment. better than Disney unless you like Disney characters. Nice shows and amazing rides keep the family happy.

Even better than we expected. When visiting Hong Kong with older children we decided that Ocean Park would probably offer a better experience to them then Disneyland. But we didn't know it would be so much fun. Rides and attractions are decent and the views from the cable car spectacular. The dolphin encounter, where the kids can play with Dolphins in an intimate setting (needs to be booked separately), was the icing on the cake. Great park, period.

Much in need of updating. A theme park with a history -- and it shows. While it seems to remain popular among tourists, a number of the facilities are apparently in need of some up keeping. Avoid weekends and holidays if you cannot stand long waits and the crowds. The best experience is the cable car ride for its spectacular view.

Fun Fun Fun. I personally think that it is a must go spot for tourist with or even without children. Although it has a long history established quite some time ago in HK, it is maintained very very well and well organized. The show is extremely entertaining which makes all audiences laugh out loud, all dolphins and sea lions ... are very cute. My children loves it.
Nice place for kids. Rides, games, lovely cable car ride, few animals & marine life (decent collection).They let you carry food and water in the park......we did not know. The f&b is expensive.

Loved most of the rides, but food is super pricey for its quality. Most of the roller coasters and rides are amazing and really thrilling so you must do those except the water based rides like the raging river and another one whose name i forget, these are just not worth the wait. Also instead of waiting hours in line for the cable car ride, you should either use the ocean express to go up in the morning and then take the cable car down or wait till late evening to ride the cable car up The food in most cases is highly overpriced and very average in quality, would recommend spending as little as possible on the food there.

Must visit place for every family. If u r going with family this place is Must visit place for every family.
There's almost something for everyone in the family.

Amazed by how big the park is. The Ocean Park is a common theme park for the Hongkongers with many adult rides as compared to Disneyland. if you are a theme park person and only have 1 full day to spare, forget about disneyland, just go to Ocean Park. you will have much more fun there. It's a little inconvenient to get there now as you will have to take the MTR to Admiralty Station at Hong Kong Island and change to a public bus to get there. But not to worry, they seem to be building a Ocean Park Station just outside the theme park and it might be ready by 2017 i think!

The famous Ocean Park in Hong Kong!. We went there as a family together, the ticket is expensive. We wouldn't have gone if we weren't going together as a family and once in a blue moon. It is difficult to tell how Ocean Park can survive after all these years, the ticket is expensive. Some of the rides were good but had to queue up for ages. There was a lot of walking to do, really had to spend a lot of time there. Food and drinks were expensive and not much option, so not impressed with those at all. Overall, it is ok. We probably won't want to go back anytime sooner...

a theme park with lots to see. If you have a day spare with the family, this is the place to tire the kids out, be prepare for a good day of walking, the cable car provide a spectacular view but not for those with a healthy respect for height.
Must do. Now this is a park on many levels with so much to see and do and is a great day out,they have animals to see and roller casters to go on great day out.

Nice Theme Park. Good theme park to balance your desire for thrill rides. The other park in HK (Disneyland) is a bit low on thrill rides (with a good reason that the park is more for kids enjoyment than adults). But this park is full of thrill rides for adults.

Place for the whole family. It is a good place for family, friends and schools. Ocean Park has developed into a few fields, for example, study and playgrounds. Schools can arrange different tours for their students. Or some NGO will arrange tours for their members. People going there will have a good lessons on plants, mammals etc. I love going there. Apart from having opportunity to learn things about mammals, I will have chances to go on the rides!!
great place for a day!. good variety of choices both for adults and kids. Strongly recommend you stay to the end to see the laser water show!

FULL DAY of fun! Great to go with friends..Go early!!!. This theme park is meant for the young and old..It is very tiring for the very young and very old in my opinion. The land space of this theme park + zoo is massive.I patronised with my friends. We are in our 20s and 30s, and here are some money saving tips for all visitors..Purchase tickets at Admiralty MTR station, the shop is located in an area where there is a row of retail shops (and a Mrs Fields cookie counter, please note my information is effective as of March 2015), this row leads towards a dead-end and a hidden toilet. This shop is the 2nd last as far as I can remember.It IS THE cheapest we found, your savings is slightly more than HK$100 per ticket. You’re welcome!!  :)If this shop does not exist, there is an alternative. Another shop located along Exit B, facing the staircase. It is not as cheap as the first mentioned, but still, it is still cheaper than buying tickets directly at Ocean Park.Next, walk out of the MTR basement via Exit B, and take bus service 629, it is a 1 way fee of HK$10.60, or simply tap your tourist Octopus card which you can loan during your trip. The bus ride is very fast and it is a direct service, unless you take a new service, 629A which has a few stops. (Please plan your visit to reach the MTR station as early as 9.30am for a weekday, so you can enjoy the entire day in Ocean Park..)Wear comfortable shoes, be prepared to walk alot, and bring a bottle of water/drink too (to save yourself on the first drink, because food and drink get very expensive in touristy places of interest as you know, about HK$27 for a bottled drink). I was very surprised to see some women wear like they came from work, in heels and dainty handbags. lol.There is not much of a need to rent a locker, it is not cheap. Unless you have bulky carry-ons? Still, even with rides, you can safely place your belongings and even slippers or shoes if you think they might drop out, in the designated area/shelf/baskets.These areas are safe as long as you remember to collect your belongings after the ride.With friends, we "strategized" our visit to the park by taking the cable car all the way up, playing as many major rides as possible, and come back down via the express train to see the animals featured near the child-friendly rides..No regrets on that, the view of the entire cable car ride was breathe taking and yet very scary because of the amazing height shifts from one pole to another whilst transferring up!!Biggest regret was to take the red & yellow looking rollercoaster ride first (near the penguins enclosure) and being greedy, we sat that 3 times straight! The more I sat for that, the dizzier I became.Other rides aren't that bad, the bumper cars brought entertainment to us, whirly bird that was relaxing, so did the fast moving (no upside down loop) rollercoaster that went 2 rounds at 1 go.My highlight of the visit was the various animal exhibits (sharks and rays, jelly fish, sturgeons, snow fox, panda, goldfish section, giant salamander!!)..OH, and the mine train rollercoaster on another side of the theme park, that ride is VERY VERY OLD but maintained of course. The fear factor is the sound made when our carriages go up the slope, and the 2 drops that brings your stomachs flying while you get to overlook the entire hill to the ocean!!That was the most scary and exciting ride within the park, sat that 3 times and my heart told me to stop riding because I couldn't stop shaking from the adrenaline.There is a river log ride near this mine train rollercoaster, but it was closed for quality checks when we visited. If I am not wrong, its a water log ride that eventually brings you to a steep drop along with a big splash (facing the ocean too). Ponchos a must if you want to stay dry.Which brings me to a ride that is a waste of time, a rapid river ride that is located in the area near the red & yellow loop rollercoaster. Ride it only if you brought a poncho of if you are prepared to get wet. If not, you’ll definitely get soaked, be it your head, body or legs!!Another tip would be to ask nicely for a poncho from some1 who exits the ride, so that you don’t end up spending more money. Some of these ponchos have been rotating from person to person in order to save money!!Food is also not a problem with handful of choices, but just be prepared to spend. Game stalls galore in at least 3 sections of this park, and its all in the name of fun for a sum of money to play.Only managed to watch 1 animal show (yes this place is massive, there’s insufficient time to see and do everything), where they featured walrus, seals and dolphins, it was quite heart warming but also..Sad if you sat there the entire time to watch, somehow you’ll know what I mean.My overall experience of this visit was great, except the sudden increase in patrons after 2pm (this was a weekday, a Tuesday).Mainly visitors of PRC came in tour groups, and its unfortunate that I’ve to say this, but they really spoil your entire experience. Talking at the top of their voices even in an enclosed place, cutting queues without hesitation as if we were invisible, doing stupid things such as standing over the yellow line of safety, bending far over the barriers at the express train and sticking their head out. And when the train arrives, they push their way in and run for dear life, all for a prevcious sear,for a ride that was a really short trip back down to the main area near the entrance.. My only line of defence was to elbow my way, block and ignore, I was thoroughly annoyed for several parts during our play time there. Other than that, the staff in this park are great, the entire environment makes you feel lifted in spirits and full of cheer. We played all the way till 7+pm, left for Admiralty MTR and popped back into town for dinner.I would recommend patrons to go back to Admiralty MTR the way you arrive, by bus. Taking a taxi cab is expensive in my opinion.I would revisit this place again because of the high entertainment value for my friends and I.  Hope my review helps! Thanks for reading. :)

Crowded and unethical treatment of animals. While there's been a lot of effort put into this local competitor to Disney, Ocean Park is intensely crowded and, unfortunately, I cannot support the way the animals are treated. Their aquariums are absolutely packed with massive fish that should not be restrained under such conditions. Best to avoid.

Must visit. It was a great experience for us. We visited here with our 2 daughters 7 and 9 years old. They loved it. We did all the rides many times. The waiting time for the rides can be over 40 minutes but it was worth to wait. If you are in Hong Kong you must visit this place.

Great open space for ocean animals and amusement parks. Great aquarium with amusement park at the southern area of Hong Kong Island. When you come here. don't expect to be brainwashed like at Disneyland Hong Kong. You may choose to visit the aquarium exhibits and shows, or enjoy spectacular views at the open air restaurants, or soak yourself into exciting rides with stunning view of the ocean. In fact, some of the roller coasters there offer the most stunning views in the WHOLE WORLD! No kidding. Crowd control is generally excellent, although the staff usually cannot do much with the commonly aggressive, line-jumping mainland tourists (Disney do a much better job dealing such).Another must-visit is the Dolphins show.The lines to the gondola line may be long but it's a must-do while visit Hong Kong. The view is absolutely breathtaking, several cuts above the Nong-Ping 360 (which is a rip-off and unreliable).
Avoid weekends. super crowded, do visit early before the tour groups come in. Check the performance schedule online before you visit, so you can get the best out of the trip.

Which do you choose, the rides or take in the rest of the park ?. It a good day out but up to you what you want to do, rides or check out animals and shows. We gave the rides a miss to do very thing else. The first thing was being on a large hill the view was amazing taking it from the cable car and sea animal show. The local who drop us there said take the cable car to the top and start your day there and work your to the bottom to beat the morning crowds. He was right got to take very thing in as long as you don't leave to early. The one thing that was at the top of my to do list was to see the Pandas and l was disappointed we only got to see one Panda who seem so distress just continually walking around and keep stopping at it den door for awhile hoping to be let in and then on wards to walk around again. The others seems to be in their dens with just a TV screen to show us. Apart from this we had a good day out

Loved the Pandas. We only went to Ocean park to see the panda's.... well thats what we thought...and ended up spending 4 hours there. The aquarium is spectacular and well worth a visit...and as for the Panda's WOW is all I can say. An-An and Li Li were in a separate enclosure and didnt look very happy....but the panda that was in another enclosure was totally gorgeous and happily munching on its bamboo...it made me quite emotional seeing it and just wanted to give it a cuddle....did the next best thing and bought a toy panda instead.. We are not really into rides these days but did enjoy the Dolphin show and the cable ride to it.

Entertainment for the Entire Family..... Rides... attractions for the entire family..You get to see the penguins.. Walrus ( from under the water).. Kangaroos..Thrilling rides of Roller Coasters.... and other rides for children...

Educational Sightseeing Event. The venue is well managed, clean and maintained. Judging by the volume of guests visiting, it is a sightseeing hot spot, suitable for couples, elders, families and foreigners. Highly recommend it.

Must Visit Park when in HK. It was a nice and fun visit at the Ocean Park especially if visiting with family and children. Train ride or cable car transport is a nice way to connect from one place of the park to another. My daughter was happy to see the penguins and the panda. Only I recommend visit period during cold months as summer months may be decrease you enjoyment as not much shaded place are available. Be sure also to be there early so you can check all the places.

Fun + Adventure = Ocean Park. The Ocean Park is situated on a hill which makes the view from the adventurous rides super amazing. To reach the upper mountain you can take Ocean Express train or cable car. On ground level there are many theme based cafes, Aquarium, Dolphin show and eating outlets which are little expensive. On level 1 and 2 are many amazing fun rides for kids and brave hearts too. I like adventurous rides so my favorite ones were Hair Raiser, Flash and Dragon Roller Coaster. There are many rides and other places to explore so take out 4-6 hrs for this visit. In evening there is spectacular fountain show with 3D effects and music.

It was ok. We travelled with 2 kids ages 4 and 8 ... We had great expectations but I was not too happy ...we went on a Monday and it was so crowded ...groups and groups of people from eveywhere... The park is divided into 2 parts the water front and the summit ..you need to go from the waterfront to the summit either by train or cable car ...we could not get the cable car to the summit so we took the express train it too was packed ...when we reached the summit all the rides were eccentric....my little one could not go on any ride except the merry go round ...and what was more annoying was that in some games like shoot the balloon or throw the ball in the hole etc they cost 100 dollars a try ...that was unacceptable.. The food was crap....(for Hong Kong's standards)... We came back the water front and there was a play area and my kids played there ...the aquarium was good ....The animals were kept well..but other wise the rides are only for teenage kids ...not worth the money

A must see parc on Hong Kong Island!. On of the better parcs that i've visited. The park is devided in 2 parts by the mountain in the middle. A lot of attractions, but also a lot of people. The park offers a great value for you money. If you have a day to spare, don't hesitate!

Fun day out. I went here for the day with my Husband and our 2 kids (ages 6 & 8 years old).We had a good day and enjoyed the rides, games, aquarium & cable car. It has a lot to offer for all ages. We found the food & beverage very expensive but I guess that’s because it is a big tourist attraction. The views from the cable car are amazing and this was one of the highlights. We took the train to the upper level of the park and we took the cable car back down.
