It’s lots of fun and definitely worth the visit but prepare yourself for the long lines as you queue for everything. We queued for over an hour for the cable car so make sure you have a hat, sunblock, water and lots of patience!

Must do - Great place for all ages.. Brilliant place for an full day outing (try and do 2 days to see everything). Kids will love this place. There are strollers available for small children for a fee of $100 Hkd. There are 8 clear sections. Each section is very clearly marked on the guide map and has all the information required. You can choose based on what you need to do based on the age group you are travelling with. For kids the best place is the the grans aquarium, water front plaza, whiskers harbour, the big carousel that are there, marine world which has the penguin show (must see check for timings), Panda sighting etc. There is thrill mountain, rain forest & adventure land for the adults. One should use the cable car to go to the summit and use the Oriental express train (which is a good experience) for returning to the base location. Lots of shops and restaurants available inside. Again very few options for Vegetarians. Outside food is not allowed. Overall Absolute value for money and great place for kids and adults.

Not worth the visit. I expected much more fun and amusement from Ocean Park. I was quite disappointed by the animal exhibitions because the enclosures were quite small and the animals looked sullen. The koalas and wallabies, for instance, looked especially morose because they were in a building that featured no sunlight and was too air-conditioned - which is not the proper environment to house these beautiful creatures seeing as they're from a warm, sunny climate such as Australia. The people who work at the attractions and enclosures don't seem to do much because there were dozens upon dozens on people cutting the lines to all the attractions, which was angering by the end of the day. I wish the employees would enforce no shoving and no cutting rules to keep some order. The theme park with the roller coasters was the more enjoyable section because less people pushed on those lines.

香港的海洋公园果然名不虚传！. 一天真的是走不完啊！ 一个价钱，那么多精彩的东西看和玩. It is a must go destination where everything is under the sun all for the price of one. We got there in the afternoon but we do not have the time to see everything. The crowd was manageable though there were some long queues for some rides. 一个字 - 赞！

awesome theme park. it was really worth it. complete theme park with ride, arcade, view, and educations. try to come on the opening hour and go directly for cable car before it takes so long to wait. the view from cable car is amazing. and also take "the tower" in H location (you can find it from the map). you can see all over view of the ocean park. overall, it was really awesome and worth it.
some fun and more run of the mill. if youve done disney world before this it is a letdown. it has a few rides but the dolphin show is great.

Must See. First we decided not to go there as it would be repetitive just like any other amusement part. But when we eventually went, it would have been an experience missed. Water show at the end was amazing. Panda is a must watch. Some of the rides we wanted to go were closed by the time we reached.

Dare and be amaze. I really wanted to go to Ocean park.why? It's like the biggest amusement park there is, with sea animals included.The Hair raiser, Mine Train, raging River & Cable Car- just stole my heart & I just got to try it.I was scared of rides before, one that turns you upside down, and literally lose your sense of direction.But To me, getting to ride it, is just One Achievement in my life. and being able to not close my eyes in the Ride, was worth it, even though I was Shivering and my heart almost fall out of my chest. I still dared.Why?Cause I'm afraid, and i want to overcome my fear by knowing how much will i fear once I tried it.But when the ride is over & I'm still alive. Then I know, there is nothing to be scared of and the experience was Wicked. I screamed AGAIN, AGAIN to my stricken brother.The walk around the Park was painful, but the things I saw and experience, made me forget all of it.https://justcuriousz.wordpress.com/2015/05/01/hongkong-day-2-ocean-park/

Excellent experience. My 2 year old son love this place. My husband love it because we can rent trolley here so he doesnt have to carry one during our travel. I love it here because of the halal food available just at the food court nearby the entrance. There is only nasi ayam available in the halal menu and the chicken is cold. So better carry a takeaway if it is not into your liking. We just eat it and it ok for us as we put the chicken inside the hot rice before eating it. We love everything about this place and will come back again.

1 day is not enough. Lot of fun for kids and adults. But to enjoy the park, you need your kids to be little old may be 7-8 yrs, most rides are for little older Kids. The animal and the variety were super.

Nice place to spend the whole day with the kids. This is place for the young as well as for the young at hearts, spend the entire day here, just do remember to bring extra shirt and towel particularly for the young ones specially during summer time when the weather comes hot and humid.Water and food are a lil bit pricey compare to the city price but what do you expect...this is a theme park that's why...water are allowed and sandwiches but rice and noodles are not.Definitely a must see and place to visit when your in Hong Kong.
A fun filled destination. The park is a must visit. Lots and lots of ride and interesting things to do. U get to see the penguins and the giant panda. The rides are very good as well

Enjoyable place. Ocean park in Hong kong is an amusement park combined with the zoo and aquarium .The amusement park located on one mountain and the zoo is located in another mountain,but it is connected together by the cable car.I went for many rides with my dad,and it was fun.Also,there are many rides that kids in young age are able to play.The aquarium and zoo are wonderful,I saw a lot of animals that I’ve never seen in my own country.It’s a nice place that’s worth for spending whole day inside.It’s an enjoyable place for people at every ages.

30 years ago when I was still a kid.. memory and enjoyable.. It is not a typical theme park as Ocean Park has all rounded activities for adult, kids, family to enjoy a day with friends or adventures of roller coaster and swing. Be prepared as it is outdoor and weather permitted for some "too hot and humid day" or "too cold that you want to stay inside" it is a great view of the southern part of HK island and a good day of outing to get some fresh air than staying in the shopping or business area of Hong Kong urban culture. I really like their way changing from years to years with Halloween theme and haunted house, sea life and now even better with more like evening visit. 30+ years ago when I was a kid, that brought me a very enjoyable day and happiness. Right now after 30 years and I still love this place.

Worth every penny!. The cable car is a must, glass bottom even better. We took a tour, which included the fishing village (mind blowing to walk around there) the big Buddha and the cable car. I was delighted we did. Spend the money, get the memories:)
better than disneyland. rides are good , better than disneyland , good rides , not too much of walking all day , of course you do require a full day for this ! good atmosphere!

Time of my life. I am not a theme park fan and i wasnt sure if i wanted to go there to begin with but boy i was wrong. I went there around Halloween and the whole place was done up in the halloween theme. I had a ball. The rides the food and everything a theme park has, this place has that and a lot more. The haunted houses, the dolphin show, the shark tank EVERYTHING. The cable car ride up the mountain is awesome. One tip though even a day is not enough for this place so when you enter have a look at the map and decide what all you want to see. This place has really long queues!!

Fun rides!. I'm not really a daredevil and my friend would agree to that but I enjoy some of the rides in ocean park. However my favorite is the animals; they are so cute!The best roller coaster was under renovation when I was there so I couldn't ride it :(

Variety and something for everyone. There is so much to do here!If you can get here right on opening, make a bee-line to the cable car to ensure you don't have to wait too long and get straight up to the summit to enjoy the awesome attractions up there.The rides up at the summit were amazing with the ability to take in the view around the island fantastic while your going on a crazy roller coaster, or walking to your next ride.The variety is fantastic with the penguins, arctic fox and seal and walrus exhibitions all fantastic and something for all of the family. Equally interesting was the Shark area and the jellyfish area.All of the rides were amazing... as was the view from the Bay View restaurant.There was lots of opportunity to purchase souvenirs (which we did!) as well as photos from our rides.

Simply wunderbar!. The ocean park is wonderful if you concentrate on the rides - river ride, mine train and many more... Easily enjoyed by children above 8 years and adults alike. Real fun and worth the money!

Great day out with the kids. A great amusement park to spend a day or two whilst in Hong Kong. Easy to get to, reasonably priced, great rides & attractions, & awesome views from the cable car & roller coasters. Arrive early on a weekday & forego the cable car to catch the train straight across to the other side of the park to enjoy all the rides for a couple of hours before any crowds arrive.The McDonalds at the far end is the best option for ice creams & treats & probably the only option for coffee. The sealife (seals & dolphins) show & bird show are good if not a little corny. Make sure you catch the cable car back & stay for the final show at 7:30 at the main entrance: you wont be disappointed. Our highlights included the Arctic & Antarctic exhibitions, shark aquarium, Polar Explorer rollercoaster, Wild West Rollercoaster, Rapid River Logride, The Rapids, The Pandas, Cable Car & final show. My kids enjoyed it so much that they chose to return there the next day instead of going to Disneyland.

Loved seeing my partners face as the cable car went over the cliff. Ocean park, what can I say. The perfect mix of everything. Flora, fauna and rides.This makes a great day out for adults and children alike. You can pace it to last the whole day and if you want to see everything you would need the whole day. The pandas are just as cute as you would imagine from all the Facebook videos you see flying around. It is kept clean and the ques etc are managed efficiently.There is a good selection of food outlets inside and the cable car journey upto the top of the park is so beautiful and so much fun. There is too much to go through really but well worth the money in my eyes.

Amazing place! totally worth the money and time... Brilliantly made...the dolphin shows and other shows were completely fantastic...it is a must visit...takes up one entire day but totally worth it and worth the money.the shops there sell very cute souvenirs.vegetarian food within the park is a problem so suggest you carry some snacks.

Woow, Speachless to this Attraction. Wooow, I do not know what to say, It just wow, Hongkong has great attractions, It was unbelievable how big it is, there were some rides and cable car, it is really great experience for the whole Family.. All families should visit this place and HongKong. A great country and nation.

It was all good except.... As per the title, ocean park is good as its is packed with alot of attractions and it is definitely a place that i would recommend for everybody. the only setback that i can think of would be encounters that i had with the rude and extremely inconsiderate tour groups from you-know-where. it was supposedly to be a very fun and relaxing day, but it ultimately turned into a frustrating day that i couldnt wait to get out of. I visited ocean park on a thursday, and it was already loaded with you-know-who tourist. so, would suggest to avoid the weekends at all costs!
Unbelievable. We had a simply brilliant time. Did not expect much and was over come with a sensational time. Arrived at opening and left at closing, highly recommend to all

Ocean Park - Hongkong.. Truly adventrous. We liked everything..The park is divided mainly in two parts - one part has more of marine life display and other part has rides.The marine animals was superb. Best we liked was penguins. There were hundreds of them.. running and swimming around.. Just superb. The variety of fishes was also good.The rides here compared to disneyland were more breathtaking.The ocean views from few spots were also superb.The park is located in two different levels. You may use trains / cable cars or escalators to go from one level to another.Overall a MUST SEE attraction if you are at HKG for a vacation.Note - You need minimum of 8-10 hours to completely enjoy this park. So plan accordingly.

More than seeing the ocean creature. You can definitely expect more than seeing ocean creature in the park. They have a lots of exciting rides and games which enhance your experience. Besides sharks, dolphins and fish, there are so much more to look at. Panda is the attraction that amuse most of the visitors.
baby rides. most of the rides here are for the kiddies, great place to visit the aquarian and sit on the star wheel.
Little Expectation, Big Surprise. Pretty incredible rides with manageable queues, great view, fun experience and the animal show with the dolphins and seals was surprising and impressive!

Full on fun for a day . I visited Ocean park yesterday and i had zero expectation on it and didn't knew anything about it, went with some colleagues . And it turns out that the place is amazing! Even though it was weekend and had lots of visitors it didn't feel crowded because of its size. Only queue i had to stand was for Cable car as its not managed well and sometimes one person travels in a car which can accommodate 6 people. The boring part in Park is the Ocean express, just don't have any expectation on it and think of it like a train.On the top there are lots of fun rides like roller coaster etc. Also the best once are the Polar animals, Penguins, Arctic Fox, Seal . I loved the penguins and seals , i would rate it the best thing in the park as its endangered animals and rare species. And then there are some water rides and restaurants at the top. We just stood in the cable car queue for an hour! and came back to bottom again to see the Panda, it wasn't doing kung fu though :P there are 3 pandas.Other cool thing inside is the big aqarium which had lots of fishes and octopus. Overall i liked it and got tired at the end of day. But as i am a vegetarian i could not find any food inside except for the ice cream . so better carry your food.

dont go if its a holiday. this park does not quite know what it is. its not quite an amusement park nor an ocean park. We had to deal with terribly push tourist groups and long cues. the aquarium is very good and off course there's pandas and that makes up for the push and shove just. the chairlift ride gives you great views. take form the top the cues are much shorter

Great amusement park combining zoo and adventure themes. This park is bigger than HK Disneyland and you'd probably find yourself too tired to visit all of the sites.The recommended sites to be prioritized are:1. The Grand Aquarium2. Ocean Park Tower where you can see the great panorama of HK from heights3. Arctic Fox DenYou can travel from the low land to the high land and vice versa by either cable car or train in The Waterfront Station.

One of the best amusement parks i've been to !. It's huge and the whole family would enjoy the day there. from little children to teenagers and there parents too . Don't miss it out i guaranty you will have a blast . Just make sure the weather is nice n cool .

Better ways to spend a day. We got slightly discounted tickets buying them at the MTR station before getting on the bus. The bus ride was easy and convenient. The park had a large crowd waiting for it to open on a Wednesday. Having just experienced Disneyland we found Ocean Park a bit of let down as it appeared to have little thought go into its design. Some of the rides were nice and the fountain show at the end of the day was very good. If you want to ride the cable car be prepared for a long line up regardless of the time of the day. The Panda exhibition was very nice, but the aquarium which I was thinking would be a centre piece was very lacking and mediocre. Food options were regularly available with the same kind of options you would expect at any theme park. Whilst not as expensive as Disneyland if you have a choice to do only one I would thoroughly suggest forking out the extra money and going to Disney instead.

Great eye-opener experience for the young ones. Don't like the queue when it's too overcrowded, especially with the big tour groups arriving around noon. The variety of animals shown there are quite attractive and refreshing, as compared to normal zoo.

Good, but would not plan a second visit. the theme parc has a nice concept between amusement parc and education for kids. Quite nice but as I am more a thrill ride seeker i prefer to visit other theme parcs. Furthermore is the decoration in the attractions quite poor. They have many attractions with animals that are very nice but the real "attraction parc attractions" are poor there is only one good rollercoaster. But the part with the animals is very good. Also nice shows and most important is the final show at closing time at the water part of the parc. Very nice show with many special effects. I really recommend to stay in the parc till the end of the show.

One of the best places in Hong Kong. Many rides, shows and many options for good entertainment with family. You need one full day for this and if the weather gods are supporting you then this can be the best Memory of Hong Kong.

The Better of the two theme parks in Hong Kong. Much more interesting and entertaining than the Disneyland Hong Kong. It takes a full day to enjoy all the rides.We booked the tickets online and had the convenience of entry into the park. The dolphin and bird shows shows are one of the highlights of the park. Do take the early shows to avoid crowds later.Overall, a must do when in Hong Kong :)

Too many mainland people.....awful!. The theme park is interesting and inside is very large. You can enjoy only if you do not bother with many mainland people......You need to wait for an hour for the cable car....all other games inside have long queue....Awful experience......

Good Day for the Family. This is better than I expected. First off, like everything in Hong Kong, it's easy to get to.
The animal attractions are great, rides you can probably find anywhere in the world, but the kids liked them anyway.
Food prices where not as much as I thought.
Overall, Great day had by all!

Extremely Crowded (More than expected). I am a thrill seeker so I am not particularly impressed with the rides, ok, Hair raiser wasn't bad. But overall I was unimpressed and uninspired. I would not recommend to go with friends who are looking for thrill.
I knew I had to queue but it was a little too crowded (worse than Disneyland) on a weekday.

Great day by all. We chose to visit the park on a weekday which was a great idea - he longest wait for rides was 15 minutes and was easy to get around. Between us we went on most rides and sore majority of the animals - there is definitely something for everyone! Easily accessible on the bus or via taxi for a reasonable price. Downside would be the queues in the afternoon. We spent 30 minutes in the line for the aquarium which was quite frankly hideous. The customers from mainland China were pushing and shoving us, cutting queues and yelling. There was even a fight between 3 men waiting in line which was very unpleasant. It certainly put a negative twist on the day. Would definitely recommend to families and groups alike - also be prepared to get wet!
Great day. We are 3 adults over 30. We arrived on opening time and left when it closed. Was a fantastic day. The roller coaster over the side of a mountain was a thrill
nice place to adults and children. ticket is expensive, but part is very nice - there is zoo with panda there, different rides, amusements there, show with dolphins (we spent there the whole day)

Was just an amazing day. You will need a full day. Ince you buy a ticket you dont pay for anything more. Well apart from food and drinks. The Penguins and Panda's were a high light. Just fantastic to see them running around and the panada having a feed right in front of us. I'm afraid of heights but managed the cable car (just, my husband said i left inprints in the centre metal pole where I was hanging on for dear life) there are various rides from thrill to very sedate. We did most. I would highly recommend a day here for families and couple's.

Great Place for Kids. Took our baby son here for the 2nd trip in February. Last time he was just over one year old, and he loved it. This time he liked it even more as he starts to appreciate things and having more interaction with the animals. He liked the panda, dolphin show, sea lion and walrus, and he really enjoyed the Grand Aquarium. While he's too young to take the rides, he liked watching other people having fun over there. He still remember the cable car ride two months after. We'll bring him back.

Another relaxing day. A very relaxing place even on a Sunday (19 April) with obviously less people than we last visited. The queuing time for games like Splash was only 5 minutes.The recently opened Australian Adventure House was great. About 50 people were allowed inside at a time. Koala Yau Yau was especially active. Probably the first time I have seen a koala moving so much. :pThe educational boards were informative and the staff were nice.Kids of 8 and 10 had an enjoyable time at the children's playground, too.

Wonderful place and must visit. Wow... I was speechless seeing the evening light and sound show.. This park has everything for everybody. I spent whole day here was and was clueless how the time was going. Every place in this park had unique attraction and meticulously designed. This park has sea life, animal life, exciting and dangerous rides and many more. You should not miss this one if you are in Hong Kong
Amazing Day with friends. go on the ride, cable car is amazing for photoshoot, see panda, enjoy a big day in ocean park, i win a soft toy also
Fun Place!. Went there with my boyfriend in the Easter Holiday, and it was crowded, full of Mainland tourists. Actually they are out of manner, keep pushing and cutting while lining up.

Fun and awesome place. Visited the park with my kids. We had great experience here. This place is well maintained. But the food was expensive in the restaurant. Tips for travellers when you visit here is you should go to summit first using the train express, and then by cable car you go to waterfront. dont waste your time at waterfront when you have arrived here, just go to summit. You can see the waterfront after finish the summit.

Brilliant theme park!. Spent a day here this week and wasn't enough to see and do everything. Would recommend two days here.The park is spread out and has an upper and lower section. Weather was overcast on the day we visited. On a clear day, the views from the cable cars and the rides on the upper level would be awesome.There are heaps of rides and the rollercoasters were great with views of the sea.There are a number of animal exhibits and shows to break up the day.Value for money is excellent and park is different to Hong Kong Disneyland, so no doubling up by going to both.We went on a Saturday, it was very busy, particularly from lunchtime. Would suggest avoiding the weekend if possible.
Bask in childhood once again. Have fun, go on the rides, see the Pandas. Do not be shy on the rides! Let your inner child emerge. Plan to spend a full day here.

Fun place & well maintained, shame about the tourists!. I recently took my 11 year old sister for a fun day at the park....get there early in the morning or face massivly long lines of mostly Chinese mainland tourists. The day started out fun and there were very short lines for rides. At 4pm the park became extremly crowded & this was a Thursday. My only complaint is that there should be park staff to monitor the lines.... there were so many toursits cutting the lines for the Hair Rasier roller coaster that we decided to leave as it was shameful. The line back on the cable car we had to wait about an hour and a mainland tourist subsequently vomited on my little sisters leg. Disgusting! I recommend getting there early and if you must return to the main entrance take the train and avoid standing in line for the cable car. Secondly......avoid the disgusting food on offer.

Surprising adventure. Went because it was close to our hotel. Great time of the year to visit in March. Got there at 10 when it opened and did not have any crowds once we enter. Great time with the great panda and red panda. Skyway was scenic and a break from the heat. The walrus and penguins were displayed well and provided very personal time with the animals. The aquarium was awesome with great variety and exhibits. There were many rides but we did not have time to go on any - standard roller coasters, etc. The food was great and reasonably priced - roast duck, noodles.

Good day out but big tour groups this time. We visited last year and loved it, this year was still good but super busy on a Friday. Massive tour groups racing around shouting at each other, we didn't seem to be able to get away from them! They were mainly looking at the animals rather than big rides but v rude and pushy! We got our tickets on our Dragonair flight as there was a bit of a discount and was easy. Not sure why they don't sell online. We got the bus 629 from the star ferry at 10.05 am which got us there for 10.30, opening time. We had bought rolls at subway at the star ferry point as had remembered the food wasn't great. When we arrived there was a bag check and all they seemed to be looking for was food as didn't even open smaller bags!! A very surly security lady told us we weren't allowed food and told us to go out having queued in the line. We went to sit right next to security on the wall to eat our sandwiches and she got really mad and started calling backup as if we had a weapon and insisted we go out! We then had to queue up again. I am sure their website says you can't take food but we hadn't read this and thought they were very rude and not at all interested in security. It is also annoying how many photos they want to try and sell to you during the day at rides and attractions and won't take no for an answer, you have to pose. Overall the kids still had a great time, ride queues reasonable, busier in the afternoon. Had to wait about 30 mins to get the cable car at 11am but fine once up at top level. Only saw 1 panda this time, super cute fast asleep great viewing. The other 2 pandas were in their rooms and not coming out!! - maybe too many noisy tour groups. Kids enjoyed the Dragon ride with its 3 upside down loops. It was a bit rattling on your head but not too scary. They also enjoyed the rocking boat. The Mine train is really fun right on the cliff face. We did 2 water rides and you do get wet so bring a poncho and plastic camera bag as lockers weren't working and no cover for bags on rides. Arctic foxes cute but not much room for them. Penguins and walrus section good but really busy. Paid 40 HKD for 3 fish to feed the sea lions when you just throw them in so not worth it as got 2 lots for the kids. Nice shark aquarium, liked the red panda and goldfish nearby - all v interesting. There were hardly any westerners there and the tour groups were v interested in our blonde kids - wanted photos of them - maybe could charge a camera fee?! Quite a few rides not operating, left at 5pm as v busy and all tired. Got bus 629A back. Wasn't sure where we would end up but stopped at Exchange square near a large shopping mall with walkway to star ferry. Took a while to work out where we were!

Better than Disney. We rate Ocean Park above Hong Kong Disney. The aquarium is really good and there is a good variety of rides for big kids and grownups. The jellyfish exhibit is really cool. Definitely take the cable car ride, it's pretty spectacular.Avoid Neptune's restaurant in the aquarium, it's overpriced and the food and service are both atrocious. We tried it twice on consecutive visits thinking we might have struck an off day the first time but no, second time was even worse!

Best theme park ever!!!!!. This theme park is amazing!!!!, the views from the summit were incredible as well as some if the views from the rides, This park definatly has some of the best rides in Hong Kong, the staff were incredibly friendly. The park is easy to get to from he MTR station with having the direct bus, it is a huge park and you must be ready to walk up hills however the rides and the animals are incredible it is a must do if your going to hong kong.

Must-Go Place_Ocean Park. Ocean Park is a place that I must go every year as I like animals, amusement games very much. There are some areas I should visit, e.g. Shark Mystique, I can see different kinds of sharks; Arctic Fox Den, I can know how they combat extreme environments of -50˚C, eat and play with their peer group; Hong Kong Jockey Club Sichuan Treasures, I can see funny giant pandas An An and Jia Jia. In addition I will have lunch with my husband at the Tuxedos Restaurant where offers us a special dinning experience, as we can sit back, enjoy famous handmade Tux Seafood Piazza and watch over 70 penguins. Every time I must spend whole day at Ocean Parkuntil at night because Ocean Park has the world’s first 360o water screen show Symbio in which two 9m-tall fiery dragons clash on screen! I enjoy all of them in Ocean Park very much.

Superb!. I went on a Tuesday, the weather plus scenery was brilliant. you have to try out all the rides, we did not wait very long for the queue, max of 5min. Spend a little HKD on the game booth and you can easily win the soft toy! trust me :)

Awesome Day out with family. Ocean Park was a spectacular experience.Ocean Park gives you an alternate solution to Disneyland, Just love it. Don't forget your sunblock and umbrellas. And lots of water. It could be really hot these days.Amazing amusement park with lots of attractions. Highlights are the Panda bears, The Cable Car with its amazing view that take you to the upper part of the park, the variety of roller coasters, but all the applauses goes to Symbio, SUCH A SHOW!!!!!!! Looking forward to visit it once again.For me personally the attraction and rides in the park is much more exciting compared to Disneyland, so I guess it will be more entertaining here than there.

Amazing experience getting close to animals. My daughter and I went to Ocean Park last week primarily to try their Dolphin and Seal Encounter programs. We managed to squeeze in a few rides as well, but most of the day was spent with the programs. We found the instructors to be very knowledgeable and very good at making the learning session fun and educational. Also, the trainers of the animals were very passionate about working with them and helped to make our experience very special. We got to spend time in the water with both dolphins and seals and it was an unforgettable experience. It was one of the highlights of our holiday. I like that Ocean Park offers more than just the amusement park /aquarium / zoo experience and gives you the opportunity to really learn and get up close to the animals. It does cost extra and you can book in advance online, but I highly recommend it!

good concept. not really for thrill seekers. A great half day out, but no it a full day. Some good rides, but nothing too extreme. Really liked roller coasters that hung you out over the sea. Penguins were cute, and staff were very friendly.
Great experience. All the rides are very good with the animal shows like the dolphin show and seals. Beautiful view and plenty to do in Ocean park.

Entertainment unlimited. Ocean Park is spread over a wide area where one must use a ropeway or subway to travel from entrance to the farthest entertainment zone. Even after spending 6 hours at the park, we could explore only about 20% of the attractions. I feel one needs 2 days to thoroughly all the rides and other attractions.

Great for family. Nice theme park for family outing. Take a long and enjoyable cable car ride to ocean park. The view of Hong Kong and its surrounding is amazingly breathtaking. The highlights of ocean park includes the dolphin show and killer whale. There are also roller coaster and pirate ship. The big oceanariums show casing creatures and fishes of the ocean. Prepare to spend the whole day with the family with unforgettable memories

Nice theme park, worth a visit. Firstly I need to say there are too many mainland tourist groups, which massively make the experience more difficult, they shout, push and bump you out the way (clearly not ocean parks fault). As for the park attractions are good, loads to do and we'll run and clean and tidy. You can't see everything in 1 day!!

Good variety, nice atmosphere.. We liked the Pandas, Penguins, marine life. The goldfish collection was interesting. The skyway to the amusement side was lovely. As we visted on a Monday the queues were short, we went on most rides. On the negative, some of the height restrictions for the kids were harsh. We took the train back down the hill, we did find this a little claustrophobic at 5pm

Very crowded on a holiday so pick your day to avoid huge line. This was a second visit and not as successful as first. I purchased tickets on line to avoid a huge Waite on the day but it seems everyone had same idea so line up was huge just to get in. The wait for rides was at least 30 minutes or more. It is a beautiful setting with good rides and exhibitions but try to avoid the crowds.
great place for kids and animal lovers. this is a must for visit for all kids and teenagers, animal lovers ,I liked the train ride , it is very tiring for a days visit

Honk Kong Ocean Park. This park was so good. They really know how to use all their space for this park well. The pandas were nice and they have an Australian part of the park. Penguins were good. The train ride through the mountain was cool then we came back by sky cabłe car. The views were magnificent. Easy to walk around and so many rides to choose. A very well run tourist park. Transport was easy to get there too.

Halloween fun. The park itself was not as great as expected, but the locals have taken Halloween to amazing new heights. Lots of people were in fancy dress, and the park itself had many if its staff in character - some were actually quite scary. Fun experience .

Amazing Park. Ocean Park is absolutely a must see for Children and adults as well. It has one onf the longest and fastest ropeways in Asia from the Entrance to the Park. The plentiful rides are of very good quality. Keep one full day for this Park. The Hop on Hop off Bus has a stop in its Route.

Great value for money. A good view while travelling on the cable. Car to the top. You can get here by local bus. The admission prices are good and all rides are included. Whether you are a thrill seeker or just looking for Mfew slow rides this park caters for all. Meals are all well priced also.

Great rides, big park, not too expensive. I have been going to Ocean Park for years, but have only just got around to writing a review after a recent trip with my two-year-old son.Long before Disneyland came to Hong Kong, there was Ocean Park. Today it is still bigger, cheaper and has more rides (which are faster and more exciting). It also boasts one of the world's largest aquariums and has other animal habitats.The new panda enclosure is a great improvement on the old one, allowing visitors to get very close to these rare beasts (and providing more educational information, too). Likewise, the redesigned aquarium and penguin habitats are all great improvements. Still, visitors may want to bear in mind that Ocean Park has come in for fairly stern criticism from welfare groups in recent years over its animal care, and some people may consider that the 'zoo' part of the park is a bit of an anachronism in the 21st century.The rides and 'fun fair' part of the park are great fun, though perhaps showing their age a bit. Be aware, though, that there aren't many rides that are suitable for younger children. Still, the park overall presents good value for money - especially if you visit on your birthday (they'll let you in for free!).

great day out. We got up early and arrived at the park 30 minutes before opening and joined 1 of 6 queues to enter. We picked up a park map available in Chinese and English versions and picked out all the things we wanted to do while we waited. As soon as the park opened there was a mad scramble for the cable car queue and you will have to run! You can of course take the express train to get to the top of the park. The different areas of the park are clearly sign posted and helpfully, members of staff were posted at strategic points to ask for directions. Despite the number of visitors in the park we didn't wait more than 30 minutes for any attraction. There are refreshment stands dotted all over the place and a few restaurants (including a McDonalds!) but they are expensive. Expect to pay around HK$25 for a bottle of water. If you don't find time to see any of the shows make sure you go see the pandas which are right by the entrance. We visited during the Easter break so there were lots of tour groups as well as regular visitors and this made the park very busy. My only negative would be the express train platform where personal space and queueing goes out of the window and you standing your ground literally is essential. There were families, couples, groups of friends and tour groups visiting so this park is suitable for all. Its a huge park and I would suggest comfortable footwear plus snacks and drinks pre bought essential. My children and i had a lovely day and would certainly return again.

Family fun day out. This was our second visit to ocean park, some new attractions. Lots to see and do, lucky this time to see one of the pandas awake and eating bamboo. enjoyed seeing the walrus and seals.Park was crowded but it was Good Friday, had to queue for 90 minutes to get cable car back down to entrance as we went on last ride as park was due to close as did everyone else!!

Awesome Experience. Ocean Park was amazing, we went very early so the ques were not long, we managed to get on all the rides we wanted. Make sure you pick up a map on your way in and pick out the rides you would want to go on. A whole day will not be enough if you want to experience all the rides. Its best to start out first thing in the morning. I totally loved the experience here.

Awesome Day for Kids' at Heart. This was my second visit to Ocean Park & I could say so many things have change. It has so many improvements & I was immensely enjoying the day in Ocean Park.We rode the cable car on the way to the top where the major attractions are located. The cable ride was one hell of an experience since me & my friend were afraid of heights, added to the thrill was when the car stopped midway & was a thousand feet below the ground.Upon disembarking, we toured around & took pictures along the way. We took rides which were not heart-pumping or thrill-seeking.We entered different shows which were a learning experience for us. We discovered so many things that differentiate the North & South Pole. Upon our time to go back, we took the train which had us in awe since it passed under the mountain & reached the other side for 15 minutes. I will be back here to bring my kids.

Good but it could be so much more. [IMPRESSION #1] BRING EARPLUGS to Ocean Park! Can you HEAR ME? Bring EAR PLUGS! Yikes, as you approached the front gate and then once inside at the lower section, you were constantly blasted with music. The sound engineer must be deaf, or soon will be, and the customers will have hearing impairments if they visit too often or stay too long. Waited briefly in a moderately long but fast-moving queue to pay for entry. The park has much directed at the under 12 set but still enough of interest for the adult crowd to make the $345 HKD charge (~$45 USD) worth considering. They do accept Visa. We immediately headed to the aquarium, our main reason for going. [IMPRESSION #2] the map of the park is very confusing and signage is inadequate to really get you easily to where you may want to go. The map is more an illustrated scene than a simple and clear aid; it really was of limited help. Found the aquarium worthwhile but no match for the grandeur of Sydney or Singapore. It did a nice job of presenting sea creatures in displays that were suitable for people of all ages. Many viewing opportunities for the tots at their height were available. There were also many small and oddly shaped viewing ports into a moderately large tank that offered a different perspective of the habitat. It was a really interesting way to display their animals. We also viewed the sleeping red pandas and read about them via the informative signage. Nearby, one giant panda was prowling around its rather large, grassy enclosure. At one point it sat down on its haunches a struck a classic panda pose. The gondola ride to the south side of the park offered sufficient quiet time and panoramic views that it, too, was worth the 15-20 min. wait. We were allowed to have our car to ourselves which was a kind courtesy given the throng awaiting. It traveled a long distance, well beyond what we would have considered walking, and the views were very nice. There were both educational and entertainment features at the top. We went to the Chinese sturgeon and the jellyfish exhibits. These were smallish but again worth one’s time. Like much of the park’s exhibits, they encouraged social consciousness about how we use our resources and how we can preserve the environments of the displayed creatures for their sakes and for ours as well. We took the gondola back down to the lower area and were glad that we had one last chance to rest our feet and see beautiful scenery.All told, we spent about 3 hrs. at the park, and for two adults without youngsters along, this was probably sufficient. If you wanted to take in any of the rides, you could easily spend at least a half day there. Bus access to and from the Admiralty MTR station was easy.

Amazing place. I didn't think that place will be this much big with so much fun for all family member, the park divided to 4 area with different transportations between it from first area to 2nd we used the train and walked to the 3rd finally raids the telfreic to reach area 4. Area one is the aquarium and the Banda but area 2 &3 is for game and adventures seekers and the children will like area 4 more.

A day full of enjoyment and thrill. This is the place where you can easily spend your entire day. The park lets you enjoy marine life e.g. Dolphin show, seals and thousands of other fishes in their big aquarium. a lot of rides let you get thrilled and a number of restaurants let you have your palate satisfied.

Fun in the sun!. I went with my Mom and two younger brothers, one a 13-year-old and the other a one-year old, and all of us had great fun! The older one enjoyed the roller coasters and the younger one enjoyed peering at all the animals, esp. the penguins! And we went on the rising tower platform to finish off the day as a family. Although the day was hot and crowded (it was Easter Sunday), there were plenty of spots to cool down at and the view of the sunset made it absolutely worth it! Just avoid all the rides and gondola with the long lines and you're guaranteed to have a good time!

Excellent day out. A really good day out and could easily stretch into 2 days to get all the shows in and do the rides. Having done this park and HK Disney in the past week Ocean Park is considerably cheaper entry and set up more for families with older children with higher octane rides. Tip: Buy your ticket from exit B at Admiralty MRT station in the tourist booth and receive HK$35 discount from gate entry and you don't have to queue. Bus goes directly from Admiralty to Ocean Park.
Excellent Park. This park is well worth the visit and will require the whole day. From rides to dolphin shows to panda bears, this place has it all. Don't miss it if you are in Hong Kong.

It's fun for what it is!. This is a nice fun park and has some joyful rides... it is not your Australian / USA polished style theme park but well worth visiting and the lines typically are not terrible... My children have enjoyed it for many visits over various years!

The best place to visit in Hkg. We took the mtr to Admiralty stn then took a bus ride to the Ocean Park.Decided to ride on the cable car first.The most awesome-st, scariest ride ever!not for the weak heart.Saw the penguins, walrus, sharks,etcLong queues everywhere,had meals from Mcdonald's,the roller coster ride and childrens' park below 5 was great! Be prepared with the hot weather, watch people who jump queue or dont even bother to queue and just stand infront of you regardless if you are having small kids or not. Still, we had fun and its a wonderful experienced.
Better than Disney. Awesome experience. The pandas were great and a highlight of the day. The aquarium was great. The food and service were great too. Much better day out that Disney HK.

Avoid a weekend. Skip the weekend if you can. Too long queues. Take the cable car (a MUST) on your way up and Ocean Express on return.
Don't miss the Hair Raiser (not for the faint hearted) and the Ocean Peak Tower (stellar views).

Much Improved. I last visites Ocean Park in 2007 and was unimpressed. When I revisted the park in April 2015, the park was unrecogniseable from my last visit - the attraction is now vibrant and exciting, with areas of the park well-themed and spacious.Highlights were the revised Panda habitat and the new Adventures in Australia exhibit, which as an Australian, I found to be accurate, respectful and beautiful!The cable car is such a beautiful ride over the bay, but the new railway is also a quicl and entertaining trip.The Hair Raiser roller coaster was another highlight and shorter lines made it easy to ride attractions multiple times!My only criticism is that the park is more difficult to reach by public transport (we opted for a taxi) than Disneyland, but I noticed an MTR station is being constructed.Would now definitely recommend Ocean Park to friends and family visitng HK.

If at Hong Kong you must visit Ocean Park. This is one of the World's Greatest Amusement Theme Park with many many rides Including World Top Ranking Roller Coaster Ride - What makes this ride ultra special is first of all it is on the mountain peak and second next to huge Ocean front rarely you get such a beautiful combination and when you are in roller coaster at many times you feel you are just hanging above the Ocean that feeling is worth millions of dollars. There are many live shows with animals and fish with Huge underwater aquarium and many many other specialized aquariums of different types of fishes including Shark, Penguin Sea Lion etc. It is so big that you need at least 2-3 days to see each and every area, activities and enjoy all the rides properly.Very good arrangement of food including Indian food joint serving hot vegetable Biryanis and Pakoras.No need to visit Disney World unless you have small kids as it is just for Kids and small sized.

Great Trip to Ocean Park. Loved the penguins, arctic fox, and the panda! So many animals to see.Make sure you come in early and wear comfortable clothing. (went there March 2015).Souvenirs are expensive so steer the children away from all of the toys!!

Good but Very hot and sunny.. Ocean Park was a spectacular experience. The only problem was getting sunburn. But other than that, the park has a lot of roller coasters, and attractions. I definitely recommend families to vist this park. And if you do not want to get sunburned, bring some sun block.

Great value. This was vast and we only saw a small portion of it. Queues were ok mostly 15 mins and even less for the scary rides. Good mix of rides for all ages and fear levels. A great venue for a day out. Transport so easy if you have an octopus.

not a bad place to visit. but watch the big crowds!!!. last time we visited ocean park was some 24 years ago. it's has changed a lot but some of the things remain the same. it's not cheap, but go to travel agents to buy tickets to save some $$$ on admission. best way to get there is the express bus from central MTR station, non stop to the park.we went on a Saturday and was surprised how quiet it was in the morning. it was pretty empty when we first got in at 10am. But the crowds will pick up in the afternoon so do all the rides early! food and drinks will be more expensive on the inside, just like all amusement parks. But no overly crazy expensive.the roller coasters are not bad, but most of the rides are very short in duration (compared to what we're used to in North American theme parks). so you may be waiting in a long lineup just for a 1 minute ride. watch the crazy crowds roll in after lunch when the china tour groups come in!!! it then becomes super crowded and busy. if you want to take the gondola back in the afternoon there will be huge lineup (2+ hours)!! Take the train through the tunnel instead. But it's so crowded and they pack you in literally like cattle herd... so if you are clostophobic be aware. Overall, not a bad park to visit while in HK. Cheaper then HK Disney which I am told is not worth if you've been to the DL in California and WDW in Florida.

Excellent Option for Spending a Day. Ocean Park gives you an alternate solution to Disneyland, especially if you do not have kids with you. The park is divided between Marine Life, Jungle Life and Fun Rides. There might be big queues for the rides, to divide your time accordingly.Tip: For two most adrenaline filled rides (Splash and Flash), it would save you a lot of time if you enter as a single rider, instead of a group. Saved me atleast 45 minutes.

Great day out with the Children. We went during the week hoping for a quiet time but I guess there is never a quiet time at Ocean Park lots of mainland Chinese tours there. We had a great time on all the big rides.Suggest you take strollers for the smaller children there is a lot of steep paths to navigate.You will need to get there early to be able to get the most out of the experience. There isa bus from Admiralty MRT at 10.50 HKD

Same old park...... Our last visit was 4 years back. Prior to that, we visited this place 20 years ago. Frankly, this park has not improved or changed much since 24 years back.Yes, there are some new attractions being brought in from time to time but no significant changes. The park is old and rides more or less same. Considering this, its not worth the fee paid nor any further future visits. There are much better and iteresting parks in Korea, Japan and Singapore.
F U N. Just love it. Don't forget your sunblock and umbrellas. And lots of water. It could be really hot these days.
best attraction park ever. very big, on top of the hill, good price and a huge choice of rides and attractions. Will come back for sure!

Good family experience. I was pleasantly surprised with Ocean Park. It is a theme park that is interactive, educational and fun. It is a zoo, has rides, walking tracks, good food, spectaclar views, and even a area for small kids to play.I enjoyed the park as much as my kids. The best things for me were the more interactive parts such as penguins and seals etc.The rides were also a lot of fun except for the the ride 'The Rapids' where you actually get sprayed with water (lots of it) and end up soaked to the skin. Apparently they provide rain coats which were not offered when I boarded the ride. Took a few hours to dry off.Probably the one issue I have is the way the park offers a family photo at the end of many of the rides. Prices rance from $98 to $198 HK. If I brought all of these it would have costed me $1000 HK about AU$180 !My suggestion to Ocean Park is to offer all the photos as a optional pack to the customers at the end of the trip on CD or print form rather than try to get us to pay on going prices as we make our way through the park.I ended up not buying anything because i'm not someone who likes being put into a forced decision as I leave a section of the park.The food prices are a bit higher than the usual Hong Kong especially the resturaunt which is about $250-$350 HK per person.Overall it's a fun place that is a bit expensive but affordable complared to Other similar parks around the world.

Love Ocean Park!. We visited Ocean Park 3 years ago and was initially not going to go on this trip to Hong Kong but I saw that they have new features so we went. Ocean Park is so easy to get to. We travelled with the bus 629 that runs from Admiralty station directly to Ocean Park, the journey took about 10 minutes yesterday so we arrived just a little after 10.30am and it wasn't incredibly busy. We was a group of 6, the age ranging from elderly to teenage, and there was lots to do and see for all age groups. We got the Ocean Express to the top and worked our way down. We spent about 7 hours in there and I think we covered most of the features. The theme rides, seeing the seals, sharks, sturgeons, pandas (although they were all sleeping!) and the new additions of wallabies and koala bear (which was also sleeping). I particularly enjoyed the old Hong Kong street and the ocean wonder show is always good. I think it is safe to say, I love Ocean Park and will always come back when I'm in Hong Kong! The only let down I had which is a similar complain from my last visit but is of no fault to the theme park is once the park becomes more busy we will witness some pushing in queues and some uncomfortable nudging. Remember to take deep breaths!
Crazy busy but fun. This Park is fantastic for the whole family but be aware if your kids are under 120cm there are not many rides they canto on

Ocean park vs disneyland. As far as value for money is concerned ocean park definitely offers more entertainment and education than Disneyland. we had a full day at ocean park two adults and two children under age of 6 and got to see most of the park but missed some bits. There is quiet a bit of walking involved to get around. Prices reasonable. Many of the rides had height restrictions that we don't often see in australia, so a little disappointing that the kids couldn't go on many of them., but that was easily compensated by being able to go to some of the aquariums. The only thing I personally didn't like at the park was the seal enclosure, no natural light, and it just didn't look like a very nice space for the animals. The time to get on rides is no where near as long as what it is at Disneyland, however expect to wait anywhere Btwn 20-30 mins. Food - one of us is a coeliac (gluten intolerant), and we couldn't find anything other than a salad to eat, so wise to take some of your own snacks to avoid getting caught short

great theme park for family with teens. We went here on a weekday to celebrate our daughter's birthday. We took the 629 bus from Admiralty West which bring us straight to Ocean Park. The park have a really fun atmosphere which is great. We start early in the morning to beat the crowd and go straight to the Summit via cable car. You would go through "Old Hong Kong" to get to the cable car. Line already form as early as 10:30 AM. The view during the cable car ride was breathtaking. You have the option to take railway to the top if you're afraid of height. There's a lot of rides located at the Summit, but most of them are fast and require minimum height. Since were celebrating a 7 year old princess birthday, the animal shows are more to our cup of tea. So the dolphin, penguin, shark and seals is where we concentrate on. But, this 4 attraction located quite far from each other, so make sure to plan your day correctly, since the road connecting to each of them can be confusing. The dolphin show get full pretty fast so come early. There's also aquarium for river fish, rain forest life and jelly fish. Back down below we went to see the red and giant panda, merry go around, gold fish gallery and the grand aquarium which is really huge. We decided to skip some of the attraction like the birds and the simbio light show which schedule at 7 PM. We leave a little earlier since we don't want to be stuck with the crowd going back after the light show. After a day at Ocean Park, I can tell you this; 1) the tourist from PRC doesn't queue for anything, they charge on in throng. Avoid, or give way. 2) bring your own camera and skip the photo taking booth, run if you must. 3) food is not as expensive as many people say it is, just know where and when to eat. Lower your expectation. 4) water is important, this park is huge, you'll be dehydrated. 5) most of the ride are for thrill seeker and teens. If you're bringing toddler, go to Disneyland instead. But my kid did enjoy herself here. 6) you need 2 full day if you plan to see all the attraction and take all the ride. Avoid weekend. My advise is either, see all attraction or do all the ride.

Not Honor What Is Advertise ...... I brought my son to this well promoting Ocean Park feature today. It was worst than few year back. When I get into the park , I took my son for the train ride. The train was over crowded and the train hardly move .... Is dangerous that no limit are allow on the train. There are some senior who had no available seat for them. It was occupy by young parent who never have courtesy giving the seat up for them. The train was dirty even though is dark in color ......,All the ride was not suitable for kids less than 1.2m ...... So my son have no ride at all. It should have warn customer in the newspaper on their advertising or leaflet when buying ticket. At least I know that my son will not be having the ride after all. I saw there are over build souvenirs shop everywhere .... This is not a park anymore and look like business park ..... Very commercial and not really a park for everyone strolling with the family like those days .......My first stop was seeing the penguin .... It was so smelly than lots of people cannot stand and walk away. There are so many fast food and souvenirs shop and not much of feature my kids can see !! The bird cage view is so bad. Cannot even see much bird like those days .... What happen to the variety of birds ....???????My son could not ride any so we go for the Dolphins show ... This was bad .... They collect HK$1000 plus for photo taking with the Dolphins .... Isn't it over business doing ...... They even charge few hundred dollar for feeding the Dolphins ....?????? This is not education at all. Those days myself can do that without paying..... I guess the Dolphins become business mammal ........,,Finally we took the cable car down and went to see the famous Panda ..... Unfortunately that panda was sleeping and not even move at all. We move over to the Aquarius section where so many small type of gold fish ..... and that's about the end of it. This is not as good as what they advertise ....... Those days everyone would choose Ocean Park over Disney Hong Kong. Now Disney is way better than this Ocean Park ........ Is a ripe off for my family ......,.

Worth it if you want to see pandas. This park it's just ok.It's a mix between a zoo and an entertainment park. As usual in Asia, the zoo's standards are lower than Europe or the USA, and it broke my heart to see animals stuck in small cages. Usually I hate zoos in general, but I never saw a live panda so I came here. The panda cage was the best one, probably because they are the main attractions. The park also feature an aquarium, a roller-coaster and couple more attractions. It's split in two parts connected by a train and a cable-car!

Amazing!!. Ocean Park is HUGE park with animals and fun rides.My family and I saw Penguins, Pandas, Dolphins, Kangaroos, Koalas and lots more animals!The park does not have a lot of roller coasters so anyone can have fun!There are long lines but nothing crazy. I had so much fun and would love to come back!!

Great place for toddlers. I took my helper with 3 kids there, my eldest daughter 2 and a half years old and my twin boys at 1 and a half years old. My kids went crazy over the animals! The aquarium with the different exhibits featuring seahorses, starfishes, sharks and sting rays had them in awe. Normally my kids who are used to taking afternoon naps were too excited to fall asleep!Unfortunately the Panda exhibit had no pandas (guess they all went to eat), so it was a bit boring. And I have to tell you parents in advance... if you want to save money, bring food in advance. I could not believe how pricey the food was - $100 hkd for a microscopic bowl of rice with barbecue pork and a drink, and even the McDonald's that was on site did not sell combo items, they only sold a-la-carte, so what would normally cost $30 hkd for a combo meal costs about $60 for the exact same thing. We were careful to pack some fruits and cereal for the kids but unfortunately for us adults we had to buy our own food. I will be smarter about this next time we go.The other thing is... if you are taking toddlers with you, Adventure Land don't really have too many rides that would be suitable for them, but the place you want to go would be to Whiskers Harbour. Also, Adventure Land was extremely stroller-unfriendly- too many hills, poor planning of the roads. We wasted a lot of energy carrying strollers by hand. Next time I will just stay in the lowlands.All in all... a great place for spending some quality family time, and great collection of animals.

Absolutely worth to visit!. I must see place in Hong Kong. There's a giant panda and penguins, cable car and an aquarium with sharks. All animals are well kept and there's a joy to see that. What might be annoying are queues.

Fabulous family day out. A wonderful, busy day spent enjoying all that this superb park has to offer. From the fun cable car ride to the dolphin / sea lion shows and excellent rides, there is something here for all the family. The park is clean, well-managed and really well thought out. The 'Shark Mystique' experience was phenomenal and to see a diver swimming with these incredible creatures was very impressive. We really liked the fact that the experience is (or can be) very educational as well. For example, in Shark Mystique, interactive screens detail all the species, how they live, reproduce, eat, etc. This is extremely well done. Also, it is very clear that this attraction operates to support animals and marine life rather than exploit it and this sentiment was prevalent in all parts of the park. Our advice would be to pre-book tickets and arrive early (as we did). This way entry is very quick with almost no queues and the park is seemingly nicely quiet for the first few hours. It does get very busy later in the day. We didn't visit the Disney park in Hong Kong so can't compare but highly recommend Ocean Park to any family.

Great fun day. It is totally worth to spend a day at ocean park.. The Dolphins show, panda, Sharks, anaconda.. all in one place. There were lot of rides options as well but I didn't tried much as I was more excited to see all those beautiful animals. I was like a kid in a candy store. There are two sections to the park summit and waterfront. You can travel between the two via cable car or train. I would suggest visit the website before going as it will let you know all the attractions available and the show times as well. This will help you in planning you visit. The highlight of the park for me was symbio. It's a water and fire later light show. Really awesome. It's for all ages and you would have a great time no matter you are visiting alone or with family and friends. Have fun!!

If Disneyland is to childish for you, this might be the one. For me personally the attraction and rides in the park is much more exciting compared to Disneyland, so I guess it will be more entertaining here than there. But for ambiance and surrounding, well not easy to beat the more well established Disneyland. Conclusion: if you bring small children, better go for Disney.

May I give 6 Stars?. Amazing amusement park with lots of attractions. Highlights are the Panda bears, The Cable Car with its amazing view that take you to the upper part of the park, the variety of roller coasters, but all the applauses goes to Symbio, SUCH A SHOW!!!!!!!Looking forward to visit it once again.

Fantastic Amusement Park. This amusement park is much bigger than DIsneyland. If you bring young children, those age 9 years old and under, you definitely should consider bringing strollers. Took the cable car and started the rides and attractions on the other side of the park first.Be warned that at certain times of the day, the park would be flooded with adult tourist groups from mainland China, so queuing lines could be quite long and were not really organized.

Great with teens and young children. Our family had a lovely time at ocean park!the attractions were child friendly but at some times thrilling enough to entertain teens! the aquarium and other animal displays were very nice and well kept.there is a long line for the Cable Car, but the view is worth it! definitely a must-do when you're there!Good tip: while walking through the park, have a rest from time to time and enjoy the view!

Family visit with 14 and 6 year old. 4 of us went, 2 adults, 1 14year old and 1 6 year old. Great time as ever. We got their just after it opened at 10 to beat the crowds and before the mid day sun. Bus from Central was less busy than the stop if Admiralty as we past it but to be fair there were loads of buses at Admiralty to cope with it. We bought tickets at a 7-11 before hand to save queuing on the day. 6 year old not tall enough to do rides but teenager enjoyed the roller coaster. Different cafes had seeming chinese food or lots of stalls selling fast food. Didn't look like there was any food for toddlers:babies. Put sun tan lotion on and wear or buy a hat there as if you are a slow walker or get caught in a long queue there is very little shade. Once inside the attractions it's is air conditioned so it's good even on s hot day as you can go in and out of the heat. I would advise not going on a weekend and there seemed to be an influx of big coach parties after 2pm so we did the pandas first and the took the orient express (the train up the hill in the park) to get to the top of ocean park to do the other attractions; shark, jelly fish, artic den. Roller coaster ride, dolphin show. Basically the park is split over 2 sites, up and down the hillside. We can down to do the big aquarium but by then had done everything and spent 5 hours and there was a 30 minute wait do we didn't bother but it's usu good having been there before. Shops with soft toys etc everywhere which naturally the kids loved. Got bus back to admiralty as it seemed that bus to Central only runs after 4 but I don't know if that is always the case. Admiralty bus zoo is outside the MTR station. Would recommend this park. Kids loved it
Great day out. Take the cable car or express train to the back of the park and work your way towards the entrance. As the park is built against the hill, you will be walking downhill.

N 1 fun destination in HKG. If you do not have enough time for fun and need to choose between Disneyland and Ocean Park, the second is by far the bigger and the best to visit there. One of the fewest to host the Chinese Pandas in the world and have a great community of penguins and dolphins. Attractions are very nice and the view is unique.

Loved the cable car. Pleasantly surprised about the place considering the relatively cheap entrance ticket. A lot of walking and waiting involved but the scenery esp along the cable car is fantastic. The rides are not bad at all.
Great day out. Loads to see and do here, great for children & adults. Lots to see and eat. The animals that are here have huge enclosures and they are looked after well. Would definitely go again.

Great!! Be sure to be prepared for long walks and waits!!. it was really awesome for the kids especially the 1 area designated for kids with jumping castles etc.. waits for the rides and cable cars are in excess on 1 hour so make sure you have water bottles and preferably umbrella and portable fan as its really hot

Family friendly. A great place for adult and children. The view from the cable car really amazing. We visit the place on Tuesday, and it was not crowded at all. We bring our kid to watch the dolphin show, visit the panda, shark, penguins and other creatures. My kid love it all. At night, nearby the entrance there, there is a water show with light and sound effect. It was a story about two dragon, very interesting.

a true hong kong theme park experience. I wouldn't compare Disney and Ocean Park.Both were worth the visit for us.Definitely more thrill rides here for bigger kids.The entire theme park is set amidst mountains, greenery and ocean, which is so unique on its own.There's loads to do here besides the rides...aquarium, dolphin/seal shows and a zoo experience all in one.Start early and you'll get more than your money's worth.Do experience both , the train and cable car (will have you curling your toes; but the view will compensate for it).The highlight for me, was most definitely getting to see the pandas....gloriously, cuddlesome creatures! Don't miss O. P. .....where else in the world would you get to see a dolphin show with the ocean as a backdrop!

Fun for all ages. Ocean Park is a fun place for families and couples. It mixes Hong Kong history, with rides and animals. We love their special events like Halloween, and always enjoy dinner at their restaurant Tuxedo.

Another good thing to do in HK. Great for adults and children alike, Beautiful views from the ride and the gondola on the edge of the hillside. Its one of the only rollercoasters i have ever been on where it feels like u will fall off a cliff during the ride. I went there during Halloween and the park got into the theme.. it was fun looking at all there decorations. I enjoyed my day there alot.

Ideal Place to take the grand kids. An immaculately laid out park with plenty of things to do for the children, There are rides galore , The kids tried out everyone but I opted out of most and preferred to have a cool drink and relax. The signage is excellent and the park is kept very clean. Plenty to eat as well. Taxis are easily available to take you there and back. A good fun outing particularly for children.

Great for children and adults. Ocean Park is definitely a better option than Disney Land for older children. Has some great rides and roller coasters. Its huge and at different levels so one requires a minimum of 2 whole days if not more to cover every thing. Children who love roller coasters will love ocean park. Even after spending 2 full days here we still missed out a lot of attractions as our kids (9 and 11 years old) wanted to repeat many of the rides. The only disappointing thing we found was that a lot of the animal shows were in Chinese.We ate in a couple places which were sort of disappointing before we found Mc Donalds. Overall a great experience and highly recommended.

So much fun for young and old. This park is a great day out for everyone. Take the bus, it is really hassle free and so much cheaper.Definitely buy your tickets online to avoid the entrance queue. The park is divided into 2 areas: the Waterfront and the Summit.On entering you will see there is a massive queue to go up the mountain (the Summit) with the cable car. You don't need to go up immediately...it is a better idea to explore the waterfront first (at the entrance) as most of the attractions are still empty (like the Panda Bear area). Later the day it gets so crowded that you won't be able to see anything at the enclosure.Then take the underground train to the Summit (you can always take the cable car back down when you are done for the day).The queues can get quite long but the rides are definitely worth the wait. Be prepared to only find Hong Kong theme park fast food unless you go into the restaurants. Be back at the Waterfront before 8pm to see the fountain show...it was one of the highlights and is amazing.

Cool park in a cool place!. We decided to go here instead of Disney as its what we felt bit more authentic! , Was a really cool park on a crazy location ontop of a huge hill with a sky lift and veers of the edge into the sea ! , The rides were cool there wasn't loads but there is plenty to see , ike Animals ETC Pandas too ! , Would recommend not far from down town HK !!

Good placr to go this month. I was in ocean park on 25 mac and i could tell you that since its a chilly season in HK,its the best weather to go to as u may enjoy the cool breeze from the seas..the roller coaster is on the top is one of the attraction u couldnt afford to miss!!and its beside the sea so you can enjoy a superb panaromic view while riding it..The cable car was one of the rides u couldnt miss too as it goes beside thh ocean..Superb view!At night theres the 3d laser water fountain that will impress you with their cool 3d and laser water fountain.Overall it is a good experience that i would say i couldnt get this type of ambience and enjoyment in asia..indeed Ocean park keeps to its name!!

Must-visit!. If you've seen the rest, now do the best. Hong Kong's Ocean Park has the right mix of theme park thrills without over the top schmaltz, plus the bonus of gorgeous animals. Seeing pandas up close is a treat. We'd been there a number of years ago and the mega-aquarium is still a stand-out: in the restaurant with its glass wall to the aquarium it feels like you'e dining underwater! (and I believe there's now an option to sleep there as well). Ocean Park's recent expansion (opened 2012) has added a wonderful Polar Adventure - even the train to get you there is an experience. Best of all, your visit is not lining the pockets of a mega-company. Ocean Park runs as a not-for-profit, so it can support conservation initiatives around the region. Plan to spend the whole day, and enjoy your visit.

Nice day out with friends/family. I have been to the aquarium in Valencia, Spain and it was better than Oceanpark HK in a number of aspects. The grand aquarium was better there, the dolphin show was better. However, Oceanpark has more jelly fishes and the view from the summit is stunning. The rides are also very enjoyable and makes the whole theme experience even better.
Must go. Awesome park in Hong kong . It has covered everything like rides, water rides, sea creatures, polar bears . can get to see lot of things inside. worth going.its a full 1 day program
Made us feel young again. We have six children but we went by ourselves and had an even better time without kids. The animals are great the rides are sick. Great day

It never fails your expectations. Every time I come to Hong Kong the Ocean Park is on my "Must see" list. And every time I find new attractions and the whole theme zones added to the old ones.It was a pleasure to walk down the street in the Old Hong Kong and "take a ride" in the old city tram; it was lovely to watch Giant Panda munching bamboo sticks and it was a pure joy to follow Whiskers' solo performance on the stage of the Theatre.We took a ride on the Hair Raiser , got acquainted with the Arctic Fox, went down the expedition trail in the Rainforest and were just in time to watch the fantastic Symbio show.It's a pity we missed Sea Jelly Spectacular and did not visit Adventure Land due to the lack of time, but we'll be certainly back! Visited October, 2013
Fun~~ ＼(^o^)／. A lot of fun attractions and cute sea animal characters. More fun than Hong Kong Disneyland as it is much smaller than other Disneyland like the one in Tokyo.... >.<

Great place for a day outing. Disclaimer - it may not be exciting for those who have seen such kind of place before.With the limited time I had, I decided to go for Ocean Park rather than Disneyland as I like real animals more than the people dressed as animals or fairies and all that fake stuff! So there I was with my camera shooting all kinds of aquatic animals, and then visiting the Pandas, firefox, penguins, koalas, birds, frogs of the rain-forests and in between also taking in some great views, going on adventure rides, a cable car ride overlooking the sea and a small raft ride! For me, it was a day well-spent.

Good Day Trip While in Hong Kong. We took the subway to the bus station, where we bought our tickets and rode the bus to Ocean Park. It was an easy ride there, however, there was serious traffic on the way back in the afternoon due to road construction. We enjoyed our time at the park. I personally wanted to see the aquarium and the giant pandas. We had a good time, but the food was super expensive. It was a good day trip. We skipped Disney during our visit to try out this Hong Kong park and I would recommend it.
Meh. Ok for the kids. Meh for the rest. The night show was spectacular - without it, the rating would have been poor.
Nice place for kids. Been here couple of times. Its good theme park, suitable for kids. They got few thrilling rides for adults too.
Suit for those who loves thrill ride. There's a lot of thrill ride. If you an adventurous person, instead of going to Disneyland I suggest you to go to Ocean Park!
Great place for children and adults. Both children and adults can have good fun here. Good restaurants around. Helpful staff all around the park. Good shows.

Don't miss out on Ocean Park when in HK. We had 3 toddlers with us when we visited Ocean Park and they loved it! The adults enjoyed as well. Make sure you take the Cable Car -- its a thrilling experience and use Ocean Express on your way down. Visit unique attractions like the Giant Pandas and North and South Pole. If you're going to eat there, look for Old Hong Kong Street food, the food is affordable but really good.

Wonderful family place to have a day's enjoyment.. My daughter met her friends here,and they spent the whole day enjoying the rides,and viewing the shows,and aquarium exhibits. It is like Marine World in San Diego,as best I can compare it. We went here 5 years ago,an d then it was not so impressive. Now it has been refurbished,remodeled a,and cleaned up to be like an international attraction. The rides are more challenging, especially the rollercoaster,which swings out over the cliff,with the ocean below. The cable ride across the mountain is especially a once in a lifetime experience. This is a wonderful place to be enjoyed with a date, friends or family.

Value for money if you love Giant pandas..
