I must admit that the only reason we went here during our 10 day trip to Hong Kong was to see the 4 Giant pandas.We bought our tickets at a discount from the small office at Admilralty MTR station on our way to pick up the dedicated bus service.Arrived 15 minutes before opening time to find thousands of people waiting. Good job we had our tickets already.Once the gates opened we headed straight for the Amazing Animals of Asia to see the Giant pandas. To my delight we were the only ones there and for several precious minutes felt as if the 2 Giant pandas were there for me. Fantastic. Slightly disappointed that the enclosure/attraction for the other 2 Giant pandas was closed for renovation.Ticket price felt expensive as we were not interested in the countless rollercoasters.Enjoyed a day to remember always.

Do it do it . Go earlyBuy tix online to avoid long queuesBe prepared to queue for the cable car but try to get there early and head straight to the cable car line, explore the top level must see walrus and arctic fox and seals .go down to lowerLevelYou NEED ALL DAY to get the best out of it. ( unless you are a click and go tourist) They dont let you take food or drinks in but its bloody expensive to buy there. Must see the aquarium and pandas.

Amazing theme park. If you ask me to choose Ocean Park or Disneland HK, Ocean Park is definitely my answer. The cable car, 4-level aquarium, fun rides .... everyone will find something to do in Ocean Park . 100% recommended!!!

Brilliant, even for adults!. While the kids got exposed to the marine life, even I had a great time on some of the rides! Definitely worth the entrance fee, infact the amount that they charge per person (HKD 348, which is approx. Rs. 3000) is nothing considering that they have so much of infrastructure and cleanliness etc.

Tiring but quite worth it.. Many places to go within Ocean Park, can spend quite a lot of time there.If possible, go earlier and on weekdays, otherwise the place will be very very packed with tourists in the afternoon.Go for the roller coaster rides, it is fun. Do visit the Vet Building where they "train" the Dolphins, it is an eye-opener.Walking around the while Ocean Park is very very tiring, as there are high slopes, but there will be many places for you to sit down along the way.

Fun Amusement Park. Ocean park has some really cool rides! Good fun for the whole family, and affordable. The Zoo part is also nice, though I personally do to like seeing animals outside of their natural habitat. Yup, they have Pandas.

A "must-go" in Hong Kong. Even local Hong Kong natives like us enjoy visiting Ocean Park – the marine lives are rich and the rides fun; every year in Oct, the whole place turns into a carnival when the Park hosts the Halloween Fest. Last year for the very first time, we took our mom there, hoping she could bask in the blissful ambience and had a taste of the festive feel even though she’s wheelchaired. It turned out to be a very pleasant surprise.Ocean Park is huge and hilly. At some points, the slope is almost straight up and down. It’s a lot of work to push a wheelchair around. But the Park is mindful to make their facilities accessible to the disabled. Out of our expectations, my mom was able to do many of the rides, and could even go into the “haunted houses”. There was no priority line. But when we approached the staff checking if it’s possible at all that we did the game, special arrangements were always quickly set up so my mom could cut the line. Inside some of the “haunted houses”, for safety’s sake, they actually held up the normal visitors so my mom (in her wheelchair) could comfortably enjoy the thrill at her own pace. And, a staff was always nearby during the whole process to make sure we didn’t get into troubles. We’re so impressed!!!Not to mention, the “ghosts” and “monsters” parading/ wandering around the park at the open area were all genuinely friendly. They interacted with us, posted for us and with us, and their costumes all looked admirable, with great attention to details. My mom had a wonderful time that day. Big applause to the Park and its staff.The best part is, admission for senior is free!!!I couldn’t recommend the Park more for everyone – visitors as well as locals, physically fit as well as disabled, kids as well as seniors. Just that in recent years, the Park has been flooded with countless tours (tourists form the Mainland). To beat the crowd, it’s better you go early in the morning or later in the afternoon.

Great views of HK from some of the rides. The Ocean Park is great place to visit – filled with both tourist and locals. The rides are quite enjoyable and the queues are not always very long. The rides are even more enjoyable in the evening and you can enjoy the Hong Kong lights with those located on the higher ground. The transport facilities near the park is very convenient. The restaurants decent and not that expensive. Always an enjoyable visit.

Fun for tourists and locals alike!. We live in HK and randomly thought about going to Ocean Park today - it was really fun! We didn't do any of the rides and mainly visited the various animal areas. We first went to the Aquarium, and then the panda habitats, cable car, and looped around the tropical forest trail. We were surprised by how much there is to see even without going on the rides! I think we like the panda habitats most - the 2 pandas were delightful to look at, and there are little red pandas too (we saw the zoo keepers feed them). It's a great park for people of all ages!Tickets were a bit expensive at HK$300+ per adult though...

Amazing place. One of the best place for travel place..I was there just day before yesterday.I play there 4 kind of coaster ..mine train ..rail ...or fast coaster which is more excited games I play 12 games in 6 hour all is excited and nice game is my 1 St experience about this fun in China ...really nice clean and best location with good view with sea and city and they HV cable car and ocean express train transport from entrance to next ground ....super fun of this here in here....I love it

Fun Day. Love this wonderful theme park and all its attractions, i spent the day with my wife and kids and there was plenty to do for all ages. Reasonably price for a theme park, immaculate in its cleanliness and the staff were all very eager to please and give information. Kids loved it.

Great day out at Ocean Park, Hong Kong. Great day out at Ocean Park in Feb 2015. Loved seeing the animals, the rides, the themed areas and especially the SHARK encounter. So much to see and do and everyone was so friendly. Stood in line for the cable car for half an hour, but it moved quickly and all the people (including the kids) were very respectful of each other.

A bit dated but still a good place for animal lovers. We had fun with the shows but I was actually expecting more animals and exhibits considering that the place is huge. Lots of rides for thrill seekers but I felt bad because of the height requirement. Our daughter is only 3 yrs old and she can't ride most of it but I actually see a lot of locals and those from neighboring cities not following the rules. Even those bringing strollers to ride the cable cars which I thought is not allowed as what is mentioned in the website. Still a place to go if you have time to spare but not a must.

Must visit in Hong Kong! . My children are 12 years and 8 years old and they had a blast at Ocean Park. The rides were thrilling enough and the animals were lively! Situated on the hillside you get a wonderful view of the water from both the roller coasters and the cable car.Loved the Panda bear and you must visit the Dolphin training and research facility. It's really cool!

Get an eticket for seamless entry, save time and try to arrive early to enjoy all!. I was extremely pleased with this experience and had a very pleasant and hassle free day. I purchased 2 vouchers to use for 2 people from klook travel and entry into Ocean Park was seamless. You do not need to print out the vouchers, simply display the PDF with the QR codes and the entry attendants will scan you through. Halfway through the day we had considered to go to Ocean Park on a second day because we were afraid we were running out of time to experience everything and had no hesitations to purchase a second set of vouchers through Klook. We went to Ocean Park as soon as they opened at 10AM and while towards the end of the day we were worried that we would not have enough time to cover all areas of the park, we managed to pull through. Ocean Park is a great theme park and would love to visit again in the future. Definitely recommend going there early in the day so you have time to go through all the attractions as they don't have fast pass. But at least my tickets were of a huge savings - thumbs up klook travel for making my ocean park experience so good!

Awesome place. We got in by a bus which we had to wait for several hours. I travelled with a family of 5 including myself. We could only make out simple phrases in Cantonese. The staff were very professional and told us directions and recommended us to take the cable cars to another side of the hill. It might look like an ordinary theme park but I think it more like a museum cum zoo which I get to see some very exquisite animals like snow fox and the main attraction I like is the PENGUINS!! Adorable animals. I have never seen them in my life before. Apart from that, be prepared to get wet in some of the rides and some rooms bring extra clothing as it might be below 10 degrees.
Great fun place!. Easy to get to. Train and bus. Staff and attractions are fabulous!!! Adults and kids alike will loveit. Seeing all the fish, sels, panda, birds.... a day of fun!
Well worth a visit. our four year old loved this place and could probably have stayed for days. Loads too see and do. Really expensive drinks and ice cream though. We enjoyed our day!

Ocean Park Adventure. You need to have a whole day to have fun in Ocean park. There are 2 options to go to the Summit, via cable car and ocean express train. We tried both of it and it was a great experience. One of their attraction is the Panda. My son really love panda so we didn't missed meeting again the panda. The grand aquarium is also awesome. Food in the restaurants are affordable and yummy. Souvenirs are not so pricey. Tip: First part to visit is the Summit via cable car, queue is not long during morning. Then try the Ocean Express train going down from the Summit. They have a special effect video during the ride.
Awesome. Place was amazing full of flora and fauna. Great shows and entertainment. Don't forget there are places to visit down and up the submarine.

The Highlight of the trip. We booked the tickets online before we went there, the place is amazing, the aquarium it's very impressive , the park is a combination of amusement park and zoo, they have so many types of animals it's overwhelming but in a good way. We saw the Panda , pinguins , polar fox , dolphins , sea lions , more than you can image. We took the train to the top since we already took the cable car to buddha we tried something different. The train was really good also with all the simulators inside while the ride. The place it' s awesome , especially for kids.

Don't bother if travelling with young kids<120 cm. Travelling with young kids (height <120 cm): If you are on a short visit to Hong Kong or are on budget , you can give this one a miss. The place is beautiful, but most of the rides here are for those with height > 120 cm. My 5 year old (112 cm) had much more fun in Disneyland where she was allowed on almost all the rides.The views from cable car are awesome, the queues are very long. Be prepared to walk around. For small children Some things that are worth seeing here are the aquarium, the shows, the cable car, the sky tower, the play area for small children with rides like Frog hopper, merry go round etc.On the other hand if you like roller coasters, this is the place. loved it for them.
Excellent day out. lots to do and a terrific cable car to get tremendous views. A little bit pricey but a good day out.

Ocean Park. It is a full day trip. It is in 2 levels. To go to 2 nd level cable car is there and Ocean express train is also available. Cable car takes 25 mts but train takes 4-5 mts. Nice place to visit. Sea lion and Dolphin show is Ok. Better shows are there in Bangkok and Singapore. Aquarium is good. restaurants are available.Food was good. It takes atleast 5-6 hrs.

Awesome! . -Went there on our own without any tour company. -In the day it wasn't crowded or maybe on the non busy day. -The place was very spacious and big and organised and clean though. -The rides and all the sight seeing was pretty awesome. -Very worth the visit the the ocean park and also the theme park. It's a must for all ages.
Everything is there. Rides/Attractions from a 3yr old baby to teens to adult! Everything is there! I love this place, just too crowded. Must try the grilled dried squid! ;)

Nice amusement park, but the elevation changes. This is the place to take your young children who are visiting Hong Kong. It has a zoo, some nice rides, and great views of the ocean and southern Hong Kong Island. Of course, you will pay amusement park prices. And Ocean Park has severe elevation changes that could literally be deadly on a hot day in the tropics. Take it easy on a hot summer day if you go.

Kids paradise but crowded with mainlanders . Jelly fish house is my favorite. Can't find similar thing anywhere else in the world. My kids love the dolphin show and penguin house. The only frustration is its very crowded with mainlanders who do not like to line up and sometimes they get aggressive. Need to be careful with young kids as these people push you away so that they can jump the queue.

Great fun with family !. I went to Ocean park with my family on a week end, and I can tell you it's definitely a place to have fun ! There are lots of cool attractions as well as many animals to be seen (I really enjoyed the dolphin show ). However, I think that many attractions (such as roller-coaster) do not accepted young children below a certain height, so I strongly advise that you wait until your kids are a little older ( such as above 7-8 years old)

Enjoyed it!. Even though we went on a Saturday and it was packed, it didn't take us long to queue for rides and cable cars. There were a large number of cable cars operating so you don't have to worry bout waiting time or sitting awkwardly in one with strangers. We had one all by ourselves (just the two of us)! In average each ride had a 15 min waiting time, which was really reasonable given that my previous amusement parks experience e.g. Universal studio n Disneyland in Japan required more than an hour! There were lots of rides but in general you will even have enough time to repeat some of your favourites. Despite some unpleasant experience with rude mainland Chinese cutting the queue and pushing around, it was a great outing overall. Food was pretty expensive but we brought takeaways from convenient stores and it didn't seem to be an issue. Will be back!

great for all time visit!. i believe every hkese has memories in ocean park, from childhood to teenage to adult.. it is just a perfect place for all time to go (when its not too crowded). go during weekdays to avoid the crowd if you could! january was a little chill to be on those high speed roller coaster but the scenery was great on the cable car!

Brilliant. Highly recommend for young and old but wear comfortable shoes! Get bus from Admiralty. Exit B from Admiralty MTR. Along the Exit B walkway is the Tourist Information Service where you can buy discounted entry tickets (HK$310 instead of 345). Or buy ahead from a Seven 11 store. This saves queues at the park entrance if you go on a busy day. If possible avoid weekends and school holidays or you will have to queue for everything. Get there as early as possible, and highly recommend you make straight for the cable car first to take you to the upper area as this just gets busier as the day goes on. Wonderful views on a clear day. We are not into the rides and went to see the animals. All in fantastic environments and kept extremely well. Our favourite were the 2 massive walrus. They were very active and seems to play up to the audience. Don’t miss the underwater exhibit where you get a different perspective of them swimming around. Another highlight is the aquarium, so impressive. Well worth the admission price. The MTR is being extended to here and this will make the journey so much quicker.

well organized park, full of different marine creatures. Full of different kind of animals especially those marine one!A lot of shows like dolphins, sea leopard, parrot, panda, ....Scenic restaurant like the one besides big aquarium and jelly fish aquariumgood evening show for a good ending of the day.you can spend a whole day there.To prevent too congested in dolphin show, remember to attend the monring one!!!!Enjoy!

Lots of fun!. We had a great time here, hardly any queuing, only one ride, hair raiser, which took 20mins for our 2nd time. The rides are awesome and we hardly managed to get through everything by closing time
Great COllection of fishes. Never seen these many fishes. All kinds of fishes in the world. It got me hooked up to the sea world

a MUST place to visit in HONG KONG. Me and my partner love this place very very much!!If you are someone that LOVES thrill rides, this is a MUST GO place!!! pls check online what are the operating timing, so you don't waste any time!http://www.oceanpark.com.hk , (i spend the whole day there from 9-6) It's also better to travel on weekdays ( the crowd were lesser, i went on Monday - average waiting time was only about 5-10 mins). Water bottles can be brought in as they have refill H2O stations. small snacks are alot allowed if you don't get caught at the entrance ..haha!!Very fun and educational place, too bad most of the shows are in Cantonese / and Mandarin, ( dolphin shows has English subtitles), the shark / jelly fish aquarium + sea lions was amazing! its like you're a part of them, swimming with them under water! there will be 1 ride which requires raincoat ( unless u dont mind getting wet) so do prepare in advance or be prepared to pay HKD 40 for 1 raincoat ( they allow u to bring ur own)I got my tickets at the MTR ( CENTRAL STATION) for HKD 310 ( which is HKD 35 cheaper! ) then took a bus direct to OCEAN PARK from CENTRAL STATION. ( they have lots of signs so don't worry about being lost, or u can ask around ) buying tickets in advance is to save queuing time at the entrance. get the octopus card which is like a debit card ( prepaid card ) which you can use to take bus/ train/ buy stuff from almost all convenient store.

Better than Disneyland. For us this is better than Disneyland. The park is so huge and involves a lot of walking and time. It's divided into two areas which you can take the tram or cable car.If you don't to want to queue then stay late here since they also close late because there will be no more queues. When we went to the other side with the extreme ones we had the ride to ourselves.Food was could be expensive but we sneak in some food and water.What we also like is the variety of things you can do here. Everyone can enjoy.

Good them park.. You can have some thriller and some kids ride there. Its good for all. There would be one day is not enough for this. You have to make hurry to reach there in morning and also Night light and music show is awesome. Best way to reach there is take bus from Admiralty MTR station.

Best place to be a kid and for the young at heart. Cool theme park with some animals and crazy rides for everyone. I just can't believe that other people would cheat on the line just to go first on the rides. Food is quite expensive but it's understandable.One day seems not enough if you really want to enjoy everything, at least for me. :PWill definitely go back
Amazing place where you learn how to take care about the environment. Fun, Training, Learning, Innovation, Curiosity, terrific mechanic games, and all in one place. I further recommend Ocean Park

Max thrilling rides and interesting shows!. We visited Ocean Park as a couple in March 2015. One important thing to note about Ocean Park is that it is basically two parts which are physically separated by more than 5km. The highland is called the Summit and the lowland is called the Waterfront. First look at the guide map of Ocean Park can be a little intimidating with so many rides and shows to cover.If I were to describe the two parts simply, I would say that the summit comprises of all the High adrenaline super thrilling rides & fantastic shows while the Waterfront section has rides mostly for children and kids. So choose how much time you would like to spend based on your group's age bracket. Also, the rides and shows on the Summit in itself is spread across mountains, which are reached by using a chain of longest escalators ever seem by me!!I think the best strategy to cover Ocean park in a single day is to be highly selective of the rides. Because none of the shows are worth missing. Rides like the Abyss , Hair Raiser, The Flash are a life-time experience. One common feeling was that all rides felt very safe with thorough checks being done by the staff before initiating any ride.Shows like the Dolphin show at Ocean Theatre , Pacific Pier , North Pole, South Pole Sections are very good. My wife was thrilled to see live Penguins for the 1st time in her life. Likewise the dancing Dolphins at Ocean Theater and playful sea-lions, walrus and seals at Pacific Pier. Seeing live sharks of various shapes and sizes through the glass also, raises your hair to see these predators from such a close range. Giant Aquarium at the waterfront is another interesting place. I specially liked the part with a highly magnifying glass , looking through which feels like you are standing in the bottom of the ocean and observing the ocean life.Overall, a must-visit for all age-group with a great collection of rides and shows.

Amazing!. A lot of fun-filled activities for people of all ages, from sightseeing different animals to amusement rides. Educational and exciting at the same time. Even if you go there alone you are sure to have a grand time.

Great combination of fun avtivities !!!. While Disneyland is more sought after iwing to its brand name, Ocean Park is no less in any respect. In fact if one has a limitation of visiting only one of the 2, I would recommend Ocean Park across it has more variety and caters to the taste of almost all age groups. There is a big of wildlife , the are high adrenaline rides, fun for little ones, good food options hence overall worth the money and time !!!
nice amusement park. is the great amusement park divide in two part connected by cable car but food is awfull they should jsvr the cutting line option like dusny

Awesome fun for all. The park is amazing, good value for money. The aquarium is great and the fish are beautiful. It is real easy to get there by bus from the Central Bus Station. Then, outside are all the rides to amuse people of all ages. Big dipper, Ferris wheel, dodgem cars, and so many more. I tried many until my head was spinning. It was a great time spent there with my family.

Something for everyone.. Look, you can go to Disney almost anywhere these days, so why not try Hong Kong's very own theme park ? It has a cliff top location that alone justifies the entrance fee; and there is a full day's fun for the whole family from fair ground stalls to white knuckle rides. Gaint pandas are there for good measure. Tips : avoid weekends if you can, and travel there by frequent bus from Admiralty MTR Station.

A unique theme park and nature park experience. There's nothing quite like being distracted at the tip of a roller coaster by the amazing view before you tumble down the track. The pandas and red pandas are adorable, the cable cars spectacular and the rides fun. A great day out and you get free entry on your birthday!

good for tourists. many people love going to Ocean Park because of the rides, animals and so on. I suppose Panda is a highlight for most tourists. Now there are also koala for people to see! the rides are quite exciting so not suitable for all people. don't worry, there would be a kid section for who can't stand for exciting rides.the restaurants are always full so you better avoid dining in the lunch hour. eating earlier is better. Be careful of the Chinese mainland who don't line up but just cut the line!

Really good day trip. One day in the park is worth it for people who have more than a couple of days in Hong Kong. We took the public bus 629 at Admiralty subway station (only HK $10,60 and 20 min) and had a really enjoyable day at the park getting to know the giant pandas and a lot of different animals, feeding sea lions (3 fishes for only HK $40), and riding good roller coasters. Note: at Admiralty station, in the way to exit B (bus stop), there is a tourism shop that sells tickets 10% off.

Fun For All. a great setting with lots of variety but the rides are perhaps a little tame. The Aquarium is well worth a visit as are the pandas, walrus and penguins. On a hot day the log flume is a must as it is a guaranteed wet ride. a lot of hill walking and escalators as this is on a mountain but the paths are well laid and comfortable. a good day or half day out with family and friends

Must go in hong Kong . Im From hong Kong and So want To recommend all good placés to all travellers. You CAN play Many exciting machinery games there and See Many wild animals as well. It it must go That You CAN find Spending one day and Night is not enough.

sometimes tacky sometimes overwhelming. ocean park in parts is an older adventure park. really going on your nerves all time playing chinese lalala techno music. but there are very nice sets of presenting you many animals as the site is quite a mixture of attractions and a zoo. the pandas habitat is really very beautiful and nicely done. also very nice the section with animals from south america , beautiful aviary ...quite open and you walk in the middle of birds. section of chinese and asian fish impressive and very instructive at the same time. rollercoaster thrill mountain great.

Fun Day Outing!. I loved the cable car ride. Advice - You could first take the train going up, enjoy the attractions up there and then come down by the cable car during mid-day and later enjoy the attractions down. If you do the opposite, you may face a threat of looooong queues for taking the cable car up during 1st half of the day and to come down by cable car in the late evening. The penguins, shark, panda are a must see at this place. I thoroughly enjoyed the adventure rides too.
Best themed park ever!. I went to ocean park with my friends during my Christmas vacation. This theme park is the best one ever.

New attractions with more rides. It was a very nice two-day visit after many years. We purchased a two-day ticket from a hotel package. We particularly enjoyed the Polar Adventure at the Summit where the Arctic Fox Den and North Pole Encounter are located at. Watching the seals from underneath the water is surely interesting, but there was only one pacific walrus on display which seems so lonely. Too bad the South Pole Spectacular with the penguins was closed on my day of visit. The Arctic foxes look beautiful and am glad they were rescued from a smuggling attempt - their lovely furry coats should stay on them instead of humans.The new ride called "Hair Raiser" was very fun but made me dizzy... As for "the Rapids", I disliked it as the sole aim of it seems to be getting you wet - they have water guns upstairs for people to shoot at you on purpose! Please bring a raincoat - my jeans were soaked. Not just wet, it was soaked which was obviously uncomfortable for the next hour.

Ocean Park in HK Has Become very Cheap. The new set ups for sightseeing are becoming lower in standard and having lower value for visiting, as the style and trend is getting more mainland styled. The extraordinary cheap site should be the Applause Pavilion. After going through a tunnel lined with rainbow coloured lights, I felt dizzy right away. I don't think the experience of going through that tunnel amazing nor the design beautiful at all. In the simple hut, there are lines of lights sketching out the figures of pandas, bamboo,and a ferris wheel. They are so ugly and boring that the hut felt like a shelter for visitors when it rains! Ocean Park is getting more crowded, cheap in taste and worthless!

brilliant family day out. I've been going to Ocean Park for probably 35 years and now go with my son. It's got better and better over the years and is a brilliant family day out. I especially love the Old Hong Kong section which is just beautiful and so nicely done. My son loves the cable cars and the rides best. The aquarium is lovely too.

Amazing, worth a visit!. Nice amusement park Worth a trip! Cable car from one side over to the other. Enjoying the view. See animals, Dolphine show and Take roller coaster. A fun park for grown ups and children. A lot to see a lot to do. Very Exotic part of the Island. Enjoy We was here in April 2007. good weather, a little humid.

Excellent trip. Great place for children. There are rides for older kids, aquariums, shows, panda and cable car ride. Need to spend the whole day there to get everything.It is way more worth it than Disneyland.
Excellent Family Trip. Once you visit Hongkong visiting this place is a must. A day is not enough to enjoy. :)The food is okay but the price is a bit more expensive than expected.

for children only. ocean park is much the same as it was in the 80's. nowadays I think it serves as a good entertainment for children. found the entrence fee very expensive. the dolphins and the sea lions show still serves as the main atraction, however too short ... my show lasted 20min! if in hk without children, a place one can miss.

Probly the best ocean park in Asia. Great range of attractions and animals interaction at a reasonable cost. The dolphin ocean performance is a must see! and you also get to see Panda in the park (but most of time they will just keep eating bamboo......). We went during the weekend which was quite busy, 30mins to an hour wait for attractions, but good part is that most of the performance are scheduled which you don't need to wait in line. I got my e-tickets at klook.com , ~15% off. I was really happy I got the e-tickets from them, I only need to scan the QR code on my mobile and enter the park. It saved me 30 mins from waiting at the ticket counter, and not saying it is so much cheaper.

Awesome time. Great fun. Lots to do. We went at a very busy time in February so we expected crowds and ques but we still enjoyed and managed to experience most of the park.A must visit with kids if you in Hong Kong.

So much to do !!. The list of rides and animal attractions just seems endless and at the end of the day we still had so much we had yet to do. the rides are very interesting and the highlight was the dolphin and sea lion show. its a must do if u r visiting hong kong. also suggest please look up min height requirement for each ride as they are very strict about height requirements.
Excellent. This park is just fantastic right from the rides to the shows. The cable car ride also is real nice. Long Queues though. But worth the visit.

the best thing in HK. I am wondering why this is ranked 20-odd. it is easily the best attraction in HK IMHO. it is better than Disneyland both in terms of cost as well as entertainment for adults and children alike. it was close to where we were staying and getting here and back was a breeze, even by cab. we reached here in the morning and stepped out only when the park was shutting shop. there was a long queue for the cable car but it was worth it. the car runs along side the sea giving the rider stunning views. at the top, the rides are built around the edges of the cliff making them seem more exhilarating than normal. our favorite ride was Flash but others gave almost the same amount of adrenaline rush. there were options available for food and shops selling knick-knacks. towards the evening, we came to the main area to see the different exhibits as well as the light & sound show (which was quite good). being the time around Christmas, there were decorations all around, making the atmosphere even more cheerful. this was the highlight of our trip!

good!keep going!. It's a great trip in Ocean Park that is traveling to Hong Kong! There has many different types of fun games,there will be many of good prizes too! It's good! Roller coasters are fun to play too! Good place

My trip to Ocean Park.. Ocean park was a really good choice for sightseeing and playing. We can see different animals and shows for some marine animals, it can be called as an amusement park. There are cable cars for looking at the whole ocean park.

Great funs for Kids and Adults. This is a great day trip for the family. Arrive early to miss the Chinese mainland tour buses. The kids will love the Panda and the kids rides, while the bigger rides are scary enough to keep the adults entertained. Doesn't have the princesses that Disney does but would be my choice out of the two parks.
Amazing. A must place for young couples and family. 1 day is more than enough. Do not forget to stay till last and watch the lighting show.

Worth the visit. Ocean park is more suited for both adults and kids than Disneyland. entrance price were around 390 HK Dollars per person. The park is huge and the rides were fun but shorter than I imagine. The view from the cable car were amazing and relaxing. The food were OK but the price is more toward the expensive side.The dolphin show were OK around 20 minutes.

Crowded and mandarin new year songs everywhere.. it's packed today, and there are lots of rude mainland China tourists. Mandarin new year songs were playing everywhere. It is exactly like U are in a china city. The dolphin show has been shortened to 10 min from 20 min, it is no longer worth to watch. I m disappointed with recent management and the park is deteriorating compared to 1-2 year ago. Except the tuxedos restaurant is surprisingly good. I will give 1 or 2 stars if we didn't goto tuxedos restaurant today.
Better than Disney. We were undecided but chose Ocean Park. What a great decision. Rides were excellent, views were spectacular, and food was superb.

A full day trip... The ocean park is the best place to visit with friends n family. The only problem here is wit the vegetarian food. The vegan people should carry their own food as the McDonalds inside too don't have any veg burger.

A must do in Hong Kong. Excellent Panda exhibit. They are clearly well cared for and are positioned in a way to ensure maximum visibility.Is a bit difficult to get to from Kowloon in a cab as not all cab drivers are authorised to enter Hong Kong island. So could require a trip on the star ferry if you are staying in Kowloon. We went on the big bus tour the day after visiting Ocean Park and realised that stopped there too.The aquarium and dolphin show was underwhelming to say the least. Not on a par with other big ocean themed theme parks which will remain nameless.Didn't go on any of the rides but they certainly looked good.The gondola from one side of the park to the other is a fantastic experience and the views down across Repulse Bay are unparalleled. The train was not very good and queuing for it was an unorganised mess. Theres only so many times a Chinese person can try and barge past you before you start to become annoyed.Overall I highly recommend Ocean Park - an excellent place to view Pandas and the journey on the cable car is a once in a lifetime experience.

Good place for family. No matter how many times we were there,we won't feel boring. The children can spend there the whole day playing happily. With the opening of the MTR in the future, it is more convenient for people to go there.

Nice place to go for kids and adults. Made in HK for everyone. Not pretentious. Informative. Fun for the whole families. The pandas get lots of attention, but Ocean Park is way more than just the pandas! Highly recommended.

Good amusement park. We visited the place during Chinese New Year, and we were little afraid about queues and crowd.We were at the gate waiting when the place opened, took the first Ocean Express to the summit and run to rides. We were surprised that for almost 2 hours, we were only ones at rides! So we could get best seats and also extra laps!When every single ride where crowded, we went to see sharks, penquins and pandas. Every attraction without any queues.TIP: Go early and do all rides then. Buy your ticket at Admirality MTR-station, you will get the tickets with discounted price (normally 345HKD, there 310HKD), then take the CityBus 629 to Ocean park.

Fun extra. We had a good time at Ocean Park. However, I wish I had been told that it is an aquarium-themed them park. I was under the impression that it was more about Hong Kong. For a short trip, I would have chosen to do something else instead. Anyway, the food was GREAT and the shows were fun for the kids.

Great time and value for money. Compared to the worlds on the Gold Coast in Queensland, Ocean Park Hong Kong, is a combination of sea world and dreamworlds at a fraction of the price. We have been twice now for day visits and I am sure we have still not seen all of the attractions. On my last visit with friends from Sydney the only comment was that the onsite maps are hard to understand.

Value for money. Though Hong Kong is more known for its Disneyland, Ocean park should be a choice if u are travelling without kids...What takes up your attention first are the vibrant colors of the entire place...Everywhere u look around shows an array of warmth and leave you with a happy feeling...An excellent place for both children and adults.. The entry ticket is 345 HKD and could be purchased from the entry gate. However if you want to avoid the crowd the same can be purchased from any hotel or online with a discounted price upto 320 HKD.To reach the place you could take a tube to MTR and then take bus no. 629 or take a taxi directly. The park has 8 theme worlds and what must not be missed are the Grand Aquarium, The polar world, The rain forest, cable car ride to the other side of the hill and a way back through the tunnel in the Ocean express. All rides are free and included in the entry ticket price.There are various souvenir shops inside the park and if you are a collector then it would be better to indulge here than search for the same stuffs outside...Take some of the joy rides if you are in for it...Its also a great learning place for the kids but only that it is really sad to see the Panda sitting all alone and the Sharks and Dolphins in captivity.. SO it might not be an ideal place for animal lovers...There are various eateries inside the park serving mostly cantonese food and Ice creams, Pizza and Mc Donalds for those who would want to try something different.It is advisable to carry water as the day could get tiring...All over a nice place to spend the entire day...
way better than Disneyland. More fun, easier access, better rides, cheaper. A classic. If you have kids w you in HK it is a can't - miss. Join the fun!

Big theme park, wonderful place for a day!. It's a very big and excellent fun park in Hong Kong. I love especially the cable cars and the wonderful view. The Ocean Park is bigger than Disneyland Hong Kong and also a bit closer to the town. But you should take a Bus, there is no MTR station (open in 2017). It's a great place for the whole family. You can see fishes, dolphin action, and you can take some special rides.

Packed Day Out. Take a whole day for this visit, it's huge & you will need the guide to get about, there are long queues so be patient, especially during peak times, take water while waiting! Great value for money for the day pass which you can get before you go rather than having to queue! There is lot of walking to see all the attractions but lots of places to eat & relax along the way. Beware you will be photographed at every opportunity, you don't have to buy the souvenir choose wisely, rides are great, train to the top of the mountain is fast & the cable car down is a must! My favourite was the pandas!

Best park in Hong Kong. Ocean Park is one of the most loved and visited park in Hong Kong. Standards are high, staff polite and well trained. Shows are great and rides are fun. A world class park not to be missed on a trip to Hong Kong

Excellent and unique. It is a very excellent fun park with unique design and attractives. It is big with lots to play and lots to see. I especially like the cable car with excellent view!!! The only defect is there are full of mainlanders who are impolite and not lining up properly. It ruins our fun.

Amusement parc with a large variety - for kids and adults. The Ocean Parc of Hong Kong is a big venue and easy to reach on Hong Kong Island with Bus or Taxi and in some years with MTR as well.The lower part has a lot of attractions and merry go rounds for kids, as well as a big aquarium and 2 Panda enclosures. The Upper part, which is accessible by Cable Car or underground shuttle has Rollercoasters, and other merry go rounds for adults or older children. It as well features a polar world, a dolphin show, a jellyfish aquarium which is very nice. The roller coaster Mining Train looks a little bit soft but has a lot of thrill on the edge of the mountain. As the Ocean Parc always is quite crowded, especially with many visitors from China, make sure to go there as early as possible. If you want to get into an empty Polar world, directly take the shuttle to the upper part and proceed to the Polar World or the Penguin enclosure.For the dolphin Show arrive also 20 min or more early,otherwise it is full. You can also take the back exit all the way down with very long and steep escalators down the mountain to the side facing Aberdeen harbour. If you have an annual pass, you get discounts on all food and beverages if you show the annual pass.I always like to go there with my child and although I have been there many times there is always something new to explore, which you missed before.The Halloween party/fair is a lot of fun and should never be missed!

Great Fun. To me Ocean Park is more fun than Disney land. The rides and attractions are just better I think. Much more to do as well. Closer to town. It's great fun and you can spend the whole day there without being bored at all.

great place for family. Ocean Park in Hong Kong is a great place for family, especially the one with young kids who would like to check out some dolphin action or who like fish. There are also theme park features so that you can take some rides while/after enjoying the shows

Thrill packed day out. Arrive when it opens at 10.00am to make sure you experience everything in one day. Great thrill rides in the Hair Raiser roller coaster, The Dragon roller coaster with 3 loop the loops and The Flash which pendulums & goes 360 degrees whilst spinning.Enjoyed visiting the Pandas and Red Pandas and also the Penguins in great custom built environments where they are clearly well looked after. The huge Grand Aquarium is informative and educational whilst thenjelly fish exhibition at the top af the cable car is also a very relaxing and mezmorising to watch.Food stops are conveniently located throughout the park and although not nutritional are fairly priced compared to other theme parks where they take advantage of the captive audience.The laser/ fireworks/ fountain show at 7 pm is worth staying to watch as it is an impressive end to the day.
Dolphins in captivity. It would be much better without the dolphins. They shouldn't be in captivity, let alone performing tricks. Date of visit was actually many years ago and I haven't been since.

Best value for residents and visitors alike. I love Ocean Park! Its a great place to take kids of any age. My son is only 2 and we've found it a great place to do many things he enjoys - from the aquarium, to taking the train to spending time at Whiskers Corner. Totally recommend the annual pass for residents.

OP Adventure. It is a park for all, especially for children and young adult. there are many kinds of ride, cable car, escalator, but still you have to have good legs to walk around the theme park. Better to go here in a big group, so will have a memorable cheerful timeFood and beverages easy to get also. Next time visit Hong Kong, I will surely spend time with my children to play at this theme park

Old but still great theme park for family. This theme park is old but very well maintained. Various rides for kids and adults. Lots of photo op here. Love it. Will go again.
Tips: bring your water bottle and light snacks.

Busy. I enjoyed it but was very crowded which is expected. The rides were fun and the shark mystic was awesome. The panda bear exhibit was rubbish as there were no bears and the one wee monkey looked so miserable she kept her face turned into the wall😒

Nice place. We stayed in Hong Kong for 4 nights for our holiday with my friends. On the last day in Hong Kong we took ferry about 10 minutes and we continue to Ocean Park by taxi.The place very nice but we need to buy ticket 350 HK$ for go inside the Ocean park. We spended around 4 hour to visit this place and we are very happy with scaring for first time with cable car and other.The last one we going to see the fish. Highly recommend this place if you are in Hong Kong.

More value for money than Disneyland. Oft overshadowed in terms of popularity by its more famous mouse-centric cousin on Lantau Island, Ocean Park deserves a lot of credit for staying relevant all these years. Following a number of refurbishments, the park is now spread over opposite sides of a mountain connected by a 1.5-kilometre cable car link. There are eight separate themed worlds. Major attractions that shouldn't be missed include the Grand Aquarium in Aqua City and the Giant Panda Adventure where two panda are housed in a climate-controlled enclosure. They do quite a fair bit of wildlife-related shows, including one each featuring birds of prey, sea lions, and dolphins. If amusement park fun is more your cup of tea, almost all of the worlds have rides or games to keep one occupied. All in all, it's good fun for the family but it does take about a day to do reasonable justice during a visit. And for the sheer variety of entertainment found here, it's almost certainly more value for money compared to Disneyland.

Educational and fun. This theme park is educational since they feature aquatic animals and we learned new things about them. The rides are fun for the adults. The rides for kids are limited, specially if yoir kid is a bit short. Their food prices are not as high as other theme parks, as well as their souvenirs. To compare, in disneyland a frame would cost HKS85 while in oceanpark it was HKS50. The laser show was awesome! Don't miss it!

Better than Disneyland (if U are an adult).... We went there for the first time after multiple trips to Hong Kong and we love it! Definitely will go again on our next trip!This amusement park which houses rides and animals truly caters for all... Whether U are young or old. A must do in this park is the oldskool cable car ride which is one of the two ways to reach "The Summit" end of the park... The other being Ocean Express (train ride). Do check out the timings for the popular marine animal show at Ocean Theatre... I would recommend going for the early ones as the later ones are usually packed.Go early as there's too much to cover in this huge attraction especially if you are into the rides. Avoid weekends as this is a popular destination for Chinese tour groups.Direction: Take the MTR to Admiralty Station. Then take bus 629 from there.Tip: Purchase your ticket from the MTR Shop @ Admiralty Station. Cheaper there and also to avoid the queue at the park.

A big day out. Came here with my 4 year old daughter. Catch the 629 bus to get here. It should have a 5 star rating, but I had to take it down a point because there were not enough rides for small children, which for me meant the ticket price was too expensive for young children. Food is also overpriced. The park is certainly in a beautiful location with great views of the sea, beaches and city. The park is divided into two sections that requires a cable car journey to get from A to B. As it covers a massive area and has numerous attractions, you need an entire day to do the park properly. Overall still a reasonably good experience.
Nice Amusement Park. It was a great amusement park to visit in Hong Kong. This would again take the entire day to visit. They have some amazing roller coaster and other rides.

Excellent value. Was a bit sceptical at first but this place was great fun and excellent value.you could easily spend two days if you went in and rode everything. Go early the morning to get the most out of the attractions

Great value. We included this in a big bus tour and thoroughly enjoyed it. The park is very popular so there are crowds but that is to be expected with any theme park.The animal exhibits are sensitive and show the animals well, this was easily the best part of the park for us. The rides were ok, however being winter quite a lot were closed with little information advising us. Be prepared for crowds of Chinese people pushing around and outright pointing at you and laughing if you're white and a little different like we experienced. This was the only downside, due to the crowds we didn't get to experience the cable car ride.

Great day out. Go reasonably early, around 11, to beat the crowds but after most stuff has opened. The cable car is a must, also the hair raiser and the rapids ride. Good food stands around old Hong Kong area, at the cable car entrance near the front entrance of the park. Easy to get to the park from Hong Kong by bus.

So fun!!. Love the dolphine show ,their aquarium and also of course they roller coaster!! So much fun!! The only bad things is we went on summer,and ya its extremely hot!make sure keep urself hydrated by bring more water!!

A fun experience. Preferably it should be visited at early morning in weekdays . Otherwise you might reach there when it is so crowded. It's good idea to bring a backpack. You can get wet so take a raincoat or something similar.

back to childhood. I take my little daughter to Ocean Park every year when in Hong Kong - since she was 2 years old. She still loves it every bit as much as at the beginning - the hoppy frog, bouncy castle, the Pandas and the aquarium in the lower part of the Park, then the cable car up to the hillside part, and the dolphin show. Truth is I enjoy it as much as she does. However, the crowds are getting bigger and bigger, and mainland package tour tourists can be a nuisance when jumping queues or milling around by the hundreds. To beat the queues for the cable car, maybe go first to the hillside part in the morning and then return to visit the lower part. In mid-afternoon, the queues for the cable car back down to the lower part are huge, and waiting times are extremely long. Good that a new MTR line will serve Ocan Park as of July 2015 - that will well shorten the trip and bus drive from Admiralty or Central. Oh, and buy your entrance ticket for Ocean Park at the special counter in Admiralty MTR station - it's a little cheaper there.....

overpriced food at all food outlets. We enjoyed a fun day at the Ocean Park. We went to Ocean View Cafe, they provide IKEA type of fast food, ie you take a tray, wait in a queue, order from some precook food and pay. We usually go to quality restaurants, that's why we skipped the food stalls and chose this cafe. The price of a plate of pasta with meat balls cost Hk $168, a curry chicken n rice cost hk $178. We paid about $200 for each meal including soft drink. The size, quality n service did not worth this much. Please show some consciences not to whip off tourists. If the Hong Kong Government wants to keep tourists, please review all your food supply.
Ocean park is nice. this place is nice, big & fun to play with. Me & My partner like it alot. We will come back & visit again.

Family Fun. The last time I went to Ocean Park was when I took my young children. This trip I went with my daughter and her son. In the intervening years, the Park has developed many new attractions and it remains a fun family day out, particularly for the young and young at heart. You might well need a full day for the lower levels and another full day exploring the attractions at the top of the cable car ride. Although the cost of a full day ticket is reasonable, the price of food and drink inside is very expensive. Apart from going with my grandson, I wanted to see the pandas since they hadn’t been there when I last went. The first trip into their enclosure, they were both asleep, one of them out of sight, but the cute little red pandas were around. We tried again just before we left and one of the pandas obligingly woke up for me, sat down pretty close to where I was standing, and started breaking off bamboos and having dinner in front of me. That alone made it well worth the entry ticket.

Huge park for everyone. We visited Ocean Park on a Saturday. Took train up to Admiralty and from there bus 629 direct to the Ocean Park. Although we expected large crowds there wasn't much! We brought tickets from the MTR shop at the Admiralty station (on the way to the bus stop). They had a 10% discount.Park is huge, hardly can cover in a day. It got both activities and things just to see, like a combination of a theme park and a zoo. Park has two main areas, lower and upper. Cable car ride to the upper section was wonderful. Quite small cable cars but they go really high!The Great Aquarium isn't that great, quite dark and empty inside. Don't spend much time there. Shark Mystique and Polar Adventure is much more interesting. Kids loved watching the playful Seals. Rainforest section is great but the Rapids was closed on that day!There are many extreme rides which are not for small children. We watched the Dolphin show at the Ocean Theatre. Just an ordinary show, nothing much (try to sit in the shade, sun can really burn you!). Ride the Ocean Park Tower for great views of the park. Also don't forget to watch the dancing fountain in the Aqua Lagoon when lit up, amazing to watch.Arrangement of the park is bit confusing and can get lost very easily. Better spend some time studying the map, if lost have to walk back a long way!We had our lunch at the Bay View Restaurant, sadly food was terrible!This is a huge park which need more than one day to fully enjoy.

Need more time to enjoy it all. A unique experience I had with my family. You will always encounter visitors from Inland China where they did not travel to outside world. So they all look at us like came from other planet. They ask if they can take photo with us and my kids. We were like celebrities that we did not mind at all. Place is huge. And family really enjoyed each single ride.

An off season highlight!. I've been to Ocean Park twice - the first time around was during the Chinese and Hong Kong school holidays. DO NOT GO! You will spend 95% of your day waiting in lines and you will lose a third of your body weight in sweat - be prepared to pay-up to rehydrate, too. You're not allowed to bring in your own consumables. In winter on a weekday, though, the experience is the complete opposite - GO! Short lines, great weather and great views. If you are smart about it you might even be able to get some snacks past security.

Nothing new . Short review :
If you went to disneyland don't bother to go to ocean park also you will not see anything new !
I like the cable car although i waited for about an hour in the line to get in !

Overrated for what it is!!. I had read plenty of fantastic reviews about Ocean Park before we went, and that it is better than Disneyland. With all due respect, I have to disagree. We went on a Saturday and it was busy, but I am sure it gets busier than we experienced looking at other reviews. The park is a mixture of a tiny zoo crossed with a thrill seeker theme park. There were one or two pandas that were amazing, and a few other animals and a large aquarium. The seal feeding shows were brilliant as were the dolphin shows. Apart from this, the rest was rather disappointing! I think this park would have been better split into two with the animals in one area and the rides in another, rather than mixed together. The park really should look at limiting the number of people allowed to enter at once as the pushing and shoving is a real problem. To be honest, this seemed to be the norm in Hong Kong and seemed to be carried out by mainly Chinese mainland visitors and locals. Being a place frequented by children, I thought this behaviour was despicable and people should be ashamed of themselves. Food in the park is overpriced for what it is. There is a small McDonalds inside but they don't do combos, you have to order everything separate; a clear money making exercise. Close to these eateries there are a number of sideshow alley type of games, and the constant yelling and screaming over loudspeakers becomes unbearable after a while. If you are strapped for time, go to Disneyland as they have a better atmosphere than Ocean Park, the food is better as is the enjoyment levels. If you have a Royal Show/Carnival setup in your country, this is no different to what you could experience at home at a much cheaper rate.

Getting better and better . A Hong Kong institution, a rite of passage for every HK kid when they grow up. Certainly was so for me in my teens. Ocean Park is a government funded theme park/mini-zoo/aquariums/scenic cable car ride. It is a little bit of everything.Lately they are building an MTR rail station next to it so hopefully this should be up and running within the next year or so. To visit you must either drive there and park or take the bus from places like Admiralty mtr. The ocean park website is quite good with all this info.Visit in the off peak. Avoid around Chinese national holidays at all costs. The swarms of Chinese tourists will scare you. Visit the red panda enclosure for cuteness. Visit the shark enclosure for beauty as well as the jellyfish house.Must try the cable car on a good day. It is built on the edge of the mountains by the sea!Try Hair raiser, it is pretty scary with several loops. The water ride is cute too.Don't expect Disney or 6 Flags branding big corporate park. It is still very local so manage your expectations.Tip: Bring water and water bottles for topping up. Food is super expensive inside so bring food too. Fruit is not allowed to be brought in IF they check your bags.Enjoy yourself! :)

Fun way to pass a day in HK with the kids. For Mom and Dad this is a much more enjoyable day than Hong Kong Disneyland. Pandas, a great aquarium, some rides for the kids, and pretty easy to get there.Don't mess about with buses, just hop in a taxi from Central . . . it's about 10-15 minutes around to the other side of the island. If HK school is in session then the park will be fairly empty and enjoyable in the morning but will still get crowded and much less pleasant as the day passes.It's definitely worth a trip and along with the science museum would be in my top 2 for Hong Kong with kids. If you ride the gondola down in the afternoon/late afternoon you will see the fishing boats coming back into harbour, which is quaint.

Awesome!!!!. Park itself is a must watch for tourist like us,while going up one must take a Ocean Exp train,and while coming down one must take rope way,for a awesome view and exit at old china town,worth a watch.Very well maintained Park with some thrilling rides.

Came back after 10 years and it was awesome. Had an awesome day with the family. Rides were great. and the views are amazing. Only thing to note is the pricing of photo's from the rides is really excessive. Other than that it was brilliant. The hair raiser is a must for all roller coaster fans. Best I have ever been on and I have been on many around the world.Kids also liked it more than Euro Disney
Family day. This place is good for enjoy a day with your family. There a lot of attractions that you can join, and cute aquatic animals waiting for you to come and visit.

Fun Family Day Out. Whilst visiting Hong Kong, we took our children to Ocean Park for their 9th Birthday. Having been to Disneyland in California only 4 months prior, we decided to try Ocean Park over Disneyland HK (which we had been told was more suited to little children). We found Ocean Park to be very clean, easy to get around, very short wait time for rides and it had plenty to offer by way of rides and other attractions. We started by seeing the Pandas, which was a great experience and you can get much closer than we had expected. We then took the bullet train (maybe 2-3 mins) to the other side of the park and did that area first up. There were a few rides our children were a little young for (but probably other kids would be fine with them), but plenty they loved. We watched the dolphin water show which we found to be pretty slow and not that engaging, but it seemed to appeal greatly to the Asian viewers so perhaps we missed something in the translation. We then took the cable car back to the other side which we would definitely recommend. Views are terrific and the ride is just long enough (maybe 15 minutes) to keep the kids happy. The food was very basic (hot dog was really the best we could find), so we probably should of taken a few snacks/fruit with us. Drinks/water was readily available for purchase. The entry fee for 2 adults and 2 children was very cheap and included all rides and experiences. Only mistake we made was not getting the hotel to book a car to pick us up at the end of the day as the line for a taxi was horrendous and took over 1 hour. Talking to staff whilst waiting for the taxi that is standard, so would definitely recommend arranging for a car to collect you.

Excellent fun for the whole family. The Ocean Park is in my opinion much better than HK Disneyland. If you like rides, if you like animals (including pandas), then this is the place to spend at least a full day while visiting Hong Kong.Also the layout of the park and all its attractive features will please you for sure. Try to be early as you will leave late for sure and probably cannot see everything.

Fun park, but wear comfy shoes. Ocean Park differs from other, more well known US parks because it concentrates on the ocean & man's interference in it, so it is at least trying to be educational as well as a lot of fun. I was more interested in the animals - pandas, sharks, birds - than rides & enjoyed the dolphin show. The cable car ride to the summit is pretty amazing & escalators save walking up & down steep hills to some of the rides. Be prepared to walk a lot at the park, though. There is a direct bus from Admiralty MTR to the park which only takes about 15 minutes. Worth a look.

Fun with friends. Nice games inside with a happy atmosphere. Great time spent with friends here.
Although the food inside are kinda expensive, and the North Polar Museum is forever under construction,

must go here. If you want cool rides, definitely this is the place. There are a lot of rides that can cater to everyone. Must try the Hair Raiser! I repeat, you must! :D Nothing fancy when it comes to food so I recommend that you bring your own. Go here in the morning and leave at night so that you will have the full experience. Enjoy!

Enjoyed the rides it had to offer. They are a lot of fun activities to do at Ocean park and the most important being experiencing some of the most jaw dropping rides that had me gasping for breath but scouting for more... Overall great experience

Fantastic place to spend the day. Ocean Park was awesome. We got there early so the crowd weren't too bad. Kids will love it and there was a lot of things to do. Easily could spend a whole day here.The line to the aquarium was a lot more "squishy" than i am used to but it moved efficiently and quickly although the aquarium's "wow" factor wasn't there.The cable car ride was amazing and the whole day was enjoyable.The facilities were reasonably clean and the food wasn't too expensive- certainly not as bad as i thought it was going to be, based on some of the other reviews i had read.Definitely could go back.. Was a great day

A lot to do in one day. We went with 2 teens. They wanted to do everything- so we settled on all the animal and sealife exhibits one day and went back another day for the fun park stuff. There was a queue for just about everything- tip: get in early and only do one of each of the rides or shows, then go back for seconds on your favourites.

Fun Day. Really big & some very cool rides. The park obviously wasn't as sparkly as Disneyland (as is to be expected, I guess) and the food wasn't appealing at all, but it was still a good day spent with my family. The fireworks/fountain show at the end of the night was cool, and the cable car had a great view.
Ocean at its best. One will be awestruck with the dolphin dance. Ocean life at it's very best. Once of the best aquatic park I have been too.
Great experience. Ocean Park is a great one day experience. Would suggest Ocean Park over Disneyland, especially if its only adults. The coasters are great fun.

Must Visit. One of the highlights of our travel in HK is visiting Ocean Park. They offer a lot of exciting rides for adults, mostly located in Thrill Mountain, Summit and Adventureland. You can get here via ocean express or cable car. It will be a good idea to directly go here first once you enter the park. The time we visited, there are just few people in queue so we got a chance to experience every ride twice. In addition, don't miss any show you watch, it is worth seeing especially their closing show "Symbio".Lastly, don't forget to visit the sanctuary of the super adorable and cuddly pandas :)

Best theme park in HK. Ocean Park starts with a bang in every way.You walk in and I went straight to the cable car to get to the rides section on the mountain and this cable car has the best view of Hong Kong and it very high, so you have to like heights but you wouldnt be there if that bothered you....lolThe ridesare very good and better than disneyland in my opinion and quite intimdating with some serious roller coasters to test your mettle.The park itself is of course based around the sea life creatures and there are various shows everywhere and worth catching too.Overall, a must and I would recommend this place for all ages and the real thrill seeker too.

very interesting place to visit. there is nothing to dislike every thing is worth seeing .a
The best enjoyable was the ride in a fantasy train up hill and the Dolphin show not to be missed.

Ocean of coasters. We decided on ocean park instead of Disney on our trip to hong Kong and that was the best decision of our trip. This place is full of roller coasters and thrilling rides. The place is huge and built on the mountains surrounded by ocean.
5 star theme park !!!!

Exciting.... This place is basically for thrill seeker. Rides are superb!!! The flash, hair raiser and mine train are a must- but not for those who does not have a strong heart. All 3 rides got 360 degree turn. The flash- would suspend you on mid air- for 2-3 seconds! The hair raiser and mine train got its rail at the edge of the cliff - added thrill huh! Anoher ride i got to enjoy is the " eagle". It is where you got lifted so high and got suddenly droped. Whats different is 1. The height - definitely high! 2. It bounces back and forth giving you another tummy -tupsy turvy feeling.If you are into animal - aquamarine world is for you. Meet and greet different sea creatures - from walrus to sea horses to sting rays...wide array of fish.They also have 2 pandas - too bad the big fat creature was sleeping when we were there.Do not miss the dolphin show, it was fun especially for kids.The cable car - stunning view!The only thing i didnt like is the " no food allowed" policy. When you get inside, your bags will be inspected and you eould not be admitted if you have food. Whats worse, the food inside is too expensive and not that great. I hope they can make modification with this. I think you can bring crackers- not too big though and place it at the bottom of your bag. There water refilling station everywhere, so water is for free.

Overpriced and Crowded. PRICE: Don't buy your tickets online in advance. If you purchase your tickets locally, there's a chance you'll be able to get it cheaper. We purchased our tickets from China Travel Service (They have several locations in HK) the morning of our day trip to Ocean Park. It was $272.00 HKD compared to $320.00 at the gate or online. LOCATION/VENUE: You'll have to catch a bus from Admiralty station. This costs $10.20 HKD/pp each way. The park was generally clean but you'll have park camera crew encouraging you to buy the pictures they took of you almost at every ride and entrance. They even already put your pictures in a frame, snowglobes, and keychains so that you will want to buy it. A waste of paper and time, i felt. RIDES: I was hoping for more thrilling rides but after you've been to places like Six Flags, the Ocean Park rides will seem boring. They do have a lot of activities, rides, and game areas for kids though so it's really more family oriented. Honestly the most exciting "ride" in the whole park is the cable card ride with the view of the island. TIPS: - Arrive early. We arrived around 10:30am and enjoyed peace and quiet but after lunch, it was way way crowded and felt like a circus... and this was on a weekday. - BRING YOUR OWN FOOD! Unless you don't mind getting less and paying triple the price.
Happy. we went there weekdays so were lucky that there was no long queue . We enjoy all of the rides. Its a long walk though

exciting. I thought this Park was fantastic,you get a bit of everything,animals,rides and even a cable car.The staff are scattered around,and you can get a commentary about the different things you are looking at.

Average rides. Terrible food.. This is my personal review. The rides were a little too extreme for family visitors. We received extremely bad food there. We had to eat two pieces of bread as the food we received were just terrible.

Very fun experience. Huge park so you don't have the feeling that you are in a very crowded place. Quite easy to win a very beautiful tedy bear that will be too big for your suitecase. Great View with the cablecar (the experience is worth the entrance ticket), big aquariums, amazing dolphin show and a few coasters. Only one is really really impresive (the yellow one), the others are not as impresive as Europeans are used to have in Disney for example.

Thrills!. This attraction is great for everyone. They have different sections in the park. I particularly like the panda and the cable car ride. Aquariums is a bit a disappointment since I've seen much better and larger aquariums but still enjoyable to an extent. Park rides is also a must try like the hair-raising roller coaster next to the cliff. Location is good because of the good vantage point. Prices are also as expensive as Disneyland but I got lucky when I've bought a pillow neck when the cashier told me that they having a promo discount from their items. Food is good, there is a mcdonalds inside only bad part is that when crowded there are not enough to sit and take a rest. Watch schedule shows as means for a quick stop which is great too. Facilities are good and clean and more organized than Disneyland in terms of queuing.

Great views. We stopped off here on a Big Bus tour just to see the Panda's and what a fabulous experience that was. We timed it well by being there around 10.30 and feeding time and saw the most gorgeous Panda having his meal. There were a few people around but gets a lot busier as the day goes on. It is a huge park and would highly recommend for families with so much to do. We didn't plan on taking any rides but took the cable car across the park. Well worth it, The views were amazing and a surprising find. We could see back into Repulse Bay and the beach areas and right out to the Ocean with all the ships. That is all we did as we were not planning on do anything other than the Panda's but would recommend highly the cable cars. Great theme park for families

Enjoyable. Well serviced by public bus from Central. Park immaculately kept and fairly easy to get around. We were there early in the morning and walked in to many attractions, by the afternoon we noticed that the lines were quite long.Excellent displays. Careful when entering attractions that you are not actually in the photo line up

Rollercoasters by the sea. There is one very good roller coaster for the adrenalin junkies but the rest are kind of Mickey Mouse. The location of this theme park is it's main attraction for me...on mountains right by the sea. The fast food restaurants are actually very good.

Mainly for the tourist. It used ot be a kind of quiet and expansive park for the locals. But about 20 years ago and after a large amount of expansion, it is now mostly a tourist attraction. Locals tend to stay away to aovid the crowd. It of course has a lot of attraction for the tourists:- large aquarium, water shows by seals and killer whale, pandas, penguins, roller-coasters and other games, gardens and restaurants. And of course, one of the longest escalators in Asia.Actually, the park itslef is quite large. But due to shear number of tourists that are arriving everyday, it is always packed. If you must go, go early to aovid the crowd and get a better chance of getting ride on one of those games, or getting a table at the restaurants.One last word of advice, buy your ticket beforehand to avoid queing up at the entrance. Moreover, bring along some cash because each entrance ticket costs more than HK$ 300, but it includes rides on the cable cars and shows, etc.

Very popular Theme Park. Huge park with lots of different aquatic life your traditional theme park rides on the side of a mountain. It also has a couple of Giant Pandas. Very popular with lots of tour groups in a hurry so expect to be pushed if you don't get out of the way. Interesting not sure if I would go again

There are discount ticket on their site.. The most we liked is the convenience to there and the game over there,the price is worthy.But some games need to queue for long and it's very tired after whole day fun.Still good recommendation.

Ocean Park (& how to get there on MTR). Good day however rather disappointing that at least 6 rides/attractions were closed. Lots of rides & a few other attractions to see. How to get there....Take the train to admiralty stop, head up to the bus station where there is a booth for ocean park. Buy entry & bus tickets then jump on board the bus (#629).

Kids Fun. WE found ocean park to an excellent place to visit for the family! We actually never went on the cable cars there as the line ups were very long about 30 mins in the morning an that is just after opening! Make sure you get a park map as it can be confusing with the different levals that rides are on! Food options are very limited if you don't like eating local food, an the smell from the fish they cook can be over powering!Quite a few rides were closed when we went there in January. But otherwise a great day out! Can get very busy though and lost in the crowds.Make sure you stay for the water show just before close and get in early for a good spot that will blow your mind!

The original, but not necessarily the best. This is the kind of place that will always have hoards of visitors, just down to its reputation. The problem is that, I wonder if that has made the owners/managers complacent. The Pandas are amazing. Their habitats allow visitors to get a great view and some fantastic photos to wow friends and family back home. Just make sure you visit them in the morning, as by the afternoon they're more likely to be asleep.The food we had was expensive and cold.I wouldn't normally be that bothered, but how hard is it to get curly fries right?!The Hair Raiser rollercoaster is great, but far from the best of its type. Slow operations mean queues move much slower than they should. That said, the cliff top location of the rides does go quite a long way to counter-act their lacklustre ride-ability. Ocean Kingdom just across the border on the mainland pretty much does the same thing, but much better. Apart from the Pandas (and geographical location), I can't think of a compelling reason to choose Ocean Park over its brand new competitor.

Too big for a day. An excellent place to spend at least two days if you have to enjoy all the rides and shows. Exciting rides like coaster, ram etc , a cable car ride, well maintained,courteous staff and ticket includes all rides so that you do not pay each time . A place for family.
Great for the family. This was an excellent attraction for families or though the adults will find enough to keep them happy as well.Excellent value for money,you can easily spend an entire day here.

expensive food. great day out but the food and coffees are expensive compared with other places in Hong Kong. Fantastic to see the pandas and the aquarium. there are also many rides for those who enjoy them ( not me) the cable car trip up to the top was lovely. there are also dolphins etc to see

Educational to a Fault. Admirably educational, but boring for us who were looking strictly for entertainment.
But the roller coasters were good and exciting.

Could have been good if the rides were open.... Having visited previously as a child, I was excited to go back to Ocean Park. However, this trip was very disappointing and has put me off from ever returning again. We were a family of 5 and spent $1585 on the tickets. The purpose of our visit was mainly for the theme park rides. However, 5 of the main rides were closed for scheduled maintenance. 2 other attractions were closed. Out of the rides we did go on (Hair Raiser, the Flash and the Abyss) they were definitely not for thrill seekers and below standard (very slow). None of the water rides were open and one main restaurant we wanted to go to was also closed. The food we bought there was extremely expensive and below standard. We also visited the panda enclosure and dolphine marine centre and all left disheartened as the enclosures are very small and not well kept (e.g. the dolphin pool was very murky). If you're going to Ocean Park with young children, it may be an enjoyable day. I would also recommend checking the sign at the front of the entrance to see if any rides are closed. Unfortunately we bought our tickets beforehand at Admiralty station, and wouldn't have gone if we have known all the main rides were closed. Having spoken to the staff upon leaving they refused to offer any sort of compensation.

Panda Delight. Ocean Park has a range of amazing animals to view. Besides the aquariums which were fantastic, the park is home to Pandas which is the most cutest thing ever. A must for animal lovers. Children will love this park. The park has live shows as well to keep patrons entertained.
