Needs more than 1 day. Ocean Park is a combination of Ocean Life, Bird Park, Zoo and Amusement Park (for teenagers). Really interesting huh ? I'm not kidding, that's why I said need more than just 1 day, to explore this park. And the park is huge, so huge that you need to take MRT or cable car to get across from 1 side to the other.Direction to go to Ocean Park : go to Admiralty metro station, choose exit B, and take a bus to directly to Ocean Park (you can but the ticket at Exit B also). Since we only have day, we are going to concentrate only something related to the Ocean Life. We see the Giant Aquarium, Dolpin show, South and North Pole Ecounter, Sea Jelly Ecounter, and many more. Don't forget about the Panda.
Amazing. The place is amazing with animals, rides, etc. First take a train or a gondola to the upper part of the ocean park where the main things are.

Better than expected!. This was a wonderful experience for my partner and I who are somewhat obsessed with cute animals. Although we ran out of time to go on any of the rides (we didn't start our day at OP till 2pm), we weren't disappointed and thoroughly felt we had received gret value for money getting to experience the cable car ride twice. There were not many people on the day we attended (probably due to the wet weather and weekday visit) so this made the lines fairly short and manageable. Lots to do and lots of fun - I would recommend as an alternative to Disneyland. It should be noted that I haven't actually been to DL in HK, only the DL in LA, USA which I didn't think was that great.

Wow! It`s gorgeous!. To get there you have to go to the Admiralty Station, if I`m not mistaken it`s exit F, right at the subway station you can buy the entrance ticket to the Ocean Park, you better do this because it`s a couple of HKD cheaper and you don`t have to stay at the line in the Park itself. Then you go out and take bus 629. First buy the ticket (around 10 HKD), you will not miss it because everybody will be staying in the line for the bus. It will take 3 minutes to get to the Park by bus. Take some food and some water with you, but you also can find different cafes and take away-s. Enjoy! Definitely its worth visiting. The rides are soooooooooooooo cool!

Stunning location. Good day out!. The park is located on a peninsula- you get stunning views from the gondola ride and then good views when you hop off it. There's a great rotating panoramic view elevation ride which provides excellent views. The park has a strong environmental and wild life conservation theme which is great to see. If you want to do rides you probably need two days here. I just enjoyed watching the animal shows and looking at exhibits. They check your bag when you come in to check you are not bringing in food from outside- though they did not look very hard so you could probably hide it easily. I had a great day- it was definitely worth a visit.

The pandas, well I want one.. The reason that we went was solely to see he pandas, talk about getting up close and personal.....the red pandas were no more than a metre away from us so the photos were great. Definitely wanted one.However we were brave, and you do have to be on this cable car ride.....as we headed up the mountain to the amusement ride area. Thank goodness we could take the train through the mountain back.Only trouble was that we found lack of signs and assistance once we got off the cable car but then it was a Tuesday.We finished off the visit with a walk through the Aquarium and we have SeaWorld here in Brisbane but I was very impressed with it and could have spent hours there I am sure.

Big Theme park. the theme park is bigger compare with Disneyland. my daughter love it...but unfortunately her height is not qualified to most the ride at ocean park. if you want to go there with your children, make sure their height min 135cm

Great Theme Park. We also bring our kids here when we visit Hong Kong. The park is located on HK Island and the cable car ride offers scenic coastal views. The park also introduced new attractions every 2 years including an evening show of laser lights, fire and sound effects on its massive fountain.

Just renovated. This place just renovated. We've been here 10 yrs ago. Very easy to reach here. We take MTR to Hung Hom take A1 exit then continue by bus. Ocean park located on Hongkong Island. This park accomodate every age.. They have several section..amusement park, antartic,,rain forest,,also some food stalls. must arrived here early morning or you'll missed a lot. The icon of this place is two giant pandas. They are so cute.

Wonderful Family Time out!. Loved the attractions at Ocean park and it can easily take up an entire day for your family:) As per my review for HK Disneyland, you can buy cheaper tickets outside the HK airport arrival terminal! It's even cheaper than the HK disneyland tickets and much more worth! :)Must go for all families at least once! Really good for children!

Great day out. I loved this day there was lots to see and do and a must if you have children. There were food and drink stalls everywhere you will never go hungry here. I will definitely return here with my family even though my kids are older now. Great day had we had a wheelchair and could still go on rides and see everything. Staff were very good

Good fun. We went to ocean park without children, and maybe it is aimed more towards kids but we still had a fun day out. Definitely get there early, there are long queues- particularly coming back from the summit at the end of the day, and in summer be sure to take hats, lots of water and sun cream. It's a full day out, we only went on two rides and still ended up being there for 7 hours but it was really good fun. Food is awful and the queues to some of the lunch places were longer than the attractions themselves so maybe take a packed lunch but all in all a recommend for ocean park!

Amazing Rides. The park is conveniently located in Aberdeen and is easily accessible by bus that starts right outside the MTR station. The MTR station offers tickets at a discounted rate compared to if one buys them directly at the park. Ocean Park is very well laid out and by far offers much better rides than Disneyland HK. connections between the farther zones are through the Ocean Express train and the cable car making it convenient to move between the zones. I found the choice of food in the various zones rather limited.

Enjoy the view, the rides, the shows and meals - All in One. Our family of 2A and 2 teenagers visited Ocean Park in Dec 2014 and we had a great time with everyone enjoy their own bits of the park. My younger daughter really liked animals so the panda, penguins, sharks, sea lions, artic fox, etc. were great for her. The older one enjoyed the rides and the shows so we watched the Emperor of the sky bird show in the morning and Ocean Wonder show at 3:30pm. For my wife and I, we enjoyed the cable car ride and also the snacks at the Tuxedo Restaurant. Tip #1: Pick up a HK Map at the airport or hotel. There is a coupon in the Map that gets you entry discount and also additional meal vouchers.Tip #2: Try to get to the park early as there are many tourists and the queue for the cable car gets extremely long from lunch time. Consider taking the Ocean Express train up to the upper area attractions and then take the cable car down as the queue is shorter on the other side. You can travel up and down to visit different attactions and shows.Tip #3: Don't miss the tuxedo restaurant next to the Penguin/South Pole Spectacular. The entrance looks a bit intimidating but it well worth to wait a get a table. You can to dine with the penguins. (We ate there twice - simple lunch and then tea break). The resturant is a bit cold due to the penguins but the soup and pasta were great :)Tip #4: Don't miss the White Artic Fox - the attraction is only accessible via the shop after the South Pole/Penguin view and many people miss it. Tip #5: On holidays, be at the shows venue at least 20 minutes early to get good seats.
A park with a difference. I was there 28 years ago I can see that the park has moved with the times. So much has changed now with new rides being added and an aquarium for sea animal lovers.

Excellent park. Had a great time, great value for money. Easy to get to on MRT and public bus, don't waste your money doing a tour. Really clean park with beautiful gardens. Rides good with short waiting times. Loved seeing the Panda.

Amazing Day at Ocean Park. Ocean Park was an exceptional experience, it was actually better then my family (teenage boys) expected it to be. This theme park is great for all ages, which is great as it's hard to find a theme park which is suitable for both teens and young kids. Cable Cars are a must as they offer such a beautiful view, as well as take you up to the main part of the theme park where majority of the rides and roller coasters are. Not a fan of aquariums, however this one is amazing and is a must see! Whole family absolutely loved it and we spent quite a bit of time there. Lines weren't too bad, our longest wait was around 30 mins and everything else was shorter then that. Word of advice, wear comfy walking shoes as it is a HUGE park and our feet ached by the end of the day. Ocean Park is not to be missed if you are visiting Hong Kong. Visited Jan 7th 2015

All dayer. Massive amusement complex, you will need a full day and plenty of stamina approx £106 for four to get in but spent virtually nothing,except on food , after that.Fantastic aquarium ,the best I have ever seen,great Panda complex and all the rides you can want, spread over a large area and on two levels, don't be tempted to walk down from the top as access is not streight forward. there is a great fountain and light show at the end of the day which is really worth seeing. Good bus and taxi services.taxi £12 for four from quarry bay so not bad.MTR is being extended here, work ongoing.

theme park, zoo, sightseeing all in one!. its a must go for friends, families and couples! you can see animals in the zoo then have fun in the theme park with sky high thrilling roller coaster rides and rides that make 360degree turn till your heart falls out! (not literally)fabulous place to spend a full day at. 5hours may not be enough if you want to cover everything from theme park rides to zoo, aquarium, cable car rides.

Amazing Park With Amazing Views. Awesome Theme park with amazing views! Couldn't think of a better place to put a park! Also amazing aquarium and shows. Very easy to get to Hong Kong's public transport system makes it very accessible. Don't forget to try the grilled squid!

Amazing view, amazing rides!. The view from the cable car was amazing and breath taking! The view from the sunset was beautiful as well! The restaurants are a bit pricy but it is expected for an amusement park. The lines for the rides weren't too bad and the aquarium, the animal trails and the panda zoo were very enjoyable as well. The dolphin show was a bit dissapointing but at least the view was very nice. The best part was the water show at night! A beautiful day!
Nice place to visit, but be prepared to line up. Nice place, beautiful cable car, great aquarium, amazing animals and flowers. Good food options. spectacular views. Too many people.

All thumbs up. If you are in Hong Kong, then this is a must do activity. The park is suited for all age categories and covers a wide spectrum of activities. Kids can enjoy their rides, parades, dolphin shows and also the aquarium. Thrill seeking adults can enjoy their rides too. Would recommend a head start for this one...

Awesome Marine Life Showcase and Breathtaking rides. A day is not enough to complete the Ocean Park tour and rides. Awesome marine life! Don't miss the Korean grilled squid. The smell will lead you to it. It's sooo cold up the mountain and the cable ride is great!

Not bad. Rides were fun and wait times weren't too bad. Average about 20-30 mins.Park is divided into sections and getting from one part to another is sometimes tricky as the signs aren't great.Food is pretty pricey but expected I guess.A lot of tourists from a nearby country that were quite rude/cutting in queues, etc. Catching a bus there was easy, but catching a bus home was a nightmare. Long wait time & bad traffic as there's just so many people wanting to head back to city.
Great day at the park!. What a beautiful park with lots to do and see, the aquarium and dolphins show were wonderful, along with experiencing the pandas close up.
love come here. enjoy with family and had great time..... we went on wednesday great day...we enjoy ride and food is bite expense but ok.... and sea anmimal are great look at... must go....

All Ages. late September 2014 I went to Hong Kong with family and friends our first full day in Hong Kong we went to the ocean park . The ocean park was good but needed more rides for kids. I defiantly recommend going up on the cable car, Awesome views,

A great day out!. Plenty to see and do at Ocean Park - which was recommended to us by locals over going to Disneyland. Fairly expensive to get in (but luckily we got discounted tickets). Easy to get there using public transport. It is set on two levels with a cable car for transportation between the 2 sites. Everywhere was clean, tidy and relaxed (apart from the queue to get in 1st thing in the morning - when the barriers went up there was a stampede - no orderly queuing that us Brits normally expect and actually it was quite frightening ! e.g. adults knocking children over in their rush to get to the cable cars !! but after spending 5 weeks in HK we got used to that ). Compared to UK theme parks, it is small but that is exactly what I like about it, that and the pandas ! A good variety of places to eat and gorgeous views. I was travelled with adults but my family would have loved it and if I ever return to HK I would visit there again.

Fun and great theme park!. I love Ocean park because of the combination of adventure game and nature seeing. Once is never enough to explore Ocean park! This visit was mostly spent on exploring the nature like penguin and seeing show. Will pay a visit back again!

alright, but needs some work. First, we bought tickets from a travel agency since it was cheaper and we are a big group. We enjoyed going around the park and getting on the different rides and attractions.The north pole (?) area needs work. There are not a lot of animals when we went there. But it was a good place to hide from the heat. They need more food variety and places to seat and eat.

Def worth a Visit. Ocean Park was a fun day out. The trip on the Gondola's was beautiful and the views from different parts of the park were pretty phenomenal as well.Knocked off all of the thrill rides - went during the week so the queues weren't too long. By the afternoon (after 1pm) the park got crazy busy so it was good that we got there at 10am.Highlights for me were the pandas and monkeys in the Hong Kong Jockey Club Sichuan Treasures - we nearly didn't even go in as didn't know what it was but were incredibly glad we did. The other highlight was seeing the artic foxes which were cute cute cute!If you have a spare day in HK - Ocean Park will surely have something for everyone to enjoy.

One of the highlights in HK!. OCEAN PARK HANDS DOWN IS SO MUCH BETTER THAN DISNEY! Apologies for my caps. But then again, I would choose Ocean Park over HK Disneyland any day mainly because of their activity choices. The rides are just one of the best, the cable car's view is just amazing and the park's animal showcase is just impressive (READ PANDA). The park may have some major let downs as well like the almost rundown carts and rides and also the food choices are quite limited. But it will surely be one heck of a day here! Just make sure you don't visit here during holidays cause that's our major mistake! took hours for each attraction cause of the heavy queue!
Very Lame. Don't want to sound like a snob, but this will appeal to the Chinese state tourist, but very communist 60's for the more seasoned traveller

Excellent. Plenty to do and see at Ocean Park. Even the views are fantastic. Great for all ages. Although on a hilly site getting around is not difficult with the chair lift and escalator. Would definitely visit again.

Great time. Positives:- Very easy to reach the park -We went as a couple and really loved the place so you don't need to have kids to go and if you have kids they will have a blast. - there were several rides that adults will enjoy and we enjoyed all the shows and feedings- if your a photographer (i am) there are lots of things to photograph- bathrooms were cleanNegatives:- You will have your bags inspected for any food ANY food. We had snacks with us and she gave us a warning and told us that next not to bring food. This is dumb and it forces you to pay for their food inside. And we are vegetarians!! But we ate our food in there anyway lol- Very crowded in the afternoon with people screaming and shouting and shoving especially when the tours start to arrive.- a couple of attractions were closed which was disappointing (penguins, some rides) Tips:- as people have mentioned before- and i took the advice and had a great time and did everything- go on a week day, you should arrive at opening and take the cable car straight to the summit. If you love an adrenalin rush finish thrill mountain first. Then finish everything else up there then go back down later (there isn't much down there anyway) we finished almost everything (leisurely) in about 8 hours - choose a cloudy day (thankfully luck was on our side) because if the sun is out it will be way to hot walking from one section to the other.
full of fun. Huge area. Lots of amusing rides. Kids love the aquarium and sanctuaries. You can see pandas and some rare animals such as the smallest monkey.

Not so amusing amusement park. During the morning, we enjoyed the ocean express ride to the waterfront coz the cable car was tremendously crowded. Good thing there's ocean express. The park was totally crowded at afternoon. We decided to leave earlier than our schedule because we are not really a fan of their facilities and attractions.If you don't have the time or budget to visit disneyland and Ocean park, I suggest that you should prioritize disneyland. Facilities and attractions wise, Disneyland is far better.

Nice and complete themepark. Very nice themepark with a variety of things to do and see. Rides for young children, more adventurous rides for older children and adults. Animals, shows. Excellent for a day out or even an annual pass if you live in Hong Kong !

Dolphin show. I had visited Ocean Park for twice. Second time is by 2010. The most impressed me is the dolphins show. Other than that, it's almost similar with Disney Land, an amusement park. The park is moderate size if compare with Disney Land. Suitable for family with kids, they will love it.
Fun Times. Great adventure park that includes rides, attractions, animals, sights, gardens, restaurants and more. Easily accessible by bus or subway.

Holiday. A totally fun place. Definitely not to be missed. The park has a cable car ride which is a wonderful experience. In case you have a fear of heights,they have a train through to the other side wThe rides are thrilling and the shows are quite captivating. The pandas were really cute. A fun family entertainment !!!

Went here to see the gorgeous pandas & kids enjoyed the rides!. This theme park has it all - the gorgeous pandas, penguins, awesome rides for the big kids, cute rides for the little kids, and did I mention the gorgeous pandas?! We got there early and the tip is always to take on the biggest scariest rides first as there are no queues first thing (people tend to work there way up to those rides!). Loved riding the cable car from the bottom up to the top of the mountain. Awesome views of the oceans. Great day out - definitely recommend! Say hi to the pandas for me!!

A memorable visit marred by an insensitive and rude server. My wife and I went to Ocean Park on our last visit to HK which was almost two years ago and this was a Herculean task for me as I have advanced Parkinson's Disease which greatly affects my mobility. We were extremely impressed by the stability of the cable cars (with a little help from mother nature) and the panoramic view was a pleasant surprise as we often think of HK as a concrete jungle and it is a pleasure to the eyes and a solace to the spirit to see rolling hills and verdant valleys underneath our feet.I made a wish to myself that I can be back around Halloween as part of Ocean Park will be transformed into a land of ghouls, vampires, zombies and other hideous creatures of the night, not to mention that there are several haunted houses with different themes to choose from, perfect for a ghost story aficionado like myself. Before I go on, we must thank Mr. Allan Zeman, former CEO of Ocean Park, for making all these and more possible. Having strolled around the park for over an hour, I knew that my legs were starting to slow down and I had to hang on to the benches for support. We finally made our way to the Neptune's Restaurant which was not due to open in another ten minutes. We waved down a passing server and asked if we could at least be seated due to my condition but he insisted that the kitchen staff and servers were not ready. For crying out loud, all that I need was table and chairs and they could start serving me whenever their royal highness were ready. This server was obnoxious, arrogant and insensitive to the extreme and since our verbal exchange was not serving any purpose other than providing free entertainment to passer-by, I struggled back to the front gate and left. Although I have never been a big fan of Disneyland despite my love for Micky and the gang, they definitely have much better facilities and transportation for people like myself.

Great in the morning! Swamped in the afternoon!. It was as toss up between disney and Ocean Park, and we chose Ocean park! We were not disappointed. We had a lot of fun on the rides and visiting the animals. It does not have the "characters" or ambience of disneyland, but certainly has its own flare. The morning was perfect for low crowds and doing everything at a great pace. After lunch, there were the typical long lines. We enjoyed a nice quick lunch at the aquarium eating with mantas and hammerheads! And of course the Giant Pandas were a hit!
Interesting. Great place and highly recommend to visit for family who have young children. It also recommended for family who have old children to spent good time and watch the amazing show.

Liquid Sex. Only the descendants of the makers of The Great Wall can build the Ocean Park. This place has the right to brag about being the best theme park in Asia. The rides are quite distant from each other so beware - wear the most comfortable sports shoes ( you can give fashion a break for a day). The Cable Car is a marvel it gives you a look of the entire park. And the alternative to that is the mini train both are good in their own sense. My suggestion use both of them on either way. The rides are good and strategically placed the Dragon ride, the Abyss, The Mine Train were my favourites. There's also a grand aquarium at the entrance of the park, probably, 10 times bigger than the one in Singapore and much much better. They even let you touch the egg of a baby shark! What more can you want? Really a nice place. If you want to tickle the adventurous genes within you then Ocean Park is the right place for you.The only thing that I found missing was the water coolers ; you could find one in Disneyland after every 50 feets or so. Not so much of a drawback but I personally felt it so thought to mention it.

Dec 2014. we've been here 2012, unfortunately, the shows (emperor of the sky and Dolphin show) now were not up to par compared to our previous visit.in fact i was surprise that it was not only me who got bored, even my 3 sons were on the verge on falling asleep, yes, it's that bad, they should have put more effort to make it more entertaining, the bird show and dolphin show at Singapore and Subic (Phils) were better.don't go on weekends and holidays, you will be with mammoth throng of visitors from mainland China and the experience will surely not be pleasant, they will jostled and pushed, unmindful of the line, very unruly, sorry for being brutally frank, but that's what we always experienced be it in HK Disneyland or in any tourist attractions and malls there in HK, in 2012, we're pushed from behind, overtook in line, now in 2014, it's the same, a group of elderly mainlanders pushed aside and overtook my 3 sons in the line to the giant aquarium in OP, the next instance, they were behind us, then my wife was pushed repeatedly, she gave them a stare down, then i heard the group mouthing expletives in mandarin, i knew mandarin and i understood what they were saying, but being respectful of elderly, i just smiled it off and told my wife to ignore them less it ruin our daythe rides here were extreme and the daring ones would love it, me? i passed hahahahathe food here is expensive as expected, this is a theme park, so expect expensive food.we shouldn't have skipped HK Disneyland, we shoud have skipped OP

must go.. this is not Disneyland but somehow the children loved it too. It gives a sense of traditional Asian theme park but more modern. it has a nice aquarium, cable car rides. the view is also awesome. Spend a day here to chill out. totally worth it.
Must visit when in Hong Kong. Its an awesome theme park with lots of things to do and great variety for everyone!Went there with friends and had a great day !

Visit on a weekday and go early. Tips: * Arrive at park opening with pre-purchased tickets to avoid long lines. During first two hours, most attractions have waits of 5-10 minutes or less.* Take the train to go up to the Summit first thing in the morning and the cable car to return to the waterfront area in early afternoon. This way, you are working against the crowds/traffic. We did not have to wait in any line using this method, whereas the line for cable cars going to the Summit from the waterfront was very long (waits exceeding 45 minutes).* Visit on a weekday to avoid crowds. Mainland Chinese converge on Ocean Park on weekends, particularly Sundays.* If you are staying at a hotel, it is well worth the extra money to have the hotel pick you up in their car from Ocean Park. The taxi line is very long with some people reporting waits of over an hour. Having a car pick you up and bypass the long lines can make a big difference in making your visit a positive one.* Be prepared for a lot of uphill walking. Since the Summit area is literally built into the side of a mountain, you are forever climbing steps. It is a workout! The views though are fantastic.

Ocean Park. For some reason Ocean Park is popular with kids. I'm always outvoted on my own personal preference of a day trip, Disneyland. Ah, I know, it's the rides. Other than rides, Ocean Park is a mammoth exercise in animal captivity and hard selling- how many photos at outrageous prices do you need? Although the ticket prices are reasonable- that's the end of the bargain. The cost of extras is not. For example, the food, other than the restaurants, is dreadful- no really, bought cheap and sold at a premium I guess. Furthermore, try finding a seat. Other than food, Disneyland pays attention to detail, down to the light fittings- Ocean Park is an array of bodge it displays. Okay, my son prefers OP, but hey, he doesn't have to pay. Go, but prepare to/for spend money/despair.

awesome day out. We decided to skip Disney Land in favour of Ocean park as we had been to Disney Land in Paris a few months ago.We got to Ocean Park early which I would recommend and headed straight for the cable car... we made our way around the park going on all the major rides first (I also recommend this as later on in the day it gets very busy!!)The rides were cool and once we had finished the rides we went around the park visiting all the animals and shows that were on offer. We were able to get up close and personal with the dolphins at the breeding center and it was so refreshing to see so many well cared for animals in Asia.It is a theme park, zoo and aquarium all rolled into one. The food was a little expensive but just what you would expect from a theme park... we took drinks and snacks in with us and only had to buy lunch.Couldn't recommend this park more I had one of the best days there and the red pandas and giant pandas are a MUST!!! As far as theme parks go you will not get a theme park with better views as it is on top of the mountain!

Enjoyable day. We visited as a couple, probably best going with young kids, park was busy so didn't que for any of the rides, some ques over 30min. Enjoyed the various animal attractions especially the pandas enclosure. Great views and lovely setting for a park. Would recommend but only if you have young children.

What an amazing theme park! A Hong Kong must-do.. I do love all things Disney, so I was expecting to like Disneyland a lot more in comparison to Ocean Park, however this place blew my mind. It is absolutely enormous, so allow either a full day, dusk til dawn or 2 days to actually do it justice.If you like a good view, their roller coasters will give you a view like no other...upside down! And the views from up the top of the park are absolutely breathtaking. If travelling with kids, they have excellent kiddies ride and great access to a lot of Asian animals, including Panda's.I would recommend eating at the cafe up the top of the mountain where you get off the cable car. The have a glass balcony you can eat your lunch on with views of Stanley and views of the ocean, it is truly an experience.If you' only have a short time in HK and are trying to pick between Ocean Park and Disneyland, I would have to highly recommend you choose Ocean park to make the most out of your day.

Great park , long waits for turn. Great park, you must go earlier because very big park. Be carefull for hot weather, you can wait for a long time to join any action . You can wait over 1 hour for getting in rollercoaster.

Crowded. We went there on Monday morning. Most of the rides needs to queue at least half an hour to an hour. We managed to see a lots if penguins, the panda bear, the artic foxs , different type of fishes & giant stingray. A nice place to bring the younger kids and a fun thrill place for the youngster too.
Average. If you have never visited at an Aquarium before you can go, but if you visited such an attraction before you need to reconsider if you want to invest your time at a similar place.

BEST TO GET CLOSER TO THE ANIMALS. Ocean park is amazing !!! if ever anyone has a day to spare in HK , I would strongly recommand OCEAN PARK……..I had a very good time there .I would surely give my hearty thanks to the transport facility which made the journey to ocean park easier. Tourist to ocean park has to just decide when he/she should go and rest things like transport etc you don't need to make its head and tail… I would advise that the cable car ride, the aquarium ,the giant panda ,polar ride , Dolphin show and the rainforest must be done. if you are taking to much of stuff to eat and drink , then be ready to see your stuff kept out by the security.If you are going in a family (teens) don't miss the rides ,especially the ride HAIR RAISER..try to go during the Holiday season to enjoy the marvellous decoration ,perfect for pics ( although leading to high wait times for rides) …yes, if going at peak times try to reach at exact park opening time.

Make sure to get there early.. It was an alright park, very clean and tired. Definitely make sure to get there early to do all the big rides as around lunch time the tour groups start to arrive and the park gets very busy. Definitely a must to go see the panda bears in the asian animal enclosure.

Great value, fantastic day out.. Ocean Park is a mix of a zoo and a theme park with great animals and rollercoasters with the most amazing views.We got there using the 629 bus from just outside Admiralty Station and it only took about half an hour to get there.The park is in two halves - the summit and the waterfront - and a train and cable car provide transport between the two halves. To avoid queues for the cable car I recommend going straight to the cable car and getting it up to the summit, then use the train to return to the waterfront later in the day.Highlights for us were the rapids ride, the mine train ride, the penguins, pandas and the bird show.We also had a giggle when we noticed some older chinese people taking pictures of us randomly - I don't think they'd seen white people before! =)Beware of tourists from mainland China, we found them to be very rude and they would just push in front of us in the queues... after getting mad at first we just learnt to take deep breaths and ignore it!

Good experience for both family and friends. As a local, Ocean Park is good fun because everyone can find something they like here. I always enjoy looking at the animal exhibits, which are highlights of Ocean Park. I would advise tourists to take the Ocean express to the Headlands and then the Cable Car back, as you would want to beat some tourists to the best rides. Thrill Mountain is more crowded than other areas, because it is newer and more popular. Best to go there first and make your way down to the other attractions. Food quality is okay, but it IS getting expensive; Cafe Ocean is a decent sit-down restaurant with affordable prices! Other kiosks such as Pizza Place offers quick bites which are cheaper than other kiosks too.Shows are good for animal lovers, but if you're short on time the Ocean Theatre Show is probably most worth your money. Favourite ride is the Hair Raiser; plenty of roller coasters and water rides for young adults and teens to have fun on!For souvenirs, the biggest shop is in Aqua City underneath the Grand Aquarium, so go there if you want sea-themed merchandise. The night show Symbio is great; it is water show with some fire effects and minimal fireworks, so stay for it if you aren't too tired.Overall, another excellent visit to the park; enjoyed the thrill, and can't wait to go back soon! It's well worth your $320.

Awesome . Massive amusement park. Should have atleast 6 hours to check out most of the stuff. Would recommend the roller coaster (fastest in Hong Kong), the dolphins show, the cable car ride and the light and the light and sound show (Symbio as they call it) at the closing of the park for the day.

Enjoyable day trip and a reasonable price. If you did everything here you would easily spend from open to close. We spent 6 hours but didn't do any of the actual amusement rides. The park is really easy to get to. We were staying on the island so we caught the MRT to Admiralty and came out at exit B which is directly in front of the bus stop for bus 629 that takes you directly to the front entrance of Ocean Park in around 15-25 minutes (depends on traffic). As you walk from the train to exit B you pass a tourist centre that sells the park entrance tickets. They were actually selling them for HK$290 which is 30 less than at the park. This also saved us time lining up to buy tickets too. The bus pulls up right at the front of the park and you take the big domed escalators up and start lining up.There's a good blend of animal exhibits and rides across the park. We only caught the ocean animal show and it was okay, some dolphins and sea lions. As per all themed parks food was more expensive in there. There's a variety of places to eat at including restaurants to McDonalds. Be ready for lots of walking and some great photos, especially the view from the gondolas.

A Great Place for Rides. I think this place should be called Rides Park. Besides the shows and the aquarium, the rest of the park seem to have little to do with the ocean. But I am not complaining. The thrill rides are what bring the tourists back again and again. Do take the cable car ride to the top of the mountain and then take a train back down. The aquarium is one of the best attractions there although it can be very crowded. They are building a MTR station near Ocean Park. Looks like it can be completed soon. It may be a good idea to wait for its completion. Taking a bus to the park means can be stuck in traffic jams.

Need one day here. divided in two parts, the Ocean park is twelve hour full of thrill and fun.book tickets earlier, be there a few min before the park opens.get hold of a map,take the ocean express up, all rides up need you(children) to be 48 inches tall or no go !Take the rope way down - the view is worth it All the rides are fun if you are game ! no need to pay for anything but for the food & souvenirsPlease do remember to enjoy and not be rushed to try everything.Avoid public holidays or queues can get longer.

Great for family!. This park is much bigger than Disneyland HK and has almost everything for all ages. There is a children play land for toddlers and young kids, triller rides for the adventurous ones, aquarium, animals pavilion for those who aren't keen on rides, a nice train ride from the base to hill top, quite a few restaurants & souvenir shops everywhere. You should spend 1 whole day here. Q for rides was fast too.

Nice.. We visited Ocean Park on a Monday of the busy October Week. It was crowded to say the least. Looking at the previous reviews and suggestions from past visitors on the TA forum we went in exactly in reverse. We straight away took the cable car and went on the top of the park and started completing all the roller coasters and thrill rides one by one. We would complete one area of the park and then hit another and so on, before we completed everything and took a train back to the bottom and completed the rest. Compared to Disney Land, Ocean park is definitely more geared towards teens and adults with its adventure and thrill rides, while Disney is definitely for the kids.It was a good experience overall. The dining options, apart from McDonalds were average and limited.

Beautiful Christmas Decoration. It's so easy to get to the OCEAN PARK. We had a good time here, so glad to see beautiful Christmas decoration in the park. We met Santa, took many nice pics. The aquarium and sea things are very big. My 5th year old is very excited to see Nobita character. Even they have small house for Doraemon and friends. For those who like to come and do not like queuing I suggested not to come on holiday season. So you will see and enjoy more. Spend your time from morning till evening here and it's fun! My suggestion for Ocean park management is they should put more signage with details rather than asked us to read the map by ourselves.

For the Young and Old. We find Ocean Park much better than Disneyland. There are more thrilling rides. The park is big and the 2 main must do items is the cable car ride (15 minutes) and the dolphine show (about 20 minutes). These 2 become the signature of those who visit the park. However be ready for the crowd of these 2 items especially the dolphine show.The cable car allows you to have an overview of not only the park but surrounding waters and hills. However the view is scondary but it is the ride that is thrilling as it travels up and down at a steep gradient which we have never experienced excpet on mountain train in Switzerland.At the main entrance, be ready to queue to buy the tickets but to avoid, you can purchase the tickets on line. Be expect to spend a day here if you have kids.

T'was a Blast!. The Park was amazing, and it got everything you need for an adventure, fun, relaxation and even health assistance! The rides were a blast that I ended up in one of the clinics but I had fun.HOW TO GET THERE: Take MTR to Admiralty Station and walk towards Admiralty Bus Terminus. Take Bus 629, and it will take you the Ocean Park for 25 minutes depending on the flow of traffic. However, the last time we were there, there was a temporary rerouting of the buses. Instead of Admiralty, we took Bus 629 in Tin Hau. It's best to be updated on the traffic routes. You can use your Octopus Card for your fare payment. If not, pay in exact amount because they will not give any change at all. HIGHLIGHTS:- It is more interactive compared to Hong Kong Disneyland. Of course, each is unique on its own.- There are live animals such as Pandas and Penguins to amuse watchers. Live shows are performed at designated places and time. - There are more thriller rides within the Park. Try The Flash and The Hair Raiser if you want the thrill of your life. - There are less nerve- wrecking rides within the park such as the the carousel, the Ferris wheel, the mini train.- There are food shops along the area, and less expensive compared to Disneyland. - There are also games to play so that you could win Ocean Park goodies and stuff toys. You can play for HKD30.00 or HKD50.00. - Every area has a theme and highlight. It's recommended if you could visit the Park for 1- Day- There are souvenir shops in every area. It's less expensive compared to Disneyland. You can buy keychains for HKD30.00, Plushies for HKD80.00, Ref Magnets for HKD40.00, Ballpens for 2 HKD50.00 and many more items to choose from. - The park closes at 7PM. If you want to avoid the long queues of the Cable Car if you're on the upper part of the Park, leave ahead. We waited for almost 1 Hour before we got into the Cable Car. There is also the Ocean Express to accommodate during the early hours.- There First Aid/Clinic was good and very comfortable. I was able to rest well, and it was clean. - There are so many people in the park. If you don't want the crowds, then this is not for you. Sometimes, people are rude, they end up pushing you!

Overrated. We visited the park in November with 2 teenagers after being advised by many people not to waste time with Disneyland.Although the rides were good and suitable across all ages the park in general lacked character.Panda exhibits were good.We opted not to eat at McDonalds and found that the alternative was very average.Cost was not excessive and transport to and from the venue easy- Addition of MRT station will make it even easier in future
Best experience. The Ocean Park Hong Kong was one of the best experiences of my life. I will recommend anyone to visit the park. The service was excellent.

Wonderful amusement park!. This park is amazing - very easy to get to by bus from Admiralty Station. Once there, the park is HUGE - with exciting things to do at every corner. The 3 must things to do are: 1) visit the Pandas; 2) take the cable cart ride; 3) go on the rollar coaster rides! Going there during off season helped though to avoid long line ups. I would highly recommend this place (although you're going to need 2 days minimum to complete the whole park).

FUN!. The locals highly recommended me to Ocean Park rather than Disneyland. And so I came. They have very pretty aquariums!! Also, they have pretty theme park. We spent the whole day there. It was very worth the price.

Better than Disneyland. hate to say this but this park beats Disneyland hands down . Maybe its just my opinion but we had to visit this place twice in order to checkout available attractions . Rides are fantastic and the Ocean life is magnificent. goto this park after you visit Disneyland .
Crowed. Facilities are good and well maintained. Educational activities for children. Very crowded with visitors and tourists groups from mainland China.

A must visit. A must visit in HK. Its a total delight for both adults and children. a good mix of adventure, fantasy and wild life. its a whole day of fun and delight. The views are breathtaking as the rides are placed with views of sea and mountain. Always rush to the top first and leave the bottom to the evening. If the cable car que is long, take the train to top and then you can venture the cable car when you come down in the evening.

Three great experiences for the price of one!. After 2 days at Disney we decided to try Ocean Park after several great reviews from friends. It did not disappoint. The cable car ride alone between the two sides of the park was worth the price of admission. Just amazing views everywhere.We got to the park 15 min after its 10 am opening and it was empty. We started at the panda exhibit and it was amazing - our first time to see these animals. Very active.After a couple more exhibits we took the cable cars across the island ... which was a good move as the line was very long at 1 PM as we were leaving. If you don't like heights, beware! The cars feel very safe but it's a long way down.The rides are clearly for the older kids (vs Disney) but our 6 and 7 year old still had a lot to do. They loved the shark exhibit - we spent a lot of time watching them circle the tank. My 2 year old son loved the rainforest section - the colorful birds caught his eye.Our children demanded McDonald's, which is by the Shark building. There is no immediate seating but if you go to the right and continue past McDonald's then you will get to a beautiful path with a wide stone wall. It's a perfect setting for a lunch overlooking the ocean.I would carve out a day for this - high quality, a great price performer and enjoyable!

A collection of attractions. This place is a theme park, a zoo, an aquarium and an aviary all rolled into 1 attraction. Although 1 or 2 of the attractions are just about average, the presence of the others more than make up for them. The park has also continued to rejuvenate itself adding more rides for the brave. With so many attractions, a hotel would be a great addition allowing visitors the convenience of covering the park at a more leisurely pace over 2 days.

Lovely views . We came with our kids on Christmas Day. It rained (moderate drizzle) all day. This was our second, my third visit here. As ever, this venue is a very popular place and the entry fee was good value. We loved the skycars because it crosses from one side of the mountain to the other, passing some breathtaking views of the sea and greenery. The rides are designed for kiddies, mostly circa 7- 14 year age group. They're designed for fun rather than thrills. The queues were not excessively long, but please do remember that at busy periods, this place is flooded by tour groups and lots of Chinese (non local) tourists whom have no sense of respect for queuing and will have no hesitation in cutting straight through everybody!Especially nice are the pandas and goldfish. The views are breathtaking and looks out to the expanse of the sea. The food is horrendous. Avoid the sausage (all varieties and from whichever stall it is sold)... I don't know what's in it, but to me it wreaks of badly recycled old grease and the locals (unlike the mainland chinese) wouldn't touch them with a barge pole! Please also to bring walking shoes... The park has some seriously undulating hills and inclines and if you go with a stroller like us, there are detours designed for wheels but these are snake like and very long paths. Overall, good park- ignore the rush and push of other tourists and your kids will come out smiling like ours. 7/10

Best theme park EVER!! Loved it. What a fantastic Park. The ride on the Cable Car was worth the admission ticket alone! Spectacular views from the cable car, you think you are just going up the mountain and once at the top you discover there is another Mountain beyond and your journey continues. Once at the top, spectacular views and a huge theme park. Ocean Park is like 5 theme parks in one, Aquarium, Seals, Penguins, Roller Coasters, Thrill Rides, Etc. We came for a day and decided to stay until close at 9pm and wished we had another day to explore more, too much to get around in one day. A definite must to visit for the young at heart and the kids. Far better than any theme park we have visited in Australia and we live on the Gold Coast, so have seen them all. The staff were so friendly and were all wearing Christmas hats, really getting into the spirit.

Amazing Time. Revisited after 3 years, this is still a very enjoyable theme park. We went on a weekday and arrived at 10am. The crowd is manageable. We took the cable car up and started with rides on top. It was refreshing to see some new additions to the theme park. Very nice views too.Some interesting rides worth mentioning are Hair Raiser and The Abyss. If you plan to take The Rapids, it's advisable to put on a poncho. They do sell expensive ponchos at the entrance, so if you can bring your own. Or bring clothings to change after. Allow some time to visit the pandas too.The crowd was okay until 3-4pm when all of a sudden, there were many tourists on group tour arriving. Hence, the long queue. So, please arrive early to avoid long queue.

Fabulous day out . We took 5 teenagers to Ocean Park and had a blast! Right from the exciting cable car ride to the top, to the thrilling rides and reasonably priced food, it was a great day out. The kids loved the roller coasters, and believe us, when the two water rides say you 'may' get soaked . . . you will! A great day out - we got the train back down which was also fun. Only piece of advice - get there early because by the time we left it was packed.

Had a blast!. Went here on a Tuesday and had so much fun, wasn't too crowded so we didn't have to queue for a long time. I guess its definitely better to come on a weekday. Transport from city centre is pretty easy. Rides were very amusing and animal enclosures looked clean and well-maintained. Favorite attractions: Giant Panda Adventure, The Flash, Hair Raiser and South & North Pole Encounter. Food and drinks sold inside the park were expectedly expensive. Takes a whole day to be able to visit all the attractions, so being early and wearing comfy shoes is definitely a necessity. Overall good fun!
Ocean park . i go to ocean park on work once this march, Ocean park is also many people And lt is very new 機動遊戲And many new 設施I am enjoy in ocean park very much~~
Renewed theme park. Ocean Park is a very old theme park in Hong Kong, however new attractions are added from time to time. Make sure you take the cable car and train in Ocean Park.

Just like other parks. Ocean park is a great place to go if you have kids or you enjoy theme rides. But do be aware, there is a lot of walking to do and there are so many attractions that it would literally take you a whole day to go around. So plan where you're going to go before hand. They have some great thrill rides and also there are some attractions with animals and aquariums. So quite a wide variety. But do be aware of the crowds. Go there as soon as the park opens or you will be stuck in lines which could take an hour. So plan ahead. Overall a great place but nothing completely special.

So many Mainland Chinese tourists!. The park is nice. But you cannot see much unless you are willing to join the throngs of Mainland Chinese tourists. There were like….. one million of them in the park. Kidding.. maybe ten thousand?They will push you to get past you, shout into your ears. sit right beside you though there are other empty seats around. There are so many of them. They cut queues and when you are taking pics of your family, they stand right in front of you. Hahahahah!Overall, the attractions are really not bad. Thats if you can deal with your neighbors. Pandas were so adorable! Cable car ride was scary but the view was really good.Dolphin show was very shortIt was really nice but you really have to endure a lot or learn to overlook a lot of things.

A new experience after makeover. Ocean park had a recent makeover and I am pleasantly suprise by the new attractions and new look. Some things are still the same. The cable car ride and the breathtaking view of the ocean is worth the visit again and again. Miss the old killer whale performance ...

Brilliant fun. This is an excellent combined theme and animal park and the organisation of everything is first class. Must see are obviously the Pandas...........awesome. Rides are great, well laid out. Cable car ride to the top is fab and the submarine tram back down different! Loved it all

NEVER AGAIN. We will never go back again. The place was so crowded and Mainland Chinese so rude and pushing and shoving - we where concerned about the safety of our 4 year old. There was also clearly a lack of park employees to handle such crowds.The wait for the cable car was 1 hour. No thanks.If you like crowds of rude and shoving people - this is the place to go.

Better rides than Disneyland for older kids but so much worse.. Ocean Park would be much better if they didn't have to compete with Disneyland. The rides are much better for older kids and adults but the place is shabby and poorly run and having a Disneyland nearby really shows it up. Still worth a visit, don't have high expectations and you'll have a fun time.

Wonderful day!. I am a big fan of all the crazy roller coasters, so this was heaven for me! I tried all of them with free fall at the end and it was enough. Other attractions are nice as well, sea world, pandas and others, but the amount of people in there is terrible.. Don't visit Ocean Park during the peak season! But overall amazing ;)
nice. its not to be compared with singapore but its nice in a way..ter r lots to see..the musiczn combined with the light settings make it mesmerizin ..the seal show was borin...jelly fishes were a

Tourist from australia, AMAZING!!. We were visiting family in HK from australia and the park was absolutely amazing!! It was massive with endless places to explore. Make sure you prepare a full day to walk around. The highlights for me were definitely the cable car and the log ride in which we went on numerous times. It is specially designed to suit people of all ages and definitely not one to be missed. Only down side is that food is quite expensive so maybe bring some of your own.

Cable Car & Marine Train. The area at Ocean Park is quite huge, it consist of 2 parts, one at the hill area and the otherat the low land area. Just need to buy the admission ticket at the counter but it is better buy the discounted ticket at other area such as Golden Crown Guest House. You can get the cheaper ticket and do not need to queue at ticketing counter.To link the 2 area, there are both Cable car & Marine train can be taken. Thus, we first visit the hill area amusement park by taking the cable car. Almost half a day later, we going to low land area by taking the Marine Train. There are a lot of attraction at low land area too.By taking the Cable Car, you have a nice view of the Southern Hong Kong Island. As for the Marine Train, you feel like the train is moving under sea but actually, it is video showing at the ceiling of the train.Anyway both ride is free of charge and it is locate inside the ocean park compound, It is included in the admission ticket

Fun day out…with a lot of walking. Be warned… you ought to put on your walking shoes for this. The place is pretty huge and it takes a bit of walking to get to the various attractions, and there are so many of them it’s quite impossible to see all of them in one day. So the best thing to do before beginning your adventure is to roughly plan out the attractions and areas you want to visit. The aquarium is pretty impressive especially when you realize how huge the central tank is, though I was more captivated with an entire section devoted to various beautiful varieties of gold fishes. The poles where the penguins live are quite cool too, sadly the polar bear section was closed for maintenance during my visit. A visit to the panda sanctuary is probably one of the standard check-boxes you should have on your list, though the dolphin show is a bit of a letdown as it was nothing too spectacular and you might give that a pass. There are a few interesting rides for the thrill seekers, though you shouldn’t miss the light show at the fountain at the end of the day to complete a memorable outing.

Ocean park Hong Kong. Ocean park in Hong Kong is great it's an all day place with lots to see and do you can get there on the big red bus that is how we went but the last bus leaves at 4.15 and you have to go all the way to Stanley and back before you get back to your motel.i think it's a 1 hour trip to stanley and 1 hour back so if you are ready for home just get on another bus not the big red bus to go home

Pure Marine Adventure. The ocean park gave my family pure adventure with lot of marine activity which helped all of us to come near to nature. The rides were thrilling. The park was planned in such a manner that it gave something to all. The dolphin show was marvelous & at last the fountain show took all credit. A must go.

FAMILY THEME PARK. This theme park is suitable for all ages, from children to adult to seniors. It not only have rides, it also have an amazing aquarium and places for feeding the animals.I love the gold fish aquarium the most.The only complaint I have is the food.

3rd Trip. Was there for the squid. Yes, I was looking forward to the BBQ squid which were sold at the stalls there. HKD40 per piece. My kids were there for the rides. Since this is my 3rd trip (2nd one with my kids), we were better at planning how to spend our time. Make sure you have a map of the park in hand. You can get it when you buy the ticket at the park counter or as you go in at the kiosk located on the left hand side of the entrance.My advice is to take the cable car rides first because if you choose to take the cable car ride back at the end of the day, trust me the queue would be very very long. We opted to take the Express train back instead.Rides were better suited for kids of ages 10 and above. If you have younger children, choose Disneyland instead. My kids even queued up twice for some of the rides. Though it was our 2nd trip, we left the park at 6.30pm to beat the crowd. On that day, park was closed at 7pm.TIP : YOU CAN GET DISCOUNTED TICKETS THROUGH CTS HONG KONG. THEY WILL ISSUE YOU THE PARK TICKETS WHICH ARE VALID FOR 3-4 WEEKS SO YOU CAN USE THEM ANYTIME YOU WISH.

Better for older kids.... As a family with early teens, this is a must-do...and i must say that i enjoyed myself at the park. Tickets were purchased online as a discounted rate and no issues getting in (just need to show the printed barcode). We started at the lower levels but if you have been to other zoos/aquariums, this is only average. 'Tis much better to head straight to the queue for the cable car to the Summit where all the cool rides are. We tried a few of them twice in a row, although for some there is a long walk between one roller-coaster to the other. As for the "pushy" Chinese tourists, this is more for the tamer rides/exhibits - the wilder rides are mostly for the younger generation, so no issues with those. We can see a MTR station being constructed across the entrance (almost completed) so transportation should be way easier in the future (currently MTR followed by bus 629)...

A must to do if your into fun. A lot of fun with a big variety of thrill seeking to the ride up the mountain on the cable car. Very much a fun day, the Halloween theme was very well done, I have some great photos for memories

Lots to see and rides a plenty. Take your walking shoes, cos there is a fair bit of walking to do. The thrill seeker rides are very good. Get there nice and early to the park and miss the busy queues. The animals we saw were all active and the Panda's were eating and playing around. Food is resonably priced as well. Do take a waterproof jacket cos you will get wet on the water rides.
Theme Park. Recognized as the the "World's Top Theme Park", it didnt disappoint. plenty of rides for everyone, though the waiting time could be long as there are alot of tour groups and tourists.
Family attractive palace. I belive you have a good time if you go to Ocean park. There are so different palaces about animal and some amasing vehicles there.

Great value theme park with plenty of variety for the family. I'm a theme park veteran having visited parks throughout Asia, Australia & US and I must say this Ocean Park stacks up against the best of them. Its not a thrill seeker park, more an all rounder with a mix of thrills, family rides and wildlife. Staff are helpful, plenty of faxilities. Yes the masses of Chinese at the front gates are daunting but once you get moving the lines move quickly and some rides i was on within a few minutes. For the ticket price this place is great value and once tired it was easy to get a taxi out.
rain spoiled the day. as we entered ocean park , there was heavy rain we could saw the indoor aquarium , had lunch, all rides were closed , even dolphin show was cancelled

A Fun Family Day - a must on your HK Itinerary. An excellent day-out for kids, and for their parents, too! Try as many rides as you can. They are super-fun, though you cannot do all of them. The Cable Car is a must try! The Ocean Express can be avoided as there is nothing special or spectacular about it. Try to catch the Dolphin Show towards the evening. It's quite spectacular and a nice way to round-off your day. You can spend the first half of the day at the Summit side, which is the higher half of the park, and the latter half at the Waterfront side.The easiest way to reach is by Bus#629, coming from the north side of HongKong Island. Very convenient. Based upon my experience, i would strongly recommend visiting on a Non-Public Holiday.

worth visiting. if you are in hongkong for a vacation, you can't miss to visit this place..very large and spacious..all the rides and shows very interesting..but don't go alone.. have fun in company of your family and friends..

Good day out, but not for a really hot day.. We had a nice day out at Ocean Park, it was a real treat to see the Pandas and the Penguin exhibition was really interesting too. The gondola and train within the park make it easy to access the different areas and there is plenty to see and do.The park is quite large and when we visited it was very hot, make sure you take plenty of fluids if the weather is warm as the park is quite large.

Good rides but too many Chinese tourists. We went on a weekday (Monday) during the HK school period so there at least wasn't huge queues from students. The average wait time was around 5-15mins (bumper cars was around 20min). We got there around 10:15, bought tickets and went in around 10:30. Took the cable car up to the Summit where we headed straight for the dragon ride, however upon arrival they were still 'testing' the ride. We waited there because they said it should be ready in another 5-10mins. We probably ended up waiting for 20 just to be told it's still not ready so we ended up going for some other rides.Overall it was a pretty good day except for the fact that it seems to be on every Visit-HK-From-China tour. Suffice to say there was a lot of 'pushing in line', 'pushing you from behind' and 'bumping into you' incidents the whole day. Good to knows: There's no bringing food into the park - they will check your backpacks and would turn you away IF they find it in your bag. Water bottles should be fine - I brought in mine.Go to the summit first, there's more rides up there and more food choices (McDonalds is located up there but the prices are higher than outside prices). Also remember to watch the dolphin/seal's performance while you are up there.If you don't want to be pushed or shoved on the connecting train, take the cable car. However the wait time would be longer.

A must visit park in HK. One word.. "FUN!!".. Son enjoyed his trip here and when he saw the cable-car, he immediately told us, that he wanted to have a ride in it. We explored the lower level first, before heading to the summit to enjoy the cool air up there by using the Ocean Express. After exploring the summit, we proceeded to the Ocean Theater to watch the Seal and Dolphin show, which we quite enjoyed.We enjoyed some of the available rides, which my son can only sit and he enjoyed the Cable-car ride the most. Try to arrive early at the park to avoid the long Qs.

Save your money. I am just going to come out and say it. Ocean Park is not a great park for kids. The rides are okay-nothing special, but the main problem is that there are SO MANY Chinese adults floating around the park that it was hard for my family to really get into enjoying the park. There are SO MANY Chinese tour buses with OLD people that it really detracted from getting around and enjoying the park. There I said it. We spent half the time trying to stay ahead of the Chinese tours because once they came to a section they flooded it and really caused chaos. Case in point-we were in the jelly fish exhibit and just as we got in 60 + senior mainlanders on a tour came swooping through and just ruined the experience for my family. This happened time and time again. Not only seniors, but adults were all over the place-hardly any kids or kids with families. Really odd feeling theme park. I would save my money. We felt it was a bit of a waste for us.

A true Hongkong Theme Park. I love the cble-car which links the Water Front section and the Summit section. It is an attraction by itself. On the way,up and down hill,we can see the beautiful beaches of Hongkong Island south,the islands around and looking beyond,the South Sea. I love also the Aqua City and the Jelly-fish aquarium. Taking no. 629 City Bus from Central(pier-7)will arrive the Ocean Park in 30 min. To avoid long queing time,be there 15 min. before the opening in the morning and take a ride of the cable-car up the Summit and enjoy the activities there before coming down to the Water Front. Edward CHAN in Hongkong

You'll need more than a day.... Ocean Park has a great range of attractions from roller coasters and water rides to sea life shows and a zoo. It's located atop a cliff so views are spectacular especially on a clear day. The dolphin show was particularly good and you have to see the pandas whilst you're there too. It can be extremely busy, so try to avoid weekends and school holidays, and don't expect to do everything in one day! I booked my tickets through Klook.com which were the cheapest I could find. Well worth it if you're visiting HK.

ONE TIME MUST. Ocean Park is a full day schedule. Live sight of Panda, Penguins, Sharks and most of all Dolphins. Please know very clearly the timings of various shows. Do not miss the Dolphin show and be seated well before the start of the show because the evening show gets house full very fast. The park is in two parts connected by train/ cable cars.Train is ordinary but better otion if you want to commute quickly.The Aquarium was also good for first timers.Roller coasters and other thrilling rides for children.

Amazing day!. Had not been there in decades and became curious after reading about it. We were a party of 6 middle aged ladies who don't do rides. We had the most amazing time. The animals there are not zoo animals. We learned so much. The setting is beautiful and well arranged. The animals live very well. The scenery is amazing. Pre-purchase your tickets online and you'll save a lot of time. Getting there is simple. Take the coach from Tin Hau MTR station. Food in restaurants there are a bit pricey for the quality.

caters to the old and young. Ocean Park is huuuuge. I don't think one whole day is enough for you to enjoy the whole place. Nevertheless, the place is great as it has attractions that will cater to all age group. Be prepared to walk, walk and walk so wear your most comfortable shoes. Food and drinks are a bit pricey so best if you sneak in some snacks and drinking bottle since there is a refilling station inside.

Crowded - not much for little kids. We went to Ocean Park towards the end of November on a Saturday. As expected the place was crowded right from when we started in the bus. We reached the park at about 10:30 am and decided to go straight to the summit part of the park through the cable car. Surprisingly, at this point we just had to wait for 5 minutes. My 6 years old daughter enjoyed this ride. Upon reaching the summit, you need to do a lot of walking and there are all types of rides. My husband enjoys the thrill and sat on the hair raiser and some other dangerous looking rides while I waited with my daughter. The wait times were not much due to the nature of these rides. But for all the other simpler rides the queues were extremely long - we skipped many of them just by looking at the queues with approximate waiting time of over 30-40 minutes. The dolphin show was alright (but not as good compared to the one at Singapore Santosa). My daughter enjoyed it and so that's fine. The penguin enclosure was good and we enjoyed looking at them - but it was quite cold inside and thankfully we were all carrying extra jackets. The jelly fish aquariums were also cool. Overall, we skipped a lot of stuff at the summit due to the queues - we then decided to go down through the train which was quick and without much wait time. The bird show at the park was pretty lame - Jurong bird park in Singapore was way better. There were two other shows at the whiskers theater (in cantonese) - they were also very lame and gave me a headache. But our daughter seemed to enjoy those too. There is a play area for kids (which you can find at any public park) - many other games (costing 10$ per coin) - which we avoided. The panda enclosure was okay but we did not get a good view of the giant panda. We were not able to visit the grand aquarium due to the loooong queue. There are more eating options at the summit, so it's better to eat there rather than coming down. All the better attractions were at the top - so it would make sense to spend more time there. You can easily skip all the shows and see only the dolphin one.

Must visit place. Ocean park visit is unique experience. It is a very big park with various interesting attraction and shows. Covering all in one day is tough. Dolphin show , aquarium are unique things to watch.

Unique location plagued by huge crowds. Ocean Park is located on the South side of Hong Kong island. Pros: amazing lead roller coaster. Crazy views of the ocean from dizzing heights. Friendly staff. The gondola ride to the park extension is maybe the best ride of all.Cons: crowded. Long lines. Some of the crowd are the DMV, Beverly Hillbillies types.

Plenty to do and see.. Spent 4 days Hong Kong in November and decided to visit Ocean Park. What a good and bad experience that was. Ocean Park was fantastic with so much to do and experience. I am totally amazed with how a theme park can be constructed on and around a mountain. The bad thing was trying to get back to our hotel by taxi. We waited 2.5 hours on the taxi rank in the rain along with masses of other people trying to get home. The park management should look to liaising with the taxi company to improve the service. My advice is to take an organized bus tour if you want to get back to your hotel at a reasonable time. Bus to taxi ratio is about 50:1. Had a great day at the park but very tied and in need of drink by the time we got back to our room.

Ocean Park. This is a Hong Kong theme park where, has many unique attractions. The set back now is that there are just too many Mainland Chinese tourists coming and brought us many other problems such as Traffic Jams, and waiting in long Q for Rides. I would suggest the following as must DO:1. Cable cars ride -2. Dolphin Shows3. Panda Home Visit4. Water cannel Ride Avoid to visit during major chinese holidays - Oct 1 - 7 Chinese National Days / Golden WeekChinese New year

Great day out on weekday to avoid the crowd. My previous visit to the park was some 7,8 years ago and I was impressed with the big change over. As I am not a big fan of fun rides so my focus was on animals. The highlight of the visit was the penguin palace, they were so cute and active. I loves the design that some part of the floor is transparent and you can actually see the penguins swimming underneath. And cable car ride was not to be missed, the view was magnificent but beware on the long queue. Best to take it at the beginning and back using the faster sea train.Also love the show of seals and dolphins as now it was more about conservation and education rather than forcing the animals to entertain the audience.Do allow more time to stay in the park ( preferably a whole day) especially in weekends as there are many group tours and the queues can be very long.
Great value. Ocean Park has so much to see and do. Well worth it. Access to easy from Admiralty and soon there will be an MTR line coming here. It's easy to fill a whole day at the park.

Better than Disney land. For the awesome views from cable car, more variety for all age and both gender kids, giant aquarium, panda, better priced store and that adventureland on top of a hill. Go weekdays for better experience.

Great place to take the kids. We took our grand-daughter age 14 months and she enjoyed seeing all the animals.Older children will enjoy the rides and there are plenty of them. Cost for two of us was just over £50 for the day so it matched places like Disney etc

Loved it!. Must do whilst in Hong Kong. In my option, alot better then Disneyland, especially if you have already been to one Disneyland, the rest are all the same, doesn't matter what country your in. Ocean Park is a MASSIVE Amusement Park spread over 3-4 mountains. Could easily be here all day so arrive early! Great stuff for kids & adults.

still a very nice place for kids and adult. I travel to Hong Kong every year. and have not been to ocean park since my kid had grown up. Now that I had a grandson which i brought alone this time. Good for kids and specially for the teens. They added a few attraction, but the rides are still the same. For me seeing the kids happy, enjoying, that good for me too.
Too crowded. Lot's to see. But had to queue for ages for everything. This made the experience less enjoyable. Make sure it is not a public holiday when you decide to go.

Really funny but crowded. I spent half a day in this park and I had really got fun. Interesting animals and great attractions in a magnificient place. I suggest to go early in the morning or late in the evening, because there is a lot of people and you risk to wait more than one hour for any attraction.

Go early. If you are at a hotel with a travel concierge desk, buy the tickets there. The price is the same, and you save the long lines at the park to buy the tickets. The cheapest way is to take the MTR to Admiralty Station (presently Tin Hau station because of the student demonstrations) and take bus 629. Take the same bus back. Make sure you get there before 11 am before the major tour buses from China arrive. When you leave, give yourself 90 minutes to get back to where you started, because of massive traffic that starts around 4 pm.If you want to try the rides, give yourself the whole day or more. We just went to see the marine and animal life, and that took 4 hours. If you want to see those, note beforehand the location of the exhibits, or else you will waste time walking to a building that turns out to be a ride. We went to see the pandas too. The pandas turned out to sleep a lot, so be prepared to see nothing, lest you be disappointed. There are two different panda exhibits. Many people line up at the first one at the Jockey Club Sichuan Treasures. The pandas were sleeping inside their dens. The other panda exhibit is at the Amazing Asian Animals exhibit. There are giant pandas and red pandas in here. They were also sleeping, but at least you can see them. Other places we liked: the aquarium and the shark exhibit.

One day in sea animal world. Good to spend one day in this water land, in particular with children. There are many interesting activities going on in the Park. Also a good education for those who are not famiar with the sea animals.

Disney is so much better. This is a very big park. So be prepared for a lot of walking. The distance between one attraction to the next is very far. Some of the rides are also very dated. The staff are also rude, but that's typical everywhere around Hong Kong.The only upside to this park is that they have 2 real life pandas, which are very cute. Other animal attractions are also nice. But be prepared for lots of walking. The only depressing part was where they house their dolphins, in small pools, which were way to small for the dolphins. This building showed how dolphins were being trained for tricks and it was very sad to watch. The dolphins should just be released to the wild, and it would be far better without any dolphins shows.Won't be returning to Ocean Park again. As the title suggests, Disneyland was way better.

Exciting place. There many large playing game facility inside. Compare with Disyney land, I thing Ocean Park is more suitable for adut as you can play the most exicting game there. Animal Zoo can be found inside the park too. You spend 1 whole day in the park.

animals, rides, shows and much more.... Located in Aberdeen on Hong Kong Island Ocean Park is somewhere I visit each time I return to Hong Kong. Much more than a simple amusement park there is a lot to do for all ages. Getting there is very simple and you can save a bit of money by purchasing your tickets before you arrive at the park from many outlets around Hong Kong including 7 Eleven, Circle K and some hotels and hostels. If you have never been to Ocean Park before then I recommend going later in the day so you can stay for the night time water, light ,& fire spectacular called "Symbio", There is a lot to take in at Ocean Park so another tip is to grab a park map find a seat and plan your visit. There are some really amazing views of the surround area of Aberdeen available from the park too, these can make for many incredible snap shots.

Great Aquarium. I went to OP for the aquarium and was not disappointed. A great display of animals in very humane enclosures. The park had rides that were fun but not up-to-date. Older stuff that had some thrills but more for kids than adults.Spent the whole day there and walked a lot. This is a huge park spread over a large area and you have to take a shuttle or the sky cars to get over the hill to the other areas. Be careful if you have issues walking....it is not going to be an easy day.Food was very expensive and not very good.

Fun for kids and adults alike. We actually enjoyed Ocean Park more than Disney as we are all adults in the group. The rides are more thrilling and action-packed. The cable car ride, with its steep drops was scream-inducing, vertigo-causing awesomeness. The main aquarium is small compared to that in Singapore but the rides certainly made up for it.The MTR station that will take you directly to Ocean Park is currently being constructed. As for now, you'll need to take bus 629 from Admiralty station. It really is not an issue but do take note that the park closes at 7PM and there's going to be a long line to get on bus 629 during that time. Tip: do not go there on weekends as there are long lines for every ride and you won't be able to maximize your time there.

Great attraction but get there early. This attraction has things for both adults and children. Get there very early you won't beat the queues but you can get near the front.
