Most people seem to head for the cable car upto the higher level attractions but suggest that you don't do that instead head to the panda enclosure they are generally being fed and are active and there are no crowds. Things will have quietened down and you can get around the other exhibits once you have exhausted your interest in the pandas. take in a dolphin/seal show in the afternoon also fascinating is the jellyfish exhibit.

Wicked!!!. Such an awesome experience! Would definitely go again! Great range of rides and food. We got there as it opened in the am which worked in our favour as we got to go on all the rides with no waiting times and then visit all the animals and watch some shows in the afternoon. Would def recommend

Amazing Pandas. A group of 12 of us took taxis (not expensive at all) to Ocean Park from Kowloon. This park is so clean and tidy. We were impressed by the animal displays, especially the black and white as well as the Red Pandas. You could spend the whole day here and have an amazing time. We had to line up for 45 mins for the cable car ride. Short lines for the spectacular rides available. I would suggest not to go on week-ends as it is much much busier. We went on a week day. So much to see and do......don't miss this attraction when next in Hong Kong.

Tips for Ocean park. 1. Get there at 9.30 before it opens and remember your ID card if you are a resident as significant discount available during certain months. 2. leave before 2pm as it fills up in the afternoon.3. Bring sun block and hard cash for playing games as not that many cash machines in the park. The food is what you would expect so bring fruit if you want to counter balance the inevitable.4. Run like everyone else to the cable car upon entry and get to the main area up the mountain. The queues get crazy.5. Use the ocean express to get down to the exit instead of the cable car- it's cool and less queues.6. Consider booking one of the restaurants at 1 island south which is a 3 min walk away (we went to GCX)7. Check the height restrictions for rides. The staff are very strict (as they should be) and this can lead to tears if expectations have been set.8. Use the escalator to get to the mining ride and river rapid.

Plan ahead.... The place is awesome for little ones. We come here once a year for the past 5 years and nothing much is change. They should have a crowd control inside as its pretty scary to be inside with millions of people rushing and pushing just to get to any ride and transport to get around the park. We are very dissapointed this time.

Tired but enjoy. I come here last may.. and oh my god its really really hot.. but overall it is good.. but you must prepare alot of drink haha.. enjoy almost all of the part of this area.. and the rollercoaster very great. It can make me crazy lol... hope can be here again next year.

Highlight of my trip . Truly exceeds expectations I am a big fan of theme parks and sea this was the combination of both. Rides were awesome best of all and scariest was hair raiser waited 45 minutes but was worth it one tip to anybody visiting if you know what a cable car is and have sat in it don't waste your time standing in the queue because it takes lots of time and you miss too much of the parks attractions

Exceeded My Expectations. Think junior Disney Land and you'll have an impression of Ocean Park. Well organized, modern, and accessibility make it appealing for a day trip with young ones. Want to ease the stress - go early, pack snacks, and plan an agenda. Too many opportunities for aimless wandering due to ambiguous signage.Avoid the crowds by taking the cable car to the far side of the park when you arrive, and work your way back to the near side after lunch. You'll find this much more pleasant and avoid the inevitable queues. What struck me that it was primarily adults in the park - bus loads of them. See the pandas, take a sweater for the penguin exhibit, and go to kids world for a ride on the carrousel. Children will have a wonderful time.

if you want a crowd then this is good. this place , when we went there was way too crowded for my liking and I think also for others who were there on the same day , Money hungry Park owners should have set limits on the number of entrants , my trip was first week in February 2011

Rainy day. As the title says, we got there and it rained. So what can we do on a rainy day here? 1) visit the aquarium - the aquarium was moderately sized, complete with sufficient sea animals for variety. What I do not like is the entrance where the entire queue is diverted to a photo point and even though you do not want it, just got to pose and get it over with before the staff lets you in. The aquarium 's design is nothing special but good enough if it is your first visits to its kind.2) visit the pandas - there are two enclosures, one with aging pandas. When we were there, the pandas were asleep in a separate enclosure so it was a wasted trip. The one with the younger pandas is open, and you get to see red pandas as well3) visit the crocodiles - can o lay see from a small view port4) visit the goldfish - I never know they are so many kinds of gold fishes5) visit the birds - I did not go there6) visit a children theme park - the 3 rides are open if you don't mind getting wet. There are also some other paid games which I do not fancy trying under the rain7) take the cable car to the summit - the theme park is split into two, one at the foot of the hill and the other at the summit. I did not go up but from the map it looks like it's a theme park for older kids. I have no idea why this place is named ocean park since the aquarium probably takes up about 2% of the park area. Apart from the adherence to the theme, I would still recommend a visit here since you get everything in one place. I believe the experience would have great if not for the rain. By the way, if you do not want to queue at the theme park for the tickets, they are also available from 7-11. After purchasing, you will be issued with a thermal paper based tickets which can be scanned at the turnstile for access into the theme park. I understand that one of the mtr station sells the tickets as well, and cheaper. Forgotten which one is it, you can probably check with the hotel's concierge.

A nice day out. If you can deal with the odd queue pushing mainlander (they are in the minority for the most part) then this is a lovely place to spend a day.I would try and avoid the weekends as it is very busy with tour groups. I called out people who tried to push in and blocked people from behind from pushing in front of me.I have to admit the staff were really good at dealing queue jumpers.The animal and aquarium areas are really good and the rides on the upper area are very good. Food and drink can be expensive but you can water from the free fountains I really enjoying seeing the arctic foxes, the pandas and the penguins the most.

Gerat theme park!. It was really fun! This park is a combination between amusement rides and zoo. We can see pandas, sharks, penguins, and many more. Unfortunately, we went here in summer holiday so it's realy crowded and hot! There's long queue everywhere except the animal show. But still worth a visit.

Avoid on Sundays - NO EXCEPTIONS!. Yes we read all the warnings about queue times. Yes we read all the tips on how to make the most of your day there.But we still went on a Sunday.Please do not make the same mistake!Minimum waiting time for the tamest of rides was 45mins, however most, including the cable car AND the train, had 60 to 90min waiting time!Not even an attempt to entertain thequeues. You are just expected to line up and somehow convince your kids that 90 minutes is not so long!Absolutely impossible with young children. Besides, the park is really lacking in rides suitable for 4-9 year olds. There is a small kids zone for 1-3 year olds and then a few great looking rides for 9/10+, but for kids in between you're left with an Aquarium (which is very good), the cable car ride itself (fabulous) and an abundance of pay & play fairgroundgames (but with most being $50 a pop you will soon be doubling the high cost of the entrance fee if you partake!)Also be well aware that there are only 2 ways down from The Summit (via cable car or train) and both had a 60min wait from 15:00 onwards.Not the nicest way to finish off a day queuing - effectively having to queue to leave!(an impressive fire, water and music show on the way out at closing time somewhat helps you to leave with half-a-smile on your face, but it's not enough to compensate what was an extreme let-down)I would say the park is well worth a visit off-peak, but in our case, it was a frustrating day spent in and out of queues and really was a waste of time, energy and money.

Family day fun. Great if you have young kids, but the crowds do get ridiculous. The queue for the cable car was over 30mins. People pushing and shoving did spoil the day for me, and yes I know its a kids park, but screaming kids/parents in an underground/underwater tunnel.....was not fun. Overall the staff were helpful and friendly. Some of the attractions are a little dated, but the giant aquarium was awesome.

Great day out.. Get there early as it takes a whole day to see everything and to enjoy the attractions. It gets extremely busy and so it's inevitable that there will be some queuing.A brilliant day out for a family.

Ocean park hong kong- queues and queues and queues. Me and My wife visited Ocean Park Hong Kong recently and the visit was amazing.queues and queues and queues everywhere long queues for cable car,long queues for the shark adventure,long queues for dolphin and sea lion show,long queues for penguin show and the panda show. do not visit this place on weekends and local holidays or you will see crowd by dozens all around with tourist groups from mainland china and neighbouring areas of hong kong.Take a map at the entrance which is free.Buy the ticket from your hotel travel agent as tourist tickets are discounted or else you will be in a very long queue which can take a minimum time of 1 hr atleast.there are many rides you can enjoy inside with your kids.Food is good inside there are set lunch items inside the restaurant which has excellent views of the sea.Ice creams are also very good.you will need atleast 5 to 6 hrs first by the cable car up to see the ocean park above-THE SUMMIT LEVEL and then returning back and enjoying the ground level. it is not possible to cover everything in one day because of the crowds so will have to see the five or six best during your visit.you can take a bus directly to ocean park from the tin hau metro station mtr as they have temporarily relocated.earlier buses used to go from central or admiralty bus station..NOT TO BE MISSED-WHOLLY RECOMMENDEDAT SUMMIT LEVEL-BY CABLE CAR1.POLAR ADVENTURE AND PENGUIN SHOW-PENGUINS IN QUEUE WAITING FOR THEIR FOOD SERVERS2.SHARK MYSTIQUE- DIFFERENT TYPES OF SHARKS AND BIG SIZE FISHES3.PACIFIC PIER- DOLPHIN SHOW AND SEA LION SHOW4.SEA JELLY SPECTACULAR5.VARIOUS RIDES6.THE GARDENSNOT TO BE MISSED -AT GROUND LEVEL ON RETURNING BY CABLE CAR1.GRAND AQUARIUM2.PANDA VILLAGE AND PANDA ADVENTURE - AMAZING ASIAN ANIMALS3.GOLD FISH AND SEA LIFE CAROUSEL4.VARIOUS RIDES5.BIRD THEATRE6.OLD HONG KONGYou can also take the train to reach the summit level.but the views from cable car are awesome it is better to complete the activities at summit level first and on return complete the ground level activities.your kids will enjoy every ride and the animals birds sharks sharks and pandas. Pros- Full day excitement,thrills and place to escape,cable car ride to summit level not to be missed for the spectacular views of the sea and land of Hong Kong.Cons-queues queues and queues queues right from toilet to lunch to taxi to bus to entrance to cable cars to return-crowd in their dozens,tourist groups in their dozensOverall- a place worth visiting with your entire family and spending a full day from morning to evening.avoid going on weekends and local holidays check the weather before going as the views could be spoiled on a cloudy weather.also during heavy rains the cable cars may be stopped so you will have to take the train to reach the summit level minus any views.

Awesome if you like to dwell in animal world. This is awesome place if you want to animal freak. The shows were the best. I saw the Koala bear feeding event, the bird show, the seal show. The penguin world and the tropical forest animals halls were the best. They also allowed to touch ray fish, star fish and other aquatic beings. It was a unique experience. Though I have been to aquariums in Singapore, Kuwait, Atlanta, Bombay, this was the best. But if you are into animal world or experience this, suggest to stay away from this place as there is nothing apart from that.

A good fun day spent there. Took bus 629 from Tin Hau MTR station - note because of the protests in Admiralty the buses go to and from there, not Admiralty station - so check before you go.They check your bags for food when you enter the park, as outside food is not allowed. However, the checks are not as stringent as those at the airport. So use your discretion what to do. The food inside is expensive and unimpressive. I believe there's a McDonald's there but again they are more expensive.Ocean park is divided into two parts - the waterfront and the summit. The two are connected by the cable car or the ocean express train. We went on a week day and there was a 5 min queue for the train to the summit and a 20 min queue for the cable car at around 12.30pm. We had used the cable car on previous visits so took the train to save time. However we would recommend taking the cable car if you have not done it before - the views are great - and make sure you see it in daylight.Pick up a show schedule at the entrance and plan your day accordingly. You would want to do everything in the summit whilst you are at the summit - you will need to come back to the waterfront to leave the park though. Make sure you don't leave it too late to come back down. The queue for the cable car down at 5pm was around 45 min. Everyone would be doing the same after 6pm so don't expect that there's much time for seeing things once you get back down to the waterfront. We did see the pandas at 6.30pm - no queue at all and there were about 5 people in the building.Bring a poncho if you don't want to get your clothes wet - you will do with some of the rides.Whilst in the summit you can take the escalator down to adventure land, or take a short walk. If you walk down you can see, and get close to, some baby Dolphins in the mammal centre.Make sure you see the Dolphins and penguins in the summit, and the pandas in the waterfront - they are the highlight of the park apart from the rides and views. The ocean theatre is great, with clever Dolphins and sea lions. You will see the ocean right beyond the theatre when you watch the show - don't miss it.You can easily spend a whole day in ocean park, if not more! For me, the staff are very helpful there. They could smile a little bit more in my in opinion. They are very used to mainland Chinese queue jumping and if you see any of that happening, don't be afraid to point that out to any of the staff and the staff would remove them from the queue - make sure you tell the staff what clothes those people are wearing so that they can find the culprit quickly to restore order!All in all I would always recommend the ocean park for a great day out with family and friends.

Best attraction of hong kong. I was really impressedThere were things for all agesQueues were reasonableCable ride was one of the highest in the worldAnimals were very interestingbus service super efficient

Great fun. Great place to spend some time having fun.so many rides for all ages.amazing views specially from the cable car ride. Good food and very clean.Only problem is staff don't speak any English. Highly recommended to visit.

Fun Filled day. Brilliant place to spent a full day. amazing rides with awesome shows and crowd. a very nice view from cable car and a good experience of metro train. food is also ok but they must add few more options for vegetarian. first time saw a panda and that was a really memorable moment

Ocean Park. The day we went to Oceanpark it was very busy, loads of seniors (many many busloads of I think mainlanders) constantly shoving you out of the way to jump the queues to take a photos or just to get there first. even when you stood in the way there would just keeping pushing and then bring all their friends with them. I did not have this problem with young people. Apart from that Oceanpark is on a mountain and you will require some fitness to get everywhere, the Dolphin and Seal show was great, the rides didn't interest all of us but as the day wore on it was such a long wait we skipped many of the rides. We decided to use a restaurant instead of fast food, after having to queue for 10 mins (there was no-one else and plenty of empty tables but we had to queue)fantasitic view looking over the water but food was not very good and three times the price. great attractions aquarium and pandas are a must. Worth the visit but maybe try a Monday.

Perfect for Under 10s. Big theme park with very few rollercoasters, two are ancient and one is new and pretty awesome for airtime. There are lots of different attractions which are well suited to young families, I would bring teenagers here but compared to US and Euro theme parks there are just not enough thrills for such a huge place... Ocean Park FILL the gaps with rides, not long walks. Overpriced, but worth a visit.

Zoo, aquarium, view point & theme park in 1!. Reasonably priced tickets. Direct bus from central again very cheap. Building a Metro line as I write which will make it more accessible. Can buy tickets in advance from most 711s to save time (same price). Few big adrenaline rides (3 x roller coaster, tall drop ride, mine train, river Rapids, log flume), small zoo area including two pandas and penguins, aquarium, cable car ride, great view spots for photos. On site bay view restaurant great views but expensive we thought. Went on a Thursday thought queues were fine other than for cable car to summit (use ocean express instead and get cable car later in day, view good either direction). Large kids area too.

Bad Experience. The mainland tourists were impolite and they jumped the queue which made me felt very angry!I also saw they throw the rubbish on the ground. And I saw a child went for a pee into a water bottle!! These ruined my great experience in the Ocean Park.
Decent Park. Decent park with limited stuff for young kids. Don't feel the wow factor visiting the park and my two young kids feel so bored that they ask to leave the park. Disappointed.

Ocean Park. It's a cute place. We were not crazy over the rides but I have to say the telefrique ride to the other side of the park is amazing. I could go on that all day long and enjoy the view! The food there is terrible. It says that there's a pizza place but it literally has one kind of pizza called shark pizza and it looks pretty shady. I personally hate a theme park with bad food it ruins the mood! and I hate it when I have to resort to Mcdonalds fries too. All in all, I wouldn't recommend the trip.

Awesome. Awesome rides and more thrilling rides compare to Disneyland. If u like thrilling roller coaster,visit ocean park! Be prepare to bring back a soft toys as it is easily win through games. Stay to watch the water show at 7pm.

What a treat. We are older, but loved the park - it has something to offer everyone - The animals are amazing from the Sloth to the tiny iridescent green poisonous frogs, the aquarium is magnificent and the Rapid ride is so much fun - you will get wet (Guaranteed) - I won't spoil the surprise. When up the top, hop in the room that goes up and turns around, it is amazing, the Pandas are astounding (always will be) and the Penguins so cute. Travel by double decker bus is the best way to get there - sit up the top at the front and let Hong Kong amaze you. I believe the MTR is heading that way?

fun day with lots to see. As with all theme parks food and drinks are a little pricey, load up your octopus card everywhere in this country accepts them. Park was a great day out fun and actioned packed while enjoying the educational animal shows. Totally recommend

Hong Kong's First Theme Park. This review is quite late. The Ocean Park is the first theme park in Hong Kong. It is a marine mammal park, oceanarium, animal theme park and amusement park with over 80 attractions and rides. During my first visit in 1987 it was really challenging to move around this huge park. It requires some level of fitness. In was happy to see the developments made at the Ocean Park when I returned after 20 years. The stakeholders invested a lot of money for the re-development of the park. The escalators they built made it a lot easier to move around the vast area.

Historic Theme Park. Ocean Park has been a "must go" spot in Hong Kong. People has been comparing Disneyland and Ocean Park. I would recommend Ocean Park simply because Disneyland in Hong Kong is rather small. Also, you can visit Disneyland everywhere in the would; however, you can only visit Ocean Park while in Hong Kong!The only down side of Ocean Park is that it is worn out because it has been there for a long time.Ocean Park is a combination of aquarium, zoo, and theme park! It is hard to have everyone in 1 location!! I highly recommended to spend 1 day at the Ocean Park instead of spending 3 days at Disney, aquarium, and the zoo.

Fantastic place. Very good management ,I visited Paris Disney land after paying for the entry you have to pay for each ride or show and to be in in a long Que but here after paying entrance charges ,you not have to pay for any show or ride,it saves your time and energy.One must visit this place ,while in Hong Kong

Go To Disney Instead. If you want to go to a theme park go to Disneyland. Ocean Park is very poor and is this odd collection of attractions most of which just aren't very good. Also be aware weekdays the park doesn't open until 10.30am which in a country where 'early' is normal this is very odd.
Wonderful Day. Great mix of zoo and theme park, park is huge ( plan to spend the day ) Panda's where a highlight, loved the daily feeding
Good for a day. We have visited the Ocean park in weekday. There are long queues for good rides. At least 30 minutes waiting was there. The cost of water, juices and cold drink was very higher side.
Family friendly attractions.. Ocean Park is a great attraction for young and adults. Lots of fun to do, things to see and rides. Kiosk and souvenir shop is everywhere.

Panda and sea animals. There are two old pandas and two young pandas in Ocean Park. There are a feww red pandas too! Sharks and Seals and many sea animals. Cable Car is a great way to travel between the Waterfront and Summit. With Ocean Park attractions located on two different sides of a mountain and wide swaths of sea in between, riding the Cable Car provides unprecedented views of the surrounding area, the sea, and the entire park.
Easy access but will get better. Bus will take you there with railway station currently being built. Great facility offering a very worthwhile day. Family friendly.

Great attraction. Very good coffee shop near entrance. The aquarium if absolutely wonderful. The cable car to the top(according to my family) is very frightening. Only place to see pandas in HK. Some other animals as well. Great spot.

My Baby loved it. My wife and my 2 year old baby and grand parents loved it , lot's of Animal , nice attraction , a whole day of fun , for all ages , very nice restaurants , A perfect day out , highly recommended .

Great place. the park is very nicely built and decorated! a lot of themes which are greatly performed and built.Panda place, birds garden, park for small children, adventure park for grown-ups - everyone can find a place for him! Enjoy the ride on the sea express - decorated like a submarine! Several places to eat throughout the park.TIP: If you want to ride the fanicular - better ride to than through, as on the way back there is a huge crowd. TIP: better purchase the tickets in advance (via web or else) in order not to wait in the line
"Outstanding". Great for disabled people - well set out and not crowded. The arctic foxes are unbelievable. A must see.

Ocean fun!. If you like to see animals, then ocean park is for you!Being we were staying over in Kowloon we could have caught various buses etc but ended up taking a taxi straight there for ease and convenience. It only cost about $120-140 HKD each way which we were happy to pay. Only took about 25 minutes to get there.Once again, the earlier you get there, the better. We got there not long after opening and went straight for the aquarium where a line was already building up. It moved quickly so no real dramas there.The aquarium is actually quite large and had many great parts to it. The only problem we found was that despite the many, many signs asking not to use flash photography. Many tourists chose to ignore it and do it anyway. Which when trying to look at the fish who live in dark spaces. Made it really hard and just felt bad for the fish really.Being a hot day we didn't venture on the cable car to see the rides but chose to stay in the entrance side of the park and saw all the animals, such as pandas. Possibly everyone was over the other side on the rides but it was nice and quiet for us to stroll through and see all the animals.All in all, a good day out. Prices are about on par with most theme parks if not a bit cheaper.
Average for anywhere else good for Hong Kong. Just a normal theme park, although the pandas were cute, but because Hong Kong isn't a particularly interesting place its worth a visit

Ocean Park. When you visit Ocean Park even one day is not enough. Had great fun over there. The only sad part was that which ever ride you wanted to go on there are serpentine queues for it. Even going back to the entrance by cable car you have to wait for a long time. The train ride was great. Loved seeing the Pandas. I found the dolphin show ok because in Singapore I enjoyed it more. Great day to spend irrespective of age.

Super Duper for an entire day of fun!. A huge park that requires an entire day and a lot of walking. Ocean Park is a combination of an amusement park, animal exhibits and an aquarium. We planned Ocean Park on a weekday and reached before the opening time. The crowd was moderate but cannot say that it was less crowded. A great place for kids as well as adults to enjoy. Some details on how to plan the day at Ocean Park.1. Buying Tickets: Tickets for Ocean Park can be purchased from 7/11 stores, at the MTR station from where Bus 629 is available as well as from the airport. We purchased our tickets from the Airport from the CTS counter in the main arrival hall for a discounted rate of HKD 265 which is much less than the HKD 320 rate at the park. For 2 adults and 1 child, we directly saved around HKD 150 which was great.2. Travel: We were staying in Sheung Wan area and travelled to Ocean Park by Taxi. It cost us HKD 90 with travel time of 20 minutes only. Alternate way to travel would be by Bus 629 which takes a little bit more time. Reaching 30 mins before the opening hours helped us queue up early. On our way back around 8pm, we took a taxi back and they are available in abundance. 3. Planning your day in the park: Once you enter the park, use the Ocean Express train and directly go to The Summit. There is not more than 5 mins waiting in the morning as compared to the Cable Car which is more crowded. Spend half the day and around 3pm take the cable car back down to The Waterfront area where you can spend the remaining 4 hours. This allows you to beat the rush for most of the attractions. We had only a 5 min queue in the afternoon from The Summit to The waterfront by Cable Car.4. The Summit: Here are the rides mainly for adults. So if you have kids, need to decide what you actually want to do. Since we had kids, we skipped a couple of rides at the Thrill Mountain and did everything else here. This is what all we did: Ocean Park Tower, The Abyss, The Dragon, Ferris Wheel, Eagle, Sea Jelly Spectacular, Shark Mystique, North Pole Encounter, South Pole Encounter and the 2.30pm Dolphin Show at the Ocean Theatre. We managed all this without any rush or queue in 4 hours. You can follow this if your priority is kids. For Adults, Hair Raiser, The Flash and Arctic Blast are must do rides at Thrill Mountain5. The Waterfront: Once you take the Cable Car from The Summit, pass through Old Hong Kong, do Sea Carousel and move to the Giant Panda Enclosure and Goldfish Treasures. Whiskers Harbour zone has a special Doraemon theme so our kids had a blast enjoying the rides and games. They had a ball. Follow that by the bird show at Amazing Bird Theatre (but the show was in Chinese, and we were disappointed with that). Move to the Grand Aquarium at the end of everything. at 7:00 we saw the show "The Symbio" with is an amazing water pyrotechniques show with laser lights, fire and fireworks. 6. Food: They check bags for outside food since it is not allowed. But food for kids is allowed if requested. Else there is a Pizza Place, McDonalds and a sandwitch place at the Summit. At The Waterfront, there are local food joints in Old Hong Kong zone. Plenty of places selling ice creams, fries, water, popcorn, etc.7. Water: Water is expensive. You can take a bottle with you and keep refilling it at water stations in the park itself. Saved a lot of $$$8. Kids can collect a lot of stickers from the cast members who distribute them for free. Various places where characters are there to take photos with. too good for kids. 9. Stroller is a must if you have kids. You can carry your own else rent it there for HKD 200 for the day10. For Shopping, plenty of shops for Souvenirs and Gifts and soft toys. But expensive. A summary of Must Dos:For Adults Only: The Abyss, Hell Raiser, The Dragon, FlashFor All: Ocean Park Tower, Ferris Wheel, Sea Jelly, Shark Mystique, Dolphin Show, Giant Panda, Grand Aquarium, The Symbio, South Pole Encounter.With the above schedule and details, we covered 90% of the park with ease and minimal wait time. Hope above details help you in planning your trip.

Fun day out. There was something a bit 'Wally World' (Clark Grizwold/ National Lampoons/ Chevy Chase reference) about this place but that's pretty typical of 1980's theme parks. Gotta know to expect that with the colours, the mascots, the music etc. but still easy to have a fun time. My wife and I spent a day here and enjoyed the short queues for rides/ attractions. We had heard that avoiding weekends was important and our Monday visit was good. Few things under repair/ renovation so not available, but that's understandable. Would I go again? Yes. And would I take kids? Absolutely, as that's clearly the target market.

Hectic and Tiring!. The place is good, the rides looked great, but with our three 3.5 year old daughter, we couldn't take most. Besides, too much of walking! We rented a stroller for her, but what about us!. I feel it could be split into days. We had to wait for the 15 min Dolphin show (slated at 3:30pm, we missed the 12pm one). The Panda and penguins were enjoyed by my daughter, so were some rides.If planned well, it could be finished in the first half( for those with kids >6 years of age), else loads of time is wasted exploring which rides you could tk.!!!!The Grand Aquarium is just OK.

The only pandas in Hong Kong. WE are senior citizens who wanted to see the only pandas in Hong Kong. There are no pandas in the Hong Kong zoo. Ocean Park in a theme park with emphasis on ecology and environment. It is well done. The park has lots of amusements and as such is geared mostly for younger folks, and families, NOT for seniors. The park is huge and to get to see pandas, sharks, penguins, etc...requires lots of walking. Although there is a cable car and a train, it only partially alleviates the problem of distance. Queue lines are long.

A very fun attraction. Numerous attraction available to ride, game kiosk to play and win, and food kiosks to satisfy the hunger. The cable car is definitely a must-ride and there are animal enclosure for view. Gift shops are aplenty throughout the park.P.S: Go when the Park is open in the morning. We spent nearly the entire day in Ocean Park itself!

Amazing Family fun. Went with my family. If you love ALton towers your gona love ocean park.Its good family fun. You got sea life aswell as the fast rides :-)I loved our day out there!! Its a must if your in Hong Kong

Fantastic Fun. We visited here recently which was one of the best days out during our weeks stay in HK. Terrifying roller coasters perched on the hillside and great aquarium and animal theme park. We took the cable car up to the roller coaster and then returned on the train (less of a queue). Great facilities, lots of places to eat althought its mainly fast food kiosks at the amusement park side and theres even a McDonalds would you believe!! We visited in October when the weather and humidity are more tolerable and also the park was fairly quiet at this time meaning queue times were short or not at all. Superb family day out - we even saw the Pandas!!

Ocean Park. A place for families and friends' outing. Thrilled, joyous, excited and lively. You can enjoy the view of the ocean, take pictures, go for hair-raising roller coasters or fascinating games, animal exhibits and shows and so on. I like the cable car ride but be prepared to see a long queue.

Disappointing Customer Service and Rude Staff. Absolutely cannot recommend this place whatsoever.When I went, the food was overpriced and you hardly got anything for the extortionate price. Furthermore, a lot of the rides were broken but they were still charging full price, and had to wait absolutely ages to get to the top of the hill, due to inefficient queue management and people pushing in front of you, and even worse, being encouraged to push by the staff. Even worse, the queues could quite easily have been mitigated for the river rapids, and for the tram to get up to the top of the hill and down (where most of the attractions were, at the top of the hill), but the staff had the brilliant idea to send the 4 capacity raft for river rapids, and the 6-8 capacity cable car, out with just one person in each. Absolutely horrific queue management right there.Indeed, the experience was so bad, we looked online on a smartphone and found that according to the Hong Kong Consumer Law, we were entitled to a refund. So we went to get one from Guest Services "Sorry, it's not our policy to give refunds, even though the law says we should" was the gist of what happened. Sure, they compensated by giving us a free meal in their most expensive restauraunt, but their flagrant ignoring of the law was just completely shocking. They even told us to recommend it to our friends and family, and even suggested giving us free tickets for them but it would be in bad faith for me to tell anyone to go here. Avoid it like the bubonic plague.

Ocean Park. If you have been to theme parks in other places, you will find this just okay. All are similar - the cable car, the long queue at every ride and most important the high prices for food. Real crazy.Most of the time is spent standing the long queue. Minimum waiting is about one hour. Random bag check is there.

One of the best. Went there last month during halloween event, they extended the park hours until 11pm. I have to say, having been there multiple times, this is my most enjoyable time. No queue at all on the cable car n the train to the summit, plenty of halloween theme shows and attractions, ocean park definitel stepped it up, awesome time

forget about Disney Land in hong kong, VISIT Ocean Park! mutch better. we had free day in hong kong, I was in Disney land, so we decided to to to Ocean Park hong kong.I was amaised! everythink is so nice, nature together with nice struktures, full of intereting things to see, very nice Aquarium with LARGE SHARKS, and other FISH. also I liked transportation to the montain by cable car, it is mutch better than OCEAN EXPRESS TRAIN to the mountain.of course need to wait some time in a que, but it worth of spectacular views when you go up...entertaiment park on the top of hill also very nice...in overall, I have spend very good time there, even we where adults with no children :)

Experience in Ocean Park HK. Interest animals both in land or at sea, ticket fare is reasonable but not expensive.You can enjoy the whole day and would like to come again when you leave.Ocean Park suits for all ages, family and friends.

Kids loved it!. If the kids love a theme park, you know that it is worth mentioning! There's many rides and easily accessible from Hong Kong island. Tip: There's 2 parts to the theme park so don't miss out on the other one where you need to take a specially built shuttle!

Nice views, fun rides . This is a great place to check the views of the ocean, the cable car is a fun thing to do. More things to do for kids than for adults. Rides are OK but if you have been in the theme parks at the U.S. Might not be worth it. The pandas are awesome you get to see them really close. Food is ok (hog dogs, burgers, Pop corns) typical food u find at parks but they also offer meal in nice restaurants. It is worth a visit just if u have a day to spare. Place is super crowded so be prepare to be pushed.
ocean park. Top rides. Dolphin show disappointing. Some good stuff like the cable car ride. Penguins encloser was excellent
such huge area. It is spread in such huge area that u need to be a giant ti vover it in one day if u like thrills u have got the place to enjoy

Stay away. the place would've been nice if our experience wasn't marred by rude mainlanders. They have a lot of attractions but the ques are ridiculous. Unorganized. Mainlanders are pushing old people, children., disgusting. Stay away from hong kong. Eeekk.

I love Ocean Park. It's a medium sized theme park, it has a decent sized aquarium and panda exhibit. It also has a good selection of rides, roller coasters etc. However the best bit is the queues, There are none! Locals don't really like roller coasters et al so every time you finish a ride you can run right back to the beginning and jump on again. I went on every ride about 3-4 times and queued for a total of about 15 minutes all day. Foods not to bad. I don't know what other reviewers are talking about with the queue times, I've been 3 times across several years and it's always been like this every time
Pandas. A plae to see Pandas. Kids would love the place with animals and all the attractions available. Easy to reach by bus.

Wonderful park. This is a wonderful park with many activities, from roller coaster to dolphins shows in a beautiful landscape. This park is nice not only for kids but for adults too. There are aquarium too, where you can see many different fish.

Top Visit Location of Hong Kong!. I've lived in Hong Kong for 9 years, and I have to say I've been to Ocean Park so many times I can't even count. Amazing place, entertaining, fun, great for all ages. Definitely miss it a lot.

An acquired taste I guess.... Positives: Lots to fill a dayGiant pandas and other wildlife (some good aquaria)Cheaper than DisneyCan't think of anything else...Negatives:Queues (for rides, animals, transport etc etc)No effort to manage queues - running minimum number of cars on rides etcLots of walking and horrible hills everywhereLimited food offerings (and expensive)Old - a bit outdated - rides - all a bit gaudyNot easy to get toOP is obviously very popular with the locals and the Chinese. Having been to dozens of theme parks around the world, we found this one a bit meh...Worth a trip? Yes if you have kids aged 8 - 14 and a spare day in Hong Kong with absolutely nothing else you want to do. There is admittedly lots to see and do and seeing the pandas (there are 4 of them in 2 different exhibits) was fab.If I had to choose between OP and Disney, Disney would win hands down.

Mind Blowing. This place really brought out my inner child. It is a world, that is, it's HUGE. The rides are fantastic, service efficient and friendly and the park itself is really clean. No much to do, there wasn't enough time in the day to do everything! the cable car ride is undeniably amazing, and a nice pause to appreciate everything that is built here...and on such big scale! Lines were long but the wait was not, you won't regret going here, no matter what age.

Very enjoyable. We spent most of day here and had a great time. The staff was very courteous and the facility was very clean. We went through their Japanese haunted house and rather than people dressed as ghosts jumping out at you, I received "Good afternoon sir, I hope your visit is pleasant" from the ghosts. The only negative comment I have is there was a strong message being presented about ocean conservation but shark fin soup was being served at one of the eating establishments.

Spectacular place!. We visited Ocean Park with our 3 young children and all had an amazing day.The cable car ride was especially amazing with the most amazing view.The landscape in which the park has been developed is out of this world and makes the park truly amazing. Our kids were a little upset that they weren't able to go on many rides due to the height requirements but were able to go on the River Rapids ride and a couple of others.I expected to be able to swim or that there would be water slides at the park, but there wasn't, maybe something to add one day!!There is also a McDonalds store there, however you can only pay by cash and no happy meals there.We left the park about 5:30pm and left by bus and then caught a train back to our hotel in Kowloon, we hit peak hour and it was super crazy. My tip would be to try and avoid leaving at this time of day during the week.All in all, wonderful day!

Such a lovely place :) A must-go. This is a huge place - so please try to spare out an entire day to be here! Its such a lovely place, huge, complete with rides & "nature". I was able to visit Ocean Park during the Halloween season, and the Park had done the place up nicely according to the season - from the little trinketed details, to the bigger massive structures & mascots. I must imagine Christmas/ New Year/ (any other seasons) must be equally lovely. Highly recommend this attraction a must visit, not as touristy as I'd think - locals love it there, too :)

best for educational tours. We purchased the tickets at the airport for cheaper price. I enjoyed the cable car ride and the train to travel to the other side. Personally, this is bigger than Disneyland and it has more attractions and rides that this needs two days if you want to tour the whole place. If you have been to Manila Ocean Park and Ocean Adventure, this is a combination of both.

Fun for eveyone. If you want to see pandas this is the place to go. Lots to see and do. Only one complaint not much food choices. Easy to get to and you can purchase you park tickets at the bus depot.

a place not to miss when in hongkong. first and foremost the tour company came late to pick us up at the hotel abd by the time we reached with city traffic it was already 12 noonso all those who want to go to ocean park need to reach there by 10 am the place has so much to offer and can not be covered in a day especially if u are a keen to take photos around therethe staff need to understand and speak english which is a must nowadays secondly the food stall staff could not understand english and veg food was not available the guide map should be a little more informative it was a worthwhile experience and any one visiting hong kong must go to ocean park

Disappointing ... . After seeing so many excellent reviews for this park I had high hopes.Unfortunately, having visited Disneyland Hong Kong a few days prior, the whole park was really underwhelming in comparison. The staff were rude and uninterested in their jobs. The crowds were rude, pushy and oblivious to their surroundings and fellow attendees. The park was so full of large tourist groups which made manoeuvring around the park difficult as it was so busy. The decor was dated and could have used a lick of paint.On the day of visit nearly all rides were down for maintenance as well as the North Pole section of the park. No prior warning was mentioned when booking tickets that these rides and areas would be closed. Very disappointing as the majority of animals we wanted to see where in the North Pole area.The Giant Pandas were the highlight of the park. Although the enclosures seemed a little small for all of the animals at the park. Especially the seals and sea lions. I would recommend getting to the park, seeing the animals you wish (as they do have some fantastic animals) then leaving immediately. Disneyland was a much better experience that Ocean Park although you could not fault the animals. A shame that this park was not at all as I had hoped.

Hello Hong Kong. Because we were doing our first holiday overseas with our son, Ethan aged 10 we gave him some option. He did some google searches on the different to visit and see. Ocean park was his no 1 choice. Ocean park is very well done - it caters for old and young and most certainly outdoes Disney Land. The cables cars to the entertainment part of the park are great with amazing views. He was enchanted the entire day. The dolphin and seal shows great. The breeding area brilliant. The lack a little in the oceanarium however the panda's and amazing goldfish made up for areas that lacked. Certainly worth the money spent but you need a whole day from early morning till late and make sure you don't do on public holiday or weekend

Good adventures - All in One Park. From thrilling rides to lovable animals, you get to enjoy everything here, at one place. It's a combination of Adventure park, Aquatic world and Zoo. Everyone will definitely find something of their liking here.You will see variety of rides here, lot more than a normal adventure pure, e.g. Roller coasters, free fall, Carousels, Cable car, Ocean express etc..You get to see Pandas, penguins, dolphins and lot of amazing birds & other animals. Animal show like 'Sea Dreams', a marine animal show; 'Emperors of sky', a bird show' are very exciting.Just be prepared to be on your foot whole day.. Its a big park, having lot of things you wont want to miss !!

fun rides huge. You need one full day to spend here if you want to experience all the thrill rides plus the dolphin show. Great time for family and children. Though we went in late we hardly had time to go in for all the rides. Recommended for all.
No. you have better things to do in HK than this. Really. Its concrete, and sterile. I recommend more on the other side of HK Island, do the Peak, or go for a hike on the Mclhose trail out of Shatin
Thrills.... Every Ride is thrilling.,. Flash, Roller Coaster... Free Fall.... everything was really adventure.... loved a lot and still feels the thrills....

Pandas, penguins & the rides!. If you love rides and I mean the ones that make you fly then it's a must to visit Ocean Park. If not then you probably can skip it and just visit Disneyland. But other than that there is ofcourse seeing the pandas, eating next to (literally, separated only by a glass wall) penguins and a whole lot of stuff to do for everyone.

get your elbows out!. Went to this attraction on a weekday- I can only imagine the nightmare and horror of the place on a sunny weekend. The crows are huge, impolite and oblivious to their surroundings.....get your elbows ready as you will be pushing and shoving right along with the bus tours to see anything....waits are long and unpleasant.Having said this, the park itself it nicely laid out with lots to see and do. The aquarium is not the world's best by a long stretch but they tell me it is the world's biggest....Giant pandas and other wildlife are worth a trip and the dolphin show was entertaining as well as making a sincere attempt to educate the masses as to the problems and dangers of ocean pollution.

Don't expect the Disney experience. After seeing Disneyland. Ocean Park was quite a drab and not money's worth. Very few options for small kids, quite a few rides were non-operational. The Penguins,the Pandas and the cable car were amazing though !

Good fun. More varied rides and entertainment / edutainment than disneyBut its a bit tedious to get there. The new metro should correct that next year. My five year old daughter liked disney more than ocean park
A good park. The park has very good rides but the staff friendliness is not there no one helps you properly and lot to walk in the park also the park closes very early as compare to disneyland

Great fun and water rides.... Ocean park gives a totally different experience from Disneyland. It has rides, some easy one's, lots of scary ones, but each having its own thrill. Some of the shows like the Dolphin show is a must watch. Make your plan a day in advance on the sequence of shows as there timings are pre decided and available on their website. Food is a big issue there, as the restaurants are mostly crowded with long waiting. We went on a weekday and still had to do with Watermelons and some fries initially. Carry some snacks incase going with kids.Tip: While there are big lines in the day, by 6pm the park tends to get more empty, you will be able to cover a lot many rides between 6 and 7:30 pm, with hardly any rush then. Plan with this tip in mind!

What a transformation!. I last visited 10 years ago when Disney HongKong had just opened and Ocean Park was a relic of a park that we felt we had to support. Now it has been revamped, rethemed and I barely recognised it. For me, the main attraction is the pandas and my advice is to keep checking them if they are asleep - we popped into the panda house twice and then on the third time were rewarded with both pandas being active. The queue for the cable car from old hong kong was huge so we went up on the train, and then rode down on the cable car - no queue! There is little shade on a hot day in OP so be prepared, and it's worth noting that whilst the protest is still on, the 629 bus to the park goes from Tin Hau MTR.

Thrill !!. If you like rollercoasters n free fall, then this is the place to go. U will forget everything , all the rides are like super thrills which like gives u a goosebump ;) , Highly recommended this place

Great park for family fun. This park has something for everyone. It sort of combined zoo, Aquarium, Ocean world and Amusement park together. So it has a bit of everything but not the best of everything. Having said that, we had a great day and lots of fun in the park. I guess my 7 year old son just loves any park with rides. Lots of scary rides for thrill seeking teenagers and adults. Also had some fun and milder rides for younger kids. Try to avoid the aquarium in the afternoon, lots of tour groups. The park is fairly spread out and a bit hilly, so can be a bit of hard work walking around on a hot day.

Great day out - plenty to see and do. We spent a full Day at park and was pleased that it wasn't crowded at all.we booked a 9.30am to 11am dolphin encounter experience for the kids and loved it. Actually only get 30 minutes in water with the dolphins but that was enough.The park is huge, we managed it ride very ride more than once. The crowds arrive arid 2pm when busloads arrive. Food is expensive but reasonable quality.Overall enjoyed the day something for everyone !

Amazing Stuff to See. This is one of the most popular attractions in the South end of the Hong Kong island. Weekends are way too busy for me, but during weekdays I take my kids here and they simply love it. You can see amazing stuff like Chinese giant salamanders, Chinese alligators and red pandas. Very cool place to visit if you can beat the crowd.

Aquarium at Ocean Park. We wasted a half day - didn't know this was such a big amusement park; we went to see the aquarium. It was pretty expensive and then we had to wait one hour and a half to get a taxi back to the hotel. The immense crowds were unbelieveable!

Great day out with great views. Ocean park doesn't have the biggest roller coasters in the world but the views and variety of attractions is impressive. The park is positioned on the side of a cliff and the cable car ride is mighty impressive. The aqauriums are great and the special Halloween attractions were scary and entertaining. We were there over 10 hours and loved it. I would recommend paying the extra for the premium queue jump wrist band, so you can walk on to most rides with no waiting. The park is especially good around Halloween.

Nice but.. Very long lines around 55 min for a 5 minute ride and this was in the week before 5pm after 5 it became crazy the amount of people, pushing and jostling was a buzz kill. Also atm's are very scarce given vendors do not take them so a 1 hour+ goose chase was required.
Panda. The rides are okay if not so so but what's more appaling is the Panda and Jellyfish. There are about few panda and a building of jellyfish.

good experience. we had good funtime there but in my opinion their is nothing special. spread around a lot of acres land with good no. of rides for adventure seekers or for family, kids or for sr citizens. all in all enjoyable.

Too big, exhausted from walking uphill. Ocean Park has a summit that can be reached via the cable car or ocean express which is very much faster (people mover). However, it is very uninteresting, good to make a fast exit from the summit at 6pm. There are rides at the various theme lands at the summit but they are very far apart and requires lots of walking, personally I feel it's kills half the joy. The sharp mystique (summit), aqua aquarium, hair raiser, flash are some of the must-see in the park. A friend told me Arctic blast is a must but it was closed for maintenance that day. Be prepared to be shoved, pushed & queue cut by people who don't respect fellow beings. It was unfortunate that on the day we were there, most food kiosks were closed & we had to walk a lot to the same venue to find food.
one more prime attraction. you need a whole day. Start early. its a buzzing place to visit. Big rides and marine animals will refresh you for a day
good theme park. very good theme park with some water rides. shpuld go with children .its like family fun. spend whole day but could have finished in 5 hours
review of ocean park. Liked almost everything especially grand aquarium, cable car, north, south pole encounter and ocean theaterOne day may not be enough to enjoy all the attractions

Great amusement park with lots to do and see. Arrive early.a. Has a mixture of rides for all ages, aquarium and even penguins. I had spec savers moment when got on a ride and had to take my glasses off, so be warned some of the rides are a bit hair raising. 13 year old loved it all.It was unbelievably hot when we visited. we did loads of rides as we made sure we arrived early, by early afternoon the place was packed and you had to queue. Inside attractions enabled you to cool down. I would say easily better than most UK theme parks and lots of space.

Much a do about not a lot. The ocean park experience was just alright. I rued the fact that I spent an entire day there. The attractions such as aquarium etc. are very average as I have seen better equivalents at San Diego and Singapore

Fun time with kids - Dec 2009. Was there with my children and we had a great time. Enjoyed the rides and the games. It was near Christmas then and the whole ambience is joyous. There was where we first saw the giant pandas and red pandas. It was indeed a memorable trip!

I want my kids to visit this as well. I went here when I was still in my pre-teens and I had a hell of a time. These place combines my love for adventure and love of animals. It's best to come here early as it will take you the whole day to experience everything that this place has to offer. If you happen to visit Hong Kong and you have a day to spare I definitely suggest that you visit this place. I actually planning to visit the place again in 2016 now not as the wide eyed kid that visited the place almost 2 decades ago but a dad that will look forward to my children's smiles. :-)

Involves a lot of Walking. *) Under normal circumstances, you can take the Citybus' Ocean Park Express (Route 629) to reach Ocean Park from Central or Admirality. But currently due to political disturbances in the city, this bus is leaving from Tin Hau MTR station. This bus leaves you at Ocean Park Main Entrance and is thus the most convenient way to go back and forth to Ocean Park.*) Fully air-conditioned double deckers for a comfortable bus ride with lots of seats and frequent intervals.*) Can pay for the bus by Octopus Card*) We bought our tickets for Ocean Park from the China Travel Service Hong Kong Ltd (CTS) at Hong Kong International Airport which offers deep discounts. Ocean Park Hong Kong - Ocean Park Ticket - 265 HKD per head. Another advantage of getting your tickets in advance is that you avoid the lines at the ticket counters at the entrance (they have barcodes so you can head straight for the turnstiles). Ticket was valid for around 6 months and you do not need to freeze on the exact date of your visit.*) Park Opening: 10:30 AM to 11:00 PM*) Pick up a copy of the Park Map and Show Time cards at the entrance.*) The Bayview Restaurant has a Set Meal of Indian Vegetarian food priced at 178 HKD, comprising of one roti, a bowl of rice, veg curry and a tiny cup of Häagen-Dazs ice-cream.*) Involves a hell lot of walking. Ocean park is a lot bigger than Disneyland HK. Start early to cover all the park in a day.*) We took the cable car from the Old Hong Kong side to Marine World. Completed Marine World, Adventure Land, Rainforest, Polar Adventure and Thrill Mountain and then took the Ocean Express from Summit Station to WaterFront Station to complete Whiskers Harbour, Amazing Asian Animals display, Grand Aquarium and then finally end the day with the Symbio show. Loved the cable car ride, a must-do with amazing views, but the train ride was dumb, you do not get to see anything from the train. *) Get there early and avoid the lines.*) It's a combined zoo / aquarium / theme park.*) Pandas are the main attraction, Sea Jelly Spectacular was excellent. Grand Aquarium is a must-do.*) Upper mountain by cable car is a must where you find all the thrill rides to amuse yourself. Lower mountain level to relax and visit the pandas and view the tropical fish aquarium.*) Emperors of the Sky, the bird-of-the-prey show, was rather lame. Ocean wonders, the Dolphin Show, was nice. And, Symbio at 7:30 PM was the best. Narration for the animal shows was in the local language and not in English, which was another dampner.*) Make sure to stay for the night time Symbio show, featuring fire, water, pyrotechniques, music and animation at the Aqua City Lagoon at 7:30 PM. *) Toilets and Drinking Water fountains are available, but do carry a water bottle for refill.*) After watching Symbio at 7:30 PM, while returning back take the Citybus' Ocean Park Express (Route 629) from Ocean Park (Main Entrance) and get down at Tin Hau (at Central (Exchange Square) under normal cicumstances). Take the MRT back to wherever you want to go.For a detailed trip list feel free to visit http://hongkongandmacauitinerary.blogspot.in/2014/10/hong-kong-macau-itinerary.html

Must-see HK attraction!. If you have time for only one park, choose Ocean Park over Disney. It is good for all ages. The animal/marine life exhibits are good for the younger ones, and ample rides to choose from for the teenagers. Bus loads of tourists from the mainland arrive in the early afternoon, so try to get to the park early. Head straight for the summit on the cable car. Avoid the park in Oct if you are not keen on Halloween. Although there are specific Halloween exhibits, there is a noticeably bigger crowd comprising of Halloween fan base. It gets hard to find walking space in some areas especially when the coach buses arrive by the throes!Dining options are pathetic both in selection and venues for such a big park. Shopping is fun for the young ones.

Seaworld Hong Kong Style. We spent a full day at Ocean Park nod found I to be a fun place to visit if you I've a mix of animals and rides. The train to take you to the top of the park was different, dark inside with an aquamarine style show on the roof. Rides were okay, they would benefit from some more water rides, one is not enough. The Panda Bears were so beautiful, a real highlight for us. Food is expensive here, but reasonable quality. The only dislike for us were the crowds of people pushing & shoving to try & get ahead of you in a queue.

Definitely a must for people travelling to Hong Kong!. This theme park is very well designed. I love the lay out and the fountain in front of the park. The fact that my mom used o go this park back in 1993 and after 2 decades I come and visit it myself and still enjoy this park, is a true testament to the magnificently designed park. The only reason I'm not giving it 5 star rating is bec some areas are in need of a facelift and it could get super crowded on the weekends you can barel ride anything. If Disney wasn't Disney, then this beats the crap out of Disney Hong Kong. Disney has a brand altogether but in Hong Kong that's it, just being honest. Ocean Park is definitely the best bang for your buck. They have crazy cable cars that almost made me pee my pants bec it's hanging on a cliff. There's lots of rides for the kids to enjoy and have a nice relaxing moment that has full view of the surrounding area at the far nothr end of the park. Really, enjoyed our stay here at this park and it's like you're not in Hong Kong, wait there's a lot of Chinese people so I guess I am in Hong Kong. Anyway, a must visit Theme Park if you are in Hong Kong. Great experience and value for a day full of fun.

Exciting day. A good outing option in Hongkong , the cable car ride is good . The train ( ocean train ) is worth experiencing . Animals ( pandas, monkeys, seals, sea lions & penguins ) make it worthwhile whilst at the park. Rides are cool & enjoyable . Couple of risky ones as well . The staff around are helpful . Food is a little concern of you are a pure vegetarian .
great place for kids. everything was good. the only thing was that it was too big for us to play everything.

Good day out if you have the time. Unexpected day out due to free tickets off the big bus tours. Massive park with animals ( pandas ) ocean animals ( seals and dolphins) an aquarium ( usual fishes small sharks stingrays manta rays ) and theme park rides. Getting there is easy on the big bus tours and its ran quite well no major queues for anything and some excellent views from the cable carts of the surrounding islands. If your from england its like alton towers. Worth it if you have free time and kids. Havent ventured to disney world so cant compare that but atleast here you have marine shows/ theme rides and animals to see. Theme park prices so not for your budget traveller so may need to take your own food/drink.

A Great Day. Our family were eagerly looking forward to spending a fun day at Ocean Park for my sons 15th Birthday and we weren't disappointed!! The park is huge and thankfully we went on a weekday, and after Golden Week so the crowds were too bad at all. We headed straight to the top/back area called the Summit and made our way to the rides as soon as we arrived (at park opening time). The cable car ride up to the Summit was spectacular and an experience in itself. Once we were there we had little to no wait to get on the rides and boy .....were the Roller Coasters were fun!!!! They also had an Arctic Area with Penguins and Snow Wolves and a Jelly-Fish aquarium, a Reptile House (with the biggest grossest spider I have ever seen) - so much more than just rides up there.We then made our way back to the front of the park and had planned on having a late lunch at Neptune's (that was until we saw the prices and then decided on a Plan B). There was so much to do at Ocean Park and we easily filled up a day with lots of fun things to do. I will say though - be prepared to walk up and down hills at the Summit. Most of the walkways are shaded, but for the ones that aren't - I can be a hot and heavy walk when it is up hill.

Better than Disneyland. There are 2 parts to Ocean park..When u enter the park there is quite a large area to experience and then either by cable car or underground train to the part at the south of Hong kong island.THIS IS A REALLY FULL DAY....

Biggest theme park. This is really big theme park with lots of rides. But we had to wait for train for long inside park. There are plenty restaurants, games, aquarium. Resuming its awesome for all the ages, and for kids i would call wonderland or magical place. they will love it. I suggest to visit on winter, as when i went it was damn hot, around 33 degrees Celsius (August 2013). My daughter was feeling sick so we could not see much and had to rush back to hotel. It was extremely hot and humid.

Perfect Timing for Halloween. Went and realised they were celebrating Halloween. Visited the aquarium, saw pandas. We even stayed till late at the Aqua City | The Waterfront, for the water screen show - Symbio.

Incredible views but so busy!. The set up is beautiful, lots of fun, lots of walking! We got to see the pandas which was my highlight along with the ride up to the rides on the higher grounds. The view was truly breathtaking! Unfortunately the lines were all so long and I think the rides need to be cleaned more frequently considering the number of people going on the rides as my friend got some allergies!

Worth the admission, great variety of activities for a day trip.... My fiancé and a couple went to Ocean Park around 11am on a Monday. It's probably been a good 6+ years since I have been and boy, has it changed!! For the better, I'd say. We came mainly for the sights and the cable car across the mountains.We REALLY enjoyed the seeing the red pandas, the pandas, the monkies, the penguins, sturgeons, etc... there's so much to see!! There are many different aquariums featuring different species spread out in different buildings. Then suddenly there will be rides, games, and other attractions. They have a new 'old school hong kong' area, and being an ex-resident that was good to see. I would suggest going to the back of the park first, then coming back out as the strategy if you want to beat the crowds. However, to beat the heat you might want to do the front of the park first, then the back since most the aquariums and arctic area is in the back (I.e. air conditioned), and you can take the underground express train back to the front of the park to leave. So I guess you should plan your strategy depending on the time of year, and how well you can handle crowds or heat. There will be tons of walking, so wear good walking shoes (though you will see plenty of mainland Chinese tourists in heels or something outrageous). You probably would need more time if you wanted to do the rides, but we did great sightseeing within 5 hours.All in all, great improvements; be prepared for crazy crowds, but it's worth it and just be aggressive :)

Beautiful Park And Attractions But Too Many People.... Ocean Park is a mixture of sea animals and roller coasters.The park is clean and gardens are kept in a great maner.The attractions and rides were amazing but the lines were too long...I arrived at Ocean Park at 10am and left at 5pm and we had onlyBeen on 4 rides...If you visit Ocean Park be sure to go during school time because we Went on the weekend and lines were too long!The fastest line was 75 mins! And a good roller coaster was up to 2 hours Wait!Would recommend it to any age of people. But make sure you don't go on holidays or weekends!

This Will Take Your Breath Away.............. We have visited the park many years back and this trip my wife wanted to return and see the changes. We were not disappointed!! The entry fee might seem expensive, but you have to remember the everything in the park is included in your entry fee. Your not constantly diving into your pocket looking for more rid fees. We went early morning to catch the Pandas and Dolphin show. This allowed us to make our way back early afternoon and leave while the masses still gathered. It would be difficult to get out and get a taxi at closing time. A great day out for this old couple.

Only visit if you are into animals. Too be frank Ocean Park does not have any thrilling rides and is best to visit their animals eg:dolphin, panda ,penguin & sea jelly they have tons of animals is like a zoo! I still enjoy my time at Ocean park and my main motive is the witness dolphin & panda. Go to the marine mammal department you can witness dolphin in a closer look!

Great for all ages. This is a must see if you are visiting HK.You get great views from the cable car and even if you only go up and back again this alone is well worth the entrance fee. The park itself has lots of rides and is extremely good value for money.

Ocean park with the grandkids. A nice trip for part of the day as we wore out the grandkids aged 3 & 4.Plenty of age appropriate rides and the aquarium was great for the kids, wore them out in a couple of hours.

Don't miss this. Very nice one lots of activities restaurants shows very good amusement park ..have a fun with cable car .. For all age groups it is the best more over one day is not enough to hill typed park so nice to see

it is good but not excellant.......... cable car and the summit were good but other things are not very attractive........it was very over crowed so we have to wait for 50 mins for each ride.panda house was good penguin and the seal areas were smelly.........kids enjoyed all thesmall rides.......

fun place for rides and animal watching. theme parks are always a happy place for me. The place is big , so wear comfortable shoes and sunscreen. Alot a whole day to explore the park. Visiting the place near holidays like christmas or halloween usually adds a bonus because the park is adorned with more decors like pumpkins and pumpkin carriage.If you are staying near the MTR, its quite easy to get there. Ride the MTR and get off the Admiralty Station , the City Bus Route 629 station is immediately outside Admiralty MTR station. you can use your octopus card for the MTR and bus ride.Quick tip: Make your itinerary, if you are taking the MTR or Citybus, you can compute the fare and load your octopus card at the airport upon arrival so you dont need to load your octopus card everytime. Go to MTR and citybus website to compute the fare using their journey calculator
A zoo with fun park attached.. Lots of fun rides (roller coasters with wonderful upside down views of Stanley and Aberdeen). You can compete with the locals taking instagram shots of the cute pandas.

Great place for good fun, both kids and adults!. Buy the express tickets (pay 2x more) if you are going for the rides. The queue can be very disturbing, with the express it can save you much time. The shows were okay but the auditorium was not very well sheltered and only top 10 rows are under the shade from the hot sun. it is advised to go at 10am and work from the furthest down. The huge mainland tour groups will come later in the afternoon about 2-3pm. Not all shows are nice, not all rides are fun, not all areas are opened. The good thing is the park is always decorated for a theme. This time - Halloween! Well decorated and we had fun. A pity we would prefer Disneyland or Universal Studio over the Ocean Park.

Better than ever - loads of animal exhibits. Went to Ocean Park as a child and loved it then. As an adult i loved it just as much. There are so many animal exhibits now including 4 giant pandas, 2 red pandas, a golden monkey, several bird species, alligators, penguins, a giant aquarium and a separate shark aquarium. The rides are also great - the cable car offers great views across deep water and repulse bay and there are several thrill rides to keep the adrenaline rushing including 3 roller coasters. My criticisms are the abundance of souvenir shops which you are forced to walk through after every exhibit, the insistence on photo taken before every ride (seriously - i've just seen a goldfish so why would i want my photo taken for that?), and finally the new train to the summit is a missed opportunity for an exhibit (its called a space train yet there are no stars, planets or anything space related at all about the journey).

Fun day cut short by lightning.. Went on a sunday with a friend expecting it to be very overcrowded and it was for the first few hours but then it began to rain meaning most people left and we had the park pretty much for ourselves for around 3 hours, none of the rides had a queue longer than 2 minutes!It only rained for around 30 minutes then it cleared. Nice rides and animals to see! amazing arctic exhibition!later on it began to get stormy though meaning most of the rides were shut due to lightning warning.overall a good day. Would recommend going on a weekday to avoid crowds

A nasty, tacky theme park. Just a shortish ride from the centre of Hong Kong island you will find Ocean Park a supposed theme park and zoo for a "fun" day out with the family. You pay your 320hk dollars per person to gain entry about £28 or $40. Once in you find a tacky theme park pushing expensive, stomach churning food at every point and shops selling "cheap" Chinese toys, tee shirts and mementos.All the decor looks tacky and the employees are dressed in costumes they might have hired at the local party shop. It was near Halloween and when we went to go into the Halloween experience, we were told that we couldn't as it had been hired by a multi national accountancy firm and was by invitation only. None of that was made clear when I paid my entry ticket. I was extremely unhappy about this and spoke to the senior guest relations officer Lyn Li, or at least I tried to speak to her but found her English poor and difficult to understand. She tried to pacify us by offering my 1 year old granddaughter a cheap pink Chinese toy. Needless to say I refused this offer and handed her the toy back.Sure the Pandas are a draw, but the other exhibits are small and there are relatively few rides. A 45 minute wait to get on the cable car did not help the matter.This place is for the Chinese population who have not seen slick theme parks available in other countries. Don't waste your time and money and head for Disneyland instead. Ocean Park could do well to take a few lessons from them.I will never come back here and would advise anyone to stay away.
Trilling experience. Two day itinerary for adults and kids.Plan the summit by train on first dat and return by cable car to avoid rush.Lower level can be done next day.

What a disappointment !. This was a big waste of time and money. It was tacky and lack luster. There was constant noise through a loud speaker and nothing to wow us. The Aquarium was OK and Panda exhibit not bad. Pretty small. Rides ho hum. I guess amusement parks are not for us. Had a much better time in Hong Kong park. Peaceful beautiful and interesting. Don't miss the aviary.

Prefer it over Disney. Went with my family.. loved it.. go on a weekday as waiting time for rides can be longer in weekends.. The penguin are was really nice.. it was a unique experience... Water rides are limited . but overall a good package.. Cheaper and more ride options than the Hong Kong Disney..

Best park ever!. Totally loved this park! The combination of rides, shows, zoo, education is just amazing. The way the park is split in 2 parts (Disney would have made that 2 parks and charge for each) is great. The rides come with the most amazing views I have ever witnessed on a roller coaster. There is so much to explore! After some rides, my 10 year old was way more interested in visiting the jelly fish special, the 3 lever shark aquarium, the pools where the vets keep the dolphins. We were surprised that there are actually TWO enclosures for pandas and we got lucky to arrive at one of the at feeding time. Even a short (15 min) sea lion show was fun, educational and kiddo still talks about it.To get there we used Citybus 629, which was difficult to find as the protests are still ongoing and we tried 3 different locations (Star Ferry Central, Central Exchange, Admirality) before we finally found it at Tin Hau! Nice was that they sold tickets for the park right there, so no further lining up at the park entrance. A bit of a bummer maybe was that around Halloween time several attractions are re-dressed for Halloween and only operate on certain weekend / holiday dates. But since we came on a weekday, the park was nicely empty.

Plan the day well & itll be worth it. Covered 80% of the park with 3 small children. Read my review for tips :). We were a travelling party of 3 adults and 3 kids aged 8, 6 and 2.5. Ocean Park is massive but its possible to see almost everything. Here are the best tips I can give you for a visit to Ocean Park:1. Get there early, at least 45mins before opening time. If you can prepurchase your tickets, which we did, it helps waiting in the Ticket queue. 2. My absolutely first thing I'd recommend is the Cable Car ride OVER the mountain - its one of the most popular attractions there. You basically bypass everything and go straight there and wait in the queue. We did this and only waited about 10-15mins to board the cable car which takes you over the mountain to the other side of Ocean Park. There will be hoardes of people doing the same thing, so I honestly recommend you get this one out of the way. By noon, the waiting time is like 90mins plus!!3. After that, if you can, go straight for the Hairraiser rollercoaster - the waiting time for that because we went straight there was only 15mins. Its a seriously fun ride, try to sit at the front if you can! When we got out the wait time was over an hour!! The other rollercoaster we loved was the Western Train one, right at the back - ahhh cant remember the name. It looked like old western style mining cars :)4. By then, there will be lots of long waiting times per ride - so choose them carefully. We didn't go on all of the rides as many had height restrictions, but the water raft one was fun (about 30mins wait time). There are some toddler friendly rides, and they tend to be less busier than the bigger kid rides. Basically if you see a toddler/kiddy ride that doesn't have a long line, go ahead and go for it :)5. All the walk through attractions such as the Polar Animals and Panda exhibitions are nice :) Kids will like that, but mind you, it does get crowded so keep your kids close.6. They are VERY strict about queue jumping, so don't do it. You are not allowed to 'hold spots' in a queue if someone suddenly has to go to the toilet, so make sure everyone, especially the little kids, use the loo before you wait in a lone queue. We saw a guy and his gf cut the queue, and the staff member made them go all the way to the back again! No joke! 7. Wear comfortable shoes and hats. I don't know whyyyyyyyy but there were women there wearing chunky heels and the most RIDICULOUS outfits there, with faces full of makeup and everything! Its an amusement park not a nightclub!
