Dress sensibly, cooler for hot weathers and make sure you wear sunscreen and drink plenty of water. A SUPER handy tip is to make the kids wear BRIGHT colours that u can spot far away in case they got lost in a crowd. 8. The dolphin show is pretty cool - BUT they DOOOOO get Full House so get there early to get a seat, otherwise you aren't allowed in! Take note of the times and try to get there at least 30mins before to get a good seat :)9. The frozen ice pops are SOOO yummy. Highly recommend. In fact, we made a point of buying one each when we waited in long queues hehe10. Believe it or not, having a stroller WAS extremely handy. When it was time to take the Express Train back to the other side of the park, the line was horrendously crazy long. BUT they have a special line JUST FOR PARENTS WITH STROLLERS. Not for people with kids, only with strollers!!! So we bypassed the lone queue and got to go straiiiiggghhhhhhhtttttttttttttt to the front! Soooooooo awesome! We could see people looking enviously at us hehe :) So if you have a toddler and a stroller, its super handy :)11. Food there was a hit and miss :/ If you're Muslim like us, it was VERY hard to find something that didn't have pork in it. I think we settled for sushi at the end because it was only thing we could find that was decent. Even then, it wasn't so great, a bit dry. So if you can bring your own little sandwiches, apples etc - I'd recommend it. 12. We stayed there the WHOLE day, almost 10hrs. It was exhausting, but you plan it well and you can do heaps. We did the Childrens Park at the end of the day as it was something to motivate the kids throughout the day if we told them we were going to that later. We saw a few Live shows and it was very entertaining. Overall - its a great park and I'd actually highly recommend it for a visit. I may not come back til much later on when the kids are taller to go on some of the other rides. Although we went on a weekday, it was the school holidays in China and it was still packed with tourists. So if you can avoid peak seasons, Id definitely say do that :))
Not better then disneyland. The people there diffrent but the roll coster there amazing the best time early day avoid if there is a bad weather the tikcet 320 HK$ for each

Either really big kids or really young kids - not much in between!. I heard great things about Ocean Park - that it was much better than Disneyland.... that was definitely not the case. The place was incredibly busy. It was insane with lines - around 30-45 minutes to get on rides or the cable car. It is extremely difficult and confusing to get around the park. You can only get up to other areas of the park by cable car or by train. My son refused to go on the cable car so it made it quite difficult. Once up in the higher areas I found it very difficult to find my way back again. There was little signage or people to assist.The rides were either for extreme adrenalin junkies or mad adults, or one area for very small children around 2 years.There was little to do for our kids 8, 10, 12, except look at the penguins, panda, and go on the raft ride.I definitely wouldn't go back to this park, and would say that Disneyland is definitely a much, much better choice for people with kids around 6-13.

Great day out with my family. Although i visited Hongkong several times,but i never went to Ocean park.But last month when i was at HK with my family,as per my daughter's wish we went there.It was really fantastic.So many things to do n see.Lots of attractions,rides,animals,birds,fish n so on.U cant do it in a day.Cable car was awasom.Great view.We all enjoyed a lot.Specially my 5yrs old daughter enjoyed to her fullest.Really had a great n unforgottable day there.Very much recomended

Great day in hong kong. Had an extra day and was told this was a good place to spend it. They were right....great scenery, marine exhibits were great. Rides were great cable car was to die for.....great day overall...would go again.

Excellent day out. We found it very easy to get the by bus. Lots of things to see and do for all ages. We particularly enjoyed the panda and shark exhibitions and thought they were done to a very high standard. The rides were really good too. We also enjoyed the cable car journey. We didn't see any of the shows that were available but there was plenty on throughout the day. Think we went out of season so queue times were a minimum. Definitely worth a trip!!

Tired but we loved it.. The park is certainly not disneyland, which has everthing just so and no litter etc, Ocean Park is starting to look a little frayed aroudn the edges. The rides include retro one from my teens but also scary rollercoasters. The pandas, and Grand aquarium were wonderful but we just didnt have enough time to see all the sights.The food though is appalling, we ate at the cafe down hear the bootm of the raging river ride. We opted for chicken and chips and I vow I am put off chicken for life. The food was just crass and very expensive.Customer service was non existant, the staff were more interested in chatting than getting clients on and off rides. This was most frustrating after paying loads of money, I want to see lots of rides but cant if staff and more interested in one another than the clients. This also happened in the cafe, on little old lady warking there wiht 3 staff chatting outside, and 12 people waiting to order.The teens loved the rides, and there was something for everyone but just dont eat there...

Brilliant Adventure Park. Went with my wife & parents in Oct 2014. One can easily spend 1 full day at the Park. Simply loved the Dolphin & sea lion show. All the rides were nice. We felt it was much more better than Disneyland, a lot of Halloween characters were there as it was Halloween week, and we could take snaps with them. One can get 10% discount in Ocean Park by buying a MTR tourist pass, so i would suggest don't book online in advance. I went on a Saturday, and it was China National Holiday week, so was fully crowded. Cable car view was fabulous, i was just amazed by its sheer size and coverage. Panda was cute, Dolphin show at Ocean Theatre is a must, Rapids ride made us wet but refreshing. Lots & Lots of attractions to visit.

Only go for the Pandas . We wanted to see pandas. Ocean Park has a pair of older pandas and a pair of younger pandas. We enjoyed seeing all four. There were some golden snub nose monkeys. . Very fun to watch. We had lunch. .. plentiful but noisy loud low class tourists made it difficult. Tourist here (like much of Hong Kong) have no concept of common courtesy and consideration for fellow tourists. Not much else here other than the Pandas. The walks are poorly laid out with lots of unnecessary duplication. This is a very hilly park so be prepared. You could easily give this a miss.
Felt like it was a first date again!. The park is so carnival theme, I love all the various games and ride. It made me feel like a young couple having our first date with a nice carnival date.

Better than Disney Hong Kong if you have older kids!. Went here with our 12 & 10 year old. Enjoyed this place much more than Disney Hong Kong or Singapore Universal... Rides were more exciting and thrill seeking. Loved the animal exhibits! The place looked very well maintained. Went during school holidays and the line ups were still minimal. Would definitely visit here again with or without the kids!

Spectacular Park. Ocean Park is a really great part divided into two sections down the bottom of the hill where there are all the animals and some shows and aquarium and then you take the cable car which was an amazing ride in itself the views were amazing. Once you get to the top you are surrounded with park rides, some of the rides were very extreme and others not so but it was a awesome day out despite the attitudes of some of the tourists and would recommend.Only thing I didn't like was they were setting up for Halloween and so they had operating all the rides and houses open but only to select people and would have loved to have been able to get my hands on tickets that would have allowed us access as well, as it looked pretty awesome and obviously we could not come back another day as heading back home. make sure to get to the Dolphin show early especially if its sunny as limited coverage and you will get all the tourists with their huge umbrellas sitting in front of you and becomes hard to see. All the animals looked happy and healthy and was really great to a=be able to see so many pandas and other animals.

Panda's. Visited the park in October it was during a national holiday so the park was very very busy. The highlight for me was definitely seeing the pandas although their are lots of other attractions to see and do. Would definitely go back if we ever return to HK

Extremely rude visitors!!!!!!!!!!. We arrived just before the parked openend and from walking in to getting on the tram to the top park was like being run over by dozens of fat kids after cake. The visitors are very rude and quite happily invade your personal space and have no respect for others. Surprisingly enough the elderly as much as the young. The park was nicely decorated for Halloween (Much more than Disney) and the rides are a little rickety. The animal enclosures looked big enough for the animals and they seemed happy. To do the whole park is a lot of walking so ensure you are well packed. The park is in a very scenic location with great views.

fun park. We went with my grand daughter. For elderly people ocean park is free of charge is you are over 65. My daughter got three annual pass at $700+ and they have been to Ocean park over four times. They have panda park and penguin park. My grand daughter can show us how she a penguin walked. This is a fun park with good education. I will go with my grand daughter more often during cooler months now.
What an awesome time we had. One can spend more than couple of days just visiting this park. This is full of great rides and exotic Panda(s)..

One of the best days out in HK. So I think it's safe to say you can go to an aquarium/zoo/theme park in most places across the globe but Ocean Park is something special.Getting There--------------------You have a couple of ways of getting there. You can head to Admiralty Station (MTR) where there is a stand that sells a joint bus/park ticket. If you don't know your way around and don't want to use the usual buses then do it this way. Get there early!Taxi is another option and if there are more than 2 of you its a good way to go. If you happen to stay at the Cosmo (where I always stay, check out my review) there is a bus stop right outside for Ocean Park and then buy your park ticket when you get there. The Park--------------The Park is built on two cliffs basically - when I first started traveling to HK the only way between the two sections was by cable car or for those with fear of height by bus. Now they have a great train that will take you between the two sections however I suggest you take the cable car - much more fun and some great views over the water.There are plenty of escalators to get you around the hilly bits so walking is not to bad for most people - disabled facilities are getting better each time I go.Exhibits------------The star attraction, and main reason to go are the Pandas. When I went ten years ago they had two, they now have four! They also have red pandas as well. The enclosures are very well designed and you get a lot closer than you would think.The aquarium section is amazing, jelly fish exhibit in particular is great.There is a massive focus on education at the park and great for teaching little ones and teenagers about the ocean. Talks are in several languages too.Rides---------Every few years they seem to add something new and its always great - something for all ages. The mine train is the oldest one there but worth it for the view as it is built right on the edge of the hillside - you do think you may fall off!.and finally..........The real star show since the renovations a few years ago is Symbio. This is a sound and light show at the newer end of the park. Without ruining it to much they project pictures onto water (think bellagio fountains, Las Vegas) to tell a story of two Dragons who learn to live in harmony. We actually went back for a second night, paid full admission just to see this part again!Overall this may be one of the best days out for both couples and families. Every time I go to HK I go here because there is always something new.

good, but not that great as expected. Typical fun place to spend a day….literally a day….due to long (extra-long) queues you must be prepared to arrive early in the morning and have all day in front. Food available is not great choice, at least for someone of European origin, but you can find few bites to feed yourself……cable car is nice, but don’t waste time in both directions….alternatively there is express train service covering same distance…..would say few good attractions , including Pandas which are worthy seeing, the rest is ok…..

Lovely Experience. Being the Asia's largest park, it has to be on your bucket list when you visit Hong Kong, all the attractions are great but i personally loved Shark Mystique, ocean theatre, Abyss and marine world game zone. We had a great experience, it is one of the best options to spend some time with your family and enjoy.

Be careful of the height restrictions for kids. We went to Ocean Park this week with our 6.5 year old twin girls. There are some OK shows, and the park is full of great rides for older kids (over 122 cm)and nice things for little ones, but was really disappointing for our just sub 122 cm kids. There are basically only infant type rides and big rides that the girls couldn't go on. Both they and we left the park feeling VERY disappointed. We would recommend the park if you have little ones, or older ones, but be very careful with the 6-7 year old age range where they fall between the 2 camps and have barely any options at all for them.

well worth a visit. Ocean park is an amusement park divided into 2 parts the highland and the lowland. The low land features an aquarium and pandas while the highland has exciting rides and roller coasters. The 2 parts are well connected by cable car and a train called ocean express. It is a good place to spend a day with family and kids.

Terrible but lack of food joints : vegetarians. Very aquarium and fun with themes but a draw back for any Indians who are vegetarians then it is pathetic situation very big place , cool if been with a bunch
LOVE IT!!!!!!. I love the way it's got thrills a spark of magic and also the Asian animals enclosure and aquarium was very educational too I love this theme park and want to come back

A fun day out. I have just been reading some of the terrible reviews left by travelers, but I have to say, I don't recall experiencing any people cutting in line, which seemed to be the biggest complaints on those reviews. This place can get crowded and a lot of the mainland tourists will block up walkways and stand in the middle of a path to take a selfie every 5 steps. But if you don't like crowds, don't go to Hong Kong to start with.We got off the bus, went up the escalator and walked straight in. We followed the advise of others on Trip Advisor and got to the park early and headed straight to the top via the cable car. We had to wait about 20 minutes in the line and there was no-one cutting in. When at the top of the park, we didn't have to wait for rides, because most of the crowd was doing all the stuff at the bottom. When we finished at the top we noticed that it was becoming a lot more crowded as those that started at the bottom had made their way up. We took the train back down and again had no real issues with lines.There is a good selection of tame rides and ones for the more adventurous thrill seekers. The Panda enclosure was fantastic and is a great place to escape the heat. As is the North and South Pole exhibits. I'd have to say that I didn't find the Grand Aquarium to that "Grand". I think the Melbourne Aquarium is better. But it's a place to cool down and watch all those selfie photos being taken.The best advice is to buy your ticket before you go. We bought ours from China Travel Service at 1/F Alpha House, 27-33 Nathan Road, Tsimshatsui, Kowloon. You'll find the entrance to the stairs about 20 or 30 metres down Peking Road. They also have other locations, so check which one is close to you. Some hotels can probably help with tickets also.Over all, I didn't mind Ocean Park and I would go back.

Entertainment block buster. This park is situated on a hill and is divided in two parts. Unfortunately on the day we went the cable car was not working so we had to take the train to go to the top of the hill. The train ride was also thrilling and the train in itself is beautiful.The aquarium in the park was very huge and I have not seen anything compared to it in my trips of dubai, singapore and thailand. Biggest aquarium ever seen.The rides in the park were hair raising. I took the Abys and enjoyed very much. There were many ascelators at the hill to take you around. It was fun travelling on these ascelators as they were the longest I had ever seen. The views from the hill were spectacular. Park is very beautifully maintained and it looks like a magical world.Food in the park was very good and not very expensive.In the end the show at the fountains was also superb.Enjoyed throughly.

Amazing Theme Park With Amazing Rides. Lots of games with little time , however we manage to tried rides such as Hair Raiser , The Flash and Whirlybird. Weekdays is the best time to visit the theme park as not many crowds compare to weekend.
Fed up queuing. After waiting in long lines for the bus to get here another huge queue awaited to get in. After 1 hour and halfway there gave up and went back to Kowloon.

Exceptional for thrill rides. If you like crazy rides, you will love Ocean Park. Would recommend getting to the summit using the cable car as soon as you arrive and do the following rides - Hair Raiser, Flash, Abyss. There are several others too. The only shows we liked were the dolphin show & Symbio. A lot of the other shows were stage performances by actors - not with animals. Be prepared to walk a lot as the park is built on a natural hill and getting from one attraction to another can be tiresome. 1 full day will be sufficient to do Ocean Park. The grand aquarium was nice with several see through glass panels.
Great Day Out. The crowds can be overwhelming (we were there during golden week) BUT the kids had a fantastic day out - awesome! and the parents enjoyed it too - this is a big tick on an itinerary

Amazing. Absolutely loved Ocean Park. The park is laid out pretty well considering it is on a mountain. Be prepared for some walking but there was a good combination of air conditioned exhibits between some pretty great rides. Make sure you go on the big rollercoaster at the top :) Was one of my favourite things in HK.

A teenager's Disney!. The rides are simply amazing....and there are plenty of rides. Don't miss out on the shows too. The best way to go forward is to arrive there early...take 20 minutes to plan the rides and shows...and then map it out. The map is extremely confusing and you will waste time going around in circles if you don't plan it well. Take the funicular down as you will be tired, and the queue at the cable car will be long in the afternoons.

A Theme Park with a mountain in the middle of it. This place is large so get ready to walk - and steps are everywhere but there are also escalators that seem to go forever. The one ride we wanted to go on was closed however and looks liked like it is going to stay that way. We wanted to go by cable car to the Summit but a thunder storm closed the cable cars and we had to go via the tram, no problem. I would highly recommend this place as the rides are more suited to the older kids and adults than Disneyland
An Old Place. It is a bit outdated and not worth to spend the whole day. It is for those whose like theme park. Shark mystique and dolphin show are not bad.

love it. we are a couple in our early 40's and love this place! maybe it's us or maybe it's the place :) the aquarium is great, the hair raiser really does raise hairs.. .food is not a highlight but that's not why one goes there anyway...

I Loved it!. I visited ocean park on a Friday in September. The weather was great (very hot!) to visit and it wasn't too busy. It was very easy to get to. There is a bus that goes straight from outside of Admiral MTR to Ocean Park. I had already brought some food from the 7/11 before I arrived however, they will not let you bring the food in and will ask you to eat everything outside or throw it away. DO NOT BRING ANYFOOD OR DRINK!!! A group of us threw lots away AND ONLY WAS ABLE TO TAKE SOME WATER!Anyway, back to the park. It was amazing. Very big. I went because it was a Theme Park but only wet on a few rides as the aquarium and other animals were just amazing. I happily went from one animal area to another. They have the North and South Pole areas, The shark mystique, insect, spiders etc. It was lovely. The even have 4 Giant pandas there who look happy and healthy. Lots of food options, a bit expensive but thats the same as all tourist attractions. Used the cable car to get to the other areas . It was a great view. Recommended. We were a group of adults around 28 and we all loved it.Go if you have time, I would definately recommend it and would visit again if I was in Hong Kong. The other thing to note is, if you leave late at the end of closing the queue for the cable car is huge and they dont fill the cable cars to capacity so it will be only 2 people in a cable car and it holds 6. I found this annoying as you just want to get down to leave!
an ocean of joy. highly recommended, better than hk Disneyland. Though you have to be prepared for a day of walking.Lots of attraction and rides.

AVERAGE AT BEST. Very very busy . Hot and crowded . The rides were only ok with lines up to 45 minutes . The shark exposer was good . Maybe they should limited the numbers for this place . Wear comfortable shoes as there is a lot of walking , hills and steps . I thing it would be an enjoyable day for a family with young kids Been there done that . Enjoy the views over HK
amazig. amazing and lovely place.we sent a full day their.they closed the parked and we were still their.don't miss it if you went to honk knog

A fun day out with plenty to do. We went as two adults and two young children. The park was well organized with a variety of activities, ranging from carnival-type rides to animal viewing. Everything was well organized and we were fortunate to go at time when the queues were short. The entrance fee was quite expensive but there was plenty to do. However, the cost of the entrance fee seemed unduly high for the youngest child (five years old) who was barred from several rides because of her height. She was very disappointed about missing out. The height limitation seemed unreasonable in some cases, but reasonable for others. We won't visit the park again until both children are tall enough to be able to go on all the rides they want to.

Not as great as expected. Visited Ocean Park on a weekday to avoid the crowds, but even on a weekday it is very crowded. Being spoilt by the theme parks in Australia, Ocean Park does not live up to the expectations of what a theme park should be like. A lot of the kiosks were closed which made it difficult to find refreshments. Lots of walking between rides, and toilets far and few between. Little shade and restaurants were overcrowded. The aquarium was very average and with the crowds made it hard to view. Only one roller coaster operating at time of visit. The only plus to this park is the two Pandas. I won't be rushing back with family to visit again. The park needs an update and more rides, refreshment booths and the map redesigned to make it easier to navigate.
Average. Same old kind of amusement park. Not a good place to visit if you want your holiday memorable. I was kind of disappointed when I went there with high hopes for this place.

Must go attraction for kids. A splendid park filled with adventure for all ages.The park is split into two sides, the side at which you enter is for young children. The place is filled with many animal exibitions such as the giant panadas and the five story aquarium. There are many rides for children like the merry go round and many others. There is a train and cable car that connects you to the otherside, the train is there for the convenience. The cable car gives you a spectacular view of the harbour and the Hong Kong skyline, along the ride you can see the vibrant colored rollor coasters waiting for you to ride them. Once at the other side there a number of rides to go on from the hair rasier (a typical roller coaster) to the Abyss (the 100 metre drop) or even the flash(the 360 ride.)There are many options for you to choose from On this side there is a beautiful jell fish exibhition that you must see. There is also a friedly dolphin show for all ages, where dolphins showcase amazinfg stunts.

Go Early. Has a mix of ocean-themed animal displays (plus pandas) and some rides, many for older children and thrillseekers. The rides were OK, but more like sideshow attractions and not as good as most theme park rides. Park is very exposed to the elements, with lots of concrete and very little shade or shelter. It also has an awkward layout and it can be hard to get around with lots of hills and some backtracking from the further attractions.Go early. A half day was enough and the park became very crowded after lunch with many, many tour groups arriving from lunchtime onwards.

Enjoyable Day. We spent a week on Hong Kong on vacation and went to Ocean Park the last day of our time there. The primary reason to going was to see the Panda bears. We arrived early, and I'd highly suggest this, as the crowds get thick around lunch time. We had the two Pandas to ourselves, and a very helpful attendant took a number of family photos for us. We also enjoyed a restaurant on the top level of the cable car terminus at the far end of the park- the views of the bay there are stunning. There's a decent assortment of amusement park rides, or if that's not your thing, there's a number of animal exhibits. Bus and taxi service was easy to navigate from the center of the city.
Good for older children. Most of the rides cater for older children and adults (>120cm). The aquarium is good and some of the other animal exhibits as well but the rides look very goood
Must go. If you adventure lover than this is place for you, awesome rides great shows good representative, must visit place for adventure ride lovers

Decent place. Decent amusement park which is good for a half day visit. Can get a little boring for adults if you're only there for the rides. Some rides were closed. The marine and animal parks are good for a quick walk through the place.

Non-Stop. Don't forget your walking shoes and take your time, it's very hilly and there's lots of walking. Take the cable car down - the view is amazing and less people going back. Check the weather and website before you go as some rides were not operating

Great 1 Days Visit. Our family had a great day. We headed to the "high ground" via the cable car first thing. Our driver suggested to do this before the mainland Chinese tourist flood the park in the afternoon. Rides were OK, but the dolphin show and the aquariums are the best! Late afternoon the park got crowded and the mainland Chinese tourist got very pushy and not respective of other people's space...
Whoy splashhhh!!!!. The ocean park was very good i just loved it the trolley was very long and it went a long way the roller coaster was very scaring and the escalater was very long.

A fun day. We chose this only out of pot luck/chance as our original plan of visiting Lantau had to be swapped to another day.The Aquarium was wonderful and full of exhibits that you could get a good view, many, many people ignored the "no flash" on photography requests.There is a themed train ride or a cable car to take you to the summit which is full of fair ground rides, which werent working as we had a tropical storm/thunder and lightning pass by.We did venture into the Panda enclosure (not literally)..I am not a fan of seeing animals caged, but it was a huge area and they looked very content.

Halloweeeeen at OP. Get more bangs for your bucks as you get a Halloween ticket get the scare of your life on and off the rides. The park is one of the best marine and animal zoo's topped with amazing adrenalin rides. but watch around every corner during Halloween as.... BOOO! the ghouls will get you

Great Fun. We went in January. Its a fun.it is not very big so you can finished it at 5 pm eaisly.there are all rides which you usually find in all amusement parks.Very big aquarium can be great attraction. Big pandas are nice which usually we won't see.For children it is lovely place.

Enjoyable day out for everyone. Good mix of rides and animal attractions. Well put together, with lots to see, and not overly commercial like 'another' theme park in HK. Prepare for the HK heat with lots of water, sunscreen and hats. Good range of food options. Suggest to arrive early before the tours arrive, otherwise it can be a terrible experience.

panda at ocean park. We went here coz we wanted to see a Panda and there was two very close up to there enclosure and worth the visit. There is also an aquarium an ice land with seals and otters and theme rides. Was a very hot day and there was many local people with shading umbrellas and bunking ques which was annoying. It was good that we went early as got busier the later the day got.

Good Day out. There are a few things not to be missed in Ocean Park. The aquarium is fantastic, the Japanese Garden restful, The Panda Bears fascinating and lots of other things are on offer. Plenty of eateries as well.

Don't waste your time. a typical amusement park. The only thing worth seeing here are the giant pandas. I had a bad experience here. It was monsoon season. It started torrentially raining. The crowds went crazy, pushing and shoving. There was no crowd control. The staff were clueless.

Go early to beat the bus tours!. My son was invited to Ocean Park as a friend's birthday treat so I went along too. They had arranged to take part in the dolphin experience which meant that they were given lots of interesting information about dolphins and then got to stand in the pool with the dolphins and the expert. They really enjoyed it and as an experience it was a good one, though much better suited to children around the 7-10 age group rather than for adults.We were then in the park early enough to mean that the rides had very few queues. However, the people manning the rides often made them wait for quite a while - goodness knows waiting for what! By 3ish the park was beginning to fill up with huge groups of people and as we left the coach park was heaving. Unfortunately the queue for the aquarium was far too long by the time we got there so didn't go in.Ocean park is very hilly and probably not suitable for those with mobility issues as there is a huge amount if walking between rides, though there are several escalators.There are many food outlets including a McDonald's but we took a picnic so can't comment on the quality of the food. .

Great day out. A water themed amusement park with a stunning cable car journey from it's entrance to the island hosting the park. Entry price is very reasonable with fantastic rides ranging from sedate to heart stopping. The rollercoasters are worthy of special mention as they're located on a cliff face. The aquarium is absolutely huge, with a single tank containing an entire ecosystem of marine life from sharks to bottom feeders. It was incredible being able to see all it at the same time! That being said, expect long lines during holiday seasons.

Not a top priority stop in HK. From what I have been hearing about Ocean Park before, I had high expectations of the place. I was a bit disappointed during this visit.Frankly, it pales in comparison to HK Disneyland or Singapore's Universal Studios. It looks old, some of the rides need some touching up and upgrades. The saving grace would be the pandas and the penguins but the other attractions are a bit ordinary theme park things.Also, because of the mountainous terrain, it's difficult walking around the park (specially on the uphill parts). Food prices inside the park are really a rip-off (HK$170 for a spaghetti meal?).Getting there is also a bit of a hassle as the MTR station at Ocean Park is still being constructed. So if you are not going in a tour group, it's either by bus or taxi for now. When you go to Disneyland or Universal Studios, you will notice how immaculately clean their parks are - this is not the case here at Ocean Park.If you're in HK only for a few days, maybe you should not put Ocean Park as a top priority stop anymore. But if you really want to go, buy your tickets at the HK Tourist Services kiosk at the Admiralty MTR Station to get a nice discount.

DO NOT RISK YOUR LIFE. Pros- Pandas- friendly staff- half decent rides- decent food Cons- line ups- safety- regulationsHonestly it is a decent amusement park in terms of staff friendliness and rides/attractions. The downside is a huge one and that is safety. First of all i feel everyone should be allowed to go to an amusement park and enjoy their day, but the type of people they get is ridiculous. People who do not follow rules at all, what is point of a line when no one stands to wait. People cut in front of lines, push and shove people out of way to get ahead and literally hit people to get to a spot in front. I would be 20 people behind lining up for a ride and have over 50 people cut in front of me to go on before i did. I respect this line as it is park rules and as a common courtesy but if people break these rules the staff should rectify this situation and move them out of the line and on top of that any violence act should be removed from the park entirely. WARNING!!! to everyone who is planning to with small children, if you plan to leave after 6 pm be prepared to fight for your life. We were at the tram to "line up" to go back up the mountain. Little did we know it was a deathtrap that we went into. we got stuck in the middle of the pack as it was slowly moving towards the tram. no one cared for the line and just cut in front as railings and ropes people just jumped over. Then on top of that people just literally pushed, shoved and punched their way through, If someone fell, well good luck your gonna get stepped on. I was with my 2 yr old nephew and i feared for his life, They did not care if you were newborn or 95 they pushed u and trampled on top of u just to get to the tram. there was only 2 staff to control over i say 300 people in line, i mean they did what they can but people are just ridiculous. They need to kick these people out of the park, violence should never be allowed. I was lucky to come out with a few bruises and cuts and managed to save my nephew from harm, but i saw a few kids hurt bleeding off to a side and older people falling to the ground. I am sorry but this is no way to run a business.honestly i would love to enjoy this amusement park and it has potential to be good, but this problem continues to occur i will never visit again. I will NEVER bring my nephew back here and will NEVER recommend anyone with little kids to go. I have been to many amusement parks with twice as many people and never feared for my life, this is the worse experience i ever had at anywhere.

well worth a day trip!. A breathtaking experience taking the cable car over to the park. We had our 'encounters' with the giant pandas, penguins and other sealife animals. Other members of the family enjoyed the rollercoasters and water rides!

Great Theme Park. This was much better than expected. Great rides, fun shows and heaps to do for the whole family. The entry price was very reasonable. Make sure you buy your tickets from the train station at admiralty as you will save a few bucks and speed up the entry time.

FRREEZZING. We were silly not to take jumpers it was freezing here. Lucky thought hey sold jumpers in the souvenir shop.Then we wondered through the fish aquarium and saw the beautiful pandas.The park looked amazing with all of their christmas decorations travelling in December to different countries is truly an eye opener and highly recommend it seeing other cultures festivities shows us how much we lack in Australia.Back to the park it was more of a local park so you don't see many tourist well we didn't see any other English looking tourist the entire day. The rides were amazing best fun however rides were extremely long.
Amaaziinng. This Park is just amaziiiing !!!!!!!!!!!!!! better than DisneyLand Hong kong. U need at least to go early to the park at 9 am for exemple but if you have kids u need at least 2 days

Worth it. Everything is amazing.. too bad that day cable car rides were not available. closed due to maintenance. As an alternative, we boarded the Ocean Express to go up which gives you a vibe of riding a submarine. ALL rides were great. The kids love it.

Ocean park. If you travel to hongkong, you must visit ocean park. Great theme park for families n couples. Easy access . The weather will be cool if you travel in nov n dec. must visit theme park which you spend at least one day over there

MUST DO!. A full day is needed at Ocean Park. Cable cars with amazing views of Hong Kong, a zoo with pandas, theme park rides and lots of restaurants to choose from! Lots of walking but you do not notice it - suitable for all ages!!!

A Great Day out. I visited this park 5 years ago and how it has gotten better, i loved the new additions, with more animals and new rides, I loved the new entrance area with the big new aquarium etc well worth the day at the park . It was easy to get to from Admiralty MTR station Tip Wear comfy shoes...lol

Fun For All!. Ocean park, is the must go to park while in Hong Kong. Lots of attractions are made for all ages and sizes. The park is so big, it will take more than a day to see everything leisurely. I did not regret going to this park. It's money well spend. Besides that, the public transport is easily accessible. Shuttle bus located at nearby train station with a small fee to pay. I only have time available to visit a single park and I opted to go here instead of to Disneyland. I did not regret my decision at all.

9 Hours of Pure Enjoyment, despite the Heat!. Ocean Park is by far the best experience to have with children (or grown up kids!) when visiting Hong Kong. We'd been to Disneyland a few weeks earlier so had a benchmark of what to expect. Ocean Park has it all:Adrenalin rides for all the family. Even though our youngest thrill seeker was 2cm under for the big rides he still had an awesome time. Yes there are queue's but as long as you go expecting this it doesn't really provide any challenges.The panda's were special as was the sealife and the daily show with the dolphin's and sealion's was worth a watch.Highlight for us was the gondola ride. incredible scenery / outlook and as long as you have no fear of heights (cause it is very very high!) you will love it.price wise once you are in all you pay for is food and drink but it's not expensive.Two big tips I would highly recommend - TAKE AN UMBRELLA - FOR THE SHADE OR RAIN. Secondly - TAKE A LARGE BOTTLE OF WATER. Enjoy! We certainly did!

What a huge park. What a day we had , loads if walking and thank goodness that we took strollers with us as there was no way our two young children would have survived the day . So much to see and do and I must say that I am so glad that we do not go on a weekend or during school holidays as the lines would have been crazy . We loved the cable car ride and we were advised from our hotel when we booked the tickets that the cable car does not operate everyday due to maintance . Great view from the cable car. Our children had a ball and loved all the animals , I was so impressed that everywhere in the park is about recycling and looking after our marine animals . Would be a great place to take older children for the rides etc .

A Must SEE, especially with the kids (but not necessarily!). Now this is an unusual recreation park, suitable for all ages, good at all times (when it's rainy there are many outdoor activities), but try to prefer a non-rainy day. Take a whole day, don't miss the attractions in the upper level on the hill. To make a long story short, it is a mandatory attraction in HK.

The Rope Way!. ...is the must unnerving thing i've ever been on! I'm sure it's safe, but to get from one side of the park to the other you have to go on the cable car which is bumpy as hell! The park itself was good fun though.

Requires Lots of Patience and Walking Yet Still Very Good. It was a bit fortunate for us to have visited Ocean Park on the first day of school in HK. This is because it is still summer, and lesser rude and rowdy tourists around. Though there are still those who loves to push, shout, and doesn't really mind that others who patiently fall in line waiting for there turn, lesser number of them will make you enjoy this theme park more. :)The rides inside Ocean Park are more for adults and lesser for children. A total opposite of Disneyland. A lot of walking is required since this is a very huge theme park. We as well enjoyed the dolphin show. It was awesome. If you wish to visit and enjoy Ocean Park, it is better, in my opinion, to visit during HK school days and not weekends or summer vacation. And make sure as well that the weather is good to have a good view while inside the cable car. :D

Plan by checking weather ahead.. Went there & it rained for an hour or so. The cable car was shut down , along with most of the rides as well. Luckily there were fishes to watch. However, lots of mainland tourists, lots of pushing, queue jumping, shouting, same as Disney trip, crude behavior shown. View of nature was fantastic, check weather forecast & avoid cloudy rainy days.

Expected better. It was a bit crowded the day I decided to go.. Also, too much of a walk. Expected it to be a lot better and interesting. The rides aren't the best, but overall it was an okay experience. could have been better

For Kids Only. I was forced to go because of my son. They had all the standard rides, and I guess my enjoyment came from the fact that my son had a good time. But the next time I go to Hongkong, I will skip this place. And the fees are too exorbitant, not to mention the additional expenses for the food while there, unless you brought your food, but who would bring a lot of food?

Worth the experience. Before I start, I want to reiterate that this is nowhere near the level of "amusement" like the parks in the USA.This is a great place to take the family to enjoy some rides and games. I am most fond of the Middle Kingdom. In all, it is an amusement park.

Great fun. Lived in Hong Kong but moved back to UK as a child. I had memories of coming here when I was about 4-5 years old. I remembered the cable cart and I was quite scared when I saw South China Sea beneath me, I sat on the floor of the cart whilst it went round. Finally got to go back to Hong Kong for a visit when I was 27 with my partner ( also excited to go). After all these years I was up for the cable cart! So much to see and do all in one place unlike theme parks here in the UK. Great family day out for all ages.We all want to enjoy a day out but unfortunately we come across some that have no manners and just rude!

Extra thrill on a hill. Ocean Park situated just out side Aberdeen Hong Kong, is perched on a hill, with a few attractions one side and the rest on top and down the other side.This is where you will find two Pandas Le Le & Ying Ying in their own made to measure abode.Then take the cable car or train up to the rides.All a bit old and shaky no smooth roller coasters here.Even the wet rides a soaking is not on the cards,a shame because the heat would dry you out.Buy your entry ticket at the tourist desk in Admiralty MTR station before catching the bus, as you will save money on the gate price.Soon the MTR will arrive at Ocean Park as building is well underway.All ok if you like parks with rides
Lovely. If you like sharks - this is the place! you can also enjoy from the playground for children and adults, but you have to know that the water and the food is very expensive there!
only a maybe. We loved seeing the pandas, and the dolphin show was fun and had great views of the ocean and outlying islands but the crowds were huge and really pushy.

Great for the kid in us all!!!. I've been to Ocean Park a few times but it has expanded quite a lot since my last visit in 2011.The price is very reasonable compared to the likes of the Ngong Ping cable car and Peak Tram and Madamme Tussauds especially if you go on the rides. We spent 8 hours there and still didn't get to see everything or go on all the rides though we did try!Notable attractions include the hair raiser rollercoaster and the giant aquarium! The funfair games where you win prizes are dotted in 2 or 3 areas and are also fun and pretty easy to win prizes to add to your day, however cost extra to play! Variety of food is excellent, in particular the area in the Old Hong Kong themed area has a lot of little kiosks to try, I had a pork steak burger with onions and it's definitely worth a try! This park makes Disney Hong Kong look small and a rip off. Definitely worth a visit but expect food and drinks to be around 3x inflated. For example a bottle of water from the local 711 will cost 8 HKD and in the park it will be 26 HKD. Still, as a major pull for tourists it's to be expected, have fun!

great place. the aquariums were very good , specially the ones with the sharks and there were a lot of interesting things like old hongkong ,the train which took you to the top of the park and the lift which gave you the top view of the park . the dolphin show was good
fun and nice place. if you love animals, and you love exciting rides. i would say that the rides here are way better than HK disneyland. The animal enclosures were really great too.

Ocean Park. This is a huge park, which cannot be completed in a day. The Dolphin show was their main attraction. You need to take the cable car to go from one side of the park to the other on the hill which is a really huge ride & about more than 50 ft high. They have also created an old HK style shops & area which was really nice.
Great outing. Went in August 2009 for 1/3 days in Hong Kong and was a nice day out with family. Great if you have children.

huge. it's huge. combining theme park with aquarium. when the weather is hot/raining i go into the aquarium watching penguin, sea lion, sharks, etc.there are some adrenaline challenge like roller coaster, and the abyss. it also has playground for kids.it's open for all age, you can try the adrenaline challenge or just simply relaxing in the area.

Good rides but too huge. This park was a good attraction with exhilarating rides and animal shows. But it was so huge that going around with children was a bit tiresome. Also, the place is heavily crowded that the lines to wait in also is soo long that it frustrates the little ones.

Kids loved it. After doing Disneyland and being subjected to long wait times for rides. Ocean Park was a great change, we arrived at 10.30am at the parks opening and didn't wait at all for any rides. It was great to have the option to go on rides or look at exhibits with the penguins, seals, sharks etc. It was a pleasant break from the heat! Kids loved it.
Overrated. Needs more improvement i have been coming here since i was a kid now i have my own family and it seems to be the same. very disappointing

Amazing. One of the best theme parks I have visited! The games are great and the park is simply beautiful and surrounded by green mountains. Make sure to check the weather forecast before going because on rainy/windy days they usually stop the games but you can still walk around and have fun! you can never get bored. I loved the aquarium and the Asian animals, especially pandas and types of gold fish which were found only in China. Not to mention, the Cable Cars it is a MUST! you get to see the breathtaking scenery, it was my favorite part at the park. Plus, the gift shops had great souvenirs and at reasonable prices. Had a wonderful time with the family at one of the world-class theme parks.

Oceanark HK: Reckless staff / Worst Security ever. We went to Ocean Park HK in early august 2014 for a 1-day visit. Some rain in the afternoon was forecasted for that day; but we went there anyway.. Below is our horror history:1. Fist, there is no organization at the entry.. no queue for buying the ticket or getting access to the park.. total chaos.. 2. Few park staff at attractions entry.. 3. The food is so overpriced..!! and the restaurant staff is rude and unpolite.. 4. The staff is so limited on communications skills.. No just Chinese people visits the park.!!Besides that, the horror started about 5:30 pm when the rain showed up..The cable car was suspended, only the railcar was available for leaving the park.. well.. everybody was running to the terminal at the high station of the park.. no staff controlling the queue or orienting visitors about exits ,.. No lights.!! it was a total chaos in the darkness with people pushing each other... I have to take my kids and wife and kick a staff entry door to runaway from a human stempede.!! There was no security staff at all.. total chaos.. with hurt kids, people screaming and crying.. ! WWe found shelter in one of the maintenance areas .. all that chaos was only beacause a RAIN.??? that was unnaceptable.. That is an unsafe park..We went to disney HK two days after.. what a difference.. !!!

Nice... I actually went there on august 2013. The surroundings were great. But unfortunately very crowded. And exhausting. The aquarium was average. There are many atractions that would have been a new and great experience for us, but unfortunately the long queues and the hot weather were very exhausting so we decided to just go home and skipped the experience.
A fantastic day in Ocean Park!. Enjoyable for a full day with family members. Everything is convenient and easily accessed. The ocean theatre is a must visit.

A must visit . The place is very nice however, slopes gave us a hard time going from one place to another. I recommend that you spend the whole day there, to be able to roam around the whole area. Walk, rest, ride and so on so that you won't be rushing to one attraction to the other. The staff are very courteous and can speak English. Local food are available and there are food stalls for those who can't afford eating in the restaurants.
Just like any other aquaria. This place is huge with aquarium and theme parks.Not only has sea life but also other asian animals such as panda and alligator.

A Theme Park with something for Everyone. Ocean Park is more than just about the Grand Aquarium. There is also the Giant Panda exhibit, roller-coasters and other rides, the cable-car, shows and carnival games. It is a true theme park and provides something for everyone. Unlike Disneyland which is mainly for the kids.A real plus point is how they managed to provide as much shelter as possible for the queue lines. In this summer heat was a life saver and helped to make the park more enjoyable.
LOVED IT. You simply can not visit Hong Kong and not see Pandas, and Ocean Park has three of them! We loved that you can ride a ride then take a break and go see animals. helped balance out the day

A must see theme park. Personally I think Ocean Park is much more better than its neighbour Dinseyland. There is many reason why you should come.----Animals!Panda is one of the must see when you are coming. Where else you can see one? ----Aquarium! One of the best aquarium in East Asia. When you come through the front gate. A giant blue egg structure stands in front of you. More than 4000 fish and 400 species are what you are going to see.Also there's a shark aquarium and a jelly fish one too if you prefer going.----Rides!Joyful family ride to extreme ones. Suitable for every family members of yours.----Events!One of the best event is the halloween event. It starts somewhere October. Trust me, when you leave. Tour face will be white all night.Also be ware this park have two areas. One is up top the hill and one is at sea level. Transport of choice is the cable car or the tram. I suggest going on the express tram(4 mins)when you are going up to save the queueing time(45-90 mins)and journey time(15 mins)for the cable car.Then when coming back down(supposing you spent the whole day up there and it is nearing close time), usually everyone prefers going on the tram or exit early. So the queue would be shorter for the cable car and you can enjoy the rare fresh air in Hong Kong city and view.
Would recommend this over Disneyland. This is one of the best attractions in Hong Kong, the Pandas are so special. You really need a full day or more to enjoy this experience.

Fun but a bit overrated. Ocean park, dont get me wrong was an overall fun experience. Its somewhat a combination of a mini zoo combined with a theme park. The park size overall is fairly big, with different zones such as an artic zone with walrus', penguins, etc, a set for panda bears, etc. you get the gist. The rides themselves were...fun? compared to Six Flags they seemed incredibly mediocre and not that exciting. The layout of the park also makes it incredibly inconvenient as certain attractions are literally on the other side of the park, in the corner, after climbing XXXXXX amounts of stairs (kill me...). Ocean Park is one of 2 (i believe) theme parks in Hong Kong, compared to Western countries which house hundreds of thousands, so maybe in that circumstance the standards are set differently, which is reasonable, but for me, it was a subpar experience. I guess i would recommend to families with children, but by no means college students visiting; just go drink or shop instead

Go there and enjoy. Even if you're a solo traveler, Ocean Park has so much to offer you. It's very well constructed and built in a great location. You may enjoy first class park activities but also a breathtaking view and nature. Definetely must seen!

Ocean Park - Great Park. So many places to visit in Ocean Park - the must is the Grand AquariumHowever, the other side of the amusement park is as much fun with rides, different attractions etc.If you are in Hong Kong, keep one day for Ocean Park and 2 days for Disney ;-)
nice. ocean park is one of the must-see spots in hong kong, not only its location can view the south china sea, but also the facilities can bring you a lot of fun.
must go. full of joy, a lot of interesting sight, show, entertainment in there, you can find everything within one park, can spend at least one whole day, it is much better to there than disneyland

Nice Theme Park!. We spent almost a whole day at Ocean Park with our 8 Yr old daughter, She absolutely enjoyed the trip. Lots of Options for Kids with Live exhibits of Panda, Penguin which was very interesting for kids. The aquarium was also very good with lots of interesting species. Would recommend this over Disneyland anytime. Plenty of good eating options available at the park. Cable Car ride was spectacular as well. For the more daring ones, the roller coaster and free fall rides are available which we didn't get to try. It was pretty hot when we went there, so would definitely recommend carrying a hat/umbrella to stay cool. Unlike Disneyland, We didn't have to wait too long for any of the attractions which we really liked about this place. Overall, I would highly recommend this if you travel with kids on a short trip to Hong Kong.
Average amusement park. apart from the dolphin show. I don't remember anything nice here :-/Must upgrade the park to be on par with other amusement parks such as Universal Studio Singapore

Absolutely Amazing - Skip Disneyland do this!!!!. Its a bit like the old Wonderland in Sydney - there are animals, in particular the giant pandas are cool. There's an aquarium, red pandas and a reptile exhibit. Catch the cable car up the mountain to the rollercoasters and other rides. It was awesome!

Marking Ocean Park. If you are up for exciting and thrilling rides, this is definitely the place. I suggest going to the Thrill Mountain the moment you get to the part as the queue gets longer. And it's better to visit on weekday, I think, compared on weekends. The area is just too big to enjoy every ride.

kids favourite!!. Ocean Park was one of the most interesting activities for our kids in Hong Kong, the rides the animals, the shows, it was a sort of all in one attraction. my daughter loved seeing the pandas, and playing in the foam, that was really super fun.even my 2 year old had his share of fun, getting to know the animals, waters everywhere, the aquariums....
Like sea world.. Its like sea world with six flags, and old HK all together.Nice old HK street to get a taste old / new.

Still Worth A Visit. If you've been to Sea World in Florida or similar sized larger sea parks elsewhere in the world at first glance Ocean Park will be a disappointment for example there are no orca killer whales, the attractions are smaller and there are less of them. However, like all sea parks, it is still a great place to visit for family fun. The bonus was the star attractions the four Giant Pandas, absolutely fabulous, wonderful to see these magnificent animals so for this reason alone it is still well worth a visit..

Too overcrowded with mainland tourists. We have done Ocean Park many times over the past 12 years. We have always enjoyed it and thought it was special because it was more "chinese" than Disneyland.This year was AWFUL. The park is completely overrun by mainland tourists. The management does nothing to manage these unruly, rude people. They jump the queues, shove other customers and ruin the experience. We were there all day and still only managed to get on 3 rides, because the lines were long and being cut by others.At one point we complained to a ride operator about mainlanders cutting in line ahead of us, but they just shrugged it off.I understand that the management want the dollars spent by mainland tourists, but inviting so many means they need to manage the crowds and their behaviour. The washrooms were filthy. We have never found this before. Never.Unfortunately, we will not return ever. Horrible experience being shoved all day long.

nice visit. Really liked seeing the pandas, though it was really hot walking in the park in this season. There was also loud noises which was very disturbing!! Not much food facility - better bring your own packed food!!

Thrilling, Exciting & Tiring. If one wants to experience height, free fall, speed and animated rides, this is just the right place. Though it can be very crowded and one has to wait for 30 to 40 minutes for a single ride. its all worth it. They say disneyland is for kids and oceanworld is for boys and girls :)

Awesomeness at its highest level!. This place is just sooo awesome. Better than USS in Singapore. I love the rollercoaster. It is built at the top of the mountain that makes it more fun to ride. The park is so huge. Cannot finish all the rides in 1 day. Downside of this park is the getting back to the main entrance. I queued for more than an hour just to get into the cable car. if bringing kids, be sure to be at the cable car terminal at 3 pm.
ocean park hongkong. its sooooo fun,specially the cable car,,, wow,too much rides,,,,come and visit u try it too,,, thats my first time to go there also but still want to go back,

Ocean Park - Fun Place. Highly suitable for a family or group of friends together for sharing fun and promoting relationships. During viewing the scene, enjoying facilities, entertaining with attractions or relaxing on walk, you not only soothing yourself but also developing closer relationship with your family or friends. Make sure to bring along decent camera and/or video camera so that you can recording down all the beautiful memories during the visit.

THE ONE & ONLY PLACE FOR ENJOYMENT. Ocean Park, the name itself is always excited for me and whenever i thoroughly enjoy.. Lots of amazing and challenging rides to enjoy... Spending my whole day in Ocean Park i just love it... Best theme park for all ages....

Nice place for the kids. The park is large. Best for families, you will enjoy and have fun. Too many souvenir shops, at every entry and exit. Long queues for the rides but the children will enjoy seeing the Aquarium, the Pandas and other animals. it's very exciting, memorable and you will enjoy it...

Big Attraction, but too many people!. This was always something that I had wanted to go to, but it was very busy and the lines were very long. It's best to go in the off season or get there really early. I guess with it being Hong Kong, it might always be busy!
Ocean Park. Great rides, great place, great shows. What more can you ask for a place? Oh and I forgot, GIANT PANDAS!!!!!

Good, but, too crowded.. Ocean Park is one of the best place for families. But, too many people and crowd control is poor. Waiting time is too long everywhere. After visit to the park, nice seafood nearby at Ap Lei Chau.

chaotic park with little management oversight. ocean park was used to be one of my favorites attractions but now it becomes chaotic with very little crowd control to assure patrons not being harassed by others. there are people cutting into lines, lying on benches, talking loudly indoor, throwing trash everywhere... hello? where are the staff??? when we told staff about it, they just walked away and said nothing they can do. if they don't change the management style, it will become a park of disorderly people
I love Ocean Park. Compare with Disney, I love Ocean Park, cause everything here are REAL! And you can have closely look of panda, jelly fish, dolphin, and many many fish too.

A day with family fun. It is the place where your family and you can enjoy a full day together. Bring your swimming suits to experience the water waves that you will not have at the swimming pool. It is educational for for children to visit the animals and fishes especially the aquarium which is one of the largest in Asia. Do not forget to ride the cable car to view the scenery at Aberdeen. I considered it is value for money.

Ocean Park not bad. Wow, too many people! Get there early and you can leave early! Bring drinks to the park before you get there! A bottle of water in the park costs $5-6. You can see everything in one day. Good for done day and thats all.

nice entertainment for all.... We went on sunday...full amazing crowd and long waiting in most of the rides and shows...For the exitment rides we can find better than disneyland also nice information on various ocean animals, really like the Panda thing... we were lucky to see fire and fountain show at around 8 evening...Many many exciting games for children but need to pay extra...Over all very good experience...

Fabulous seeing Giant Pandas at last. Yes there were other animals and it was a lovely zoo but the major attraction for me were the Panda's. We visited in August and it wasn't too busy. They were in full view and seemed very happy in their surroundings which all looked very natural. Well worth the visit.

Got to see a panda. Very hot day when we visited in August and the park was quite busy. I would not have wanted to queue for the rides but my family and I were there to see the Aquarium, the pandas and other animals. Great lunch in the restaurant at the top of the cable car.
Ocean Park. The park is large and I enjoyed the coastal ride even though it was scarry. Very exciting, enjoyable and memorable

Nothing so special,have fun with friends. For families or group of friends,it is a nice opportunity to have fun with roller coasters and so on ,but it wil be boring and waste of huge amount of money for a lonely traveller.Ocean Park is designed in a way to make you buy souvenirs, in every entry and exit you will find shops.There are more than 5 shops for one attraction like amusement park.You should try to ignore those stupid shops and find right way in order to see a panda or penguin.

Adventure Time. Went to Ocean Park Hong Kong with my family. Love the animals, the pandas, the sea creatures jelly fish, most especially the hummer head, we even bought a big stuffed hummer head for souvenir. The cable car rides to see the rides on the other side is great. The highlight of the day was the dolphin show after a long day of walking it was a delight to take a seat as my feet were aching. Will come back again.

Avoid the park on a sunny day!. 3 adults, 1 six year old and 1 baby. This is one trip that we were so excited about but we all ended up going home after 3 hours because of the unbearable heat. We went here on Aug 26, 2014 and as expected there are plenty of visitors. The lines are long. My 6 year old son and I rode the whirly bird. We fell in line for an hour and the 1 minute ride was not worth it. Then we looked for a restaurant to eat but the two restaurants nearby are jam packed. The few places which can help us shield from the heat of the sun were likewise full. We decided to go back to the other side of the park to look for other restaurants. We used the cable car going back and it is the only ride we enjoyed. Good thing there are no lines as few people are going back. But it is the same predicament as the gruelling heat consumed our energy. Instead of eating, we decided to leave by taxi without objection from our son. He was also tired. I just hope that ocean park will put up some more air conditioned establishments where visitors can wait, eat, stand by or just relax. Our Disneyland experience on a sunny day was way better. Disney has several places with shades and several establishments with aircon. But to be fair, I am sure we could have enjoyed ocean park if not for the heat.

Park of 2 sides. I did not quite understand the need to split the park into 2 sides and the hot/humid weather did probably get to me so I wasn't enjoying too much of the rides with the kids. Overall, just an average park to me.

Had a great day, one day not enough. The park is really huge with a lot of things to do. We started of with the aquarium which is not bad at all, the Ocean enclosure with Mantas rays are a treat, the north and south pole adventure is also a complete delight. The other highlight was the dolphin show, my parents just loved it. there is a lot more to see in terms of animals and fishes, including the Pandas, sea horses, chinese sturgeons, there was great white shark enclosure yet to be opened.The rides didnt disappoint either i personally loved the hair raiser and Flash. Plus we did not have enough time to visit all the rides. The rapids is a fun ride for all ages. i truly had a wonderful time . Must visit

Great Experience. Although it's hot and very crowded due to summer holiday, however it's very enjoying and educated trip in Ocean Park. There are educator around the aquarium, you can just ask a question, they'll start giving you all information of the aquatic species, their preferences.

Fantastic scenery,poor staff attitude. Loved the scenery and the overall attractions. Queue average 35-45 mins. Fireworks and show at 1930hrs is the best deserts. No matter how lovely this theme park, its all spoiled by its staff attitude, rude and arrogant. Shouting and screaming at you. Shame on your staff.

A complete combination of fantastic theme park, zoo and aquarium. I took time to visited this mega theme park during my business trip in Hong Kong because I really wanted to see panda. But sadly, at that day all the pandas were having their long-nap so I can't have a chance to see the attractive panda. But overall, I really like this place so much. It's very fun to discover the whole place; full of joy and also a plenty attractive to see and try. This place is like a total combination of theme park, zoo and aquarium. I think, I almost explore the whole theme park except the cable car. One of the unique and my favourite spot in this theme park was the replica of a city street the old Hong Kong, which bringing back the culture of Hong Kong in mid 50's - 70's. I also loved the mega aquarium building, which present a huge tank full of fish. Very attractive and i suggest you to never missed this place with your kids during your visitation in Hong Kong!

family vacation. its better than Disnely land our family like it very much better to go late in order to fin a less waiting time all there is Panda and monkey add to it the most amazing laser show i sow in my life

do not go when your children are under 125 cm - otherwise it is wonderful. beautiful park, nice attractions, but funny enough they let you pay for full children fair for children and do not allow them in most attractions, although this is a reasonable park condition, it does not justify to let children pay a children fee and they are not allowed in the attractions. a merry go round for 200 hkd I can find any where. so go there when you r kids have grown up to 125 cm just to be sure, as i see the 122 cm is done with strict measurements, and i see children missing 2 cm sent away. the old part of the park reachable with the escalators is now a secluded area, hard to reach.

Good value. There is plenty to do and see at Ocean Park, Hong Kong. It's a combined zoo / aquarium / theme park. The weather started off promising but the monsoon rain soon appeared which we were totally unprepared for. Therefore, my advice would be to take either an umbrella or waterproof coat, unless you are happy to purchase these from Ocean Park. The cable car ride to the upper level where the rollacoaster and rides are located gives you a stunning view of the surroundings. We were disappointed to find all the rides were closed due to the bad weather, however, what we did find a little strange was that the cable car service was still in operation which took you up to these rides.

Forget Disney Hong Kong!. A super kids friendly place with many things to do for the adults as well, is a much better theme park than the Disney in Hong Kong. Bring a poncho with you to enjoy the water rides and a big heart to get on the roller coasters, the Flash, or the Abyss among other - while mesmerizing yourself with the amazing views of Hong Kong at the same time. Plan two full days, at least, to enjoy your time while at the park! You will enjoy it ... and if you had planned a visit to Disney in Hong Kong, take my suggestion and drop it!! Just go to Ocean Park and you will thank me!

Solid all-around theme park. From Giant Pandas to small flat rides to "Hair Raising" thrill rides, Ocean Park is a great day to spend a day or even two. There is a public shuttle you can take for just a few Hong Kong dollars that you can board right from the exit of the MTR. Compared with theme parks in the US, this park is quite a bargain, however food is just as expensive. Must-do's: the Hair Raiser roller coaster, Summit cable cars, and the Giant Panda Adventure. These three attractions will give you the perfect spread of what ocean park has to offer: a unique thrill ride on the edge of a cliff, astounding views of Ocean, and up-close encounters with very special animals.Other than incredible attractions, Ocean park is spread over a small Mountain which gives you the opportunity to explore the giant park. Be prepared to walk a lot. Overall, this is 4.25 out of 5 stars.

Must visit. A must visti place, especially with family and kids. Very entertaining both for kids and adults.You can easily spend 1 day there,Make your kids happy. For me it is much better than Disney Land.

Even in the heat of August a great day. Ocean Park deserves the place it has earned as one of the top 50 theme parks in the world. The only drawback is the multitude of Chinese Mainlanders who will visit with you. England taught HK residents how to cue - it will take a miracle to teach Mainlanders! The only drawback is the price of refreshments; I think Walt Disney taught them how to price a bottle of water, but the aquaria are really worth the $24 HK for a bottle of water.

Family friendly theme park. On our 1st day in hong kong last April 14, 2014, Myself together with my husband,son, nephews and sisters, visited Ocean Park. I would say that this is a very nice and family friendly theme park, complete with all the rides, restaurants and bench to rest at. You can see all the views above and below captivating views while riding the cable car.What excites me most is our ride in the mine train. It seems that our heart pound so much and seems to stop beating for a while during this very long ride-that's maybe because of the very fast movement of the train. During the ride, you can see the beauty of the china sea.After the ride, we decided to explore the place.I should say that the park is very beautiful,clean and very well maintained not to mention their very accommodating staff. The food is good, you can choose for their wide selection of food. The games are not for the young ones only but also for the young at once.We went home with a staff toys we won from the games. The whole was a very tiring day but a very memorable one. I recommend this place to everybody.Given the chance to return to hong kong, i will re visit Ocean Park.

GO EARLY. Took a taxi here. Not sure if there is a better way to get here via MTR. We arrived early to beat the crowd, and by mid-day, the place was packed. The park itself is huge and there are many options for activities including animals, rides, and an aquarium. Our favorite was the sky cable car that takes you from one side of the park to the other. The views from the cable car are incredible. Get there early and avoid the lines.

Ocean Park - so much enjoyment. With the family, we had so much enjoyment, thoroughly enjoying an fantastic day, with everything from memorable adventures and adorable animals and unique marine life. The day at the park was great with easy access to the rides and minimal queues. The cable car across the cliff face was brilliant with everyone liking the thrill of the ride.

HUGE!!!. Ocean park is bigger than Disneyland HK.
Start early to cover all the park in a day, plenty of food options for Indian Vegetarians too.
Enjoy thr ridE

Family day out!. Ocean Park is huge with lots of animals, aquarium, fast rides, cable car, train etc - loads to do. A really good day out for the family. Only 30 mins from the city and a cheap taxi price. We ate at the theme park but personally would not recommend as we had a poor meal but that didn't spoil our day. My highlight was seeing a couple of Pandas. If you have kids/teens and your in Hong Kong then worth the visit.

only waiting and no rides!. We chose a wrong day ( 16th August, Saturday) to visit this place and from the word go, it was only crowd and more crowd and waiting and more and more waiting! We had to wait for at least 75 minutes for each of the ride lasting only 2 minutes ! We could not do all the rides and also could not see all the attractions! All the restaurants had a waiting time for 30-40 minutes and finally after some 40 minutes, we got the rope car and came out of the park to wait for another one hour to get a taxi! All the money was spent on simply standing ( no place to sit) whole day on the sweltering hot sun!

Chinese approach. The cable car and the rollercoaster along the coast are a great experience, but the Ocean Park overall seems to target chinese guests who just have a different taste in many things. Though kids might not mind anyway...Tends to be seriously crowded, so avoid weekends, holidays and afternoon. Best time is in the morning.

Brilliant. Ocean Park was fun with the family, had to do two trips for us to finish all the activities. What I enjoyed most was the cable cars to cross the aquarium to the fun park where we had fun with the "hair raiser" roller coaster.

Great family attraction. Newly renovated aquarium got a lot to see and worth the 45 minute wait to get in. The new Hair Raiser roller coaster was much more intense than the old one. Worth the 45 minute wait also. The panda pavilion and the the gold fish were worth to visit. If it's not the heat and the crowd, we would appreciate more. The tuxedo restaurant where we were dining with the penguin was a nice and cool place to dine and rest in the mid afternoon. Overall, my kids enjoyed it and an afternoon well spent.

Better fun than disney land. what else can I say, ocean park easily beat disney land in rides and attractions. It was reasonably priced and the food inside is good quality! Try the penguin restaurant, its amazing. You dine in an igloo shaped restaurant surrounded by penguins swimming in the water. Great place to visit
Worth visiting. Huge park with lots to see. Good place to bring kids and have a fun family day.It's usually very crowded though, so try get there early and plan the route wisely

Meh.. Perhaps I have been spoilt as I have been to the LA Disneyland and San Diego Seaworld. The line ups were ridiculous, the aquarium was very average especially after we lined up for an hour to get in. The Pandas were really cool though. There is a cheap bus from Admiralty station but there was a 2 hour line up to just get the bus to the park. We took a taxi and it was only $AUD10, take a taxi and it saves time and hassle.

Adventure Park for all. Located on Hong Kong island this fun park is recommended even if just to see the pandas. Upper mountain by cable car is a must where you find all the thrill rides to amuse yourself. Lower mountain level to relax and visit the pandas and view the tropical fish aquarium.

Wrong information. When we arrived we it was wet we asked what rides were open and we're told all of them. We went inside and found out that in fact none were open except a merry go round. The panda enclosure was very good but paying $50 for a panda enclosure seems a bit much considering that, again, we were told that the park was open by an employee. Also plan ahead if you want a taxi back as we waited over an hour to get one.
Poor show. I don't think is worth the money it really needs an upgrade specially the aquarium in comparison with others around the world is dissapointing

Ocean Park. As you may have gathered from the other reviews it was very hot and very crowded. Lots of coach parties from the PRC. Having said that, there are some good attractions. We liked the pandas - they were asleep; that's what pandas do. Also good was the huge new shark aquarium - I think it's the biggest fish tank I've ever seen, and it was (blissfully) inside and air-conditioned. The penguins are also a good choice on a hot day. The queues put us off most of the rides. We ate in the Tuxedos restaurant - OK, not great, with quite a long wait. When you get to Admiralty tube the bus queue is terrifying, but it is well-organised, and the staff were stopping people cutting in.

You get to see Pandas!. The highlight of ocean park is their panda exhibits. They have four giant pandas in two different exhibits which was the main reason for my going to ocean park.
