They also have a giant aquarium which is really neat as well as other Asia animals. The pandas are very active in the morning so get there when the park opens. At first, the park may seem very crowded but once you get to the top, there is not that many people. All of the rides are on the mountain and there are plenty of rides for your enjoyment including some crazy roller coasters. The cost is around $30 a person. Try to avoid going on a hot day because it is miserable and you will be done with the park in just a few hours. I was able to do everything I wanted to do in about five hours and by then I was hot enough. Overall, a great theme park and much better value then compared to Disneyland Hong Kong.

Lovely Day Out... We went in Winter. We went in December and During School Term so had a lovely time, and it was relatively quiet.The Queue for the Cable Car was the longest queue we had to wait in.Worth the wait - its the most amazing ride across 3 hills.All the rides were fun if not slightly dangerous.There were lots of little food stalls.Overall a good day.The only thing we found strange was seeing large groups of Single Chinese Men (no disrespect), standing in groups, smoking.and the other thing was that there was quite a bit of queue cutting which is annoying especially considering how much we love to queue in good old England

Don't go there during Summer.. By the look of it, you know that this place is build on three hills and its no easy feat to build. However, I wasn't doing very well with the hot weather and it wasn't long that I had realized that I could not carry on walking anymore. If it wasn't my sister that encouraged me to move on, I would have gone home by 3pm. I felt that there were too many rides in the park and not many animals to see. Fair enough, it wasn't a zoo, its the theme park. The facilities were really far apart from each other and thats why you have to do a lot of walking. The hills are not easy to walk because you are walking on slopes. It was really crowded. The only thing I am happy with is Neptune Restaurant (when you don't have to queue), the bus to reach there (they are fast and many. They don't make you stand throughout the ride. They ensure enough seats before they go), the animals we see and the cable car (don't go if you are scare of heights). Not only I wish it was less crowded. I wish there are more than one way to go back to the first part to the park so that you could go home (other than the cable car), and more shades, please.

It's a super big fun fair. My sister and I went to this park on the 30 July 2014 at around 11 a.m.. The weather was super Sunny and warm. We took MTR to Admiralty station and took bus 629. The queue was in orderly manner and almost everyone gets a seat as they have catering many buses to service the 629 route. No pushing and squeezing. When we have reached the park, from the entrance, I can see a big hill with a sea horse design on it and a big fountain. It looks like a theme park full of surprises. The ticketing booth is full of people and tour groups. As we have gotten the tickets from the Hong Kong airport, we went straight into the park to get our tickets scanned. There isn't any proper queuing system to get the tickets scan and ended up splitting up with my sister. Upon enter, we can see there are lots of small children and parents. Near the entrance, there are many souvenir shops. The souvenir shops have a wide range of souvenirs to choose from. There are different types key chains, bags, caps, hats, jewelries, magnets, soft toys, hoodies, T-shirts with conserve the environment messages, mugs, Hong Kong style ornaments, items related to there mascots, and even biscuits or cookies. I would suggest to buy these souvenirs when you are about to exit the park as you would want to keep holding onto the souvenirs when taking the different rides in the park. The park also requires you to have full energy as it is very big and full of slopes.There is a bakery shop at the left side near the entrance. The shop sells sandwiches, buns, desserts and cakes. There are turkey, beef, duck and salmon sandwiches, and there are peach, tiramisu, and almond chocolate Eclairs to choose from. Do try the duck sandwich and the peach Eclair. I bought back to my hotel after visit the park and it still taste delicious. Walking further down from the bakery, beside the Big Aquarium, take the escalator up to check out the famous Neptune's Restaurant. Over there, you can get 5-course lunch for around HK$258 per pax, which consist of a soup, salad, main dish, drink and a dessert. For the soup, you can top up additional dollar to upgrade from pumpkin soup to lobster soup. There is only salmon cheese salad and for the dessert is Haagen Dazs ice cream. Alternatively, you can also order another 4 course meal at HK$568 which everything (drink, roasted pork ribs) is up-sized with salad and dessert for 2. While lunching, you can see the aquatic animal in the aquarium and you can take pictures with them. Alternatively, you can walk further down where there are push carts selling drinks,cold and hot food, and even small watermelon which costed HK$40. Walking away from the Neptune's Restaurant, you will reach an area where to need to walk up to see monkeys (Le Le and Hu Hu) and pandas in a air con environment. The pandas are usually asleep. This is one of the place which to can see pandas and over there you can buy many panda related souvenirs. After visiting the panda, you may have to skip the Ocean Express Waterfront Station as this will bring you to another side of the park behind the hill. In front of the station, there is a tent showcasing different types of seahorses. Walk further down, located beside the "seahorse" tent, there is a place called old Hong Kong. The place showed the how Hong Kong looks like at the olden days. You may want to take many pictures here especially if you like things with nostalgic feel. There are also mini stalls selling Hong Kong style food, and game stalls where you can get to play fun fair style games. However, you need to play extra for the games. There is also a carousal where children likes to play. As for the adults is for the nostalgic feel when they were young.Walk away from the entrance of the Old Hong Kong and turn left 2 times, you will enter into a Panda Conservatory. You will be able to see Red Panda and the "Normal" panda. Again, the pandas are usually asleep. Walking out of the conservatory you will be able to see other animal such as terrapins, craps and goldfishes. Outside the conservatory, there are Panda theme restaurants and souvenir shops. Beside the Panda theme area, at the right side, there is a area where you can get to see different kinds of birds. However, is was enclosed and viewing the birds is difficult. If you are walking straight away from the Panda theme area, you will reach an area which is "children's paradise". All the items there are very fun fair style and you have to pay to access all the items.After touring the different area in front of the Ocean Express Waterfront Station, proceed to take a train to the other side of the park. The station and train are beautifully and detail designed. Do check out the amazing performance in the train which uses sounds, lighting and projections.At the other side of the hill beside the escalator up, you will be able to see the arctic animals and full of fun fair stuff. At the right side of the escalator you will be able to see parrots, , various birds, very small monkeys and other creatures that like to live in swampy and dark areas, like poisonous frogs, snakes, eels and cockroaches. Walking out of the area and turn to left to the other 3 areas of the park, there are seals, dolphins, and sharks. Other than that, the park is full of fun fair rides, snack bar and slopes. Towards the end of the park opening hours around 4 to 5 p.m., the park is jam-packed with tourists and the routes are jammed. Seeing this issue, we joined in the long queue to take faster way which is the cable car ride back nearer to the entrance where we can exit from the park. The cable car is very high up, small and provides a panoramic view of the nearby islands.Overall, though the park keep delivering the message to conserve the environment. However, it does not lived up to it as it has more fun fair stuff than animals. It is definitely a place to have fun, not a place to look at animal. As there are full of slopes and few shelter, it not suitable for old people or people with difficulty in walking. I hope they can make changes to the route and providing more services to this issue. The map is also not draw to scale, all written in Chinese and doesn't show what is in the attraction. I have many times enter a super long route and not know what is it at the other end, causing exhaustion from walking.

Very crazy theme park rides and nice cable cars.. I took on the 'Abbys' ride and we were sat down with a safety buckle and the machine took us up to at least 100 over meters up the tower and then we had a free fall down and it was shocking!!!! That was my first and last ride in Ocean Park. If you are that kind of 'daredevil' person then go ahead and take your sweet time to enjoy the rides! Went there in March 2011

Long Wait Times. We visited this attraction mid week, the lines to ALL rides and attractions was for us un exceptable. Every line showed at least one hour wait. The only thing that was worth seeing/doing is the chair lift, again an hour wait for 5 minute ride both ways. The aquarium though large was average. The pandas viewing was disappointing, one asleep the others in their housing viewable via cct.I would never go back or recommend to my friends this attraction, but in fairness we did not see many show that were programmed because of the long wait and us being tired waiting in lines in 33deg temperature.

family fun. A great place to take the kids. We saw the giant pandas and went on lots of rides. The queues are awful but if you stay until the early evening they are much better. I wish we'd spent more time in the day looking at the animals and other attractions and left the rides until later, as given the queuing a day isn't long enough to do everything. There is a bubble room but you need a change of clothes (suggest taking a swimsuit and small towel). The cable car ride down the hill was great too.

Pandas pandas pandas. The Pandas are a big draw and the new enclosure is the best Panda enclosure we have seen anywhere in the world (and we have been to a few!). The zig-zag shaped enclosure ensures you can view the Pandas where ever they are in their well designed and maintained environment.Some of the areas very close to the bears has floor to ceiling glass. other areas further from where the bears flop around has half walls. Friendly staff mingle with the crowds maintaining low noise levels so as not to startle or upset the bears. It is very good.However, there is downside. And it is pretty big. The old Panda enclosure that I saw only 5 years ago and was then very impressed with, has deteriorated into a shocking level of squalor. The older bears are still kept there but now monkeys share the enclosure. The grass looked dead and the smell was atrocious. This is in marked contrast to how it was just a few years ago and was a bit upsetting to see.Beyond the Pandas, the next impressive feature is the aquarium. I am not usually interested in fish but I have to say this was very impressive. A wonderful structure that enables you to see the fish from above, the side and from below. The only thing I thought a little distasteful (or ironic perhaps) was the King Neptune fish restaurant next door.
The best part of Honk Kong. Excellent ropeway ride, unparallel water life display, could not expect to see a penguin in South-East Asia. The best part was the dancing fountain son-et-lumiere show.

Rides, food, entertainment and PANDAS!. What an amazing day. We had the entire day here with a group of around 10 people. Queues look big but move very fast so don't be put off by them. The rides are excellent. The shows and entertainment are excellent too. Seeing real life pandas up close was an amazing life experience!Make sure you watch the fire show at the end...

one of great attractions. If you on backpacking - be sure to visit this. Take bus A29 at Central. Is straight bring you to there. And start from the top. And make sure your battery camera fully charge.

hk trip isn't complete without visit to ocean park. Nice seaworld type theme park with rides and exhibits. Take the cable car to the other side for a scary ride and nice views of the bay. The pandas are always fun to work. Make sure to stay for the night time symbio show!

Pandas were excellent. We were amazed that so few people went to visit the panda. We almost got the exhibit to ourselves the twice we visited (once going into the park and once coming out). The train through the mountain is excellent way of getting from one part of the park to another. It seemed very busy before the gates opened, there seemed to be almost no Europeans other than us, people were very friendly to us but when we got into the park it never seemed to busy. I would go back to this park again.

Probably lots more fun during the non-peak period.. Visited Ocean Park during the peak period on a weekday, boy it felt like it was the weekend. It feels much bigger than Disneyland with animal attractions and rides put together. Queuing was definitely inevitable, even to enter some animal exhibits. Managed to sit on 2 rides (Flash and Hair Raiser) and that was all, the rest had an average waiting time of an hour which was a waste of time. My friend and I decided to watch a show mid day which turned out to be a tanning session as we were forced to sit outside the shaded area. Umbrellas were aplenty - thank goodness our view was not blocked, but can't say the same for others. The cable car was one of the best rides I sat, the view and thrill of climbing a steep mountain is pretty unparalleled.

Get Closer to the animals !. We loved the Ocean Park HongKong and definitely would be back ! Come early because there's always a queue.Prepare to do a lot of walking ,because this venue is hilly.Admission tickets are HKD 320 for adults and HKD 160 for child aged 3-11.The park consists of 2 parts , The Waterfront and The Summit , this 2 venues are connected with a cable car and the Ocean Summit Express ,make sure to try them both ! The highlight of this Ocean Park are the Giant Pandas ,at the Amazing Asian Animals,and the Dolphin Encounters , .Not to be missed are the Animal shows.Many reasonably priced restaurants scattered in the park , and serving time was superbly quick ! Efficient staffs.Altogether ,its a fun filled 12 hours ,from the opening 10.00 am until 10.00 pm !
So far a better Ocean Park I've seen. Amusement Park + Zoo/Oceanarium = Ocean ParkAmazing viewsSpectacular ridesFor first timers like me, definitely a worth visiting attraction next to Disney Park.

ocean park. unparalleled access to.. and views along the way to die for. what a combination of highs, thrills and spills, laughs and sights. well done ocean park, interest maintained over all these years!

Fun Filled Day. Ocean Park is huge! It is hilly and you will do lots of walking! Easy to get around from the bottom of the park to the top with the express train or the cable cars. The views from some of these ride are just breathtaking! If your an adventure seeker the roller coasters are a must! I much preferred this park to Disneyland. For its various rides & attractions. Including visiting pandas, the aquarium and the live stage shows.

Worth visiting. Combing a zoo and an amusement park is pretty cool, and new for us.The location is superb, take the funicular to the side of the amusement park and you'll have some awesome views. It's not a very large park, but good for a about 5 hours of fun (if it's not busy).

Added Attraction. Access from the entrance to the hill top is easier now because of the express train. Visitors don't have to take the bus to visit the entirety of the park. They have added more rides for those courageous ones.

Best views ever from an amusement park. This amusement park has espectacular views in general but on some rollercoasters, leaping out over the water, it's unreal. We stayed in the marvellous and highly recommendable Ovolo in Aberdeen which was only 5 mins away. Eat at the Terrace Cafe. Magnificent views. They have fans that blow cold air at you too and the enclosed option with a.c. on the floor underneath is far too noisy.

Good day out. Seeing the Pandas was the highlight for me I also loved the penguins and seals and although there are plenty of rides I preferred the animals. The park is big being built on very steep terrain which makes the cable car a great way to travel from one side to the other. We stayed until closing and the fireworks and light display was really good and unexpected as we had not heard much about it. I travelled with my 16 year old and a friend and it was a great day out but I preferred Disneyland but if you have time visit both especially if you want to see Pandas in a very natural looking environment.

Too crowded. No shades. Queues aretoo long.. Epnxbsjw dont go to this place. I am even surprised that this place got an overall rating of 4.5. This place is too crowded. In fact, all of the attractions suck to the max. Management must be too greedy to let a gigantic wave of people in. I hate this park!!!

An amazing park. Lots to do. Rides,animals,aquariums,games in a well designed park. The cable car is a must. Entrance fees includes all rides,cable car rides and feeding of animals. But be prepared to wait for the different rides. We were there at opening time 10:00 am. There were already a lot of people. But the staff are well organised and know how to move masses of people. Not allowed to take your own food in.
Great. Brilliant! Lots to do but very busy! Loved seeing pandas, penguins and sea lions! Downside, you have to queue for rides which can be up to an hour which is no fun in the humid heat!

Fantastic! A MUST DO!. This park is amazing! We had an incredible time and would have spent more than one day if we had known it was going to be so much fun. If it's this or Disney, definitely do this! Make sure you stay late and see the fireworks/laser show...a must see! Go and you won't regret it!!

For the love of Dolphins. This place is a must visit in Hong Kong. Do take the cable car to the top; the view is amazing. I couldn't get enough of the Dolphins. The show was outstanding; absolutely fab!!!
The only let down was choice of food available for vegetarians. Overall it is an experience to be had.

Must visit very massive theme park . Amazing theme park not to miss ..one of the major tourist attraction in hongkong for all ages ..can skip disneyland but do not miss ocean park ..cable car too long too much height but worth every bit ..massive too much walk but worth every bit ..amazing submarine train not to miss at all ..very beautifully made ..

Aquarium, rides and pandas !. If you travel with children, Ocean Park is a must-do in HK. This park combine classical rides, great aquariums and a zoo part (with pandas !) in one place. Its cable car service to go from one part to the other offers one of the best view on South China Sea possible. Be careful though, the park is always very crowed and a waiting time of one hour per rides is a classic. Get your entrance ticket directly at 629 bus stop near Admiralty MTR Station, you'll save a lot of time.

Theme Park for the Young Adults. Compare to HK Disneyland, the rides here are more suitable for the young adults and were more exciting. Situated up on the mountain where the view is fantastic and also comes with some marine life such as penguins, seals, dolphins that will make your trip an educational one.

Excellent !!!. I am really impressed ! It was an old park but there are so much life in it ! We had so much fun. The park almost covered every kind of interest and age groups. We spent most of the time on motorised games. We will go again for the aquarium. The pandas are very cute too.

Very busy. Perhaps we are spoiled with our water park options in the UAE but this place was a little 2nd rate. Plus it is just so hot to queue for rides in July. They need to add a big wave pool and rides that include getting wet.

Hot day at Ocean Park. We got to Ocean Park around 10 am and the park was already really busy! Make sure you get there when the park opens so you don’t miss out on any major shows like the panda feeding and dolphin shows which start almost immediately after opening. The sea lion show is good and the red pandas are adorableThe park is huge and quiet easy to get lost. The lines for the rides were too long and too hot to wait in so we didn't go on any rides unfortunately. We ate lunch at the underwater restaurant called Neptune's, the atmosphere was nice there aren't many places where you can have lunch whilst watching marine animals swimming around. The food wasn't too great, there weren't many options but enjoyed the entertainmentIt was a short tiring day we left around 2 pm as we were exhausted from the heat as there is no shaded areas to rest.Overall it was still an enjoyable day but I would recommend not to go on a hot day

Rollercoasters with ocean view. Ocean park is worth a day trip if you stay in Hong Kong (...for those more interested in sightseeing than amusement parks, there is even a replica of old Hong Kong with plenty of food to discover.) For me, the best parts where the tower with an excellent view over the outlying islands as well as the rides whose looping give you the impression that you drop into the ocean. One day is enough to explore the whole park if you start early. Also, even though I visited twice on weekend days, the lines were never long.If possible, visit over Halloween when a lot of haunted houses open their doors all over the park.
Hot Day at Ocean Park. I recommend going to Ocean Park when its less crowded (which is mid-week) and no so hot if you can. We were there for only 4-5hrs but enjoyed it . Loved the Cable Cars

"Thrill Mountain" - new section. You have to try the Hair Raiser ride...really raises your hair on this one...awesome ride. The Flash is another good one. Just make sure you don't eat too full prior to getting on rides! Also check out the penguin attraction. These are fairly new to Ocean Park, if you haven't been there in the last 2 years!

Fab but crowded and beware of bad mannered visitors.... Ocean Park is in a stunning natural location with amazing views. Anyone who goes there, young or old will be wowed! The animal shows, such as Dolphin show, in the big pool-theatre are always fun, but please make sure you get there early to get a seat. Feeding time for the red Pandas is also a must.The rides are good and genera impression is that they are safe and well maintained, and there is good variety of age-levels, i.e. rides for the youngest and for daredevils! The cable car is spectacular, and the transition from the upper to lower areas, I mean the view, is amazing.In all it is one of its kind, and both informative regarding sealife, animals and sustainability and fun. The one bad thing (and this is not the park's fault) is the fact that it has become TOO POPULAR with tour-groups in recent years, and sadly not everyone respects queuing, taking turns or even other people's privacy. I have seen tourists taking photos of people's children up close without asking (even taking photos of me, presumably because I am of other ethnic origin than them), push people out of queues, spit, smoke and break into restricted areas (yes, I have inside information on this!) making visiting the park rather stressful for those who do not appreciate this sort of behavior. I think it might be a good idea to introduce some HKID holders only days, so that Hong Kongers can get to enjoy their own attractions too.

Good amusement park day out. This is the only amusement park in Hong Kong with the thrill rides (Disney is just for romance, familes and shows). After the expansion at the hill, there's a lot more to play. Avoid going in the weekend and the public holidays in China, such as early October. It will be very crowded with people and you won't have a good day out but queuing.The Halloween batch is getting worse in the recent years so I don't really recomend it. It is not horrible at all and the things are just too fake.

Ocean Park - Best Ever Trip. Ride were pretty exciting and it was life time experience. This was my first trip outside India which was one of the best.Wide variety of rides, underwater aquarium and ride on Cable car made my day.Must visit place in HK. I was lucky to see the live fountain show which was another best part of this visit.

All in one fun - uniquely Hong Kong. The randomness of this park makes it a very Hong Kong attraction - where else could you see pandas, an aquarium, ride a cable car, and have all the traditional roller coasters and thrill rides still left to do?! I've been several times now and it's still fun, whereas Disney seems pretty small even second time around. A taxi there will get you to the right spot, but the bus back can be a cheaper option if traffic is heavy. Be aware there aren't too many food options for vegetarians - most of the food is quite snack-y anyone but avoid the restaurants which are really over-priced. The park is pretty poorly signed over on the thrill ride side so pick up a map at the entrance.
Unforgettable. Great oceanviews. Take a ride in the cable car and check the park from above. Take at least half a day to visit the whole park.

Exciting Family Park. My friends and I tried the rides in Ocean Park and we had a lot of fun. We also did a lot of souvenir shopping, ate at their restaurants, and simply enjoyed the day with friends. A beautiful park to be shared with family and friends.

A must when u visit HK. The park is divided into two parts, headland & lowland, connected by cable cars or an unmanned railway. Main entrance at lowland... Suggested to take cable car to the headland & back using railway or vice versa to experience both. Cable car ride is scenic and comfortable, queues may be long though. It will take less time using the railway but it may get crowded at times. The aquarium is located next to the main entrance. U may also see pandas, goldfish, birds, Asian animals and some other animals at the lowland (waterfront). There is also a kids playland called "whiskers harbour" for young children, where there a rides and a playground. Scheduled bird shows are available right before entering the kids' playland. U may also see how old HK is like at the old HK street. U will pass through it when u are heading towards the cable car station. There are food stalls, stall games & props in old HK style.Thrilling rides are at the headland (summit) where u can also see penguins, seals & sea lions.U need a cardigan to go visiting the penguins if u intend to stay there longer. There is a restaurant next to it. Try getting in at around the penguin feeding time, then u can watch those penguins cramming together for food while you are enjoying yours. The restaurant is not cheap, food portion small & quality so-so... Therefore a right timing makes the dining more value for money.U can also see rainforest animals in the expedition trail located next to "the rapids", a ride that may get U soaked.Scheduled dolphins & sea lions show are also available at the headland. Further down the theatre u may find Chinese sturgeons, sharks and some more rides. Headland is also a perfect spot for sunset watching. Don't forget about the jelly fish near the summit cable car station.Avoid school holidays as it may get real crowded. HK is also very hot, so better go there in autumn or winter.There is also a fountain & light show at the fountain next to the aquarium every night at park closing time.Don't expect to see all animals, watch all shows and get on all rides in a day. Plan your visit & book beforehand if u would like to do some animal encounters such as penguin feeding or touching the dolphins.

Starting to show its age. I booked the Dolphin encounter for my wife's birthday. My wife really enjoyed the encounter and I took many good photos. Had it not been for this I would have given a lower rating.The park is starting to look old and some of the attractions I previously enjoyed seemed to be not so good any more. I remember the first time we went, the dolphin show was 45 minutes and was very entertaining. It is now just over 10 minutes and a little boring. I am sure there used to be a lot more jelly fish too.

I have a lot of fun!!!. I really like Ocean Park. I went there by MTR and dropped by at Admiralty Station and buy the entrance ticket of Ocean Park there (exit B of Admiralty Station) and it is cheaper (it should be HKD 320, but here it was only HKD 290). The place is huge and exciting, could not finish all of them in one day. Many attractions and aquarium to see there. I can see Panda and Penguin, so cute. Do not miss the cable car, the view from the top is great. It was crowded on the afternoon, so it will be better if you come in the morning. The weather is very hot since I went there on summer, you need to bring water with you or you have to buy drink there with excessive price. But no need to worry, you can refill your bottle there with drinking water dispenser for free. Overall, I am really having fun at Ocean Park and it will be on my destination list when I go to Hongkong.

Fantastic, if not chaotic. We went during the only two weeks of summer holiday for HK (unbeknownst to us). If you happen upon HK and wish to go to Ocean Park in the last week of July, I really would advise against it. The queues are 1hr + for most attractions and there are literally thousands of people all competing for each queue.Negative comments aside (which I admit is strange, given the excellent-rating!), the park is absolutely humoungous - it has a pair of pandas (Giant ones, no less!), an impressive aquarium, a number of rides which you'll find at any respecting theme park and its own cable car system to assist in traversing the park, which is split into a lower and upper area, divided by the mountain.A great day out. Top Tips: Go early and purchase tickets the day before if possible - the queues are quite long all through the day and there are literally thousands of people flocking to the site all day long.

Huge area and still nice. I was there in July and there is a bit rain, so it is not so hot. But, please do not come in July, it is very very hot and crowded. Many countries in Asia are having the same holiday times.

fun for all ages. don't miss the cable car ride from one side of the park to the other., the views are spectacular. the park has a great huge underwater aquarium with a vast variety of species. don't forget to visit the cute pandas! if you make a merchandise purchase part of the proceeds will go to support the wilderness conservation and research !
try if you have time. if you have enough time and traveling with children can consider this theme park, try not to visit at the summer time because so hot and crowded.

Aqua-Fun !!. A completely unexpected experience.
Fun rides ... amazing animals (particularly the Shark Mystique & Secret life of Seahorses)
The Cable Car ride is on another level!! ... over the mountain and to a whole other ride heaven !!

Diffinitely A go for Children.. The place is really good. If you have children, this place is where you wanted to stay for the whole day. There are so many activities that my son enjoyed much. The only problem are so many visitors but you can explain the reason why.

Excellent day out. I went to Ocean Park during my 5 days in Hong Kong and I really enjoyed my visit.There is a bus that brings you directly to Ocean Park from Central station on the subway and it costs 10.60HKD for one way. A return ticket is also available.The park has both rides aswell as an aquarium and animals to see which means there's something there for everyone to enjoy. The two highlights of my day at Ocean Park have to be the dolphin show and the cable cars. I definitely would advise not to give these a miss.

A must visit! Pandas!. There are giant and red pandas at this park. The sea lion and dolphin shows are ok, they use to have an orca and the tank was far too small. It still look a bit small now but the animals look happy enough.The attraction area is big, it's a whole day trip make sure you get up early to go. There's plenty of places to eat inside as well - just expect to pay more for it. They're constantly transforming the park so every time I've come back to visit there's something new.They're also building an MTR nearby, not sure when that will be completed but it'll mean that you don't have to rely on queuing for those Ocean Park buses in central HK.

A very fun day out!. Ocean Park is one of the biggest, busiest attractions I have been to, also one of the best! I really enjoyed the cable car ride, which had amazing views. The rides were good fun and there were plenty of cool animals that I had never seen, not being a HK resident. Despite the humidity, heat and queues, this is one to go to!

Nice place, definitely better than Disneyland HK. If it wasn't for the extreme humidity combined with heat, this place is a nice one... Definitely to recommend, nice for families, friends or couples... The only downside are long queues and sometimes people behaving with lack of manners, and those umbrellas that hit your face as their holders just walk without paying attention to surrounding people.

Anika's 7th Bday Trip Treat to Hong Kong and China!. Ocean park is very big, you cannot go around and enjoy everything in a day, you need at least 2 days to try the rides and everything! We like the tower 360 view of the place! It was soooo nice!

Fun day out. Despite the heat and the crowds we had a good time at Ocean Park.I love the cable car ride. It's probably the best out of the whole park. My recommendation is to head directly up to the summit via cable car in the morning.. Complete the rides and attractions at the summit and head down to see the animal encolsures below.

Massive Place. After reading revies on here I expected amazing from this place. It definately didn't live up to my expectations. It is massive and the only way to connect the two sides is either by Cable Car or the Ocean Express. We took the ocean express as the queue was shorter. Lots of rides and roller coasters but if you want to do this sort of thing expect to wait on average for 60 minutes in a queue which then limits your time to see much else. If you want to see a show get in early or you will miss out. A massive park so expect lots of walking. I prefered Disneyland

Don't bother going!!. The park is great with amazing views and the cable car is fabulous. Unfortunately this would have to be my worst experience ever in a theme park and I have been to many around the world. No shade, crowd control poor and the pushing and shoving and the way many behave is disgusting. We were pushed and shoved and at times particularly at the train station at the end of the day it was dangerous. Do not go to this park, it's really not worth it if you want to have a relaxing and fun time in Hong Kong - it's unfortunate. Shame on the staff running ocean park they really need to review the number of people they let in and set up separate lines and employ more staff to better manage the crowds. My son is just saying now - the lines were long, no places to sit and eat and get out of the sun, minimum wait time for rides was 75 minutes, really busy. If you want to go don't go in summer and in the middle of holidays.

Cable Car is a must!. I love the cable car ride. It's probably the best out of the whole park. My recommendation is to head directly up to the summit via cable car in the morning.. Complete the rides and attractions at the summit and head down to see the animal encolsures below. =)

not for the summer. park needs to provide more shading and maybe some rides to move pp around. The dolphin show was not as good as it used to be. It was very hot and expensive. If you even when to park in the US, most of the rides are like kiddy rides especially most of the roller coasters.

Fun day out. Despite the heat and the crowds we had a good time at Ocean Park. The cable car ride across to the other side was amazing. Fantastic views. One big tip - get to the cable car entrance early as the queues can be very long with a wait of almost one hour! Nice park with good rides and shows

Worst theme park experience. We went to Ocean Park on a sunday, and we took the bus from Admiralty. Greatly recommended. All's well until we got to Ocean Park. It was extremely crowded. The loud and sweaty crowds at the Ocean Express (you can guess which country they are from), pushed, shoved and cut Q, with no regard for young children or anyone. The situation is badly managed by Ocean Park. The theme park workers could only shout at them "do not rush, do not push'. They just ended up getting shouted back at. It was stressful, chaotic, miserable (no shade, under the hot sun). I have never experienced such discomfort at a theme park. I am supposed to be on a holiday, and my kids are supposed to be having the time of their lives. But instead, they are experiencing this ugly side of humans. I am dismayed that this has been going on for a while, but Ocean Park is not doing anything about this. There must be a minimum number of persons allowed into the park. Where is the crowd control (especially for the group tours)? Hong Kong need to do something about this! I had very fond memories of this place, when we all came more than 10 years ago. The facilities have definitely improved, but the park need to improve in terms of crowd control. There should be separate Qs for family with young children, another Q for tour groups, and a general Q. The nasty crowd has made the place awful. It is almost impossible to get a cab home (after just three hours at the park, we just wanted to have a quick exit) but there were hardly any cab. So we still ended up getting the bus back. The bus shuttle is great though. Well organised, the buses are timely and clean.

Loved the animals. The aquarium is okay, not the best. I loved the pandas though, and the sea lions and the penguins were really cool. The cable car ride was good, the train was a disappointment. The rides are just like any other amusement park. Does not give a wow feeling overall.

Great Day. Had a great day at Ocean Park. Used the direct bus service from Admiralty station which was well organised and efficient an prepurchased tickets at 7-11 which made for a quick entry. The grounds are huge and there is plenty to see and do to fill a full day. The dolphin and seal show was fun but I suggest waiting till the crowd thins before attempting to move from the theatre. Took the train to the top and the cable car back and avoided the que both ways. Overall well worth a visit

Fun park!. Apart from the hot weather and the too-many-groups of Mainland people (who kept trying to cut the queue and pushed us out), Ocean Park is really a lovely and HUGE park!We mostly went there to see the fishes collection that they have and we only got on a couple of rides. We loved the cable car ride and the varieties of fish in displays! Their stingrays and sharks are gigantic and amazing! Not to mention the jelly fish display! We especially love the Shark Mistique place. We went on the Ferris Wheel and it was lovely to see the scenery of Hong Kong from way up high.Their park is stroller and wheel chair friendly, but those stroller paths are often longer than going up & down the stairs. The staffs are friendly and helpful. They have drinking water taps and the toilets were clean.We had dinner at their bay view cafeteria. The food was just so so and quite overpriced!
Awesome fun!. Amazing and fun rides! Good for kids + teens! and the views are spectacular when catching the chairlift across to the other side.
Nice but busy. I loved the park, attractions and infrastructure in general but it was completely full, the people don't respect the queues and are unpolite
Better than Disney !. We enjoyed it more than disney. Mainly because the nice cable car. Location of the games are on a high mountain. The waiting time is not very long. We saw panda as well !

Too much time lost on queue. We didnt enjoy much our time here in Ocean Park. Too much queue everywhere. And mostly is China mainland guests, they dont queue much. We even have argument with some of them as they just skip the queue and they arent happy. All of the attraction, you need to queue at least 45 mins. It look the same with other theme park that we go before. If you dont have much time in Hongkong, better give this a skip.

Breathtaking view and rides!. I had been to HK for about four times already and of course the happiest place on earth, Disney Land was never missed but it is the first time that I was able to take a tour of the Ocean Park.If you are looking for adventure, and real fun, this is the place to be, the trip to the Panda's sanctuary is very exciting, although they weren't that active when I visited their section, they were still a sight to behold. And then you would also find the penguins section up on top of the mountain wherein you may take the train or if you are up for more adventure, you must definitely line up and take the cable car and enjoy the majestic view up high.Aside from these lovely animals, you would also get to really enjoy the rides that they have to offer, imagine a roller coaster all the way on top of the mountain and your view on the loop would be a cliff, such an adrenaline rush indeed. And then there are also those interactive water boat rides wherein you can splash water on the riders as revenge to those who were able to shoot you and get you drenched. Not to mention those rides which will turn you 360degrees both horizontally and vertically at the same time. And these were just some of the things you may enjoy.Better make sure to be here early to be able to cover most of the places and check on the places you want to visit first and their closing times, there are attractions which closes earlier than others, better get your itinerary checked so as to not miss anything.

DELIGHTFUL DAY SPENT. Smart travelers would just gloss over the long escalator, the panda pen, the aquariums, the cable car (breathtaking!) and the amusement rides and will hie off to the area where they recreated old China. The structures there are a sight to behold and nearly every corner worth a picture.

Good for kids. Very nice journey from the cable car till the park......only that there is a lot of queue and you need more than 1 day for the same as we reached at 10am but could not do all the swings in one day....1 day is enough for disneyland but for ocean park you need 2 days else it gets very hectic
Excellent theme park. Ocean Park is a great theme park. It has such a wide variety of rides, animal displays, views and cable car. It's got something for all ages.

A really fun day!. We went to Ocean Park for a full day out, intending to do as much as possible. In the end there was no way we could have seen everything in one visit - the park is too big! The best bit from my (parental) point of view was the staff. They were helpful, chatty, knew their stuff and even went out of their way to help us to get to the places we wanted to get to. The queues weren't too bad either, certainly not as bad as Disneyland, and the staff had at least been trained in queue management.The highlight of the Park wasn't the rides, although the cable car was amazing, or the sea life show. It was the mini zoo with the giant salamanders and giant pandas. That was something we hadn't seen before, and the kids loved it.I'll be back again soon!
Fun, Fun and more Fun. That´s all you are going to get if you go to Ocean Park in Hong Kong. A bunch of fun rides and beautifull views.

Good variety but long queues for everything esp taxi home!. Park has a lot of variety on offer but no wow factor! The queues for everything were minimum 45 mins and in heat of 37degs and high humidity this was a question of whose tolerance could stand the test! The pushing in the queues was also bad as was skipping the queue! Cable car ride not for those afraid of heights! It doesn't look too bad on the entrance side as it looks like it only goes to top of the hill you don't realize that's only the start of the adventure! Our car also stopped leaving us hanging for a few minutes wondering our fate! The queue for the train down took 45 mins and the kids said they felt like they were in the hunger games, with all the pushing and shouting it was a question of tactics to maneuver or jostle yourself into position to ensure you weren't skipped ahead of again! Seals,penguins,walrus and pandas all lovely to see and nice combination of rides, but aquarium nothing I haven't seen elsewhere and after the hour long queue in that heat fairly disappointed with it. The food is terrible so take your own if possible again pushing and skipping queues at restaurants. The worst part of our day was actually trying to get home. We left park at 6pm to wait for a taxi which took us 1.15hr to wait for. We tried to find out about public transport but no one could help us,it was chaos, people were queue jumping and the taxis only came every 10mins and with three queues to choose from they didn't always service our queue. It was horrific in the heat and humidity! It really spoilt the day! Overall too many long queues for everything, no fast track system!

super rides. the place has everything from rides to dolphins to scenic places for all age groups, absolutely worth it. WEAR COMFORTABLE SHOES! the walk in the park is exhaustive, do not wear anything that hampers your walk (few miles!!)
Overpriced, too busy.... Lines too long, too many people, too expensive. Ocean Park's faux environmental theme grates. Go to Disneyland.

Nice family park. We had a nice day out in Ocean Park in Hong Kong. The park is big enough to have a full day of fun for young Kids and adults. The Aquarium is quite nice and big and has a lot to discover. Overall a good experience

Something you can’t miss when you are in Hong Kong.. Nice environment for all living creatures in Ocean Park and the little Zoo with Pandas! Staff with high level of training a well-organized place for visitors and families
Great View. You have to try all of those rollercoasters, you will get a scary fun ride and also have the chance to see the beauty of sea and mountains around you.

One of the best attractions in Hong Kong. Wow, I almost gave this place a miss! Fortunately, my husband insisted on going and we had so much fun. This place is something of an amusement park + zoo + aquarium. It definitely satisfies anyone's desires. Whether you choose to ride a roller coaster or see the pandas (both giant panda and red panda) or watch the dolphin and seal show, you are in for a treat. And the views are simply spectacular, particularly from the cable car. We went to Ocean Park in the morning after having bought our tickets in advance from the airport counter of China Travel Service. We paid 262 HKD/person instead of 320 HKD/person and, in addition to this, we skipped the lines at the Ocean Park entrance. You can easily spend an entire day here, but we chose to leave at around 2.30 p.m. because we had seen and experienced everything we had wanted.The highlights for us were as follows: the giant and red pandas (not to be missed!), Mine Train and Hair Raiser, the dolphin and seal show, the huge aquarium and the penguins. The only thing I deeply disliked was the lack of good food. They serve hot dogs without bread (?!?!?), for example. We finally decided to eat in the city.Tip: If you don't want to stand in line for the cable car, you can take the Ocean Express to the other side and return with the cable car. The lines will be significantly shorter.

A day is short for this park. A sound piece of advice : Take 2 days with your kids for this place. Day-1 : Take all the outdoor activities.Day-2 : Visit Indoor Aquarium with exclusive Dolphin Shows (Prior Booking is a must).

Fun rides. My hubby and I were deciding whether to go Ocean Park or Disneyland initially. We decided on Ocean Park as it had more adult rides. Public transport going to Ocean Park is pretty easy, we took a bus straight from Kowloon and then walked about 10 mins from the bus stop to Ocean Park.The place is huge! It is right next to the sea so expect some great views even as you sit on the roller coasters etc The theme park has lots of roller coasters and rides that will keep adults satisfied but be prepared to queue up for quite a long time.My personal favourites are The Flash and The Hair raiser on Thrill Mountain.

not as good as before. like the disneyland, now the park is flooded by tourists from mainland china who are less civilized, expect them spitting, littering and even pee/pooh around you. Also the dolphins there die earlier because of captivity. Your attending just encouraged the act of kidnap baby dolphins from their wild family and going on the route of "humane" training to perform for you.

Great fun!!. Just been there after more 10 years time. They improved a lot. Much better environment, friendly staff. There are way more people though. I hear their CEO "has been" moved on. That's sad to hear it.

Great Family Place. We had a fantastic day at Ocean Park. There were lots to do and lots of choice in rides. Go up to the peak on the train first as this is where a lot of the action is. The South Pole and Arctic exhibitions were fantastic. There were amazing rides up here and I have to admit a few were too scary for me. We took the cable car back down which was very scenic. We saw a bird show, Sea Lion Show, Sea Horse Exhibition and went to the Aquarium, which was fantastic. What spoiled the aquarium was it was packed and loud with quite a few rude people who only cared about themselves. My 6 year old girl was rudely pushed by a middle ages lady who should have known better. Even so it is a great place to go and has more to offer then Hong Kong Disney. Don't buy the souvenir photos at the entrance as you can get them cheaper at the The Horse Exhibition.

Extreme rides amazing.... Just for fun but fear is gone when extreme rides all done. L O L, no not me but my son and niece having all the experiences with great strides. Me and wife enjoying on other attractions of the Ocean Park in Hongkong especially the Train ride and Cable car.Nice place to be in with families and friends.If you wanna enjoy the place, be there on the first hour of the operations so you could enjoy all the attractions.

Not that thrilling. I love roller coasters but in Ocean park there were only a few. 2 bigger roller coasters but during our visit one of them was closed :( the rest is about shows and aquariums which were ok

Very nice and Huge!. I'm not sure how much area this place takes up but you need one full day to see the whole thing. Dolphin and Sea Lion show, Pandas, Monkeys, Penguins, Fish and other sea creatures whew. The list is endless... Very nicely built and has a very fancy train to take you uphill in case you are not comfortable riding cable cars. Plenty of shops to buy souvenirs and other stuff.

Just about ok. Spent most of a day at Hong Kong's Ocean Park. It looks tired and a bit run down ... especially when compared to the Marine Park at Sentosa, Singapore.Worth a visit if you have young kids ... but for adults, certainly many better ways to spend your day in HK.

Wonderful experience!!!. Memorable trip to Hong Kong with my boy friend's family. Really open my knowledge. huge land. Many beautiful lanscapes. i love dolphins' show, huge Buddha statue... Definately come back if i have chance to travel to HK.
Good thrilling rides but too much walking. THE HAIR RAISER was the best ride and most thrilling. Cable cars were good giving awesome views. But too much walking as the Park is too spread out

Great mixture of things to do and see. I went to Ocean Park about 12 years ago and remember it being good. I went again last week and it was better than I remembered. The nice thing is it has some really great aquarium exhibits but it also has quite a number of rides, and there are rides for all ages. Highlights for me were the Grand Aquarium, the breeding centre and the new shark exhibit. In fact if you enjoy your day visit, on your way out you can just pay the difference to upgrade the ticket to an annual pass, which we did. They have a decent mix of food outlets, both Chinese and Western. The cable car that takes you from one side of the park to the other gives you some wonderful views and is really quite long. Definitely Ocean Park should be part of the itinerary for anyone visitng Hong Kong.

Love it!. Everytime I visit HongKong I always make sure to visit this theme park. I think ive been here for more than 6 times already. Everytime I visit there is always a new attraction. I love the cable cars and I will not get tired even when I get old in visiting this place :)

Best place to enjoy with family. visited HongKong in June 2014 with family. I would recommend Ocean Park than Disneyland as it has more things to enjoy with your kids. Kids enjoyed at the different games counter.Don't miss the fountain show at end of day

Chinese SeaWorld with a little more Disney. Cool place. Much like SeaWorld in the US, but with a little more Disney added - characters, rides, shows. Definitely worth a day to go there. There are truly some spectacular views as you go around the park. Be sure to wear comfy shoes as the park is essentially carved into two mountains.

It's okay, but should probably have gone to Disneyland. There is nothing wrong with this place, it's just that it's not amazing. It's a big zoo/fun park basically. There aren't really any excellent rides, although plenty of them are good fun. Equally, the animals are all quite interesting to look at, but none of them are any more interesting than if you went to a dedicated zoo. The Giant Pandas are an obvious draw, but they were sleeping and away from public view.The behaviour of other guests was also a bit of a problem: following an argument, a man struck his wife in the face and caused her to bleed, which was obviously horrendous, but park security did arrive promptly and took it seriously. I suppose you get plain bad people anywhere, so it's difficult to blame the park for that. Less seriously, not everyone queued properly for attractions. A lot of bus tours from the mainland come here, and it seems there is a great pressure to visit all the rides before the bus leaves to return to Guangzhou. What tends to cause issues is when one or two family members join a queue, then the rest of the family hustle through those of us that have been waiting patiently in order to claim the space that was "saved" for them, which causes a lot of annoyance. One Hong Kong lady, turned and hissed at us "these people are not from Hong Kong. They're Chinese!". It was difficult to know precisely what to say. An "ahh. I see" did the trick, but to be fair, the queue-jumping was annoying for everyone.Overall, it's seriously not a bad place to go, but if you don't have much time in HK, it could probably be spent better elsewhere. in the absence of Giant Pandas, I should probably have gone to Disneyland.
Hot weather but thank god for exhibition centres. Rides are exciting and even though weather was hot, we can hide in the exhibition centres to visit the penguins and sea lion.

Never go there during weekend /summer holiday . You won't be able to enjoy if you have to queue for like 1-2 hours for just an aquarium until 34 degree celcius. Crowds just made me faint. For food , mcdonalds is the cheapest choice, the price of its food is almost the same as it's branches throughout hk, Anyway , i hate queuing !

Not just for the little kids. The rides were all very fun. We mostly enjoyed the more adrenaline-pumping ones, especially The Flash, The Abyss, and Whirly Bird.Be sure to wear comfortable walking shoes. The park is huge. Also, it is best to arrive in the morning so you could explore the whole park. A whole day seems to not be enough especially if you want to do more than one take on the rides.
😎. This is an excellent place for the whole family . Games for all ages. A lot of information about the ocean life. It's an entertainment as well as education . You need the whole day to see it all.

Wowee!. Went to ocean park in May 2014. Excellent park with great variety. My girls loved the aquarium, dolphin show and the rides were great. Low queues helped us get around it in one day. I loved the pandas and the cable car. Food was plentiful and a good price. A great place to visit.

Excellent - if you are prepared to pay the price & I don't mean $.. If you enjoy queuing for a minimum of @ 45 mins in the sweltering heat for each ride ( which I would not be inclined to do in any temperature), you enjoy roller coasters and heights ( which my son & I are both terrified of), very loud and crowded places (say no more); then this would be your perfect excursion. We are not exposed to these kind of parks at home, (gladly:)) so it is hard to compare, but I would guess Ocean park is pretty good as far as parks go.Sadly we didn't get to see much, as most queues were over 45 mins long and the assistants advise you to come back, which meant we bounced between many seemingly endless lines. The aquarium being one of them. It was in excess of 37 degrees and the park is nicely spread out, so to do this in winter would be much more enjoyable but possibly more busy. Due to the heat and queues my 9 year old actually asked if we could just go home and swim in the hotel pool! We spent over 5 hours there and only managed one ride, the cable car and one show and of course the beautiful Pandas. The time was spent queuing and walking, we didn't stop for lunch or shopping. So a long hard day with few rewards. There was so much we would have loved to see but couldn't get into. Very disappointing .What we did see and enjoyed was the Pandas, unusual Asian fish, reptiles and animals. The cable car up to the summit was fantastic ( even for height phobics such as my self). The views over Repulse bay and the yacht club are spectacular, that made the whole trip worthwhile for me. We took the metro and had no queue purchasing tickets there but saw many queues. at bus line and park. The queue from the Metro by bus to the Park was nearly 800 meters long, right around the block and not moving fast. So we took a taxi HK$ 72 including toll. So worth it!If you are brave enough, I would suggest the following:- Take a taxi from your hotel; half the time, 10 x less effort and air-conditioned @ HK$60.- Get your map and find your bearings and plan it well before setting off, or u could walk in circles.- Organize around the shows you really want to see and are prepared to queue for.- Take sun block, comfy shoes, hat, fan, water, humour and plenty patience. - Definitely do the cable trip up, worth the queue. - Go as close to 10 am as possible (opening) as the bus loads come in from mid day through and it just gets fuller and fuller. Plan the whole day to be here and to do a lot of walking.

A great alternative to Disney HK. This is a sprawling large park, many rides and good aquariums and shows. A great family outing and for us who have been to Disney we prefer to check out the alternatives. Some rides had a little too long lines, and the distances between some areas were a bit long. I missed more shortcuts and transport. The ticket prices to get in were also very reasonable. There is a direct bus from Admiralty terminal to the park, very convenient, as the MTR stops right under the terminal. Recomended
Not recommended. Abuse of animals, DO NOT support this! Boring and uninteresting. With such a high entry fees i would recommend people to watch a whole day movie.

Best experience in HK!. As I had an extra day to spare in HK, I decided to visit Ocean Park. It was a decision well made. Transportation is quite easy, just hop onto their shuttle buses and it'll take you there directly.I visited all the exhibits, and they are just incredible. Be sure to check out the North Pole exhibit - it's newly opened and the seals are great! The shows are great for children, as they're interactive and performed in three languages (English, Cantonese and Mandarin). The zones system makes it quite easy to get around, but be sure to take a map with you - you'll be sure to get lost if you don't! The food & beverages inside the park didn't really suit my palette, but they're definitely reasonably priced.The ticket might seem expensive, but considering it covers everything, it's definitely worth the price.

Not as good as Disney. We were there last week. The wait for some rides was around 75 minutes. The rides were very short and not worth the effort. Disney was much better value for money and far less crowded. If you are going during summer - take a lot of bottled water with you and be prepared for long hot day. A hat and suncream is a must.

Very expensive day, so take food and lots of bottled water!!. Hong Kong was very hot, humid predictably expensive – and in places, (dare we say it?) rather odorous. Although, to be fair, it must be hard to be otherwise with those temperatures..We will briefly mention our visit to Ocean Park, which was did not rate that well with any of us, although the thrill rides that my daughter and her partner went on were “good”, (if you were happy to queue for an average of over an hour, for each – and this was on a weekday when the school term was in progress!!). There was insufficient shade; no drinking fountains that we could see (unforgiveable, as you could easily run out of money there, - the cost of food and drink was daylight robbery) and a confusing layout (we spent about 20 minutes trying to find the cable car entrance at the top, because we had been following the “to cable car... with wheelchair access” written after it). The frontage of the park is visually quite dated and in need of redecoration. Unfortunately for us, the three staff we asked directions of, could not converse in basic English either.The best bit for us, (or perhaps the worst if you are really scared of heights!) is the Cable Car. I am not so good with heights anymore, so I was quite stressed on the descent (the queue was an hour if you caught it to ascend). However, the views are truly spectacular – quite unbelievable. If we hadn't experienced that, the $320 HK dollars we paid to go in would have been rather wasted for us. However, we didn't go in with children and their part of the park, plus the animal areas may have been much more rewarding... There is a dedicated frequent bus service to take you there (629 from Admiralty Station). Journey was about 20 minutes, passing en route, through a tunnel of about 2 km in length.

Alot of fun!!!. Went there and all i know is that i had a blast from the moment i went in to the moment i left. The zoonpart is very cool. The rides are awesome, and managed to go to the Abyss which i wanted to go for a long time... Didnt disappoint. Awesome!

Pandas!. Worth going just for the view from the cable car of the coastline. Went because we wanted to see the pandas, didn't realise they would have more animals on display. One large rollercoaster but the queue times were sometimes very long.

My Kids Enjoyed..... If You are looking for something exiting come to Ocean Park.It was not as kid oriented theme park as Disneyland, but kids loved it. We bought Ocean Park from our travel agent.We loved the long cable car. We loved the Panda zoo and the aquariums, Roller coaster, Wheel, Mono Rail,Sharks,& lots & lots of unforgettable rides.. Queue can tend to be a little bit long. Some of the rides were not really suitable for little kids. Must visit place in Hong Kong
Ocean Park - hongkong. Amazing ocean life, penguins, sharks , dolphins, and shows .. Cable car ride cutting across the scenic bay

Good place, nothing extraordinary. Good amusement park. The cable ride was the best part with breath taking views. Polar region was good too. a couple of rides were'nt operation which was bad. Dolphin show was ok, have seen better one in Gold Coast.

Good day out. If choosing Ocean park and Disney Land HK i would chose Ocean Park Not only you get to go on rides but you also get to go to the Zoo as well which its pretty good for the price. If you a thrill seeker Ocean Park its not for you nor its Disney Land. The Place is crowded with people mainly from china so getting on rides takes a long time Ocean park sometime offers night time entry which take away alot of the crowd and can also enjoy the beautiful city night if you go on the cable car at the right moment. Food are overprice so bring food with you Some of the toilets are dirty so chose wisely (bring toilet paper)Overall i recommend coming here only if u have a spare day at hands if not there are better things to do in hong kong

Discounted tickets . . . Twice i"ve been in this park, 3 years apart and both times, rain ruin my day. But it was nature and no one can do anything about it. Any way, when planning your trip, make sure to check discounts & promos of attractions you plan to visit.During our trip, hk mtr has a 10% discount coupon for ocean park day pass when you avail their airport express travel pass. Attached with are other promo coupons for madame tussauds , ngong ping 360 cable car & disneyland. There was also a stall at Admiralty Station who sells ocean park ticket at discounted price. . HK290 (adult) / gate price is HK320.

Great destination. A wonderful large park but be prepared for the heat and for a lot of walking. We arrived early and were caught in the "orange" rain warning. We were able to buy the ponchos right at the entrance. Later it became very hot. Be prepared to buy lots of water or watermelon halves to survive the heat. If your children are little, you will want to research the rides ahead of time to save yourselves a lot of walking time. Generally speaking the rides and play areas for the little ones are mostly near the main entrance. Once you take the train or the gondolas you are looking at rides for bigger kids.The place will be packed but then again most fun places in Hong Kong are that way. If you are a group of 3 or more and are staying in Wan Chai, consider taking the cab rather than buses to the park as it might actually be cheaper and more convenient.The food in the park is great. Lots of options from finger foods to sit-down places. Recommended.

Spectacular Ocean Park ,Hong Kong. Visited this awesome theme park in December 2010, with family. The rides were fantastic and my kids had a ball. The cable ride to the other side of the park was longer than expected and a bit scary but it all was worth it when we reached the other park . Lots of exciting rides and fun for the kids as well as educational facts for the kids to learn and see about some animals. Great day out and highly recommended.
The rides. The ambience and rides were thoroughly enjoyed by my adult children. A must go place during your visit to Hong Kong

All i can say.... well very good. Worth a visit, its cheap for aussie standards. Here a tip if you go. Before you get off at admity mtr, there will be a mtr shop next to exit B (underground), and they will offer ocean park tickets for HK$290 (around $41 aud, compare that to themes park in Australia, and that's a bargain) or you could pay HK$320 at the gate or whatever, and get a octopus card for the buses (long line tho). Its like a combination of sea world and dreamworld into one park. But food/random items however will end up the same as you would pay back in Australia, if not a bit more. But food there seem to be alright (much better than Australia theme parks) I went there mainly for the rides, but had a look at some animal places when the place gets busy. The maximum i waited was 15 minutes. But then again i went in the morning (ridden a few rides), then explore the animal joints when the place got busy, and when people starting to leave, go on more rides and double dip on rides in which i like. Rides are soo awesome (but if your going solo, don't bother using the single express line, because its still the same wait really). Toilets are alright enough (even though staff do clean them frequently, its still stinks anyways)Only bad thing, its a trek (even by express bus), but lucky an MTR station will be built there in the near future. And the park is a trek to walk around and when your against the hong kong summer, its not fun walking (but thankfully for air con animal en-closers and escalators)So i would be happy to return there in the near future. Or if i lived in hong kong, i would defiantly buy a yearly pass that they offer

Lots of exciting rides. The ocean park has lots to offer to teenager as well as small kids. The best part is the train and the cable car. However, the food variety caters to only Chinese. I wish the McDonalds was available near the entry/exit, rather than one corner of Ocean Park.

Delightful animal parks, long walk, teen-appropriate rides. We wanted to see real pandas that's why we wanted to visit this park even if we were in Disneyland (HK) the day before. With my 5-year kid, hubby and I took our last attraction visit before our flight going home in the evening.I learned that the park was huge and would entail long walks. Since my kid is impatient and has a tendency to get tired easily from long walks, I needed to plan our trip carefully. I decided to focus on the animal parks and check the feeding schedule of animals on their web. I also learned that there are 2 sections of the park which are so distant from each other (waterfront & summit) - you need to ride a cable car or train. So be mindful in plotting which schedule or show you want to see. You may miss or get late to catch the show or feeding.We bought our tickets at the MTR Admiralty (Exit B) on the day itself. There's a long queue of buses going to the park. Since we have limited time to spend at the park, we thought of bringing our food inside. Wrong decision. They don't allow outside food to be brought in. Only bottled water or water jug is allowed. It was raining when we arrived at the park at around 10 am. That's probably the reason why even if it was Sunday, the visitors were not as great as anticipated. Umbrellas and transparent rain coats are available for purchase near the entrance. The rain stopped before lunch and the heat was unbearable while walking within the park. That's why the umbrella was a wiser choice.The park lacked the "dreamland" atmosphere of Disneyland but had its very own distinct character of being an animal or marine sanctuary. There were animal mascots that my kid loved.Since our objective is to see the Panda, so we visited the the Panda village first. My kid was so delighted to see the Panda. She wanted to cuddle or hug them had not been for the glass wall that separates the visitors and the animals. It was these Pandas that garnered the "very good" rating for this theme park. Otherwise, it would have been just the same other theme parks.After the Panda experience, we went to the Summit section via the Ocean express. My kid enjoyed the short show while inside the train. Most of the rides are located in the Summit section but these have height and age requirement so we didn't line for them thinking that my kid would not pass to any of them. We visited the North and South Pole encounters. My kid liked to watch the sea lion, walrus and penguins being fed. Being pressed for time we decided to leave the park after lunch, we walked a hilly long and tiring walk going to the cable car. Since it's early afternoon, there was no queue and we were able to ride immediately when we get there. We also didn't miss the grand aquarium.Overall, it was a good exercise because of the long walks, the food was good (more than acceptable) and we just loved the Pandas!

Be prepared to queue. The rides are great, exciting and some are just scary. Worth it for adults but the queues can take an hour and you cannot have the kids accompany you so make sure there is someone who can look after the younger ones whilst you queue.

Half fun, half education...a perfect full day in HK. Although Ocean Park has been around since 1977 (almost three decades older than Hong Kong Disneyland) nothing about Ocean Park feels tired, rundown or neglected. Of the two major amusement parks in Hong Kong, Ocean Park is hands down (or flippers down) the superior one.Ocean Park is half amusement park and half museum, making it a full day of fun and learning. The upper half of the park contains mostly rides while the lower half contains mostly exhibits and shows. The tram ride between the two halves is almost worth the price of admission.At Ocean Park, you don't feel barraged by commercialism like you would at Hong Kong Disneyland. Ocean Park is Hong Kong's homegrown institution, not a Western import. There's no Snow White or Mickey. Instead, it's Whiskers and James Fin walking around -- characters that you've never heard may grow to enjoy.There seems a genuine concern with conservation at Ocean Park, not just a shallow effort meant only to appease hipsters and environmentalist wanabes. In other words, Ocean Park's brand of conservation is the real deal.My only gripe is that, like most of Hong Kong's tourist attractions, the park will get overcrowded on weekends and holidays. It's best to go on a Tuesday, preferably on a cloudy day that looks like it might rain (but doesn't). The park is also very hilly, so people with less stamina may find it tiring to navigate the park.It's great to hear Ocean Park has planned aggressive expansion. They're building an onsite hotel and tons of new rides and exhibits. Ocean Park is one of five "can't miss" destinations in Hong Kong.

Highs and Lows. My family of four- kids 11 and 7 braved the weather and visited on a Friday in June. We were in the parking lot by 930am. then close to 10am(as we saw groups of people ascending the escalators) we went up to buy tickets. I waited in line since gate does not open till 1030am. It was sweltering by the time the gate was open. The Highs-We viewed the pandas first which was nice since it is air conditioned and no lines. The animals make it worth enduring. Panda was sitting close up and eating bamboo leaves- it was amazing to see this animal in action since they are rare to see in other parts of the world and if so seldom active. The animals are very active and the exhibits are amazing. I thought the shark and big aquarium viewing areas are better than Sea World Orlando. The food was surprisingly good for an amusement park-we thought even better than inside Disney/Florida. We ate in the restaurant with the penguins for lunch-no wait at top near polar exhibit. Penguins were so active-diving and jumping out of water. They come up close to glass and stare at you! We had dinner at the resturarnt with aquarium tank- no wait great service and very relaxing. The staff throughout the park is beyond helpful and very friendly. The Lows- the lines are long- but comparing to other parks that is what one typically endures unless timing/situation works out. Being that this park is on a mountain/island the pathways are quite hilly. Most people were considerate, but as others have posted there are those who visit that will push you to get ahead. They will push you in the bathrooms and rattle doors trying to get ahead of obvious lines. They will also line jump and think nothing of you telling them to get back in their spot. Some rides have staff that monitor the situation. The rides do not always follow height requirements- after waiting 45 mintues in a line for one ride we began to see children who obviously met the height being asked questions and then removed from the line. As we approached the staff said that there is also an age requirement! Even if your child passes the minimum height they had to be a certain age. This was disappointing as we made sure to check height and read the signs before even getting on line. We planned on leaving and not staying since the heat was unbearable even for a South Floridain and not many rides for young kids. However we did end up staying till park closed- finishing dinner at 830pm. Instead of comparing to other parks we just had to change our expectations of what this park offered. Animal exhibits great- ride selection/thrill not so great. The lights on the fountains were beautiful. We took train up to the top because the line was shorter(12:30) -got right on and then took cable car down(6:00) waitied an hour.

We were disappointed. It's good and I'm glad we visited, however it wasn't great. The terrain is not particularly suitable for young children or the elderly. I was exhausted walking up the hill from the log ride and I don't fall into either of those categories.The day we visited was hot and busy which didn't help. Many of the staff either didn't understand English or didn't want to understand, very disappointed for a main tourist attraction.There was no real character or theme to the place.The queues were quite long, especially waiting in the heat. For example the cable car was a 75 minute wait. You need to take the cable car or train to get to the rest of the park.Also the toilets often only had 2-3 cubicles in the block so even that was a wait.

Superb!. I've been to Ocean Park twice, but given a chance, I would gladly go again. Although it lacks the dainty details I admire about Disneyland, it features a complete variety of attractions. There are enough roller coasters for thrill seekers and merry-go-rounds for youngsters. Moreover, it features attractions for people who can no longer enjoy the former, but are too old for the latter. Definitely a place all ages will find enjoyable! I hope they'd put up more food stalls with varying dishes/cuisines, though. As for cleanliness, it's a 3.5/5.Nevertheless, there are truly a lot of things to see, animals to watch and sights to marvel over (hence, a lot of walking). This is an adventure you shouldn't miss!

Great Day for Kids & Adults. We visited Hong Kong toward the end of a three week trip around Asia. My 13y.o son was done with temples, palaces and walls, so we decided to give him a day out at Ocean Park. He enjoyed the day thoroughly and fell fast asleep on our return to the hotel. Good decision & outcome.Ocean Park is huge. You will struggle to see every attraction and take every ride, even if you turn up at opening time and stay through until after dark. There s a great mix of sea-life and animal exhibits, rides for young & old and some old-fashioned side-show arcades where you can try various tests of skill to win a stuffed toy. The panda and penguin exhibits were high-lights. The roller-coaster style rides are all great because they offer fantastic views of Hong Kong harbour, in fact I cannot think of another amusement park that would offer such fabulous vistas. Ocean Park is a great day out.It can get crowded and in the tropical heat this can be a little overbearing. Get there early, take and umbrella & fan and drink lots of water. TIP: when you first arrive, travel to the rides you want to do most to minimise wait-time. Then I suggest you travel to the far end of the park near the Mine Train, or Space Wheel.
