There was no wait time for these rides when we arrived there mid afternoon - we figured because they were so far removed for the main attractions.

Beautiful Park. We arrived at Hong Kong's Ocean Park with high expectations in accordance with the photos that we see on the Internet. The scenery is beautiful with shady trees make this a very comfortable park. But the attraction is not very satisfactory performances. Panda venue, it turns panda was sleeping. Wishkers performances and animal show turned out in the local language, we can not understand. Which is far from expectation is performing dolphins and sea lions. Our expectations with a magnificent venue on the waterfront, featuring spectacular performances, but it just shows the dance and movements that are not special. Performing Dolphins and Sea Lions in my country feels far exceeds this performance. Other rides look very old and not too many takers. In short, this place is magnificent, but it is not supported by the readiness of interesting performances. Boring. Note also the vehicle home, if riding the bus, the vehicle is quite a long time coming. Better to take a taxi and get off at Central or Admiralty MTR station. Do not know if I want to return here again.

Great day out. We recently had a great visit to this massive amusement park. It is a little strange as perhaps 1/4 of the park is on the side where you enter while the other 3/4's is over the hill which you reach either by cable car or train. I only say this is that if you leave remotely near closing time the line for both is pretty huge with a corresponding waiting time.All-in-all though a great park with heaps of rides, shows, etc. to keep everyone entertained.
Don't Miss. Great place to spend a whole day, the cable car ride and a visit to the panda's is a must, has everything for all ages.

Ocean Park. The gondola ride was enjoyable, the park is rather old, due for upgrading. The joy rides are more for kids above 12 years old. Still, my children who were younger then love the park because there are some animals and aquariums to visit. Park is huge, be prepared to walk a lot from one location to another. Recommend to visit since there is only ONE Ocean Park to go, other than Disneyland HK. It is not a waste of time if you are a family with young children or teens.

Much better than HK Disneyland. The Ocean Park is a theme park that will show you the true Asian culture of entertainment. Nature preservation is of top priority. The collection of Asian flora and fauna endemic to the region is so fascinating. Everyone should see the Panda bear, the Red Panda, reptiles, all kinds of goldfishes, birds, salt water fishes, orchids, etc. The park rides are comparable, if not better than Disneyland HK. I specially enjoyed the cable ride. They are now connecting Ocean Park to HK's railway transport system for easier access. This place is so huge, that a one day stay is not enough.
Good attraction with family. The location is upgraded compare to previous time. Now us much more to enjoy and view. Have to spend more time to enjoy the attaction.

Great day out!!. Plenty to see and do at Ocean Park so make sure you go early to give yourself time to get around it all. As long as you're not scared of heights make sure you go on the cable car ride and enjoy the experience!!

Perfect!. Just perfect!Easy access,enormous place!Has everything for any age!there are a lot of activities,really interesting and funny!You need more then one day to spend there if you want to see everything!Worth the ticket&really beautiful souvenirs!

Ocean Park. Great way to see all the see sea animals and the best are the Pandas as you can get close to them. Clean and neat and the gondoliers make for a great ride with a view to the next attraction.

A Great Ride Whichever Way You Look At It. Not my favorite but kids or young adults over 14 years love the park. The rides are awesome, scary, and fun all in one. Unfortunately there is not much to go on for those under 10 years. The worst nightmare is the entrance at 10am where some 5,000 try to get in and have to pass through a 3 to 4m wide path (due to park construction). a frightening experience if you have young children. The park covers an extensive area and in wet weather is not much fun. The park has become quite commercial in the last few years and this has spoils the enjoyment. The restaurants and food bars are crowded and none too clean and the food is poor, and the toilets whilst clean are quite difficult to find. If you have a stroller you will find difficulty in and around the park as access for strollers is very limited. This also applies to wheel chair access.

Needs Two Days. GDAY,We knew it would be busy so we got to the park before it opened but everyone had the same idea.We have been here a few times over the years and there is always something new, the Arctic display with the penguins and walrus was very good and we tried most rides but ran out of time as we never made it to see the aquarium at all. We will love to visit again but we would do the rides one day and come back and see the displays another day.
Nothing special, really. It such a tourist trap with expensive ticket, for adult its not interesting at all, but if you travel with kids then yes, its worth visiting.

Nice place. Its worth to visit...it has more thrill rides then Disney land , most of them have height restrictions so kids can not go.Place and design of ocean park is also good. So u hv to go other area in train or cable car.

Great Fun Park. I love Ocean Park, when family come to visit I generally make a point of having Ocean Park on the list of things to do.Its easy to get in around, its quite big so good walking shoes on and a hat etc...The only issue I found was the food area was super crowded and to get in get food and leave was almost a 2 hour ordeal.Plan to go early in the morning and so your at the front of the pack moving around.Lots of animals to see here and its quite well maintained I thought and lots of great photo opportunities.It also had lockers there for a fee so that was good to be able to drop things in there.I always love going back!

Owner's and management too greedy. My family is on a 5 day vacation to hongkong and booked our ticket online. ON Monday morning went early and was so surprise that park is so full at 9:30 AM. The park don't put limit on the number of admissions. Around 10:45 AM my family fall in line for arctic blast and with too much people the place smells awful(you know i mean, my wife got stomach ache of the smell) . The park said that waiting time is around 15 minutes that it took 50 minutes and worst is, we are under the sun. The management is very greedy for not limiting park admissions.This unscrupulous business practice makes visitors especially kids hate the park. Caution, for tourist from the US or europe dont waste your time unless the park put limits number of admissions. After our only ride, we went home and i feel sorry for my kids for the way the park operates. Its not visitor friendly. Also refreshment prices is rip-off.

An unbelievable view. The tram going up to the top of Victoria Peak is well worth the trip up to the top. You get the most wonderful view of Hong Kong. Definitely buy a postcard to send home from the top post office. There are numerous gift shops in which to buy souvenirs but they are more expensive then in town.

What an experience! Awesome!. Ranging from close encounters with the Giant Panda, to the Penguins, the arctic wolf, the aquarium and the shark enclosure, there is a lot to see and explore. This is just one aspect of the Ocean Park. Then you have all the rides and activities like the cable cars and the train ride. Spread across a vast land mass on the edge of the ocean, the location is amazing and the whole experience and thrill of moving around the park is worth every drop of sweat. Highly recommended for a thrilling and an endearing experience. Enjoy the roller coaster rides of the raging river, it fun time all the way. Go early to make the most of the park. China travel services is a good place to buy the tickets for the Ocean Park as they offer good discounts on the tickets.

Great Experience. A large space of entertainment for all ages, ranging from marine parks to thrilling amusement rides.
Best to get in early as the crowd comes in as early as the park opens.
Easily accessible by their shuttle buses that are available at the MTR station.
Cable car ride at the park is splendid with wonderful views.

Useful Tips for you.... Tickets: You can get cheaper ticket from China Travel Service (CTS) and each costs around $262. However, CTS only accept CASH! Not credit cards!You can use MTR to Admiralty and caught citybus 629 (Ticket costs $10.60) to the ocean park.I advise you to go earlier before 10am as you can take photo at the main entrance before you go to enjoy the games.IMPORTANT: Take the express train up (ONLY 3 minutes) and take cable car down. I go up using train and enjoy a lot of games without need to queue up long. After playing games and watch the marine show, I take the cable car down at around 1pm without queue. Just walk in and take the cable car leisurely. When I reached down there, the most amazing thing I've seen was people still in long queue to go up there while I have already enjoyed a lot of games and shows.MUST: watch the marine show (dolphin and other mammals) and you may eat at Tuxedo (watch the cute penguin while eating at the same time)

Ocean Park. Buy your park tickets at the train station where you catch the bus to the park, they are cheaper. Purchase your water before you get to the park, it will be much cheaper. When taking pics in the park, be sure to look @ the price list before committing to what they want to sell you. We paid almost $100 for pics before we realized there was a price list. Wait times for rides was about 60 mins. We were drenched before we rode any rides due to the humidity. Use a map to navigate the park so you can see/do everything you want. North & South Pole exhibits are a must see.

Awesome park - miserable time. There is no doubt this is an amazing park, but you couldn't pay me to go back. Hoardes of uncivilized tourists made this a hellish experience. I and my family have been pushed, shoved, hit with umbrellas, and elbowed out of the way. Hard to even fully describe the experience.

Great day out. A great collection of animals and rides, and cool layout being on two sides of a mountain. The cable car is wonderful although very long queues. Howeve, queues for rides are not long at all! Like all theme parks, real lack of good food on offer...

A great way to spend your stopover!. Ok, so I may be a littl bit biased as I love fun parks but had a fantastic day riding the rollercoasters, log ride and marine exhibits (the walrus enclosure was a big highlight). Lots of fun for young and old!!!!

Fun Park for a day. we went to the park on Thursday, it was not too busy until mid-afternoon. We loved the Panda exhibit. It was the main reason we went to the park. The park is very clean and with a beautiful setting(over the hill). Food choices are fine. We travelled with several teenagers, they enjoyed the thrill rides a lot. In the afternoon the dolphin show was very full, there were many mainlander tourists came late for the show and were not happy with the standing in the back situation. We were lucky to have our seats reserved earlier before the show time at the VIP section, because one of the local friends who has the yearly pass. All in all, it is worth to spend a day in the park, we enjoyed it. Please don't miss to visit the beautiful park when you are in town.

Ocean Park. Thrilling for adults and kids.. Ocean Park is aptly names. You can see the blue waters from most of the rides.The best part about Ocean Park is that both adults and kids can find their type of rides.The park is divided into different sections. I suggest you get a map before you begin. The kids love the rides and they loved watching the panda, penguins, various species of fish. For the adults the best rides are - Hair Raiser, Whirly Bird, The Flash and the Mine Train.Also must experience are the cable car ride and ocean express train.There a lot of eateries in the park. You will need patience in Ocean Park - there is a long queue fro every ride. For more information you can read the following blog - http://tamsbrokencompass.blogspot.in/2014/06/normal-0-false-false-false-en-in-x-none.html

Good for sea looking. Very good for family who had kids, entrance ticket is cheap. The way you go there is very convenience (by MTR and go alone park's bus). In contrast, do not come in weekend or long holiday because some places, you need to wait a long time for entrance.

Fun place but defintely not for kids?!?!?. We are a family of 4 with 2 kids aged 9 and 5. We selected this place exclusively for kids only! But not all activities are for kids!!!?!? My elder was atleast allowed in some rides, whereas my little one wasnt!!?!? So we had to skip many rides just for the sake of them! We have been to Lunar park in Sydney-Australia. That too 2 years back!!! Many of the rides similar to these rides were allowed atleast with the supervision or accompanied by an adult!!! But was really dissappointed here!!! Dolphin show was just the usual dives and jumps-fun for kids( atleast spl for kids!!) The rapids was an excellent ride !!! Which we 4 enjoyed! A small kayaking type which looks like made out of wooden logs and takes in a small stream kind of thing and drops down splashing into water.Might get wet! The queueing up was just killing us, each rides took atleast arnd 30-45mnts! How much can you cover in a day!?!? There are many different food outlets,drinks,snacks etc arnd each activities area. We had Indian food at thriller mountain near the clown corner. Was very good, but had to wait atleast 30 mnts to get a table!!! be it inside the aircon hall or outside?!? They have trains to take you up the hill,cable cars, looooong escalators. Choose according to your activity! From MTR you have bus which takes us to ocean park- not free! 0cean park itself is situate in a hill!!!! So be prepared for all the steeeeeep ups and steeeeeep downs around the park!!!! Which totally worned us out and had to walk from one place to another and very time consuming!!!! The hot dog mine train was mind blowing!!! Excellent fun for thrill seekers!!! Its a roller coaster ride by the side of the mountain surrounded by sea!!! Ofcourse my little one wasnt allowed and it was a good thing! My elder one was allowed. The age isnt the matter in any rides but the height matters for every ride!!!  We couldnt cover many activities for the reasons1. Ups and downs in the roads, which was time consuming,which was also a reason for us to miss out the aquarium at the entrance and many such activities!!! 2. Queueing up!3.Height/age limit in many activities! The one and only place for kids at ocean park will be whiskers club!!! If your trip was only for kids make it your first choice, the rest is upto you! After our last ride at the rapids we took the steep escalator above...not just 1 but 2!!! Really steep and looong ones!!! Then to the cable car which ends up in whiskers club! Wheel chair/pram users have priority allowance(separate entrance) in the cable car ride. It was almost time up for the SYMBIA laser light in water show and also the closing for park time 8 pm! Not much exciting...but thats the end of the park time, so def you get to watch it :-) For all rides and activities try shortlisting the best and feasible by your group/family. You can check youtube videos uploaded by many travellers !

Excellent day trip !. All the rides are super !!!! Never expected the Ocean Park to have such great rides...The rollercoasters are awesome and so are all the other attractions. Very well made park. I just did not fancy the food too much there. The dolphin show was really good.The cable car ride is a must-do...especially in the evening.We took the train up to the rides-area and came back via the cable car.

Nice aquarium. This is a wonderful park and we love the aquarium. Must also see sea jelly spectacular and polar adventure.Just try to avoid the tour group arriving at about 1pm ... Or you may get really annoyed by their behaviour (pushing you, trying hard to be faster than you, stepping on you, shouting out loud) ... When the tour group tourists are not around, we did have an enjoyable visit.

fun. So much fun! Kids and Adults will love it! Check out Pandas and Penguins. Ocean Park got lots of cool rides. The only not so fun part is that you have to queue everywhere and the queue is long..and you cant buy the fast pass. But still I recommend to check it out!
Great time with kids. This one caters to both children and adults. Do plan your visit by looking at the map in advance, else you may miss some great attractions.

A nice surprised!. Visited this place 3 years ago and was really really disappointed about the place. But i was pleasantly surprised from my recent visit. It's more organized and more things to offer. We reached around 11am, which is not so crowded. We were able to see and do what we planned and by 4pm, we were ready to leave. Our timing was just right, to avoid the queues and crowd. Group tours comes around 1pm....Tip: You can purchased your entrance tickets at the Tourism counter in the MTR (before you go up the stairs to the main road). It's much cheaper.

Unique Location = Unique Experience. Every thrill-seeker has been on attractions similar to those at Ocean Park, but the park's unique location on the coast of Hong Kong Island makes it one-of-a-kind (imagine hanging upside down from a revolving pendulum and looking down to find the Pacific Ocean staring back at you). Like at any amusement park, food and beverage are a bit overpriced, but the expansive wildlife exhibits and diverse assortment of rides make Ocean Park a must-see for Hong Kong visitors young and old.

boring, perhaps. went to ocean park in may 2014. due to the hot weather & fall sick during the trip, i found that ocean park is boring compared to disneyland..the rides were boring & not challenging..my advise is, dont go to ocean park during summer period....you may lost your mood and just try to stay inside indoor....

Great theme/aquarium park!. I love this place. Great rides and interesting sights to behold! I found the food to my liking. The weather was great during our stay. We find the lineups for the gondola ride way too long yet we held out for the fantastic view. Taking the underground train ride there was very quick as there was almost no line up.

If you love rides, don't miss this one!. Rides on top of the mountains with views of the ocean? You can't beat that! Make sure you get there nice and early, it gets pretty crowded soon. Express bus to Ocean Park is very convenient. The cable car to the top gives you breath-taking views of the ocean. The thrill rides are very good although the queues can get long by the afternoon. This park is better than Disneyland in terms of thrill rides. Totally worth the money.

worth visiting. This place never gets old. Ride the cable car, the view is breathtaking. A very big park, get a free map at the gate so you will not get lost. Go in the morning so that it would not be too crowded. Few years ago I saw many pandas but the last time I went only one left and he was sleeping.

Nostalgia coming back. Never gets old, extremely popular as it has always been. Feels like 10 years was just yesterday. It's the same exact feeling, from classic cable car rides to the gently rotating observation deck all providing fantastic views of HK's famous skyline, the South China Sea, Aberdeen and the outlying islands.

Great place to visit with family. Not only the exciting rides, the park actually divided into few areas and worth to visit each one, such as aqua city, asian animals (panda), marine world (dolphin show), many more..If you plan to visit each area and every show, I'm sure 1 day is not enough unless you walk super fast and not taking photos. For the rides, try to avoid weekend and holiday, otherwise you may need to Q for 20-45 mins for each ride. Once you bought the ticket and enter the park, get 1-2 maps from the booth on your right, suggest you start from aquarium, amazing asian, then back to old hong kong, after that take cable car to the summit, enjoy your rides and show at marine world > adventure land > rainforest > thrill mountain. After that back to whiskers harbour before leaving the park. This is to ensure you cover most important show/ride in your visit.Hope my info do help you plan your trip and please give me useful vote if it does, thanks.

I need more. one place that i have to visit when comeback to HK, more exciting than Disneyland. I finally meet Penguin, lol To many attractive place but people so crowded. you need to take their map with you so you have a guide where should visit first.

be a child for a day. very nice entertainment , good rides, did not have to wait too long .photo service can be better . should give options of digital photo downloads like in disney land. cable car ride is a must.

We are there for the Polar Bear, Dolphin show and Penguins. The Park is providing the nursing rooms for fussy mama like me...Almost every toilet, there will be a nursing room..Kudos..The Polar bear is awesome, and my daughter loved the Dolphins and seals show very much..People have the tendency to push you even you are with a baby..the just don't care...so be VERY patience...I dont take any adventure rides but those looked kinda fun...one day..Maybe...The staff is sooo friendly...So, 5* for the park and staffs..But 2* for the pushy crowds

huge theme park. Ocean Park is a huge theme park, combining both education and fun at a same place. For you who don't really like rides, you can just visit the animal exhibits. I loooove the penguins and panda (although panda is not really an ocean animal). It was extremely hot when I was there, so get your sunhat or umbrella prepared if you travel in June. Ocean Park was easy to reach by bus #629, which you can get from Admiralty MTR Station.

Family Fun - it keeps you coming back. This is my 4th visit to Ocean Park, and it was one of the best. Despite being one of the oldest theme parks in HK, it keeps reinventing itself. There are always new areas to explore and keeps you coming back. It caters to everyone in the family...not just the kids. The animals/aquariums kept the younger kid happy while the rides kept the older one (11yo) entertained. We particularly liked the new attraction that features animals from the Antarctic & Arctic. There are now alternatives to travel between the Summit area & the main entrance other than taking the cable car ( which always have a long queue!)..its called the Ocean Express and it feels like a theme-park ride. Can be quite fun for the kids to pretend that they are in a submarine.It was easy to get to, even if it was far from the city.If staying in Kowloon, I recommend taking the ferry to HK, and take the bus 629 from the bus stop just right next to the pier. If you are in HK, go to either Admiralty Bus Terminal ( next to Admiralty MTR) or Central Bus Terminal@ Exchange Sq. You can buy tickets to Ocean Park together with the bus ticket at the bus terminals. I had a Octupus card, so I just paid on board and bought my tickets at the main entrance. If you happen to have a HK Map, check to see if there is a discount voucher on it. The one I picked up from the airport had a voucher that gaive me 15% off on tickets when purchased at main entrance.
Holiday trip. The choice depends on different age groups. The Long Qs were pain. Most of the time is lost in the waiting. Too much to choose and nothing exciting. Avoid going in summer to this place.

Can't get enough. This is definitely a must when in Hong Kong. A better option than Disneyland for adults and teen children. The rides are more extreme and more enjoyable in my opinion, there is much more to see here, especially during the Halloween event. They have dolphin shows, pandas, penguins and such if rides are not your thing. As with Disneyland, food prices are inflated here. It sure is worth another trip.

Ocean Park. Great place for both adults and kids. A lot of walking involved so wear sensible shoes and also light clothings especially in summer when it can be really hot. Might also want to bring along some sunscreen. Be prepared to wait in line for the more popular rides and attractions. Plan your route as you don't want to walk unnecessarily.

Great fun for friends and family. You need to reach Ocean Park via bus (at Central MTR station) as the MTR station is still under construction. Arrange 1 day for it and I suggest to go earlier so that you will be able to enjoy most of the rides/games and shows. Time management is important as you need to discuss with friends/family which shows/games which they want the most (Kinda impossible to have all rides/enjoy all shows). I would highly recommend the ocean park shows with dolphins. For younger children and elderly, they can enjoy by visiting all the museums of panda/sea horses/penguins etc. Most of the rides are for children above certain height. it is better to check out before queuing as I witnessed how disappointed the kid was when she was refused for the ride. Most of the visitors go for fast food as they are relatively cheaper. A few of the roller coaster were under maintenance when I visited (little disappointment). Nevertheless, I had great fun there and would visit again if I visit Hong Kong again.

Good but can improve. Don't visit OP expecting a Disneyland experience. Disney experience is unique, tailored to all age groups and they have possibly now developed a competence in delivering service. OP is huge, multiple areas but it takes the theme park concept seriously to have a sole focus on rides. Ofcourse there are activities like the aquarium or watching the Panda nobble on trees or seeing the dolphin show, things you would be aware of if you have possibly been to say Sentosa in Singapore. The Customer service staff is possibly not that competent but they do try well.Some of the rides are quite adventurous and if you have small kids it would be a no-go for them. You would not get a decent continental spread restaurant except if you take the cable car and reach another part of the OP to get to a few restaurants.Things to enjoyThe Ocean Express which takes you from one to another part of OPThe Cable Car ride provides you good views of the South China Sea on one sideThe dolphin show is lively, not to be missedThe penguins are many, and kept in a cold place, carry your jackets for this placeFrom Admiralty MTR, you can take bus 629 direct to OP. Since this place is in Aberdeen area, you can choose to go early in the morning by 10 AM and come early to possible enjoy the Central Area or places like Stanley as well.

Something for everyone. You need an entire day for all the rides and see the animal exhibits.It is a 15 minute bus ride from Central. It is super easy to get to and from the park, there is a dedicated double decker bus that goes non-stop from Central to the park and back, it leaves every few minutes.The animal exhibits are interesting and the rides are fun! There are lots of places to eat within the park, mostly fast food. The Panda and Walrus exhibits are must dos. It was just my husband and I, no kids and we had a great fun day. Its a nice change from walking around the busy city. We went on Tuesday around 11 am and it wasn't too busy, we only had to wait a few minutes for rides. We went in June and it was HOT, so dress appropriately and drink tons of water.

Something for everyone . Regardless whether you are with children, teenagers or adults, Ocean Park will still be able to entertain you and your group. Despite having gone to the park around 5-10 times over my primary and high school days, I still look forward to a trip to Ocean Park as it's a great experience each and every time.Having been to both Disneyland and Ocean Park, it is quite clear that Ocean Park is much better value for money. Simply speaking, there's a lot more to do at Ocean Park (and that even adults have fun). The panda enclosure, cable car, aquarium and dolphin performances are all must-do's. I have personally grown tired of the mechanical rides since they are more tame compared to those available in Six-Flags and the likes, but that being said, they're still quite fun.

Great but not for young children. Great rides, but all of them are for senior children above 7-8 yrsAvoid on holidays, too crowded and wait times betw rides can be big. We were literally torn by the heat and rush. The roller coaster is great but not for faint hearted, but could have been a bit longer in time. There is one blue one for the kids too. Abyss free fall is a must try. Take the tower first so you can see the whole park and choose which ones to do early. Go up by train. Come back by cable car

Huge Amusement Park. 1 day is definitely not enough to try all of the rides and visit all attractions in the Ocean Park! Although I've only been to most of the attractions, and not the rides, I indeed enjoyed the whole experience! I love the Giant Panda attraction, and riding the cable car! And if you are planning to go some time, come early around 10am so you'll have plenty of time to roam & rest.

One of a kind....!. I thought this to be a just another aquarium park...... however, the conclusion was a much better and technologically advanced park when compared with parks of other far-east asian countries... The park is very spacious; creatures are kept in bigger enclosures; the layout of enclosures is very innovative coupled with excellent sound and light effect.The view of the creatures from the glass ceiling is unique..... giving a mesmerising effect of a glass tunnel. View from the huge, single piece glass wall is extraordinary.Other exotic animals, especially penguins and panda, are also interesting.

More tourists than space. Really not worth it anymore, as you'll spend your whole time fending off rude tourists and waiting in line. If you want views, go to the peak or lamma island. If you want a gondola, take ngong ping. If you want roller coasters/aquarium/rides, I guarantee there's a better one where you live.

Great theme park for young adults and teenagers. A regular theme-park visitor, I enjoy going to Ocean Park because it caters to young adults; many rides and roller coasters for adults, and the cable car is the highlight for most tourists. I must say I still like the sea-themed carousel; brings out the child in me. Ocean Park also incorporates wildlife conservation and culture into its decor, so great for those who want to learn more about HK and the environment. Queues generally short, but depends when you go. Peak times include summer and Christmas, as well as Chinese New Year.Overall, an excellent theme park for young adults. Also value for money as the park is quite big and you have lots to do :) Oh yes and the Grand Aquarium is stunningly designed and beautifully showcases different aquatic animals. A must-see!

Kids loved it!!!. It was not as kid oriented theme park as Disneyland, but kids loved it. We bought Ocean Park entrance ticket @ MRT station at a discounted price.We loved the long cable car. We loved the Panda zoo and the aquariums. Queue can tend to be a little bit long. Some of the rides were not really suitable for little kids.

Its the perfect adult theme park. Sorry kids but i must say that Ocean Park should have been for adults only (big laughs) the rides, the map and the whole theme park apart from the cable ride all the way to the other side of the park was phenomenal. I guess it beats the western theme park because even though the colors and mascots of the park are quite child-ish i find the whole park so inviting and loved the rides especially the dragon coaster.

Loved the pandas expect queues!. Loved seeing the Pandas which are housed in groups of two in two seperate enclosures. As we went mid week the queues where not impossible. Also the Aquarium is very very impressive. Mantra Rays and hammer head sharks flying over your head is quite some experience. Cable car is excellent although expect to queue. We went on a Wednesday so hate to think what queues will be like on a weekend! Great views from the cable car and the Tower ride. Also tried some of the thrilling rides! The Abyss which drops you freefall from a tower. The Hair Razer which was excellent but involved a very long wait while queuing. The food in the park was not so great but managed to get a mini pizza from one of the stalls. Travel to and from was by Bus although it looks like they are in the process of building a MTR station there which should improve things greatly.

Where to find a cheaper ticket to visit this Great Place.. Ticket was 320 HK$ at the entrance gate. But if you r staying near Nathan road, you may find a lot of Western Union money transfer services and you can buy tickets 30 HK $ cheaper.

Fun! Fun! Fun!. Me and my family enjoyed Ocean Park! Bigger than Disneyland so there are more walking therefore more tiring. I enjoyed the food in the old Hong Kong Village, love the facade. My daughter who's a panda lover totally enjoyed watching the pandas.

Average but with a good cable car ride. Ocean park is an average water park with rides, few aquariums and average shows. aquarium is good. The one with sea horse was partcularly good as we had completely different view about sea horse. cable car ride was good with scenic view. Birds show was quite average. Has number of restaurants and souvenir shops. if u r staying near nathan road you may take MTR( metro) till admiralty station and then board bus 629 ( double decker airconditioned ) bus to ocean park. ocean park ticket is 320 hkd.

Great Fun. We thoroughly enjoyed Ocean Park.Lots of rides and attractions for all ages.Tip, go early and on a weekday. The park opens around 10:00am and we did all the rides by like 2-3 hours.The longest line we had to wait for was 2-3 minutes.Make sure you take the train up to the summit/peak and take the cable car ride on the way back. This will save you alot of waiting times for the cable car and rides.

Brilliant day out!. Not quite disneyland but we had a wonderful day out here. We caught the MTR to Admiralty then caught the citybus 629 ($10.60) directly to the Ocean Park entrance. The park is split into two sections, the first has various animal exhibitions including pandas, monkeys and sea horses. There was also a section dedicated to "old time hong kong" that was great for photo exhibitions. There is also an aquarium.The second part of the park is accessible by cable car (which provides a lovely view) and contains lots of theme park rides and the "arctic" and "antarctic" animal exhibitions. The rides were quite good but queues were long when we were there.We spent about half the day here and had plenty of time to go on the rides and see the animals. It was a very well kept park with food and drinks stalls. Even though it was busy, the only queues were for attractions when we were there.If there is time, I would recommend going for a day out,

Ocean Park Hong Kong. Fantastic. If Disneyland is 5 star, this one is 10 Star.Don;t miss this one and plan 1 full day for this.Tickets - You will get best price from CTS China Travel Services). After an extensive research, i found CTS to be offering best discount all through the year,. CTs has offices all over Hong Kong. There is one right at arrival lounge in Hong Kong Airport, as soon as you come out after custom's clearance. They sell tickets with a validity period and hence we do not have to be stuck to a specific date. The ONLY challenge with CTS is they accept ONLY cash. There are other travel agents with offices and you can buy from them as well, as they accept credit card payment. Buying online or across the counter can never be cheaper than purchasing thru travel agents.Tips -Fantastic place and never plan Disney and Ocean park on consecutive days, as both places need a lot of walking and you will get tired. Thus, plan at least a day of gap between the visits to these two facilities.This is one place that offers all the various amusement options. right from train ride, cable car (pretty long ride covering over 2 mountains), river raft ride, aquarium, musical fountain, polar region animal life, dolphin and sealion spectacular show...............list goes on !!!Must experience :-Hair raiser (one of the most scenic and spectacular roller coaster rides (its on the top edge of the mountain, with sea front and has over 4 Kilometer ride). Raging riverDolphin show (at Ocean theater. Please check show timings and be there on time)Bumping carsMany more.......Fantastic place.Travel to site - The best way is to go to Central station and take a bus to Ocean park. On return, they have buses right from ocean park to Central station. Very convenient.
Must see. The Cable car ride -awesome,Dolphin show -beautiful,The various rides awesome ,Seeing penguines,seahorses,various fishes Worth seeing
Hot Ocean Park. Wish there were more trees and shade to take a breather in the scorching heat. My 8 yr old daughter enjoyed the cable car and train.

Interesting combination of sea animals and thrill rides. This park is relatively good for family with middle age elders. Went with my parents in their 50s. Both educational and quite fun.
The only thing was it was relatively crowded and no way to pretend queue cutters, which then can be a turn off.
Nevertheless we enjoyed ourselves.

Great views, even if you're not here for the rides. Lots of great views littered all over the park, if you're not here for the rides.
Street food there wasnt that great. If only there were slightly more affordable restaurant options.

Kids would love it. Be sure to carry plenty of water. This place is far bigger than Disney, has rides tgat are scarier than Disney and to top it all, has an amazing assortment of wildlife on the premises. You perhaps can give Disney a miss, but not the Ocean park. My personal favourite was the part when I finally got to see Pandas, live, for the first time in my life. Plus the smile on my kids face when they saw the penguins. Be prepared to walk a lot. In hot and humid weather. You will need a lot of drinking water as the humidity saps your enery in the first hour itself. Apart from that, an excellent day spent at the Icean park.

Old theme park that still manages to retain some of its charm. This theme park is rather old as you know. We took a bus up there and then back after. When I was there, it has 2 new rides under construction and 1 newly opened. We tried all of the rides and it was exhilarating! The dragon ride was awesome! But I still prefer the "skydrop" ride for a quick adrenaline rush. We also went for the marine show. Dolphins and seals were very well behaved! Overall, we had a great time here, though I would prefer to visit a universal studio than this if given the chance to go again.

Must place to visit. Awesome theme park, however would advise not to bring babies or kids under 5 as they wont be able to play any games and it has limited place to rest with airconds. For teens and adults awesome place if you dont mind to get sunburnt and waiting for queue. a walking distance from one place to another area. would advise to go up with the cable car in the morning because less people then go down using the express train as the express train is very fast prob 3min ride. They have very adorable pandas, the aquarium is huge and must see!
Excellent Theme Park. Looking for all the thrills of a theme park, then go to Hong Kong's Ocean Park. The rides are magnificent...

Best Park Ever!. This is by far my favourite theme park I have visited. My family and I decided to go here, as opposed to Disneyland, as we are all a little older and figured Ocean Park would allow for a more interesting experience, and we were right! the rides are all fun, and the beautiful marine animal displays are the best part. It's all very education, and I really didn't want to leave the park!!! The cable car over to the second part of the park was nerve racking as we were going through clouds/ fog, and it is only a cage - saying that, i felt safe in there. A great experience and will be back in a heart beat next time i visit Hong Kong!!!

Day 1 of HK Trip. The park is so large that you need to revisit it again if you want to ride everything. At first I thought that it was just a park for ocean thingy because I forgot to google the place. I was amazed by the train that transmit the visitors from one place to another. It's like another world in the park. I've also experienced here the highest escalator ride. I also love the dancing fountain and the lights during the night. I also love the Pandas. In summary the place is great to visit especially for those child at heart.
great place plenty to see. great day out unforgettable cable ride , see pandas , all sorts to see here , rollercoaser here to a must for all familys

Great fun!. Great Park for rides! We got there before open, went straight to the side with the rides, straight on hair raiser with no line. We then worked our way to the bottom and did not need to line up once! It was so quiet until lunch time until uou go to the main top of the ride area again. Then there were hundreds of mainland Chinese there, who were all rude pushy and the lines are big lines . I recommend going early, getting rides done in the morning then taking your time in the afternoon.
A good day with kids. If you have kids under 7, this could be fun. But, you cannot travel to HK simply to visit this park. It can simply be part of your itinerary when you are in HK.
A must. if visiting with family then one day here is a must, a lot of activities, a nice cable ride, a lot to do with many rides but if you get hungry your food option is limited but still ok

Day Of Action. The best part of this visit is the cable car ride. Wonderful sight and speed. Need to spend the whole day or not sufficient to cover the place. Better to bring water as it is a bit expensive, especially on a hot day. The rides were fun and the waiting time not so long even on a Sunday.

Amazing!!. Had an absolutely amazing time on our trip to ocean park last week so much to see and do and without a doubt once of the best theme parks I have been to. We went midweek so it wasn't as busy and as we had the big bus tours sightseeing ticket getting to and from the park cost nothing as the park is one of the designated stops! A word of advice take spare clothes for the water rides and plenty of change for the food places as many don't take cards and the only bank I seen was at the entrance to the park itself :) really can't recommended this place enough money definetly well spent!
up to scrach. good place, hips of shows and ride, great value unlike the australian ripp off, gigantic aquarium,and rainforest attraction, very very clean, good food prices

great park for all ages. had fun full day at the park.. cable car was wonderful and ride was good, food options are limited but sufficient.. would be some trouble if are veggie but can manage,..can visit for full day

Getting better. Ocean Park has been going for over 30 years and they are in the process of a massive expansion and also making Water World 2 , soon it will be even better with the MTR being extended out there. I first moved to HK when I was 2 in 1972 and when Ocean Park opened it was the highlight to a lot of expats and it only keeps getting better.

Fun times - but oh so humid.. Had a great time at Ocean Park - did as many rides as we could, but the humidity the day of our visit really zapped our energy. Had 4 hours of fun - did plenty of rides and not too many issues with crowds/lines which was great. Ended up leaving a bit sooner than we had planned, but managed to fit in some shopping on way back to our hotel. The aircon was fabulous.

Truly Enjoyable!. If you are undecided whether to visit Ocean Park or Disneyland, Ocean Park is definitely the choice! I've been to Disneyland and I can tell you nothing memorable from the trip except from some experience with rude staff and horrible attitude.Ocean Park offers much better rides with lots of interesting animals viewing emporium. All the animals are fantastically taken care of and they are simply beautiful!Enjoy every single moment!

Ocean park. Good vista for families. Try to find cooler months to visit. Went in end of May and excrutisngly hot. Lots of tourists on weekends.TipsGet in just before opening (10/1030am) You will thank me later! Have been a few times and tour groups come in in early afternoon making waiting times for rides very long Take express train up and take cable car down ( most people line up for cable car) wasting precious time Bring a raincoat if planning on wet rides like Rapids (buying one in Eat in Tuxedo (a restaurant that houses an enclosure where kids can see penguins swimming live)Must watch Marine Show at Icean theatre. It gets very very full so go early for seatsCheers

Rides Galore!. The name is quite mislesding but it was awesome! I expected to get bored, because I'm not a huge fan of Aquariums/zoo and its shows. I've been to other aquariums and once inside, it looked the same with the last one I visited. I'm glad that there's so much more to this park than its name implies. Lots of rides to choose from and also quite different from that of Universal SG and HK Disneyland. It's big and would need the entire day to get around.

Hong kong Ocean park. I am used to all the Disney and Universal parks, but this park was awesome. We could feel the Asian vibe everywhere. Do go very early, as the bus to the park starts to queue very early. Park is clean and well maintained and animals are looked after well.

Not impressed. Having been to other Ocean Parks in other countries, we were rather disappointed with this one. The shows were cheaply done. Every shows clash with the other. The show areas looked run down. You would need to take a shuttle or cable car to go to the top, where all the rides are. And that was the crappy bit. Mainland Chinese hog the place and it's filled with them. They do not queue and will push their way in front of you, not hesitating to knock you bodily or with their umbrellas. Be careful if you have small children. The queuing areas are not covered or shaded so if the sun is out, prepare yourself for a nice sunburn. Once on top, the queues for the rides are so long that time is wasted just for a ride every hr or so. Signage is also poorly done so you'll get lost in that huge area many many times. A disappointment in general.

VERY HOT WEATHER. went to ocean park a couple of days ago for a family day out ,wow it was so hot what a relief when we went to see the penguins also pandas were great did not do the sides as the kids too young good day out all in all

Great day out. i loved it there, did not expect too.super clean, food is a little expensive, the cable car ride is great fun, the Jelly fish part is worth visiting as is the Dolphin show.There are 2 areas with Pandas the out one is good though I thought the indoor Panda was bored, it was walking the same route continuously.

Great Fun!. We had a great time seeing some rare animals like arctic fox, spotted seal,walrus, and different types of sea horses. While going up we used the "Ocean express" and on our way back it was the cable car ride - it is at a height of 1500 meters and there are 240 cars going back & forth.It is a must-do'. There is a lot of walking to do so make sure that you have sensible & comfortable shoes. Make sure you have your rain-gear handy (umbrella / raincoat).

Fun!!. Visited for 1 Day. While if you plan aggressively you can cover most of it in 1 day, it can be a stretch with Kids involved. Veg food is available in 1 restaurant and a veg Pizza, both options suck but outside food is not allowed so you dont have any option. The rides are good and if you are a thrill seeker you will enjoy The Hair Raiser, The Flash and the Abyss. For water rides The Rapids will make you wet so have a pair of clothes handy or if its sunny you will dry up quick. The map provided can be confusing best to ask around as there are multiple levels to maximize the lovely ocean front space and do take the cable car to enjoy the view. The penguins and the hammerheads at the Aquarium are a must see so is the Sea Horse.

Great value lots to do. Really good day - unfortunately due to wind/rain lot of the rides closed in the afternoon. Possibly better and more to do than Disneyland ! Good mix or rides and sights e.g. Pandas so entertaining for adults and children. Only one entrance and buy your tickets in the underground station and get a discount. The bus and underground set up is excellent. Great day - and very good value for money

Ocean park might not mean "Aquarium" anymore. I'm a fan of Aquariums, whenever I travel I would try my best to visit the nearest aquarium of that area if I can. Ocean park is actually the first Aquarium that I have visited (when I was a kid) ever! At that time it was almost purely an Aquarium, meaning the attractions are the Marine life. Ocean park has changed since. The last time I visited (now with my kids), it already changed, with more rides and stuff and less marine themed attraction. Sure I might sound like I am complaining, but maybe it is also a good move by Ocean park.For instance, the Pandas are one of the favorites of my kids, for the second timers as well as the first timers amongst us. The Red Panda would make them squeal (though park employees are there to shush those who are too loud). The Artic and Antartic exhibits were also quite nice, though we were already quite cold from the rainshowers, we were freezing when we went in, nice to go in there during summer I imagine. The Penguins and the Seals were a treat for the kids. There is also a really big but interesting Walrus that surprised us by going near our group and "eying" us one at a time.I felt most of the shows were short, but what can we do? The Dolphin show is already dated in terms of tricks, compared to other shows. Bird show and Sealion show actually were more interesting for the children.The Main aquarium seemed to have become less interesting now, maybe because there are many other aquariums even in Asia. There are some exhibits that are not well maintained anymore, like there was a small display of amphibians, etc. and we actually couldn't find them in the display. The Jellyfish and the Seahorse exhibits however were quite nice and is what I would expect from Ocean Park. The Sturgeon fish exhibit was nice as well, but seems like it isn't as interesting for many people. The Goldfish pagoda is always a treat to visit, I have never missed visiting that exhibit whenever I go to the park. If you like Rides and attractions, then what Ocean park has moved towards is what you want. There are so many rides now that caters mostly for adults, though there are quite a few rides just for kids. So yes, if you like more thrilling rides than what you get from Disney, then go to Ocean park. The location of the big rides will give you extra thrills. I have a bit of a fear of heights (yeah I can take the cable car ride though) can't imagine riding the big roller coaster along the edge of the mountain in ocean park. There is no more entrance/exit at the other end of the park, so everyone arriving and leaving will have to go to the main entrance/exit. This means that if you took the cable car, you will need to either take it back or take the faster Ocean park Express (funicular). Those who can't take heights can take the Express both ways.

Unique attraction but too tiring. This is a sure shot place to visit when in Hongkong. The park is located in a serene surrounding and is accessed by a cable car ride which gives astonishing view from the top.There are many fun filled and hair racing rides which are definitely experiencing. There are lots of informational material for the kids. The only drawback is the long queues to return back through the cable car way.

Excellent for family and youngsters. One of the most established themed parks in HK but they keep building new attractions and having promotions. Highly recommended for families and for younger people the rides are also fun too

Best amusement park in Hong Kong. Many times better than Disneyland, and less expensive as well. Huge area. Small kids play area, rides at the top of the hill, animals and aquariums. There is a wide variety of rides, some for smaller kids, and some for medium and larger kids as well.Love the pandas. They're air conditioned, along with the north and south pole exhibits, so when you get too hot you can visit one of them. The food is reasonably priced as well. Hints:Don't go up the tram before 4pm. Go up the train, and then come back down the tram later. The lines for the tram going up are ridiculous.After you go down the tram, fried noodles are available for about $22, and you get to add your own sauce/sesame seeds.Get there as soon as it opens and ride the rides until about noon, or 1pm. The crowds don't really hit until afternoon.

Terrible experience. I expected it to be a relaxing day to be spent on a theme park, but I was wrong and defintely would not go back. Long queue everywhere, worse than that was some people tried to jump queues and there was nothing much we could do as the place was overly crowded. Some staff were yelling out to keep the queue in order. That was everything I could remember from the visit.

Worth every penny!!. I LOVE Ocean Park. The rides here were much more fun than Disneyland. This place can accomodate all family wish. Spend a whole day to visit this place.Last time I visit Ocean Park, a MTR station was on construction process, so it will be easier to reach. I got there by double-decker bus from Central, quite fun actually.You also can bring your luggage, they provide locker for rent.

Ocean Park Hong Kong. We only had one day to visit Ocean Park so it was pretty rushed but wonderful, there is so much to see and do. We will certainly be back and will bring our Granddaughters, they will have a ball and will allow at least 2 days as well.

Awesome !!. I would rate it as one of the best amusement parks in the world for the location, views and the variety of things there. Great rides, the cable car ride with breathtaking view, huge collection of sea animals, penguins, panda... Its worth the time and kids just love the place.Make it a point to have lunch at Tuxedos restaurant which has a glass separating you from the penguins. its an unforgettable experience along with very good food.Try reaching early, and may be straight away take ride up on the cable car and finish the rides there then come down and finish rest of the things. That ways you would be able to avoid rush. Its very easy to do up and down courtesy the train service.

Too many mainlanders. All we can see is people queuing forever, the estimated time of waiting is always underestimated, we were not able to go on many rides, only 3 considered the price to get in is not worth at all.You are not allowed to bring any food or drink into the park... A bottles water usually cost about 5 Hong Kong dollars cost 25 in there. Not so fun...

Ocean Park - loved it. Went to Ocean Park after Disney. Although not as polished we loved it. The setting is spectacular, with roller coasters perched on the cliff side, escalators to transport you up and down the cliff side, a cable car ride which gives the best views and although enclosed the highlight for us were the giant pandas. Recommend.

Suits all age group of family. Do not miss the show of Ocean Theatre. Performance of dolphins and sea lions is among the top I have ever seen. The children playground provides lots of fun for little kids. Exciting rides are available for adventurers. Cultural villages allows leisure walks. The annual pass is worth to buy.

Better for thrill rides. I love Ocean Park. This is where the higher thrill rides are between here and Disney. If you have children, young children, then maybe Disney is a good choice. But, Ocean Park is also a good choice. It is not just the roller coasters, but it is educational as well. I like seeing the pandas. I really like how the park is right on the ocean. But, it is a hilly area you will walk a lot and, of course, it gets hot in Hong Kong. I do like the park though and would recommend heading over when you get a chance.

It's Magic all the times !. Even if I went at least 5 times , each one was special. you can discover new things all the times and I like the idea to mix animals with fun attractions . the view from the cabin going up is great and take pictures from it is just super cool . I definately suggest to go if in HK .
Beautiful Setting and Timeless Attractions. A park with amazing views, some classic rides and a few interesting animal encounters. Just avoid weekends and public holidays.

Good value. Get there early. One issue for wheelchair users.. I haven't taken the kids to Disneyland yet, but common consensus in HK is that Ocean Park is the better venue. It gets very crowded from around 2pm onwards when a lot of the Mainland day trip bus tours arrive, so get in early (9.30am opening I think) and head to the top of the hill via the train to enjoy the most popular attractions before the lines form. There are three attractions set a bit away from the rest of the park and accessed either by a series of escalators or, if you are in a wheelchair, a very long and pretty steep slope going down around the perimeter of the park. It is a long slog back up the hill, so be sure that you really want to join those rides (if you can) before heading to that corner. For long termers in HK, the annual pass is great value.

Ocean spectacular!. This a place you can spend the whole day and you still feel you have not seen enough!!! The place is good for family members, both old and young!!! It's also an educational place for the kids to learn about the ocean creatures!!! There are also rides for all ages and various shows to keep everyone fully occupied and happy!!!

I'm hard to impress but I loved this park. We took our three year old daughter and being from Sydney with a great Aquarium, I was a bit sceptical about how good the experience would be. We got there at about 11am on A Tuesday in May. Wait times were minimal and the aquarium offered a range of things to see for us and our daughter. We then went to see the Monkeys who were vey cute and different to anything at Taronga Zoo and then caught the cable car across to the other side of the park where we had lunch in a restaurant with a glass wall to a penguin enclosure! That was fabulous. Caught the train back and saw the giant panda, followed up with the kids play land with zero waiting time for all rides and then out just in time to avoid an afternoon influx of tourists. Really worth the money!

The best theme park. I have truly enjoyed Ocean Park. The rides, the animals and the light show at night, all was great. I would recommend to go early in the morning, when the park open, yes, you can simply spend one day here, there are just way too many things to see and to do. Overall, this was the best theme park that I have ever been to so far.
Best theme park in Honk Kong. Great location, fantastic views and fantastic rides, a must go for anyone who lives or is visiting Hong Kong.

Great for the kids, be prepared for the crowds.. It was wet the day we went. It was over Easter, and we waited until the main holidays had passed. Glad we did, Took public bus out their,and arrived close on opening time. Tip. Do the big rides and your must sees first before the crowds arrive, More and more people arrive as the day goes on and by 4,00pm when we left it was pretty crowded, remembering it was wet. Didn't go on too many rides, but I'm sure will keep older kids, teens entertained
Great. Just like all ocean parks really but it had nice touches and a good verity of fish, was great seeing the dolphins

Best location for a theme park, despite some issues. First of all Ocean Park in general is a fantastic theme park in probably the best location in the world. The views of the sea and Aberdeen from the cable car and summit are amazing.The park has some great rides at the summit and the bottom part is entertaining as well with the Aquarium and Panda enclosure etc.Strange start to the day though, we arrived before 10 thinking it opened at 10. 10.30am was the opening time. No problem, we joined the queue which was growing by the minute.At 10.30am we were allowed in and people were hustling to get to the cable car to get to the summit first. But we were halted in our tracks by a second rope where we had to queue again. People were eyeing each other off and you could see this was going to be a free for all once that rope dropped. And so it was; people were virtually running the Olympic 100m sprint to get to the cable car first and who knows how many were knocked down in the process. Anyhow, we were in the top 10 and the cable car ride is amazing! Sea views out towards Repulse Bay were stunning.Once at the top we thought we rushed to the Dragon rollercoaster only to encounter...you guessed it, another rope!! The rides do not open till 1100....Arrgghhh...it is humid, we are sweating and now we are just standing here twiddling our thumbs...plus everyone else was now arriving. So, 1100 it was, then we took off to get in a few rides before the queues got too long. We did ok, few rollercoasters, the tower and a few others sufficed before the crowds really came.Then the rain came....we sought shelter in the Ocean Theatre and waited for the next show. Unfortunately it lasted 2 minutes as a thunderstorm lashed the park for an hour.We took in a few more rides afterwards and noticed the pushy mainlanders...they literally just walk past you in the queue and no-one says anything. We eyed these two off and said thou shall not pass!We took the train down and back up again, pretty cool but crowded again.At the bottom we enjoyed the panda enclosure plus the fish and had a browse in the souvenir stores.Another mark against OP is the distance between different "worlds". The log ride was miles away and sent you down into the depths of who knows where (no one else did either as there was only a handful of people down there) on the original slow escalators they had 20 years ago.Transport there is easy enough by bus or taxi, taxi is cheap, but beware of peak hours, the Aberdeen tunnel gets really congested so avoid 1600-1900. We wanted to go to Kowloon but he said wait in the harbour tunnel would be an hour! Screw that we said, we'll take the ferry.All in all a long, tiring day but we still tried to get the most enjoyment out of it. Perhaps we'll plan better next time. We had a better time at Disneyland as it was flat and well organised.Enjoy people!

This is Awesome!. The Ocean Park in Hong Kong has many attractions suitable for any ages. Roller coasters for people who are not scared, and some small rides even for some elders! Even though you need to pay to enter this awesome attraction, it has around 50 different types of games! There is even a train in which connects the two different places of games, and inside the train, it looks like the train is underwater! I recommend everyone to stay there for some longer time since some attractions (like shows) take up to 1 hour.
Great theme park. Good place for tourist to visit. There are easy way by bus from admiraty station to go there.The are many animals and awesome rides. Must visit.
Happening place of honkong. One of the most visited place of Honkong. Bit little costy. But still good. From cartoons to rides and dolphin shows everything is amazing.

All day wonderful stay. We paid something about 220 HKD all included with lots of fun rides. During the weekends it has lots of Chinese people, you have to wait in a line for every ride. I will never forget my space-wheel ride, I'd never experienced any of such rides before. The Ocean park has beautiful flamingos, birds, lots of sea animals, an extremely huge aquarium with sharks, rays, big fish... This aquarium is like 3 storeys high. We saw a diver feeding sea animals. I am still impressed by the huge aquarium. The Ocean park has many escalators. When you finally get to the top, you can see all the island and sea around. The scene is magnificent. There would be a skeleton of the yellow roller-coaster that far behind your back for a nice picture. There is a a show with dolphins. You can go there earlier to get better seats. After all our trip we took a cable car down to the entrance. I was scared as usual. The view was stunning. I think that most of the rides for the adults, though. If you have little kids and not much time of your stay in Hong kong, you'd better go to the Disneyland. Little kids will not remember the aquarium creatures, I guess, but they will certainly enjoy the cartoon heroes in the Disneyland.

Must take time to visit. So far due the weather,we have pending visit Ocean park up to yesterday,the guest house have offer us for dicounted ticket this zone.There are huge theme park and really it takes a whole day to visit which make we feel exhausted.There are both gaming and sight-seeing area,especially the cable card which we like most.

need 2 days. the park is beautiful place expanding on two levels connected via cable car and an ocean express train. If travelling with small kids, most of the rides can not be done. Most of them need a minimum height of 107cm. Also time wise for each ride there is an approximate waiting time of 20 min. The dolphin show is very good. A Mc donalds outlet is there on the 2nd level. It is a good idea to start early and reach at the opening time. Carry umbrellas or hats as it is too sunny during may and also humid. For vegetarians, please carry eatables along to avoid hunger.There is a huge queue for cable car while returning so going by train is a good idea. Also its a different experience. The ocean express takes around 8 min to come down as compared to 20 min for cable car. going with tours is avoidable as there is no special guidance by them inside the park and one feels completely lost. they only extend the pickup and drop facility and buy you tickets for the park.Mostly they ask you to return by 6.30pm which cuts down your timing of fun in the park. city bus-973 stops right in front of the park and drops till tsimshatsui area i am sure it being a very popular destination many other buses would also be there. overall to enjoy the park completely and to take all the rides, I felt that 2 days are needed.

Fantastic. Place to have an adventure. Located over the back of Hong Kong island we booked a day trip there and had a blast. There are so many things to do or rather u must do. The pandas, sideshow alley, the cable car rides, amusements and other animals. Even the scenery is fantastic. We thoroughly recommend this for a full day experience

Fantastic theme park. It must be on you Top 5 things to do in HK. It is situated down south from Tsim Tsa Tsui but is worth the time and effort you spend on the commute. Plan your entire day at this park. To do: 1. Dont miss the pandas...2. Dolphin show3. Light and sound show by Symbio (One of the best shows i have seen)4. Hair Raiser ride - only for the fearless. 5. Goldfish collectionTo miss for sure: 1. Neptune restaurant - totally worthless place for dining. Enjoy your time at the park.

Fun Place!. Ocean Park is a great place with lots of things to do. The two main things are aquariums and theme park rides. The park is divided into 2 main sections, 1 at the foot of the mountain where it is mostly exhibits about marine life, and the other is at the summit where the thrill rides are. You can take a train or cable car up. The train is much faster, while the cable car comes with a fantastic view of the sea and mountains in the distance. For that, the queue was really long. I had to wait around 20 minutes to go up the summit and 30 minutes to go back down. The thrill rides at the summit are great, my favourite was the Hair Raiser, a coaster that climbs up the side of the mountain, and you get great views of the entire area around the park, beautiful! There are also tons of animal exhibits, from the polar animals to the rainforest animals. Some of the rides are scattered quite far apart though, so sometimes a longer walk is needed to reach places such as the Mine coaster. Overall, it's a fantastic place with tons to do and you can really spend the whole day there enjoying yourself.

Rollercoaster theme park. Nice park, especially the nature and the pandas. If you're from Europe or N.America, the roller coasters will probably be a little disappointing. Try to avoid national holidays or even weekends for that matter...

fabulous place for kids. huge lay out , be ready to walk, carry enough water though there a lot of eateries . beautifully organized. enjoy the cable car ride to the other side.The cable car stops for a minute in the middle and you feel like you are floating in air. The rides were good but check with them before taking kids else you might stand in a long Que with a small child for an hour only to be disappointed in the end. Panda enclosure was great
Nice. Good place should go by taxi. The place is good with shops,aquariams,animals and awesome rides. Must visit.

Fun,Fun,Fun!. We had a surprisingly fun day at Ocean Park. We had been to other Asian theme parks and have been disappointed, but Ocean Park turned out to be a clean, well-run with a variety of options for a whole family. We took the MTR to Admiralty Station and hopped on the designated Ocean Park bus where you can also purchase entry tickets (plenty of big signs direct you to the bus). The bus took only 10mins. We did notice construction of a MTR station across the park entrance so maybe be running next year? The cable car is a must-do, there are big scary roller coasters for the brave, smaller ones for tweens, bumper cars and a small kid section as well. River rides and live animal displays ( penguins, pandas, bird etc). Plenty of places to eat including a licensed McDonalds if you don't want the fried squid snack! It was a slightly cool day which kept the numbers down so we didn't have to wait more than 10mins for rides. We were there for 6 hours and did not see everything ( we skipped the dolphin/seal/ birds of prey shows as had seen plenty of those back home). So, take the whole family, get there early at opening time ( bus tour groups seem to get there in the afternoon) and go on a weekday as the weekends draws more crowds.

An astonishing experience. The park has several attraction of which I liked most was the aquarium. You walk surrounded with fishes through a tunnel and meet several ocean themes. There is a cable car which brings you to the top of the hill and reveals a magnificent view to repulse bay which is the top address to live in Hong Kong or to go swimming. Up there there is a dolphin show and several ferris wheel alike appliances. A nice smooth walk downhill finishes a nice day at this great venue.

Ok day out. Disney is better. Ocean Park is not hard to reach. If you are on the island, take the MTR to the Central stop. Do not go to the Admiralty stop as some books might suggest. Facing city hall at the Central stop, you will see a huge bus depot to your left. It is open air, so walk thru until you find bus 629. It will be clearly marked. There are far fewer people waiting for the bus here. As you pass thru the Admiralty bus station you will see literally hundreds of people waiting for the bus, so to avoid this, go to Central instead. If time is limited, I would chose Disney over Ocean Park, but if you have time this is still a good day out. Once the bus leaves you off, go up the escalator and get in line to go thru security. Once thru, you can buy a ticket, 320 HK$ for a basic adult ticket. Once in the park, check the electronic monitors to see what rides, restaurants, and shows are closed that day. Then follow the signs and walk to your left thru old town to the trams. They will bring you to the top of the mountain. Besides the fantastic views, you will arrive at many rides. From there you can map out the places you want to see. There is also a train that connects two parts of the park. Use it as walking is difficult with up this hill, down that hill, and then back up more hills again. This will save you some energy. There are many rides and there will be a sign out front to let you know the approximate wait time. As it was school vacation, the wait time was just too long and we could ride some. The park really lacks eating options. At Disney and other parks there are numerous restaurants, but here you will find mostly fast food stands, and then sit on a wall to eat. One of the drawbacks here. There is a North Pole live animal building, a South Pole building and of course a dolphin show in the aqua stadium. When leaving check the destination of the bus. Still bus 629. Most of the time they will go back to admiralty station, which is still an MTR stop, so easy then to hop on a train back to your destination.

Zoo Aquarium & Theme Park all in one. Probably our favorite attraction in Hong Kong had something for everyone with a well layed out theme park with a good variety of rides and experiences.The cable car provided an amazing view.The ocean park was nice clean and with good looking exhibits a must do when your in Hong Kong

On top of the world. I have not been to an amusement park like this one which is situated on a mountain. My thoughts of ocean park was that despite the lack of space, HK managed to create a very successful park to enjoy. The train ride from one mountain to another was amazing. We loved all the different kinds of goldfish and the biggest highlight was watching the two pandas!

One Full Day Needed!. Visited the park for the second time in early April. So many attractions that 1 full day may be needed!! Need a lot of walk but worth it for the fresh air, an escape from polluted city area. Get the ticket from travel agent at cheaper price and purchase a return bus ticket at the bus terminus in Admiralty that will drop/pick you up right at the entrance. Food stalls available inside. A visit to see An An and Jia Jia the pandas is a must! Their new seahorses attraction is also interesting. The facilities and attractions are very educative and professionally managed. All in all, it's really a family-friendly recreational park where I would be happy to return!

Biggest theme park in HK. It's a nice park to be visited especially if you are coming with kids. Try avoiding going on weekends as waiting time becomes too long. Personally I recommend going by 10 in morning.

Favourite day in HK. Took our 3 year old and had a blast. Great theme park and highly recommend. Cable was a great experience too..easy to get to in taxi, clean, heaps of attractions and good for all ages.

Loved Ocean Park!!. Ocean Park is great! The pandas are lively, the Goldfish Treasures is sublime, the Grand Aquarium is also good,and the cable car is terrifying but worth the experience. The Polar exhibits have a Pacific Walrus and some very cute Arctic foxes, and the carousel of sea creatures is divine! We didn't even get to see all of it and we sure want to return!

The Original Theme Park in HKG. I have been to HKG Ocean Park many years and during my early childhood till now, the park still amazes me.Still one of the best Amusement parks in Asia. Currently competing with Hong Kong Disneyland, to which is a huge task, but they have managed due to incorporating a zoo within itself. There will be stiff competition when Disneyland China opens it's doors in the near future, but nothing beats this park.The park caters for the young to the young at heart. Hope this park lasts a long time to come.Highly recommended and if the budget can be stretched, do both. Ocean Park and Disneyland.Transportation is simple. Catch the MTR to Admirality and look for the Ocean Park Shuttle Bus. Can also be found when you catch the Star Ferry across. You will need most of the day to enjoy and plan to go when there's nice weather due to the cable car ride!

Great place to visit in Hong Kong. Had a wonderful day at the Ocean Park with my mother and sister. There are everything for people for all ages. Dolphin Show is wonderful and at the same time educational. Recommend to come early as there will be a lot of people visiting later in the day and you do need a full day to visit Ocean Park.

Great Big Park - Big Pricy Park - Fun!. The Ocean Park is big, and pricy and fun! Like most amusements parks, kids love it & dults drag themselves through it. Unless you're a lover of amusements parks this park could be anywhere in the world. You're not in Hong Kong, you're in Ocean Park. Access is easy VIA metro and park buses from anywhere at any time in HK.

Best Wheelchair Assistance. I brought my blind and physically disabled niece to Ocean Park in Hong Kong last July. We were given priority to all the rides, easy access and special ramps for wheelchair. In Disneyland Hong Kong, we had to queue up in long lines for rides.The Ocean Park staffs obligingly sat through some thrilling rides with my niece because I wouldn't dare to ride with her. I am so grateful to them all.We had a wonderful time thanks to all the staff in Ocean Park!

discount ticket. there are discount ticket for we to buy on the zone of our stying,we have wake on 7AM and take a breadfast nearby,just one metro from Tsim Sha Tsui station will reach the Ocean Park Bus Terminal,take 15 minutes bus will reach the park,and we do enjoy to see the wild animal and organism under the sea.

Great Day. Had an awesome day at Ocean Park - with the various rides, the aquarium, shows and of course the cable car. The cable car had great views and i would reccommend seeing the Dolphin Show. Going early in the morning I found good as you did not have to line up for rides or to get in. Though as the day went on, just got more and more busy. Overall, we had a great time, and you definitely need a whole day to do all of Ocean Park.

Unexpected Delight. We had an amazing day enjoying watching animals up close.Just wish we had seen the animal experiences earlier - they were priced well but we didn't see the flyers till later in our visitRides where good too

very nice. kids n ppl of all age enjoy here. worth visiting this place. a bit confusing place inside comparing to disney . the timing n chart to folow is bit confusing ...but a really wonderful xperience . must visit.

You must go. I have been coming to HK for years and never came here, what a mistake, it's great, lots to do for all ages, I have come 3 times in two weeks and still not seen it all, the hair raiser is amazing and the cable car ride up to the rides is a ride in itself, bring food as that's expensive here, a lot of mainland Chinese seem to be there and they seem to take more pictures of us than anything else but that you get used to just saying no, getting there is easy by bus from admiralty and to be honest it's as quick as a taxi and cheaper, if you think you will come back 2 times more in the year then get a yearly ticket and that gives you more discount

Great family park. My 15 months toddler love it very much from the aquarium to seeing panda, cable car rides, sea lions and penguins. He was on full excitement during entire visit. A well maintained park for the family. Definitely recommended.
