Excellent. Its great fun. Has almost every attraction you can imagine. From Pandas, Aquarium to hair raising rides. Best place to visit with children. They'll love it.

Good Learn & Fun. Lots of info about sea animals. The park had a lot of rides as well for the kids. The high light of the day was the Sea Carnival parade / dance show. The costumes were very beautiful and music outstanding.

Not to Miss In Hong Kong. Ocean Park is a good visit with older Kids as many of the Rides are not open to small children, but there are still plenty of attractions for all. Don't miss the Grand Aquarium and Pandas on the lower level. Most of the rides are on the Summit, which can be reached by Cable Car or Train. The Dolphin show is a must see..

Fun for all ages. A great day out lots to do for all ages. The cable car into the park is great and spectacular view to the south china sea and local areas. If you enjoy walking this is for you the Park is set on a side of a mountain so it is very steeps and hilly. Lots of rides and attractions, tiger, panda and more. It will take you allay to get around so bring your walking shoes.

OK. This a pretty OK place. If you have time, then go. If not, don't. Not as interesting as Disneyland, where it was FUN. Ocean Park is more muted, not much things to see. Maybe if they revamp it alittle...
Great Fun. This is one of the best attractions in Hong Kong, the Pandas are so special. You really need a full day or more to enjoy this experience, don't miss or the kids will not be happy.

Not a 'must do', but good fun. Liked - the cable car ride (not for the faint hearted!), the pandas and the arctic and antarctic exhibitions. Views also good.Didn't like - the large tour groups and particularly their inability to adhere to the 'no flash and keep quiet' requirements so as not to disturb the animals. Didn't bother with - the rides.An enjoyable half day out - some fairly twee areas (and rides) but some educational and enjoyable areas as well for all ages. Easy to get to (and the bus trip shows you areas of HK you might not otherwise see if you stick to the MTR) and lots to see and do. Don't expect to find postcards on sale (no idea why they don't stock them there!)

an amusement park with a difference. Nothing different in terms of rides from most of the other amusement parks, but the layout, the added attractions like cable car, ocean express, ocean theatre, pandas, old hong kong make this place very attractive

It's a zoo in disguise.... It's a zoo with a few rides? Is it me or is this place stuck in the 80s? The attention to detail is sloppy- wooden dividers with poorly painted designs lends this place an air of parsimony during its phases of development. The escalator is rubbish and many of the rides are old. On saying that, the cable car ride is stunning as is the aquarium. The dolphin show is a show- should it be? The food situation is abysmal, expensive badly cooked junk with nowhere to sit.

very nice park worth a visit. May be Ocean Park is not the best Themepark in the world but its worse a visit if you are in HK for some days. Avoid the park on the weekend its crowded, Monday to Friday very nice, at least all Themeparks are mostely busy. We stayed for one week in HK for holiday, 5 adults and 2 kids. We took a taxi to the park, it was very easy and not expensive. I organized the tickets via our concierge in the hotel, tickets are not cheap but honestly you don't get something for free. We don't had the feeling we were cheated for the price. The park itself is a mixture between zoo and fun park. The landscape is amazing, very very green. We took our own food with us and some drinks, nobody checked our bags. Near the entrance area you have a lake with loud pathetic music, its a bit surreal. At first we visit the Aquarium, its a middle size one with a lot of information about the ocean. Our kids liked it very much to touch a starfish. Afterwards we took a look to the Panda's. All buildings are in good condition, the whole park is very clean and well maintened. Service staff is very friendly and helpfull, especially if you have small kids and a push trolley. If you are finished with the first part of the park you can use the cable car (very nice view) or the train to the upper part with all fun attacktions like rollercoaster and more. The train is typical themepark kitsch but its what we expacted and well done. If you want to do the water rafting, be aware you will be completly wet in end. An umbrella will not help. We stayed 4 hours in the park till 3:30 pm and left then because many tour groups were arriving and it was very full. Back to the hotel we took again a taxi. Taxi queue direct at the main entrance. Take care about the information sign for the right taxi.

Fun for all. This is a zoo and amusement ride ParkWe only went on a couple of rides, to get around the Park, but the rides were busy and popularThe Zoo was the main reason for our visit and we were not disappointedSeeing the Pandas made the trip so worthwhile
ocean park + amusement park. we thought it's just a park with oceanic animals but they got lots of roller coasters and stuff like that. so it's a combination of both.

Crowded on a Sunday but still worth a visit. We got our tickets via 7/11 which saved us some time in the queue. We were there on a Sunday morning, when the park just opened. So many Chinese tourists on a Sunday. We were also underwhelmed by the Giant Aquarium. Having been to Aquaria in Kuala Lumpur, we were surprised that Ocean Park's version is much smaller. The cable car is a highlight, but the lines for the rides are terribly long, with some reaching 60 minutes of waiting. We left early to avoid the mad rush out of the Park, and the shortage of taxis when closing time comes.

Good Fun. Great rides. Wonderful Aquarium. Awesome once in a lifetime Panda exhibit. Great ride in the cable car with some breathtaking views. Loads of walking. A must visit for theme park enthusiasts, whenever in Hong Kong. A great way to spend half a day.

A good place to spend your day. This place is amazinghly fantastic. It is a great place to spend your entire day. You can enjoy so many rides and diffrent attractions, you will be dead tired by time you leave and then too u wouldnt have seen the entire place coz its so huge.

Good experience with nice theme. I had chance to come to one of the most recommended attractions in Hong Kong. Ocean Park provides you great experience with nice them park. There are many attractions and games inside the park. There are three large areas you'd need to visit. From the starting area, take the express train or cable car to come to the second one where games are located. Then come visit the third area for food if needed. From the second area you can see the Aberdeen bay where cruisers and ships are. A great combination of mountain and light-green will probably fall into your eyes. Tip: take bus 629 from Central Pier 7 or from MTR Admiralty Station, Exit B and alight at the park. Buy entrance ticket at the bus station to save time. Otherwise you would have to wait in a long line-up at the entrance gate of Ocean Park. Lots of people especially so many groups of adults come in.

Adventure lovers, go here!. I am really an adventurous person and I like animals, a lot. So I recommend this place to be so nice because its like a location with a package of zoo, park, amusement, restaurants, and so on. Really very nice to come into.

A phenomenal experience for a very reasonable price. At first we were apprehensive about visiting yet another Oceans park, but I am so glad we did. The aquarium, animal exhibit Dolphin show and the cable car itself were quite interesting and worth the admission money (~US $44 including the return bus fare from Admiralty station). On further inquiry we were told that the rides are Free. Absolutely FREE!! Coming from Singapore, Free has a special place in my heart now.. If you are in HK and whether with kids over the age of 4-5 or just a bag-packers Oceans world is a place not to be missed.. And did I say the rides are free...;)

Good varieties of rides and animals. It is a great place for families and friends to visit with lots of rides and marine life to see. Should take the cable car rides to have a good overview of the areas and scenery. However, the average waiting time is around half an hour for most rides.
Great theme park. My teenage kids and I had a great time with many hair raising rides. A must visit experience in Hong Kong.

Waste of time and money. If you are really very very keen and have lots of days and money to spare and if your child hasn't ever been to a park of this kind then go. If you do go a few tips. The lines are crazy, park is not well marked so you will be sating a lot of time. We went with our 4 year old and there are few rides she could do. Reach early, try and go on a weekday and complete everything by 2 ish. If you do finish early and have some time to spare then take a bus to Stanley. This way you save the trip to get here coz where Ocean Park and Stanley are located you need to take a pretty long bus ride or cab ride after the MTR. Basically steer clear of this if you don't like horrendous lines. Maybe if you do this before Disney you won't feel that cheated. The only worthwhile thing is the cable car ride.

Ocean Park. You must visit ocean park if you are in hong kong for more than one day, Brilliant entertainment views and fun! Highly recommended and cheap enough for whats on offer-dolphin shows, birds shows, rollercoaster rides, pandas, cable car etc. Must dedicate a day to it! AMAZING

What an experience. This park is amazing, you could spend days and not see it all.Once you enter the only other cost is food and drink, all the rides and exhibitions are free. The park has beautiful garden displays, lots of sea creatures, and an amazing gold fish house. The carousel has beautiful sea animals that you ride and is just so brilliant, it makes you want to be a kid again. The cable car ride to other side of the Park is excellent, very steep and high but well worth the trip. Lots of exciting and thrilling rides, if you like being tipped upside down and back to front. We arrived at around 11.00 am and found that this time was good ,later in the day the crowds really started to build up and become crowded in some of the exhibits.
Wow........... Nice theme park. Love the Pandas. The show is nice and very educational. The aquarium is amazing especially with the Jelly Fish tanks. Will visit again in future...

Far from the best but OK. This theme park has a lot to offer but some of the attractions are average. If you like rides get there early and go on the Gondola or train to the top of the mountain because the lines for the thrill rides even on a weekday are 1hour wait. There are some worthwhile rides in the park. The queue for the Gondola after lunch will be over an hour. The animal shows are poor, the panda bear and monkey exhibits are a yawn. The sea lion and dolphin show are pathetic to say the least, not even close to Sea world San Diego and Australia. The Aquarium is OK but not Great, The Arctic exhibit promises a lot but delivers little and smells bad. OK to pass the time. If your a westerner take your own food as the menu is a little hard to swallow

Adventure!!!. When in Hongkong, whether you're a teen or an adult, i think Ocean Park is much preferable for adventure-seekers like me. The only disadvantage, which I think a lot can relate to, is the long line of wait per ride/adventure. A day is too short if you want to enjoy all the rides. Avoid going on peak days and holidays because for sure, you will not enjoy the ride-all-you-can you paid for. But in terms of experiencing fun & adventure, Ocean Park provides wide choices of rides for kids and the young-at-heart.

Mix of shows and rides, good for all age groups. Lots of walking in store for you. Shows are nice. Rides are ok. Didn't go for the extreme rides dye to Q length. Anticipate at least 30-40 mins Q for popular rides. Cable car ride was very good. Food and beverage are over priced. Souvenirs and photographs are way too expensive. But having come here, may as well go with the flow!! Spend more time at the Summit if you are older than 13, otherwise time is well spent at the waterfronts area. A couple of places have Indian food but not very great tasting, so go with the non-indian stuff if you have the palate for it!!

Excellent place for all ages. It is really a excellent place for entainment no matter for animals and mechanical games. The animal performance is joyful and fun. However, too crowded and full of people all day long. Need to queqe up for long time for the train up to the top or those mechanical games. So, strongly commended you visit this during weekdays.

Great, but very crowded (sometimes?). Great place, tons of attractions. The main problem was that is was crazy crowded when we were there. Many attractions made no sense to wait for (45-75 min waiting in line). At the end of the day this situation improved and we got to try most that we wanted, hence the 4 stars for quality of rides.

A great day out. Fantastic rides that will get your heart going. Try to avoid holidays or weekends where possible and a good working knowledge of the public transportation system will definitely help to get out here. The bus ride can be a lot of fun along the way as well depending upon which route you take. There are rides for all ages there however the best rides are focussed towards teenagers or adults. If you get there early enough you can enjoy a few rides back to back without having to wait in line again, it will depend on what day it is through. Make sure you read your map and try and get around to each location. Some of the rides may seem a little basic, such as the Mine Cart however can be just as much fun as the more popular ones.By far the greatest park Hong Kong has to offer and worth a day visit.

Great for all age group!. Ocean park is a great place! It goes from theme park to a wonderful zoo. There are animals in there that I have never seen before no even in Singapore zoo. North Pole section was amazing, the South Pole just as incredible!! They put so much time and effort to build that place. The dauphins shows was amazing.As a grownup I really enjoyed it.
Better then disneyland. The animal shows and ocean views are superb.. but crowds can spoil the moment. Go on weekdays early to avoid weekends and public holidays rush.

Better than Disneyland. More stuff here for adults. Disneyland is just for young kids. We're not a big supporter of zoos, but you can see two pandas here -which were our first. You'll struggle to do everything in a day here..... Tip: DON'T take the cable car (1 hour queue) to the other side of the resort - use the tunnel train (no one queues for this). Take the cable car BACK (no one queues for the ride back)

Beautiful. This place is a once in a lifetime experience! It is a wonder world of ocean creatures, displays, shows and the biggest most fun filling rides you can think of. It is very big and to enjoy the whole experience you must be there when they open until they close.
fun!. lots of things to do, rides, games, aquariums but the best for me is seeing the pandas. lots of games which is fun specially if u win :)

A great day out. A great variety of activities - the rides are not cutting edge and some are a bit tired however ideal of young teens - the views are wonderful & the cable car is an attraction in itself - wonderful aquarium - the dolphin show is perhaps a bit unnecessary
Fabulous. Cable car was a bit scary due to the wind blowing it all over the place but the highlight was seeing the Pandas

Fun day!. This was a big surprise especially after ready with mixed recent reviews. We got lucky as it was not extermely crowded. The park is very nice, my wife and I took our 3.5 years old and almost 1 year old daughters so there were a few things we could not do but overall it was great. The reasons why I did not rate this higher was because:-Lack of places to site and eat-Dolphin show was just ok-Panda exhibit is nice but I expected more Pandas, there were two only-Some parts were under constructionThe reason why it deserved 4 stars:-Cleanliness-well planned restrooms-helpful staff-The ocean express was a life saver with the double strollerI would recommend spending half a day there if not longer.

A fun park for family and friends.. Ocean Park is a great place to visit. It,s fun, entertaining and educational too. The aquarium is amazing with lots of different type of fish. Tropical forest has interesting small animals and creatures. The cable car ride has stunning view. I highly recommend to family and friends to visit.

Pandas were the main draw card. We've seen and done alot of theme parks in our time and Ocean Park was decent although very crowded despite an early start. Rides were often very short for the wait time involved.The rides don't have the charm/story/experience of Disney but to compliment them the animals are great and seem well cared for and in good health. I'm quite sensitive to exploitation of animals for profit and while these animals do generate profit, there appears to genuine interest in their welfare.The park is clean, staff helpful and friendly. Loved that the park is perched on the side of a hill so you get great views out to the water. Many merchandise outlets! Lots of food options - none are fabulous but some are decent.Apart from the queues, we really enjoyed the day and the transport to/fr via bus #629 from Admiralty MTR was easy.

Must Do Panda Experience!. We signed up for the Panda Zookeeper experience through Ocean Park's website. Our education director, Vivian, and the Panda keepers made this behind the scenes a once-in-a-lifetime experience that was so worth the moderate expense! In addition to learning about giant pandas, we got to prepare the food for Lele, their younger male giant panda, FEED him the food we prepared, and then went into his exhibit area and laid out bails of fresh bamboo. Once out of his exhibit area, we went around to the front of the exhibit where regular Ocean Park patrons are, and got to watch Lele eat the bamboo we left for him. We also got to visit behind the scenes of the red panda named Chong Chong. Best experience ever!Since the panda experience is from 9am-11am, we were at Ocean Park early, and had heard about the long queues which happen typically in the AFTERNOON when all the Chinese tours show up. So, my tip: Go first thing in the morning and ride the popular rides then, because around 2pm, the park is full of people and the lines do get long. We had a less than 5 minute wait for the Hair Raiser roller coaster ride and 15 minute wait for the Whirly Bird. If you are like us and want to buy souvenirs, you might want to check with the main gift shop at the park entrance. They were offering 20% off your purchase, but only at that shop!

If Disney's land is too young for you, Ocean Park is you destination. If Disney's land is too young for you, Ocean Park is you destination .The rides are extremely fun and quite various. It's suitable for both families and friend groups. Kids can enjoy watching tons of animals while teenagers or adult can take a lot of exciting rides. Great experience!

Fun filled day. We took a taxi from shatin to reach the park. It was about 250hkd. It was drizzling through the day but that didnt dampen our spirits. The cable car ride to the summit is amazing n should not be missed. The rides were good and my 12 year old was shaking for an hour after she sat in the hair raiser roller coaster :)The aquarium is not that great in comparison to what we had seen in sentosa Singapore. Same goes for the dolphin n bird shows. Food is expensive similar to Disney but the seating n relaxing places r much less than Disney. So while the wildlife is not spectacular, the overall package is not too bad especially if u have young kids.

Suitable for everyone. One of Hong Kong's must-see attractions long before DisneyLand was even built there, Ocean Park offers families and couples / friends an excellant day of fun.There are rides for the more adventurous, and thrill seekers. The rides are good for adults and children alike, so definitely provide bonding and great fun for friends, couples and families alike.There is a giant aquarium with many different species of beautiful sea creatures - fishes, seahorses, corals etc. One can expect to be awed.There is so much to see here, and the park is huge so expect to do some walking from one end to the other. There's crowds at this popular tourist spot, but trust that one won't be disappointed by their visit here.For more detailed information and photos, do visit:http://thearcticstar.blogspot.sg/2014/01/cruising-china-shenzhen.html

A family day attraction. Ocean Park is worth visiting especially if you're into Pandas. We love the cable car which is such a delight. A very huge amusement park and do take the whole day. Rides are fun. Do not bring any food with you as they do not allow you to. Food is quite expensive in there. Lots to see and is equivalent to some sort of zoo experience.
Great fun park. This is the best fun park in Asia in my opinion it has more to do for the kids over 12years old who enjoy exciting rides and activities. For younger kids Disney is better.
For kids and adults!. There ist enough for l whole day to do and to see. Go up with the Nautilus and down with the cabelcar. May be you wait half an hour to go in.Check out the Dragon it's real fun!

Brilliant Day Out!. My teenage daughters went to Ocean Park with their (more mature) brother and they all had a thoroughly wonderful day out. The rides were "scary" enough to thrill and without the long queues we experience here in the UK at similar parks. The location of the park looking out to sea makes it all themore different to Chessingtona nd Thorpe Park!As well as the rides they saw marine life and Pandas!The entry fee was reasonable and they thoroughly recommend this to any visitors.

Loved it - you need a full day. We have been to Disney/Universal Orlando so weren't expecting too much. We wanted to see the pandas and thought the kids (9&7) would enjoy the rides. We bought our tickets in advance from a 7/11 store which was good as there was a queue. We got a taxi from the Harbour Grand Kowloon and it wasn't that expensive and was quite quick. We got the bus back at the end of the day and there were huge queues but lots of buses so it was very easy. The park has so much to see and do for families with kids our age. We really had to move quickly to get enough done in a day. We loved seeing the pandas and saw 3 out of the 4 of them which was great. We loved the cable car ride up to the top section - great views. The kids loved the rides and the queues weren't too bad compared to Chessington in the UK!! The park is in such a beautiful setting and was definitely a great day out for our family, so glad we went. Do go early to fit it all in. There is a lot of walking and some rides are quite far from others and up and down steps / escalators. A few rides were closed but that didn't bother us. Looks like a poncho is a good idea for the water rides. It is busy but so are all theme parks. We will go back if in HK again.

Great Theme Park. Getting there is relatively easy where there is a direct bus (num 629) from outside Admiralty MTR station. The park is huge and please do plan ahead. You can avoid the long queue for cable car by taking a internal shuttle train. Do visit their dolphin training area to get up close on how the trainers mingle with the dolphin. And also, the dolphin show is not to be missed.

Noisy, crowded and expensive. Don't go to Ocean Park if you dislike crowds, noise and paying too much. The aquarium exhibit is small and very crowded. If you're looking for rides or if you're with small children this might suit you, but if you want to see wildlife - stay away.

Fun rides and good collection of aquatic animals. This is another place that is fun for kids - Some of the rides like Hair Riser, Flash, Abyss are good thrill rides, Rainforest - Rapids is a nice experience in water. The park has a very good collection of animals - Panda, Penguins, Seals, pacific seals, sea Jellys, Grand Aquarium has a huge collection of fish and Sting grays, Dolphin show in Ocean theatre is a must watch-ve - Asian food is atrociously expensive for the quantity and the items served. Don't know about other cuisines.

Great for kids. There is so much to see. Please plan ahead on what you want to do ax there is so much to do Please ensure you allocate enough time to wait for ride, queue are very long on weekend and wait time were up to 45 mins.

Way Better than Disneyland (If you have no kids along). Getting to Ocean Park is really easy via MTR, as there are a lot of Ocean Park buses at Exit B of Admiralty Station. The ride going there was very pleasant.At Ocean Park itself, there's a huge diversity on what you could do, from rides to different animals. I would recommend you go on the cable car first, which gives you such a great view of the entire place. It's a huge park, and it's a relaxing but very scenic ride. From the top, you could begin choosing which rides to go to. However, like I said in the title page, if you have smaller kids who aren't really into rides, then it would be much better to go to Disneyland instead. I think Ocean Park will be worth it only if you can go for both the rides and see all the animals. Since we had kids along (who didn't do the rides), our visit was more limited. The kids were still very pleased with the Ocean Theatre show, as well as the penguins, though.Still, what stays in my mind for Ocean Park is the long cable car, the classic rides, and the penguins and pandas. All in all, so much fun.

Best theme park experience. Best theme park experience I had in my life. It's the combination of theme park and ocean zoo. Really suitable for kids and family. it is an "edutainment" theme park, where you can learn about animals and at the same time, having fun. If I were Hong Kong citizen, I'll get myself a year pass!

Definitely worth visiting when you're in HK. Lines everywhere but turnover is fast! The rides are short (<1 min) and only 3 roller coasters but plenty of other attractions available (zoos/aquarium, cable car transport, old Hong Kong, bird cage, etc.) Water Screen Show was absolutely amazing and worth seeing.

Fantastic experience. Get the MTR to Admiralty Station and follow signs to Ocean Park buses at Exit B. You will pass an office where you can buy tickets to save queuing when you reach the park. They are also cheaper to buy here. The buses leave every 10 minutes or so from the bus station just outside the MTR exit (bus fare not included in the price but you can use your Octopus card). Ocean Park is brilliant. Loads of animals: Pandas, otters, seals, dolphins, penguins and a massive aquarium to name but a few. Some of it has to be seen to be believed. Cable cars take you up the hill which is part of the experience. There are quite a few roller coasters and thrill rides but expect to queue for 45 minutes or so for some. Make sure you wait till the finale about 8pm near the entrance at the fountain for the light/fire/fireworks show.

Great day out. Great day out with many activities fit for the whole family - rides, shows, animals etc. Easy to get to from Causaway bay bus station. We were there during China public holiday week, so decided to get the first bus out. Also, left the park early to try and avoid long delays on the busy back to the city. Price was about $50AU per adult.

OK but not worth the price. Overall, it was an OK experience but not worth the price. Long line and pushing people for not so attractive exhibition. With the exception of the Grand Aquarium, the show at the Ocean Theater and the views when taking the Cable car, it left me and my family disappointed. The food is awful, greasy and fattening. Not what you expect for the price you pay.
Awesome place!. It's a huge place! We were not able to visit all the attraction in one day! The kids had a great time!

Over cautious height restrictions on rides. We went during the week as we we're advise that weekends would be horrendously busy. Unfortunately, my 6 year old wasn't tall enough to go on many of the rides and this pretty much spoilt the experience particularly as she is a regular visitor to Legoland Windsor!!It was great to see the pandas but overall Disneyland was much more fun!!

Spectacular views, great rides, lots of pushy crowds. Ocean Park has expanded over the years and especially relatively recently in response to HK Disney. Many of the rides are pretty hardcore, especially for a wimp like me; if being in fear of your life is not your idea of a great day out then you are going to find few things to sit on and be spun round in. There are some slightly less death-defying rides, however, such as the The Rapids, which are fun.The cable car ride and views are superb.The animals are also fantastic. The highlight, though, undoubtedly, is the pandas, which are beautifully and meticulously catered for. Other reviewers mention the mainlanders and their strange, pushy behaviour. It's all true. They seem to be in a hurry and like to push and shove. If this is the first time you have experienced this, it's worth recording it as a new cultural experience. But make sure you drive those elbows outwards at 45 degrees as necessary — and never give ground!

Busy. Was so busy and longer queues than Disneyland. Felt like the hussle and bussle of Nathan road all day.Few places to sit and rest. Toilets hard to find. Cable cars broke down for 1/2 hour. Was fun but the points above detracted from it somewhat.

Culture of cutting queue. Everything is good about this place. I love the rides, the scenery, the shows, the attractions, the flowers, the animals. Awwwwwww~ the dolphins are cute! <3 However, I was really disappointed with the culture of cutting queue from some inconsiderate tourists.Even though it's not peak period now, I have encountered about 5 cases of people cutting queues. This is especially irritating when you were tired and you had to queue for an hour or so for your turn, and yet, there were some inconsiderate people who will cut the queue like nobody's business. When these people cut queue, the people queuing didn't even ask them to queue from the back, and they let them in (they do not know each other). My experience tells me that these people do not dare to cut in front of you if you actually voiced out sternly that everybody is queuing and they are supposed to queue too! I think we should voice out and stop letting these situations happened, so that these inconsiderate people will not keep on thinking that everyone will let them cut in anyways.

Great place if you ignore mainlanders. Went on a weekday. You don't have to make any online reservation, simply head to any 7-11 store and say "hai yang gong yuan" and number of tickets. Hassle-free purchase. Head over to Admiralty station and follow the signs leading you to bus 629. The last stop is Ocean Park and the ride takes approximately 15mins. Present the 7-11 ticket for entrance and the first attraction would be the Grand Aquarium. I was lucky enough to spot a unique fish at the Grand Aquarium. *refer to my photo* The body has a moon, it's even smiling! Overall, it was an average exhibition. However the gifts they have were magnificent! I got myself a really adorable penguin.We went for more exhibitions afterwards and skipped all except on thrill ride. My bad experience came during the queue for Ocean Park Tower. Mainlander aunties were discussing about how to cut the queue. It was really annoying because the queue was not even that long!When it was our turn to enter the deck, the staff sounded really pissed off at the mainlanders because they simply cannot follow simple instructions. I was quite sullen too because they were speaking at the top of their voice, reverberating throughout the entire viewing deck.By the way, you will often smell something really fragrant in the park. It is actually grilled squid from the stall. I strongly urge you to have at least one person to share the entire piece with,otherwise it gets kinda revolting.Before you leave,remember to go Old Hong Kong section of the park. Look for the ice cream stall which sells a coca-cola ice blended. It was awesome and quite a bargain! Go deeper into the area and you can take photos with an antique bus on display there. You can even enter the bus!Take bus 629 back to Admiralty station. Or you can opt to head to Aberdeen for Jumbo restaurant like me.

no way im going back!. Took my family there to have a great day out, The only thing good is about the sea aquarium part and visiting the pandas and monkeys.We went on only one ride and that was enough, We queued up nicely and a bunch of mainland china people starting to queue jump and then all these chinese people started to form a queue being one into three. My kids constantly got pushed and shove and trod on . As we eventually reached the ride we told them that this certain lady had pushed in all the way from the back. The staff immediately pulled her out but made a dramatic scene of it, thus making all these mainland china pointing at our family. The ride did say people with high blood pressure mustnt go on these ride but the amount of frustration the kids and i had we werent going to go on anymore ride!!!!!The dophin shows was a short prob no more than 30 mins . I rem as a child it use to be longer than that,
Good day out. We enjoyed the park with some good rides to go on. The food at the restaurant was just ok but the stunning panoramas more than made up for it!
Awesome. Get your ticket at admiralty MTR station, slightly cheaper. The rides was awesome, nice adrenaline, awesome view and the sunset was magnificent!

An ok theme park ruined by Chinese tourists . Was a public holiday so we knew it would be busy most rides a 30 min to an hour wait some even longer. Put your walking shoes on as very large park with lots of hills to go up and down. Hard to find your way around as the map is not clear at all. Not suitable for kids under 120 cm height as not many rides. So probably 6 years plus.Rides over very quick also.Missed the shows as too busy. Beautiful scenery and the cable car is a must do.Like most posts beware of Chinese mainland tourists. They push and try to cut lines. We had a mass rush to get into the cable car line lucky the security guard took control to stop all the mayhem before someone got hurt.Would not recommend park unless older. Do another day at Disneyland.

A great mix of rides and attractions. Is was a wonderful place to visit with the Panda's and penguins in stark contrast to the thrill rides. I visited the park about 10 years ago and was disappointed but they have certainly done a great job rejuvenating it. Be wary of the pushy Chinese visitors who don't seem to appreciate taking turns or pushing small children put of the way.

Very very crowded!. Provided you don't mind being pushed and shoved and cut in line by Chinese tourists, then you'll have a wonderful time at this place.They seem proud of the fact that they were voted the 17th best theme park in the world - are they kidding?Many rides and food outlets were not operating when we visited. They have one or two decent rides, the rest are all carnival type rides you could ride at any local county fair.We visited the Dolphin show - it was so bad that it was funny. We left before it ended and didn't bother visiting any other animal show on the basis of the terrible dolphin show. To the owners, go and check out any Sea World and see how it is done.There are plenty of better things to do in Hong Kong so if your time is limited don't bother trying to fit this place into your itinerary - you'll be sorry.

great time. this was one of the best animal parks i have been too. My wife was a little be mad at first with the way we did the rides but we were able to get in like 6 or 7 rides in the 6 or so hours we were there. with only one of the them being more then 5 min wait. the restaurants on the other hand make sure you get there early to reserve a table like for the tuxedo restaurant ( this one is the one where you get to eat next to the penguins.

good time!. we went there on march.... we had a good time, we love the cable car...its the nicest thing i think..we saw the bird show, dolphin show... and some acrobatic show.. its amazing..we went with my five years old daughter, so we dont really play much, as most of the rides are for teenager and adult...but my daughter enjoyed those shows, cable car and the grand aquarium....and the panda, etci suggest those family with yound children, you plan your way before... so you dont have waste your time walk to the whole park, cos its sooo very big... much bigger than disneyland...so for family with yound children i think can just see the shows, cable car is beautiful... the aquarium..food in there is ok too.. i ate the spicy beef noodle at the panda cafe and its nice...buy your ticket at admiralty mtr, its cheaper....we from tsim tsa shui took mtr to admiralty, just one stop and then took the 629bus to ocean park... it was a good ride and cheaper...

Ocean Park. Ocean Park was brilliant. It is built on a mountain, the scenery was beautiful whilst eating your lunch overlooking the beautiful blue sea. The animals were excellent and everywhere was spotless. Definately worth going.

Ocean of people; Park your money elsewhere. To achieve a good balance, every tourist attraction should come with not just the good stuff but also visitor warning. Ocean Park's warning should read: Beware of brash, rude, loud, uncouth tourists who have no qualms of barging and cutting queues. With a pat-on-the-back smile for having behaved that way.My family and I arrived on a weekday morning at 11am hoping to beat the heat and the queue. The crowd was still mangeable, with computerized signs at queues indicating expected waiting time, which is useful. We went to several shows and exhibits before lunch.The crowd increased significantly after lunch where hordes of tourists were flooding into the popular attractions. We were prepared to wait 30 mins to get into the Grand Aquarium. The snaking queue was orderly at first with a few trying their luck to nudge ahead of you while moving along. And the deafening noise from the chatter and shouting! Without warning, a few of them decided that it was fun/right to crawl under the flimsy barrier to cut lines of queue. They scoffed and laughed at the sign that read "Please do not cut queue". Once someone saw someone cut queue the floodgates opened. Groups of people followed suit and soon people around us were pushing and shouting. We were pushed from all directions and my elderly parents had to fend for themselves when we were separated. Having decided we could not take such an incredible, we crawled under barrier and exited the queue.There was absolutely no decency in the way a good portion of the tourist behaved and the best part of our visit was us leaving the place. You are way better off spending your US$41/S$51 per person elsewhere. Do yourself a favour and treat yourself to a good meal elsewhere instead.

Full of rude tourists from China that cut in line. The park itself is very nice but tourists from mainland China tried to cut in line constantly. We enjoyed the day but the employees should really focus on making sure the rules are the same for all visitors.

Lovely place.. My first visit is in 2005 and I fall in love with this place. Its awesome. On my first visit to Hongkong, I missed Disney land and visit Ocean park as per my ittenary. Rides, location, price, quality, food, everything is just great. A must visit attraction, its a hongkong own park. I really miss this place. My last visit is in 2010.

good but spoiled by crushes. Good park in a great location. Fantastic aquarium, good rides. The day was spoiled by the behaviour of large groups of coach parties when "queuing". To protect my children I had to hold on to supports and hold back the tide of people pushing from behind. It was quite scary. If we were to go back, we'd get there as early as possible and finish earlier.

Giant pandas awesome but go early. We only visited the park to see the giant pandas but were positively surprised at how great it was. Cable car ride was spectacular. Sea horse exhibition was amazing. North and South Pole adventures has great animals. Our advice is to go early when it opens at 10 am - by mid afternoon/early evening it gets really crowded with crowds that don't appreciate the etiquette of queuing! Well worth a visit. Food was not good unless you like dim sum, very average fast food and dim sum so I would take a packed lunch.

Don't miss the pandas!. Visited here on our first day in Hong Kong and was pleasantly suprised. The wildlife experiences, especially the pandas, were fantastic! We found some of the rides a bit wild and lacking in stories but that might be us being used to Disney. Don't miss the pandas and the cable car.

PANDA & PENGUIN. yeah, i come here just to show my son real Panda and Penguin because we never see it before. ocean park is like people park, the entry ticket is not expensive, you can see many animals here. there is also cable car and many attraction. the park is huge and clean, its good but dont expect too much. many restaurant at the "old Hongkong" but only a few chair and table so you have to wait until other people finish their eat.
lot of walking. lot of walking in the hill. heavily crowded and poorly managed. not much of fun except for one dolphin show.

Cant do everything in a one day visit!. We made use of the star ferry and 629 bus to reach Ocean Park at 10am opening time. Hordes of people seemed to disappear via the train to the other side of the park. We stayed to enjoy the panda's, asian animals, sea lion show, and goldfish exhibits...we also had lunch in Neptune's (see review) and saw the aquarium. We opted to head over the other side via cable car and soak up the fresh air and wonderful views. The other side of the park gets extremely crowded but we still took in the rainforest exhibit, penguins, and ocean theatre dolphin show. PLAN WELL AHEAD for the dolphins as the venue will overflow the available capacity. Show seemed to be in Chinese although we didnt mind as we didnt come for the commentary. There's a heap of rides some of which we would have loved to try...but as it was, just doing the above saw us back in the queue for the cable car ride back at 6pm...a full day indeed! Loved the Old Hong Kong street! Needless to say we caught one of the last buses back to Central before hopping the MTR back to TST and finally reached our hotel by 8.30pm. I would suggest completing the other side of the park early in the day as you might avoid some of the afternoon crowds...and they are MAJOR crowds. Dunno about best theme park in the world...but it's certainly worth a visit

Definitely better than Disneyland!. Located just 10 minutes on the bus from Admiralty, Ocean Park is really convenient. We visited with our 5-year old daughter and we all really enjoyed our time there! We saw one of the pandas, the red panda, an otter frolicking in the water, penguins and Arctic foxes. The Goldfish pavilion is simply beautiful. When asked, my daughter said she loved Ocean Park more than Disneyland.We will definitely go back on our next trip!

Enjoyable Day. Have been to Ocean Park three times now, most recently for my daughter's 10th birthday. Overall the facilities are very good. There's a reasonable selection of rides to suit all ages (though this isn't the place for hard core thrill seekers) and the ocean scenery is spectacular. Need the whole day to get through things and definitely do not go during Chinese National holidays. Food is poor but not as bad as HK Disneyland.

Better than Disneyland. A good place for both adult and kids to visit. Lots of marine life and animals to see. But I heard that April is the mating season for panda so you won't be able to see them now Some local touch which is a plus. Down side is that it is a bit crowded with too many mainlanders. Must see the dolphin show and ride on the cable car. If you want cheap food there is a McD

Best Theme Park in The World. anyone who wrote a bad review of this is seriously in need of tickling hard because they must be a right old misery gutstheres something for everyone here be it hot air balloons rides that go off a cliff over the sea and back and cable cars that are either scary as hell or peaceful and serene depending on how chicken you are (i was the chicken) i love this place and want to take my daughter here because its an experience you never forget

Let's celebrate your next birthday at Ocean Park. I am not kidding, let's plan to celebrate your next birthday (with your friends and family) at Ocean Park, if you are the holder of the Hong Kong Identity Card ; as you would be enjoying free entry to this one of the best Theme Park and with Live animals in Asia and in the World on your Big day.Pandas, Penguins, Dolphins, Whales, Sharks, Jelly Fish, Seals, Sea Cucumbers, Sea Urchins, Sea Horses, Rare types of Fish...............you named it..............all are waiting for you to visit them, inhabited in the vividly designed water spots and environment.You may take a ride via the Ocean Express (train) or you can travel by the Cable Car to enjoy the spectacular views of the sea to the other side of the Island within Ocean Park. There, you can enjoy the ecstasy of riding on the roller coasters or other exciting games in the Amusement Park.I think the best way to describe Ocean Park is to keep yourself fully entertaining under a delightful, high tech & lively environment, with variety & with many lovely & friendly & amazing animals (both land and sea's) surrounding you ; it's really worthwhile to go there and enjoy such a unique & relaxing moment via your own personal experience.P.S. Do visit and have lunch at the restaurant within the Penguin House, it's really yummy, not expensive and you can watch the feeding of the penguins on live, at some specific time slots.At least once in your life time, to visit Ocean Park of Hong Kong, come come come !!!!!!!!!

Lots of sea animals. This is a good place for young kids and teens. The young kids will find the aquarium, pandas, dolphins amazing and the teens will be excited by the adrenalin bursting rides. Entrance fee is reasonable. Try to avoid visiting during Chinese national holidays. It can get overcrowded with people jumping queues although Ocean Park staff are constantly on the alert and will stop this happening.
Can't finish within a day. Just before taking cable car, you must try all those traditional Hong Kong snack, spacy fish ball, pork bun, fried noodle.....though it not cheap but worth to try, yummy!
Excellent!. One day was not enough for me to visit to while park even during low peak season. If possible, reserve more time to explore this wonderful park.

Worth spending the whole day with the family. We spent the whole day at this park, enjoyed the cable car rides, the Panda Bears, and the animal shows (sea lion, dolphin). Definitely a great place for the family to enjoy and relax at the same time

Only one problem. Ocean Park has an impressive variety of attractions, something for anyone of all ages. You can "swim" with the dolphins if you want to do that. It is easy to reach by public transport, and not as expensive as Disneyland. So what's the problem? It's way, way too crowded. Hong Kong has become a magnet for visitors from Mainland China, and every one of them wants to see Ocean Park. It's best to go when the weather is at its worst--that might slim down the crowds somewhat, though not much. If you can't tolerate crowds, don't go.

Wonderful for everyone. It's a place where everyone from baby to elderly would like to visit. You can have exciting games like roller coaster or you can visit the places where penguin, panda, dolphins reside. The view of Deep Water Bay and the ocean is beautiful and astonished. The only drawback would be there're always crowds so you may need to queue up for games and food!

Great Family Outing. Ocean Park is full of fun for family. It is a combination of amusement parks (with games), a world class aquarium and a small zoo (the four pandas are the highlights!). There are also many animal performance (by dolphins, seals and birds). It is good for a full day visit. But the catering there is very expensive so bring your own!

A place for all ages. If you are coming with a family, this is the place for you. It has something to offer for people of any age. Ocean animals, pandas, thrill rides and the cable car ride will make your visit memorable.

Incredible Ocean Park.One of the world largest aquarium!. I love Ocean Park.It has lots of my favourite animals there.Recently they newly open a penguin stadium with lots of lovely little ones living there!It's very easy access to the Park,just take the tube to the ADMIRALTY station and then gets off.Go up to the ground looking for a bus straight to the Ocean Park.Bus ride about 20 mins will be the entrance of the park and is a terminate stop.It's nice everywhere except a bit crowded with the Mainland Chinese tourists there.However,you can enjoy it the most and the Hong Kong government is building up a tube station at the Ocean Park in the coming days and the Park is projecting to build a hotel.So,it is getting better for everything.

Ocean Park, not to be missed!. Go early and stay late!!!Cable car ride over the mountain! Submarine ride through the mountain! A world-class aquarium! A spectacular panda preserve! Amusement rides to satisfy all ages!

Amazing experience with everything to all ages. Acturally, I work in here, but this is an unbiased review, and no commercial too. I can bet no other animals can be as lovely as the giant pandas. They are helding 4 pandas with the oldest 36 yrs old giant panda JiaJia in the world. She is still very healthy.Beside, they have many amazingExhibitions to show other animals, like the rainforest, aquarium and dolphins show,etc. And more are coming like sharks and korala.In addition, they have rides for all ages. roller coaster, cable cars and many others.The park are very rarely divided into two parts and connected with both a train called ocean express or cable cars.One last reminder is don't forget to pre-booking the encounter programs if u want to get closer to the animals.

All together for a good day.. Zoo and a theme park, great day out, good chance to see the pandas, aquarium is fantastic.
Stay late and you will see the fire show!!

A fun day had by all. A great day full of rides,shows and displays. Well worth the entry cost . Food bit ordinary. Would recommend it to others. Both husband and I are 48 & 52 and we had a great time.

Great day ! fun -filled day. i went with couple of my friends and her baby. it's so much fun even thought we are with an infant. i was especially fascinated by the panda! i suggest to visit ocean park during week day, avoid sat and Sunday and especially public holiday!
Not bad. Expensive but they have 4 pandas!!! Amazing to see and the aquarium was very good too. Apart from that it was a big theme park.

Our ocean friends.... Pandas, sealions, walrus, turtles, dolphins, foxes and penguins. So cute! Highly recommend the hair-raiser rollercoaster, you don't often get to do loop the loops over the edge of a mountain and the views are stunning!

Family fun. Great for little kids. It isn't as easy to get around as Disney but it is worth the effort. Something here for all the family and all age groups. White Knuckle rides for the adults and a (new?) smaller kids section with bouncy castles and mini rides as well as a really good soft play style play park. The animals, birds, fish, pandas etc are a great experience too.

Ocean Park. Hadn't been there for many years but took a visitor for the adventure. The aquarium is wonderful and the looks on children's faces worth a million dollars. Very clean, but gift shops are a wee bit overpriced.

"cable cars & exciting rides". 1. Admission fee of 320 hkd. Best buy it at any 7-11 stores to save from lining up and price is just the same.2. Take the Citybus route 629 at Admiralty MTR station(follow signs for direction),this bus stops directly at the entrance of the park.Just swipe you octopus card to pay!3. Cable cars,escalator and a ocean express(train) are the mode of transportation within the park.The park is divided into (1)THE WATERFRONT; where the animals and the grand aquarium are located and basically it is the main entrance,it opens from 10:00am-7:00pm (2)THE SUMMIT; where the exciting rides and adventures are located and the ocean theater as well,it closes at 6:00pm.The park outside is beautiful,they have a dancing fountain.The Grand Aquarium is fantastic,they have the largest STING RAYS i've ever seen in my life!!Cable car ride is one of a lifetime experience but the queue is about 20-30mins,it's a big wow & worth the wait though! Dolphin and sea lion show at Ocean Theater was a SPECTACULAR, do come a bit earlier because it becomes full so quick!!

Best day from our trip to HK. Travelled as a 18 year old couple and had the best time at Ocean Park! The Park itself is situated right by Clear Water Bay and Aberdeen, so you have breathtaking scenic ocean views while on the rollercoasters. There is a selection of rides to fit all different age groups which is nice. The Theme Park also includes Panda exihbition and other animals aswell as an aquarium. The also have a dolphin show- did not see though as do not believe in Dolphin Captivity. Saw posters for an up and coming shark arena too. Ocean Park is split into 2 parts and are connected either by a cable car (great views!) or a train. Food and drinks were not too overly price either. Had such an amazing time here! Really recommend.
good place. very good place to visit.lots of people in the Ocean Park.I like everything there, the Hongkong people are nice ,when i lost my way,they always help me ,Iam sure you will not regret

Good old Ocean Park. My first time to Ocean Park was some 20 years ago. I still enjoyed my afternoon there recently. We bought our tickets from the tourist office and got a discounted rate. Board the public bus (629) at Admiralty station on Hong Kong Island - it is very easy to get there. The Park is a combination of a theme park with rides, a mini-zoo with selected birds and wild life and a museum showcasing Hong Kong in the early days through some old shop facades on old Hong Kong Street. Have a meal at the Terrace Cafe and take in the beautiful view of the ocean, with the string of cable cars fighting for attention. End the day by taking the iconic cable car down from the restaurant. It is still worth a visit.

Expected a lot more. We spent the whole day at Ocean Park and we were a little disappointed. It was so busy with bus loads of mainland Chinese queue jumping and pushing in all day, by the end of the day we were telling them to get to the end of the line..infuriating! The queues for all rides were 30-45 minutes, food not the best and as mentioned not many places to rest weary feet.Pro's: cable car ride, view from summit, the rides were good, once you got onto them.Con's: long queues and waiting times, not enough sitting areas, not a great variety if food, animal enclosures/ aquarium were ok but not great.My tip for visiting would be to try to pick a day that isn't busy as it is absolute madness, especially when visiting with young children.

Something for Everyone. After a few wet days the sun came out and off to Ocean Park we went. Purchased our tickets at the seven 11 saved lining up. The aquarium was first class and the panda was awake which was a treat. It was a long queue for the cable car but wow what a ride. The view back to Deepwater and Repulse Bays were spectacular. What I really liked about this place was that there was something for everyone and it was nice to see whole families out enjoying the day.

An Ok Time. I only gave this park a 4 rating due to seeing the Pandas. The rest of the park was a little disappointing due to not enough sitting available through out the park, cafés/restaurants, and not a large number of rides. The food places were all busy and mainly Asian food. If you had kids that don't like Asian food there wasn't much else to choose from. There were very few refreshment places around. The park is very limited in the attractions and animals. My highlight was seeing the Pandas. We were lucky enough to have our hotel do a shuttle service to the park. They are in the middle of building the MTR. There are tours to the park if need be. Overall it was ok, but I wouldn't race to see it again.

oceanpark. head up first then go down at the very most 3hrs before closing or else you'll end up in a massive crowd of people and long lines.dont miss the 7pm show in the fountain area, its great. the food in old hk isn't good. just taste it for the experience. we spent the whole day and we couldn't see everything. you probably need 2 days to see everything. there's a very long escalator there like in the peak. many areas lead back to where you came, you need a map to explore properly.lots of mainlanders not lining up.dont let them pass.

Good place to spend a day with kids. The place offers value for money, especially if you have a full day to spend. There were ride options for all age groups and the Cable Car is extremely exciting. The food options are very limited and are pork-beef base as with all Chinese food (suggest you carry picnic lunch boxes). Please check weather before you go - avoid rainy days!

Thoroughly enjoyable. . Ocean park was THE most enjoyable part of our recent trip to hong kong. While the rides were average, and a couple of the big rides were closed for maintenance on the day of our visit, it was the number and variety of animal shows and exhibits that made the trip so great.The pandas were so cute, the jellyfish mesmerizing ... the polar bears and other arctic animals were interesting to see frolicking around.The animals appeared really well looked after, with good-sized enclosures, and lots of toys and interactive equipment inside all the enclosures. Lots of zoos around the world could leatn a thing or two from ocean park, in terms of how their animals should be housed and looked after.Visiting midweek, queues were minimal for everything we went on, with the longest being about 15 minutes for one of the roller coasters.Dining options were a bit limited, but then again, we weren't there for the food, so that didn't detract from the experience at all.We even adopted a couple of plush penguins from the gift shop, really soft and adorable; my wife claimed they kept begging "take me home, take me home" every time we walked past ~~~

if you have more than 3 days.. you must go there :-). I was meant to go there the first time i was in Hong Kong but i didn't have so much spare time..i could go finally last november 2013, the best way is to get Ocean Park bus from MTR Admiralty Station Exit B(but hey they are building a mrt station just in front of ocean park so probably in 1 year or less it'll be done !) bus ride is about 20 minutes(without traffic.. ) ! Once there is really amazing the choice of entertainment.. seriously is HUGE and i was there in the early morning (10 am at entrance) and it took me the entire day to get on most ( but not all ) the attractions!AVOID sunday or special holidays.. i went there on monday and cause of the queues i've lost lots of time.. but if you go on sunday expect the entire city of Hong Kong there :-Pi'd go there again cause was such a beautiful day.. one thing not to miss is the cable car(long queue) .. you got to see one of the best view !!!

Watch "The Cove". Before anyone goes to an aquarium I recommend they watch The Cove. A disturbing documentary revealing how dolphins are caught and what happens to the ones that are not chosen for captivity.

Great Park!!. So much to do and really need more than a day to do everythingQuite a big area to navigate too as on a hill so prepare for a fair bit of walking..and queues at busy times, including the cable car & monorail going up and down the hill...although monorail seems to be quicker if not as exciting!!Great to see the gorgeous Pandas too

So good, they wont LET you leave. Decided to come here rather than Hong Kong Disney since it seemed better suited to older guests.If you like theme parks you'll love this park. There aren't a lot of high adrenaline rides (and while I was there one of them was under maintenance), but they're pretty spread out so you can explore the park at your leisure, while checking out the animals and shows.Seen some reviews that state the animals are being mistreated - got to say while I was there I didn't see anything of the sort. Frankly this was the best treatment of animals I'd seen while in China - decent sized enclosures, things for the animals to interact and exercise with, no over handling, more places in China should be treating their animals like this.My 2 biggest vices - the animal shows are very 'meh'. On the one hand, most of the animals aren't doing tricks, which I approve of, on the other, the shows aren't very engaging even for children. Secondly, the only way to get into the main area of the park is by ride. Either the cable car or the Ocean Express train. In the morning that's fine - by the evening? Be prepared to wait up to an hour just to get out of the park while everyone tries to get back to the front area for the nightly light show.

A messy layout. We enjoyed our day at ocean park but the layout is certainly not the best of the theme parks we have been to. There are so many steep, steep hills and escalators (thank goodness) to walk to get to everywhere around the park. The giant pandas were gorgeous and special to see for us Aussies. Some of the rides were good but nothing special or different to the rides at dreamworld in Australia. The dolphin show was terrible and we got up and left after 20 minutes. I think it was because they repeated everything in 2 languages. Nice to cater for us but it made it slow and boring to watch. Given the layout and all the walking there is to get to everything we wouldn't go again on our next visit to Hong Kong. Maybe when our children are older, a lot older and they will happy enough with the hours of walking.

When the Ocean meet the Park. - big theme park with so many game for child and adult, not for infant.- i was came in low season in weekday so not so crowded we can get many attraction & game just queued 10 minutes.- there is drinking water tap in some toilet area.- panda, seal (sea lion), pinguin, china golden fish was amazing, especially the walrus soo fabulous big.

wow place. a great full day adventure park for children as well adults.so many rides to do the time gets short.lot of eating places great crowd. just be sure to remember the arrival bus parking because the exit is on the other side. what a hill climbing cable ride and train down the hill.this was the best place to visit in hong kong.the park is located up and down on a hillock evereywhere. so clean beautiful it is.great dolphin show and be sure to inquire about the show time before starting uphill rides and be seated atleast 30 mins prior to get a good seat otherwise far away seats are not so exciting.a must visit on this tour
Terrible. Horrible abuse of aninmals there! DO NOT GO! Very little to do, poor food and crumby gift shops, which you not except from the sky high entry fees

Nice place, but very tiring. cable cars are always jammed packrides are superb though it is very tiring to shift to another place to another.i am not a fan of the aquariumsit is always jammed pack with touristnot for old people

Nice theme park. The place has a variety of rides and attractions. Although the aquariums are small compared to other oceanariums, other attractions will make up for it. you can choose the express train which has a cool underwater themed media or the exciting cable car for going to different sections of the park. Most of the rides have height restrictions. I think i saw a mtr station under construction which will bring you directly to the park. Highly recommended for first timers in Hongkong.

Spend whole day from morning to evening. Got the Ocean Park ticket in Chung King Mansion or inside the guest house we stayed,there are discount 30HKD for each ticket.We took metro for 1 station and reach Admiralty,there are sign board,and we choose Exit B for Ocean Park shuttle bus,there are lot of people waiting over there in morning,and there are place for game and sight-seeing,cable car,we feel exhausted after the whole day in the park.

good park with lot of attractions. here we have spent only half day. the cable car ride was a wonderful experience. but had to wait in a long queue. they had show in their amphitheater which was good. here the park is divided into lot of good segments each of which is separately chargeable. this makes it an expensive visit. you get a good view from bay view restaurant which is located near the cable car drop point.

Not for young children unless european heights. Our 4 and 6 y.o missed a lot of the rides.. there were more than 20 of those I guess and they can only get on about 2-3 only. Dolphin show was ok but not amazing.. close encounter with animals were interesting but only for children age 8 and above...such a waste..People in HK esp the locals hard found warm to others perhaps it is their culture but i supposed there is nothing wrong if in places with travellers attraction employees train to be more warm and friendly and more helpful in giving direction. Obviously Jacky Chan did not represent the "real" Hongkie...I wish we did not put OP into our list so that we have more time to explore buses and ferry and trams

Rides from thrill seekers to small children well set out and good fun. Many varied levels and types of rides. The cable car has great views and many different places to eat and rest . Great for viewing the pandas

A full day well spent. Park in the south part of the Hong Kong island with access by bus number 629 from Admiralty MTR Station ($ 10 dollar HKG) where you can also purchase tickets in advance. Some queues are inevitable (you are in China) for worthy attractions, especially the coasters at different angles of the bay and the ocean, as well the cable car.

Symbio Show, a must watch. When you get to the park, start immediately from "The Summit" (the top part of the park where you reach with Cable Car or the Ocean Express train) as it closes first at 18:00 before "The Waterfront" which closes at 19:00. We reached at 11:30 (park opens at 10:30) and we could not visit all rides because we spend more time at the Waterfront, especially the Aquarium. Go through the Aquarium very fast, it wasn't that great as I expected. Lunch we had from Bayview restaurant, located at the summit stop of cable car. Food I'll rate from 4-4.5 and the place was not really clean, may be it was late in the afternoon, but the view outside was amazing. Try to sit at any of the corner where you will have view on both sides. The best ride for me was the "Hair Raiser" at the "Thrill Mountain". The location of the "Adventure Land" was a bit awkward, had to walk a lot. The park visit ended with the Symbio show at the Waterfront, its a must watch. Try not to stay close to the fountain as this show has some fireworks which might deafen you, if you are very near to the detonator, and the fire will make you feel like you are in a sauna. This is the only show we were able to see and also missed the rollercoaster ride "The Dragon". One day wasn't enough, so I suggest you to be there when the park opens itself at 10:30.

This place just keeps getting better. There has been a real push of late, to make this something special for Hong Kong, and its impressive. The standard of entertainment is really up there, I'm a fan of the dolphin show. The sky cart ride, with its spectacular views out to the ocean, as it cuts its way through the mountain, is not to be missed. You'll understand why it's called ocean park, when you go.

Not fully landscaped. Compared to co-HK theme park (Disneyland), this caters more adults because of its more aggressive rides. Plan areas you want to see, others are FAR hike from the other - as the park is separated and reachable by either Cable Car/Tram. Due to the large land area, most parts are not furbished. REMINDER: Be sure to print ticket barcode for those bought online. Neither Customer service accepted confirmation email. I was directed to go to a local library via taxi to print (took about 30mins). At the library, there were 3 other people printing the same thing. I think this is something basic they should have.

A little disappointed. I had big expectations since a lot of people said that this is the best amusement park in Hongkong. The rides, undoubtedly, are interesting. Some of them are thrilling and I don't even have the guts to ride them. But I don't fancy the aquarium. I think it's still too small and mediocre. I also saw the giant panda exhibition, and imagine how surprised I am to only see 3 pandas at the building. I can even see a lot more at the zoos in Indonesia. I'm impressed to know that the cable cars and express train are available inside the park, though. It is very helpful to prevent yourself from getting too tired because the park sure is big. The view from the cable car was also stunning! However, you have to be patient because I had to wait for 30 minutes to get into the cable car.. you will definitely wait longer during weekends. Ocean park was fun and enjoyable. Maybe I just had too many expectations and maybe I didn't get the chance to explore it more. If you want to get the whole "tourist experience", you better visit it. But if you don't really fancy amusement parks, I suggest to save your 380 HKD and spend it somewhere else. And for muslim visitors, there are 1 halal restaurant inside the park. I still suggest you to bring your own food and eat at the dining tables inside, since the halal restaurant is not so easy to find. There are praying rooms inside as well, you just have to contact the information centre to get more info about the location.
Great theme park. Good value, amazing setting on the south of Hong Kong. Good variety of rides and the water park is good too

Better than Disney for adult. Entrance fee includes all rides and eventually should be a whole day program. It has some scary rides such Hair Raiser and Flash that must not miss. You may avail cable car over there and park is open until 7'o clock of evening. Bus 629 is the best way to go there from Admiralty MTR station. Usually in weekend there is huge queue in every rides.
Unique park - youll need a full day. Had a great day. Avoided the rides completely and focused on seeing the wildlife and that took from 12pm to 5.30pm.. great place for young and old.

Go but do not expect much. The park is even better to see the Giant Panda and the aquarium. The amusements are very weak but it depends on your experience in parks of this kind. I do not regret it and liked it, it was a day well spent.

What can I say...... This place are just awesome. Very big area with lotsa interesting theme. Tried the roller coaster & cable car that passes at the edge of the hill. Pretty cool scenery. A must place to visit when in HK!!!!

So much fun. My wife and I had the best time here even if the weather was not the best. The dolphin exhibit was excellent and the only ride that we went on was so much fun it was like we were young again. The food places need to improve as they were overpriced and not very eatable.

Bigger than expected. I wasn't sure what to expect, but I liked the combination of both animal attractions and also the rides.
It is a huge park. It was ashame that the Panda was asleep when we were there.
Ocean Park. Lovely place for children and adults, roomy, different things to see, lots of animals including a Giant Panda. Children friendly, is a little hilly to walk around. Great day out though

Fun for the family. Great fun place to spend the full day. Lots of activities and the cable car that takes you to the other side of the mountain is great. The Giant pandas are a must as well as the two aquariums.

Its just too good!. It is a place where you going to spend a whole day visiting. They have marine park, theme park and even performances that surprise you all the time. The food is relatively expensive and I found that the cheapest food is still McDonald XD. The theme park is just exciting and be warned that if you are having a heart problem don't ever try their roller coaster. It's damn awesome and people keep shouting when they are on it.Bring your kids here and they will learn a lot in the Marine Park. The performance at night time in the man-made lake is also awesome. Worth to visit even if you know the entrance fee is going to burn your pocket.

Worth the visit.. Returned to this Theme Park after many years. Took MTR to Admiralty Station, Exit B. Then boarded bus 629 direct to destination. Entrance fee HK$290 per pax. Nice place to visit. The weather was nice too. Cool and windy. Spent 4 hours inside the park. Got chance to view the Pandas too. Unable to take cable car (fee included) due to strong wind. Understand, need to wait half an hour during weekday . Imagine longer Q weekend. Worth the visit!

Great Place for all ages. Exciting place for all ages. The rides are great - the cable car is a must. The collection of species is superb. The panda is the biggest attraction. Good dining joints (though slightly expensive).
Fun, fun, fun. Brilliant fun if you enjoy gut renching rides or just watching a dolphin. The gondala ride to the summit is breath taking and a must.

My son and husband had a great time in this place!. We got our tickets at the MTR station (admiralty) it was cheaper than if you purchase it in Ocean Park. Visit the Grand Aquarium and also the North and South Pole Spectacular, your children will enjoy looking at the seals and penguins and including the very large walrus. :)

WELL-MAINTAINED. don't really have a specific comment here. My first experience with this park was at the age of 10-11, then 16. There were a lot more now, the polar adventures, the penguins were great. A couple of pandas were cute. The cable car was still there, a bit scary with strong wind. They added the "ocean express" which was the train taking you between the old and the new zones. It was good! No long queue.There was also this Old China Town around the entrance of the cable car. There were food stalls selling fish balls, dim sum and buns. Not bad.What's supposed to be the highlight like the fish tank was a bit disappointing. Quite old and not that impressive.Saw the poster advertising that the Koalas are coming. should be good!

Brilliant. This park is simply magnificent with plenty of things to do for all ages and many rides, and animals to see. Must visit the pandas and take many photo opportunities. Would suggest starting at the top, go via cable car then come back down via train to get both experiences. There is lots to see and do, just beware when it is busy queing times can be long for rides and the train back is a free for all....it's madness. This should not ruin your day here though it is lovely and a great day trip.

thrilling experience. We had a lovely time and our children didnt want to cum out.The rides were ok but the place is worth going around.Had a funfilling day but tired walking as it is a very large place.The aquarium was amazing.Have got life long memories.Thanks once again Jet for flying us Hongkong.
Average theme park. This theme park is an average theme park with lots of rides. The sign boards indicating directions are very confusing.

Too crowded. The ocean park is nice. Lots of sea creatures for kids and adult to explore. There's lot of rides. Adult or kiddie ride. The only thing I don't like is too crowded. When we went there. The line is terribly crazy. Too much time wasted just to fall in line. Most of the crowd I think from china. So they kept on cutting the line. Pushing. Talking with very loud voice. Stepping on your foot without saying sorry. I advice before going to the any theme park in Hong Kong be sure to check the holiday dates in china. So you will really enjoy your vacation without too much crowd.

A great day all around at Ocean Park. I visited Ocean Park on my last day in Hong Kong as I had a 20:00 hr flight out. I had checked my luggage in at Central at 9:00 am and headed to Ocean Park. It took about 40 minutes by local bus to get there. The park was very busy by 11:00 am. Most of the good rides had 45 minute plus waits. However, the lines were moving and there was plenty of other options like shows, aquarium the monorail and cable car to keep you busy. There was plenty of food and drink stands and a scenic restaurant attached to the aquarium. Allow plenty of time to exit the park (allow an hour) to get from the far end of the park to get to the Exit/Entrance and another hour to get back to Central plus the Airport Express train to the Airport if departing on the same same day. I had a good time there but wished I has more time.

The best day in Hong Kong. We really enjoyed the day at the Ocean Park! If only we had come earlier in the morning. There was so much to see and experience that we didn't have time for everything. The aquarium was amazing, but we liked seeing all the other animals too. And they seemed to have quite nice facilities. Ocean Park also seems to be interested on environmental issues.There were enough bathrooms all around. We ate at the Bayview Restaurant and the food there was good. We were there during the week and the day was cloudy so there were not that many people. I suppose the place is like hell on sunny weekends.A few tips: To get there with public transportation go to the Admirality MTR station. There are signs to the bus stop and the buses go non-stop. On the park we suggest to start on The Summit side. Most people go through The Waterfront side first and then The Summit so the crowds move at the same time. The Summit side attractions also close an hour earlier. The lines to the Cable Car were ridiculous on both sides even on a slow day so we used the Ocean Express.

MAKE THIS PLACE ON THE 8TH OUT OF 10 PLACES TO SEE IN HONG KONG. If you're used to a big aquarium like in Monterey or the one in Las Vegas you won't like Ocean Park Aquarium. If you think you have to go because there are rides, not worth as they have limited rides only. If you want to see more animals, you can see it in all the zoo where ever you go. Maybe you want to see Panda in real, then yes - this is a place. But not worth for the high fees, expensive snacks, expensive picture taken on their booth will cost you $30 to $50 with mugs or whatever promo they have.  If you have a list of 10 places to go in Hong Kong, then make it on 8th and it's up to you if you will pursue to go. My opinion, it's not worth at all.

Amazing! Perfect for all!. The main attraction of this ocean park is the amazing dolphin show. The grand aquarium and the polar adventure are very informative. The different varieties of goldfish add a value to this park. Its a must watch tourist attraction in hong kong.
