Thrilling to the Core.... Make sure you get to the park nice and early as you will surely want to repeat a few rides... Make sure you avaoid school holidays to minimize your time spent in a que. The park has attractions for both the young and old.. You can afford to take a DSLR and a tripod along with you to capture the memories.. The staff are very friendly and coorporative...

Don't expect too much. The only thing bad I experienced was the food. It's very pricey and not for everyone or tourists who don't like chinese food. I wanted to take my money back. The pictures took by the Staff were pricey too. But the train ride and the rides were all so amazing. I rode every ride there (except the kiddie ones) and it did not disappoint. Fast and exciting. The views were amazing even if you're on their rollercoasters. Definitely recommending this place to anyone who wants to go to Hongkong. :)

Not so impressive!. When I visited it in the mid 1990s, it was really impressive. Given today's technology, it left me wondering what happened. It was definitely left behind.The aquarium was disappointing and the foods were even a bigger disappointment. Too pricy, mostly Chinese and not inviting at all.The things i loved were the panda show, the cable car, the fountain and the landscaping.We arrived at 13:00 and when we were leaving four hours later, it got too crowded. It was hard getting to the exit.I hope by the time I come back with the kids, in a year or two, that improvements are done to place it back on the map.

Something for everyone. Rides for all ages. The water ride is hilarious because some people are not prepared to fork over the $40HKD for rain jackets. You will get wet because there are a couple of water gun stations that are always manned. That's right - you can have fun by spraying water on others. If you aren't into rides the animals should entertain you especially the pandas. The numerous aquariums provide great viewing angles. The dolphin show was good but short.The gondola ride over the mountain provides a great view. For those with fear of heights and want a faster ride the tunnel train is another option.Food is overpriced and not that great. Avoid the crowds and get started in the morning on weekdays. I went on a Wednesday and there were very short lineups.You may want to stay at a hotel that has a shuttle to the park.

Hong Kong Ocean Park - Marvellous Adventure. Great time spent with friends! Lots of great pictures, time flies there. Could recommend visiting it to those looking for the relaxing and off bound weekend

You Need a Full Day. Incredible set up and plenty to do for all ages. Good dining facilities, from restaurants to snack foods everywhere. Was worth the money as the entry ticket covers all areas of this massive complex. Souvenirs on every corner of each exhibit. The only let down is the long, horrible wait for a chair lift back down the mountain. A pity they cannot move more people quicker so be prepared for 1-2 hour wait when returning down on the cable car. Overall, a fun day.

2nd to the other theme Park but not sure why?. Living in the shadows of Disneyland, Ocean Park stands by itself...lots of similarity to Disney, at a little cheaper price. Don't be fooled into thinking this is a cheap rip off, this was built first (1977) they are for ever improving it, unfortunately on our visit in 2009 there was construction work being carried out as I believe they were building several new attractions. As we had sampled two days at Disney, Ocean Park paled in significance. The kids really enjoyed, we adults did too, probably due to it not being as busy as Disneyland. Ocean Park has its own mascot/Characters, each one just as cute as Disney. the photos are on a par with Disney and it cost me another $700... all in all worth a visit, to be honest if you was to try one and not the other, then you would not be disappointed with Ocean Park.. Thumbs up
Ocean Park. Had a great time with all the rides. My kids enjoyed our 1day tour to this place and I still want to come back to this place over and over again

A really good aquarium experience. This was the second best place to visit after HK Disneyland according to my granddaughters. For me this was so much better, more to see and do for someone who is 62 not 15.I enjoyed the aquarium and the fountain display in the main lagoon. The food choices were reasonable and not too expensive.To get there is very easy, we went via Admiralty MTR station, followed the signs and joined the ticket queue.The one disappointment were the pandas, both feamles were in their dens, both males were outside, one was asleep. The other paced his cage and it was distressing to see.The characters they had dotted around the park (Halloween) were great and we all enjoyed their antics and the interactions we had. They made a good day so MUCH better.If you have a day to spare then this is a good use of your time. If you want a contrast to the commercialism that is Disneyland, then this is also the place for you.Enjoy, we did
Great park. A fantastic park to visit,lots to do with average food.The cable car is a must unless you are afraid of heights.

Exciting visit at HK Ocean Park. Went there last November 2013 with friends. Enjoyed the marine exhibits, plus the recreation of Old Hong Kong. But the crowning glory was the cable car ride! The shops also had an excellent selection of bags, trinkets, and other souvenirs. The food was ok. The views from the hilltop were breathtaking. Overall a must-see in Hong Kong!

A great day!. We went there on a weekday, which ended up being a cloudy day. This was perfect as the weather was just perfect, not too warm, not too cold.We were looking forward to seeing the pandas, however were a little disappointed that they weren't out of their back room. I was later told that they do not come out as much, but you may get lucky to catch them. We did catch one who kept coming out and doing a little lap around his den, then going back in.The large aquarium is just amazing and beautiful. Lots of fish to see, and the large viewing area is great. We also enjoyed the passage way where the fish swim over you.We took in the dolphin and seal show, which was ok. We did a couple of rides, which were also ok. We took the gondola back to the entry, which was nice, as you get a very nice view of the park and surrounding areas.We decided to eat at one of the restaurants at the top, close to the cable cars, and the food was good, however extremely expensive. We spent $500 for lunch for 3 people, including my son's plate. I'd recommend eating somewhere else, at some of the stands along the way, or the McDonald's we later found out was in the park.Overall, this was a great day and we really enjoyed ourselves. Definitely a recommended visit!

Exhilarating!. The views are spectacular especially on board the cable car. There are more extreme rides than Disneyland, not for the fainthearted. Convenient to go there on your own even without a tour guide as the transportation everywhere in HK is reliably efficient. The food are a bit pricey though and not much choice especially for the kids. The big aquarium is overwhelming. Overall, this theme park is not only for the kids but for the adults as well who seeks for thrill. Will definitely check this again when I come back to HK.

So Fun!. Went to OceanPark for the Halloween festivities and had an excellent time. The rides are fun, though lines aren't always quick moving (as in, they take forever), but despite rather limited crowd control, the park is fun. Animal exhibits and the tram/gondola ride up are also must do's!

Do not miss! A great day out!. A lovely theme park set on a mountain so with beautiful views (particular from the Mining Car Rollercoaster). We loved the aquarium and the pandas, such a nice mix to go with all the rides. Though avoid on public holidays!!! We went around Chinese New Year and there was a 45minute queue just to get into the aquarium.Very easy to get to via public transport by Metro (we went from the train / bus station Hung Hom) and then from the metro station you get a very cheap shuttle bus to the park. An awesome place to visit though you definitely need the whole day!!! and stay late as it empties out of all the familes and you can walk on the rides with practically no queueing after about 7ish.

Great Excitement. Ocean Park recently expanded about 150% of its previous size into the middle part of the mountain. The transport to Ocean park is also convenient and cheap, keep in mind to get and Octopus transport card to travel around Hong Kong, buy it at the MTR (metro). For children, grown ups, teenagers, this themepark is amazing and there are so many rides that lines are not as long as other themeparks. The price is relatively cheap, similar to other entry fees of themeparks around the world.

A place no visitor to Hong Kong should miss. The well-planned layout of the different themes in the Park as applausible. The long ride of cable car up the mountain top areas gives you a spectacular view and unusual cable car riding experience. There are action filled games, as well as a good collection of oceanic species, are entertaining for both young and old. The Panda corner is a good bonus to the visit.
Fun!. This is a good place to visit for families and kids. You need a full day trip to enjoy this theme park and remember to visit the Panda.

Eehh.. It's okay. I was thoroughly disappointed. If you are like me, you travel more for adventure and different settings. Ocean Park was wicked hyped up and recommended to me from almost every local I met. I had to go see what all the fuss was about. It's HK's version of Seaworld + an amusement park. Even on a weekday, there was long lines to get everywhere. There are animals you can see, an aquarium you can go in and also a show you can watch. The amusement park side had few rides and again long lines. It is a fun place to go with friends but for me, it was not worth all the hype. If you're bored, I guess it's better than staying in all day.

After all these years.... still love it!. I have been going to Ocean Park as long as I can remember. I was there again during the Chinese New Year. Yes, it was extra busy and you have to queue for almost everything (be prepared for sharp elbows) but i think it was worth it. Most of the package tours arrives mid-late afternoon but they are usually gone by the 4-5pm. By then, the queues for the rides are short and the exhibitions are almost empty. The new aquarium is not as good as the old one, in my opinion, but very spectacular nonetheless. I also like the walruses, but the Chinese sturgeons are very creepy.Bring a bottle of water with you as it is expensive to buy one in there. There are a number of places you can refill your bottle for free, but i can only remember the one next to the penguin enclosure. Food is ok, you can get a good size sandwich with fresh salad for hk$50. Bring some sweets and chocolate, it's a long day with lots of walking.Oh, try to go on the mine train after sunset. It was the BEST!

Good theme park which have everything. It is a good theme park which have everything you want. The adventure rides, panda and penguins seeing, the aquarium and so on. Is a great place for visit. The park divided to 2 areas and you will have to take the cable car / train get to the other side. You will for sure be attracted by the scenery there. It is amazing and beautiful which you will have a panorama view of Hong Kong which cover the sea, mountain and the city.

Worth a visit. This is HK's answer to Disney. It's quite eclectic with it's panda exhibits (2 of them), which have nothing to do with the ocean. The cable car is fabulous and the rides are pretty good, especially the newest rollercoaster at the top of the hill. The cable car up the hill usually has a long line. Take the train up and the cable car down - much faster!

Great place but better with less people. This is a really great park to bring the little ones especially in HK where there is no zoo. Kids would love it and for the grown ups, they can enjoy the rides.However, with the influx of mainlanders Chinese into Hong Kong it is often packed and this makes it very crowded and having to queue for everything. Otherwise, it's a place not to be missed in Hong Kong.

Ocean Park is a fun place for young & old people. Good place for a walk, take your children to see the aquarium, take a cable car and it will takes you from one place to the other places of the area! All in all, I loooove this place .. beware it can be very busy and please try not to go during the week-end!

The best place to be when on vacation. Will definite come back here. many wonderful things to see. spent half the day inside the grand aquarium. kids would love it as well as adults too. Rode the cable car 2 times. amazing sights. wasn't able to see all because of time constraint. Will try to go there earlier and when most people are not on vacation or not during peak season.

great time outdoor. I went to ocean park with my 18year old son.At the entrance we saw the spectacular fountain..There is a place that exhibit the two adorable pandas.The aquarium also show cases many types of fishes.The hongkong old street brought back many memories of roadside hawkers and the goodies sold..Taking the cable car up to the other adventureworld was very breathtaking.we could see the entire sea scenery.There are many rides for different age group and fun fair stalls that can win attractive prizes.The latest ride the train that can sent one up to the top of mountain uses special effects on train top to create underwater feelings.It is an enjoyable trip one must try.

the amazing rides of my life. cable cars, rides, and the what if i left "what if i tried the abyss?"budget meal inside and my ever favorite mcdonalds french fries.its the most beautiful themed park ive been to.
Big and Fun. This Ocean Park is super duper big. And not only that they are games with education together. Is about teaching the children to protect the environment.

Every penny spend can be explained.... The place has no words to explain. A life time visit, the theme park has a place for all. It turns you to a kid and I kept jumping and hoping around places. I completely lost myself for 12 hours inside the park.The lower place is a kind of live musuems, the middle park has all crazy rides and the upper park have the most attractive Dolphin & Seal show.If you have kids, its a must visit place, they will love it and will praise your greatness for taking to Oceans Park...I am so so excited even as it write this review, that's what i meant by "Every penny spend can be explained... ;)
very fun place. had panda there and the fish tank to see so many types of fish some really big ones too the cable car ride is fun and the rides ok

What a treat for the family. Make sure you have your walking shoes and you woke up with a large amount of patience for the crowds. With that being said the park is extremely efficient and the flow of people is great.Food stalls are good and the rides are nicely spread out.The shows were amazing and make sure you try the cable car and the roller coasters.... Great and tiering day out

Amazing, but not enough time. Ocean Park is an amazing experience! They are much better than Disneyland Hong Kong, and it was worth the money we paid. We went from the morning until closing time, and even though it was a very quiet day, we didn't see everything because the park is so big. If you go, I would suggest to go on a weekday, instead of a weekend to avoid long queues, and maybe go for two days so you can do things a bit more relaxed and see everything. The highlights were definitely seeing the pandas, and the light show at the end of the day. Plus, it's pretty cool to be able to go upside down on a rollercoaster and have an amazing view while doing so.

Amazing park. I visited ocean park last week, it was great experience. This park is suitable for age group , it is very big. Cable car system is amazing. very well organised. It is easy to go by bus.only bird and dolphin shows are not quiet good like singapore. but children may enjoy. unlimited fun for every one no matter what is the age.. just go enjoy it.

some thing new each time I visit. I have visited Ocean Park now a few times and each visit there is always something new to explore. This time I made a point of going in the afternoon as I wanted to stay and watch the "Symbio" Light, sound and pyrotechnics show. This show only goes for a short time but is spectacular, well worth the wait and a must see if you haven't seen it already. This was the first time I have seen the park at night and even this is a sight well worth staying for.Now several breeds of penguin and a couple of arctic foxes have joined the animal on display in the park. Be warned though that both the penguin and arctic fox areas are very cold, but on a warm day it does make a pleasant place to spend a few cooling minutes. Later this year there will be some new animals joining the menagerie when Ocean Park opens an Australian exhibition.all up Ocean Park is a great way to spend a day and a few dollars too.

Tired but Happy :). two thumbs up for this park, this park is so big, you need to ride on the cable car to go to another side of the park. there's a 2 panda stay at this park, the dolphin show is not that good, not like dolphin show in philippines. The prices of the food here is over price also the water. there's a lot of people when i visit this park, very crowded. but over all? this park is so amazing :) oh wait! the comfort room is clean :)
Nothing Special. Just like any theme park but its a really really big place. You should take the cable car for a scenic view!
great allday out stars are panda,s fun fair & lots more. nothing to dislike we where entertained all day, turn round and there was something else to see orr try....

Dolphin shows!. We went when there was a torrential downpour which shut the rides and themepark. We couldn't go on the balloons or cable car for a while so check the weather before you go! It is very crowded and the shows were spectacular despite the dull rainy day.

Fabulous. A wonderful place to visit. Great aquarium, so many beautiful fish. Loved the penguins & seeing the giant pandas. Thoroughly enjoyed ever aspect of it, allow plenty of time to visit as there is so much to see & do. Hair raising thrill rides for those who dare. Even though we were too old to do any of these we enjoyed watching those who did

A great theme park. Heard good things about Ocean Park and the time spent there with the family did not disappoint. Although it took a long time to get in and quite a bit of walking we loved every ride we went on, including their big rollercoaster at the back of the park (name escapes me). Throw in some pretty pandas and squeeky dolphins to gaze at and its definetely one of the beter ways to spend a day in HK

Ocean Park Hong Kong. We had a fantastic day out at Ocean Park. The rides are mostly for older children, there aren't really any rides for the younger ones. My daughter is afraid of cable cars, so that was a bit of a problem, however there is now a train that takes you up to the park as well. Our main reason for visiting was to see the pandas, but one of the panda attractions was closed as there were babies there, but we did see one giant panda. The sea life centre was great, as was the dolphin and sea lion show. Plenty of photo opportunities with lovely views and fountains. Well worth a visit, especially on a week day when it is quieter.
Huge. So much more exciting as compared to Disneyland. Was surprised that waiting time isn't that long, there's so much to see and play. Great experience.

Great for adults and children. Worth a visit if you have time. It's a theme / animal park, set in lovely surroundings and much nicer than the Disney one.
Go see the cute giant panda!

Something for everyone. A theme park, aquarium, zoo and breathtaking cable ride all in one place. This is value for money in expensive Hong Kong. Do the cable rides first to get amazing views of Stanley Beach. Theories are thrilling but be warned that the queues can be long.
Good for families and children. It's a good amusement park spread over a large area. Rides are like any other amusement park. If you are going as a couple, you can avoid this place.

Ocean Park falls a little short of expectations. I found that there was not enough to see or do. It seems there is a big panda craze there and lots of panda merchandise to entice the panda fans. We found the aquarium a little too small and the variety of sea animals rather limited.The sea animal show was out of the way and accessible by cable car with queuing time of 45 mins each way and thus it fell short of our expectations. Since this is the highlight of the park, the show should be packed with more interesting stunts and acts. Perhaps incorporate seals and penguins with the Dolphins. It was nothing new and should be updated. The staff were experienced in crowd control and ushering.More food carts with greater variety would be appreciated to add to the enjoyment of the show nearby the Dolphin theatre. Would be nice to have some sea food. Enjoyable cable car ride with lovely ocean views. The photo stations are very well positioned and of good quality. A good way to spend 4 hours max.

Fun place to spend the day!. The park offers something for everyone.Good theme park, has a good long cable ride from one part of the park to another.There are a few aquariums and Giant Panda enclosures.Lots of photo opportunities and you can have your caricatures made.Fun place to spend the day.

Something for everyone. We decided to go to Ocean Park instead of Disney Word on Lantau. Its cheaper and closer, and we were super happy with our decision. Ocean Park is a mixture of amusement park and Sea World. We enjoyed the great aquariums, huge tanks with sharks, sting rays and more. We had a decent meal and then headed to the pandas. There after took a few roller coaster rides. We went on a bad weather day in February. (smog,but no rain) and didn't have to stand in line too long. Longest line was for the gondola trip, so we skipped that one and took the cable car.

Crappy overpriced food and tortured pandas.. The rides and roller-coasters are really good at ocean park. However you may have to wait in lines for over an hour. If you are going purely for the rides then I suggest you go at 4pm til the park closes. Usually by then everyone has left and there are no lines. The dolphin show and aquarium are good but usually very crowded so make sure you get there earlier. I would suggest to avoid going on weekends or any public holidays. The food is TERRIBLE and waaaaay over-priced. Virtually nothing healthy and all junk food. There is an enclosure they call the panda "sanctuary". I use quotations here because it is FAR from being a sanctuary. The pandas are isolated in separate enclosed areas not much bigger than a tennis court and are on display to the public through glass windows that are open at the top. Before entering there is a person who holds up a sign that reads: "please be silent and no camera flash allowed". But dont think that this can stop people from doing exactly that, screaming to eachother and taking pictures with their obnoxious flashing cameras disturbing these poor animals. Very sad.

Excellent Theme Park. Went on a Monday and it was still crowded. Took 629 from Admiralty MTR Station, bought the entrance tickets there, and within 20 mins we reached Ocean Park. This place has everything - Animals, Sea-Life, Rides. Being with very young children (4 and 1 year old) we knew very few rides were suited for them on the other side of the cable-car ride, so we spent a good half a day checking out the animals like pandas, aquarium, goldfishes, etc. There ARE kiddie rides here, and our older one had a good time on the train ride, drove the RC Car, carousel, etc. They were close to being empty as most visitors are there for the thrill ride.We enjoyed the cable car ride but not the 1 hour queue. On the other side, we went to the Ocean Theatre 10 mins before showtime and still we couldn't enter as the huge amphitheatre was full! We had to stand and catch the show from a corner. Be here at least 30 minutes they say.The rides on this side are meant for taller kids and teenagers up. Our child could only take the Artic Blast as he was exactly 100cm, the minimum required height.We took him on it twice, and two times the staff have to measure him! The other ride which I think he can take would be the Ferris Wheel but we had run out of time. Do check out the North & South pole exhibits - sea-lions, seals, penguins and we saw warluses swimming above us. Lots of up and down hill walking between the 'old and new' part of the theme park.We were trying to beat 6pm closure time, and took the train down to the entrance to catch the Fountain show. While waiting, we had some snacks at Old Hong Kong - not good at all. We left and took a taxi instead of 629 as we saw the hordes all rushing for the bus and by then I was kind of spooked by crowds. We spent HKD66 to Admiralty where we stayed, quite affordable and convenient.This place is huge and it is quite impossible to catch everything, so plan ahead. Ocean Park is very crowded even on a Monday. 90% of the visitors are Mainland Chinese, and the tour groups come after lunch. Some will cut the queues and when confronted, will kick up a ruckus, so just have to bear with it. Ocean Park is definitely bigger and better than Disneyland. It is a good theme park and has something for everyone. The rides are amazing and the animal exhibits aplenty. Note that the helpful photograpghers will upsell you photos and sourvenirs, so if you do not want to feel obliged, say no fto their help. The curt and unsmiling service staff needs big improvement, and also make more effort to handle the queue jumpers.

Did the seal encounter - Simply Amazing!!!!!!. We prebooked the seal encounter only to land a 5 degree day but can't predict the weather. Swimming with the seals was breath taking the staff and trainers were amazing people and the seals are beautiful special thanks to David the seal for letting us pat him and for his amazing temperament and tricks. The park is huge we didn't cover too much of the park as the weather was just too cold but we saw the aquariums, panda, penguins, snow foxes, and of course the seals all the animals had really clean and spacious houses and are well looked after. I would recommend doing the seal encounter prebook it online you won't regret a minute of it I certainly won't. Purchase a two day pass at the door and go around lunchtime.Thanks SEAL staff for an Amazing Experience!!!!!!

Ocean Park. the rides are awesome...some very scary
food is great
people are warm and friendly
cable car on the side of the mountain was very exhilerating

a little confusing map.. I just love theme parks and this one was a lovely one too.Enjoyed all the rides.A must visit if one is into fun and thrill but be very careful and get hold of the map before exploring the park.Overall a great experience for both kids and adults.
A day fun. Good for tourtists or friends gettogether. It will be a bliss if it is not raining during the time you are there.

Like it! Worth the visit for. I got impressed when just arrived on how systematic it is, especially when queuing to get the tickets! I would say it is well maintain (first time visit but didn’t really see a lot of thing that felt old or shabby), convenience, and the Dolphin show is cool! There are 2 ways to get to the Dolphin show area (by cable car or the train that has less queue and it’s just 10mins! Somewhere before you reach the cable car area, something call Ocean train…)The aquarium is so over my expectation, the set up and the species there are great! They’ve got snow fox that usually people easily miss out, so if you happens to be here, go find it! Well of course the roller coaster is also worth the queue! I came here with Mum & Aunt and the 3 of us also enjoy it. Can’t compare it with Disney Land HK as I did not visit it, but the local usually advise you to go Ocean Park :)

Too many people; queues too long for attractions. On a nostalgic visit to Hong Kong where I lived and worked for over 20 years - I hadn't been to Ocean Park since the early 1990s. I knew they had added a lot more attractions so as today was a bright and sunny (though cold) one I decided to go and see. I wish I hadn't. There were possibly thousands of mainly Chinese mainland tourists (some elderly Hong Kong groups) I queued half an hour to get in. I queued half an hour to get into the aquarium - which I didn't think was anything special. The Panda enclosure advertised a queue of 45 minutes and to get on the cable car 60 mins. This is at a time of year when it is not the peak tourist season. I won't go again and I would advise you not to. It's also expensive at HK320 for an adult ticket.

start to finish. better come very early because lines going to the cable cart would take you a lot time. Start with the farthest theme park and you will find very short lines. I enjoyed riding most of the scary rides. I like that there are more food choices and at very reasonably price. I love the night water and sound show.

Family fun at Ocean Park. Went in the middle of the week and it was not too busy. Cable car ride was fantastic with an awesome view over Deep Water Bay. Some rides were closed but the best one was the Hair Raiser. The Symbio water show was also good with all the music and lights. The Panda's was very lazy and just lying around. Was good to see all the different fish species and also the Jelly fish and a small Sea horse. Definitely worth a visit.

Great day out for everyone!. This is My first visit to ocean park and I wasn't disappointed. Plenty to see and do for all the family. My advice is go early to cover this huge park and get a chance to try all the rides. Took my 6yr old niece who wasn't afraid to go any rides, unfortunately there were height restrictions on some but managed to get on the fastest roller coaster there!! I recommend to Grab lunch around the 'old china town' otherwise there's Macs and other fast food joints. Don't miss the dolphins and seal line shows, pandas and cable cars...etc...etc!

Great park but over crowded. We went in Feb and was taken back by how busy it was. This is the 2nd time we have been, this time is much less enjoyable!way to many people in the park, 99% of people from Mainland!a lot of shouting, pushing and shoving and queue jumping. i would still recommend to go but be prepared to stand your ground and watch your little ones otherwise they will be pushed and shoved or even trampled on if not careful.what a shame to this iconic beautiful park loved by many Hong Kong residents.Credit to the staff working there though...they have a tough job and do there best to maintain order. Clean environment and clean toilets too.we have given Disneyland a miss incase we experience the same rudeness. another shame to hk.

Must see attraction of Hong kong. Get your self involved for at least 6-7 hours. It is a very big park. One can reach there via direct bus from Admiralty bus stop. Cost of entrance ticket is. HKD.320.00. There are two parts one is at lower level and other at higher level can be reached through cable car or train from the base station. A full day fun & enjoyment for kids & for others also..Vinod TandonDelhi

Ocean Park. Went for my Birthday. Free Entrance for me. Not for my lady. We arrived in the early afternoon. It was enough tim ego see the front half of the park. Which included panda bears, massive aquarium, caimans, goldfish. Then we took the cable car, which at this point had a 15 minute wait, to get to the other side of the park. Upon arrival there, it was full of people. So full, that the lines for each ride were almost filling up the queue space. And there was no respect for the lines, people would just walk past you in the line to go until there was no more space. I eventually had to put up my arms to prevent people from walking past me. We had time to ride three roller coasters, and look at the penguins and seals before the park closed. We boarded the train back to the otherwise. It was total mayhem to get on. I recommend going in the morning, doing the roller coasters first, then making your way back to the zoo like area on the inland side.

Great park,enjoyed the fishes,panda, penguins and cable car. Such a huge park,1 day isn't enough to cover all the attractions and rides so you have to plan well according to your likings. We really enjoyed the panda, penguins, cable car and fishes. One annoying incident though, when I was looking at the fishes one Chinese guy bumped me so he can take a picture, how rude! He did not even say excuse me or sorry, a true gentleman indeed grrrrr.

A 'Must" on your Hong Kong Visit. Let me preface by saying we did not get a chance to go on any of the rides so I can't really comment on them. However, we did go on the carousel. The line which seemed intimidatingly long moved fairly quick since the ride literally is less than 2 minutes it seems. It felt like a rip off in some aspect but we just got back in line to appease the children. Also, we had a choice between Disney and Ocean Park and from what we were told, it was like a Hong Kong Seaworld. I didn't do my due diligence and look up reviews, but maybe that was a good thing since I was blown away with all there was to do there. Having already been to Disney in the US we opted to go to Ocean Park.My family and I visited Hong Kong at the peak of summer when it was scorching hot. In some instances, we dreaded going anywhere with the temperatures being so unbearable. However, we couldn't let the weather ruin our once in a life time trip! We have 2 toddlers ages 2 and 1 at the time. They knew just walking up to the place that there was some fun in store for them. Admission is pricey, but let me tell you its definitely worth it! Riding in the cable car and overlooking Hong Kong and the amusement park is worth the admission price alone. Even my father in-law who lives in Hong Kong believed so. It's a breathtaking view of the water and landscape. We spent the entire day there. I felt we had made a mistake going so early and closing the park but looking back, it was the right thing to do. It was difficult navigating with two small children especially when temperature and nap time play a huge factor but we trucked along and somehow made it work. After getting off the cable car at the top, we stopped to have lunch at the restaurant. The kids took a quick snooze while we took in the scene and enjoyed a few drinks. We spent most of the day just walking around viewing the attractions and taking plenty of pictures. It was just too extremely hot to do anything so anytime we could step indoors or get some shade we took advantage of the opportunity. We were upset that the Panda exhibit was down for maintenance during our visit. When will we ever get to see live Pandas again?? No matter, there was still so much more to see. My absolute favorite part of the park was the aquarium. They rival even the best ones here in the western hemisphere. I couldn't believe that I paid to get into an amusement park and got to experience this lovely aquarium. By this time it was dark and we kept hearing announcements to go to the lagoon located in the middle of the park for a special treat. Boy were we in for a treat! All I knew from other reports was that there would be a fireworks display. They have fireworks every night so of course we wanted to see the fireworks. What we weren't prepared for was their water/light show in their lagoon. I can't describe in words how awesome the show was, you'll just have to experience it for yourself if you ever get the good fortune of visiting Hong Kong. This is an all day trip, in fact if we ever go back to Hong Kong we will surely be visiting Ocean Park again. The only bad part about closing down the park is the rush to get on the bus. This process at night is long and tedious and of course if you're with kids they will be cranky. So be prepared and have a plan. If you're visiting Hong Kong, be prepared for 'line cutting'. This is looked down upon however, it happens... a lot! I was flabbergasted with the gall of some fully grown men/women cutting in front of small kids or even worse not offering a seat to a senior. This is a culture thing from the mainland, most people in Hong Kong have the decency to follow the rules. Its just shocking so be prepared to stand your ground. Overall, regardless of age, you're sure to have a great time at Ocean Park.

Loads of fun for little ones!. Wow! This was a great amusement park/aquarium. It is actually many aquariums in one location. My children, aged 7 and 10, loved looking at all the exhibits. The rides were great too. Look for the escalators on the map to help you navigate the long walking distances.

Worth going here. We really enjoyed our trip here. It’s a very big amusement/theme park, probably bigger than Disneyland. They have more rides and attractions to offer. We spent the whole day with the park and we still didn’t get to ride all of it. Like Disneyland, some popular rides and attractions can have long waiting lines. Many rides cater to a more mature crowd. Lots of fantastic rides and attractions. Unforgettable longest Cable Car ride I’ve ever been spanning two mountains with a great view of the sea on one side . First time I’ve seen Panda Bears. Relive the past and see what the early days of HK look like when you pass the Old Hong Kong. Great dolphin show at the Ocean Theatre. Awesome viewing panels at The Grand Aquarium. It’s more fun and enjoyable here.

Disneyland meets Sea World........ Spent a wonderful day here with friends. Arrived early on the bus trip from Admirality Station after catching the MTR from Kowloon. First stop was the Pandas...gorgeous. The fish display was fascinating with beautiful colours and shapes. Did the Polar Adventure with penguins, seals, walrus, sea lions and had a brilliant time. The environments that have been created are sensational and so interesting for all ages...young and old. Next some of our party ventured onto the rides: top of the list was the Hair Raiser rollercoaster....sensational ! There is so much on offer that we just couldn't cover the whole park in one day, so decisions were made as to what was a priority....absolutely on top of the list and didn't disappoint was the cable car. The ride is slow and you see so much of the park and the surrounding country side.....spectacular views. We lucked the line up and only had to wait 10 minutes, but at other times of the day the line wait can be as long as 1 hour or more....Also did the large aquarium which we thoroughly enjoyed. A great day out for all ages, and so much to see.

better than Disneyland.. I had to choose between the two and I chose oceans park as for me this was a better choice. And if u read around people will tell u the same. It took me the whole day there but i still couldn't finish seeing the whole park. Btw bring ur own food, they have terrible choices there. This is the one point that i guess Disneyland takes a lead in. Around closing which is about 630 or 6 there is a light show. It was good, not the best but good. Its contending the fireworks show at Disneyland I guess.

WOW, exhilarating rides. Best rollercoaster i have ever been on, EVER!!Also the chance to see panda's was amazing.The cable car to the otherside of park was well worth the wait nd lining up for.Found a lot of rides not suitable for kids (dodgem cars, you had to be 8y.o to even ride with a parent)

Must visit if you're a thrill seeker. some of the craziest rides facing the ocean all around - plus animal shows and the cutest pandas!make sure you head down early though cuz it gets crowded like everything in china does, but its worth heading down there if you're in hk and like adrenalin

nice park, worth to go. very nice park, a lot of fun.personally I like the cable car, the panda, and the aquarium best.sometimes there are too many visitors in the park, need a lot of time to queue up.

Up close with Pandas. Ocean Park is not a cheap day out. It has all the tourist draw cards....tacky souvenirs, junk food, stomach churning rides, queues BUT it has pandas and other wildlife. The information given about the pandas is most informative and the views available are very good. Speaking of views, the vies of HK are magnificent. We didn't go on the cable car because it was a horrendous queuebut the funicular was also entertaining and much quicker.It was well worth the entry fee and we have vowed not to purchase any bamboo products again in order to protect the panda habitat

Nice View and Fun Park. Been to HK more than 10X.1st time to the Ocean Park. Should have visited this place much earlier without thinking all theme park are the same. Glad to find out that this park is very unique.I went there on the eve of the Chinese New Year. Most of the tourists were from China Mainland.Went into the park at exactly 10am. Managed to the 1st few to take the Cable Car. The view was excellent. Knowing that it was impossible to visit all shows and take all rides in 1 day. I came up with a schedule of what rides to take and what shows to watch. I liked rides and hence completed the main roller coaster in the park : Hair Raiser, Arctic Blast and The Dragon. It was a new experience to take roller coaster rides and looking at the beautiful South China Sea. The lines were not very long. one of them was just a 5 min wait. The longest was about 30min. Could due be the timing. New Year eve is a typical reunion dinner day so not many HK locals there. Tried a few more rides like The Rapids, The Ocean Park Tower, and Bumper Blaster before going to a Dolphin show at Pacific Pier. All the rides were nice and well managed. I have a very good impression of Hong Konger.I found them very hardworking, dedicated and cheerful. I know Cantonese and that added to the fun. After spending most of the time at this side of the hill, I took the Cable Car back to the ground level and visited The Grand Aquarium, Old Hong Kong and Giant Panda Adventure.Managed to catch a ride on Ocean Express.Do not miss the Jelly Fish in the Aquarium ! Well presented by the park! The Roller Coaster, Jelly Fish and the Cable Car alone will worth the ticket price.Left the park at around 5pm to take the bus to the city.Had a wonderful day!Should have visited this park more than 10 years ago.I should have change my mindset that all the theme park are the same.

Sea creatures, mammals and birds, too!. great for all the usual scream-your-lungs-out roller-coaster and other fun rides for the kids. What's best, though, are the dolphin and sea-lion show (check for timings - 4 to 6 shows a day ...and hit the seating at least 45 minutes before, to avoid disappointment!Also, the Panda enclosure which give you a great up-close view of these magnificent creatures (There's two of e'm) and the cold and (unfortunately for us but fortunately for the animals) dimly lit interiors of the Penguins area, and the sea-lion aquarium. No flash lights are allowed, so tuck the camera away and just feast with your eyes. Educative and informative lit-boards keep you in the know, at every turn. The usual rides, and amusements abound...but it's a day filled with long walking between sections, so get your feet used to the idea, a few days in advance.
Fantastic day. The kids went by themselves like the locals do. Very busy and packed. Had a fun day, only wished they had more time to enjoy the animals.
its very romantic place for vacation ocean park. if i have a chance and have a time i want to go there again for a relaxing to my friends and ofcours to experience riding to cable car the best
Sunny Panda Day. Ocean Park is lovely. The highlight for us were the amazing pandas. The park is fun ,more chinese than Disney and chinese acrobat shows and dancing. A lovely day out.

Paradise for Kids. If you are with Kids, a visit to Ocean Park is must. If alone or with spouse, even then you will enjoy all rides and other shows. You will not feel to come back early till the park is closed for the day.

Disappointed. Family visit on a weekday. All interesting attractions needed 45 minutes or more. Personnel is unfriendly. Many visitors of course but flows of people not well managed. Food and beverage low quality and prices are double as in town. Do not go there except if really you want to spend 12 hours for max 10 attractions. Best point is the aquarium: really amazing

more fun than Disney. A very good day out cost H$320 for adults H$160 for kids over 3 and concession for over 65yrs. Gets very crowded now with mainlanders so get there early. See Pandas and dolphins and the aquarium is popular but the old atol was in my opinion much more interesting. The subtrain is best to get to the other side of the park and the cable car is best coming back, this is purely based on the length of the queues. There is plenty for kids and grown up kids to see do and eat.

Average theme park. I don't really understand why people will feel that the rides at Ocean Park are better than HK DisneylandI agree that they may have a slightly greater number of so called thrilling rides but all of them takes a long time to queue for and they felt not as stable and you often get a headache from all the violent vibrations in the ride, which shows that the ride is not as well built. The cable car is a nice touch, and ocean park is certainly big enough and there are much to explore.Overall if this is your first time you should give it a shot.
Biggest Sea animal park ever!. If you like sea animals and fishes then you must go to Ocean Park since it is one of the biggest I have been too!

Would recommend this over Disney for HK. The location only of this theme park is great as it's build on the side of the hills of Aberdeen. Hanging upside down on a rollercoaster and seeing water and forest beneath you is a completely different feeling. As rides and rollercoasters are concerned OP is much better than Disney (and I'm a huge Disney fan so...). They also make a big fuss of holidays like Halloween, Christmas and Chinese NY (very nice decoration and animation)Tip: go early because in the afternoon all the buses from Mainland China arrive and we all know what that means...

had a blast. we went here for the kids they had a ball it has the best roller coasters around in fact after here disneyland was a big disappointment for them , (they dont have any roller coasters at disneyland except for space mountain )its easy to find your way around, it is big though and very steep its on the side of a cliff theres lots of walking, ive had a knee injury and found all the hills a little hard , its up and down and up again, but i just shut up and did it for my girls needless to say when we got back to the hotel i took 2 pain killers and a couple of beers , the coasters are great high and fast and just what they wanted , some good animal attractions too, i was too scared to take the chairlift up to the summit at the top , ive seen at the photos and know how high it is so i took the monorail up and net them at the top all happy , a great day take your own food trust me .

It's one of the best Ocean theme park in the world. If you go to Hong Kong, you can't miss the Ocean Park. Best attractions: Cable Car, the Aquarium, Sea life carousel, Goldfish Treasures, Panda village, Sichuan Treasures, Pacific pier, the long escalator...etc.Try to avoid: The Old Hong Kong (what a waste of time), Ocean ExpressThe park is big and beautiful. It's located in south Hong Kong Island and next to the Deep Water Bay and it's easy to get to too. Although I have to say that it is not as good as before but I still highly recommend it to anyone.The only downside is the huge amount of Chinese tourists flooding from the Mainland. They don't like to queue and love spitting on the floor, speaking outloud and extremely impolite. They generate lots of income but also destroy the image of Ocean Park at the same time. They would scare the tourists from the rest of the world away.Tips: try to avoid weekend and public holiday

Good fun!. Whilst Ocean Park may not be as big as Movie World, Dream World or Universal Studios, it still is worth a visit when you're in HK. Great fun to be had, and the shows (whilst cheesy) do have a nice environmental protection story behind it!

Small, long lines. Best part was the cable car.We got the fast train up and cable car back.Kids enjoyed rides but as usual lines too long.Animal exhibits ok.They are building a metro train line direct which will improve connection to park.

Big PROBLEMS with kids 1.0m not having anything to ride on. Sort it out guys.. So I guess the healthy and safety executive at Ocean Park has decided that even the mildest of rides get the 1.2m height bar even 1.3m height bar.What am I talking about? Attended with 1.0m tall child 4 year old and she could practically ride ON NOTHING. So our experience was seriously cut down to just watching other people riding.In Europe I think we may be just a bit braver because the exact same rides are available over here and most kids 1.0m tall get to ride them! We are not exactly talking the Days of Thunder Terminator Wheels to Hell Fire Storm Rollercoster or whatever names they call them. We are talking about TEA CUPS and GENTLE log rides. So why have Ocean Park run scared? Maybe its the litigation or the fears of safety. Anyway once we realised we could ride absolelty NOTHING all we could do was watch others or go see fish in tanks. No worries here because the place is huge and we enjoyed the expanse.Just know the place is very hilly and if you are not on your A game it will kill you (Me pushing buggy - It killed me) but I feel fitter for it and burnt the callories up.OK so its mostly a rant but we did enjoy the place so I dont want to spoil their ranking by marking them down but I did want to let of steam to say to the management come on and sort out the thrill rides for the smallest...You COULD do it if you wanted to.

One day is not enough. First and foremost, anyone getting into this park would have to say that "This park is huge". Bigger than Disneyland Hongkong; so you would want to start as early as possible, if you have just a day to spend here. Its got more than 80 thrilling rides to enjoy and spread over two small mountains- Highland and lowland connected by a cable car.The roller coaster are not to be missed specially the abyss, hair-raiser and mine train. This park also, has amazing aquariums, specially the polar animaks, walrus, sea lions and the way they are kept and maintained is commendable.Dont miss the cable car ride and take the train for the way back.
Ocean Park - What a blast!. Fantastic place to visit for the day while in Hong Kong - lots to see :-) The shark exhibit is to arrive in 2014 - pity we could not see it.

Ocean Park. Huge park. Requires an entire day to complete. Tram & Cable Car always filled with people. Downside: place filled with mainlander chinese with bad manners. Always pushing when entering and exiting the tram. Not forgetting your queues getting cut.

Great day out for family with teenagers. Our family of three teenagers arrived at 10am on a Wednesday and were thoroughly entertained until we left at 5pm. Heaps of rides at the top of the mountain (where we spent most of the day) of varying intensity depending on personal preference. Best strategy I would say is to go up to the top early on cable car and then come back down on the train late afternoon. Whirly bird, bumper car, the rapids and rev booster had the biggest lines during the day so get to these early. Most other rides had 5-10 minute lines which is no problem. Glad we went here instead of Disney (with teenage kids).
Nice!. Good place to visit especially with kids! Good marine life in terms of flora and fauna to be seen. One of hong kong's premier attractions especially if you visiting with kids
Good attraction. By all counts this is better than Disneyland Hong Kong. Apart from good mechanical rides there are facilities more intelligent than Disney attractions.

Entertainment Galore!. Ocean Park had the best rides:fun, thrilling and entertaining. The Hair Raiser and Abyss were just Wow. Also love all their Roller Coaster rides. Had the most amazing time here.The show at their Waterfront in the evening was the best I have seen so far. A perfect blend of animation, fire, water and technology.

Need more time here. Theme park, water park, zoo, historic scenery area, playground, theatre.....all in one.Getting here is very convenient, you can get the information everywhere in Hong Kong.First thing to do when you reach is get a brochure and check the show time and places. You should go for the shows if you have time.

Must visit in Hong Kong. At the outset, this is a must visit place in Hong Kong. Only issue is that it is little off and visit there needs to be planned. We stayed at L Hotel and its hardly 2 Km from Ocean Park. Plan to reach early morning and straight away take cable car to go up. Less waiting and weather is good. Enjoy fantastic morning view of hong kong city in clear visibility. In later half, come down and enjoy the day. Enough places to eat. Children may get tired walking whole day.

Great day in the ocean park.. The only thing i regret is that we didn't start there earlier, so much things to do for any age group and amazing food and just great time. Highly recommended to anyone who is visiting Hong Kong.

Too good, better than disneyland, scary rides. If you want some scary rides this is your place, if you want childish stuff with easy rides then go to hong kong Disneyland, so it depends on your choice, we first went to disneyland, then to ocean park, and loved ocean park rides as they were of our age since we didnt had any kids with us, so it boils down to your age and with whom you are going. Turbo drop, flash are really good rides, did those again and again. loved it. food is on the costly side, shows are good, park is big and has different sections/areas. all in all it is a full day place. good views , good restaurants. liked it.

theme park and zoo in one. The rides here would have to have some of the best view in the world. The roller coster is on the precipice of a cliff that abutts beautiful Hong Kong harbour. If you dont make it to The Peak, the cablecar is probably the next best view of Hong Kong. Food and drink is pricey here - a bottle of water is almost three times the price of the supermarket.

8 hours worth of entertainment. Getting the bus from Admirality Station is really straightforward- its well signed and there are many double-decker buses leaving every few minutes, so no long queues. Get there early and go on a week day: we arrived just before it opened and while there were lots of people, we didn't queue for a ride until the evening where we waited about half an hour for 2 of the last rides we went on. Really not bad. The aquarium and animals are really interesting, and they make the experience both entertaining and educational. The conservation messages are inspiring, and one tends to comes out with new resolutions!It's uniquely situated between the mountains and the sea. A great place to stay. Finished the day with the fountain show which was quite impressive.

Good for bigger kids, cheaper than Disneyland in all aspect. We searched through the forum and found out that CTS offers discount to local attractions. For Ocean Park it was 20% discount for adult, about 22% for kids. Tickets were issued immediately for Ocean Park, and they gave discount vouchers for various food and merchandise outlets, i.e. buy $50 of food and $15 discount etc so really worth it. The most convenient way to reach CTS travel, at HK International Airport Terminal 1, Exit Gate A, opposite the gate will be 10-12 travel booths, look for China Travel Service. They also provide discount to Disneyland but discount was only about 5%, still a saving nonetheless. CTS only accept cash unless transaction > HKD3k.Our second visit to Ocean Park since 4 years ago, the Summit is where all the exciting rides are. We went during a rainy day on a Monday, so not much of queue. Advisable to take the cable car as view is really nice, and cable car service could be stopped if weather does not permit. Also explore the Summit and try all the rides before lunch hour. We see large tour groups, mostly from China, after 2pm. Immediately the queues for rides lengthened. Mind you, it's not only one group, easily 6-10 groups that arrive together, judging by the different flags the tour leaders were holding.Exciting rides for teenagers are Hair Raiser, the Dragon, Abyss, the Eagle etc. Didn't try the Rapids as it was really cold, kids wanted to try Whirly Bird but was halted due to bad weather. For Ocean Theatre's dolphin show, it's not that exciting if you have been to the Sea World in Gold Coast, but good for first timer I guess.Ocean Park is quite a big park, Adventure Land at the Summit was also closed while we were there and yet we spent almost 6 hours at the Summit, including lunch and exploring the animals at marine centre and Polar Adventure. We visited the Panda and Grand Acqurium only later in the evening, took the train down as cable car service was halted due to strong wind. The Grand Aquarium was really well done as part of the package for the Park, in other places one may have to pay just to view these marine species.Overall, food is cheaper and tastier in Ocean Park than Disneyland. The park is becoming more popular after the upgrades, with more rides, more shows and more opportunities to interact with the animals, i.e. the Marine mammal breeding centre. Really worth the price to spend a full day there.

Great aquariums - avoid the kids if possible!. I went to Ocean Park in August 2006 and had a blast - Ocean Park had a strong focus on aquariums, with many theme park rides and some theme park-like displays to go along with it. Not to mention, the amazing views from the gondola! Things have changed a bit since 2006, though. When travelling there in January this year I found the park to be much more artificial - it's started to feel like Disneyland with animals. In spite of this there are some excellent displays, and there's a good focus on sustainability, with many signs urging patrons to reconsider their own activities (consumption of shark fin soup, use of bamboo chopsticks, energy use etc). Unfortunately I think I was the only one who read these signs.Some exhibits are a little depressing - some large Arctic seals in a tiny enclosure surrounded by electric wire doesn't really fill you with joy, and in peak season there can be a long wait for almost anything - aquarium exhibits, rides, the gondola, even food. Be prepared for mayhem if you go on a weekend or school holidays!Before going look out for discount coupons for entry, they seem to be everywhere. There was a sign at the Kowloon Star Ferry pier which suggested if you took a photo of it and presented it on entry you get a 10% discount. Most tourism booklets seemed to have a 15% discount voucher as well.

Tons of fun!. We're a young married couple and went here for the aquatic life - so cool being able to experience an aquarium, animal life like pandas, and an amusement park. The Hair Raiser was an AWESOME roller coaster!! The cable car between was a beautiful ride - super scenic - take the cable car back at night. We went on a Tuesday or something so lines were practically nothing - went for the Christmas show and they had a spectacular special effects show. Totally worth it!
It's a kids place. If you have a young kid as I have you definitely should visit the Ocean Park; your kids will enjoy it and believe me you will do as well.

Very hilly. Be warned, getting around this place requires walking up and down some inclines. The park is located in two separate areas either side of a mountain. The kids grandmother struggled at times. There is a great mix of attractions, shows and rides at this venue. Kids and adults of various ages and interests will enjoy the park. It's worth staying for the closing light and water show. Tip: on entry, most of the crowd (such as us) lined up for the cable car to "get across" to the other side of the park; dont do this unless there is no queue. Instead, take the Ocean Express (subway) and later on if you want, take the cable car back to the lower area.

Good times!. Had a great time riding several rides and touring key attractions. Don't miss the giant aquarium, the dolphins and seals show. They have several awesome and thrilling rides if you have the courage for it. If came with your kids make sure to visit a special section with playground and kid-friendly rides. The only down side I remember is the lack of queuing supervision from the staff to manage some of the rude Chinese tourists who likes to cut in line.

Prepare for thrills and long walks!. As soon as I stepped inside the Ocean Park, I told myself that it is going to be a long, exciting and tiring day! The park is so huge and jam-packed with rides, attractions and shows! Again, its so huge that a day is not enough to go around and see and try everything that Ocean Park has to offer! Unlike disneyland's thrill seeking rides will take you hours just to get in but here it will only take you a couple of minutes just to get in to one. The more deadly the ride, the shorter the lines are or its only just my experiene?

FUN DAY!. If I had to choose between Disneyland & Ocean Park...I'd go for Ocean Park! it's more value for the money and has something for everyone not just kids. Ocean Park is mainly divided into two main attraction areas: the Waterfront and the Summit, which can be further divided into eight different attraction zones: Amazing Asian Animals, Aqua City, Whiskers Harbour, Marine World, Polar Adventure, Adventure Land, Thrill Mountain and the Rainforest. All these zones offer a wide array of exciting rides and animal exhibits.It was my first time to see the Panda, the penguin and other exotic animals which is nice, the cable car ride was so cool and the view was breathtaking.The only thing I didn't like is waiting for almost an hour for every ride but it's my fault for going on Saturday! so try to avoid going during weekendsHow to get there by public transportation:The Citybus Route 629 runs daily from Admiralty MTR Station or Central (Star Ferry). The bus fares are $10.6 for adults and $5.3 for children (aged 4-11).

Great place to spend the day. You can easily spend at least half a day here to a full day. The rides were really good, and the way your belongings are stored makes it very convenient, as you don't have to lock them up somewhere before you can walk around. Every ride has a place to store your stuff, and it is quite secure because it is separated from the rest of the public and watched by their staff. Some of the best (aka scariest) rides are the hair-raiser, abyss, the flash, and the mine train. Would recommend going on weekdays to avoid most of the queues. We went on a weekday noon and most of the rides only required 5 to 10 minutes of queueing. When it was evening though, the crowd had ballooned and the waiting time had increased to 15 minutes to 30 minutes. You can buy food here, but they are generally junk food and terribly expensive (unsurprisingly).

Ocean Park. Kids and kids at heart will love this place, since my son love's fishes and water, next time we come back, I am bringing him here. I have been here as a child, and my husband has also been here during his teen years, and when we come back, we will come back as a family, my son will love it.

GREAT DAY OUT!. This was lots of fun for the whole family. Lots to do and see and some stomach churning rides to boot, as well as some much milder ones!Get there early and wear comfortable clothing and shoes, as you'll be doing a LOT of walking, despite the many escalators etcSome nice food to be purchased at the little food stands along the way.Just a tip..... if you catch the OceanPark bus from the MTR station, just make sure you also purchase your RETURN BUS TICKET when you pay for your admissions before lining up.... we weren't told we needed to do this (despite obviously being confused foreigners!), and after lining up for a long time to get onto the bus, we were refused entry onto the bus and had to return to the end of the line again to buy our bus tickets!! Very frustrating, and I felt we should have been told about this when we brought our Ocean Park pre-entry at the same place.Other than that, this was a memorable day and I would highly recommend it!

Great For Kids - Needs More Attractions. Been travelling with family here for more than 10 yearsFirst-time to have it with my youngest son who had a blastNever gets old with the kids - but I would like to see a different routine with the dolphin show, as well as the panda living quarters

great place for the kids. Lots of things to do with the kids and places to eat. The cable car is a must for the fantastic views although not ideal for those afraid of hights. There is an alternative train ride which will take you to the other side. There are massive queues for the buses if you stay to the end but its fairly orderly with bus attendants at each of the stops.

Animals and Rides. It is an interesting combination animals + rides. There is something for everyone. They even have two pandas there : ) Very interesting layout and the higher level of the park has nice view. Can be a long wait for cable car so consider express if you want to save time.

fun day!. Ocean Park was much better than I had imagined it to be.It was pretty chilly so maybe the nice weather also contributed a bit to the enjoyment. Rides and attractions were sufficient to satisfy all ages. Photo-taking opportunities aplenty. we loved the roller-coaster ride "hair-raiser", even my dad! Also, the cable car ride was very enjoyable (don't worry, the queue moves pretty quickly)Come here early (to avoid the mainland tourist crowd), and be prepared to spend a whole day here to maximise your ticket price!

Enjoyable day. Went with family ( 12&14 yr old)Chose to do this over Disney after reading reviews.Thought admission prices reasonable.Caught mrt to admiralty. line up for the bus was just massive so we decided to hail a cab which cost just under 60 hkd to get there in about 20m. They were offering tickets at the bus stop at a discount ( 40-50hkd less) but we had already pre bought ours.The park is massive and although my kids have done numerous worlds in both Australia and overseas, they still enjoyed it. It has enough for older kids to keep them entertained.The park is deceptively MASSIVE. How women walk and go on rides in high heels is beyond me!!!!Toilets clean. Didn't buy any food as ate before we went in.Queues weren't too bad ( weekday) at most we waited 1/2 hr. Limited adrenaline rides but plenty of other things to look at.Toilets clean.Easy signage at exit to catch bus/cab back.Spent 4&1/2 hrs there and didn't look at everything there.

Fun for kids. HK Ocean Park is huge.As usual number one tip is to wear a comfortable shoes (your own preference,I like flat comfy shoes).Outfit should depend on the weather.Keep on mind to check the weather forecast.The aquarium is big.My kids enjoyed the meerkat show and the pandas but it was the Penguins they loved the most.We spent longer time at the South Pole Adventure than in any other part of the park.They had fun chasing the Penguins.Ocean Park is worth a visit if you're in HK,so be sure to drop by and enjoy the rides as well.

The highlight of our HK trip. This was one of my highlights of our trip, visiting "Ocean Park", this is because we finally got to see the Pandas, which were absolutely beautiful. A great day out but the park itself needs a little TLC as a few rides and cafes were closed. We visited in November which seemed to be a great time of year to go as the crowds were very minimal, we had heard that you can be lined up and waiting in lines for hours to see attractions, we did not have this problem. We also went on the Cable Car which was very scary but a must while visiting the park.

theme park. unfortunately several big rides not working on the day we visited. We bought pizza, which was not warm, and very indifferent. We ate later in the aquarium, food was lovely. Overall a good visit with some down bits, closed rides mainly. We had hoped to eat in a cafe but 2 floors were closed and huge queues. All facilities were clean and we felt there was value for money.

More than just a Theme Park... As compared to Disneyland, I would very much prefer the Ocean Park as there are much more things to see and do there. With an aquarium and many other animal exhibitions including Pandas, Penguins and the sealions, its definitely more than just a theme park, moreover its well situated beside the sea and on the mountain with spectacular views as well! Ocean park is definitely suitable for all ages.Rides may be a bit old but its still quite well maintained and safe as well! Different intensities of rides are available and suitable for all kinds of age group! As usual for many theme parks, food and drinks in the park can be very expensive so try to bring some of your own water and food in if possible. Also, try to avoid the weekends as it can get very very crowded, you will probably spend half of your time there queing. The park is also rather big with many areas and themes and may require some walking down and up slopes. So be prepared too!

Has changed a lot the last time I went. This is definitely a great place to take your kids. However, the shows now are all cut short and it's become more of an amusement park than an aquarium like it was in the past. It definitely looks very beautiful and if you don't go to Cheng Du this is a great chance to see a panda.However, it feels like a big shopping mall now with rides. Good to go with kids. Also, don't go on the 629 from admiralty...the line...was really long could take 2 hours to get on a bus to ocean park.Take the 171 from Mong Kok to Ocean Park.

Very hard to navigate. Ocean Park had so much promise! It's spread out so far I assume to disperse crowds, but you spend most of the day walking around looking for stuff. The signs don't match the site map! So be prepared to get disoriented. If you haven't been to many theme parks, you will probably think Ocean Park is pretty good. But if you've done a Disney or SeaWorld etc, you will be very disappointed.

WE LOVE AND ADORE OCEAN PARK!. Ocean Park was forecasted for doom with the arrival of Hong Kong Disneyland, and man did they rise to the challenge. This is one charming adventure after the next, and for a park a few decades old, amazingly contemporary. if you're a local, and especially if you have kids, get the season pass - pays for itself very quickly. In short, Ocean Park has all the rides and animals you could ever want, and you can easily conquer it in five/six hours. My daughter's favorite attraction is the penguins and the bird show - they never get old, and very personable experiences with the animals who seem happy and healthy. the kids section at OP is a special treat - if you're a local, you can go just for that - it's nicely tailored for young kids (rides, games, etc.) and has different themes throughout the year. Ocean Park will always have a special place in my heart because I've been there so often with my young daughter.

Great for families :). We spent the day here with our children and left when it was dark! Needless to say that there is plenty to do here even if you are not so inclined to go on daredevil rides, like myself ;) There are lots of shows to see and novelty games that you can play for a small fee.A note on where to eat. I read, before our trip, that the food is atrocious and very expensive etc, etc. But at the end of every road, is a golden arches... So it seems! The trick to the McDonalds at Ocean Park is that they only offer an a la carte menu, which means you need to purchase all menu items separately and they don't offer meals as such. This means that you're paying a little bit more. HOWEVER, if you're Australian, your food bill still ends up being cheaper than what you would pay for at home anyway! Enjoy!
Fun Playground. Different activities for various age grounds. Also different levels of intensity of the rides. Get in early as it does get busy and try and buy your tickets before you go there
go fo the Pandas. Worth visiting the Aquarium and the pandas and the gold fish. its on the big bus stop to Stanley. Plan for a two hour stop

Loved the Aquarium. The rides are def fun. But what excited me more was the Aquarium. It was simply beautiful and so informative.Loved the Giant Panda as well. Tried a few rides. Good fun.Good options to eat. Absolutely fun place for kids and adults.

Revisit my Childhood. We decided to visit Ocean Park to revisit our childhood. We took the MTR and disembark at Admiralty. Then we took the bus specially catered for Ocean Park. We bought our admission tickets which was HKD20 cheaper than the usual. Once there, take the map to plan where you want to go. If you have kids, visit the animal enclosures and also plan out which animal shows to go to. Go early for good seats. If you prefer thrilled rides, take the cable car up as there's nice sea view. Most of the rides take 20-30 min wait even though we went on a weekday. So you must really plan properly. A place for the young and old but you must have the patience.

Great family experiences for everyone. It was amazing to watch the Pandas. Get there early to beat the tour buses and crowds. It is a very well organised park which is able to move people through areas efficiently.

A Theme Park and Oceanarium. Visiting Hong Kong is not complete without going to Ocean Park especially if you are traveling with children.Everyone will surely enjoy the Park. There's a lot of different type of rides accordingly to your age.You can experience here the great adventure you ever dream, The ride on Cable Cars at Ocean Park linking the Lowland with the Headland may be the highlight of the trip to Ocean Park for me and my family, which can bring you to the spectacular breathtaking view of the green mountains, as well as the scenes of blue oceans. It takes approximately ten minutes to travel between the two destinations.Checkout their website for details on getting there, entrance fees, new stuff, park guide & info. www.oceanpark.com.hk

Excellent Place to have fun for the family. We were there during the Dec Christmas period and found that 1 day is not enough to cover the whole park. Lots of games and things to see. Aquarium and Panda area is nice and the kids were enjoying the games too much that we spend a lot of money there...The Flash is nice but the Ocean park staff didn't warn people on the possibility of dropping your things during the ride. When I was position high up there, someone actually drop the handphone. It crash to the ground and 1 pcs became 3 pieces....haha..Taxi going back to Kowloon was a headache as not much Taxi driver want to go over s the tunnel always jam. They rather send people around Hong Kong island. We ask the taxi driver to send us to Admiralty MTR station where we took the MTR back to Jordon. It is faster and cheaper.

Excellent rides and sheer enjoyment. If one plans well, you can cover all the rides and enjoy your day-trip here. As soon as we entered, we went to the extreme end of the park (adventure land) and completed our rides there without any queues. This saved lot of time for us to enjoy dolphin show (worth to see) and other rides. Inside food is very highly priced and you do not have any choise as outside food is not allowed. Overall, good experience.

They took away the main attrction !. This place used to be great. It had some good attractions ( still has some good attractions ) and one awe inspiringly great one. A massive three story indoor tank which was circled by a darkened spiral staircase, so you could walk up and around, or down and around the outside of the great tank from the light above to the darker depths below and be amazed at the sharks and rays and huge monster fish circling. It was not only gobsmacking but kind of spiritual - sounds odd I know, but there was something primeval about it - a universe in utero - well they say we came from the sea !They got some numpty into to re-vamp the Park and he seems to have got rid of the one truly great thing about it - the massive three story high tank and replaced it with a lot of lesser attractions and many many more shops and food stalls all selling the same stuff. So what was an experience to remember is just another - candy coloured frisking. Sad.

Fun for the little ones. Our 2 year old loved ocean park. Other than the obvious animals which were great there is a whole section for small children with rides & a big play ground which she loved. This park also has great parent rooms for breastfeeding mums. Getting there on the bus was OK but if you can afford a cab it's easier with prams etc. Overall a great family day
8.5/10 Walk too much. There are some interesting places to go to in this park, but the worst part is walking too much. Try out the cable cars, that's one of the fun things to try out.

A great Day. We spent a whole day at Ocean Park, we preferred it to Disneyland. So much to do the Giant Pandas were gorgeous and a great aquarium. The cable cars to the other side of the park are a ride in themselves and the high thrill rides did not disappoint. It is amazing to ride a roller coaster on the side of a mountain and also over lovely water. I did find that there weren't a lot of food stalls around at lunch we had to search for somewhere and we also found it a bit tricky to navigate around the park at times.

Meet Jia Jia and An An and learn from them. The first time I have been to Ocean Park, I thought that it would be like any other park with basic attractions like roller coaster and so on. I have now to admit that every time I go to Hong Kong I end up there. In 5 years, they have significantly upgraded the park and the latest attraction with the penguins is just awesome. Going into a close to zero room in the heat of HK watching these penguins swimming (the fact that you can see below the water surface is just the idea of a genius) is enough to entertain you. The major attraction is in fact the giant and red pandas. Difficult to see the same and so many elsewhere in Asia apart going to Chengdu. Add the new massive aquarium, dolphins shows, some cheap and good HK style food and somehow a relaxing atmosphere, a cable car with a view and you will have a nice place to spend some time. Needless to say that it is a paradise for kids of any age; one side of the hill is more relaxed whereas the over has some thrilling attractions. Unlike Disney, you will not find big parades; American style it ain’t. Do not miss some specials: feeding the otters or the pandas. And you can do more, like having private session to swim with the dolphins or learn more about the pandas and feed them yourself and receive a Panda ambassador certificate. Ocean park is also about learning. If possible do not go on weekends as it tends to be packed.

Great fun for kids and adults. We had a great day at the park. Amazing to se Giant Panda and the Red Panda. Didn't now there were so many different species of Gold Fish.
