You can see some of them at the park. There were so many amazing animals to see. We went in January, a bit chilly but no queues. A great park for both children and adults.

Took up the enitre day- lots of fun. Great show put on by the killer whales, probably the best thing about the theme park- a must watch. Great rides, and a few good spots to grab some good food (we had chinese). You need to reserve an entire day for Ocean park, as it takes a while to get there (located outside the city area), but absolutely worth a whole day.

adventurous and funfilled. Could see penguins, seals and even rare jelly fish live. More over the cable car was quite funfilled as also the rides. The hick up was food for vegetarians as most of the food outlets were not serving veg food. But the fish lovers will have the feast. One should never miss the dolphin show, aquarium last but not the least the light and sound show. Children will love to see and touch star fish.
More fun than DisneyLand. The rides were more suited to thrill seekers and young adults, although expect to queue up for 15 minutes per ride during the holidays.

Fun Place. Good Fun Place. Went with our 4 year old kid. However, most of the rides are not suitable to him, he did enjoy many other things like the aquarium, the giant panda and cable car ride to the summit.We didn't go to the adventure land, but it seemed to be exciting. REst all other places we covered. The only thing management seems to improve is to have more English speaking staff, especially at the eateries. They could also do better with training them on smile and better customer oriented approach... Lessons to be learnt from the Hong Kong Disneyland here :)

Plan your day carefully. This attraction packs in A LOT, you need to decide whether your visit is about theme park style rides or animals and plan your visit accordingly, there will be queues for most attractions so you won't get them all in in one day; especially in the weekend or public holidays.Week days are not too bad but still quite busy with "argey-bargey" tour groups from the mainland.Most of the animals are kept in what appears to be natural environments which is great to see in this part of the world. The dolphin and sea lions show was not overly degrading to the animals and just about strikes the right balance between being tacky and entertaining for kids.Ticket price is not cheap but includes all rides, shows and cable car so not bad value.Finally -top marks for their stance against sharks fins soup!!

A must place to Visit. We heard alot about Ocean Park from Trip Advisor Reviews so decided to plan a day for it. It was a worth While Experience. Ocean Park is a very Big park and have alot of attractions so please have atleast one full Day. Please Book in Advance online as you may get alot of discounts and some good deals. Moreoever you will avoid queuing for buying tickets which can take from 30 mins to an hour depending on the day. Plan for weekdays would be a better idea,The Park Opens at 10am till 9pm so plan to be there early so you can cover Everything in one Day. The park is spread into multiple areas and have Thrill rides to Animal Shows so pick your best Bet first.As soon as you enter the Park, Bunch of people will approach you to click your pics with the background and offer you souvenier for $400. They are very quick in service and can easily convince you but i didn't find it worth spending this money. We covered Aquarium and it was worth the visit with many species in collection. As the Park is very Big, We decided to start backwards so we made our way to the Rides at Adventure Park. Please note that While they have escalators to move around the Hill, you have to walk a bit so be prepared with the Family. All the Rides are worth even for Kids, my 6 years old kid enjoyed the park more than Disney Land and was allowed to go in most of the rides as the minimum Height requirement is 48 Inches Tall. (Plan Accordingly if you are travelling with Kids)Hair Raiser, Flash is a must for Adults :) Though most of the rides are very nice.While we could not cover the complete park in 9 hours. 12 to 9pm, it was worth a visit and i will recommend to everyone to spend a day at Ocean Park for complete Fun :).
Great. My only suggestion - get there early if don't you will wait for long periods of time. Also if it doesn't matter to you - use the single rider lines - you get on the rides heaps faster!
Fantastic experience. Loved getting in with the dolphins, a good education session before then into the pool with them, it was truly magical.

The BEST Park in Hong Kong. I am personally a person from Hong Kong, and this park is great! It's like a zoo with lots and lots of animals, not just sea animals. It is highly recommended to go see the jellyfish--they look like they glow in the dark! There are animals shows like dolphins and tigers and birds! The queues are all very short, unless you go to Ocean Park during the summer....

Beautiful. Travelling to Ocean Park does take some time from Kowloon but is worth it. The park combines an aquarium, zoo and a theme park together to produce the perfect experience, even for older children. Queues are reasonable on all the rides, but the stall games are quite expensive. In terms of the experience, Ocean Park is amazing. The entire theme park is a myriad of thrills, from the roller-coasters and rides. We dined at Tuxedos Restaurant, which is quite an alternate experience. The seating offers a view of over 70 penguins, which are quite funny to watch as you eat. The price of food is a little expensive, as you would expect from a park restaurant, but very filling and delicious. A whole day is needed to visit here and public transport to Admiralty Station is readily available outside the Park.

Great place, interesting for all ages. Being an experienced traveller with the kids I can say that most of the entertainment parks have lots of people and long queues where you spend hours. And I am happy to say the Ocean Park in Hong Kong is an exception to this rule. There are no queues!!! All our time was spent on different activities not on waiting. Ocean Park is a combination of the zoo, oceanarium and the amusement park. There is a special zone for toddlers which is both interesting and safe, it is a very practical solution. At the end of the dat at 6.30 they have a lazer/fountain show, worth watching if you are in the park. In general, a very positive experience.
Best theme park ever!. This is my favourite theme park! It has a nice mix of thrilling rides and animal encounters, all at a beautiful location.

Not a very good park to visit. Like: Only the AquariumDislike:(1) One point to one point too far away, the uphill and down hill every where(2) Not suitable for my 6-8 years olds kids, most of the rides they can not ride.(3) Restaurant and fast food too many people, no change for HKD 500, no acceptance of credit cards... (4) After buying fast food no place to sit at all.(5) Non of the shows are interesting.(6) No taxi back to Kowloon during festival period, have to take bus629 to MRT, then take MRT back to Kowloon.(7) No fast lane, wait for hours just for a children ride.(8) This park is for the age from 15 to 29 year old only.

Hmm I wouldnt go a second time. All we kept hearing was how great Ocean Park was ! We went up there and thank god we bought tickets for entrance at the bus stop at Admiralty MTR because when we got there the line up to get in was easy an hours wait! The Pandas were the hightlight and we loved them! But everything else in this park was the same old stuff - not sure if its because we have seen the gorgeous zoo in Singapore or the worlds largest Oceanirum - we just weren't fazed about anything. Worst park was walking into the area that was full of kids games (show games) and of course they all wanted to play and each game was $10-$50HKD! Ocean Park is spread on 2 mountains and lucky we went in the winter because we would have been absolutely buggered had it been hot! Again just like all theme parks in HK the wait time and line ups for rides was insane - at least 60mins wait so the kids missed out but they loved the cable car ride down (in which I kept my eyes shut!) Way way too scary for me, and much scarer then the Ping 360 to Big Buddha which I thought was absolutely terrifying (that's another review hehe) I wouldn't go back to Ocean Park and I wouldn't really recommend it unless you've never been to an aquarium or zoo

A great day out.. The theme park is fantastic and the cable car connecting the two parts of the park has an outstanding view. The rides are good and this theme park has a good mix of animals and rides. Very good day out for all ages

Panda's & Jelly fish!. Make plenty of time for waiting in queues and you'll enjoy your day here. We waited an hour to get on the cable car to go to the Ocean Park Tower and waited another 30mins to get on it. The 360 degree view was awesome. The highlight for me was seeing the Panda's, Red Panda's & the Jelly fish display. Others say it has the scariest rides because they are perched on the side of the mountain.

World's Best Ocean Park. Magnificent. Everybody that visits Hong Kong should definitely visit this amusement park, there is too much to talk about the panda's, the rides, the views. Just choose food wisely.

will surely go again..... we brought the kids and my parents for this trip and it was truly a great experience for everyone. It was the start of winter and it was cold but of course everyone had fun,fun and nothing but fun. We took the public transportation and it was not a hassle at all.

Great city getaway for the day. One of the best places to spend the day in HK, I especially enjoy the scenic cable car ride. The park has built a train that can transport people up and down as the cable cannot handle the volume.Lots of good rides in the park. Mcdonald's is also there but what out for the old Chinese non english speaking cause you will have some challenge ordering. This is a tourist location, one would think the place including Mcdonald's would hire people that have some English knowledge, instead you will get the attitude with your food!!

Overwhelmingly good. Ocean park is amazing! A theme park on the side of a mountain overlooking the ocean! What more could you ask for? The rides are more exhilarating because of this, you will be on a rollercoaster, not only high above the ground but an addition 200m above sea level because you're on a mountain! A must do in Hong Kong.

Not up to Australian or US standards. I took the kids here on a stopover in HK to kill a bit of time. First of all the entrance fee is not cheap in my opinion. Although the park itself was fairly quiet there were huge lines for any of the decent rides so i didn't bother. The pandas don't look happy and the two I saw were both exhibiting obsessive repetitive pacing behaviour which is distressing to watch they clearly need more stimulus.Overall very average but i live on the Gold Coast so i'm fairly spoilt as far as theme parks go. i won't be going back

Brilliant.... My experience at ocean park was brilliant there was so much to do and so much to see. my family and i enjoyed the train that took us to different parts of the park. The rides were also very good despite the long lines i would personally recommend this park to anyone who comes to Hong Kong. The Tower Ride is great as it gives you an Arial View of the City..The roller coaster rides are amazing…(This review was written by my 11 year old son).

A very good way to spend a day out with the family. Ocean Park is Hong Kong's home grown theme park and is located on the south side of Hong Kong Island. The park originally opened in 1977 and was the sole theme park in the territory until the arrival of Disneyland a decade again. In order to remain competitive with Disney, Ocean Park underwent a multi-year renovation and general upgrade of its facilities. The park has been further transformed by the addition of new and exciting attractions and wildlife experiences that have greatly enhanced the experience of spending a day at the park. Today, you can easily spend a whole day at Ocean Park enjoying traditional theme park rides, games and performances as well as aquatic and mammal experiences. In comparison to 10 years ago, Ocean Park is a more enjoyable theme park to visit and it might be even better in the future as an MTR station is being constructed outside the entry gate. There are hotel plans as well, which will provide guests with the ability to stay at/near Ocean Park in a few years time. What we most enjoy at Ocean Park: Being wildlife enthusiasts, we are quite biased towards the animal experiences and spend most of our time at these attractions and exhibits. In our opinion, the Grand Aquarium is great and really shouldn't be missed. Equally, the Amazing Asian Animals Area is well worth spending time. You are able to get closer to the younger pandas on display here and the red panda (fire foxes) are brilliant when they are active. We very much enjoyed watching the feeding session here recently. Resident pandas, An An and Jia Jia, are always worth seeing as well. They were the star attraction for us for many years before the arrival of the two younger pandas and other wildlife since 2007. Other enjoyable wildlife which you can experience include the previously mentioned red pandas (a present favourite of ours), as well as the arctic foxes, penguins, seals, sea lions and walrus, which can all be found in the North Pole and South Pole experience. There is a jellyfish exhibition, Chinese sturgeon exhibit and traditional animal performance shows that are worth checking out as well. A Shark encounter is presently being constructed and should be ready later in 2014. A special mention here for the cable car experience is deserved. Many visitors to Hong Kong are eager to enjoy the Ngong Ping 360 cable car experience on Lantau Island but lack the time to make that visit and Ocean Park. Not to worry, the cable car ride at Ocean Park is very good. You scale a mountain and then transverse its side until you reach the Summit terminus. This ride offers you very nice views of the Hong Kong coastline. While not the same as Ngong Ping 360 experience, it is a very good consolation for those who don't have time to do all the major attractions in Hong Kong, and some will even argue that this cable car ride is better than its more famous peer on Lantau Island. Its a very pleasant surprise to your visit to Ocean Park and is included in the price of your entry ticket. Overall, we very much enjoy Ocean Park and highly recommend it to visitors to Hong Kong. Compared to theme parks elsewhere, the entry fee is reasonable and then entire park is family friendly. The classic theme park rides and activities are as fun as you'd expect and the wildlife experiences are unique and very enjoyable, providing fun for adults and children alike. Tip: You can find a park map as well as a complete and comprehensive list of attractions on the Ocean Park online website. Maps and performance show / feeding time schedules are also available within the park, conveniently located at stands near the ticket purchase booths at the park entrance. It is well worth looking over the schedule to help organise how you want to send your time within the park. Animal feeding sessions don't last long (5-10 minutes) so its important to be in the right spot at the right time if you want to watch. Tip: Due to a vast increase in tourists coming to Hong Kong these days, Ocean Park, like other major attractions in Hong Kong can be very crowded. As such, in order to maximise your time, we suggest buying your tickets before arrival (tickets can be purchased at 711s or at the ticket booth next to the bus 629 stand at Admiralty). Then, arrive at the park around 30 minutes prior to opening time so you can enjoy as many of the rides and attractions as possible before the crowds swell and potentially make you feel less comfortable. This is how to help maximise your time in the park. Tip: At present, our preferred way to travel to Ocean Park is to take bus 629 from Admiralty, where you can also buy your park entry tickets (HK$320 per adult). There are plenty of buses making this route and the journey is direct, taking 10-15 minutes to journey.

Glad we visited the ocean park. Ideal for those vacationing with grown up kids who've crossed the Disney age.The rides may be classified as normal fun to daring and stomach churning.Well maintained penguin and sea lion enclosures,some unusual arachanids,marmoset monkeys ,birds and a fabulous show by the dolphin and sea lions .the park is well connected by trams,escalators and walkways.The view from the top is panoramic glimpse of hongkong bay and the islands.The tickets are all inclusive but the food.The laser lights and water show is a must see

Fun for all. The animals are well looked after and give an impression that they enjoy interacting with people. There's also a lot of educational materials to the public on how to look after the animals and the environment.

Great Way to Spend a Day. I visited Ocean Park a few days after Christmas, with all of the holiday attractions still in place.Ocean Park tries to provide something for everyone and succeeds in a big way. The scenery while riding the cable car is breathtaking. Pandas, a recreation of Old Hong Kong, a stage show,rides, giant aquarium, animal shows and all topped off with special Christmas presentations, including a children's choir singing carols in English.The admission price (HK 320) is reasonable and despite huge holiday crowds, even getting there and back was easy on the beautiful double-decker bus 629 leaving from the Admiralty stop on the MTR. A tip: Later in the day there may be a long line (queue) to ride up on the cable car. Go early to ride up and then ride down-where there was no line (queue)-later in the day.Definitely worth a whole day and if you have kids, will want to go back again.

A must see but.... We went in Jul 2009.It is a must see when in Hong Kong, but considering it is built on a mountain, it would be great if we were mountain goats. It is hilly and some effort is needed to get to attractions, etc. Still it is worth the effort. At least I can say I have been there.

Most beautiful theme park in the World. A fantastic and awesome setting on the hillside overlooking the South China Sea. Nice range of coasters and the chance to see Pandas. Plus one of the most amazing cable car rides you can take.

Go for the cable car first. Once u reach ocean park, go for the cable car ride to the mountain side . The queue gets very long the moment the park operates. Saves a lot of time when u queue early. Later on, use either the cable car or the ocean express train to travel back. We managed to take the cable car ride to and fro, and the same applies for the ocean express train. Once on the other side, go for the ocean tower ride. It gives u a bird's eye view of the whole ocean park & it's scenic surroundings. Check out the feeding time for the pandas. Go for the Panda exhibit near the ocean express train station, near the main entrance of the park. It's more close up. There's also another panda exhibit cross the mountain, together with a monkey exhibit. That is not so interesting as the pandas are kept behind the glass exhibits and u have to follow the queue of people. I think most people missed the panda exhibit I mentioned. It's the best time for picture taking when they are munching on the bamboo leaves. We were lucky to see one feeding. The other was sleeping like a log. You have to be there as early as you can before the crowd sets in. We enjoyed the peaceful walk on the other side of the mountain as we were one of the earliest to arrive. It's a combination of a zoo & amusement park. Check out the ocean theatre performance. Take bus 629 from Admiralty MTR. Buy your park entrance tickets there, so u don't have to queue at the ticket counter outside the park later. Can use octopus card to pay for the bus ride, about 20min . Plan for a whole day there to enjoy the rides and various exhibits.

Clean ocean park with new attractions like hair raisers, and the acrobat show is worth seeing. Ocean park is very clean and has new attraction like new rides, etc but food is very expensive a simple rice topping with pork as ado and white chicken or duck costs like hkd100 plus

So So Park. Arrived on 30 Dec 2013, 2 adults and 2 kids. Would rate the Park so so and for me not near as good as Hong Kong Disneyland. The Cable Car ride was very good with excellent views, we went for it straight away and the queuing time was 15 minutes. Both Dolphin show and Bird Show were poor in comparison to other dolphin and bird shows that I have seen, hope Ocean Park address these as a priority. Aqua Adventure Show was really good. We booked tickets online with Grayline Tours which included tickets, hotel pick-up and drop-off. We reached at 10am when the Park opened and left at 6pm when the Park closes, it is not possible to cover everything in 1 day but for me 1 day in this park is enough. Make sure you get the show timetable at the Park Entrance and my tip is to organize your day around the shows. I would say do a show straight away after using the cable car instead of going on the dodgem ride as we missed the North Pole show. Pulled out the Ferris Wheel Ride queue after 5 minutes as it would have taken an hour to get to the front of the queue. No fast pass system available in this Park. Not enough rides for under 10 year old kids. Panda enclosure and feeding time was worth seeing.

Great mix of rides for everyone. There is a good variety of rides for all visitors. Food stalls are found everywhere around the park and the food is fairly affordable too. Expect to queue for most attractions though.
Enjoyable journey. You have to start your tour early so that you can enjoy all the rides and have a remarkable experience

So much to see & do. Would defiantly recommend a visit to anyone if any age.There is so much to do & see. We enjoyed the rides, the dolphin and seal lion show, the aquarium, going to visit the pandas and much more. Then to finish the day off we enjoyed a light, water and fire show outside the aquarium at around 7pm. There is a map & show schedule in English as well as Chinese as you walk into the entrance. The map is a definite as the park is so big. They are currently building a metro station for the park, but it is easy to get too by metro & then bus. We got a taxi there which was reasonable price & then took bus & metro back to our hotel in Kowloon. There are signs as you exit the park to the bus station or taxis which ever you would prefer. Really enjoyable day!!

Loved it. Having seen Singapore Ocean park, HK's trails....But yes, it is a good one day visit. some of the shows are amazing which you must not miss like the dolphin show, the sea lion show...Children are sure to enjoy!

great!. Before going I read that it tries to be a zoo, aquarium and theme park but is a bit of a jack of all trades master of none.This might be true but also allows for a bit of variety rather than being forced to have only one of the above and hence quite an enjoyable day out overall.Highlights - some of the 'thrill rides' were quite good and definitely more thrilling than the Disney rides in Tokyo Disneyland/sea and by extension possibly Disneyland HK? Namely hair raiser, dragon, flash, mine train to name a fewPandas were great, really enjoyed the arctic/antarctic exhibits, the aquarium, jellyfish and the dolphin show.tips - like all theme parks get there early as it is busy - weekdays preferred - go to the website beforehand to get an idea when the animal feeding times are. Write them down or screen capture it if you have no phone internet on premises. - dolphin show was pretty popular people noted to grab a seat early although latecomers still were able to find seats when I went - cable car always has a long queue. Possibly avoid by taking the train and noting the peak times (queue FROM the entrance huge in the morning, queue AWAY from the entrance huge in the evening- plan accordingly)  - I don't know where people were pre-buying tickets because the line for the tickets at admiralty station wasn't short - even on what was a pretty busy day things massively quietened down in the last couple hours after the chinese tour buses went away and the families with small children went home. Great time for rides especially the thrill ones. Had literally no wait and squeezed in like 4 rides in the space of an hour including a repeat of mine train which I waited an hour for during the day. - there are a few rotten apples amongst the tourists so bringing a sense of humor is mandatory - there is a fair bit of walking as the park is huge even for a theme park so wear comfortable shoes - we saw a few disgruntled single riders who went on slower than the normal ride

Oh My God !!!. Boy !!! this is something you should not be missing. Advice to travelers is if you are out to enjoy the entire park, its a 2 full day affair minimum. One day you cant even cover and you will be tired. So pack your bags for two days if you want to get the full benefit. Do not miss any attractions. everything is worth watching. All rides, amusements and everything and anything.
fun and great value!. fun place for the family. a mix of a zoo, Seaworld, and theme park all together. the tram ride through the air on the side of the mountain is thrilling!

Interesting place ...forever busy and crowded!. As we were repeat customers coming from North Point area, we took the public bus(Citybus 41A) from NP Bus Terminal. This is a low cost and efficient ride to Ocean Park. For overseas travellers, you may get a discount on the admission ticket (normal price adult HK$320) when you present your airline boarding pass or the passport.Getting to the park by 10.00 am allowed us to spend a longer day there and was able to enjoy the many fun rides and shows. The most remarkable one was the Hair Raiser(super roller coaster) and the least challenging one should be the cable car ride. You need to just sit back and relax and watch the view below you. Not bad.Ocean Park facilities are great and well maintained. The public bathroom and rest area are clean and tidy. To save time and money, if you need to... you can also pack your favourite lunch and eat on the go. We felt the dolphins show was just average ~ 15 minutes of show time. Also watching the pandas eating and playing around in the enclosure may give one some entertainment. Yet it is not everyone's liking to watch animals in enclosed area.Overall, it was an interesting place filled with activities and sights and of course, the crowd. Rated 4 out of 5.

A good time but... Ocean park is your typical theme park, it doesn't have more to offer than the usual. But the kids enjoyed it. We did however had to decide between Ocean park and Disney land, Disney is more expensive but may have been the better choice. The only thing awesome about Ocean Park is of course the whale show, and the aquarium.

Nice day out with the family. Be there early and take the cable car immediately to avoid the queues. Take the underground on your way back if the queues are too long for the cable car. Pandas and aquarium were not busy in the late afternoon.

Very Nice Outing. I booked my tickets through Big Bus. Later on, I found out that you can actually get a 10% discount if you purchased the tickets through Sky100 Tower ticket counters.Booking through Big Bus does have its benefit anyway. I was able to extend my Big Bus tour i.e. paid one day for a 2 day tour where one day did the whole Green and Red line tour and the next day did the Ocean Park tour.The attractions was fantastic - kids loved it but time was not on our side. Queue was long. Photos taken there quite expensive about HKD100 a piece.The Old Hong Kong attraction was also nice. It gives a nice glimpse of HK during the olden days. Panda enclosures is a must visit. Just loved looking at those cute pandas and how they move about. Do visit Ocean Park when in HK. You'll love it.

For kids aged 3 to 83. Had a blast with my family and friends because of the many attractions here. Souvenir items are reasonable priced. Food carts are almost every where and transportation from and to the hotel is never a problem

Great time with children. Will require a full day to cover the huge park. Just 20 mins from central by bus 629, which is the only public transport, although a new MTR station is being built right up the entrance of the park. My son of 8 years had a great time. Food esp some traditional ones are all over the park. But I took away one star in the rating because -1) some of the rides looks dated and 2 ) there is no priority pass or separate entrance for higher priced tickets. If you are there on a holiday then pl be prepared to wait for 25-30 mins or more for each ride

Wonderful . My boyfriend and I had a wonderful day here (we are both in our 30's). So much fun that you can't really pack it all into one day. The gondola ride up the hill was the highlight - stunning views. The rides are amazing - hair raiser is a real must - extremely thrilling. A must see in Hong Kong.

I wish the park hours were longer!. There's just so much to see in this wonderland! I wish we really tuck to our plan to go there before lunch time, so we could've seen more shows and tried more rides! The aquarium and the pandas are cute and educational, but don't take long going through them, because the real fun awaits when the cable car takes you over at the other side of the mountain! We queued for the cable car for about 45 minutes, and this was on a Monday (I bet the lines would be longer on weekends and holidays), so make sure you allot time for this. Otherwise you can just take the tram, which is faster, but not as fun!Adrenaline junkies will love Thrill Mountain! Go first for The Flash, which wasn't nearly as terrifying as it looked! You'd think you'd freak out from swinging 360 degrees hundreds of feet up in the air--but no, it was actually my most favorite! Hair Raiser comes a close second. The Abyss was the bomb! It isn't for the faint-hearted! And if you're scared of heights, be sure to pick out a seat facing away from the cliff and the sea ;)We wanted to have another go at the rides but by 6 pm everyone was already wrapping up! In the end we didn't even see the sea lion shows, because there was just so little time walking and queuing from one ride to the next!This is definitely a must-try Hong Kong experience! I think most of the hostels sell discounted tickets, we got ours from the hostel we were staying at. Be sure to bring bottled water (because they cost thrice as much inside the park!) and go there before lunch time!

nice place to be with the family. some nice attractions and a good place to be with family with teens. the aquarium was cool but the best attraction was to get a glimpse of the panda which to the excitement of everyone came very close to the glass pane. the cable car was also good but quite a long queue but thats something you have to expect at almost all theme parks. difficult to do all in one day but really enjoyed the rides.

Even if you are not into rides, taking the cable car up and view the scenery itself is worth the visit! . Heard about Ocean park umpteen times but was hesitant to visit. Mixed review of people saying the rides are old fashion and not worth visiting. They are wrong! We were so glad we decided to go! The rides were original and not fanciful (in terms of sci fi or high tech) but they were authentic to the core. My favorite is the old school fly swing. I was elated to sit on one of those. It makes u feel high an forget the troubles instantly! The amazing part is how those roller coasters were built on the cliff. The view was fantastic even while riding, you literally felt that the roller coaster was diving into the sea! It really add the excitement into the rides. The cable car ride was great and if you have time, visit the patio of Hagen daz for ice cream, the view is worth it! I will really recommend family with kids especially older kids and teenagers to go as they will have fun there!

Amusement park for all. Is a family trip, so i make sure each of us at least to have a ride on those "machine". I did it! Beside that, observing animals also can be enjoyable in Ocean Park, such as seal, penguin, sea creatures and panda. Suggested if your schedule is free, or just want to take a look the new set Hong Kong old Street, is quite fun!

Ups and downs . Great views of Aberdeen. The big dolphin show was quite boring, maybe the least interesting we have seen. The small show at Whiskers Theatre however was great for our 3 year old and very well done. Overall the park feels a bit dated, but still worth a visit. Wait for the metrostop at the park entrance to finish though, the bus queue is long.

They hold dolphins captive... would be a great place otherwise.. Watch "The Cove", then make up your mind if any place that still holds dolphins captive performing in tiny pools can have any other review than "terrible". I do wish they would close this side of the park because the rest is pretty great.

Just another amusement park BUT it had pandas!. We went to ocean park on a mission to see pandasl's and we were successful! The staff in the panda enclosure were nice enough to stick around while I asked my 20 questions. The park overall is pretty average and having never been to HK before I'm not too sure if everywhere is this busy but I was getting frustrated. The other people in the park seemed to have no concept of manners and just shoved us out of the way! At the start of the day we were so excited from the panda's we didnt mind, but the other tourists in there were infuriating. More relative to the park itself, the layout compared to the map seemed not quite right so we found ourselves going in many circles!Bottom line: go for the panda's and the aquarium but if you are a westerner, pack more patience than you have ever required.

A Quite Nice Experience. We visited on Saturady,First we went to MTR admiralty station; exit B; you will see bus 629 waiting there. We got the entry passes from there ; 320 HK $ for adults. The Aquariums ; pandas; cable car view; old hongkong; ocean express; all are amazing. To cover everything one day it is difficult; overall a must go for having fun.

Ocean Park - day visit. Visited on the 30th Dec 2013, got their around 11:30 - lots of people in line to buy tickets - though lines move rapidly - should have bought tickets online Once in the park it's like any other popular rides have long lines - Avg waiting time 30-60 min. Other rides are quickWatched the dolphin show and the aqua voyage both were enjoyable. The firework display at 8pm worth the wait. This time of the year weather cold must take warm clothing.Food on the pricey side if you can carry snacks and bottled water.Most people leave after firework display prepare yourself for Long Lines for the bus transport to stationIf you not taking a cab.

Great Expereince and Must Visit. I was there in the park alongwith my daughter. There were pletiful of rides, one better than the other. The only downside was long waiting time due to the holiday season. I would recommend this park visit to everyone who come to Hong Kong
Brilliant. We loved it here. Amazing park with awesome rides for all ages. Plenty of photo souvenirs for purchase at cheap prices. Great great great!!!

Another Theme Park. beside DIsneyland, Hongkong had Ocean ( theme park and aquarium plus lots of show there )Spending 1 day here, to try all the ride 3x, definitely worthed if you like that kind of things..

Dolphin experience. We arrived just before the park opened and without the crowds ocean park feels extremely different. As we approached the ticket counter to confirm the dolphin experience for 6 of our party of 15, we were met by ms sing who was in charge of education. She was very accommodating and welcoming. As the experience with the dolphins began I thought it would only be for a few minutes. It turned out to be more than an hour which was worth the fees. The faces of our family and the experience to be with dolphins was priceless. Highly recommended.
A Tourist attraction. If you have the time and enjoy theme parks, it's worth a visit. Brilliantly designed, the chair lift is a must.

Go for the rides, go early run to the cable and line up.... This is a great park for the rides, which offer majestic views and thrills. If you wish to see majestic animals in small cages, you can do that too. Unfortunately what you have read about mainland tourists is true and may ruin your day. HOLD on to your kids at all times, people will push between you and your kids. Again avoid weekends and holidays, come early, buy your tickets at Admirality Station in advance and you may really love this!
Ocean Park HK. This place is definately for those who likes roller coasters. I spent whole day there. Singing fountain at the end of the day was amazing!!! Great show!

This is the play park of Hong Kong. The original place for a day out of exciting hardcore fun and getting there is another adventure.Everyone knows Ocean park and why dont you join the millions who love it so much they keep going back.

Ocean Park with the Family. Worth the Money, super big and i think you will need 2 days to venture all. Loved the BBQ squid. We had so many, dipped in Sambal Belachan that i brought along. LOL. Put on your most comfy shoes!

Disorderly conduct spoiled visit. Ocean Park seems well thought out and designed but the disorderly conduct of some of the guests made it difficult to enjoy and I left with an unpleasant feeling. Forming queues was especially difficult for some guests. Some would enter a queue in the middle of the line. Even in line, they would push and shove to get ahead. If guests don't know how to self-discipline, Ocean Park needs more staff to maintain order.

the new aquarium is a real disappointment. I used to live in HK and visited Ocean park many times over a 12 year span. 3 years later, we visited again on holiday from the UK. There's lots to do and many more rides (for those who like them). But for me, the new aquarium is not a touch on the old Atoll Reef which was world class and contained the best selection of fishes I've ever seen. Why they have replaced it with something much less interesting I have no idea. The old sea lion enclosures were also so much better than the dark & gloomy ones they have now. I remember the sea lions swimming playfully up to the underwater viewing panels giving visitors a real treat. As another reviewer mentioned, since the influx of mainland Chinese into HK in recent years, this and Disneyland is now swarming with ill-mannered, pushy, rowdy visitors, and queuing for attractions takes so much longer. And it has become excessively commercialized within the park, and visitors can expect to part with at least HK$800 - 1200 each. That includes the entrance fee, a meal (around HK$120) photographs (HK$198 for one) drinks (HK$26 for a 500ml bottle of coke) and lots of opportunities to part with more cash on fairground type stalls.The cable car ride is still going, thankfully, and is well worth the wait to get on board. But they've added the Ocean Express train as an alternative.In my opinion, the arrival of Disney has forced Ocean park operators to enhance the park in order to meet the competition. But in so doing, they have lost some of the best attractions that they were well known for.The dolphin / sea lion show wasn't as spectacular as I've seen here before, but still worth a visit. We arrived at the 3.30 show 15 mins early, but all the seats were taken already. So do arrive well in time or you'll be standing a long way back.

Fabulous!. We went to ocean park & loved it. It had an aquarium, pandas, dolphin show, sea lions & penguins. Such a lovely place. However there are not many rides here. The restaurants are very expensive here but nice, we had a great fun day & would recommend this place by the south china sea, very beautiful views of the ocean & the dolphin show was great.

Must-go theme park. Chose this park above Disneyland Hong Kong to find that the choice was well made. This park offers you a variety if rides with ocean life as well!! While returning from the park, the timber trail ride was the best ever! It gave us a picturesque and breath-taking view. Had lunch at the restaurant inside the park and was an experience of its own. The place has an aquarium with penguins in it. It is temperature controlled which is equivalent to sitting in Arctic however, they do give blankets to keep the guests warm till they finish their meals!A complete entertainment package for all age groups!

Prepare to walk.... We have been to Disney land on our last vist. So this visit, we went for Ocean park instead. From many reviews, we understand that Ocean Park is of much better facilities than Disney Land. Well, it is certainly not disappointing.The fist place we visited was the aquarium, compare to SEA aquarium in Singapore, it is relatively pale with less variety. But it compensates with some exotic species like hammer head sharks, deep sea organisms such as Nautilus, glow fishes.Visitors are poilt for choices when come to amusement rides, the place is divided into a few sections with each having its share of equipments, enough to fill your urge for excitements. Because of our wide spread of ages, we did not manage all the facilities, which to me is a little unfortunate. Anyway, I don't think we van finish all the games neither even if we arre on our own.,One disappointment though, orca was taken off the menu, and also because of the huge influx of Chinese visitors, the place became very croweded, and Chinese visitors are a rowdy bunch. Imagine that I was only there after more than 12 years of absence, and I can witness a fight simply because 2 parties compete for view space. It certainly does not reflect well about China's image.

Fabulous for a 9 year old. Had a fabulous day here. We are regular Disneyland visitors, but had been told that in Hong Kong Ocean Park reigned supreme, so we gave it a shot. Turned out to be a fabulous day and one we would do again! We got a cheaper ticket from the Chinese Travel Agent at the Airport (recommended by a great lady at the Hong Kong Tourism Board) and headed off on public transport to the park.We alighted at Central Station and got the bus to Ocean Park. All very efficient. Entry to the park was quick and painless and we were soon running around the park having a ball. To go from one area to another it was a delight to take the cable car. What an experience in itself. So many rides to entertain a 9 year old, although she is a bit of a daredevil! Only downside was waiting to go in for lunch at Tuxedos. It was a great meal but there were 30 people in the queue before us, and this was at three in the afternoon. Once we were seated we had a great view of the penguins - both swimming and feeding.Great day, and one that would be enjoyed by many, especially those who like the thrill of roller coasters and rides that frighten the living daylights out of you!

Zoo, Aquarium, Amusement Park all packed in one Package!. Gosh, Ocean Park is really Huge! There are so many things to do and see there. Love especially the super cute pandas and red pandas. I supposed we need another two to three trips to complete everything. Would definitely want to go back again!

A Great Park to visit. Visited this park 2 times in 3 yrs time (both in Dec) when we did stop over in HK. The park is less crowded than the Disneyland, we always choose to enter the park at 10AM before busses with mainland tourists arrive. The asian animals are always amazing and we love the pandas. We choose to take the train to the other part of the park and watch dolphins show, and then take the cable car ride down, no queue at all. I always wonder why most people do not do/think that ;) There is plenty of small rides/playground for toddlers next to the Panda area. I would say i see more local HK families with kids during both visits than in Disneyland.Location is just 10 min ride with bus from Admiralty station, and i saw a new MTR station being completed, would be perfect!The only less issue is there are park photographers offering taking family pictures with our camera and then they use their own camera for "commercial purpose"Best place to visit in Hong Kong with young family.

Nice place but too crowded. Got to see seals, sea lions n panda really closeup. The dolphins show is disappointing, crowds started gathering to watch the show from as early as 30 mins b4 the show. Show itself is only 20 mins & definitely have seen much better shows by dolphins prviously. The park was very crowded when we visited on a Monday 23 Dec, which was too crowded. Purchasing tickets at the park took a long time. Some rides look very interesting, but the rowdy crowds from a particular country really puts us off. We were being pushed into the train, with other tourists pushing and running and jumping queues. We were glad to get out at the end of the trip.

For animal enthusiasts. Ocean park is more fitted for the animal lovers and older children. It may not be as fun as disneyland, but it's for a change. The animals are somewhat the main attraction, so it's technically just a zoo, but a really good one. I definitely recommend this for the whole family, especially for those interested in animals.

Fun day for the entire family. Worth the entire day, maybe even two. Did not manage to cover the entire park. Would love to be back there, but hopefully during a season where there's less of tourist from a specific country who pushed their way around, including in the loo. Skip the dolphin show at the Ocean Theatre, it's an insult to the dolphins who are way smarter than what they displayed on the show.

For older kids - pref 8 and above. BB is about 3.5 years old. many of the rides not suitable for this age. Aquarium is fine but slightly dated. Tank has many species of fish but pales in comparison to Sydney's or Singapore's. Waiting time rather long even on a Monday! Looks a little dated actually. Would give this place a miss if not for a new experience for bb. Cable car and ocean express train a good idea to move people from one side to the other.

The views! The animals!. My two favorite things about this amusement park are the gondola ride with spectacular views and the native animal displays: pandas and goldfish.The panda pen displays two black and white pandas and the lesser known red panda. If you've ever admired goldfish, make sure to visit the goldfish pavilion, where they are displayed as though they are in painted Chinese scrolls -- as art.All the rides are fun too, as is the aquarium.Make sure you go first thing when they open, and on a weekday. Otherwise, the crowds are almost impossible.

Fun Day Out. One of the best parks I have been to. It really caters for everyone of all ages. Also such varied things to do Pandas and monkeys, roller coasters , amazing aquarium cable car..... No long queues which is refreshing. The worst bit was leaving as we had to queue for a taxi which took an hour. Also some of the taxis which would come agonisingly one by one decided not to take you and drive off empty! The queues for buses were equally as long. If you go I would recommend that you leave well before the park closes (6pm) or arrange with the taxi taking you there a pick up.

Huge. This theme park is MASSIVE and diverse. The attractions range from spectacular to poor. Surprisingly the lines for the rollercoasters were very very short.Be sure to get there early. In the afternoon Chinese mainland tour groups come, and they come in the thousands. It will quickly become very overcrowded even for such a huge park.My one complaint is there was very very few places to eat undercover. It started to rain while we were there. and the fights over the few chairs under shelter were not pretty.
lots to do. just keep in mind Hong Kong gets cold in December and wet!but tyhe food at the Terrace? restauarant had awesome views and food was good very helpful cashier

great for families with kids. Been here a few years ago and noticed that the park has been refreshed. Bought my tickets at a discount at the airport and had discount vouchers for meals and shopping. The aquarium was great but not as impressive as the SEA AQUARIUM in Singapore. the big glass panel to view the fishes was majestic but they do not let u sit around to admire the fishes. The panda enclosure and panda adventure were great. One day wasn't enough for the park as there is so much to do. The crowds from a nearby country was quite a putoff as they were loud, rude and q-cutting. If u stay long enough for them to leave with their tour guides, you'll find the park returns to it's peaceful tranquil nature allowing u to see the animals and enjoy the rides.

Visit to Ocean Park. It was a sunny Sunday when we visited the park. As it was a weekend, there were a lot of Mainland Chinese tourists at the park too. The attractions were quite spaced out and requires a lot of walking (not ideal for wheel chair bound visitors and young children). I also felt that the attractions' themes were "confusing" (example panda enclosure and some of the rides) in certain aspects. As the park closes at 6pm, one may not have enough time to try out all the rides and view the exhibits within a day. Best to go on a weekday if you do not want to "squeeze with the rest".

Fun Place for Kids & Adults too. Bring kids there is a good choice ,kids like it very much .Me too. There are shows in between so, do check out the showtime and plan your tour around the park.Do checkout the water show at the end of the day!! It's great. The longest queue was for the cable car - about 30 minutes. We had took lots of pictures on the way up of the view across to Repulse Bay and Stanley. Preferable go on winter as you will have to walk a lot. Besides, try to reach there as early as you can to avoid the crowded.

Ocean Park Hong Kong. They provide rental of buggy car for kids, convenient for parents to stroll up and down with younger kids. Restaurant are overcrowded had to wait at least 1 hour just to get a table. Food price are overly charged.
Old but a GEM. This unassuming park brings back memories of how amusement parks used to be. The games stalls were a thrill for the kids, the uncle ringo kind of rides also appeal to the little ones.

awesome. When I first reached here, I was overwhelmed with the attractions in the park, so much to do, so little time!! There are shows in between so, do check out the showtime and plan your tour around the park. Lockers are available at the right building after you enter the main entrance.There are two sites where the arcades and rides are on the other side of the mountain which you could reach by cable car (long queue). So, check out the lower station on the pandas and head to the upper station for dolphins, penguins, jellyfish and fun rides!! The view from the cable car were awesome and the rides are even better!!If you are there with elderly who may find it too tiring to tour the whole park, plan some different activities for both the youths and the elderly so that both generations can have fun their own way without being too tired.Do checkout the water show at the end of the day!! It's awesome and yes, the bus shuttle service is available late enough for you to finish watching the show.

upgraded since our last visit 2010. The new aquarium near the entrance has some fascinating sea creature displays-- great for children.The design of the park route is unchanged, which is not convenient. Once you go to the top by cable or by shuttle train, you cannot walk down by pedestrian route. So when many visitors are at the top, you have to wait with the crowds to go on the cable or shuttle train again.

awesome. I love roller coasters and the guy who decided to place this one on the side of the hill was a genius I would highly recommend this park just a shame when I visited there were a few repairs/refurbishments happening. Staff very friendly and helpful water show at the end of the day was an eye opener

Fun day out with plenty to do. Took the 629 bus to get there. Long queues to get onto bus but it was manageable. Ocean park has more to offer than Disneyland but of course Disneyland has the magical atmosphere. There is definitely more for older children and teens here esp better suited rides. The cable car ride is a must - there were really long queues for the cable car ride when we arrived and we noticed they were not filling up the cable cars hence the queue was moving very slowly. We would have probably waited 90 mins or more so we took the express train to the other side - takes about 400 passengers hence no waiting. Good selection of rides on that end but more geared for older children. Once we were done exploring that side and seeing the penguins and sea life we took the cable car across. The queue was much shorter - approx 15 minutes. We only managed to see one panda bear but my son was thrilled and that was the highlight of the day for him.

I am not a kid and I loved it.. Got there on a 6X bus from Central. The driver spoke little English so I went passed Ocean Park by one stop - the one I should have got off at is close by the end of Aberdeen Tunnel - so I wandered back paid my money and stayed until Ocean Park closedThe longest queue was for the cable car - about 30 minutes. I had a car to myself and took lots of pictures on the way up of teh view across to Repulse Bay and Stanley. I recommend getting the cable down and the "train" up to avoid the queues..The guide map is not clear but I did almost every ride that was not closed for maintenance sharing fun with locals - we were turned upside down together on the Hair Raiser and luckily being midweek the queues were about ten minutes or less for a ride (of a just a few minutes). Got soaked together on another ride - hey on a hot day why spend money on rain poncho.Loved it.Free fall thing was fun as was the other ride that just about made it over top when it seemed you might be stuck see video if an upload itDo them all - I just never bothered with what seemed like simple bumper cars.Try to make it one of the excellent Dolphin and Sea lion shows about 30 minutes before the advertised time.The Panda trail was great - as well as a couple of the usual Black and White Pandas there were red ones as well. The otters were cute and the fish were fascinating.It was getting dark by the time I left which made the closing show of sound, light, water and fire all the better.At closing time there is a special express 269 bus service from outside Ocean Park. Just check as some go to Admiralty (which had queues) and some go Central (which I just walked on and got a seat upstairs - but it was full and standing by the time it left.Take water - buy snacks and souvenirs there.

Awesome rides. I visited this place after visiting Disneyland and I have to say that rides over here are much better then those at Disneyland. Disneyland is there for experience and ocean park is for rides only.But try not to visit on a hot day, as u will have to walk a lot.
animals + theme park. well, i prefer this place than disneyland. there's animals to view, rides to enjoy. love the cable car ride, awwsome view! be prepared to spend the entire day there
enjoyed the roller coaster. its perfect for families and friends as well. the aqua and wild life is well maintained and the roller coaster is jsut amazing.

Fun times but a long wait. We went on Dec 9 and due to the amount of student tour groups and adult tours the lines were extremely long for a weekday visit. This was our second time in the park, though our first visit was 10 years ago. The park has changed a lot since then. Our favorite attraction was the Dolphin show which is a must-see for everyone who visits. We were fortunate to be visiting with a annual pass holder member so we had VIP seating for several of the shows. This was very convenient as the VIP seats as dead center and in a special area with security staff who checks. You need to acquire a VIP ticket from Guest Relations at the beginning of the day and arrive at the theater/showcase for your selected time. We also enjoyed the Arctic exhibition with the penguins. Very cute and charming. Most of the rollercoasters were fun, but sadly on the day that we went the Mine Train and the Dragon were both out of commission due to maintenance repairs. The pandas were fun to see but they were sleeping when we went so it wasn't very exciting. If you arrive around 2:30-4pm at the Panda cafe you can experience a super good deal for $98HK which includes a BBQ pork noodle with orange juice and a ice cream. It's better than any other food deals they have available. They call this the "tea set" lunch. We spent the whole day there from 10am til closing 6pm, and we were treated with a incredible water illusion show at the end of the night. We were also impressed with the massive gift shop that is in the Summit. We found lots of goodies there.

Like the expansion. Spent the whole day there! The rides were fantastic especially the mine train and the flash! At the end of the day, taking the cable back to the entrance with the night view is a must!

Exhillirating. A must for those who love those adrenalin pumping activities. Forget about the lower deck. Go straight up via cable car or the submarine. That's where the actions are. So may rides and things to do. My son didn't have time to finish all the rides coz we wasted time at the lower plane. By the time we went up at about 12pm there was already a crowd queuing up at many of the rides. There is simply lots to do, visit the penguin enclosure, dolphin 'hospital and training' area, panda... Worth a visit for the young and the old.

great for family. i went to both disneyland and ocean park and seriously this park has a lot more to offer than disneyland which i found boring though kids may love it.i spend the whole morning and evening in the park.i just love all the animals.and the rides are not disappointing too.

Overcrowded, not suitable for older adults. It's a combination of an aquarium, a zoo, and an amusement park, as a result the place is huge so you most likely won't cover them all. You would be mistaken if you think you are getting all 3 for the price of 1. The one saving grace was the cable car. Highly recommended, although may not worth it if the queue is too long.There were very little sitting places and these were in high demand. It's not easy even getting a quick bite to eat at the concession stands because the seats were mostly taken by tired people resting there. The shows felt forced and tired, and I do not enjoy being lectured on while on vacation, even if the message is positive.Beware if you intend to take a taxi back at the end of the day; it's very poorly coordinated, and you could be waiting forever.

Crowded but still worth a look. Ocean Park has gone through quite a thorough makeover since the last time we visited here in 2001. Be prepared to queue for entry to any attractions there. Also due to the busload of tourists, be prepared to tolerate any uncouth behaviors and not let it spoil your day. The longest queue in the park had to be the cable car ride. We queued for an hour but it's all worth it.

Place was ok but tainted with loud & brash tourists. My family and I enjoyed the attractions and rides in Ocean Park but compared to our visits 4 years ago, Ocean park seems to be infested with more tourists.They came in bus loads and armed with a digital camera, these tourists brazed through the park, talking loudly and cutting queues. Highlight of these tourists would definitely be at the grand aquarium. Even though there were signage placed outside the aquarium for visitors to refrain from using flash photography, almost all these tourists were taking pictures of the marine animals with flash and when they were told by the staff not to use flash, they merely brushed it away and continued snapping pictures away.

A full family day out. Ocean Park is now a huge attraction, much bigger than it was when it opened in the 1980's. It has a great number of 'rides' and fun-fair type attractions pitched at families and young children. Also has a great aquarium, panda's and the best penguin pool/house I've seen

Good alternatve to Disneyland. A must go place other than Disneyland. It is still worth the effort to spend a day to see nice animals, especially those which only live in north and south poles. Dolphin show was not that spectacular, but still not too bad to spend 1 hour there. Those roller coaster rides are much exhilarating than those in Disneyland. Food was expensive though.

Huge Theme Park. A very huge theme park compared to Disneyland. The entrance fees is much cheaper than Disneyland. Need lots of walking in the park. The cable car rides is awesome. The tram ride ( Ocean Express) was fantastic with animations in the cabins. The rides in the park is more thrills and suitable for teens. Most rides required at least 120 meter height in order to take the ride. There were some sightseeing point like old Hong Kong street, the panda and aquarium. Overall a good and enjoyable theme park for family.

Half the rides were out of service. I was little disappointed with Ocean Park as there was no indication given on their website that some of the major rides were out of service. We skipped the aquarium side as there were too many people. We made the mistake of doing this towards the end of our trip when we were running low on energy (and sleep).

Good theme park but choose your day carefully. Good theme park with selection of rides for everyone. Very clean and well kept with lovely flowers everywhere. Its really important to choose your day for going if possible avoid weekends and all public holidays its just too crowded to enjoy. The show at the end is worth staying for- its very professional. The reason it doesn't get 5 stars is the lack of food options. We have eaten in middle kingdom- a Chinese restaurant which is good and well priced but far away from everything else so this time we went to Neptune's- fabulous ambience with hammerheads and manta rays swimming inches from you but the food is hideously over priced and such mean portions that we went straight to the bakery afterwards. There is really nowhere else to eat- Tuxedos is almost as bad as Neptunes.

A great day out. Visited Ocean park on our recent holiday to Hong Kong as the children were a little bit older. The kids loved the day, lots of walking up and down hills etc, but the rides, animals and entertainment were fantastic.

A Great Day Out!. We could have spent an extra day seeing everything here! Transport to Ocean Park was organised well from Admiralty MTR station. Many buses were available to get you there. Our favourite parts - The North and South Pole animals exhibits, Pandas (of course), and the Aquarium (better than anything I've seen). Our adult kids enjoyed all the rides they could fit in. We had a photo taken and bought the cheesy souvenirs - almost had the snowdome taken off us in airport security on our way home. Our whole family enjoyed the day, and there is something there for ALL ages. If Disneyland is not your thing, this will be. Or why not do both if you have the time!

Ocean Park HK. If you been to Genting, Sunway in MY then Ocean park may be just OK or disappoint for you. Too many ppl and long queue for simple rides. Getting food there is another issue. So if possible carry some food with you as they don't check your bag. Cable car ride was OK but again Genting and Lankawi is much better. Also this is pricy. So decide before you go if you go for a day trip.

Has a bit of everything!. Ocean Park has a real mix of activities: cable car, rollercoasters, aquarium… We had fun and recommend it; it’s not many places you can ride a roller coaster on a cliff top. The cable car is lovely and there are good views from much of the park. We loved seeing the giant pandas and the aquarium is actually really good, which we weren’t expecting. Down side: They have clocked on and now prevent you bringing in your own food and charge quite a lot for refreshments. The self-service restaurant is quite expensive but there are cheaper options and the food is good and views are amazing.

Fantastic day at ocean park. Went here on Dec 4th this year. Had a really great day, went with a friend. We went with out kids and really had a fun day. Only thing we found a problem was that know where seemed to sell coffee/tea. Only a couple places sold cold drinks. Found eating a bit difficult, but possibly our tastes on what we like to eat. There was so much to see and do, the Panda`s were amazing, as were all other animals. The theme park part was fun fun fun and we are in our 50`s. Lol. We laughed so much on the water ride got absolutely soaked. Good job was hot day, so soon dried out. This would be a fantastic day out for kids. And really good value. Cost around 25.00 pounds adults. Not sure about kids, but well worth the money.

Worth to visit. A Zoo, Aquarium, funfair and a theme park in one. Exciting rides available.Only con - too many up slopes. Tiring at the end of the day. Not advisable for senior citizen.How to get there:MTR to admiralty station then bus # 629Back to hotel, we took taxi to causeway bay cost about HKD 78.

Terribly crowded. I have visited this park many times, this was like the fifth time, can't see much improvement, overall prices up and lines longer, too many mainland visitors, terribly crowded, couldn't get transportation when we left the park, won't come back until Metro arrives here.
Worth to visit. Very nice park worth to visit to reach there use the MTR to admiralty station then bus # 629 . This is the cheapest easy way .Have fun :)

Inconvenient location. Senior unfriendly facilities, run down rides n some are not available. Can't even get a cab back to Kowloon. Lousy public transport system. HK Disneyland is MUCH MUCH BETTER! I won't recommend ppl travel with senior n young children.

If you have time, worth a visit. This is unlike anything I've seen - a zoo, aquarium and theme park in one! It can certainly keep you entertained for the day. However, I wouldn't out this at the top of my list of things you must do in HK.

Good For Family with Kids. Traveled there with my 4 year old son. It was great. After having seen the S.E.A aquarium the aquarium was a bit of disappointment. The rides for kids were fun, and the view from summit is excellent. The cable car ride had long queue.-- Take the tram/train up to the summit and the cable car down. The queue for the cable car at the summit was not as bad as compared to the way up from the park.-- Don't fall victim for the guys at the entrance who will take your photos. They will then quickly place your photos in a key-ring and paper-wight and hand it to the kids. Their target being kids, parents will be forced to buy those for exorbitant rates.

Ocean park- good for kids. This is my 3rd visit to this park and it seems to be getting more crowded! In my view , the attractions are decent compared to HK Disneyland and the cable car and 'submarine' ride up the top is great. Outside food is not permitted to be brought in and I think they are building a new tmr station so you do not need to take the bus in if coming in the future

Disappointing. We Travelled via the MTR to Admiralty Station and then took the city bus 629 to the park. Buy a return bus ticket as its easier. There are few rides and most of the park is a little tired. This park suit families with young children rather than teenagers.

Unique setting, intriguing adventure. This is really a great place for young and old.Try for yourself and see what I mean. It is betterto go in weekdays to avoid the crowds and November through January is the best timesince the Hongkong weather in May is normallywet and June through October is hot, humid withlots of typhoons. February is usually the codestmonth, and with winds blowing, the rather exposedareas may be unpleasant.

Nice place for kids. I have visited lots of aquariums so it did not make me very interested. But i believe it will be good for families who have children. One of the best was cable cars. It was amazing to see such a view. It was breath taking and a little bit scary :) also it was good to see pandas :)
FUN always. food is a bit expensive, you can bring snacks if you're on a budget.make sure to wear comfortable shoes, coz it's a long day's walk. the park is really really huge.

Can get crowded with very long queues for the Cable Cars. Great place but, as the title suggests the queue for the cable cars is insanely long. Coming down we waited approximately 90 minutes, which wasn't much fun with two 7 year olds.Outside of that the park itself is great fun and the display at the end of the day was great.
WOW!!. You will have visit this place to exprience when I say WOW!!Ideally 5 hours are good to spend. Do watch the show at 4.30pm

Ocean Park changed a lot since 1997.. I came here when I was a small kid in 1997, and when I back here this year, this park had change a lot! The park expanded largely. There were many new rides and attractions, they even make some theme park like rainforest and undersea theme, maybe the this idea was to compete with disneyland Hong Kong. Best ride got to be Hair Raiser!

Amusement Park across ocean. Ocean Park name can be realized only if you go on the cable car. I felt its good time to travel in the cable car in the evening so that you can have a view of the park and vision by day light and night light. Inside the ocean park, every ride is free. With kids you can enjoy a lot more with variety of activities and games. We enjoyed the cable car ride the activities across the sea than the aquarium. Aquarium has some interesting facts about the coral and its importance to ecological system. Being a couple we had limitation of fun. Worth a visit.

True Value for Money: You wont have to struggle managing your time and money. There are so many things to enjoy in Ocean park... and its not expensive at all compare to Singapore or other place I have been to. Another remarkable difference with other high end theme parks and this one is, Ocean Park is meant for the children whereas in many others (Sentosa, Universal Studio) I found there are a very few (only 10% may be) games/ rides/ events truly dedicated for the kids.There are lots and lots of rides and fun items there and you wont have to pay for each and everything you see at every step... one/two tickets are good enough to cover everything.. there are bird show, dolphins seal shows, Merry-go-round, fun posts, aquariums, roller coaster, cable cars, many things. And, view, nature locations.. amazing..! It was an off day in between my official trip and missed my kids a lot, going there.I highly... praise and thus strongly recommend parents to go to Ocean Park with your Kids.. Its truly value for money!

Don't miss this adventure. When you step inside Ocean Park HK, the child withing you will be mesmerized!A day is not enough to explore vast attractions in this place.My mom and I came to this place with no plans at all.When you come here, I suggest you come up with an itinerary so you can identify the attractions you'd like to check out because you may not visit all. It is better to make a list of your top attractions to visit.

Great fun day out. Loved the Pandas. Cable car trip to second level afforded breathtaking views. For the younger members of our group aged 16 to 31 the thrill rides. However had to queue 1 hour for hair raiser. Go early need to be there all day. Lots of rides but be prepared to queue as at all theme parks. Never less than 20 minutes.

Really an OCEAN of Attraction.. This is one of the best ever attraction i have been. The size is just too huge...and i literally mean it. it is so huge...that it has to be seperated by a huge mountain...and how beautifully they have used this by building a mammoth Cable Car and an underground train, option is yours. Cable car ride was too amazing and out of the world experience.The theme parks are also too good...each theme park has its own unique rides and attractions, mix for kids and adults. We had travelled with our 5 yrs old kid and were not able to enjoy a couple of rides, due to her height restrictions, but no worries on that. We actually get tired by the end of the day by visiting all the parks and almost difficult to cover everything in a day, cos there is a big queue for every ride you want to go.Lot of places, there are photographers who would click pictures from your camera as well as their's, and by the time you go to the booth, they would have a frame, keychain etc ready....which is an amazing speed.The only problem we found was no option of pure vegeterian food and not water fountain. We had to buy bottled water evertime and it is very very expensive.

Fun time. I wasn't sure if it would be worth visiting but I was wrong.It was great! It is a smaller Hong Kong equivalent of Bush gardens really.The animal exibitons are the best thing about the place. The indoor aquarium is fabulous, and the fact that you get to see YingYing the Panda was the best part of the trip!! There are also small red pandas which are adorable.There are loads of different animals and little areas to visit.Unfortunately when we went the rides were close for maintanence, but they where not thrill seeking rides anyway so I didn't feel i missed out on much.The dolphin and sea lion show is a must, the view of the ocean behind the show is absolutlely goregous and the show itself was brilliant.If you are considering skipping this then don't, it is worth the trip and amazing vallue for money in comparison to other parks around the world.

Exciting rides and nice grand aquarium. The park is very big and there are many attractions but not for the faint-hearted ones! Their rides are all very exciting. We enjoyed viewing most of the attractions such as the Sea Jelly Spectacular, Grand Aquarium, North and South Pole exhibits, Panda Village etc. Missed some of the ocean shows as the park is too big and we were too lazy to walk back to catch the timings.

The best theme park in the region. Ocean Park is unique in that it offers so much choice for all age groups in wonderful surroundings. The only set backs are the cafes and snack bars are expensive and limited and crowds can be overwhelming especially during holidays.Our visit was in the middle of the week so it was a real pleasure and no queues for the rides!Discounts are available and promotions frequent. Always ask for the latest deal or check on line.Recently the park has undergone a makeover which has been very successful and makes getting around even easier!See you there soon

Basically a zoo with rides. As this was my first trip to Hong Kong, I noticed some ads for this place around the Subway and on TV, I asked some of my girlfriend's family, who are locals, if it was worth going to, and I was told it was. So we went.I love animals, and seeing them up close. Don't get me wrong, I feel for them being locked in a cage, but a lot of times places like this are also rehabilitating animals or learning about them, I have no idea if this place was, but I like to tell myself that anyway. There was a dolphin and seal show, it was OK. The jellyfish exhibit was pretty great. They had an arctic pavillion with some penguins, arctic foxes and other animals. There were a ridiculous amount of animals to see, it would take you all day to see them all. I guess for me the big attraction was that they had about 5 pandas, and it's the first time (i think) that I have seen pandas. Turns out they're a bit of a let down. They just sit around and eat bamboo leaves all day and barely move. Still very cute.The rollercoasters were nothing special, but luckily the day we went had pretty low lines, so we went on a few.I would say it's worth it.

Changed so much, but AMAZING. Loved it, changed a lot since the last time I went 8 years ago.
But amazing. The variety and depth of animals, practically a zoo with a theme park and so much to see.
A PERFECT DAY TRIP!
PANDAs!!!!

Good day out!. Not really a place to go at the weekend or a public holiday. (just too many people!)But, if you are passing through Hong Kong and you go mid-week there is a good chance you will miss the crowds. Saying that, it is getting very popular (and has been for some time) with main-land Chinese. (even mid-week!!)That said, this is an excellent day out.Lots to do from toddlers through to adults.Get there early, when the gates open at 10am. You can buy your tickets earlier than that at the kiosk and start queueing early if you want.Below is a link to their homepage. (not sure if it is allowed... but anyway)http://www.oceanpark.com.hk/html/en/plan-your-visit/overview/Plenty of info there to peruse and plan your day before you get there. Take note of the "Plan Your Visit" page. You will be able to see what is closed for maintenance.You can rent baby strollers and wheelchair's if you need to.Rental Fee for single stroller is HKD $70/day. Wheelchair rental is HKD$60/day whereas senior citizens aged 65 or above can rent a wheelchair at HKD$30/day. In addition to the cost, you will have to pay HKD$100 refundable security deposit.There are many parts to the park and it does make for a long day, so do try and plan in advance, taking timing between shows (if it is shows you want) into consideration otherwise you may find you are late for the start or may even miss it altogether.Some excellent rides for all ages at the theme parks with a number of rollercoaster rides. 2 different areas for rides. One for teens/adults, and one for children. You need to make sure you are in the right area for you. Consult the Park map, its dead easy.Both areas are separated by a mountain and are connected by both cable car and a train. Beware!! If you leave it too late on the far side of the park, you may find you will have to leave the park on that side and get a taxi back round to the main entrance. (if you need to meet anybody on that side)Plenty of food and drink inside, but does get a little pricey. There is no reason why you can't take a picnic, kids love 'em. So go to the local supermarket, it all adds to the fun. Plenty of places to plonk down and get stuck into the sandwiches!An altogether great day out!!

It was mostly rides and gift shops.. It seemed a little too Disneyland. Too many gift shops. To leave the exhibit you had to go through yet another gift shop. They even were selling items inside the Aquarium. Only saw 2 pandas, in different areas, and 1 red panda. Not worth the time unless you are a teenager or have a child with you.
Great views. Ocean Park has a great cable car ride with views over islands and sea views. There are lots of rides and lots of animal exhibits.
a treasure place to go. i think it is the best ocean/marine park in the world for my opinion, games, food, suitable for all ages of tourist. kids, teens, young and old. funny and beauty place
Better than Disneyland!. Rides, sea mammal shows and more. Ocean Park is well worth a full day of family or couple fun. Amazing rides that rival anything in Asia. Fun for couples and teens as well.

Enjoyable Family Day. Got tickets at the MTR station so adults (over 12 ) ticket process were 290 HKD instead of 320.
