Then grabbed bus from admiralty station, about 12 minute bus ride (off peak).Large attraction over a large area main options are walking although cable car and internal train from one end to the other is available.Queues are you would expect (Monday) but nothing over 30 minutes. Enjoyable day kids tried most of the rides/attractions and found it more enjoyable than Disneyland HK.Need to allow at least 5 6 hours and worth staying for the evening light show at 18:00 when park closes. Everything very clean and well sign posted

Nice park good combination for kids and grown ups.... Theme park is nice. there are lots of animals that you can see which is very nice including animal shows. There are also plenty of rollercoaster and other things that are specifically nice when you dont have fear.... Very busy during weekend but better during the week. What is nice is that there are almost no waiting times which i personally appreciate a lot and is not so common in Europe. Excellent attraction to spend a great day with by the way, an astonishing view on the sea side of Hong Kong.

Amazing Day Out. Where to start - so much to see and do in this place its unreal. Very worth the money. We visited as couple with no kids and had an amazing day out. Slight disappointment that the big roller coasters were closed due to high winds and at the 2 times we went to go on them so were the cable cars but given that this was days after the typhoon in the nearby Philippians we understood and appreciated the safety precautions. But this did not stop us from having a great day out from start to finish - if you can be at the entrance in time for the closing light show at the fountains - fantastic and one of the best displays we have ever seen.Will def be back again as did not get to see and do everything here and that was despite some rides being closed and us being there from 11am to closing! A great day out.
Day out. Good to go on weekday..avoid holiday and weekends as the queue can be up to 45 min each ride. Lot of improvement since my last visit.

Pandas were a real treat. Kind of a cheesy amusement park for us spoiled Americans. I wanted to go specifically to see the giant pandas. The two in the Jockey Club environment were really disappointing, however, the outdoor habitat for the other pandas was great and I got some really good still and video shots of them in action. So glad I went despite the cost of the ticket and cab ride because I couldn't imagine being in China (or the SAR of Hong Kong) and not taking advantage of the opportunity to see these amazing creatures.

Get there early, beware of tour groups.. The park is getting dated, but my two young boys(7/10yo) still had a good time on all the rides. The North and South Pole exhibits were pretty good. You can stick your head in a dome and get a close up look at the walrus'. He was lying right next to the dome, with his big eyes staring at you only a few cm away!! We caught the cable car up to the top, it was a good ride. Not many queues for the rides early, but be prepared for lots of walking up/down steep paths. By early afternoon we were ready to return to the lower section to view the pandas, gold fish and the indoor aquarium. What a shock! It was like grand final day at the MCG. There were hundreds of tour groups from mainland China, all of whom had no concept of queing or waiting their turn to see anything. It was impossible to see anything, without being pushed over, by aggresive Chinese tourists. My young sons have bright red and blonde hair, and found constantly being touched and photographed a bit unsettling. We won't be back.

check the height requirements prior to going. I went with my 5 and 6 year olds, my baby couldnt go on hardly any of the fun rides like he could at Disneyland. We enjoyed the dolphin/seal show, and seeing the pandas up close. Wait times were a bit crazy for rides, and I learnt that locals will get pi**ed off at you if you allow more than 1m gap between you and the person ahead of you...beware!
Good but not great. Mostly old-fashioned rides, great distance between sections mar the experience. There is a stunning view to be had from some rides of the sea and mountains though.

Awesome - go during the week. The queues on the weekend can be terrible - but if you go during the week, the park is awesome. You'll be able to go on rides multiple times, and there are some pretty good rollercoasters. Real highlight is getting to ride rollercoasters whilst being on the waterfront - offers some great views if you're not throwing up!

Not the best compared to other attraction. One of the star attraction was the dolphin show which was really a letdown. My daughter got bored after 5mins. 1 dolphin was swimming ard aimlessly and the storyline came in 3 different language which really affected the whole show. It was really crowded during the weekend and the rides were really not that good compared to disneyland. However if its ur first time to Hong Kong, go at least once but dont spend your whole day there. If you want to skip the queue, purchase your ticket online and self print (the bar code on the ticket is the most impt, do not use econ or draft print to save ink). Getting there was really easy and fast.

It was good... but not great. After reading reviews, I had high expectations of Ocean Park. The Aquarium and Pandas were fantastic, but overall the park was a little shabby. The set up didn't make a lot of sense and it all seemed very hodge podge. Overall, we had a good day.
too busy at the weekend, and good only for bigger kids.. didn't find this place overly fantastic. Loads of rides etc, but alot of walking around, and long queues of weekend tourists. not great.

Good alternative to Disney land but alot of walking up and down sloping surfaces!. Good alternative to Disneyland. Focus on sealife, have many pay as you go rides which are very traditional. The cable view is a MUST! Good for young kids on the dolphin watch and the sealife. Otherwise bit too old not as pretty as Disneyland
Great park. We were there with 4-years old daughter and she enjoyed every minute. Rope road is brilliant, dolphin show worth to see. All the day you enjoy and enjoy. Pandas are so cute

Wonderful experience!. This is hands down the most beautiful amusement park in the world. The summit and waterfront are perched upon two different mountains and the views which you get while on the cable car are to die for. Absolutely stunning location. Apart from that, there are so many rides that you would probably have to skip some by the end of the day, so plan well in advance. Make sure to make it a priority to go for all the shows. The animal enclosures are fascinating. Loved the Panda adventure and the Penguins at the North Pole. All the main rides are up on the summit and there is a long line for the Cable Car, so make sure you cover the waterfront as soon as you can and join the line. We were unlucky to have missed the Hair raiser and Dragon as they were closed due to heavy wind. Also, three more rides were under maintenance which left us dissapointed. Make sure you avoid going here on a windy day. However, the other rides and shows more than made up for the missed ones, especially Abyss and Flash. If you are a Vegetarian, you'll have a hard time here as there is rarely anything veg here so carry something to eat in advance. That apart, I had a wonderful time here and this is undoubtedly one of the best parks in the world and is on par with the Hong Kong Disneyland. (Would have been better if Hair raiser and Dragon were open.)

much more adult themed park. Enjoyed myself here, at first was not sure but in the end had a great day.Rides were closed due to maintenance but i was not bothered as had flight back to uk that day.Enjoyed the sealife aquarium in which you see fish, squid, sharks and other sea life.saw bird king dom which was disappointing as could barely see any birds.Took a cable car ride to other side of island and saw ying ying the panda in panda kingdom which made my younger siblings dream come true.ate lunch in bayswater kingdom, food was decent.Also saw dolphin and sea lion show which was good but not as good as florida which is expected.had a good time here and was excellent final activity before having to fly back to uk.if you are adult and enjoy theme parks choose this over disney.

great. its just a huge park with lot of rides and attractions. the view is just superb. very easily accessible. u just have to get out of the mtr and then therz a ticket counter which gives u the option of buying ocean park ticket at discounted rates and the bus takes u directly to the ocean park. rides are fun and ther a animal shows lile dolphins seals pengiuns pandas etc. its really good for childrens. so make sure u visit it when u r in hong kong.

The Best Park I've Ever Visited!. a must visit while you are in HK! so much fun with ton of attractions! i bought the ticket from my hotel which was cost HKD200.first step up in the park,i visited the super giant aquarium with many kind of fishes,jelly fishes, and many other sea creatures.but a long longg Q before getting in.the other attractions i hv tried are the cable car, birds show, panda. you can also eat at The Old Hongkong area that sells many kind of foods. etc etc.this place is soo soo BIG. maybe it's impossible for you to try everything in just one day :) but overall,it's worth to visit! the only thing i didnt like is the long Q i had to take bcause at hat time was chinese holiday. so many chinese tourist flooding this park. but it was ok :)

Good day out. Well maintained theme park, busy but not too many large queues. They have some good roller coasters and rides. The park is set on two levels with a funicular and or cable car taking you between the two. A few characters, great animals and shows. Evening show good but not as good as expected.

excellent park for slightly elder kids. Excellent park for a great day outdoors.Has a world class aquarium and the dolphin show is good.The rides are excellent,Cable car ride has a very good view.Overall a great day.

Fantastic Hong kong park. This is the best park in the world, made on top of the mountain in Hong Kong, and after 30 years this is super funny park is NO.1 in Asia, pls. take all you big family to this park and it will make all happy so see and feel good, and have fun.
Super Enjoy.... My parents enjoy the whole ocean park experience.Dolphin and sea lion show is the best.I also enjoy the racing sea.Cable car is spectacular.

Fun for both adults and children. It has more exciting rides than Disneyland (i.e. a roller coaster that twists and turns right on the side of a mountain where you can see the sheer drop below). Overall, I'd say it has a lot more attractions for adults. Although they also have a good mix for kids to enjoy, such as the less scarier rides, an aquarium, and even some pandas.

DO NOT MISS IF YOU ARE WITH YOUR CHILDREN.. Had been at this ocean and mammal theme park on 28th Oct,2013 with my wife and 8 year old son.The park looks little old(started in 1977),but very very well maintained,gigantic and divided in to two parts connected by two means,namely cable car and ocean express(train thru tunnel).To enjoy the whole park one should reach early at 10 am and only on weekdays as queue can be hour long on holidays.Hardly 20 minutes from Kowloon or 40 minutes from Hong Kong.Grand aquarium at the base park is best and I advise one to go to summit after this via cable car.Summit(other part of the hill) has all kinds of rides like Abyss,dragon,hair raiser etc (all kinds of roller coasters),water rapids,polar adventures having North and South ploe animals,kids play zone and food court,trampoline jump.Ride via cable car is breath taking and must remember last cable down is at 6 pm.But one can take ocean express,the train thru tunnel,till 8 pm which takes hardly 7 minutes.At the base,water front station Sichuan adventure having rare animals,Giant panda show,old Hong Kong street etc can be enjoyed till 7 pm.Varieties of fast food counters are available and they are definitely cheaper than Disney land,HK.Overall an enjoyable day we had.

Lots of excitement!. Because some parts of the theme park are built on hills, the scenery is amazing. Spinning 360 degree on the roller coaster will allow you to enjoy nature at very different angles. Simply stunning. The dolphins and seals performed great!I only went there for a while due to tight schedule. I would think a full day or two days is needed to fully enjoy this place. I went on a Saturday and the crowd is too much for the park to handle. During the weekends, tourist from neighbouring countries tend to visit Hong Kong. Thus, go on a weekday!

Give it a miss on holidays. A well designed ,large and fairly good land and water theme park. Lots of interesting things to do and see and spent a full day here. Aquariums, panda zoo,land rides, extreme rides, water themes etc.etc.Dont go there in the holiday season or on weekends. The crowds comming here from the mainland has to be seen to believe.If too crowded give it a miss.

Good value for money. The park looks dated and the cable cars looks like the design of the 70s. The train is unique. As you ride up or down the hill, you will be entertained with TV screens mounted on the roof throughout the train. Even though it is old, the rides, the scenery, the South Pole exhibits make it a must-visit attraction in Hong Kong.

Good & Bad points. The theme park is a good day out if you have older kids or are a kid at heart - it's near impossible to navigate with an infant/toddler in a stroller! I understand its built on a mountain and they installed steep escalators to get around this but it's not practical for families! Due to slightly high winds the cable cars were not in operation the day we went which made the queues for the ocean express quite extensive - even at this it moved quite efficiently.The exhibits were good to look at though the polar exhibit is misleading with its Polar bear entrance (there are no polar bears) The queues for rides can be 45-60 minutes, the large tour groups from mainland China can be rude and quite pushy!! I will return to Hong Kong but am in no rush to return to Ocean Park!!

Valuable & funfilled.. I bought mine ticket at the admiratly station at only 290hkd, which helps me save 30hkd. My family and i had fun in ocean park. It's really valuable. It's like going sentosa but you are paying for just one amount to play everything. They have theme park, tiny zoo, tiny bird park, aquarium, penguins and so forth. I spent half of my day there but it wasn't enough. You should go on the december instead cause it was still quite humid when i went there on the first week of november.

The Pandas were the highlight. ironically, although it park which supposes to have sea animals, it does have pandas. their enclosures are huge and visitors can see them really up close. they are like a few meters away without any glass panels.the aquarium had a number of large and unique species as well.the rides was average. it was kind of old. it looks like it required some major overhaul. in terms of rides, the rides selection was more like an amusement park than a theme park. the rides were largely more of the thrilling time and not for the faint hearted. like almost any major attraction in hong kong, it was flooded with mainland chinese which spoilt the experience a little. pushings, shoutings and queue cuttings are a very common sight. the staff simply do not do anything.

i dont bring kids, so meh...... the only attraction i enjoy was the cable car, the cable car that bring us from below point to the top where many rides and shows. nothing spectacular about the shows nor the rides. but the same experience cable car also available on the trip to big Buddha.

fun day. 3 kids loved it, especially the roller coasters at the top. One of the few theme parks of the world with such a great view.Food was ok at the restaurant. Oceanarium was interesting. Needs a whole day as queues are long.

Not as good as last time. My last visit was in 2010, but since my last visit, oceanpark has changed alot. To get there, take the MTR to Admiralty station, and take the bus to Oceanpark. Bus is approximately 30 minutes. While there are plenty of attractions and exhibits, many exhibits were under renovation when i got there. For example, i walked for about half-an hour to an exhibit which was under renovation- an utter waste of time. Food is very expensive as well. All in all, do go there if you have not been there before, but the experience when you go the second time, will not be as good

Fun, just felt like a big kid again. Definitely worth a visit - get there nice and early. We took the bus that was available from Admiralty Station. Very easy to get to however, recommend going there once it opens as there are always the large chinese tour groups that arrive later. We went during the week and the lines for the rides (for the big and small kids) was much shorter. There was only one ride that we waited up to 45 minutes, but others were less than 5 minutes. Staff there are very friendly, and the various exhibits etc are very interesting. Worth checking out some of the shows that they have, but make sure you grab a Show Guide as the times may vary. You also have the option of the Cable Car or the Express to get between the two main areas of the Park so suggest the Cable Car up and then the Express back to mix it up. Highly recommend it, even for adults. We just felt like big kids again. If you're adults, would choose this over Disneyland as plenty more options when it comes to rides and various attractions.

Perfect day out for teens.. Great park with a good variety of attractions from animal exhibits to rides, restaurants to shows, there is something for everyone but in particular teenagers.I'd happily recommend Tuxedos for dining alongside the penguins, and it has great air con for a break from the heat.You should stay to catch the closing show, Symbio, if possible, as it's really lively with a surprise or two! And of course the Giant Pandas in their own large pavilion are well worth a visit.My only criticisms would be that at times the map/sign posting could have been more accurate and a few more big thrill rides wouldn't go amiss. And my best advice is arrive early to head up to the top of the park to ride before the it gets busy, before heading down to the animal exhibits later in the day.

Excellent park, good for all ages. I went to the park several times with my daughter at several ages. It has always been a success. There are always new things to do and many temporary/seasonal stalls and exhibitions.The Halloween one is particularly good, especially for teenagers.The Pandas located above the aquarium are often sleeping inside their cages and one cannot see anything, but it is always possible to see some in the animals of China pavilion.Be prepared for a lot of walking even if you take the trains and cable cars. Avoid the weekend as there are a lot of people. Afterwards, one can go to the Thai restaurant on the beach in Deepwater Bay, a couple of minutes by taxi from the Park.

A COMPLETE PACKAGE FOR ME!. We went there on the 25-28th October 2013. We used Citybus 973 from Chungking Mansion,Nathan Road,Tsim Sha Tsui for HKD13.6/pax and took the bus at New World Center point(near to Avenue of Stars). We had great view of HK residential along the way and we used Citybus 90 for the return journey and dropped off at Wan Chai.This Citybus 90 also go to Central and the fare is cheaper compared to 629 bus.Ocean Park was really big and luckily they got Cable car so we didn't have to walk back to the entrance and at the same time got opportunity to enjoy beautiful ocean view. Upon entering the entrance, Ocean Park people offered to help us to take our picture.And then again with his camera.He said its nothing and if we like it,we can buy it. But then when they printed out the pictures and made it into the keychain, we couldn't resist to see how cute that things were.We decided to buy it and cost us HKD188.We learnt our lesson so the next time these people wanted to take our picture,we just passed it.I am not that brave,so I just played Raging River(log flume),the Rapids(water raft) and Artic Blast. Artic Blast was like a mini roller coaster but really gave me a thrill. hehehe. However my husband did try for the Dragon and when I asked how's he feeling.he just said he felt nauseous.Maybe he wanted to make me feel good.We enjoyed watching Penguins at South Pole and Pandas. They were really cute. We also managed to watch Dolphin Show at Ocean Park Theater.It was Halloween fest when we came so there was K-Pop Madness haunted house.The zombies liked to hide and shocked us when we were about to arrive.Its creative though.We are muslim and I think Ocean Park just recently launched its Halal restaurant. But since we wanted to keep us easy to move around, we brought lots of food and 2 bottles of mineral water.We even packed ourselves tuna sandwiches and we actually brought all the food from our country Malaysia.
Good theme park, too crowded. Great rides, too crowded though.The cable car ride from the Waterfront to the Summit was great. Hair Raiser was the best ride by a huge margin! :)

Not worth my time. The first time I went to Ocean Park was over two decades ago. I thought that the recent renovations would increase my chances of having a good time like I did in HK Disneyland, but boy was I wrong. The rides and attractions were lousy, and the place was packed with too many people.

Had a great day out here. Ocean Park is a great place to spend the day. A combination of fun rides, amazing animal dispays and entertaining shows. There are some really good places to snack on local foods including a reproduced Dai Pai Dong area too.This is a great place to view some sea life but don't forget to visit the Giant Pandas while you are there.

100% magic. Traveling to Ocean Park at Halloween was a dream. I am not sure if I could make a better experience. It was perfect. Pandas (Giant and Red), Alligators, birds, all sorts of everything to make for an exceptional day out.

Ocean Park is not the same anymore.... the park used to be a open area. Now there is no spacein the ground. You only see visitors and buildings, stores,funny sculpture. The best is the view from the Cable Car overlooking the sea. It is too expensive for what you get.Little fun even for kids. Eateries without resting places likeMcDonald.

An enjoyable day. Since HK Disneyland has opened, we have noticed Ocean Park has made some great improvements, so it was a pleasant surprise. Previously it had looked a little tired. We went of a Friday and even then is was fairly busy, but we understand on the weekend it is much worse with long queues. We bought our entry tickets ((HK$320 per adult) with our return CityBus ticket from the Ocean Park ticketing office close to the MTR Admiralty Station (Exit B). The cost or the return bus ticket was HK$10.60. For us, the major attraction is still seeing the pandas. You can just stand there admiring & watching them, and occasionally getting the great photo. We were a little disappointed with the north polar adventure as we were expecting to see a polar bear given the promo material at the entrance to this exhibit ... all we saw were a few different types of seals & walruses. We had lunch at Tuxedos which is next to the penguin display and were able to watch the penguins at play through a glass wall ... great for the kids. Unfortunately, we found the food just average. Plenty to do for the "bigger kids" with all the amusement rides up on Thrill Mountain. The cable car ride provides great views of Deep Water Bay & Repulse Bay areas and certainly worth the trip.

A pleasant surprise. After having read many reviews of Ocean Park, our family of 4 wasn't really expecting much but we were pleasantly surprised. There was so much to see and do. Our favourite section was the animal area where the pandas were housed. We thoroughly enjoyed watching these beautiful animals. We also loved taking the gondola up to the areas at the top of the park where we went on a variety of rides and through antarctic exhibitions. A day wasn't enough time to fit in all the different areas of the park. It was great.

Another amusement park. Yes, you must go there for the spectacular view you get from the cable car ride! I visited when there were Halloween decorations put up all over, jack o' lanterns and the likes, which gave the place a nice festive feel. A couple of rides seemed challenging (recommending the hair raiser roller coaster and the flash for the daring). Definitely go on a weekday, it was crowded but the lines for the rides moved at a faster rate. I avoided the aquarium and the shows since I have been to and seen one too many, but on my way to the exit (we took an exit only meant for groups usually, which was a blessing since there were far less people), there was a dolphin habitat which we entered only to be able to watch these beautiful creatures in their "home" pools relaxing and playing with the trainers.

Halloween at the park!. Second time I am visiting Ocean Park during the Halloween celebrations and I am loving it! The whole park is decorated in detail to suit the halloween theme (even the toilets) and there are loads of characters lurking around to give visitors a good scare. Sadly, we didn't finish all the haunted houses as we were busy visiting the animal attractions, taking rides and playing games (to win cute stuffed toys). Will definitely be back again next year!

Great fun for the whole day. Went on a Monday (during school time) and crowds were easy, no more than 5 or 6 deep on each ride! I hear the place gets packed on the weekend though. Lightshow started at 7 or something so worth staying around for that just to cap off the day.

Great place but bad tourists !. I like Ocean park, the aquarium is fantastic also this place can be relaxing as it is surrounded by the sea, games are quite childish, nothing exciting for adult. We went there during the weekday to avoid tourists however massive Chinese messing the place, they speak very loud and disturbing, not following instruction and attempt to cut the queue, I was really pissed off by the Chinese tourists however Hong Kong local people are much more polite and different !

Some great rides, but quite sprawled out.... Ocean Park does provide a good range of activities, and for all ages. It's a shame its so hard to negotiate as a new visitor.We only had one day, and we did purposely avoid Friday/Saturday or Sunday, but still found it quite busy.Getting there was fairly straight forward using MTR to Admiralty then bus 629 to the park. We brought our park tickets at the bus station.While we were at the lower level, we visited the Panda Village, but not a lot to see as they were mostly sleeping.The large aquarium was ok, but maybe not as exciting as others like Kelly Talton's in Auckland New Zealand. We enjoyed Raging River ride, The Rapids (you will get soaked), The Flash (not for the faint hearted), and my favourite Hair Raiser.The North and south Pole Encounter were mostly good.Because of illness we didn't get a full day, and didn't see any of the shows, but we felt it would be a repeat of some of what we saw at Sea World in San Diego.We would have enjoyed it more if they had employed an express or fast pass system to maximise your time. It must be over packed on the weekends or holidays.Meals and snacks were fine, but the Korean dried Squid is not for us. We had a meal at a restaurant near the Polar encounters, and it was cave like, and atmospheric, with good views of the Penguins and their habitat through a large glass wall.The Park is nicely situated on several levels of a hill, but it provides a problem for easy access. The escalators and cable cars are great but time consuming.It's noisy particularly near the "sideshow Alley".I was a little irked by the Halloween additions in some areas - a lovely big Aquarium, with random plastic Pumpkins in it, but all in all we enjoyed our visit here.Plenty of shops for souvenirs, and good toilets.Cable Car ride is a pleasant, quiet distraction.

Best Theme Park. Such a friendly place, with a park for the older people and a park for the smaller people, with just a cable ride away from each other. A variety of rides and a great way to spend the day.

A MUST!. Ocean Park was a nice surprise to us.On our last day of a Hong Kong stay we decided to visit the park as one of my friends is an amusement park enthusiast. The park is kind of a blend of Sea World, zoo, and Six Flags. Thrill rides, roller coasters, and bumper cars are just a few of the rides. Animals of all kinds, from pandas, to penguins, to dolphins, and exotics fishes are also spread throughout the park. There is something for all ages at this park. I can't recommend it enough. Perfect for anyone from solo traveler, to couples, to families. If you have the chance-GO!

Excellent theme park at an affordable rate. We spent an entire Thursday at Ocean Park and we had lots of fun. Since it is Halloween month, there are Halloween decorations and “haunted houses” for free visits (with the day ticket purchase). However, we went for the rides first, hence missed out a lot of animal exhibits, including the pandas. We managed to catch the view of the sleeping panda though.Pros: - With the price of HKD320 per person, it is very affordable. It is like getting a package of different attractions / tickets in Singapore (e.g. Universal Studio Singapore, Halloween Horror Night, River Safari, Cable Car ride, SEA Aquarium, etc). - There are plenty of exciting rides.- Love the dolphins and penguins.- Great scenery from the top of the cable-car.Cons:- The park is too big to be covered in a day. We have reached at 11am and went back at 8pm. Yet, we have not covered a lot of the items. - Although it was a Thursday, each ride took us about an hour of queuing time.We will definitely go back to Ocean Park again, and hope by that time, the new MTR station will be operable.

A park with dual personality. I last went to Ocean Park 40 years ago. It has changed. It is bigger, but not better.This park tries to do 2 things, and I am not sure they go together. First it is a marine park, with aquariums, dolphin shows, and other water based educational exhibits. These are interesting and quite well done (especially the seals and walrus area). The dolphin show is well worth going to - but is really no different to other ones elsewhere in the world.Second it is a fun fare - with a number of wild rides meant for youngsters.It is spread over a large area - lots of walking - and there is a lot of up and down, although cable cars, trams and escalators help. But it becomes a tiring day.Went at a weekend in October, and there were lots of people but queues for what I wanted to go on (not the wild rides) were OK. I suspect the fun fair side would have involved a lot of waiting!As with all theme parks food and drink is poor and extremely expensive (HK$20 for water). Buy outside and take with you.The best way to get there is special bus (629) from Admiralty, leaving regularly.Worth a visit for the marine side - cheaper then Disney - but nothing like as entertaining.

Great for families. Do head to see the walrus & penguins. Very intriguing. The best part was the marine life research centre. Spent almost an hour there observing free roaming dolphins jumping out of the water, playing with balls. The vets were also present to answer my many queries & also witnessed them taking temperatures for the dolphins! Thoroughly enjoyed myself. As for the rides, they were not as thrilling as it looks, except for Flash.

Not worth it!!. Long lines for everything. The cable car ride queue was more than 1 hour and it was on a weekday. The food option is also very poor and overpriced!!! The rides are more for teens and adults and would not recommend for small children. If you are going with small children then Disneyland is a better option. Ocean Park is also huge with rides all spread out which involves a lot of walking hence would recommend hiring a stroller for small children.

Lousy attraction with lousy halloween. Decided to head to ocean park after visiting Disneyland for my previous trips to Hong Kong. It was a regretful decision. The Q for the cable car ride was superbly long and tourist from China are trying their best to cut queues. They cut into queue in a large group so unless you can tell them where the queue starts from, be prepared to wait for a few more cable cars before you step into yours. As halloween is less than a month away, the park has scare actors and several scare zones and attractions. They were not scary at all. More of funny that scary. When you stepped into the attraction, polar adventure, you will see one huge polar bear figure that looks like the one from the Coca cola ad. So I was looking forward to see a polar bear. But after checking with the staff, there's no polar bear in the entire park. Tickets for ocean park is cheaper than disney but i will rather pay more for disney tickets. i dont see myself heading to ocean park again.

Never go on a Sunday or holiday. Long lines ..ticket 1 hour ..every ride 1 hour ..zero food options ...left us pissed to no endthe rides were nothing special. Otters ..sea lions were the only thing unique

Panda-riffic. Pick a good schedule for a panda-riffic day. Hong Kong Ocean Park has its own charm and some things that Disneyland cannot offer - hair rising rides and giant pandas!What's great:- It's a hybrid park (oceanarium, marine mammal park and amusement park) which offers variety of things to see and do- Scenic view of the park and some parts of Hong Kong- Very good animal exhibits and gigantic aquariums. Great to finally see the pandas after years of watching documentaries.- Newer additions North and South Pole offer a good, icy relief from the heat and a real Happy Feet experience - Amazing rides for the thrill-seeker- Great value, surprised that ticket price is much lower than Disneyland (I paid around Php5,000 for 3 adults)The not-so-great:- Incredibly hot and crowded. Even if you're not the umbrella-carrying type, you will need one. Bring sunscreen.- Dophins and seals show is just average, I have seen better- Long walks, the park is huge and attractions spread all over the place compared to the very compact Hong Kong Disneyland- Cable car was closed for maintenance  Ocean Park caters to a more matured group and offers a different experience. Worth a full day visit and definitely worth seeing the pandas and penguins. I recommend purchasing tickets in advance to avoid the long ticket lines in the hot sun. Very crowded even on a Monday with hordes of tourists from Mainland China.

Great Value. My kids aged 8,11,13 and husband preferred Ocean Park slightly over Disneyland solely because they found the rides more scary. I on the other hand not one to go for thrill rides preferred Disneyland. THE PROS :a) Ticket prices are reasonable and our hotel sold to us even cheaper at the 'old' prices b) Great value for money with many & varied rides, cable car ride, Grand Aquarium, Goldfish, Panda, Seals and Penguin exhibits and also a research centre where we could see the dolphinsc) Beautiful views of the bay and theme park when taking the cable carTHE CONS :a) Ocean Park was huge with rides all spread out which involves a lot of walking. Adventure Land (where the Mine Train, Space Wheel and Raging River) is a bit isolated. Good thing though was we did not have to queue long for rides there that the family went twice on the Mine Train.b) The Arctic Blaster ride had no protection over the weather and it was pouring while we were there queuing for about 45 mins. Queue was long as the Hair Raiser was closed for safety and the Arctic Blaster itself was only allowed to operate to 75% capacity as too wet.c) Giant Panda was fast asleep in the late afternoon but thank goodness the Red Panda was actived) Taxi queue was very long and waited for about an hour.

So much to see & do!. We had such a great day here. Animal exhibits were really good. Lots of rides for all ages. We did a dolphin encounter which we would definitely recommend it allowed us to get close & pat & play with the dolphins. There is a max of 6 per group so you get plenty of time with the dolphins. Book in advance to avoid missing out. You definitely need a whole day here. Great for all ages.

This is definitely NOT Disneyland but Gondola ride is awesome. Family and I spent a couple of weeks in Asia this summer and we ended up staying a few days in Hong Kong. We decided to try out both Ocean Park and Disney HK. I'm going to post a separate review for Disney HK so I'll focus on our Ocean Park experience here.The Good: The prices were about 20% cheaper across the board than Disney HK. The Gondola ride between the two parts of the park is a great ride and on a clear day provides for some of the best arial views in Hong Kong. Truly stunning and a one of the places in Hong Kong where you can enjoy some silence!!! They also have a number of real roller coasters and other rides for grown ups which made my 15 and 17 year olds very happy...The Bad: The whole park is not designed for or caters to Westerners and you totally feel it. The entire operation seems to be geared to PRC tourist bused by the thousands. While the less expensive food was about 20% less than Disney, the service was 80% worse and the food qualty was 60% worse so not such a great deal. The more expensive dining options were as expensive if not more expensive than Disney and food quality and service were not great. None of the staff at the park seemed to be trained or particularly service oriented.We were with family friends who brought a thick Ocean Park coupon book. Don't bother. Everytime they tried to use one, the employee either claimed not to know anything about it, refused to accept it or it turned out to be a total bait and switch.To top it off, one of the newest roller coaster rides (I think it was the Hair Raiser) my kids were really looking forward to broke! The worst part was how management handled it. We were in line for about 30 minutes inching to the entry gate and things seemed to slow down. For the next 20 - 30 minutes we hardly moved at all (except when people started leaving the line). Only then did we hear someone on the speakers apologize that they were testing the roller coaster for "safety" and that the ride should start again soon and to please wait. The same annoying annoucement ran again and again for another 15 - 20 minutes then suddenly they change the announcement to "sorry, ride is closed"... What a Joke.Again, I think our disappointing experience really has more to do with expectation management and reference point (big amusement park fans in the US, Singapore and Japan - all much better!). I don't think Ocean Park could care less if folks like us ever came back as I can't image westerners represent a material percentage of their business or profits. They seem to be building and expanding like crazy and it was pretty crowded (super long lines at the McD) so the formula must be working for them!

Give it a miss. Was so disappointed by Ocean Park, especially after a great 2 days at Disneyland. This was crowded with 45min queues to experience animals kept in poor conditions. The rides had 45min queues so we didn't bother with most of them. Limited food options. Overall - tacky.

Amazing Place. We visited the park last week. Halloween theme was in the air. You could find a lot of ghost-like characters walking around but ready to pose for a picture. Excellent rides. It is better than the Disney-HK. My favourite was the raging river. The waiting time was about 60 minutes but worth it. In most of the rides, the waiting time is about 10-30 minutes. In the evening it became very crowded since it was a weekend and also Halloween special events were happening. Enjoyed every moment of it.

Better than Disneyland. Ocean park is better than Disneyland. ...it is very large amusement park which has zoo.. Rides.. Cabel car and train... but still all prefer disneyland because of popularity....empty during weekdays so 7-8 hours is enough to cover everything.You will get direct MTR then a bus to reach ocean park. If you contact your hotel or 7-11 you will get tickets at cheaper price.

Overwhelming Ocean Park. Another great visit to Ocean park.Unfortunately it was an extremely hot day so we didn't stay as long or see as much as we would have liked.I wanted to just see the pandas and wasn't disappointed.The cable car ride was just as fabulous as previously. I loathe heights but still managed to enjoy the scenery. Other than the carousel, this was the longest queue - approx. 20 mins.There were so many new additions to the park from visit 3 years ago - Grand Aquarium, North Pole, South Pole - to name a couple.Most of the day was spent at the Poles. Deliciously icy relief from the heat. The animals were spectacular - sea lions, walruses, penguins, artic foxes, et al.Old Hong Kong City was amazing.The Ocean Express ( a futuristic train) running through the mountain was interesting.Didn't go on any rides this time (disappointing) due to the heat.In cooler weather, this would be an all day / night attraction.The pandas and cable car are worth the admission price.Will go again if I get the chance.

Beats Disney Hands Down. Its a beautiful place to have a great time! I went with friends but this is ideal for a family day out. Lots of good rides and interesting marine exhibits to wonder around. I found the cable car between the two sides of the park a little unnerving but was worth the trip.

Not for stylish European. Dont go on weekends !!! There are massive lines that can go up tp 2 3 hours. After being in universal, Disney. the ocean park is not the same. Its bigger and have more attractions but it is not a dream come true. Allot of very vocal Chinese that dont mind other people.The themes are Chinese so unless you are local I recommend to skip .Ps the food is wxpensive and horrible.

halloween season. Ocean park is decked out in halloween decorations for the month of october, with special events happening in line with this.There are up to 5 'haunted houses' to explore, some pumpkin carving displays etc.However, the crowd is huge and the queues are crazy! we queued an hour for just one haunted house.. which only took 2 mins to walk through! however, kudos to the extreme high effort put in for the props and hiring of so many scare actors who were extremely dedicated to their roles. other rides and shows are still in operation too, but yes, you have to queue queue queue for the rides. do not miss the dolphin show though, it was awesome!

great value, minimal queues (Oct 13). always a great place to visit with young kids. we went to disneyland in paris then to ocean park in HK on the way home to australia. disneyland is best described as a day of waiting in 45 min queues to do a 3 min ride, then doing it all over again. ocean park is much more interesting - pandas, cable car, etc for toddlers (my kids are 3 & 5 yo). all at a small fraction of the disneyland price. i would highly recommend.

great attractions, could be planned better. The good things first :1) Lots of animals such as penguins, sea-lions, walruses, seals, pandas, dolphins etc which is great for people like us who only see such animals on TV otherwise ---- the sights themselves make the day in my view2) Great trolley ride --- goes over the ocean and hills --- stunning views on the way though in the morning, the wait can be a little long3) Great food options --- zillion times better than Disney's parkRoom for improvement :1) The park is very big but I thought a little dis-organized with attractions spread all over the place leading to crazy walks between 2 attractions --- Disney that way is superbly compact --- not sure anything can be done about this !!!2) The cab line while exiting in the evening is > 40 minutes because there is no MTR connectivity yet (should be there soon though) and because half the cabbies for some reason dont want to pick up people from this place -- can spoil the mood after a fun day

Good place to visit but not on weekends. I and my family visited ocean park (on a weekend) during our recent trip to HK. It takes entire day to do justice to the theme park, not because it is huge but because the waiting time for every attraction is toooo long.The only thing you will remember after you returned from Ocean park is that you were in queue most of the time. Some tips to avoid long queues. Buy tickets from any 7-11 stores. That will save you 1 hour of waiting in front of the gate. Immediate rush to the cable car station (take left after you enter the park). The cable car ride is very beautiful. Try the boat rides (there are 2 of them) as soon as you can. Maybe 1-2 shows. That will take the entire day. Good place to spend time with family. But I personally feel the entry tickets are overpriced (HK $ 320). If you have to pick just one from ocean park and HK Disneyland, I would recommend Disney (although the cost of entry tickets for Disney, HK $ 430 per Adult) is more than that of the ocean park.

Best Value Theme Park. We visited Ocean Park with our kids (4 and 6 YO) and I think I actually enjoyed the park more than them! We arrived just shortly after the park opened and headed for the panda enclosure. We have pandas back home in Singapore too, but I haven't got the chance to see them, so seeing pandas in Ocean Park was quite refreshing.After that, we took the tram up to the summit and had the most amazing time of our life with the rides and visiting the various animal/ marine enclosures, then made our way back down the park with the cable car that overlook the beautiful repulse bay. The waiting time for the cable car was close to 45 mins, but it was worth it.The park has so many rides, I lost count of them. We waited no longer than 20 minutes for any ride, some rides have virtually no queue at all. Besides, the rides, the animal enclosures are really interesting and educational for my two kids. Don't miss the grand aquarium, it has the most stunning view of the stingrays, sharks and so many different kinds of marine life. I love looking at the sea lions and walrus, it was so mesmerizing watching them swim gracefully.It's October and so the park was decorated for Halloween, there is additional attraction which show case some of the most unusual pumpkin cravings that I had ever seen.For the price of one theme park, Ocean Park quite possibly offers what I could get from three different Singapore's attractions (USS, River Safari and SEA Aquarium). All in all, I felt that Ocean Park is THE BEST value theme park I had ever visited and I also prefer it over Disneyland Hong Kong. I would definitely recommend a visit if you have time in Hong Kong because you need an entire day to cover this enormous park.

Fun for all ages. Ocean park has evolved a lot since i first saw in way back 1993, our last visit was october 2013, i came with my four kids, and i can say the kid in me came back for a day, really enjoyed the park, the rides and themes are very nice, involves a lot of walking, good for the health if you don't mind, it's like excersizing while enjoying, cable car never fails to amaze me, my kids enjoyed that very much, the simple looking rides that we tried were actually more than meets the eye, highly recommended specially for teenagers.

Quiet. When I was there, it is quite quiet. No queue for all rides. I think it is good for small kids but not really for adults except for the rides. After a while, it get bored for me.Other than that, there is some "exhibition" to see for kids. Most rides are for kids.

Great Theme Park. One of the very good theme parks to go to. Once there you must sit on the Flash / Hair Raiser / Abys and some the great rides which will thrill you till you leave. If on a short trip to HK then it can be a miss. But if out there on a long trip then going out there once is a must. Specially for your children as there are a lot of theme parks within covering a wide range of sea life / animals / birds etc... have a blast going there just dont be drunk CHEERS!!!

Great day out. Ocean park is a combination of park and fun park, something for every one, use the cable car or funicular train to get from the low lands to the headlands there's even Hong Kongs second longest escalator there is so much to see you will need at least a full day if not two!!! to see it all, great fun

AMAZING !. soo much to do and see, you need a full day there so get there as early as possible.Pandas, Pengiuns, Huge aquarium.Lots of big and small ridesDifferent shows to go and see, dont miss the Dolphin and Sea Lion show!!!Would love to return!

A full day. Easy to get there with a train ride and many double decker buses,number 629, to get you there and back. And then a full day of activities awaits you, with a huge oceanarium, many restaurants, go to the top of the hill for more fun and see the penguins in a freezing Antarctic environment. My highlight, panda bears eating their bamboo and strolling around. Worth the day.

Have a nice honeymoon and fun over there!. There are huge theme park and we need to queue for many games,there are extremely clean and the cable car can view over the sea in Hong kong.Transportation are quite easy too reach and staff are friendly.Enjoy the funny day overthere.

Tons of fun. Only at first glance this place seems to be small one. In fact, it's a huge park, with lots of attractions and places for recreation and entertainment. Everything is so convenient and the view from the cable car is simply fascinating

Awesome Day!. An excellent day out with pandas, dolphins, birds, monkeys and rides! We all had a great day, I especially liked the cable car ride along the side of the mountain taking you to the theme park. We had a quick snack for lunch as the patk closed at 6, which was a little disappointing really.

5 yo kid couldn't take any rides! Too short!. The bus ticket queue was horrific, there was a slight scuffle that we experienced :( 6yo nephew was excited but as we walked on, we found that he couldn't go on most of the rides due to the height limitation! They were extremely strict, and there was only 1 that he could ride, apart from the cable car! The park is HUGE, aquarium was impeccably managed, and as it was halloween, the actors hired as ghouls were excellent! The only gripe is that, it is extremely HOT and TIRING, no water coolers and you are forced to purchase drinks at about 5SGD / bottle!!

No surprise. The park itself is good, long lines could be seen in all games, too many tourists from the mainland makes this park expensive in everything and out of order, the worst thing was the transportation to leave, terrible!!! we had to wait more than one and a half hour to get into a taxi to go back to the hotel after a whole day walk, won't recommend it!

I had a great time!. Went early, but found the travel to the Park to be easier than expected having researched it and spoken to the hotel for assistance.It is a large park with plenty on offer and fun to visit when in HK

Fantastic Tram Ride. The ride between the main park areas is in itself worth the price of admission but don't visit in July ! It's hot, humid and far too many people visiting at the same time. We waited in line for 45+ minutes for nearly every attraction and they last maybe 2 minutes max each.

Panda perfect day out. We largely visited Ocean Park to see the Giant Pandas - and we were not disappointed! We arrived before the park opened and headed straight to see the pandas after this we used the incredible cable cars to reach the Summit and then made our way back down the park over the course of the day. We waited no longer than 20 minutes for any ride (including the main rollercoasters) and often didn't have to wait at all. The park was also decorated for Halloween. This was done really well and added to the enjoyment of our day. However, without doubt the real star attraction of the park is it's location with many of the rides affording stunning views across the South China Sea. What a setting! We thoroughly enjoyed our visit to Ocean Park and would recommend a visit if you have time when in Hong Kong.Top tip: There are many options for food in the park - some of the restaurants are VERY expensive (and serve average food) while many kiosks or smaller street food options look better value for money - and taste.

Great fun.. My daughter and her husband took me to this amazing, fun venue. The rides were many and varied. The wait for some of the more popular ones was long so allow plenty of time particularly if you are with children but the fact that we went on a weekend day probably contributed to this. Great to see pandas up close. Overall a fun experience.

Mix of fun. Is quite nice place, where you can find all kinds of marine animals and nice amusement park. Huge park, if really needs to know every place, you have to go for two days, one day is a tight time.Attractions to all ages, if you can, go!

another fun place!!!!. lots of attractions & rides! nerve-wrecking cable car ride!!! especially enjoyed the penguins & seals/walrus attractions... my kids had a fun time riding the roller coaster though the long lines was a let down...

Pick your day and it's a great place.. We visited on a Tuesday. Arrived at 10am with pre purchased tickets. Took bus from admiralty mtr ...all very easy and sign posted . On arrival at park we took cable car to the top and worked our way down. We waited 5 mins max for everything and went on some rides multiple times. Totally soaked on rapids ride but dried very quickly. Food and drink was more expensive than out of the park but compared to uk or USA prices was pretty good. Was lovely and clean, staff friendly. Became really busy at about 1400. We had done all the rides then and took our time in aquarium and panda areas. Easy transport home. A good day. Kids aged between 9 and 23.... all had fun.
Execllent theme park. It is a execllent theme park in Hong Kong. There were many attraction and show like amazing asian animals, aqua city. I enjoy to get closer to animals.

Can skip if you have a tight schedule. An average theme park. Quite a big place to cover. Should not go when the weather is hot as there are not many resting areas. Bring your brollies esp during rainy season and you may need it when you watch the shows as most seats are under the sun and it is pretty HOT. Most rides are too dangerous for the little ones. Food is not cheap. Shopping is reasonable.

Another big kids fun park!. If exciting rides and attractions set in beautiful surroundings are what you seek then Ocean Park is a must visit. Our grandchildren loved the excitement and thrills provided by this spectacular attraction. The story book characters come to life as you whiz from one ride to another and all too soon it is time to go! Highly recommended attraction that should not be missed.

Lots to do!. I've been to Ocean Park frequently over the years, and am very impressed with their new exhibits and rides! The North and South Pole regions are great, and not something you would normally see. The shuttle train connecting the two different areas is also a great alternative to the cable car if you are in a rush.

Good attraction. We visited with 2 kids. Theme park was not a good choice for the kids as they haven't got many to ride. My wife took few rides while I waited with the kids. We took few photos and watched the dolphin show. It was nice

Water fun park and educational fun. When were kids parents bring us to other great place this the great stuff happens kids and parents and family can be busy everyday and at the same time having fun and educational stuff I will always came back here since I enjoy fishes and animals as long as it swims;)

Best amusement park in Hong Kong.. If you had to chose one amusement park to go to in Hong Kong this would be the one. Something for all ages to enjoy together. From rides to dolphin show to old Hong Kong to jelly fish.
Wet and Wild. A place where you can really appreacite the beauty of nature. From Bears, to dolphins, Seals and that very wide aquarium Wow!! I feel like I am Ariel.

Sky High. This was an awesome attraction, you can see a lot of the HK bay and city. The day was windy and rainy but the ride was awesome disappearing into the rain clouds and seeing the waterfalls from above.

LOVE this PARK lots. Despite having visited Hong Kong so many times, this is the first time I visited this theme park with my parents. I may need about two days to complete most of the attractions in the park taking into the account of the queuing time. Due to time constraints and also the fear that the rides may not be suitable for my elderly parents, I only managed to hop on to the rides that are the least heart-thumping.- The Rapids (bring your own raincoat / purchase at the counter or else you will be drenched), - Rev Booster (not for those who are prone to motion sickness)- Artic BlastBesides the rides, we spent most of our time at the exhibition hall:- Grand Aquarium (sea creatures - fishes, jelly fish, seahorses, etc)- The HK Jockey Club Sichuan Treasures (Panda, Red Panda, etc)- North Pole Encounter (Walruses, seals)- Gold Fish Treasures (lots of gold fishes)And don't miss the Ocean Theatre dolphin show, do plan ahead of time and do check their website for any updates - http://www.oceanpark.com.hk (the cable cars were closed at the time of our visit)TIPS:- To avoid the queue, do get your tickets at the Kiosk at Admiralty MTR station (HKD320 for adult ticket) - after getting your tickets, head straight to the bus station - the bus to the park, bus No. 629 runs almost every 10 mins or less. - No discounts for elderly unless you are a HK citizen or HK resident pass holderI will be back again :)

Great, but too crowded on the day.. This park had some great roller coasters, water rides and animal attractions, as well as a wonderful chairlift. Unfortunately it was simply too crowded to be enjoyable. Having visited a variety of theme parks in different countries, you're often warned of long queues, but this was the first time I've really found it to be an issue. There is a strong possibility that if we had gone on a different day it would have been fine but all I can say is, AVOID GOLDEN WEEK at the beginning of October.

Good for any age. This is the most awesome theme park that I have ever been because I really learnt something and enjoy with the ocean animal. Other than that, this theme park is good for sunset and ocean viewing, it is really a nice view. And the animals inside the theme park are the most active animal within a "zoo" that I have ever seen.

Have Funny Day Overthere!. There are long queue when we reach there,if we want to play some games,we need to pay,but for Ocean explore,there are free and we can walk smoothly,we enjoyed ourselves overthere!

Travelling with small kids not frecommended. The place is no doubt fantastic, however if one is travelling with a kid, you will not be able to take rides. In my case, my daughter also wanted to take the rides and she was not allowed. Therefore we could not enjoy the rides together. Also, the rides they have for small kids are available in India also, therefore we didnot find it out of world types. We enjoyed the dolphin show.

Was once my favorite place, not anymore. Ocean park was my favorite place to visit as a kid however since the last time i was there, things have changed and my experience at the park was not up to par. The park itself was fine however the crowd was insane (this was in november btw). 80% of the people at ocean park were main landers with no proper etiquette.... line cutting and not respectful to others and the park doesnt do anything about it. Other than that, the park has expanded with alot of new rides and attractions. Old Hong Kong was very amusing and the aquarium was great. The dolphin show is not as exciting as it just to be but still ok. The recommendation is to take the train to the top of the park and start there first then work your way down. Everyone tends to hit up the panda zoo first but the best time to go see the panda is the feeding time. Find out the time for their feeding and get there 25 minutes earlier and you will have an awesome view. Cable car is hard to catch later on the day, so do this early if you can.

Good times. We were all "toured" out in Hong Kong and were debating between Disneyland or Ocean Park. And we chose Ocean Park (disney were too similar to the one in LA).We took a cab here from Wan Chai, cost us about HKD 55. Very easy and quick way to get here. Ticket was HKD320 per adult and you are in for a lot of fun. The park is quite big, and there were a lot of walking involved. We went to a lot of rides, and some rides were a lot busier than others (we suspect is the location). We enjoyed the ride by pequin (don't know actual name), hair raiser, dragon, mine train and a few other random ones. It was a good times to spend with the BF who enjoys a lot of rollercoaster.Coming home was a pain, no taxi! So everyone took the bus that bring you straight to Admiralty for HKD10.6 SUPER VALUE.

Great Family Day out. A fun family day out. Lots of different rides and the aquarium is amazing! Worth exploring. Not a lot of rides for my 3 year old is the only thing that would raise if you have a young family.

Once a life time,yes.... When we were there,it was the beginning of some Chinese holiday,so many thousands of families with children were occupying all areas.It was very very crowded.Long waiting time for riding the cablr car and to get some food fm food courts as all was overloaded with visitors.Strongly recommended to visit this place when it is quiet season.

ocean park. lots of exciting and amazing rides around, dolphin show is the main attraction ...we just got bit tired seeing entire park, its located in the top of the mountain , where they will take us in a train

Great day. We went midweek and had a fantastic day! We went with our 4 year old daughter who really loved the amazing animal exhibits and shows. It was not very crowded when we went - did not have to wait very long in any lines or deal too much with heavy crowds. The only fall back to this is that they closed various rides due to the lower attendance. My husband had no waiting time for any of the roller coasters. It was a great park - not quite to the standard of our SeaWorld parks here in the U.S. or with super amazing rides, but overall we had a great day at Ocean Park!
don't go. super many "chinese country side" people go theretheir actions were horriblethe park instructions are not enoughoverloaded peoplethe shows time not convinent

Place to visit once at least..... One of the most famous places in Hong Kong, there aren't many roller coasters and when I went it was full everywhere, had to queue all the time. The price of water and food is overpriced, feel been rip-off.

Good for kids. Good attractions, it was very very crowded and we spent for up to 45 min in a line. Be prepared to be hungry unless you bring your food with you. Food selection is poor for Westerners mainly Chinese food and there was a lot of people waiting in a line and a lot of people trying to push in. Generally, it was a fun day for children, but very tiring for adults.

Amazing all-in-one attraction. Lots of marine life as well as pandas to see! There were also a lot of rides but not many were for young children. In my opinion, the thrill rides were much more scary than Disneyland. Stay till closing for a spectacular water display with fireworks. Worth waiting for the show.

Fun day at the Park. It was our first time to Ocean Park, Hong Kong and it was a pretty fun day. My fiancé and I took the MTR which was near our hotel to the Admiralty Station, then there were buses that would take you directly to the Park. Long lines, so go early if you want to have enough time to see every attraction in the park. The Park itself was nicely done. Something like Disney would do. There is lots of construction going on at the park as they are expanding to bring more attractions in 2014, however, this will not affect your trip as the entire park is open for business. Be prepared to do TONS of walking. The park is pretty big and spread out with lots of hills in between each attraction. So, with the typical South East Asian tropical heat, wear comfortable walking shoes and bring sun block and a hat or umbrella to help you make it through the day.We did see quite a few people who had brought their own food to eat (locals). As a tourist, this is not practical so be prepared to pay the super high price of amusement park food.  If you plan to see any animal shows, show up for them at least 1 hour before the start of the show or else you may not be able to get inside as the seating fills up fast. Overall, we had a pretty good day. Enjoyed the time there and especially the roller coasters (well, I did.... my fiancé vowed never to ride them ever again in her life! hahaha) Definitely a place to visit if you are going to be in Hong Kong.

Great family outing. A great place see and play. Comparatively to Disneyland, Ocean park is more localized hence lesser shoving and pushing :) My kid loves the place but she is not tall enough to play the rides. Great place to come again when she's older :)

Ocean Park for anyone. Go in the morning ,the crowds are bigger in the PM. Big park with plenty of walking. Got our tickets at the door for $50Aud. Food is dear ,same as any theme park, not abd day at all !!

Amazing family outing. This is definitely better than the overrated Disney park. There were many extreme thrill rides,along with various animal shows and food stalls. The best ride was The Flash, also the expedition trail was worth the visit. The down point however was the long queues for each and every ride and therefore a whole day is more than necessary to explore the park. My tip: go to the park early and first experience the rides and then see the animals,as the queue for rides increases in afternoon.

Great theme park in Hong Kong. This is my 2nd trip to Ocean Park. It's still great and fun. Huge and spent a lot of time walking around the park. You can spend the whole day here. Must try the gondola/ cable car ride. Pandas are must see in this park. Looked relax and carefree although many tourists are clicking their cameras. The rides are well mixed and suitable for young children, teens and adults. As it is a huge park and need some walking, it may be tough for family with babies/ toddlers.

We saw Pandas. We saw PandasTraveling with two teenagers we visited Ocean Park on a Monday. We caught the MRT from Mong Kok to Admiralty Station. Then followed the signs to the 629 bus. Fifteen minute bus ride and we were at Ocean Park. Arrived at 9am for a 10am opening, people already queued.Gates opened at 10 on the dot and we were in within two minutes.We decided to go straight to the Pandas so we joined the flow of people headed the same way thinking wow the Pandas are popular, well we were wrong everyone was headed to the Cable Car, no one went to the Pandas and we walked straight in.There was An An the panda sitting eating less than 5 m away from us and no one else around. He ate we watched. We stayed about 20 mins others came in but very few in numbers. How glad we were we went straight away because we went back at 2.30pm we waited 10 mins to get in only to find both Pandas out the back and you could only view them on TV screens.Had a 30 min wait to get on the cable car at around 10.30am. Well worth the wait it is a 12 minute ride to the top with spectacular views. On the way up the rain started.Rode the Rapids in Adventure Land a good raft ride and you get very wet, even if it isn't raining.Kids wanted to ride Mine Train but when we got there it was closed not sure if it was because of the rain. Went to Raging River a quick fun flume ride with no waiting so rode three times. Fun drop at the end.Another fun ride was Arctic Blast roller coaster. Queued 30 mins due to reduced loads because of rain.Went though the Grand Aquarium about a 10 min wait and moves through a very well presented aquarium allowing crowds to move through.Easy trip back, a row 629 buses queued to take the crowds back to the MRT. About 25 minute trip in the traffic.This is a great amusement park which covers a large area not good for very young or elderly. Has heaps of different rides so everyone will find something they like and it is cheaper than many other similar parks around the world. Great value.Get in early and see the Pandas if that is your thing, they were ours and were, worth the price of entry alone.

best day in hong kong. have been to many, many theme parks but this is by far the best. no queues, so clean. day ran seamlessly. lots of walking. rides were fantastic. could easily spend 2 days here with kids.

Great family park!. Our kids ages 19,12,11,9 loved Ocean park. We had gone to disneyland few days before and they were so bored there they wanted to leave after 2 Hrs. They love roller coasters and scary rides and Ocean park had it all. My family wanted to take the cable car up the hill to the next level where all the rides were I'm a afraid of heights and do not like cable cars but I did it anyways for the kids. I had thought it was just a straight short ride up omg to my surprise the cart turned to another hill and you are pretty much dangling from a wire over the ocean yikes!! Lets just say i didn't look down once and it felt like the longest ride of my life. At closing time we took the express train back down :). Ocean park is a must for families coming to Hong Kong. Its a great place to spend a whole day. There are so many attractions and rides. The kids will be all excited to see the Pandas. Our family loved this place!

Nice day out. Great theme park. Got 10% or so discount based on the coupons in the tourist booklet. Be sure to pick these up at the airport. The park is quite big and hence is a full-day affair. Do not combine with anything else.Cable-car was awesome. Rides are predominantly suited for adults. Most had min height of 130cm. So there was nothing much for my 4yr old to do apart from the different carousels. Expect to queue for 20 mins or more on an average. Do the 'Single' rider option to save time. Must do Hair-Raiser and Abyss. Save time by avoiding the giant-wheel. I'm sure you'd find this nearby your home somewhere.Lack of vegetarian food option. (Is it too much to expect a simple bread toast even?)

Not stroller friendly. It is a great and fun place for kids, teens and adults, but definitely not for babies who still need to travel on a stroller. The park is very big, you need to walk quite a lot from a park to the other. There are lifts and escalators at some places, but not for all. I saw quite many parents forced to carry up their strollers at some places. It is not very short distance. It is really too tough for parents and I do not think the babies enjoy it too.The restaurant provides quite many selections of food, but beware that some hot items sold out earlier. The portion of food is big, can be shared for two persons.

Hong Kong Sea world experience. Went on a Wednesday and got there just after opening. Go early and you will need whole day. Made use of 10% discount on entry tickets by showing peak tram tickets we'd used earlier in week. Amazing views on cable car ride. Went on some rides with my 7yr old son, but rides appear made for children over more than 130cm tall or over 12yrs old. Crowds and tourist buses start pouring in late in afternoon and queues and streams of people are long. We decided to leave at 4.30 due to crowd.

World Class Attraction. Let me start by saying you could easily spend 2 days here. There are so many attractions, rides, animal enclosures and shows plus much much more. The highlights for me would have to be seeing the native animals up close in particular the pandas and red panda. I also enjoyed the rapids ride and cable car which gives you amazing views of the park and surrounds. I would definitely go again and this time spend longer as didn't manage to see everything in just one day. We also visited Disney but for me this was so much better.

Gets better and better. Ocean Park has expanded and created more rides over the last few years, I assume to compete with Disneyland. For me it has always been better than Disneyland as it has rides, animals and a cable car. It's where you can see pandas too. However be warned it can get extremely busy so be prepared for the crowds. We go early and go to the far side of the park and work our way back to the entrance, this seems to avoid the main queue build-ups.

Great day out. Spent a very enjoyable day here, be there at opening time during the week and head for the furthest away areas, you will have them to yourself for a few hours but expect you groups after lunch. Well worth the money!
A MUST. Far better than Disney Hong Kong. The animals were amazing got close to a walrus (even with 3 feet of glass between us) was quite scary. Close being right under it.
ok. It makes a day with the kids. The aquarium is very rich. The penguins restaurant is definitely to be avoided: poor food and FREEZING temperature

You must go!. What a day! Amazing!!! We had so much fun. The views from the park and the roller coasters were breath taking. We loved seeing the animals. Only downside which you will get at most theme parks was that the food sucked! Bring a packed lunch or snacks if you can.

Excellent ,every thing is there. U can not visit whole ocean park in one day.there r so many attraction for all age group,realy enjoyable.roller coster is very very very adventurious,fish aqurium,train,cable chair, all the way it is one of suberb.should visit while u r Hongkokg
Looks amazing! Huge area.. I saw it from the tourist 'Red Bus' as I was travelling solo. If I had kids with me, I would probably spend hours there to sea all the attractions within the Park.

great day out in HK. Ocean Park is a great place to enjoy animals, rides and shows. A good combination for a family that has lots of interests. Red pandas were the family favorite - very very cute and the enclosure made it easy to watch them. The dolphin show was a highlight. Old HK section was cheesy. The park is crowded, as noted by other reviewers, but honestly, it is not nearly as crowded as an average day at DisneyWorld. Expect to spend a very FULL day here.

Great for kids. This is probably one of the most popular amusement parks in Hong Kong. Last time I went with my little cousin (8 yrs old at that time) and she was probably the only one that enjoyed it a lot. There are animals to see, but the most popular animal to see is the pandas. Most of them were sleeping when we were there though. They do have a lovely panda gift shop which was neat. The rides are basically for little kids. When my sister and I went (we were probably around 13-15), we were not impressed by the rides. We went on the (supposedly) "tallest" ride in Ocean Park and it was a miniature ride that would've been ridden by little kids in the US, but apparently you had to be tall in HK to ride it. So all these Cantonese people were screaming their heads off while we were on there, and my sister and I just had a not-impressed look. There are some cable cars and you get to see the view around. There are sea animals shows too. There actually weren't a lot of people there last time I went even though it was during the summer. I recommend this place to people with little children.

Great theme park, very crowded. Its expensive, but its worth it because once you're in theres nothing else to pay except for food and drink, plus any souvenirs you may want to buy. With an emphasis on animal conservation, the Panda enclosures are a must, and don't forget the beautiful little red panda as well, cute as a button. I need to emphasise this is not a zoo, however there are some great themes here and you will see a lot of themed animals. I especially enjoyed the aquarium, and the novel way they encourage you to look at conservation.The dolphin and sea lion show, whilst aimed at the kids, also had a strong conservation message which I liked.Food was good though expensive, but why let you wait in a queue for ages, promise you a free tub of ice cream if you buy a certain order, then when you pay, make you go back into the queue again to collect your free gift. Surely a freezer at the counter would alleviate the complete chaos that ensues.The undersea train (not really) was good as my partner was not into going up the mountain on the gondolas, but there is an attitude here, even though the ground staff are really helpful and monitor the crowd sizes of each train compartment before letting you on; that you have to push, scratch and fight your way onto the train when you know you're getting on anyway. That attitude is prevalent here and i came away with several bruises.In fact dont go in a weekend, its far too crowded when hot (30 degrees the day we went) and there are areas like the train which are quite unpleasant.The rides also had huge lines but everyone was enjoying themselves once on them.Would we go back, yep I guess so, but not in the weekend. Take sensible shoes, its a big walk, and be prepared for at least 4 hours minimum to get the best from the day.

Enjoyed very well!.... A very enjoyable day at the park. Rides all you can. My first time on different rides in just few hours, and I did it!!! Its an amazing park ever!!!!!!.... A very experience journey. Crowded but can accomodate. Tired but really worth it!!!. .... Have a nice restaurants in the park at your cost and the food is really tasty. For me, I really liked it. It is really good for healthy people.

Theme park HK style. Very good amusement park in HK. Its good to bring kids here or as a couple. Need a day to visit. But you might want to avoid visiting during public holiday. It was really crowded when I visited with my wife. Kudos that the staffs are preparing route so every visitors are regulated when travelling from one site to another. Dolphins and seagulls are amazing.

Very fun full day out. Really enjoyable day with a mix of attractions. Fair ground style rides as well as rollercoasters and animal enclosures. The animal enclosures are really nice (not like some upsetting ones you see in other parts of China). The food is good value in the park and we stayed from open (10am) until the closing firework show (7pm) and still had plenty to do. Highly reccommended.

Fun but Tiring.... The park is very big and you definitely need a day to visit. Plan on a lot of walking and think twice before bringing your oldman with you. Great place good mixture of everything, for all ages, rollercoaster, water rides, Pandas, aquariums all sort to please all. Unfortunately the cable car were closed when I visited so we have to travel by ocean express to the other side of the park.And you need to enter Ocean Theater an hour earlier in order to enjoy the dolphin show.
