We went there 30 minutes before the show begin and the place were already full and we got no place to sit.One piece of advice do not go on a weekend, and check out chinese holidays before you go if you want to avoid long queues.Better to go early morning as the park will start crowded in the afternoon.I went there on Monday (out of HK school holiday) but we still had crowded with other visitors, especially the tour group from the mainland.Lastly, always carry a park map with you as the directory in there is very misleading and confusing... trust me on this.

Amusing, but overcrowded too.. I liked it, it is large and there are many things to do. But it is too crowded, too. One should wait for about an hour or even two to get to an attraction...under the sun...The park is divided into two parts, and one can get to and from the second part only by the cable car or "the Ocean Express" that are also considered attractions, so one should wait long even to get to another part of the park.

Heaps of fun for the kids. Unfortunately the week we went the gondolas were out for maintenance. But we had an awesome day nonetheless. A bit or forewarning - don't expect that this will be up to the standards to European or American theme-parks - it really isn't comparable. The attractions are a bit cheesy, the rides are "old" technology but it's a wonderful day's escape from Kowloon or Hong Kong for the kids.You're not supposed to take food in but honestly - the "restaurant" food quality is beyond terrible. Play it safe and go to the McDonalds at the summit. And I'm not a big fan of McDonalds by the way..... Otherwise, treat it like a "Back to the Future" (episode 1) adventure and you'll have a great day. And the Pandas are super, super cute :-)

Asian sea world. This is a very asian water/ aquarium/ seaworld king of park. I believe larger tah what you see in the San Antonio Tx sea world with lot more rides and attractions but be prepared if you do not speak chinese. Mostly everything is in chinese, he shows are in chinese, the food is mainly asian seafood with spicy falvour.

Oceanic Fun!. Ocean Park for me is more for the bigger kids... The area is big so I dont think anyone could finish it in a day. What we did was decide on which shows to watch and rides to go to. Come early for the Dolphin Show people would swarm to get in... we were lucky to get inside entrances even if we arrived when the gates were already opened the show starts about 3pm so plan your park itinerary well if you want to see the show. What I could remember was that I'm proud to have rode all the rollercoasters! Families with little kids could go to the shows and the exhibits... see the panda, jellyfishes etc. Unfortunately there was no Panda show during our time because they were asleep. Plan ahead to get most of your experience in Ocean Park its quite big so be really prepared. Note: be prepared to walk a lot too since rides/attractions are far from each other. If you are with friends make a deal that you wont fight over which rides to go on next or stop because you are too tired of walking!Its a great place for family with bigger kids who could ride the big rides e.g. rollercoaster and its fun for friends who's game for all th rides!

Had a lot of fun here. I really enjoyed walking around and looking at all the sea animals. We rode on a few rides but I would probably stay off the wooden roller coaster. It was a little painful on the back and neck.

it;s better than our expectations. thrill mountains is absolutely thrillling.. it;s a full day affair.. we went very well planned by nine am.. and enjoyed most of the rides.. and the show with dolphines was most entertaining.. so is the pandas camp

So....BORING..... Our Ocean Park visit were a little disappointed. We had high expectation due to many good reviews and recommendations, but unfortunately we are not enjoyed. The rides in OP cater more for the range of ages from teens and above. We are family with 2 young children (3&5 y/o). We can't participate most of the rides except the dated and boring rides in Whiskers Harbour.The show and performances are good but could be better. We been to SeaWorld Gold Coast, the Aquarium and the Dolphins & seals show are much more better. The only things that we appreciate the most are the Giant Panda and the animals in Polar Adventure.Oh yah...another thing that really turn me off is the photo taking section at the entrance of every attraction. They will keep approach you to buy the photos that they had "force" you to take. This is really annoying....We got bored after half day in the park and we left early.

Loved the park. We arrived at 5pm and didn't have to line up for anything. We were able to watch the pandas for a lot longer and there was only a small group watching. Neptune's Restaurant was great. Sitting right next to the big window into the aquarium watching the stingrays, sharks and fish floating by. The park was very clean and well laid out.

A great place for fun filled day. A very nicely kept place, full of entertainment. Starting from the large aquarium, animal (dolphin. sea lion, birds) show, rare species like Pandas and Monkeys and to top them all, the amazing rides make a full day of fun. Must place to go when in HK.

boring. i think this park is meant for people who have kids. i went with 3 other adults and there was nothing much to play. the games there were old. and really, the place is small. the show was boring as well. not much shade along the way. will not go the second time.

Avoid it if your civilized. Shameful behavior of the customer's in tour groups .I simply could not believe that the park did not have enough staff to control the rabble. I'm disgusted with the state of the attitude of way people act.I've been to mainland China and people do not act like this in theme parks there.the park is also poorly laid out.raising the price will not teach people manners it will simply make more money and deliver a horrific experience. Thumbs down

Unpleasant and rude tourists. Firstly i normally am a very tolerant person but This was definately the worst theme park I have visited due to the grade of customers (mainland tour buses). The queues were borderline dangerous especially for children as people were pushing very hard. If you can tolerate bad manners, unnecessary shouting and umbrellas blocking your view all the time, you might survive this zoo of a park. no need for animals stand back and watch the humans. Ocean park must be raking it in off these ignorant consumers, but if you want an enjoyable, civilized day out, this is definately not the place for you and your family.

AMAZING. This is my second time i go there and very enjoy being there. Must see the amazing giant panda and the penguin. It will make you feel that you are not in Hongkong. And for the attraction you must try the 'Hair Rising' Its really gonna raise your hair up.

Great rides. Great Views from the roller coasters. Stay for the late show. The Ocean Park is located about 20min bus ride away from Admiralty MTR station. There is a dedicated bus service to the park from the station and regular services. Even after the fireworks show.There are many animals on show such as Dolphins, Sea Lions, Seals etc but the main attraction is the Panda. They are so majestic. Roller Coasters galore. There are so many and of varying sizes. The 1 thing they all seem to do is hang in the air for a couple of seconds so you can take in the excellent scene of the islands and boats. The Dolphin and Seal show is great. Try and get in early to get a seat so you don't miss out.You will need roughly about 6 hours to fully appreciate this place. At 7pm or 7:30 on certain nights, they do a dragon show at the front fountain. It incorporates the fountain with lights, fireworks and fire. This show is brilliant and to think I was ready to skip it to go back to the hotel. It would have been the worst mistake of my life.

Too many people... Very little shade :(. This is my third visit to Ocean Park. It seems that, with every visit, the place gets more crowded and more difficult to navigate. Do not get me wrong, the rides in Ocean Park are amazing. i recommend the Hair Raiser, The Flash, the Raging River, Ocean Park Tower and the Abyss. there are so many thrill rides for adults that a day is really not enough to enjoy them all... considering the fact that each section is really far from each other. REALLY far with hills and long, slow escalators to and from. walking from one section to another takes around 10-15 minutes if you are fast - and you have to be fast as it gets really hot in the afternoon and there is very little shade available.We enjoyed the animal shows immensely. it was nice to see how the trainers trained their animals. visiting the Pandas were also a highlight - and a welcome break from the heat as their area is airconditioned. Another break from the heat are the South Pole and North Pole enclosures where it was REALLY cold. It was nice to wander around and see the penguins, the sea lions and other animals. i really admire the conservation efforts of Ocean Park and you really get to appreciate the care they take with the animals that they care for. Make sure to catch the feeding times of the animals, it's noted in the event schedule flyer you can get when you enter the park.When we visited, the cable car was not in operation so everybody was jammed into the train going up and down the summit (where the good rides are). People were pushing and cutting lines and, generally, being disrespectful to each other. it was a real turn-off. AND it was a weekday so i cannot imaging how bad it is on weekends :( same thing was happening on some of the rides, too. so even if Ocean Park has improved their rides, their shows and their services, these factors made our visit not so enjoyable. and since we went to HK Disneyland the day before - the difference was more obvious. hopefully, my next visit won't be as bad.

Outstanding Blend of Entertainment & Education. We've visited Ocean Park at various times since 1981 and have never been disappointed. This was a first trip for three of our grandchildren & our daughter-in-law and the first since childhood for our oldest son. The park continues to add meaningful and entertaining attractions that maximize the impact of its unique topography and peninsular setting. From unusual Red Pandas & an outstanding aquarium to multiple amusement rides and live entertainment, this park has it all at an exceptional value. Language is no problem for international guests and staff are personable, well trained and well informed. Transit by Dedicated Citibus route 639 from Admiralty ( take Exit B) from Admiralty MTR) plus the ability to buy park tickets adjacent to the bus boarding spot is very convenient. A great choice for a great day. Start early to beat thre crowds and plan to enjoy a full day visit.

If a place this crowded is enjoyable, it is REALLY enjoyable!. This place is very crowded and you need to plan to ensure you get the best out of it. It will be ideal if you are there even before the park opens so that you get your tickets and get in when it opens. The cable car ride is so popular the queue forms very quickly and who can we blame? The scenery is beautiful! The clear skies, the blue sea and the mountains. However, I will recommend to take the Ocean Express up to the submit as your first stop and then the cable car down to visit the other attractions. This saves you a lot of time queuing as the Ocean Express takes more people at one go and you are amongst the first to enjoy the submit with significantly less crowd. Once you are done at the submit and ready to go down, you will realize there is hardly any queue for cable car down as people are still coming up. That's when you can take the cable car down and enjoy the rest of the attractions.There are a lot of animal shows and you have to be there early to get a good seat. The best show I think is the dolphin show. Love it! The pandas and otters are my other favorites too! This place is amazing!

Ocean Park, Hong Kong.. I visited Ocean park along with my family and enjoyed a lot to see the different portions of the park like Grand Aquarium, Cable car, panda, penguins, seal show and fascinating rides etc. etc. Halal food was also available there. My children liked the gift shop, it was big. We visited in June it was warm, travelers may visit to Ocean Park in winter season.

Excellent Dolphin Show, Panda, Otter. Must go in the early morning and you will need morning till late afternoon to enjoy all the attractions, shows, photos taking.Do plan your journey to watch the feeding show of Panda, Red Panda, Otter, penguins, etc. Most importantly do remember to watch the Dolphin show, well trainned and adorable dolphins are must watch. Go early - 1 hour early to get good seats.September is a warm month, suggest Winter months better, else you better drink a lot of water to stay hydrated.

Rides are Wild. Rides at Hong Kong Ocean Park are much wilder rather than the HK DIsneyland's. Ocean Park caters more of the teen agers to adults age range. i like the old Hong Kong part of the park, after dropping off the cable car, Coin Pressers are much cheaper here.
family day out !. We spent an entire day out here and the kids wouldn't have left if not for being overrun by tiredness and sensory overload- the sights n rides ..good timepass and family fun !!!

loads of fun... it's a fun and amazing place for kids and for adults too!! me and my little brother enjoyed our visit so much! Âmazing rides, excellent food stals/restaurants,beautiful aquariums and animal haitats.. we especially enjoyed the panda and the re panda hbitat, the jellyfish aquarium and the underwater world. We also enjoyed the rollercoaster and all of the thrilling rides. we will definetly visit again!!

Fun but Tiring. It's fun. Marine life and arctic life info and aquarium is nicely built. enjoyable cable car and ocean express rides are good too. the swings are also exhilarating. however, its huge and its hard to cover it fully in a day unless you go in morning and stay back till late night. you will be exhausted. also, in case you are teavelling with younger kids its even more tiring. Dont't go with infants or kids below 5 yrs of age. They will be tired soon and you might not even be able to cover the entire park and you wont enjoy then. Food is pretty expensive. Though there are many options available. Keep some cash handy, there is just one ATM and to locate it and use it you will have to walk a lot. Dont go on a weekend, it seems like the entire China has arrived... And in case you decide to go with infants, carry your own baby stroller.... The quality of theirstroller is really bad and theycharge $HK 75 for that... Overall a good entertainment place!
Park in the Ocean. Nice place for the kids. They really enjoyed the rides and the splash. more attractions and more entertainment.

Ocean Park Hong Kong. I suggest you visit the Grand Aquarium, The Amazing Asian Animals habitat, The Giant Panda habitat, experience the cable car ride, the rides, which are all free, except the parlor games. Also you can bring food and drinks, but food and drinks are available for purchase. Also I suggest you go on a weekday, and not on a weekend or holiday, as many Mainlanders flock this popular theme park.

Absolutely Brilliant!! . Went to the Park on a Friday and had one of the best days of our trip! The aqurium was huge with such a wide range of diversity from starfish to giant turtles to hammer head sharks!! Saw The gorgeous Pandas and went on some pretty scary rides! The Dragon rollercoaster is definitely scarier than the Hair Raiser! Spent in total 5 hours in the Park and we wanted to go back the next day... Love Ocean Park!

Excellent scenery, lots of information on conservation. Beautiful place and all exhibits provide excellent information and their conservation effort. Well done! The show and performances are entertaining. Loved the dolphins (Marine World) and sea lion (Whiskers Theater) performances are excellent. The grand Finale is definitely the Symbion show with live fire, water, lights and fireworks!However the Whiskers Harbor is a little disappointing.
Great day out. The cable cars were worth the entry price alone! A few good thrill rides without the queues of Florida! And pandas as well. Great day out.

Great location rides disappointing. We had heard great things about this park so had high expectations, unfortunately although the location is amazing the rides were a bit dated, they didnt last long and were not as good as the ones in UK. Nice pace to go but we left early as we got bored.

Cable car is under maintenance. For the time being, the cable car is under maintenance so the marine express will be rather crowded. Get there from Admiralty MTR station via bus 629 is a breeze but getting back during late evening took an hour.Prepare for queues, no need to guess why.Bring a bag, fill it with water and food.

Avoid hot summer months. Great fun and better value than the other amusement park in HK. However avoid the summer months when the crowds are huge and with the hilly terrain and high humidity it will wear you out very quickly. Too few shady areas, too few restaurants and too many people.

Must come place in HK. Very nice roller coasters. They have like more than three.I tried everything, and it is awesome! if you want some thrilling experience, this is definitely the choice rather than Disney land! There is also HUGE aquarium there. Buy the ticket in HKTS first, cost you lower and it is absolutely free from queue!Food there is bad, and there was a long queue. Make sure bring water and food for lunch because you will be there for the entire day!

View from cable car best part. Agree with other reviews. Rude tourists from mainland and staff not trained to handle crowds. Mainlanders push you out of the way and have no respect for lines. Didn't go on many rides because lines were too long and almost an hour wait for something that wasn't really that special. Best part was view from cable car and restaurant at top. But if you have younger kids they'll enjoy if not too hot of a day. Definitely go early as others have suggested. And if very hot day take umbrella. It helps shelter you from heat when standing in line. We thought it was comical to have staff yelling at all the mainlanders to be quiet inside panda exhibit only to be completely ignored.

Fun day out with great views. The cable cars that go to Ocean Park are well worth the visit in themselves. Absolutely stunning views over the South China sea. A typical theme park with a crazy chinese edge, there's rollercoasters, dolphin shows, giant slides, pirate foam parties, flying cars etc - the kids will love it, plus couples can find something to entertain themselves. The food isn't great (typical burgers/fries etc) and could do with adding more variety and maybe some healthy options. Good fun day out.

Better than Disneyland HK. Usually I enjoy Disneyland, but when I went to HK, I think this park is way better than DL in there. Ocean Park is bigger and nicer, has more attractions. It was lots of fun in there. We had great time a whole day in Ocean Park...

Great Ocean views. Great family day out. When you arrive and take the escalators to the entrance the ocean views are great. Ocean Park has a great aquarium, shows and rides. Take the chair lift when your leaving, great scenery. A must do.

Better than DL HK. Lots of space. Take the cable car up to the big rides and use the "submarine" ride to get down to the lower levels. The big rides on top of the hill give thrill seekers an extra bonus - sheer sides down to the sea!

Funfilled and Fantabulous.. We went to Ocean Park yesterday, September 5. It was very big with 8 sites each with a different number of attractions. There were thrilling rides everywhere and there were rides for everyone at all ages. We tried to play as many rides as we could but it started raining very heavily so at last the rain reduced so we played many rides and at the end we finished 6 out of 8 land sites which is a lot! The rides are very thrilling and also have proper safety measures. The rides as well as the service is very helpful. I recommend starting with Marine World, Adventureland and Thrill Mountain first because they have the most thrilling rides ever and then you can continue with the others, we regret because we could not play in Marine World as the park was closing down. And Ocean Express is a great way to travel to the other end of the park. Ocean Park is amazing and worth everyones visit!
fun. enough fun for kids; queues weren't much cos we went on weekday; but was fun,got to see the pandas,dancers,;daughter had lots of fun

Ocean Park HKG. Must see .... entire family! Best is the cable car ride all the way up and then a train ride that we took all the way back! :) Spend a complete day there and still there will be lots to do! Kids will love it. I am not a kid - but still loved it!

Fun. The cable car ride was an experince in itself, breathtaking view of thr island. The rides were great although had looong waits everywhere. The Penguins were beautiful & the Pandas cute. Thanks to Neha who played a great host:)

OCEAN PARK HONG KONG. The park is quite dated, which shows in the state of the rides.There is not a huge choice - the food is reasonably priced.The chairlift that takes you from one side of the park to the other was wonderful.

Ocean Park - Wally World for Adults - Loved it!. From my Blog about the trip...While at dinner with my friends John and Myla in Hong Kong - they mentioned that Disney in Hong Kong was less about "rides" and more about the Disney characters and culture. Marty - their 14 year old son highly recommended Ocean World. He said the rides were "awesome" which is all that my daughter Brighid had to hear. Disney was out - Ocean World was in.We took the bus to the other side of Hong Kong island - which by itself was a thrill ride like no other. The large public bus was going 50 miles an hour down winding mountain roads like a bat out of hell. The locals were used to it - but you could tell the tourists by the white knuckles and tight grip on the bus seats throughout the large double deck bus.We arrived to the resort outside of Aberdeen after 45 minutes. It looked like a typical amusement park except for the geography. The grounds were perched on the side of a mountain with a prominent cable car strung over the top of the summit as far as the eye could see. So far - pretty cool. They certainly had my attention.There were cartoon characters of course - none of them could possibly approach the Disney level of greatness - but they were awesome for their kitschy style. I immediately thought of the movie "Vacation" with Chevy Chase. The visit to Wally World was one of the best parts of the movie. It was a shame that Brighid never saw the movie as I really wanted someone to validate my comparison. Where was my friend Marcy when I needed her. She would surely appreciate the reference.We arrived inside the park and made a beeline for the cable car. On the way all of the foot traffic got funneled through "Old Time Hong Kong" - a recreation of what things were like in the Colonial Hong Kong at the turn of the century. There were lots of places for photo opportunities and it seemed like the Chinese and Asian guests were eating it up. I could only think of the stink this would raise in the United States. The level of Political Incorrectness was off the charts. There would be a lot of Asian Americans that would be highly offended - I am sure.The cable car was a small gondola with 8 seats. It went straight up the mountain to the peak and then on over the top. The views of the island and ocean were extraordinary. I could not believe that this was so beautiful. It took a full 10 minutes on the cable car to get to the other side of the park. Most of the good rides were here - as well as the aquarium and river park.We spent most of the day riding roller coasters. While I enjoyed it thoroughly - especially with my thrill seeking teen - it was rough. New fangled roller coasters are now more about speed and G-forces that strictly about thrills. My body is feeling it this morning after a long day doing loop-de-loops. My inner ears had to be a mess. Equilibrium was affected as it felt like I had "sea legs" the rest of the day.The afternoon ended all to soon. It was time for the last thrill ride of the day. The 6X bus back to Central Hong Kong. The driver did not disappoint we rode up the mountainside as quickly as we rode down - to the same affect. White knuckles and amazement with the skill level of the bus driver.

Lots of fun, amazing location.... 2 nd visit with kids now almost in teens. Truly variety of categories from adventure to aqua to polar. Laser water show at 8pm is worth it. The location is truly the big show. Costly but not so great food.

The view. The views from the cable car are worth the price of admission. We went from the Peak to the park and it was an easy cab ride. Getting back to our hotel from the park was a little tougher. The line for a cab was very very long.

Exciting Rides!!. It was really a nice trip for me. I went there onJune 2012. I loved the place as well as rides. Really i miss it. Unfortunately i could not complete all the rides due to lack of time. If i get chance again i will go again.

FUN AND AMAZING. The show is nice, the sea gull, penguin so cute.
sea jelly so beautiful. My friend could get her eyes off them.
souvenirs are the one not to be missed.

a day spent at ocean park. we cannot see and enjoy the whole ocean park in a day. we went to the ocean park and first got our gold pass made, it costs around 750 hk dollars per adult. i had known this fact earlier that we cannot explore the whole ocean park in a day and so gold pass will be a better deal. it remains valid for a year, and anyways i was here for some more weeks......we went to see the aquaria....thats huge here....one has to travel via cable car to the other side of the park, which is both exciting with beautiful views catering our eyes. the shows are entertaining and liked by kids. at polar adventure we get to see polar animals like walrus and seals in captivity, even arctic fox is there. shopping here is very expensive and not a good idea to shop here coz one can get the same stuff outside at less than half the price. if your are with kids its a place to enjoy......but nothing extra ordinary about it as far as i saw it......and yes, during hot and humid climate i did enjoy the chilled watermelon served with a spoon for us to scoop and eat it !!
Nice and fun. There have 2 very very cute panda and the animal shows are funny and nice, especially the dolphin show. The big aquarium is very very nice with many type of marine life.
They got Pandas!. Good theme park with zoo (Pandas included), aqua park and crazy rides. Cheaper than Disney and not as crowded.Just minutes by bus from Central.

a fun place to visit. lots of fun at the park riding the cable car, and fun for the whole family.ocean park has a lot of history inside the park and exciting things to do, surel to keep your family entertained throught the day.

Different Experience from HK Disneyland. My family and I wanted to see the amusement parks in HK, along with seeing a few sites in HK. We ended up mostly going to restaurants in HK Island, near Ocean Park, and also going to HK Disneyland. I really liked that Ocean Park had really good adult rides, like the roller coaster and the floom rides. It was also good that the park had live animals around (felt like a zoo with rides). Also liked that Ocean Park was relatively close to other HK Island attractions compared with HK Disneyland. I didn't like it that Ocean Park seemed a bit on the dirty and worn side, but not so much that I would dissuade anyone from going there.

Ocean park perched on the mountainside. This park is an excellent example of what a theme park can be, perched right on top of a mountain surrounded by water on several sides. the cable car transportation to the main park section is not to be missed for the views alone! the coasters of this park are a large mix of old and new with rides packed into every noon and cranny that an attraction could be squeezed into. Don't be afraid of steps, many to be taken, but escalators are everywhere to move those who can't climb the great heights that are present in this beautiful location.
Panda monium. We did not expect to find such a fun theme park in Hong Kong! Loved the Pandas! The Skyride gave us great views of Hong Kong. They also had a hot air balloon ride!

IF YOU HAVE A DAY OFF. the park is spread out with a great view of the islands. nothing like seeing hong kong upside-down from a ride. however, the rides don't really compare much if you have been to numerous amusement parks but for a day to spend with friends and see live pandas it is cool. i suggest you go on the cable cars to the furthest part first and then make your way back. this way most of the rides are still empty and maybe you will have time to catch a show or two or even visit the aquarium which sadly i did not get to see for lack of time. i'm sure i missed some things so get an early start and you won't need to rush throughout the day.

It's Big!. It really is big so go early, wear comfy shoes, take an umbrella and jacket.Getting there took a little more organisation than anything else in Hong Kong so allow some time for that.It is busy so try and get a map before your visit and pick the most important attractions to you before you go. Even still the rain can change your plans. Some attractions are cancelled when it rains , be sure to ask. We booked our daughter the dolphin experience. A truly up and close experience , a real winner for us. The public display was cancelled due to the rain.The queues took about 20 mins, the system works!If you have time this is great for kids. Go.
Ocean Park Experience. We liked where it is located, with a very good view. We enjoyed the shows and appreciated the very big aquarium with all sorts of marine life.

Fun place. Incredible place. Fantastic family venue, for adults, teens and younger children. Initially seemed a bit offputting when planning transport as no train service but the buses were incredibly efficient from Admiralty station. Hong Kong is a beautiful place with all high rise buildings, hills, islands, ocean, shopping malls, dim sum however when it comes to theme parks. Yes... Ocean Park is best in Hong Kong compared to others for my opinion
Best theme park. Very accessible and huge open space. It may seem so hot but it was worth it. Cable car ride was magnificent and efficient too. Will definitely come back.

Nice park. This is obviously for kids, well not quite. I am amazed by the aquarium. That u literally went wowww! Again, the queue was something like 45 minutes for us to literally get in.We might return again if we have more time next time when we visit but it wont be for awhile till we go back to ocean park again.l
awesome!. LOVED the rides! This is one of the best experiences i had in my life at amusement parks. I didn't even care that it was scorching hot under the summer blaze. =P

A must-experience for kids and adults alike. One of the best places to be in Hong Kong. One should not miss visiting this theme park where everything is all about fun & thrills. The first time i visited Hong Kong was in 2008 and been back last month, August 2013. Both visits include spending a day at Ocean Park. Nonetheless, both times were all great experiences. Last month though, the queues for the rides may take most of one's time (may take 40mins to 75mins wIting time) and may become frustrating with the scorching heat but my friends found a way out. The rides have a single rider queue and it really saved our time. You don't really need to talk with your friends while riding those scary and thrilling rides so we decided to just queue as a single rider so we can really save time, decide to meet at the exit before going on to the next ride, and we get to have more time exploring other rides. It is pretty useful when we only got a day to tour around a massive park. Fun, fun, fun...

Better than Disney park. We visited Ocean Park on 1st Sep which was also our Son's birthday. It was a great experience with Ocean park, each attraction was designed keeping kids and families in mind, wheel chair and stroller friendly pathways and lifts/elevators were always there. Excellent staff always ready to help which made this experience far better than Disney Park experience. Train ride was very good as it gave a feel of submarine ride to my kid, cable car was fun and so were other rides like Ferry's wheel, Frog leap, carousals , mini train . Panda observatory was also a unique experience.

Fun-filled day. Inspite of the large crowds we had an enjoyable day exploring the various attractions in the Park. My daughter really enjoyed the rides and the penguin display. We will certainly come back again and hopefully have more attractions.

Incredible location. Fantastic family venue, for adults, teens and younger children. Initially seemed a bit offputting when planning transport as no train service but the buses were incredibly efficient from Admiralty station. It was a busy August Saturday and the park was heaving but in comparison to UK parks the ride queues were acceptable - 20 - 30 minutes for some great rides. Perhaps not the absolutely greatest thrill rides in the world but the park is at the top of a hill and the view as you were on a ride with not much to see below you except the South China Sea several hundred feet down was sensational. With giant pandas, dolphins and incredible views our only regret was not allowing a full day. We arrived at 11 and had to leave at 5.30 and felt this was inadequate.

Best time in Hong Kong. Okay, Hong Kong is a beautiful place with all high rise buildings, hills, islands, ocean, shopping malls, dim sum however when it comes to theme parks. Yes... Ocean Park is best in Hong Kong compared to others for my opinion. I can say one of the bests all around world :) You can find many assorted rides, animals, scenery all in this park. This is why it is crowded and is a tourist spot as people are lining up from 9 30 am at doors, like we did :)The park is grounded on two sides of a hill and connected with a cable car ride(erected on a cliff and might be thrilling for some) and a funicular ride from the tunnel in a train where screens are installed on the ceiling to give an atmosphere like we are travelling under water. You choose which one to travel with, we went by funicular to avoid cable car queue and reach the other side quickly; came back by cable car to rest during our ride with beautiful scenery.The entrance side is mainly for animals and more childish rides with shops and restaurants. The other side is for the 'real' rides; 3 out of 4 roller coasters are extremely exciting, all classical rides in water, on rails, in air...etc.... Seals, dolphins, a big aquarium, a giant panda, gold fish room... this can take a whole day for you (if weather permits). You will definitely be exhausted so better schedule a massage for afterwards. This is a must visit in Hong Kong especially if you are a theme park/roller coaster fan.

so huge, you need more than one day to explore it. To celebrate my son’s 8th birthday, we planned a one-week Hongkong trip, which included a visit to Disneyland Park, Science Museum (see separate reviews), and Ocean Park. Our visit was in August 2012.Important: Ocean Park is so huge and the attractions are very far away from each other that you should make sure you’re wearing comfortable shoes because you will do a lot of walking. We started our visit by riding the cable car up to the mountain... it was a breathtaking experience! Later that afternoon, we went back down via the train (nothing special). If you are visiting in the summer, like us, be prepared for a very,very hot day. My son runs inside gift shops and souvenir shops just to feel the airconditioning. And because you will be walking a lot, you will also need to hydrate regularly. There are many rides in Ocean Park but we didn’t try any because we have motion sickness. The dolphin show was good, as well as the Jelly Fish museum, and the Goldfish treasures. We also liked visiting the pandas, the walrus, then the oceanarium. Many of the attractions have photo taking as part of the experience...but it’s up to you if you will buy them as souvenirs(as photos or key chains). We bought our photos made into key chains at our cable car ride and when we visited the panda. On our first day, we also had a fantasy photo taken... making it look like we were riding on the back of a whale....this is our favorite...and the staff who took the photo was also very nice . Ocean Park is so huge that one day visit is just not enough. If you plan to visit it for more than a day, you might want to consider checking-in at L’Hotel Island South (see separate review). If you purchase your Ocean Park tickets from this hotel’s front desk, you get a ticket good for 2 days for the price of a one-day ticket. Also, this hotel offers a free shuttle bus to and from Ocean Park, which is less than a 5-minute ride away. This proved to be a great advantage when on our second day visit, the weather was bad and it was raining with strong winds when we left the park that night. We saw a long queue for the taxi .

Very disappointed and ripped off.. My family of six(15,13 & 6 twins) found the service rude and unhelpful. We are at a family park and my kids continually said they were board and wanted to go. We discussed our poor experience with a supervisor and she did not care and went about her business.I refused to spend any additional money in the park due to my experience. Disneyland 10 times better.My advice do not waste your money or time on your holiday by visiting this park, send the extra day at Disney land.
Great Place. much better value for money than Disney Land. Long waiting times but worth it. It must be just a Hong Kong thing for everyone to be so arrogant.

must see. if you're visiting hong kong, this is a must see, but beware of the mainland china people, if you want somebody to help you take a picture, give it to the people who speak cantonese(hk ppl speak canto) or the staff, NOT the ones that people who speak mandarin. if theres a long line for the cable car, take the train first, and take the cable car on the way back, its the smarter thing to do, i visited the panda at the perfect timewhen i saw it coming out of the hole and plopping down to eat bamboo

Fantastic, Suitable for all ages, but very hot during Summer. We really enjoyed the adventure, some people told us this is the old park but I believe they have refurbished the Park and well maintained. This is the must visit place in Hong Kong, with the entrance fee that we paid it is worthy. There are many zones cater to different age of groups, playground and rides for young children, the Adventure Land for those who love high speed and challenging rides, leisure rides for families and senior citizens.The Park is crowded but the staff there are able to control the crown professionally and they are very polite and friendly. We are able to see different animals that we seldom see in our daily life like seals, penguins, walrus, sea lions, dolphins and of course panda. There are many animal shows and feeding time as well, so we need to manage our schedule well. My children express the Grand Aquarium is one of the best aquarium they ever visited. The park is big and crowded, we suggest the first thing is to take the Ocean Express from Waterfront Station to the Summit (hill top), visit all the sites at the Summit then only take the cable car down to a other sites. We have avoided many queues because many people are going up hill later, we can see many people queuing up for food, train and cable car while we are going down during noon time. The only cons is during Summer is very hot, all of us have sunburn. .
had a great time. this park is well worth the visit. just the cable car ride alone into the park is spectacular and not to be missed. the aquarium is fantastic as were the zoo and park rides

A Real Eye Opener. In terms of a tourist attraction this is a real eye opener. It is a giant mix of a zoo, aquarium, and amusement park, and it plays a very important role in the conservation of endangered wildlife. There are very realistic habitat displays of the giant panda, arctic, antarctic and dolphin to name only some of them. Huge sums of money have been invested into this Park by the government and it is money well spent. The park is ranked in the top ten in the world and you really need two days to see everything. And maybe a third day if you want to do all the rides. It provides first class entertainment and its only drawback is that it is a very very busy place. It is a "must see" when in Hong Kong.

Cable car to fun!. I enjoyed Ocean Park as a child and I enjoyed taking my brothers when they were little. It continues to be a fun day out in Hong Kong. It's quite far away but it's definitely worth the trip. Be sure to go early. The cable cars are enjoyable and are just the start to a day of fun!

A must!. A must visit place especially with children or even adults. Well maintained parks, clean, efficient and friendly staff. We were there around 10 in the morning and left at closing time which was around 7'ish. Much to do, crazy fun rides (I loved it all), aquariums with fishes of all sizes and shapes, panda bears, marine creatures, dolphin and seal show. There were even man walking on stills, clowns, acrobats and street dancers.Plenty of food and drink around. There are staff who will approach you to take photographs and you can decide to pay for this later (totally optional).A great place to go and have fun.

Queues a nightmare and no good for little kids.. Avoid this if you have small children, there is so little that they can access - minimum height is 120cm on most rides, apart from a couple in Whiskers Harbour. There is a small childrens play area, but not worth the visit. We visited on a weekday, queues for every ride were at least 45 minutes, and the staff don't bother filling up the rides to shorten queues. Food and drink is extortionate ($20 for a small bottle of water - at least at Disneyland you can fill up a water bottle). To cap it all, when you are fed up and want to leave, you have to queue up for another 45 minutes just to get down the train or cable car to get out! Only good thing is the views from the cable car...

Don't visit on weekends. We visited this park on Sunday. It was way too may people. It was very crowded in some of the indoor displays. When you eat there is no place to sit except on the floor. The park needs to add more tables for visitors.Ticket prices were fair.

Great Rides. Lovely Aquarium.. Get there as soon as the gates open. Lots to do here. Get on the popular rides early so as to beat the queues. Lots of fun rides if you enjoy roller coasters. Flash, Dragon and Hell Raiser.Missed the shows but the Aquarium was rather nice. Wide variety of animals and fish to see. Can be educational if one takes the time. An entire day is required.

very nice. this place is realy great for almost all ages the only bad thing is that you have to walk a lot and it gets tiring but there many benches where you can just sit and have a cool icecream .the rollercoaster here is a must go and another thing never take the cable car as it tkes a very longare take the train its fun and also shorter

A must do in Hong Kong. This park is huge and there is so much to do you really need two days to do it justice. However you need to be prepared to queue if it is busy. We only got to do the roller coaster due to time but that was awesome. Would love to have done all the other rides. There is also other sights to see in the park such as the panda bear, turtles, sea animals in the aquarium, etc. The cable car ride is also a bonus, you get to have quite a good view of the park as well as the outlying islands. Highly recommend this place.
Not worth at all. To crowded with many tourist from mainland China. All rides have long queues but the biggest problem is that the visitors from China do not follow the queues.

A fun day at the Park. The tram was an awesome ride, but get there early because the lines were long. There was definitely a lot of variety and options for families to enjoy this park. The restaurant in the park can be improved, food wasn't good. It would have been nice if the price of admission wasn't so high.
a ocean park on the top. Most of the ocean park is on the ground floor,But this one is on top of the mountain, so most of the ride will give you a very good view. Don't forget to visit the Panda.

Really geared for young kids, Cable car is great, some shows not. Visited on a hot sunny August day and the crowd got pretty big. The initial part of the park was not great. Really geared for young kids and the bird exhibits/shows are sub-standard. It was good to see the Pandas. Eating in Neptune's Restaurant was cool with a nice ambiance due to the large Aquarium although the food was bland and forgettable. The walk through the Aquarium was not good as it was too crowded and with very little information provided. The cable car ride was great (averages up the score). The river Sturgeon and Jellyfish exhibits were also good

Not a fan.. First of all, I love animals. That's why I was so disappointed because when we came here, animal shows were temporarily not showing. I think the theater was under construction or something. So I spent time people watching and picture taking. Second, I am not a fan of theme park rides. And I tell you, the moment I saw this mountainside roller coaster, I immediately feared for my enjoyment and life. It was just a good thing that we came here early in the morning, so my niece who loves rides didn't wait long in line. She was able to ride the most fun ones. Maybe younger ones will enjoy Ocean Park more.

amazing entertainment in hongkong. this is the best entertainment place in hong kong.and you need 2 days to explore it completely.so schedule for atleast 2 days of ocean park for your next visit.Its huge, and divided into various zones.you have to travel between the various zones by using the Train, Cable car, esclators, walking,whatever way you chose,various eating options.Various great rides.lots of fun.Panda, animals, and birds.I guarantee you a very good time inside.MTR to this place is under construction,as it is in abardeen part of hong kong.but you can catch a direct bus from central bus station.

Choose the day of visitation carefully. Currently overrun by mainland tourists.long lines, unenthusiastic staff, closed attractions, and table food service so chaotic it is not worth the attempt.For all intent and purpose, this venue has become a one-day dumping ground for certain northern visitors. To get any value from your visit, pick a day when they are all shopping and the weather is not sunny.

How a waste to come here. Better do something else which more fun than to be here. This place is so crowded when i came on 7 Aug 2013. But the tickets keep selling and selling. Many people were on queue for long time from 60-90min per-game and it's not convenient when the peak season. I have rent a stroller for my boy but when we played a game and my son were walking with us to be on queue so i put the stroller on this parking space but when i came back the stroller was gone. I asked the man whose working near my stroller and he said he didn't where it was and not seem to care to found my stroller. So i say goodbye to my $HK 100, as is the deposit for the rent stroller. So overall i do not like this place at all and i will not suggest my friends or my family to go there because they will regret if they go there and really wasting time.

Best and Amazing. If i am allowed to make a controversial statement I would claim that Ocean World is better than the Disney World without any doubt. I am not sure how many people would agree to it, but this place is worth a day tour. You would be spellbound with the entire experience. The variety offered by Ocean world is outstanding. I mean you can visit underwater world, see the Panda bear, see birds carrying out stunts.The price for Adult is 280 HK. If you are cominmg through the MTR come out of Exit B and alight on Bus 260 which would be parked. These are double decker bus which continously runs to and fro from the park. You can also check for volunteers there who provide you about 40 HK discounts, thus you can purchase from there as well.

Wel worth the cost. I have been to Hong Kong every year since 2007 and I have never been able to get to the Park but last year with my eldest daughter, we went so she could se the panda's and I was so please to see them in better shape than they are in Beijing..you really need to spend at least 2 days here as once you have finished the bottom section there is the fantastic cable car ride up tot he top and the fun rides at the top where the roller cosater sits right on the cliffside...takes your breath away..and no I didn't go on it..too scary for me..but it is so worth every cent..

Been to Ocena Park on a Sunday - Big Mistake.. Sundays is a bad day to visit the Ocean Park, simply because its so crowded with people. I think besides the locals its full of people from these huge big group tours visiting Hong Kong. One has to stand in long queues to visit the attractions and the rides wait can be as long as 30-60 minutes.The staff looked over worked on this day and are not very polite and informative. The prices of drinks and food is expensive. On the positive they have a very good aquarium and the cable rides are awesome.I would recommend people to visit on a week day if possible as maybe there is lesser people so that one can enjoy a lot more. Its a place for families and kids to go.

Worth every cent. Ocean Park was fantastic, my 3 children loved it, good rides and great wildlife. Must see Nth and Sth Pole exhibits and Giant Pandas. Get tickets from 7/11 to avoid cues and go weekdays. Was hot take plenty of water. Cab there abt $80HK. Get there ar opening 10am and leave late you will need all this time.

Family with children -first visit to Ocean Park. We really enjoyed our time at ocean park. The gardens were wonderfully kept with beautiful scupted hedges. Queues for the young children's rides were relatively short, except there weren't all that many. The queue for the big merry go round was surprisingly long however, as many adults (at least half) actually lined up for this ride too!! It also took a long time for them to go around and buckle everyone in for this slow ride, and once everyone was buckled, it went around for 2 whole rounds before the ride was over!! Worth the queueing up? I think not!Conversely, the cable cart was well worth the wait. The views offered (of the sea and islands) was nothing short of breathtaking. It is a must experience. If you're scared of heights, it's still a must experience!On the other side of the island, there are more thrilling rides for older children. We didn't go on any as our children were too young for the rides. Instead, we had ice cream and watched the dolphin show. The show itself was good, but nothing compared to the shown in Sea World Queensland (Australia). We felt sorry for the dolphins as the pool they spent the rest of their time in seemed remarkably small. If you love marine animals, you'll also enjoy visiting the aquarium. My children loved it, especially my son who would stare for hours if we didn't remind him there was more to see. Overall, we had a wonderful time, and it is definately worth the visit. Word of warning: When you're feeling hungry, I recommend NOT going to Neptune's restaurant. Though it offered amazing views of the main aquarian tank, do not go if you expect good food. We ordered the lobster fried rice (x2) which was less than average and the pan fried black cod which I immediately spat out before chewing. I normally love eating fish, whether it be fried, steamed or grilled. However, the black cod they served was like no fish I'd ever eaten. I don't know how to describe it other than it was not edible. All in all, we paid just under $200 (Australian) for four dishes, 3 of which were under average and one which was inedible.After we left the restaurant, we passed by some small stalls set up outside which smelt wonderfully delicious and very reasonable price :(

Decent but Crowded. I am giving this place a rating of three because I thought the views from the top summit and attractions were good. This would have been an awesome place if less people. I just went two days ago and the place was massively overcrowded. I thought Chinese New Year was peak season? Anyways, we only got to go up the cable car, ate lunch there (to avoid the Mainland Chinese crowds), saw the Dolphin Show, the Pandas, and went home. I wasn't planning on riding rides, so it was no big deal. However, if I had kids or a family this place would have been literally hell on earth. The crowds were horrendous. How a theme park can operate like that is beyond me. This place needs to raise the admission fees to like $100 US per person to make it comfortable to enjoy it. Way to overcrowded.

A world unto itself!. An excellent way to spend a day in Hong Kong. The theme park features an underground marine park showcasing marine life, a panda enclosure and water seals which one can feed at a fee. It also has a wide choice of activities; from river rafting at high speed, an area where one can swim to cool - vital in the summer heat! - a high speed train ride, and many fun activities at the peak. It is creatively designed, so one can get to the peak using either the cable cars or the 'ocean train'. There are also many escalators all over to easily get round the various amusements and many food outlets selling a variety of food. It has a huge fountain in the middle which offers a stunning view of synchronised water jets. The cost was HKD 280 (140 for children), a very fair price considering all the attractions. There are also some educative tours targeting children, some however must be booked in advance. It can however get crowded, so get in as early as possible (opens at 10 a.m.). Also carry swim wear for a dip to cool down!

Good for family. A good place to go for all ages for a day trip. The aged and young ones could enjoy viewing all the shows performed by birds and different marine animals, visit their habitats, etc. While the energetic youth could enjoy the various rides and games in the Park.

too hot, too crowded. august might be a bad time to travel to HK Disney and Ocean Park. The weather is just too hot, and the visitors are just too many. we thought Monday would be less crowded, but we were wrong. It is jam packed with people. all that we were able to do was get into the aquarium (long queue, but its ok, because its cold in there), and the panda area (no queue. seems like people already bored with panda). According to the map, there should be many interested rides and shows that we wanted to visit. But instead we decided to visit the exit gate.

Wonder Land. It was definitely a wonder land for the kids, there are animals to see and plenty of rides and shows. Our fave is the cable car ride. It was a breeze in a hot summer. Given a choice again, we will not be visiting the park in August. It was HOT to the max!

Taken for a ride. I had chosen ocean park over Disney land for a visit based on the feedback I got from people. The park was really big and there seemed that we had lot of activities to cover. Unfortunately the weather condition were overcast and there were only a few spell of rain. Because of this more than 80 pecent of the rides and shows were canceled. This should have been informed to us before we purchased the tickets. After paying 280 hkd for the same we felt like idiots. My advice would be don’t visit the park if the climate is overcast even

A theme park on top of a hill. Ocean Park is a theme park for the whole family. It has an aquarium and a carnival section for roller coaster rides. You can get to see two chubby pandas, Jia Jia and An An. The dolphins and friends show was good. However, it could have done better on crowd control and the queueing system is not as good as Disneyland.

No worth for visiting during summer. it is too over crowded , and the ride average take about 70 -90 min waiting time , very expensive food in the restaurant as was one meal ( curry rice , kid meal , 1 beer , 2 can drink cost about 400 plus HK ) it doesn't make sense , most of the place not well maintain , No cover and fan in queue line .

Way too crowded. Ocean Park has been on Hong Kong for a long time. This place has quite some history, because of Old Hong Kong, with the whole atmosphere excataly the same as HK in the 60s. The animals were great, since it was like a zoo. Certain places would be more crowded though. This is one of the two places in HK where you can ride a cable car. There are long lines for that though, also for the other rides. I also highly recommend that you take the ocean express, since it is air conditioned and faster that the cable car to get to the other part of the park. Sometimes everyone would squish you, and then you should definitely take the cable car. As maybe some of the other reviewers have said, there are long walks. There are lots of different games you can play, but the quality is not that good. The only games with good quality are those one that you pay to play. You might win a plush, or walk away losing $25-100 HKD. Take the bumper cars for instance. I waited for 30 minutes for the ride, but the game only lasted for 3 minutes and the cats were really slow. The only way you can go is when other people bump into you. The also let a lot of people in at the same time, so it was too crowded.The food though is really good, and food all around the world can be served. There is lots of different food in the restaurant above the terrace cafe. The restaurant is called the Bayview Restaurant. It used to have jellyfish in a glass window so you can eat with the jellyfish, but they disappeared. The restaurant is like a buffet style, except you pay at the end, like a school cafeteria. Another thing is that there is no proper line in some snack kiosks, and if people cut in front of you, no staff members will help you sort this out.

Good adult rides, AVOID summer weekend crowds. We went on a Saturday, two days after visiting Hong Kong Disneyland (after the 10yo recovered!)Transport:Got there by taxi from Kowloon, came back by public transport as the wait for a taxi back was 1h, as informed by a security guard. No difficulty with public transport, Bus from Ocean Park to MTR (train) Admiralty station on Hong Kong Island, then MTR to Kowloon (or wherever). Bring small change, or get a loaded smart card for public transport.Problems:Huge crowds, as it is the summer holidays in HK and Mainland China. Lots of jostling in the lines, and the ubiquitous umbrella shielding the sun is a hazard for non-umbrella wallahs! Some of the rides had ridiculous lines: 80 minutes for a 2 min ride on the Rapids, consisting of a serene log-boat ride, then ONE drop of 10 meters or so only. Definitely not worth it.The Hair Raiser and the Runaway Mine Railway were good, and the lines shorter.Coming from Malaysia, our own Sunway Lagoon theme park has as good rides with much shorter lines!Practicalities:The whole of Ocean Park is built around a steep hill/ mountain. The entrance is near sea-level, where the aquarium, and some attractions are. To get to the others, there is a cable-car or a funicular train through a tunnel to the top (Ocean Express) that you need to take, and come back down the same way. There is fair amount of walking, with however lots of escalators between the levels. Views from the cable car and some of the rides are superb. Drinks are at the usual inflated theme park prices (water at HK$22, etc). Overall:If in HK and you want some theme park rides, with additional marine attractions (seals, sea lions, aquarium), then do go, BUT avoid the weekend, and the whole summer if possible!

REALLY GOOD...BUT CROWED. Visited Ocean Park a few days ago. It was very good, but between the over crowding and the darn unbrellas I don't I could repeat. The dolphin show is trying to be "Sea World", but falls short. If you don't mind crowds have the time its worth a once over.

Wait wait wait. The park is great but they had twice as many people as they can handle. 1 hour to buy the tickets and minimum 30-35 minutes to get into any of the attractions- even the restaurants had a waiting time of over 45 minutes. Whats worse is that a lot of places do not have shade for the waiting area- remember to carry an umbrella as the heat can be too much especially if you have kids.People don't mind cutting queues or pushing to get their way even when they can see small kids.

Worth it. It was rainy day. Its summer so it was proper hot and the queue was pretty long. The penguin place was real smelly. Other than that, everything was fine. Enjoyed the cable car and the tram. Can either just enjoy the performance and pay a visit to all the animals or you can enjoy the rides.

surprised by this place. Kids wanted to see Pandas and this is the place. Who knew the us parents would be so entranced by them. The Pandas and a beautiful gondola ride over the ocean is worth the visit. But we hung around and rode lots of rides with our little kids. Crowd was low and we left before it presumably ramped up. One of our favorite memories of HK.

The Ocean Park –The best theme park in Hong Kong. If you are getting bored with shopping in Hong Kong and would like to do something different, the Ocean Park is a wonderful place to go. It is easily accessible. You could buy the ticket and take a bus from the admiralty MTR station. Animals to see – The panda are one of the most famous animals in the Ocean Park. Sometimes they hide inside their little cages though if it’s too hot. If you don’t see them in the Panda house, there are 2 more panda in the Asian house. Exotic birds, jellyfish, penguins, seals and dolphins are some of the animals residing at the Ocean Park. The aquarium in the Ocean Park is one of the top aquariums in Asia, it is huge with lots of beautiful sea animals; big groupers, different kind of sharks, sting rays, turtles are a few of them. If you don’t want to be squashed watching the beautiful see animal, there is a restaurant above the aquarium and you could enjoy your dinner comfortably whilst watching all the fishes swimming leisurely in the aquarium.Another must-see activity is the Ocean theater. There are a few shows per day where the dolphins and seals perform. They are brilliant.You could either use the cable car (highly recommend) or the train to go to the other side of the hill where all the rides are – the Abyss, Mine Coaster, Ferris Wheel etc. I haven’t tried those, so cannot comment. All in all, Ocean Park is brilliant and no matter what age you are, you could easily spend a wonderful day there.

Great Park Poor Inside Transportation. Great Cable Car ride worth a trip, the polar express and the theme is good..but mid day the queue become 90 mts long ...and the whole trip become a pain ...some of the rides are average...shows are mainly in Cantonese....unless you are Chinese you probably want to skip this place ...

Must Visit. This park is way much better than the Disneyland. If I only have 1 day in HK, i will choose this park. My boy enjoy it. Lots of exciting rides. The cable car connecting the mountain is cool. The park is huge and we need to walk really2 a lot. The park is not Muslim friendly. No halal food available. We were all starved and tired. We just couldn't complete the park. Worth to visit.

cruelty in the name of education. Animal performance is the main attraction in Ocean Park. Any one who is aware of animal welfare knows that wild animals in captivity is unnatural & is bad for the animals. Ocean Park keeps seals, dolphins & hold performances by them. Tourists, mainly from Mainland China, cheer as theses poor creatures are forced to perform. Ocean Park always says that this is to educate the public about animals. I don't see how. This only tell people to laugh at them & usually children think it is all right to capture wild animals & make them do pleases them. This act is similar to the Japanese who capture whales in the name of science, instead they end up on their dining tables.

A brilliant day out!. As regular visitors to Hong Kong, we decided to try something different and chose Ocean Park! It was very easy to reach with the number 629 bus from Admiralty; when we arrived at the bus stop the queue was very long already (this was around 8:45am) but there were plenty of bus company staff around to direct people and lots of buses departing. Bus ride costs HK$10.6 and takes around 30 minutes.We bought our tickets from the ticket office in Admiralty MTR (near exit B) and got them for HK$150 each instead of HK$180 each.We were lucky and managed to get on the cable car up to the summit as soon as we arrived and the views were amazing over Deep Water bay. Ocean Park is built in a very unique way - the rides are on the side of the mountain and if you have the nerve to keep your eyes open you will be rewarded! The rides on The Summit are very good, we went mid-week in July and there were hardly any queues for any of the rides. We tried the Hair Raiser (very good - we went on twice!), the Mine Train (a little rickety and jolted you around) and the Dragon (this made us feel a little sick with the loops, hanging side ways and jolting!). There were also lots of other more sedate rides suitable for young kids.Pacific Pier was nice to walk through and watch the seals basking in the sun, the Ocean Theatre was excellent with the dolphin show and seals. The animal handlers seemed to really care about the dolphins and seals they were interacting with.The Jelly Spectacular was amazing! It's great to see jelly fish up close and admire their lethal beauty. The Polar Experiences were good too but very, very cold - we couldn't find the arctic fox enclosure. We got the strange funicular down to the Waterfront area (it looks like something from a Jules Verne novel) to visit the Aquarium (massive and very informative) and the Sichuan Treasures panda and golden monkey enclosure.One thing we would say it that it can be VERY loud and there is a lot of shoving, pushing and queue jumping that goes on from the huge groups of Chinese package tourists, so be prepared! We were there in a non-busy time (mid-week, July) so we would hate to see how busy it is in high season on a weekend!The incessant 'pose for photos' at the beginning of each attraction became a little annoying, but it's fine to tell the staff you don't want to stop and pose for the photos.All in all, a great day out for us adults (letting our inner kids out for the day) or families alike.

Happy and tired!. Originally me and my girlfriend planned on going to Disneyland, but upon reading the reviews (Small and only a few adult attractions) and considering the price we opted for Ocean Park instead. Try the grilled squid and watermelon!Do bring swimwear underneath if you want to try the water rides since you'll definitely get wet. The lines are about 30-45mins on a weekday for the rides but nothing too extreme, we also enjoyed the animal conservation areas (seals, jellyfish, penguins and the pandas) and learned a lot on the nature of these animals.The areas were well segregated but do take note that there is a long line for both the train (Ocean Express) and the cable car going to and from and those are your only way to get back, so plan ahead and start your day at the top rides so you won't be with the masses when it's about time to go down, and try to avoid the bulk of the visitors as the lines here tend to get unruly and pushy; if you're particular about personal space then good luck to you. All in all even with aching feet me and my girlfriend enjoyed our visit!

so...so. 1 day is not enough for seeing the whole park. It's overcroweded, long long lines, noisy, very annoying working people with bells. And sellers want only cash, goods are overcharged.Thriller Mountain, cable car, dolphin show and some others are great.

Paradise for Kids and Adults!. I really enjoyed my visit to Ocean Park. I had never had so much fun when I was a kid in Singapore. Tried the train rides, hot air balloon, walked inside the shops and the aquariums which made me grin happily from ear to ear. An attraction that everyone should visit in Hong Kong.
very good Park. You can see all the animals of the sea!!! it is the best place for kids but also for adults! But you should not go during july or August! It is very warm and you will not enjoy it!!

Great theme park. A local theme park that have lot of attractions, from aquarium, panda to rollercoaster and lot of ride.. We just visit the aquarium, panda and try some ride.. The first one is Hair Raiser.. A great ride!!

No wonder is one of the top 10 attractions. My sisters and I went here on a Saturday. There was a tropical cyclone signal number 3 that was issued by the government the day before so we were expecting to get drenched all day. However, that day, we were blessed with perfect, sunny weather, which made our visit all the more fun. This place is jam-packed with things to do! Young and old will enjoy all that Ocean Park has to offer. We really enjoyed watching the red pandas get fed in the 'Amazing Asian Animals' area. The 'Whiskers and Friends' show (dolphins and seals) in the Ocean Theatre is also a must-see. What was great about seeing the animals and their trainers was that you can see how passionate the trainers are about what they do. They love those animals dearly. The cable car ride to the top is very scenic. Keep in mind though that this is a continuous ride to the other side of the park - about 20 minutes. If you're not one for heights, you can choose to take the Ocean Park express train, about 5 minutes. I highly recommend going by cable car as you get spectacular views of the ocean and neighboring islands. They have rides for people of all ages. We were pumped for the roller coaster rides - The Hair Raiser and the Dragon (twists and turns expected). The River Rapids was very refreshing on a scorching hot day. There's also the Ferris wheel and carousel for those who are looking for family- friendly rides. Lastly, we had to keep in mind that with every theme park or attraction that we visit, there's always some people that may ruin our stay by either cutting in line, shoving or pushing. We had to just push all of that aside and see the place as a bigger picture, the fun-filled and adventurous park that it is. I highly recommend to out this on your must-do list when in Hong Kong.
Family day. This is by far the best family day outing for children in Hong Kong. It will be crowded but they seem to cope

Ocean park night 9 PM show. Worth visiting while coming backA show wherein they combine many elements like water, light, sound, fire, floating fire etc. etc. The effects are terrific.If you are ending your day at Ocean park, reach the central park in the end around 8 PM wherein u see a show, while coming back come to almost the gate and u will find around 9 a show which is no where on the itenaries, no where mentioned but it if terrific. Enjoy a lovely show.

Impressive setting and some very good attractions. Saturday 29 MarchVisited with DW, DS(16), DD(13) & DD(10)Left the hotel at about 8.45am and caught a taxi to Ocean Park. Arrived at about 9.am, after going through the Aberdeen tunnel, which again was an impressive engineering feat. We were very early as the park did not open to 10am so we picked up our tickets and waited at the front of the Q. We were first through the turnstalls, but then had to wait in another holding area before the park officially opened. We wanted to be first to get the cable cars to the top of the mountain. We were first to the cable cars, but unfortunately the winds meant the cable cars were not running so we had to double back and catch the Ocean Express. This is a train that goes through the mountain to take you to the top of the park. Again, impressive engineering and a very quick & efficient way to move a large number of people into the main part of the park.The whole park is huge and it is set in one of the most impressive natural settings of any theme park I have visited. The main rollarcoasters and some of the animal exhibits are at the top of the park so we went to these first.At the top of the mountain we went on a number of the main rides:a) Arctic Blast – a relatively tame rollarcosterb) Hell Raiser, an intensive coaster, with a number of loops, built on the side of the mountain and over looking the Seas. DW bought a picture of me on this as she thought I look terrified, which I was !c) Mine train – another traditional type of rollercoaster, but in a superb setting on the side of the mountain overlooking the sea. We went on this a couple of times.d) Ferris Wheel – traditional type of ride, in that it takes a long time to get all the people on. Probably not really worth the wait.e) The Dragon – Another rollarcoater with a couple of loops. Ok but not as intense as Hell Raiser.None of the above had any significant Q’s.As the weather was wet and windy we gave the 2 water rides a miss.Whilst at the top of the mountain we also went in the following animal exhibits:a) South Pole penguin encounter. What was special about this was that you could see the penguins swimming beneath your feet.b) North Pole Encounter – saw them feeding a walrus, as well as a baby walrus and some seals.c) Chinese Sturgeon Aquarium.d) Sea Jelly Spectacular – this was very impressive, contained some huge and beautiful jelly fish. We caught the Ocean Express down the mountain and then went to the Panda Village. This was very good and DD10 loved this part. It had 2 Giant Pandas and 2 red pandas. We must have spent about 1 hour in here watching the Pandas eat. By now it was about 4pm and the cable car had opened up. I wanted to go on this, so persuaded everyone else to give it a go. I don’t think anyone was that keen. Anyhow we caught the cable car back to the top of the mountain. Good and impressive views, but spoilt by the fog and the limited visibility. At the top long Q’s to come down so we caught the Ocean Express back down. By now it was about 5pm and stating to rain heavily. We joined the long Q for taxis and had to wait about 35 minutes. We were back at the hotel for about 6pm.

A Must See in HK. Though it was raining, HK Ocean Park didn't failed to amaze us. From the grand marine life, the penguins and pandas, to the mock up of the Old HK life and the cable car, there is a lot to see. There are a lot of people on the day that we visit but the park is so big that you wouldn't really mind the crowd. Really worth the visit. We arrived late afternoon that's why we never really get the chance to see all the shows and attractions. 1 whole day is recommended when visiting. We will definitely visit again to check out those that we missed on our next HK trip! :)

The Place is Overrated!. We only explored the aquarium, the seal/penguin habitats and the roller coasters during our trip so we probably did not see the entire complex. We like the aquarium the most as we found certain "wow" moments in there. However, the fact that most of the park was located on the hillside really dampened the fun. At one point we had to walk uphill on a long stretch of road with nothing to see on either side so it was both exhausting and boring. The exhibits and rides seemed to be randomly located and there were not enough signs to tell us where to go. The park has expanded over the years but we think that this is not equivalent to proper park design. We will not go back there next time we visit Hong Kong.

Amazing place & very popular - needs 2 days to do it justice. We visited with a group of roller coaster enthusiasts in July and were given a guided tour of the park and the coasters by the staff. This was great, as the park was very busy, but it did mean we missed out on seeing many of the marine attractions.To be honest the park really requires a full 2 days here...it's a large site with attractions at lower and upper levels, the upper levels are reached via cablecars (very scenic with amazing views) or the funicular railway through the mountain (which has a few surprises too and worth doing at least once...and it's also faster than the cablecars).In the heat and humidity traversing the sloping paths of the park can be hard work although there are plenty of escalators to take you up and down the various levels (there are attractions all over the place!). Our tour was quite rushed to get all the coasters in, but if you can take the park at a more gentle pace it would be more bearable.We didn't really get to see any of the marine life, so would love to go back for that, and we missed seeing the pandas too, but you cannot beat the park for thrills and amazing views. We did see the jellyfish exhibit though...highly recommended!We dined at the Bay View Restaurant and had a lovely meal - and the views from the restaurant were simply to 'dine for'...spectacular to be honest. The restaurant can get busy though and when we left after the meal the waiting area to go in was so packed it was a challenge to squeeze past all the people to visit the toilets...I expect you can book a table in advance, but not sure.The roller coasters are a nice mix of gentle and more extreme rides and the views hanging upside down on the Hair Raiser coaster are simply breath-taking. The log flume is VERY WET (lots of water jets / sprinklers) so ideal on a hot day but prepare for a soaking! The iconic ride of the park is the Dragon coaster, which looks lovely and is painted a rainbow of colours but is a little rough through the loops...but again the views from it are spectacular.It's a place we will have to return to and spend a more leisurely two days...one day was fine as a taster but having got a taste for it we will definitely need to come back...well worth a visit, despite the crowds.

The world to see.. A place to visit and see the wonderful display of marine life and the life of a panda. The place carries one of the best Dolphin shows I have ever seen. If you go Hongkong and dont see Occean Park , your trip is not complete.

Amazing Park Must Go. I almost go every year and the park is just keep improving! no matter on the service, infrastructure, attraction points etc..and i know Hotels will be coming in next 5 years.As a local Amusement Park, Ocean Park really done a good job to stay entertainment to all the visitors and show new experience every time they come visit.Truly recommend!

A must visit attraction. The cable car ride was awesome with amazing viewsThe animal exhibits are nicely maintained and the animals look healthyGood variety of ridesEasy access to gift shopsBeautiful aquarium

A lifetime must-visit theme park on earth.
