Ocean Park is an awesome theme park offering you various unique experiences with thrilling rides, amazing Asian & polar animals like pandas & penguins respectively, special marine species such as sea jelly, as well as animal shows plus cable cars with specular sea views, kids world and old Hong Kong local icons & food..... there are surely lots for you to explore, a lot more than you can expect!

super the super, best thing in town. when you do Hong KOng and forget the ocean park, well, you did not go to HK. it is local, it is nice, it is clean, good food, affordable park prices, to see and do it all, this is work, almost. ha haA Zoo, a park, a cable cart ride, roaler coasters, fun rides, for kids and for adults - the aquarium is a wow!!!, polar bears in ice. you seen it once, you go back, was there in 1998 and many time onwards. The Hk rain can spoil the park fun, take care when you go
Fantastic park. We loved everything about the park. Gob smacked at the size and ease of the venue. Lots to see and do.

Great Day out. A great day out, too much to see in one day, quiet in the mornings but starts to get very busy about noon. The cable cars to the top of the park are a must, the train through the mountain is quicker, but the view is amazing from the cable car.

Brilliant theme park. I have been visiting Ocean Park for at least one time per year. Each year, the management of the park will add something extra to keep the park attractive. As such, the park is well maintained. There are so much to see and experience in ocean park. A day may not be enough to see all highlights of the park. It is highly recommended to watch the dolphin's show and see the different kinds of animals such as pandas, penguins, dolphins, sea seals and sea elephants. As the number of visitor has reached 7 million per year, please expect to have queues everywhere. You may need to wait for at least 30 mins for thrill rides or cable car transfer.To sum up, it is a park suitable for everyone from all ages and all walks of life.Enjoy!

Theme ParK plus Zoo!. Great day out. Get there early. Huge park on a hillside....lots of up and down walking. Lots to see and do and lots of stairs! Loads of rides but do expect lengthy wait times of 45 - 60 minutes throughout the main part of the day. Very little vegetarian food in the park other than fries or corn. Far more reasonable admission than Disney.

Ticketing. Hello All,I took my daughter to Ocean Park to relive some of the highlights of my childhood with one exception - THE QUEUE FOR THE TICKETS!!The queue was massive, more than an hour, at noon, under the Perspex roof with no fans (my daughter was the least fan around.....).After buying the tickets we noticed you can actually but tickets before going to OP at 7-11s, the 629 Bus Terminus at Admiralty & a few other places.Do it! It'll make the start of your OP Adventure much more fun

Excellent & Professional Theme Park. Very enjoy to visit the park but always feel the time gone very fast. Not enough time to visit all areas. Suggest well planning before visit, otherwise you feel lost. Recommend for family or adult vistor.
Ok. Great park with various attractions for all ages, recommended. Be aware that the park opens late and closes early and is huge so make a schedule early to get r in places you want to know before!

good family place. a good place for the young and old,even for the kids.It's a creative place showing how the old Hong Kong looks like,for the kids,there are big penguins,sealions and even can see dolphins in close view at the vet hospital inside the ocean park.While the youngster can play all the roller coasters etc there as well.estimated to spend a day there.No worries,there're food sold there as well.

Just go, there's something for all age and you won't regret. It's very well designed, lots to see, lots to play. Forget about Disneyland Hong Kong and just spend a day here. Try to avoid weekends though as locals also love the place and add to the tourist crowd on weekends.

There's something for everyone!. Ocean Park is one the highlights of my most recent Hong Kong trip. It definitely has something for everyone. The place is really big and there's so much to see. I specially love their Artic area and their big aquariums. Felt like a kid again running around the place amazed by the sea animals.I also enjoyed the cable car and tram ride that you can use to get to the other side of the mountain where the rides are (yes it's that big!). A little tip: You can buy good discounted price tickets from the tourism shop just before you exit Admirality station going to the bus stop for the Ocean Park. I think tickets are at 250 there compared to the 280 ones sold in the park itself plus there are no lines at all in here so you can go inside the park at once right when you arrive. :)

This is the play park of Hong Kong. The original place for a day out of exciting hardcore fun and getting there is another adventure. Everyone knows Ocean park and why dont you join the millions who love it so much they keep going back.

Glad to have returned. Being hometown resident we would normally skip typical touristic spots, for they are usually crowded, we have been there so many times and we know of other good places with less people.We went to Ocean Park in late Jun 2013 in order to make use of the complimentary tickets from a customer before expiry. It turned out to be a fantastic day. We had little expectation from the beginning as weather was not stable, and were prepared to get rain. The weather ended up helping a lot... the park was less crowded than usual because of the grey sky and we had little waiting time for most of the games. Less people also means less heat in the queues. We had to praise Ocean Park for revamping a lot since our last visit like 5 or 6 yearts ago. There had been major renovations and new paths paves, new stalls set up, new washrooms built, new covers for queues to sheild off rain or sunshine ... Our kids are a bit bigger at 8 and 11 already so we concentrated on the more exciting rides and roller coasters ... there are many thrilling rides which even adults would have second thought before going ... one is lliterally thrown around 1080C in mid-air and you don't know which side is up. We skipped a lot of the shows (e.g. dolphin & seal show, bird show, etc), aquariums (sharks, jelly fish, etc.), small kid area (as we have seen them millions of times when we still had the annual pass years ago). Only 2 we visited were the penguin house (which was new to us) and panda house (which we did not visit so often). We left after 4-5 hrs in the park. One needs to budget a full day here to try out all the rides, exhibitions, shows, game booths, etc.We went up the mountain using the new train which is much faster than traditional cable car. There is no view but one saves at least half an hour for the queue and extra walking. The train itself is also much faster. Nice video is played on the ceiling of the train all along so it is a nice experience. When going downhill we opted for the traditional cable car to enjoy full view of the park overlooking the shoreline.Parking lot has been revamped also to be a covered carpark. So we didn't have to suffer the heat accummulated inside the car when we got back into the car at the end of the day.

crowed with mainland visitors. Facilities are good and well maintained. Educational activities for children. Very crowded with visitors and tourists groups from mainland China. Can be extremely hot during summer.

Surprisingly good. I wouldn't normally join in to an amusement park, Disneyland etc i wouldn't normally bother with. But I went with my partner and her sister to ocean park and ended up being completely surprised having a great day. The rides are varied and great fun, the live animals are surprisingly well displayed and seem to be extremely well looked after and the live show at the end (symbio?) was far better than I expected. Get there early, by 10ish, to beat the queues and to make the most of the day. Avoid Sundays and if possible Saturdays and try to avoid school holidays.A surprisingly great way to spend a day in HK

fun and enjoyable for different ages. good enough for one whole day. clean, well kept. lots of activities, shows and games. considering the admission ticket price and what it offers, it is a bargain as a theme park. as it is quite big, may be a bit tiring for elderly. do it slowly. If going in summer, definately hot. Like most theme parks, quite a lot of visitors usually.Advice: go as early as possible; take the cable car or train to the farther part of the park first then you will make your day even more fun

Wet yet wonderful trip. It rained most of the time we were there but it was all worth it. The Pandas were sooooo cute !!! check the schedules so you wont miss a show. Cheaper souvenirs here than in Disney. The food is quite expensive and not much choices available.

One Day Visit to Ocean Park. If you are in Hong Kong and would like to visit a Theme Park, I would recommend Ocean Park over the other one (mouse mouse). Reason being that Ocean Park provides you a good view of Hong Kong when you take the cable car and it has different facilities for all ages to enjoy. It has a small facility park for 4 and below and obviously, there are other facilities who are for the dare devils. Also,there are many animals there for you to visit and you can spend a good part of the day there without getting bored. Highly recommended if you got a day to spare at a theme park.

Great for a family outing!. This is the perfect place to go with your friends or family, as long as you take precautions for any of the water rides! Be sure to go early in the morning, as that way you will be able to go on more rides! The dolphin and sea lion show is particularly spectacular, and definitely worth seeing! I would recommend you to arrive at the show arena up to 15mins before the show starts, as that way you can get a seat in the shade!

Very nice for kids!. They have a little bit of everything; the aquarium is the most interesting and beautiful thing they have. They have a very nice show with sea lions and dolphins and the rides are also very nice. If you have kids, they'll love it!!

Very good and well worth it. Good value for your family entertainment for the while day. Tip: you can get discounted ticket at China Travel Service (http://www.ctshk.com/english). Also you can pack your own lunch since the food inside is fairly expensive which is expected.

Wonderful place for the kids. Took my grandchildren here in June 2012 - very, very hot day, but still enjoyed it. Loved that there was only one fee and everything else was just queing. It is very well layed out and lots of space to sit and enjoy your own lunch.

One of the better places to spend your money and time in HK... Ocean Park is by no means huge, but for a small city like Hong Kong, it is as good as it gets. The management of the park is top notch and the rides are better and more exciting than Disneyland. Part of the attraction lies with the fact that they have educational shows with real animals... unlike the oversized rat and dog u get in Disneyland... Its located on the South Side of HK Island, reachable by public buses and minibuses (get these from the bus terminal below Exchange Square in Central) or a 15-20 mins cab ride from Central (around HKD 70-80). Disneyland is located on Lantau Island, the same island where the International airport sits.... it's a longer journey and not advisable if you are squeezed for time.
Excellent all ages. Lovely park to visit. Much more interesting than Disney. Lovely aquarium. You need half a day. A varied variety of amusement and the scenery on the way is spectacular.

Suitable for all ages. There are two theme parks in HK. But if u only have a day, I recommend u to go to Ocean Park. It provides different activities. For children, they can go to children areas. For Teenages or people love exciting things, ocean park have different games for u. For elderly, they can still watch different kinds of animals and watch dolphin shows. Ocean Park really worth u to come.

Cheaper than Disney but better than Disney! Panda at the park. Cable car bring you the scenic view of China Sea! Visit the ambassador of China - panda! The ticket is cheaper than the Disney. Enjoy the dolphin show!

Very overcrowded. I went in April and in July. On a normal weekday the park is bearable with not so many visitors, majority of visitors were tourists. But on a public holiday like I went on in July...it gets extremely overcrowded with tourists and locals, and with the heat, it's terrible. Queues for rides are an hour and the cable car queue is even more ridiculous. That aside...There are many things to see and do in Ocean Park for all ages. The penguins and pandas are the main must see attractions. The rides are pretty good, just avoid going in the summer/public holiday. We ate in the restaurant with a view of the shark aquarium, that was pretty good and not something you get to do everyday. Just be prepared for the heat and the crowds.

A popular gathering point for visitors from mainland China. The park is the home of four giant panda and other ocean creatures. In addition, visitors may take a ride of cable car uphill and ocean express downhill. It is a place full of fun and joy but very crowded no matter what time of the day, what day of the year. Be prepared to spare time for queuing. Anyway, it is an ideal amusement park.

my dearest lovely pandas. One of my favorable places in Hong Kong. It is a place full of memories of all Hong Kong Kids, including myself, I still enjoy visiting this amusement park even if I am an adult now. I like Ocean Park because I grow up with this amusement park. It gives me new inspiration and happiness for each visit, it is never old.
HK created Brand !. Anytime a lot of customers ! One word : Terrible .Quality of customers are show too low esp in queus and dining as well as in shopping area !
excellant park. like the park but i prefert to visit the park in autume or winter. it is not too many place to rest.
only in good weather. it's a nice place to spend a great day out with kids. a lot of funny rides,some really interesting shows,cute pandas to watch,bright flowers everywhere

Ocean Park. One of the best place to spend a day in HK with your family and friends. Definitely a great choice to enjoy the great weather in March and let off some stress from your daily routine life on some of the exciting rides.Don't forget to visit the kids' area and let them have some fun too... =)http://jbabiesdad.blogspot.sg/2013/03/hong-kong-4d3n-ocean-park.html

Great place. I went to OP by bus 629 from Admiralty. So many attractions there and i like the cable car. It was so great, i can see the ocean from above. There were panda, penguins, and sea creatures.

Best theme park. IT IS REALLY A GOOD PLACE TO GO!!! Rides are really spectacular and you won't want to miss even a single ride! Try all the rides especially the flash, the abyss, the hair raiser, and cable car! Really nice place. The animals are worth seeing too! Best show during 8:30 in the evening!!

A great theme park to visit in HK. Loved everything about this park Split into two with the sea theme and then by cable car or train to the adult roller coaster rideLots of places to eat, park was busy but not too bad staff very helpfulDon't miss it

Great for families. Seeing live animals was great along with the shows with sea animals (dolphins, sea lions).
We loved it

Value for money- Aquarium/Zoo and Theme Park combined. It's has a one of the best Aquarium i have seen having the full varieties of Sea Animals and a Well Stocked Aquarium. Add in the Panda, Dolphins Show and Seal feeding its worth visiting just for these things alone. The park is Super Huge and Spread Out, it will take your whole day. You will have to travel by Cable Car or a Metro from one end to another which is divided by mountain. Both rides are awesome and you don't feel like its a waste of time. You will get amazing views to look at from the mountain top and the cable car.The rides look awesome and terrifying but are Not So. I got shivers looking at them but the actual ride were not that thrilling. May be they don't give the extra push as i saw kids being allowed on most of them.The lines for the rides are extremely long with waiting time of 30 minutes but after 6 pm you can get a ride within 5 minutes. Felt most of the rides were understaffed , with just 1-3 people managing a attraction. The Food and Drinks are expensive but still cheaper then Disney Land and the entry tickets are half priced(220 HK$). Get the tickets from travel agents at Admiralty Bus Pickup.I actually enjoyed the Marin- Animal Exhibits more then the Ride's.

Zoo/ aquarium and theme park all in one. Very enjoyable day at Ocean Park. We took the bus from the Central/Hong Kong MTR station - about a 30 minute ride. Long line to purchase the ticket at the entrance (this was at about 10:00 AM) You can buy tickets online but we didn't since we didn't have a printer while traveling.The best parts of the lower level were the pandas, the aquarium, and the Sea Lion show. The bird show was fun but short, and was very hot with the sun overhead. We stopped by the pandas multiple times because the first time they were both almost out of sight sleeping, but later were very active.The train to the upper level had less of a wait than the cable car, but was pretty packed, so its kind of a toss up as to which would have been better.The "rain forest" raft ride on the upper level was a great way to cool off, but plan on getting very wet - if the ride doesn't do it by itself, there are water cannons overlooking the ride that guests can use to spray you. Upper level had more rides than the lower level - nothing extreme like a Six Flags, more like at a Disney park. The combined dolphin / sea lion show was pretty good. The North and South Pole areas were another great way to cool off in the afternoon, as well as see penguins, seals, and walrus.We ate at one of the restaurants on the upper level - nothing spectacular, but not as overpriced as at a U.S. theme park, and it had a great view. Hong Kong lines up a ton of city buses outside Ocean Park around closing time, so no issues getting back. Be aware that the return buses at closing don't go back to the central station - they drop everyone off at Admiralty station, so have a plan to get back to your hotel, etc form there. All in all a must with kids but don't discount it if you are just traveling with adults. We had a great day there.

Odd but interesting. We went on a whim to Ocean Park to see the pandas, and not knowing much more about the attraction, planned only to spend about 30 minutes there. However, when there, we found the "other side" of the park which included pretty fantastic rides and one of the best aquariums I've ever been to. We stayed the majority of the day and had a FANTASTIC time! It's sort of like Six Flags and Sea World in one.

Wait until the kids are at least 12 years-old.. We went to Ocean Park for the rides. My daughter was tall enough...but not old enough (had to be 12) for at least one of the rides. We also visited Disneyland which was much better for the younger kids.

i loved the pandas. brilliant a zoo and theme park in one!! loved and adored the pandas they were amazing- lots of queues for food - theme park fun - a great day out with something for kids and adults
WOW. One of the best theme parks i have visited in my life. I was hoping to get a chance of riding more attractions however, rain was on the way and lasted for more than one hour

Symbio was spectacular!. Went there late afternoon as we got lost on our way! :DAnyways, we arrived around 4pm and still the place still packed with tourist though most of them are in the exit area already. The park wasn't that crowded already, went inside the oceanarium and was amazed with the species inside. The spider crab with very long legs, it was really huge. big kois, and other species I can't remember. We didn't have the chance to see the panda as it was sleeping when we went there. Better go there earlier if you are with kids as for sure they would really ride all the free rides and also bring extra clothing for your kids as some of the games there require them to get wet.
WOW!. Better visit this place early.. as it gets packed quickly... The Cable Car is scarier than the NGONG PING... as it is small... (T T)

Mix of attractions. We visited here not knowing quite what to expect. On entering, we saw a bright, attractive, busy centre and, as the Aquarium was immediately in sight, our first impressions were that it would be mainly an educational experience. We soon realised that it’s equally a place for rides.Apart from the Aquarium, where there was a clear message about conservation and protection of wildlife, the educational attractions we visited were the South Pole, the North Pole, the Panda Exhibit, and Old Hong Kong. I’m not sure how much young people gain from exhibits such as these; most seemed to be running from one window or viewpoint to the next without reading the labels and signs (or having someone explain them). We missed the bird show and the seals performing on stage, but just as well, as I’m not a fan of performing animals. We appreciated the Ocean Express – a train disguised as a submarine - which offers an alternative to the chair lift for moving between the two main park levels. Very clever! Although we didn’t use the chair lift, I can see that it would offer splendid views of the Park and surrounding areas. It would be worth the ride to put parts of Hong Kong Island into perspective.On the very hot Friday we were there, we had no trouble with long queues for what we wanted to see. It was impossible to buy a cup of tea or coffee for a reasonable price. The café at the entrance was offering one cup of tea – I assume it was made with a tea bag – for about AUS$6! Sorry! No sale!The system of buses at the exit is very well organised. Huge crowds were dealt with quickly and we were on our way with little waiting.In summary: There’s something to please everyone. You’ll find zoo-type attractions (fish and aquatic animals, mammals, birds); performing animals (just like a circus); rides galore; and Old Hong Kong, an outdoor museum exhibit.

Spoilt by the crowds. We have lived in Asia for 2 years and are used to crowds, however there were far too many people let into the park and it spoilt it for all. The queues are too long, the people are pushy and rude and the staff have a hard job managing the volume of people.Many of the staff also didn't help lines to move fast either - the guys at the bumper cars worked so slow we thought they were just trying to annoy us all!. We gave up on a number of rides as the kids were being pushed by other people due to the over crowding. Management should reduce the number of people allowed in - even if it meant putting up the price.We also thought the shows were very poor and not up to the standard we expected. Most of it had limited or no English (or English you couldn't understand!)We would not consider going again - which is a shame as I think the park has so much potential... Now too many people and a victim of its own success??On the positive side, the food at Terrace Cafe was good (although not cheap) and the bus transport from the Admiralty MTR to the park was easy.

The theme park with something for everybody. I been to Ocean Park many times over the years. I remember it well from my childhood. I fondly remember the water and Ancient China spin-offs that opened and closed back on the eighties. There aren't many local HK people that have never been here. Many came when Ocean Park was a park with a few rides and had a cable car facility. Now they bring their children and grandchildren here. I've personally have grown out of the rides, but I love the aquarium, the pandas and this fabulous place where they have on display, many breeds of goldfish. No visit is complete without a ride on the cable car.

Long lines. Worth a visit, but be prepared to wait. Get there before the doors open at 10AM and head straight for the gondolas that take you up to the rides. Get a few rides in before the lines get too long. We waited 1.5 hrs for the log ride. The restaurants are packed -- you'll find people pushing up to the front to get a number during lunch time. There are some fast food options, but not much and still expensive. Crowds taper off in the late afternoon and lines for the rides are almost gone.

Long ride lines but lots of fun. Make sure you allocate a whole day for Ocean Park and be prepared to wait in line for 45minutes for some rides. Also lots of walking as the park is very spread out and there are some parts that are downhill and you have to walk a good 10-15minutes to get back up. We didn't get there until about 11:30 and was very, very busy at that time. Being in the middle of summer too, it was very sunny and felt like about 40degrees c. Had been to Disneyland the day before and while there are only a few big rides at Disneyland, Ocean Park has MANY and is about half the price for admission. Don't forget sunscreen, water and pack snacks!

Too good. I visited Ocean Park Hong Kong on 8th July 2013 with my family. My draughts 15 and 11, and my son 4 had a blast. These is something for everyone at this park. The location is exotic and the park is so very nicely laid out. Don't miss the roller coaster Hair Raiser as it is really awesome. The sea lion show and the dolphin shows are great and a must. You may not miss much if you can't see birds show, as it is not very special. The water slides right at the entrance is fun for kids. Cable car is a sure 12 to 15 min ride beside ocean and gives a very nice view of the ocean and the mountain. The park is split between two halves and the attractions are also split almost equally. D get a map and show timings to plan what to do and be where at what time. There is a nice chain of restaurants at the mountain side where u can eat what ever u want. The rides, free fall tower, panaromic view tower are good and highly recommended. A must if you are in Hong Kong.

My city. This is the place I have been many times, it is also an icon of Hong Kong.I should say Ocean Park is divided into 2 main themes, Animal and Rides.You could see so many kind of animals in there like Panda, Penguin, Seals, etc. Extremely interesting for kids.For Rides, not many places in the world can enjoy nice Oceanic view during the Rides!!Great place to go and see how local theme park beat Disneyland.
Worth it for the Pandas!. Ocean Park is a great place to enjoy during your Hong Kong stay.Great shows, great rides, sunning views and the amazing Pandas!
Thrilling Rides..!!!. Amazing place. Very neat & clean unlike Genting in Kuala Lumpur. The rides are really thrilling & enjoyable.The Dolphin show was very good.

Nice park invaded by rude mainland chinese tourists. Ocean park is a Hong Kong landmark. I grew up visiting since I was young. Every year I would take my children to the park and make sure they love it like I do. This year is the worst ever. I can understand why Ocean Park needs to raise its admission fees in September 2013. They have to keep away those cheap mainland chinese tours and high cost of maintenance. We went to the park yesterday with 2 young children. We experienced at least 4 mainland chinese families tried to cut in line in front of us. Either waiting in line for rides or just waiting for the train to open the door. They would dragged their kids to cut in front of people. They have no shame at all. Even my 7 years old asked me what's wrong with those people. Another case, there was this mother let her son pee on a very busy path. There are bathrooms everywhere in the park and no lines at all. We actually felt sorry for the little boy at that time. We were just speechless!!!I think we will just stay with Disneyland next time.

Family adventure.... Nice place to visit, one day is not enough go around the park, you must be there early so you can enjoy all the rides and adventures. Bring extra batteries for your cameras... Stay till closing time to watch the beautiful lights and the fireworks...

Not that great. with a 2 yr old and 4 yr old not that great. We went on a roasting hot day, we got very wet which was good, Queues weren't great. Not that there were many rides for them.Felt sorry for the animals, conditions aren't that great in comparison to Australian Zoos. People that are going on the rides are so hyped up that they aren't calm enough in my opinion to be seeing animals. We had Lunch in the aquarium restaurant which was beautiful food and on the pricey side. Great to sit and see the aquarium but you also have to put up with screaming of people viewing the aquarium down stairs. Why scream??? I really don't understand.We were massively disappointed for our four year old who could not go on a ride we thought we could accompany him on. We couldn't understand why??Anyway we knew going into it that it wasn't really a place for young kids but here for 2 weeks so had a day to kill. They enjoyed the little kid area but it was a bit lame. We are hoping Disney will be better for our kids age group.Was really impressed with the disability access and facilities.
Adventure land. good place to spend your entire day, its not only a zoo but also an amusement park. the entrance fee was totally worth it. For kids, family, teens

It's more than just fishes. At first thought Ocean Park is just like huge aquarium and that's it...Didn't know that it will be a huge theme park, and great rides for all the adults and kids..you have to ride the train inside yes they have it and they also have a cable car inside just to get to the other side of the park...In case you're going during the summer season, make sure to bring an umbrella.. because it will be really really hot... not much shed and airconditioned place you can hang around
Best theme Park ever visited. Best things:South PoleNorth Pole.Ragging river.Panda.Old Hongkong.Cable car.EconomicalCons:Too crowded on weekdays also.Food

Nice themepark/zoo. A nice place to spend a day. Nice rides, some pretty wild ones. Same park also has animals (seals, penguins, pandas, jelly fish...). Beautiful area, take the gondolas over the mountains both ways to enjoy the spectacular views. Prices are reasonable

Great theme park. Admission is basically all inclusive. Aquarium is small but it has a lot of variety of species. Very educational yet fun with many different rides. Got to take the cable car. What I disliked is the park is always crowded.

Great value. We spent a fun filled day here. Our teenagers loved the rides and the other attractions. Very reasonably priced and well maintained, with great views from just about very vantage point. Defintitely worth a visit if you have older children.

A cutest panda home. Ocean Park i miss you baby. Ya its great pleasure to watch this beautiful creation. All things are so natural and systemic. Nice entrance with big statue.A nice souvenir shop with variety of show pieces made with stone or marble like Buddha image/statue, dragon, and many others species.So many decorative iteam that you cannot turn over your eyes.A acrobat place where you can see many item along with singing and dancing. So many food court as per your choice, vending machine,So many rides you can enjoy. A big lake with orchid garden where live birds are standing, nice gold fish with different shape and color are so peaceful. People work there with wearing there traditional dress which is very amazing to watch. Foods are also awesome. A big tower to watch full site. Butterfly home, Dinosaurs zone, nice seat all over for relaxation. A long distance cable car ride to enter in the Panda's home. Ya they are big cutest and so dear-able to watch.They are busy with the bamboo tree. The cable ride is excellent to watch the hill and ocean side by side with green and blue all over. I cannot forget any moment just thinking to join with them again and soon. Love you ocean park

Fun! Fun! Fun!. Many changes in Ocean Park. The public swimming area is no longer there :(! Either way, Ocean park remains as a very good destination for any tourists seeking thrills! Roller coaster rides are the best..:-)

A bit more than just theme park!. Didn't have that much expectation, after hearing it was apyet another theme park. But now I say that .i would have cursed my luck, had I not been in there. Boy! What a place! And such a great and well demarcated prominence for both animal/marine displays and rides alike. Loved the cable car, had to wait for half an hour in the line though! We ended up taking the Ocean Express train ride, that's an alternative to cable car, atleast 5 times and that was a unique experience too. Among the anmal displays, my favourite was that of the polar region. Haven't seen such healthy dolphins in any of the Asian aquariums I've been to.

Wholesome, family, entertainment!. As the name suggests, Ocean Park is a theme park mostly focused on the aquatic life. Starting from a musical fountain at the entrance to the gold fish exhibits to the sea lion show to the arctic exhibits, this place has a whole lot of things that will keep the children enthralled! However, in order to make the trip more memorable, they have also added pandas and birds to the collection, thus completing the water-air-land triad!They also have a decent amusement park (with roller coasters, ferris wheels, etc.), a cable car, a train and a replica of old Hong Kong within the complex!Families should definitely spend one full day at the park to let the kids enjoy all the exhibits and the rides. There are ample dining options inside the park. A good umbrella, sun screen and a hat are a must as the weather can alter between hot and rainy during your trip.Ocean Park is, undoubtedly, a must-see attraction for all tourists to Hong Kong!

Not good for smaller kids. We visited here last week with our 2 children 7 and 4. This place would be fantastic if you had older kids or were visiting as adults however for young children they were very very limited in what they could do. They did not meet the height requirements on almost every ride which was disappointing and frustrating to them. There were a few rides which we were confused as to why they couldn't go on. The park is very spread out so it takes time to travel from each world to the next making it impossible to see everything. With the lines on each ride and the time it takes to get around you will definitely need a whole day. We ate at the bay view cafe which was terrible. The food was expensive and horrible, cold and was as if the food had been sitting for days and recooked several times. Even the chips were so over cooked that there was no potato left inside - don't eat here - yuk! The buses at the end of the night were amazingly organised. After the lighting display and the close of the park there were buses lined up and it was no trouble getting out of there. So overall, don't bother with small kids - its just not worth it however for adults and older kids I'm sure this would be a massive hit. There is no shortage of rides and things to do providing you meet the height requirements.

Attractive theme park with various amusements. Ocean park Hongkong is more than just an ocean theme park...it;s actually serving so many rides and experience. You can watch ocean habitats, dolphin stage, ride a submarine, cable car, raftings,in one theme park....it's worth the money you pay for compare to Disneyland....

Fantastic. It's a must do.. We visited Ocean Park on a Monday. The park was not too crowded so the waiting times were never over 30min, except the log ride, where we queued for almost an hour. The rides were great. As a family we rated the Hair Raiser, Flash, the Dragon and the Mine Train the best. For kids note the height restrictions to avoid disappointment. The Hair Raiser is 140mm. If you are tight on time maybe give the Raging River and Bumper Blaster a miss. The Polar Adventure superb. Loved the Dolphins. Unfortunately ran out of time and didnt make it to the Pandas this time. The park has improved a lot since we visited a few years ago.

Sanctuary. for marine enthusiast like me this place is a sanctuaryFrom dolphins to penguin, they got them alli suggest to visit ocean park for at least 5 hours as there are a lot to seedon't miss the dolphin show in ocean theater its very entertainingNorth and south pole is also a must visit place the penguins are just unbearably cutethe only thing i hate from this place is englishi am fairly tickled by the amounts of the staff who doesnt speak englishhalf of the visitor came from outside hong and non mandarin speakerso hiring a bilingual staff would be a no brainerbut sadly the more and more i ask the staff for help the more i found out that most of them doesn't speak english

A zoo and an amusement park all in one. Perfect!. This place has quite some history, because of Old Hong Kong, with the whole atmosphere excataly the same as HK in the 60s. The animals were great, since it was like a zoo. Certain places would be more crowded though. This is one of the two places in HK where you can ride a cable car. There are long lines for that though, also for the other rides. I also highly recommend that you take the ocean express, since it is air conditioned and faster that the cable car to get to the other part of the park. As maybe some of the other reviewers have said, there are long walks. There are lots of different games you can play, but the quality is not that good. Take the bumper cars for instance. I waited for 30 minutes for the ride, but the game only lasted for 3 minutes and the cats were really slow. The only way you can go is when other people bump into you. The also let a lot of people in at the same time, so it was too crowded. The are quality good games, and those are the games where you need to pay to play. You might win a plush, or walk away losing $25-50 HKD. The food though is really good, and food all around the world can be served. There is lots of different food in the restaurant above the terrace cafe. The restaurant is called the Bayview Restaurant. It used to have jellyfish in a glass window so you can eat with the jellyfish, but they disappeared. The restaurant is like a buffet style, except you pay at the end, like a school cafeteria. Ocean park is rich with history, and it already opened for more than 30 years. I like it because of its fun games like the chair swing. I would rate it 8/10

A great full day, worth the money.. Ocean Park was really a great day out in Hong Kong. You need to make sure you get there as soon as it opens and plan to stay until it closes. There is plenty to do and see with a number of great shows and attractions. I love rides but didn't even have time to do any rides by the time we went to all the different parts of the park and watched a few of the shows. I suggest you plan your day well in advance, check on the internet for the times of the various shows and have a look at the layout of the park and plan you day around the shows, looking at the exhibits in between the shows. Great staff, great shows, and great exhibits.

Great Fun, Good rides. Visited Ocean park recently, had a great day in the sun. Very big park with loads of great attractions. Only downside i can think of, was that it was extremely busy, and i visited the park on a Thursday in the heat of a Hong Kong Summer. Cable car ride, was gorgeous with great views over the park itself and the ocean and outlying islands. Excellent rollercoasters, especially the Hair Raiser. Blisteringly quick! Animal exhibits were ok, but the polar one with the seals and walruses was good, and nice and cool to get out of the heat! A good day out with fun in the sun.

This place is awesome ..... This place is fantastic. Much better than Disneyland. The park is in a beautiful location and as stated in all reviews there is a lot of walking. The rides are fantastic and there's a lot if them. Animals and shows are great . If there is a cue at the cable cars to go up the mountain, I suggest taking the train to the top of the mountain and riding the empty cable cars down, then take the train back up - it saves you waiting in ques. Take a change of clothes so that you can enjoy Neon Splash- water gun fight attraction- in the afternoon. It cools you down and is a lot of fun for all ages. Loved this place and can't say enough about it.

Great day out!. What a day. First tip, go early. Following reviewing a previous review we headed for the summit first. Skip the cable cars and travel up via the train, the wait for the cars was 45 minutes and 5 for the train. You can always take the cable car back down. There was no queue when we left. We travelled with a 20 and 17 year old, they went on all the roller coasters and " wet" rides. The maximum wait was 20 minutes. Better than Disneyland, where waits can be up to an hour per ride. Suggestions.....pack sunscreen, water, comfy shoes (you walk miles) and a small towel. In july we sweated, it was so......hot!. Drinks aren't too dear but the food is only ok (like most theme parks) After riding on most of the rides we headed back to the lower section, by this time we were hot and exhausted as we're the Pandas, who we couldn't view, as they were asleep near their pens :( , don't blame them. We only viewed a small portion of the lower section but had a wonderful day. This is a better park to visit with teenagers than Disneyland.

Love the pandas. Hate the crowds!. Okay to be fair it was Chinese New Year, but honestly I have felt so overwhelmed by all the pushing and shoving (just plain rudeness of some tourists). That said the people of Hong Kong are fabulous, and polite. They handled the sea of tourists well under the circumstances. As for the part, it is beautiful, clean, well-organized and has some absolutely fabulous views of Hong Kong, the mountains and the sea. The free gondola ride was simply fantastic. I'd go back in a second. Food, not so much.. What's with those "squid kebabs"!!
Pandas and fun for the kids. The pandas are an attraction and all the other things too. Again the cable car is a hit with the kids. Busy but bearable.

Great place. Stupid tourists.. I went there mainly for the animal attractions. And to this end it is a massively amazing place. It has a superb aquatic center with very beautiful fish. The set up is clearly thought out very well. There's also a very well maintained arctic center where one can see the walrus, sea lions, etc. There's also a Panda section and well, a lot to see. What's appalling is that 99% of the tourists are not able to follow instructions. They use their camera flashes when signs explicitly say "NO FLASHES", and they bang on the glass scaring the fish just to see them move. They can't queue up. And they yell at anyone who's in their way. So, my animal experience was great. But the people around made it very unbearable. I'm not perfect, but I think we all can try to be a bit more civilised.

Family's Ocean Park Adventure. The family enjoyed the cable car ride, merry go round for my 7-year old daughter, bumper blaster for my husband and two daughters and of course the show at Ocean theater, we adore the dolphins and sea lions..they were all amazing!It was so unfortunate though that at around 2pm of April 30, 2013, while planning to board the hair raiser, heavy rains with winds hindered us to do so. Instead, the family head home at Panda Hotel but the city traffic was terrible due to the heavy downpour.

average theme park. when this place on 2nd july..this theme park are mainly for kids not adrenaline junkie.. the most thrill ride "the hair raiser".. other just so-so...me and my friends felt like conned by the advertisement.. since i went there on tuesday, so the place not so pack with people, so the queue also not that long but there's still got people cut the queue..the main reason we went there are for the rides but the rides are disappointing.. we spent some time at north& south pole area to watch penguin and seal..it was great to be in there bcoz it's cold while the weather outside very hot (summer time).. there's no halal food for muslim.. the map kinda confusing for me..we dint go to the aquarium.. there's plenty souvenir shop..i will not come back to this theme park..

Need more time. Good theme park.. for 280$/pax, this park is quite accessible for everybody. There are 2 problems though, I don't think you can enjoy all the facilities in one day, it's simply too many and too long queue. The 2nd problem is the HK weather was quite unpredictable. When we entered the park, it was so hot and sunny. But in 2-3 hours, we had several light to medium rains. So, umbrella and rain coat are a must if you don't want to get held by the rain.

We visit Ocean Park every year. Note that starting the end of June, they have Summer Splash. So if you would like to get wet, bring a change of clothes with you.We didn't, but my daughter still joined the water fun. The day was hot and humid when we went, so even though she was wet after a water gun fun time, she didn't feel cold. She just stayed in her wet clothes for the rest of the time that we were in the park.I went with 2 teen girls, they both have been to the park many times. Their main goal this visit was the rides. So we went there right after we enter the park. Park open at 10, and we were at the rides around 10:15.They did Rev Rooster first and the line was only 15 minutes. After that they rode the Hair raiser, and that line was 20 min. After they were done with Hair Raiser, the new line was 45 min.So, if you want rides, get their early and do those first.Near the Hair raiser roller coaster, there is North pole and South Pole exhibit, and there is a Snow Fox show room.Most people know about the dolphine show, but there are also otter show-- we usually see the 2:15 show, and sea lion show.When we were there, there was a dancing show near the Panda show room.Ocean Park seems to have something new every year that we visit there.Food and drink in the park are quite expensive.

Fantastic Ocean Park. Very beautiful huge park at seaside of Hong-Kong island. Big zoo with wide range of animals.White bears pavilion is very big and very cold inside. Aquarim is very big. Panda pavilion. Birds pavilion. Also there are many amusement entertainment attractions for children and adults. Cable car over ocean with great views. One day is not enough to see all.

Lots to do. But avoid on holidays and weekends.. Its got a lot, perhaps a little too much to do. You would never be able to cover each and everything in one day. It is certainly value for money with lot of thrill rides, some simpler ones for the little ones and the giant aquariums, pandas and penguins. But my only problem with Ocean park was that I went on a public holiday and it was soo crowded thst I hardly did 5-6 rides and I was a single rider. The average waiting time for each attraction was 45 mins which was a killer. And I think there is a scope for bettet crowd management since they were sendind the cable cars etcwith just single people or couples which could otherwise accomodate 4-5 ppl. Crowd management was better at Disney land.

Ocean Park is GREAT!. To get there, take an MTR to Admiralty MTR station and follow the signs that lead you to the bus heading to ocean park. The bus is very frequent and there are MANY buses to and from there. No worries about long queues/wait for the bus. What you must note that the bus journey is quite a distance and you should secure a seat. Its a fixed price of HKD10.60 one way, and payable by Octopus card.Contrary to many advice given that you should buy your Ocean Park tickets at the MTR station, I did not find any travel agent selling except the official booth by them selling tickets at the standard price and the queue was long. It is suggested that you buy the tickets from your hotel and sometimes they sell it at a cheaper price (Probably cause they bought in bulk earlier before the price rose) and you avoid the queue at the bus interchange and at the entrance.I went there on a Thursday and reached there some time after the opening. Although I was there later than the opening time, the queue for the cable car was considered short and quick, I waited only about 20-30minutes. I headed straight for the cable car to go to the summit. This is suggested as the summit was less crowded. If you're a thrill seeker you should quickly head to all the thrilling rides as they are usually empty and you get to ride immediately. If not, you can cover the area at your own pace, it isnt very very crowded that you have to wait hours for a ride.The longest waiting time I had was for the cable car, the arctic blast and probably whirly bird. Non-thrilling rides tend to be more crowded.You should cover the summit before 1-2pm because that is when the mainland tour groups start arriving and the summit gets VERY VERY crowded. I would say the rides are sparesly located and alot of walking is required. Especially on the summit at where the mine trains are. It is an isolated section by itself, so ride till you're satisfied and be done and don't go back. Cause its a LONG walk there :xI must say, Ocean Park has better rides than Disneyland (Never been to the HK one but from the looks of the website, there arent many rides) and it doubles as a zoo/aquarium! Its like getting the best of both worlds.Unlike what other people, who usually leave at around 4pm, I finished at 6pm after taking most rides and seeing most exhibits.Overall, the whole park is done up very nicely and looks very new and colourful!

I loved it and wished we'd had a kid with us!. The Ocean Park was fantastic. Sort of.The down side - very unhappy looking Pandas - I don't know how much they were enjoying their captivity. I always feel that way when animals are in enclosures though. Strangely, I am much less concerned for marine creatures and LOVED the aquarium. The octopus and I had a love affair through the glass, the jellyfish were like disco balls and the sharks were hammer heads which always look great sailing by above you.Every exhibit had interesting facts displayed about them and the focus was very much on conservation.The dolphin show was actually very good as those things go - amid all the somersaults and acrobatics there was a genuinely moving story again focusing on the importance of taking care of marine animals.And in order to get from the aquarium level of the park UP, UP, UP to where the dolphins are (as well as the rides and the view) you can catch a cable car or a train. TAKE THE TRAIN!No offence to the cable car - I'm sure the view is amazing - but the train is full Jules Verne style adventure! We got attacked by a giant squid and saw a volcano erupt. It's low tech video effects projected on the roof of the train cars but the train itself is exactly what you would imagine The Nautilus was like and little kids loved it. Very cool (in a nerdy way).

Nice!. -Amazing Parks-Fun with friends-Animals: Panda, penguins, ...octopus....ocean animals-Bring snacks...-Not recommended for little children or sick/ pregnant ladies-In September it was cloudy but hot-You need half a day

Choose over Hong Kong Disney if you have children 10 or over!. We went to Ocean Park the day after we went to Hong Kong Disney. The price of the ticket is more than worth it! Part amusement park, part water park with many great ocean animal attractions. We expected it to be crowded with long wait lines but it was one of the most fun days we have spend as a family in a long time. Great roller coasters and don't miss the animal exhibits! If you go, don't forget to get one of the frozen fruit skewers......yum!

'Two thumbs up'. With less crowds like the Disneyland, you can easily enjoy more rides here. The surrounding and views are wonderful especially on the island side. 'Two thumbs up!'Small time-saver tips:- more people getting the cable car to the island instead of from the island. So get the train first and come back with the cable car. -The big aquarium will close last,so dont waste more time here at the beginning. -Dont think that you can manage to catch 2 different shows from this 2 different parks within 30min interval.-Moving in & out continuosly to the island is a waste of time, So enjoy with the 1st Park (skip on the big aquarium) and move to Island Park. Last one to the Big Aquarium.-830 pm - firework in front of Big Aquarium.

Extremely hot in August and queues worse than Disney California. We wouldn't recommend going here in August as it is just too hot. Our children asked to leave after a couple of hours which is unheard of in our family !!!! It was unbearably hot and the queues for some rides were over one and a half hours. Some good rides but a long way to go to feel hot and tired.

Great place to spend a day. Its a very Huge park and there are many rides all over the park. The Park is very Huge and so it needs a lot of walking which can be very tiring if its sunny and humid. The Park is also over the hilly area where the walk to the top is a very tiring one. Over all if you need to spend a day with family, friends and kids its a place to be.
big lines and less fun. We will have to stand in a line for an hour and then the number comes and also very unfriendly staff always tries to take pics for money
Oh my gosh. We had a wonderful time here, even got my husband to go on the roller coaster, we had a absolute blast at this place well worth the money to get in, would go again in a heatbeat.

Family fun. Went to Ocean Park with the family in summer 2012, lots of attractions and things to see. A must do if you're going to Hong Kong! Definitely worth the price. I rated it a 4 only because I'm more of a disney park person.

Amazing park! Lots to do for all ages.. I really enjoyed my visit to Ocean Park! The park is located in beautiful surroundings with ocean all around it. I would recommend getting there for opening time (10am) to make the most of the park. At the start of the day the queue for the cable car will be quite long so I recommend taking the Ocean Park express which is opposite the cable cars, this is a short metro like ride up the mountain to the top and has a large capacity. The ride features a little show inside with screens showing different types of fish and so on.At the top of the mountain there is plenty to do including the roller coasters, rides and various aquariums. The jellyfish aquarium is really good and one not to be missed. The Sea Dreams show was also great fun although it gets very full quick, so arrive around 30 minutes before the show. The north and south pole exhibits were also a highlight, although very cold inside, be prepared!At the bottom of the mountain (I took the cable car down around 3pm and the queue was only 15 minutes) you can visit the two giant panda exhibits, they were active whilst I was there which was good! There is also a sea lion show down there as well as the Grand Aquarium which is definitely worth visiting, the main tank is quite a sight. There is also a big range of rides that little children can ride in this area.The best way to get to the park is to get to the Admiralty MTR station and then you can buy your park ticket and bus ticket together. You want to go to exit B, although it is well sign posted in the station. The buses run back and forth all day and not to 4pm as their website says. They are also building a MTR station right outside the park but I think it will be a while until it is complete.

Fabulous views, clean park, some great rides. We had a clear day (which, admittedly, can be rare in Hong Kong) and the views from this park were just unbelievable. We took the train to gete to the top because we had heard that the wait for the cable car could be over an hour long. With the new "Hair Raiser" coaster, there were some great rides for the teenagers. Park was pretty clean. We ate at the "Bayview" restaurant for lunch - again, great views. Food was very good, if a little on the pricy side. We also went on a Wednesday, so we weren't dealing with the weekend / holiday crowds. Longest wait was for a water ride because it was extremely hot by the afternoon. Positives: not crowded on a weekday, clean, good rides, good food, good value price for ticketsNegatives: layout of park will have you doing alot of walking / backtracking since there are alot of areas where you "can't get there from here". If you find yourself in "Adventure Land", it will take a good while to hike back out. Favorite rides: Hair Raiser; The Dragon; The Abyss; Mine Train; The Flash (disclaimer - 14 and 16-year old teenage boys...)
Ok. Please check out the weather before visiting, buying online ticket is a good idea to avoid a long line

Improve frequency of cable car trips, crowd control in some aquarium viewing... it will be much more attractive. Value for $$?? Certainly. Relatively cheaper for a family oriented theme park although it can't be compared to world renowned ones like Disneyland within that region.Walkway coverages are scarce and sheltered resting areas are often crowded by meal hunters and tour group congregations. Esp if one visits on a hot day or met unexpected rain.Prices for food & beverages could possibly be lowered as a measure of being just "Ocean Park".... Yes its TOO PRICEY.Hats, umbrellas, sunblocks whatever that can shelter you from the merciless sun or rain is definitely a must. Bring or buy lots of water and/or beveragesfrom the bus terminal (@Admiral Stn) before entering.Old Hong Kong Street food kiosk are decent, its tasty despite the prices. The rides are met with snaking queues and a no-go standing under the sun doing so esp. with kids.The north/south pole exhibits are in my view very well displayed. The timings for shows and feeding/ trainer talks for both waterfront & summit are very tight. Do plan your itineary before going esp. with small kids. Whisker theatre shows meant for kids is definitely not worth the time. Was met with quite a disastrous display for the bird shows with most birds not responding according to the scripts!!! *yawn*.However, with shortage of manpower (too obvious) one can't complain too much for the entrance fee. A good 6-7hrs with kids. Symbio at end of the day is a thumbs up from me.

A classic theme park, renewed. This theme park has been a favourite of mine as I've grown up in Hong Kong.The theme park is cheaper to enter than HK Disneyland, but it's not as action packed or new.The park has been updated and expanded over the years, but some rides need a little touch up to give it that 'zing' it had years ago. However saying this, this attraction is not boring.You'll find it to be one of the few theme parks out there that is built on a cliff. This provides excellent views on some crazy roller coasters. Recommended to go for the scenery and the surprisingly large number of attractions to enjoy.

Something fun for the everyone in a beautiful location. Ocean Park is a great day activity in Hong Kong. It has rides and roller coasters for thrill seekers as well as a zoo and aquarium for the less adventurous. The amusement park itself is on a peninsula right by the sea which is a gorgeous location which you can admire throughout the park.

Fantastic day out. I visited the park alone and was advised to go early, first attraction was the cable car and this was fantastic, so I repeated it 3 times during the day and the longest I waited was 30 minutes late afternoon , I'm not one for going on fast white knuckle rides but there was plenty to do . I stayed for 7 hours and didn't see everything , if you have time this park is a must .the Dolphin show was great and it gavel time to sit as the park is large but there's plenty of signs to help you . Food and drink is a little more but that goes for all these parks where ever you are

A nice funny wet day. Ocean Park is huge, spread over two hills . It is one of the best theme parks in the Asia with amazing roller coasters and other rides. One who loves rides and animals cannot give it a miss. We visited it on a rainy day, and we were amazed to find thousands and thousands of visitors even on that rain soaked day. Avoid going on the weekends due to the excessive crowd and queuing up hassles.A must visit family place in Hong kong!!
Better value for older children than Disneyland.. Our 10 year olds had a great day with the rides and seeing the pandas. Perfect location. We went early to escape the crowds and heat.

not bad/not great, do it if you have time. Lot of animals to see, however the dolphin show wasn't that good because the dolphins were not doing what they were supposed to do. Beware that the fun park attractions are closing earlier than the park and you can almost not notice that from the map.

Lovely. Check out the aquariums as there are a lot of different species of fish here and they have gone to the trouble of making some great viewing areas for interaction with the exhibits. Then after all this head over the mountain...

Dolphin Show is nice. I went with my family, my children enjoyed the dolphin show very much. We did not able to enjoy the most of the other ride because my children are too young and not tall enough to make it into the rides. I think the adult and older children would be able to enjoy this park very much but not for the younger children because the park has very few things for young children to do.

Amusement park to enjoy a variety thing... C1 ( 2013.06.21 ) I could knew why Hong Kong people love this park, after visiting there. There was divided into two area, I could go to another area by cable car or train. There was broader than I think, and a lot activities. Aquarium, Panda pavilion, dolphin show, experience the Arctic, etc, there was many funny things. I was so hard because of hot weather, but that was a fun trip.
Leisure at its best.... If in Hong Kong... Ocean Park is a place not to be missed... It is even bigger than Disney Land in HongKong...

Panda and dolphin show.. I love this park because of panda and dolphin show. The panda garden inside have few panda look very q. Don't miss out the dolphin show, you can check the show timetable before you visit. Other than this the game all just normal nothing surprise.

A wonderful mix of fun things to do and see. Loved it... Lots of fun rides to enjoy from Roller Coasters to Ferris Wheels...and a Cable Car ride across the hill gives a beautiful vista of Stanley Beach and others.. it is great for the adventurous and faint hearted. As well as the fun stuff there are Dolphins, otters, penguins, walrus, seals and other water creatures ... A huge aquarium, an ocean show, a bird show and then you can visit the Pandas... Red Pandas and giant Pandas... They had four giant Pandas and seeing them alone is worth the visit. Would visit there again without a second thought.
PLACE. Wonderful place in Hongkong to spend a day with family and friends and to have fun with the amazing and thrilling rides in there

Bigger and better. I've been before a number of years ago, and went back to find that that the park had grown substantially. It rained constantly, so the exhibitions were a little more cramped than usual (otherwise people tend to stay out in the activity areas), but it was good fun nonetheless. Just wish we had better weather to go on the terrifyingly good rollercoaster.

Poor imitation of sea world.. I had great expectations from ocean park. It was a huge let down. All the shows were in Chinese and for those of who did not speak the language, there was no english translation available. It seemed to be more like an attempt to copy the bird show from the Singapore bird parkand to copy the dolphin and seal shows from sea world. The aquarium though highly ranked did not live up to even one thirds of what Singapore offers at underwater world, Sentosa. The ocean park, I realized only caters to those who speak Chinese. Those who have seen sea world or have travelled to Singapore will miss nothing if they skip this attraction. Given a choice to anyone who has to pick a holiday destination in Asia, please keep Ocean park, Hong Kong as the last one. If you miss it, you have nothing to loose.
wow. i have nothing to say.. its just WOW.. i mostly liked the envoronment and the facilities there.. everything was perfect.. loved it

Highly recommended. This is the first time I go to the Ocean Park despite it is the fourth visit to Hong Kong and I loved it!I have been to theme parks in other parts of the world and this park definitely is of very good standards. Even beating some established theme parks that I had been to. The entrance fee is about hkd 280 for adult and hkd140 for children age between 3 to 11. We reached the park pretty late at about 4.30pm and the park closes at 8pm. Even with the limited time we have to explore the park, we felt every dollar is well worth it!The first interest we visited is the Aquarium and I was impressed by the grandeur of it and the good variety of fishes on display. Just sitting and watching the fishes swim by is already worth every dollar I paid. The aquarium has a huge number of stingrays in it. Enjoyable to watch them swim by.Other fishes, there is also pandas that you can see in the part and some other. Interesting mammals. Penguins are there too but it can be pretty cold in the area where you get to see the penguins. We took a tram over to the other side of the mountain to see the other park and was surprised by the tram ride. The tram looks like a submarine and the whole area is so well designed that you really feel like you are under water.The other side of the park is magnificent! It shouts fun, fun, fun. The parks I full of rides, not for the weak hearted. There are also game stations and I felt I am in the middle of a carnival. There are also scenic part of the park where you can get a view of Repulse Bay. Very beautiful especially when the sun is setting. Had wanted to take the Ferris wheel but due to lack of time, we took the other ride which brings you all the way to a very high point and gives you a 360 degree view of the whole park. It was awesome.Before the park closes, the was a show at the fountain area which uses a combination of water, lights and fireworks. It is awesome.Getting to the park is not difficult. You can take a bus from Admiralty MTR. Ride is hkd10 per pax and the ride to the park is about 15 mins. Going back from the park is the same way. At first, I thought with so many people leaving the park at the same time, I may have to wait for at least an hour for the bus. But I was wrong. The park is very efficient in taking care of this. There are enough park employees to direct traffic to the buses. Within 15mins, we are already on the bus and the buses are very comfortable. The coordination in this aspect is really world class. Had an enjoyable half day in the park. I would definitely visit the park again. The next time I will give it a full day.

very nice but for kids or with family. Once again, no kids, no family together and crazy place in Hong kong. Ocean park is very nice and kids friendly park with lots of water rides, plays, games and lots of fun.If you at any MTR station, you can get more information or a cheap ticket from local advertiser and agents for the park.
highly recommended with kids!!

Awesome. Ocean Park is huge, spread over two hills . It is one of the best theme parks in the world with amazing roller coasters and other rides. One who loves rides and animals cannot give it a miss. We visited it on a rainy day, and we were amazed to find thousands and thousands of visitors even on that rain soaked day. Avoid going on the weekends due to the excessive crowd and queing up hassles.

An island of fun and ocean adventure. A great place to visit for amusement rides and nature trip. The place is divided by sections and in order to reach the other end one has to ride cable car. One can see aquarium pandas and dolphins and sealion shows and enjoy rides such as roller coasters ferris wheels and other. Great place for family and friends.

family trip. this place is amazing loads too do for kids and adults alike its huge park loved the cable car rides fab views liked the aquerium and enjoyed feeding the sea lions great fun. liked the rides and found the views were so loverly

Better than Hong Kong Disney...sort of. The theme based entertainment parks are not quite as grand as the ones found in the US. However, Ocean City was quite enjoyable. It is divided in two with the Aquarium part and younger children's area at the base, and the bulk of the rides a SKYTRAM ride away. The skytram goes along the side of a huge cliff and was one of the best parts of the park. There are some really fun rollercoaster rides along the edge of the cliff and a gorgeous view. This is far more teen and adult friendly than Disney HK - Which wouldn't be much fun if you didn't have kids with you because it is a fraction of the US version...and caters more to the family friendly vibe. When we went - There was hardly any lines... we rarely waited more than 5 Minutes.

One Giant creative ocean park. The park is huge!!! It's an amazing ocean park with so much to explore! The place is very clean and there are so much to do there. I got to see seal to penguin to panda! There were many different parts to visit and each part have its own theme. So much fun and so many things to see for old and young people.
Worth it. It is fun for both adults and kids and is far better than disneyland. We loved the jellyfish area and the hairaiser ride was AWESOME!!!

Ocean Park. My daughter and I really enjoyed the day at Ocean Park. At the lower level are most of the animals and the cable car ride takes you up to the theme park rides and another aquarium. Great fun and we would definitely recommend visiting. Easy to reach by bus from town though an MTR is presently under construction.

Fun and huge, but very old.. I don't know how people can squeeze all rides in one day but I definitely couldn't. I didn't know that the park IS SO HUGE, and it comprises of so many parks. To get to another park is a long walk. It's worse if there are so many people and you waste time lining up. But despite the long walking distance, the rides were fun and thrilling. Definitely enjoyed Hair Raises roller coaster! A must if you visit Ocean Park. Head over to see panda before you leave..I only saw one though. :( Was hoping for more. The cable car ride was beautiful, lovely scenery and view. Many of the attractions were for family, so it's good though. It was quite a rush for me because I was catching the tour bus, but I managed to get on the rides that I wanted.

A good place for kids in HK. A nice place for kids and adults bonding. Overall an interesting place if it doesnt rain if not very hard to find shelter. I also enjoy the cable ride which is free within the park and u can get good views of the entire park on the cable car too.

magical!!. After visiting Disney we were a little sceptical about visiting here but "WOW" who thought a theme park, zoo, aquarium and a bit of history all in one. The penguins were amazing and seemed to play up to the cameras.
Don't bother with Disney visit here!!!

enjoyed myself this time!. I dont know why i enjoyed the park better this time... I saw the penguins, sea lion and the oh so lovable pandas. I was a bit disappointed because the dolphin show is closed due to some repairs but it gave me more time to see the other attractions and was able to ride more rides. I also enjoyed their aquarium and the rare species that are featured though this will never beat the old but bigger aquarium they had before. Also the water and fire show around 7 pm was truly awesome!! Oh btw, the cable car ride has always been enjoyable :)

FUN!!! FUN!!! FUN!!!. We visited here year 2006.I've been to tons of aquariums, but OCEAN PARK is the BEST...Not only because of its aquarium but this park has lots of fun to offer.There are lots and unique of thrilling rides. There's cable ride to go from one mountain to the other. Awesome...It's definitely tiring because it's a huge park and we have to walk a lot otherwise it's worth it.Definitely will come back!!!
great fun!. a fantastic place to enjoy spend ur day. lotsa thrill rides and exhibitions around the setting. amazing scenery once u get to the other side. a place for every age. and the place is huge!

4 Seasons in a Day. The Ocean Theatre was not what I expected. The shows were simple. The rides were great. A lot of rides for adults but not enough rides for family. Be prepared for a lot of walking and sweating if it's a hot day. Food at Middle Kingdom Restaurant was good but service sucks. Overall opinion was just ok. Could be better.

So boring. I've been to Disney Amusement Parks in Japan and USA. And compared to perfection of Disney Parks this is really a waste of time. Pay a little more and head to the Disney Park. The Ocean park is one of the worst amusement sites I ve ever visited. The Delphine show was no show. The just let them swim from left to right and right to left. The lunch was one the worst I've had inHK so far. Only highlight is the Panda area. But that is all.

Rather disappointing!. We went to Hong Kong a few years ago and I read great reviews about this park. However we were very disappointed with all the walking that you have to do in order to reach from one ride or show to another. And july is very very hot and humid in HK. Also the rides were not well managed as we waited for hours to go on one ride and just before we reached the end of the queue we were told that our daughter was not tall enough for the ride. It would have been a great help if the height charts were given at the beginning of queues rather than at the end! I would suggest that if you want to visit any attractions in HK, make if the Disney land. We did not find any thing else remotely interesting there.

Fantastic!!. Great place for a day out. The cable car ride from one island to the other is simply fantastic while most of the rides are great. The water show in the evening is not to be missed. The only area of concern is lack of better food options but overall its a great place. My kids rated this place far better than Disneyland.
Professionaly managed water & fun park. nice rides... good crew...professionaly managed...neatly mantained....would like to go again & again

Enjoyable Day For The Entire Family. What a great day out. We were not sure what to expect but well worth the trip. The children loved 'Old Hong Kong'. We all enjoyed seeing the pandas and the aquarium. The bakery near the exit is excellent. Definitely do this again on a return as there were things we did not see. Highly recommended.

Better Than Disneyland. This place is amazing. We got there when it first opened and left when it closed and really needed another day there. Some rides there is quite a wait and the rides are aimed more for adults and older kids. There is so much to see: the aquarium, pandas, Rainforest exhibitions, great cafes and the gift store is fantastic. Going on the Cable car is the best and the view is spectacular. We actually thought the whole park was better than Disneyland. A must if you come to Hong Kong.

Ocean Park Vacation 2013. Comparable to Disneyland, amusement park offers more rides for teens and adults. Seemed more like a carnival with a zoo than an amusement park. Cable car ride is a must! Was disappointed that a lot of the animal feeding was at an additional charge. Park requires a lot of walking especially to adult rides. Not many shortcuts like Disneyland to other parts of the park, therefore, not very convenient when traveling with elders or young children. Park tries to have performances throughout the park, but shows were not very entertaining. Be prepared to walk down slope and back up when heading to the adult attractions. I still prefer Disneyland even though smaller. However, ocean park is still a good place to add to your itinerary.

A day at Ocean Park!. the park was really hugeeeee and there were so much walking to be done! the summit closed at 630, while we thought it would have closed the same time as the park did: 7pm. So we didn't manage to go to many rides. But the seals and penguin exhibit at the north and south pole were spectacular! Was a pity that the cable car queues were soooo long, so we took the ocean park express both ways. Would definitely visit again, its a wonderful place!
Great Place. We went there without no expectation, it turned out that we had a fun time but annoyed by ppl from the most populous country in the world. I recommend this place over HK Disneyland

Wild adventures. When you enter please take the cable car and visit all the rides in the far off part of the island. These rides get crowded later in the day. Take the train and watch the pandas and other attractions later in the day.

Fantastic day out. Amazing animal enclosures and shows. Loved the seal enclosure and option of feeding fish to the seals for $30.The cable car ride was a breathtaking experience with amazing views of Hong Kong while connecting the two sides of the theme park.The rides were fun and we were happy to find we didn't have to wait in line for more then 10 minutes for each ride we went on.

Awesome!. Ocean Park is a must do if you are visiting Hong Kong. We went straight up on the cable car to the area with most of the rides. We rode all of the roller coasters. The Hair Raiser is definitely the best! :)
Will return. This is a gem compared to HK Disney - more variety and more places for the kids - love the aquarium - you can spend hours in there. Also the pandas are super adorable.

Lots of fun and good variety. This place had it all. My 7 yr olds twins liked it and so did the parents. I was quite impressed since the entry fee was quite reasonable. What I liked is the fact that not only did it have a fantastic aquarium and also interesting animals such as pandas (our first time to see live so was a treat) it also had rides too so it was a good mix of educational and also fun. It also had a good dolphin show. At night they have a really good water/light/fire show. Again I was impressed. And all this done against a beautiful backdrop of HK. All in all worth doing.

"REALLY NEW". I been frequent in ocean park for years but this time, LOT different.. Soooo good to be back. New Rides, new theme, bigger, livelier. Indeed... ocean park is better than disneyland they said, i said, with hotel accomodation inside would make this a perfect theme park.... why no hotels in this area? please have one.... guaranteed full pack... we need it.
Interesting. Quite a lot to do but the slides are very slow, not sure how they cope with any crowds. Food is very expensive.

Fab day out to suit all ages. Great value for a great day out. Plenty of sealife and rides all included in this massive park. Go up the mountain on the cable cars with breathtaking views. Well worth the $250 HK dollars or equivalent £23 UK pounds sterling. Definitely worth going to. Rides are from the scariest to the calmist.

Worth visiting once. Great place to be with older kids +12, as most of the rides are for them. We were eight of us reached here at Admiralty by MTR, then a bus ride to Ocean Park, very comfortable journey.BUY TICKET AT ADMIRALTY STATION FOR HK$250, AT PARK THEY ARE FOR HK$280 WITH LONG Q! The park is very well maintained & most of the rides are working fine.
