The aquarium is too good, but as mentioned people didn't care not to use flash while taking the pictures, i would like to request "kindly follow the rules". The rides are fantastic, little bit extra waiting is there at very popular rides, approx 20 to 30 minutes, it is part of the game so lets not crib about that! at other rides the waiting is just 5 to 15 minutes. There are restrooms at regular intervals, but the provision for drinking water is poor! as HK is hot most of the time they (organizers) should take care of this basic necessity. When it comes to food it is very difficult for vegetarians, better carry your own stuff. The longest waiting time is for the cable car, to save time we took the train to go up but to come down we didn't want to let go of the amazing ride, so had to wait for 60 minutes!!! it was somehow worth it.The ten minutes light,fire & sound show is excellent way to end the day at park which starts at 7:30pm sharp.Over all a nice day at Ocean Park!!

Not like it used to be. Ocean Park used to boast one of the world's largest and most beautiful aquariums. Unfortunately, they no longer have it. The Grand Aquarium is still there but it has moved to the lower park, and not as impressive as it used to be. They used to have quite a lot of fishes and many different types and sizes too and a multi-level aquarium where you can walk on the outer circumference to enjoy it at different depths. Now the old area has been converted into the home for multiply exhibits of penguins, seals, etc.The panda exhibit is still quite good although they only have a pair of black and white pandas here plus a pair of red ones.If you like thrill rides, then Ocean Park still continues to add attractions every few years. This time it was the Hair Raiser, a multi-loop roller coaster. As an avid fan of roller coasters, I had to try this one. It's different and new, although because of its continuous loops at a pretty similar speed, the element of surprise is missing. Other popular coasters have these gaps of slowing then surprising you with a sudden boost of speed or sudden drops. However, for the average rider, it will be a good ride ;-)

Ticked off the bucket list.. Just returned from a full day at Ocean park. Got there early & as soon as the Park opened, headed up the cable car to the thrill rides. If your seriously scared of heights catch the train up! Sadly the hair raiser rillercoaster was closed 4 maintenance &there was no notification at the entrance or the website which was annoying. Its awfully hot this time of year &there are next2 no drinking fountains around the park so bring water, hats, shade umbrellas& sunscreen! Pandas were good2 see as was the penguins/walrus displays! Gave a brief reprieve from the heat. Most of the rides did very little 4us& some rides had No waiting@all. Hv been on way better rides@other theme parks! The big aquarium was ok but people used flash photography continuously wen asked not2 &yelled at family members in their group 2get their attention consistently which gv me a headache very quickly! They all seemed2b in such a rush! Food was rubbish but I expected that. Other trip advisor members say this is better than Disney. We disagree! Each park has good & not so good elements. This 1 is ticked off the bucket list & If we are ever in Hong Kong again we wdnt go back to this park.

Excellent. Had a fantastic day at Ocean Park today. Getting there was so easy just take the MTR to Admiralty then the 629 bus, got there in no time. The aquarium was just amazing never see so many stingrays and hammerhead sharks and heaps of other fish and it was really great with all the different aspects and viewing areas, kids would just be in awe of it all. Got to see the Red Pandas on display soooo cute and the Giant Panda which was really what I Wanted to see just gorgeous. Took the train up the mountain and the fantastic cable ride back down. Heaps of clean loos everywhere. Some of the areas are under refurbishment but there is still so much to see and do that it really didn't matter. It was really humid today but there are plenty of places air conditioned to cool you down again. There was a bit of queuing but it just is what it is, the longest queue was for the cable car to go back down the mountain. All in all we would thoroughly recommend you get there early and spend the day there it was just fantastic.

Very good place to visit. The place is slightly away from the central area, but still relatively easy to get to.Actual Ocean Park is quite impressive, has to main parts and a lot to see. You can easily spend a day there and its a great place to take the kids.I would recommend to go during the summer if possible, when its warmer and everything is open.

scary but enjoyable rides.. The rides especially the hair raiser is scary at first but we enjoy it. The aquariums are great. ocean park's rides like the hair raiser, flash and abyss are for the guys and gals with guts.
Not a good place to visit. We expected much and we found it to be average. It is so crowded that you have to wait for 30 to 60 minutes every where.
Fantastic with animals. Saw the lovely pandas, penguins, sea lions and the adventure of the parks. It is a lovely enjoyable day spent with family members.
Definitely coming back. Went there in July, though they had strong typhoon the week before we got there, it was burning hot when we arrived. The cable car brought a cool view of the sea and the park.

Great fun!. I haven't been to Ocean Park since I was a teenager. Now as a mom we brought our toddler here for her b-day. The aquarium, the panda exhibit, and the penguin exhibit were all very impressive (that says a lot since we have been to aquariums in 3 continents since the birth of my kid). The cable car ride was memorable with stunning view of the south side of HK island. The only problem I have is that there were 2 restaurants on the lower portion of the park and one was closed for preparation of a private event. The lines at the other restaurants were longer than the rides. What kind of management decision is that to close one of 2 restaurants during a busy public holiday weekend (6/1 is Children's Day in China)? Very inconsiderate & probably money losing one.

Fun Place to Visit!. It was an educational, fun and entertaining experience at Ocean Park. One will learn much about the animals specially those at risk of extinction. The Chinatown area provided a good glimpse of the The rides were thrilling (The Flash). The animal show (dolphins) was also very entertaining. There is just so much to see and a whole day is not enough to experience it all!

Coming Back For More!. if there's one place i love most about HK, it's HK Ocean Park. I'd give up one day of shopping just to go there (gasp!) While i had super cute photos from disneyland, all the action is in HK ocean park. they have awesome rides for thrill-seekers like me. if you're more interested with the rides than with the picturesque landscapes and attractions, suggest you head straight up (ride the cable car) once you get there to avoid the post-lunch lines at the rides (which is located at the top of the mountain). try the newer rides first (hair raiser, the flash, etc), and then try the older rides (abyss!) too. once you've had your fill of the rides, you can go down (use the tram) and check out the pandas and show before you leave. i'm sure i'll be back on my next trip to HK :)

Great place to spend your time here. Easy access to ,ove from the other side to the other one. Easy to get foods, we ate at Panda rest, there's a Haagen Dazs ice cream for compliment, just exchange your receipt at the cashier.. Nice

hair raiser. its a must to ride the hair raiser coaster at ocean park. its the fastest i have been on.ocean park is divided into the lower ands upper parks connected with a cable car that is a reason in itself to visit.dont ride if you have heart probs.

Much Better Than Disneyland. It has many extreme games. I love the cable car ride. My kids love the Hair Raiser roller coaster & Mine Train.. it was superb holiday. There were penguins, walrus, panda, birds, aquarium was great! Overall, we like all of it!

Great fun for kids (of all ages). The yearly pass is great value. Take our two young kids there regularly and they have a special kids zone which is great. New attractions around the North and South Pole are informative and entertaining and a welcome respite from the heat on a hot day. Food is typically awful and unhealthy in the park but who goes to eat there!

Pandas and rides. Loved loved loved the panda enclosure! Use the train oneway and gondola the other when visiting the rides at the top of the park. I believe they have added a arctic experience in the recent months as well, which is meant to be worth a 2nd visit

A FABULOUS VALUE FOR MONEY DAY OUT. I am not one for theme parks normally but Ocean Park is fabulous. We went on a public holiday in Hong Kong by mistake and were concerned there would be overcrowding. It was busy but there is so much to see and do that we hardly had to queue at all. The views from the cable car ride are fantastic (worth the entrance price!) and the combination of well managed zoo, world class aquarium (just get yourself a coffee and sit in the restaurant at 2nd floor level next to the glass wall to take the weight off and enjoy the rays and hammerheads sharks) make this a wonderful family day out. Highlights - pandas, aquarium, cable cars, dolphn show....and so much more.

Adults would enjoy more.... The rides are mostly catered to adults more so than the kids although there are attractions like viewing panda, fun fair-like section and aquarium. It is a huge park..too huge in fact for my liking cos apparently it was hard to cover all areas especially on a hot day. The shows such as seal and dolphins were done only in native language and so left foreigners who do not understand the language a little bewildered.What I loved best was the BBQ Squid and the cable car ride although I didn't feel 100% safe with small kids knowing that they could possibly slide through the gaping grills of the car. Bathrooms seems scarce and the environment does not seem to be wheelchair or handicapped friendly.Overall, just an okay experience unless the standard to match was Disneyland which we visited the day before..hahahahaBut with the entrance fee and the hassle of getting there....I guess you can do given you keep an open mind to visiting it.

"Small Island With a Huge Attraction". Months before we arrived in Hong Kong, i personally try to 'Google' this amusement park.. I never expect that it's incredible!! Our tour guide did a good job, he asked we to pack early so we can spend plenty of time inside Ocean Park. Honestly it's quiet tiring up there, since it's a mountain, you have to climb it man. But who cares right, you're able to see the ocean view and play lots of attractive. I can't remember much, since the place is divided into many section. But i think, we did cover all of them. Kids and teenagers will love this place. Full with scary games. there's a place with a Old Hong Kong scenery (entrance to ride the cable car). It's beautiful. This is a MUST place to visit when you're in HONG KONG! Go as early as you can, people start to fill the place in the afternoon.

A great family outing. The park is well set out with different areas for the ocean creatures, the adult rides and the little people. It is well run with good facilities. Lunch at the top overlooking the china sea is great and the food was reasonable. Also catered well for little visitors. Gondola ride between the ground level and the top ( the park is in two sections) is spectacular. The train ride was disappointing and could have been so much better.Overall well worth a visit. It gets very busy and in summer is very hot so dress appropriately and take shade, sunscreen and water

Excellent!. best acquariums i ever seen. my daughter was thrilled seeing panda, sears and all other sea animals we never seen before except on tv and in books. i loved the cable car, but a bit scare of some crazy rides up there, so i stayed away from them. i heard people screaming, but it was all fun. i was impressed with the conseveration strategy in the park.

Worth every penny. Went there in December 2011. (I know I decided to review it now)The rides here are great as compared to Disneyland. Not because I don't like Disneyland, its more "ADULT-ish" here...After going around the aquariums and pandas (if you wanna go watch pandas, go see them in the early afternoon. Its hard to take a picture without flash at night as we are not allowed to have flash photography on the panda areas) on the lower mountains area...hop on to the cable car up or the Ocean Park train the mountains, that is where all the fun is. I took hair raiser and the mine train roller coaster, Its awesome... The dragon was a so-so ride though. Get on the Abyss Turbo Drop to see the awesome few only to be screaming as you were thrown down within seconds. Dont miss this place... Awesome place for family and friends.
Great family fun day. Roller coasters, animal exhibitions, aquarium, views. Easy to get there by taxi. Panda fantastic to watch.
Free for seniors. I had a great time taking the rides and seeing the Pandas and the aquarium. Avoid the lunch room - the worst food I had in Hong Kong !
super crowded. brilliant cable car ride with gorgeous view. long queuing time though and little shelter from the strong heat.

Enjoyable and exciting always something new to do. If there one wants to do then why not go to Ocean Park? It's enjoyable for a wide demographic range but mostly for overseas visitors from China, every now and then you get locals and other overseas visitors. The place generally is overcrowded even on weekdays and some lines for some exhibits are long and exhausting especially in hot humid weather which can make people feel like they're in a sauna, last year when I went there was a arctic penguin kind exhibit and for people who experiences cold weather a lot will find it just the right temperature to be in especially from the intensive heat but I see many visitors wearing winter jackets and I was the only one with a T-Shirt!! When you go to Hong Kong it's a must visit, as it's fairly cheap but can get a bit overcrowded. I recommend that if you don't like waiting for 15-45+ minutes to get into some exhibits then it's not something people can handle especially those with heart problems.

Great Day Out with Kids. My kids are fans of Ocean Park- we have visited Ocean Park for the 3rd time in 3 years! They just loved the animals in Ocean Park such as the Pandas and Penguins. The Tuxedo restaurant was a big hit as we could dine and watch the penguins swimming gracefully in the icy water. We had the privilege of watching the giant panda eating bamboo and it was amazing. In The Grand Aquarium, there were moon jellyfish, lionfish, stonefish, napoleon fish, hammerhead sharks, blue tangs, stingrays, manta rays and many more sea creatures. At the North Pole Encounter, we saw spotted seals, sea lions, a huge walrus and an artic fox den with a few artic foxes. It was exciting seeing the baby sea lion feeding on its mother's milk.Would recommend better for young children as they will like the animals. Rides are mostly not for young children as they are quite intensive.Try to get an annual pass for this excellent attraction.

Good for a family day. Ocean park has it all, beautiful aquariums with amazing variety of fish, fun activities and splended shows.
The prices are cheaper than Disney world and you get more value for money at Ocean park.

Great for children and adults. Ocean Park is a theme park - definitely worth going to but if you don't like being around kids, then I'd suggest staying away. Take a taxi there as it's a bit out of the way. If you have kids, you definitely want to stay there for the whole day to make the most of it.

Amazingly Huge Park. We arrived around 10:00 am, so we did not spend much time in lines for the attractions. The park was huge, so be ready to walk for hours. We were not able to cover everything because of the bad weather. We could have tried more rides & attractions had it not rained. I am not so much into adrenaline-pumping rides so i wasn't able to try the "extreme rides" which my husband and my in-laws tried. There were just to much to see, and i think one day really is not enough.Best thing i love about this park: their diaper changing/feeding areas are SUPERB! they have numerous separate and spacious changing/feeding areas which were equipped with an A/C, a couch, a bottle warmer & a changing table. Every parents' wish! The entrance fee was worth it, it costs about HKD 280 and you can also purchase it from 7-11 outlets to avoid the long ticket lines at the park entrance.Will probably go back when my daughter turns 5 so she can better enjoy & appreciate the park.

An amusement park with some amusement. Good place to go, ride the cable car and see pandas!! The park is quite big which means you have to walk around. There are some rollercoasters which are quite fun. Food is a bit expensive. Its worth a visit but its not really good for younger children as the rides are quite intensive.

Had A Great Time!. Agreed with other reviewers, if you want to do a theme park in Hong Kong, do Ocean Park over Disneyland. Yes, it was ultra "cheese" (it is a theme park), and no I did not go with any children :) The panda bears were definitely the highlight of the day! We caught the sea lion show, all in Cantonese, which was pretty fun too. I had a really great time walking around the park and getting to see all of the animals. The cable car ride was a must-do, I didn't end up on any rides on the other side due to time, but the views alone are totally worth the wait in line. Also had a decent lunch at the restaurant that is right by where the cable car lets you off. As far as a theme park, it was reasonably priced and turned out to be a lot of fun. Would recommend it if you're spending more than a couple days in Hong Kong, and are looking for a goofy fun day trip.
So hot. We went there in ocean park April...it was so hot. Not relaxing. It was tiring. Next time we should visit ocean park HK during cool months.

What a dive. We got a free trip to Ocean Park, weren't planning on going there. The pandas were gorgeous, this was the first thing we saw and we thought what a great place. We caught a cable car to the top of the park where the rides were and not it was shabby and outdated, well in need of an overhall. The food choices are very limited, Chinese style, not very nice. I think there was McDonald's there but that was a train ride away. There is little shade there, was a big disappointment, wish we hadn't wasted a day on this. The jellyfish were really good.
Too much fun for one day. A great park offering lots of different experiences but we found it too big and a bit disjointed at times. I loved the pandas! Great thrill rides.

A great experience. We as a middle aged couple (50's) went to Ocean Park on a Monday in May and were surprised how quiet it was, no queues to get in and only a 15 minute wait to get on the cable car over to the other side, which was the highlight of the day cause Hong kong had turned it on weather wise, the harbour looked spectacular. We went on nearly every ride, except the roller coasters, and covered nearly every square inch of the park in 4 1/2 hours as there was almost no wait for any ride or exhibit. We thought the park was great value entry wise and food wasn't that expensive either compared to theme parks in Australia. We thoroughly enjoyed ourselves and would highly recommend it to anyone ,although, I can't imagine what it's like on a weekend in high season.

Brilliant!. I absolutely loved Ocean Park (if you can only squeeze in one theme park - pick this one over Disneyland). We bought our tickets at the hotel and skipped the ticket queue (no difference in price).I hate all roller coasters and most rides, but there was enough to keep me occupied when I wasn't holding backpacks and hats at the bottom of all the rides!We went straight to the pandas, while the crowds rushed for the other side of the park. We were the only ones watching them have their breakfast and were able to take some great photos!The cable cars weren't running for the morning due to high winds. There weren't many queues, and if there was one, it was a relatively short wait.We caught a taxi to Ocean Park with no hassles, but had to wait in a queue for about 45 minutes to catch one back to the hotel - the bus would have been a much better option!

Definitely worth a visit. Ocean Park was really good - lots to do and see compared to Hong Kong Disneyland. There are rides as well as animals. The lines are not as long as Disneyland's nor are there too many children. Definitely worth a visit.
Excellent!. You should visit this place if you like active rest. A lot of attractions as for peoples who rest with child, so as for young extremal peoples. I recommend it.

One of The best. Much bigger & better that Disney, & much cheaper too, take the train up the hill if cable car is crowded, finish of the big rollercosters at the top first & take the cable car to come down & complete the stuff below that way you will be doing the reverse of what others are doing so less queues to handle.
amazing !!!!. everybody will appreciate the huge aquarium with all the varieties of fish & etc. it is worth a visit.....

Beautiful. The Ocean Park at Hong Kong is worth a visit for all tourists. Not only several varieties of fish etc. are kept for the view of the visitors in the huge aquarium glass enclosures, there are so many amusement rides too.

Fun but Tiring. You'll be amazed with how wide and big the place is. If you would want to meet real pandas, penguins, seals, arctic wolves and other exotic animals then this is the place to be. You also have to try their rides especially the Hair Raiser with a 360 degree loop☺

Fun day for all ages. Ocean Park has something for everyone. The whole park is well set out, attractive and easy to find your way around. The shows throughout the day - e.g. the otters, sea-lions, and bird theatre - are great to watch. On the day we were there, the Grand Aquarium had tiny toddlers as fascinated as their grandparents. The giant pandas and the lively red pandas are not to be missed; we just couldn't see enough of them. Judged purely as a zoo, however, I would have to say it's not as comprehensive or as interactive as some, particularly Steve Irwin's Australia Zoo, in Beerwah, Queensland. However, Ocean Park is also a really good amusement park, with lots of rides that kids and teens will love, and a cable car ride that gives great views of the islands. Easy to reach by bus, and an all round great day out.

Awesome fun on the mountain top rides !. We decided on going to Ocean Park as HK Disney sounded a bit "lame", caught the bus from Admiralty station (purchase your ticket from the MTR booth as you are leaving the station as it is cheaper than at the park) about 10.30 in the morning (there is a bus leaving every few minutes). When we got to the park we ignored the attractions on the ground level and headed straight for the cable car to the top of the mountain and had an absolute ball. We didn't have to queue for any of the rides and were able to take our time enjoying our thrills.After we had finished on all the rides we headed back down, much better plan to do the rides first as there was now a 20 minute wait for people to come up the cable car and the rides were beginning to queue (a board displays the average wait times).Once back down the bottom we found somewhere for lunch (near the pandas) that had a good range and was nice and clean then a quick look around some of the exhibits and then back on the bus after having spent a fun few hours.Lot's to do to keep the kiddies amused and plenty for the adult child at hearts.

Disney with teeth. Easy to get to. Bus from Admiralty MRT station.Lower level has a very fine Panda Enclosure -Red and Giant Pandas;a superb aquarium;many attractions for younger children.Upper level,which is not visible from below is reached via a train (impressive engineering incidentally) or cable car. This area is aimed at teenagers and adults.It is quite large and divided into different sections e.g. Thrill Mountain, Marine Land etc. Many rides of varying adrenaline quotient plus tamer attractions. Some- Hair Raiser big dipper,The Abyss,The Flash will satisfy connisseurs of serious rides.In short something for everyone. Excellent.

Must not be missed. Great place. Reach around 10.30 in morn to avoid crowd. Catch the cable car to go to the top level to play in the major rides. Hair raiser is a must try. Finish all rides by 3pm at the latest else you would be waiting in long queues. Post this Catch the train and come down to the ground level snd enjoy other games , aquarium etc which can be done in a leisurely pace.
good for family, of course.... Went there because of the Panda, the rest is good for family as amusement park. Easy to reach by bus from Admiralty MRT.

Great place for kids, not so great for adults. Went to this place with my friend. This is a vast place with an indoor aquarium with lot of water animals. There is a giant Panda hut too. I and my friend really enjoyed watching the Panda :)We ended the trip by visiting the rides via cable car. The cable car ride is a must. You can see so many islands of Honhg Kong from the top. Looks so amazing!It is a good place to spend one complete day in Hong Kong. Some of my friend visited both Disneyland and Ocean Park, and the general opinion was that Disneyland is way better than Ocean Park. So if i doubt between the two, better choose the DisneyLand.

Everyone loved.. Visited with family including kids aged 4,5,7,9,11 and senior citizens. Everyone loved it. Thrilling rides, amazing location. Beautiful view from the roller coaster.May need more than a day to enjoy all rides.

Kids voted best day in Hong Kong. We loved Oceanpark , there is so much to do, the Aquarium was amazing, the cable car great, and the rides fab! We also thought it was great value for money as the ticket price includes all rides .The food was also reasonably priced.Very clean, pretty and sooo much fun !!

For all. Ocean Park is catered to all ages. I have been going pretty much biannually for over ten years, and I still have a massive amount of fun. They've also expanded recently, adding a bunch of new roller coasters that I haven't yet tried all of them (the last time I went, they had completed three new rides, but several were still being worked on). The rides in general are really good, and have an age range from about 3 to however old you can be, whatever tickles your fancy. But of course, little kids always want to ride the big rollarcoasters, though there is a high minimum on those.Though not as polished as HK Disneyland, OP is just massive and has a huge range of attractions, from rides to shows, to animals/the aquarium.Definitely go to the aquarium. Though some think it's boring, it still strikes me every time because it's just gorgeous and massive. The sharks are always coo, as are the stingrays. They've got dolphins and orcas somewhere else in the park. Pandas, foxes, etc are somewhere else, too. But take advantage of the zoo aspect of OP.Cable Cars are always cool.You can make them rock if you want to, and I've never heard of the cars falling. Convenient way to travel to the other side as well. (it's a pretty long walk)

Great day out. This was a great day out but I think you need more than one day there two days would be less hurried ,if you want to see and experience everything the giant pandas are gorgeous and don't miss the dolphin and sealion show I would like to see a little more western food options for those who want a change from Chinese foods if you don't want to taxi it back from there to Kowloon take the 973 bus from outside this bus runs from the Stanley markets and is a cheap way to have a tour of Hong Kong it was great we used it a few times it drops you off near tsim sha tsui station or you can get off anywhere before that it was idea As we only had to go around the corner to get the shuttle bus to our hotel great value day out

Wonderful day out for kids and adults alike!!. My day started with a stress-free bus trip to the front entrance of Ocean Park. Lots of people, but the Hong Kong public transport is second to none, and coped admirably. After exchanging my voucher for a ticket I was in. There were queues, but the whole process took barely 5 minutes. Once inside, I was a bit over awed by the Ocean Park map, but the set-up of the place allowed you to go through the whole park without back-tracking, seeing animal exhibits, shows, and keeper talks on the way. Huge array of food available, from snacks to full on restaurant meals, all reasonably priced. There are toilets everywhere, with hand disinfectant, and even smoking areas for those of us that need them :) I spent the whole day there and enjoyed every minute. The only time I had to queue for longer than 15 minutes, was for the cable car. An equally easy bus trip back to North Point ended my day on a high note. If you're in Hong Kong you definitely should spend a day at Ocean Park. I had an excellent day, and I'm a solo female traveler in my mid forties!!!

Good for children & family. good place for children to see aquarium, panda, and other sea animals. lots of ride for children, some roller coaster for adult to play too. Also small cable cars take you to the upper part on the hill (the summit). Travel to/from the park and city is very convenience, take MRT to Admiralty or Central then take a dedicated Ocean park bus. Buy entry ticket from MRT booth in Admiralty MRT (Exit B) get $30HKD cheaper from regular price $280

Summer Visit. Musts during your visit during Spring/Summer season. Must wear slippers or waterproof sandals as there are puddles due to sudden rain showers. Must bring extra shirt or small towel. It can get very hot and humid and rainy alternately really fast. Plus walking in and out of air conditioned attractions can give you a head ache. Bring an umbrella or windbreakers/raincoats. Bring water. Eating around the park is pretty decent and choices are varied. Choose the best attractions to buy your souvenir pictures. It can get very costly purchasing them after every attraction. Take your time and enjoy the park. Don't worry about the pick up, it's easy to get back to your hotel, whichever side you're on. Within Hong Kong side, taxi's are available and for Kowloon side, you can take the 629 bus (HK$10.5) to Central station MTR to get you to your nearest station (about HK$9)

Out Disney's Disney- Fun For All Ages. If you are in Hong Kong, particularly with family, this is an attraction that you should include in your itinerary. This park caters for all ages whereas Disneyland Hong Kong at this stage is purely for the under 12's (A work in progress though). Ocean Park has been there for many years and has been a mainstay of Hong Kongs entertainment scene for decades. The attractions are varied from Pandas, to merry go rounds for the tots to terror type rides for the teens. As an ocean park theme there are wonderful exhibitions of marine life. Most fasccinating of all is the jellyfish exhibition. They are all there the seals, the sharks and much much more. This is a place for all ages. You need a full day to take it all in. I flew to Beijing particularly to see Pandas in the zoo (terrible display. Dark, dingy & unkept) then came to Hong Kong and there in Ocean Park is the most wonderful display available. It's worth the entrance fee alone to see the pandas. It is more fun to go with a family group because you can vary the fun according to the age groups. Close to the entrance it is all for the under 12's and at the top of the mountain (via chairlift) it is a teenage riot of thrill rides. Hong Kong has done itself proud with this park and it caters for a variety of themes (Halloween, Christmas etc) and it brings in the locals en masse as well as the tourists. Not exactly cheap but excellent value all round. It compares with Disneyland on price but I think if you have a wide range of age in your group Ocean Park is the better option. The views from the chairlift ride are spectacular and it is hard to believe that such a large tract of land in such an overpopulated city has been made available. Magnificent views out over Lamma Island and the cargo ships moored at sea make for one wonderful panoramic view of the back of the island. One of the great theme parks of the world. Highly recommended!

Visit OP if you don't like the other theme park in HK. Went to the OP with the kids since they have season pass. Visited on a weekday and the crowd was reasonable. Didn't have to wait too long for all the rides. This was the first time I visited OP since 198x. OP has upgraded many of its attractions and rides. IMHO, better than the other theme park on Lantau Island.Again, it appears getting in line in an orderly fashion is not a virtue the Mainland tourists normally do. I had to constantly "bitxxh" people out. If you can overlook this minor fault, I'm sure you can enjoy this establishment.

Hair raising rides and beautiful animals. You get to see Panda's, Firefox's, Walrus and so much more. Then the cable ride has an awesome view and on to the rides which are hair raising, but so much fun!

Must visit when in Hongkong. I booked our family's ticket online, that way we didnt have to cue the long line. The rides were thrilling specially "The Flash", it was dissapointing though that the kids were not able to ride "the Hair raiser" due to thunderstorms and pelting raindrops in the afternoon, when the park had to close down all the rides. All in all Ocean Park is a MUST VISIT place when you're in Hongkong.
Awesome day out. even in the rain! Kids aged 12 and 9 loved it. The combo of zoo, aquarium and theme park is interesting but works well and we all had a great day.

Must See for Hong Kong Trip. Ocean Park overs a wide range of attractions from aquariums to rides. This theme park offers something for visitor of all ages. Buy tickets from travel agencies as they offer discounts. Ocean Park is big enough to disperse huge crowds so the park does not feel congested. Make sure to wear comfortable shoes as you will certainly do a lot of walking. The good thing about this place is that you are not required to rent lockers for rides because yet have compartments/places to leave your bags before you board the rides. Clean washrooms and good souvenir shops. Avoid rainy seasons as this might ruin your vacation. The view of the cable car is enough reason to go here. Went there as a couple May 5, 2013. Transportation to and from Ocean park is now issue as frequent buses cater people to and from Admirality MTR station for just 3.5 HKD.

Pandas!!!. I went to Ocean Park for one thing and one thing only.. the pandas. I came all the way to China in search of them and here they are!The girl panda was sleeping but the boy panda was out munching on bamboo. It was awesome! They also have a red panda which I decided was super cute. :)About half the rides were closed on the thrills side. :( I did go on two of the rides and they were ok. Older and pretty shakey. I was amazed and thrilled to see the seals and penguins, but the poor Walrus just looked sad. I had lunch at the Aquarium restaurant, Neptunes, and it was ok. Overall, pretty over-priced. Also side note: the Ampitheater is closed for repairs until June.

Pretty average. As far as this kind of park goes it was ok...we really went for the pandas and that was worth the trip for sure...they were amazing, particularly the red pandas which are so very different. One can really get up close and personal with them which is also fantastic. Also the view from the top was stupendous but apart from that it was pretty ordinary and touristy. The food was also pretty ordinary there...

cool. directly from mydiary: "Sitting along the cliff on the South Chinese Sea, I rest after a day at Ocean Park's where my stomach was tested after the American breakfast with bacon & eggs and Chinese rolls of spring, the bad road on the bus to get to this place and the luna park activities... However we have had fun like two kids! The thing that struck me the most was seeing the panda in the park... they were enjoying crunch of twigs! Exciting! They were so tender! " born2travel.it

true! this is much much more fun to go to than hk disneyland. we had so much fun here at ocean park than hk disneland we enjoyed alot of rides n sceneries here the only thing that i wish we did was i wish we went there a bit more earlier so that we had d chance to see more but still we enjoyed it n d best part is that we waited till d last show fireworks display i so love it! i was smiling the whole show :D beautiful!!! best place for a family to go here we had alot of good memories here <3

Too Crowded & Costly. This place is too crowded at most of the times & the ticket is also costly.Ocean Park is well spread out & there is a fancy train service & cable car available to go from one entry side of the park to the other side where most of the rides are. However the wait for the cable car can be too much of a hassle given that serpentine queues can greet you & in case it pours then you can get all wet as even umbrella might not be sufficient as it happened with us.The maintenance at some points in the park is not upto the mark. Most of the visitors are from mainland and they go by the herd mentality and thus can easily fill up the lines for various attractions.The good part me & my wife liked are the giant pandas, penguins, sea lions & walrus for which they have created artificial habitat. Another good theme we liked is the water ride but you need to have raincoat or plastic cover with you as otherwise you can get wet. These are available in the park but are costly.The food served at the restaurants here is nothing to home write & is best avoided if you can.

Much much better than Hong Kong Disneyland.... Great day out for kids or adults, but my advice would be to go early as you can easily spend the whole day and not see everything or go on every ride...The Roller Coasters are great fun, Abyss and Cable Car are also well worthwhile and HKD $280 to get in is well worth it...Had a lot of fun with my 5 five year old in the kids' arcards, although ended up spending hundreds of dollars on games to win enough tickets to get the stuffed toys and (haha) but it was fun. Only down side to the arcade areas are the more moronically stupid people working the other games that were not busy, who consistently kept ringing they're stupid bells to attract and customers when in fact all there were doing was driving everybody away from the arcade!!!!Be aware that if you are at the far end of the park, that it is at the lowest level of the land, so after a long day it is a bit of a tough walk back up the hill back to the cable car, so be ready as there are no escalators, it's all walking...Would highly recommend Ocean Park to anyone with kids, or overseas visitors, but if you are visiting from overseas, please don't do what the mainland Chinese do and sleep all over the place, it just looks so uncivilised.

Its good. we visited this theme park a day after visiting the "other" theme park in Hong Kong. it would be unfair to compare the two. But the ticket price is almost half and service is better at the Other theme park. attendant has a bit of a language barrier. and all attendant uses/preoccupied with there personal cellphones.... rides are a bit more for the teens than the kids for ages 12 yrs old and above.overall a good experience but not the best.
Best park on the Island for Kids. Theme is the sea and the park has various activities around it. This is on the south side of the island with better air quality.
Amazing. The Rare Razor in amuzement park was a never forgettable and pleasantly horrifying experience, dont miss it and also the cable cars were amazing!!

Good for older kids. This park is good for teenagers and the young at heart, the park is built in two sections with a mountain in between and you go to each side via cable car or train. Has some really great thrill rides!

Fantastic Day out. This was a great place for the whole family. We all really enjoyed it and it was much cheaper than Disneyland. Please don't miss the cable car ride to the attractions at the top. One of the highlights was the North and South Pole pavilions behind the Arctic Express roller coaster. Really well done. The seals/walrus' and the penguins were so cute. Rides were all excellent too. Something for everyoneThe Aquarium is also a must see.We went on a weekday so there were no crowds at all and barely had to line up for anything.All in all, a great day out and can highly recommend it. It's easily accessible by public buses too. Make sure you have he correct change if paying by cash or even better, have an Octopus card if your in HK a few days. Public transport is the way to go
Not what I expected. It was just another theme park,I went there years ago & really enjoyed,found it very hard to find your way around & very hilly

See pandas alive. Aquarium was great and so the giant pandas. Otherwise there were too many people (It was Sunday), but everything was well organized, so you did not have to wait too long to see everything. It´s worth of taking the cable car to the other side, because the views are great and the is a nice terrace restaurant over there.

Fun for everyone. Overall its a pretty interesting themepark.The ocean theatre is a must of you are a dolphin lover.the show is.aweome.Most of.the awesome part is located uphill. With only the symbio and panda stuff in the main entrance area.Being too big do expect to walk a lot and in the months of april may dont forget an umbrella. You will get long waiting times for most things but mostly its worth the wait and most of them dont exceed 45 min.Dont forget the hair raiser.its their best ride.If you have one day free in hongkong then this a welcoming refreshing dayout esp with kids and family.

One of the best!. So this park has it all - beautiful views across the China Sea and out towards the islands, forest all around, fantastic mix of rides and the chance to observe some wonderful animals. There is a huge amount to see and experience: we (5 adults and an 8 year old) were there for a 5 hr day, but we could easily have gone back to see more or do it at a more leisurely pace. We went on a week day and got there at opening time. We had virtually no queues for any of the rides which was pretty unbelievable! Us adults got to scream and see the landscape upside down from a mix of rollercoasters, or freefalling from another attraction. If you can keep your eyes open, the views are spectacular. 8 year old loved all the water rides and galleon ship. Penguins, seals, seeing the panda was all great too. We had a wheelchair user with us and staff were incredibly helpful too. Excellent!

Excellent Value - Great Way to Spend A Day. Here are my tips. Save 40 HKD by buying your ticket at China Travel Services (one location at Peking Rd and Nathan Rd, TST). They don't confiscate water at the gate so bring a bottle or pay 20 HKD for it outside (also vendor by the bus stop at Admiralty). Get there at opening 10 am and head for the cable car and work your way back. This will avoid the crowds and tour groups coming in later in the day. Jump on the Hair Raiser coaster first thing with no lines. Very confusing going to Marine World (lower section by Ferris Wheel) over to Rainforest side. Only access is by an overpass which opens at 10:30am. Loop under this overpass to get to the other parts of Marine World and to return back. You can't cross from the cable car (only heads back to Waterfront). Ocean Theatre closed for maintenance May 6 to June 7 2013. Don't worry about storage lockers for your backpack and cameras when going on a ride, you can leave it on shelves or baskets placed beside the embark point of the ride. Bring a poncho for the wet rides to keep dry or pay 30 HKD for one. Contrary to other older reports, McDonalds in Marine World more expensive than elsewhere. No combos offered - 24 HKD for a drink and 21 HKD for a Big Mac not including fries. Pandas at both Giant Panda Adventure and Sichuan Treasures. Don't miss the red pandas at the Giant Panda Adventure. Feeding for all pandas at 2pm. Don't miss North Pole Encounter and Arctic Fox Den both beside South Pole Spectacular but a bit hidden.

Wonderful Park. I visited Ocean Park with my husband last week and OMG what a ride!! wonderful park with lots of things to do both for kids and adults. One day was not enough. wish i had two!! It was so good. Must do!!

Great Day Out - GORGEOUS RED PANDAS. I was pleasantly surprised by Ocean Park. There is loads to do here. We went on a not so dry day, so the crowds were smaller, which was definitely a good thing. There are loads of different little attractions, many aimed at children, but adults can still definitely have a great day here. Get a bus from Admiralty MTR station - no MTR to Ocean Park. Its cheap and you can use your Octopus Card.There is an Asian animals sections, where you can see giant pandas and red pandas. Absolutely great attraction. We were lucky to see the keepers interacting and feeding the red pandas, so we got up close to their habitat and took great pictures. There are other animal exhibits too, gold fish, alligators, a rainforest enclosure and more - check out the park website for a list, but my absolute favourite was definitely the red panda. Even the giant panda exhibit was better than the one in Macau. There are animal shows as well - a bird show - which was good - if a little cheesy and mostly aimed at kids, but the sea lion and dolphin show is the main attraction and was great - lasting about 45 minutes I suppose. There is an aquarium here too. It not the best aquarium I've ever been too, but it was good, and had a good variety of tanks and fish and shark species. For me the best part was the cable car to the top of the park. It was terrific. The views of the park and surrounding area are lovely. At the top of the park there are fairground rides, a rainforest enclosure with birds and animals (the spider monkeys are gorgeous) a jellyfish exhibit (which was cool), a giant sturgeon exhibit, and the main theatre for the sea lion and dolphin show. There is just loads to see here, and many food stalls and restaurants to choose from. Allow a full day. Everything is free once you pay park admission. You obviously have to pay for food and souvenirs.
Fun for older kids. This park has more rides for bigger kids (10 years and older). We had a good time for the whole day.

The panda enclosure was pretty sad. Ocean Park wasn't quite what I expected, I felt like the only westerner in the entire place and it was definately aimed at local visitors.The park is pretty massive, and I'm sure it's great for families but pretty expensive.I only had half a day in HK and really wanted to see some pandas so I spent a rather hefty amount on my ticket and headed in.Once you avoid the many groups (and their umbrellas), I headed to the bird show. Unfortunately nothing was in English so I had a hard time figuring out what it was all about.After this I shot across to see the pandas - first in a larger exhibit but the pandas were hiding up the top and I couldn't see much. Then I went into the Asian adventure side and it was really sad.The giant pandas looked very agitated and bored, they both walked back and forth, hit the wall, turned around and did it again. It was like those children you see who rock from boredom. Pretty sad.Other than that I wasn't interested in any rides so I left early.

ocean park , hk.. Been to ocean park about 8 hrs ago. and back in 1980s....things have changed a lot....loads of new attraction....eg.panda, ocean jellys,,, couple of new thrilling rides....but still the ocean theater act by dolphines is my best one....don, t miss that show...thats what I would recommend. Cheers.Tharan

Amazing Experience. Its a combination of theme park, aquarium and a cable car ride put together. very good value for money, especially the fountain show end of the day. Note that you will be very tired and with aching muscles end of the day. Ensure you get in time for the dolphin show and the bird show. Plan well, as the park is spread out and if you have kids, they are not going to walk all that much. Indian menu available in Bay view restaurant.

The most favorite theme park..!. Its build for me! Hahahhaa. I really love oceanpark. So sad, i didnt go to all objects. U should catch there early morning. Staff was nice and the queues is not a big thing for me (i went there on weekend). Wooaahh. I wanna go there again. I miss the lazy panda, big aquarium, rollercoaster, all..!

The best theme park in Hong Kong. It's not just the convenience of it being a theme park on Hong Kong Island Ocean Park has grown and added attractions through the years and has been a favourite of the family for many years. It's getting overcrowded with visitors nowadays, but it's good to get there early and get the cable car across the hill and make the most of it before the crowds arrive. If you live in Hong Kong and have a young family season ticket is a must.

Just as good as visiting Disney!. Our daughter wanted to go back to Ocean Park even though we had purchased two days Disney passes. This park has been improved incredibly since the last time I visited. The Panda exhibit was a special treat and wonderfully presented.

Must see while visiting HK. The Ocean Park is a must see while visiting HK. It is well laid out with ample experiences for guests of all age types.The cable car ride to the Summit and the train ride from the Summit to the Waterfront are must do's. The food at the Bay View Restaurant is very expensive and the vegetarian options are extremely limited. However, the ambience and the location are good.The map to the Park, unlike other places one has been to, can be very misleading at times.The Panda enclosures and the Emperors of the sky shows are excellent. The queues to the rides however can get to be very long and time consuming so plan the visit at leisure!

Ocean park Rview. Amazing and Awesome.We started early from TST 9:15 am. Best to pruchase tickets from Admirality station (as you exti), you get them cheaper. As you come outside of ths station, ther are some men asking for tickets to be puschased, we ignored as we already had them. Clearn indicatation at MTR guided us to the way outside MTR. There were alreast 5-7 busses waiting to pick all those heading woards OP.No. 629 takes you stratight to OPgood view of Hk Skyline as you cross to OPOnce you reach there (we reached 9:30am), there were already some queue to go inside. the park open by 10am.As soon as the gates opened, we headed startight the the cable car to take us to the other side of the mountain. the park is distributed on the other side of the mountain and you can go either by train called as ocean express or cable car. We preferred the cable car early.once we reached there, we had almost zero queues in lines and enjoyed most/all of the rides. It tool amlost 5-6 hours to complete all. Just when we thought all were done, the Mine Train was the most facinating that I felt.Tired and almost ...phew, we decied to head back via cable car again, Sadly the security guy announced a waiting time of ~2hr. we rushed to the Ocean express and reached down in 15 mins. Saw the giant aquarium and the pandas and relaxed.My kid ( 8 yrs) loved the the remote speeed bard for 8 dollars ....did it thrice.a very good family entertainer for all ages..most of the rides have a strict rule on the height and age. My son was stopped for many rides.Tips:I parks allows you to carry food/water. best to be take a bagpack and stull it with water, fruit jiuce etcif possibel carry a rain cort, there are 2 rider where you can get wet/soaked. Raincoat costs ther 30$try to finish the other side of the mountain first, in this want when you plan to cme back, you can be bit more relaxed.before you head back, make sure you dont miss the bird and whisker show.. starts at 5pm.lastly enjy the acquarium and its wonderful fushes....kids will love this.also enjoi the long starrs,..ther are atleaset 4 of them to reach from one to anothermust visit when you visit HK, Tomorrow is big buddha... ;)
dpejis HK holiday. This is a place especially for children.The cable car experience is very good.The sea lion and dolphin show is too short.The underwater aquarium is also limited.

The best amusement park in Hongkong!!. Not much rides for younger children 7 yr old and below but ideal for young and older adults. The place is so big and vast that you’ll need to walk a lot. In my Opinion Ocean Park is better than Disney, aside from the rides , they have the aquarium, zoo, nature park and a lot more. 1 day is not enough to explore the whole place. Try to eat in their Bayview Restaurant, its quite expensive but food and ambiance is great.

A Wonderful Surprise. You cannot fault it, the rides are fantastic, the panda & aquarium was out of this world. the research areas are a marvel and such great work they are doing to protect to local wildlife. i kinda wished i had kids of my own. it is such a great place to learn and have fun. However the food is something that needs to improve, you are better off taking your own food and drink.

Fantastic Theme Park. This theme park in Hongkong is one of its kind where people of all age can enjoy. It has everything from carousal to roller coaster. One of the main attractions in Hongkong. A must go place while visint hongkong.

Theme Park with a difference. Been here several times and i have never found a theme park quite like this anywhere else. It has something for everyone. Its part zoo, part theme park, part fairground.The Panda enclosures are great even if the pandas are sometimes "shy". There are sea lions, red pandas, reptiles, and a huge aquarium containing all types of fish, sharks, ray, turtles etc. The aquarium is actually better than a lot of other stand alone aquariums that I have been to.As for the rides, there are several rollercoasters, river rapids type ride, observation tower, etc.However, on a pleasant day, the cable car ride is worth the admission alone! Fantastic views over the island and the south china sea and it can be so peaceful.Depending on queue times and how many of the rides you want to go on, I would suggest allowing between 4-6 hours - so its not a complete whole day out, but it will take up a large portion of one day. I arrived at 11am, and left about 4pm. One negative thing would be that you usually find yourself next to a very large group of noisy tourists, usually from mainland China which can really be annoying and frustrating, but that isn't the parks fault.TIP: hopefully its still there, but there is a Tourist Attraction Gift Shop in Admiralty MTR station as you exit to get the Ocean Park Bus. Its actually cheaper to buy your park entrance tickets there, rather than at the gate, which will also save you queuing at the entrance. They speak English too!

Forget Disney - Ocean Park is THE PARK of Hong Kong. Quick Summary: If you were to visit one theme park/zoo in Hong Kong, make it Ocean Park.Pros: Pandas, dolphins, cable car, rides, carnival games - all packed in one park. What more can you ask for?Cons: Can get really hot/humid in the summer; also long queues for special nights (e.g. weekends for the Halloween monthThis park has a bit for everyone. As a local I've visited this park a two dozen times and Disney maybe a dozen times. Forget Disney - THIS is the park you would want to visit.Save at least half a day for this park. You must:1) Visit the Pandas2) Visit the Ocean theatre3) Take the cable car - a 15 minute ride from one side of the park to the other (Ocean Park is situated on both sides of a mountain)4) Take the crazy long escalators5) Save some time for rides, carnival games, the aquarium, other animals, etc.6) Check out the special events. E.g. the month around Halloween will see OP transform into a haunted park with staff dressed as monsters running around scaring people in the park! All large indoor areas will be transformed into haunted houses where staff will scare you. Remember, no touching!Tips: - Avoid the hot months. If you can't, just make sure to go after 3pm. - Take the MTR to Admiralty and follow the signs to the bus (yellow double-decker buses) at the bus terminal.- Check park hours as they differ because of weekend/day and also special events- Eat at McDonald's. Everywhere else is slightly overpriced. Ocean theatre is nearby!- If you do go during the Halloween events, be SURE to purchase fastpasses earlier from their website. Lines can go up to 1hr+ for the better haunted houses

Entertaining, easy to get to, but a little less-than-perfect in terms of viewability and crowd control. We went primarily to see the Giant Aquarium (certified divers can apply to dive it) and shows, rather than ride the rides. I can see this place appealing to all ages rather easily. There were a ton of families with babies there, which I always think is strange but little kids were intrigued and happy, so it all seemed ok.We had coffee and a muffin in the bakery that were both very good (park prices though). The line for the Aquarium was a bit longer than we would have expected for a relatively low-attendance day and standing in line to walk through it was a bit odd. Once you get in, it is fairly well-designed and they have a good array of species. The walk-through parts with Hammerheads and Mantas flying by is easily my favorite -- awesome. There were a few interesting speicies of seahorse and an octopus, so some good opportunities to watch and be amazed. The stands for snacks were either out of everything or never really offered it. All they had was chicken legs and hot dogs. Like every theme park, all of the shows and rides dump you into shopping opportunities - I actually really don't like this feature of the parks - it cheapens the experience.Bad weather meant we weren't able to take the sky lift up or down the hill - so we ended up on the train. Crowds in China (even Hong Kong) seem to be quite pushy and it gets to be tedious, just be mentally prepared. We went to the bird show, pretty crowded, primarily in Cantonese and really short. Eh.All in all a good way to spend a day and pretty easy to do.

Just fantastic. So much to do at Ocean Park, the whole family loved it, the panda house is fantastic, the underwater aquariums where fantastic as well and a welcome relief from the heat outside. Easy to spend the whole day there.

A great day out for a family or even a couple with no kids.. Ocean Park is a huge theme park that boasts many attractions and reasonable entry cost. It's built with kids in mind but as an adult I found a lot of interesting and enjoyable things, including 4 pandas (the best setting to see them is the back enclosure not the first and most popular one). We also enjoyed the water show but it was extremely busy so try to get there early or you will struggle to get a seat. The only downside really was the cost of food but that's normal in theme parks all around the world and easy fixed - just take your own lunch and make sure you have lots of snacks for kiddies. Other than that, it was a great day out for the whole family. PS. We went during the week and were told it is much busier during the weekend and school holidays.

Nice park. A well-maintained park. Love the 'lazy' and cute big Panda also the Red Panda. Inside the Aquarium world is magnificent, you could see giant fishes passing by in front of you in a big aquarium, some of them are the kind that I've never seen all my life..lol..Unfortunately we enter this place together with some noisy groups, we see them pose in front of fish tank instead of observe it, strange..The view from cable car is nice, it's free and you could ride it back & forth.The ticket can be obtained in small counter nearby Admiralty MTR Station exit B which headed to Bus stop, we found it cheaper than others.

Rides and Penguins. A great theme park with some grin inducing rides, plus pandas and penguins, what more could you want. I advise going for something to eat in the penguin restaurant, expensive yes, but you get to be just a foot or so of glass from some of the most wonderful creatures on the planet.

Pleasant Surprise. We went here on recommendation of a coworker and I am glad we did. I don't think I would ever have thought of going as the marketing of the place doesn't really mirror what the place really has to offer... it was MUCH better!Just take the MTR to Admirality and follow the signs to the bus. I recommend that you buy your entry ticket at the MTR as you can then skip the queues when you reach Ocean Park. The bus ticket is bought upstairs. They said that bus would take about 20 minutes but its more like 10 and they leave frequently as people get on. The park has plenty to offer, lots of attractions, animals, nice gardens, underwater world, dolphins and sea lions, shows, feeding of the pandas... things for young and old. My favorites were probably the Giant Pandas, the roller coasters and the cable cars. The queues weren't as bad as at Disneyland and there is a lot more to do and a lot more to choose from, not only when it comes to attractions but also the animals, the entry fee is lower and you get so much more then you get at DL.A couple of things tho... some of the small children cant go on certain rides due to height restriction, they need to be over 1.45cm... just as a note as I did see a few young ones crying their eyes out because they couldn't go on certain rides. If you go on "The Rapids" I do advise you to get a rain poncho or you will get soaking wet :DAll and all, it was a really fun, fab day out for all of us.

A fun time. It was a very foggy and misty day the day I went. I'm not into amusement park rides, but if that is your thing you will have a great time. I did enjoy the Giant Pandas and the Red Pandas. Was a good way for me to spend a few hours, but you could spend all day if the weather was good and you were into the rides.

Good place for the kid at heart.. This is another must see place when in Hong Kong. With the addition of their new attraction which is the Panda bears. Kids and even the kids at heart will surely enjoy the place. The rides were really awesome compared to Disneyland. For thrill seekers out there should try riding The Flash, Abyss and Hair Raiser.

Animals & Rides. Ocean Park was a great surprise for me. I expected it to be a "marine" park with a few rides attached.....not at all. On entering it appears to be like a large zoo. There are exotic birds, reptiles, fish and the Pandas - I think there were 4 or 5 (maybe more) Giant Pandas (which you can get really close to) and similar numbers of Red Pandas. There was also Arctic and Antarctica enclosures (suitably "cooled" so take a jacket) with penguins, walruses, arctic foxes, seals. sealions etc (no polar bear tho). The rides area is separated from the animals (by a mountain!) and you have to go across either by cable car over and around, or a train through, the mountain. The rides are quite close to one another like a traditional amusement park with all sorts of roller coasters, dodgems/bumpcars (slowest most unexciting dodgems I've ever seen!), and other favourites - some of the animal encounters are also in this rides area.There are some decent restaurants on site, some affording great views of the coastline and sea from their elevated positions.All in all a good day out. We were there from 10:00 til 18:30 and just about managed to "do" everything - including the Pandas three times!

Bustling with crowd ..has something for everyone. I loved the Underwater world and the Dolphin and Sea lion Show.One needs to spend an entire day at Ocean Park to be able to cover it properly.Not to miss the Space Shot ride for anything !!

Fun for families. Been there once for a half of a day and it wasn't enough time. Enjoyed it alot and would return. Lots of water activities and good water shows. My kids loved it but there's so much else to do in Hong Kong.

Unbelievable family entertainment. My kids aged 10 & 6 were awestruck. I was thrilled to see pandas, a walrus, arctic fox, giant salamanders, freaky goldfish. There are no belugas or killer whales like all the brochures / websites advertise as of April 2013. Go up on the train and come down on the cable car. You will need a whole day. The food is extremely expensive. We were forced to eat trusty old Macdonalds fish burgers (being Muslim). Lots of walking and rides. Queues for rides, be expected to wait and wait. The shows are quite tacky and lacklustre. We took the MTR subway and at Admiralty got the special bus (629 I think) straight to Ocean Park and back again.

Better than HK Disneyland. Ocean Park is bigger, has more rides and variety of food than HK Disneyland.We went on a weekday on a school day so the crowd was not so bad. Waiting time for rides was approximately 15minutes.Lots of choices for food and fairly clean toilets.The cable car ride and the train ride inside the Ocean Park premises was also nice.
good. Main highlights are pandas , dolphin and sea lion show is adorable tram ride and aquarium and last but not least amazing musical fountain show ,

a nice childhood memory. when I was 13, it was my first time to Hongkong, my aunty brought me to Ocean Park, waaaoo! It is really a happy hour for little me, no matter how it is now, it was really a miracle place for me at that moment.
Fun Fun Fun!. Was quite nice. We had a fun day out in spite of it raining heavily on the day. We enjoyed more than in Disney!

Great Fun In The City. Ocean Park is huge and there are a lot of things to see and do- from the amusement park rides, shows, cable car rides and so on. I think a day is not really enough to go around but I always have fun like it's the first time every time I go here.
great for all the family. 2 kids 13/17yrs mum and dad. some thing for us all.very surprised to see the Panda's was not expecting that. highlight of day. feeding time. boys liked the rides.

Great day!. I had a choice between Disneyland Hong Kong and Ocean Park Hong kong. After looking up information, I chose Ocean Park. Disneyland seemed rather dull. Ocean Park had it all! If you went for the rides (like me), you were certainly not disappointed. Plus, they had animals (including Panda Bears). Seals, penguins, different kinds of birds, etc. As well, they had an 'old Hong Kong town'. The park is HUGE and has soo much to offer those looking for a great day out. When I go back to Hong Kong next year, Im certainly going back to Ocean Park!!

Love those Pandas!. Ocean Park has gone through a massive renovation over the years and now they have much more attractions.Part theme park and aquarium. Ocean Park is a great place for all ages.Their main attraction is their panda exhibit.

Great themepark. We were so happy about choosing Ocean Park instead of Disney. We had a great day, and the park had a lot of fun rides for adults. You have to walk a lot to get around, but is is worth it and you can easily spend a whole day in the park. From the MTR station "Admirality" you can take a bus directly to Ocean Park.

The childrens desire. A great place but be ready to walk. The Park is built on the edge of the mountain and what an experience. We found the park well signed and organised everything worked and was great fun. Food was abundantly available and the ocean show was spectacular mixing live entertainment with local talent. Great place for the family. Book the day though and get there when it opens

better then disney. We spent 7 days in Hong Kong and as we have kids had planned on visiting disney, which we did and was great. Then on our last day decided to visit Ocean Park, WOW! WOW!Not just rides but animals as well, such a great attention to detail. Loved the Southern Ocean exhibit freezing cold with the penguins.Also coming from Australia very excited to see the pandas and the gorgeous sloth. Would have loved to be closer to the capybara they seemed so far away.Overall we had a fantastic day even though it started off rainy. Curious why the seals etc were not in their area due to inclement weather, would have thought a bit of moisture wouldnt have bothered them.Cable car ride was breath-taking.Old Hong Kong was interesting.Could have really done without the carnival people shouting at us each time we passed, ie coin toss etc.Excellent value for money. And not a mouse in sight.

Wow! Spectacular & a great day out.. Again, get here early. Fun for everyone from the pandas, dolphins, seals, penguins in lovely 'worlds' to the huge two layered amusement park. Would be a great place in the heat with all the water amusements but equally fun in some rain. A must when in Hong Kong & dedicate a day there.

Disneyland much, much better. Rides and attractions very poor compared to Disneyland. Layout is not good meaning a lot of walking up and down.Cable car ride was nice but doesn't beat going to The Peak, plus there's a cable car ride to be had if you go to see the Big Buddah. The only saving grace are the giant pandas.
Great for older children. We loved Ocean Park, however, we didn't realise there would be so many height restrictions - more suitable for kids 130cm +

Great family day out. $28 dollar entry covers all the rides and exhibits. Arrive early though to avoid any queues on the rides.Straight through bus from Central no 629.We spent 6 hours and one of the highlights was the marine mammal breeding and research centre with a newly born baby dophin with its mother.Something for all ages and great value.

Family Fun. Ocean Park is a really great place to go for a fun day out with family. Kids of all ages love it! Rides suitable for everyone - and if you aren't one for the rides, check out the animals. Pandas are brilliant, so are the penguins. Some fantastic rides and basically NO queues for most of them - when I went, anyway.Only problem is that the food and drink is a bit overpriced - everywhere is 24 HK$ for a drink. But good value overall for the entrance fee.Spend at least 5 hours there - you will not be bored!

Not to be missed. We liked everything about the ocean park, only the queues are to be disliked. But well, that happens at great attractions.You probably need 2-3 days to fully enjoy all that is on offer. If you have to choose between this and Disney, I will advise to choose this, except of course, you need to tick off Disney on the 'list' of places visited. I'm saying this based on visiting both sites.A lot of fun for the whole family

Not For Small Kids!. Put simply, the height restrictions on almost every major ride make this a complete waste of time and money if you have young children. Even the River Rapids ride was restricted at 1.22m for absolutely no obvious safety reason.The park layout also makes for an awful lot of walking. Getting the cablecar UP may be simple, but finding the entrance to go back DOWN requires pretty well circumnavigating the park.Very disappointed and feeling totally mis-sold. Don't go there unless your kids are at least 10 years old and 1.4m tall.
Fantastic!. Awesome experiences, value for money and some unique activities and sights. Definitely worth it - 1 day is not long enough to do this park justice.

Fantastic sea life. A great day out, something for all the family, the aquarium is one of the best you will ever see and the sea horses are amazing. This is our second visit and it just gets better every time

Ocean Park Hong Kong. This was my first time reaching this place. It is a wonderful place - with special emphasis on taking care of the environment tucked inside an amusement park.The highlight of my trip was seeing the Pandas for the first time. They are so magnificent. This is one park that I can recommend to all tourists and would not mind going back to!

Excellent place to spend ur day with/ without kids. The place has a great variety of marine and wildlife. Its a must- see attraction of HK. Its far better than HK disneyland. Love the cable car ride and the recently added Polar Adventure. The rides are superbly thrilling. Remember to watch the awsome fire/ water/ laser show at 8.00 pm

Great day out!. Ocean Park is spread over a large area on two sides of a mountain. As I had little kids with me, we didn't ride any of the roller coasters - although they looked really fun. The cable car ride from one side of the park to the other was well worth the price of admission.
Very fun place to visit. we enjoy the park even though just for few hour. must go there for whole day and bring families especially kid. try everything if you like adventures..
Great rides and animals to see. Easy to spend 8 hours here. Rides for all kinds of kids and adults. Pandas, penguins and great aquarium to visit. Cable cars a must.
Halloween in Ocean Park. Do go to ocean park for Halloween, cause every halloween, ocean park has a theme, and there will be some haunt houses! great fun and joy with my fds.

Great day out!. Had a great day out here with our 5 year old daughter, lots to see and do, we went on a public holiday so it was very busy, packed with chinese mainlanders!. That said, we didn't have to queue long to buy our entrance tickets and everything is done very professionally.The cable car from the lower part of the park to the top of the mountain is quite spectacular, fantastic views of the coastline.Penguins, Pandas, Otters and so much more - whats not to like for a 5 year old?!

Thrill Seekers Haven!. Spend the entire day and you'll have one of the best times in your life! Be adventurous don't just be contended watching the amazing aquarium, bird show, animals on displays and mini rides on the park located at the entrance area! Go for the big! Ride the cable car and have so much fun on the other side of the Park!Merely riding the cable car is already a thrilling experience! The cable car will be gliding thru stiff mountains passing different highest elevations with a magnificent view of the vast ocean below! It almost feels like flying!Don't miss the rides! All rides are designed to make your heart palpitate to its highest level! Although its sheer fun riding, sometimes the ques will make you back out due its long line of daredevils particularly in the roller coaster Hair Raiser Ride! The whole Park is so beautiful and well maintained. Rides and attractions located at the far areas have escalators. Safety and security of the park are one of the major concerns of the staff. But I noticed during our visit, the rides still continue even it was already raining! As much as possible don't visit during weekends and holidays because its super sure jam packed. We were there during holiday season, the whole place almost all occupied. Aside from the rides, the show in the Ocean Theatre is also a must. The closing water show called Symbio is worth waiting! Don't miss it and be captivated!

Panda Habitat worth seeing!. Ocean Park is a beautiful cross between Disneyland and SeaWorld (for those of you from the USA). I spent an enjoyable afternoon just traipsing around the different attractions/exhibits. The Panda Habitat is truly spectacular! With both Red and Giant Pandas in a cool climate controlled environment (which gives a nice respite from the heat & humidity of Hong Kong), you can spend several hours just watching these fabulous critters.

Fun at ocean park!!. Had a fantastic day at this park whilst on holiday in Hong Kong. Went with my husband and kids and we loved it, pity about the heavy rain we experienced that day that made it absolutely impossible for us to ride on the roller coaster but nevertheless we had a fun time at the cable car ride which made us appreciate the beautiful views of the mountains. The wildlife attractions were fantastic, we loved seeing the cute pandas. This park also offers a great variety of different species of goldfish which we had never encountered before on other marine parks it was truly an amazing experience.i totally recommend visiting Ocean Park when visiting Hong Kong,ah and I forgot to add that entrance fee was a very reasonable price.

Entertainment on max. Surely I don't have the chance to visit such museums often so that was taken as a rare possibility. I had my first rollercoaster ride (level 5) - scary yet exciting!!! Cable car trip is something worth also. What I disliked was the dolphin show - very poor one. Dolphins were only 4 and I am afraid did not know a lot to do. I have been to few more around the world which were breathtaking. This one - no.

Great Park for all ages. We went to this Park with our son and his wife.The Park is basically in 2 halves separated by a cable car or a train and we tried both. Really great views of the bay from the cable car. We were there on Good Friday and the queues were still quite reasonable and we were able to try most of the big rides with only about a 10 min wait for each. The cafe at the top area was good and with great views and basically there are great views of the bay from most areas of the siteThere was both a good aquarium and a great panda house.We really enjoyed the day and found the staff good also.

Incredible Value for the Money. We (one adult, one nine year old) spent the entire day at Ocean Park in March when it was cool and not too crowded. I found the price of admission a bit steep, but we were there for 12 hours, rode the cable cars twice, all the rollercoasters and rides we could handle (few for me, more for my daredevil son), visited the aquarium, saw a show, played arcade games-- it was a wonderful day out. I can see why one might wish to avoid going in the heat, and/or when it would be crowded-- the lines for the rides could clearly be very long (we never had to wait more than five minutes, and in some cases walked right on)-- but we found it an excellent value for the money!

wonderful experienced. Ocean Park is an amusement best for a whole family. If you are animal lovers its a best place to go. Especially with kids because they got more rides to offer. I can't forget my experienced when I Ride in Cable cars its a breath taking coz am scared in heights but the views are so fascinating. You can see the wonderful of nature.

Amusement park. It is a must see place and u can spend the whole day enjoying urself and when little tired with the rides u can take a break to see the dolphin show and the jelly fish.Situated in wong chuk and long shan in the southern district of HONG KONG opened on jan 10 ,,1977 which conssits of 210 acres of land .Timmings:- 10.00 AM to 7.30 PMSummit close :- 6.30 PM Car parking :- 9 AM to 8 PM Free admission for below 3 years and above 65 years but should be the citizen of hong kongThe must amazing to see is the 4 storey aquarium consisting of more than 2000 fish .ocean park hong kong was the first to develop new breeds of goldfish.

Great Park. We went on a cloudy day. Not too many people. No line at the rides. Everything went smoothly!What we loved:Cable railway - it is a lot of fun and has a gorgeous view of the mountains and oceanRoller coastersService - there were people all around the park ready to help outWhat we didn't love:Dolphin shows - IMO it was mediocre - could have been much betterDistance - It is a very big park.
