Although it was fun to walk through it, it requires a lot of walking from one place to the other.

avoid weekends. I don't usually care much for amusement parks but Ocean Park has a lot to offer. The rides are not my thing (especially after I tried the Hair-Raiser and nearly fainted) but the views from the cable cars are excellent and the sea creatures are fascinating! The admission fee is not too high either.Avoid weekends and holidays if you don't want to stand in line all day. When I was there, the morning time was pretty relaxed before the park filled up with tour groups from mainland China. The food is overpriced but I guess that is to be expected.

A Lot More. A lot of fun for small kids, young kids, older kids & much older big kids. Not a huge park like some others but nevertheless it offers quality entertainment. The wildlife attractions are a great opportunity to see some animals that are not often seen in most zoos.The rides are thrilling enough for this much older big kid.Really enjoyed our day out.

A LONG DAY OF WALKING. Ocean Park Hong Kong went on the MTR on the Tsuen Wan line to Admiralty then board a 629 bus from the station to Ocean Park cost 10:60hk$ for bus.We purchased our tickets from a tout as we came out of the MTR station and paid 260hk$ per ticket a 20hk$ per ticket saving on the park entrance price.I was a bit unsure about this but there was no problem we gave them the tickets and went straight into the park.I would say that everything inside the park is sold at a high price food drinks and items from the gift shops which there are a lot its not just Ocean Park, Disney, Universal, they have you in their park so you have a choice pay the prices or bring a back pack with food for the trip.There is lots to do but its very spread out and sometimes you find yourself going back over somewhere you've already been to the park map shows where things are but sometimes the route to that attraction does not actually take you to it its there you can see but not get to it?The cable car is an example of this problem.But all in all we had a good time even though the weather was chilly and raining I would say that the day we went the park was quiet and we never haad to queue more than 10 minutes for anything but looking at the queue line set ups if its busy you might wait 45mins - 1 hour on the popular rides It was a nice day out but I would not want to go again if I was in Hong Kong.

Good. We went there on 30th March. It rained and ruined our day. But we still managed to go by cable car (very nice views ). Inspite of the bad weather and winds we felt safe in the cable car ! We enjoyed the north pole and south pole enclosures. The sea lion show was good. We lost pretty much time walking from peak to the correct bus stop (about 1 and half hrs !! ). It would have been easier to take a taxi from peak to the ocean park bus stop.

Disappointing, give it a miss. My kids were very excited about visiting this place on our recent trip to Hong Kong but we were all very disappointed. First of all it was hard to get to - the website said we could get a bus from Central station, but when we got there we were told the buses only went from Admiralty so we had to take the underground and then the bus, which took ages. When we got to the park, the queues to buy tickets were quite long, as there were only 2 ticket windows open. We were given no map or help finding our way around. You need to realise that most of the rides are a long way from the entrance and you have to take a cable car or a train to get to them so the queues for those are enormous. The signage is poor, we did get a map but had a lot of difficulty finding our way around and there are hardly any park staff to help. The food options were not great either, not enough restaurants and service was poor and rude. We got to go on 5 rides all day - not great value. Then there was a thunderstorm and they closed the cable car so the whole park had leave via the train (you cannot walk down) so we had to queue for over an hour just to leave the place. The best bit (which we almost missed because it is not highlighted) is that they have 2 giant pandas in an enclosure near the entrance so we saw them just as we were leaving! Overall, I cannot recommend this place, there are plenty of other theme parks around the world that are much better.
terrifying cable car in windy conditions to top. Good Panda exhibits.Rollerdoasrters are not my thing, although husband enjoyed being scared to death.

Fantastic. Thoroughly enjoyable day, book through Expedia before you go, includes pick up and drop off at hotel and entrance (normally very pricey) to the park, very cheap, and well worth it...i think you need two days to do everything though

Had a blast.... Spent the day with a group of friends at Ocean Park enjoying the rides and attractions, especially the wildlife (pandas, penguins, dolphins etc). This venue catered for all age groups and thrill levels but you need to take decent walking shoes as its expansive.Would definitely recommend as a must-do for those visiting Hong Kong.

Avoid weekends!. Ocean Park has grown year on year and with the MTR being extended to Aberdeen it will soon be a lot easier to get to, the park is extremely popular especially at weekends so if you can avoid visiting then it is best to do so. The Pandas are well worth the price of the entry ticket alone and the cable car ride gives fantastic views over Aberdeen and the sea. Food in the park is a bit hit and miss and the restaurants are always busy, queues form for the most popular rides from early in the day and they have not yet mastered Disney's ability to make waiting in line part of the ride. Ocean Park is an excellent family day out for children of all ages.

Cooooooool. Its one of the best, if not the best in Asia, we loved it very much.try to not be there on weekends if you dont like long Q's.there is intersting shows, be sure not to miss them.also there are varieties in food.Aquarium is massive and amazing.jelly fish aquarium is lovely and dreamy

Good theme park. We chose to visit Ocean Park as we had already been to Disneyland. It was a nice experience although would have been nicer had we visited on a nice sunny day. It is about 1/2 the price of Disneyland, but in some ways its 1/2 the experience.
Nice place to spend whole day with family. The aquarium is amazing and I think Ocean Park better than DisneyLand if you are travelling in HongKong.

Awesome Ocean Park Adventure. If you want to enjoy a fantastic time with your Teen Kids, this is the best place to be. For fun and adventure like no other, I would definitely recommend this place for the active teens and for who are young at heart. Start with the thrilling cable car ride that will surely excite your senses especially then it goes up there to the High Land. Once in the high land, explore all the awesome rides. For the animal lover, this is also a good place to get to meet fantastic animals, enjoy the dolphin show and meet the seals. Also, do not miss to say "hi" to the panda and the the red raccoon. Enjoy the flamingo also and say "hello" to the marine creatures at the oceanaruim. Go back to the low land by riding the amazing train express. I specially love eating the grilled squid while lazily watching the dancing fountain while the sun sets. Have fun and let me hear your amazing experience.

HK best theme park. Took Mtr to admiralty then bus 629 ($11,6) to ocean park. I get cheaper ocean park ticket in Mtr station, about $250. Complete theme park.for thrilled game , mostly in summit area. Whisker for animal and little kids.try the cable car,fantastic view

Compact, fantastic and ride the cable car!. This place is amazing, it's worth the entry price just to ride the cable car and see all of the islands! The pandas are such a bonus, coming form the UK with 3 children we are often lucky to see one or two, but they had loads in amazing enclosures - fantastic.The rides are well maintained - it can get hot waiting for the ride, but we went in the summer. I simpler loved the views from each "high" ride.

AMAZING. We went to the park on a stormy afternoon with an amazing sunset, and taking the cable-car across the mountain was almost the best part, after the rides. The park is split into zones of more and less intense rides. I recommend The Abyss and the larger roller coaster. Love this place, fantastic atmosphere!! Went with two families with young children.

A pleaseant surprise. We had not really heard of Ocean Park before but was very happy with the visit. Nice animal shows etc as well as good rollercoaster. Only minus was on the length requirements. If your kid isn't 122 cm/4 feet it is worth considering something else. Except for that this beats Disneyland every day in the week

Not for small children. We (family of 4 with 2 small kids [3.5 and 1.75 years] went to Ocean Park second last weekend of March (Rugby Sevens weekend). Had heard good things about Ocean Park, but was very disappointed as this park is not well suited for small kids. They have really great rides for grown ups and older kids (and i would have enjoyed that for sure), but the offering for small children is poor. I have seen far better aquarium (and less crowded) - the Panda bear presentation made you feel super sorry for the animal (the one which was supposed to be active was just sleeping). The rides for small kids are really sad compared to Disneyland and some require excessive extra pay.Will not go there again until kids are at least 10 years old. If you visit Hong Kong with small kids and have limited time, rather go 1 days to Disneyland and the other to the Peak + Stanley.
This is a must. My husband & I spent the whole day exploring, what a wonderful place, the rides are great, if going to the show be very early it gets packed & still more people coming in

Overkill. Does not have the character and charm of Disneyland. Ocean Park is trying to be too many things at once. It's an aquarium and zoo and theme park rolled into one. Over 10 year olds who find Disneyland babyish would enjoy the rides here, but overall we would not visit again.

A bit over-rated and over-crowded. I read all the reviews about Ocean Park before going. So we went, and we found it way too crowded, most good rides were 40 to 60 minutes. I also found the park somewhat confusing to navigate. I saw many people holding maps trying to figure out how to get where they wanted. Took a couple of attempts to get to the backside of the park. The park is built on a large hill/small mtn and had a tremendous amount of walking involved. I thought the train going up to the top was really neat, and the red panda exhibit was well done. Unfortunately only one panda was out when we visited.

Good Educational and Fun Visit with great value for money. Good Educational and Fun Visit with great value for money.. The place offer exposure to Sea Life, Birds and Asian Animals along with great shows and Rides....

A waste of time and money, unless you have children. My boyfriend and I were in Hong Kong in November 2012 for 10 days so tried to fit plenty of top attractions in. Unfortunatley, we found Ocean Park a waste of time. After queuing forever to get in, the queues only got longer inside the park. There was nothing very interesting for us to see, or rides we found very exciting. However, the park was clean, and the staff were friendly. I also think it would have made a more enjoyable day for children, it's not really a park for adults. We wouldn't be in a hurry to return.

This is not just Ocean Park its a life time experience. Ocean Park in Hong Kong is a must visit place. This place offers you to see amazing creatures of deep sea and also gives you the feeling of visiting the north and south poles of earth. You can get the feeling of scuba diving minus getting wet and oxygen apparatus. The dolphin and sea lions shows present here really amazing, the dolphin show is very cute and awesome.If you are adventourous there are also some breathtaking rides available for you on the Summit of Ocean Park.If you are a Indian or Vegetarian then it would be very difficult to find a Vegetarian Meal, though there are couple of resturants offering vegetarian meals its very expensive, hope Ocean Park administration provides more vegetarian meals options to its visitors in coming days.The Symbio the sound and light show at end of the day is very good and relazing.

Not a fan of mammals in captivity. Was there for the Halloween at nite scarefest which was ok but way too crowded. Way too many visitors in the park for it to be enjoyable. I would not go during a regular visit because the dolphins at OP are NOT born in captivity but found in the wild of Japan and bought by trainers during the dolphin slaughter of Taji. Not cool. After watching The Cove can never look at dolphin and whale shows the same. The mamals are absolutely miserable in captivity separated from their families and often die a few years later from severe depression only to be replaced by a new crop of wildlife.

Visited during may 2010. good whole day fun experience. would advise that you get a map, check the rides / shows available and plan a bit. get to the shows little in advance. not sure if it was here , guess it was .. long escalator rides. if its likely to rain (as it does during in May) - but a Poncho at the store. very handy in the rain (and also if you sit in the 'wet area' for the water based shows.

Fine Theme/Amusement Park in Hong Kong. Ocean Park has come a long way since Disney moved in across the bay. The park has a reasonable assortment of fun and thrilling rides. The cable car along the mountain side is a must-do activity as is the 'funicular' train through the mountain. There is something for all ages including rides, shows, and animal exhibits. Check out the Giant Pandas and Red Pandas!Ocean Park is easy to access, but have a plan before you go. Whenever the new subway station opens, access will be much easier. Enjoy!
fun day. great fun day out, get there early tho and go straight up to the top of the mountain and work your way back oh and defo dont go when school holidays are on mental

Compared to European themeparks not very exciting... Although it's nice to see panda's and penguins, the park is not very exciting. Especially the rides are quite boring, compared to European themeparks. I'm sure it is a fun day with family & kids, but I wouldn't recommend it for couples.The best thing about the park was the lunch with view on the penguins ("Tuxedo's" restaurant) and the eggpuffs sold at a kiosk in Old Hong Kong.

Great attraction. There's a great variety of rides and attractions. Aquarium is very nice but expect a long line up. The dolphin and sea lion show is worth seeing especially if you have kids. The view from the cable car ride is amazing but for the faint-hearted, the ocean express train is an option. My only complaint is the lack of good quality food choices. The noodle soup is a good choice but the rice dish tasted worst than airplane food. Take the 629 express bus from Admiralty west bus exchange. Overall a very good value attraction.

The best aquarium with Pandas and rides. It was the best aquarium we ever visited. There were two Pandas there and did not disappoint. The panoramic glass acquarium is a wonder. They have an interactive bird shows and have a nice amusement rides. For about $35 canadian, it was cheaper than Disney and offer more amenities.

Great theme park for adults. Went here last May and I think most would agree that it should be one of those places in Hong Kong that any tourist should visit besides Disneyland. It does not only have the typical aquariums (though the aquariums are really cool in HK Ocean Park), it also has a zoo (with the pandas of course!) and lots of extreme rides. The only down side is that it's a huge place. I was not able to watch all the shows and was not able to try all the attractions because I had to walk, walk, walk. If you have children with you, there are only a few rides that they can enjoy as most of the rides have height requirement and are really extreme. You need to arrive there very early if you want to fully enjoy the park. What I liked most was the Fountain show before the park closes. It was one of the coolest fountain show I've ever seen with lots of special effects and even pyrotechnics.

Ocean Park March 2013. Superb day out, went with my wife and two girls (12 & 9) , had a great day. Got the MTR & then bus (purchase an octopus card makes things far easier in getting around HK). Plenty to do all day long and it's pretty cheap as well compared to most theme parks. Went to Disney as well which was good but this was better, topped off with the show at 7pm.

Rides for adults and Animals for kids. We went there on a Friday.Getting there - took MTR to admiralty station, then follow signs to ocean park bus. You can purchase tickets at a discount at a travel agency before exiting the station. Costs HKD30 cheaper. Bus rides was quick and reached the park in 20 min. It seems that there is construction of MTR station that will make the park even more accessible in the future, instead of taking 629. Security check - There is no need to surrender your bags for checks. Hence, if you need to bring some food in just walk in normally past the security guards. ^^ bring lots of water especially on a hot day. Attractions - animal exhibits for children and rides for adults. The aquariums offer excellent views, with lots of sea creatures that were very lively compared to some other marine aquariums that I have been to.  The dolphin show is not to be missed. The penguins are also up close without a thick glass barrier and you get to experience the 10 deg C coldness where penguins live.  Downside: the railway is on scheduled maintenance and hence queues for the cable car is long.

Fun afternoon, even if you don't like rides. Went during the week (I can imagine it's a bit of a "zoo" ;) on weekends). Not much of a ride person myself though I did quite enjoy the silence of the cable car ride. We ended up going around to see all the animals, their feeding times are especially fun to watch. Most of all enjoyed the vast aquarium, especially the bottom floor when you can look up to see all the different marine species swimming above. We stood there for a while just mesmerized. The red pandas were also lively to watch and are quite the characters. Overall, was pleasantly surprised. My big tip though is: go during the week, in the morning preferably (unless you love huge crowds and not having an inch of personal space . . .)
The Best of The Hong Kong Theme Parks. Great for the teenage kids. Excellent rides, a great aquarium and well laid out. Easy to spend the day there without getting bored.
must go!. we really enjoy the hair raiser roller coaster! unforgetable xp! the park closed by 6pm open @ 8am bring extra shirt and ride all as you can wink wink!;)

Nice and fun. The ticket price I bout there at HK $ 290. I don't know why the internet is selling it at HK $550. The place is big. All the thrill rides are at The summit (that's what they call the place). It has lots of rides and they all have a place to put your stuff so you don't need to rent a locker for HK $10/ hour. All the rides close at 6 pm so plan your trip wisely. There is a lot of animals there like panda, birds, otters, sea lion, seals and all kinds of fish species including jelly fish and sea horses. To get there you need to take the MTR to admiral. But if you want to get a good seat take the bus at central. Take the 629 bus it cost about HK $10.6 one way.

Great experience. Understand that the place has just undergo some refurbishment and it turns out great. Spacious park with lots to enjoy. From dolphin shows to live animal.... fishes, panda, birds and so on. There is a cafe at the other side of the park which can be reached via cable car (must try) or the train (currently under maintenance). There are quite a number of eatery stalls around and a cafe at the peak. Fast food you will have Mc Donalds. So should be a problem looking for food. Overall is a good day trip there.

Fun Rides Paradise. I really love Ocean Park, it's already my second time to visit the park but will definitely back if given a chance. Even my 7 years old son loved it too, he said he likes OP compare to Disneyland. The park offers many activities like the extreme rides that we're so excited to try them all, and after we got tired we go watch the animal show, and of course before we leave we drop by to the souvenir shop. Just too bad that we didn't get a chance to try the cable car because of the strong wind that time. Make sure to wear a comfy shoes because the park is huge so expect to do a lot of walking.

Great Visit @ Ocean Park. Our family of 4 (with boys 7 & 10 yrs) spent an enjoyable day at the park. We bought discounted tickets at the visitors centre at Admiralty MTR station before boarding the direct bus to the park. Bus fare $10.30 for adults, half price for kids. We got to the park in about 15 mins and were able to walk right in - glad to skip the long ticket queues! Lots of attractions for kids of all ages but food was not cheap & not the best HKG had to offer! Cable car ride was fantastic despite the queue as we rode right over the edge of the island! Be aware of the options back down to the waterfront entrance though. The return queue to the cable cars were horribly long so we decided to try the free shuttle bus which needed us to take ling stretches of escalators down to the group tour bus bay ( very very crowded) and had to wait for the bus which then had to go through bad traffic before finally making it back to the park 1 hour later!

Best Theme Park in Hong Kong. I have been to Ocean Park several times.. and I never get tired of it... Go to exit B of the admiralty station, you'll find there travel agencies selling cheaper tickets around 20-30 HKD savings.. Take the bus going to the park, it will take around 20 min drive going there and you'll be dropped in front of the park. The park is separated by a mountain, you can either take the train or the cable car. For those who are afraid of heights, take the train instead. The last time we visited, the wind is quite strong, and cable cable car is a bit swaying and you can hear the wind blowing! Do not miss the dolphin and the seal show. There are also rides for teens and young adults. - Don't forget to wear comfortable shoes as you'll be doing a lot of strolling around....

Better than Disneyland. Since we've been to a lot of Disneylands outside Hong Kong, we decided to skip that and go here instead. It's cheaper, way bigger, and it's a zoo, marine park and amusement park all at the same time. The rollercoasters and other extreme rides are on another area you can access by cable car so you can also get a great view from there. Make sure to wear very comfy shoes as you would probably do a lot of walking, our feet ended up pretty sore at the end of the day. Also if you're planning on a 1-day trip, go through all the interesting ones first, you'll probably run out of time exploring everything.

Wonderful place.. It had really changed so much after years. Take a cab from Admiralty on Hong Kong Island, cost about HK$100 save you lots trouble as will reach the entrance of the park. Buy tickets online printout and show at the gate. Visit The Grand Aquarium, lots of marine life creatures. Proceed to the Waterfront Station take the Ocean Express up to the Summit. The cabins are cool and travelling time up is fast. Be amazed after you exit out, breathtaking views. Lots of rides up there, depends on the day you visit so queuing is part of the game. Plenty of eateries, gift shops etc. After all is done up there, take the cable car ride down hill more wonderful views along. Walk past the Old Hongkong after you exit the station. Shows you the older side of Hongkong. Checkout the pandas and gold fishes too. Is a wonderful place to be in. No regrets.

Terrific Fun day. We went to Ocean Park after reading the reviews on Trip Advisor.we caught the MTR and then the bus directly to the park which was very easy to do.we had a group of 6, being 2 Adults (parents)and 4 adult children (17 yo - 22 yo)Ocean Park has the entire family catered for with the fantastic rides from the top shelf Hair-raiser to all the animal exhibits, and not to be forgotten the cable car ride!!!! The park is very clean and well organised, we spent the entire day there, but you could easily spend two days.enjoy!!

Unbelievable value. Highly recommend going to Ocean Park,has everything from a cable car ride to rollercoasters and a massive aquarium,you can also see penquins and seals, great value for money. Tip though arrive early as the crowd builds very quick once opened although even with thousands of people you still do not have to wait all that long in line for things

Lots of fun!. I loved Ocean Park - it is such a fun place to visit and has a lot of different amusements including animal exhibits (we saw fish, panda bear, birds and seals) and also has some really fun rides like roller coasters and the like. It is well laid out so you can visit all different areas. The cost of entry was alos very reasonable considering it is definitely a day's worth of entertainment. However, I can imagine that it would get so crowded during peak times and we had to wait quite a long time (30 minutes or more) to get onto the most popular rides. Highly recommended! If I went back to HK I probably wouldn't go back but only because I've already been there, but having said that, I do think it is an excellent way to spend time.

A bit dated......but ok. Ocean Park I feel was probably amazing 10/15 years back, but if you've ever been to a Disney Park, it makes Ocean Park seem a bit old and dated. However everyone there seemed to be enjoying themselves.It cost 280$HK entry and once inside all rides are free, I went on a Wednesday and there wasn't really much waiting time for rides which was good. It's very spread out up the cliff top aside the coast (which can add to thrill of some rides) so be prepared to do a lot of walking. The cable car ride was good as the views were pretty amazing, in fact you get great views most of the way round the park, which is a plus. Once you get to the end of the park as its so spread out they provide a free shuttle back to beginning, you have to get your hand stamped for re entry otherwise you can't get back in....i found the bus ride a bit odd, you actually leave the park and are back outside on the busy roads of Hong Kong for about 20 minutes (depending on traffic I guess) before once again back at the start. Anyway the re entry is worth it for the light and water show which they put on at 7pm each night. It was quite impressive so you should definitely stick around for this. The dolphin show was also good.To get to Ocean Park I took the metro to Admiralty on the Island Line and from there you take the bus number 629 which goes directly to the park, there was a lot of people waiting for the bus but you don't wait long as they have several buses all waiting at once, so it was fairly quick. The bus fair is an additional 10.60$HK each way, use your octopus card or have the right change to pay.Overall, I think if you don't go to this park with high expectations i.e. don't be expecting Disney standards then I'm sure you will enjoy it. For me one visit is enough, if only for the views.

Marvellous attraction. Ocean Park is a mixture of rides, aviary and aquarium. The fun-fair type rides are exciting, although not exceptional bu comparison with some modern theme parks. The roller coaster is longer than most, and contains three loops. There is a detonator-type attraction, which is the highest that I have seen, and there are a variety of gentler rides for the fainter hearted. The aviary is a walk-through atttraction, covering about an acre of ground, and containing an amazing variety of colourful tropical birds, with a selection of ground-living birds and water-fowl as well. The enormous aquarium is viewed at four levels - on the surface, and then at three deeper levels through large viewing panels in the sides of the fifty-metre tank. There is a seperate, large, jellyfish display. There is also an impressive sea-lion enclosure, visible on two levels - above and below the surface.The whole site is in two parts, joined by a cable-car which connects the two in a ten-minute ride. The lower, smaller part contains a large enclosure containing giant pandas. we were told that the numbers varied according to arrangements with other establishments; there were eight pandas present when I was there. The staff are all friendly, and all speak very good English. Access is by bus from a site on Hong Kong Island called Admiratly, where combination admission and bus tickets are on sale. The park tends to be busy; it is recommended that Chinese holidays, especially New Year, are avoided by tourists.
perfect for whole family. Ocean park is good for whole family unlike disneyland because disneyland is for kids only. its location is also good and its quite big also.

Too Commercialised. This is the third time we have visited Ocean Park and now that the building has been completed it has been transformed into a mega Fun Fair , all facilities included in the price which for a young family is an added bonus.We always enjoy visiting the Panda enclosures and seeing the Dolphins perform , each show is run every 90 mins and worth the trouble of gaining entry.

Always a winner with the kids. Always visit on our trips to HK. The staff were super friendly and helpful. We forgot to take nappies for our 4 month old so the staff rang around to each other to find out if anyone had spare nappies in the first aid areas. Lots of baby feeding/changing facilities here so that was a big big bonus for me.Always recommended for a family visit to HK

Not impressed. Service staff are good and speak English. We took the cable car from one end to the other. The cable car ride is about 10 mins and not for the faint-hearted. The queues are extremely long and we waited about 1 hour just to get a cable car and this was on a weekday!Loved the animals though I thought there'd be more to see.Go early if you want to take the rides and spend a leisurely day there and wear comfortable shoes as the place is huge and there is A LOT of walking.

Adventure Zone .... Ocean Park is a must visit place while in Hong Kong . Not because of its rides ( that one can find in other places also ...) , but because of its breathtaking view from the Cable car ...One can see some parts of the city , the sea , the islands , the yatchs , and of course the ocean park itself ...Its a nice and comfortable experience ...but a real adventurous experience for the ones going for the roller coaster rides ... One such ride is where you are kept inverted at a height for some time and then brought back ... Not my cup of tea ...Aquarium is good and gives a wonderful insight and experience on the sea creatures / fishes .You can find a huge collection of soveneirs that you can buy from Ocean park . Wonderful ..A highly systematic and convenient systems inside the park .Enjoy !!!

Great for kids. Overcrowded is the only way to describe this place. After queueing for a long time just to gain entry, everything inside is set up for kids and large tour groups. As we are a couple in our sixties, rides were hardly of interest to us. The dolphin/seal show has been cut back considerably since our last visit. The new areas are the polar and rainforest areas which are both good and worth a look.

Awe..... Wait for it.... Some. This amusement park is huge! Had tons of rides and attractions. 1 day is not enough if you want to try every ride, sad that its only open till 7 pm.. Some of the attractions were far apart, i mean like a 5 minute walk apart, your feet will definitely hurt after you visit this place too bad there isnt a taxi or something inside this park. Their restaurants were a bit pricey for their meals, good thing there is a mcdonalds inside the park. Overall this place is definitely recommended when visiting hongkong especially if your into amusement rides.

Crowded for rides, great aquariums. The place was extremely crowded. There was an unbelievable line to take the cable car to the main part of the park. The rides were very crowded, but the aquariums were surprisingly not very crowded. The variety of sea life was very impressive and well done. The food was okay- they have opened several higher end restaurants recently, and things were edible (very picky kids) but not anything you would go out of your way for. The bathrooms are much better than before, but still dirty because of the huge mainland tour groups who use western toilets as squats and make a mess everywhere.

A place for the people who enjoy rides!. I like everything except for the rides since I am afraid of heights and roller coasters. If you have little kids with you, I won't suggest this place. This is good recreational place for teens and adults. Surely, there would be a lot of activities they can enjoy. I think one of their highlights is the cable car which is one way to cross to the other mountain. I tried this but can't help myself crying. :-)

Nature meets Theme park rides. The aquarium on the hill as it once was in the Seventies. Created to help marine science and conservation with an educational bent. Gradually this park has added white knuckle rides and candy floss, plus a bit of twee olde Hong Kong nostalgia to become a park for all seasons. However, somehow the combination works and for a young family the Nature of which there really is quite a lot from dolphins and seals to tiny marmosets and large sloths is exotic and intriguing. Plus there are those rides so loved of children of all ages.The Park certainly has a bit of class and pulls off the odd mix with panache. It probably helps that the design and setting has good taste and the staff are personable. Go early, head straight over to the hill and work your way back to the entrance.
Average. Staff needs to be trained and adhere to the standard procedure to deal with tourists who push-in instead of keep serving whoever is good at pushing in or pretend they can't see it happening.

A walkway to excitement. Everywhere you look,something is happening,all the park has tooffer is very good and well done.Only one downfall is the volumeof people and the queues you stand in, some about 300-400long,we waited sometimes 2 hours.I was saddned to not seethe orca on show with the dolfins.A real all round spectacular place to go

Just fine. 1) Too many people spoiled the excitement at Ocean Park.2) Spacious place with the long distance among attractions are quite a burden.3) Suitable for teenagers and elder people.4) For my family and I, Hongkong Disneyland is better.

Great fun. This is a fun place to spend a full day. The cable car up to the theme park gives a great view over the whole area and bay. The dolphin and sealion show is well done. The rollercoasters are decent and there are plenty of other rides and things to see and do including some pandas. Bring food and water though as it's a rip off inside like all parks.

an excellent day out. Ocean Park was better than we thought. It is a massive park with plenty to do for all ages. There are rides catering for all ages and very varied. There is also an aquarium which was cleverly designed as you start at the top and work your way through passages of many creatures down to the bottom. There were other creatures to see in the rainforest area and north and south pole areas and also pandas. All animals seemed content.There are also cable cars getting you from one area to another but these are not suitable for anyone with a fear of heights as they go along a hill edge and there is a huge drop below into the ocean. Amazing views from the cable cars though. There is also a viewing tower for those who like to feel a bit more stable.I would recommend this place and we all had an excellent day out.

the best rides in asia. we went there aand i went on the rollercoaster at 58 years old i must be mad, however, it was an experience, some of the main land chinese who where their came and asked to have their photo taken with the brave westerner(stupid more likely) this is not for the faint hearted believe you me never ever again, the rest of the park is excellent and well worth the trip, you can get there by bus if you want to the number 6x stops rightin the car park

Don't miss. Great value for money only £23 per adult and for seeing giant pandas, dolphin / seal lion shows and lots of great rides with zero ques before twelve it's one not to miss, great value for money even just for the cable car ride it's worth it! I m normally tight but the park owners should charge more it's worth more than the current ticket price.

Mind-Blowing!!!!!!!!!!. An amusing Park.To get to Ocean park Nearest MTR is Admiralty. When you get off at this station you can follow the sign board to the bus (Exit B I think, bus no-629) to Ocean Park. You have to buy the bus ticket which costs HKD10 each way per adult. Advisable to purchase return ticket.For Park ticket they can be purchased online and you get the voucher which can be exchanged for tickets at a separate counter dedicated for online/vouchers. Alternatively you may buy the tickets at any 7 eleven. Cost is the same everywhere HKD240.Or stand in the long queue and purchase ticket at the entrance directly.Park has 2 sections. The summit and other one has the Panda/old town and etc. etc… suggest to do the Summit 1st when you arrive. As all the staggering rides are here.We enjoyed all the rides except space ride. It makes you feel giddy. Or could be other reason as we did all the rides and this was the 2nd last.All the rides are worth waiting in the queue. Wonderful Hair Raiser, Flash. Rev Rooster doesn’t look that great but once you sit you have a great time. All rides are mindboggling.Wear you most comfortable flip-flops or any comfortable footwear it’s quite a good walk whole day.To eat you have quite a few options. 1hour before the park closing they have light and water show. Do not miss. Its once of the best thing. Try to stand to the right side where you have the small boats in water you will not get wet and you can shoot the entire water show.Rest you may explore yourself, why wait go ahead enjoy!!!!!!!!!!!

Older Doesn't Always Mean Washed Out. I honestly enjoyed Ocean Park more than Hong Kong Disneyland; maybe I found Disneyland too "kiddie" for my taste, and Ocean Park had something more to offer: I loved the cable ride, the Hair Raiser rollercoaster, the pandas, the Grand Aquarium, the Ocean Express train ride, even Aqua Bakery and its goodies.

Fun and enjoyable day spent. Went there in December 2012. Advisable to buy tickets online or at various supermarkets across Hong Kong as if you buy at Ocean Park, you have to wait for very long. I waited for nearly an hour as I did not buy using these methods. The park is very fun and enjoyable. They have this long cable car ride which gives u breathtaking views. The park is very huge and has many exciting rides. Many locals also recommend this place instead of Hong Kong Disneyland as Ocean Park is cheaper and have more things to do. Tickets costs about 290 HKD. Its suitable for people of all ages.

Excellent Theme Park. I went last year with my girlfriend and have a great time there. The cable car ride has a nice view to take pictures. The rides were good although I think I'm getting too old because I felt a bit afterwards. Halfway through the day it started pouring so we had to cut the visit short. I actually reckon this was better than Hong Kong Disneyland from an adults perspective. If you have kids I would say HK Disneyland would be the place to go but nevertheless you can't go wrong with either if you take your kids. When I went I didn't see any mascot's if they don't have any they should, it would be more appealing for the kids

Don't miss this place.. We were going to go to Disneyland but decided on Ocean Park instead. Glad we did. Great place - rides, shows, animals all for about $35 AU. Getting there is easy and the whole place is super organised. Get there early as it gets busy in the afternoon. Enjoy the cable car ride.

Loved this park. Our family of 2 adults, 3 kids aged 2,5,8 visited on March 1st. Had a wonderful day. Older child enjoyed thrill rides and animals. Smaller children loved the Whiskers harbour! There were not huge queues and we were able to have rides on everything we wanted to. The dolphin and sealion show was a highlight. The arctic blast rollercoaster was the perfect introductory rollercoaster for the 5 year old. The pandas, penguins, arctic foxes, toucans are a really neat addition to a theme park day. We spent the entire day there and definitely recommend staying to see Symbio. Symbio was more impressive than HK Disneyland's fireworks! The souvenirs are pricey, as is the food. They let us take in drink bottles but stopped us taking in our fruit and biscuits. If you've been to any other Disneyland, and have to decide between HK Disneyland and Ocean Park we recommend you go to Ocean Park. It is a unique attraction whereas the Disneyland is the same experience you can have at any Disneyland.

I can't believe I went.. I only went to help out a friend with her young daughter and son. I'm not the greatest fan of amusement parks. Ocean Park was a surprise. First it is immense, like Disneyland it has several distinct areas. Take the cable car, let me write tat again: take the cable car! It is spectacular...incredible views, distance traveled, I really can't find the right words, but it put in the right frame of mind to enjoy helping to take the kids on rides and enjoying them. The design and engineering isn't Disney, more lie a big State Fair. It was a good time, less costly than Disneyland.

Park with an excellent view, rides, and displays. Love the park, with animals, cable car rides, displays with taste of HK, and roller coaster rides.All in one 'themed' park with excellent view of South China Sea. Great one day trip for both adults and kids.

Rides not so great but aqua show and aquarium worth seeing. If you are used to going to US or European theme parks then the rides here might disappoint you slightly but the dolphin/sealion show was great and the great aquarium was good too. My favourite thing of the day was the jellyfish section they were lit up with multicoloured lights. I took some awesome photos.
Ocean Park. Nice for having fun in the park with crazy rolercoasters and also something to learn and see about the oceans and their habitants...

Ocean park HK. Myself and my sister visited ocean park in January and overall we though it was great. The animal enclosures are astheically pleasing, with heaps of room for park visitors to veiw them. It is quite a big park spread out, so wear some comfortable shoes! The entry price was pretty reasonable considering the amount of rides and attractions. My favourite ride was the hair raiser :)

excellent!!! i had so much fun there! someday i'll be back to ocean park hongkong.. even though so many people there when we were there at 12th february 2013, and the queues are crazy...but it's worth it. the grand aquarium was excellent, fun rides, i haven't explored all park. someday when i get back to hong kong, i'll be back to ocean park.

A nice park with blend of things to do. The first thing that impressed me at Ocean Park (HK) is the good distribution of focus on habitat and amusement. Its spread over a vast area across one tall hill also makes sure that the waiting time at any one location is not large. One can keep moving on to other options if any one is croweded. The evenings are a mix experience at the park, as when pretty late, most of the rides gets less visited and its a good time to quickly get to participate in them. The new Artic section is very well done, and same goes for the newly added rides. My family is addicted to here that we are now Gold Members for the second year.

Very well organized. This is a combination amusement park zoo aquarium .It is well designed and spreads over a ridge with a scenic cable car ride connecting the two main segments.Obviously the place is very commercial with stores and restaurants at every corner.The redeeming feature is that the fish and animals are healthy,very well displayed and that the vastness of the site allows for the crowds to disperse and be bearable.There are some stars including pandas that are quite active.The aquariums are impressive and clean.The show with dolphins and seals is a bit corny but clearly is aimed at children.Altogether well worth a visit.

A fabulous day!. Went on this visit begrudgingly but I am really glad I went. I went just after chinese new year and even though there were still a lot of visitors from China the place never felt crowded.We had at most a 10-15 min wait for the rides and the rides themselves would equal any of the Disney theme park rides.The cable car ride is amazing and the views from the cable cars are stunning, definately a must for any visitor.The aquarium is the best I have ever been in (and I've been in a few throughout the states) the array of fish and Hammerhead sharks, brilliant!We loved the Dolphin and sealion show but get there early as the ampitheatre fills up quickly and holds several thousand people and the panda's are definatley worth a visit.The park was spotless and very well run, my only complaint was I didn't have enough time in the place and would get there earlier and allow more time when I visit again.
loved it!. Excellent entretainment for all ages and great price ! Have to go ! Fun rides, amazing views, places to eat and shop. Loved the Panda bears !!!

Fun! Fun!. We spent 8 hours there and it wasnt near enough! There are many things to see and do. Exhibitions, rides, shows etc. Our family of 4 (2 adults and 2 children) had so much fun. Park are well kept and maintained. We went on a workday and waiting times for rides etc was around 5-10mins. Staffs are helpful and plenty of instructions and signboards for guidance. Money worth spending!!

Great place!. We spent about half a day here, it was not long enough.. I have been to 3 different Disney Lands, and also Disney World in Florida... I would call Ocean park the best. If you visit here dine at Neptune's Restaurant it has an indoor aquarium and the fish are amazing, you will also see a diver swimming around in there as well. The food is pricey but good. The rides are amazing Roller Coasters on a cliff who would have thought! But this is Hong Kong and everything is always done on a grand scale. Ride the tram to the top for all the big rides, the view is something else. When you are done there you can take the tram back down or the better yet take the Ocean Express.. When i saw this train my first thought was Harry Potter. Also visit the panda's. All in all we had a wonderful time here and will be returning next year to spend a full day.

Exciting rides!. I've been here a couple of times and always enjoyed myself. Strongly recommend going on a weekday if possible. I never had to queue more than 5 mins on weekday in May! Get your tickets at the airport to avoid a long wait to get a ticket at the park entrance. Also, wear comfortable shoes because it can be a long walk between rides and some pathways are uphill. Give yourself half a day at the park.

Giant theme park. I went there with my family and the original intention was to see the panda (ying ying and le le).It was easily reached by bus from Admiralty station, and it is hugeee!!Apart from the panda, we saw a lots of show attraction, riding roller coaster, and there is even a long ride by cable car or train to separate the section. It took us a whole day to see the whole theme park. This feels like zoo and theme park combination. There are a lot of nice spots for picture taking.note: grab a map on your entrance to check the show schedule!

Ocean park- fantastic. We opted for ocean park over Disney because we wanted the bigger rides but ended up being overwhelmed by the animals. Fascinating and beautiful animals displayed amazingly, we got so close. Add to that the amazing cable car ride it was a great day out

Very very Big Theme Park!. When we reached Ocean Park Honkong, I never thought it was really big place. We had so much fun there. Although it was quite tiring during the walks there and here, it was still great! You can purchase the tickets in the entrance and get a map of the place so you wont get lost. I suggest to go the other side of the mountain first before explore the site near the entrance. It's best to ride the cable car first going to the other side so you can see the whole place. When you get to the other side, enjoy the rides, watch the penguin show and then you can go back to the site near the entrance through the underground train. You can find the location via map. Enjoy the place until the closing, don't go home yet before the closing they have this 3D show in the fountain area. It's really great, better find a good spot for it, (The front near the tables is really a great spot.) Then enjoy the performance, it's around 10 to 15 mins. It's breath taking so don't miss any of it.

lots of mainlander. This is a fun place to spend a day in Hoong Kong. If you have one. Nothing oriental, ordinary theme park. Couple of thinks based on views. So you just go high and look around. You can feed animals or use roller coasters. Or any of lots of things. You can go to the winter zoo, there's a pinguins, bears and other anmals, you can go to aquarium. Lot's of things. But lots of mainlanders as well. You'll see.
Pandas!. Well worth the visit purely for the Pandas. Didn't particularly go on any of the rides just loved looking at the animals. Clean place and great for families!

Ocean Park. We were there the week of the Chinese New Year so to say it was crowded is an understatement. But still very impressive but be prepared to queue. We got the bus from Admiralty MTR (1st queue), but you are moving all the time. Strongly suggest buying tickets ahead of visit (at a 7-11 store) or another major queue when you get there. We decided to catch the cable car to the far side of the Park first which took over an hour - but you are moving all the time. Once over the other side we went straight for a coffee where we had the most stunning views of the bays and South China Sea. We were not interested in the rides but wanted to see the animals. Amazing exhibits in good surroundings. We loved the penguins, walrus, pandas, and the very impressive aquarium. And never thought I would be so taken by an exhibit of jellyfish - very clever. Well worth a visit, but avoid their public & school holidays if possible.

Best value theme park i have seen. paid $250 for a ticket to this place (compared to $400 for HK Disneyland) and was pleasantly surprised. It really has a lot packed in here for the money. There are rollercoasters and rides, a zoo, live performances and also an aquarium. Its split into 2 parts and you need to take the cable car (or there is a train if you dont like heights) between them, which itself is very nice and gives you a good view of the islands. Ate in the chinese restaurant here and the price was reasonable and the food was good. As i visited during the chinese new year, the place was heaving, there was a lot of queuing involved for some of the attractions but then again hardly any elsewhere in the park. A tip would be to get in early and head for the other side of the park and work backwards ( i headed for the rollercoasters early just in case there were queues later). Another tip is to take the cable car over to the other part but take the express train back, when i was there, most people seemed to go for the cable car back and there were huge queues. The train however, seemed to be a lot more organised, still queuing involved but it moved along nicely. The final bit of advice (if you are still there) is to watch the fountain show at 7pm before leaving the park. I was on my way out when i heard the announcement so stayed on to watch and wasnt disappointed. Overall good day out for family and friends.

Kids loved it!. We visited Ocean Park for only one day. Big mistake as it takes at least 2 days when you have young kids! Really reasonable entry with no queues. The queues for the rides looked long but moved quite quickly. We really enjoyed the cable car and dolphin show. The kids loved the rides and shows. A favourite was the water display and the remote control boats. We ate at the panda restaurant. Wasn't cheap but the food was generous in portion size and fresh. The kids meals were huge and included spaghetti bolognaise, fish and chips, fruits salad and jelly. I had the pork dim sum and it was divine. Totally recommend the panda buns filled with warm custard.There is lots to see and do. The rides are endless and there are numerous animal shows to see. The cable car was spectacular and the ocean train was fun (designed like a submarine experience). We all enjoyed it but will definitely spend 2 days there next time!

A day full of fun.... Located on a mountain top and surrounded by sea from three sides this place is an absolute visual delight. The place is divided in two parts. The base area near the entrance consists of an aquarium, a theme market named "Old Hong Kong" and few other small attractions. But the real fun is on the mountain top which is connected to the base through cable cars. The cable car ride to the mountain top is an exhilarating experience in itself. All the rides are exiting but the most notable is "hair raiser" the floor-less roller coaster. The rain forest section is also good fun. Staffs are friendly and amenities are good. Food options are limited though. If you have kids you may stop to enjoy the live shows performed at the base area.I also liked the "Old Hong Kong" market which showcases heritage of Hong Kong and offers plenty of local traditional food. Though the place becomes very crowded on weekends in particular. The long queue for the cable car from the base is an irritant. Overall the place is extremely enjoyable and big enough to keep you occupied for a whole day...Being located far off from the city centre it not connected by Metro yet. Though I had seen metro work in progress when I had visited this place last in mid 2012. Big Bus has a hop off/hop on point near the park gate.
Fun and educational. Aside from the great rides, there was much to learn about the many animals. We enjoyed the park very much.

Best theme park in the world. The queues for this place are horrific but if you havent been before it is worth the wait. The park is divided in two. One half is centred around a giant acquarium which is quite spectacular. A cable car or underground train connects the two halves. The queues for the cable car are long but I believe worth it. The other side would be fantastic if your daughter is 1.2m tall or even better 1.4m tall. Unfortunately my daughter is 1.18m so the only ride she visited was the tantrums!All in all a thoroughly enjoyable day out, although my feet are in serious need of a massage now

Biggest Park ever..... Very well organized, big crowds during chinese new year, but all in a perfect order, great show with the dolphins and adorable pandas, we had an unforgettable time, will probably come back cause its very big we have not seen it all...

Saw my first panda!. Had a great day here, the park is a great mix of zoo, aquarium and theme park! They had it all decorated for Chinese new year, and the animals have some of the best enclosures I have ever seen! Well worth the visit!

What's not to love!!. People this is Ocean Park!!!! Visited Jan 2011 and was like a big kid. So exciting and ever ride was going except for one that was being built, can't wait ti go back and conquer that one. In Jan the queues were a little long but the waiting time depended on the what ride, the more popular the longer the wait but most rides you were on in 15-20 mins.
Something for everybody!. From the cute Panda to the mighty Sharks and from the thrill of the coaster to the fun of the games, everybody can find something to do!

Pandas!. Went on a weekday and did not find the lines were too long. Overall, a very enjoyable place to spend a sunny day. It's not just for families with kids! The aquarium and "amazing Asian animals" section near the entrance is fantastic. The 4 pandas were incredible to see up close and the staff were very knowledgeable and friendly. Everything was well-kept, clean, and organized. In the other section of the park (up the mountain) also has some animal exhibits -- a north pole and south pole section. Remember to bring a sweater, because those areas are kept quite cold! I loved the penguins and the artic fox. Very cute! Dining options are okay -- of course everything is overpriced, but the beef soup noodles I had at the Panda Cafe were decent (80 HKD). If you bring a picnic, there are some good public areas with picnic benches where you can sit. The cable car is a must, however this was the longest lineup of the day. We waited about 40 mins. At least they have umbrellas along the way, so you aren't getting sunburnt while you wait! The view from the cable car was spectacular! On the way back, we took the tram, which was way faster although less scenic (it goes through the mountain, so it's just a tunnel of darkness). We did not go on many rides, because just looking at all the animal exhibits can take up the better part of a day. Still, despite the expensive ticket price, I felt this was definitely worth it.

Better off going to Disneyland. We went to Ocean Park over the busy Chinese New Year and the crowds ruined our experience. Our children spent 95% of their time waiting in line and everyone, parents and children alike, felt as if we wasted our day. We would have been far better off buying 2 day tickets to Hong Kong Disneyland rather than spending one day in each theme park. Disneyland is a huge step above Ocean Park in terms of quality and also has very good systems to handle large crowds including posting wait times and scheduled fast track line options for the most popular rides. Disneyland has a global brand name to protect. Ocean Park needs to try better to emulate its more savvy rival. If you decide to go to Ocean Park anyway, do so on a work day and hopefully you will have a better experience than we did.

A Place which represents Hong Kong Island. First of all I am a typical HongKonger, born and spent my own social circle in the Hong Kong Island, or you may find my comments not mutual. I didn't go to the Disneyland, or big buddha in Hong Kong, but honestly Ocean Park is a benchmark of Hong Kong Island. A must to go!Try out the cable car: that is safe and fun, and you would see a side of beautiful of Hong Kong Island, you have to try it.If you come over during October, they would have a theme which called "Haunt House", and only opened for that during the night. many Halloween theme haunt housed and you would have a good time there, tickets should be booked in advance.Only one more opinion, please don't watch too many dolphin shows there. As too many mainland chinese come here and keep watching the dolphin shows, they made the dolphin over work everyday (almost 6 shows a day, due to the HK articles). It is very sad. It would be seriously harming their routine life. Be a animal lover.

Plan it on weekday !(full day). Be preaped for walking... get comfy shoes ( dis holds true for entire hong kong trip).. They have 3 /4 main sections ...dnt miss panda and aquarium..then thete is summit..uf you are a ride person then you willl love it..Hair raiser is must do ... they have separate line for single rider..( which was shorter)...it is really scary...:P... i have done lot of roller coasters so skipped mine ride.. space one and river one are cool... long waits beause of new year holidays... but wirth a visit..we grabbed sandwich on the go..dis was tiring day ..one mention to mainland tourist.. they are worst among asians in terms of que ettiquets..even old ladies were pushing throughout..it was really irritating...

Great idea, poor management.... The idea behind the park -which involves not only entertainment but also education - is great, but it fades away the moment you actually live the experience. Food Court and Restrooms are disgusting (people spit ALL over the bathrooms, men and women) and there's no regular cleaning of the tables where you were suppose to eat. The attractions should be more organized: people skip lines by jumping or running in front of others. The translation of this is mismanagement. The park is NOT for kids under 5 years and there are no rides or attraction that make it unique. An average park, with dirty bathrooms and poor service management. Instead of wasting your time and money here, go to Disney Hong Kong.

Worst Theme Park experience...be prepared or drop it !. We spent our CNY holidays in HK with our 2 kids (7 & 9 years old), enjoyed all places visited except Ocean Park - horrible, we wasted 1 precious day.Positive (I try find - to be objective as much possible)- Big park with lot of rides.- Roller coasters (Hair raiser - this is the one you must ride).- Nice view with cable-car - but not as nice as Ngong Ping 360, of course.Negative (again, very objective)- Very very very...very crowded.- Long long long...long waiting queues (up to 2h30!). Boring, no "themed" queues like in Disneyland.- Majority of PRC tourists - be prepared for no manners: pushing, cut lines etc...total dis-respect. I have seen many disputes of locals complaining about PRC tourists attitude. Myself also had to remind 3 times a father with his 2 sons to stop pushing us and trying to over-take us - incredible.- Park separated in 2 areas - must ride cable-car or train...with additional queue to go there and...to leave the park ! Never seen that in my life, I would like to explain my and many other tourists frustration to the park designer!!!- Bad organization - inefficient staff.- Rides not for small children (min height) - don't understand so strict, no problem for similar ride in Disneyland HK.- Few places to eat, poor variety, mainly snacks (restaurants are for the "rich" - over over priced). And guess what? You even have to queue for 15-30min to have a simple snack.- Far distances between the rides, prepare for a "marathon" day, up and down, not flat field (thanks again to the park designer).I know this was during peak season, but we visited Disneyland 2 days before, and the experience was totally different and within our high expectations. OceanPark was a total waste of our precious holiday time. Pls make a favour to yourself: erase this park from your list. Disneyland is around 40% more expensive, but you come back from there with an happy family and the feeling of not haven't been ripped from your money.

Scenic Thrills. What an enjoyable way to spend a day! Thrill rides, plus unusual animals and a great view of the surrounding water and islands. Make sure to enjoy a cable car ride to take advantage.There are pandas and penguins and a large aquarium tank, and feeding times are public. There are live shows -- we saw a wonderful Chinese drumming performance in celebration of the New Year, plus a travelling dragon dance.The Hair Raiser roller coaster is amazing: twists and turns and loops at high speed. The other large roller coasters provide thrills, too, and there are many other stomach churning rides.Go early in the day to visit some attractions before the crowds arrive -- it's a popular place. Bring your walking shoes and your water, because it is quite spread out.

very average. the ocean park is a very average experience. It is too huge and the terrain is very unfriendly when you have small kids along. there is nothing spectacular in the park which you would not have seen before

Worth a visit. A visit to Ocean Park was enjoyable for the viewing of the aquarium and the giant panda exhibit. There was an hour wait for the cable car so we took the train up and used the cable car for the return trip with only a ten minute wait. Younger visitors seemed to be enjoying the variety of wild rides at the park.
Super Fun For the family. One of our favorite places to visit on holidays and long weekends. It just keeps getting better and better with familiarty

Such a big park to cover. There are rides, feeding sessions, shows..therefore upon entering make sure to grab the map nd show schedules to plan your movement..lots of walking uphill and downhill, especially to see the dolphin show and to go to the cable area..bring umbrella and your own water..I didn't see any drinking water refill stand in this park.

Loved it!!. Ocean Park is wonderful!!! If you love animals and want to combine seeing the pandas with a few thrill seeking rides you will love Ocean Park.Ocean Park is very easy to get to on the MTR and be prepared for lots of walking if you want to see everything. There are two panda areas. The first one near the entrance was absolutely packed (even though we had arrived early) and was more a case of 'click a photo, move on.' There is a second area further back which we stumbled on and was pretty much empty. Just us and the pandas so we could enjoy their antics without the crowds. The penguins were gorgeous and the air conditioning was a lovely respite from the heat.Ocean Park is very well laid out and extremely clean. Eating options are limited with many of them being stalls/stands. We found an indoor cafe which served very average food at high prices. Due to the lack of shady places to sit and eat this was our only choice on a stinking hot day. I agree wholeheartedly with many reviewers regarding the rudeness of visitors from Mainland China. I was almost physically pushed out the way by a rude older woman who just glared at me when I told her not to be rude and wait her turn. Be prepared for their pushiness as it can spoil your day if you are not used to it. Overall I would visit Ocean Park again but maybe in winter next time!

Fun for the whole family. Rides for all ages, dolphinshow with humour, lots of walking, clean, helpful staff, colourful, great aquarium (we got to see the diver feed the fish!), good choice of restaurants and shops. All in all, a very good day out! The queue at the busstop to get there seems long, but there are so many busses going there, so don't need to wait long. Very well organized.

I chose this over Hong Kong Disney based on the locals. During my 90 day around the world trip (see my blog: www.toscanoworldtrip.blogspot.com), I visited Hong Kong. During my stay there, I wanted to do something my daughter would like as we had already visited Lantau Island (something I wanted to do). I was faced with the choice of Hong Kong Disney or Ocean Park. I was about to choose the familiar Disney but many locals (even the Concierges at the upscale Hong Kong Shangri-la Hotel) convinced me to try Ocean Park, in that it had a more local theme, was less expensive, less crowded (very few non-Chinese tourists) and had many interesting attractions. And they were right! Only about a 20 minute taxi ride from central Hong Kong, the park is set on a beautiful hillside which makes the coastal water views from the park and the rides and on the cable car, very beautiful. They have very interesting and fun rides and a Chinese market section as well as more local food concessions than typical fast food franchises. It was definitely a different experience from your typical Disney and while you can always visit a Disney, you'll have to visit Hong Kong to visit Ocean Park.

Pandas and walrus made the day!. My 14 year old and son and I didn't think much of Ocean park. It was towards the end of our stay and you just get sick and tired of the pushing and shoving by other tourists, especially when in lines. If it weren't for the giant panda and amazing walrus we would have totally written the day off.

NOT for children under 122cm tall. Poor experience. Although the lineups were not as bad as disneyland, we had a 3.5 year old (who is quite tall for her age), and a 13 month old. Disneyland catered for both children with all the rides. Ocean Park was clearly for kids aged maybe 7+ years old, to be allowed on any rides to start with. While we went to Ocean Park expecting a Sea World (Australia) type experience (instead of a theme park with rides), we were disappointed on that front too. Ive seen just as good, if not better, animal displays in zoos in Australia, and at Sea World. The few animals there didnt take that long to meander through, which left you the choice of going on rides (not if you have young kids), or queuing for ridiculously long times to see one of the shows. The guide booklet for the park did have minimum height requirements written down for each ride. We realised that one of the ONLY rides our 3 year old could go on was right at the bottom of the park on the other side- which we couldnt see was accessible (with a stroller) on the escalators that go down and down and down.... so we were pointed around a ramp/walkway that would allow us to get down there. Im not joking when I say we were walking around the side of the mountain for half an hour. Then we we got 5 minutes away from the ride someone told us that the ride was closed for maintenance. We couldnt get out of the park fast enough. Probably wouldnt return even when the kids are older, just a bad experience all round.On another note, the signs were very unclear in their directions for wheelchair and stroller access- I cant tell you how much time we wasted going in circles and asking staff who seemingly had no idea either.

Get ready for the awesome rides!. We spent the whole day at Ocean Park....the verdict...if Disneyland has the theme rides....then Ocean Park has the thrill rides. Our favorite...definitely the Hell Raiser...two thumbs up. The view is spectacular while riding their cable car while their dolphin and sea lion show was just ok. Plus factor also are the presence of escalators located on the mountain side. Plenty of cool and screaming rides to choose from and their marine aquarium is just great!!!!

Be prepared. If you had been to Singapore's Universal Studios, you could give this a miss. Rides are very toned down and there's nothing much to see. Plus, the heavy influx of PRC tourists make gave it a bad experience with all their pushing and shoving and cutting of queues. You, can go, just be prepared. I wasn't.

Too huge!. There are a lot of attractions, and the park is really huge. You have to spend a whole day if you really want to go around the whole park. We were there from 10am-6pm, yet we are not able to visit some part of the park.For me, Disneyland is a better place to visit.

The othe side of HK. Just an entertaining and awesome park...the Aquarium is superb and it is a kid's paradise...One day in not enough and i strongly suggest the park owner to raise the price because if on monday it is too crowdy, imagine during the week end...

Overrated -no comparison to Disney!. Before entering the park I had the mindset that Ocean Park was going to be awesome and outrank and beat its fellow counterpart - Disneyland, due to reviews I had read. I had planned my holiday in Hong Kong so that the best would be saved for last, so our last day would be spent in Ocean Park, how wrong I was! On its own, the park is good but when compared with HK Disneyland, I would be leaning to Disney. If you are tossing up which park to visit (and you don't have time to visit both, then the following information may help you). Negatives (when compared to Disneyland):Very spread out, you have to walk quite far to access attractions and rides. The 'summit' area has little linked circuits and many dead ends. For example, we had to walk down a slope, then two long escalators, a flight of steps and a path to reach the mine cart roller coaster. There was nothing else down here so we had to go all the way back. About 10/15 mins sent just getting back up. Valuable time that could be spent on rides!The terrain is very up and down. People with mobility issues, not good with walking will have difficulty here. So many stairs, it puts you off visiting certain areas as you know you will have to walk back all the way you take to get to the attraction. Where as in disney there are not dead ends, everything is flat, there are limited stairs (maybe a couple here and there), attractions are closer together = more time spent on rides. I didn't find the staff as helpful as Disney members were. Many staff struggle with English, yet they work in a popular tourist destination? For example, we decided to have a hotdog for lunch and went to purchase be from the hotdog cart nearby. I wanted a normal hotdog, my brother wanted a signature hotdog (aka. Hot dog with extras). The man who served us had no clue what a signature hotdog was. He told us he only had one type (in very poor English - he seemed very confused by our order), yet the people before and after us, had the signature dogs. He had to check with someone and still told us there were no signature dogs when clearly on the board they said they had them. We just gave up and my brother had the plain one instead.The eating places around the park were limited. Yes, there were heaps of places to eat, but many of them sold the same thing as each other. I found Disneyland had more variety. One of the major issues I had with this park was its inefficiency in ride preparation. For each ride there are waiting bays with numbers to organise the next riders while the ride is in progress - well that's what they used them for at Disneyland, the staff here had no concept of waiting bays. Instead they would waste time by allowing people to wait in a massive line, then guess a rough number of people who would fit on the ride let them through to CHOOSE their seat. That is a problem in itself - people chop and change their mind and change seats while you are trying to find an empty one. People literally push to get the 'good seats' - the front and back. I don't see why it is done this way when it would be more efficient to have people waiting and being told where to sit so they are ready to get on the ride. I found this quite frustrating.One last negative (just because I am really picky). The queuing area was non-stimulating. At Disney, the queues are themed to match the ride and there are quite a lot of different scenery to look at as you progress through the line. Ocean Park however, limits their scenery to metal chains and poles. Positives:Symbio - the water/laser/firework show at night was great and is almost on par with the equivalent at Disneyland.There are a huge selection of rides accounting for various age groups. There are more roller coasters here then at disney.Little queues for this time of year. Highly recommend travelling in winter. I think the longest queuing time was about 20mins. Animal sections were great. All of them were active and on show. The red pandas were especially cute. There is spectacular scenery, especially from the summit area. Very good for taking photos. The cable car ride to the summit is also VERY worthwhile. I know this review seems highly negative, but many people had told me prior to my visit how much better this park is to Disneyland - so I had huge expectations when I saw how fantastic Disneyland was run. Ocean Park did not live up to these expectations, but in saying that, I still enjoyed my day (as tiring as it was), the rides and the night show. I'm not saying don't visit, Im just giving you all the facts so you know exactly want to expect and don't end up as disappointed as I was.

Great Day Out. My partner and I spent an entire day at Ocean Park and enjoyed the day immensely. We went there on a tour I organised via viator and when the guide told us we would be there from 10 until 5, i initially thought that it was going to be hard to fill in so many hours but, happily, I was proven to be wrong as there was plenty to see and do during the time we were there. We decided to go straight to the upper park via the cable car. This was a great experience and we got great views of the surrounding area. The upper park included lots of attractions, the highlight probably being the dolphin and seal show. The whole message behind the show is about humans respecting the oceans and its creatures and although some people criticise these sorts of shows, we were impressed with the genuine care and affection the handlers showed towards their charges. We also enjoyed the time we spent inside the polar display and got a good view of the penguins. Other highlights of our visit included viewing the pandas and the red pandas who were very active and quite enchanting. We had a very nice lunch at the terrace restaurant. It was very tasty and not at all expensive and the view from this area is also stunning. As others have observed, this park is quite hilly but if you are reasonably fit, getting around is not difficult. We also visited in January when the weather was quite mild - I imagine it would not be quite so easy to get around in very hot weather! We chose to visit Ocean Park in preference to Disneyland and were very pleased with our choice.

Went to see the Pandas. What a fabulous park! We went in thinking we would see the Pandas and leave - but no - we stayed for hours. Pity we didn't have our grandson with us as he would have loved it. I hate cable cars but I did ride this very very long one to the top. Did not see much with my eyes closed but my husband said it was spectacular. Lots of animals to see, rides to go on and nice food. Well worth visiting even without children. we loved it. HK$560 for two. Around NZ$100.

great for older kids and adults, not so for 4-6 year olds. The roller coasters here are insane! They are pretty much off the top of a mountain, and are great fun. However, we went with our 5 year old daughter, who loves roller coasters (she did the ones in HK Disney the week before) and she was not tall enough to ride on all but one of them. She was also to young for the 'swim with' attractions - swim with the dolphin, sea lion, etc. We had a good day there, but it would have been a great day if she was taller. In fact, we probably would not have gone if we knew going in that she would not be able to ride most of the attractions (and there are some great ones). Another note - we ate at Neptune's restaurant, in the park. It is AWESOME! HUGE aquarium, so you eat while watching over 100' x 50' (my estimate) of hammer head sharks, sting rays, sea turtles etc. Good food, too, overall this meal was a highlight of our 3+ week trip. Lastly, be prepared to WALK. A lot. Up hill, downhill. Take the cable car to get from the lower park to the upper, and back again, its better than the train. We went on a weekday, the weather (Jan 2013) was perfect for the day, high 60s Fahrenheit. There were NO lines to speak of on any of the rides, which was great.

The Pandas are wonderful here. This is a well established theme park which seems to have recently undergone a make over. It has a combination of younger children attractions, some wild rides (for the teen group) and a small but well maintained animal section. We really came to see their giant and red Pandas and we were not disappointed. The Panda section is in a quiet corner away from all the noise - in fact you would not know you were in a theme park and the enclosures are designed that you feel you can reach out and touch the animals, they are so close.
