We also went to the Polar experience where we saw seals and penguins - they even provide real ice for them to sit on - wonderful (but take a jumper it was freezing in the exhibition) We arrived about noon - and the park was quite quiet - however at about 2.30pm it suddenly filled up and the queues were huge.The park is easily reached from a No 70 bus to Aberdeen.

Rides and animals!. This is an impressive property-even if just in how it exists on a challenging piece of land. A few good rides and a lot of animals. Good fun if the weather is right! Bigger, less expensive than Disney.

Overall fun and exciting. I have been going to Oceanpark since I was 4 years old. (I'm in my late 20s now). It is a very exciting place to have fun, very educational too. Everytime I go back there, there is always something new. The animals they have are trained!!! Even the otter and the red pandas. The must sees are the panda, penguins, cable car, aquarium and the animal shows. The downside are the queues that can get very long and some rude tourists. Didn't enjoy the food as well. Worth a visit. Recommended to go there on a weekday to escape from the crowd.
Had a wonderful time!!. Well worth a visit, but plan to spend a whole day there.Dont eat in "Pandas Cafe" the worst food during my 10 days in Hong Kong.

A poor excuse for a theme park. We had heard lots of great things about Ocean Pak, with some even claiming it was better than Hong Kong Disneyland. Perhaps it was this that caused us to be so greatly dissapointed. The rides felt run down and in need of repair. The park is split in to two areas and you need to take a train or cable car to get from one to another. We tried the cable car as it looked like the views would be great travelling across the mountain, however after a one hour wait (with impatient kids) the only thing we experienced was fear from a cable car that felt like it would collapse over one bump. The biggest issue I had was that my seven year old was not able to go on many of the rides. This was especially frustrating as he could ride every single attraction at Disneyland and Universal Studios in Singapore. Perhaps it's due to the poor construction of the rides. I would personally not recommend to anyone.

Had a wonderful time!!. By other countries theme park standards, I must say that Ocean Park is still very good, worthwhile and nice for whole day visit. The park price inclusive of all rides is priced right. The rides are varied and exciting. Some rides are new and some are standard fare but still with it's resident panda and other animals, the big informative Aquarium plus the scenic cable car ride and much much more, you get a lot to explore and try you won't notice that you have already spent a whole day in the park. Although the park has been hongkong's attraction for several years, I must say it's still a must see.

Go to see the pandas. We had a day to kill in Hong Kong beofre catching an evening flight to Canada, so thought we would go to Ocean Park - expecting to see an aquarium. However, it is so much more then that... The best bit was seeing the pandas as we had not realised there were any in Hong Kong. The park is very spread out so you have to take the cable cars to get to the other side of the hill, but the view from them is fantastic. Lots of roller coasters and flume type rides to go on, and when they say you will get wet they are not joking, but it is all part of the fun, and you dry out pretty quickly in the heat. The bird show is short but worth going to see, you can get the main gist of the talk even if you do not understand chinese. It is the first time we have seen a trained vulture. We brought our tickets at the bus station on Hong Kong Island, then caught the shuttle bus, which saved standing in line at Ocean Park itself. The price was the same. Well worth a visit, but plan to spend a whole day there.

Ocean Park HK. The park is divided into two main sections. The main entrance is on the Waterfront (lowland) side and is linked to the main section on the Summit (headland) via a scenic cable car ride and a marine-themed funicular train called the Ocean Express.an Excellent mix of education and fun and has fantastic sealife section,great rides for all ages,relatively short queues an like others and has competitive price.

Aquarium + Themepark in one. A good aquarium, with the normal range of fish, including sharks and stingrays. Also had a few less normal aquatic creatures, like penguins, seals and a walrus.Plus it has a selection of roller-coasters and other themepark type rides.Overall good value, I'd recommend.

few fun moments in long waiting queue. we were group of 6A and 5C, celebrated last day of 2012 at ocean's park. started early in the day, thinking of crowd and it happened so. purchased tickets just after coming out of MTR, not from official booth, but from the vendor. had to be in bus queue for 5 min or so.... then a journey to 20 min. reached to ocean's park, with huge crowd awaiting to enter. once entered, was horriffic situation. volunteers not able to control the crowd and no correct information was available. there was jam-packed queue at every ride and thus made all ride impossible. fortunately, we've started reverse way. every one was going to cable car, we took the train... gone to adventure land and hurray.. able to take twice the ride. then came to swing and roller-coster way. over there also less crowd. had gala time in those rides.but then till noon, all rides had 45 to 60 min waiting time and volunteers were getting rude. so thought of taking break.later during sunset, reached to highest peak time and had kudos to 2012's last evening.....

Interesting. A great day out. We went by taxi, but there is an MTR Station in construction which will make transportation to and from Ocean Park easier. A great mix of animal enclosures and rides. The Cable Car ride was a highlight. Easy to get around the park - there were people in wheelchairs and elderly immobile people working their way around the park too.
Great value for the money. Too crowded but this is a theme park! Lots to do for all ages and they put up a few great life shows. Just seeing the pandas is worth the price of the entrance ticket

Great value and lots of fun. We went here twice while in Hong Kong with our teo kids 11 and 12. We stayed in HK for about 10 days and went here about half way through.Kids loved the rides and I loved the pandas. We went on a few rides with them too. We didn't see all of the park first time, it was reasonably busy. I recommend going in cable car to the top when you arrive. Leave the bottom area until later. Then take the Express Train back down when you are finished as the lines for cable car are very lengthy later in the day.As another person mentioned, great cafe/coffee shop down the bottom sells pastries etc. the only decent coffee there. We stopped here just before leaving.We then went to China and came back to HK for a couple of days so we promised kids another visit. A very busy day (Sunday) but we saw many more rides and they were much braver and rode the fast rides.Great value compared to Australian theme park prices.Very easy to get to by bus, always plenty if buses when ready to leave.I love HK transport system, very efficient.

Quite fun and convenient to get to. We were there mainly for the penguin encounter, overall it was fun to meet the penguins (always exciting to get up close to animals) but for $880 it was not that worth it. The majority of the time is spent on boring classroom talk (an hour), then 5 mins watching the penguins get weighed and maybe 5 mins out in the exhibit (we were dressed in black and white penguin jackets for display in the exhibit too). Feeding was not by hand but just thrown in the tray which the penguins don't like very much, they prefer being fed by hand or thrown in the water which we weren't allowed to do. I guess in order to protect and respect the penguins not much can be done, but for 10 mins interaction with them and $100 for a photo it was just less fun than I expected but a special experience nonetheless. We didn't go to all the rides or the Whisker's Harbour (kiddie zone) but I would assume 4 hours would cover the whole park (especially on a weekday). I think a must-do is to make a reservation at Neptune's Restaurant at the aquarium and request the corner tables which are exactly by the aquarium wall instead of just looking from afar. The aquarium was absolutely the highlight for me and I could spend all day there just watching the huge manta ray and sharks swim by. Food, as expected was quite awful, but an absolute must go for lunch or dinner. Then I would suggest heading to the panda exhibit if there's not a super long line and then taking the cable car over to the summit side (seems like more people take cable car back at the end of the day) and taking the ocean express (10min ride) back when you leave. Once over at the summit you could plan around the shows according to schedule and exhibits (very small exhibits, with no lines each would probably take 5mins). The less scary rides had the longest lines (rides at Adventure Land, whirly bird swings, arctic ride, bumper cars, raging river rides etc) so probably best to go to the ones you really want first, and jump on the scary ones on the way (hair raiser roller coaster, the flash etc), by around 5pm most tours have left and you could probably go on all the rest of the rides very quickly before rides close at 6pm (park closes at 7pm). Overall great fun, the park is very easy to get to (very close to town), and rides and seeing animals are always fun.

Great Fairground for the young. There cannot surely be a better fairground in Hong Kong. There are many great rides on the upper level, which can be reached by a wonderful cable car ride providing excellent views of the surrounding bays. There are seal and penguin enclosures, though these are relatively small and seem to be in subdued light providing a less than enlightening experience. On the lower level there is a large aquarium although the crowds make viewing difficult at times. The best exhibits are the pandas largely because they seemed, during our visit at least, to be largely ignored.At the entrance to the cable car is a tacky area described as Old Hong Kong, which is an excuse for fairground games with simply hideous prizes.One bonus is the little cafe to the right of the entrance, which is passed by by the coach loads of trippers, where you can get a decent cup of coffee and a snack.Overall, this is a great place for young people but an average experience for seniors, who do not get any senior concessions unless they are Hong Kong residents.

Good time. This is a fun theme park to visit. It reminded me of Busch Gardens, since it had rides and also animal exhibits. There are a couple of very good roller coasters, pandas, penguins, etc. A good place to take the family for a day. We went on a weekday and it wasn't too crowded.

Worthy whole-day!. We were there last year for a fun vacation and yes, it was FUN! Since it was during holidays, the crowds are huge thus most of the restaurants were full. I love the two black & white pandas while my friends love the rides. We miss the dolphin show, but we still had alot of fun. In short, this is a place suits for everybody. Worth every penny for the whole day!
Excellent. Ocean Park is The BEST!!! I really liked it!!! I went with two of my Friends (Leo & Rohan) and my dad (Michele).

Best theme park in HK. My family of 4 loved Ocean Park. We loved how there were so many different things to see and do. Seeing the pandas are a must! We also went to Disney, Ocean Park wins hands down!!!

Okay. We spent 4 or 5 hours here , mainly to see the Panda bears. The crowds were enormous , a lot of pushing going on . So it was not as relaxing as I thought it would be. They have some very interesting exhibits . You get on a cable car ride that takes you to the top of the hill and here they have a lot of the rides .A roller coaster set into the side of the hill . We personally did not do any of the rides , still suffering from jet lag .But just enjoyed walking around .Had a meal in a restaurant / cafe at the top which was nice and had a nice view to Repulse bay I think . It would be a good outing for children but for us it was pretty average .

Fun and educational Eco-themed theme park.. It's like a zoo+theme park with nice ocean view. Highly recommended for both adults and kids. There is a stall selling the best grilled cuttlefish I ever had, not found outside ocean park.

too many people with slow turnaround rides. unlike Disneyland, this place is like a mess and very confusing and pack with people. the queue line to buy something or getting on the ride are not so nice, some people will try to cut in the line, very bad manner, never thought will see this in Hong Kong. most rides are taking to much time for turnaround, like getting it/out. end up we spent so much time on queue while taking only a few rides.not really recommend this place, unless you have time left in HK and find nothing to do.

Pandas live here!!!. Pandas are indeed the big draw that allows this amusement park to compete with Disney. Closer to City and yet many things to do at nearby Aberdeen....suggest a dim dum excursion at Aberdeen to avoid crowds on weekend--everywhere else in the City.

Rated as world's best theme park in 2012. Ocean Park is a great park to visit with rides, cable cars, and a lot of things to see, plus its featured Ocean Show. It is keep on expanding. Will recommend it.

Simply Fantastic. Not only for kids, the rides will excite everyone. But too crowded during the new year season. But the climate was very good and the cable car ride and roller coaster will sure capture our heart.

One of the best ever. Ocean Park is one of the best theme park I ever entered. One day tour is just not enough where there are lot of attractions that cannot be missed out. The animal kingdoms including big aquarium, panda zoo and penguin are among main attraction here. Further up using cable car, excitement are waiting for those who want to challenge their adrenaline rush with exciting rides. The one that cannot be missed out is Ocean Theatre show with awesome Dolphin and sea lions show.

Pretty spectacular. Spend a all day in the park and it was simply amazing. Don't miss out on the fantastic aquarium and in the Panda area...simply spectacular!!! The Hair raise ride was...omg...the most incredible ride ever!!! I loved it!!! Don't waist too much time in adventure area, pretty basic and not worthy. Overall an amazing day out despite hundreds and hundreds of other tourists. A must see park if you like rides and animals.
another theme park. Kids and teens will enjoy going here. Yes, there are several rides, but nothing compared to Six Flags.

Fun for the kids. Very busy on a Sunday,but us Kiwis are not used to crowds like the crowds in Hong Kong. We caught a bus to the park from one of the metro stops and also bought our park tickets there at the bus stop. The trip is not long so jump on a bus and stand to avoid the wait for a seat. The rides at the park are tame if you have done Disney or Universal Studios or I suppose Six Flags but one or two of the roller coasters still provide enough of a thrill for the boys! We loved the penguin, seals and the aquariums here and the pork buns in the old Hong Kong section. Our two teens enjoyed themselves and the cable car is a great ride for them. A good family day out and we are glad we went. Bus service to and from the park is efficient and the park and facilities are very clean as we have found them always to be in HK.

Adventure at its best. The visit at Ocean's park in Hong Kong is unforgettable and one of its kind. One can never forget the journey to Ocean Park and the adventure involved in taking the rides at Ocean Park. Also, the entry fee is worth it when you spend a day at Ocean Park, Hong Kong. Must see place.
Panda's !!. Great day out , stay till the end and watch the water and light show.The park have 4 pandas which are just wonderful could have stayed and watched them all day .

Best theme park in HK. If its Ocean Park vs Disney world the choice is simple - Ocean park.The views are amazing due to its location on a coastal mountain range, this along with the cheap price is what sets it apart from other theme parks I have been to around the world. The rides are good, look new and have a wide variety. Impressive selection of animals, pandas, snakes, monkeys ect The food is average however very well priced for a theme park.Entry price was about half what I have paid for theme parks this size is the past and it was superior in quality. The day I went it was overcast but not raining, Saturday and in autumn - All ride waits were under 12 minutes, many had no wait times. Bring a raincoat as you get wet on some rides.
A very fine Park. We both enjoyed it. The pandas alone were worth the trip. Lines were not bad except for use of the cable car. Weather warm and sunny that made the main shows more enjoyable.

Amazing! Hair Raiser!. fantastic visit, we came on a Saturday- a little crowded but fine. we got here by a 15 minute taxi from central, and from there we got our tickets and went to the cable car. I personally think the cable car is better than the train- but it's just my opinion. once we got to the summit, we went on the hair raiser. it is a fantastic ride- with no floor. very thrilling but not for the fraidy cats! next we went on the bumper cars- a lot of fun with family. we did a few other rides, but then we went to Bay View Restaurant for lunch. very nice, but a bit to fancy for a casual weekend. but I must admit- the food and view were spectacular! we then finished off with with a few good rides, and went back on the cable car. of you visit regulary, get an annual pass- it saves a LOT of time!
Better than Disney. Ocean park was far far better than Hong Kong Disneyland. Would highly recommend it. But try to on a week day and early in the day to avoid the large crowds.

Fun Fun Fun. We were with my 2 and a half year old son so we just went to enjoy the cable car ride (which had breathtaking views) The rollercoasters seemed like fun and I will definitely try them sometime in the future. The Aquarium is amazing -- so much fish and big fish to see-- its a great place to take a toddler and of course the fountains were a lot of fun for him too.
Must see. This is a must see destination. But be prepared to spend the entire day. The aquariums are excellent. If u ask me i would opt this than disney land.

Not just your usual amusement park!. It's not just your 'usual' amusement park where you try the rides and have your pictures taken with mascots and stuff. What makes it special is that it has so many attractions to see like the big aquarium, the Panda area and the cute goldfish area. It's like an amusement park AND a zoo! Heck, it even has a live dolphin show inside! Since the whole Ocean Park so big, there's also a cable car inside, which is an amazing experience! The only thing that bothered me was that there were TOO many people. As in, you CANNOT try the rides without waiting for at least 1 hour (we went there on a Saturday; try going there during the weekdays)! It is also very big, which can be quite tiring after 3 or more hours so be prepared to do lots and lots of walking...

A must if you have Children. Ocean Park have made some great changes in rescent years, gone are the days of the tired 1970s park and replaced but a park truly there amongst the world best. Fantastic attractions for the animal lovers . The aquarium and polar adventure areas are superb.

Definitely worth it!. Just the cable car rides to and fro to get to each side of the park make this trip worthwhile! This place is amusement park meets zoo! Lots of fun on the roller coasters and other rides, plenty to choose from. Great aquarium and shows. Even enjoyed the section 'Old Hong Kong' where they made a mini-town that was dressed up like Hong Kong from the 50s and 60s. Try the caricature artist in this section (converted to around $20 CAD and had it laminated there for cheap) because he's really talented.

Great day out for all ages!. Spent our last day in HK at ocean park, and had an absolutely fantastic day! We caught the cable car up to the summit first thing, which I would recommend as you get to go on the rides with no queues! The views were spectacular (not for the faint hearted!), the rides are great, something for everyone. Plenty to see in the way of animals too, the enclosures are great, really enjoyed the polar areas and aquarium - get to walk underneath the huge tanks! The dolphin show is well worth a see, amazing animals ( get a seat near the front). And definitely catch the light show on the way out at 7pm, topped off a really great day! Not just for kids, two 25 year olds had great fun!

dedicate a whole day for this trip. even before we went here, my best friend and i have been checking which one is better, disneyland or oceanpark? she really wanted to go to disneyland and i wanted to go to oceanpark, we even came to a decision to go to both places, but i think one amusement park is enough for our entire trip.. so had to do some little digging/ research. and a little birdie told me that disneyland is more kid-friendly amusement park, and the rides are more likely to be enjoyed by kids.. so ocean park it is..going there is easy as 1-2-3, take the central mtr to admiralty station and just look for the exit where the ocean park bound bus is waiting. even purchasing the ticket is easy, no long lines... once you enter , you'll see this huge structure painted with blue and yellow color (if my memory serves me right), its the grand aquarium (one shouldn't missed) the tour starts at the shallow part of the ocean and the different creatures you'll see in it then it goes deeper and deeper.. its a huge mistake to go there on a half day, we weren't able to see the penguins and the pandas, but we rode the cable car twice, if your into dolphins and seals, they have scheduled shows there... but if not you can just skip this attraction and move on to the other (i got bored after 5minutes), the park closes at 6pm (for those who did the day trip)...oh and did i mention that i find the escalators in the mountaing everything just shuts down at 6pm...even if weren't able to go to some of the attractions here in ocean park, its still pretty awesome... just wear really comfy shoes when you go here, because you will do a lot of walking... have a great trip everyone :)

Over crowded. Made the biggest mistake of going there on 1st May - a public holiday (Labor's day) Was crowded like hell... could not enjoy a single ride or even dolphin show... Watching fishes was a great experience

A place for young and old!. A pretty interesting place to visit, didn't know what to expect except for the dolphin show. We watched the 3.30pm show and it was interesting to see how tame these dolphins and sealions are. Ticket entrance is HK$280, but we brought ours for HK$20 cheaper at the train station. Be prepared for the crowd at the park as mainland people are rude, harsh and loud. We took cable cars ride up and the view is breathtaking! You can see the sea view and it was simply beautiful! Yes, definitely will be back in a couple!
fun day. ocean park is great for all ages, a bit like sea world on gold coast aus but larger . a short reveiw but much better for teens than disney .note bring your walking shoes .

Thrill to bits. Plenty of dedicated bus to/from Ocean Park. Very efficient service. Best theme park for everyone. It's a big place. It can handle the huge crowd and very spread out. The view is worthwhile on the cable cars. So many rides that you need a whole day there. We were there from opening time to closing and we still missed a few things. Fantastic and wicked Roller Coasters. It's not all about rides, there's lots of animal and marine exhibits too. Stay till late and watch the dramatic fountain show. It's unforgettable.

Great day out at Ocean Park!. Our family (including 2 teenagers) had a ball at OceanPark! Loved the pandas & the rides! Was worth thewait to see the Laser Show at 8pm! Easy to catch thetrain & then bus from Kowloon! Be prepared for lots ofwalking! Great day had by all!

Good rides, nice scenery but lousy dolphin show. I like the Ocean Park. It has nice scenery and you can see repulse bay as well as the other coastal settlement from there. Do take the cable car ride. Although it's scary like hell, but it's really a good way to appreciate the scenery of HK island south. The rides were fun too, very suitable for teenagers and couples. Also, they have a number of enclosures and aquarium. Quite nice i must say. The jellyfish one was one of the coolest one I've seen. Also, don't waste time watching the dolphin show. The queue to get in is crazy and the show does not have much entertainment value. It's basically repeating the same stun over the 20-30 mins performance. Catch the bird show instead, although it's in cantonese, you really get to experience the HK culture / life.It's hard to dispute that this park is still one of the best parks in Asia.

Pretty fun day out, but can be done in half a day.. Ocean Park is on the southern side of HK island and is reached by either taxi or a multitude of different bus routes which go directly to it (the new MTR line is schedule for completion in 2014/2015 I think).The park itself is a nice theme park, and is around HK$100 less than Disneyland, so if you're looking for a cheaper option, this could the go. The park layout is split into two main sections, you have the main part of it around the entrance which is home to most of the aquatic and wildlife exhibits and the Summit section, which is home to the parks roller coasters and thrill rides. The bottom part is where most people start and provides some very well done exhibits for marine life and local wildlife. The main aquarium in particular is massive and a must-see. To access the Summit section, you can travel by either the famous cable-car over the mountain, or the new tram/train ride. The cable car is the much more scenic option, but is also normally a lot busier and slower. Would recommend catching the cable car on the way up, and the tram/train back down (much smaller queue usually). The Summit section is the thrill ride part of the park, and has a good selection of rides. The biggest and best of them all is their new floorless coaster, "Hair Raiser". A good coaster and pretty cool location situated on the side of the mountain, with great views out over southern HK island and the South China Sea. Other notable good rides include the Dragon coaster, the Mine Train coaster, Arctic Blast and the Flash. The rapids ride is very average and quite short and the log flume ride was unfortunately closed for refurb during our visit, but looks like a fun ride. The polar walk-thru exhibits are also worth while checking out.Overall, the park is entertaining and fun, but not in the same league as major theme parks like Disneyland and Universal Studios. If you arrive at opening when the crowds are small, you could probably see and do everything within half a day easily.

For animal lovers and thrill seekers!. If you like animals and thrilling rides, then this is the place for you! Loved the roller coasters where you think you're being thrown into the ocean! Pretty cool! Loved the pandas and the penguins. Food in the park though is expensive.

Wide range of attractions and great aquarium. Pluses = great aquarium and jelly fish, range of rides. Well kept.
Minuses = height restrictions for 5 year olds seemed way excessive given the nature of the rides. Food vendor range was limited
Great fun day out. Loved the animal exhibits and the rides. Wish it was open in the evening instead of rides shutting at 6pm.

One day is not enough there. Heard a lot about this park from several mouth and found it better than all description. It’s a huge park with multiple themes. Be it nature walk, zoo or fun rides; everything was available there. In the down the hill part, they have a very Giant Aquarium (3 story tall) with all kind of seas creature in it. It is a real treat to the eyes to see such a colorful sea life, indeed one of the best part of the park. Further, in the Amaing Asian Animal section, lazy Panda’s activities and Red Panda are delightful to watch. Bird shows and adventure show (sky fare) were also good.Journey to the hilltop thru a long rope was is just amazing. Thrilled to see the sea and mountain below the trolley. The roller coaster on the top of the hill (especially the ‘Hair Raiser’) was out of the world and best I ride I had so far.It’s fun to watch playful Penguins, Sea Lions and Walrus in the north and south pole sections. Birds like ‘Toucan Ramphastos’ and fish like ‘Pirhana & Electric Eels’ increases the interest element in the visit of Rain Forest. A good bird eye view of Ocean park as well Hong Kong’s beauty can be enjoyed from Ocean Tower.Several restaurants are available at various place to fill you up while exploring the park. The best part of the park is the Ocean Theater where Dolphins and Sea Lions perform unbelievable activities. Dolphins were very more active and entertaining compared to lazy Sea Lions. This show has typical timings and make sure you don’t miss it any cost.There were several more attraction available in the park and definitely it is impossible to cover the whole park in just one day no matter how early you reach there. Journey back to downhill thru Ocean express was okay but very fast (3 minutes only). The fire, lighting and fountain show as closing ceremony was fantastic.Overall it is one of the best Amusement Park I even been, wishing to visit it again.HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!!

Complete fun package!. You take bus 629 from Admirality station and it takes you right in front of Ocean Park. The park has a mix of wild life and fun rides. There is a theme park uphill which can be reached via cable car (it is a fund ride). Way back can be taken thru Orient Express train.
Okay park. Small park. Not a bad place to visit if you have time. There is not a lot of rides. A lot of walking.

Great park for families. I think this is really a great park with multiple themes in a park. You can enjoy fun and wild life park together. Apart from that, the dolphin and seals show is a must see show when you are now. This park has two section, the hill top and lower ground. The recommendation is to go through the hill top first by taking the cable car. Spending about 6 hours to enjoy and then spend about another 2 to 3 hours at the lower ground park to make it a day.
Visited Ocean Park Jan 9, 2013. At most of the entrance, the Ocean Park staff would asked you to take photo. Later at the exit, they would "paster" you to buy the photo.

3 Nice Roller Coasters. Hair Raiser is a nice, aggressive short Roller Coaster ride. The Dragon is a longer but still interesting Roller Coaster ride. The Mine Train Roller Coaster has nice long drops. All the Roller Coasters have great views of the surrounding ocean bays.On the day we visited (January 3rd 2013) the queues for the Roller Coasters were very short.

A theme park worth your time.. Amazing theme park with lots to see. Take rides and animals to see. This theme park caters to all age group. The rides are pretty thrilling though it can get better. The sights are beautiful. Just that it may be a little crowded at the cable car and some rides might need to queue up to an hour. Buy your ticket from a 7-11 to avoid the long queue at the ticketing counter at the entrance. With so many attractions in one, this makes the 280 HKD really worthwhile. A must do if you're a theme park lover!

NOT MUCH TO SEE, NEED IMPROVEMENT. I visited the park, with my family and my sister in law's family. Especially this time also with my two grand children. Annika 2 years old, knows most of the animals, thanks to her IPad. So she expected much from the visit to the Ocean Park, because we all keep on telling her that we are going to see Panda, Zeals, pinguins, polar bears etc.... But not much to see and rather disappointed. Entrance fees are not cheap, but the animals display are really inadequate. The zeals require more ability to act. I saw development is still on going, hopefully soon it can become as good as the Ancol Park and Disneyland....

Great price, some good exhibits...but tour groups were problematic!. We (2 adults and a 5 year old) had a unplanned last minute trip to Ocean Park, wanting to fill in some time before our plane took off! Thankfully there were some locker facilities so we could pile all our onboard luggage into them and set off to explore the park.It was a little rushed, but we expected that and actually, managed to fit in a fair bit to our 3 hours that we were there. As the admission fees are very reasonable (compared to Australian prices), we were fine with only being there a short time.The pandas were great, as were the goldfish, which we thought were hilarious! The north and south pole exhibits were fantastic, especially our underwater encounter with the walrus (admittedly, there was 60cm of glass between us). The aquarium was also great, especially the hammerheads.The dolphin/seal show was okay...but the crowds, especially the large tour groups, made it quite unpleasant. There was a whole lot of pushing and discourtesy, which was frustrating and did detract from the enjoyment of the day. Not sure what you could do to avoid this, except perhaps expect it and do you best to laugh at the situation.We didn't go on any rides as our 5 year old was just under the height restriction and the kiddie rides were too young for him. Thankfully, we had already been at Disneyland earlier that week, so didn't really feel like we missed out. Food was very average, although we just had a quick snack of hotdogs.Some of the park is a bit 'plastic' and there are certainly sections that could do with some much needed renovation, but overall...it was a great way to spend a few hours and expend some of our 5 year old's energy before a 15 hour flight. It doesn't quite have the magic of Disneyland, but the animals were great to see, so that made it worthwhile. If you wanted to make the most of the park, you would want to be there for at a full day and the rides really cater for those over the age of 8+.

excellent place with good price. All the attraction is good.From the animal kingdom to the thrill rides.The auarium is also good.Even it is not as big as disney resort for me Ocean Park Hongkong is a good place to visit.The facilities they have also very reasonable in price.We definetely come back there again, once we visit Hongkong

super fantastic park. my last visit here was in 1988 and what a transformation from then to now. From nothing much to something brilliant for both little kids and big kids. We had a fun day from start to finish and left absolutely exhausted. We cant wait to return someday to relive it all again. It was a pleasant change to have everything included in the entrance fee. Especially the Giant Pandas. Here in Adelaide, South Australia we also have 2 giant pandas on loan from China but it is quite expensive to view them.thank you Hong Kong.

Good for families. We took MTR to admiralty, then took bus 629 going to the park. We paid HK$300 for roundtrip bus and park entrance. The aquariums were clean. The dolphin show was okay. There were lots of people and there was a long line for the cable cars.The rides look okay ,too but we didn`t try them . Park surroundings were clean with food stalls. The highlight of our visit was our picture with Santa Claus.

Good place- more for families. It is a good place to visit, the panda's, cable car and rides are good attractions. However when we were there two of the big rides were closed. I could see it being alot more fun for families with kids, however make sure they are taller than 140cm for the rides!

Brilliant park!. Just go for the cable car! It takes you up and over the edge of a huge hill top and the view is totally spectacular on the other side as you head towards the other half of the park - quite spectacular. There is plenty to do here - the aquarium is great and has an array of large fish and reptiles, the (new) Polar section is brilliant, the enclosures and pools are huge! You can really get a good view of the animals from above and underwater too. There is a lovely dolphin and sealion show, again in a large pool, and plenty of other animals to see. Giant pandas get swamped (mostly by Chinese tourists taking pictures) so they always seem to look a little weary but they are there and they have nice enough enclosures. There are big thrill rides and plenty of carts and restaurants, and I really enjoyed myself. Also the bus service from Admiralty is brilliant and really well-organised.

Enjoyed this park with my friends. I loved that they have three Kingdoms in this theme park. The lower kingdom featured the water parks with all the different swimming pools. Great for kids but since we were all adults, we felt like kids enjoying the splash in the watersides. The Middle Kingdom is interesting with its Chinese stalls with one stall that reads out your personality based on the shape of your face. It's nice to spend a whole day there

Fantastic theme park for adults and kids alike. We have been to Hong Kong many times but never made it to Ocean Park. The trip we took this Christmas was the first with our 7 month old so we did a few more "kid-friendly" things, including Ocean Park. Our little one is too young to enjoy it, but we had a great day.The highlight was the four Panda bears, but there are also many other amazing animals on display in very nice enclosures that seem to provide lots of room to run, fly and swim.There's a dolphin and seal show which is good, but typical of a water park and many show rides for all ages.An excellent day out for a family with kids or just for the adults who want to see some incredible animals and people shows.

Used to be good. Not any more.. This was my 4th visit in 10 years, and by far the worst, after 4 hours I was so sick of mainland Chinese tours pushing past myself and the children that I couldn't wait to escape. As for the shows and sights, there are more souvenir shops then exhibits and the best part of the park has been replaced by an amusement park with extra charges. Big letdown and not worth a visit or the 80 euro entrance fee for two adults and two young children.Cable car ride and Pandas are the highlights of an othwise waste of 4 hours of my life.
Good day out. This is first time I have ever seen a Panda! They were asleep or hiding when we first arrived however when we went back they were eating and were so cute!

It was not Disney, but it was worth.. I've visit Hong Kong Disney many times, but not the Ocean Park. It's worth my time there. Many things to do there especially the shows of the animals for entire family. The only bad thing is that you may not understand anything in some show even though they narrate in English because the same narrator talk both Chinese and English and their accent may confuse you if it was English or not ...

Excellent. Beat Disney HKG hands down.Wonderful mixture of live exhibits (several pandas and amazing aquarium and sea life to marvel at.) and also rides for those craving a little action and excitement.Food is fairly priced with a range of options but you do not go for the food. Indeed go to the outlets before lunch crowds form.

So much fun, so many people.... As I loved Ocean Park I must honestly say it's full of people. More than you can imagine, standing in line usually takes around 30min and can be longer cause often even if you see 1 person it doesn't mean suddenly friends and family of that person won't appear and from 1 person you will have 10 standing in fronts of you, we even got apologized by staff cause someone from chinese trip just got in our line in moment we try to get to see Panda's. It's impossible to see whole park at one day but it's not only about the people - OP is very big, not only having park with animals, but shows with dolphins, cable car, rollercoaster etc. and if you have birthday you can enter for free but only if you're a resident of HK (maybe something has changed but I'm not sure)There was someone complaining about no typhoon refund - people are not responsible for weather and HK is full of typhoons, if they had to give money back every time there's a typhoon to every person it wouldn't be a good business. Just for future - use a public wifi to check on official site of HK gov about weather warnings - usually you know about afternoon typhoon in the morning so when you wake up you can avoid places like this if there's typhoon on the way.

alternate to disney; shame about the mainlanders. the only thing that wrecks ocean park, or disney for that matter is the mainlanders. I forefront this so that you can steel yourself for it, accept it and take the park for its positive features (and not for those abusing it. I understand cultural differences but, spitting pissing and smoking anywhere you please is not cultural; its lack thereof.) Since it's expansion, Ocean park has become much more feature rich and better for repeat visits. i have a monthly pass and try to go during low tourist times (which is not many). The overall design of human traffic for rides and transport is overall on par with Disneyland. Not an easy thing to do. disney knows their crowd logistics and apparently so does Ocean Park. Especially since they revamped the aquarium and the entrance. Ocean Park has a good mix of rides for the kids and adults; plus the botanical/aquarium portion lets you slow down and relax a little. recommend if you have a day and want to get a variety of park types into one big park. best amusement park in hong kong.

A place to see Penguins... A great place to see aquatic life and north and south pole animals. A must see place if u r in Hongkong. Rides are not for small kids. Cable car ride is exciting. Indian vegetarian food is available at Clowns corner, u have to ask for veg food as no board or sign is there.

A little dated but good to spend a day here. We visited the Pandas, aquarium with the sturgeons from China, took some of the rides and were lucky the queue was not very long as it was a weekday. Most locations has aircon so it was really pleasant even during summer. Heard that the park went through a major Renovation in 2012 so I'm looking forward to visit the park again in 2013! A must go for all travellers.

Typhoon hit & NO refund for tickets. Just after we arrived, a huge storm began, and then a typhoon hit!i was told by the blank faced cashier,"No refunds or 'rainchecks' " on any tickets, even when a typhoon hits!adding to this, most of the rides were shut.The panda bears were in the distance, so no real photo op there either.Im sure it would have been a different story, if the weather was goood! heheheee

Combining Recreation with Education. I haven't been back at Ocean Park for over ten years so I was surprised at the improvement and increase in scale that had been done. I am not a fan of high velocity or action rides as I easily get dizzy. Fortunately, there are other places within the park to go to see animals; both marine and land. The walrus and the pandas were especially adorable! At the higher levels, you have a great view of the southeastern coastline of Hong Kong island and you can do better by riding the cable car. We were not able to complete touring the whole park so come early and be physically prepared.

Do not take kids between the age of 3 and 9 (or under 140cm tall). Great park, fantastic rides, no queues (we went on a Sunday in jan) - a really great way to spend the day. HOWEVER.The roller coasters and other grown up rides are all located in one area - this means a standard family of 4 (with a 4yo and a 7yo) are left in a situation where everyone misses out (or one parent is left looking after 2 bored little ones).The little kids area is designed for toddlers and the rides there are appropriate only for under 3's. it is also about 25 minutes by cable car from the big kids rides.Another annoying point - the fun police.... Hight restrictions on many of the rides are unnecessary - surely it's the role of parents to judge if a ride is appropriate for their kids. A good example is "the rapids" a fairly stock standard ride - but a hight restriction of 122cm.

Ocean Park HK.. Just the place for kids, the young and not so. At least the Panda was out. Clean as too. Despite how busy the place can be there are quiet places for people . Prices, well don't expect cheap.

Has to be the best overall theme park in the world. Crazy mountain top location with stunning views from rides, plenty of variety of rides and shows for all ages, go early to avoid the crowds, probably best done over 2 mornings rather than one long exhausting day. Our favourite was the Jellyfish spectacular, wonderfully bizarre...and the pandas of course!

So much to play so little time. Ocean park is HUGE! Go early.. There's a lot to explore and ride. Look out for the promotion when dining in the restaurant. We had lunch in the Panda cafe. Apparently the food we ordered include a Haagen Daaz ice cream, but yet the cashier did not gave it to us upon our payment. We need to claim it by showing the receipt.
Loved it. Went with our 2 sons aged 10 and 13. We all had a great time on the rides and went back to our hotel absolutely exhausted and with great memories. Can't wait to go back.

If you have time and kids- go!. Ocean Park is a cross between and aquarium, a zoo and a theme park. Really well done. Lots of amusement rides. We had a full day and still didnt see it all. Up to Disney standard. Great for big and little kids. Recommend the cable car - amazing views

Hong Kong's Other Disneyland. Ocean Park is another option when visiting HK. OP is much bigger than HK Disney and some of the rides are quite good and more adult. There is various wildlife on-show here and it is one place you can see the pandas (and I also enjoyed seeing the walrus).On the negative side the food is of a poorer quality and even the western food (like a hotdog) has an asian style to it so if you looking for something simple to eat you might not get what you expect. Wait times for the rides is an issue even when the queues don't seem long. One reason is that they allow for you to take yours bags into the ride area and then store them in baskets. This seem to creates a Benny Hill style drama with people getting on and off and on off and on and off before the rides can even start.The souvenirs (stuffed animals) appear to of poor quality and not to the same standard that you would get at HKD.Overall I think that this is still a good place to spend the day with your kids but like HKD plan to go when it is not packed.

Great place to spend your day!. Went to Ocean Park to see the giant pandas. There is so much more to do as well. We have been to lots of seaworld type parks but this one was different and Is certainly worth a look. We went in December. There were no lines and the weather was very mild.Ocean Park is like a zoo, sightseeing attraction & amusement park all put into one. It is split into The Waterfront & The Summit.Beware it gets very crowded though however it is still very quick to get on rides no more than 10 minutes waiting time on each ride. And the tickets are very great value for money. Must go attraction in Hong Kong!

Great theme park!. My girlfriend and I visited Ocean Park on Thursday 3rd January 2013. It was very easy to get to and we arrived around 11am. We didn't have to queue to get tickets and they cost 280 HKD each. The park is in 2 sections with the mountain in between. A cable car or train links the two. The cable car was awesome, great views and we only queued around 15 minutes for it. I think that we visited on the best day because the weather was clear and from my experience of theme parks it was very quiet. We headed for The Hair Raiser roller coaster which again had no queue, it was really good fun! The park services were excellent and all toilets were well kept and clean. There was a good range of rides for adults and young children and the zoo aspect really added to the experience. Food options were not so great however. We ended up having a Macdonalds because it is normally a safe bet and this was the longest queue we had all day. The other food options just didn't look so nice but we normally expect to eat fast food in a theme park so this was fine. We watched the dolphin and sea lion show which has spectacular views and the show was good, much better than the dolphin show in Singapore! The log flume ride was not working but we did see this on a sign before we got near the ride. I am not sure if the park list ride closures online and we didn't look in advance but this is always a good idea. The only negative incident involved queue jumping where a small Indian boy blatantly walked under the line on the Arctic Blast ride and went straight to the front. No one seemed to say anything so I shouted up and then more people helped move the child to his large family who to everyone's amazement entered the ride queue and all tried to just keep pushing in front of people. Twice I said something to them and they seemed to think they were not in the wrong. After we had been on the ride I informed a member of staff but we didn't hang around to see what the staff did about it but everyone in the queue was getting very frustrated. I just thought I would mention it because it is always something you should look out for at theme parks! The staff at each ride seemed to be helpful and friendly in general.We returned to the entrance area via the train which had no queue and is also an interesting ride for those who don't want to brave the cable car. We visited the pandas and large aquarium. The Aquarium was excellent and miles better than the one in Singapore. All together it was a great day. The park is very different to any other I have ever visited and we were not sure whether we should really be doing more cultural things rather than visiting a theme park but it was definitely worth it. Thanks!

Average Attraction Worth for a One-Off Visit. No repeats.. I have heard mixed review of HK Ocean Park from friends, family and colleagues, so when I went to HK decided to check it out for myself. Don't be fooled by the name Ocean Park. There are also Panda and other fury creatures on display. Animals that don't immediately remind you of the OCEAN. When we arrived it was pretty crowded with bus loads of tour groups what I observed to be from mainland China. I bought my own SLR camera and was taking photo of the kids and all when a staff member offered to take our photo using my camera and then using her camera. Was wondering why she took our photo with her camera which I later discovered she tried to persuade us to purchase those photo with a paper frame of the Park which I felt was not necessary, since we also got our own camera photos. I know they want to make money, but it would make more sense for those without cameras and would like to have a photo as a sourvenir. The park is generally divided into two areas. The Waterfront being mainy the exhibits showcasing the fishes, the oceanarium (it did not live up to my expectation), the Pandas. i.e. Amazing Asian Animals, Lowland Gardens, Whisker's Harbour, The other area is known as The Summit, its the amusement park area which is accessible via cable car or train. The Summit consisit Marine World, Thrill Mountain, Adventureland and Polar Adventure. We took the cable car, for which we had to queue for 45 minutes. The cable car cabin itself was a bit small for comfort but it'll do and aptly sit three adults, two teens. The cable car ride was a test for the nerve for those not in friendly terms with heights. The view from the cable car was magnificent although the weather was a bit hazy at that time. The ride took about 15 minutes with intermittent stop along the way (for reasons never made known to the cable car passengers). The amusement park area looks dated with rides that do not gives the rider much confidence. We tried most of the rides. The rides were pretty much the same with the ones that can be found at Singapore RWS Universal Studios or Malaysia Genting Highlands. There's a Water show - Ocean Theater where dolphins and sea Lions perform tricks etc. What I like best: The amusement rides, the great view from the cable car ride, cool weatherWhat I like the least: The crowd, long queues, Non-existence of Halal Food outlet. What to wear, depending on the weather, our travel was in Mid Dec 2012, thus loose pants/jeans with T-shirt andn covered shoes/sandals will suffice. Bring a small compact camera will do, instead of those big and heavy DSLR camera.If you are planning a visit, this will definitely be a whole day visit. You can basically cover this whole park within 1 day, provided you start your visit immediately when the park opens. For Muslim travellers, I suggest you have a heavy breakfast and bring packed food to the park and skip the proper lunch and straight head for supper after your trip. Queues for Taxi outside the park is notoriously long. We waited about an hour before we got a cab back to our hotel. There are public buses nearby but you need to ask around to know which bus to take to your preferred designation. If you have children in tow, I suggest taking a cab to prevent the kids from being even more cranky after a full day at the park and to avoid the possibiiity of getting lost when taking the public bus which are full to the brim. Overall this park is good for a one-off visit. Not worth a repeat.

Nice relaxing and fun day. Visited Ocean Park in early December when the crowds were relatively small, and didn't have to wait more than about 10 minutes for a ride. They have 4 roller coasters, the most intense one is the "hair raiser" which is probably not that intense if you compare to major theme parks in US/Japan. Also a lot of children-friendly rides as well as many animal exhibits. I would recommend starting as early as possible because in the afternoon from about 2pm onwards, large buses full of tourists from mainland China start to come in and it makes the park much more crowded and the lines get much longer. Also, beautiful views from the top section of the park.

Terrific - Good value, great entertainment and well organised. Following on from Chana2's review we also spent a whole day here and thought it was excellent value. Couple of tips: You can buy your tickets before you go from a 7Eleven which will save you a bit of time at entry; get the MTR subway to Admiralty and the 629 bus there and back which is really easy; most of the food places stop cooking at about 6, so eat early or eat left overs; andmake sure you stay for the 7pm light and fireworks show. We got there at 10am and rode rides and did activities all day. The rides were great, the Jellyfish display is cool and make sure you see a dolphin show.The whole day was topped off by the coolest Panda ever!Probably one of the best days we had in Hong Kong and at HK$280 (AU$35) a person is VERY good value.

A fantastic ride. Its a very well designed park one where the attention to detail is amazing. The rides are all well designed, well maintained and thrilling. we covered the whole park, took the train one way and then the escalators and finally the cable car to return. You can avoid getting wet even on the so called "wet rides" by purchasing a HK$25 raincoat while in que. They make it all so convenient. You have shelves to keep your stuff when you go on rides and collect it after the ride. The roller coasters are wild especially Hair Raiser which goes off the hillside in a 360 loop. Didnt do it. The food choices are decent and pricing is as one would expect. Overall a value for money experience and you can easily spend over 7-10 hours there.

awesome!!. u can easily spend a one full day here.... its has a variety from adventure/breath taking rides to beautiful n super shows... even the rope way is long and awesome scary if used at night...carry some snacks with u, not too many food options were easily available!!

Didn´t expect the chaos!. It was a huge place with many many exciting rides but after coming from Disneyland which was lovely and fun and calm, Ocean Park was a shock because it was chaotic! Chaotic because it was full of loud tourists from China! Once you adapt to the chaos and the noise then only you can focus on what to do and where to go :-) For Muslim travellers, please bring food as there´s no halal restaurant inside and every single stall had Pork or BBQ pork in it. There´s many layers of Ocean Park so come early morning with comfy shoes to get all over it. There´s a seaworld of sorts, rides, aquarium and even the underwater train. I intend to go back again and finish up the rest of the rides we couldn´t this trip!

Don't miss a HONG KONG staple - Ocean Park is for big kids too!. Last time we were here was on our honeymoon 25 years ago and we were glad we came back! I am not one for rides at all but the displays and animals were fantastic. I loved the jelly fish house and the penguin house was really interesting. The show was a little lame with the dolphins but as it was only short I can handly that. The kids (older boys) enjoyed the ride, but the Gondola ride from one part of the park to another is a favourite of mine from when we first came. The park has changed enourmously and there is more to do and it is fresh and professional, with a large aquarium. It continues the theme of the Ocean and does it pretty well for a small theme park.

Seaworld, Dreamworld and Underwater World - with Pandas!. Speaking particularly to Queenslanders or those who have holidayed in South-East Queensland, Australia, Ocean Park is a mix of Seaworld (seal and dolphin shows), Dreamworld (thrill rides) and Underwater World (aquarium) - with Pandas (my favourite)! Go on a good-weather day so you can take a cable car over a mountain from one section of the park to the other (alternately there's a subway ride). To get there go to Admiralty MTR station on Hong Kong island, then follow the signs to exit B - Ocean Park where you can take the regular 629 bus (and also buy tickets for the park) to the main entrance. Allow yourself a full day to see and do most activities.

suitable for older kids. Definitely for older kids,limited rides for younger kids (below 7yrs old). Our activity was limited to animal visit and a few rides only. Not as enjoyable when we were in Disneyland. We used the MRT and bus no 629 to get there from Tsim Tsha Tsui MRT Station. The public transport service was very convenient to use although we have 2 kids (5 n 3 yrs) and a stroller with us. To save time and maximize our experienced at the park, we used the train/tram to get to the uphill park and the cable car to get back to the downhill park (where the park entrance located). We only spent about 4 hrs in the park due to weather conditions and decided to visit the Victoria Peak later at the evening. There is no Halal Restaurant in the park but noticed there is a vegetarian restaurant in the park map (located next to cable car station at the uphill park). The restaurant was so congested, crowded with people when we get there so we decided to head back to the downhill park. We got our light meal at the bakery shop near the park entrance (we bought vege. sandwich, salads n croissant with hot drinks). So we suggest that for Muslims, do pack some snacks for your kids and for your own. Getting from one place to the other is quit a distance .. n the kids complained their feet hurts. At this point, the stroller becomes your life saver.There is a stroller rental service in the park just like the one in Disneyland and they also provide storage facility. Both located near the park entrance. We advice family with young kids, skip the ocean park.. it just not worth it. Maybe sightseeing with the HK tram will be more enjoyable for your little ones n less stressful for yourself.
Exciting Park!. When we were there, the weather was nice! Had good view when taking the cable car rides! Took the train but the cable car was better. Spectacular view. The rides were invigorating.

FUN day out. My sister and I went to ocean park in December 2012. I believe this was a really fun park to visit. We went to almost all the shops and we tried all the games. I believe one day is enough to visit this park but I wanted another day as we did not manage to visit everything because we stopped to take pictures every few minutes. This is more sort of a zoo than a theme park, we saw many animals that we had never seen before such as pandas, dolphins, penguins and others which you can see for your self and be surprised. I just hope they are taking care of those animals. Anyways other than that we truly enjoyed the show on the fountains at night and all the games that we went on. Loved it will try to go back again if possible
Fun ride. It has different kind of rollercoasters, boat travel, aquarium, fireworks show at night 8 pm. Awesome place for people of all kinds (kids/adults)
A park with many HEADS. An Attraction which was flooded with many people. Everywhere is packed sardine and with long long Queues. There isnt much chance for the kids to have rides with such crowds.

great value. we loved ocean park. Value for money! My only things that annoyed me were the Koreans (sorry to offend) but they push shove etc and some of the rides needed a little attention. we had 3 kids under 6 and not many rides they were allowed on, most you had to be 120cm or more! otherwise a great day,

Good Place To Be. This is an educational park where you can learn a lot about the marine creatures. The huge fish tank was amazing, you can see all the big fish swimming around really fast. Next time you see the word "tuna", you would not think of the bread along with it, but a really large fish. You can find other entertament equipment here in the park if you do not mind the queue. If you have not seen any pandas in your life, you can find a pair of them here.

great but go early in the morning. twice I ahve been here with my 6 year old and a friends 5 year old. The aquarium is awesome, the cable car is a long and scenic trip, the raging river ride is fun and lets the smaller kids on. The other rides all seem to be for children over 125cm and they are strict for obvious reasons. The queues are so long for rides . The panda exhibit is wonderful and both times has been relatively empty as was the goldfish display and the Rainforest walk. The animals in the rainforest are brilliant and the Toucan is beautiful. we went to disneyland and our 10 year old thought it was lame compared to Ocean Park. I will go again but be first there so not to queue.

Better than I remember but it isn't to great for a 6 year old. I think this park is really for under 5 and over 8. It didn't really suit my 6 year old because he couldn't go on many of the rides. It is a cool place to go and there are many things we could do but it will be much better in a few years.

Great amusement park. I like this place and recommend it to those wanting to go to an amusement park. Clean with nice rides. Worst part is the rude mainlanders who jump the line and are slobs and uncivilized.

A "MUST" place to visit when you are in HK. I personally like Ocean Park more than Disneyland. It is more suitable for older kids but it is definitely a nice place to visit when you are in HK. The park admission fee is consider cheap as it covered all the rides in the theme parks and including caber car, Ocean express train and seeing panda & all shows.We will sure be back to here again during next visit in HK!

beautiful exhibits, attractions and rides... shows were boring. To get to Ocean Park, we took the MTR to Admiralty Station. Look for the exit to Lippo Center then catch the 629 bus to OP. We bought our tickets from China Travel Service at the airport. (Located after customs declaration. Stall # 4 ; left of McDonald’s) Adult ticket from CTS is HKD 240 and child is HKD 120. CTS only accepts cash. Vouchers were issued by CTS that needed to be exchanged into park tickets at the entrance. There was no line when I went to have the vouchers exchanged. Bags will be checked before you enter but they were not very strict about bringing in food or drinks. We brought along with us some light snacks (chips and cookies) and bottled water without any problem.We were at the park as soon as the park opened (9:30AM during our time of visit - December 28, Friday). We went in the Grand Aquarium (which to me, was the highlight of the park) and the Panda Village first and there were only a few visitors. We did the shows in the Waterfront next from the Amazing Bird Theatre and the Whiskers Theatre. The bird show was just ok- bordering on boring. Mainly in Cantonese but the host/trainer did a little English translation. We did the Sealion show next which was a better. It was translated in English but then the show would not need any heavy translation for you to enjoy it. We had lunch after the Sealion Show and waited for the Whiskers and friends show in the same theatre. We were very disappointed as the whole show was in Cantonese. It was supposed to be a fun and interactive show for little children but we could not understand anything so we left a few minutes into the show along with other park visitors who do not speak Cantonese. I am not sure if there are separate schedules for an English show but I did not notice it on the show schedule hand out.After we were done in Waterfront (early afternoon), we tried to get on the cable car but the line was too long so we crossed to the Summit using the Ocean Express. We went through the Expedition Trail and headed towards the show in Ocean Theatre to watch the show - Sea Dreams. I was surprised to find the show quite boring. I've been to Ocean Park before and I did not remember the main show to be boring. The show revolves around the story of a little girl and her Yeye (grandfather) who dreamt about humans and animals living in harmony. People were leaving in the middle of the show. My kids were nudging us to get up and leave but I asked them to wait thinking the show might climax later... it didn’t. I was fighting to keep my eyes open during the show. The kids liked the North and South pole encounter with all the penguins and sea lions to watch. It was a bit crowded already but still manageable as there were no lines to get in. A lot of thrill rides here in Summit. Rides older kids and teens will surely enjoy. My boys were not interested in the rides. We did want to try the Rapids but had second thoughts because we did not want to get wet. By the time we wanted to exit the park, the lines going back in the Cable Car were even longer that they had to turn away people from getting on. We were forced to ride the Ocean Express again back which also had hoards of people waiting to get on. The lines were long but it moved quickly anyway. If I could do it differently, I would try going up to the Summit as soon as the park opens via Cable Car next time and start my day at OP there. Maybe that way I will go against the crowd and will go back to the Waterfront before everyone else wants to start leaving the Summit. I would give the other shows a miss and probably watch the sea lion and the main show - Sea Dreams (even if it was boring for me and only because it is the main show in OP) or take the other shows as my last priority.

Watch out!. Just like being in communist China, you're herded around the park one way (or it seems like that) with constant safety warnings and music blaring out all the time. Avoid unless you fall prey to the advertising you see everywhere.

Something for all... And more!. From the animals to the thrilling rides... Via the sights from the cable car and viewing tower... ocean park does not disappoint. Excellent value for a whole day/evening of entertainment... Accessible by a frequent and cheap bus!

Love this place!. We had a lot of fun at the sprawling Ocean Park, despite it being peak holiday season and the crowds and queues everywhere. There were lots to see and do. Come early and be prepared to leave late!
amazing place. great value for money, lots of activities, great rides, well maintained exhibits. beware of terrible stink in the exhibit area for the sea lions and penguins tho!

A local theme park packed with China tourist. On a very tight trip hence I could only choose between Disneyland or Ocean Park. No regrets of picking Ocean Park!It's just another amusement theme park like other countries' do have too. However, the cliff side rides and cable car were an exciting ones! Windy and cooling in the afternoon. The rides are so-so, some for the kids and some for the adults too (the extreme one). Food is rather expensive in the theme park (same like any other theme park in the world).A lot of China trips visited the theme park, especially after lunch time. Go there early to enjoy the rides without a lot of crowds from mainland China. They are at times pretty rude (cut the queue, bang into pedestrian just to catch up with the trip leader, push from behind to get into the tram). Just be careful and stay away from them if possible.The dolphin show is amazing! Perfect timing with story line, even the adults are enjoyed too! As usual, the visitors from China seated in front holding a huge umbrella and block those seated behind, beware of it.Overall, if you don't like Disneyland (because it's so small and you find Japan 1 more worth it), Ocean Park is another choice for a local theme park in Hong Kong.

Amazing experience!. Recently returned to Ocean Park for a second visit... and was not dissapointed! The park boasts a wonderful combination of thrilling rides and great animal displays. The cable car ride provides beautiful views and is quite exciting. There is more than enough to keep you busy for a day. The sound and light show provides a wonderful end to the day.

Good Day to spend in HK. Took a bus from Admiralty MTR to the park. Octupus card can be used for the bus fees. The entrance tickets can be purchased from the booth and MTR or when when reached the park.The cable car ride is awesome and the dolphin show is great. During hot weather, it's best to be 20mins earlier at the dolphin show to avoid sitting the hot sun sitting at the lower seats, umbrellas will be requested to be closed, however if the aim sit is to sit close to the stage & performace, just endure the sun. Many rides, interesting exhibits and animals (pandas included) to be viewed.Not be missed when in HK. Should take a whole day if visiting with kids. Thanks.
the best!!. ur visit is not complete without visiting ocean park hongkong.. try their hair raiser and the flash.. their park is unique and lots of attractions

Slightly run down. Having been to Disneyland Hong Kong, personally I think Ocean park is slightly run down despite of having more games than Disneyland. Thankfully, I went there with my wifey as it is not so kid friendly with the up and down surface. The restaurant standard need some great improvement as well; variety not that good. Maybe it's time to do some upgrade work after enjoying a success run for a decade.

Great for older kids between 10-18 yrs old. The park was well maintained, despite being 35 yrs old. We enjoyed the cable car ride and the dolphin show. We couldn't enjoy the rides because we traveled with a young toddler. There were plenty of exciting and thrilling rides for the young teens. So, this park is highly recommended for the "daredevils". Similar to Disneyland, the park and toilets were constantly cleaned and maintained.

Big let down after Singapore and Bangkok. I went with my 6 year old daughter, wife and mother in law, all of whom love animals. We had been earlier to the Singapore and Bangkok to see similar parks. We were terribly disappointed. The shows with the animals were of a very poor quality stand alone, in comparison to Singapore and Bangkok, they looked like rip-offs. The park is also very poorly laid out and searching for food is quite a task. The McDonalds is hidden away with no signages, as if the park wants you to eat that the more expensive food elsewhere.
A bit too hilly for young kids.. It was a good park but there are too many steep hills for young kids or a stroller. Makes for a very difficult day if the temperature is high.

Go there earlier to avoid long queuing time for ticket. Took 45 mins to get ticket. Better go there early.I think ocean park management had put a lot of effort to improve the facilities in the past few years. I'm impress.

definitely not for kids. if you are travelling to hong kong with kids below 6 yrs old,dont go to ocean park.it is not kid & stroller friendly.the rides are for teen agers & the gap between rides is very very far. theres a ride that you have to go down a steep hill before you can ride.my 5 yo kid who was tall for his age was rejected in most rides bec he did not meet the height requirement. my poor 2 yo was also able to ride like 2-3 rides only as there were only very few rides who cater for his age.we also expected their shows to be world class but the marine & bird shows are so boring they were even in chinese so we canot understand. the shows in ocean adventure in subic,philippines are way better..i can proudly say that the shows here in ocean adventure are really worlds class;)

A lot to do for kids and even more for teenagers. The journey to Ocean Park itself is an adventure for my two boys. They certainly enjoy the double-decker bus ride. Almost everything in HK is efficient. The tourism industry is certainly well-developed. Pains has been taken to ensure that tourists can get around efficiently. Getting to Ocean Park is good proof of the government’s conscientious effort. At Admiralty MTR Station, visitors can buy entrance tickets to the theme park. That will save you the hassle of queuing at the park itself. Even if you have not bought the tickets, do not fret. There are many counters at the park to ensure you get a ticket quickly. By 10 am, gates are opened and visitors can enter to have fun. There are two main sections in this theme park. The new aqua city is interesting. The aquarium is very nicely done. The home for the famous pandas is lovely. We like the cable car ride and the train that will take visitors to the other section. There is a mock-up of olden days in Hong Kong. Sad to say, the shows are not too fantastic. The management tried to incorporate some values in the shows but unfortunately, they were not done in the most interesting manner. Given such wonderful environment, the shows deserve more attention from the management. Another room for improvement is the array of food available at the park. Somehow the kiosks do not sell a wide array of snacks. I cannot even get milk there. Isn’t the park targeted at kids? Many kids still drink milk, especially when there is no good food available.

Get there early. After reading other reviews I decided to take my family of four to ocean park early. We arrived there by taxi at 9.30am and went straight to the cable car terminal to the back end of the park. This meant we had a great time on most rides with no crowds. By 1.30 after a quick lunch at middle kingdom the kids had their last roller coaster rides and we were done. We took the ocean express back to the front part of the park and spent the rest of our day squashed in with the thousands who just seemed to arrive from nowhere. I'm glad to say we were out by 4 and back in our apartment in kowloon by 5 using the double decker bus to admiralty. A must if traveling with family but go early.

Ocean Park day after Christmas. Park was a great value; downsides---the lack of discipline exhibited by others in traversing the lines on the popular events. Most disturbingly was the tram ride through the mountain; pushing/cutting etc. The troller ride around the mountain to the park on the other side--longest and most scenic in my life.

Great Jelly fish exhibit. We have been to lots of seaworld type parks but this one was different and Is certainly worth a look. We went in December. There were no lines and the weather was very mild. There was a lot of rides and heaps of exhibits including giant pandas and red pandas, sea lions and seals. There was a exhibit just dedicated to goldfish - I had no idea there were so many varieties. The penguin enclosure was also a liitte out of the ordinary as parts of the floor were transparent so the penguins swam under you. The large walrus was in an enclosure that allowed us to walk under it and stand in glass domes that were placed in the middle of the enclosure. At one stage he lay over the dome and we were able to get up close and personal! My favourite was the jelly fish aquarium. It was very dark, and contained many tanks packed with jelly fish (many of them iridescent). The tanks were illuminated with lights which slowly changed colors. It was amazing and so different to any aquarium I had every seen. Definitely wirth the $280 Hong kong entrance fees.

Go early, there's lots to do!. I last went to Ocean Park years ago, when it was a tired and poor cousin to Hong Kong Disneyland. But my recent visit (really due to my 4 yr old) was a pleasant surprise. My little boy didn't want to leave! Some highlights:1. Warm coats for the Penguin enclosure - that was really cold (near 0 degrees?) and we weren't really prepared for it. Also, watch out for the penguins swimming under your feet. That was a nice touch in enclosure design. ;)2. Get tickets beforehand if you can - we made a last minute decision to go to the park, and the ticket lines were really really long! 3. Bring a poncho or waterproof coat for the log / water rides - the park now has 2 water rides, where you get a bit wet. Particularly in winter, the coats will keep you dry while allowing you to enjoy the ride!4. Young-kid-friendly section - there are rides for younger children at the lower section of the park. The older kids will enjoy the thrilling rides up the hill.5. Take the cable car early - the assistant manning the line told me that the line taking the cable car DOWN the hill starts building up from 3.30pm. That's when the wait grows beyond half an hour. We beat the rush just at about 3pm.6. Prepare transport pickup to avoid end-day taxi line - that was the worst part of our trip there. Families leave around that time, and the line for the taxi was almost 45 minutes for us.

Over-crowded and needs makeover. I had high hopes before visiting this park. Boy was I disappointed. Firstly, there were just too many tourists in the park (perhaps they should consider a threshold), to the point where people were shoving and pushing around (when getting onto the express train to get to the summit of the park or looking at the animals/fishes).Secondly, I feel that the park needs some refurbishment/ makeover to keep on par with other world class theme parks such as Disney or Universal. Although its concept is inherently different from the major theme parks, the park should continue striving to better itself and remove decorations, shows or infrastructure that looked a tad dated.Some plus points: great Chinese food offerings and excellent goldfish display (my first time).
