Good time to be had for all. Went to Ocean Park to see the Giant Pandas. There is so much more to do as well. Went on a few rides, enjoyed it. Although there was a lot of people, being a Sunday, the lines for rides were not bad at all, especially the more adventurous rides.

A theme park with a lot of added attractions such as North Pole region. We paid hk$280 each to visit this theme park. U can take a bus 629 at admiralty mtr station to go direct to ocean park. We spent the whole day there to view all thr attractions including a dolphin and sea lion show. Remember to take the cable car first to avoid long queue.
Don't come here on school holidays. Nice place to spend time, especially for seeing pandas, penguins, etc etc because i haven't seen one before. But so crowded.

Liked it better than HK Disneyland. I've been to HK three times previously and always thought of Ocean Park as a poorer cousin to Disneyland. Since I 'avoided' Ocean Park previously and we were looking for somewhere to go during this latest trip, we decided to head there.We paid S$138 for two adults and two kids. A few tips for first timers:1. Arrive when the park opens at 0930 hrs. 2. Head straight to the cable cars to the other side of Ocean Park. The early bird truly catches the worm - you can go for multiple rides on the same attraction before the crowd catches up with you. 3. Give the show at the Ocean Theater a miss, unless you're watching sea lions and dolphins for the first time.4. If you leave when the park closes (or near closing), be prepared for a long wait if you are taking a taxi. A safer bet would be to take the bus.

Great place to spend your day.. Ocean Park is fun. So many places to check out, so many attractions. And most of all Pandas :-). If you're looking for somewhere to kill some time or escape from reality this is it. Rollercoastera, restaurants, shops.

Excellent place. Good place to visit with family . It divided into two parts. An advice for those who wants to go there , we should go to 2nd part of ocean park first then only continue with d first part of ocean park .

Great acquirium but more mainlanders than a Chinese border crossing. We spent an afternoon here. Yes, the acquirium was great. But you can't overlook the 100,000 mainland tourist (which, in case you don't already know, means 100,000 screaming, pushing, yelling, littering souls). We walked to the Deep Water Bay beach afterwards and sat for several hours to recover our sanity.Easy to get to, and free entrance on birthdays.

Best theme park in Hong Kong !. Second time to Ocean Park and we are still wow by the many new attractions ! The park is simply too big to be covered within 1 day. On the 1st visit, we covered the kiddy rides, panda, shows, aquarium and cable car as my son was just 3 yrs old. That took us almost a day. On the 2nd visit, we covered the adventure land, mine train, raging river, cable car, ocean express train, panda and the gold fish exhibit. That took us almost a day too ! My son is 7 yrs old now and he could ride most of the rides as he was 1.23m.To maximize our experience and to avoid the rude tourists, we adopted the strategy below as after 2pm, you would see lots of the rude tourists :1) Reached the park at 10am2) Took the cable first3). Experienced multiple rainforest ride, whirly bird and the arctic blast (barely queue 5 mins)4) Took the Ocean Express Train (no queue) and we had the whole cabin to ourselves. The ride was peaceful.5). Lunch at Panda Cafe6). Visited the Panda, Gold Fish Treasures and the Old HK game zone7) Took the cable again (no queue)8). Experienced the Ocean Park Tower, bumper blaster and arctic blast (queue for 15mins)9). Visited Polar Adventure10) Experienced the mine train and raging river (queue for 5 mins)11) Took Ocean express train (met lots of rude tourist who cut queue in front of kids and shoved the kids as well)12) Shopping

Easy access, great value and a great day out.. We had a choice - Disneyland or Ocean Park and chose Ocean Park because it wasn't Disneyland. It was a US$10 cab ride from our hotel in Wanchai, about twenty minutes, and after paying the single, very reasonable, entrance fee (less than $50 each as I recall, but check the website) we had access to all attractions and all day to explore. We visited on a weekday in mid-December, so the theme was Christmas and even though it was VERY crowded (everywhere is, unless you are there very early) my wife and I both had fun on the rides and visiting the displays which were all themed to promote Chinese interest and culture - the Yangtse River and its habitat, etc. Lots of environmental protection interest for activist children and lots of fun and learning, too.Would certainly recommend it, but suggest not on a summer weekend unless you REALLY dig crowds!

Rides are better than I envisaged. Having been to several theme parks, I am quite surprised that the rides are quite thrilling. Would not recommend this park for kids below 1.4m as they will be disappointed not being able to get on many of the rides. Dolphin shows. The last time I watch this show was more than 20 years ago, I enjoyed it thoroughly then. This time round, with my 12 years son, I wish they had kept the action/show going like before. Too much talking and commentaries by the hosts ; as if we are on an educational tour. ? we left midway thru the show.

Another Visit well worth doing.. You must take out all day and get there early as this is one great day out. Went there for our anniversary and has to be one of the most memorable days and will always stay with us. Has something for everyone and once you have paid - the attractions are included in the price leaving you free to just explore and enjoy.

Better alternative to Disneyland. Excellent venue and full day out for our family (6 & 8yr olds). Similar $$ to Disneyland however broader range of attractions (including multiple Pandas and spectacular cable car ride). Lots of fun and broader range of rides for different thrill levels.
Overall experience. Kids will thoroughly enjoy this place. The view on top of occean park is really good and lots of rides for the kids to enjoy

for kids and families. this place is maybe enjoyable if you are 12 years old... but for an adult without kids its just not very exciting. the aquarium is far worse than the one in once saw in lisbon - and the rides on the other side of the park are quite boring aswell...

Nice layout and easy to get there. 1) very easy to get there by MTR (admiralty) and direct bus (exit B) to Ocean Park2) we enjoyed the cable car ride alot3) the Ocean Park offers a lot of activities (from rides to viewing ocean animals to watching Pandas!)4) downside is....beware of some tourists who were shoved you around (without apologizing) and also cutting your queue.

Still good. I would say that it is still a place to go in Hong Kong ... An alternative to hk Disneyland ... They made improvements to their new rides like the hair raiser! Whoo... Love it! I still recommend tourist w kids like me to still visit this place

Better than expected!. My kids (aged 6 and 3) loved the experience at Ocean Park! The aquarium was nice, as was the cable car ride. We had lunch with the penguins, and it was good fun! I went on a Monday which was nice I was told the park can get crowded on the weekends, which would make the experience less fun.

a must in HK in going with family. I enjoyed Ocean Park very much. As a theme park, there are more to experience than a normal ocean park. The dolphin show was fantastic. Night fire and light show was surprisingly good. I went with my parents. Very happy to see that they had a nice day too.

Great value for a whole day. The Ocean Park is really a very good park for spending a whole day and get some change from looking attractions in a big city. The combination of roller coasters and watching animals is very good and time is running. We started when the park opened at 10 am and without big breaks and driving an attractions twice , we really had to look to see all what the park offers (and we stayed there for 8 hours). But really impressive are the jellyfish as well as the big reef aquarium. We also had not much waiting time as we started in the morning, going up to the end of the park and went from there down (on average i would say 5 minutes per attraction). Only for the roller coaster "hairraiser" we had to wait for 20 minutes, but this was because of driving with it at about 3 pm when more people arrived. In fact: very good, a lot things to do and see (also for grown-ups), we recommend: start at 10 am and immidiately use the cable car to start from above.

Crowded with Mainland Chinese. There were many, many tourists from Mainland China, who don't quite understand about queuing. You have to wait for quite a while for the rides but this is just like a lot of popular theme parks around the world. The rides are not bad and you get to see a couple of pandas and other animals as well.

Better than Disney Land, by far. This is a much better place than Disney Land. The cable car, which operates for like over 30 years never have any problem (unlike the 360 one which actually fell during maintenance). The location is this park is on the hill side next to the sea, which is very scenic with fresh air - a rarity in Hong Kong.Attraction wise it is nothing too exciting, however the aquarium is pretty good and fun.

Another must c in HKG !. Whole park is set up over a very wide area. The entrance part has a few rides and a site of how old HKG used to look like. A cable ride takes you over some scenic beauty and its ends on another area having even more breathtaking stuff like the seal show, dolphins, penguins and a few rides as well.

Very Cool!. We decided to go to Ocean Park as we wanted to see the Panda's. We were pleasantly surprised at the other attractions here!! We loved seeing the seals and walrus and penguins and all the other attractions. A very fun place!

So crowded. The view is superb, there are many rides to choose from, varying in thrill. You need to take a cable car/ocean express to the summit for most of the thrilling rides. There's a mock-up old Hongkong street section which is quite nice. If you go early, you won't need to wait long to be on the numerous rides offered there. But as noon approaches, the crowd increases, you will need to queue for 30min just to buy the entrance ticket and it can be rather unpleasant even moving around the park. Food and drink is expensive.
Have fun every time. Children love it. They have the theme parks, the sea life and animals. Don't try to do too much in a single day, visit a couple of times.

A fun an full day out!. We went to Ocean park not knowing what to expect. When we got there we were quite impressed at everything it had to offer, and that was before we realised there was a whole other section you had to take a train or cable car up to! Once we realised this the park really became alive. Carnival games, rides, character meet and greets, aquariums, animals, it really was a zoo meets carnival meets theme park and it was way too extensive for us to be able to see everything in just one day. We went in school holidays so it was very busy. The toilets didn't seem to be cleaned very often (in comparison to Disneyland which we went to a couple days beforehand) and staff weren't quite as interactive and friendly but overall it was very worth it and a good day out.

Awesome park. Best day i have had in a long time. All the adults ran around like little kids to get on each ride, it was awesome feeling like a kid again. Huge park with lots to see wnd do. Gondola ride up the mountain is awesome with great views of the island and surroundings. Hair raiser wow what a ride. Dolphin and seal show so funny and a blast to watch. End of day water and lights show is spectacular and a great way to end the night. Ocean park in all very affordable with friendly and helpful stuff and i will be back again. You guys rock.

Ocean Park keeps reinventing itself. We last visited ten years ago, before we become parents.We brought 4 kids to Ocean Park (OP) again in Sep.Initially we thought kids will only be impressed with Disney, but OP has something for everyone.We love the aquariums, watching the seal and walrus slide up and down.Kids love the new Polar Adventure, with arctic fox, penguins etc. The penguins are swimming right under our feet, through the transparent floor !The Pandas (both white and red) are always crowd favourites.If you love thrills, Ocean Park's rides will not disappoint.You need one full day to soak in OP's fun, and we recommend that you rent a stroller for the young ones.

What a great day out!!. There aren't many theme parks you can go to these days for £20 per adult! ....have you ever seen a Giant Panda for real or a Hopper Penguin or even a Bird Earing Spider?...Well It's all at Ocean Park..plus some ace rides and a superb cable car ride which gives views of Hong Kong Harbour and outlying islands that just take your breath away!! It's a fabulous day out even if you,have to queue to get a ticket for 20 mins on ask day as we did. Go do it!!!

No longer a choice to spend a day with family. too many people, too disorderly, trash everywhere, and no staff cares. people are getting rude, cut in line, talk loudly, again, staff don't care. suggest them to have Courtesy Ambassadors" to guide tourists behave themselves.

best amusement park not to be missed..... best theme park with lot of good & fablous rides.both cable car & train within the park are best bet to be around the theme park.as the name suggest it is developed in ocean within the island.a treat for those who enjoy amusement park rides.must visit if interested in beautifull views & theme park.

Fun. This place has fun ride, typical junk food and lots and lots and lots of walking.(uphill and downhill) it amazying a guy owns that park on a mountain. It looks very good on the bus toward Stanley.

Mixed feelings.. Most importantly I must say the animals are extremely well cared for by an incredible team of dedicated and loving staff. Seeing the commitment of the staff as they went about their duties of looking after their charges was heart warming.In general the exhibits were also of a high standard and in good condition. So why only an average rating? In my opinion the park was not really equipped to deal with the large crowds we experienced during our visit. It was a chaotic crush of pushing and elbowing that made me anxious and the flurry of people all trying to see the animals was frenetic and not at all relaxing. The animal shows need a complete overhaul. The shows are outdated and lack any kind of magic or energy. Whilst pushing the conservation message is essential in their presentations, the flow as well as dynamism of showing the animals is completely lost in translation. One message that came through loud and clear in the dolphin show is that dolphins will save humans from drowning which, in my opinion, is not the kind of message that should be broadcast to an easily convinced audience. I have plenty more feedback for Ocean Park and should their management read tripadvisor they are absolutely welcome to make contact with me.There is also plenty of room for improvement with regards to the catering team/food outlets. In general I thought the service was poor and the food was of below average quality. Overall I think that Ocean Park is a top quality facility that is dedicated to animal care and conservation.

Good place to play, but not when its crowded. The ocean park is a fun theme park to play if you arrive early and avoid the peak season. And the rides were pretty good, the problem comes down to THE STAFF WERE NOT SO FRIENDLY ( the staff at the shops still quite friendly but the staff in charge of the rides... we can say that they don't smile). Try to make sure you are in the queue. According to my experience a few days ago... RUDE TOURISTS COME AND CUT THE QUEUE and rush like that they never sit on the ride before in their entire life. If you come here for the rides and the shopping for souvenirs, it is a good place to come but try to avoid the crowded period, as a huge number of tour groups were already there and still counting and the tourists from other countries ARE deliberately rude like they own the whole place to themselves. BEST THINGS TO SHOP: Stuff toys! ( they are very cute!), T-shirts and bags.Worst time to visit: 3pm( the crowd will be rushing in by late afternoon)BEST TIME To Visit: Non-Peak Period .

You'll get a good exercise. There are a lot of aquariums and rides. You need to be here from the time they open up to the time they closes to enjoy the entire park. Since half of the park is located on top of a mountain, be sure that you are wearing comfortable foot wear. This is way better than HK Disneyland. For tourist that has limited time and can only visit 1 theme park in HK, Ocean Park is highly recommended. It has cheaper tickets with more rides and attractions.You can get 10% discount by surrendering tickets from Ngong Ping, the Peak or the Wax Museum. I don't know why this is not being promoted.

Still as excellent as always!. There's always new exhibits when I visit Ocean Park, even though I visit it once a year! The polar adventure is definitely the highlight for me this time. The arctic fox is so cute! And I had the pleasure of dining with the penguins this time at Tuxedo Restaurant, and what a marvelous experience it is!I'll be back next year!Tip: Be as early as you can, so that by the time you finish The Waterfront exhibits and take the cable car up to explore The Summit exhibits, the crowd from the tour groups would have just arrived and you'll be able to avoid them.

A fun family outing. Slightly out of the way as you need to take Citybus bus service 629 from Admiralty Station to reach the theme park. About 20 mins away by bus. A huge theme park with busloads of tourists, literally. Due to the magnitude of the theme park, you probably won't feel the congestion. You only get to 'appreciate' the crowd when you explore popular attractions or take the train/ cable car. Ocean Park puts together a zoo and a theme park. A good concept, I think, especially for families. Young children can enjoy themselves interacting with the animals while the more adventurous can take some of the thrill rides. My family particularly enjoyed the panda enclosure. The 2 pandas were so adorable! Be warned that lines could be long. We waited for about 1 hour to take the cable car down the top of the theme park. Mind you, we were there on a weekday. A good place to consider going, especially you have the extra time. Ps: I noticed they were in the midst of building a MTR station at the entrace of the theme park. Perhaps it might be more convenient for tourists in the future.
Family theme park. A theme park more for families with kids.Definitely a place to go to if you are visiting hongkong.I am more of a rides person.. so this will not make me go a second time

Amazing and Massive Zoo/Theme park. This place is massive, the bottom section/zoo is brilliant, the animals are all in fantastic condition, all look happy and in great enclosures.Up the top is a massive theme park, it is massive! The very top had relatively new rides including a great roller coaster, beware the doughnut water ride will get you SOAKED!!! Basically water hoses pointed straight at you!!! We spent about 5 hours there and loved it, would not recommend if you do not like rides or theme parks but for everyone else it is fantastic!!! Beware it gets very crowded though however it is still very quick to get on rides no more than 10 minutes waiting time on each ride. And the tickets are very great value for money!Must go attraction in Hong Kong!

For the price, it's actually pretty good. I was amazed at how much the park had to offer for the price I paid which was relatively cheap compared to Hong Kong Disneyland or Universal Studios Singapore. The park is separated into 2 zones. The first zone consist of the aquarium, the bird house, the goldfish attractions, and of course the panda attractions. It was a wonderful experience for me since I haven't been in an aquarium since I was a kid and I've learnt a lot from the different species of goldfish. The second zone consist of the theme park rides. I highly recommend HairRaiser, the flash and the abyss. Do note though, that some of the rides here are not the high thrilling kinds but are adequate enough for a fun and relaxing time. Overall, I had a great experience in Ocean Park. It's definitely worth the money and it's a place for you to forget about all your problems and simply have fun and relax.

Good Fun. Be there early, go during weekdays and avoid the throng of people coming in after lunch. That said you can enjoy the rides without having to fall in line. Expect to be wet when the sign for the ride says so. Its a bummer through when you later meet the throng of people eager to see the attractions as well, especially the noisy and rowdy ones. Some of them are just pushy and plain noisy. Expect long lines after 3 pm either in the attractions or in the rides.All in all a good day of fun.

Just about average attractions. We visited ocean park for a full day visit. The park is divided into Waterfront (lower part) and Summit (Upper part). You can use either the cable car or train for the movement. The lower part has aquarium, panda and some other things. The aquarium is good and big. However, if you have been to sea world or one in Baltimore in US, this is just about ok. Most of the rides on the summit have 120 cm height limit and my daughter was not able to participate. That pretty much reduced the number of attraction to half.The highlight of the visit was dolphin show and sea lion show. It's must attend.All in all, it is a half day thing and don't expect too much.

Awesome!. Ocean Park is like a zoo, sightseeing attraction & amusement park all put into one. It is split into The Waterfront & The Summit. You enter from The Waterfront, where there is a ginormous aquarium, several animal enclosures (including the normal & Red Panda), & a night market style street (there you get to try your luck on local games & eat local food).Take the cable car to The Summit. You get to go along a stretch of ocean devoid of human interaction, & as you are reaching the other side, you get to see the Hair Raiser in its full glory.The Summit is large enough for a full-day trip on its own. Remember to try the Hair Raiser & Rev Booster if you're into roller coasters. Or just take all the rides since your ticket is valid for a period of several months.
Alton Towers meets Water World. Great for everyone..some kiddies stuff and also a couple of fast rides on the side of cliffs! We had a fun day!

Go! Even without kids! Much better than any park in the UK.. With its picturesque location on the side of a sea facing cliff, enjoy rollar coasters with the most fantastic views. Great value, considering the amount there is, incl cable car*, pandas, rides, water/light show. *I just have to tell share this! In the cable car, which is high and at least a couple of km, we shared it with this cute French girl, about 4 years old and her Dad. When the car went over the peak and the views of the ocean were suddenly possible, the French girl exclaimed "oh la la" and hugged her Daddy. It was more French than watching Amelie whilst eating escargots and drinking wine. I share this because I too felt like an excited 4 year old at times. Go and rediscover your inner child. What a moment!

Go for Halloween Bash!. We were lucky enough to be able to catch the Halloween bash this past October, and it was the most fun I've had in Halloween... ever. The costumes were incredible and the staff was completely in character, scaring people also outside of the haunted houses. The carnival was also tons of fun, with creepy stuffed animals as prizes, and drinks with fruit eyeballs inside. I would recommend getting the more expensive pass so as to skip queues, and catching the side shows outside the haunted houses [Chinese Vampire Clubbing was almost the highlight].The cable car at night is also very, very cool.

awesome rides. It was raining when we reached at 10 am, but there were many animals kept indoor so we spent our time exploring Pandas, Penguins, monkeys etc. And then it was time to enjoy the rides as rains stopped miraculously. The OCean Express (train) was a great ride which took us to another part of OCean P and the rides there were out-of-the-world! Flash, Rev Rooster, Hair Raiser, Whirly Bird were one of the few awesome rides! Food for veg Indians is a problem. There is a Bayview restaurant serving something that was presented as Indian, however, did not look appealing. there are many snack outlets where we get popcorns, softdrinks etc. The fountain show (called Symbio) was spectacular v unique...do not miss it (7 pm).

A place for all ages. Me and my folks (middle 50's) had a great fun at Ocean Park. It has something to offer for all age group. I love cutie An-An and Jia-Jia. Dolphin and Sea Lion Show is very entertaining too. I just feel sorry for the Arctic Foxes, they seem lonely. Food is expensive but my mom likes the beef though. Too bad, I was not able to try the rides.

a park for all. i love ocean park. it is a park suitable for all man kind. if you're teenager, try the game suit u or get wet with all the adventurous games. if you are child, enjoy the child activities just like watch the fishes in the ocean stadium, panda, dolphin and those shows. if you all seniour citigens, you still can enjoy a lot in the ocean park. i spend my whole day in ocean park but still unable to finish all programs. i will go to ocean park again if i go to hong kong again...this is a park suitable for everyone.

for the inner child in all of us.. This has to be one of the best amusement parks in the whole world. Not only do they have great rides that fly out over the water, they also have a wonderful aerial cable car. There are also animal and sea life exhibits. Everything is rather spread out and a day is really not enough time to take it all in. I've been here 2 times and still have not seen it all. The atmospehere is great though, there is something for everyone here. A new additon this year is a section called 'Old Hong Kong' which was really warm and beautiful. The smell of grilled squid being sold from stands thoughout the park is wonderful and you should try some. Ocean Park is easy to get to with public transportation and will be even easier when the new MTR line is completed. Whether you have children or just want to give your inner child a good time, come here, you will not be disappointed. I love this place.
Loves the sea!. All about the sea... I love the rides here and all the attractions! Foods are not that expensive too! I love the cable car, ride it instead of the train!

Great Family Day. Absolutley loved Ocean Park. Really easy to get to from Kowloon. Smooth ticketing process and once inside there was something for all the big kids as well as the little one. Highlight for me was seeing Pandas for the first time. They were especially active whilst we were there so that was a real treat. We pretty much took on nearly every ride with the Rollercoasters being the most fun. Wait times for some rides were up to 45 mins which was a bit frustrating but unavoidable. We actually caught the train up to the top this only had a 5 min wait.Waited and watched the Dolphin show which was very cheesy - probably would give this a miss if I went again.......but good I supose if you have never seen Dolphins.All in all OCean Park was a fun but exhausting day out.
Surprised and impressed. Brilliant - panda, aquarium and polar animal exhibitsDisliked - people! Avoid the lunch time crowds by getting there early!

Fascinating. It is best place for children. Plenty of shows, attractions and so on. You can spend there all day. There are a lot of fun. Great and beautiful place. There are cute pandas, funny fishes.

Waterworld brought to you by Ocean Park HK. This has to be one of the most recommended tourist attractions every Hong Kong visitor should go to. It's perfect for families especially those with kids, also excellent for friends coming together to have fun.It is also a good place to learn and explore more about our oceans.Food and drinks are affordable. You'll find a lot of souvenir shops around, whenever you exit an attraction.Tips:1. wear comfortable shoes because you'll be walking a lot2. bring a bottle of water or two3. bring an extra shirt if you're touring during summerTry the Hair Raiser, ride the cable cars and tour the Old Hong Kong street!

A bit weary amusement park. There are two amusement parks in HK, this and Disney World. Ocean park is a bit old but it is certainly local. Roller coasters are ok, animals are very nice but the best was the cable car trip in between the two places park is located. We were lucky with the weather as it wasn't sunny, the park was quite quiet so we didn't have to stand in queues.

Just brilliant. An amazing mix of rides (the Hair-raiser rollercoaster and Mine Train on the edge of a moutain is particularly thrilling!) and animals / nature exhibits. The new Polar Experience is especially impressive (and chilly). Absolutely adore the pandas - too cute! And the cable car and rotating tower are experiences in their own right, offering great views of the south of HK Island. In short, something for everyone... just try not to get caught up in one of the many large tourist groups!

Great Family Day Out. The park has steadily expanded over the years and there is something here for everybody - thrilling rides, rare animals in imaginative enclosures (4 Pandas included), one of the best cable car rides anywhere, a good Chinese restaurant and numerous snack stalls and shops. The entry charges are very reasonable for what you get - purchase tickets on the way there at Exchange Square bus station to avoid queues.As another reviewer has mentioned, the only drawback with this attraction are the hordes of over-excited and garrulous trippers from the mainland who push and shove anybody out of their way in their haste to be first. They completely ignore instructions about not using flash cameras to avoid startling the animals and are a thorough nuisance in general. Park staff seem to have given up on any attempt to make them behave to an acceptable standard.The park and toilet facilities are kept spotlessly clean by a small army of cleaners and gardeners.

WOW Absolutely LOVED Ocean Park. I had my birthday while staying in Hong Kong as as I was a mermaid in a former life Ocean Park was the place where I wanted to spend my birthday!!! Can't comment on any of the rides as we where only there for the fish and animals. We loved the giant pandas, this is the first time I have ever seen one for real it has taken to the grand old age of 47 for this to happen. One was sleeping but the other was having a tea of bamboo shots and was absolutely beautiful. The park is fabulous the environments they are created for all the animals are amazing problably the best I have ever seen in the world and the giant aquariam litereally takes your breath away it is absolutely fantastic, I would have stayed under the main dome all day watching the hammerhead, rays, turtles and fish crusing by. A day I will never forget.
Excellent. Fun place to spend 1 or 2 days with family, has many exiting rides and shows; overall must visit for families.

better than disneyland. we went to both disneyland and ocean park and found it a lot better than disneyland esp if u have children around 10-15 years of age.The layout is great, view from the cable car is simply amazing.though we only had half a day to spend my daughter aged 10 loved the aquarium,the animals and the birds. the various kinds of jellyfishes were her favourite. be ready for a lot of walking and a lot of sun if going in the morning. i will recommend carrying either a small cap,hat, or umbrella to protect from the sun,they r very expensive within the park approx 100$.the food is also not great and very little variety especially for indian travellers and those being veg.yet it is totally worth the the visit.also loved the shows and the penguin and walrus enclosures.does get a bit crowded during the shows and standing in those queues was really boring and tiring.

Great fun. We liked the aquarium and the dolphin show we loved sitting on the chair lift,The aquarium had lots of different sea creatures my favorite were the hammer head sharks,stingrays and lots of different species of fish.

thrill rides but long queue for everything. very crowded with mainland tourists who don't understand how to queue in an orderly manner - jostle for entry into tram, panda viewing, camera flashing away & they are LOUD everywhere they go!

Good to go to, but if pushed for time don't bother. We went as it looked good on paper. We thought a bit tame, Aquarium good, live Dolphin show very good, but similar to any other. Most of rides slow, ok for kids. Overall good to go to, but we were in HK for 13 days so had the spare half day.

A brilliant day out for a family. Visited with my husband and 10 year old daughter mid week. They went on all the rides and rarely had to queue (it got busier after lunch, but not so much that it was annoying). All the exhibits were brilliant (they make some aquariums look like goldfish bowls in comparison) and if you plan your day you don't have to walk uphill. Some rides involved water, so they were great to do once you started feeling the heat. We arrived just before opening time and were second in line in one of the queues. Everybody headed towards the cable car first, but we went to the pandas and were the only ones in there. Brilliant. Overall, well worth a visit if you have kids. There is a section for the littlies.

BEST EVER EXPIERIENCE. I've been to Ratanga, Gold reef and Rand Easter Show, and from all the little ive been through this is the most andrelane rush ive ever expierienced. The hair riser, The freakingFLASH ok i was scared never went on that but yoh all the rest was over awesome. Guys from SA this is tops a must and a must to atleast spend two days. The cable car view was tops.
Not to be missed!. Not a rides fan & didn't take a single rides. But it's a place to go! Still enjoyed myself all the way. View was simply breathtaking! Defintely better than HK Disneyland.

A very interesting day's visit. I went with my wife to Ocean Park. We did not go on any rides and went up on the Ocean Express. Before we went to the top we went and saw the bird show and the aquarium. Both areas were well worth the visit. Once at the top we had a good look round and found Jelly Fish aquarium. It was fantastic. All in all the visit was a very interesting one. If we had been the sort of people who enjoy the rides it would have been even better. We came down on the cable car. Quite an experience in itself.

Nautilus Restaurant Great!. Ocean park is a little dated itself and the rides are more like our "fun fair" rides. However the aquarium is superb, look out for the sea dragons. Go to the nautilus restaurant for lunch - get in early or much later as great to get a good seat- worth it - we weren't too hungry but both had a starter that's all - the view is brilliant!!

a little disappointed. having been to some of the great parks in the world this one was a little disappointing for me. There are little activities that a 4 year old can engage in. It was peak when i travelled and queues were long and hardly moved. The variety of meals were very minimal and were had to share a plate as they ran out on what we ordered. The signage is poor so one is never sure where to go. There is a tram that takes you to the other part of the park and that is ok to try. The pandas were the highlight of my visit. I wont be attending anytime soon.
GREAT FUN. even as an adult this was an amazing place and my friends and I enjoyed it very much. Bit of a queue to get in but once inside it was very enjoyable. Good value too.

Full day's entertainment, but bring your own food. Easily accessed by direct bus from outside Admiralty MTR station. Takes about 20 minutes, and costs HK$ 10.80 Standard entrance to park is HK$ 280 and gives excellent value for a busy and tiring day's entertainment. The park is divided into two sections. The lower part has all the animals, including two very active pandas, a huge aquarium, a sturgeon features, crocodiles, goldfish and more. Also a large kiddy playground and little rides. There are two ways of getting to the upper level - by cable car (great views), or an express train, which is described as a wonderful experience, but it is really just a moving train in a tunnel.The upper part of the park has several different sections, with lots of daredevil rides. Not for the weak of tummy ! Two things to be aware of with Ocean Park. First, it is very big, very spread out, and extremely hilly, so prepare to be exhausted. Second, the food caters for Chinese tastes, but definitely not Western palatte. Lots of noodles, chicken feet, dumplings etc, but none of the traditional fast food you may associate with places like Disney.There are the usual rip-off tourist traps for souveniers - best avoided. The park is spotlessly clean, including toilets. Young children may be excluded from many of the rides, either due to height restrictions, or just because they are too scary. Elderly or disabled visitors will find this tough going. Get there very early (ready for opening at 10 am), and be prepared for very long waits at the cable cars as the day goes on. Well worth a visit, with enough to keep you occupied for at least a full day, if you have the stamina.
Water water water. Make sure to buy water elsewhere. 20hkd for a mineral water in ocean park. This is a very big park and very hot during summertime. Make sure to have protections against heat
"if you don't like coaster ride, don't come!!". Ocean park - theme park for adult and Disneyland - for kids. the rides is thrilling and hair-raising, so i decided not to play...what a waste..!

Great fun and educational too. This place is fantastic the combination of Marine Aquarium and amusement park means this place has something for everyone. Check out the aquariums as there are a lot of different species of fish here and they have gone to the trouble of making some great viewing areas for interaction with the exhibits. Then after all this head over the mountain to the amusement park for the roller coasters and all the rides that will bring out the inner child.Don't forget to check out the Pandas.
Its more than any aquarium. You can easily spend a day or two at HK Ocean Park. There are numerous rides, animal shows and aquarium to visit plus the cable car ride is excellent
Worth The Visit. Worth the visit but avoid it on the weekends and public holidays... too crowded. Weekends are much better.
An extremely huge playground. There are perhaps twice as more rides than Disney Land. My kids love the place as they have plenty of places to go to and play.

Great day out. We absolutely loved Ocean Park. It is a Great combination of a world class theme park with really Great rides and a small zoo that presents amazing animals such as Pandas and adorable red pandas as well as a very nice sea life shows with dolphins and seals. The rollercoasters in my opinion were really good.

Great Day Out!. Ocean Park is a very big park built on a mountain - fantastic views of surrounding sights but be prepared to be walking up and down stairs and hills. It is very big and we didn't manage to do everything in a day.We arrived and went straight up to the Summit to watch the Dolphin and Sea Lion Show. It has a good view out to sea while you are waiting for show to start and can watch the ships coming and going from port.We got to the summit by the Ocean Express, a great train ride in a tunnel through the mountain with tv screens on the roof - giving you the sensation you are underwater.The two highlights for me were:1) the Aquarium. It was amazing, there are so many creatures to see. At the end there is a HUGE tank with a really amazingly thick glass or perspex viewing wall. It was between 2 and 3 stories high.2) the Pandas. I loved the pandas. Both the Red and and Giant Pandas were gorgeous. They looked very healthy. I could have stood there all day and watched them. The place has many great photo opportunities.There are many shaded areas, you just have to look for them.As we left about 4pm there was a lot of groups coming into the park. We had no trouble at all getting a taxi.

The alternative to Disney Hong Kong. As most know, Disney Hong Kong is similar to its US parks, but much smaller. Ocean Park, on the other hand, is massive. It contains an Aquarium (two if you count the Jellyfish exhibit), two panda habitats, long cable car, four roller coasters (including a new one called "Hair Raiser"), dolphin show, etc., etc. Certainly see Disney, but the next day, check out Ocean Park.

Ocean Park. Came here last january, and i would rate this as a 4. Dont mind waiting in long lines because the weather wasn't hot. I had so much fun riding the rollercoasters and watching the dolphins perform cool tricks. Me and my cousins enjoyed going around,

Loved the place. Its been over 20 years since we last went to Ocean Park. The place has certainly changed.You have two main sections the "Waterfront" which is located as you enter the Park. And "The Summit" located on top of a nearby hill. You can get from one to the other, either by cable car that goes over the hills, or by a train, that cuts through a mountain. The views from the cable car are fantastic.We caught the cable car to the Summit as we wanted to go to the ocean theatre show. It was nice, but not spectacular. Speaker system here was terrible.Going to the ocean theatre was fine, as it was downhill all the way. But coming back up from it was quite steep. Not good for my bad back, in fact my back got so bad, that we had to leave early. The whole summit area is very hilly. Walking can be hard work, as you are constantly going either downhill or uphill.Maps are provided free as you purchase your ticket. But I suggest you download a map and study it before you go, so you arnt going over the same territory all the time.We had a quick look around the summit area, but decided to go back to the Waterfront area as its not as hilly.Loved the panda enclosure. Nice big clear viewing areas. But got annoyed by people pushing and cutting in front of you as i was waiting for the right photo.I must admit the mainland chinese are very good at cutting in at queues, and they dont seem to have a problem with your photo blurring as they push in. Thats not the parks fault, but stand your ground, and dont allow it to happen.Walked around the "waterfront area" as there are many displays to keep you occupied for hours.Beware of all the official photographers all over the place. We just kept saying no thankyou and they would go away.I could have spent the whole day here, as there is so much to do. Recommended for any age group.Its wheelchair friendly as not many stairs, mainly ramps, but the Summit area would be hard work for the person pushing the wheelchair.I also saw them stop the cable car for an elderly couple who were a bit slow to move, to get on. Thought this was very considerate of the Park to do this.

The inner kid in me was released again!. Had so much fun!
Plan your flow inside the park by marking the shows you'd want to watch. Also if you can go on a weekday, do so to avoid long lines.
But overall experience was great!
Too bad hair raiser ride was closed. I was really looking forward to that.
A must visit place. Very well managed beautiful and complete entertaining place . My family enjoyed it alot . Beaware of tax drivers they may cheat you

The usual large park where many people.... Beautifully located on the mountains. But everywhere many waiting in line, despite the fact that we were there on Monday .. Aquarium is not very interesting. If you have nothing to do, have children and are used to the hustle and noise, this is the place for you! But we have seen a panda! The plan is executed

Rollercoasters are disappointing but animals makes it worthwhile. As the line says, the rollercoasters are not much fun. Old, and outdated. But the animals there makes the trip worthwhile anyways, as well as the Cable Cars they have there with a great view!

Great day - but don't rely on a taxi!!!!!!!!!!. Great day for older kids . My 10 and 13 year old had a ball. Great rides and attractions, lots of walking. The dolphin experience well worth the extra money. The only negative to our day (but a big negative) was the unbelievable queue for the bus or taxi to get home. The queue was atleast 3 hours long, people jumping into the line, and about 1 taxi every 10 minutes. Ridiculous. I WOULD NOT RELY ON PUBLIC TRANSPORT (BUS) OR TAXIs at the end of the day. I think they are building a train stop.We got there early (10am) before the crowds arrived at about 3pm. Well worth it - we didn't have to queue for anything. Worth noting that the food options on the rides side of the mountain are pretty average. Not many shady places to sit.

Better than expected. I read alot of feedback from other travellers, they mentioned that there is nothing much in Ocean Park, the most is only spending half day. But it is bigger than expected, and there are quite a lot of things to see and play. End up, we stayed till evening 7pm since 1030am. The ocean threatre show is below expectation, we were standing behind the seats on the top as there were full of tourist from China, very squeezy and hot. The speaker system is not good, unable to hear clearly.You could expect alot of chinese tourists who are being rude and cutting the Q. Be prepare! We were quite unhappy with them and actually warned few rude tourists.

great place for kinds, but not for the big and tall.... I have split feelings about my visit.On one hand the staff was amazing and helpful. I quite enjoyed the aquarim and the pandas, actually the whole Waterfront part was a very nice experience. But the reason I went there is for the rides and that was where it became quite the opposite of amazing. Being 179cm tall and having curves taught me an alltogether different walk of shame at this park. The Dragon and the Abyss I had no problems getting into, but as soon as we reached the newer rides, well simply put my hips didn't agree with the seat at the Hair Raiser, and then my bosom was too large to fully close the safety thing at the Flash. Didn't really want to try any other rides after that. And I thought it was ridiculous - not in any single amusement park in all the places around the world that I've been did something like that happen to me, never. I haven't even given a thought that something like this might happen when I decided to spend my day here. But it would be an amazing place to go with children. Shame that the rides didn't take into consideration, that not all the people from around the world are petite...
Fun for everyone. This is a sprawling park with lots to do. I really loved seeing the Pandas and the kids loved the rides. It is pretty hilly so wear really comfortable shoes and cool clothing.

A good day but the Park is so spread out.. but the Pandas were amazing.. The park was good, but we found that it was not laid out very well, and was so hilly and we seemed to be walking for so long to get to places. The reason for the visit was basically to see the Panda Bears and that did not disappoint. We only went on a couple of rides as we don’t like the spinning rides or a lot of the rollercoaster type rides, so only went on a couple of water rides which were at different parts of the park, viewed the jellyfish exhibition, aquarium, saw the pandas, did the train and sky rail. The one thing that did annoy us was that everywhere we went they wanted to take our photo and then want us to buy, we ended up just walking straight past them when we entered anyway, just found that it got bit much, can understand at the beginning of the park but not at nearly every entry place. They gave my youngest (6yrs) on a couple of occasions a snow globe with his face on it and said look you can take this home, then we had to explain to him that we had to buy it and if it had all of us on it then we probably would have.

An aquarium, amusement park and amazing views make this a great day out. Plan to spend a whole day here because there's plenty to do. We started early and visited the huge aquarium, then caught an acrobat show before moving on to see a bird show and a seal show, rides for young kids and a beautiful goldfish aquarium with some very exotic species.All the was before we got to a diorama of old Hong Kong where we took some pictures and ate some (mediocre) street food. We then took a thrilling cable car ride to the top of the hill enjoying spectacular views along the way.The top of the hill is where there are even more rides, including roller coasters, a log ride on water and more. In the evening we took the cable car back down and found a good spot to see the water and pyrotechnic show.Ocean Park really is a great day out. Just note that if you are going with kids 5 and younger, many rides will be off limits. There's still plenty of animals to see and rides for them to enjoy, but if you're a parent who enjoys thrill rides, you may have to take turns while your partner watches the kids.

Nice Attraction in Hong Kong. Only planned to go to Ocean Park and Flight Experience during my Hong Kong Trip. The park has a lot of funs, and my family had a great time there. The park is clean and the games are great.

Ocean Park. Our family, 4 adults and a 13 yo went here and we all loved it! I definitely plan to return! We concentrated on seeing the animal exhibits, and enjoyed them all! We took the cable car ride to the Summit...I am afraid of heights, but the ride was very "steady" and after a little while I even started looking out of the car! We had lunch at the Tuxedoes Restaurant with the penguins and it was something special to remember. We caught the night show on our way out and enjoyed it also. Don't even think of doing it all in one day! Look at the map online and decided what's important. We didn't do any rides or shows, just seeing the animal exhibits, having lunch and a little shopping took all day! But it was still well worth it!

Pandas and roller coaster. Good entertainment park for young teenagers, maybe under 14. The pandas are quite amazing as you can see them from a few meters behind a glass wall. The roller coaster were fun for my kids and too much for my tomach. But some I did with them. The dolphin show was more average. Food inside of the park is rather disappointing. A good alrernative for kids from 10 to 14 compared to Disneyland.

Great Value with something for everyone. Lots of rides and attractions. Thrill seekers will love rollercoasters and the like, especially the FLASH! Seaworld, Cable cars, shows, food...a full day of fun!

one day is not enough. we went to ocean park on a rainy tuesday. but much to our delight, there were still lots of things to do, inspite of a number of rides and attractions which were closed due to the weather. food is overpriced, but there were a few relatively cheap ones at the old hong kong street. there were no drinking fountains like in disneyland, so be prepared to shell out a few bucks for the expensive bottled waters. the place is wonderful, though i am not really impressed at the park layout. due to the numerous fantastic attractions and shows, one day is not enough to fully enjoy ocean park.

Fun Fun Fun. The attractions were great. Make sure you allot the whole day and end with the light show at night. Forget the bus pick up (if on tour) it's easy to get a cab/taxi after the show. Wear comfy shoes. Best season February, nice and cool....
better than disney. its great, its huge, lots of roller coasters and fun, nice views, excellent attractions if you're going with family and/or fiends.
Nice place to spend a day. The best attraction is the Rope way, The Giant wheel at the top, The Jelle Fishes there are really worth seeing.
Ocean Park rocks. theme park meets zoo ....something for everyone.....new rides and animal enclosures are fascinating...been yearly pass holders last couple of years and can thoroughly recommend.

A great day out!. I loved this place theres so much to do there for people of all ages. The only downside I found was the food. The neptune restaurant is very expensive and portions were small. And if you want to avoid the rush start from the top and work you way down. Because everyone goes to the aquarium first so do that last and it wont be so busy.To get to the top, cable car ride is a must do, dont bother with the sea train thing its rubbish. There fireworks display that is on every night at 7pm is very good but theres not really alot of fireworks but there is alot of fire and water!
Ok place to be at. Have seen better places in Singapore and was expecting same here,. However if you are in HK, should spend atleast 2 hours here

Excellent day out : just 1 day isnt enough !!. Visited Ocean Park on a Sunday , arrived around 1130hrs and found the park quiet which was great as rides had no queues. The cable car over the mountain provides stunning views and the selection of rides available suits all ages.Visiting the Polar exhibits are a wonderful way to cool down on a hot day in Hong Kong as the exhibits are air conditioned to around 10 degrees. These exhibits allow close up views and photo opportunities of various Polar animals are stunning. The Asian animals exhibit housed 2 Pandas which are a stunning.. The ocean aquarium is huge and houses some stunning fish from around Asia.The day previous we had visited Disneyland .... Ocean Park for us was much better experience with minimal queues, food and snacks at reasonable prices, and a greater selection of rides and attractions than Disneyland. If you have young children the draw is Disneyland and the Disney Hype is a must, for older teens and adults Ocean Park wins Hands down !!
Fun in Ocean Park. The cable car existing, wow, up to the mountain. my kid love it .Also roller-coasters, and some animal exhibitions, such as panda, penguin, seal .........more than 2,000 fish

Best amusement park in Hong Kong. Go there early and spend a full day, the entrance includes all rides, the foods and drinks inside are affordable. Best place for a famil day out! Avoid the fake ticket sellers at the bus stations, buy tickets ONLY at ocean park!
Good place to visit. Children will like. The cable car ride to summit was very good. Get crowded later in the afternoon, so start early.

A fun place even if you don't like rides. Ocean Park is so much better than is rival theme park, Disneyland. It has quite a few fun and exciting rides, especially the Hair Raiser. Younger kids and older folks will also like it with all the animal shows and the aquarium,

perfect for all ages! :). the ocean park is the best places for family, friends, couples, singles! you will enjoy every place and a very worth it to go.. Its my first time to go there and I want to go back again.. I already missed the place!!

Nice to visit. An aisan themed Ocean Park with the usual marine displays. Under renovation when we were there it's got great views from the cable car and the tower ride. Disneyland has taken a lot of visitos away from the outdated facility and whilst we were there there was massive expansion and refurbishment underway. Still worth a visit.Take yourself there on the local MTR and busses, thats part of the advnture as well. The food there was OK and we certainly enjoyed the day there. Make sure you check out all of the times for the various shows so you can take them all i. We didnt do the rollercoaster rides, not our thing. An enjoyable day.

Fun for this old kid.. Took the 629 bus from Admiralty MTR outside Lippo towers.Probably got here too early but did not have to contend with the hordes of tourists who arrived later. If I could do it again, I would:1. Still Arrive early.2. Go to the Grand Aquarium - spend 1/2 hour - preferably in silence.3. Head to the Summit via cable car - snag your own and enjoy the views.4. Polar encounters - seals, a lonely walrus, penguins. Nice to see them when there aren't too many people around.5. Jelly fish.6. Rides - I did: Hair raiser, The Dragon, The Mines, Raging River. Would do these again and work up the courage to try the other rides. These rides have the unexpected side effect of helping you to stop thinking about work. Highly recommended.7. Ocean Park Tower - great 360deg views.8. Visit the attractions I missed - Pacific Pier and Atoll Reef. Would give the sturgeons a miss. 9. Head back down to the waterfront and see the Pandas! There are 2 enclosures which are both tightly patrolled to ensure the tourists don't make such a ruckus - bonus for me. Amazing Asian Adventures is where the younger 2 pandas live - they are pretty young and active. I watched them for about 45 minutes. They must not get too much nutrition from the bamboo because that is almost all they do - eat. There were red pandas too but these were very shy and I only got a brief glimpse of one. They looked very cute too. In the Hong Kong Jockey club sponsored panda enclosure were the 2 older pandas - one of these seemed to be asleep for most of the day. The other, well he looked just sad. Don't know what the baseline respiratory rate is for these animals but he looked like he was short of breath.10. The goldfish - well only if you want to "marvel" at how these fish have been selectively bred for their ridiculous features - we don't need genetic engineering of the future to see how badly it can turn out!11. Go back to the Grand Aquarium but there will probably be hordes of noisy, rude tourists by now.12. Give the shows a miss - they are not great. The food didn't look good so I had Mcdonalds - which was more expensive than downtown. The park is not very well signposted but the unexpected benefit is a good workout. The latter 3 reasons are why this attraction is 4 stars and not 5. Overall, highly recommend - even for people without kids and traveling alone! Also great value for money. Definitely do this if you don't want yet another day of shopping. It is much much better than Disneyland.

pandas, child park, terrible music. the only good thing there is funicular. Pandas are also nice (actually best pandas I've seen). OK, old hong kong installation is nice as well. But overall I didn't like it at all. Not so many people in weekday in autumn, but queues everywhere, terrible music like in space holliwood films, bad service both in the ticket office and food sellers, security and shops. Maybe, bad mood, but a bit of soul everywhere (read a bit of better management) - and the place could be much more attractive.

Pandas!. The is something for the adults as well as kids. There is have a beautiful aquarium. Two pandas have lived in the park for many years and we were lucky to see the two other pandas on "loan" from the mainland. I understand that it can be very crowded but it wasn't bad when we arrived and we had very short waits for each of the attractions. I recommend that you avoid going first thing in the morning or on the weekend.

Love OP!!!. We love everything about OP HK. My son enjoyed everything in it. Although one must consider the weather or temperature of your day trip. December is quite cold so i guess if you are not geared enough, you might not enjoy much the park. Oh, and don't forget to buy some of those grilled squid, they are really good. :-) Also, don't forget the cable ride. It is a bit scary at first but I think it is quite safe, though.Also enjoy your bus ride going to OP (from Admiralty). Go there as early as possible so you can enjoy the whole park for the whole day!

Ocean Park Excellence. One of the best attractions in HK and well worth a visit. It thoroughly deserves the rating it constantly gets.The park is clean ,well run and all of the staff were helpful. There is plenty of rides to keep the thrill seekers happy,as well as the kids amongst us. But the highlight of the visit had to be the Pandas,At the time we visited they were feeding and showing off,and just enjoying themselves.All of the attractions were good,and one of the other highlights has to be the cable car ride,what views over the island.!!All in all well worth a visit and will revisit next time in town.

This Park was disappointment. to visit, first when to get in you hear loud symphony heavy rock playing and then i did not find so much enjoyment there than in disney land. it was ok to visit, was not for me solo old man, maybe for kids.

Vast theme park. The cable car of course is a must because of the nice view and it takes you to the other side of the park over two mountains (although you can also take the Ocean Express train as an alternative), but you have to devote much time in queing. Not so many rides for younger children aged below 7 years old. The souvenir photos taken by the official photographers were quite expensive, although you are not forced to buy them.

great fun for the whole family. my kids love the rides here! first plan your trip and arrive early. take the cable car to the summit. breathtaking trip! try the bumper blaster & arctic blast. visit the south pole spectacular and north pole encounter too. make sure you visit adventure land and ride on the mine train and raging river. my kids did them 3 times! we didn't really enjoy the show and wish we had spent more time at the aquarium and panda encounters. will be back!

A travesty of its original intentions. Ocean Park was started in the 1980s as beautiful peaceful gardens with some animal attractions such as the marvelous aquarium and the seal wave cove. There was also considerable research behind the scenes into dolphin conservation.Now the place is like Alton Towers but worse. The gardens are gone, there is incessant loud pop music played through speakers along the paths, and every attraction has 'exit through the shop'. The animals are still there and the aquarium is even larger, but they are a mere sideshow for the people who are attracted by all the 'thrill rides'. The environmental messages were ignored by the vast majority, as were appeals for 'quiet' and 'no flash' by the panda enclosure.Be under no illusions; this has become a place for young people (not young children) in search of an adrenaline rush.It left me in tears.

A great day in a very nice park. It is a wonderful experience. The park was very clean, and everything seemed fresh and newly painted. The only thing that was a problem was walking up a very very long hill from the Space Wheel ride.

Not for children under 7. Recommended by my office (but maybe they had never been, or were mildly retarded in recommending this place). I had two children of 3 and 6.Got there when it opened, no big queues and we got the cable car over to the bigger rides section (this was great for the kids and that’s the 2 stars – from then on it went rapidly worse). One of my children could go on a number of rides but maybe only about 25% of the rides, my youngest child being approx. 1m tall could go on very little and it only really left the baby rides.This is a place for children who I reckon are from about 7-13 as they will be able to go on a lot of the rides – you have to be at least 1.3m for most of the rides and a number as I recall were higher than this.My first issue was with the signposting – sure they exist but could be better… I felt like we did a bit of needless walking about at times and with 2 kids it was tiring, especially down to the Pirate ship area as most of the rides we couldn’t get on with my 6 year old anyway!Make sure you go straight for the cable car, later in the morning and into the afternoon the queues are simply horrendousFood choices are poor, food is just crap, no decent choices or even half decent choices for a Western familyAquarium was rubbish – I was disappointed at this especially having recently been to Cape Towns aquariumPanda enclosure was good (though not for the animals – I bet its too small for them – in a sealed environment)My biggest issue was with the quantity of people, especially from early afternoon, it was like the hordes of Babylon had descended on the place with what must have been 100’s of coach parties and a lot of older people. I have nothing against older people its just what were they doing in a resort that is really for children – this is not a place for adults only… just don’t even think about this place if you don’t have kids around 7-13… you will feel a complete muppet for coming here… so older people don’t come to a place for kids! – I felt like the entire population of Southern China was at the resort the afternoon we were there… yep it was shoulder to shoulder in virtually the entire resort!Back to the quantity of people – I felt like an extra in a stampede – so many people getting on train to go back down from the cable car/larger rides section it was just awful. We had tried to come back by the cable car but the queue was at leas an hour long so that was a ‘no-go’ – it was hellish….Being in Asia you find that people have absolutely no manners at all – and push in on queues and don’t care about anyone’s personal space (I half expected someone to clear their throat for good measure also at times!). I found my self widening myself most of the time to stop people walking into our children, to stop them being walked into… people here don’t care, they are so rudeAnd then we found people taking pictures of our kids – I have no idea what that was about – We had to kindly ask someone to stop taking pictures of my boy – it was just bizarre, it was definitely a WTF moment.. though this has nothing to do with the resort, just indicates there were quite a few weirdo’s at the place.. all on coach parties by the looks of it from Southern China.The biggest highlight was leaving – never to return again…

A Great Day Out!. What a super place this is. I went there with a group of friends- ages 28 to 59 so a wide audience to appeal to, however there was plenty of fun for all! Adventurous rides for the dare-devils, log-flumes and the animal exhibits for the less adventurous! The park has a worthy environmental message running throughout and views to die for from the revolving view platform.I loved the way all animals have really suitable enclosures. The penguins, seals and walrus have deep water pools, the pandas have extensive grassed enclosures.This was an excellent day out with plenty to do and tons to see. I recommend it whole-heartedly.

fun place. its a fun place for kids and adults as well:P the kids will get to know and understand underwater creatures and the adults will enjoy the fun rides:P too bad Hair Raiser is down when went there though...

Crazy day. I was really crazy for games there.The ocean park is really big . You 'd better prepare the full day for it . And you 'd better choose which you are really want to see before. You can't go to everywhere in one day . I like the show in the theatre .

Ocean Park. We went specifically to see the Sea Jellies, Panda, aquarium, Goldfish Treasures exhibitions. We were not disappointed. Allow plenty of time, do not go on a weekend, and arrive at opening time 10.00 am in order to avoid the masses of tour groups. Head straight to the Cable Car that takes you to the top of the park and work back down through the exhibits. We did not make use of any of the amusement/thrill rides.

An awesome day of fun!. With heaps of attractions & thrill rides, what more could you ask from 1 of the best theme parks in Asia?here's a link on Buses that run back & forth to the theme park:http://www.oceanpark.com.hk/html/en/plan-your-visit/transportation/public-transport.html

Amusement park with rides and animals: worth it!. I have been to this park many times but it is always changing and adding new things to make it better and bigger.It is located on a mountain and you can get there easily by bus from Admiralty. There is a direct bus and you can even buy tickets to the park there or in any 7/11 store in Hong Kong to avoid the queues at the main entrance. Or you can buy it online (www.oceanpark.com.hk/html/en/home/).Entry ticket prices are reasonable as it includes all the rides (HK280 for adults and HK140 for kids).If you want to enjoy all the park has to offer is better to plan a full day for it. Do go early and preferably on a week day as you will have almost no queues for the rides and attractions. It is better to get out a little bit before it closes or it will get too crowded and it won’t be easy to take a bus or catch a taxi.There are not too many indoor activities so it is better to avoid very hot and sunny days.Wear comfortable shoes as you will walk a lot.Take a map and a show schedule at the entrance and plan what you want to see on one side and then on the other side of the park.Usually the cable car has a long queue and I would recommend going there first. The views from the cable car are amazing. It will go up the mountain and take you to the other side of that mountain and you will have stunning views of the harbor. It is quite tall and if you do not like highs you can always take the underground train. If the cable car is too crowded this train is much faster also.This park is good for small kids, big kids and adults as it has different kinds of attractions and rides.My daughter is 7 years old and loved the merry go round, the frog hopper, the playground and the talking tree that teaches kids to recycle as well as the whiskers show, the dolphin show, the pandas, penguins and walrus. She also liked the mascot meet and greet and enjoyed taking photos with them.My son is a little older (10 years) and enjoyed the whiskers show, the dolphin show, the pandas, penguins and walrus and the Rapids, a water ride.For more adventurers (kids or adults) there are roller coaster rides like train mine, artic blast, and hair raiser as well as raging river. On the water rides you will get wet, maybe even soaked.There are 2 panda exhibition halls. The one nearest to the aquarium is always crowded and have long queues. It is small and doesn’t have much space, reminds me of a corridor. The new hall (Giant Panda Adventure), almost opposite to the underground train station, is much nicer and usually doesn’t have so many people. The environment is much better and it looks more like a natural environment. They have red pandas in this hall also.The aquarium is nice and has a lot of fishes and an area where you can touch some of them. The park has a program for the kids to learn about sea life and to protect the species and even spend the night in the aquarium. My son did it with his school and loved it!The polar adventure area was new to us and very, very nice but quite cold (bring a coat!). The penguin hall was nice and kids and adults enjoyed it. There is also walrus, and artic fox den (the entry for this one is not easy to find as it is on the exit of a gift shop. Do look for it as the artic fox is really cute).The dolphin show isn’t what it used to be when they had the killer whale, long time ago, but they do tell a nice story and try to make people aware that we should all protect the animals.It also has sea lions doing some tricks as well as the dolphins jumping around. And for an extra price you can meet a dolphin.Nearby, there is a pier with seals that is very nice. You can see the seals outside the water and even feed them for a fee, and then you can go down and see the seals swimming under water.The final show in the main fountain with 3D effects is very nice and worth seeing.We went to the park for 2 days in the end of September/beginning of October and there were a lot of Halloween decorations around the park but they had a different ticket for the Halloween party at night time, which we didn’t try.Water inside the park is quite expensive and I remember paying HK20 for a 300 ml bottle. I had bought some in 7/11 and it was only HK5, but it was hot and it finished fast. Do bring water and some snacks, especially for the kids.Food prices in food stalls are reasonable but it is fast food. There is a restaurant in the Grand Aquarium that we didn’t try and the Tuxedos restaurant, which is very nice. It has a large glass to the penguins and you can watch the penguins as you have lunch. It had a long queue and we waited around half an hour but it was a nice environment inside. Prices are a little bit higher than in the food stalls but I found it reasonable for Hong Kong standards. Do bring a coat as it is quite cold in the restaurant.
Not for small kids. This park is for older kids looking for an adrenaline rush, very little to do for toddlers and the food options were awful.

Wow.. We only had a couple of hours at this park and you need a good day to explore what is on offer. The Pandas were the highlight for my wife and two boys. The park has a lot to offer and the only disappointment was not enough time.

One of the best things to do in Hong Kong!. As an expat living in Hong Kong, we continually have visitors and I always take them to Ocean Park, it is my favorite things to do. Ocean Park isn't just for kids, it is for kids and adults alike. There are great animal exhibits, it seems like they are opening new ones every few months and there are fabulous roller coaster rides and also tamer rides. In my opinion, if you just go to visit the Panda exhibit it is well worth the price of the ticket.A few suggestions to ease your visit, buy your tickets ahead of time on line, at least the day before. You can pick them up beginning at 9:30 am. Pick them up and get ready to go in as soon as the gates open at 10 am, sometimes they open a little early. The first stop should be the Panda exhibit (check out the park map to acquaint yourself with where they are located). For some reason, most of the visitors don't go there until a little later on and you can normally find yourself in the exhibit without a whole lot of people around. Also, they are fairly active in the morning eating their bamboo and wandering around their enclosures. We have been lucky enough to see them splashing in their stream, it was pretty incredible. Photo opportunities abound in the early morning. After you leave the Panda exhibit make sure you take a few minutes to watch the otters, they are always very active and it's on your way out of Panda area.My next stop would be to either ride the cable car over mountain (this is a beautiful view and great photos) to the other side or ride the new underground tunnel...both are a must, we typically take the train over and cable car back at the end of the day. If you like to ride rides, the new roller coasters are a lot of fun. The lines typically aren't too long first thing in the morning and you can get a lot of rides under your belt. After you are finished riding rides, the new penguin exhibit is great and also the new aquarium. All the exhibits are good, but those are my favorites.Ocean Park is a great way to spend a half day or full day, depending on how much time you have to spare on a visit to Hong Kong. The park is normally in full swing (very crowded) by about 1 pm, when the tour buses arrive in full force. We typically go first thing and leave by about 1 or 2 pm and head to Stanley Market for a nice peaceful lunch somewhere on the board walk!Ocean Park isn't Sea World, but it is a fabulous place to spend a day and Sea World doesn't have Pandas! Go check it out and enjoy!

An excellent family venue. This park is just brilliant. It offers fun for the big and litte kids. One side of the mountain caters more for the little kids with merry go rounds, a small ferris wheel, great playground and train rides. A short cable car ride or train ride and you are on the other side, which is more of the wild water rides and bigger and scarier rides. You could definatley spend a full day or more in this park. Food is not allowed and bags are inspected upon entry.
Great value. Dont miss this one. Make sure you go. There is plenty to do and see. You will need a full day. Full of fun and action for all ages. A marvelous aquarium.

Great experience with Wildlife. This was a great experience for any age, gender alike. It provides great amusement rides and also many places to view animals. Definitely a place children would LOVE. Would say that it's quite expensive though.
multi-themed park. go not just foir the rides, but the cable car ride, the dolphins, sea lions, penguins, the walrus, the grand aquarium, and last but not the least, the spectacular SYMBIO.

Amazing. The Park has been designed to be enjoyed not only by kids but also for adults. They have educational facilities regarding marine life.Cable rides are also available if you want to see the view of the park but if you really have problems with height, you can take the train which is available as well. Also if you are looking for thrilling rides you can try train mine, flash and hair raiser. But this rides aren't for those who got heart problems and fear of heights. I managed to get my family and aunts to get on a water ride and they did enjoy it though we really got wet!

Fun day out!. We had a really fun day out at Ocean Park. We took a bus from Admirality which took us direct to the park and where we were also able to buy our park tickets so that we didn't have to queue when we got to the park. The cable cars across to the rides is quite an experience!! Amazing view, but can be a little scary if you are scared of heights. There is an underground tram that you can ride instead. We rode back in this and was very quick. There are a number of fun rides for adults and kids and we didn't have to queue for any of them for longer than 20 minutes, but most just needed a 5 minute wait. The Flash was definitely my favourite ride. The panda's in the first section are definitely worth a look. All on all a fun day, but wear comfy shoes as you will end up walking miles!!

Great for kids and sea lovers. Ocean Park is a theme park mixed with an educational aquarium. Our son loves it, we spend the mornings learning about the sea, the fish, the sharks, the jellyfish etc... and the afternoon we roam the rides looking for the next thrills. It is a cheaper, closer and more educational alternative to Hong Kong Disneyland.
Fun. Long line-ups, but that is to be expected. I found this to be much more enjoyable than the Hong Kong Disneyland. Stay for the fountain show at the end of the night. it's a lot of fun to watch.

Worthwhile trip. We took a trip out to Ocean park as someone recommended us to go see the pandas. They were really cool, but the rest of the park was an experience also. It was a pretty quiet day so we ended up being able to go on a lot of the rides and roller coasters. It's just amazing that they built this theme park essentially on the side of a mountain. The views of the ocean all around the park were just beautiful. Even though there are a lot of things to do in HK, we took a day to do this and felt like it was totally worthwhile.
