fantastic. we chose to visit ocean park on a whim and found a vast area full of animals and entertainment we spent the entire day and could have returned the following day if we had time. the cost of entry covers most attractions and the on site restaurant provide better than average food at reasonable prices. we especially enkoyed the panda enclosure, these magnificent animals have a pleasant looking area and are treated with respect by the staff and visitors.

Fantastic day out. Be there early, buy your tickets from any 7/11 store in Hong Kong to avoid the queues. Easy taxi ride from Time Square, and then return. Less than $40HK (depending on traffic) each way.Once in the park Take the 15 min cable car ride to the other side of the park to begin your fun and awe at the spectacular views of Repulse bay area.Its a fun filled day out for the kids and the big kids. I’m an adult and had a fantastic dime, on the Ferris wheel, rollercoasters, water displays and many many other rides. Food in the park is very average, unless you go to a restaurant within the park, which can be a little expensive.Maps are a little hard to use to navigate, as the paths and locations are not clear on how to get from place to place.All in all, a great day out for the whole family, and thoroughly recommend it.

much better than expected. it was a large park with so much to do considering the low price (when compared to theme parks in europe and the US) they had a good selection of animals and rides and the light show at the end is well worth sticking around for-it gives disney more than a run for its money! We went in october and didnt have to que for anything at all. It is also worth visiting the tuxedos restaurant, which isnt cheap, but there is a large glass wall where you can watch the penguins as you eat. Do takea jacket for in there though as its unsurprisingly freezing!

Great fun for kids. We visited Ocean Park with the main aim of seeing the pandas! Unfortunately the panda enclosure is fairly small and visitors are ushered through in an almost conveyor belt type fashion meaning it is both crowded and very difficult to stop and take photos. That said we were unprepared for the rest of the Park and the huge range of attractions on offer. I was there with my 7 year old for which there were more than enough rides to keep her occupied all day. But at the same time teenagers are just as well catered for with an abundance of thrill rides. The Park has recently opened a new Penguin attraction which was great, although do be prepared and take a jumper with you as the penguin enclosure is kept at a much lower temperature to the 30 degrees + outside! One of the Park's highlights for us was the cable car ride which links the two distinct areas of the Park - the views are amazing. I personally felt places to eat were limited and were typical of an amusement park as in primarily fast food. Ocean Park is not, in my opinion, a patch on Disney, however as a family friendly day out in Hong Kong it is hard to beat.

Great Fun. We were supprised at the size and different attractions of it all. reccommend to go early and take it all in . animal attractions were great, cable car was fun, as was the train(try it)rides were fun and the lines were short and some had no lines at all. advise to go during the week(we went on a tuesday)

Enjoying Ocean Park. The rides are Ocean Park are for both the young and the young at heart. We enjoyed the roller coaster and the ship away. They also have vast variety of interesting fishes at oceanarium.

Pandas & penguins. We came here specifically to see the pandas & they were adorable!! The park was pretty quiet on a Monday. The location of the park is so beautiful & I enjoyed the view on the cable car in between the 2 areas. We got to do the penguin experience which included some info on the penguins, what they do as a penguin-keeper, & actually got to touch & take pics with the penguin. The staff were very friendly & just a wonderful once in a lifetime experience I think. It's a group of 4-6ppl usually, but my husband & I were the only ones to do it this particular day, so it was like a private tour about penguins. $100+/pp but worth the splurge since we'll never be back :)

Best theme park/zoo I have been to. My tips for a better experience:1. Go on a weekday if possible to avoid the biggest crowds2. Get there at opening time of 9:303. Go straight to the cable cars and enjoy the ride across to the rides before its too hot or crowded4. Wear your most comfy footwear (it's a very big park and you will walk lots)5. The cable car restaurant is air conditioned and the food is good and the drinks cold.6. Plan your route around the rides to use escalators and not go over the same ground too much.It's a great park and my only criticism is it could really use more shaded areas.

This is a great place for the family. We live and die during the hot summer months in HK at Ocean Park. The activities for our two year old and four month old are great. Get there early, right on the open at 930 am and be leaving before noon as it can get crowded.

One of the best theme parks I have been to. What a surprise day out! This attraction should be ranked much higher. Only went because we met a fellow traveller who recommended Ocean Park. The best way to describe Ocean Park is a zoo and amusement park in one. The entry is great value at $35 AUD that includes all rides, train and cable car. The animal enclosures are excellent and there are plenty of shows throughout the day. You will need a full day if you want to see everything and try out most of the rides. A taxi from Causeway Bay cost $100 HKD during non peak time including tunnel toll. Would return to Ocean Park next time I'm in Hong Kong.

Best amusement park ever!. Having been to Disneyland we decided to try Ocean Park. After Day-1 we only saw half of it, so it was a natural decision to go back second day.The park is huge, full of interesting animals, very safe, and with relatively good and not overpriced food.If you go there, don't miss the Pandas, the dolphin show and the penguins! If you just go there for the rides, have fun on the Adventure mountain!

The Chinese Disney Version, and is awesome. Been there with two young children, and the park was amazing.If my children were older or If I was going with my mates, no worries, the Park will cater for all ages and tastes.Yes the cable car is old, but the ride is amazing, with wonderful views. When the roller-coasters appear...wow!!!Roller coasters and elevators on the top of the mountain, how awesome is that? Aquariums, penguins, pandas, seals, and much more, not only a park but also a Zoo, a-m-a-z-i-n-g!!! Unfortunately life is not perfect and there is always something bad to report... In this one is the outrageous prices for food and beverages in e park, specially in comparison with Disneyland Hong Kong.Go!! It's worth it!!
Pandas!. Loved the pandas. The park is very well set up with lots of attractions. PS Take an umbrella in case of downpours!

a worthwhile visit to ocean park hongkong. it is a very good theme well worth visiting.it is a combination of amusement park,marine mammal park and animal theme park.It is divided into two distinct areas about 2 km apart separated by a mountain.Thses are called Headland or Summit and waterfront I personally liked The Summit better.We went from waterfront to The Summit in a charming old world railway carriages and came back by cable car.All these are free ie you dont have to pat for any ride or anything else except the entrance fee.Before coming,some people were selling entry tickets at a price lower than the printed price.We were allowed entry with these tickets.THERE ARE SO MANY THINGS TO SEE AND DO THAT A WHOLE DAY SEEMS NOT TO BE ENOUGH. In water rides one has to buy a plastic sheet for not getting wet which is available on the spot and is overpriced.Giant pandas can be seen in the open panda enclosure.

The best amusement park in hongkong. Great entertainment; A day packed with fun and excitement; Thrilling to the core...Some of the rides like the Roller coaster and the Flash were really HAIR RAISERS....though small kids would have to stay back...Great place!!!!Get indian food too in the food court near the Bird Play area/Flash

If You have to Choose, I Suggest You Think Twice before Going to Disneyland. First up, I confess, I have never been to Disneyland. Any of them. The reason is simple: I cannot think of a more horrid way to blow my bucks than drowning in a sickly sweet milkshake of something that doesn't have milk in it.Fortunately, two years ago, whilst staying with some Hong Kong local friends of mine, we took up their advice and took our late teen kids to Ocean Park.What a truly fabulous place.Accesibility is most straight forward by bus. Through the Aberdeen tunnel and you are there. Hong Kong has a fantastic public transport system; it is a consequence of necessity, but it is really good. You must get an Octopus Card. That means one for everyone, a separate one for everyone, children included.Entry is most reasonably priced; don't try to skimp; the park is many rolled into one, and with enthusiastic kids, could occupy two days. Others have noted there is not much hotel accommodation nearby, but it does not matter: if you are staying on The Island, you can be quickly at Ocean Park via the excellent public transport system.Ocean Park is a zoo, amusement park, aquarium, 'seaworld', and nature reserve (Honk Hong style) of the highest standard. The cable-car rides to and from the major areas of the park are worthy tourist attractions in their own rights. We spent one day at Ocean Park. The entire site was clean and extremely well cared for. The Amusement Park rides interlace the enormous headland aside Aberdeen Harbour. There are therefore some stairways to negoiate, but nothing I would consider strenuous. As you walk between attractions, you will enjoy pathways bordered by well-kept and charming gardens. Food onsite, is, as expected.Towards the 'bottom' of the Park is the aquarium and 'Seaworld'. Both are excellent. be mindful of the showtimes for the 'Seaworld'. It would be a great shame to miss an excellent show. Now, having said so many positive things, I will also tell you we went to Ocean Park in midweek, during October, a sort of nothing time. But, it was so nothing that the 'kids' ran off the end of their favourite roller-coaster and straight back onto it. No-one else was there. I hestitate to hope you may enjoy such fortune, but I believe the mid-week option is good. Enjoy. Please note: the web site does not allow me to select a review date earlier than Nov, 2011. We visited Ocean Park in Oct 2010, and as I have been to Hong Kong 20 times+ since with work, and have a number of friends living there, I think you will find my review relevant.When in Hong Kong, do, with or without kids, take a day to visit Ocean Park.

Just Fabulous. Wow, we were so impressed with Ocean Park, it had everything. Loved the Pandas, Walrus, Seals etc etc. All the activities and attactions you could want in one place and so well maintained. You need the whole day and some patience but well worth it. It was a very easy train and bus trip from Kowloon. Mind you, we are seniors and had a ball.

The best day out with or without kids. I loved this place. It had so many more attactions than Disneyland and so much more to see. The wildlife attractions were like nothing I had ever seen before. Definately a must for anyone going to Hong Kong.

Brilliant, breathtaking, a must!. We were absolutly blown away by Ocean Park. The entry price is an absolute bargain for the amount of activities and visual delights that you will experence while you are there. Allow a while day and night is our tip. If you have young children there is a whole section dedicated to them - rides, games, palyground and activites. The animals they have on showcase here are so varied from an array of gold fish, parrots. panda bears, reptiles, they amount we saw was really surprising. The sky rail is breathtaking and the rides on the upper part provide adults with their fun. The aquarium was amazing and a little tip from us, stay after the night show and have dinner in the restaurant. The place is basically deserted and you have dinner with floor to ceiling aquarium views, dining as the turtles, sharkes, manta rays and fish swim on past to stay hello. That is our other tip, you must definatly stay for the evening show. Such a production - world class!

too many attractions, too little time. so much attractions & rides that you'll probably need 2 full days. If only there's a hotel nearby. Hope the MTR will be completed soon, so the current bus service doesnt seem adequate to serve the crowd.Must visits are the panda enclosures, new aquarium, north & south pole enclosures.Nostalgic HK street, bakery & eateries are quite disappointing though. Limited food choices at the old HK street do not appeal to the crowd. Bakery could be more creative, eg: have waffles, buns in turtle or squid shapes (ocean world theme). Most eateries close at 5pm, this is too early, considering that visitors stay behind for the light show at 7pm

Great day out. Lots to see and do, think I enjoyed the Zoo more than the rides, Im not a rollercoaster fan but still enjoyed it. The rides here are pretty tame compared to ones found in UK. If you can go mid week then there is practically no queueing

Dolphins. My wife is just crazy about dolphins, and we enjoyed the program to meet the dolphins in person and go in the pool with them to touch them and hug them (no swimming though). The park itself is very nice too! You can enjoy the rides and the views at the same time.TIP: Go early and go to the top as soon as possible, we had no queuing and it looked very empty while in the afternoon everything was packed!

A nice surprise.. I wasn't sure what to expect but we actually had a very good time at Ocean Park. We really enjoyed seeing the Pandas, both the black and white and the red pandas. It was such a treat to see them so close up. We weren't able to ride too many attractions as the park is very spread out over the mountain. We had to take either the skyway, submarine trolley and many escalators to get from one level to another and being that it was our first time, we weren't able to plan our visit very well. Besides, it was summer and very crowded! Not too many shady and cool areas to hang out and rest. It can get very stifling in some areas of the park without any breeze. I'm not sure I would ride on any of the "E-ticket" rides as many are positioned right near the edge of the mountain. I'm sure they are safe since there's been many before me but I'll keep my feet on the floor! It was a nice combination of rides and exhibits.

worth spending your whole day. it is quite easy to find since a lot people recommend this place and hong kong map have proper explanation on how to go there. Once you enter ocean park, you should choose either go for rides first or go for aquarium and shows. For these, do check out the shows time (panda feeding, dolphin, seal etc). between the time, instead of relaxing doing nothing, do get on the rides. my only regret is that i couldnt try the whole rides T.T... The foods are expensive, in case you r on budget, bring food and water for your brunch, lunch, dinner..it saves a lot..when i came, it was raining..so remember your raincoat or umbrella!!

Amazing morning. My mom and I spent a morning at Ocean Park. We aren't big into the rides etc, but really just went to see the pandas.. It was such a wonderful morning.. Instead of spending only an hour or so looking at the animals we wanted to, we went on train rides and the cable car and jsut had the best time. The facilities are incredible and it is a fantastic place for both adults and children. A great place to also pick up inexpensive gifts for the kids back home. Very enjoyable and well recommended.

Surprisingly fun. A theme park largely aimed at kids, but as a middle aged couple we still had a good time here. The attractions are well run, there are lots of laughs and surprises around the park, and the chairlift ride is amazing!
Crowded. The rides needed at least 10 mins to queue and there were many people cutting queues which made the duration of waiting longer. Overall it was a good experience

Not their fault but we were disappointed. Based on the recommendations by my HK friends, this was like a place that you had to see. So of course we did so.Friendly word of advice - make sure that the day you visit Ocean Park is not a public holiday in HK or China. We made the unfortunate choice of visiting Ocean Park on the Mid-Autumn holidays and we were overwhelming by the deluge of mainlanders. This had a flow on effect as all the rides had a wait time of in excess of an hour. At the end of the day, we manage to have 1 go on the bumper blasters (bumper cars), space wheel, the rapids and the cable cars.The space wheel had no wait time probably due to the fact that it was located in a isolated part of the park. I had wasted 2 hours waiting in line for the Hair Raiser but gave up considering that snail pace that it was moving it plus my 7 year old was gettting hungry.Also bear in mind that as Ocean Park is build around a hillside, there is some degree of climbing and walking to do. Escalators are present but will not get you from point A to point B totally. Bus service from Admiralty to Ocean Park was easy and directions were available. Probably will visit on the next trip if it happens but remember, not on a gazetted PUBLIC HOLIDAY!

Good family entertainment. The park has a great mix of animals and rides. The cable car and train connecting the two parks are great fun. The highlight for us was seeing the giant pandas and the red pandas, but there are loads of other animals as well. Some bits feel a bit too commercial with lots of opportunities to spend money on silly fair ground games and that spoilt the atnmosphere in places.

Good day trip. Great zoo/amusement park. Entry fee is reasonable compared to othr parks Ive been to. The animals seem to be well taken care of, large cages except for the raccoon! Smallest cage there with no place for him to hide or get cover!Panda bears were great to see, once in a lifetime experience to see them. Line ups were sometimes long for different attractions but moved very quickly.Take a ride on the cable cars, very cool and on the other side of them is the dolphin park that puts on a great show.-Wear sunscreen

the long long queues and crowd make it maddening. it would be a nice place to go and enjoy if only the crowds are manageable..it took almost 1 hr to get it..then about 1 hr waiting in queue for each ride..that spoils the experience. go to hong kong in weekdays..that the only way to enjoy..and never ever go to hk in any kind of vacation days like their independence day..christmas etc..you'll repent it.. when we were there more than 2 million people from mainland china came into hk..u can imagine the rest
Great day out. This park was lots of fun. Lots of fun rides and the added bonus of seeing animals - especially the Pandas.
Excellent. I like it all in the Ocean Park, like ocean, cable car, water sports... it was great time for me when was in the Ocean park. we went with my friends 6 persons. all of us enjoyed well

Not bad. Ocean park was ok, more scary rides than Disneyland but not as nice or well organised. The pandas were lovely, the queues were not bad better for teenagers. If you are sick of public transport a taxi was cheap.

Ocean Park. I had been to Ocean Park 20yrs ago and told my partner how cool it was way back then, he said he didn't think it sounded like something he would enjoy. So he googled it, got interested, and we went and had so much fun. Unfortunately we were told to go to Central and we needed to get to Admiralty, so wasted valuable time going the extra MTR, we didn't actually get there till 1pm, which turned out to be far too late. We had to go quickly to see all that we wanted to and ended up missing the penguins, three of the rides and most of the laser, fire and fireworks display at the end.Best parts of the day were the pandas, the wonderful growly walrus (I've never seen one before and he kept us spellbound watching him swim, lunge himself out of the water and roar, very cool) the house of jellyfish, wow! and the bird show was a clever surprise.Worst part was at the end of a very hot day waiting an hour for the gondola only to find that groups of one or two were having a whole gondola to themselves when they hold seven people. The queue could have moved twice as quickly if they had organised people to share. That was maddening actually, as parents were carrying sleeping children, old people were standing the whole time and it could have been avoided. Plus we could have all made it on time to see the light show finale.
Overrated. The experience was a bit over rated. They need to upgrade and include a water park especially in HK summer.Panda's and red panda's were great though.

One whole mountain!. We went starting from the other end of the mountain and went out of the other end, It was huge!There is an escalator in the mountains, beautiful view around while climbing the mountains riding the escalator. Many different mammals from the sea, a cable car, restaurant, souvenir shops, good restrooms, elderly friendly and even has toilets for handicapped. Friendly and accommodating staff, but some of them their English cannot be understood. Prices are quite affordable. Needs to walk and walk and walk, so wear a comfortable shoes, and bring umbrellas, if it rains you do not have a place to run for cover.beautiful sea creatures, wonderful aquariums and the penguin, i loved it it was entertaining and fun.Recommended for all ages to see!
Disneyland is better. We went to Ocean Park. This place is highly recommended if you have small kids. Else disneyland is a better place overall
must visit. mus visit family attraction.can try super crazy thrilling rides.merchandise cheaper than disney's merchandise.cable-car must try !!!
it was exellent. we use the transfer from admiralty mtr station .just the bottel water was very expensive and the weather was very hot and humid at that time and we must drink water alot .

A fun day out. We had a great day at Ocean Park. We went on a Saturday but didn't feel it was too busy. They are a bit full on always trying to take group photos and sell them on though. A nice toddler section was a bonus.

Great attraction.. Did a full day tour of this attraction. Plenty to keep everyone occupied. Unfortunately the cable car wasn't working for us here either. If you have your photo taken on the train to go up to the next level your photo is available at the top, which wasnt made clear.

Good for everyone, lots to do.. PLace is huge with lots of things to do... rides, animals (panda, sea lions, dolphins, penguins, etc), shows, cable cars, etc ... be prepared to spend a whole day there just to cover most of the things to see. Lot of walking to be done inside the park but eating places all around and unfortunately very hot when I went so carried lots of water.

Not for young families. We recently visited Hong Kong and had Ocean Park as a "must see" due to some great reviews. It was very easy to get to, caught the MTR to Admiralty and then one of many buses which took us straight to Ocean Park. Once we arrived, we went to the Aquarium which was extremely overcrowded and very difficult for the kids to see the tanks due to being pushed out of the way all the time. Unfortunately, the cable cars were not working whilst we were there which was a huge dissapointment as this is obviously one of the main attractions of the park. The only way to the other side of the mountain was by the train which again was extremely overcrowded. As the Park is spread out over both sides of the mountain, during such hot weather was a real effort to get young kids easily around the park. There was an area for younger children which was quite good, however, we felt that this park really catered for teens. Don't bother taking prams or strollers there as to get up and down the mountain, to and from the different areas, is quite a task, particularly in hot weather. We had been to Disneyland earlier in the week and Ocean Park did not compare in the slightest. Ocean Park is old and in need of a refurbishment and the park attendants and amenities are few and far between. We did not come across any drink stations and at every attraction you were pulled aside to be photographed and then hassled to buy it. We felt it was overpriced and belive that we would have had a more enjoyable time spending a second day at Disneyland.

Awesome fun for the whole Family!!. This was a great day out and caters for little and big kids alike. We caught the train to Admiralty then pre purchased tickets which saved a few dollars. We the jumped on one of the several double decker buses that took us direct to Ocean Park. There are plenty for rides and attractions to keep everyone busy and we left at closing time. Most of the rides had queues under 15 minutes As is the norm with these parks the food is absolute rubbish and over priced.

Spent a good day there. We went last week with 3 kids (6,8 and 10yo) and 5 adults. For older folks, there is a lot to see, but also a lot of walking involved. The park is huge and covers the front and back side of a mountain. The cable car was down when we were there, but the train was convenient enough to get to and from the back side of the mountain. Food is expensive as well as gifts. So, bring food if you're on a limited budget. Bring water also. I don't recall seeing any filling stations like they had at HK Disneyland. The exhibits were very enjoyable, and the kids loved the animals. The do have a "rafting" ride that you will get wet on, so if you think you may ride it, bring swim suits (for a hot day). Good shade is lacking in some parts of the park. The roller coasters are fun, but the two largest ones really rattled our skulls - so they were only 1 timers...

Not to be missed.. Ocean ParkWhen we were planning our trip to Hong Kong Ocean Park was high on our list, we went to Disneyland which we really enjoyed then did some other touristy things the next day and then a visit to Ocean Park. We took the MTR to Admiralty and whist leaving the station we spotted a shop selling tickets which were much cheaper than the at park tickets. We then left the station and joined what looked like a massive queue for the buses but there were many buses and within about 10mins we were on the bus; remember to have your octopus card out as you have to swipe your pass before you get on. After a short journey we were at Ocean Park, as we had our ticket already we just joined the queue to have our bags searched. Do remember to bring in a bottle for water with you because it is 20HKD in the park.The park is very big and I have heard that it looks dated but we did not see any signs of this and thought it was well looked after and nice and clean. There are lots of different areas and unless you go early you will struggle to do/see it all in a day. There are not many shaded areas in the park, so a tip is keep popping in to see the penguins as you get cooled down lovely. We really wanted to see the Panda’s while we were in Hong Kong and we were not disappointed as there are four to see, and they are FAB, I could have stayed watching then all day. Don’t forget to go on the cable cars they give a great view of the park. There are lots and lots of rides for all ages with a few that you need to go on with an empty stomach! Most of the rides have little storage boxes for your camera’s etc which is a really good idea, and before you get on some of the rides you are given a little basket to put our items in.I couldn’t say which park was better out of Ocean Park or Disneyland as they are both good for different reasons.

Awesome day out. My family and I went to Ocean Park primarily to see the Pandas. There are two awesome exhibits hat show off the Pandas and to see them up close is well worth the visit. The park also has an amazing Penguin exhibit which in itself is a must to see. Seeing how they swim underneath you and also how cold it's and gives you a feeling of how the Antarctic is. The park has some awesome rides, ones that you expected to see at Disnyland. The pak is split up over the mountain. The only drama is that most of the rides (90%) are for adults or older kids. In saying that it's well worth the visit. Easy to get to as well. We caught the Star Ferry over from the main land and caught one of the many mini buses up to the park.

One of the best theme parks......... If you visit Hong kong this must be a must on your list. Have a full day. Choose working days, if possible to beat the queues for each of the rides. Although I personally am not a rides person the shows with animals (Sea Lion's, Dolphin's) is nothing like I have seen before. Also get to see some cute panda's. Reserve a full day for this. Ngong ping (Giant Buddha) and Disney Land are closeby. All these attractions are at Lantau Island close to the airport. Also some cute souveneirs that you can take back to remeber the experience. The tickets are expensive but worth the spend. For Indians you get desi khana (not very authentic but you will survive!).

Fun for all ages.. I lived in Hong Kong from 1974 to 1986 and Ocean Park was a regular treat for my two children. My son, his wife and daughter (4yrs old) have lived there for over 8yrs now and as I go back every year Ocean Park is a must. We all have as much fun as we did many years ago. The Panda enclosure is just wonderful, seeing these beautiful animals up close is not to be missed as is the aquarium. Unfortunately the food is not a great attraction, long queues and not so great food but overall a great day out for all ages.

Ocean Park - don't compare with Disney - just go.. Easy to get to : - 1. Just get an MTR train to Admiralty.2. At Admiralty, make sure you look for the exit signposted for Ocean Park which will send you out close to the bus-station.3. Buy your bus and park-ticket at the booth.4. Get on the bus that takes you direct to ocean park.5. You use one of the tickets you've been given to the park and one for the journey back.6. When you leave - join the queue for the buses to take you back.When you get to the queue, don't be dismayed by it's length - we left when the park closed and the queue was a mile long. Then a bunch of buses arrived, the queue evaporated and we was on a bus with less than a 10 minute wait.Astonishing.Ocean Park is so-so. Just some fun.We went on a Tuesday - and there were a number of rides closed when we was there - one of the was the chair-lift which really disappointed us.We reckon Ocean Park and Disney are nothing like each other so I wouldn't bother about comparing. Also - I don't think you'd want to do more than 1 day at Ocean Park. We were pretty casual and I don't think we missed anything - though we did get there when the park opened and left when it closed.Our longest wait, about 30 minutes, was for the roller-coaster but we think it was worth it.The other rides are fun and we didn't have to wait long.Just go and have fun.
Fish all around. Nothing to dislike in this place, every little space here is good. The attractions, the Panda, Gold fish and the Aquarium brings back the child in me. Super love to go back here.

Average park, not in the class as sea world in the US.. I went to ocean park waiting to relive my experience in seaworld and Disneyland 11 years ago in the Us.I was abit disappointed. There were nice things to see and a few rides.. but quite basic to my taste and impressive as the American version.The only real interesting thing there was the view. The park is located on a mountain ovrviewing a beautiful marina with island.. so its nice to take the cable car or sit on the balcony in the cafe and see it..

spectacular rides. the aquarium was not really something to look forward too..but the panda (though he was camera shy urgh!), sea-animals shows and the rides were awesome!!!!! a day is not enough to enjoy this place. I also enjoyed their cable car ride to get to the other side of the mountain (thrill mountain) where the thrilling rides are..you have to queue and wait more than 30mins to get a ride and the ride will only last 2mins!! but still its worth it..

what a change from last year. so many new attractions and rides the penguin section is outstanding and the new chia town is great note try and time your trip to hong-kong while there are no school holidays over there otherwise it is bedlam.

Fun family day. We spent a few hours here when we visited. There was so much to see and do. Dancing fountains, fish, some rides, plus much more. We also got to see pandas for the first time. Good choice of eateries and the souvenirs were at a good price, with plenty of variety. I would be quite happy to visit here again, next time I go to Hong Kong

HAPPY KIDS AND GREAT DAY. Hello, We went to ocean Park with our 2 kids 3 and 5 years old and my wife. We all had a great experience despite rushing in order to be able to do what we planned to see and do in the great pleasure of our kids and ourselves. Be purchased the ticket online groupons and manged to save about 300 yuan overall. We saw the pandas (not too active mostly sleeping) dolphins (great show) sharks,crocodile,monkeys, penguins... Cable car is a great experience and the view was splendid, the girls loved it and give you some time to enjoy the quiet time and the view.Better buy some drinks before arrival, food is overall over pricey, you need to look around if you want to find affordable prices.The 2 negatives points were the fact our kids were too small and limited to most of the attractions and the limited time, better be there at the opening with your tickets already purchased to save time.There is a kids corner with some attractions for young kids where they could have a good time before heading anywhere else, it is a good start after the visit of the Grand Aquarium, Sichuan treasures(Pandas) and Giant Pandas adventures (Pandas) 2 different places to see the Pandas...then the cable car to take you to another part of the park for more attractions. (you can take the Ocean express Train but nothing to see and very quick compared to the Cable car's view...

A must see attraction!!!. You can see 2 beautiful Pandas!!! The views of the park are unbeliavable amazing!You have shows, rides, it is a great place to have family time.You need a whole day in the park.Be aware that if you need to take a taxi after visiting the park, you are better off walking outside the park and try to find a taxi.It is very hard to get a taxi inside the park unless you are not in a rush. The wait can be long!!!

Pandas. Need I say more?. Ocean Park is actually a surprisingly large theme park. It used to be the biggest in Hong Kong until Disney arrived, so I think if you have children you'll be here for a whole day. Our main goal at Ocean Park was to see the panda exhibits and fortunately these are very close to the entrance and don't require taking the cable car to the top area of the park.As mentioned in other reviews, get here early if you want to avoid queues. We got there around 11:00, and queued for about 20 minutes to get tickets, so not too bad, but this was off-peak season.The panda exhibits are excellent. They have about 6 giant pandas and if you get there during feeding time (around 11:00) you get a great view of these amazing animals. In addition to the giant pandas they also have two red pandas - look them up now - these guys are amazing.Once we'd finished with the pandas we were going to check out the aquarium but there was a 45 minute wait so we ended up leaving instead. A great few hours out if you don't have kids and just want the chance to see live pandas.I must mention that you might be suggested to get a bus to the park, I would say that's not worth it. We took a taxi from Kowloon all the way there and it cost us around HKD 50.

Too fun!. Great place for kids and their parents with plenty of shows, games, attraction roller-coster, water-fun, pass-ways, cable cabins, special traine, decorations etc..... Large aquarium above the head with variety of fishes and species just awesome. Different food on site. Vending machines around the theme park.For visiting must take at least whole day from 9 am till 7 pm.Enjoy!
Worth the price. The contents of the park VS the ticket price is fair. There's rides, shows, animals.. Good way to spend a day.

Ocean park hong kong. Knowing crowds at theme parks, we decided to visit it on a weekday. And we were glad that we did. There was a crowd but managable. Mostly mainland Chinese tourists. I last visited the park more than 15 years ago. Much have changed. They added new attractions and up graded some rides. The park is divided into 2 sections. There is the entrance on the lower part if the hill. There you can visit the aquarium, they show case all kinds of ocean creatures. Then there is the sichuan treasures, birds, pandas and a place where little kids could ride and play. Try to catch the shows where you can learn about the animals. Very educational for the family. The cable car was down for repair, so we took the ocean express, a monorail with an underwater submarine theme to the upper hill side. There were more attractions here. A must visit to the polar expedition, rainforest, jellyfish and watch the show at the ocean theatre of dolphins and sealions. There are some rides thrills for adults and children as well. Lots of walking up and down the hills. The view is Specatular. Just imagine riding on the roller coaster by the edge of the cliff overlooking the ocean. Scary and thrilling indeed! We caught some cheap tickets from a local travel agency and catch the bus from admiralty mtr station. The city bus takes you directly there. Just make sure you have an octopus card with you. It is a theme park, zoo and rides. Something for everyone. Educational and fun to be there. Glad to visit if you are in hong kong. Affordable compared to Disneyland.

A great day out. A great combination of zoo and theme park. The rides were fab (hair raiser is particularly exciting as it hangs over the cliff edge) and the pandas were so close it was an incredibly opportunity to see them.

HUGE PARK. The park is huge. Really really huge. You have to take the cable car or ocean express (train) to go to the other side of the park.What we loved about Ocean Park are the Aquariums, Penguins, etc. Rides were also fun! Although we went there on a weekday, so they close the rides as early as 6pm. Too bad we didn't get to experience the other attractions.Be sure to be there in the morning. It will literally take a whole day to go around the park.

Enjoyed the rides. I really enjoyed the rides especially the Flash where its my first time... try to have the Tower and Cable car where you could see the aerial beauty of the park and sea. You will also enjoy the live shows of the dolphins, sea lions, penguins, panda's who are really beautiful. Dont forget to bring any type sunscreen because its really hot and extra shirt/pants so you could take the Rapids.The park is open 10am upto 7:30pm, I suggest you should check the map so that you will enjoy all the attraction and shows...

Fun the first time. A lot of fun rides but because of the number of people, it takes a while to get to the front!Visited as a teenager twice while visiting family in hong kong. Expensive but tasty food, and enthusiastic staff from what I remember. The attractions are dated, and after the first time you don't need to go back because you would have seen it all, or something similar.

Recent upgrades aren't enough to make it attractive. We have been going here for years as we have young children who really enjoy the rides. The recently added new rides are the biggest attraction (for the kids) now, certainly not the huge crowds and the revolting food. It actually is not that far from Central and will be more accessible when the new MTR line opens but that will probably make it worse. Having said all that the Pandas are wonderful, well cared for and it is a great way to see them up close - just make sure you are quiet and don't disturb them as instructed by staff. Too many people don't seem to respect these lovely animals.

Worst theme park ever!!. Don't waste your money going to this Ocean Park! Very far distanced, old and ugly attractions! Please don't waste your precious money going to this ugly and outdated place!!! Very rude chinese locals. Most of the rides are really rusty! Not accommodating and friendly staffs!!
It was too crowded now. Ocean Park had been the best place to go for family before 2002 when Hong Kong was flooded by Mainland Chinese tourists. It is too crowded and noisy now.

It has everything.. Fantastic park for young, old and thrill seekers. It's a aquatic theme park at the front and thrill rides galore over the mountain. Personally would choose this park over Disney if i could only go to one of the parks.

Stars for the Animals. My family and I visited Ocean Park because the park had gained much reputation in our country, and, we just grabbed our opportunity to be there. The park was clean, tidy, but extremely crowdy. We were not interested in any of the thrill rides, so, we ignored the roller-coasters and high nauseatic games. The cable car and the observatory tower were our favourite. Then, the animals. The exhibits for animals were clean, well landscaped, and well managed. Animals were given enough rooms to move around as well. We liked the Pandas and the Seals the most.I have to agree that the food in the park was very expensive. But we took it as the price to pay in the theme park. To reach the park, we need to take either taxi or bus, not very convenient comparatively, to the transportation to HK Disneyland. It was extremely crowdy during our visit (middle of May), and it was extremely warm. The time passed extremely slow during the queueing time. Umbrella might be helpful to deter blazzing sunlight and sudden rainfall. I shared more about our experience at our blog- bettyandlingshing.blogspot.com/2012/06/hong-kong-ocean-park-and-repulse-bay.html. I would give 4 stars to the park, for all the conservation efforts and the happy animals inside the park. Must visit? Yes.

Good theme park. Went there early during a Sunday so it was rather crowded, especially with Mainland Chinese visitors and other tour groups. We went there more for the panda exhibits since we have not seen one before. It's a good place for kids to go as there are quite a number of attractions around such as the aquarium, animal exhibits and the cable car ride, although a few of them like the coasters have to started to look a bit dated. The food here is rather expensive though but if you compared it overall to Hong Kong Disneyland, it is still cheaper.Overall, a good experience for us.

Below average theme park.. We visited during a week day in early September with our young (almost 2 years old) son. We never had to line up for any rides at all.The cable car was not working on the day we went.The park is very spread out and a gian pain if you have a Child in a stroller as there are still quite a few stairs here and there.The food was as expected, not very good and a bit costly.The aquarium was a massive let down, the Melbourne aquarium is much better.The Pandas were interesting and have a similar set up to those at the Adelaide zoo. We were dissaponted in the options for smaller children, but noticed that most other visitors were much older adults which may explain the lack of rides for younger kids.Overall it was ok, but I Would recommend Disneyland Hong Kong over this park - especially if you ave smaller kids.

Dated Theme Park. My 2nd trip to Ocean Park, the first was in 1990 ( 22 years ago). The problem is this place has not changed! Could be the extremely hot weather in Hong Kong now or the pushy people who refuse to join the queues in Ocean Park. I couldn't wait to get out.Food was extremely pricey, like most theme parks. There is a McDonalds in the theme park itself and some other restaurants.The most enjoyable time I had was the cable car ride to the top. The ride was extremely cooling and the scenery was awesome. This was the only quiet time. Probably the last time I will ever visit Ocean Park. Another thing to note, if possible, don't visit Ocean Park during summer, most unpleasant experience .The weather is so hot that you might get a heat stroke.

New and exciting rides. I went to Ocean Park 3 years ago and it has changed a lot. There are new rides and attractions. It was quite busy though and I went on a weekday. So be prepared to wait in lines for 40-45 minutes.

Theme park. Ocean park is not only a place for kiddies ,,,,, when I went I never had a hil so consequently never went on rides,,, but I went to see the fantastic giant pandas they have as you cannot go to hong kong and not see the beautiful giant pandas,, they are a must,, there is also lots or adults to do without having a child ,,

Over priced attraction. Except for the big aquarium, the other attraction (including the dolphin show) was just average. The panda cage only have 2 pandas and other animal attractions are only a few. For the price we paid, it was not even a worth effort to do.

A park for everyone. The theme park has been well developed and there were areas for sea creatures, aquariums, pandas etc. there was also a children theme park with lots of rides with short or no queues. An awesome place for the young and old to spend a day together.

2 time here and still good. The coasters have been upgraded and new addition were made. The trill mountain and forest trail was fresh and fun. The hong kong old street was full of history and street food of hongkong ( no smelly tofu) . The hair riser was one of the best coaster I have taken there. The pandas are still there, but recently they add a bigger aquarium. And it was awesome !!!

Brilliant trip! Thrilling and plenty to do and see!. I came here with my boyfriend during our 3day stopover in hongkong and it was a lovely breath of fresh air from the hustle and bustle of the big city! the views from the cable cars and rides are STUNNING.The rides were great, barely any queues compared to theme parks I've been in before. Don't be expecting Alton towers or six flags standards of rides - they are a little more tame, but still highly enjoyable! The hair raiser was my favourite! It's worth waiting for the front row! Food choices were standard and decent prices. We ended up in mcdonalds because we'd run out of money but even it was ye same prices as outside the park. The aquarium was fantastic. Best one I've ever been to! We saw the diver feeding the sharks and rays which was unbelievable! We got to touch a starfish, and all the displays are really great.Even if the queue is long to get in it goes quickly! They told us it would be 45mins and I think it was 15 we waited! The giant pandas were gorgeous and had a lovely big enclosure to play in. And the red pandas were so cute- they had been trained a little and so were showing off! We really did have a great day and unfortunately couldn't stay for the later shows due to having to catch our flight but we would have loved to. the park is lovely, and good price considering you get a theme park AND an awesome aquarium!

natural park for kids. compare with the business disney this park not only give a funs to family but also educate family and kids to love the environment, love the earth, love the family u are staying in...hope more places can give this kind of education not only money...
Great park. Great place to take your kids. Especially older ones but there is still plenty of things to do with the younger ones. Amazing Panda exhibit. Wonderful place to spend the day!

nice getaway with kids. it s a nice place to go with kids, but better for older ones, as little ones can only see the aquarium, the dolphin show and all the other animals. the attractions are mainly from the age of 6 or older. but still it s a lovely place to spend a day.

Worth it for the Pandas. Ocean Park is defnitely worth while especially if you have children - they will go crazy! I would defnitely recommend getting to the park as early as possible as the lines are long and there are millions of people. Luckily for us, the asian animals were all near the entrance and that is the main reason we visited the park. The Pandas made the trip really worth while. If you havn't seem then before, then this is a must see. I would recommend going when there is the Red Panda feeding as well, as usually they sleep quite a lot and it is really amazing to see them when they are up and active!We didn't go up the cable cars for the rides, as it was extemely busy when we went and the lines were ridiculously long, but I hear that they are also fantastic. Denfnitely worth the visit!
Huge. What a large area of shops,one gets lost ,but what fun,where ever you go there are help desks to get you back on the right track.The people are very friendly and helpful.

Big Day Out. Quite possibly the best theme park in the world, as it combines rides and attractions with simply stunning views and rainforest gardens over a huge mountain site.. and because comparitively it is extremely good value at 280hk per adult (about 35aud at Sept 2012). We decided to choose Ocean Park instead of Disney as Ocean Park seemed more for grown ups! If you combined the Gold Coast's SeaWorld and DreamWorld in to one park and then chose a panoramic location, that's Ocean Park .. but much cheaper, much broader with no hint of sanitised "franchise" you find at movie studio parks etc. We had a great day riding the various roller coasters... the Hair Raiser was much smoother than similar giant coasters at Universal Singapore, making it a great ride. The runaway train was great fun, as was the dragon, both more traditional coasters and once again with those amazing sea views. The polar coaster was the most sedate but still good fun. Don't miss the two different water rides, as they'll help you stay cool on a hot Hong Kong day. Long, covered escalators (also with those views), move visitors up and down the side of the mountain through parklike grounds, between the various "worlds". There's a McDonalds on site for a quick pit stop, a welcome sight if you've been travelling Asia for a fortnight or more as we had. Then there's the two aquariums (more welcome respite from the heat) with walk through and under views of a huge range of sealife, and of course the famous pandas. They are in a state of the art, cooled environment and watching them eat, play and sleep is just delightful. There's only two pandas, but time your visit and with a bit of luck you will see eating, playing and sleeping as we did. We timed our visit to avoid Sundays and to avoid school holidays. Also, get there just before opening as many people seem to arrive from lunch time onwards and we completely avoided queues. Ocean Park made us smile time after time. This is one park we will definitely visit again.
Roller Coasters. Short lines and really good coasters. Lots of places to eat and relax. Be sure to take the cable cars in at least one direction, the views are great.
Ocean Park. A fun day out - love the animals, but the park would have benefited with a team that knows how to really put a park together like Disney.

A day at Ocean Park. Ocean Park is a big theme park with lots of rides to choose from. I like the pandas, I stayed there for about an hour just to see them roam around. One day stay in this park couldn't be enough.

Loved the pandas. My friend and I visited at the end of July and really went mostly for the animal exhibits. We weren't really going for the amusement park part of it. We visited on a Tuesday and it was pretty empty during the morning. We arrived just after opening and didn't really have to wait in lines for anything. We really loved seeing the pandas! They weren't really doing much but they were so cute and very close. After lunch it seemed like the park was completely packed so even going during the week does get busy. We did visit the amusement park side but didn't go on any rides. It is a great place for families but we probably would not return if we were on our own again.

Excellent. If you are bored with Disneyland you should really try Ocean Park. Very well organized, but may be with too many visitors over the week end, the attractions are first class and often unusual

Ocean Park, Aug. 2012. The admission ticket in 2012 is HK$280pp(~u.s.$36). Its hours are 9:30 am-8pm. Take mtr (subway) to Admiralty and there are signs showing the exit to Ocean Park bus station. Though, a mtr station at Ocean Park is in construction. Bus 629 at this Admiralty mtr goes to O.P. I understand there are also buses departing from Central mtr and Central Star Ferry. Check O.P.'s website. Buy the bus round trip fares(HK$10.6/trip) and admission tickets at the bus station. The bus trip is around 30 mins.Try to arrive at Ocean Park early and take the cable car to the other side of the park, the Summit, as soon as you arrive. Most of the roller coaster rides are at the Summit and will be jam packed as hours go by. Same with the cable car line. You might want to go on the water rides first and then proceed to Thrill Mountain, Hair Raiser etc. I arrived at O.P. around 10 a.m., spent about three hours at the Summit, with the first two hours going on some of the same rides twice with no line and waited an hour for the last ride.Then, take the express train back which has shorter line since most people are at the Summit in the afternoon. Enjoy the rest of the park and try to leave before ~5pm since that's the time most people will leave the park and is also the starting time of mtr peak riding time. Or else, stay until 7 pm or so before the crowd leaves at closing time, 8 pm.Overall, I enjoyed this amusement park. It has quite a few rides with different level of excitement. Of course, the rides are not as thrilling as the ones at Six Flag Magic Mountain or Knotts Berry Farm. Things are quite organized and employees tried their best. I did not run into people trying to cut into lines as I had experienced two years ago at HK Disneyland. Maybe it's their employees, their system, or people learned to behave better. Drinks aren't too overpriced, an icee is HK$32(~u.s$4); food is also affordable. Of course, the must see is panda exhibition.

Don't go on Sunday. I went to Ocean Park last sunday. It's a great place, a fun place, but oh so busy!! So busy that you queue for up to one hour for a two minute ride; that does not make sense to me. Nor does it represent value for money, 'cos in the five hours I was there I rode two Rides, plus Cable car and Train to get to the higher level. Sorry I am not prepared to queue like that; it's no fun, especially in 32C and humidity. Just too many people, mostly Mainland Chinese. Friends tell me to go during the week when it's less crowded and queueing times are more reasonable.

The Ride of Your life!. Oceanpak is such huge adventure park for all ages. We were thrilled by the cable car ride minus the long line of course...And to our surprise the other end of the cable car ride would bring a triple thrill esp. for people who love exciting and thrilling rides of their life. These rides...well we didn't dare to try. :) We were contented looking and listening to the screaming people on board!

great place. Great place a little bit run down compared to disneyland but well worth it. awesome rides unfortunaetly the heat this day was unbearable and there is a lot of hilly walking around the place. The rollercoast scream was the best!!!!!!!!!!!!! and the gondola ride and view next to none. would be good to be able to get around the park easier.

Great fun in Hong Kong. Enormous theme park with a zoo, real pandas, giant aquarium, roller coasters, and probably bigger than disneyworld paris and florida put together, you could spend one week here and not get through all of the rides and attractions and it is only 15 minutes in a cab from central HK
Amazing place. I like the animals there, but dislike the tourists who are mostly from china, they are most terrible and rude.

Excellent park, with a footnote. Ocean Park is an excellent theme park with a wide variety of attractions and animal exhibits, including the popular giant pandas. The park is expansive and will take up a whole day to see it all. I have been here anumber of times and notice each time how the management is making improvements ans enhancements to the facilitites.Two points on the negative side1- The dolphin show seems tired, the dolphins seem tired. They must perform about 5-6 times a day. I feel that the show is not worthy of Ocean Park's standard. It needs a large scale revamp, or needs to be scrapped altogether.2- The park closes at 7:30. It is really too early. There is no good reason why the park cannot stay open until 10pm. Even if some of the live animal exhibits had to close, the midway could remain open. Hong Kong gets extremely hot in the summer. In the evening the cool air is so nice...then everything shuts down. Hours of operation should be extended

If you like roller coasters do not miss. This place is cool and very unique. It is an amusement park that is on and around a mountain. The show are second rate though. The roller coasters are awesome! and don't forget to see the Panda's! It is probably the best environment I have ever seen panda's in.

Really Great. We did a day trip to Ocean Park, one to see the Panda's and secondly to have the day in the park. Was a really good day with plenty of rides for all age. The area is kept clean even with thousands of people.The Panda's were fantastic and is worth going for in any case.

Too hot and crowded. It was a hot August day and the park was very crowded. Lines to go on rides averaged about 45 minute wait which mean for the 4.5 hours we were there we only managed to go on 4 rides (one of which was the Cable Car that takes you to the top park). I'm not sure I would recommend this park or visit again.
Fun for kids. Not bad to go waiting time is crazy though!!! But nice for kids and much fun and many things to do. Food was not wow at all vegetarian have no much to get there

A few good rides but needs improvement. Ocean park layout is difficult to navigate. It has a few interesting rides but some of them have become very old and rickety. we enjoyed the hair-raiser and flash. The rapids ride was disappointing. the old roller-coaster (Dragon) is useless. The Ocean theater was boring. Park has not water fountains. restaurants were crowded.

More than you expect. The first visit of Ocean Park was 20 years ago, but this time with kids was excellent and more than I expected, not only the roller coaster, but also the shows and the aquarium and the exotic panda (which can save to zoo only to see it). It just one flaw, some tourists like to jump the queue and yell loud in public area.

Beats HK Disney easily. Overall I was quite impressed by what is included in the park and if comparing to the other local attractions it is a good choice. It has a good mix of attractions for young kids through to older kids and adults. The aquarium is disappointing - not worth queuing for. Falls short compared to so many good places I have been.The Dolphin Show is distinctly average compared to what other similar parks put on, and I'm talking small scale parks as well!We didn't spend a lot of time at the summit, where most of the rides are, as we had three small kids; so I can't give much comment.The panda area is good, and the attractions for small kids are decent. There are many things which are not in control of the park operator, so I comment here only for advice, not in rating the park:- terrible visiting in the heat of August; it would have been much more pleasant to visit at a cooler time of year.- the popularity of the park meant that it was very crowded and the 'typical visitor' falls short on queuing etiquette, manners, etc. This made it difficult to navigate the park with two strollers. Always difficult to find a quiet time to visit such a park...So, at the right time, and with the right weather... a good park.

Fun day!!. we were there from 10 in the morning until closing time. there is so much to see and do :) -- the rides are fun. my daughter really enjoyed the cable car ride up the mountain -- the scenery was breathtaking. :) :) the only down side was the humidity -- but thats something we overlooked cz we were busy having too much fun --- this was well worth the trip the closing event was fantastic -- with the water, fire works and graphics -- story of the dragons :)that same night we had heavy rain fall -- for a person from the middle east where rain fall is scarce...that was the perfect ending to the day :)what a memorable day! :) :)

Great fun, very easy to get to.. The cable cars over the mountain and the view of the coast really sets this theme park apart from the rest. Queues weren't too bad either, considering it was July when we were there.

Good way to spend a day. I went on my own to Ocean Park and had a great time. My favourite part of the park was definitely the panda enclosure which was absolutely thrilling, and the cable car up to the top part of the park. I found getting there quite easy, the bus from Admiralty MTR is well-signposted and quite quick.I went on a weekday morning and actually found the queues pretty bad. The park was extremely crowded and I had to queue for 25 minutes to go on the large rollercoaster, not to mention numerous queue jumpers (which as an English person I find maddening). On the rollercoasters and other rides there is no need to use the lockers - instead there are shelves where you can leave your belongings and shoes while on the rides (they are next to the staff not the queue so pretty secure).There seemed to be two panda enclosures I think - although I was a bit disoriented as the map I picked up was in Chinese - d'oh! The aquarium was quite good although not really worth the 20 minutes I had to wait in the queue to get in. Something else excellent was the sea lion show - it was entertaining, heart-warming and witty, and it's worth going early to get good seats. Overall the food is reasonable (I got some pork ribs for about 20HKD) and the staff are friendly. The atmosphere is great but the queues did detract a bit from the day for me, although that is obviously not the park's fault. Definitely recommended.

Well organized, helpful workers, pandas, aquariums. The day we went the Typhoon 3 warning signs were up and the rides were closed, so we went to see the aquariums and pandas.We spent about five hours there even with the rides closed. By afternoon the overhead tram was running, and we enjoyed a scenic ride along the coast high above the land on the edge of the sea. Be aware that the shows also shut down if it is raining. We went on a rainy day and there were still a lot of people there, but the rain helped cool things down. Lines were orderly with no pushing or shoving. Just a very nice day.

Worth the price, worth the time! So much fun!. They have a lot of rides both for asults and kids. A lot of attractions. But don't go on early january and rainy seasons as there are a lot of shows and rides that are closed. When you cross the other side pf the park, either take the underwater train or the cable car. I recommend not to miss the cable car. This is a thrilling experience as the travel is quite long ans the cable car is high. I am afraid of heights but I grabbed the chance. Just don't move too much as it will shake. Lol. The train is little boring. We thougt that we could aee the water from inside but to our disappointment, it is covered and they only put tv with aqua shows for entertainment. The ride was even short. Don't miss it in HK.

Good for older kids. Won't recommend if you have kids that is 5yrs & below, all the rides is not suitable & they have a min. height requirement. If you are a couple with small kids, go for Disneyland instead coz you will be spending more time Q-ing then enjoying yourselves. The Q was ridiculous long, longest we had to wait was 2hrs!!. There's so many tourist from mainland which is NO NO for me ( we have too many them here in SG) so kinda turn off by it.

Never on a Sunday. This is a great value theme park and well worth taking a day out to fully explore and take it all in. The rides range from the hair raising to the death defying and you will almost certainly get wet!There is a cable car, a fabulous train which goes under the mountain, an aquarium, pandas, water fountains and enough to keep you occupied and entertained from 9am till 10pm.Try not to visit on a weekend however as it will be packed. On the day I visited some rides had waits of up to 90 minutes by mid afternoon though I did not wait more than 15 minutes for anything.I had two concerns 1. The day I went it was hot, very hot, and there's no water freely available in the park. Nor is there anywhere to rest and take shade from the sun. The vast majority of places to eat we're small units offering takeaway. There are seats but with the park being busy finding somewhere to sit was  very hard. Add to this the fact that most awnings were not fully deployed and so even where seats were available there was no shade. I felt it was deliberate to keep people spending on water and drinks and was pretty unreasonable. Not that prices were high the park entry and items in the park were generally good value and I would have stayed longer and spent more had it been comfortable but sadly it was not and we left early.2. There was a huge number of umbrellas in the hands of a great many people all trying to  keep cool and in the shade. The problem is that I had to spend the day trying to dodge the pointy bits and retaining my eye sight. At one stage I witnessed several riders use their brollies to avoid getting wet on the water rides. It was bizarre and frankly dangerous.Despite the above we had a good day but if there was to be a next time then midweek and outside of Hong Kong school holidays.I would however recommend a visit, it can be great fun.
better than disney for me. loved the marine show, exciting rides, cable car ride and the panda! cheaper yet more value for the money than disney.

Ocean Park. Good Aquarium, better than the one at Sentosa in Singapore. Good dolphin show, though quality of the dolphin show has deteriorated over time. Sea Lions didn't do much. Sea Lions at Singapore are much more active and better trained.

Don't visit during summer school holiday. We didn't like it - it was just too many people on a hot summer day. Took 45 minutes to get tickets, but that was just the start of quequing. The park itself was well set out, and certainly had plenty of things to do - but apart from the giant pandas (which I would get to later), they all somehow disappointed. Especially the dolphin show! If you've been to Sea World, this show would make you wonder whether they've actually done any proper training. Jelly fish place was ok. We didn't do any rides as the queque was crazy - 1.5 hours of wait for a 3 minute ride. Giant panda though, for those that haven't had too many opportunities to see them before, were awesome. The one called An An was very active and seemed very happy. We had our tickets worth just seeing him! The other only highlight was Tuxedo restaurant, which was another 30 minute wait before getting in. Apparently you could reserve a table - anyway, in the restaurant you could actually see the penguins swimming around as it forms part of the antartic centre - how awesome is that! The food was ok, quite pricey, but given the surrounding it's really worth it. We might go back next time but will make sure to avoid the July/ August summer holiday.

View from cable car option worth the entry price alone. Ocean Park was such a great day out :) My friend & I tried out as many rides as we had time for (the queue for the "Hair Raiser" rollercoaster was a tad lengthy-tedious, but my rollercoaster-crazy friend had a massive grin on her face after the ride so I guess it was worth it, lol); decided to be kids & played the fair-ground type games in the Marine World Games Zone (except unlike fairground games they weren't rigged, we won heaps of prizes, & everyone, including the audience, were charmingly enthusiastic when you did win, instead of looking grumpy / resentful - I tried to hand one of my toys away to one of our "supporters" but they just smiled happily that our good time was their good time, & wandered off); had lunch upstairs in the Grand Aquarium & watched giant sharks and rays swim about in front of us in their stories-high tank as we dined); cought a water-splashy stage show where the dancers outdid Disney in terms of funk, fun, enthusiasm and creativity (sorry Mouseketeers); spied sleepy pandas, red and giant (it was a pretty hot day we went); and wow, yeah, the cable car option running between the Waterfront and Summit precincts (there's also a train option, which was great, but the cable car...). The panoramic views over landscape, sea, islands and sky as we floated along above the contours of the hill were stonkering. Abolutely amazing. So glad we went.

Be a kid again. There are quite a lot you can do in the Ocean Park. There have marine world, aquatic animal, some theme park rides, adventure land and the most interesting for me is the panda. I did not know the panda is inside the park, so is surprise to me. It is a great place for family gateway.The only thing that made me tired is the queue. As we went on the weekend, there were so many tourist even though it was a rainy day itself. Each attractions we need to queue for at least 30mins. We almost spent 50% of our time just to queue to see everything.
ocean park. just like seaworld style of the park. what i love is the cable car up in air. I forget how they call but love it. visit March 2005
Nice place. The park is good and nice for the Kids. The kids will enjoy all rides , the ropeway is excellent with the best view of the ocean

Forget it, complete waste of time unless you really like theme parks and crowds.. Too many people in the summer, too long line ups to everything. Too many rude and loud tourists with zero manners. I got bumped in lines, got rolled over my foot by a man pushing a stroller directly in my face. Some exhibits are not worth visiting, however i loved An An and Jia Jia, the two adorable pandas from china. You are not suppose to make noise in the panda exhibits, but people totally ignored it. The cable car ride along the edge of mountain and ocean was good. Meals be purchased from park, but they do not provide reasonable number of tables. Almost impossible to wait for empty tables as mostly were occupied by people not consuming food or drinks, as well as their bags and backpacks.
Unforgettable Moment. I was with my boyfriend (and was 4months pregnant :) ) but I still took the rides without them noticing... haha! Love all the rides... Wish to come back soon.. :)
Must see.. One of the best aCquariums in the world. Avoid summer if possible due to heat and long queues. Great for children and adults. Not to miss in hong kong.

Fun day at a reasonable price. Its typhoon season, so we took a chance to visit the park. Liked the rides and other attractions, and it was cheaper than going to Disney where we were last month. Locals don't like the rainy weather, so that meant that the lineups were unusually small. Unfortunately, typhoon season also means high winds, and several shows and rides had to shut down by mid day because of it. We took advantage of the metro all day pass coupons on Ocean park--up to 60% off admission (but usually 10%), and $10 off on food.

Wonderful views on the cable car. We chose Ocean Park instead of Disneyland as we wanted to see more of Hong Kong than Disney. The cable car ride had wonderful views but went really close to the cliffs so not for the faint hearted. You could see the beaches on this side of Hong Kong island going up, they looked so beautiful. We went in May and although it was not quiet it was not full either. Seeing the pandas and other wildlife was really special as we had not seen them at Chester or Newquay zoo. The rides we went on were all very much for small children as our two were three and four at the time, they enjoyed them immensely. We cannot comment on the bigger rides as we did not venture on them. All in all a great day out for the kids.

Much better than Disneyland; line-cutters are shut down by staff. We had a much more enjoyable experience at Ocean Park compared to the one we had at Disneyland. A few reasons:(1) Just like in Disneyland, visitors from mainland China will use every opportunity to cut in line; this happened to us in Ocean Park three times while we were lining up for food within 15 minutes... However, each time they were asked by the staff to go to the end of the line. Note that in Disneyland the staff will not enforce the rule whatsoever.(2) The park is much more spread out than Disneyland, thus, it is much less crowded(3) There are a lot more to see than just rides (Disneyland is all rides); if you only do the rides you will wait for a long time standing in line, but, if you like to see the pandas, the aquarium, etc, there is not any line to speak of. We brought our toddler and we were able to visit every single attraction that did not have minimum height requirements.(4) A lot of attractions are indoor and air conditioned which is a great refuge from the summer heat (in fact, the polar attraction is freezing inside!)(5) Do not miss the Symbio show at 8pm!Highly recommended!

Painful Day at the Fun Park. We had a family trip to the park 3rd August with friends (total 5 adults and 4 kids). All very excited until we entered the park and realized the number of people that had also had the same idea of going there for the day. We queued up for the cable car to take us to the rollercoaster area over the top of the hill, what a mistake. We had to queue in the heat for over an hour. Thinking this was the end of our troubles and looking forwards to a good day out. We then found everything we wanted to do had a minimum queue time of an hour. In the end we managed one rollercoaster ride, a visit to the ice kingdom to see the seals and a ride on the spinning disc. What a waste of money and time (5 hours to see three attractions). We decided to take the train back through the hill at 3pm before the queues got too big as the wait for the restaurants at the top was 1.5 hours. Will I ever go back – never! Would I recommend a visit – only if you go out of season of school holidays, otherwise forget it! Not sure how Disney fairs in comparison, perhaps we should have gone there.

Need more than one day. Being an amusement park addict I found myself in Ocean Park early August 2012 when visiting Hong Kong. It is rather larger and spread out so expect a lot of walking and going up & down REALLY long escalators to get to the different sections.There are so many rides I doubt anyone could get them all done in 1 day, given the amount of time you had to wait to get on the popular rides. I opted to go to Ocean Park over Disneyland as there were more 'big kid/adult' rides here rather than young 'kiddy' rides at Disneyland.There are also some great exhibits as well including asian animals, polar bears, panda bears and the huge aquarium.Definitely recommend Ocean Park if you are visiting Hong Kong.

Nice 'facelift', large crowds with service lacking in certain areas. We visited the park 5 yrs ago, so clearly we can compare the old and new. While there is definitely improvement in the 'hardware' , somehow more has to be done to manage crowds, queues and space for visitors. Pros : 1. More rides for big kids, interesting exhibits ESP with regards to educating visitors abt marine life, conservation etc. They did a good job getting kids engaged and sending message across. 2. Refreshed themed areas eg : the 'Old Hong Kong' is a uniquely Hk piece, with retro music and memorabilia - fun for kids and us too. 3. Transport to and fro : smooth and frequent bus services from Admiralty mtr area.. Even during peak hours . Cons : 1. Long waiting time for rides : I was disappointed to find no electronjc boards or service staff to inform visitors estimated queueing time for the different rides. I think I spent an average of 45 mins for each of the rides. I only saw the electronic board at an area just outside the cable car station - its not the right place . There has got to be a smarter way around it. 2. Blinded by camera flash : I was upset by how insensitive some visitors are to the 'no flash photography' rule. While there were staff holding placards and reminding visitors to not use flash , perhaps more can be done to educate visitors why no flash is allowed. 3. Crowds crowds crowds : lunch was a nightmare at the restaurants with queues so long, we decided to just grab a hotdogs from the nearest kiosk and settle down somewhere..(no, no shaded umbrellas or lovely picnic spot - it came down to 'anywhere shaded') The kids had fun, the adults were just there to mind the kids . I suppose that was what matters?

Good family fun park. be careful you need to walk a lot, also a long and high cable car ride. Lots of rides to keep people of all age happy, we spent 1 full day and still could not finish all rides. Evening has very good laser and sound show don't miss that.

Only if you have spare time. Went there on a Friday, arrived at 11 am and it was already packed with chinese mainland visitiors.Good atractions but overcrowded. The cable car worths the trip. If you buy the Octupos card you can get a discount. 38 euro for the regular price.Take the 260 bus, bescause it is a direct bus to Central.Left at 4 pm and there were still thousands of people entering the park.
Ocean Park. Great place to spend the day with kids. Rides for all ages. Food options minimal, Chinese and McDonalds. Great sea life shows and Pandas!

Ocean Park. One of my favorite parts of China. I was with a group of 30 or so teenagers ranging in age of 14-18 and 10 adults. There is something for everyone. We saw panda bears, crazy roller coasters, and dolphins. Our particular group started with the pandas and oh my God were they cute! We saw the dolphin show which was amazing, and then saw the roller coaster, which two out of our group decided to go on. Then came the park closing ceremony...DO NOT UNDER ANY CIRCUMSTANCES MISS THIS! There was water on fire and dragons and all sorts of amazing. Find seats early because it gets kind of packed.
right price. its a must see place for every tourist ,,,,,really worth it ..especially the cable car ride and the roller coasters.

Worth visiting. Our family of 2 adults and 3 young children visited on an overcast day with temperatures in the 30's , I can't imagine how we would have coped with the enormous Q's had it been sunny. We arrived 10 minutes after the park opened having bought tickets in advance from the china travel service. We waited in line to go through the turnstile only to be told to join another Q to exchange our tickets for entrance vouchers . We eventually got in about 20 minutes later.
