Whilst I don't feel that the fees are excessive given the size of the park and attractions there , be prepared to spend an awful lot of your day in Q's with tetchy, hot children, being pushed and shoved from all directions especially if it's a weekend in the school holidays.Also carry plenty of water and wet wipes with you and a snack as some of the cafes are quite pricey. If you and the kids manage to cope with all this , it is a great family day out with plenty to do. If you feel your nerves will be shot to ribbons , I would seriously recommend somewhere a little bit quieter

Nice Theme Park. It's no Disney Park, but it has a lot of rides and attractions to keep you busy for hours. It was a weekday and it was still very crowded. The size of the park allows everyone to spread out except for the queue at the cable car which was nearly an hour. Was worn out long before I could see everything.

a great day out!. Ocean Park was fantastic. Much better than a trip to Disney HK. The cable car rides are a must in itself. Arrive early as there are lots to do and see. The Pandas are adorable, so too are all of the other animals they have on display. Watch the seal and dolphin show (I actually got chosen to be a part of the dolphin show! Arrive early and watch staff come through the audience to look for participants). Fantastic rides also!

Too Busy.. This would be a lot better if they controlled the number of people they actually let in the park. I was in HKG on business so had 1 day to do something and decided on this. It was a hot humid day and it was a saturday. The queue to go on the cable car was 45 minutes, and then it was 60 minutes to go on the "Hair Raiser" roller coaster which lasts about 30 seconds. Just moving around was difficult it was just too busy, most decent rides were minimum 30 minute wait and decided not to bother on a number of rides and shows.I imagine it would be a lot better to go during the week when it is not so busy!

A great theme park. Our friends suggested us to visit this park. It was hot on that day but we still enjoyed it very much. We played the roller coaster, cable car, visited the acquarium and saw the pandas. There were a lot of marine life in the aquarium, we took a lot of photos at there. It was our first time to see pandas, they were so cute! They were eating bamboo leaves and moved slowly. They stayed a a room at a quite low temperature, which made us feel cool inside. Overall speaking, this is a nice park which you can spend the whole day on it. You can play games and see different kinds of animals at the same time. After this day, we finished our Hong Kong trip and heading to Cardiff in the UK.

Great to see marine creatures. Take in some shows at Ocean Park. Like Sea World or Marineland. In HK, most things are smaller scale though. They also have roller coasters and cable cars to add to the fun!

Loved it!!. The Cable Car ride is a must, the views are breathtaking....The Pandas cute as (Please remember NO FLASH on cameras) The Aquarium amazing and if you are game enough the Hair Raiser Rollercoaster...Great day!!

Busy Not Much Fun. I recently visited the Ocean Park on Hong Kong Island... I went with my Mum and Dad and a some friends that travelled with us. The first thing I would like to mention is the prices it was expensive (or it sounded expensive to me) the queues were immense.. The restaurants were at least an hour of waiting so we ended up not eating anything. Just a takeaway and the food was soggy and we soon chucked them in the bin. We were there a total of 5 hours and we managed to get on 2 rides witch both were 2 minutes but they were both very good rides.. dont get me wrong...my Mum said that it felt like a 'lost day'.

It's a must-go for tourists. It's just ok.... for me, just too crowded with people..... mostly visitors from the Mainland China... it's a must-go place as there are lots of other things to see and do... such as cable car, aquarium and pandas.... it's also centrally located - take the bus from Admiralty MTR station.....

A fun day out. This is a great way to spend a day, although it gets very busy, and it was very hot. The aquarium is amazing, and the cable car was great for the views. There is a fun splash area for kids, so bring a change of clothes or swimming things ideally as they get soaked! There is a fun dolphin show, which is lovely. We did a really good ride called the rapids, which was great fun and fairly gentle, so good if you're not really into fast scary rides like me! Be prepared to queue for a long time for everything, which is the only downside for me. Even getting out of the park takes ages if you have to get the cable car back down, and then the bus back to Hong Kong. It took a good 2 hours to get back to the hotel with all the queuing. Definitely worth a visit, especially if you have children over about 6 or 7.
Nice. good mix of education and entertainment. However it is not cheap and during school holidays be prepared to wait. The attractions ae nice and it is of international standard

Great! Worth going, drinks are pricey.. Ocean Park is a hong kong experience which I have skipped going to every time I've been in hong kong. This time , since a friend was making a once in a lifetime trip, I decided to take him there. We went with a friend of ours from hong kong. We had no children with us, just 3 adults. The first thing we did was buy tickets online, I did hear you could buy discounted tickets from travel companies in advance or by the gate, we didn't because it seemed like a bit of a hassle. We just bought them from the ocean park website, and printed them at home $280 hong kong. This saved us time at the gate because we could go right in with the tickets. On the day we went it was 35 degrees celcius in hong kong, but it wasn't too bad because most of the day we had were up at the top of the mountain, doing the thrill rides. The mountain top is reached by going on the cable car, (a free trip) it's worth doing even if you plan to skip the big rides. The first ride we went on was the Hair raiser, a large rollercoaster. We went at 1130 am on a Tuesday and the ride time wait was 30 minutes. I was expecting line jumpers because of the mainland tourists from China, but there was none of it at all during the day. Everybody was quite polite actually.The rides were fun, with the longest waits being all under 30 minutes. One thing that was quite interesting, and sort of stupid on the part of Ocean Park was that often a ride would start with empty riders. There would be riders in carts that could hold 2, just riding along. So strange, there is no single rider line, and the attendants do not seek out single riders to fill out the attractions.During the middle of the day it was the height of the 35 degree day, so we ducked into the north pole adventure, an air conditioned walk through with sea lions . A nice place to stop and hide from the sun. The sea lions were very visible with no problems being seen. Then we took lunch at Tuxedos. The lunch was $600 HK for 3 people, we had a large duck pizza, 3 non alcholic drinks and a large salmon, chicken salad. Definitely a tastier alternative to a hot dog or typical amusement park food. The portions were quite large, and the best thing about it was that inside the restaurant they have a viewing area of the new penguin exhibit, where you can see the penguins without going through the south pole area. You can take pictures and hang out all there for the hot part of the day. One tip, I'd recommend for tourists who are not used to ordering food in restaurants in Hong Kong: you flag down waiters. Do not wait for them to come by and check on you, they don't. They are not being rude, they are waiting for you to flag them down for ordering, and bill payment etc. There is no catching the eye of a waiter, subtley, that's now how it's done in Hong Kong and in the Theme park there is no difference.We also got 3 cute Penguin souvenir aprons / bibs at the restaurant on cloth which actually were souvenir grade items.I'd say the restaurant was worth going to.We left the park at 730pm on the citybus which takes you to and from Admiralty Mtr ($10 hk) we had gone on about 10 rides.I'd say that there was no way a family with children could have done so many rides in the short time we were there. The rides are quite spaced apart. Small children also will have a problem at ocean park because the minimum ride for many rides was 120cm, with some rides at 135 cm. The attendants will actually check, and not let you on either .There is no disneyesque chlld hand off , while the adults take turns riding either, so if you are bringing children who are too small to ride, and you want to ride I'd recommend bringing a 3rd person to help babysit.Food and drink was relatively inexpensive in the park, and looked alright, but Ocean Park allows you to bring in as much as you want so I would recommend buying your snacks, and lunch inside the 7/11 that you'll find in the Mtr and packing it in a purse. We did not find any free water refill areas, so bring lots of water, even in restaurants the water is $42 HK.I would recommend doing Ocean Park in 2 or 3 days not trying to cram it into 1 day, it was worth it.

Good times. This place was great fun as it has many different attraction for the whole family. It is great for children of young age as well as teenagers. We are an adult couple and had good fun. There are many different attraction as little 'towns', rollercoasters, aquariums, animals, water shows, great views and so on.To get to the other side to of the park you can choose between the cable car and the train. I recommend to take the train as it is much faster and basically no waiting line - also you can get the stunning views from the park.I read also many comments regarding the waiting time and we never had to wait longer than 15 - 20 min. I guess it is depending on the time of the year. We arrived there around early lunch time and left around 4pm. If you come with kids make sure you bring a lot of sunprotection and a stroller is a must as well a comfortable shoes. It's a good work out, too ;)Down points:The food is (as I have experienced in every attraction park) a total disaster. It tastes like plastic and you have not much choice.

Stay away. Swamped with rude obnoxious mainland Chinese. I've been to dozens of amusement parks. I'm used to lines. I live in mainland China. I speak Chinese (English Spanish too)The major issue is that the Chinese go (to say they have been). In general, due to their acceptable behavior in China, they literally stand right on top of you -as defense to guard against other people cut in line. I'm American, 185 cms and 110 kilos. No one cuts in front of me. But when it is 36c, I definitely do not need people standing on the backs of my shoes, bumping me repeatedly, , not trying to continually push past saying their friend is in front of me. So outside of the 8 hours of having ones patience tested (we waited in lines 8 hours in order to do about 10 minutes of rides... 5 rides.) I would say that the park is poorly run.First, the worst was the water ride calls raging River. We waited 75 minutes. The problem? They had capacity to load 2 lanes of boats at a time. They choose to only staff one lane. Why? It is a sunny Sunday afternoon. Had they staffed appropriately, the line would have had twice the load speed.They have clocks telling you wait times -but amazingly the clocks are no where near the rides. They don't have staff informing you of actual or approximate times. I was told 20 minutes for one ride, it was almost 2 hours, and tools 90 minutes for one, and it was 35.You should definitely skip the north pole exhibit. It has 2 seal s, , and a walrus. 90 minute wait.If you are dying to go somewhere, go to Chimelong in Guangzhou. Yeah, the people are the same, but it is cheaper and had better rides and much better management.

More than a Theme Park. If you are an adventure person and loves the excitement of the rides on a Theme Park, this place is for you.Ocean Park has the scariest ride you can think of that will definitely blow your mind.But if you are the person who is afraid of the rides and just wants to stroll, enjoy the views and shows just like me, well, this place is for you too.There are several activities that you can enjoy, shows that you can watch, amazing views that you will see, and maybe simple rides that you can handle.Make sure to visit the Low Land as well. :)

Wonderful Day out at Ocean Park HK. We have visited Ocean Park last October. This is also a Must see attraction in HK if you are a family with young children. Our kids (8 & 6 years) enjoyed the rides/shows though some shows restricted us since our boy child have enough height to participate. The entry starts with Aquarium and Panda cell and then train ride up to the mountain. There are lots of rides for young children. Various animal shows are also very good. You can get the fantastic view of HK Islands. You have to walk, climate may be hot and expect long queues for rides/shows. Food inside the park is fantastic ( I think you can bring your food) .We had a late arrival in Ocean park and we could not participate on some rides/shows so we will be visiting HK Disney Land again during this November 2012..Cable car ride is worth so better to take for going up ( for come back you have to be in queue around 1 hour..!!!!) and come back by train.Overall a nice experience and recommend for everybody for a one day trip.

Fantastic!!!. We went to Ocean Park on sunday, though we knew it would be crowded.The place was fantastic, suitable for everyone. We were a family with teenage and toddler kids. The place was great for every one. If you have just a day for Theme parks in Hongkong, Ocean park is the place to go to. It has more rides, exotic animals(in their environment)!!! The place is more cheaper in terms of eateries, souvenirs etc.

Need a whole day!. I grew up in HK and used to hold a season pass so coming back after 18 years with two teenagers I wanted to take them to the places I spent my summer holidays. The park has really changed since then and probably more than doubled in size. We started at the Aquarium which was great, some really amazing sights and a great palce to escape the heat! Although crowded we were able to see everything and not feel enclosed. We then went through 'Old HK' to get to the cable car - only a 5 minute wait which was great considering we got there first thing when thousands were all arriving at the same time. The cable car views are worth the visit. We then hit the rides - to begin with the queues were not too bad but as they day went on they were long so we chose carefully which ones we really wanted to see. The North and South Pole sections were not as good as I had expected but the air con was welcomed by that point! The information about the conservation work made up for it tough and there was something for everyone. We got the train down the mountain and saw the Pandas - we all fell in love with the red pandas!Once tip for the top is if you want to see any of the shows - get there early to get a seat!Great day out and something for everyone.
Great fun for adults. Good rides and great fun. Lot of walking involved though, hence exhaustive during high temperatures...

A great day out. Would have given 5 stars but a number of the rides were not open. Terrific train that takes you under the mountain to the other side. Take the cable car the other way. Fantastic views. Aquarium is excellent and the Panda exhibit was well done. You need the whole day to cover everything.

Worthwhile Attraction. We recently visited Hong Kong and as parents to 3 teenage girls, we always try to fit in a theme park on our travels, and Ocean Park did not disappoint! Although costly to eat and drink within the park, the cost of entering and the free entry to the dolphin show, pandas etc made the visit well worth it! The rides were loads of fun and we enjoyed getting wet on many of the rides on such a very hot day! An attraction for young and old, and the hi-light for me was the Cale car ride fom one side of the park to the other with breathtaking views over the coast and hillside surRounding the park!!

What a big and wonderful theme park. Compare to the other theme park in Hong Kong, this one is much more bigger with vary attraction. You may find underwater scenic walk, panda, roller coaster, etc. Much more suitable for all ages. A bit far from the city, it takes about 45 minutes by bus from Nathan Road.And during the peak season, like a school holiday or national holiday, it will get very crowded, but still in acceptable queue time.I'm trying to compare with the other one, since both actually had a different theme and each have their strong points.You should visit Ocean Park, since this is one of the remarkable theme park in Hong Kong.

A Whole Day of Fun but really hot~. I missed Ocean Park when I visited HK last year so this visit was a must. They were celebrating 35 years anniversary and it was really great! New stuffs were opened with new shows. The highlight of the visit is definitely the last show before the park closes. It was a Musical Fountain + Laser kind of show and it was really awesome. The crowd wasn't too bad except for one of the rides in which we queued for about an hour. The heat was horrible though I must say. For those travelling in July, travel light and bring plenty of water! Umbrella is a must really. I really liked the aquarium too but as it was one of the more crowded venue, it wasn't really as enjoyable as the people do push you around and stick their heads in whenever they want.

Absolutely wonderful.. I had a fabulous day at Ocean Park. It is a must for anyone who wants to see the pandas - I was glued to the spot for at least 30 minutes watching them!Views from the cable car are amazing but definitely not for those with issues with heights!Great show with the dolphins and sealions (which I was not expecting!) & other shows around the park. Rides are not fabulous but some of the rollercoasters offer even more great views from right at the edge of the cliffs! Worth trying them out if the queues aren't too long.

Fun but busy and hot in July. Had a fun day at Ocean Park however in July expect it to be busy and crowded. The highlights are seeing the giant panda's up close and the penguins swimming around. The dolphin show was great and put a smile on the face. The queues are long but move quickly. However they do pack the crowds into the attractions so just beware. Apparantly the rides are good

Very corwded during summer holidays. We went during summer and spent most of the time queuing. THe rides on the top of the hill are more challenging and fun. Quite a big place to check out. Do be careful if you are bring young children as the Chinese are not afraid to push and cut queues

oCEAN pArk a must!. If you are in Hong Kong and you have the opportunity to checkout something other than Disney, then Ocean Park is the place to be. Go to the end of the park for the rides and don't sit in the restaurants as they are not very good and a bit pricey. Your best bet would to pack a sandwich and a drink. Then you can take your time to do a walk about.Now they have some new attractions and it is a fun place to go.Check the weather forecast first before going and never go on a public holiday as many people from Asia are there and you will be in a queue for hours.Best get there early so you can leave early to avoid the mad rush back.Take bush 72A for causewaybay or 75 to wanchai..If those don't work for you follow the crowd!

A bit like Seaworld. To get to Ocean Park you need to get to the Admiralty bus station where you can buy your entry pass and catch the bus dirrectly to the gate. We went on a Saturday and dispite the warnings the crowds were not bad. The highlight was the Pandas and the Asian animals. The "dance of the Jellyfish" is also worth seeing. If I went again I would pack a cut lunch as the food looked fairly ordinary. The gondola ride is worth doing but the old Hong Kong display is quite underwhelming. We went on a couple of rides and sent about 5 hours there. If we had kids with us I would expect you would spend all day there.

Lines are too long but overall fun. The kids had a great time but the lines were crazy long. longer than the US Disneyland, i believe. The exception were the rides that were further down the mountain, where my kids repeatedly went on the roller coaster. Of course, we knew it was going to be hot but we didnt know we were in for a typhoon level 3 :-). The rides closed down at 3:00pm so we visited the exhibits. The aquarium was cool and so was old Hong Kong. The panda was nice and we got to see it. The Dolphin and seal show was nice too. I would compare this park more to Seaworld. The food prices were reasonable as well.As you exit the MTR on the Hong Kong side, there is a MTR store when you head up to ride the Ocean Park bus. They sell discount Ocean Park tickets. Adult @ $250 HKD and child @ $125 HKD versus regular tix at $280 and $140; respectively. This was a nice discount & we didnt need to pre-buy. I also found discount tix @ China Travel services at $240/$120 but you have to preorder and cant change dates so it was too cumbersome. Make sure you check the weather before you go ;-)It's very easy to get to, MTR, then Ocean Park Bus. At the Park, you have to either ride the cable car or the submarine to the other side of the mountain for the rides. We took the submarine there and it was a nice experience. However on the return, after rides were closed around 3pm, the cable cars were closed as well (due to typhoon), the submarine was the only way back to exit. It was crowded and the pushing/shoving was horrendous. Children were pushed as well as the elderly to enter the submarine. Not sure if there's a person limit capacity but i'm sure it was way beyond. Aside from the lack of manners/courtesy/danger of fellow attendees, the visit was a nice visit. Just make sure you leave a few hours before the end of the day.
Value for money!. this is a whole day attraction. there's so much to do and so much to see! Kids and adults will both enjoy this park. Stay for the fireworks display at 8pm.

Bit unfortunate. We didnt have such a great experience mainly because of the weather. They took our full $900+ to get in but none of the rides were open because of the rain including the water rides. We also got extremely ripped off at the Waterfront Restaurant which was very expensive for just chicken and chips and terrible quality. Maybe in good weather and a different restaurant it would be a great experience.

Full of fun. Had a full day here with our 2 teenage kids so we first caught the cable car up to the rides. If you are scared of heights like myself, take the train instead! The family loved the cable car, I didn't. We stayed until closing but didn't get to see everything. It was screaming hot so we tired out pretty quick but kept going. We got a taxi there and back, so so cheap. The acrobatic display was great along with the final light, water, fireworks display. Lots of fun.

Fun day!!. Ocean Park was great fun and worth checking out with or without kids. I took my 5 year old son and he could not go on quite a few of the rides as he was too young but there were still rides he could go on. The park is quite spread out across a large mountainous area but there are cable cars and shuttle trains so easy to get around from area to area. The aquarium is great and I especially loved the Jelly Fish house which was stunning with loads of changing coloured jelly fish. The pandas were also fun to see. It is a mix of ocean animals and rides and makes for a fun day. We got there early and it was quiet but by about 2.30pm it started to get really crowded so we left but had had a great day. Easiest way to get there is by going to Admiralty station and catching the Ocean Park bus from there as you can get your tickets etc there and you get dropped off right outside the park. The buses also return you to Admiralty at the end of the day.
blue sky reflects blue sea. kids, teens, couples, family gathering.everyone gets fun of Ocean and park. Sporty or bling bling pictures view.

Good day out. This was a fun day out, plenty to see and do! The dolphin show is a must, alot of effort goes into this, if your not one of those it's cruel to keep them in captivity then probably you beat not go!Only problem is food! Lack of for westerners unless you enjoy Macdonalds! So suggest you pack your own lunch if with a family! Some of the rides are old looking but I do believe they have done some renovations. Especially on the panda pen! This was disappointing mind as they tend to just be laying there asleep, so don't get your hopes up of seeing fluffy pandas waving or dancing at you!Suggest going over by cable car as fantastic views! Crazy trying to get out mind so suggest go early in the morning and leave before the park is closing! Also ensure you know how you will get back to your hotel as buses are everywhere and cabs far and few if busy! Get ready for a crowded day! The Chinese love this place!!

You need two days at least for Ocean Park. What a Brillant time the family had here, even an old girl like me. We all had such a fun time, with so much to see and do. My best advise would be to try to visit in the cooler months, our first visit was September and even though we had plenty of water and umbrella's the heat took it toll on all of us. There is very little shade anywhere and very long lines for some of the rides. There is something here for all ages. There are plenty of food outlets here, the toughest decision was which one to choose. Don't just take the Cable Car up and down from the top level of Ocean Park as there are very long lines especially in the afternoon/evening when people are starting to head home, do yourself a favour and take their train, it was great and much faster and less crowded. Don't miss the fire and light show they have just before closing it was incredible. Make sure you have 2 days for Ocean Park you will be disappointed if you only do one day.

Massive improvement from 3 years ago - but still very hot !. We last went to Ocean Park 3 years ago. We were very happy that it has changed dramatically! New coasters have come in with Hair-raiser being the best with loop-the-loops. Newer and more exciting look to the park! Much better value than Disneyland. HKD 240 for adults compared to HKD 399 for Disneyland !!!The second parking lot has now closed, and everyone enters through the main entrance. Get there early (we did it at 9:30) and got to the coasters early . Hardly anyone were on them, and we got round all the coasters by 11:30. However, when we went for the repeat Hair-raiser ride, it was around 40 minutes waiting time.Best way to cool off is to go to the Panda's enclosure and the Aquarium - wonderful air-conditioned delight!Negative aspect - waiting line / queue management is non-existent, coupled with excitable Mainlanders, who use a lot of elbows..... :( Ride staff are a bit lame. They hover and wait, and not interested in getting the line going! If they paid them by the number of people they put through the ride, it will be a lot more interesting !Like California, they should use water-cooling with their fans to help people cool down! More shade is needed, and UMBRELLAS SHOULD BE BANNED !!!!!The seaworld dolphin show was very good, but mainly in Cantonese with a smattering in English and Mandarin.Go there - but be prepared to get very very hot !!!

Too much hype, too little substance.. Do not visit in the summer. Crowds and heat are overwhelming. Ocean express train ride - useless! Dolphin show is good - but could be better. Get to the ocean theatre at least an hour before show starts or you miss good seats. Food awful! Carry your own. Toilets are filthy. The only thing we liked is the tram ride - you get some blessed peace there.

Nice place for even Couples. If you are on honeymoon you can still enjoy this place and remember your childhood days. The place is full of activities. Games Rides and underwater aquarium is worth a visit. The easiest way to go is by bus.. connected from everywhere in hong kong

Pandas and coasters!. A great day out with friends and family - lots to see and do, including fun rides and exotic animals. The food isn't that great, but apart from that the experience is fantastic... highly recommend.

Nice outing. Ocean Park was a pleasant surprise when I first visited. It may not have the excitement of Disneyland but its worth a visit especially if you have kids - the pandas are a good attraction.

it's big, it's croded, it's more expensive than a "Sea World" or "Six Flags" but hey, the views are unbelievable.. Yep, it's a big theme park. It has all you expected. Built on a pretty steep hill by the Ocean the surroundings are great but it also has all those things I hate about theme parks. Crowds, overprice food, long lines, etc. try Disneyland if you have little kids. Plenty of little kids stuff here, but the pluses are for 12 and up. great roller coaster.
Great for Kids. Great place to visit on even bad days, has so much to offer, nice to get away from the bustle of Hong Kong Downtown for a while.

Best Place for Family Bonding. I went there last May with my siblings, my parents, my nephew & nieces, my mother-in-law, and of course with my wife and kids and it was an unforgettable experience.Ocean Park Hong Kong has a lot to offer for everyone and one day would not be enough to try it all.The whole family can be amused by the shows and their huge exhibit of marine life. The young and adventurous can try their various rides which range from 'safe and entertaining' to 'extreme and crazy' (the best I and my kids had was the Hammer and the Extreme Roller Coaster nearby). There are also a lot of food outlets to choose from and novelty shops where you can buy your souvenir items.One thing to note though is that the place is really big so you need to get a map upon entry or you'll spend most of your time moving in circles trying to find the attraction that you want. :-)
Ocean park adventure. Good place for the whole family. Tiring but all fun
Good theme park for families. This is a good theme park for families. I like the middle Kingdom a lot

Great fun for kids. This is a charming theme park, somewhat different from the more commercial Disneyland ( which I love nonetheless). Been here in 2010 and it has since been renovated which is good cos the old park seem kinda jaded. There is a good mix of exhibits e.g panda, huge aquarium, glow in the dark jellyfish and rides. The cable car ride is a must try. The queues are not that bad and some of the rides are quite fun.We took the mtr to Admiralty then took bus 629. There are clear signs at the station. Do get tickets at the Admiralty mtr station- there are promotional prices. Overall a good experience.
entertainment for the whole family. there's something for everyone. ocean park has been revamped, and it's even more fun now! a must visit.

Disney alternative. Easy to get to by bus from Admiralty MTR or taxi and easy to get out !Great days adventure with everything for young and old. The only negative is that food (both quality and price) are a bit off, but thats the price of these places.recommend going to the top first and doing the rides EARLY, in the morning, and then go back down later in the day. Winter is better than summer due to the heat. Beware of the mass mainland chinese crowds who will remind you that overpopulation is not a myth.

All in one fun!. It is an amusment park, aquarium, and roller coaster adventure all in one. Everything is also nice and compact so you can use that time to go on exciting rides or learn about endangered animals. This is worth your time and money, be prepared to spend the whole day!
ocean park. very good place , cable car, express train, various rides , dolphin show at 3pm is worth watching, memorable day of our tour

Rollercoaster Galore. Once again, u take a cable car from on part of the park to another. Its soooo amazing. Really hot and akward in summer. Most of the food places are where the rides are. Be sure to eat there first before u come back the aquarium section.

In my opinion better value than Disneyland. Great Park and many things to be enjoyed. On the downside, most of rides are not for small children, even for bumper car, the rider must be at least 122 cms high eventhough accompanied by adult
go to China Travel Service (CTS) to buy discount ticket. Adult ticket only cost HKD 240 compares to HKD280 if you buy on site.
great day!. hard to get too but worth it when you get there, the only complaint is that it is far too big! expect a lot of walking. get there early to make the most of it.

see Panda there. try to avoid weekends
go there when it is weekdays
go early
cable car is a must
Panda is a must
a lovely place
there is a MacDonald inside the park

The place to go back to... I just loved the place and i enjoyed it more than i enjoyed disneyland.. I love the dolphin and sea lion show.. The cable car and most of all THE ABYSS!! I have conquered my fear of heights in this ride!!! Ilove it and would like to try it again!!!!!

Prepare to queue during school holidays.. Nightmare on a hot day. some rides with little shelter from the sun when in line. The littlies area was very accesible, plenty available for younger ones. Rides brilliant but expect to wait and wait. Not worth it in height of summer. Panda exhibit depressing and tired, just like the pandas and i couldnt blame them poor things!! The dolphin and sea lion show was awful!! No real education on the animals or any indication of preservation. just a disney, feel goody theme with the poor creatures humilitating themselves doing trciks....Time to change the theme..PLEASE!
Perfect for the family... they've got awesome rides.. perfect place for the family.. we loved the cable cars.. don't expect too much from the bird shows though..

Great for a family day. We have been to HK about 6 times but have never visited Ocean Park. Silly us! We had a fantastic day checking out the pandas, seal show, dolphin show, log ride and the cable car. We didn't make it to the aquarium so we'll have to go back on our next trip. We heard the food is not so good so we bought pret a manger sandwiches on the way.

Great Park!. After traveling for 3 weeks through Asia, our time in Ocean Park was a welcome relief. We really enjoyed the Aquarium, the Pandas, and the Dolphin show. Be prepared however for very long lines at the cable car and the rides. Also we encountered very pushy CROWDS everywhere. I would advise arriving when the park opens, bring your own water/snacks. The gift shop is a great place for HK souvenirs.

It's not Disneyland after all.... You can see that it's less organize, less resources, and less cleaner compare to Disneyland but it's cheaper...Less organize: you need to walk quite a distance from one attraction to others; Less resources: it needs extra time for the operator to check on the security before start the attraction ie Carousel etc. Less cleaner: restaurant is a little bit old and not so "clean", the same goes to toiletMost of the attraction is not suitable for young children; at least must be 122cm height.
Great for the kids. Great for the kids, awesome rides and the ride on the cable car is awesome

Great park but the walk can be a challenge. We loved the diverse main aquarium ( with the sharks, rays, etc) and the pandas as well as the rides, old Hong Kong exhibition and shows. However, at the 2nd tier of the park, I could have done without hilly and long walks between attractions. Overall, quite a visit.

Dont miss it. It is as imp as disneyland if u visit hongkong.If u have a kid ( who clings to u if has to walk a lot) plz get a stroller. they r sturdy and can carry 20-22 kg child easily ). First finish off with lower level so the kid is at ease . Pandas are great to watch. Then go by cable car to higher level( great view). ( Come back by tram at night ). Great rides, long queues even on weekdays. Raging river and mine train r quite a walk away but dont miss them .Wear comfortable sandels. Best was rapids, infact on a hot day, its a brilliant idea to take rapids first, get wet and then move arond in the park. u feel like a walking AC..ha ha. Reserve full day for the park( or u wl b scurrying like a mad hen to cover it all)

Brings out the child in you!. We decided on a whim to go to Ocean Park, after a half day at Stanley and Repulse Bay. It cost about $35AUD which is a bargain for what you get. It was a Friday and quite busy in some sections of the park, especially in the Thrill Mountain section. Our first choice was the Hair Raiser roller coaster, which was only opened in December 2011. The line was very long and it took us about an hour to get on the ride, which if you are a roller coaster fan was awesome. The park is huge and you need a whole day to see it all, unfortunately we did not have enough time and chose to catch the larger rides over the aquarium and other animal attractions (including Pandas). Most of the rides are pretty good, some rides we could jump straight on including The Dragon and The Abyss. The only other ride we had to wait a long time for was The Rapids and it was lame! Not worth the wait at all. Even for a week day it was quite busy, I would avoid on a weekend as the lines would be crazy!Overall Ocean Park was an awesome place, I wish we had more time there.

Fun day for kids. It was very similar to Seaworld and Dreamworld combined together.Had a lot of interesting rides which my 11 years loved. The show was good. Food prices were very HIGH! Be prepared and take a lot of water as it was a hot day when we visited.Gate price was good.Much cheaper than any theme parks in Australia.
Great Family day. What a place......In March there are no waiting times and the weather is great. Ocean Park is a MUST SEE

WOW WOW. I am not generally a theme park person but this was amazing. The ride on the cable car gave a magnificent view and the rides catered to every type of excitement. The aquarium and general aquatic life was fantastic. Well worth what at first seems quite a lot of money. I will go again.
average ocean/themepark. It might not be an objective review as we only spend a short time here. Because it rained in the middle of the day, so we had to proceeded elsewhere. Not much to review. :(

It was OK – but what you should know before you book. So we booked this through Gray Line and If you do this there are some things you should know. First of all you are picked up at 8am but its 10 – 10:30 before you arrive at the park. Where are you during this period, well Gray Line take you to a jewellery factory where you are paraded into a large showroom where they want you to buy things. I was not impressed with this at all.Once you get to the park you are advised of your meeting spot and pick up time which is 4.45. If we were to visit the park again we would make our own way there. If you take the MTR (train) to Admiralty station, then they have a citybus shuttle that will take you to the park. We found that language was a barrier with the drivers on the shuttle bus. it cost about HK $10.60 each, make sure you have exact change or close to it as you don’t get change, you don’t even hand the money to the driver – you place it in a box.Now onto the park – the park is split into 2, one is for the animals, the other for the rides. As it was school holidays while we were there we checked out the rides in the theme park but the lines were too long and it was way too hot to wait.The animals were nice to see – the highlight obviously being the Pandas and there are 2 locations in the park where you can see them. We had lunch at Neptune’s Restaurant which I do recommend, it’s an amazing feeling eating lunch in front of the aquarium wall. Definitely a highlight of my whole HK trip.I would go back to do the rides and see the pandas again, I’d just make sure it wasn’t school holidays!(PS - They do a bag check before you go in to check for food)

Go on a weekday. The park is rather crowded even on weekdays but is unbearable on the weekends. They don't have an effective system for queuing like a fast/express pass so expect long waits for rides or other attractions. There aren't any stand out rides either save for the roller coaster that is near the cliff side and offers a great view for thrill seekers. The performances aren't very entertaining either and it definitely won't sustain your attention if you don't know how to speak chinese.On the plus side, the park is well maintained and they have a great cable car ride and a bunch of escalators to make it easier for visitors to go around the park. It's a decent amusement park but it's loses out to the more modern and extravagant competition like Disneyland, Universal Studios, or even Everland in Korea.

good park, but not for baby and lil kids. I really had so much fun during my stay in Hongkong. The 1st time i went here when i was 13 YO and i still remember how much i had fund together with my siblings and cousins. The 2nd times when i was having my honey moon :)this place is very attractive, has lots of vigourous play and veryyyy biigg. however, probably i will not bring my 2 YO boy to this place first since there will be not many things that he can play with and the place is seems quite too big for lil kids... they will ended up with exhausted.the rest... i really cant wait to have my right time to bring my lil boy to this place.

the biggest escalators i have ever seen and pandas too. we visited in sept 2010, one thing i didnt want to miss was seeing the pandas, this park was amazing. get there early as there is lots of walking and rides and adventures and shows. the show was in chinese and the backdrop was the ocean, it was beautiful and we did not understand a word. lots of food there. the aquarium was multi levelled, huge, dont miss this attraction. oh, they have a huge bldg for the pandas and the escalators are the fifth tallest in the world.....too much for me...they have different ways of crossing the park, either by skyride which is quite long or the new subway they have built there. quite a sight all in all!!!
Good for older kids. Our 2 children did not really find many rides *(they are 7 and 9) but the park overall is great. Food mainly average quality.

Good park, a real shame they still exploit dolphins though. It's a great place to spend the day with children. The aquarium is interesting though a revamp could be done. The attractions are really good and great fun for every age ( our kids were 5 and 3), the panda are so cute.The only major downer is the fact they still use dolphins in their show. It doesn't bring much and when you know how intelligent dolphins are and how depressed they can get in places like this, some even commit suicide.( no surprise they have tiny spaces with no decoration at all... Even a shrimp get plants and rocks in its tank!!).That is a real shame. For the rest though, well done!

Ocean Park. There's an abundance of mainlanders, which really throws off the entire atmosphere of the park. It feels like the mainland there, with the screaming and the dirtiness. The queues are absolutely horrific. However, the park itself it quite nice and has many attractions.

Great day out. We visited ocean park and had a great day. The animal enclosures and aquariums were fantastic. The cable car ride balloon ride were all included in entry price which was great value. Kids would love this place we went without kids and had a blast so I would recommend to anyone.

Ocean Park - Not much fun for smaller kids. The Ocean Park attractions would have been more fun for older children (our 4 and 5 year olds were too tired and irritable by the end of the day. Not being kids that enjoyed rides so much they were quite overwhelmed by the walking that they had to do. The things they loved were the Cable Car ride, the Atoll walk and Old Hongkong which was quite charming. To add to the heat and overall exertion, not being able to find any Vegetarian food was definitely a minus and made the whole experience not such a great one.
i love this place. Ocean park has something for everyone! I loved every aspect of it from the cable car, to the pandas, the aquariums, and the rollercoasters!!!!

Very nice place. It's a very nice place to spend the day. I was with my wife and we had a lot of fun. The location of the Ocean Park is between a lot of hills so you can enjoy the scenery, it has a lot of nice rides, and it also has some nice shows like Birds and Dolphins.If you are going in a hot day, you will be very tired, my advice is to take hats or umbrellas and drink a lot of water.The park has a silver and gold passes (600 to 800 HK$)so you don't wait in long queue. Honestly i found it silly because, apart of the roller coaster, we didn't wait more then 10min.I recommend the place to couples and children as well, they will love it.

A good mix of things to do. Arrive early so you have plenty of time to spend a fair bit of time at each attraction. I love the multi-language maps! I started off the morning at the top and took the tram up. Everyone was busy lining up for the gondola and figured I shouldn't waste the time. Overall, was rewarded by taking the gondola x2 and the sundown. Loved all the attractions. The rides were small compared to the american rides at Six Flags but why not? It's definitely a place great for kids.

Real HK. Ocean park have more then 30 years in HK. If you know Hong Kong you can feel how full is this city. So try to imagine where to put a roler coaster here?? Its easy.. lets do it on the top of the mountains!! :) A nice place to spend a day,

Amazing place especially for children. Lot of rides for children and adults. There is a cable car that takes you from part of the park to the other. The cable car ride gives you a picturesque view of HongKong. On return, you can also take the Ocean express which is a train that gives you the feeling of traveling underwater. There are various animal shows that you can watch.

Great but tiring!. Ocean Park needs more than just 1 day if you plan on going on a few rides & visiting all the sights. Its great fun for kids & adults as well, if you like that sort of thing! The Pandas we lovely to see! So were the Jellyfish!

Halloweens at ocean park. Halloweens at ocean park was one of a kind of experience that my daughter would remember all her life . Have to experience ocean park , haloween nights at night time and get a real view of hong kong bay. It's fun unlimited.

Getaway. WOW! What an entire day getaway. You can spend 2 full days here. Easily accessible from anywhere in HKG and has entertainment for all ages.... wildlife, thrilling rides, good food, souveneir shops and great shows. Children will love to keep coming back here.

Modern Update. Ocean Park has been vastly impoved under new chairmanship. Its great fun. Lots of new attractions including huge fish tank, shark tunnel, panda house. There are trill rides too. Hotels going in. Its quite crowded though and the area around it is undergoing major works for a new underground rail line.

Ocean Park, Hong Kong. This is the 2nd place most attraction for all the travelers after the disneyland Hong Kong. The place is clean and many attractive place to see included cute panda and lion sea show. To explore this place it take a day to complete. The fare is not expensive and it valueable what we had paid.We enjoyed to visit this place and if we have time we will visit it again although the location it up the hill.

Big but crowded. Interesting combo of zoo and amusement park.The train to the upper park is fast and capacious."Hairraiser" is as its name, hairraising but too short and the que was around 50min.Dolphin/Sealion show was average in "stunts" but still very good amusement.

Ocean park 2012 is a pleasant surprise. Was not expecting much for OP since the last time i was there --- which was more than 20 years ago. Boy was I pleasantly surprised. Upgraded rides, fun atmosphere and comparable to the "other" park in HK with the friendly mouse. Nice alternative if you haven't gone to Disneyland.
it's kept updating. i've been here for several times, it's kept updating all the time, which brings you a fresh feeling every time

Ocean Park. This was the most favoured attraction for the little ones. Ultra clean and lots of varies attractions. We actually saw the giant pandas moving! It takes more than 1 day to see the park fully. We enjoyed not having so much merchandising.

Older Attraction - Great views from Cable Car. Ocean Park was celebrating it's 35th birthday year on our visit and unfortunately it is time for a facelift for the park. However, although it is obvious that it has not kept up with the latest technology there were several surprises still in store for visitors. Everything was well maintained and the animals well cared for. The continual theme of education and preservation throughout every exhibit was wonderful to see. The Cable Car provided the highlight for the day as it provided amazing sea views as it took visitors over the mountain to the other half of the park. The Native Chinese Sturgeon exhibit housed large, healthy examples and a walk through aquarium which was lovely and best of all - the Pandas! So beautiful.
great for adults. if you do not have children, then ocean park is the place to go. great rides, great aquarium. however, its quite hilly so expect to get tired

Should be ranked top 10. I have lived in Hong Kong for many years before 2002. Since then, I visit here every summer with my family.We go to Ocean park every year we visit HK.Ocean Park constantly changes, it's never boring.OCEAN EXPRESSSince 2001 we discovered that the train that goes between main entrance and 'the other side of mountain' is much more convenient than the cable car. This time we went back and forth between 2 sections of the park -4 times. The little train only take 3 minutes to cross over, and there is almost no line. Plus it is air conditioned! It was 33C when we visited this time. The aircon felt really good. While we rode the Ocean express, we heard others had to wait for the cable car for 1 hour.THRILL MOUNTAINThis was new since we were here summer of 2011. This is the year my kids can fully enjoy roller coasters, so they did almost all of them. The hair raiser looks scary, but my kids and their friends loved it. My kid was 11, her friend was 13.We tried Mine train first -- to ease kids into the roller coaster business, then the Dragon -- which is 30 yr old? then Hair Raiser. I didn't even go... I am too old for that. Kids enjoyed so much they went twice.POLAR ADVENTUREThere is a new polar adventure. It was not fully open while we visited, but the penguin part was open. It was c.o.l.d. inside. It was fun though. Ocean Park did a great job with the display and education information.OTTERSThere are 2 otters near the Panda and gold fish place, near the front entrance. It's not advertised much, but there are otter feeding time. Somehow we always get there to see the 2:15 feeding time. Those 2 otters are so much fun!RED PANDAThere is red panda feeding time too, I think it is around 2pm, we missed it. They are pretty active.LINESWe were there on a Thursday. Go in right at opening time (10am). We went to Thrill mountain first -- which is the summit side, that require taking the Ocean express to cross over. There was almost no one there. No lines for anything. No line for mine train。 When we visited the sea lions at Pacific Pier, almost no one but we were there. The park got busier after 2pm. Getting on Hair Raiser took 20 minutes or so.

Great for toddler. Many sight-seeing such as visiting the Aquariums, Monkeys, Pandas, Show performed by seals and dolphins. Occupied the attention to my 16th months old child, even though we do not get the chance to enjoy exciting rides. It also took us 20min for our turn to take the cable car down from the top even though we came down at 2.30pm which consider a short queue. We left the place 3 hours early before 8pm to avoid the crowd even though that day is a Monday. Overall experience, satisfied.

Worth to Include in Your Itinerary to HK. A must to include in your trip to HK if Disneyland is another agenda in the itinerary. A fun and refreshing place for all ages, be reminded to enter as early as 10 am and possibly avoid weekend due to heavy influx of visitors from Middle Kingdom. Due to limited restaurants and non availability of halal food, will recommend to begin your day with heavy breakfast and to bring your own food since Muslim visitors having difficulty to have meal inside, unlike Disneyland which is very strict with outside food.You may start the tour inside with panda enclosure before proceed to the queue for cable car, a refreshing view of the ocean and surrounding area. Please wear suitable sport/walking shoes for you to cover the big area. Dolphin/sea-lion show is a must as it is very entertaining.All in all it worth to allocate the whole day for this park.

Great place for the kids. My second time to Ocean Park after my first visit 6 years ago. The park has just gone through major revamp and opening new attractions since last year. I like the new Grand Aquarium, where you can see many fishes and aquatics wonders here. It is located near the main entrance, so you can visit it first, or leave it to the last. I went there on a not so crowded day, so no problem with most of the queues. If you plan to go on a weekend/holiday/school holiday, check the ocean park map before you go, decide the attraction you like most and plan your route carefully. Majority of the theme park rides are at Headland. If you like the rides, I would suggest to take the cable car up to the Headland as early as possible to avoid long queue. And take the train down from Headland to Lowland, the train can take many people in a single ride.

very fun. this place is very fun! i really enjoy it... the one time entrance ticket is so worth it especially if you come early! in our case, we missed the chance of trying all the amusement rides because we did not know that the rides will be closed by 6pm, we came after lunch! =( but just the same, we tried everything we can and had so much fun.

Great Park & a Great Value!. Ocean Park is so much fun for ALL ages - the kiddie area completely thrilled and enterained our young children, and we loved the amusment park. We all loved the panda exhibits, tram ride, and the many aquariums and aquatic life! Very picturesque setting, being on both sides of a mountain. Would love to go back again!

Excellent day out with kids. A great day to spend the day in HK if you have kids. Lots of rides for the kids. There is also an aquarium and a Panda enclosure.We were there at feeding time so it was fun to watch them eating. The train ride that takes you up the mountain is not great but dont miss the cable car ride while returning. You get a fantastic view of HK from the top of the hill.
Very average amusement park. If you like amusement parks, and have nice ones where you live, its nothing special. If you don't, then you may like it.

A Spectacular Adventure in Hong Kong. Ocean Park has improves a lot in the last five years. The original rides still rock but the new rides like the hair raiser, river rapids and the aquarium are just wonderful. The staff were wonderful and helpful they made the lines move faster than most amusement parks. The scenery is wonderful from the Park. Kids of all ages can enjoy this park. Also, the park rates are reasonable compared to Disney land Hong Kong. Something I really enjoyed about the Park is the administration has taken a deep interest in educating visitors about conservation efforts of wild life through attractions like the panda and golden monkey viewing. Also the Hong Kong culture and heritage is also nicely displayed in the Park. Overall it was a wonderful experience. Wish we had more time in the Park. Looking forward to visit again.

"Hair Raising" Adventure. If you like roller coaster rides, then the HAIR RAISER is a MUST VISIT attraction at Ocean Park. A word of caution though: ALL OTHER RIDES at the park will pale in comparison if you ride this first! So I suggest you leave this for last.The queue can be long, but it moves fairly quickly. No need to rent a locker at the bottom if you have bags and small items that will fall out during the ride -- there is a bin nearby that you can deposit and collect these pre and post ride. Though if you have shopped and have valuables, then rent the locker at the base of the ride before heading up.Don't ride if you have just eaten a big meal! If you are the nauseous kind, your meal will definitely come back up. I also don't suggest the ride for kids pre-teen or below (even if they are tall enough) since the ride can be daunting. It's also best to go on a day when it isn't raining, and preferably clear one. Once may not be enough of a ride! Though ou'll have to queue up again for another go, it's going to be worth it.
Spectacular Ocean Park. What a wonderful way to spend a day at the excellent venue.Brilliant scenery and activities. Well worth a visit.

Great place for kids with families with a superb view and fantastic gondola/chair lift ride.. We went up the mountain in the futuristic (think back to the future) train which was interesting. Saw the Pandas, both sleeping) the aquarium (very good view of lots of sting rays, some sharks and colourful fish) had a look around and then caught the gondolas down the hill. Magic. Very high up with spectacular views. Love it! Not too expensive either, so great value for money.

whole family fun. If you have small kids like i do, go to whisker's harbour, the whole place is suitable for them. The frog hopper was one of my children's favourite. Not crowded. F&B quite expensive. Ride on the cable car! i am totally afraid of heights but acted cool for the kids. They loved it very much. Long queue, and some push their way to jump queue. Its normal here it seems. Try to guard your line. You can easily spend 3-4 hours here. A must visit.
lovely aqua show. Unusual fish & dinner excellent. Would go again. the highlight and the fireworks were brillant. Good excellent in aqua restuarant
Must see. We liked it very much cause it is so much fun there - animals, Pandas!!!, Aquarium, cable car, so many attractions and You can be there for the whole day for 280 HKD

Breathtaking Park. Upon entering Ocean Park you are immediately struck by the size of the place, land is such a premium commodity everywhere that we were pleasantly surprised. The rides are included in your entry prce however to go to the shows you have to pay. Its easly accessed by both bus and trains but wear comfy shoes it takes all day to see everything and you go up and down hills all day, there are the longest escalators l have ever seen to help you get up and down but as there is only one entrance/exit its a long walk to get out of the place. Its a very clean place and the animals are well cared for and patrons are asked to be quiet in several locations, there were no empty cages so visitors saw at least 1 creature on show at every window,a definite visit if you can fit it in.
Great Theam Park. My 7yr old daughter enjoyed very much and will definately go again.
Great place. Very good fun for adults and kids. Some parts were under construction when we visited. The closing show is great. Small kids could be a little scared as it is loud.

Hong Kong Ocean Park. Great place, excellent choice for taking your kids to spend a fun day.
Don't miss the Neptune Resturant where you can dine along side a three storey high aquarium.
For all ages. Check weather before going and be ready to walk. Fantastic aquarium and new roller coaster by the mountain.
Wonderful for the kids. I enjoyed myself tremendously. First time overseas and it was a blast. Kids enjoyed the rides and so did I
Its Ok if you have time to waste. Went on a Monday and the lines were very small. Bring comfortable shoes because there is alot of walking.

A Wonderful Park for a Day Visit. Ocean park is a Womderful amusement park that also has a large oceanarium. It has a few marine mammals and Panda Bears. This park is like all the other parks that I have ben to in Asia, it is clean and very well kept. This is a wonderful one day trip to take your family, or just for a couple to enjoy the rides and marine life. You will also enjoy the view from the cable cars and walkways atop the hills in the park.You can't compare it to Disneyland but it is a nice Family Amusement Park that you should enjoy visiting.

Well worth a visit. We squeezed in 4 hours at Ocean Park and we're very glad we did. It helped that the skies were clear and blue so the views were fabulous but the mix of theme park attractions with quality animal exhibits (esp pandas and aquarium) was great. We will definitely go again.

Great to visit it again. The amusement park is so huge that it's difficult to go back and fort from one place to the other. Most of the rides are for adults and it is not recommended for kids since they have a strict age and height requirement that is sometimes not accurate, the sign and brochure says something and when you reach the ride itself they will tell you that the kid is not allowed. it's frustrating for a 9 year old.
not at par with disneyland. Disneyland is far better,did'nt find value for money
It is worth it. I think it is a very interesting park. Worth a visit .
Hong Kong's style Park. There are different animal you can see, different recreational facilities, give you different experience.

A lovely surprise. Was expecting a basic attraction but was very pleasantly surprised! Very clean overall and the staff were friendly throughout the whole park. The pandas were beautiful and the displays were great. A fantastic aquarium and there are also theme park rides for those that enjoy them. Food was very reasonably priced for a them park and a good choice. Also the souvenirs were reasonably priced as well.
Worth it. Huge and many activities. Choose 5.30 slot for Ocean theater. 3.30pm was too crowded even on weekday.

is simply great. we have an annual pass, which is a great value. you can take an ocean park express - bus no 629 from admiralty mtr station, it takes approx 25 minutes.we usually spend most the time in whiskers harbour, which is suitable for kids from approx 1 to 6 years old or so...smaller babies might like the train "toto the loco". there is also mary go round..even on sunday there is little or no waiting timecable car ride is a must, the view is amazing....the attractions for bigger kids and adults might have much longer queues, sometimes you need to wait 35 or more minutes for 2-3 min ridedo not miss Grand Aquarium!!check the website for show times, and make sure you come well before the start of the show to get a good seat. I would recommend Terrace Cafe for its beautiful view, we hardly find anything nice to eat in Ocean Park thoughfor us, Ocean Park much much better than Disneyland

What a lovely surprise. Following my check in to Marco Polo Hong Kong (chosen as I am a GHA Discovery Black Card Member) I was informed that my free local experience was a visit to meet and greet some giant pandas at their local attraction Ocean Park. As i was flying solo on this trip I decided that I would take up the offer the following afternoon unless I found something else better to do!!!A limo was arranged to pick up and drop off and as I wasn't tempted by any of the other Hong Kong highlights I decided to take up the experience with very little expectation.What a wonderful park clean friendly and visually inspiring from the minute I walked in to leaving nearly three hours later. I could only wish I had my children with me as I felt guilty having all this theme park fun without them!!The honorary panda keepers experience was what I was there for and this was a memory I will keep with me for a long time interacting with both giant and red pandas behind the scenes preparing food and hand feeding them bamboo shoots (with the benefit of a large steel door between me and the 135kg giant panda)I am not known for my bravery around animals however I was completely awestruck as to the level of care and attention these animal recieved and as such cannot wait to return with my family to share this wonderful experience with them all.Highly recommended

Ocean Park. This is the third time I went to Ocean Park. The first being more than 30 years ago and the second , five years ago. I have always like the Ocean Park as I feel they have much to offer. However, this time round I was a little disappointed. I think the main reason was the hot weather ! It was a very , very hot day and I never perspired so much in my life ! I am living in the tropical country and if even I say it is hot, believe me it is hot ! There wasn't many air con restaurant or air con souvenir shops that I could take refuge. Many of the animal shows were also held outdoors. The weather was really a killjoy. I have come to decide that I would never visit a theme park duirng summer.
a great place to spend the day. such a lot going on, this was our second visit and so much had changed in the two years - always worth another visit

Best cable car ride. The cable car ride at Ocean Park is the best, as you passed the spectacular view from above. Unfortunately the queue gets very long. The staff are very friendly. I also enjoyed the Panda exhibit.It is quite a climb getting around Ocean Park so please brace yourself and take along water for a hot humid weather.

Pandas! Fish! Cable Car ride! Ocean Express Train!. Ocean Park has vastly improved from my 1st visit 18 years ago. We bought some discount tickets before exiting the MTR station and then got on the bus to the Park. We only needed our Octopus cards to travel there. For 3 adults, 1 child, and 1 baby it was about USD$90. We limited our attractions to those that would accommodate a 4 year old and 1 year old, so my review doesn't include any of the roller coaster rides or even the merry-go-round. Even without those rides, Ocean Park still offers a family with young kids a full days entertainment.When we arrived at Ocean Park, we didn't see the elevator and took the kids and the stroller up the escalator. At the entrance was a large lake with a water show every few minutes. There would be a fireworks show at night but we didn't stay that late. We decided to head into the aquarium, located right next to the lake. There is an elevator that you can take if you have a stroller like we did. There was an open water area where you could see some fish swimming. Then my son touched a starfish and we went deeper into the building. There were large glass areas under and around the aquarium where we could see many large fish, sting rays, and hammerhead sharks. There are little displays for unique sea creatures like the flashlight fish, the camouflaged seahorses, and spider crabs.Next we lined up for the cable car ride. To get to the line, we walked through the newly opened "old Hong Kong" area. There are little carts to get some food, snacks, and drinks. Everything seems reasonably priced, though I do not recommend the soft serve cone - it was syrup and ice and almost no milk or cream or the egg waffle snack - just flavorless. The coke ice was pretty good. The line at 10:30am was not very long and we were able to pile into one cable car. The cable cars do not stop, so have the attendant help you with the stroller and when you arrive on the other side, have the attendant pull it out. It was a beautiful ride over Ocean Park and the surrounding ocean.Once we got to the other side we went to the rainforest display and to one of the gift shops. We found the kiddie ride area and rode the little pink train ride twice. My son is a big fan of trains. He wasn't tall enough for the carousel and the rest of the area seemed like amusement park/fair games to win prizes, so we did not go further. We rode the Ocean Express train back down to the entrance side. There is a cool movie that plays on the roof of the train while you are riding down.Now back at the entrance we went to see the pandas! Outside the entrance to the Panda exhibit is the crocodile exhibit. The display crocodiles look a lot like the real thing. There were 3 pandas in the large air conditioned picturesque enclosure. It's the big white warehouse that can be seen from the cable car ride. There were also 2 red pandas that are a cross between a panda and a raccoon. We were just in time to watch the red pandas being feed. The other pandas were either eating or lounging around or sleeping. Outside the panda exhibit was a koi pond and the goldfish exhibit. There were lots of unique looking goldfish. It was almost time to go, but my son wanted to ride the cable car again. We went to the line and it was over an hour wait. So we noticed that the return cable cars were empty and decided to go back to the other side via the Ocean Express train and come back via cable car. It worked out since we only had to wait for 1 express train and there was no line on the return cable car ride.We rode the bus back to the MTR station and headed back to the hotel. The kids were exhausted and slept. There was definitely a lot more to see and experience at Ocean Park, so we are looking forward to going back in a few years when the kids are older and not afraid to ride some of the rides.

Well better than disney land. Its cheaper than disney land! And more to do. Nice water fountain display at the end to finish the night of! Plenty of rides and things to see, panda's where people was raving about, food and drinks was at reasonable price, nice cable cars to see the park from above. Went on the hottest day in hk and wish there was a fountain to get wet! Beware if getting taxi- make sure the meters ticking! Hk taxi drivers are big big cons!!!

Pandas and other animals. Lovely. Lovely place. Loved the 2 pairs of pandas. Other animals were nice too. Cable car ride was lovely. Did not like the winding and sloped pathways that made you walk a lot.

An enjoyable leisure park!. The weather was cool and pleasant(we traveled in Feb)due to which our complete day at Ocean Park turned out exciting & fun. Its spread across huge area and one has to walk a lot if plan to cover the entire park. We enjoyed rides, pandas, underwater aquarium, cable car ride, hot air balloon(though not being operated by hot air), good food everywhere, So overall a nice experience and we suggest a one day trip to this theme park of HK.

Not suitable for kids who are not at least 125-130cm tall. We were looking forward to visiting Ocean Park again with our now 6-year old boy. No doubt the park has vastly improved and is in a very good state. However, our son was very disappointed that most rides on the 'mountain' were not suitable for him because of his height. We asked a member of staff what children were allowed to do in this area and it was only the theatre where they show sea lions and dolphins. No surprise our son and we were not impressed. There are a few rides for younger children at the bottom of the park past the pandas. But - in my opinion - that would not justify the expense to come here for a day. At Disneyland at least he could use almost all rides and was very happy. It would have been good if it would have been pointed out to us that the majority of the rides were not suitable for a 6 year old.

nice for younger kids. nice park but not so stroller friendly as there are many hilly areas. old hong kong was nice. also recommend the cable car ride. we had an early dinner at the bayview restaurant which offered a nice view.

A Hong Kong Must See. This is Hong Kong's theme park. The people of Hong Kong, with Disney coming to town, have adopted Ocean Park as their own. This is where the locals go to have fun with their families. Great food, an aquarium, zoo, and theme park rolled into one beautiful place. I've been coming to O. Park for decades, and the changes and upgrades are really something to see.

Worth a day trip to the famous Ocean Park. We always thought that this park is for kids only, so when we went there as a couple, we were pleasantly surprised that this park could be romantic too.The cable car ride was the most pleasant, with beautiful scenery of the harbour.The Old Hong Kong attraction was very nostalgic, you should take black and white photos in ths area for that old rustic scenes.
can see they are never stop to get improve. like the cable car, aquarium, restaurant, souvier shops and of course the most exciting game in HK so far.

Fun day at Ocean Park HK. Ocean Park is another great place to take the kids. Here, they dont scrutinize your bag at the entrance at all, so we can bring in our own prepared and packed food inside. Fee is pretty steep, but worth it if you cover ALL areas within. Its really a big place with awesome aquarium area and cosy panda area. Besides that, we can take the cable car up to the higher area within and the ride will give you a spectacular view of hong kong. Again, coz we went in summer so the hot weather make queuing for rides pretty challenging and tiring. Other than that, ocean park is simply awesome!! I highly recommend this place. Plus it is accessible for wheelchair bound individuals and getting a cab ride back is also very easy as there are abundance of cabs just outside. To really enjoy everything here, one must spare about 4-6hours here.
Great for a day out. Part wildlife presentation, part theme park with multiple attractions.

Excellent Park. Wonderful park with a nice selection of rides, including Hair Raiser, a B&M Floorless Coaster. The Summit area of the park has breathtaking views, and the lower section of the park has some very nice theming and atmosphere. The cable car is a must for its great views, though I suggest you ride it to the Summit as soon as you arrive as queues for the Cable Car can get very long later in the day. The food was great - very delicious options at a reasonable price.My only complaint is that there are very few fans, misters and shade around the park, and in the 30 degree heat it can become very difficult to walk anywhere without drowning in a pool of sweat.

Nice but the walk.... I was there with two 12-year-olds and 2 ladies in their 40s who are not used to walking. It was the beginning of summer and what with the travelling and all, we missed theDolphin show - too tired to check it out. Cable car ride was fun and the kids enjoyed all the rides. Muslims, if you are particularr about what you eat, please bring you own food as unlikeDisneyland HK (Tahitian Terrace at Adventureland), there is no halal eating outlet. There is a bakery where seafood sandwich is served.
180hkd experience. I prefer ocean park than Disney land coz it's more to see and the cable car itself was an experience to try
"experience we cannot forget". Ocean Park and Disneyland are really the top attraction in HK.Any age will feel the happiness brings by this places.Love it!

Worth a visit, some great rides!. I visited with two children, 8 and 11, who are theme park veterans, were fresh from Disneyland, and so a very jaded pair. The decision of both was that it was better than Disneyland as far as the rides and thrills (not as good in theming). It was a very enjoyable day, and we could certainly have stayed longer (eventually driven out at about 3.30 by a thunderstorm...)Transport - we caught bus 629 from Admiralty, having first caught the MTR there. There are very clear signs leading from the MTR to the Ocean Park bus (my obsessive checking on the net of just which exit to take was quite unnecessary), and once you arrive at the bus area there are well ordered and shepherded queues for the buses. You can also buy your theme park tickets right up where you wait for the buses, to save time once there. The trip was only 10-15 minutes, much quicker than anticipated. Reverse trip again it was very well ordered to get people onto the buses, but a longer trip.Theming - there are themes to some extent in various areas of the park, and an 'Old Hong Kong' section which is cute. Generally it is very nice, and there are some lovely gardens, although not quite up to Disney standard. Getting around the park - getting around can be by cable car from one side of the park to another, train from one side to another, escalators, and walking (some fairly long, deserted walks in places). The cable car was a great experience, with beautiful views, and quite a dramatic trip. We arrived early and so had a cable car to just the three of us. On the way back we caught the train due to a thunderstorm closing the cablecar, which initially seemed a let down, but proved to be a great ride in itself due to the 'show' on the ceiling. While some of the walks were long and uphill, we really enjoyed the scenery, and the feeling of being almost alone within a theme park.Food - There was a good variety of food, and a lot of stalls where you could get a snack. There are a variety of restaurants which could suit most dietary needs. The restaurant we ate at had a lovely view but very ordinary food, and there was a mistake with the order which meant I missed out on eating. Rides - some really great thrill rides here, as well as an area for little kids (we didn't make it there). Most of them were so good that we raced to get straight back on again! On the day we were there (A Friday, which was initially fine weather) queues were very short, with an absolute maximum of 10 minutes (although the bungee trampoline would be longer) and many where we could get straight back on or even stay on. One thing we did find was that there were a few rides (about 3) with unusually strict height requirements compared to what I have found on similar rides elsewhere, which meant that my 8 year old could not ride. On one ride (the drop ride) she was turned away initially when we reached the front of the line, without being measured. Upon exiting and seeing the height requirement we found that she exceeded it by 1 or 2cm, so had to line up again, which was annoying.Other - aquarium, shows, pandas, other animals - all was very enjoyable, and we didn't manage to see it all in one day. Also have to say it is an amazingly scenic amusement park - the terrain, the greenery and the water views (including seen from rides) were just beautiful. Well and truly enough to keep pretty much anyone occupied for a day.Overall, it was a great visit and one which I would definitely repeat.Tip: Head straight for the cable car upon arrival to avoid queues for both the cable car and the rides on the other side

good rides, good fun. been to disneyland and ocean park and think i still prefer ocean park over disney. of course, the kids will have a different opinion but think ocean park is doing a good job. love the proximity and convenient location of the place
Fantastic for children and Adults !. A fantastic park that has grown over the years and is still expanding, this is a must for all families with children, superb !!

Pandas and Cable Car, and that's about it.... Much has been said about Ocean Park, so we decided to check the place out. As a comparison, we visited Disneyland HK (again) the next day and it was our unanimous decision that OP needs a total overhaul if it is to remain a top attraction. On the to-do list - aquarium - other than the giant fish tank, the exhibits and placement need a total re-think. Langkawi's underwater world is much better.
