Rides : unfortunately, not that interesting and some are just old and tired (eg carousel next to the Old HK area - just compare that to the Cinderella carousel in HK Disney and you will know what i mean). Animal shows - ok, but not something that I will go out of my way to watch. Game stalls at kids area - best avoided like the plague unless you loads of cash to burn. What was good was the cable car ride (awesome views!) and the pandas (very cute, mesmerising), which went a long way to mitigate the ticket price. I think OP tries to do too much and as a result there is a lot of stuff, but not all of it is good. We won't return unless there is a very compelling reason to do so.

Ocean Park - more fun for your Hong Kong vacation. My wife and I both agree that Ocean Park is a wonderful way to spend a day if you are vacationing in or near Hong Kong. We went during the month of my birthday, which entitled me to get in for 1/2 price. One of the things we liked the most was the tower drop. It was quite exciting, but not so much so that we had to do it a second time. Perhaps, besides the Panda exhibit, the best attraction was the cable car ride high above the mountains and the sea. The view was outstanding. Certainly one of the more fun things we've gotten to do in Hong Kong.

Sensational Theme Park. Great mix of rides and animal exhibits - something for everyone and now also features a historical Hong Kong experience that's interesting. Like all theme parks however the food is overpriced and relatively poor.

Half-Half Feeling About This Park. The Bad: The performances are boring. The dolphin and sea lion performance is boring although the view of the ocean in the backdrop is beautiful. The signs in the park are not clear. It is frustrating especially when I am trying to catch a show or talk and cannot locate the place. I gave up trying to fit all the shows & talks in one day which are sub-standard performances anyway, and instead concentrate on the rides which are more enjoyable. The park looks very 80s and I felt like I was transported back to 1980s (30 years ago!). The park needs a renovation if you ask me. When I first enter the park, there isn't a wow feeling, instead it feels very old-fashioned. What is beautiful is the park is located where the ocean and mountain meets so the nature side of it is beautiful but not the manmade side. However as it is located at the mountain, it is very hilly and tiring to walk the hilly paths.The Good: Visit the pandas during their feeding time so that you can watch the pandas eating, which is interesting. I like the goldfish exhibit too where there are so many variants of goldfishes out there. I took the train ride to the other side of the park where the rides were. The train ride is interesting if you can pretend you are underwater when the train is actually cutting across the mountain. The cable car ride back in the evening is very nice too, as the line is closest to the ocean edge. The show at the end is quite good too with water and fire effects.

Show were great. The Dolphin show and the sea otter performance and also other animals performance was great to watch . They even invite guests to participate in their performance. Mostly children though....

Awesome place for adults and kids. I enjoy the all the show in ocean park, especially the dolphin show! I could still remember the two cute panda, miss them so much~ Kids would definitely love there, adults would love their crazy roller coaster! A must go in Hong Kong!!

Good outing. Its worth a visit . do your home work well . Know which bus to board and where to eat . If you want to eat cheap , don't eat there . The train ride was good . You may be lucky to see school children coming with a band to perform . But this does not happen everyday. The cable car ride gave us a good view of the surrounding areas.

Good but be prepared for rude tourists.. Good experience and lots of fun, as expected in theme parks. Just be prepared for the gatherings of Chinese tourists that don't seem to budge. Be sure to avoid the fancy restaurant overlooking the water - it was expensive and definitely not worth it. The price we paid for a pathetic bowl of udon noodles would have gotten you something simply devine from temple street!

Theme Park. Not very interesting especially if you have been to Sea World (Gold Coast) or Universal Studio (Singapore). A bit worn out and a bit disappointing to watch the panda on display as most of the time they might be sleeping.

Superr funn... The park is huge you need atleast two days to cover it up whole.. i loved the rides. the dolphin show is something you cant miss. the only problem i faced was in finding vegetarian food as i am a veggie.you would get hell tired roaming around whole day but the fun is worth it..

PANDA'S. Since our last visit in 2002 they have done a lot of remodelling and now have 4 Pandas plus a "Rainforest" enclosure which lets you get up close and personal with a Sloth. Take the cable car up and the "Nautilus" back down fore something different.

Excellent. Absolutely fantastic. Very well organised park. Good mix of animals and fun rides. Use both the cable car and express train for different experiences. We organised to be honorary panda keepers, which was amazing. Get to make up their feed and then feed them veg. Dream come true!

Go for the Panda's stay for the rides!. We went for the Panda's and enjoyed the rides. There's a short cable car journey to the top of the park where the rides are. Be prepared for a long walk if you want to do the whole park and all the attractions. The jellyfish experience was a bit disappointing, many dead Jellys in the tanks.Tips - They say you can't take water in, but you can they don't check, you'll need it while you trek around. Weather permitting at 19:30 (at the Aqua City Lagoon) there's a multi-media nighttime spectacular featuring fire, water, pyrotechnics, music and animation.

Best day!. Absolutely love this place! I am an avid theme park goer and this is the best!! Combination of rides, pandas and fish, with an epic view! On top of a hill surrounded by sea and other Islands. Interesting to navigate but my best day in Hong Kong and well worth the visit and great value for money!

PANDAS :). I went here instead of Disneyland in order to see the pandas. I managed to see 3 pandas in total so I was very pleased. There is also and interesting array of animals, especially the goldfish garden as well as the jellyfish section (loved this!). The rides seem like a lot of fun and the views from the big swing is astounding. The area called Old Hong Kong is really cool too but the "traditional food" they serve there is oily and tasteless. The views from the cable-car is quite beautiful but I will not reccommend the cable-car for anyone who is slightly claustrophobic or scared of heights as there aren't any emergency buttons in the car so they have to stay put the whole way through. The aquarium is also a must see! We only had limited time and spent an afternoonthere but I would reccommend a full day.

Excellent day out for family. A theme park and zoo rolled into one! Ocean Park is located towards the bottom of Hong Kong island. It has two levels, one at the bottom of mountain and the second level at the top. The bottom level has a range of animals, including a small aquarium but the definite stars of the attraction are the 3 pandas. You can choose to take a short train ride to the top of the mountain or get the cablecar. We took the train up, which is completely enclosed and acts like an submarine simulator! The cable car on the way down, offers amazing views of the area. At the top, there are a selection of rides, rollercoasters and other sick inducing thrills! If you are in Hong Kong around halloween, then make sure visit for the night shows!
Getting old. The nearest thing to a sea life park. Getting quite old but if you're tired of Disneyland, this is the cheaper alternative.
A Surprise.. Closer to Hong Kong proper than Disneyland and a great place to take children. Lots of rides, shows and animals. Much bigger than I had anticipated.

Too Many Tour Groups. Difficult to enjoy since the park is teeming with tour groups from the mainland. Took us almost 90 minutes before we can ride the roller coaster. However, this will be a good park if you're quite a daredevil since the rides here compared to Disney's are more for the brave

Let the pigeons loose let the games commence. Rides, animals excitement that's what'd install for you when you visit this great theme park. The cable car rocked steadily to the top of the hill so as to access the rides section of the park, particularly the Hair Raiser What a ride. Back the down the hill and take in the great views again - out to sea and aspects of the park itself. The other highlight was seeing the large and smaller pandas. Great day and plenty if photo opportunities.

More fun than HK Disneyland. I think Ocean Park is a way better bargain than Disneyland. When I visited HK Disneyland, I felt that it was really small and the rides weren't very exciting. You won't get that in Ocean Park. Ocean Park has rides for all ages and of all intensities. It has a few aquariums, panda and bird exhibits. It also has a lot of other amusement park activities to do. You must take the cable car up or down some time if you go, the view of the bay is amazing. It's a sure win for everyone in the family.

Lots of things going on. And the line's not irritating. They ensure that everyone will not wait for a very long time. And there are no people cutting lines (we heard that Disneyland's filled with kids always cutting the line).There are a lot of things going on, good for the entire family. The food sucks, though.Bring your own drinks (they'll let you) and even food (but there's a McDonalds store inside). Because drinks here are a major rip-off.

Very fun!!. I like it here, its not really like the disneyland in hkg, i found i more challenging in ocean park. You will tired to walk in ocean park, it'll feel you go for hiking, i suggest that u wear the most comfortable shoes that u had. But its all worth it anyway, burn more calories and get so much fun!

we are coming back!. my family and I created the perfect memory. one of our highlights of hk vacation was ocean park.a. ease of getting there. bus from admiralty or central gets you to the doorsteps and it ain't expensive b. price is decent when you compared to amusement parks in australia, Singapore and cheaper thn HK disneyland and much more to see than Malaysia klcc aquariac. there's plenty to see and it's fun for young and old. my mum had a great timed. most happy to meet giant pandas and watch the dolphin n seals show e. old hong kong was great for picture takingf. fishes, jellyfish, sichuan monkey, birds; all sorts of sights ; some with shows of their own. we actually did not complete everything much to our dismay despite being there for 6 hrs plus.g. if it's not weekend the crowd is still ok and maps are easy enough to let you venture through two areas - waterfront and summit connected by cable car n train (indoor disguised like submarine)h. having a meal at terrace cafe with the cool wind and enjoyed the view; food pricey and tasted okthere's currently some new additions yet to be open and like I said few attractions we missed/ hadn't have enough time.. so my next time to hong kong- ocean park is still on the list!
Nice to walk around and look at the city. Reallly noice. Go there at dawn time. It is a long park and it is worth walking around. Relax, sit and check people and families around you.

A brilliant day out!. We visited Ocean Park while on holiday in Hong Kong in preference to Disneyland. It was really easy to find, and although it was a Saturday and the buses were busy we didn't have to wait long. I really couldn't fault the park at all. We visited with children aged 9 and 11 and they loved it, as did we. The aquarium was the best I've seen, and it was great to see the pandas. There were queues for some of the rides, but not too long. The park was absolutely spotless and good value - £71 for 2 adults and 2 children. The only fault I could pick is that we didn't have time to see it all!

Good!. Visited Ocean Park with my husband. My first impressions were of that Beverly Hills Cop movie...you know the one set in Wonder World... The whole place is quite old looking but that kind of adds to the fun! The rides were very good, some hair-raising, the place is huge (you can get a cable car or train from one side to the other) and there is a large selection of food outlets and of course souvenir shops. The animal experiences were my favourites. We went to the marine life show where the dolphins and sealions entertained the crowds with their antics. We fed the sealions ($3 a cup of fish)...my highlight of the day. We also got to see the giant panda bears. Our only downside was the Aquarium. The crowds of people inside were unbelievably rude and bad mannered. Everyone was banging into everyone, no apologies, queue skipping, barging past people, really awful experience. Couldn't wait to get out of there. Thankfully we could see when we exited that they had held back some people from entering until the crowd dissipated, really bad experience in there. Otherwise, good fun park, I still prefer Disneyland but that's just because I love Disney...the rides in OP are more adult and there is more to do...it's also $100 dollars cheaper per person than Disney...good day out!

Great home grown park!. Easy to get to the park, super value for money.What I suggest you should do but it is weather permitting and I have yet to include rides into this very basic itinerary. :S 1. Take the hot air balloon at the sky fair first because it always has the longest queue but if you are first, there won't be a queue :D2. Try the cable car to the top which means you will walk pass the old hong kong place!3. See the jellyfish4. Take the sky tower5. See the sea lions6. Watch the famous performance at the Ocean Theater.(it has deproved a lot since the lost of the killer whale)7. Take the ocean express down8. See the pandas (there are 2 venues in total to see them, make sure you see them at both venues, the panda village and the jockey club si chuan treasures)9. Watch the bird show at the amazing bird theater10. Grand Aquarium11. Watch the water show at the Aqua Lagoon, 7.30pm12. Visit the gift store near the entrance which is the largest for some souvenir runJust remember to start off early so that you can experience everything in the park! (: Enjoy!!!

Better than Disney. Time is better spent here than at Disneyland. Once the stuff atop the park is complete, it will be even better. The best thing in the park is the gondola ride. Stunning view of the south side of Hong Kong island. Be brave and try the Korean style squid.

Nice park. Ocean park accessible by mtr and after that we can use 629 bus. I admire the grand aquarium because it is so big and thick. But the most interesting is PANDA village! The panda is so cute and adorable. Must see attraction!

A theme park with escalators - awesome. We spent a day at Ocean Park. It was great. The park itself is very clean and tidy. Escalators are available everywhere considering the park is on the side of a hill. Good rides. Great views.

Ocean Park, Hong Kong - Wow!!. We've recently been to Hong Kong (4 days in mid May 2012) and as time was a factor, we couldn't decide which was better - Disneyland or Ocean Park. After asking the locals and doing extensive reading, we decided on Ocean Park. What a ball!! To book the day pass entrance ticket, it's far easier (and cheaper) to see if your hotel arranges this and rather do it through them. If you're into white knuckle rides then you simply have to go on The Hair Raiser, Flash, The Abyss, The Dragon, The Water ride and the Pirate Ship - they were all fun and we just lined up and went time after time!! The other "normal" fun park rides are also available. The Polar Express rollar coaster ride will be opening soon.Great Panda's, Golden Monkeys, Red "Fire Fox" Panda's and cool aquatic life. (No flash photography obviously.) When it's hot an humid, take LOTS of water to drink and enjoy the cable car ride from one side of the park, over the hill overlooking the South China Sea to the Bird and Dolphin/Sea Lion shows. "Locals" are a little rude by jumping the que but just stand your ground. Public transport is easy, effcient and cheap. Just have a map, the correct change ready or, even easier, buy on Octopus card (much like an Oyster card) and top up when you need to. This card works at KFC, 7 Eleven, and the MTR system as well. Handy!Can't wait to go back just to do the rides again!!! Who says that Hong Kong is just for shoppers???PS - Ladies, if you're not used to the heat and humidity, then just forget about wearing any decent make-up. It all melts off anyway!!! Hope you all enjoy it as much as we did.

Aquariums and fun rides, more for little kids. The park was lively and full of amazing aquatic animals. You can learn a lot about these animals when you go to Ocean Park. The setting is more for young kids though, so if you have children who are interested in learning about animals and going on fun, ocean-themed mellow rides by all means go here!!

Park good, not so good for the pandas :(. We were really looking forward to this trip, and had read about the conservation efforts of the park. We found the opposite, VERY small enclosures, or totally unsuitable to the animal. The red panda (which likes hiding up high trees, with lots of foliage) had NO trees, and was pacing around the enclosure, seemingly very distressed. It felt like more of an outdated zoo. The pandas, the park's star attraction, were in a bit better shape, but still had to put up with people banging on the glass and flash photos (there were staff around but no one was enforcing the 'quiet and no flash' rule') Quite an upsetting visit, paired with the condition of some of the caged birds (Great Hornbills in a small cage). As an animal lover, I couldn't recommend it.

Been there twice and it never failed me.... the first time I went to Ocean Park was in 2009 and the second time was last February 2012. One whole day is not really enough to experience the entire theme park. If you are adventurous enough, the rides will certainly thrill you. We just walked. In 2009, the train is not yet available so we don't have any choice but to ride the cable car. Now, if you're afraid of heights, you have a choice to ride the train instead.
Worth a visit.. This was good value for money. The times of animal attractions and shows is a bit hard to find. This is no Disney Land but for $40Aud a pretty good day out.
We had a ball. The cable car is worth the entry fee, alone. Great rides and a wonderful aquarium. The seal/dolphin show is a must-see.

not for small kids :-). Lot's of exciting rides kids needs to be at least 122cm to ride on most of them. We wanted to sample but since I have 2 smaller ones we were not able to. From Regal Riverside there is bus along Sha Tin Wai Road ( Bus 170) that will bring you to Aberdeen Tunnel Station from there just follow the sign to Ocean Park about 5mins walk

still fun!. i have realized a way to beat the crowds and queues in ocean park and the cable car: *go early in the morning~~ please eat a full breakfast first because you will get hungry!! 1) dont see anything near the entrance first. make a beeline to the "underwater" train up to the theme park2) play around the theme park then go to the dolphin show last. 3) there is an aircon enclosure that you can sit in if you are too hot. this is esp useful if u visit during july when its sooooo hot. 4) next, make ur way to the dolphin show after walking around abit. 5) nearby there is a place to eat. please dont order the pork.. its very dry. try to order the white chicken. that one is super nice!! 5) make ur way to the cable car. ( if you dont want to watch the dolphin show, take advantage of the dolphin show time to sit the cable car. we did that and the waiting time was less than 10 mins coz majority of the people were at the show) 6) when u reach the bottom, make ur way to the panda exhibit or go see the aquarium. aquarium should be last because that is the place with aircon. ENJOY!!
Thumbs up. Ocean park very easy to find by public transport Big park need atleast 2 days to cover allTry 1) cable car 2) train 3) many more attraction Should go place ,,,

Nice attraction.... Ocean Park in Hongkong is a new place for everybody. It is also educational in the sense that kids will learn to know more about animals and their habitats. There are also rides for those who love excitement. Fun for the whole family...
trip to ocean park hk. its been a great and memorable place .. love it ocean park hongkong!
Worth a visit. Ocean Park worth a visit. Cable car ride amazing but be prepared to queue for ages to get on and even longer to come back. Very hot the day we went. Reasonable value for money.

Wonderful!!!. Went to OcenPark with my family, we have two kids - 11 and 9 yo.This is a wonderful place. We had targeted to see things which we do not get to see at other places. The cable car to the top was fantastic......wonderful view and a very scenic experience. it is a MUST DO.Once on the mountain side, there were so many rides and games to enjoy. In short a lovely place to enjoy. Only problem during our visit was the HOT weather.
Don't miss it. Prepare the whole day for this visit. Be there early as the lines can be long. Ticket price is all worth it even just for the cable car ride. Lots of attractions.

Fantastic attraction, for kids and adults.. You can go there by MTR(underground), when you get out, there's a guy who sells cards for the park(25HKD), then you take the bus directly to Ocean Park. Don't go on a saturday or sunday or holiday. The most beautifull attractions for me are the animals, especially the Panda bears. Everything is very clean and organized. Food and drinks are a bit expensive. Great views all around.
A place with lots of fun. Ocean Park has been in HK for many years but it keeps adding new features. I never get tired going to Ocean Park

Hong Kong's original park. Ocean Park is one of the must-visit when in Hong Kong. We got discounted tickets as we've got a friend who is a staff at Ocean Park. Ocean Park is a huge huge place and you have to walk quite a bit. The rides are similar to most theme park rides but the main attraction is definitely the dolphin show.The dolphin show is at an amphitheater and only certain parts of it are shaded. The best thing to do is to arrive about 30mins before the show and grab any seats in the center towards the back row. That way you'll get to see the entire pool under the cool shade. The first show before noon is the best as it is not too hot yet.Food is alright, plenty of choices but the queue is long everywhere during lunch time. The only thing that we probably disliked was the queue to every attraction. The queue was caused by the Park's policy to get your photos taken before entering the attraction. Of course you can opt not to buy the photos after that. You can even opt not to take the photo in the first place.You must try the cable car and the hot air balloon ride at least once.

Fun day for the family. Went to Ocean Park twice. It is very convenient to get there, just take Citybus 629 from Central station and it brings u right to the park. I found the second visit more interesting as we covered more attractions. There are many interesting stuff to see, like animals, aquarium as well as thrilling rides. The park is divided into two sections, Summit and Waterfront. To get to one part to the other u have to either take the Ocean Express Train or cable car. Suggest going up to Summit by one mode of transport and coming down by the other, so u get to experience both. I liked the cable car better cos of the view u get to see outside! Mountains, seas, houses, totally breathtaking! It was even cooler during the cable car ride as we went in autumn.The rides are very thrilling so we didn't take them. However we took the Ocean Park Tower which brings u all the way up and u get a great view below.Remember to watch the dolphin show and visit the giant pandas. Unfortunately the pandas were sleeping during my trip there :(Bayview restaurant located at the Summit has pretty nice food with ok pricing, the set comes with ice cream. Souvenirs in the park are cute but expensive.Tip: avoid weekends and china holidays it gets very very very crowded

must go on a weekday and prepare to walk ALOT!. best part of the park visit was the cable car ride to the other side of the park. summer time in HK is mostly hot, EXTREMELY humid and having to move from one ride to another is quiet a distance. we spent over half a day in the park was to only ride less than 3 rides and that;s including cable car roundtrip. Just be prepared to walk walk and walk and then wait in long que. Too many Chinese tourists with umbrellas to block the sun was so annoying cuz, it was actually a struggle to pass them without the umbrellas poking my face. WHY WHY the umbrellas when there is no rain!!!!!!!!!!!
Absolutely fantastic place!. Totally loved the place. Rides are amazing. Hair raiser and the dragon are the best. You can barely cover the whole park in a day. Must go.

A Day of Fun in Hong Kong. I would suggest visiting on a weekday when the lines are shorter. We took the double decker bus out to the park. Upon entering the park you can visit the panda exhibit and the aquarium. Then hop on the sky ride to take you over the mountain to the other side where all the rides are, the views are amazing. Be aware it is very hot so wear light breathable clothing and be sure to keep drinking water. Then spend the day going on all the rides. We loved the log flume and wild raft rides because we could get soaked, my only complaint was the water wasn't cold enough, the heat is very intense. The teens in our group were brave enough to go on the roller coaster that seems to fly above the water. There are dolphin and seal shows throughout the day. Also many food stands and a carnival area where you can play games for prizes. To get back to the exit, take the train through the mountain or, you can take the sky ride again.

Went instead of Disney. Decided to go to Ocean Park on suggestion of local/friends. Overall was a great experience. Make sure you can manage hills or don't bother going. Looks like MTR station being built out to the park. If your are expecting Florida or California, don't bother.

Go on a weekday!. I have been to Ocean Park about 10 years ago and it was originally not on my list of things to do during my stay in Hong Kong this time. But everyone was raving about how awesome it was and how much it has changed so I decided to go on a Friday. Best decision ever! We got there around 11 something in the morning and there were no lines at all. We got to go on every ride we wanted and saw the pandas. It is a big park but I think if you plan accordingly, you can see everything you want. I watched the dolphin show and it was good but if you've seen many dolphin shows before, it's nothing extraordinary. The views are magnificent. Overall, a good experience on a not so busy weekday.

Great place to go for adults and children to have a good day out.. Go and experience this place yourself, because if you don't like it, or your children don't like the park I will be totally surprised. The park is of a reasonable size that you should expect to spend nearly all day there. There's plenty going on and lots of rides to try. Whether your single, a couple or going to Ocean Park with children it's a very pleasurable experience. My fiancé and I really liked the place and intend to go back soon and she doesn't even like roller coasters, he, he.

Panda's place. My main reason to visit the Ocean Park theme park was to see the Pandas! Din't get disappointed. Got to see two chubby Pandas, chewing their bamboo leaves to glory. In fact they were too meticulous and clean, in finishing up their meal. Very intriguing indeed! Also the couple of Red Pandas were also a thrill to watch. So cute. May was too hot in Ocean Park and thanks to the Pandas, we got to enjoy in the cooler environs laid out for them.Besides the Pandas, Ocean Park is a combination of Sea World and many other roller coaster rides, which would consume one whole day if you were to complete all of them.Thanks to the cheap Digital Photography, there is someone taking a picture of you at various points and waiting to sell that to you for couple of hundreds of HKDs.The Ocean Theatre experience, where they show a live event with the Dolphins and Seals is a disappointment. If you have been to the Sea World in the US or witnessed Shamu the killer whale, you would know the difference. Anyway, the Ocean Park is worth the visit, just for the Pandas. There are not many of them and what a lovely creatures they are.
Ocean Park. Don't go in March. To cold and windy. Had to shut down cable cars
Worth visit. Lots to see but kids will like the rides. Very crowded so go early. Soon, with MTR' will be an easy ride from any station

fun but it's too crowded. The park is quite fun as there are quite a lot to see. Don't go during weekend as it is too crowded. You will regret when you need to line up for an hour for taking roller coaster!

ocean park 2011. i dont like their cable car coz when the wind blows it get might fall in the ground...well it nice place especially if you're adventurous, you'll really feel the thrill on the rides..babaligtad tlaga sikmura mu and you're butt is mapapaangat talaga!

The Old Hongkong street is a must go!. Maybe I'm getting old.. I'm not into the ride. Even that, to me that place is not as exciting as USS or Disney in Jap.The Dolpin show is still as good.. The best thing i like is the old hongkong street. The food there is a bit X but the taste is not too bad.Cable car ride view is great!

Fantastic for the whole family!. Ocean Park has what few places in Hong Kong do: a lot of space! It is built on both sides of a hill (connected by a scenic cable car ride or an express but less scenic train ride, both in the park itself). It is great for families with children of all ages. The first side has lots of animal exhibits, gentler rides for little kids and mellow adults, a quaint "Old Hong Kong" reconstructed street, and pay-as-you-go games that your little ones will love. The far side has the serious rides, theatres for dolphin shows, and more. Travelers to Hong Kong, as well as those who live here, must pay a visit to Ocean Park. We love it so much we have had annual passes for three years now!
Wonderful ocean park!. We love this place so much. Good place for entertainment!

Fun, entertaining and educational. A must-see when visiting Hong Kong wfor families with kids. Check on the website for ongoing promos and arrive early in the park to see and experience all the attractions and live perfomances/activities in the park.

World Class. Our first visit to Ocean Park was in 1996 and when we came back in April 2012 the place looked completely different. We were very impressed with the new infrastructure, facilities and attractions which never failed to entertain and amaze. There are things of interest for everybody from wildlife areas that included pandas and exotic animals, gigantic aquarium which needs to be seen to be believed, dolphins and seals and the fairground rides. The mountain express train was incredible and just looked like something out of a 'Jules Verne' novel. Disneyworld across at Lantau Island cannot compete with the diverse attractions on offer here.The cable car ride to the higher level provided magnificent views across to Repulse Bay and the sea and the new Old Hong Kong street reconstruction was very entertaining.One of the minor points about the park was the price of drinks and snacks on sale. Although you would expect to pay a premium on these they seemed to be a bit expensive.

Wonderful day out for sea lovers and others. There are multiple ways to get to Ocean Park and as we went twice we took two methods of transport.As Ocean Park is one of the most popular attractions in Hong Kong you'd better be prepared to wait in line for the bus, but it's definitely worth the wait.However if you'd rather not wait out in the heat it's better to get a taxi, as it's air conditioned and can seat a family of 4 per taxi, although it may be a bit expensive, again it's still worth the money.There are several things to do in Ocean Park for everyone in the family : Adults, Teenagers and Kids.The theme park has an area that has kid-sized rides specially for toddlers and of course have the full sized rides for the older people.Ocean Park has an Aquarium where you can look at flashy fishes and stunning sea turtles,and also a exhibit where you get to see Red Pandas and several other animals.Definitely one of the top attractions in Hong Kong.

Awesome. You will have to set aside a good 9 - 10 hours of your day to see all of this park as it is huge. The park itself is awesome and out of this world. We really enjoyed it. The cable car ride is a great experience!!

Enjoyed Everything. We liked it so much that we visited it twice in April. There's something for everyone - the cable car, ocean express (train ride), the panda and sechuan monkeys exhibit, the bird show, old Hong Kong, the acrobats, etc. We didn't do the (amusement park) rides which looked fun. It's nice to be outdoor enjoying the weather and have fun at the same time.
Wonderful Day. Took the family to Ocean Park and had a lovely day- plenty of rides, and hills to climb! Dolphin and seal show, chairlift, pandas, aquarium - well worth the visit.

Unbelievable. Rained the day we were there but if it hadn't it would have been the best place to visit.. I can't believe the rides they have there and how it's built on a hill from top to bottom.. Super. A must visit
Fine!. You need a day for this if you want to do the rides. But there a few animals to see. (The aquarium is not good, but the pandas are like megacute!)

not disney -- and that's a good thing. Went with our 2 year old to ocean park. Had to take it slow, and only scratched the surface, but it was fantastic. Must dos: both panda exhibits (better than san diego zoo), the amazing, amazing aquarium, the cable car, the dolphin show. For older kids/adults there appeared to be some amazing rides, but we'll have to wait to try those out on a future trip!
A must do. This was by far the best in HK - well layed out and well done. Very informative. The rides too are excellent. Value for Money!!

A good day's outing. Transport to Ocean Park is well-organised - bus 629 from outside Admiralty station - an Mtr station is currently being constructed near the Park. The cable car ride was spectacular and everything is well set out and clean.
Park with games. It was a good park for teenagers and kids .Plenty of games.Cable cars for a beautiful scenery of Hongkong islands.
Ocean Park. Like the new setup of the old HK street, it creative old memory for the old folks and photo take opportunity.

Fun for the whole family. The rides were fun and family friendly, catered to adults and kids.
One downside was we went on a public holiday, crowded and long queue for rides and missed a few due to long waiting time.

One Day is Not Enough. Upon picking up a map at the entrance of the park, one fact was realized: Ocean Park is huge.And certainly, one day was not enough to explore all attraction of this place.I and friends decided to first go to the area where the extreme rides are. The trip via cable car provided a magnificent view of the south HK. The cable car is small but just enough for 6 people.It was a weekday so there were not a lot of people in the park. Lining up for queue did not take a lot of time. We rode the the Hair Raiser twice without really waiting for too long. Same scenario was seen for the other attractions. For kids too young for thrill rides, Ocean Park offers various shows. Among them is sea lion show which was too kiddie for my taste but nonetheless was appreciated. It was lightly raining and the venue was open so that affected the whole experience a bit.There are lots of things to do around Ocean Park and one must have a well thought plan because one day is absolutely not enough.The park closes with a great fountain show.The only things that may need room for improvement are the following:1. Food was expensive. But then such is expected in all theme parks.2. The queue for cable car back to the main grounds was terribly long. This was the only queuing we did not appreciate. An hour would be wasted before one can get to board a cabin.3. There were not enough buses for back to the nearest MTR station (Admiralty). Again, we waited under the drizzle for minutes.Overall, Ocean Park was definitely a fun-filled place. Ideal for families and friends.

A day of pure fun. You start your day perfectly already when in line for the bus to take you to the park. Order and organization of large amounts of visitors can be a lesson to all the parks in the world.The thrill and beauty begins at the entrance to the park with lovely orchestra and the cartoons characters who greet the visitors.The park is divided basically into two parts: the lower part is dedicated to birds and entertainment for younger ages and the upper part is dedicated to sea animals and attractions for the olders.It does not matter - both parts give you the perfect pleasure.Transition between the two parts of the park is done by a train digs into the mountain or by cable car which is right on the mountainside.Do not miss the cable car - the beauty of thescenery and the thrill of driving on the side of a mountain so high above that is something that you can give up.No problem to lose the time in this place and all the attraction or shows is something that must be done.Do not miss the birds show or the sea animals show.Huge aquarium and the jellyfish booth is an opportunity to get close to creatures so amazing and unique that only nature films can get you close to them.

Rainy visit to HK Ocean Park. It started to rain soon as we set foot on the park but still tried to make the most of our visit! Still enjoyed it though as my son really appreciated the different animals he was able to see in the park. He's 7yrs old by the way. Would have loved to enjoy the other park attractions however had it not been for the rain. One thing I noticed though that compared to HK Disneyland, HK Ocean Park has less "staff" that look after/guide their attractions.

Wonderful, fun traditional. This is the kind of fun park I remember from the childhood, only well updated. As much as I like Disneyland and love to go there, the Ocean Park is a strong competitor and varied from Disneyland. It has aquariums, fun rides, pandas, lots of walking space, a wonderful cable car and spectacular views. A MUST DO for anyone visiting HK with kids, just keep out of the main kids school vacations.

Giving Disney a run for their money!!. We came to Ocean Park several years ago and WOW!! what a difference. This Park is giving Disneyland a run for it's money!!The whole park has been upgraded; the shops, food outlets, rides, displays and transport from one level to the next. It is well worth a visit and don't forget your camera as you will see pandas, red pandas, bubble blowing seals, birds, all kinds of fish & sea creatures in the aquariumand & you'll get to ride the cable car or the very interesting train!!There are kiddy rides, water rides, carousels and rollercoasters and of course all the souvenirs and character meet & greets.This Park is very well worth a visit and allow a full day to enjoy it all!!

Cute. It's like a small Six Flags overlooking a bluff on the sea. (Breathtaking view's)....................around $40+ pp USD; and not too long of waits. We however just went to see the Pandas which was well worth the money
rides of your life!. i tried almost all of the rides. better rides, cheaper food, bigger compared to Disneyland! Deserve a second visit..:)

Best Halloween party, but long queues. The best time of year to visit Ocean Park is Halloween. All the staff get dressed up, and there are plenty of awesome horror houses and rides. It's also open at night for Halloween, and HK weather in October is fabulous. At all other times, the queues are shocking and its no fun standing around waiting for everything.
Prepare to conquer your fear!!. The location was superb.climate was fine..rides and attraction are breathtaking..cable car was a bonus..

best amusement park in HK by far. Great rides, fabulous scenery as this park hugs the coastline and the cable car ride from the entry into the park is a highlight. Great displays like the jellyfish and sea life park.
Go at opening time before the mainland tourist buses arrive as the crowds build and the queueing concept rapidly deteriorates after then.

Great day out!. Great family day out! There is a variety of animals and rides. Unfortunately one of the children was unable to go on a lot he wanted (6yrs) and he was upset, but it was a good day. There was a Mc Donald's there, which was the 1st one we saw whilst away and the kids were very excited! It's on the other side though. There are rides and animals in the 1st section, then you line up to go on a cable car over the other side for rides (lots for older children/ adults) and plenty more restaurants (including maccas) and alley games and shows with the sea animals. The birds there are beautiful! The bird show was spoken in another language and we were unable to understand any of it, however it was still good to see. The birds were beautiful and afterwards you can get your photos with the macaws behind you.
Value for money. Was worth every penny.All in all a great experience for the children as well as adults.
Great if you have kids. I have no kids and it seemed very kid oriented and there were too many of them for us to enjoy it. We liked the rollercoasters. If you do not have children I would skip it.

Great theme park. This is a great place to spend the day in Hong Kong. Has enough to do for all. Lower area has things for lottle ones, and up the hill in a cable car gets you to the fun rides. There arfe dolphin shows too. Do take your hat and apply lotsa sun screen anytime of the year sun will be harsh
Pretty boring really.... Line up for rides were huge, food not great, aquarium ok and the show was just ok. It is in fantastic position though with a cool view from the cable cars.

Good, but faded in places and very crowded. Lots to see here, and the rollercoasters and view are great. The animal attractions felt a little old, and in need of an update. The main problem we had was that we visited on a weekend (probably a mistake) and the crowds made the experience unpleasant at times. We rushed through some things, just to get away from the hordes of people. We had to take a ticket to wait for a table at any one of the restaurants for lunch, and then service was very slow. Walking between attractions was difficult, because of the sheer volume of people. With less people it might have been a better experience.

a must see in HK. The park was really nice and clean. We especially enjoyed watching the pandas play around, and the jellyfish were just spectacular. Its easy to get to the park and the entrance fee is reasonable. There were however few choices for food inside the park

fun in hong kong. spent most of the day at Ocean Park in Hong Kong city and had a great time. Very very hot but lots to do and see and great attractions. Went on one of the roller coasters thinking it was a bit of a pansy one but screamed all the way round. Ha Ha was not a pansy one at all. The other bigger roller coaster though was extremely scary looking and I stayed away from that. They have escalators going up to the top area and little cable cars that take you back down to another area where the panda bears are. Ocean Park covers several acres of land and is very entertaining and a great day out.

Great park for all ages. Exciting Rollacoasters for 11yrs+. Well set out park, Plenty of exhibits, the Panda's, the AquariumOld style, Chinese Village. The Dolphin Show. Quite a lot of walking perhaps not good for elderly people. Plenty of food stalls and very reasonably priced. Recommend for families!

my daughter enjoyed this place so much!. everytime we visit, we always felt that it's truly worth the trip, my daughter love the shows,especially the dolphin show, and the rides, it's a great amusement park.i was not very impressed with the aquarium thou, but the goldfish room was impressive. for us, 1 day is not enough, because we wwanted to see and enjoy everything.:) we were lucky that weather was good that day and didnt rain, it was not hot neither which was great because a lot of time was spent walking around,will definitely go back.

Something fishy going on.. Everywhere you look marine life abound and in the most creative presentation! What the best thing about Ocean Park is I believe is there is always something new to see or experience in every trip. So it was great!

A lot to see, a great day out for all. What I liked the most about Ocean Park was the way that there is so much to do and see; we are not contrived to have 2 or 3 activities; the site offers multitude of choices, including a dolphin show, a visit to the Panda, a cable car to get to the top of the park, thousands of fish species to see, discover or re-discover. Best to plan the whole day there.

come early and go late. this is a very very big amusement park, spreaded over to different regions. a well managed park, right to be called the biggest oceanarium of the world. Be prepared to be breathless, while coming over here.

Good fun. We loved the park. Again: arrive early and make sure you beat the crowds. The rides on Thrill mountain are definitely hair raising. The roller coasters are fun, but the new roller coaster is not a smooth ride, so be prepared to get bashed around.... the views from the rides and the roller coasters is amazing... Really high. The shows in the park are okay. We were there for the rides, but of course we also went to see the shows and the aquarium. We spend a full day at Ocean Park, beat the crowds, go early, leave around 5 pm. Highly recommend this park.

My Son LIkes It So Much. If you go during the weekend the queue is not that long. My son's favorite ride is The Rapids,Raging River, Ocean Express train. My son is too young for the rest of the ride. For the water related ride do bring along a raincoat/ waterproof attire. if not, you could buy one on site but for the money you are spending to buy a disposable rain jacket you might as well bring along your own. Also, bring your own drinks/food; any drinks/food in the park is always expensive, for example, a plate of roast duck rice would set you back HK$70, which you could get a take away on your way to the park for HK$28. You would always find a nice spot for a picnic so do consider bring your own food/drinks. The only one thing i find not as convenience is the bus that you have to take from Admiralty Station; there is always a queue there; not so fun when you have young kids waiting in the queue.

Worth a Visit. Visited Ocean Park and I must say it was an amazing place. Two parks divided by the great surrounding mountains. The lower area was mainly entertainment and rides for the smaller kids and the high side which you can catch the cable car (recommended) or the train was for the thrill seekers. As the theme park is situated on a steep hillside the rides are three times as frightening. I was amazed as to how they built this park virtually hanging on the mountain edge. If thrill is not your style then visiting the pandas and the massive aquarium is worth a visit.

A must do!!!!. The park it's self is breathtaking and spectacular! There are just so many fun things to do. I went last december with 3 friends and their kids and we had a BLAST!!! We all enjoyed getting wet while being treated fantasticaly by the wonderful staff's hospitality!! I will definitely be going back many times to come!!! Overall MAGNIFICENT!

Full fun day!. But beware of weekends as the throngs of mainland tourists will be ijnvading the place :) Not that anythings wrong with that but qeueing up for an hour to get on a ride is not my cup of tea! However on a weekday the place is brilliant. Catering to all ages and mood types, ranging from the circus style shows to the dolphin and sea lion shows to the awesome rides, to kiddie play pens and bouncy castles, to the great food court with lotsa choices etc. i loved it... many times ;)

Disappointing 'New' Attraction of the 'Old Hong Kong'. The Ocean Park was promoting a new site of attraction called 'Old Hong Kong' during my visit. I had no special expectations except that I thought there should be talents dressed in old Hong Kong costumes performing one thing or another besides other ought-to-have old Hong Kong attractions which would bring back people's memories of life experiences. Disappointingly, most of the buildings that I saw were only wallpapers. Only one actor dressed in a rooster was seen. Based on his costume, he was meant to be one selling the 'aeroplane olive snack' but he just wandered around with nothing to sell. The so-called 'authentic' old Hong Kong snacks mentioned in the promotion were not made and did not taste the way I had when I was in Hong Kong decades ago. I give 3 stars out of 5 only because this review is about the Ocean Park which is good in general. Otherwise if it's for the 'Old Hong Kong' attraction itself, I can only give 1 star out of 5.

Super Fun. An amusement park and an aquarium combined!! Animals and rides!! Great, great fun! And half the park is on top of a mountain. You're riding roller coasters out over the ocean, literally. Put aside the whole day for this activity. Long lines (not as bad as Disneyland) and thousands of people. But, in my opinion, one of the top three things to do in HK.

part zoo, part aquarium, part theme park - fully awesome. we visited here the day after we went to disney land hong kong. 3 out of 4 of us preferred it. The aquarium is excellent and was not crowded, the giant pandas were wonderful. There was quite a long queue for the cable car to go up to the main theme park area, so we took the train - which was amazing - they have made it seem like a submarine - with projections of fish etc on the ceiling. There is a good range of roller coasters and water rides - with v little queuing. There are plaenty of places to get a snack etc. Our younger son really enjoyed the dolphin show - which wa simpressive ( even if I anm not sure about the ethics). When were ready to go back down, there was virtually no queue for the cable car- so we got to do that too - all in all a great day out.
Fun park. Great rides and shows for both kids and adults. The park is on a mountain so expect long and steep walks. The cable car system is fun though.

Good value & great for children & adults alike. We came here on a cloudy saturday morning & spent the day here. My daughter loved the animals & the fun fair although couldn't persuade her to go on the roller coaster. There is also padding pools & a small water park but we didn't use this as the weather was quite cool. The cable car ride was good but there is an alternative train ride if you are not keen on heights.

Great fun park. Pandas a must see. Got the 629 bus to Oceanpark. Made the trip for opening as queues are fairly large. Made a line for the Pandas. They were great and a highlight of the park for us. Then walked around the lower area and took the cable cars up to the top. What a great way to travel. Did the river raft ride and the large tower. The most scary ride was great. Saw some amusements but did not partake as have to pay. Went to see some other rides then it rained soooo hard they shut the park. Only way down was via the train with 10,000 others. Despite this it is a great fun park and would visit again if came back.
great day out. Well worth a look, better than disneyland , lots of attractions, on a sunny day take some shade with you ( hat or umberella)

Get there early. This was an excellent day, family with 2 teen daughters.We arrived about 30min prior to the gates opening. On entering, went straight to the top and hit the big popular rides early. We were there over the xmas holidays and the park was pretty quiet until about 11am then all the tourists on organised tours arrived and the place went feral.Had a great time and this park is a must for any visit to HK.

Not all the changes were for the better.. Smitten by the brilliance of the Ocean Park from a previous visit in 2002, I couldn't wait to enter the portals of the park once again in Jan. 2012. Alas, I was in for a disappointment.Not that the park itself is too bad, but I was initially put off by the hordes of tourists from the mainland. The park was in fact so crowded that walking in places was difficult. Thank goodness for my online advance booking, I saved hours in waiting in queue just to get in.The wait for the cable car was two hours minimum, walking from the Chinese Sturgeon exhibit to the jellyfish spectacular took almost an hour for all one could see was bobbing black heads.OK, so the overcrowding was not exactly the park's fault.But several of the 'improvements' (since 2002) were not really improvements at all. The large Atoll Reef aquarium at the upper level has now been moved to the lower level and is now called Grand Aquarium. When I eventually managed to fight my way in, through all the overcrowding, I found it has shrunk considerably in size. And instead of being surrounded by clear glass panels on all sides, you now have to stare upwards at the fish. The walls are made of mock rock like formations with thin strips of glass in between, giving a very limited view.The terrific Goldfish Pagoda of 2002 set against a terrific lake landscaping is now called Goldfish Treasures, and is but a mere shadow of its former glory. This too has been relocated, and there is no sign of the lagoon at all, something else is built along the lagoon.The terrific Amazing Amazon exhibit has gone too, and is now the Emerald Trail. It is nothing but that, just a trail. though it does make for a refreshing change from the crowds outside, with its recorded bird sounds and lack of crowds. Reminders of the former Amazing Amazon format are the suspension bridge, and the toy but realistic looking mechanical anaconda, which just sits there, without the mock strike.All in all, over commercialism has robbed the Ocean Park of its former charm. It's now blatantly, well, commercial, with much of the earlier attractions severely watered down.It's might still be interesting for a first timer though, and the colourful Ocean Park 35th anniversary dances within the premises were a saving grace, in only a trifle.And yes, someone mentioned pandas. There is a Giant Panda Exhibit which is supposed to house two pandas gifted from China in 2007. Only one was there, and there is a lot of unnecessary cage-side furniture added around the enclosure. There is another in the Amazing Asian Animals exhibit. Wonder what came of An An and Jia Jia which we had seen in 2002, which was at that time the pride of the Ocean Park. And yes, the dinosaur trail exhibit has gone as well.Food stall abound, but one is at times choked by the pungent smell of cooking meat at several places.

Great for the kids. Love this park, a must is the Pandas in their wonderful enclosure. This park is very asian base but rides are good for the older kids. Be prepared to walk as there are lots of hills. Cable car ride is good.
Nice. Hair Raiser Roller coaster and the Flash is sooooo cooool
So fun!!!. Cute animals, fun rides, Hong Kong! This place was extremely fun, my kids adored it. Who could ask more?
Pandas!. I only give four stars because pandas are always great. Otherwise a bit lame. The cable car is nice though.

Wash out on a rainy day - HUGE CROWDS. Had a very negative experience with the humungus crowds at every exhibit.To make matters worse, it poured heavily and the entire visit was a washout.Rides were stopped, balloons would not operate due to weather......yet no refund.The train ride from one part to another was extremely crowded and the cable cars were stopped due to weather...Moral - DO NOT GO THERE ON A RAINY DAY OR DURING VACATION TIMES. THE CROWD AND RUSH RUINS THE VISIT.Queues everywhere - from entry to rides. Massive queues for taxi's when we left the place. Average waiting time was 2 hours for a cab......yes 2 hours. We left after waiting 45 minutes and got bus number 629 to admiralty which was convenient.

Adventureland!. Loved the rides especially the Hair raiser, Mine train and the Abyss. There are some dizzying rides like flash and eagle. I enjoyed the dolphin/seal show and it was great to see the pandas and monkeys. Will definitely go back next time!
Lacklustre place. Lacklustre if you are used to well-run American amusement parks

Fun for kids and adults. Enjoyable day - great for kids and adults - easy to get to by subway and bus. Aquarium facilities, pandas, birds, alligators etc. Amusement park rides on the other-side of the park accessible by cable car (which was enough of a thrill ride for me!).

All time favourite!. Ocean Park... how do I start?! This is an all time favourite - its completely different from HK Disneyland!It is huge, it has lots of rides - both for kids and adults, a big aquarium and the deep sea world area which also has sea lions/whales shows... another part is like the zoo as well which has different animal which includes the most famous Panda!!You need to get a cable car to the other side as well or you can walk all the way - the cable car is amazing you might be scare if you don't like height as its pretty high but you get some amazing view as well... the cable car is like a ball shape and you can get in it on your own or with your party so you don't need to share with others you don't know!The other side there is a 3D cinema and other small rides, and there is a Waterpark which opens up in the Summer time.You will definitely need to visit Ocean Park if you go to Hong Kong!!
Fun day if you have the time. Not a total "must-do" in HK unless you LOVEEEE theme parks. It is better than Disney Land and has a lot more rides/shows.

Average. Had rather high expectations of it, but suffice to say that:- their marine animals show was average- rides were average (except that I didn't try the newer thriller rides)- the Aquarium was ok (a bit small)Expect there to be long long queues for everything.I went on a Fri afternoon (the Park tickets being included in a half-day city tour) thinking it'd be better on a weekday but it was not the case. Practically hordes of (China) tourists. Can't imagine what weekends will be like.The best part about the Park was the cable car ride (except for the 30 to 45 min queue), and the fact that the Summit is located on top of the hill - the spring weather was cool and scenery beautiful.Owing to all the queues, only had time to work in one show, 2 rides, the jellyfish exhibit and the Aquarium in one afternoon. Factor in time for queueing :(

Good but not really a must do. To put in context, we are a 21 year old couple who really like animals which was the main reason for going. We do like theme parks although only been to the theme parks on the Gold Coast in Australia, Disneyland Anaheim and Universal Studios. If it is your first trip to HK then this probably shouldn'y be on your list unless you have a lot of time. It was good and nothing wrong with it but wasn't amazing. Probably worth a visit simply to see the Pandas while you still can. Aquarium was pretty good but probably on the same level as Sydney Aquarium so if you have been to Sydney you basically know what to expect. Dolphin show was alright. Rides were good in particular the Hair Raiser rollercoaster. Food was bad and expensive, typical for theme parks. If you have kids it is probably a nice day trip.Quick travel story: Park is split in two levels and to get to the top there is either an express train/tram or the cable car. If there are thunderstorm warnings the cable car closes which it did when we were there. This means the only way down is the train/tram. There were thousands of people trying to get down on this one tram which holds maybe 100-150 people. People were literally pushing to get to the front of the line and there were some children and old people getting crushed which was pretty sad (no injuries). It was quite an experience. It was funny afterwards but at the time is was not fun. I think they might need to look into possibly building another way up and down the mountain.
Definitely worth visiting!. This is a great place, so much to do and see! Very nice setup, good (though crowded) aquarium, thrilling rides. Warmly recommended.

Poor Man's Disneyland. If it wasn't for the Panda Bears and the EXCELLENT views from the cable cars my review for Ocean Park would have been very ordinary. Caught the bus from Admiralty and when we arrived this place was super busy (at 10.00am in the morning). It took exactly one hour in a queue to get our entry ticket and when we finally got into the attraction, it was queue after queue after queue to see anything or do anything. Further to this, the "top park" did not have any sort of flow to it and you found yourself doubling back over long distances to see anything or do anything.
awesome theme park!. My daiughter liked the place especially because they have a lot of rides for smaller kids :-)
Great experience. it was really good for the older children the rides were fantastic and the park price was cheap

Nice escape. It is nicely kept. One entry fee including all games and visits to the exhibits. The setting itself is worth going. Enjoy and go early to avoid the crowd! Food is expensive inside the park, so get a full breakfast before you go.

Full of fun!. Fun rides and nice shows with dolphins, seals, birds etc. Cute pandas and beautiful fountain. Ocean Park emphasizes the environment protection and consersation, that's very meaningful. Awesome view from the summit. A little drawback is that not so enough signboards and staff to guide you through within the park, it's quite tiring with the slopes as the area is more to a natural landscape . You may just ask around, most of the staff are quite helpful. But we encountered a very unfriendly staff, she was at one of outdoor booth that sells stuffs. Anyway, it's full of fun!

Lovely. Be prepared to spend a lot of time there! The rides are AWESOME and the wait well worth it. You pay entrance but all the rides are free. Lovely gifts shops. Really a lot to do and see so get there early. Sure you will enjoy it as much as I did :)
April 2012. Beautiful weather, the drifting fragrance of many flowers. A very nice family park that has Pandas.

Beautiful. This is a must do! We went in January and thought it might be too cold. Light jacket, and we did it all. Saw pandas, rode rides and even had a wonderful gondola ride. You will need to allow at least 5 to 6 hours if not more for this park. Hours at this park are a bit odd, I believe they open a 9am and close at 9pm. The view at the park is beautiful. Easy to get to by the local bus. You can buy the tickets for the park at the bus terminal along with the park tickets. This is a very nice park, I would do this park instead of Disney if you have teens. Disney is more for little children in Hong Kong.
great family fun. very clean and great value. perfect for taking children

Nice Day at Ocean Park. Enjoyed a nice day at Ocean Park with my wife and in-laws. While we did not take part in any rides we did enjoy the cable cars, and Ocean Express train. We also enjoyed all the animal displays and flowers. The views from the upper section of the park are also very nice! Would be a great day for anyone but especially a family with the kids!! You could easily spend a full day here!

Add it to your to-do list. Great day out! Not just for kids, it happily entertained us adults for a full day!! Great value for money.We really enjoyed the sea-life exhibits and the rides were great fun! Definitely one to do when you are in Hong Kong.

Would not recomend. Sorry long review, but it's thourough.I have to say that this is the worst amusement park I've been to. I was there from about 12:00 to 17:00 on a tuesday. There is so much to comment. For starters the the ques was 45-60min each. We spent about 2,5 hours in ques inside.The park is split into two areas, where the entrance and exit is in one area and the rides in the other. The only way to get between is by cable car or train and the ques are huge. Who designed this? The pathways were very clumpsy as well.OK, to the actual attractions. They were a disapointment. The aquarium consisted mainly of ordinary fishes. They had some exotic stuff, but very little (hammer shark, stingray and octopus) and they were small. The jockey safari consisted of two pandas and two monkeys. The ares they were kept in looked really sad.The emerald trail is just an artificial forrest. The animal sounds are from speakers hidden in the trees.Amazing asian animals consists of two pandas, some small turtles, red pandas(didn't see them), an otter and different goldfishes. The goldfishes was somewhat cool. There were no gators.On to rides:Beacause of all the ques I only had time for the Hair Raiser and the water slide. Both were fun. Slitely shorter and more comfortable wait at the Hair Raiser. Choose your rides carefully 'cause you only have time and energy for a few.The food joints wad not good. The socalled pizza place had one type of pizza, a 3inch veggy pizza. Tried the sandwich joint too, even though it was clearly unsanitary.If you choose to go to Ocean park anyway I recomend buy the ticket at the Admiralty station. That way you skip the enormous ticket que at the gate.

Too many visitors. The Park was built some years ago & it can only accommodate certain number of visitors. They really need to expand & add in a few more attractions. There are just too many visitors for the Park to handle.

Ocean Park is FUN!. There is a lot to see and do at Ocean Park. We could have gone back for a second day. We were impressed by the size and how easy it was to travel too. Definitely visit the Panda enclosure and the aquarium. My nephew and I loved the aquarium. And the 'hair raiser' ride is a must for the thrill seekers.

Ocean Park. This was a fun filled day out and very good value for money!As well as the obvious scary rides...the Hair raiser was terrifying!!!!The animal exhibits and aquarium and very interesting.We were lucky enough to see the Pandas at feeding time and it was a wonderful experience to be so close to themThe cable car ride over to the otherside offered reallygood views.
Visit with overseas friends. Clean and various types of fiun but needs 2 days to visit
to spend xmas with my princess. excellent place well worth the visit for all ages, part zoo part theme park, chair lifts are amazing, fantastic views
Fish and Panders. Theme park with great exhibitions of sea life (and Pandas)... dond miss the Jelly Fish display
Fun and exciting.. Plenty of rides to enjoy. Cable car ride Ocean park Tower ride, minetrain, the balloon ride.

Great Fun for the Kids. Lived here during summerr months when living in Hong Kong. The Kids loved it. Of course this was pre Disney. Have not been for a few years , but remember the kids were always at me to go (again and again)

Enlightening and Taxing. Especially for the Aquarium and Dolphins and Seals show, they are so enlightening however, if you don't have the energy of the teens, you might as well give visiting this park a serious consideration. The whole place is enormous and shows and places to see are quite far apart, making it just touring the whole place a tremendous feat to the feet. But I will highly recommend this park to the young, energetic and strong-willed individuals.
Good Curry. Spent my birthday at Ocean Park - free for birthday girls / boys. The curry was pretty good there. Service was excellent.

Loved the dolphin show!. The entire park is wonderful. We used the cable car - which in itself is amazing - mostly because of the views one gets. The dolphin show was spectacular, sea jelly interesting, so many goldfish, and of course the grand aquarium and plenty of colourful corrals. Getting there is very easy, by the direct bus. By your entry tickets at the Admiralty MTR - saves times and also they sell discounted tickets.

Fun day for everyone.. Exactly what the title says!! With a very good admission price, only 28 euros per adult and children up to three years old free, and many interesting things to do and see, it is one of the best theme parks i have been to. I loved the aquarium, my kid loved the pandas and the carousel and we both loved the cable car ride which is definitely the highlight of the park. Didn't get on the Ocean Express as it was closed for maintainance. Unfortunately i didn't get on any of the games either, as much as i would like to, but those who did obviously seemed to have the time of their lives. Go as early as you can to avoid the long queues.

Definitely Not for young children. It was mainly buses of mainland tourists, mainly over 40 to 70 years old, we could not get into any shows because of the sheer amount of people, these bus tours completely take over ocean park,including all children's rides, as and adult with a 3,5 year old and 2 year old the staff were not proactive in helping onto cable car etc, They are obviously trying to rake in as much as cash as possible, at the expense of keeping the park manageable

Good Fun. Get to Ocean Park as early as possible to beat the queues and take the cable car to the rides, the dolphin show, the jellyfish exhibition (excellent) and more! Do check out the times of the various shows so that you can fit them all in. The Pandas are in the first area before the cable car and were surprisingly easy to see close up and we got some good photos. This was surprisingly relaxing compared to many theme parks - you can get a better entrance rate by buying before you get to Ocean Park - HK$250 instead of HK$280 - and the bus to and from Ocean Park was very easy to find and well organised.

Great for families with older kids. I visited Ocean Park with my 7 year old son. As he was less than 1.2m, there were many rides that he could not go on although we went on them at Universal Studios Singapore e.g. Rapids. They also did not allow us on the bumper cars even though he was riding with my hubby. We loved the very long ride on the cable car. The view was breathtaking.The dolphin show was a disappointment. I'd expected more. We watched a Dolphin performance at the Jakarta themepark and we felt that it was much better, in comparison.Food-wise, it was rather expensive, as with all theme parks. But the cuttlefish was really yummy although the smell was a little strong.The finale was really magical. Worth staying behind for.
Not fun!. The Oceanarium is very poor!If you are not a little kid, you do not like it!The only thing what you can come back, look at the giant panda!

Huge theme park. Our kids (2 year old and 8 year old) enjoyed the sea lion show, the aquarium and looking at the animals (pandas, red pandas, reptiles). We took a couple of the rides, and the kids enjoyed the ocean themed carousel, a refreshing change from the typical horses that you find on most carousels. I liked the parent-and-child seats on the carousel, makes sense when you have a toddler with you =) We tried some local street eats such as curry fish balls and HK pancakes at the Old Hong Kong Street (we also bought lots of panda cookies for our little girl who absolutely loved them! This outlet used to retail in Singapore at Central Mall for awhile and we were disappointed when they ended their business in Singapore), it is all good! We all enjoyed the cable car rides, especially the kids who were thrilled to be so high up! The toilets were relatively clean, this is important to me as I am particular about hygiene. The only downer was that some fellow tourists shoved me when I was attempting to alight from the bus to Ocean Park, and I had been carrying my toddler, so we nearly fell.

Amazing Theme Park. Best views. This was an amazing park. The views are amazing with rollar coasters hanging off the edge of the mountains. The cable car ride was really enjoyable. Unfortunately the park isn't very well laid out and there is a lot of hill climbing just to get around the park. To add to the issue the bus service that normally compliments the cable car was closed so we were forced to queue for 30 minutes to get on the cable car just so we could exit the park.

A good place to tour if you have kids.. Good place to explore especially for kids. Didnt take much ride but the park is big and spacious with a small game arena. Souvenir from gift shop a little pricey but exquisite.
Panda Bear----. You could enjoy rides, dolphin shows, etc... but foods are expensive and not so good...

We loved the cable car ride!. Such a well maintained park in a beautiful setting. Handy tip: Buy your tickets at Admiralty Station just before you head up to the buses, the MTRtravel centre offers tickets for HK$250 for adults and HK$125 for kids. If you buy from the kiosk at the bus terminal upstairs, it's full price.

Highlight of Hong Kong. Many friends have told me that Ocean Park is much better than Disneyland! And you have everything that you need from Disneyland in Ocean park. Rmb to stay till 8pm for the light show which is much better than the light symphony in Victoria!

Spectacular Views. The price of admission is worth the gondola ride alone. The rides are decent but the views you get from the Abyss(free fall ride) and the Hair Raiser(roller coaster) are so breath taking you almost forget you are on a ride. I'd go again. We went on a weekday in March and there were not line ups anywhere.
Great fun. Best entertainment park in Hong Kong. Great day out for the kids.

Crowded, lame shows, rides are ok.. We went on a non school holiday weekday and it was still extremely crowded. After getting off the bus (which also goes to Stanley) we ran across a street, stubmled through construction sites and climbed a set of stairs to the theme park. The first part of the park was mostly animal exhibitions and childrens rides. The panda exhibit was most charming with the pandas within close proximity through strategic food and shelter placement. We reached the next part of the park through a scenic cable car ride that is certainly not recommended for the faint hearted. Heaps of thrilling rides in this part of the park. The shows are all quite disappointing and long as it is translated in English, Mandarin and Cantonese. Overall Ocean Park is worth a visit for the pandas, scenis cable car ride and thrilling rides.
Did not go in. Although we did not go in - the view from our bus tour looked fabulous and we would definitely visit there next time we visit Hong Kong.

Ohh you have to take the cable ride. Ohh the views from the cable car where outstanding and the fun park on the other side of the park was fun loved the big tanks to go underneath and look at all the fishloved the panada feeding ohh they are so well looked after you will be so suprise how well they look and treated like babies so nice to see

Nice place for family vacation!. Our family spent the whole day in Hong Kong's Ocean Park (May 22, 2011) - one of the best amusement park in Asia. The location is very nice since it is located in the mountain. The cable car we rode is funtastic including other rides.Dolphin & Seals show is awesome...however, i felt pity over those animals used for the show. I hope they were be maltreated.A must see place in Asia. This is highly recommended.

Searching for things to do, go to Ocean Park. Ocean park is really awesome. There are many things to do there, you can play a variety of different equipments. And a wide range of people can play there, because there are different equipments for kids, teenagers, adults, and old people. Also there' s a aquarium with many different fishes you never seen before. Also there are always food stations all over the place, in case you get hungry. It is a great place for friends, families, or couples to come.

Well-maintained and remains interesting. The cable car ride along the steep hillside by the ocean, the longest escalators, the pandas, the rides - all a resounding YES. Only the braised beef noodles at the peak was a disappointment...
Nothing like!. Enjoyed this place very much! Good thing I visited this first before HK Disneyland. Loved the larger than life aquarium and the long escalators hehehe
Fantastic place. Something for everybody from scary rides to watching animals.

A day well spent!!!!. We spent 5 hours in Ocean Park. In hindsight, we should have spent more than 8 hours. Ocean park has lot of things to do and surely, by the end of the day, it will be difficult for you to move your legs (due to tiredness). At various rides, the park has cameras fitted which take your picture and then the staff tries to sell you for 98 HK dollars. Its a bit pricey, but if you think that the moment captures is good, probably its worth it. We took one of those images. Another advice is that, probably it is better to visit it during the weekdays (unfortunately, we went on a Saturday, and had to wait for an average of 30 minutes for the cable car ride each way). Overall, had a great time at Ocean Park.

Nice Park, Great Aquarium New Roller Coaster was a Headache !. The Parks entrance is very welcoming as is the lower part of the Park, we caught the Cable car to The Summit which is the Ride part of the park fas soon as we arrived, My wife wasn't to keen on the cable car as it's quite high but the view is fantastic.The rides Mmm what can i say ? most are ok but the new Roller Coaster (Hair Raiser) is Shocking, it felt like the cars had square wheels, my son and i love Roller Coasters the bigger the better, but there is something drastically wrong with this one it vibrated so bad that we both came off with headaches !The lower part of the park was very good, the highlight for us was the Aquarium, we have never experienced fish like it, there were so many different types, We ate in the Aquarium with a table right next to the Glass what a view, Great food and very reasonable prices i highly recommend it.Great Park just a shame about the coaster.
Great place for kids and families. Pandas, porpoises, rides and a great cable car ride over the ocean near Repulse Bay.

With new rides, maybe. The entrance to Ocean Park is excellent, and its neat and trim in the front section. Jump on the cable car, which is great, and head over to the rides part on the other side. Scenic ride, for sure. Unfortunately some of the rides are pretty old and look clapped-out. To my eyes, one in particular looked really rusty and dangerous. other rides old too, but noticed a new rollercoaster being built. I would say more new/replacement rides are needed here, but still enough to do for a day. Like the pandas. Don't like paying extra for some amusements on top of entry. Don't go at the weekend!!! Incredibly busy.
Happy pandas (unlike in Beijing). Great rides and the animal areas are fantastic. Easy access from HK via bus.
