it was ok, we just enjoyed the cable ride and the pandas, nothing more.. for the entrance fee, I'd rather go back to hk Disneyland. we just enjoyed the cable ride and the pandas. we didnt even bother to eat inside because it was toooo expensive. this is advisable for adults who are adventurous for the rides.
excellent. it was a fantastic place...its like a zoo with a theme park....nice for children and adults....the rides were fantastic....worth the $$ and visit...a should go place

Must do. They have something for everyone here from the thrilling rides to the animals and aquariums, I only had half a day and only did my must sees like the pandas and wildest rides. The jelly fish exhibit isn't very big but REALLY cool. The summit (one half of the park) is located higher up and has beautiful views in every direction. Some of the rides are also a good way to get good views of Hong Kong island up-side-down ;)

Not worth the trip.. Our trip was the morning of December 11, 2011 (Sunday).My friend already told me that a trip to Ocean Park is not enjoyable because of the steep climbs that you have to do. Still, I wanted my son to have the Ocean Park experience, because when I was a kid I had a lot of fun in OP.We bought our tickets from China Travel Service and they are much cheaper than if you purchase from Ocean Park itself. We took the MTR and then a bus. Upon arrival, we exchanged our ticket vouchers for the actual tickets. And off we went inside, people on the entrance are saying "Welcome to Ocean Park" but they are not smiling at all. We immediately went to find the dolphin show and had to line up for almost an hour to ride the cable car. Some groups of elderly chinese cut in line and expect everyone to give way because they are old. I mean hey, everyone needs to be fair, they need to wait like the rest of the guests. The cable car ride is ok, we had fun looking at the scenery and we took some pictures.The dolphin show is not impressive at all. It is like the dolphins do not like to obey the trainers at all. I had more fun watching the Ocean Adventure dolphin show in Subic than in Ocean Park Hongkong. The popcorn sold near the dolphin show is a waste of money, it is not popped at all because it is full of hard bits. We like the dried squid more than the popcorn.After a bit of walking, we found the train and much to our dismay there's a lot of people too. Chinese people in Ocean Park do not know how to line up properly! They keep on pushing everyone and some of them even pick their noses in public! Talk about gross!We met 5 nice ladies in the train though. They look very sophisticated and they can speak english. They thought my husband is chinese and i am indian, lol for that one.Lastly, we tried to enter the aquarium although line is long we still went. Again, the super rude chinese elderly kept on pushing us that we got into a fight with them. We decided to leave Ocean Park instead.LIKED----------- Cable car- Musical fountainDISLIKED-------------- RUDE Chinese elderly will push you all the time. They do not care if they might crush the child that you're with. - There is no staff that oversees the line, so these chinese elderly always cut in line and shout rude stuff at you if you don't give them way.OVER ALL IMPRESSION----------------------------------Ocean Park administrators should learn Customer Relations. They should visit HK Disneyland and take notes how it became the happiest place in HK. NOT WORTH THE TRIP especially if you have children. Go to Disney instead.ENTRANCE FEE:Adult - 280 hkdChild - 140 hkd

a must-experience. For me, without Ocean Park in your itinerary is just like not going to HK at all. For when I think of HK, this theme park just comes first in my mind. We went to Ocean Park on our very first day. So glad, the weather was so supportive. When we entered the place, I knew I wouldn't be looking at theme parks the same way again. Everything was great! The place, services, rides, attractions.. "The Flash" was the best ride I've ever tried in my life.There were 2 main areas of attractions in the park. One is at ground level and the other is at some part of a mountain. You can go to the other side either through cable car or through a train. We really had a great time taking pictures that we ran out of time and ended up not trying some of the rides (the roller coaster!). We also had day tickets only that around 7 pm, one of the security guards had told us to go out already (there was a halloween night pass). I would love to go back and try those rides that I have missed.TIPS:1. Bring the map always!2. Don't forget your camera. Documentation should be at its best!3. Water, water, water!4. If you want to start at the exciting rides, you may opt to travel to the other side (mountain) first before going down (we realized this later on..)5. Patience..... You are not the only person in the park.

Great place to visit. Ocean park is a great place to visit, but be warned it's huge! Get there early too as it is CRAZY BUSY and expect a long wait for exhibits, rides, food, even toilets.... Still it's a definate place you should visit. I found it difficult to find places using the map and be warned this place is full of steep hills. If you have problems walking you may need to rethink your visit or get a wheelchair, although with the amount of people there a wheelchair could be a problem in itself. The panda's were lovely and the night show on the water was mesmorising. The venue itself is not too hard to get to via public transport but I'd recommend a taxi. Leaving will be your problem if you leave upon close as you will be fighting amongst thousands to get back to where you need to go. Still a great experience I say

Loved the cable car ride!. It rained when we were in HK. The cable car ride was a bit wiggly but it was ok and fun. The giant aquarium is nice and there were a lot of sea creatures I've seen for the first time =)

Beautiful. It is a day of fun with the message of how to care for your planet. Your great experience starts with the ride in the cable car across the hills and the sea way below. If the sights are not challenging enough for vertigo, the rides most definately are. The food options offer immense choices and the birds and animals steal your heart. The aqua show is amazing with seals and dolphins which tells you how to live with natures habitats without ruining them

overrated but still worth a visit. compared to hk disneyland, the rides here are designed for adults and more "death-defying." its advantage over disney is that there is a cable car ride to take you to the other side of the park. the souvenir items and entrance fee are also cheaper.still, if you are not into theme parks, you can give this one a miss or just allot half a day for your visit.

Well worth it, get their early as it will take a whole day escpecially with young kids. The cable car ride is amazing and well worth the money in itself. Go do the cable car first and that side of the mountain rides as the lines get too long later in the day. Then go back and do the entrance side last. The dolphin and seal show was disappointing, seen one dolphin jump out of the water you have seen them all. Go do some rides when the shows are on as the lines are empty. My friends and I did the park in about 4 hours without young kids.We didnt do every rise, watch every show so it would be longer if you took more time. With young kids you would want the whole day.

twas better before. I always visted Ocean Park everytime i went to Hongkong and always like being there.The last time i was there was maybe 4 years ago and when i went back last week, i was disappointed, somewhat sad because i felt it has lost its former glory. I did not like the way they renovated the aquarium, it seemed smaller now and less exciting, had limited sharks and less big fishes on display. I also missed the golfishes on display, and the flamingos, i just dont know if i did not see where they were, I felt there were less shows and not spectacular. I hope the management find ways to bring back its old excitement and have better shows.

It was Just Fine. Nothing spectacular really, only things I enjoyed are the pandas and the 3 roller coaster rides and the tower view which gives you a good surrounding view on top. Other than that, you will definitely need a good pair of walking shoes, a good night sleep and plenty of water as the park is huge and divided into 2 areas where you need to take a cable car or train or shuttle bus to the other part of the park. I would suggest having McDonalds or other food station but not the restaurant as the price are tripled compare to the normal food you get to eat out of the park, unless you feel generous and don't mind paying more.Overall experience was okay, enjoyed it but very tiring due to the walking as the park rides/theater/attractions are quite far apart from one point to another. So beware! You will need to go as early as possible to enjoy the most of it. Travel period 5th of March.

worth it just for the view. Ocean Park is a great place to go for people of all ages. As it is so easy to find your way around in Hong Kong, we caught the underground to Admiral station where we picked up a dedicated bus service (route 629) straight to the park. There was a ticket office for the park in the station and we saved HK$30 each by buying them there. Usual fee is HK$280 each.The park is divided into 2 main parts as it is situated on a mountain. You get the train or the cable car to the other side. The view from the top and the cable car is spectacular as you are on a peninsular so you can see the city and the dramatic coast line and islands. The attractions are on the sides of the mountain and there are escalators joining them to save you having to walk up the steep paths. This makes the roller coasters very exciting as they protrude out over the cliff edge. Some attractions were being renovated but there was still plenty to see and do. For the less adventurous there was the aquarium, the dolphin and seal shows and the pandas and there were nature discovery walks. Take your camera. As extra info, after we passed through security at Hong Kong airport I bought a bottle of water to take on the plane with me, as did many others and they were taken away from us as we boarded. All other airports I have been in allow this.

Love the Pandas. I loved the pandas, nearly worth the entrance fee just for them £100 for 4 people, not cheap! Found the rest of the park very busy, huge queues, lots of queue jumping, very frustrating, More like a huge Brighton pier for the rides, kids liked it but 45 min queue to go on bumper cars, waste of time, much prefer Disney.
Very nice. You need a whole day, the place is so massive but it's worth to see everything in ocean park,especially the shows inside the ocean park.
more to see and do. great views.. better rides and great scenary. easier to get to. more variety to the park, enetertainment as well as educational

Best Park, superb cable-car ride!. Ocean Park is a major attraction in Hong Kong, any visit to Hong Kong should include the world famous Ocean Park. Taking the cable-car, we ascend to the Marine World, in the headland section. From the cable-car, we have an unparalleled spectacular view of Hong Kong Island and the sublime South China Sea beyond.really worth it!Hong Kong Ocean Park will fill your day with wonder, pleasure and excitement and reward you with satisfying memories of your visit to the impressive Hong Kong Ocean Park.

Loved this !. As part of our Big Red Bus tour, we went to Ocean Park. Interesting scenic ride on the bus, quick entry and a plethora of things to do and see. long-waits (up to 30 minutes) for a number of the features but we really enjoyed the huge aquarium and the cable car (instead of a long-wait for the cable-car-back, take the train ;). The Dolphinarium was closed for refurb.All-in-all we liked it !
Good rides and fantastic location. Lot of rides.Its too big and kids have to walk a lot from one place to another.One day is not enough to cover the whole park

The best theme park in HK, but don't eat inside!!!. As a 35-years-old theme park in Hong Kong, it is still attractive and surprised to the visitors. It has good maintenance to the facilities and always develop something new to the people. You may spend whole day in there. Panda and the aqua life are the most attractive to us. The park has also shown and educated people about the important of aqua protection and the care of mankind to the environment.  One of the disadvantages is the quality of food. It has rooms to improve. We bought some popcorn, but it absolutely terrible. Dim-sum is also horrible. They should provide more choices to visitors

Great family day out. A must do for families with kids. We went to the panda area, saw two pandas and two red pandas. After that we went to see the otter food display which is really cute. We also went on all the rides. They were really fun and lots did loop the loops. There were also really fun water rides. Imogen (aged10)

Better than Disneyland. I would personnally rate Ocean's Park to have better rides than Hong Kong DisneyLand. Spread over areas which is larger than Disney, be ready to walk if one wants to enjoy the rides spread over. The ocean express train ride is also good
Great Experience!. The Panda's and Aquarium are absolute must see's and do's when visting Hong Kong.
AMAZING!. Great park! I loved all the places! One of the best amusement park i have ever been too! I loved the place! The animals were very cool! Interesting places!

Enjoyable. To reach there get down at Admiralty MTR station and take the bus 629 which will directly drop at ocean park. The park is very clean and worth visiting.The park is mainly divided in two parts summit and waterfront. The summit area is more exciting and has lot of rides. There is a map in english available at the entrance which details the park layout, it can help in planning your time. The park is very big so make sure to reach early.My suggestion will be to see the aquarium and panda centre in the waterfont section first and take the cable car to summit. Enjoy your time in summit and then come back to the waterfront section by train/cable car and based on the time exlore other areas.The food is a major problem and limited options are there for vegetarians. This is one negative point about the park. So have a nice breakfast before you go.Some rides are awesome (hair raiser, eagle, dragon train, flash etc.). The ocean theatre show is good.I am not too crazy about rides so spent most of the time in the areas which were based on marine life, which I think should not be missed.Overall it is a nice one day trip.

Loved the Pandas. We went to this attraction just to see the pandas. That was an excellent expereince. It was a slightly windy day and the cable car was not enjoyable at all. The roller coasters were OK. We caught hte MTR from Jordan and the bus to the Ocean World. That was part of hte adventure. I would not pay to get there with a tour, making your own way saved money and was not difficult at all. Getting around Hong Kong is so easy.
Fun and not crowded. A break from culture. No queues and a nice balance of rides and animals. Love the pandas.

Great day out for all ages. It is probably the most scenic amusement park out there with plenty of rides for everyone. The highlights for us were the cable car (no queues after the opening out or back from the Summit in early afternoon), rides at the Summit and in particular the three roller coasters, the pandas, watch manta rays, sharks being hand fed in the giant aquarium. The dolphin and sea lion show at the Summit was good too. Easy to get seats on a weekday's morning. Go on a weekday and when the park just opens - you can walk in to all the rides. Noon/early afternoon are the busiest time with long queues to the cable car and most popular rides. Another planning tip is to check the park's website for which attractions may be closed on the day you are visiting. This is done randomly and you are better off checking to avoid disappointment.

Very Disspaointed the waitress would not serve us as she thought we could not afford to eat in Neptune’s Restaurant. My children of 8 and 11 really loved the whole park experience. From the Marine life to the Rides. But they stopped enjoying themselves when we went to Neptune's Restaurant to have lunch and we were first in line, The waitress serve 4 other customers and then told Me that it was a $100 minimum spend per head, which she was em-plying i couldn't afford, and before I could answer her she walked back into the restaurant and closed the curtains. As a Head Chef from Adelaide, Australia, I was very disappointed that someone could be so rude at such an attraction. It was the only place in Hong kong of our whole vacation that we felt discriminated. We left the park disappointed and hungry.

Exceptional Aquarium. Although we enjoyed the rides, the ease of getting to Ocean Park using public transport, and the phenomenal view from the cable car, we were most impressed by the Aquarium. We have visited many aquariums in the past and this is our top pick.
Excellent family day. Good place to go with sttractions for all ages. Rides are well run. Shows are good and you've got to see the Pandas.Aquarium is also superb

Too huge to explore in one day!. The title says it all. It's too huge to explore in one day. And that's a good thing. It means there are a lot in store for you here. You can choose if you want to travel to the summit through cable car or the Ocean Express (train), either way, both are fun to ride. I suggest you take both to and from the Waterfront to the Summit. Brochures are available at the entrance so you wouldn't be lost. Park map, dining guide, show times are all in the brochures so make sure you grab all of them.

Well-groomed. Ever seen a red panda? Ever seen dolphins and seals playing to the audience? Sharks through a glass bubble? This is a great place for kids and adults alike and there's a fantastic view of the south side bay from the restaurant on the hill.
great place for everyone. I went and took tram as well as visited the rides and such, then I noticed the pool area, great show with the dolphins.Also a zoo and Panda exhibit that is really great.

Eat before you go . . .. One does not go to an amusement park to eat so you will not be disappointed with the array of dross on offer laughingly called food. Long queues, poor quality and dreadful service . . . everything one should expect from an amusement park!That said, Ocean Park is terrific, we have annual passes and go about twice per month. I say we, but I mean the kids, they love the rides and when they are bored with those there is plenty more to entertain them.I'm not a lover of these places but OP knocks Disney's offering in Hong Kong into a cocked hat. Been to Disney twice in five years yet to OP many times a year.

Good but Let Down by the Queues at the Entrance. We visited Ocean Park on a fine afternoon at the end of December, so it was during the peak school holiday period and, as expected, there were a lot of visitors there. It was surprising, therefore, that only 4 of the 12 payment kiosks were open at the entrance to the park, which meant that it took an hour to queue to buy a ticket. Once inside, there's plenty of space and it's a typical family-oriented zoo/park of the sort that you can find throughout the World. The Panda enclosure was the main reason that we went and it was good, with sensible viewing arrangements. The aquarium was very good. We weren't there for the rides but the youngsters seemed to be enjoying them. Overall, it's pretty typical of its genre and easy to get to using public transport.

Will go again, especially to see the Dolphin and Seal show. We went on a Friday, not on a school holiday day and there were very little crowds- just the right amount of people there. Because we went in February most of the water rides were closed so I would come here in summer again. The wait for rides were 10 minutes and under, which was very good. We arrived at 2pm and had pre bought tickets for HK$235 each (just under 20GBP). The queue moved very fast. As we had no bags to be checked an attendant just scanned in our tickets and we went in. First stop was the aquarium. This was quite impressive, especially at feeding time. Next we went over to the summit side by cable car. The queue was long and took nearly an hour. If you are not afraid of heights then this is recommended as the sights are quite beautiful from here, especially at night on the way back when all the lights turn on. THe summit had most of the more grown up rides. I liked the Hair Raiser ride though it was short. The Dragon ride just bashed my head round a lot. Food here was quite expensive and we ended up snacking a lot instead of buying one big meal. I ate this particularly tasty rice stick near the theatre just before the Dolphin and Seal show. We didn't pay attention to any of the story apart from the middle part when there was a particularly funny act. We just enjoyed the Dolphins jumping out of the water and doing tricks. The rainforest exhibit was also very good and so was the panda exhibit, though the Red Pandas were sleeping. The souvenirs were generally on the expensive side but very cute. I managed to find a whole stand of good quality discounted charms for charm bracelets and necklaces so brought a load back home. We left at 6:30am, just in time to get on a crowded bus back to the MTR station. All in all, it was a good day out. When going there we took the MTR Admiralty Station Exit B. From there is was hard to miss the bus stop as it had a ticket purchasing stall right next to the bus 629 for Ocean Park. We sat on the top deck and loved the great view of Hong Kong from there. We would come here again in the summer for sure.

A great day out and a well run park. The aquarium is amazing as are the cable car rides. Food outlets are conveniently located all over and if you're not partaking in the excellent rides then sit back and enjoy the views over the south china sea.
The theme of this place is historical and very Chinese.. I enjoyed going from one ride to the other. I love splashing in the pool and loved visiting the Middle Kingdom
Ok but crowds. Ok but a little tired now. Was great in them 80s. Go on the bus no6 from central.
Best Park in Asia. Do not miss a visit to this Park it is much better than Disney, and is located not far from town, have lunch in the Chinese restaurant in the sealife centre it is amazing

memorable. The cable car ride was sure an exciting experience, stretching from low land 'across the sea' to the high mountain. Admiring the sea views from high above during the ride was amazing and fun! Aquarium and viewing of acquatic life Interesting. We only saw one giant panda, which was so cute! Rides were enjoyable though a bit scary for my teenage daughter.

the pandas were super active!!!. what a great place to visit to see the pandas. we went early in the morning when the gates opened and were lucky enough to see the pandas. they were super active, moving around, eating bamboo and coming up to the viewing window. later in the arvo, they were hiding and away from the public eye. facilities are great, wide range of food to eat at a good price, clean washrooms. the afternoon was very busy from about 2 p.m. onwards, lots of group tours arriving. my suggestion is head there in the morning to avoid crowds.

nice enough. Visited here shortly before flying back as we wanted to see the panda's.The queue up to get into the park was massive and by the time we got through the gates we were already sitting down having a drink.Very busy place and with all attractions like this you get some really ignorant and rude people who haven't even got kids with them.Queue jumping was rife when we went,the aquarium was full of them surprisingly!The queue for the main attractions like the pandas wasn't that much of a wait,we queued for 5 minutes and that was well worth the 5 minute wait.The ride up the cable cars was quite breathtaking however they would stop randomly to let on disabled people,they didn't tell you this when going up or down just when you was handing mid way through the air!The rides were fantastic,the little cafes were good but totally packed out with people trying to get drinks etc.designated smoking areas are dotted around the park,try not to get caught smoking not in a designated area otherwise that will result in a fine.

fun for those under 21. More to see and more to play than the Disneyland Hong Kong, the cable car ride is great , even compared to the 360 cable car in Ngon Ping! Worth the price, unless you only fancy the Mickey and Minnie characters. Pls be reminded that they will check your belongings to clean up your own sandwiches pack
Fun and educational. Great for the kids to see all kinds of creatures of the ocean plus shows and rides

Great family day out. This is the play park of Hong Kong.The original place for a day out of exciting hardcore fun and getting there is another adventure.Everyone knows Ocean park and why dont you join the millions who love it so much they keep going back.

exciting rides. exciting rides good for both kids and adult small kids rides are on low land and adult rides are in high land but the dolphins show are not as good as before, but be prepared for a long waithing time for everything as its really crowded everyday. But really worth a visit

Too many people. Far too many people and half way throught the day the electricity packed up so all rides closed. It was fixed fairly quickly. Long waits for rides and they aren't very long. Having said all that we enjoyed our day there but kids would have got bored waiting in lines.
Better than Disney Land. Way better than Dinny Land! Great scary rides great aquarium... Very professional... here to stay! Go OP!

Fun Fun Fun. This place is way more better than Disneyland. It has so many rides and attraction. The location is great. There are two parts of this park. Lower and upper. We have to take cable car to go to the upper park. Teh view from the uppee park is breath taking. Beautiful..

No Time But Feel The Cold. When this Feb consider really cold for someone like me who born in a humid country! Average 12 degrees celsius plus its near sea side with strong wind.The shows are great but as for games, you need to spend full day to play all as there's many tourists and really can't stand people with no sense of respect. Keep pushing, cutting Q and talk really loud. There's Q-ing everywhere even the washroom. But feel lucky even if you Q for the washroom!! As you can't really find washroom everywhere in Hong Kong. Most of the washroom need a key to access! If you can't wait, do not visit or you will go crazy!View my video below :http://youtu.be/AGexqrgaPb8http://youtu.be/9SZAmeYkOiAhttp://youtu.be/EcPaHPbVLp8http://youtu.be/zyaAWuD44Ewhttp://youtu.be/9SZAmeYkOiAhttp://youtu.be/ElP-3I884Dg

Theme park not just for kids, but for adults as well!. Kids and adults will enjoy this theme park. Children will love the dolphin and sea lions show while adults will enjoy riding the cable car and the roller coasters! Price is definitely worth it. Better than HK Disneyland.

Beware of rude tourists. If you can't stand people who have no sense of respect for others' personal space, do not go. Quite a few tourists from a certain culture like to stand right behind you in line. Since it's a theme park, there are lines every where. When people from other cultures line up in some less sophisticated manner, it can ruin your holiday mood. Less sophisticated manner also includes jumping line. So be prepared. If you can't stand it, do not go.

Nice Relaxing experience. Since we went to Hongkong a few days after chinese new year, we expected a lot of tourists in Ocean Park. So we left around 9am . Going to Ocean Park, we bought our ticket at our hotel for HK$280. we were told that they have the same price at ocean park without falling in line. so we bought the ticket from the receptionist of Novotel Nathan Road. going to Ocean PArk, we took the MTR to Admiralty, just before the stairs going up Admiralty, there is a kiosk selling Ocean park tickets for HK$250 only. ( lol) oh well, the queue wasn't that long though. then we just went to ride the bus629 to ocean park for HK9.60. it's about 15minutes to Ocean Park. Ocean Park renovated and added more rides. I really wanted to ride their crazy rides but my husband is not a fan of rides... so we just went to the Aquarium, checked out Mr. Panda Bear, (both have long fast lines.. tolerable, the weather was cool) and watched the Seal and dolphin show. we took the Cable car and the queue was about 30minutes.. there is a Balloon maker going around the park to entertain kids who are waiting in line for rides/shows. it was a relaxing day for us =)

Good days enterainment. went to ocean park July and it was a great days entertainment with plenty to see/do.... they had panda there in an ocean park which I found quite funny however I love aqualife and it really was amazing seeing all the sealife in this place. Best way to get there was by taxi as taxi are generally good price, especially comapred to the UK....
surprisingly good!. have been hearing stories about how boring this place is but to my amazement, i actually quite like it. guess beauty lies in the eyes of the beholder...
Pandaass!!. They just renovated Ocean Park last year, and it looks wayyy better than the old OP. Definitely should visit! If you're lucky, you'll see An An (the panda) awake and eating.
nice park. very long and very high roller coaster and not suitable for those faint heart. Park is too big and i think one day is not enough to all attractions

Classic Park that's a part of Hong Kong. Ocean Park has been in Hong Kong for many years and it continues to grow. It's a small amusement park with a small aquarium/zoo. People flood the place to see the pandas, which are very cute. There are cable cars and train rides in addition to roller coasters and pirate ships. It's not Disney World but a great day for the family. It's on a mountain, so there are lots of stairs and hills. They try to put in escalators for the higher elevations but it's definitely a lot of walking.

You need a full day. A full day here is required. There is so much to see and do.It's not just rides, the Pandas and aquarium are brilliant and the cable car is wonderful. There is something for everyone, don't miss it.

Panda's go see the panda's. We went to Ocean park specifically to see the Giant Panda's, and weren't disappointed, we were really suprised how much there was to see and do, great for adults and kids alike.There is loads of wildlife to see including red and giant Panda's, Dolphin shows, reptiles,fish and Sea lions, a cable car ride from one part of the park to the other is not to be missed!!Good value for money
be back again. love the dolphin show and hope to do all the rides!
Local version of Sea-World... and more.. Ocean Park was developed in HK and had grew into the heart of each HKners. Lots to see/play and a great place for the entire family to go.

A great day out for children or adults. We visited the park on the Thursday after the Chinese New Year. The Monday and Tuesday had been public holidays, so we thought it would be quieter by then, but it seemed like the whole of Hong Kong had the same idea, because it was absolutely packed out! I'm just glad that we didn't want to go on any of the major rides, because I think we would have been queuing for hours. We managed to get around most of the other attractions though and most importantly, spent about half an hour watching the giant pandas - which was the main reason we went. We really enjoyed the cable car ride - even though it was a fairly misty day and we were packed into the tiny car with another four adults and it was worth queuing for. The Ocean Park Express, which hasn't been open very long, was quite disappointing though. It's an alternative way of reaching the summit instead of using the cable cars and we went back down on it, but it just seemed like a slightly fancy MTR!As I said, we didn't go on any of the other rides, but we still managed to spend about 5 hours doing all the other stuff, so it's a really good day out - even for two old fogeys like us!
Great fun but crap food. Fun park catering at its worst. Recommend bringing your own.

One of the must see attractions in Hong Kong. Great park in Hong Kong. Try coming when the park opens so you can visit most of the attractions and at least the park is not too much crowded. There is a lot of good food outlets available inside the park. Enjoyed the seal and dolphin show.

Never eat at neptune's restaurant @ ocean park. Never eat at neptune restaurant there, rude waiter. When I asked for aquarium side, the waiter raised her voice "Do you see any empty table?!" i point one, then she said "it's reserved"
What the F?! A restaurant with hawker attitude.

Hong Kong's oldest theme park. My favorite part of Ocean Park is the grand aquarium. I have never seen anything like it - the viewing room at the end is of the largest tank I've ever seen with the most diverse tank I've ever seen. Ocean Park has several roller coasters as well. There is a dolphin show, sea lion enclosure, jellyfish and more. My second favorite attraction was the pandas. Third, the goldfish exhibit.Food at the park doesn't run as high as most theme parks, so it's reasonable to eat there. Would recommend avoiding going in the hot summer months if you can and avoid Saturdays, which is often the busiest day for tourists.

avoid weekends. There is one important thing to say about Ocean Park: avoid weekends and go early.In weekends, busses full of mainland Chinese are dropped in front of the attraction park and believe me.... you want to avoid this. Even after having lived in China for 3 years, I want to avoid this.So if possible go on a weekday and go early in the morning.I would not go to the dolphin show, it is a bit stupid, even my kids did not like it.The kids loved the attractions.It is not allowed to bring in food or drinks but as a foreigner, you might be able to sneak in something. (they don't check a lot) It is impossible to buy something healthy inside the attraction park so unless you want to eat popcorn, hamburger or noodles you might want to put a healthy sandwich and an apple in your backpack.Do go to the big aquarium, it is impressive!!!It is not a bad idea to check how to go their with public transportation. This is certainly important for the way back home or to your hotel. In the evening there is a very long queue at the taxi stand (we waited for 50 minutes !!!)

Too crowded, queues too long! Try going later in the day ..... We went to Ocean Park 3 days before Xmas and for most of the family it was disappointing. It took 30 mins to queue for the tickets. As it was Xmas the entrance snowed which was quirky! Then to get to all of the rides you have to catch a cable car or train. We waited 45 minutes for the cable car. The attendants weren't filling the carriages and only one was operating (there are 2). The view up was fabulous! Then the first ride - you guessed it - 60 mins wait. So after 2.5 hrs we finally went on our first ride. This was pretty much the same all day. The only respite was when a show was on and the crowds were less. We didn't buy any food as the queues were too long and they were few and far between. After 5hrs we headed back to the hotel - even our 12 yo wanted to leave. All the facilities are there for a great time but the crowd management is poor and not worth all the waiting.

Perfect Day Out. for the older teenagers its a far better choice than Disneyland. Big Rides, Big water, Big fun. As long as you don't have a problem with the cable car ride (which i think is amazing on a clear day) it can only be fun.

Better than Disney. I have been to ocean park like 12 times in my life. Everytime is fun even if it is raining. The shows are great and the exhibits are calmingly wonderful. The cable car ride is still a bit scary but worth the view. food choices need a lot of improvement.

Wonderful Amazing Park. Ocean Park is the most popular park in Hong Kong. It is located in the south of Hong Kong which calls Aberdeen. Its size can compare with "Wonderland" of Toronto. All kind of excited rides... many shows related to the ocean. You can see dolphin and whale so easy. There is a very large playground for the kids under 12...the rides are suited for little kids and even teenagers, for example, Mary-Go-Round. From there, you can find many kind of animals like lovely panda, fierce lion and tiger. On the other hand, transportation to get there is very convenient. There is shuttle buses route between Admiralty MTR and Ocean Park. Price is very reasonable. In conclusion, an amazing park for all ages.

A better HK experience then Disneyland. Ocean Park was in HK long before Disneyland. The park has stunning ocean views, and a wide variety of attractions. I particularly enjoy seeing the pandas. There are also more thrilling rides then disneyland. Only complaint is that the park is starting to look dated. Some remodeling would do it good.

Love the mix of rides and animal. Forget Hong Kong Disney. I loved the combination of rides and animal displays. The latter were very informative and the enclosures nice. The Pandas were particularly gorgeous.

Ocean Park is great fun. We chose Ocean Park over Hong Kong Disney on the back of recommendations from locals - and their tip was spot on. It may lack the real "theme park" look of Disney, but this place was great, with something for everyone. As a result, we had a great time.The rides which often hang high over huge cliffs have a real Hong Kong feel as a result of this unique topography. There are 3 decent rollercoasters - all hairy in their own way. There are also a number of tamer rides to suit all ages and fear factors.The animal exhibits vary from the rather old fashioned dolphin show, to the fascinating jellyfish and sturgeon acquariums to Giant Pandas and red pandas.There is a huge amount to do here. It is a great day out from the bustle of downtown Hong Kong. Definitely worth a visit.
Better than Disneyland. Apart from roller coaster and the like, the aquarium and cable car are pretty awesome too.

Something for EVERYONE. Leaves Disney in a dark hole in the corner. I have been here with young kids, with teenagers and even on my honeymoon - the rides, animals, jellyfish display and overall layout are unbeatable. Go!

Escape the city.. Excellent place to see the aquarium, pandas, cable car and the new train link to top and bottom of park. Don't expect state of the art roller coasters and rides, just a good day out.Recommended to visit on themed periods, such as Halloween, as an extra effort is made to make it into a magical place.Avoid weekends/ holidays, if you don't like crowds.
Limited time. Although i was only there for just a very, very short time (arrived at 6pm), i know i could have enjoyed more if i arrived earlier. I will definitely come back to this part.
Better than Disneyland. The rides are for both kids & adultsRoller coasterRaging riverRaftingsome of the must try'sIts lot of fun not to be missed if you are in HKK

Heavy Weight competitor to Disneyland HK.. Disneyland may have the big name, but Ocean Park has the coolest rides. So if Space Mountain is not enough... Go to Ocean Park and try some serious mechanical attractions. They got their act well put together as competition with the Disney guys is fierce. Recommended.
Great for the kids. Easy to get to via train, Admission reasonable which includes all rides the only thing you had to pay for was your food or gifts...A must see for the children.

Fun & Excitement in a Day's trip. A theme park set upon a mountain, not a very high one but one that's good enough to give you a scenery of the seas and trees. Hong Kong's Ocean Park is a place where travelers, with friends and/or family can all go. Rides ranging from the child's exciting level Ferris Wheel to the adult's affair with an overloop roller coaster. Of course there are other rides in between those levels.To enjoy it further, hop on to the in-park cable car that will bring you from the bottom of the park, to the top of it. Along the 15-20 minutes journey, enjoy the beautiful landscape that Hong Kong has to offer, away from the office buildings (if you want to see the skyline, head to The Peak instead). Don't forget your cameras too!Currently when I was there, there are some construction works ongoing to expand the park further, fortunately, these construction works won't obstruct visitors in anyway.Lastly, head to the Pandas' enclosures to see the Pandas of China. Be mindful of the rules and regulations while in there, such as no flash photography and loud noises.
Kong with the kids. Great spot to take kids while on vacation. It's like half museum/zoo and half Disney Land with the rollercoasters, log slides, and other cool rides. Beautiful views too.

New lease of life. Disney was supposed to kill it but this venerable attraction has been improved and is suitable for 5-100 year olds. The acquarium is probably the best in Asia. Crowds (they pay entrance fees) are a fact of life but hey, that is why it is so good.
better than Disneyland. Ocean Park is miles infront of Disneyland because of it modern outlook /Disneyland is resting on its image without being gobsmackig as i expected from my youth

Awesome day out, something for everyone. We thoroughly enjoyed our day at Ocean Park
The rides were good (the newer ones a great deal better) we headed up the top first thing in the morning an it was a great way to beat the crowds reducing the wait time for rides,
Great to see the pandas and the aquarium was amazing
Pandas. If you see nothing else, see the Pandas, the cable car is fun for the view, an old park but well worth the visit
an educational journey. bring your kids along and show them the real world!

Rides.. Loads of funs. Go any where here for a good ride. Do a serial riding. Tiring so you could do this in two day split visits. The donor show was the best. They have a monster roller coaster under construction... Hope you enjoy..

Fun and Educational!. There are two side to this park. The summit and he waterfront. I recommended that you go there early and take the cable car straight to the summit side where all the rides are. Since most people get caught up in taking pictures and going to the first thing they see, the lines are pretty short for the rides.

Great Fun!!. Super duper fun. Went there with my brother. We both had amazing time. Rides are great. Its colourful and at few rides the view is just amazing!! Def would like to go again if get chance.

oceans apart. Ocean park has improved by leaps and bounds over the years and if you had your choice between visiting Disney or Ocean Park, then definitely choose the latter. There's special section for little ones with gentle rides and a large playground plus a bird show near by. A cable car ride away (Take that instead of the train to the South side as the views are great) on the other side are thrill rides for older children and adults. And of course the aquarium, Shark reef, jelly fish habitat and Sea lions are not to be missed. There's also the pandas which are adorable and a separate section that houses a red panda and trained otters that perform for the trainers. When you get tired there are always the shows. Get there early as they fill up quickly.
Fun Amusement Park. Great place to spend an entire day at. Good if you have company. Lots of rides, a dolphin show, some other shows and food and fun.Get there early to make the best of it.

Best Park of Attractions in Hong Kong!. Forget the rest - go for the BEST...OCEAN PARK! My children love it and grew up with it, we love it too!Buy your entrance ticket together with your return bus ticket in Admiralty, board the bus and there you are!Great value for money, clean, well run and organised, responsible attitude to animals, stunning views from the park over Deepwater Bay and Aberdeen, no horrible commersialisation like other parks. Fantastic day out!

It is a good park, but not for small kids.. The real attraction of this park is not merely the animals themselves. The park offers much more. We especially enjoyed the death-defying rides! The only setback was, our 5 year old son was not allowed to be in most of them, and so he started getting frustrated upon the first rejection and eventually cried on the succeeding ones. =( Nonetheless, he had something to look forward to in the future.

Avoid the weekend crowds. We visited on a Tuesday to avoid the weekend crowds. Even so, some of the lines were quite lengthy. We waited an hour for a balloon ride, and up to 30 minutes for some of the other rides and my local friends told me that this is quite short.The dolphin show was impressive, and a good opportunity to spread the message about clean oceans and stopping pollution. The dolphins weren't all that cooperative - perhaps they're bored doing the same thing three times a day.The food from the stalls is simply awful. Takeaway greasy fast food at its worst. Think McDonalds (they are there), but the rest are just as bad. Perhaps the cafe or restaurant might have been better.Even so, Ocean Park is doing some great conservation work, and has an impressive array of attractions. The ticket price is reasonable and it's worth spending a day there with your young family (preferably a weekday when there are fewer other people).
Went to see the Pandas. We basically went to see the Pandas. Tickets are expensive and the park is huge. If you can't walk for long periods, it may be difficult. It can't be done in a day.

A Park for every age. Can do with friends, family or even alone, don't miss the Hair-Raiser, Flash and the Dolphin show. Pre-book to avoid long lines. Also, the Halloween do they put up is pretty good.

There are pandas at Ocean Park!. Love watching Jia Jia & An An, the two cute n chubby pandas having lunch. That was the highlight. The aquarium was alright. Seen better ones elsewhere. The cable car ride was fun too. Not as good as Ngong Ping 360, but pretty cool. Many other amusement rides here n there expected of a theme park. And pretty water fountains. The park was very crowded, long ticket lines, but then, HK is a very crowded city. There seems to be park photographers almost everywhere. Bought some 'official' photos from them....expensive but nice.
Excellent. Better than Disney Park in all respect. Trust me for adults go for this park only. And if you are with kids then offcourse go to Disney Land. But the rides are just awesome for adults.

Fantastic Fun Park !!!. If you have children or not this is a great place to visit. It has so many rides for young and old and so many things to see and do. It is a must place to visit for a fantastic day out.
awesome. full day visit is a must. has everything for every age group.
Great rides.. Huge area... More than the aquarium, the rides were enjoyable and the huge expanse managed the crowd well. Give it enough time to enjoy thoroughly.

Great Fun. If you have more time than just doing Disneyland then this is also a fun place to spend time with the kids. There is plenty to do and with further ongoing construction it looks like it will be bigger and better in the future.

lower entrance fee. for kids and adults wanting to try a theme park, they can go here. Once you pay for entrance, you get to ride the park's cable car and enjoy the rides once you get to the main park. If you get tired of Disney, try Ocean Park

Ocean Park Review. Ocean Park is a good place to travel.You can watch the amazing bird show and dolphin show.You can also see the cute seals and ride on the thrill rides.The train at the entrance is very good.You can see the animals in the ocean.There are also aquiriums.You can see real animals in the sea.Find out more by visiting Ocean Park.

extreme rides!. We didn't stay at Ocean Park for one whole day. We only needed approximately 5hours to get around the park. We didn't really enjoy the show with the dolphins, because most of the lines were in chinese (we were expecting english narration). We were also looking for more international restaurants/food but all we got was McDonald's. We enjoyed the extreme rides (Disneyland doesn't have these). Overall, it was a stress free day in Ocean Park.

The most amazing tourist attraction I've ever been to Phenomenal!. Last week while on a stopover holiday in Hong kong I decided to visit the Ocean park as a friend in China had recommended it to me. I was so pleased I did.The park is truly amazing!The entry fee of 301 HK dollars for an adult includes return bus tickets to and from the park. from the MTR station, I was amazed at the spectacular aquarium,panda sanctuary,performing dolphins,rain forest etc.The attractions are wonderful Make sure you take a good camera! Photographers on site at the gondola station also take beautiful photos of you ,which make lovely souvenirs for a really good priceOne of the main highlights of the park is an incrediblle gondala ride across the park.I can only describe the park as' spectacular" in every sense of the word.I spent a phenomenal day there !!Don't miss it!!I A 5 star attraction!!Andrew

Pand'a'monium. A must see. Well worth a visit esp if you love Pandas as much as I do. I didn't have much info on this place before I went. I didn't know there were pandas at the park. There are 2 exhibits - one inside and one outside with 2 pandas in each location. You are only separated by glass (inside) and a fence (outside). So close. I spent at least an hour at each location then went and explored the park. At the finish, I went back and spent even more time with the pandas. Much much better than the short time you are 'allowed' with the pandas in South Australia. There were lots of other animals (seals and otters very cute) to see but these were my faves.A huge area to cover with lots of carnival rides spread out across the mountain side. To get from one side of the park to the other involves a very high gondola ride. I hate heights but the view was worth it. Construction of new / added attractions hadn't been completed when we were there. There is no easy way to see everything. Escalators are needed. The attractions are built in a spiral. Lots of backtracking. takes up a lot of time. As with all these places - go early.If you aren't into rides, the animals are worth the cost of ticket entry. Enjoy.
A park which represent HK. a place which you can gain fun & knowledge at the same time!
Dec visit. Arrive early and leave early before the millions of mainlanders do. Apart from that it is a great park for the entire family.

OK - pandas are the best bit. Got there early having taken the express bus from Admiralty which is direct. Took the train to the summit and would recommend not queing for the cable car first thing. We got to the top where the rides were and it appeared that nothing was actually up and running they were still doing safety checks on most of the rides. I am not a small person and found that I could not ride the mine train and that Hair Raiser was a very tight squeeze - if you were a Western man of over 5ft 10 you would have problems. Felt this was a let down as a lot of Western people are considerably taller than Eastern people. Also when Hair raiser did work we went on it but when coming back into the station to disembark the cars in front had not moved and we were stuck until they could get everyone out. The annoucements were not in English and we had no clue what was going on. We took the cable car down from the top and there was no queue, when we got to the bottom the queue to go up was very very long! The pandas are wonderful and that is what redeemed Ocean Park for me. They are very well looked after and the keepers put out food that encourages the pandas to come down to the front of their enclosures so you get a really good look at them.Ocean Park need to decided whether they are catering for the Western size or the Eastern size and fix it. If you open at 10 then make sure everything is ready to go, it was like a ghost park I expected to see zombies coming out of the hedges!
Thrilling. this is a must, a great place to spend the day with the children and adults. Unlike the theme parks in Queensland this is cheap

Ocean Park - bigger than Disneyland?. Set over a fairly vast landscape of mountain and hillside, it would definitely take a day to fully explore. There are sedate rides for the children as well as hair-raising rollercoasters for the wild at heart. Don't go for the marine life as although it's there, i found nothing mind blowing about it. It was great to see a panda but i felt sorry for it having to live in such a small space (set up like a zoo enclosure really). There's plenty to do and see, eat and buy (like most HK theme parks) and it's all very clean and well looked after. Lots of food options and once you get up to the top of the mountain, the views are beautiful too. We had problems getting a taxi at 4.30pm when we were leaving the park and queued for almost an hour so be careful of leaving too late.
A differnt park. Try this if you are tired of the American park, and if you have interest for life at sea

One fascinating place to spend with your children. I've just spent a week in Hong Kong with my 2 kids (9 and 10) and found out that when you visit Ocean Park, it absolutely not enough a day to see and enjoy all the attractions it offerred ! Ocean Park is a very big themepark and divided into 2 areas : The waterfront and The Summit. Both has its own attractions with The Summit has more challenging attractions such as Hair Raiser (the giant roller coaster) and Mine Train. We enjoyed getting wet in The Rapids (rubber boat adventure).Those 2 areas connected by cable car and ocean express. Took the cable car and get thrilling by its height and the Ocean Express is a aquarium-like train. In The waterfront area my kids enjoyed its grand aquarium and see the Giant Panda! It was really a lovely experience and we could not see all the attractions in one day trip. Surely we will come back and visit Ocean Park again in the future. If you have your tourist day pass (transportation easy access card) it is entitled discount for the entry fee and it is easy to go there, just take bus no.629 outside Admiralty MTR station.

Fun, cheap amusement park. I enjoyed the rides which were better then some I had experiences in other amusement parks outside the United States. I also found the show on the birds to be fun. The enviromental theme was also refreshing in a region that has gotten a great deal of press for not doing much in this area.

quite crowded. tha park is worth a visit, especially for the zoo, where you can see the Pandas. We could not see the acquarium since there was a 2 hours wait to get in, so I really have no idea if this is worth the wait.

Great fun for all the ages ....and even more for kids. Everyone coming to HK should try it at least once, especially if they have not seen similar parks to compare to . Great HK islands views and scenery
Perfect Place for the family. It is a wonderful place to visit with family, the price is ok and there are a plenty of options for the enjoyment of kids of all ages.

Might be abit dated but heaps of fun!. Our whole family enjoyed a day here. Plenty to do and see and sooooo clean. We were there in the quiet season and on a week day so absolutely no waiting for rides. Loved the Pandas

20 years later and am still loving it. Top tip: go in the morning (they open at 10), to avoid the huge group rush that tend to arrive in their hordes in the afternoon. I've been visiting Ocean Park since they opened and they keep reinventing themselves. On my latest visit, the pandas were active (eating, not sleeping), and I was most impressed with the jellyfish, new aquarium, and old favourites like the goldfish house and sea lions. Am so looking forward to the Polar areas opening this year. Lots and lots of scary fun-rides, if that's your thing. And of course, the cable car ride is a must for any visit: go to the top area by train and return by the cable car, to avoid the rush. This way, you can probably enjoy the ride by yourself, to savour the views in blissful silence.

Loads of fun. Really glad I spent a day here. The Pandas were amazing. Many other cool animals (red Panda, Chinese Sturgeon, Jelly Fish, Dolphin and so on). The rollercoasters were great. Also, the cable car from the bottom part to the top offers a great view. Imagine its great to take kids there. The food, however, is rather awful and overpriced. There are several options, from mcdonalds to "proper" restaurants, and the best ones might be good, I did not try them. Altogether a great experience.
The best amusement park in HK. Way better then Disneyland, Live animals shows, a spectacular aquarium, nice roller-coaster. A nice half or full day of fun

Fabulous!!!! long queues.. This is all about fish , rides and more scary rides..the ABYSS is a must for the brave only ..you can hear the screams of the faint hearted and they are terrifying!!!! the dolfins are the endangered pink ones,,,,quite a nice show...VERY VERY LONG QUEUES in holiday season so here is a tip..... keep the dolfins for last . buy the tickets and then ....grab a look at the panda park next door via cable car..( it will take about an hour and half from start to finish...very nice) and then do the aquarium .Having done that finish your rides and then stretch your legs at the dolfin show stand...sit high up...the view is very good ..you can see the sea .the rides..the works. lots of stuff to eat as weel DO TRY THE SNOW CONES...the taste amazing!!!

Thrilling and Wonderful. It is such a bright and colorful place with gentle to exciting rides. Fun place for my kids. Must try rides - Hair Raiser and RainForest Ride..Lots of screams, fun and laughter..Lots of fun games stalls and interesting prizes to win and of course sumptuous restaurants. Took long and exciting cable car ride and the Ocean Express. Only thing I disliked were the long queues!!

Brought out the kid in us.. We visited here with no prior plans and took public transport from Wan Chai to Aberdeen. Interesting way to blend with the locals. From Aberdeen, we took another bus to Ocean Park. It's a little tricky to get around since most people don't speak English and most signs are in Chinese. For all the trouble we went through, we were rewarded with a fantastic visit here, albeit short. The long slow cable car ride to the top provided a lot of thrill especially after we saw the flimsy towers that held it together. The cars were swaying vigorously but I must say I enjoyed it. A lot of shows were held at the same time so we picked only the ones we were interested in. The dolphin show was as usual tops. The trainers were topnotch with great interaction with the animals.

Never old and never tires. Hong Kong weather is very unpredictable. We came in December when it should be cooler. Instead, Ocean Park was scorching hot in the afternoon. We didn't bring our hats or sunglasses. We were very well prepared for the cold when night came.Still this place should rank high on everyone's visit be it the first or subsequent time. Just come well prepared with your day pack stuffed with the water bottle, hat, sunglasses, fleece jacket and a light waterproof jacket. The waterproof jacket proved highly useful for the water thrill rides as well as the unpredictable weather.

Fun Theme Park. Its a fun place to be if you enjoy the various rides that the park has to offer. Its here that we saw the most unique and wonderful kinds of Gold Fish. Some of the roller coasters are right at the top of the peak, at the ocean side. amazing thrill.
Nice. It is very big!! so you must go early in order to finish the fun you must had inside Ocean Park.. I regret that I didn't make it to go hot airballon as there are long queue!!

Changed- for the better. Ocean park has not always been consistent with the quality of their attractions and general layout of the park. However, the creative thinking that has inspired the new rides and "lands" has given the theme park a sense of direction. Ocean park used to be the best, and only theme park, and they slowly went downhill from there, but when disneyland came to play, ocean park stepped up their game, and this definitely paid off. The new rollercoaster "the hair raiser" is absolutely, hair raising. The new aquarium is fantastic, and has you in goosebumps in sheer awe of the creatures in the massive glass tanks. The childrens area is still the same as always, and has been that way ever since I can remember, and it still holds the classic carnival charm. A must-see for all thrill seekers, animal lovers, children and adults alike!

Great Place to Visit. The aquariums, shows and rides make this park way better than Disney.The cable car ride is scary at first but fun! :)I've been here twice on two separate visits to HK and I love it each time :)Even if it's raining, just put on a raincoat and walk to an indoor aquarium, no problem :)Quite tiring walks due to the steep roads, slippery when it's raining, so be careful!For the dolphin show, be there atleast 30 minutes before to get good seats, ESPECIALLY when it's raining/drizzling, so you wont be stuck in seats without a roof over you :)Love the panda and fish section as well! The Sea Lion show is also quite good :)
A surprising standout--make Disneyland a miss.. the setting, the variety, and the efficiency. Great and little known day out with kids.

Great for kids. Good place for kids for a day out in HK. Plenty to do for a full day. Enjoyed dolphin show. Food a bit expensive and you have to line up. Avoid very busy public holidays. as it is a popular HK attraction for locals.

Great place but not for couples. Went there with my husband. We didn't really get to ride anything because we're both scared of everything that lifts our feet from the ground. Oh, the only thing we did there was the Raging River and yeah we ate! :) Don't miss the Dolphin Show. Great place for families with kids!

Ocean Park-alicious!. Went here for my birthday (I'm 34) with low expectations as the last time I was here, I was considerably much younger.Great aquariums, animals and entertainment!Ended up staying the whole day.Rides are a bit pedestrian, but good for the kiddies (if you have any)Food was modestly priced, but also a bit ordinary.Lots of public facilities available and signs to help navigate.Would definately come back when I'm with kids.

The Giant Panda!. I could have stayed all day watching the pandas eating their bamboo. Lots to do at park particularly for young & young at heart ..fab water show,roller coasters & the cable cars were terrific . Very easy access frequent bus service from central terminal
Ocean Park. A lot of facilities for both teenager and kids and a big compound. Should have more water cooler though.

Hong Kong Amusement Park. I visited Hong Kong with my two sons (11 & 18) in November. The city is colorful and there's more shopping than you've ever seen in your life! But, one favorite excursion was a day trip to Ocean Park. FIrst of all, the double deck bus ride to the park was alot of fun with so many beautiful sites along the way. We rode by Repulse Bay (absolutely gorgeous area) and the Stanley Market which was nice as well. Also, Ocean Park was very reasonable --- $30 or so...can't remember exactly. I recommend you ride the roller coaster that goes upside down. It was a lot of fun and not scary at all when you're on it. I haven't ridden a roller coaster in many years but rode this one and I'd do it again in a heartbeat. One more thing, there's ALOT of walking here because the amusements are built into a mountain and are on several different levels. The view from the park is spectacular.

Ocean Park is way too crowded these days!. My family and I visited Ocean Park in HK just last week. Perhaps it was the holiday season, but it was way too crowded. We arrived late morning and the queues everywhere were very long so that wasted a lot of our time - in the end we could only take one ride and caught only the Sea Dreams show!Nevertheless, we still enjoyed ourselves as it was the first time being there for the kids and we stayed till closing time at 9 pm.Our favourite stops were the cable car ride, the aquarium, and the Sea Dreams show. But the most unforgettable moment was when I discovered I dropped my wallet containing all the HK dollars we had as a family! And I didn't realize it till we were about to pay for some stuff we bought - just before closing time.I ran all the way back to where i thought I might have dropped it but was stopped by two security guards who said that the section of the Park was already closed and they could not let me enter. I tried explaining that I lost my wallet but they kept saying that it was closed. Then one of the guards must have suddenly realized what I was saying and described my wallet to me! It turned out that he was the one who picked it up and had sent it to the "find-and-lost" department (or that's how he said it).I ran to the place and true enough I found that it was my wallet! Thank God! What a relief! Compliments to the honesty of the security guard! It was not hard to imagine how my family's vacation could have been completely ruined if he did not find it, or if someone else took it and not returned it! That experience will stay in my memory for a looong time to come! Thanks, Ocean Park!Some tips: 1) Go as early as you can! The crowd comes in around lunch time and builds up through the afternoon!2) If you want to catch any of the shows, please go to the venue early (by at least half an hour!) They open the doors right after the preceding show and they allow people to come in to take their seats for the next show - so it's really first-come-first-served!3) Pack your own lunch/dinner if possible - food and drinks in there are expensive!

Great trip with young children. If you can avoid the tour groups, mainly from the mainland, this is a very enjoyable day out. Plenty of attractions, I am sure all children would love the pandas and aquarium. The new South American themed part is a little on the small size but has some interesting creatures in it.
nothing much. it just like the other amusement park nothing much to do maybe i dont like those rides, the view from cable car was beautiful
Ocean Park. Good place for the kids and great rides. Dolphin show is a must see and the Gondola ride down the mountain as well

Ocean park was great!. Oh my God. The cable car was very awesome. The height and the scenery downside was amazing. The rides were great. Even my parents enjoy it. Hair riser and raging river is a must ride onesThe panda, goldfish and sea jelly collection were awesome. Two thumbs up for ocean park!
love it!. hail to hair riser!!! love the aquarium & the amusement park. had a great time here

Full day needed. Never seen a big sea lion and panda? so this is the place.The acquarium is a must do!! The giant sting ray was just too awesome. I can spent there hours watching the stingray glide like a big flying saucer circling its perimeters. The Panda aaah so cuddly and cute yet fragile. The dolphin and sea lion show was not that bad too. The rides are more for the adults. Theres a moment of eerienes when you dangling up over 20 feet storeys for 5 seconds before you are dropped. Feel the air going in your lungs whoa!! Try the abyss drop. Good outing but the queues was just horrible.

Great Entertainment for the whole family. Ocean Park has recently been renovated and has now a great new aquarium as well as some great new rides.And for a moment of relaxation don't forget to take the cable car and enjoy the beautiful view over the South China Sea!

AMAZING!!!!. I thought this was one of the neatest places ever. We were all adults that went (but kids at heart) and had an amazing time. What more could you want - huge aquarium, a zoo, smaller niche aquariums with goldfish or jelly fish, dolphins, a huge amusement park, and so much more we didn't even make it to! Some recommendations: buy your tickets online so you can avoid the ticket line. I highly recommend going first thing in the morning (it usually opens at 10:30 a.m.). The park is split into two parts connected by a cable car and an underground train. If you want to avoid lines for rides and everything else, go immediately to the far side of the park. Everyone seems to do the closest side first, so the far side is EMPTY for the first hour or two after they open. We got on all the rides with no (or very short) lines, before everyone else came to the far side of the park. We then did the first part of the park last, which was not such a big deal because the rides with line-ups are mainly on the far side. I also HIGHLY recommend taking the cable car - the views are like nothing else I saw during my time in Hong Kong. Also, as great as the park is, I did not see much food that looked really appetizing, so don't come hungry.
Thrilling rides. The rides at Ocean Park were more scary and thrilling compared to Disney Land. There were a lot more rides as well
My kids LLLooooVVee Ocean park. Great theme park, in the middle of no where.. lots of interesting rides.. Bravo

Nice Park. We had a nice time at Ocean Park. My husband thought it was a bit too crowded, which was to be expected since it was the holiday season. We visited the aquarium, the pandas and the jelly fish but the Gondola ride and the view really made it worth it. We didn't try many of the rides because the lines were too long.**If you do go during a busy holiday time, I would recommend pre-buying your tickets. We bought our tickets through a Big Bus package and we avoided all the lines. If we had to wait in line we probably would have skipped the park.

we loved it!. Loved the whole experience! especially that its not only an amusement park but a zoo and theme park and nature park combined! Good for adults and kids 7+. Small kids cant ride on all rides. But u need to start early because its large, and purchase the tickets ahead to avoid queing. tickets can be bought from hotels or big bus representatives :) we loved the pandas! enjoy!

Still good and gets better. Visited this place twice and found that it has gotten better. As many people had already comment lots about this place, I will just go straight to the point:Pros- Pandas and Aquariums are spectacular. Cons- Not enough kids rides, no parades (it's about time for a parade), not enough food variety (mostly hotdogs and fast food)For those who wouldn't mind paying for an expensive dinner, do make reservations at the Neptune. It is located at second level of the main Aquarium and you can sit right next to the fishes (separated by glass of course) while you eat your dinner. The setting is perfect, though servings are rather small (I am a 85kg male Asian). I believe I spent around SGD350 for that dinner for my family of four (2 adults and 2 young kids). However the views is what made the dinner worth. Highly reccomended.

Panda Land. Great way to spend your day for adults and kids. The animals are definitely amusing from the pandas to the fishes. We got a video of a panda releasing a healthy log while sleeping. The rides were okay. Tip: -don't wait for the coaster with the water. The ride is about 10 seconds but with an hour wait in line. - plan your route according to the show times- bring water and food
Great place and value to spend a family day but way overcrowded.. Very well up keep and maintenance but way overcrowded. Too many smokers. Expect alot of second hand smoke.

Alternative locatioon to see Pandas. Customer Service could be better. Do not have a warm feelingwhen going to the Ocean park. BUt the place its self is interesting but the signages and amusement parkls need improvement so that visitor knows what is avaliable and where to go.

Small & Expensive. It is make of 2 location to form this Ocean Park. 1 at the lower moutain side, the other 1 at the peak. need to use cable car to travel from this 2 location. Waste of time for Adults.

Fun rides are even better than that in Disneyland!. Ocean park is easily accessible by City Bus 629 from Bus Depot located right on top of Admiralty MTR Station. Do buy the return bus fare & Park admission ticket together, so as to save the hassle when arriving at Ocean Park.The Park had expanded beyond recognition since my first visit some 20 years ago, save the outdoor escalator and cable cars. The Park is divided into 2 sections: lower section for younger children with child-friendly rides, and this is where the Grand Aquarium is located too. Impressive collection of marine lives within the Aquarium.Guests can access the higher level via either cable cars or the new Tunnel Train. At the higher level, the main attractions are the dolphins shows and thrill rides. The Park had recently added 3 new thrill rides, in addition to existing 8 thrill rides. As such, it is sufficient to entertain thrill seekers with all these varieties.

Adult's Disneyland. If you're planing to come to Ocean Park, be warned that you're gonna need to spend the whole day there to cover all the attractions! Recommended to come in the morning when the park opens if you want to enjoy all the attractions and be back home before dark. The reason being long waiting times for the popular attraction rides, especially during peak periods. The cable car is a very popular way to get to the summit where all the park's attraction rides are situated. However, I took the clever way by avoiding the long queue at the cable car station and took a tram to the summit instead. Not much queue and it got me to the summit safe and sound!

Loved the animals. We don't do rides. We visited Ocean Park for the sole purpose of seeing the animals.For any animal lover or zoo aficionado, this park is worth a visit, because you are bound to see a specie or two that you have never seen.Our favourites were the giant pandas, the toucans and toucanets, and the Chinese alligator. There was a huge aquarium too, but it was funny to be greeted by a seafood restaurant upon exiting the aquarium. Weird!Nonetheless, it was worth the time and money to visit Ocean Park if animals are your thing, because it is probably one of the best animal collections in HK.

Accessibility. Took bus from Tsim Sha Sui. Hunted for the bus stop on Peking Road, as advised by a cop who consulted his mobile phone app., but could not find it . Found the bus stop on the next road after a lot of walking. Realised that we should have gone to the main bus terminus. Even after getting down, it was a long walk, especially with the threat of a drizzle. Return journey was easy as a number of buses left for Admiralty metro from outside the gate itself.
must go. suitable for people with kids. they have a wonderful show with dophins
If you love Pandas, a must see. Great time with the kids enjoying the animals and the rides. A beautiful location in Aberdeen.

Fun for young and old. What can I say, it has everything for visitors of all ages. The food is quite pricey inside, but it was still filling. They did say food and drinks are not allowed inside and bags will be inspected, but nobody inspected our bags, making me wish I brought in my water and not have to spend 20HKD just for a bottle of distilled water.Take the cable car ride, it is quite an experience the shoreline from above.

What a great way to spend your day!. This is the most relaxing fun ride palce on Earth. Love the ride by cable car up to the mountains for rides. The view from the mountain top is amazing. You can see one part of the whole Hong Kong Island. There are many interesting rides for childrens and adults alike. Really enjoyed the exciting rollar coaster rider overlooking the ocean and mountains. Great great place to spend your day!

As good as new. Went there for the 2nd time in 10 years and must admit that the thrill is still the same. One of the richest population of fish and other sea animals and displayed in a logical manner. The Dolphin and seal shows is always a treat for the eyes just as for the rest of the amusements. For 308HKD inclusive of return trip from Central- you have value for money. Plan for a whole day there with a cable car start. You'll simply leave every moment of it.

Great for the kids and maybe the adults as well :). We went to Ocean Park on a whim after spotting the giant balloon from Victoria Peak. The friends I was travelling with were all in their early 20s and had a 'thing' for aquariums. We caught a taxi out there (which took about 5x as long as it should have - handy hint: it should take around 5-10 mins to get there from the Garden Road Peak Tram Terminus). The entry prices were fairly reasonable (around $220 HKD each). The water park itself is enormous and very well serviced - there are lots of attractions, food stalls and (of course) shops.The exhibits were clean and well presented and the animals were simply amazing. My favourites were the pandas! The aquarium was also well worth a look.Finally, it sounds like a typical tourist attraction, but the cable car was absolutely amazing. The views over the bay and towards Hong Kong Island were something I'll never forget.In all, it's not a typical HK experience but it's a great thing to do if you have extra time up your sleeve. The cable car ride alone makes the entire visit worth it!

Real coral reef with huge fishes ! Nice place for seeing happy pandas !. At the beginning we go there for the aquarium and the pandas ! It is located on the south of HK Island. You can buy a ticket including bus + Park at Central. Really convinient ! There you have big aquariums with real coral reef, big fishes, pandas, attractions... Perfect place if you want to enjoy a moment with your family

Not for Us. I remember going to Ocean Park over a decade ago and loving it. However, this time, I did not. Part of the reason was because we were travelling with 2 kids under 5 and 2 senior citizens. The hilly terrain at Ocean Park was a "killer" for us. :( We had rented strollers but even pushing strollers up fairly steep hills can be tiring! There were many steps/escalators and it is not easy to negotiate these with strollers. :(The park is also not very well designed as the entrance and exits of rides were not close together. We ended up having to hike back to where we left the strollers and grandparents at the start of the ride! Those of you who have been to Disneyland would know what I mean. It's easier there.The place was also horribly crowded with tourists travelling in big groups...this can be quite intimidating. After we left the park, we counted almost 40 or more tour coaches at the carpark!The Cable car ride was lovely. The Sea animals show was not bad, but the Sealions were better than the Dolphins. The aquariums were nice.We probably won't be going back there any time too soon.

Not really worth it if you aren't with kids. I mainly went here to check out the pandas. In the end, I basically spent $40USD to look at them and walk around absorbing the atmosphere. It really isn't that different from other amusement parks... my advice if you are travelling solo and not that into rides is to skip it.I could completely see this being an amazing day for someone with kids. There is a lot for them to do - just not much for the solo traveler...
