Very very good. Had good fun at the park... too bad the Pandas are a bit lazy the day we visit.For rides, choose to go early (right after they open at 10-ish) or late (before they close at around 19:00) to avoid the crowd

Crowded & Long Queue. Waiting long for all the ride (We went on normal Monday instead), we went for the dolphin shows but it too croweded until we blocked in front of the entrance, other animal shows are boring, worth to wait till 8.00 p.m to watch the water dancing in front of the main entrance, all others are in average.
Ocean Park. Ocean Park was fantastic, great rides and attractions. Love the giant pandas! It is a huge place with easily enough to keep everyone happy for the entire day!
Height restrictions should published. Fantastic in general but I wished that they would tell/advise height restrictions before you walk to the actual rides and in our case face disappointments.

A Thrilling day out.. I love theme Parks so this place was a "must visit" place. What an excellent day out with so much to see & do. To start with the Cable care ride that takes you from one side of the park to the other boasts excellent views over the local coastline. Then there's a mixture of rides to suit all ages & to finish the day off why not sit back & watch the wonderful Dolphin show. Oh & they have some nice restaurants there too. All in all not to be missed.
Value for money. Having visited the park since it opened in the late 70's I feel it s well worth a visit. New attractions have opened, but my favourite is the red pandas.
very amasing. You should have a enough time for that almost the hole day. very good place for children.

Good value for money. Ocean Park is very interesting for adults (and teenages) and was good value for money. Will be better now new rides have opened. Food expensive but to be expected. We went on a Monday afternoon and it was not too crowded until we were leaving about 6pm.

Good location, good experience, lacks in some areas though. When you first walk in you are overwhelmed by what if before you. If is located at the base of a mountain (which you can catch a cable car up and over to the other half of the park while looking out to the ocean). Every thing is in English also, so you can find your way around easily and the staff are very helpful. Even if you don't ask for assistance they come and ask if they can help you find your way. We went with our 15 month old and he was so excited about all the animals that we were going to see. Unfortunately, i found the shows lacked a little. I do understand that the animal trainers are doing well to speak part Cantonese and part English and i get that doing all that while you are looking after an animal and making it perform is no easy feat, but alas after going to an Ocean park in the States or in Australia, i found that this Park fell short.The transport to the park is very efficient and easy to catch which is another plus. Worth it maybe if you are going on some of the rides etc. But we wanted the animal attraction part of it and that's why i am only rating it so.

Great attraction - wear comfy shoes. Top Tip for Ocean Park: When the queues for the Cable Car ride are too long, consider taking the train option. Ocean Park Express runs every 5 mins, and has a large capacity so the wait time is always always much shorter than the Cable Car. Return from the other side by taking the Cable Car, which is comparatively a shorter line. (Except for 5pm onwards, so if you'll like to minimize queuing time for the Cable Car ride, upon arrival, head straight via Ocean Express train to the other side, enjoy those rides, and then come back to the entrance section. Avoids the mass herds.)
Real Pandas. Ocean Park is the place to go to if you just wanna have some fun!Our teenage daughters really enjoyed the rollercoaster rides,and a bonus were the pandas.They were soooo cute!
Great fun, good value for $$. Must visit for all first timer to HK.A lot more fun and cheaper than Disneyland HK.Cable car ride is great and the view is worth the entrance fee.

Good for young and old. My kids couldn't get enough of the place and were upset when we had to leave at the end of the day.The love the animals show and the acrobat show. The rides were also worth going for - we did not get to try the more thrilling ones, but the kids had fun anyway.The grands had a great time too. Definitely worth considering spending 2-3 days there if you can afford the time.

Not many rides. It was great to see the Panda's-they are so beautiful. Lot's of animals to view & great kids amusement area with kids rides.Not many adult rides & the line up to go on one takes anywhere from 1-1 1/2 hours. But this is probably the best park in Hong Kong. It is a huge walk everywhere as the place is on a hill-so take comfy shoes.
Nice attraction. Nice place to spend entire day..Dolphin & seal shows are a must see...Indian cuisine is not present ...Better to carry some snacks..

New rides, nice to see. Definitely worth coming here, they are constantly getting new rides. If you have a student ID, opt for the annual pass. Good value and get 10% off on drinks/food inside the park!
Shows & rides. Unfortunately, it was pouring when we were there. So, remember to bring umbrella with you at all times

Better than Disneyland. Much more fun and things to do. HKG Disneyland cannot be compared to the ones in the USA. It is so much smaller. Ocean Park has ride attractions, shows and a large aquarium. Also saw pandas! Note: Went to HKG Disneyland 2 years ago.

Above Expectations. Huge park with tons to do. It's a huge place. The cliffside rollercoaster was tons of fun. Best view from a coaster ever. Lots of rides were closed for renovations unfortunately. Still there's Pandas, an aquarium, dolphins. Takes a whole day. Go early to beat the crowds.

Too crowded. My family's second visit to this park. Our first experience was memorable and enjoyable. But this time round, our experience was a little disappointed due to the overcrowding and hardly get to enjoy most of the rides. In fact, during that time we went, some of the interesting rides were closed for their members only. The dolphins show was not that fantastic as the previous one that we watched before. The pandas enclosure still the same. There are some upgrade done of course. Overall is ok provided one does not mind the crowd and time spend on waiting for practically everything, from buying food, rides, cable car etc.
Good educational tour. aquarium was fantastic. And you get to see Pandas! This was definitely a bonus!

A fun place for family. We took the cable car up and came back down with the Ocean Express train. Both give you an awesome experience, one with a panaromic view and the other a similar-underwater-sub experience. Most of the rides are applicable for mid-primary school age children and may not be suitable for very young children.The Symbio multimedia water fountain show and the huge aquarium is wonderful too.Unfortunately, food are not up to mark though.http://babysmooches.blogspot.com/2011/12/hong-kong-ocean-park-25-11-2011.html

Ocean Park has upped its game and met its competition head on. Ocean Park is HK's long and venerable theme park, which has been in operations since 1977. When Disneyland opened, many predicted this would mark the park's demise. The truth is far from it. In fact, I'd say that OP has gone from strength to strength, upping its game to meet the competition head-on. They have recently opened their Thrill Mountain, which has 3 major rides : Rev Booster, Whirly Bird and The Flash. The first two are relatively fun and easy on the heart. However, it's the Flash which will send your heart racing. It spins you upside down, and you are literally off your seat. When it ended, I had to stop and catch my breath before deciding whether to have another go. That was how intense the experience was. The other ride which we enjoyed was the Rapids. Understandably, with all the new attractions, the older rides like the Abyss, Mine Train etc were not well patronised. The children loved the Dolphin and Sea Lion show, and the scenic cable car ride. We ended the day watching the Symbio light show. It was well worth the wait. Overall, I was impressed by the developments at OP. Would definitely be back because I saw a new roller coaster called Hair Raiser undergoing testing. Yeah!!

big timesaving tip. dont queue for the cable car at the entrance near the park entrance.go to the other side of the park via the ,train, and just walk onto the cable car there with zero queuing..up to an hour if queue with everyone else near the park entrance.most of the best rides are at the far end of the park anyway.

Good place for kids and adults. Great rides more for adults, nice Chinese restaurant, amazing roller coaster albiet small . All in all a great way to spend the day but a bit of a long wait for the ride back in the evening.

Great day out. loved the park, pleanty of rides & shows. Tip - do the cable car from the top down, no queue when done that way, queue to go up was horrendous 45+min wait. Take the alternate route up. Go up the tower view - stunning views of the park & Hong Kong.

A fun day out - even as a corporate event!. Our company recently organized a corporate day at Ocean Park. We were some time to roam and try out the different rides. Panda enclosure was excellent - its just amazing to see these enchanting creatures up close. Even if they're not doing much and just lying around. The aquarium, if you've been to the ones in Singapore or Sydney, is a bit lacking. I'm told little kids still enjoy the aquarium, but as an adult and if you've seen better ones probably best to skip it.After an hour we were gathered together for some team-building activities. This was all very well arranged and the Ocean Park activity leaders were well organized.
Panda Power. Even as a adult with grown kids , seeing the Pands made me smile .Worth the effort nice habitat built for the expanding Panda population

Nice park. The park is too big for a day as the rides and the cable car queues are long even on a weekday. There is not enough time to cover the park as it rather big. The aquarium is something you should not miss. But the park map is really confusing as the attractions are not according to the location. You ended up with a lot extra walking. This is worst park map that I came across.Nevertheless this is a great place for family.
way better than disneyworld. Fantastic day out with rides and fun things to do. well worth a visit adult or child

Wonderfully upgraded from two years ago ! Worth it !. I visited the park 2 years ago and was impressed by the work put into this attraction. This time, some upgrades have been put in place and it is even better. The view is lovely from the top. We didn't get to ride on all the attractions cos of the loads of people from China. A big tip is to get there early, do all the rides first, then go for the other attractions later. The aquarium was a treat, esp the Leafy and Weedy Sea Dragon, amazing creatures. Watch out for the touts selling Ocean Park tickets outside of the Admiralty train station, they could be fake and rip you off for only an attraction of 10% less. Many prefer this over the Disney in HK esp if you have teens.

fantastic. we visited Hong Kong on the way to Australia and stayed 2 nights.The highlight of it all was Ocean Park just to see the Panda's. The park is amazing but the attraction for me was the Panda's. I could have stayed in the enclosure all day but there was too much else to do . The cable car ride was awesome the aquarium was fantastic. We got a taxi from the centre it was easier than finding the right bus in a very busy city.Excellent day out but get there early to get your money's worth and avoid queues. We had no children with us so I could'nt comment on cost for food. Well worth a look if you have the time.

An exciting place to be!. What is the best way to start a tour in Hong Kong? Well, my kids and I chose to spend the start of our tour in Ocean Park for all the attractions it has to offer! We were pretty excited to take our very first cable car ride - the view of the land and sea was splendid! Although it was raining hard when we were there, it didn't stop us from exploring the park. We rode up and down the escalator from one attraction to the other. Unfortunately, we were not able to ride all the rides since we didn't have enough time. We did make sure to see the pandas, the jelly fishes and all the other animals there. We got to ride the Space Wheel and it was a rather unforgettable ride!Truly a day is not enough for you to fully enjoy Ocean Park especially now that they had opened new areas, but perhaps planning your trip there can help. The next time we go there, I'll check out their website first as a guide.

A must to see the Panda. Easy access by MTR Subway and the special Ocean Park Bus. Good show, nice cable car. Challenging Rides for more adventure. Good for family visit but food inside are expensive and no good.

Great Day out. This park is located on Hong Kong Island - easily accessible by bus from the Central Bus Station on the Island (leaves every 20 - 30 minutes). The park itself is great - half theme park half zoo/ aquarium. There are plenty of great rides as well as dolphin shows & Panda Habitats. There are 2 sections to the park (you can go between the 2 by cable car (has great views of the surrounding islands & Aberdeen). Good value for money - $50NZDpp including all rides & shows. Plenty for all to see & do

Hongkong Ocean Park in My Mind. Hongkong is always in my mind...and in my heart, too. I have been to that beautiful relaxing place 3x and each time my satisfaction level is on high. With so many attractions and of course the endless shopping sprees, my favorite place to go though is the Ocean Park. Every HK visit I had means a visit to the Ocean Park. With it's adrenaline pumping rides and it's animal attractions from my beloved pandas and sea lions, not to mention the breathtaking atoll reef with it's colorful fishes, majestic sharks and all other sea creatures. And you will not get hungry because all over you will have food stalls with tables and benches under the trees or restos - take your pick! Shops selling souvenirs are also available to make your trip more memorable. Of course my camera is always a part of it for HK Ocean Park will always be in my mind....and in my photos, too! :-)

All In One Attraction. Must see for young and old. Beautiful views great rides for every type of visitor and educational as well . Lots of walking so wear comfortable shoes and bring extra clothes as you will get wet in some of the rides. The only negatrive is the food and drinks are little expensive.

Renovated and rejuvenated!. I have nostalgic memories of visiting Ocean Park as a child, and it did not disappoint! It has been recently renovated and the rides no longer look tired and dated. The new aquarium exhibit is impressive and houses a good variety of sea creatures. The addition of Pandas is welcome, but it is curious why the 2 panda exhibits are housed in 2 separate buildings!It would be helpful if the park map set out which rides have height restrictions as we went to around 5 rides, only to be told that our twins fell just below the minimum height bar. In such a massive park, certain rides are far-flung and walking to them can take a good 10 minutes - it certainly feels like a waste of energy if your kids can't get on the rides!Also, be sure to get to the dolphin/ sea lion show at least 30 minutes in advance if you intend to get a place to sit. We arrived 15 minutes before the 3.30pm show on a weekday only to find ourselves cordoned off from the seats which were filled to capacity! We returned 30 minutes before the 5.30pm show and enjoyed the show. The views from the fringes of the park are stunning and Kodak moments await!

Wear comfortable shoes. Great fun park but very large. One tip if you go early in the morning make your way to the rear of the park to avoid the crowds. The train is the best and fastest way between the two joined together parks. The pandas and dolphins are really good but the last show is at 5 best time to go not busy at all. Really good show not to be missed. Transport to the park is so easy get the metro then a bus. Park web site has all the details. If you are looking for a day of fun in hong kong this is a must. Lots of walking between rides though. There is also a fantastic water show with fireworks and flames not to be missed at the main entrance. Time of show will be posted as you walk in.

Amusement park and Ocen park...great combi. Ocean park is again a must see place. The first half of teh park has Panda's and various kinds of Fish. the other part, which is connected via a train and ropeway is a delight for Amusement park lovers. The rides are simple amazing. One must also watch teh dolphin show as it was teh best. The sea lions are attention seekers and damn cute. I woudl say 10 times better than Disney land...must go and plan teh entire day at teh ocean park.

Awesome!!!!!. Hello my friends i can tell you this place have some awesome rides and animals and birds ....this is the best place to go in hong kong with your family... in this place i request you to not to go on saturday or sunday cause it will be total rush and you will not enjoy a thing...

A place where kids and adults can enjoy!. Initially, it was between Disneyland or Ocean Park. Since my brother (25 y/o) and my sister (23 y/o) haven't been to a theme park in ages, we all agreed to go to OP as advised by our friend back home. If you're up for the rush and excitement, go to OP and try out their rides. Meanwhile, if you want to reminisce with your favorite childhood Disney characters, Disneyland would be the place for you.

Great fun!. So many rides, so two days would be best to spend at theme parks, because the queues at the rides are incredibly long especially at peak times! You would be waiting up to an hour for the popular rides!Like disneyland- or even on the MRTS too, there is lots of pushing and shoving, and umbrella to the eye poking. So be warned!

Better than Disney...... Our small family of three enjoyed our day to ocean park much more than Disney. There were no horrendous queues (in the kids area-I believe the adults area was much busier) and our son said he liked it better. There is a mix of attractions and some are better than others but for little kids this place is great. It has a good playground with appropriate rides. The aquarium is impressive. Overall I would go here rather than Disney if you had to choose.The down side was that the food we had wasnt good quality and was very overpriced and in the adult area (the summit) many of the rides were closed which we were unaware of. There are display boards around with information on them and it was possibly on there but I think if you were going as an adult for the rides you should be told this before you fork out the ticket price..........
planned to go there tomorrow. great place for recreation and having fun together with teammates
Family with small kids. If you have a family with small kids don't miss it. and enjoy all the time there

Great Rides. Better rides than Disney for the older chid / teeneager.
Cable cars scared me 20 years ago when we first went there - they still scrae me now!

Not much more than a glorified carnival with a few pandas and fish thrown in to distract you. Everyone seems to know someone who likes Ocean Park, but I simply cannot understand the attraction, and we have tried on 3 separate occasions as visitors often think they want to experience it. This place is overpriced, dirty, nothing special (with the possible exception of the pandas, but even that falls short of its potential and is quite boring), and the service throughout the park (e.g., at restaurants, such as they are) is very, very poor. If there is an audience for this place, I suspect it is one of two groups: 1) people with very young children who are hard up for entertainment and aren't willing to pay for HK Disneyland or have already been there; and/or 2) teens looking for a venue where they can get away from parental oversight and be obnoxious (particularly true at Halloween). There is some potential here, but most everything is so poorly done, with abysmal service and so filthy (trash everywhere), that it's hard to find the "bright spots." If you miss visiting Ocean Park, the only thing you will have missed is wasting your money. Definitely not worth the visit.
Good place to bring kids along. It's a good place to visit for educational purpose especially for kids.The close encounter with panda bears is worth of every penny spent.
Not to be missed. One should reach in time and carry sunglasses and enjoy all the rides
Nice park!!. we got the chance to see different types of sea creatures.. and riding the cable car for the first time is awesome!!

Fabulous for kids. There is something for everyone here. I took my 7 year old daughter and her 7 year old friend. They saw animals, sea lion and parrot shows. They had rides on hair raising rides which had them screaming with fear and excitement - then running for a second ride. They were mesmerized by the walk through undersea world. They played in the playground and reluctantly found time to eat some fast food. They eventually came home in a taxi still laughing and happy whilst I collapsed in front of the TV with a 'few refreshing cold ones'.A BRILLIANT DAY OUT to easily rival Disney.

More themeparks and games to play. Good to travel with kids and enjoy the fun ride in the park. More new themparks coming soon. Visit during the cold season, otherwise, you'll be full of sweat. Have fun!

Had a great time!. Had a lovely day at Ocean Park. The aqauriums were lovely and the seal shows were entertaining. As expected the food was expensive and of poor quality so you are better off sticking to Mcdonalds which is probably the cheapest option. I also enjoyed seeing the pandas which was one of thw highlights of Ocean Park. There is good information next to various animals and birds. Would definately recommend. A good day out all the family.

Very Good Sea Park, and Old Style Amusement Park. This one has got it all - an Excellent Aquarium - Penguin Deep Freeze - Pandas, Junk food, real food, and shows. Buses run from the city to the park every 5 or 10 minutes. The park has 2 sections connected by 2 strings of cable cars, and a spooky train. There is an excellent jellyfish building. Two exhibits have pandas, and a few red pandas. In recent years - their attendence records beat Hong Kong Disneyland.

great entertainment. A place where the full family can have a great time.The lower portion is fun for the yound and old but the real experience is on the upper hillThe rides are scary and great and require some courage to get on a few of them.A must visit.

Probably one of the finest parks in the World. I suggest anyone to go to the fabulous Ocean Park- one of the best amusement parks in the World for its attractions and incredible location in the mountains of HK island- riding a rollercoaster here is an amazing experience as you have these huge drops and loops overlooking the ocean and huge sea cliffs- The aquarium is extremely well designed and the tunnel beneath it will stun you as well as the main glass window - The pandas area is probably one of the best I have ever seen. The pandas look so happy and they are so fluffy!- Riding the Nautilus is a must (and much nicer than Disney's!)- The Cable car has some of the best views you can imagine over the bay, sea cliffs and ocean... I never imagined that an amusement could be built in such a topography - a part in a valley and another part in a mountain!- The final show in the main fountain with 3D effects is at the same level or above Disney shows... unforgettable!!- The Halloween party is really daunting and you can ride most attractions in the dark!- And many more to see and do! It makes easily a full day of action and fun.The best part for me was to see the sunset when I was starting the rollercoaster ride... wow!!For sure you will never see amusement parks the same way after you have been to this one...
fantastic place!. wonderful place to visit.. love the rides and the dolphins performance!!

Never go park... Not at all good....outdated aquqrium & other attractions...crowded with thousands of people..Ready to be in que for 2 hours to see or experience a train ride or dabble car ride.... It's a waste of time..
A good package for a day. There are plenty of attractions. Something for everyone.

Better than Disney Land - make sure you got there. This park is 1000 times better than Disney Land. It offers so much, that you don't know what to do first. We loved especially the Gondola ride and also the Panda Bear Place, the Aquarium and not to forget the Sea Lion Show. Make sure to be there!

Good for the kids. Likes:1) the pandas2) the cable car ride3) the aquarium4) you can take your stroller inside most attractionsDislikes:1) the long queue2) the heat3) most food areas are outdoors4) very little shaded seating areas for families
Not for elderly. Need to walk up and down stairs, even with elevator, but still a tiring process for the elderly.
Amazing!. We had two children 8yrs and 6 yrs and they both enjoyed Ocean park more than Disneyland so much to see and the Aquarium and water rides were a hit.

A whole new experience.. Since my last visit in Dec 2009, the main entrance received a total remake, new aquarium and many more mechanical rides to attract more teenagers.Ocean Park has introduced entry check to prevent people taking in food and drink, in it's misguided believe that will encourage people to buy the over priced food and beverage within the park.Overall the park is investing to improve the experience. Maybe a better range of restaurants are more reasonable prices and advertise them in it's web site, so visitors can make informed decision whether to food and drink.

Don't waste your time. I thought I came at Disneyland, because most of the attractions are for kids.If you are older than 7-years old, don't go there. Instead, fly to Singapore, to Universal park — it would be much better.

AWSUMMM. Now this is what i call a place.It was a brilliant experience in ocean park.The rides, the cable car, the volkswagon train n what not.The best part was the raging river and the aquarium.If you go to hong kong and not visit ocean park then no use visiting hong kong.

Halloween Bash was amazing and so was the food!!!. Allow me to focus on Ocean Park Halloween Bash event held yearly around October. I paid HKD 680/person for a privileged pass with dinner at terrace cafe and it was the best decision I made. Privileged pass is a MUST or else you would end up queuing for a long long time (1hr) for each haunted house.They have 8 haunted houses with around 15 shows scattered around Ocean Park. My favorite was Fear Factory and the 3D show. Fear Factory scared the living daylight out of me. And the 3D show, it was more like a 4D show. They have a huge screen in front and below where we stand, each with 3D effect. It felt so real!Overall, they really spend a lot of effort trying to scare you! And it's so fun looking at people screaming, running, and get shocked! hahahaa... Oh and their decorations and costumes are GREAT!! TOP NOTCH!The dinner was a 4-course set meal. I wasn't so keen on it because usually food in theme park isn't all that great. But oh my they proved me wrong. The meal was great. To top it off, the Terrace cafe is located on a hill (cliff) just next to the sea. It is breezy and relaxing. And you get to see HK evening skyline too!So yeah, if you visit HK in October, this should be on top of your list.

amazing. its great place to go in the morning, enjoy the cable car, the rides, the fishes, the jelly fish, the pandas........perfect place for family, nice hotels near by, many free shuttle buses also, just carry the map when u go hongkong, so u can plan where to go when do go ..dont worry about why do go ..cos they are all nice ...hongkong is nice nice nice....

Ocean Park, a great park near an ocean.. Ocean Park in Hong Kong, China is a clean huge park beside an ocean. The great entrance will welcome you with a big balloon. More exciting well wishers will greet you with song and dances as you enter the park. What i like most is the cable car that allows you to see the view from above. It will take you few minutes in going to the other side of the mountain. What i regret most is the insufficient time we had to enjoy the different exciting rides. However, my family enjoyed the dolphin show that last for an hour. We had our lunch in the area which could be found easily. This park maintains cleanliness and therefore littering is a BIG NO to them. I love the park and it is good for family bonding. Children will really enjoy the different activities lined up in their lists of undertaking while in the park. They have also introduced the endangered panda bear which they protect most. They have also with them pictorial booths where you could choose from with a fee after the end of the respective tours. One should not forget to buy souvenir items. There are plenty of stores parading within the area.

Halloween Night. We went for their night halloween event thus missed out the usual performance of Dolphin, panda etc. However the theme park is big and lots of exciting rides to play with. I will want to visit again for the normal day time

Good experience for kids - but quite haphzard. Rides are good. Kids will love them. However, they are placed across the park without proper signs on how to get the next ride. Too much walking mainly because rides are not connected with each other. So, you may end up coming back all the way to go to next ride. Summit is worse.Nice area for smaller kids in waterfront. Very good waterfront show at 7pm. Due to Halloween, lot of people came dressed up like various characters. It was fun watching them.Definitely visit Giant Aqarium. Its very good. The dolphin show was a whimper. If you've visited Sea World in US, skip this show.Don't miss Panda.Overall, decent experience.

Thrill. It's a huge park so study the map well so you can make the most of your visit. We were able to take those rides that interest us (which are basically all of the adult thrill rides) in one day. Highlight of the visit is Symbio! a lights and sound show that caps your Ocean Park visit.

Still a "must" go if you haven't been there before.. Almost 15 yrs since I last came here and so much has changed. The park has a lot more to offer aside from its signature rides and shows. Don't miss cable car ride which was an experience all by itself, ocean theatre shows with dolphins and sea lions and the panda adventures were crowd pleasers. For the thrill-seekers there were plenty of rides to choose from: the eagle, abyss, mine train, raging river, the dragon,rapids, the flash and space wheel etc. It seemed like the park has evolved from a foreign-tourist oriented park to a local-tourist oriented park which cater to "mainland tourist". The bird show could have been more enjoyable if was in English for tourist to understand but as I have said there were more mainland tourists now than foreign at a ratio of prob 10:1. And it could be crowded and nasty during the peak times. If you value your personal space don't go, if you have small very children, avoid especially the Summit part of the park (there are lots of uphill walking/stairs, althou escalators are available). The Waterfront part is good for the children though, if not crowded. If you don't want pushing and shoving avoid Ocean express too! Food was more expensive than Disney and not that good. There were lots of trees and canopied walks so queuing in the midday sun was tolerable than in Disneyland. And they set-up fans and mist around the parks to cool you down. Still a must go if you haven't been there before.

Newer and more attractions added... always crowded. There are lots of new attractions that have been added to Ocean Park. The Aquarium, the Giant panda and Red Panda are worth the visit. There is train that goes back and forth that is an alternative to the cable cars. The dolphin show is still fun for the kids. But the place is a zoo around lunch times with long lines of people purchasing over-priced food.

Amusement park & Zoo all in one in the middle of the city. This amusement park is the best place to see pandas up close and without bars or glass windows, even better than the Beijing Zoo. There are rides for all ages and the view from some of the rides are spectacular. Be prepared to do a lot of walking since the park is expansive and very hilly. My children ages 10 and 11 enjoyed all of the animal exhibits and the rides.

Cute, nicely run, something for everyone.. We enjoyed the park overall. The goldfish, Panda, and jellyfish exhibits were highlights, as well as the cable car ride. The main aquarium is quite nicely done, but pretty much what you expect & the lighting is a bit frustrating in some views, and hard to photograph. If you take the cable car over the mountain, there's a whole 'nother half of the park, with rides, restaurants, exhibits, and amazing views of the harbor below.

Plusses: see pandas and exotic animals - minusses: long lines. We had a free day with our kids, ages 10 and 13 on a trip to Hong Kong, and were told to come here. First advice: do NOT try to go to a Chinese style amusement park on a weekend in the summer. It was 100 degrees, and there were a million people waiting to get in. Once inside, every ride had over an hour wait in the hot sun, often with no shade or relief. Rides were okay -- the one roller coaster that goes out over the bay was pretty cool. Even had to wait a half hour to be seated for lunch in the terrace restaurant. The jellyfish exhibit was very nice and the panda exhibit was also good. But as American tourists. we probably should have stuck with Hong Kong Disneyworld instead. At least they have Fast Pass.

Cable cars, zoo, games all in the park, but too many people, jumping the queue. Can play for whole day with my kids. But too many people on Saturday, and many people like to jump the queue... Food are expensive and not good.

Great rides for adults, great aquarium for kids, the pandas are so cute. Definately worth a day here.. We went to Disneyland as well as Ocean Park and we are glad that we did - they are very different. Disneyland is more for kids whereas Ocean Park is for both adults and kids (and it is cheaper). Our 16 month old son loved the aquarium and seeing the pandas and other animals at Ocean Park. We caught the dolphin show at 3.30pm and it was great, packed though! so try and make the 11.30am show for less crowds. We took our seat for the show half an hour before it started and the grand-stand was nearly full already. The dolphin show and all the thrill rides are up the top of the mountain (via the cable car or train) so do these first and then head back down to chill out in the aquarium, panda enclosure etc.My Husband and I took turns going on all the thrill rides - my husband loved the roller coasters. The log ride down the river was a bit boring, just floats around and then has one sheer drop - not really worth it. The ride up the escalator by the entrance to the train to go back down the mountain is awesome - don't miss it!It is a massive park so be prepared for lots of walking. And take an umbrella in case it rains (it is bound to!). The shops have some neat stuff in them so don't forget to do some shopping.We caught a taxi to Ocean Park from North Point because we couldn't figure out how to bus there.

Fantastic. This was one thing I really, really wanted to do in Hong Kong, I have never seen a Panda before (apart from on the TV) and was so excited. We got to the park for opening time and went straight to the panda's and got there for feeding time and it did not disappoint at all.The park has an old fashion feel but I thought all the animals were kept really well, we didn't really try the rides we went on one I think it was the Dragon and we both had a headache for an hour, getting old I think!We took the train up to the top and then the cable car back down which seemed to work well as the line was massive for people waiting to go on the cable car when we came down.We still spent nearly 5 hours at the park, just a word of warning like some other people have mentioned some people are very very rude, in our case it seem to be the older ladies that had a problem with queuing but we made a brought it up to staff and they sorted it out.We got a taxi here as we were staying in Kowloon and didn't want spend ages traveling.

Amazing Panda Enclosures. We went only to see the panda's, they had a very tranquille enclosure where there are staff to ensure the up most silence. The panda's have soft music playing, and air conditioning!!! There were keepers picking up the dead leaves and supplying fresh food around the clock for these guys, was amazing.There were also enclosures with Red Panda, Chinese alligators, Carp, Pygmy Marmoset, Capybara, Kinkajou, Otters & Green Aracari.

Go for the pandas. True: the giant pandas are infinitely cute, and worth the ticket. There are other interesting animals, and they all seem well treated. Installations are nice and the views from the city are great! Just don't expect any thrills from the roller coaster.

Ocean Park - Great Animals, Good Rides. A theme park, zoo & aquarium.. Great day out. We went on a Monday and arrived just after opening . A big sign on entry stated that outside food and drink were not allowed. All bags were given a quick check by staff on entry, we had water bottles and they went in ok. All rides except Ocean Park Tower were open. We went on most rides in the morning, they had minimal to non-existent queues. Mid-afternoon it seemed that bus loads of people arrived and it became noticeably busy, and queues looked long. Make sure you wear comfortable shoes as there is a lot of walking around, up and down ramps or stairs. The map wasn't the best to follow but there were signboards with arrows to point you in the right direction. There were plenty of toilets located all around the park. The Pandas were well worth seeing. The aquarium was huge with lots to see. Worth the money for hours of entertainment.

Hot, but fun. The rides were great, and the general atmosphere was bright and cheerful. If you're going there early in the morning, try taking the tram all the way to the top where the rides are first, and work your way down - my wife found that was the best way to shorten the time spent queuing :)

Great fun - but wear your walking shoes.. We went to Ocean Park with our two children (aged 11 and 13), and had a ball! On the negative side - the park is getting a bit old; the quality of the surroundings (buildings/paths/gardens etc) was pretty average compared with amusement parks in QLD, Australia; it was a little difficult to get around as it's very hilly; it wasn't that easy navigating from one one attraction to the next.HOWEVER, on the positive side - the rides were great; there were hardly any queues when we went; the aquarium was really good; the dolphin/seal show was fun; the pandas were beautiful; the food outlets were ok (much better than Disneyland); and there seemed to be plenty of staff around to help direct us when we got lost. We booked Ocean Park via a hotel tour - we would not do that again. It took us 3 hours to get from our city accomodation to the park as we had to pick up people from other hotels and then, the bus made us wait for nearly an hour at a jewellery manufacturing place (this had not been on our itinary!) A much better way to go to Ocean Park is to get a MTR train to Admiralty Station, then catch the 629 bus to the park.I have read a couple of reviews about other "tourists" being rude and pushing in front of you - we experienced this too - my advice is to learn how to stick your elbows out and push back!ONE WARNING - Ocean Park does not want you to take your own food in - your bags (only) are searched at the entrance.Our children said that this was the best thing they did in Hong Kong! We wish we could have spent more time here.

Most rides were closed when we went. When we visited most of the rides were closed which was unfortunate. The rides we did go on were fun though. We went fairly early in the morning when the park opened which seemed to be a good idea as towards 1-2 bus loads of tourists started to show up and the lines got longer. The pandas were fantastic. It's worth the money just to go and see them. The cable car rides were also very cool.

Poor quality park. This park is poorly designed. It is located on a hill and it is very hard to find your way around from ride to ride. You have to travel up and down many esculators and a cable car and train to get around.The rides are not safe, with many not having saftey straps to hold you in.We set out to the park on a cloudy day, by the time we arrived it had started raining. We paid to get in and then found out that only three rides were operating and they cancelled the shows. We should have been informed of this at the entrance, because we would not have paid to enter. A waste of nearly $700. We left after at lunchtime and it was pouring with rain, yet ques of people were paying to enter and not being informed of the lack of working rides and shows.Also we brought rain jackets for $30 each at a gift shop in the park, only to find a staff memeber selling them for $20 at one of the working rides, not impressed.Staff were unhelpfull and could not always correctly direct you. I can understand why other reviews had said that they only had time to do a few rides, because the distance between rides is quite long and if you are walkiing between rides and the waiting in a long que, then little would been acomplished.
HK Ocean Park. Everything is great. Never miss this place when you travel to Hong Kong. It's one of the best attractions.

Great time for the whole family. We were due to go the the park a day earlier but the staff at The Langham informed us it was a local holiday so would be very busy.What good advice we went the following day which was quiet. The entrance fee worked out at aboutthe equivalent of 23UK pounds each for three adults.That included the magnificent pandas ,aquarium etc and ride on the cable car which gives great views. For the more adventurous there are numerous roller coasters etc but not sure if they are extra. Anyway a thoroughly enjoyable day.

Saw the pandas. Two pandas were here and we able to see them both. Lots of water fountains and sculptures for the kids to laugh at/with. Worth the visit if the kids want to see pandas. Food is reasonably priced.

"ok". Seeing the panda's was the best part of the park.Had a few good rides but the rest were pretty rubbish! Probably more of a kids theme park. We went on a Friday during the day and many of the rides were closed and not opening until the evening which was annoying.Theyre building a new section of the park which looks like they are building another big roller coaster.Park poorly laid out... so much walking around!

Wasn't going to visit - SO glad we did!. The original theme park in Hong Kong.Wasn't really interested in wasting a day on this holiday visiting a theme park, so we didn't.After learning there was an AQUARIUM & PANDAS here, we popped in for a couple of hours when doing the south of the island, between Stanley & Aberdeen.It cost about £25 (GBP) to get in, cheaper than those in the UK, and had so much more than what we were used to.AQUARIUMLargest & most amazing I've ever seen in my LIFE! Done the only way China could do it - bigger and better than anywhere. The highlight was the reasonably priced restaurant which overlooked the largest viewing gallery I had seen. Perfect for a lunch.PANDASComing from the UK - these were the first pandas we had ever had the chance to see... WOW! So impressed, they loved playing up. Recommend going around feeding time.2 were in 1 enclosure, 2 in another.CABLE CARGreat way to see some coast line, as well as getting from one side of the park to the other on the peninsula. Recommend getting the cable car 1 way, and the train back.THEME PARK RIDESStandard theme park, we only went on the 1 ride, as we were short on time - but I'd say it was well laid out with good maps. If we had more time, we would have spent more there.BEWAREPublic transport to/from is a bit of a nightmare and you need to be a bit savvy with the busses. Takes a bit of planning, luckily we had a good guide book to hand.OVERALLIf you're holidaying as a family, take a day out to do it, otherwise, if you like aquariums or pandas - definitely worth dropping in.
Cute Panda. They have Panda and many marine animals with extreme rides, it's a good place for family

Waste of time. Now, we all know that in amusement parks you spend much more time standing in line to take a ride then actually on the ride, but this park has devised new methods of wasting your time.The paths between the rides are long and confusing. For example: let's say you want to go down with the cable car from the summit and you managed to get to the Exit of the cable car, how do you get to the Entrance? Well you need to go down the hill a few hundred meters. Turn left, even though you can see that the cable car is on the right. Make a loop under a bridge. Pass a few intersections some have signs some not and then go back up the hill an additional few hundred meters.Another example: you can go down an escalator on the back side of the summit to access a few rides. The escalator going up brings you to a different place then where you went down. Now you need to spend more time finding your way back to where you wanted to go.Another way of wasting your time is the long lines for the food stands, which are way understaffed. If you want to see the dolphin show – be there 30-45 min before show time or you will not be able to get in.Gave Ocean park 3 stars and not 2 since my daughter said she did have fun, and that I was just disappointed that my favorite ride (the rapids) was closed due to typhoon warning.Tip: Check if there were any typhoon warnings before you go to ocean park. Some of the rides will be closed. Even if actually the weather feels fine.

Disappointing. Staff didn't seem to know where some of the rides and attractions were and the map provided was a bit hard to follow but we managed to work it out. Also rides were under renovation due to the Halloween holidays, it would have been nice to have this advised on arrival. We were disappointed to walk all that way to the rides only to find it was closed for renovations.

Great park but lots of walking. Overall I did enjoy ocean park because of the beautiful aquarium, dolphins, pandas and seals. However it is a lot of walking and I recommend you check the daily forecast before hand because it can get extremely hot and uncomfortable. There are quite a few rides but nothing very intense which made them pretty boring. If you love animals then I recommend you visit ocean park.

Good. It was very fun, but some of the people were pushing and shoving in the line. When I went the Chinese people had one week vacation, so there was more people than usual. Most rides had anywhere from a 45 minute to 2 hour wait, but it's very much worth it. The Amazing Asian Animals is also worth it. I highly recommend this park.

Amazing Visit, Adrenaline Pumping Rides, but Make Sure You Visit Early Morning. We chose Ocean Park over Disneyland, and there was no regret. This place is absolutely fantastic. It is highly recommended to start as early as you can. We took Bus 629 (HKG10.60) at the Admiralty MTR, and reached Ocean Park by 9.30am. There were already people on the queue at the entrance.When we got in, we took the cable car and went up to The Summit to start with the adventurous rides. The cable car ride was fantastic; it offered great view into the surrounding ocean. For those who prefer not to take the cable car, you can opt for the train ride. We were glad that we started with the adventurous rides as we basically did not have to queue. By late morning, the queues to the rides were already building up and some took more than 10-15 mins.Some of our favorites are The Abyss, The Dragon and The Flash - they are all super adrenaline pumping!We took the cable car downhill and then went to see the pandas, took the merry-go-round and visited the Grand Aquarium. We spent quite some time at the Souvenir Shop; as there are so many interesting buys. We missed the crowd favorite - The Hot Air Balloon as the waiting time by noon was over half an hour! Food is aplenty; with many restaurants (which can be quite crowded) as well as food stalls.Overall, it was really a very good visit.

fun - an excellent half-day trip. We found Ocean Park easy to get to by MTR then a bus direct to the Park, bought the Ocean Park tickets as exited MTR (at Admiralty MTR station Exit B) as this included the bus fare. The buses left from outside the station. At the park we visited the Panda habitat which was very interesting but I felt the pandas were a bit frustrated with their enclosure - though apparently they have more space away from the public viewing area. The roller coasters were great fun - try the Dragon and the Wild West Mine Train (great view) for thrills and laughs. We also loved the excellent aquarium and the cable car ride which gave us a great view over Deep Water Bay. We went early in the season and fairly early in the day so the park wasn't too crowded. An excellent day or half day out with something for everyone.

it was fun. i came here to see the pandas because i love them so much and for the rides. it was fun. we went on everything and saw a few shows which were actually worth your time (kind of). the other side of the park that didn't have the rides was kind of boring but it was good to walk around and experience it at least. ocean park was the first place i've ever seen a red panda which was awesome and you get to see the koalas sleeping in the trees. i loved it :D

Put on a good pair of shoes and visit. It's worth setting aside a full day to visit Ocean Park. Its very hilly and much larger than you'd think so put on a good pair of shoes! Saw various women managing it in heels and astounded how they could make it through the day.The park is split in two, with a cable car (shut when we went) or shuttle train to take you from one side to the other, the near side having the aquarium and panda exhibits, and a childrens area, and the far side concentrating mainly on rides. This splitting of the park maybe made it less great for larger groups with persons of verying ages, as its not great for splitting and wandering, but really geography dictates this. The far side of the park also has great views of the bays of the south of the island.The main problem of the park was that many people (I'm informed mainly from the mainland) have no concept of waiting or standing in line and would often push or barge in front of you. They would then be incredulous when you stood your ground and wouldn't allow them to barge past. The park have signs up "strictly prohibiting" this, but so far as I could tell nothing was ever said.

the breathtaking cable cars....at Ocean Park.. I was with my son in going to ocean park...a tip to those who plans to go there..never mind bringing foods with you as it will not be allowed entry, you may bring umbrella for those complexion conscious ones..the place is so great and really big, we went there as early comers, and had the cable cars as our first ride, my gosh it was so breathtaking, and never imagined it was that long...the marine aquarium was so impressive with variety of live marine species on it...for those travelling with kids, ocean park should be a must...

Save a full day for this one!. I felt the ocean park was way better than disneyland, but im guessing thats because we were all young adults and the rides in ocean park were more appropriate. The ocean park is easy to get to, just take MTR to admiralty, and then take the bus, i dont recall the number, no worries there are clearly visible signs in english, and you'll even find a booth next to the bus stop for tickets. The park is a bit confusing though, and we found the map to be very vague, and got lost a couple of times. Best option is to follow the direction boards along the way. Most of the area is covered with trees especially when you cross over to the other side, either by underground train or cable car (which seems awesome but was closed when we went). At the entrance side you can go see the pandas, the aquarium, and other attractions we didnt have time to cover. We went to the other side, where there were numerous rides for ones adrenaline rush!It is a bit hilly, even though there are escalators to take to to different places. The view was magnificent too, there will be many points to overlook hong kong. Also, make sure you go see the pandas, it was a much better experience than trying to squeeze your way in the beijing zoo. Set aside a full day, because you will walk a lot, and there are really a lot of activities. A tip, if you wish to see the dolphin show, get there REALLY early. We got there 15min before, and it was fully packed( and it was a big sitting area), so buy lunch and go save yourself a seat.

on a clear day, waterfront coaster and cable car rides are a treat. Rare to have clear, non-smoggy summer days in HK, but when there is one, it's a good day to bring the kids to Ocean Park. Much bigger than HK Disney, too. The aquarium is one of the coolest attractions with sharks, rays, tuna, etc, swimming around and above you as you walk through the cavernous rooms. Dolphin show is narrated in Cantonese, Mandarin and English, and one needs to get there at least 1/2 hr early to get the seats in the shade. Roller coasters are mild/medium, with The Dragon by the waterfront being the best they have. Cable car ride up and down the mountainside are not for the acrophobic, and the view is fantastic. Unfortunately, Ocean Park gets really crowded with rude tourists from the mainland who unabashedly cut the lines at every opportunity. Panda viewing areas get pretty crowded, too. Again, watch for pushing and shoving by mainland tourists. The park employees are not effective in combatting that behavior.. it's just too rampant. Patrons are left to fend for themselves. It's to the point where we feel really sorry for the HK natives who have to deal with the surge from the north. Other than that, our day there was really fun.

Not for the very young, very old or infirmed visitor, but go!. Ocean Park is not Disnyland and is not trying to be Disnyland. If you understand this, then read on, please. I was a single, black female with dreadlocks, traveling through Hong Kong last November, 2010. I had accompanied my husband on his business trip, so I was alone almost 90% of the time. I am writing this review after reading all the "bad"reviews of this park. I noticed a theme, so I thought I would add my opinion and experience to the mix. I took the MTR to the bus depot where I bought my ticket for entry to the park. Like many attractions in Hong Kong, the shuttle of buses out to Ocean Park was harried, chaotic and crowded. I was born and raised in NYC, so this did not bother me at all. I got a map at the entrance to the park (as my husband had taught me to do - we never used maps for our  parks in NY). I immediately knew I wanted to go to the side where the "adult" rides were located, which meant taking the tram over and across the park. This line or queue took about 45 minutes, but it moved a few feet on a regular basis. It was a Thursday, mid-day (11:00ish or so, I think) and very warm and sunny (around 36c). I appreciated the warmth of the day; it's part of visiting this part of the world! I boarded my tram with two young Asian girls (in their 20's, I guess) who quickly helped me take pictures of myself in exchange for pictures I took of them together. When I hopped off the tram, and this hopping is the way to get on and off, by the way, they went one way down a hill, only to circle back to me to help me orient myself to the map and take a picture of me in front of the tram. I later met a pair of girls from Australia and a couple from England, with whom I later rode back with over the tram, she being five months pregnant, couldn't ride many of the rides on that side and they were headed for the Panda exhibit (I would follow them to the red Panda exhibit and then lose them at the carousel). I love roller coasters and tried to ride all the fast rides; it was a disappointing experience,  but only because I really like my rides fast and scary (think Busch Gardens in Tampa, FL  or Universal Park). I did not eat at this park as I am trying to be a vegetarian and also avoid fast food. All the restaurants for food looked crowded anyway. I agree about places to sit and in the shade. I noted that the locals brought their food to these benches and parked it there, hogging all the cool spots! I spent my time in the cool of the gift shop and powered down that way. By the time my hunger and fatigue took over, I had put in four hours in the park and two bags of gifts to bring back. The shark aquarium was not worth the pushing, shoving and poor visibility. I had never seen an exhibit of jellyfish, so I spent more time in that cooler, calmer atmosphere (fewer crowds in there too). Every theme park that I have visited, has had one or some of its attractions either under contraction or closed for maintenance. To describe this as a negative is to see the glass as half empty. I must say I loathe crowds, so if I found this park a pleasurable experience, it is because I left my "expectations" in my hotel room and ventured out with "wonder" and "excitement" as my companions. I wish more travelers packed more of their tolerance and patience then shirts and shoes. TIP: The park is slapped onto a side of a mountain (which gives you those fabulous views from the tram), but the hills don't disappear when you touch land again.
Beautiful Place. It is a beautiful place to visit with your family. there are rides such as roller coaster. also the staff there is polite and help you a lot.

aquarium, zoo, thrilling rides, beautiful scenery, awesome value!. Never thought I'd visit an amusement park in a foreign country, but I'm glad to have experienced this one! Where else can you see panda bears, sharks, and ride a roller coaster on a cliff overlooking the sea all in one place? Our 3 teenagers quite enjoyed it and went again the next day. It was a Friday morning when the gates opened and we experienced no waiting time at all. We headed straight to the cable cars to do the big rides over the mountain where it was empty. We even rode on the same rides over and over again due to no lines. When we were finished with the rides around noon, we headed back to the first mountain to visit the zoo and the aquarium where the crowd factor wasn't an issue. When we purchased our tickets at our hotel, they had a promotion for a free extra day, so the kids went again the next day. This time at about 4:00 pm, Saturday. Again, another great experience!

Overcrowded!!! Forget it!!!. We were attracted by the giant panda, the acquarium, the games... We spent more than 40 euros in a "normal" Monday and we could not make almost anything!! The normal waiting time to every attraction (aquarium included) was between 60 to 120 minutes. The site was so crowded that you could hardly walk. The logistic of the site (with cable car, trains, escalators) was so poor that you can loose hours just trying to reach an attraction or another. We could not see the dolphins show because the teather (more than 1000 seats) was completely full one hour before the geginning of the show. Two thinghs at least were positive: the giant panda and the fantastic sight over the HK bay from the cable car.

Great day out!. This was my second visit. The park is in two parts and you get to the second part by fabulous cable car ride with great views. They are building a new roller coaster but there's still plenty of other rides. It was busy and there were the usual queues. We love the aquarium and the PANDAS! No metro to park as yet but plenty of buses go there from Exchange Square or taxi from central isn't too expensive.

It's okay. Once is enough.. Maybe it's my expectation level. Maybe it's because I have been to nicer and newer theme parks and aquariums. Somehow, Ocean Park didn't quite measure up to my expectations.The rides are rather old. Maybe I feel that way because I had just visited Universal Studios Singapore which is spanking new.The animal exhibits like the aquarium pale in comparison to big aquariums like the Melbourne one.What won me over was the GIANT and RED PANDA exhibits. Adorable to no end, they put the sparkle into my visit. The dolphin, sea lion and bird shows weren't too bad. It was nice and entertaining.All in all, I'd say it is an average place to visit. Don't expect very new and exciting rides. Don't expect to see big and varied animal exhibits. Pick a season when the sun isnt scorching hot and the heat is giving you a headache. Go on a Monday, there really aren't as much queues (We didn't have to queue for any of the rides!)Hope you have fun at Ocean Park!

Don't bother. Long queues, poor signages, not worth it. Visiting this was probably the worst traveling / holiday experiences I have ever had. I went with my husband, our 18 month old and my 68 year old mum. It was unexplicably hot and humid. And worst of all crowded. I mad the grave error of lining up for 45 minutes to get the tickets. We then had to queue and queue for everything. People cut us at the queue at every point. We took a map only to realize it was in Chinese. There was no map in English! From the moment we passed the entrance we had no clue where to start. The signages were very poor. For such a huge park, in fact, it was abysmal. We wanted lunch but Didnt see signages for any restaurant. We saw a family with a mcdonalds bag but their directions didn't help, we couldn't find it. The only thing we enjoyed here was the view from the cable car ride up. We left the park without seeing even ONE attraction. Because of the queues. If you don't have older people and kids, and have an incredible stamina, monk like patience and desire to get sun burnt, then go. If not don't bother. Instead go to Disneyland, which was wonderful. D read my review on that.

Need a limit on the people they let in. Me and my partner had such a horrible experience at Ocean World. Was way too crowded for a Tuesday. We had to wait in line for 1-2hours per ride which meant we only got to go on a few rides throughout the day. On top of that, we found the other patrons at the park some of the most rudest people ever encountered - pushing in every chance they get. When complained to park staff about this, they simply ignored us. Food is nothing special, attractions are nothing special either.

Great Panda's and good marine exhibition.. Ocean park..... Okay big amusement park combined with best seen panda centre including red pandas... Best I have seen through China. As with most amusement sights in china, expect to queue and queue even to get food at lunch. Easy to get to from Hong Kong central. If you don't have children but like Panda's and marine exhibitions then go along. Value for money is still there.

Too hot, too crowded but awesome pandas!. Long queues for everything except the animals which was the best bit. We were there for giant panda and red panda feeding time. Totally awesome. And it's air-conditioned in there. My 6YO started crying about 1 hr into the visit as he was too hot. Not enough indoor cool spaces. The animal stuff was awesome so that turned around another potentially catastrophic visit.

Too crowded. I visited ocean park on a Wednesday butI did not expect such a crowd. The bus from the metro station to the park was convinient but was crowded with people. The rides were good but there was a crazy 1-2 hour queue for each and every ride. The cable car ride was beautiful but again, too much crowd. The park is vast but there were so many people that we were fed up and left after 3 rides. No exaggeration but there was a 3-4 hour queue for McDonald's during lunch time.The only good thing was that we saw the giant panda. Easily avoidable, but go there if you have to. If you do go, make sure you carry an umbrella because we forgot and all of us got a tan!

Don't miss this attraction!. I loved this attraction- incredible value. There are rides, aquarium, zoo, pandas & gondola ride. I recommend you go backwards through the park to avoid long lineups. (There's a gondola ride that most people take to the other side of the park- I would take the metro thing up and gondola back.) I found the souvenirs well priced and there were many places to pick up food. If you need sunblock- make sure you bring it with you! (They looked at me like I was nuts when I asked for sunblock. We ended up buying sun-brellas.)
Good place to visit...but once is enough. Very big park with many attractions....but queue too long.....

Excellent rides and panda viewing. This is a one of its kind theme park divided into two sections and believe me the upper section or the hill was so much fun - as it houses all the rides we tried the mind train(roller costar), and 2-3 more rides but the disappointing part was that we could not do all the rides as there was a waiting period of 1 hour+ for each ride, nevertheless it was fun the dolphin show is also a must and please reach there before time as they close the gates 15 min before the show startsthere were two ways to reach the upper level and we chose the oceans express wile going up and the cable car while coming down also there is a show where people were diving into water from platforms on the lower level which was great, besides that we saw panda's there and there was a hot air balloon ride too over all it was a great experienceP.S- avoid going there on a Sunday as it is too crowded on that day

Can be a much better fun if not for the 1-2 hours queue at each ride!. Went with my sister on a Saturday morning.Although it's summer holiday in Hong Kong, and knowing that it's a Saturday, I was expecting a good crowd, but did not expect a crazy 1 to 2 hours queue at each ride! Did not have that much of fun as I did with Universal Studios Singapore, due to the badly organized queue which was all under the sun without shelters. And with too many inconsiderate people with umbrellas and who does not watch where they are swinging it at, I was really disappointed.But I guessed, as a theme park, they are able to provide a good variety of fun, so I rate it an average, but I would not go back again.

Not worth the time. The weather was pretty hot and humid when I went so that spoilt my mood in looking around the park. That was nothing really very fascinating. I seen better theme parks. We didn't watch the animal show even though we are 1hr early! So, you have to really be 1.5hrs ahead of show timing if you want a seat! I think it's filled up with tour buses.

Great and fun attraction park/zoo for kids & adults. If you like animals and have fun at the same time, this park is for you! It's very close to the city center and you can get there by bus. Entrance is not that cheap, but reasonable.The park has 2 areas: one downstairs with the animals (even pandas!!) - one upstairs with the attractions for kids and adults and a huge aquarium. Some attractions have water, so if you go there on a sunny day it's great!I've been there with a group of friends and we had a blast!!! If you do not like the heat, get there in the afternoon after 4.No need to bring food and drinks, everything is there!

Great to see pandas. Ocean Park is great fun and a great place to see pandas. The cable-car provides cool views and the rides are pretty fun with a variety available for all ages/ thrill-levels. Everything is included in the entrance price which is good (only souvenirs and food at own expense). Very crowded though and queues can vary so advise to get there early. Also there is not a lot of shady spots if going in the summer - sun is very intense due to being on a mountain!

A Tourist Looting Place!. Though the attractions are good, the cost of food, beverages and souvenirs inside the Ocean Park are too much! They charge anywhere between 3 to 5 times the cost of the items. During holidays, there are long ques for every counter - if it is in Summer, it is frustrating.

Excellent attractions but HOT and CROWDED in August. I did this with my 4 year old son, while the attractions are excellent....it is HOT, summer sun combined with loads of people made it a very tiring afternoon. I would certainly recommend the effort but go prepared if you are going with small kids. Plenty of snacks (the food on offer is pretty bad), water (as already mentioned it is HOT), go early to avoid the crowds and be prepared for them to walk some distance (or for you to carry them).

Amazing....experience yourself once in a lifetime. Ocean Park is an amusement park with ocean life, and i bet you will get lost if you are first time visitor to the place. The cable car ride atop the ocean & mountain is amazing and to get its full effect, it is better to use it while coming down from upper part of the island. Spare one day for this place and you will not regret. The panda, dolphin & sea lion show is amazing. The different fishes in its aquarium is breath taking. The rides are superb. There is a ride called The abyss which gives you the experience of free fall. Food options are limited and water is much more costlier here than local market. At night, the different colored musical fountains are beautiful to watch after a tiring day. You will spend 2-3 hours walking around. The people here are more friendly & helpful. The choice of food is limited to 2-3 items for a strict vegetarian. There is a McDonalds near Dragon ride, but only veg item is french fries.

Surprisingly good - and well worth a visit. I am not a fan of park rides and initially wasn't going to go on this outing, but the kids checked the internet and said us "olds" would really like it there, so off we went. We were going to catch the shuttle but ended getting a taxi (needed 2 for the 7 of us), and glad we did. The taxi took the scenic route from the hotel - a little fast to take any photos, but a very interesting trip. We arrived early and found out they didn't open till 10.00 - it was then an almighty rush to get in the gates - if you go to any asian countries you will find they always jostle to get to the front and get there first!!!!The first exhibit we went into was the aquarium and it was fantastic there is no other word. It contained all manner of sea life, was very well set up so that everyone could see everything (even though there were a lot of people there) - all ponds were well marked so you knew exactly what you were looking at.Next was the Panda enclosure - the two that were in there were playing coy, but we did manage to get quite a good look at them after a short wait.It was an extremely hot day when we were there o stopped for a cold drink and to allow our 14 month old grand daughter to have a nap before continuing on.We took our grand daughter on a little kiddies ride which she totally loved and also in a water game, not sure if she or her Mum and Dad enjoyed that more!We then decided to take the cable car to see the remainder of the Park. We didn't realise then that the rest of the park was actually on the other side of the mountain and really "around the corner". Got onto the Cable Car and it was a fantastic trip - there are around 240 cars taking you the 1.5 ks to the other side - it was a little scary when the cable cars stopped mid stream.By the time we got there we were all starving so elected for a quick bite before exploring - just the traditional chinese type food. The kid wanted to go on a couple of rides - us adults weren't all that interested, so we waited at the end for them. The wait for almost all the rides was at least 40 minutes which is a bit long in the heat of Hong Kong, but at least they were free, so I guess not worth complaining.This part of the park is literally on the side of the mountain and there are huge escalators to get you up and down the mountains (thankfully!!!), so we had a bit of a look around whilst we were waiting. We also saw a reasonably large monitor lizard and I am sure there are heaps of them wandering around. Next was the roller coaster and again around a 40 minute wait, but where we needed to wait gave us a fantastic view back to Aberdeen and the Harbour there and also out to some outlying islands - great photo opportunities!We had been at the park for quite a few hours and were going to head back when we realised there was another very large aquarium with seals, so stopped to investigate that and saw a show as well, which was really good.By now it was getting near to the last cable car back down the mountain - two of our party had gone off to find another ride so we arranged to meet them at the cable station - we almost missed the last car!The view back down the mountain was sensational and also gave a great view over that side of the Park as well.So despite the fact that initially I didn't want to go, I had an enjoyable day and glad the kids convinced me to go.

great park. We have been to Disney World, Disney Land and we rated the Ocean Park as a good attraction. Though we may not use Disney World as a comparison, Ocean Park is a little treasure that every family will enjoy. There are a lot to see and make sure you will get on the Tramway and scare the daylight out of your life as you look down below and only see trees and no ground. Great park to visit when you are in HK.

Disappointing. I had visited Ocean Park back in the late 1980s when I was a child and was really thrilled to be returning for the first time since then. The park has certainly got bigger and has got more animal attractions, more restaurants and more rides but overall I felt let down and disappointed.We had read on the foruums that it was best not to go on the weekend and to go early so we left very early and went on a weekday. However getting a bus from Admiralty was a joke - the queue literally went right out of the bus station and round two street corners! So we got a taxi instead. When we entered the park it was packed and it was very hot. Standing in lines for up to two hours with small children in sweltering heat isn't fun! It would be great if there were some cool, airconditioned, places on the summit side of the park but there are very few, if any, so park visitors are left to melt in the heat. The Panda enclosure (waterfront side) is great because it is nicely cooled - ironically the owners of Ocean Park care more about the comfort of the pandas than about the comfort of the park's paying visitors!However, the biggest travesty about Ocean Park is that Waterworld was bulldozed to facilitate the expansion of the Waterfront. Waterworld was a series of open-air swimming pools and slides and was great fun and a great way to stay cool in the hot weather. For some inexplicable reason, this amazing resource was scrapped and what has replaced it is a pale shadow of what was there before.I'm sure many first-time visitors to Ocean Park will enjoy themselves. But as someone who visited when it was in co-existance with the wonderful Waterworld, I cannot help but feel sad and disappointed that shortsightedness prevailed leaving a park that really is not as good as the Ocean Park / Waterworld I visited as a child in the late 1980s

Never go during summer holidays!. We went on a Wednesday. It was hot and humid. The crowds were phenomenal, staff had no control over the mainland chinese guests who insisted on opening umbrellas in narrow winding queues, poking people in the eye and trying to jump queue at every possible opportunity. Inside the animal exhibits, people were shouting and shoving to get to the front. We could not get in to see the main dolphin show as it was completely fullup despite having many sessions. Queues for rides took over an hour and a half. There are not enough places for people to sit and rest, we ended up eating our lunch sitting on the curb roadside cos there were inadequate tables. Although there were things we still wanted to see, by 4pm, we just couldn't wait to get out..

Enormous waste of time and money!. We visited Ocean Park our frst day in Hong Kong, having read good reviews. I fail to understand how anyone can rate this park highly!The que to get in wasnt too bad, but the place is so busy and badly planned that in 7 hours we went on 2 rides and spent 20 mins wandering around a mediocre aquarium. There were people everywhere and enormous queues for everything, in particular the cable cars.. Distance between all the attractions was enormous and signposting terrible - having spend 5 hours walking around in incredible heat, and the other two queueing for the river rapids (which lasted barely 1 min) this is a definitely a place to be missed -do not waste your time! I have been to many theme parks and many aquatic centres across the workd and this is undoubtedly the worst of them all!

Simply amazing!. Sea jellies, sea lions, and pandas are just among the many animals you can see at the Ocean Park. A lot of attractions, great selection of restaurants and food stalls, and doplphin/ sea lions show round up this great place in Hong Kong.You can move from the lower to the upper part of the park and viceversa by taking the underground Ocean Express or the cable car. The cable car is my personal favourite since you enjoy a breathtaking view on Hong Kong islands from there.I planned to stay only few hours at the Ocean park, but ended up spending my whole day there....

Super entertainment park. Ocean park is one of the older theme park in HK, however, with kids who are under 10 years and personally interested in rides, this place is THE place to go in HK. Kids love this place as there is many different things they can do. The park is over 2 levels. The lower level has shows and rides for kids. The new aquarium is a great attraction along with the panda. Reaching the upper level is through cable car and an breathtaking journey. Its about 2 km long and takes 8 minutes. View is excellent. The upper level and some of the most thrilling rides. The abyss, mine train as really scary. People with light heart should not take it. Flash is equally risky. In terms of stuff for kids, the dolphin show should not be missed. 5 dolphins and the syncing between them in a must see. Finally, dont miss the light, fire, water show at the end of the day at lower level. This is really nice. Quick suggestions: There is no water fountain and water is priced expensive. Carry water if you need lots of it. Also, like any other theme park, be ready to walk a lot and stand in queue. Overall, I have been there twice and still not experienced all rides. Ideal to take the annual pass if you live in HK.

Thrilling, Adrenaline Rushing RIDES!. I've been here 3 times already and I've never tried all of their rides--sorry, but I'm scared!-- the rides are good for adults but there are for kids too--especially the aquarium and the dolphin show.
