So it is really worth visiting.The rides goes extreme like revolving 360 degrees, etc. just check their website... :) Anyway, if you will ask if Ocean Park or Disneyland, I'll say first--> BOTH, since they both have their own charm. but if you don't have the budget and the time, Go for Ocean Park.. It is bigger, more excitement (as there are a lot of extreme rides) and that it is a jack of all trades since it is both for adults and for children.However, it is only until 5pm so there are no fireworks like disneyland--> but who cares about fireworks if you want excitementGoing here is easy, you can ride the 629 bus from Admiralty station --> it will go directly to ocean park.Foods are not allowed inside, they are checking it but I don't know why they did not check my bag full of chips and water! haha!And... don't go here when it is summer in HK, IT IS REALLY HOT, unless you love the sun. go for it. One of my visit in May, I ended up going under a tree near to the eating area and stayed there for awhile. I suggest going here in winter so you will enjoy it better since there is no sweaty, tiring feeling when you are under the sunAnyway, this is all I can say, hope it helps!

Good unique getaway. Nicely themed amusement park on the seaside has got a quite a few attractions.Things to plan while visiting the park.1) Go early - the park is divided in two halves and is quite spread across so will take time2) Check for discounts - if you have been to other places like Peak Tram , Disneyland etc - retain the tickets , you might get a discount even if that's not advertised (I got 25 HKD off for peak tram ticket)2) Prioritize the rides - lots of options, some awesome, some good , some miss able - get a map and check what you want to do 1st . 3) Check out the various eateries on the park 1st on map- depends on your tastes some might appeal some not - every kind of food is not available at all the places.5) Check the show timings for the aquatic show - you will not want to miss it.

Wonderful attraction for family with children. Ocean Park, located at the southern coast of HK Island, was a short taxi trip from our hotel in Kowloon. Admission Fee: HKD 280 for adults, half price for children age 3 and above. Enjoyed the spectacular views of marine life at the Grand Aquarium, in particular the Manta Rays and Sharks gliding above one's head. The Panda Habitat was not as impressive, with only one Giant Panda present when we visited. Then we took the scenic 20-min. Cable Car ride up to the nearby mountain. The Rapids Descent Ride was fun -- be prepared for a wet experience from the sprays and also from playful adults using water cannons to shoot each other! The Dolphin Show was fairly standard, apart from the inclusion of Sea Lions. Be there early to secure the shady seats! And we found it convenient to patronize the food stalls located right at the Dolphin Show. Finally, we visited the interesting Chinese Sturgeon exhibit, where the air-conditioning provided a welcome respite from the hot sun. All in all, we rate Ocean Park a "must-see" attraction and a good alternative to the HK Disneyland, esp. for families with children.

Pandas were great...cable car ride fun.... We went to Ocean Park primarily to see the Pandas and my hubby wanted to ride the rollercoaster We arrived as soon as the park opened, caught the 107 bus from Hung Hom and were there in about 20 minutes. We waited in line for the cable car to the other side of the park for over an hour but it was worth the wait, the views were amazing. On arrival to the "theme park" side of the park we quickly got in a couple of rides before the lines got too long. The Mine Train Rollercoaster was fun for the kids but is certainly not a thrill ride. Then we did the River Rapids and got really wet which was great because it was so hot. By the time we had done these two rides it was about 1pm so we quickly had some lunch and went in search of the Dragon Rollercoaster which is the only reason my hubby came. Found it....closed for maintenance until 4pm and it was only 2pm. The kids were starting to wane by this time so we filled them with isotonic water and did the pirate ship, an oldy but a good ride for the kids. It was so crowded and hot that we decided to give the rollercoaster a miss and go back down to see the Pandas. No lines for the cable car on the way back so a quick trip and an ice cream and then straight to the Panda enclosure. We arrived at the perfect time and were right at the front waiting for the Pandas to come back out and we were not disappointed. The only annoying feature of this is that so many people were using the flash on their cameras, it really takes away from the whole experience.We dropped into the aquarium on the way out...this would be absolutely wonderful if they actually could limit the number of people in there. It was just so crowded that we ended up just walking straight through without seeing anything because there were so many people at every window you could not see anything and yes...you guessed it...they were using their flash again.Though it was really crowded, the lines were long and it was hot, hot, hot....the kids say that this was the best day out that we had in Hong Kong. Well worth the visit for the kids.

Definitely worth the visit. Ocean Park, Hong Kong is definitely worth a visit for young and old.Allow a FULL day, pick up a map at the entrance.General admission price is value for the attractions it includes.Popular attractions include a wild rapids ride through a rainforest, pandas, cable car, submarine-style train, neon-lit sea jellies ...Other special venue/activity prices could prove a bit steep for families, but there is plenty to do and see for the general admission price.Take a camera - fantastic South China Sea and shipping views from the cable car and elevated areas of the park, and plenty of opportunity to photograph favourite wildlife.Sun and rain protection are also recommended, as are shoes suitable for navigating slopes and escalators, queuing and traversing this sizeable theme park.

Unbeliveable behavior of the employees at the Mcdonalds. Not sure how I should react to the behavior I have experienced at the McDonalds food stand at the peak of the Ocean Park. My family along with a nephew and a niece visited Ocean Park on July 13; we were at the summit area waiting in line to purchase food at the McDonalds food stall. There were many big red umbrellas providing shade for people who are lining up to purchase food. I was there waiting to purchase ice cream cone for the kids. As the weather forecasted for the day called for frequent heavy rain, the sunny sky suddenly turned into cloudy, and the heavy rain soon followed. At the point when I reached to the register to get the ice cream cones, the heavy rain started to fall. People at the waiting line are scrambled and squeezed closer under the red umbrella. My wife and my 10 years old son and the 5 years old nephew were among the crowd hiding from the rain under one of those read umbrella, they were waiting for the ice cream cones that I just purchased at a price that are 4 times more expensive than that in the city. After I passed the ice cone to them, I noticed that a worker from McDonalds holding an umbrella came out and started to close all of the Red umbrella while people are still hiding from the rain under it. After she had closed all of the umbrella and forced out all the people to other place to hide from the rain, she moved on to closed the last umbrella of which my wife, my son and my nephew was under it, having the ice cream cone that we just purchased. She told my wife to get away from there and go hide somewhere else. I was really mad and amazed about what and why the workers at the McDonalds would do such a thing. It seems the park is not that courteous to provide rain shelter for the visitor, not sure if they are there trying to sell more rain coat or not. I would expect the park is there to provide a fun and enjoyable experience for the visitor, but the behavior I have observed gave me a displeasure experience. Coincidently, the ocean park worker at the game stand across the McDonalds started yelling “Get you rain coat for $49 here, we have rain coat available!!!"Overall, the Ocean Park is a fun place to visit, but the place does not provide enough facilities and areas for visitor to deal with the rainy weather. There are not many areas in the park that the visitors can hide from the rain. Even the food court area do not have a rain proof roof, you will have water leak while you are sitting at the table trying to enjoy the expensive foods.

Crowded but good day out. I had visited Ocean Park over 20 years ago and expected it to have changed. I also expected it to be busy so we made every effort to get there early and in fact arrived about half an hour before the park opened. We took the bus from Admiralty and bought our park tickets at Admiralty which worked fine. We decided to do the rides part of the park first and headed off on the cable car which is worth doing just for the view. As we went on our first ride the heavens opened and we got absolutely soaked with rain. What I hadn't expected was that if it rained some of the rides closed. We bought hot dogs for lunch but there wasn't a huge amount of choice apart from fast food. The area for lunch was very crowded but we did find a table which we shared with a party from mainland China. We then went back to the lower part of the site which is more like an upmarket zoo. The pandas were great and so were the goldfish display and the large aquarium.

Good but very looooong queues........ The queues were terrible.......very long queues.....but I guess I think it was school holidays and soo it was packed....the panda display and the cable car were worth the wait......much more suitable for teenagers than disneyland....Would recommend it but try not to go during school holidays......

A park of two halves... one great.... ...one terrible.Its hard to write a review of a place that in one day provided some of the highlights AND lowlights of a trvel destination. Ocean park is like that... the park is plit into two halves, one, the entrance side, is chock full of natural attractions, panda bears, aviaries, an amazing aquarium and wonderful nature walks along with good food, some great shows (a high diving show - wonderful!) and lots of childresn attractions (though these are of a lesse quality). The other side of the park, an amazing cable car ride away, is really a world apart. A series of second rate county fair type attractions like a small ferris wheel or a terror drop, but totally over-crowded and to spread out, involving long treks int the heat between them and LONG queues. (and really, the rides are not the type to appeal to a theme park junkie -- I like my adrenaline rides - but this was no 6 flags...) We may also have visited on abusy day as the queues were ridiculous and a lot of the facilities were overloaded such as overflowing toilets and sold out stalls etc.My advice would be to spend the day on the nature side. Seeing pandas up close and the wonderful aquarium and shows could take all day when you know the other side is not really worth it (apart from the cable car there and back - great, and a lovely seal exhibition where you can see them above AND below water).So definately worth a visit to see the nature based activities and a great cable car - but dont cut your visit to the entrance side short thinking you're missing out on the other side of the park - you're not.

Pandas or Cable Car .... The panda display was fantastic and worth the wait, but expect to be pushed around as others scramble for a better view. Flash photography was supposed to be a no no however many did flash - annoying.Scenic views from the cable car ride are well worth the small wait in the queue.A park for both the young, lower park for small children, and older, with the upper park for the teenagers. Something for everyone. We saw the dolphin show and were disappointed, as there is no comparison to Sea World in San Diego or Sea World in Gold Coast of Australia both are world class and Ocean Park was mediocre at best.Worth the visit - only if you have time to spare.

Very busy, long lines, need to go more than once.. We have been to Ocean Park twice now and have bought a yearly pass - we live in Hong Kong. Both times we arrived when it opened and the crowds are huge even then. We spent all day there and only had 3 rides, the lines are up to 2 hours long and most rides only last 1-2 minutes. The pandas are great to see. If possible go during winter and during the week. Also pack food and drinks, the line up to McDonalds was about 100 meters long. if only in Hong Kong for a short stay I would give this park a miss, it can be a day wasted in lines and it is not one of the best fun parks in the world.

I love the cable car!. We spent an entire day here at the ocean park. We didn't have the chance to get in the rides but I really enjoyed the 8minute cable car ride. It's kinda scary but you will forget all of your fears and worries because of the very nice scenery. There were also a big air balloon but we were not able to ride it, too bad. Do not also forget to watch the dolphin and see lion show!! We were so tired of walking around but it was so fun!

Nice place.... Been here during my 1st trip to HK 2 years back. Nice ride up on the steep escalator then an amazing cable car ride down. A lot of attractions to see. The marine aquarium and the panda bears are fantastic. Good facilities and place is well maintained. Great place to bring along young kids, they'll love it! And you need an entire day to see everything.

Went for the giant pandas...the rides were more interesting. A friend from Hong Kong had suggested that I go to Ocean Park to see the giant pandas. That part of the visit was ruined by the behaviour of all the people who don't understand that no flash means just that or that any of the other rules should also apply to them. An An and Jin Jin, the two pandas lent by the PRC seemed very bored by the whole affair and by the behaviour of their compatriots. The rest of the park was well-done attraction park fare but the ecological message seemed to clash with the more commercial aspects. This is no Singapore Zoo, but would still be a fun time for a family or group of friends.

Second eate amusement park in a great location. We went to Ocean Park mid week thinking it would be quieter, but was packed. A cross between sea world and a general amusement park, we found ourselves in long queues for basic rides like the Ferris Wheel and for shows that were mainly in Cantonese. Comapred to Disneyland, this is not worth the effort.

Nice park in Hong Kong. We had a great family visit to Ocean Park. The rides and exhbits were great. The dolphin show was great along with the divers. We took the bus from central pier. Look for bus 629. It is very hard to find. My only recommendation is to skip the rapid ride. I have been on many and this was not that good.
excellent day out with friends. nice park with lots to see, well worth the price!Downside: super hot in day time!
best theme park!!! :). more adult rides than Disney theme park. scarier rides!!!

My family had lots of fun!. Went to Oceanpark with the whole family and we had a blast!We were able to see the panda feeding, dolphin and sea lion show, bird show, the sky fair and try most of the rides. One day isn't enough to see and try everything! Had a little schedule of where to go around the park so we can see all the shows and make the most of our time. Very nice experience - great for all ages.

Good but Humid!!. Had gone to the park on a Sunny June day. It was terribly hot and humid. You can take an MTR to Admiralty and 629 bus will take you directly to the park entrance. Overall park is very good. One can see Pandas here (which were sleeping all the time). The cable car ride was enjoyable with awesome view.Aquarium was ok.

One of my favourite attractions in Hong Kong!. (I posted this initially as a reply to someone on the forum, but I thought it might help someone who doesn't go on there)On our first trip, when we asked a couple of young adults (Hongkongers) whether we should go Disneyland or Ocean Park, they first said both. But when we pressed further for only one, they all said Ocean Park in unison. It is very much a Hong Kong landmark.There are not only rides but also animal conservation messages in the form of enclosures and the animal show. Animals being cooped up makes me sad though.My favourite rides has to be the Mine Train (roller coaster). I'm not a fan of roller coasters, but this was incredibly fun (I close my eyes and scream in absolute fear) and everyone who took it love it! You can see the joy on their faces after the ride. Tip: take the underground train (Ocean Express) located within the park to get to the hilltop rides first thing you arrive in the morning. You can go see the pandas first at the enclosure nearby of course. There are less people and you have more energy to take the rides. Once you are done, take the cable car ride back down to the waterfront where there are numerous attractions (panda enclosures, aquarium, kiddie rides) as well. This way, you avoid the insane crowd (many of them tour groups) that surge to the hilltop rides later in the day. Just look at the cable car queue when you arrive back at the waterfront to know how insane it can be.They disallow food to be brought in, but we managed to smuggle in some.Lots of stairs.

Excellent Animal Displays. We spent a morning at Ocean Park mainly because i wanted to see the Panda's of which we got to see four- bonus! The animal exhibits were amazing, clean, large and well laid out. I particularly liked the Panda's and the Jellyfish displays. The queues were not too long but I must admit i didnt enjoy the aquarium as there seemed to be an incredible amount of people jammed in there pushing and shoving so we only did a quick tour of it and were glad to be out. The cable car was ummm interesting with a disturbing amount of creaking and cracking. My husband however reassured me by saying "Dont worry the fall wont kill you... You will drown when it rolls down the hill into the water" but we made it over and back in one piece and got some great photos in the process. We had a nice lunch at The Bayview Restaurant. We really enjoyed Ocean Park but be prepared to do ALOT of walking and for some reason most of it seemed to be uphill lol...

good value. we spent 1 day at ocean park with our 2 children we all had a good time started with the cable car to the top and worked back rides were okey and as we were there early did not have to wait long plenty of places to eat clean wash rooms new areas still being built enjoyed feeding time at the seals complex and the pandas not far from our hotel 10 minuite drive by taxi

Great for teens but not really for young children. My 3rd visit to ocean park. Through the years, the park has expanded a lot, and there are significant improvements. Rides are targeted towards teens and adults, so it might not be as exciting for young children.This is my children's 2nd visit, so we skip most of the shows other than one which was noted "fun for kids". We were expecting some animals, but it just involved clowns and mascot presented in a mix of Cantonese and English. Although we understand Cantonese, we didn't enjoy it.

Incredible value: Arrive early for panda viewing. Ocean Park is an exceptional whole family experience. Our group varied in age from 6 to 50+ and all were entertained well for a whole day out. Tips:Buy your tickets down the MTR for 10% discount.There is a LOT of walking involved so it pays to start by grabbing a map and planning your route - the signposting could be improved! Drink lots if you go during an extreme heat warning day. Go early before the tour groups - start out in the morning so you don't experience the nasty crowds (and its cooler!)Ocean Park has undergone a redevelopment over the last few years and new displays are more eco-friendly in approach. Start with the pandas in the outdoor enclosure for a truly moving experience. The aquarium and goldfish display are also excellent, as are the jellyfish (though they are tricky to find).Food is average but its probably hard to accommodate all tastes. Prices seemed reasonable. You can bring in your own and no one searched our bags (unlike Disney).Lots of reviewers seem to draw comparisons between Disneyland and OP. I don't think its a fair comparison. This park was the highlight of my entire HK trip, as its REAL. If you want an 'amusement park' please go to one. We only did one ride at OP; the Raging Rapids, which had us soaked and laughing for the next hour. People who complain about the price should try adding up the likely cost of all the rides, gondolas etc they go on. If you went on a gondola or to an aquarium in US or NZ you would pay at least 2/3 the total price for a day at OP all inclusive, so in my books its exceptional value, despite us not doing most rides.Would I return? Absolutely.

An Amazing. In my opinion Ocean Park in Hong Kong is most important attraction. The Park has a lot to offer. There are a lot varieties of fish and sea creatures. Apart from this It has a pair of Pandas, Crocodile and a Chinese Giant Salamander. The park is situated in two parts and the transportation between two is arranged through cable car or train. There are quite a few rides and one can enjoy hot air ballooning as well. Well, no one should miss half an hour dolfin show, it is the most amazing show I have ever seen. Consider all these different things, one needs a whole day to enjoy the ocean park. The ticket for one person is 250 HK Dollars. In my opinion no one should miss it if you happen to visit Hong Kong.

Say hello to the Panda. The Ocean Park is a must visit when in Hong Kong. Especially the kids. The rides, huge oceanarum and the Panda are special attraction. It also has a ropeway and a train ride which is a must see. Kids will love the Dolphin Show.

The highlight of our trip!. It was sunny, humid and hot and yet we love the cable car ride to the summit. As we are from Asia region too, we dont really have any problem with the weather. The panda village was great and of course the aquarium too. Food and beverage there were much cheaper than Disneyland. And they dont stop and check on our bags as we brought some food and snacks for our baby. The souvenir there are much cheaper than Disneyland too.However, it wasnt that baby-friendly in terms of baby care room, toilets, etc. And most of the rides are made for older children.We were glad we rented the stroller there as it was made to stroll uphill and downhill that our baby enjoyed so much (as it was very airy compared to our Graco stroller). Prepare to walk a lot though.

Wow ! Great Improvement.. Ocean Park is revitalized under the new management. I was here back in 2009 but boy was I really surprise with the pleasant renovations it had undertaken, everything is well landscaped. Do visit the Grand Aquarium , a must see, it beats Sentosa Underwater World !

It's amazing worth seeing. I visit this place after a long time, me and my wife was looking for an exiting day and yes it was more fun and exitement every moment we spent in ocean park.start with photo session at entrance till we came back and have done our lasat photo session in baloon bag.We tried most funrides, climate was perfect for walking and choosing the ride we want, sometime its create more exitement when waiting for a longer time in queue. We both felt that one day in ocean park is not enough but choosing right place and ride make more fun and exitement

Fantastic day out!. Great place to spend the day with friends or family. Very organized, clean, well maintained, friendly staff and all in all a superb experience. Not the biggest roller coasters in the world but still good. The dolphin and sea lion show was amazing.

Better than Disney, Worth a visit, Great Dolphin Show. Ocean Park, is the pick of the two theme parks in Hong Kong. Bigger, spread out, more rides (though, you want real amusement parks, go to the USA), fun cable car ride across the mountain, and subway train ride back.Easy to get to by local bus, we went on a weekday so crowds were smaller, meaning faster times to access rides. The Dolphin show was very well done (I Love Dolphins) with sea lions also taking active part. They had a few roller coasters, the Abyss drop, etc.Also the aquarium was nice with very different and weird fish.Oh, the Fully A/C'ed environment for the huge Panda's they had there was something else too. Those chaps were busy eating their bamboo leaves in Air Conditioned Comfort!!Worth spending a day with the kids.

Everlasting memories. I can still remember how amazing Ocean Park was when I went 9 years ago when I was 6 and I want to go back. It's still worth going to and it was very busy when we went but aren't theme/water parks supposed to be? The dolphins were great at the water park bit and when you go up on the cable cart (if it is still there) you can see the pandas. It was a great family day especially with the rides. If you are travelling to Hong Kong make sure you visit Ocean Park.

Ok But Disney Much Better. Hi all,We went to Ocean Park with high expectations from reviews we had read and to be honest were a little disappointed.. If you into rides you will probably enjoy it better than Disneyland but as far as a family day out there is no discussion Disneyland wins hands down..Things are SOOO spread out at OC and there is alot of walking for very little result the live animals (panda's ect) and the aquarium are very good but unlike disneyland the entry fee does not cover everything this is a arcade type area were each individual game is HK$20 which was disappointing but the biggest disappointment was the food.On recommendation from staff we ate at the Middle Kingdom Restaurant and this would be the worst meal I've had in 7 trips to Hong Kong it was disgusting and the service was nothing short of rude and pathetic so be warned STAY AWAY from this resturant.The closing light show was quite good but once again well short of disneyland.So if your looking for a good fun family day out Disneyland is the place to go but Ocean park is worth a visit..
Very nice. Nice place - a lot things to see and do. The dolphins show is a must, don't miss it.

Too expensive for a non-profit theme park. The entrance fee of HK250 is way too expensive even though this covers all attractions and rides and whay did I say that?! It is because most middle-aged to the elderly folks who go there will never go on these body-twirling rides so they are subsidizing the rest. The Park should have 2 fees - one without rides and the other with rides. On top, the restaurants are atrociously expensive . You will have to pay HK82 for a lunch box (served on a plate), which would have normally cost HK30. Bottled=water is HK16 and there are no drinking fountains anywhere so you would have no choice but to pay up and for this so-called non-profit theme park. The dolphin show also lacks lustre as there are only 4 dolphins and they did not perform many acts either. The attractions were very crowded and the workers seeemd unenthusiastic as well. The only saving grace for my visit was the bathrooms, which were kept relatively clean for the sheer number of people - thank goodness!!By the way, please do something for the poor croc - it really looked pathetic small for the poor reptile!!I cannot say this is any better than Disneyland except for a larger space and more rides...Here you go again, rides..

superb. amazingly fun for everyone!. the trip to ocean park was one of the most fun things i've done anywhere! there is fun for all in the family. not only are there dozens of fun rides, like the crazy roller coaster and the cool eagle, there are also places to see animals, like the giant panda! the 2 things coupled together made it an excellent day out. don't miss it, come here instead of disneyland for sure!

More enjoyable than Disney. This place was much bigger than Disney, and with the number of people entering these parks, Ocean Park certainly is better to accomodate to prevent overcrowding. We spent almost the whole day there including my mother who has a bad knee, and yet she's not complaining as she has plenty of rests in between.Some of the attractions can have long queues (like the water raft), so if you can, attend those ones earlier in your trip.The cable car trip back was kinda scary (due to the heights) but it's one of the best, enjoying the sceneries around you from the top.

Great fun for older kids - better rides than DisneyLand. I lived in HK and was a teenager when it first opened. It was great then, better now - I could hardly recognise the place. We took our 11 and 9 year old kids - they had a great time and thought it was much better than HK Disneyland (and half the price). Get there early (10am, mid week) and make for the cable car to the top section - the rides will have very small queues. Our kids loved the 2 roller coasters, the Abyss and the water flume.

Disappointed tourist. My friend & I went to visit Ocean Park on April 4, 2001. We went on a Monday, a day before a holiday in Hongkong (April 5th). This is my 3rd time to visit the theme park and was amazed to find more improvements in the park. Everything was organized except that they lacked food stalls, restaurants, etc. to feed the park visitors. We were not able to have lunch and decided to leave earlier than planned, foregoing the park rides. The lines to the less than 6 food stalls were snakelike & the wait was about 45 minutes. The other stalls only sold water & drinks because the hotdogs/fried chicken/sandwiches, etc were sold out. yes, they had hotdogs on display on the stall near the balloon area but it was for display only. the bakery had sweets and most of the bread were sold out, we wanted to eat lunch. By the time we decided to dine at the Jellyfish Restaurant (about 2:30PM), it was closed : (I hope the park management will provide more food stalls or fast food/cafeteria where people have a choice of food & seating areas. I was not able to find the Rialto, maybe I was just too hungry to look for it. Yes, I will come back for another visit but I hope there will be food to eat inside the park since we are not allowed to bring in our own sandwiches or biscuits.

long way to walk!. It's a huge place! spread over high hills on a peninsular, just getting from one attraction to another going up and down escalators and on the cable car takes ages. The attractions are well thought out and all in all for HK$250 each money well spent. Not much in the way of food outlets - taseless fast food. The bus from Admiralty is fast and efficient.

Better if shows were conducted in English. It's a very old attraction and the infrastructure tells its ageI can accept that the shows were conducted in Cantonese (with a bit of English and Manfarin thrown in) but felt it would have catered better to the sizeable foreign visitors had it been contacted in English (and have Cantonese phrases thrown in)Great day out for the whole family young and oldTip: Start with a cable car ride to the summit and make your way down to the waterfront past mid-day. Go for the earliest theatre show (only 1 at summit) and finish the rides while the crowd has yet to arrive. Make your way to the waterfront after lunch and catch the remaining shows and see the giant aquarium before ending the day with the pyrotechnics show late eveningOverall, you get what you paid for and some improvements when renovations are complete should make it even better

Disney vs Ocean Park. If you come to Hong Kong, you must visit Ocean Park and Disneyland. But I think Oceanpark is better than Disney land cause there is alot of Disney world that I've visited and Hong Kong Disney actors are not genuine.The souvenirs are all a repeat and a bit more expensive and the rides are nto as fun as Ocean Park. Must plan where you want to go first cause there is an uphill and the ground area but both are good. And heard there is an upcomign new zone too!

Good day out. We visited on a Tuesday and the park was not very crowded so we did not have to wait too long for any of the attractions. The highlights for us were the Pandas, the aquarium and the jellyfish. You have to be pretty fit to get around as there are a lot of hills to climb so plan your route carefully.Our day was partially spoiled by large groups of very rude elderly Chinese, each group wearing different coloured baseball caps and being led by a person with a flag. They barged their way around the park elbowing you out of the way to see an attraction and conversed by screaming at each other. All in all a good day out and the grandchildren enjoyed it.

Wonderful experience in the park!. We took Star Ferry from Tsim Sha Shui to Central and waited for bus 629 in front of the pier. The bus just took about 20minutes to travel to Ocean Park. We felt amazed with the double cable car system go to the top of park. We enjoyed the fantastic seaview in the cable car. We enjoyed the dolphin and sea lion show. There is a "Giant Panda Adventure" – An impressive purpose-built habitat that houses rare giant pandas, making their first appearance in Hong Kong. Other than that, the viewing dooms for underwater sea creatures really captured our interest.

excellent view from the ropeway trolleys.. The trip with children was excellent, I really liked the pandas, the hot air ballon, dolphine show, the ropeway, the leap of faith, the rollar coaster etc. Its an amazing place. Very very nice ocean park museum, where I could see rarest of the rate fishes, jelys, sea horses and coral reefs. Excellent is one word.

a must see for kids! fun and educational. after a pretty stressful day at disneyland and having to contend with the hordes of people and never-ending lines, ocean park was a welcome attraction. getting there is an absolute breeze. just get off at the admiralty mtr station and signs will point you to the exit leading to the bus stop. there, you'll find a booth where you can buy bus tickets plus park admission tickets, and you can pay with credit card too. the bus comes every few minutes, a big roomy double decker. it's not a really long drive going there, maybe 30 mins or so. i was really surprised when we reached the park. it looked so different from when i was last there around 10 years ago. they seemed to have completely revamped the place -- new decor at the entrance, new landscaping, a man-made pond, and a spanking new grand aquarium. the aquarium was really fun! kids will love seeing the octopuses, manta rays, sharks, crabs, and squid up close. after the aquarium, we also got to see pandas and alligators, a bird show, and a sea lion show. all very kid-friendly attractions. there was a kiddie playground as well that had rides suitable for small tots that my children went crazy over. if you get hungry, there are several restos and cafes scattered around. we had lunch at the panda cafe, which i felt was kinda expensive. souvenir shops also abound, and it will be hard saying no to your kids since the stuffed animals are admittedly just so damn cute. ocean park is divided into two sections that are accessible to each other by cable car. we spent the whole afternoon in the first section alone (the one with the aquarium, animals, and kids' rides) and didn't bother crossing over to the other more adult-oriented side anymore (the one with the crazy roller coasters and everything) since we were with very young children. ocean park is a nice place to visit for the young and young-at-heart. i saw a lot of old tourists from the mainland enjoying the animals (we're talking maybe 60-70 years old here) and the park wasn't as crowded as disneyland. they also make it a point to promote taking care of the animals and the environment, so you really feel a sense of purpose to all the park's activities (as opposed to mere commercialism/profit). do make it a part of your itinerary, if you can.

Impressive aquarium & Giant Panda's. The Park is going through renovations and has more rides coming, but there is already plenty to do. The aquarium is fantastic one of the best I have ever seen, and if you don't snorkel or dive this is a great way to see the underwater world. They also have Giant Panda's and a great display of Gold Fish. Plenty to do for a day visit with a cable car that takes you from one side of the Park to the other. My 80 year old Mum even went on the log ride and the Mine roller coaster. Price was good value for money approx $35aud per adult. Check for seniors rates as in some places you have to be a Hong Kong resident to get the seniors discount but have your pension/seniors card with you.

Exciting for me but not exciting for partner!. Took the MTR & Bus to Ocean park, easy and uncomplicated to get to. Heaps of buses to take you there, one double decker bus comes approx every 2 minutes or so.Atmosphere: Lively, lots of people we went on a monday so there was alot of people but i dare not go on a weekend, you would be queuing up for ages at the attractions. We were basically the only westerners there but most of the staff were able to communicate in english.Food: Limited to junk, very poor, McDonalds was the only thing palatable however you would need to be in the line for at least 15 minutes. Rides: Queuing up for 10- 15 minutes and then the ride is over in less than 1 minute. However exciting whilst youre on them. Be prepared to wait. using the rides is included in the initial price of $250HK per adult.Animals: Definatly go see the Seals, Pandas, Aquarium. We were unable to get into the arena as it was full to capacity. So thumbs down to that, as we were especially looking forward to looking at the dolphins.This park is quiet a trek, so do not even attempt to wear high heels to this park. I saw hundreds of women wearing them and i felt their pain, i was wearing flats and my feet were sore. Also be aware of the disgusting stench for fried/grilled korean squid which wofts around the park, no offence unless you like eating and smelling that! Alot of merchandising shops after each attraction, obviously one of the ploys to get you to spend more money. At $250HK (~33AUD/USD) an adult its a "cheap" (compared to australian attractions which start at $50AUD per adult) day out, quiet fun for me as i went on alot of rides, however my partner was bored and cranky after walking around for 5 hours.

Entertaining and educational. This is a nice park. Don't go on a public holiday or weekend. A mix of an entertainment park and a zoo. A bit underfunded, but very charming for an establishment like this. Forget Disneyland. Ocean Park is worth spending a day (and about 200 HK$ for an adult)

don't waist your life going to crap!. Please don't waist your life by going to this park!Because we arrived queued for 2 1/2 hours to get a cable car to the other side of the park.The cable car was grotty and very crampt and swaded soo much even on the way back when there was no wind!My daughter was crying as she she was soo scared!when we arived half the park was still being built we were the only western people in the hole park! all the rides had 4 hour queues so we queued for another 4 hours to get the cable car home(the last one leaves at 6!)the park train was not working so you had to get the cable car! the only good thing about the park was seeing the giant pandas and red pandas!so yer thats my opinion of it!Also a waist of money as it was soo over priced! the end!

Really enjoyable, teenagers loved the scary rides. We were in Ocean Park in early Jan 2011. We took a taxi as the bus timetables seemed complicated.I suggest you take the cable car to the top part to the park and make your way down. The views are fantastic from the cable car.Don’t miss the Panda Pavilion or the Jelly Spectacular. The waiting or the rides was short and we managed to get on multiple times.Food was expensive and limited to junk.We finished at 5:00 p.m. and had difficulty finding a taxi to take us to TsimShaTsui. It was peak hour and none of the taxis wanted to go there. In the end, we took a taxi to Star Ferry and cross over from there.

Very crowdy place. Ocean park is very good choice to have a rest with a family or friends, but you have to try to go here not in a prime time (weekend and holidays), as there`re so many people that you can stay in a queue for a 30, 40 or more minutes for each side-show!Forever-repeating music you can listen almost everywhere in a park is very annoying after first 15 minutes.If you`re here do not forget visit pavilion with giant pandas!

What an amazing place Ocean Park is!!!. Absolutely loved 'ocean park'- never ever seen anything quite like it! Such an amazing location with the view of the sea, mountains and harbor:-)This place is gigantic with absolutely every ride you can think of! We got to see flamingos and panda bears, hot air balloons, cables cars!If u go to hong kong and do not experience this then u will be sorry!!Loooooooved it! :-)

Fun for all ages. I went to Ocean Park with my two siblings who are 6 years my junior (they're in their mid 20s). I must admit, I didn't expect to have much fun and I even thought we'd be done by midday. We spend the whole day there and still hadn't seen the whole park - it is massive and has so many levels as it's sprawls across the side of a mountain. The park has sealife, wildlife, rides for all levels of adrenalin, fantastic scenery (the cable car was my favourite part). There are cute souvenirs everywhere, better to get them at the end of the day to avoid carrying them around and stuffing them into those trays when you go on rides. Rest assured they are all priced the same and they dont respond to bargaining (darnit).

Must visit. The lacation of park is excellent the rides are fun for both kids and adults.The dolphin show was treat to eyes and all around views are wonderful.More food oulets can be there.This is as good as disneyland and we must visit it

Great day out in Hong Kong. Ocean Park is a must visit for families travelling with children. It is geared up for young and older children and is simply a great day out. The park has the ever famous Giant Pandas and many rides including a hot air balloon one - lots of restuarants and stalls selling a variety of food, popcorn, drinks etc.The cable car from one end of the park to the other is a great experience and the train back is also good. There are rides for smaller children and than the Train mine etc for older kids. The aquarium and dolphin shows are very popular and well organised.All in all a good day spent with family at a great park.

Pandas!!!!!!!!!. We caught the bus from Hong Kong island straight to the park which was very easy. This takes you to the top of the park where the rides were and you can take a cable car to the zoo bit. The views from the park were amazing. We went on a couple of rides but were really there to see the pandas. The pandas were lovely, there are four Giant pandas and a few red pandas. The enclosures are large but not too large that you can't see them. It was a good day out. It might be worth taking a pack lunch - food on site didn't look great so we waited until we got back to Hong Kong island.

Funny pandas. The whole park is quite interesting. There are a lot of animals many of which I have never seen before. I liked pandas the most. One of them was sitting 4-5 meters away from the public, eating bamboo and staring at the people. It was so funny. There were 1 or 2 pandas more but they were sleeping or hidden somewhere. Besides animals there are roller-coaster like attractions and a cable car which transfers people from one part of the park to another. I liked the cable car because of nice views from it. To sum up I recommend visiting Ocean Park but several hours are enough for it.

Don't Bother. Just came back from the park today and sitting in my hotel room writing this. It was over crowded with mainland Chinese tourists who were loud and had no concept of what waiting in line is as they would often push you or try to cut in front of you. The rides were too short and not really worth standing in line for. The best thing about the park is #1) the summit portion of the park where you can have a gorgeous view of the outer islands and beaches. #2) the gold fish display.If you should decide to go to the park anyway, absolutely avoid going to the Terrace Cafe right next to the tram station at the top of the park. DO NOT let the view it offers suck you into eating there. I ate there today and the service was non existent. I had to flag the waiter to query where our food was and when it arrived it was cold as though the food had been left in the kitchen and the staff just didn't bring them out to my table. Would have saved some good money had I just bought some food from a food stand.Did I mention how crowed and stuffy the park was? I'm a Chinese American living in the CA so my perspective maybe different from yours but no matter, you've been warned.

A bit of disappointment. 1) Upon reaching the place at Tai Shue Wan Entrance,it was not too crowded.2) Ocean park tower is a must visit place for tourist and it was quite enjoyable taking the ride.3) The location among the rides are far from each other & looked disorganised.4) The cable car was suspended on my visit due to the strong wind.To make it worst,the Ocean Express Waterfont also was closed for the maintenance. What a bad day.Hence, we had to take the bus to go to the Waterfront.5) The best experience here was to have a closer look at the PANDA.6) At least one day is needed to explore the Ocean Park. If you are a nature lover or adventurous teenagers, this place is for you but not impressive to a family with small kids.My family & I enjoyed our visit at Disneyland than the Ocean Park.

Tiring but definitely fun. You need a whole day to explore this theme park. It is a guarantee that you will see a different landscape of Hong Kong from the cable car. Amusement rides caters to everyone and expect to have an adrenaline rush with some of them. Despite of its name you will not only see creatures from the ocean but also those cute pandas. Since my Mickey Mouse days are over, I enjoy more my visit at Ocean Park than HK Disneyland although I still found Mickey Mouse more cute than Ocean Park's Whiskers.

One day will be more than enough!. Ocean Park's name led me to expect a theme park similar to Wet N Wild on Australia's Gold Coast, but this is more like Sea World.It's an enjoyable day out, but be prepared to walk a lot as the pathways are quite meandering and you often need to retrace your steps to get to the different attractions.The animal exhibits are the clear highlights and the park is worth visiting just for these. The rides and other attractions are merely filler in comparison.The pandas are incredible to watch and the park manages them very well. By cleaning out the enclosures regularly and hiding bits of food, they make sure the pandas stay animated and entertaining for the crowd.The sealions are another highlight, especially at feeding time when for a small fee you can throw pieces of fish to them. Great fun for the kids! The Sea Jelly Spectacular is also well worth a look, although not recommended if you suffer claustrophobia as it gets quite crowded.The admission fee, food and souvenirs are relatively cheap compared to those at Australia's theme parks.The rides are much more teen to adult than those at Hong Kong Disneyland (which is aimed at younger children), with a couple of rollercoasters and other thrill rides, plus the cable car which runs between the upper and lower sections of the park. For those who prefer not to be suspended that high in the air, there is also an enclosed train which runs between the sections.Worth a visit, but one day will be plenty to see everything here.

An awesome experience!. Wow! Ocean park HK is such an amazing experience for both the young ones and the young at heart!!! Its guaranteed worth your money. Went there last December with my husband and though it was raining- it was fun,fun,fun and we enjoyed every moment of it. I will definitely go back to Ocean Park this holiday season (this time with my family).

Educational and Fun!. Ocean Park is one of Hongkong's theme park with strong emphasis on wildlife conservation. They have their own wildlife conservation foundation, guests can support this by giving donation into the box placed strategically in various exhibits and animal shows. BookingBooking a ticket can be done easily online through http://oceanpark.com.hk Tickets are also available for walk-in purchase either at park entrance or at bus 629 stop at Admiralty (accessible via Admiralty MTR exit B along Drake Street outside Lippo Center). Annual pass is also available, but for tourists, 1 day pass is just right. Getting thereThe easiest is to catch Citybus 629 that runs from a bus stop at Admiralty directly to Ocean Park entrance (both main entrance and Tai Shue Wan entrance). It costs HKD10.60 and payable by cash (exact change as bus driver does not give any change) or Octopus Card. Animal ShowsThere are at least 3 animal shows which guests can watch during their visit. The Ocean Theatre shows skillful dolphins playing with their trainers. Sea lions also take part in the shows. Selected guest are chosen to interact with these animals. Show is narrated in both English and Cantonese. Emperor of the Sky is an animal show about birds. Too bad much portion of the show is only narrated in Cantonese so it's hard to catch up on what's going on. Whisker's Theatre shows another sea lion show which is dedicated for little kids. Animal ExhibitsAnimal exhibits are scattered on both lower part (main entrance) and upper part (Tai Shue Wan entrance). In the lower part, one can see Giant Panda exhibit and Amazing Asian Animals is home to more giant pandas, red pandas, goldfish, otters, and a gator (yes, I can only spot 1 gator there, but they do care to put it as an attraction) as well as small bird exhibits next to Emperor of the Sky Theatre. In the upper part, guests can enjoy more marine-life exhibit such as sea lions at Pacific Pier, jelly fish at Sea Jelly Spectacular, sturgeon fish at Yangtze River Expedition, more fishes at Atoll Reef, and some birds at the Aviary. RidesIn the lower part, one can enjoy SkyFair, a balloon ride similar to Characters in Flight at Downtown Disney, Orlando but the admission is inclusive in your ticket, a Sea Life carousel, and bunch of kiddie rides at Wisher's Harbour (Whisker is the name of Ocean Park's sea lion mascot). Thrill rides are located on the upper part. There are 2 coasters: The Dragon and a Mine Train. Another thrill rides including The Abyss Drop Tower, Space Wheel, Raging River flume ride, Flying Swing, a Crazy Galleon, and Flash, the newest pendulum ride. Food & DrinkLots of eateries are scattered throughout the park. There's a McDonald's too at the upper part near all the thrill rides. Pricing might be a bit steep as any other theme park with good portion but quality and taste is quite an issue. Transportation inside the parkYou can use either 6-seater cable car that takes 8 mins to cross between the 2 lands or use a 2-min Ocean Express funicular. Both equally fun and exciting but cable car is more thrilling. ServiceStaff doesn't interact much with guests, so hospitality is not a big item here, but they do the job serving guest adequately. SignageClear signage in English is scattered throughout the park, so one no need to worry about getting lost.

This was a massive disapointment!. Ocean Park was a massive dissapointment.Their website betrays this place to be up and happening. Unfortunately it is not.When we arrived at Ocean Park our group was given pamphlet handouts and maps of the Park. 1 pamphlet was about the upcoming attractions for the park - these are the attractions that might possibly bring everything up to scratch.There are basically two different parts to the Park. The first area (near the main entrance) is where you will find the Pandas and a lot of younger child friendly attractions. If you are a teen or older i would bascillay bypass this area and head towards the upper part of the park.We took the cable cars which in all honesty in quiet a long ride. Nice view over the ocean but when looking over the park you can see a lot of rubish everywhere.The second part of the park is somewhat better but still a great disapointment.The way i would explain it is that it looks like an amusement park had closed down somewhere in the world and Ocean Park had bought all the amusement rides. All rides look old and very outdated (with todays technology i expected more).The park is huge. However you need to walk about 5 minutes or so between each ride. It becomes a tiring day quickly.Overall i actually wouldn't recommend this to anyone (unless you go once they have their new attractions up and running, which includes waterslides etc) Sorry to be blunt but its true.

What a disappointment. We took our 5 year old and 2 year old here in mid October. It was a weekday, and yet still flooded by mainland groups. The pushing and yelling just made the whole trip unpleasant. We were 10 minutes early for the dolphin show and of course all the seats were taken. But people were still pushing and yelling at one another outside the arena trying to catch a glimpse. Ocean Park is also quite barren. Not that many trees to provide shade and we were baking even though it was mid October.The layout of the park is also not very intuitive. The map not very helpful either. The only thing I enjoyed was the jellyfish place because it's just so cool! Would we return? Absolutely not.

My son enjoyed the visit. People are comparing Ocean Park from HK DIsneyland. You can't compare them because they are not offering the same thing. Like what my son said, the experience are entirely different.We took the escalator going up and the cable going down. If you are afraid of heights, you can take the ocean express. It is a short train ride to get from lowland to highland. I liked the view from the ocean park tower. My son enjoyed the dolphin show. He also liked the atoll reef (aquarium) and the panda village. He tried the bungee trampoline and had fun. We were hoping to try the hot air balloon but there was a long queue so we skipped it. They only thing I hate about the place is that the attractions are far from each other. You will definitely get tired from all the walking. So avoid visiting during the summer because it is super hot and humid.

Crowded and dated. We visited in the first week of October - a bad choice. This is the holiday season on the mainland and thousands of tourists pour in for the celebration. All the exhibits had looong queues to get in. Not pleasant with a young child. She felt apprehensive.The dolphin show was enjoyable but no different to the one we saw 30 years ago - possibly not as good,. To get a reasonable seat we had to be there early. Most of the rides are 'white knuckle' rides - also not suitable for a large portion of their target audience. Moving around the park was slow because of the crowds so we were unable to see most of the other special events.We tried to get a taxi home but again a long line waiting for very few cars. Eventually caught a bus and train which was very easy

Disappointing rides and difficult to access park but animals worth a visit. Ocean Park is a place more for a whole family activity with children and it's difficult to cover the whole of the park as one must cover a lot of uphill downhill footwork. It is very tiring after a while and the distance between parks is far and in hidden trails. Also, the rides are disappointing for adults. Maybe kids might find it thrilling though. But there are a lot of animals there that's worth the visit like panda, dolphins, jelly-fish, the aquarium, etc. We ate a an indoor air-conditioned chinese restaurant and it is shocking to find that the price is almost the same as eating burgers outside in the hot sun. I don't know the name of the restaurant though but it's somewhere near the stall games area.

Ocean Park Halloween Bash 2010 is AWESOME. If you are in Hong Kong and enjoy an night of scary halloween fun, Haunted Houses, Ghoulish Monsters that are each and individually a kodak moment then Ocean Park is a must see visit while in Hong Kong. I have visited Halloween events all over the United States and really have not seen an event as outstanding as Ocean Parks Halloween Bash. This Hong Kong park has set the bar haunted event attractions. Every year Ocean Park creates over 500 new signature creatures that ghoulishly greet guests in their haunted themed areas. Guest line up for photos with these creepy kodak moments. The haunted houses are awesome, the attractions are really designed well with effects that really put fun scares into the guest that visit the attractions. Some of the attractions are even interactive and when you leave the attraction you are able to check your score on how many ghosts you captured while in the haunted attraction. Ocean Park Halloween is a Hong Kong locals favorite. The guests from Hong Kong are mad about this place and eagerly anticipate the annual event. The reason the locals like this event so much is because every year the event changes. If you are in Hong Kong and enjoy Halloween I would like to encourage you to visit this outstanding seasonal event!If you are looking for somewhere to stay while in Hong Kong near Ocean Park I would like to suggest L'Hotel Island South. The property is brand new, excellent guest service, and has excellent shuttle service. The hotel provides a free shuttle available to its hotel guest. The shuttle goes to many places inclusive of the train stations Hong Kong and Central, Causeway Bay, Aberdeen Center, Ocean Park and a few other stops. Ask for Alex Chow - Guest Services Manager. Alex is an excellent host and his fellow staff members provide guests with an excellent hotel experience.

Great Park .. Great View .. and Panda's. The view from the park is amazing. And so are the fishes. And the Panda's. And the Sea Lions ..
Some nice rides and a good Dolphin show. Good place to spend the whole day.
They should invest in some western style restaurants aka Disney. Its difficult to find a good place to eat.

must see in HK!. me and my husband enjoyed this place!
lots of rides and the place is just amazing!
quick tip: come early! we were there when they opened.. and left just around noon!
we got all places covered and tried everything!

Good Theme Park but a mass of largely un-managed people. We went to Ocean Park the 2nd week in August. Firtsly the Park is huge now, looks likely possibly even getting bigger. Soon will demand the need for at least 2 days. With the volumes and queues seeing the park even in it's current shape in 1 day is near impossible to enjoy the fullest.1 issue I have with the park is effective queue mangement apart form guide ropes. Queue jumping was ripe meaning the signs for 30 minute waits may mean 50-60 if 1 family line hopper welcomes 3-4 family jumpers. This trick is prevalant in many theme parks bout particularly bad at the OP in times when they are busy.Food is not to bad for price buy the general merchandise is not good at all for price.rain all day.Overall OP is a must do if only to ride the Dragon or the Runnaway Mine train sites of the Island.

Avoid Ocean Park on weekends, school holidays and in hot weather.. Our family's day here was disappointing. We visited on a Saturday in the middle of Hong Kong school holidays on a very hot day. There were huge queues for every ride and very little shade from the sun. We only got to try two rides, which was very disappointing for my kids, but the heat and the long lines were too much. The layout of the park was also challenging, with a never-ending system of escalators that linked the upper and lower levels of Ocean Park. I would not recommend taking children that need a stroller. Our young son refused to walk because of the heat and the distances and the stroller was a nuisance in this uneven terrain.Some things that we liked were the cable cars (a 4 lane highway so not much waiting needed), the aquarium and the wet zone. The pandas would have been good except that only one panda was out of its enclosure and was sitting at the back facing the wall. Travelling to and from Ocean Park from Admiralty station was relatively easy. You can buy a pass into the park at the station near the bus stop, which worked well for us.

If you are visiting Hong Kong, don't miss "Ocean Park". Ocean Park as it sounds is an amusement park build near south china sea/ Pacific ocean or one of its rivers. The good part about Ocean Park is its demography. Its constructed on a hill top. You'll have to take escalators for about 5-6 floors and after each escalator, there's a level which is dedicated to an activity zone. The park has a very high class sky tram which takes you from start point to the main games area through the ride on the ocean. Park has scary rides, fun filled rides for kids and for scary people like me, panda house, mini games stalls, ocean ride, sky rocket (if i call it like this), dolphin show, and many other good places.You will find eating joints which mainly serves oriental food. You cn grab soemthing in your bags before you visit here. The traffic in this place is heavy on weekends but its good fun.Wear your sports shoes or any comfortable pair. Do get something warm to wear as it may get cold in evening.

Good mix of animal attractions and rides. Ocean Park is expansive, so allow a full day and wear some good walking shoes. To get there, we took the MTR to Admiralty station then exit B to Bus 629. Entrance fee was HK250 for an adult and the bus trip was HK10.60. There is a good mix of animal attractions and rides so there should be something for everyone. We thought the panda exhibits were the best. Unfortunately we went on a rainy day and so some of the rides were closed for safety reasons.

If you like uphill hikes and waiting for hours, no shade or seating then this is for you!!. My family and I went to ocean park. We had been told by many that it was a wonderful day out- how wrong! The park is much too spread out, many rides are secluded and are a long walk uphill. Ride queues are in the sun and busy even on a weekday. No seating or shade for any park guests. 1 hour wait for lame water ride. 50 minutes for train ride.No customer service whatsoever. Go to Disneyland!Do yourself a favor & DONT GO!!

excellent trip. It was a wonderful experience for being there.I must recommend this place for adventrous trip.Sporty persons can enjoy this trip alot.All the rides are full of thrill and adventure.And also there is a large options of rides for small childrens also.

An enjoyable place!. My brother and I visited HK Ocean Park on a very hot and humid summer's day. We really enjoyed ourselves here - more because of the setting of the park, cable cars and the variety of animals they have here, than because of the rides themselves (and we love rides)!A very enjoyable day - enjoy!

I love Panda Bears! so this was a MUST SEE for me!. I spent an afternoon at Ocean Park, and as others have mentioned, be aware of which enterance you get dropped off at, i took the bus from Admiralty which was direct, that was nice as it takes over a half hour to get there from Admiralty. there is a lot of walking, which is fine, just be aware and have comfortable shoes on, and of course the humidity in HK is unreal. The highlights for me were the sky tram, amazing views from up there, however i waited in line for well over an hour to get on the tram. The main reason i visited was to see the Giant Pandas, and i was not dissapointed! there are two areas where there are pandas, the Jockey Club where there are three individual areas for three different Pandas, 2 of the three were out and they were adorable. you can get pretty close, and take some great pictures, just no flash, as it disturbs the bears plus you just get a glare on the glass. the 2nd place to see the pandas is the amazing asian animals exhibit, i saw two giant pandas there, very close up. Plus they have red pandas which are just too cute. for me it was well worth going.

Worth a look For the Giant Pandas. Not sure what to think after reading the reveiws but when anyway and made our own way there on the bus which saved us £18 from a tour price.If you are looking for Alton Towers this isnt for you and to be fair the rides are very tame, with the log flume just having one drop and the runaway train the same but the locals go wild!!!The whole park is split into 2 on two hillsides which does mean alot of walking..escalators and the shows are ok if a little bit cheesey.The panda exhibition was great and for us worth the entry alone..think its for more the little ones but we enjoyed it..but beware the locals dont like waiting in lines!!Half day visit is enough

Put on your best shoes and get ready for lots of walking. I took the Ocean Park City bus (HKD10.60 for adults and HKD5.30 for children under 12) from Admiralty MTR station which goes direct to the Ocean Park. You can buy the park ticket when buying the bus tickets too. Note that there are 2 entrances at Ocean Park so you have to know which entrance you are at in order to follow the map. We have difficulty figuring out how to get our way around after entering only to realise later that we are at the Tai Shue Wan entrance. At The Summit, we enjoyed the Raging River ride, Pacific Pier (Seals) & Atoll Reef. We went during off-peak but the park is still very crowded. The gates to the Ocean theatre were closed before showtime as it's full hence we missed the show much to my kids' dismay. Be there early if you wish to catch the show. Rides at the Summit is more apt for older kids while younger kids will enjoy those at The WaterFront (downhill). Long queue for the cable cars although it moves quite fast. Didn't managed to see the 2 Pandas at the Panda Habitat as they are both hiding in their "rooms" when we were there so we can only see them via the CCTV. Would recommend to leave before park close at 6pm in order not to be stuck at traffic jams (since no MTR station within walking distance).There's something for all ages and the best part is most of the attractions & rides are free. The only flaw would be the park is rather old but since it's not-for-profit, we can’t expect much on it's maintenance anyway. The park area is big so you have to be ready for lots of walking around. Both my mum & kids are completely exhausted by the time we complete the tour, unlike Disneyland where all the attractions are pretty confined.

Difficult to justify going more than once. Lots of walking.. We went on a Sunday and it was busy! It is a not-for-profit organisation with ideals of improving environmental awareness. This message, however, is lost in the combination of zoo (small) and theme-park design.It is located near to Aberdeen and easy to get to (we took a taxi). The Park is looking tired and they are obviously trying to create activities for adults and children to do & watch eg Sky Fair. We went to the Ocean Theatre to see the 'Sea Dreams' show which had dolphins and seals. The show itself is unremarkable (and not helped by the hundreds of people insisting on using an umbrella to shield themselves from the sun, thus obscuring the view for those behind them). The rides are only suitable for older children and there are long queues to get onto the Mine Train and Raging River. The Ocean Express train is only a 'virtual' underwater train linking the two areas. The Atoll Reef was interesting but crowded. The eateries had basic food (not expensive).  We would probably not go again- it is tired, only semi-interesting, and lots of walking.

Poor attraction - cable car ride is only good thing. Ocean Park is a poor theme park when compared to peers across the globe. I was unfortunate to visit it during a particularly scorching hot day which meant the long ques sweating to get onto rides were followed by utter rage at the poor quality! The only good attraction is the cable car but if you plan to visit the Giant Budda, save yourselve some money and dont go to Ocean Park. The cable car that takes you up to the Giant Budda is larger, longer trip and better views.

Tiring and Crowded. If you plan on visiting oceanpark on a weekend, especially Sunday - expect HUGE crowds. The day we went to Oceanpark there were a lot of tour groups - We brought our 3 year old son and it was exhausting since he got tired easily and refused to walk. I couldn't blame him since the terrain is difficult to navigate, especially the uphill slopes. The atoll reef would've been nice, but it would've been better if they limit the number of people going inside per session as it got really crowded and there was not enough airconditioning to fill the room. We were literally pushed around and forward due to the large number of crowds and it was dark and hot. My son kept crying and he couldn't see the fishes which he absolutely loves. There were quite a few people who went outside the emergency exit to get some air coz they felt faint. In short, we were all like sardines vacuum packed inside the Atoll Reef.If you're travelling with teenagers, Oceanpark would be a great place to visit - their Dolphin show was great and they have a lot of thrilling rides like the mine train. If you're bringing toddlers, I would recommend Disneyland since it's more suitable for young children. Oceanpark is just way too big and difficult to navigate because of the terrain if you have to bring a stroller and children's stuff.
Nice day out. Combination of Zoo and.... Nice day out. Combination of Zoo and theme park.
Great day out. Good place for day me and mate went there good loads to see very packed go early get onto most of the rides full day for 250HKD

tiring and confusing : mediocre rides. Except Mine train none of the rides deserve a special mention. Moving around with small kids was painful. SOme rides were not operational adding to the pain. Overall a mediocre experience.

Expect long queues. Built on the side of a steep hill, it's divided into two sections - The Summit and The Waterfront. To get between each you have the option of the cablecar or Express Train.Opening hours: approx 10am - 7pm.Located at Aberdeen on HK Island and easy to get to by Public Transport (bus 629 from Admiralty Station).Cost is HK$250 (adults) and HK$125 (child 3-11) but there were alot of coin operated games especially in The Waterfront section.The Summit is directed perhaps to the older child/adult for thrilling roller coaster rides like The Dragon and Mine Train. Ocean Theatre and Aquarium are there. During our visit there was the How to Train Your Dragon exhibit which was interesting.The Waterfront is more younger child style and also includes the Whiskas Theatre; Giant Panda Adventure and Bird Theatre.The day we went was really really crowded and we had to wait for over an hour for rides and exhibits and then the Raging River broke. The map; park and signage are really confusing with no logical layout. The pathways are narrow and many times the crowd was at a standstill. Can be chaotic!There is a lot of building work going on so expansion is imminent.Not sure where the conservation message went? Afterwards tip: have dinner at the Jumbo Floating restaurant, a 5 min taxi drive away.

Had a good time. Often compared to Disneyland HK but Ocean Park is a great attraction as well. Enjoyed seeing the giant pandas, riding the cable car, and watching amongst the huge crowd the sea animals in the Ocean Theatre. They have good rides and their entrance fee of HKD 250 is reasonably priced. Line jumping is supposedly prohibited but I don't think they have enough staff to enforce this policy; had the same experience in HK Disneyland too. Going to Ocean Park was not too difficult. Just went to Star Ferry Pier in Central and waited for the bus to arrive. We rode the small bus (not the Citybus 629) and was only charged for HKD 10.50 per person. On our way back to our hotel, we took the Citybus 629 bound for Admiralty. Each person was charged HKD 11. Will come back to experience the rides next time. The Abyss, Crazy Galleon, The Dragon , Eagle, Raging River, and the Mine Train all look promising. If you're in good health, walking around Ocean Park should not be a problem.

Great rides! Ok animal shows. Long walks in between attractions. Eating areas are lacking.. Well first of all, it's easy to get to Ocean Park. Just go down Admiralty MTR station, go to exit B and outside is the line to the bus. If you have an Octopus card, paying is a breeze. We first saw the Flamingo pond, which is cool because we don't have those in Manila. Same with the otters and especially the Pandas. The Goldfish area was also a sight to see. Riding the Abyss and the Dragon made my day.We went on a Sunday so imagine all the people in the park. All the benches were filled so you had to eat standing up. Ok for the adults but not the kids who started getting cranky. Good thing they enjoyed the Cable car (we rode thrice). The underwater train didn't really go underwater as I expected but just showed videos of fish and sea creatures with sound effects. The animal shows were nothing out of the ordinary.The Atoll Reef was a claustrophobic's nightmare. Imagine hundreds of people slowly walking the tunnels going around the aquarium. It gets slower because of picture taking. Kids should be carried or else they don't get enough air.If you want the complete experience then pair this with a visit to HK Disney. For me, one visit is enough.

A must see for both young ones & adults!. Ocean Park was one of the most unique experience of our trip to Hong Kong! It was amazing! It was a combination of adventure, fun, good food, sight-seeing, knowledge! It is divided into two hills & the hills are connected by both cable way & underground train. Both this mode of transportation are a must-take! Another very unique thing about Ocean Park was the escalators (very stiff & long) running between different hillocks! There is also a huge huge huge aquarium with 1000s of aquatic species! This is a MUST SEE! But one caution I must add, people traveling with strollers or wheel chairs are gonna have real trouble negotiating them around the escalators, cable ways & steps.

Loved the Ocean Atoll Reef Exhibit, the Cable Car Ride, and the Panda Exhibit.. Went on a slightly rainy day in December 2009 (small periods of light rain only) so the park was not as crowded at all. While I agree ome of the attractions may need some upgrading, however, I was mainly there to do / see a few things -- the Ocean Atoll Reef Exhibit, the Cable Car Ride, and the Panda Exhibit. The Ocean Atoll Reef had a huge aquarium with lots of gigantic sharks, sting rays, and many other types of fish; you can walk around the 4 levels and get amazing views of the marine life swimming and floating around. The Cable Car Ride down the mountain was fun as the view was simply breathtaking. The Panda Exhibit was cute; I've seen pandas in the past before, but these endangered animals are a rarity and there's only a few places in the world that you can see them, so I really wanted to do that in Hong Kong. I absolutely loved those three things and thoroughly enjoyed my visit to the Ocean Park.

Poor Value for Money, not one for families. We visited in early Jan 2010, after being attracted by the promise of an inclusive family day out. The youngest in our party, 5 years old, could only go on 4 out of the advertised 19 rides, which in comparison to Disney (where she could go on 100% of the rides) was terrible - particularly given she paid full child price. The 7 year old was tall enough to go on only 9 of the 19 rides........... again, poor value for money. To add to that the dolphin enclosure and a couple of the other animal interactions were also closed 'for maintainance'. We went to order food from a concession (a hot dog concession) at 12:15, to be told they had sold out of hot dogs, and there was a 15 minute wait for fries....... pathetic customer serivce. All in all I would not recommend to families at all.I complained to customer services, who didnt appear in the least bit interested.To cap it all, after leaving very early, we filled in a customer service feedback form on the way out, and were given a halloween 2009 mug - only 3 months after the event!Dreadful value for money, one of the worst experiences in the world for this kind of attraction

Good Rides but Too Much Walking and No Magic.. Best: Pandas, Show by Sky Fair, Mine Train, The Abyss and Raging Rivers.Good: The Dragon, Space Wheel, Atoll Reef and The Swing.Average: Ferris WheelLet Down: Turbo Snow Tubing and Spellbound on ice.Pros: Great rides, Pandas and good sky fair show.Cons: Spread out heaps: Lots of walking. Construction. Doesn't feel magical like disneyland.

Speas a full day here ... enough interesting things to do.. I visited the Ocean Park in Hong Kong on 10th, 2010. The tickets to ocean World are HKD 250 per adult which translates to approximately INR 1500 (which is very cheap in my view compared to the rides of offer and the activities you can do there – as compared to Essel World and Water Kingdom which I have been to in Mumbai).You can get to Ocean Park, Hong Kong from the Admiralty Station. Bus No.629 takes you straight to the Ocean Park at the Peak Entrance. It is important to note that there are 2 parts to Ocean Park. The first one is on the Peak and the second part is the Waterfront. These 2 parts are connected in 3 ways. You can choose any of the following 3 ways to travel between the Peak and the Waterfront. (1) Ocean Park Express (Train Ride) (2) Cable Car (Very Scenic and highly recommended, however scary for people who are afraid of heights) (3) Shuttle Bus The map of Ocean Park is also split into 2 which is the Peak and the Waterfront and you will need to plan the 2 parts separately as you would want to move from one to the other only once in a day, else you will end up wasting time and miss out on all the fun things to do in Ocean Park. For the complete review you can visit my Travel Blog which is www.traveltantra.blogspot.com

If your visit is short do something else.. Don't go at Halloween if you have small kids. The gore factor is big and made my daughter cry. Aside from that we went on a day that was a little rainy which I think helped us to enjoy shorter lines and have a good time. The cable cars are fun especially if you are skipping Ngong Ping. Our kids would have stayed at the children's park all day had we let them. The Panda's are worth seeing if you have never seen them before. Coming from the states this isn't a place to go if you are looking for a great roller coaster park. If you have more than 10 days and kids then I think it is worth it. There is a lot of free and cheaper things to do in Hong Kong if your visit is short.

An interesting and fun day out.... Had never heard of this place before visiting Hong Kong, but very glad we took the taxi ride from Wan Chai to Ocean Park , which is close to Aberdeen Harbour. The taxi was only HKD70 and entrance was HKD250 per adult. The theme, not surprisingly, was sea life and they have some interesting exhibits and a decent funfair to keep younger ones happy. The best exhibits/attractions were the Pandas, Atoll Reef and Pacific Pier. Would recommend allowing 4-5 hours for a decent visit.
