We took the bus back to Admiralty (for the MTR) which was less than HKD12 and took about 30 mins in fair traffic.

Something For Everyone. Our whole family enjoyed the day trip to Ocean Park. We took the MTR to Admiralty Exit B and picked up the 629 bus which dumps you at the front gate.The park is built on Hong Kong Island which isn't as flat as a pancake so expect a little bit of a work-out on the legs. It's not too bad though, the have plenty of long escalators, cable cars and trains to help you get about. The scenery from around the park is quite spectacular whether over looking Aberdeen or shipping movements on South China Sea. There were enough thrill rides to keep the kids happy (Dragon, Mine Train, Abyss, etc), some more tamer rides for the older folks (Raging River, Tower, Skystar), and everyone loved the Pandas ( Red and Giant). That combined with the odd street performer, doplin show, otter feeding, sea lions, etc made for a fun day out.Cost to get in was approx AUD$35 an adult, half for kids. Except for food and drinks (which aren't at rip-off prices) everything is free once inside. We went between Christmas and New Year. Weather was about 20C and the longest queue was about 10 minutes. As I said, a good day for all with a bit of exercise thrown in for free.
Hate It. Waste of time and money. Too many walk for nothing.

Ocean Park Halloween Bash was great fun. Ocean Park Halloween Bash was great fun. There were 8 haunted houses with different themes, with crew member dressed up in scary costume. The atmosphere was really nice. But there were too many people queuing for going into the haunted house and you need to get in early to avoid the queue,

A great day of entertainment and sights and a getaway from the city.. Ocean park has loads to do and you can spend hours here amusing yourself.
I would recommend going on the rollarcosters and catching the dolphin show that is on at regular intervals (check the time tables). Once inside the park and paid the entrance fee all the attractions are free.
Great fun for all ages.

Unique Theme Park, but very crowded. We went to Ocean Park on a very HOT day in July. There were throngs of people everywhere and it was especially crowded in the Reef exhibit during feeding time. It was so crowded (wall-to-wall people and they were pushing), one could easily lose their party or children and it was impossible to really leisurely appreciate the myraid of ocean life in the large tanks. The roller coasters were not too exciting for the teens, and wait times were about 30 minutes or less, depending on which roller coaster you were doing to ride. The teens thought The Abyss (drop ride) was more exciting. This is not a park for extreme thrill seekers. Many rides are geared to 12 and under. The best part of the day was riding the cable cars that transported you from one mountain level to another. Quite an amazing view from the cable cars! To get to the cable cars, we had to wait at least 30 minutes in a very long line. The line was moving though. The other highlight was seeing the pandas. Ironically, the panda habitat was not crowded at all and it was air conditioned so we could enjoy the pandas. For some reason the lower level was not as crowded as the upper level, but maybe it is because we did the lower level towards the end of the day. The park map is a bit confusing and some signs are posted in ways that are ambiguous. I would have rather gone on a cooler day and during non-peak times. Still, the park is unique and has an interesting variety of attractions.

Pandas. I think Ocean Park is worth the visit purely for the Pandas who are fascinating animals. They are so peaceful to watch and I cannot help but smile when I think of them even now months after our visit.Fortunately for us they were awake, I guess they do not do much to entertain the visitors but indeed why should they?I think Ocean Park would be a great place to visit if you have children also as there is plenty to see and do.

Entertaining - Don't have too high an expectation. I had 2 children in tow age 6 and 8 who were very excited by ocean park.Getting there was a pain. The public buses will stop across the road from the carpark to Ocean Park but it's not well signposted, and you need the busdriver to tell you when to get off.2 sections to the park. The entrance half is really kitted out for very young children with the panda enclosure. As mentioned before, the panda's are very dull, but the enclosure is fantastic. Nowhere else have I seen animals live in such well air-conditioned comfort!. If it's getting too hot or noisy for you in Ocean Park, head to the pandas, where you can enjoy aircon a the massive enclosure, and noisy people have a "No Noise" placard thrust in front of their face!At peak times, there's an hour queue to get on the bubble car to the other side. If you do find a big queue, hop on the shuttle bus outside the entrance - every 30 mins. to the other section of the park.The other side "Headland" has the more thrills ride. Although my 2 kids have been veterans of several theme parks, they found the height restriction to be a pain. Even the log flume has a caution on it! If your child is less than 4 feet, they are severely restricted in the number of rides they can go on. I thought the US was bad on precautions !!! My small 6 year old have been on similar rides in the UK without any problems at all! On a week-day, non bank holiday, the queues weren't great. 45 mins for the log river ride. 1 hour for the runaway train. Only 5 minutes for the loop-the-loop rollercoaster. 30 mins for the big-wheel (2 revolutions only...)The dolphin show was enjoyable. Massive theatre. The front 1/3 seems to be empty as it's not covered. Seems like a good place to watch, until you get a family of 4 with massive umbrellas wielded in front of your face! So if you have kids, it's best to sit in the shaded areas where umbrellas remain closed!Overall an enjoyable day-out but if you are mad-keen on theme-parks, don't get your hopes up too high.Beware of the discourteous adults from the mainland whom will queue-jump at the drop of the hat (these are generally 50+ year olds when seem to get too hyper-excited) Although I'm not blessed with height, I had constant head-ache from being jabbed by umbrellas!!!!

Waste of time, too many people.. Ocean Park in Hong Kong is a marine based theme park. It comprises two sections[although no one tells you that], an arrival section and the main section, which you have to take a cable car to get to. When we visited, there were just too many people and when the park closes, its an hour waiting time to get the cable car back to the arrival section. Don't waste your time, there are many better things to see in Hong Kong. John from Adelaide, Australia.

GREAT SOURCE OF KIDZ ENTERTAINMENT. Ocean Park - A Complete Days Entertainment Source For Kids. Kids Freaked Out Seeing The Dolphin Show - A Truly Unique Relation Between Man And Animal. Kids Freaked Out Seeing The Dolphins, Seal, Pandas. They Had Great Rides For Kids. Normally People Traveling In Tour Packages Are Only Given Half Day Tour To Ocean Park. But In My Opinion You Need A Complete Day Especially With The Kids.Have Fun...

Worth a visit but not for the Pandas. We visited Ocean Park on May 28 which was a HK Public Holiday. We arrived right on opening time and so it wasn't too crowded (yet).The location of the Park is stunning and amazing, built over 2 sites on the side of a mountain. The cable car cleverly links the 2 park sections as well as provides a ride and a chance to relax. Also there are covered outdoor escalators to assist you with the climb from entrance to attraction. The rides aren't state of the art but are fun nonetheless. Go to DisneyLand if you want the razzle dazzle. The Dolphin Show was OK, I have seen better, but my kids loved every minute of it and the view from the Theatre is spectacular. Must do's include the Raging River Ride - so much fun for everyone hence the long queues; the Sea Jelly Aquarium - so many wonderful and weird jelly fish; the Cable Car ride for the view.We allocated half a day to spend at Ocean Park and for us, it was just about enough. We visited the Pandas and indeed they were cute, but dull. They were all sleeping! A large crowd of visitors spent ages looking into a Jia Jia's enclosure - at a sack! Jia Jia was in the next enclosure snoozing on a log. We laughed and laughed and laughed and took a photo of the sack and the crowd.Definitely worth the visit for the trip to HK Island, the bus ride, the Raging River, the Jellyfish and the experience but I wouldn't be rushing to Ocean Park purely for the sake of seeing the sleepy Pandas.

Jia Jia. The Ocean Park in HK is a theme park located right in the heart of HK and very close to the causeway bay where we were staying. As a family park destination it is just about OK but the entry prices are steep, about HK$720 for 3 adults and one child.The park is divided in two parts, with a cable car ride joining the two. The cable car ride is quite interesting, it is steep and goes by the side of the sea to reach the other end.Among the attractions, important ones are the baloon ride-a giant baloon which takes you up at about 100m to give a panormic view of HK, the Panda bears, various other animals, including the dolphins and the sea lion show!!Lots of eating and playing arena. All in all a good place to go wth family especially if you have kids in the age group of 2-12

A great day out for all ages!. Ocean Park is a great day out for all the family. It is on two sides of a mountain with a cable car joining the two parts. The cable car itself is worth the trip!The top part of the moutain is aimed more at older visitors with lots of thrill rides, but also the seals and dolphin theatre. When you get there find out the time for the dolphin theatre as it is not on that regularly and we missed it.The bottom part is aimed at the smaller children, with lots of great activities. It also has two fantastic Panda exhibits. Not only Black and White Pandas, but very cute Red Pandas. Don't miss them.We had a situation with an umbrella we bought our daughter which broke that evening due to a manufacturing fault. We rang Ocean Park and they delivered a replacement to our hotel within a couple of days - such fantastic service.Enjoy the trip!

Enjoyable but not spectacular day out. Got reduced price tickets from travel agent in Kowloon and had beautiful weather for our day at the park. The attractions are a mix of zoo and amusement park and are spread over the top and sides of a large hill (escalators and cable car take the strain) which makes for excellent views of HK coast and across to other islands. Dolphin and sea lion show was excellent and venue has great views. Aquarium, cable car ride and wild water ride all very good. Various roller coasters etc are there but they looked fairly tame by modern standards. Six giant pandas are kept in enclosures where visitors can get very close separated only by glass but we thought they looked bored and frustrated and that enclosures should have been bigger. Food outlets looked good but we think meal we had at main restaurant was source of food poisoning which started that night. Worth a visit but don't expect state of the art rides.
The best ocean park in China. Just simply the best!no words can express!i love it!

Maybe we should appreciate the fact that Ocean Park is not made of plastic.. I am very irritated by the fact that most of the complaints about Ocean Park are about the temperature, the walk, the fact that Ocean Park is not Disneyland, and the fact that there is not enough indoors in Ocean Park. Maybe we should all take a breath and realize that Hong Kong has possible 40 degree summers. Let's appreciate that Ocean Park is not plastic, and that it is not made just for tourists, but for the people who actually live in Hong Kong, many of which find Disneyland too fake for them. If someone decided to go somewhere, wouldn't they search up a bit about it? If they did, they could, perhaps, wear sneakers to said place, so they could walk around, and try to admire the gardens and nature around them as they did. They could wear thin clothing, get a hat, or simply go to the place when the weather was cooler, like when the skies are somewhat cloudy. I must say, though, that this is not a good place for those with small children, or, at least, those who have with them people that tire easily. I also realize how ridiculously un-stroller friendly the park is. I think this is a place best for older children. Maybe above 10. But at least try to appreciate the amount of sky you can see as you zip off on a roller coaster, rather than complain because the roller coaster is not in a building filled with fake stars.

Under valued. I have been to Ocean Park a few times over the years, as a bachelor, a couple & now as a father with a toddler.I have always found Ocean Park to be refreshingly different from the 'plastic' world of Disneyland. True, the park is set over hiils, is in a hot country and requires walking - but it is stroller friendly as parks go.In context, its a fantastic day out with a very good mix of features for ALL members of the family.E.G. There is a dedicated park for toddlers. There are beautiful gardens, entertaining shows & activities for older visitors and there is lots for thrill seekers. There is a fantastic jelly fish aquarium, atoll reef & dolphin/sea lion show too.The negative reviews seem to come from people who don't realise that HK is hot place & Ocean Park is basically an outdoor venue and that Ocean park does not try to be like Disneyland.

Very Disappointing Experience. We visited Ocean Park at the beginning of November 2008. We got the bus transfer from Admirality MTR with no problems and were dropped off at the Highland entrance. Our first impression of the park was very disappointing - we couldn't make sense of the map provided and took a while to get our bearings. The rides are old and shabby and in need of updating. We got on the Raging River (log flume) ride first and while enjoyable its in dire need of an upgrade. We got absolutely soaked on the ride (half expected!)and spent the day smelling like dirty water or wet dog - God knows what was in the water! Places to sit and rest to top up sun cream etc.. are extremely limited and even areas around food stands are tiny. The park is set over a number of hills with plenty of steep inclines and escalators - not child / stroller friendly at all - we had to keep taking our son out of his stroller to use the escalators. A large percentage of rides / attractions were closed when we visited and the animal enclosures were under refurbishment. We left the park within two hours, disappointed. Don't waste your money - take the MTR out to Disney instead!

Not as good as expected. Travelling with yound kids, I find Ocean Park very stroller unfriendly with all the steep grades and steps. The park was hot, crowded, with little shade and no place to sit down and take a break. Exibits were dull and boring. Maps and signage were not very helpful. Shows were average, nothing too special.The park staff was very courteous and helpful as do most of the F&B outlet staff. The cable car ride was nice. Going back again? You can count me out.

This park is hot...literally. I visited this park last week and found the heat unbearable. There was hardly and shade and when we found some, the radiant heat off the footpaths and surrounding fixtures made you feel like you were sitting in an oven. There are no air conditioned eating areas and when you do buy some food to eat there is only limited seating so expect to eat standing up. The three tier escalator to move you up the mountain made you feel like you were being transported to the gates of hell as the the heat was over bearing. They desperately need fans on that to at least give you some moving air.The only cool refuge we found was in the Panda exhibit. Needless to say we stayed in there for over an hour. Not only because it was air conditioned but also because the pandas were beautiful. In fact I'd really only recommend going to this park if you've never seen a panda before as pretty much they are the only unique thing about this park.We also found that being Westerners that we were stared at alot which also made us feel uncomfortable. We didn't experience this anywhere else in Hong Kong and for that matter I've not experienced it to that level anywhere else in the world.The park is set out over a mountain so requires alot of walking up and down hills. In the heat this almost killed us. The rides are nothing to write home about. The day we were there the water flume ride was closed. There was no mention of this at the park entrance when we bought our tickets.The jelly fish exhibit was pretty good. I felt sorry though for the dolphins in their tiny pool (I've swum in bigger suburban back yard pools). So in summary this place needs alot more air conditioned areas (particularly eating spaces) to cool guests down. They might also want to think about eliminating the need for visitors having to walk up hill long distances in the heat

Our 2008 Summer Vacation. We went to Ocean Park via bus. When we arrived, we took the cable cars to the low land where we saw the animal of the month exhibit (frogs), the adorable pandas and some street performances...In the highlands, we walked through the Atoll Reef and the World of Sharks. We then strolled around the park and visited the shops. Some of us had fun in the rides. We also watched the show.

Terrific time with kids and grandparents. The only problem with our day at Ocean Park was the overcast day. Threatened to rain but never did...much. The rides were great for our kids, ages 6-12, lines reasonable, especially early in the day. I was so happy not to see giant costumed characters everywhere and not to have the children bothering me to buy buy buy more things. The entrance ticket covered more than enough--expected to spend half a day, and ended up spending the whole day looking at dolphin and seal show (get there early and reserve a good seat!), riding rides, and generally looking at sea creatures--didn't even get to the southern half of the park!We'll go back for that next time, and skip HK Disney again.

Cable Car Ride=A but Overall Experience=C. I visited this park on the 1st trip out of the hotel with my wife and a 5 years old daughter on 19 November. We took the only bus outside Admiralty MTR Station and paid for the entry tickets at the bus terminal.We arrived at the higher ground after a 25 minutes ride. Upon entering the park, we had to take mutiple upward escalator rides in order to visit the Jellyfish and shark sites. With a 5 years old kid, it was a nightmare to spend time walking from one place to another in the park. With nothing much to see, we just kept walking and walking uphill and up many steep slopes. The Jellyfish site was a letdown if you have seen any of such eslewhere in the world. We were so tired walking we gave up visiting the shark site because it would mean another long walk again.We took the cable car ride downhill and that alone was the best and worth the price of the ticket. It was a spectacular long ride around mountains. Great scenery and peace up there.When we reached the station downhill, it was another dreadful long walk again to see the Panda who were all sleeping!My girl complained about nothing much to see in this Ocean Park and felt rather disappointed. We couldn't be bothered to take the shuttle bus uphill to switch back to the return bus ride back to town (already paid for when we purchased the return tickets). By that time...we were just too tired and would rather pay a cab to get away from Ocean Park.I wouldn't recommend it to anyone with young kids around. Just stick to Disneyland and skip Ocean Park. You are warned.

Fun and cheap - great amusement park. We went to Ocean Park on Thanskgiving. We took a city bus and were there in about 20 minutes from Central. It is a straight shot with no stops. It is very reasonable and my only regret is that I didn't do the dolphin encounter. We found out too late how to sign up for this up close and personal experience. The only ride we had to pay for was the race cars but it was still cheap at $30HK. The Shark aquarium is nice but very crowded. Be prepared for pushing. This was the only time I experienced this but we seemed to have entered when there was several tour groups.If I ever go back to HK I will go there again. There is so much to see and do and will take all day.

Spectacular Ocean Park. A group of parents with our children, all boys went to Ocean Park on Friday 16th November 2007, we all had a wonderful day and thought it was beautiful from the amazing views, to the rides, and to the spectacular cable cart, what an experience and what a day.Not much choice in food selection for the kids, however the parents loved Mr Squid. We loved the seal show and seeing the pandas. It was a great day overall and we would definitely go again.

Amusement Park in Hong Kong. I really loved Ocean Park. It is so beautiful, the gardens, butterfly exhibit and real pandas. Also, I liked the fact that there is a tree that helps people recycle by talking and thanking you for throwing in a can,etc. I was nervous about taking the steep escalators up but I finally got on the water flume ride, which is the ideal ride for the adventurous, roller-coaster types. Some of the sculptures will remind you of Aztec art.

Unique theme park experience. Wow - half of Ocean Park is perched high on a mountain overlooking the water and the other half is at the bottom of the mountain connected by cable cars. The rollercoasters literally hang off the mountain - its worth seeing just to marvel at the layout of it all. It's kind of a zoo, fun park and seaworld all rolled into one.Piece of advice - arrive when the Park opens (at 10am). We didn't get there until 11.30am and ran out of time to do the rides. Plan out your day carefully to cover as much as you can. There's typically a line for the cable cars and unless you want a ridiculously long walk there is no other way to get from one side to the other. We went on a Friday and it was packed, especially in the afternoon - can't imagine what it would be like on a weekend? The pandas were great - the most active we have ever seen, somersaulting and playing in the water! There were fun rides for the kids - a grandprix car track, a balloon type ride, rapid ride etc. The dolphin and seal shows were nice - you aren't going to get the quality of a US Seaworld but these animals were great to see in any capacity. The aquarium is outstanding - best fish etc, better than any we've seen. Our kids loved it - and we really enjoyed the fact that it was different and kind of quirky. Low end food was pretty bad but that's par for the course for a fun park - they have a McDonalds and other takeaway places. We're really glad that we spent a day there - it's not perfect but its so different than any place we've ever been that it was more than worth a visit.

Good for a week day outing. I have lived in HK 2 years and never been to Ocean Park because I never have a day off during the week and would never visit on the weekend because I know it will be packed. Anyway with visitors in town I went today and we had a very enjoyable day with hardly any queues. $70 for parking and $185pp to get in. All rides were inc. in the price but the arcade style games all over the park weren't.First up were the panda's at about 10.30am, one eating, one sleeping and the 2 two year olds were wrestling so it was a good start. You walk along a queuing race to see them but it is on 2 levels so you go past twice and can see them easily and can stop if you want.Then we took the cable car to the other side and really enjoyed the ride. The Ocean Pier sea lion exhibit was good. We did all the rides and none were too scary. The Raging River and Mine Roller Coaster were a bit of a trek to get to but worth it. The aquarium was quite impressive and a good place to cool off.Food options were not great so we had McDonalds and there was no where indoors to eat and cool off so that was a bit annoying as were the hoards of mainland tourists wanting to take their picture with me nad my blonde hair - very pleased we didn't go on the weekend but on the weekend I think there would be more food options as many of the smaller kiosks were closed. Gift shops were dissapointing - poor choice of postcards and fridge magnets.We centred our day around finishing with the dolphin and sea lion show which had alot of promise but was a bit of a let down actually. The sealion show at Taronga Zoo in Sydney is 10 times better even though the set up isn't as nice. Get there 30mins before if you want a seat in the shade. All seats are individual so squashing is not a problem but on weekends it would be full - there wasn't much room left today.Non-operational rides were listed on the website and at the front entrance so this avoided any disappointment. Generally I thought the park was well maintained (a bit of paint needed in some areas) and there were lots of toilets all of which were above average in cleanliness. I would recommend it for a good day out, don't go with any expectations and you won't be dissapointed. Highly recommend you get a season pass if you have kids in HK but you will have to splash out a bit more cash for many of the kiddie games and attractions.Have yet to go Disney in HK but I think it will be a different experience, Disney is probably more 'perfect' but less enjoyable for adults without kids.

Very very busy and hot!. See my earlier review for July 18th 2006, when we loved Ocean Park. We went back in August 2007 and noticed quite a few differences.It was VERY hot this time and the lack of shade was noticeable.It was incredibly busy, with queues too long to bother with for some attractions. t was difficult to even move around sometimes, and the queue to get the cable car back was more than half an hour.The park is undergoing rebuilding and some attractions such as butterflies and goldfish/carp seem to have disappeared.4 Pandas now present, but all were asleep both times I tried to view them.Food is still crap, and you also have a long queue for it.Pandas, Cable Car ride, aquarium and shark tank are still worth the admission prices on their own, but maybe not when you are accompanied by thousands of locals carrying you through in a sea of bodies.Do not queue for something called the “Panda Extravaganza” show, which turns out to be an assortment of locals dressed in furry suits doing a song and dance act. Avoid at all costs.Get there at opening time to have at least some relatively quiet time to look around.

Fun Times in Ocean Park. I went to Ocean Park recently (July 2007)I had been to Disneyland the day before and it was interesting to see the difference between the two amusement parks.Ocean Park has much better rides - if stomach churning rides are your thing.There are 2 Roller Coasters - one with loop-the-loops and a corkscrew, and the other a little less scaryThe Abyss - where you travel about 50 feet up in the air, and then DROPThe Log Ride, A spinning contraption...litterally HEAPS of ridesWhat Ocean Park lacks however is the comfort of Disney.I did go on a Sunday, which is bound to have more people in the park, but the lines were the same as Disney lines on the Saturday. The only problem is that there is very little shade and moving air and no airconditioning anywhere.I would definitely recommend Ocean Park, but would advise you take an umbrella to shade yourself, and possibly a little personal fan, just to take the edge off the heatEnjoy!

The worst amusement park I have ever visited. My wife, my 5 year old daughter and I just spent part of today at this place. After spending yesterday at Hong Kong Disney and enjoying it very much, today was, quite frankly, a bit of a nightmare. After riding 4 or 5 very lengthy escalators past numerous tacky shops and foul smelling fast food stands, we arrived at the sea lion exhibit-a disappointing spectacle! Hard to imagine following hundreds and hundreds of people through claustrophopic corridors for 2 hours with a five year old in search of something that resembled an aquarium or something close to the attractions at places like Sea World or the Vancouver Aquarium, but that is what this place is like. Apparently there is an aquarium, but the line up to see it was at least 1-2 hrs wait.At the end of our visit, my wife politely asked the "guest relations" department for a refund of our admission fee and, fully in keeping with the rest of the experience, we were given the option of filling out a guest comment card.We generally enjoy our visits to family oriented attractions-even if some are a bit tacky. This place, however, is in a different league!Best advice-stay away!

Disappointing. Had great expectation since the staff at the hotel highly recommended it. They even said that it was better than Disneyland. We went to Ocean Park a few days after going to Disneyland, expecting better things, unfortunately it wasn't to be.The bad:- need to walk a lot without cover in 30C heat. Unlike Disneyland where there are lots of cover, it's in short supply in OP.- couldn't find any drinking fountain. Soda costs 3x of what on sale in 7-11!!!! - rides look and feel out of date.- lots of amusement park type games which you have to pay extra for playing.The good:- gondola ride - raging river- the crowd quite well behaved, a good thing since there are lots of mainlanders.- lots of scary ridesSummary:don't go, better take the train to Thung Chung and get on the gondola to Ngong Ping 360. Obviously Disneyland is a must.

Dont bother - No Giant Panda's. Ocean Park is advertised as a wildlife park with many rides and attractions. The main reason I went there was to see the Giant Panda's which turned out not to be on display as their enclosure was undergoing major renovation work. It was appalling you didn’t find out till you had paid for your ticket and entered the park that you couldn’t see them. The few other animals that were there were so difficult to see and held in such tiny pools that I was appalled. The rest of the park was either closed or the few rides that were open were very tame. Save your money and go and see a real Giant Panda conservation centre or visit Disney World for the rides.

Top 5 Rides at Ocean Park. If you want to be a kid-at-heart once again, or if you want to test how courageous you could be as an adult, here are the top 5 rides you must experience at Ocean Park, HK:No. 5- The Raging River. Be prepared to get wet in this 2-minute ride. The downhill slide is the best! Not to mention that this is the instant your photo will get taken, so SMILE... Note: If you get really scared, be sure to keep your mouth closed, okay. Some photos can get very unflattering!No. 4- The Dragon/The MIne Train. These are two different rides, which to me, practically gives the same sensation- so you could choose either one if you are pressed for time. They're just like your regular roller coaster, only the view down below makes it extra-exciting! Keep your eyes open, or the experience will be only half as good.No. 3- The Space Wheel. Surprisingly, this ride does not have a lot of fans- the queue isn't that long. But believe me, the experience is awesome! It does feel like being thrown into the sky like a yo-yo- only you're trapped in a "car." Beware though, you will definitely feel a bit nauseated afterwards... So don't eat before getting in!No. 2- The Cable Car. This is the most relaxing ride, best ridden at night when you're heading back to Lowland from Headland. The lights in the park provide an amazing view, and it is the perfect way to cap the night... Finally, No. 1- The Abyss. This will certainly test your limits. Pretend you're inside a lift, only sitting down and carefully (!?!) strapped. Imagine plummeting down so fast your gut seems to travel up your throat...then rising up to replace your organs, only to plunge down again. Whew! What a ride! If I were you, I'd chose the section which gives you a full view of the cliff. This is definitely super-fun!Hmm... On second thought, just be kids- be fearless. Leave the rationalizing to adults!

It's awful and then it gets worse. What a terrible load of rubbish. They lure you to the south coast of Hong Kong Island with the promise on Giant Pandas and sharks. Closed. Actually half the attractions are closed. Bunch of roller coasters and lots, lots and then more teenagers with camera phones. It's a hike to get there and generally EXTREMELY unpleasant if you're over about 19. Avoid. Go to the Peak for lunch instead. Don't eat in the main building. Go outside (hard to figure out how) and find the lovely Lookout at the Peak restaurant. Great view. Pretty Garden. Not cheap but worth it.Enjoy.

Give it a miss if you don't have children...... My husband and I went to Ocean Park in October 2006. It had it's good points and it's bad points..Good - Without a doubt it was probably worth the admission price for the cable car trip up to the higher part of the park. The views really were truly amazing. The aquarium was also quite interesting. A big plus was that the queues for the rises were really short, so if rides are your thing, you could have got your money's worth. Bad - I would give it a miss if you don't have children, as many of the rises are aimed at children. A big draw for me was to see the pandas and, like another reviewer, I did find it a litle upsetting to see the relatively small enclosure which they were in. Same goes for the dolphins. if you do only have a few days to spend in Hong Kong, I think there are other must-dos rather than visit Ocean Park.

Panda, nothing exept pand. I am a huge fan of gigant panda (love these creatures with all my heart), if you are not, DO NOT GO TO OCEAN PARK. This would be simple wasting money and your time.1/ Park divided into 2 parts - lowlands (with panda habitat) and highlands (rides, marine show, aquarium). To get ther get 629 bus from Admiralty or Central (pier 7).2/ You pay at the entrance but all attractions in Lowlands (exept pandas) are for extra money - carting, whiskers ride. Cable car is free but operates only after 11:00 (park opens at 10:00). But pandas are great I don`t know any other place in the world where you can see these fantastic animals so close.2/ In the Highlands almost nothing to do or see. Marine show is poor and in low professional level, feeding sealions (25 HK) is swift and ordinary. Aquarium is indeed 3 -storie galleria but around Asia I`ve seen enough of it. All rides are pretty usual, no signature attractions at all.3/ The summary - better go to Disneyland.

Perfect day at Ocean Park. The day we visited Ocean Park was the only warm sunny day of our trip. The views were spectacular and the temperature was perfect. My kids, 14 and 11, enjoyed the rides and with no waiting lines my son rode the Abyss 5 times in a row. The cable car view alone is worth the trip. No, it's not Cedar Pointe but for my amusement park starved kids (we live in Shanghai) it was a great day. Around 3:30 in the afternoon the tour bus groups started arriving and things got more crowded. We used the KCR Ocean Park special ticket which includes a free KCR pass and shuttle bus for the price of admission to Ocean Park. Definitely a good value compared to the tour packages who wanted an extra HK$100 each over the admission cost.

Enchanting. The cable cars here are my favourite thing in Hong Kong - the views as you ride are stunning (and I am afraid of heights, but always try to ride on these when I visit HK). I think these alone are worth the admission price.The first time I visited here, I had considerable walking difficulties following very recent surgery, but coped ok,and found the staff very anxious to help.The water-themed attractions and the pandas are marvellous and I love the quirkiness of attractions such as the goldfish pavilion and the giant escalator.The Middle Kingdom is unusual and prettily laid-out.This theme park has a Chinese feel to it - don't go if you want a plasticky Americanized experience - do go if you want a happy day out with something different to see and do.

Amazing dolphin encounter!. My husband and I went to ocean park on Monday 7th November and spent around 4 hours there - 1 1/2 hours of which was the dolphin encounter. I wasn't sure about whether we should go to Disney or Ocean Park - but from forum advice decided to try ocean park. The website was quite helpful - as I found details on it of the dolphin encounter program. This was really good fun! It cost an additional hkd$685 approx. I booked it 2 weeks in advance over the internet as there are limited places on it. Basically you get to go behind the scenes to meet the dolphins. The encounter consisted of 1/2 hour induction class learning about dolphins. Then those taking part in the encounter changed into waterproof waders and then got to feed and touch the dolphins. I really enjoyed this! I learnt so much about the beautiful creatures and loved meeting them. My husband wasn't taking part, but as a guest got to join me in both the class and watching me in the little pool - at no cost. I thoroughly recommend this! We also saw one of the pandas (an an - chi chi was resting!) which I also enjoyed. Atholl Reef is really great too - it is worth taking the time going round it and really looking at all the different fish etc. A lot of folk just seem to rush on past. We did do the cable cars too. I do have a bad fear of heights and was dreading it, but wanted to say I had done it. The ride is really hairy, lots of clunking noises and jolts - however, the view from the car is great - if you are brave enough to open your eyes!!!!We weren't really bothered for the rides, and I can appreciate those comments that say the park is dated in that we chose not to eat there, and some of the attractions were closed for refurbishment. I found it hard to score this - because the dolphin encounter was excellent in my view, however overall I think the park is average - I have therefore gone in between the two. If you are simply wanting a day for the kids on different rides etc, then I suspect Disney is the better option, however if you love animals, and want a day out of the mad rush of Hong Kong, Ocean Park is worth going to and has some lovely scenery.Hope this helps.

Only cable car is worthy. We went to Ocean Park last Thursday! It was a very hot day even it was already November. Not many people so don't need to Q up for the cable car. It was a long ride with spacious scene of HK landscape & seaview, but quite scary! The worst thing is the toilet very dirty & smelly, I dare not to go in when saw it, liak!!The food also so so only, compare to Disneyland.Need maintainence if want to compete with Disneyland.The dolpin show also not very interesting, we sat under the big sun, so hot that we cannot stand to watch the whole show finish. Will not go again if we go HK next time!

Forget about it!. We were just there 31st October 2005. Do not waste your time going to this 'attraction'. Extremely not stroller/handicap friendly and very poorly maintained. Not a good place to bring kids under the age of 5. We wasted an entire morning not because we were staying on by choice but because to get out of the park itself is a chore with lots and lots of walking to do from point to point with plenty of stairs! There is nothing much at the Lowland Park except for the pandas for the younger kids. As for the other side of the park, the shark aquarium had only one reasonably big shark (Sentosa's underwater world is better). Only good thing was the Atoll Reef which was nice but filled with stairs from level to level(no ramps!!). The cable car ride is OK for the view but those who have a fear of heights should stay clear as it gets quite scary at certain points and it's a long ride. The park staff were also hardly to be found anywhere(if you needed directions). The toilets were very dirty and the variety of food sold in the park was not good.

Nice park with good landscaping and beautiful views!. I visited Ocean Park on a recent trip in August with some friends. It was a hot humid Monday. We spent about 5-6 hrs from 10am till about 4 pm and did not even manage to cover all of the park. Its huge!Most memorable was the cable car ride. This is a great experience with beautiful view of the sea and surrounding islands. If you only got time to do one thing at Ocean Park, this is IT! Take the cable car! Of course depending on what time of the day you go, there's going to be long queues... but its a really wonderful 10-15 minutes ride, enjoy the sea breeze while going over the hills at a pretty precarious angle. :)We watched the Dolphin and Sea-Lion show which was entertaining but nothing special than what is expected from such a show. Took the Roller Coaster ride called 'Dragon', i think. Take it for the wonderful view coz its perched on the side of the cliff. The ride was short and not too hair-raising but still fun! Plenty of other thrill rides as well but the best stuff would belong to the sea creatures. The nature reef was very good. Its therapeutic to look at the different fishes and the beautiful corals. Pacific Pier houses the Sea Lions. Its also nice esp at feeding times. The Shark underwater gallery is also quite interesting.All in all, I'd say that Ocean Park is an excellent family-themed park. You cannot finish it in one day but its nice to spend a few hrs here to stroll among the greenery, see the fishes etc and get on a few thrill rides.It's not Disneyland but a very good cousin, in my opinion. :)If you can manage the time while in HK, do visit the Ocean Park. Of course, try to visit during the off-peak days and in good weather so you don't have to jostle with the crowds.
